immunohistochemical study of c-fos-positive lymphocyte infiltrate into human squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck during radiation therapy and it clinical significance .
c-fos have be report to be one of the immediate early gene in signal transduction system after many kind of stress , include ionize radiation .
change in c-fos expression induce by radiation therapy in tumor tissue have not yet be report .
in this study , we have attempt to determine whether c-fos expression be induce by radiotherapy in human squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck and to establish a possible correlation between c-fos expression and the therapeutic effect of radiation therapy .
twenty-seven patient with tumor of the oral cavity , oropharynx , and maxillary sinus be examine , all of which be confirm a squamous cell carcinoma .
after obtain the patient ' inform consent , biopsy be perform before treatment and at dos of 4 , 10 , and 20 gy of radiotherapy , and the specimen be preserve in liquid nitrogen for further examination .
serial sectioning of 6 micrometer be perform use a cryostat , and sample be immunohistochemically stain use the streptoavidin -biotin peroxidase method and a monoclonal antibody against c-fos .
three of the 27 patient with squamous cell carcinoma show slight expression of c-fos in their tumor cell before and/or at 4 or 10 gy of radiotherapy .
the tumor show high radiosensitivity .
concern tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte , the rate of moderate or remarkable grade of c-fos-positive lymphocyte before radiotherapy and at radiation dos of 4 , 10 , and 20 gy be 8.0 , 29.2 , 4.8 , and 0 % , respectively .
the relationship between the immunohistochemical finding and the antitumor effect at a radiation dose of 20 gy be examine on the corresponding h & e-stained section .
in patient whose infiltration of c-fos-positive lymphocyte into tumor tissue be moderate or remarkable at 4 gy of radiotherapy , the tumor respond significantly well to radiation therapy ( p < 0.025 , chi2 test ) , and the patient take a significantly favorable clinical course ( p < 0.05 , chi2 test ) .
in a sample from one of the patient , c-fos-positive lymphocyte be identify a cd4 positive and cd8 negative .
therefore , the high radiosensitivity of squamous cell carcinoma in our sample could be explain by an overexpression of c-fos in the tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte induce by small dos of radiation therapy , and these activate lymphocyte exert a cytotoxic effect against the cancer cell .
1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear cell from patient with renal insufficiency .
a reduce expression of the vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) in parathyroid gland of uremic animal and human have be observe .
similar result have be obtain by our own group in peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) from patient with secondary hyperparathyroidism to chronic renal failure .
however , the reason for these change be not clear .
in the present study , we have investigate the specific uptake of [3h]1,25(oh)2d3 by pbmc of 11 woman with advanced chronic renal failure ( a-crf ) , 6 woman with mild-moderate renal insufficiency ( m-crf ) , and 23 healthy woman .
the mean dissociation constant ( kd ) be similar in both group of patient and in healthy woman ( a-crf : 0.7 +/- 0.5 x 10(-10) m ; m-crf : 1.1 +/- 0.9 x 10(-10) m ; control : 1.0 +/- 0.6 x 10(-10) m ) .
however , vdr concentration be significantly decrease in a-crf ( 0.8 +/- 0.5 fmol/10(7) cell vs. 2.3 +/- 0.9 fmol/10(7) cell in control , p < 0.001 ) , whereas no change be see in m-crf ( 1.7 +/- 0.7 fmol/10(7) cell vs. 2.3 +/- 0.9 fmol/10(7) cell in control ) .
no correlation be see between vdr and serum calcitriol or pth level , when consider both group of patient together or separately .
conversely , a significant negative correlation be find between vdr and serum creatinine value when a-crf and m-crf be consider altogether ( r = -0.63 ; p < 0.01 ) .
treatment with two different schedule of oral calcitriol ( five patient with 0.5 microgram/day for 1 month and four patient with 2 micrograms/day for 7 day ) do not change vdr concentration .
we conclude that the low level of serum 1,25(oh)2d3 of uremia be not responsible for the decrease in vdr concentration find in these patient .
regulation of b-cell commitment to plasma cell or to memory b cell .
during humoral immune response , b-lymphocyte activation be follow by differentiation along either the plasma cell pathway or the memory b-cell pathway .
recent study suggest that cd40-cd40 ligand , ox-ox40 ligand , a group of cytokine and intracellular transcriptional factor may all contribute to b-lymphocyte differentiation control .
induction of phosphatidylinositol turnover and egr-1 mrna expression by crosslinking of surface igm and igd in the human b cell line b104 .
we have previously show that a human b lymphoma cell line , b104 , express surface igm ( sigm ) and surface igd ( sigd ) , and that crosslinking of sigm and sigd by anti- igm antibody ( ab ) and anti- igd ab , respectively , induce ca2+ influx to almost the same degree , whereas only sigm -crosslinking cause b104 cell death .
here , we investigate the accumulation of cyclic amp ( camp ) , the hydrolysis of inositol phosphate , protein kinase c ( pkc ) activity and the induction of egr-1 and c-fos mrna expression by sigm- and sigd- crosslinking to examine difference in the signal mediate through sigm and sigd in b104 cell .
both sigm- and sigd- crosslinking with antibody induce elevation of camp level , phosphatidylinositol turnover , pkc activation and expression of egr-1 and c-fos mrna , although sigm -crosslinking be more effective than sigd -crosslinking , presumably due to the high expression of sigm than of sigd .
egr-1 mrna expression induce by sigm- and sigd- crosslinking be inhibit by h7 , erbstatin and genistein , but not by ha1004 .
erbstatin and genistein inhibit the sig-crosslinking-induced egr-1 mrna expression in a dose-dependent manner parallel to that observe in the inhibition of sig-crosslinking-induced protein tyrosine phosphorylation .
phorbol myristate acetate induce egr-1 mrna expression but forskolin and dibutyryl cyclic amp do not .
these finding suggest that the egr-1 mrna activating signal through sigm and sigd be protein tyrosine kinase- and pkc- dependent , but protein kinase a -independent .
cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 rescue b104 cell from death induce by anti-igm ab , but do not affect the expression of egr-1 and c-fos mrna , show that csa and fk506 affect signal transducer differently from or downstream to these molecule .
the difference in signal transduce through sigm and sigd in b104 cell be discuss .
the zinc finger transcription factor egr-1 be essential for and restrict differentiation along the macrophage lineage .
we have isolate cdna clone of myeloid differentiation primary response ( myd ) gene , activate in the absence of de novo protein synthesis follow induction for differentiation along either the macrophage or granulocyte lineage in human myeloblastic leukemia hl-60 cell .
one cdna clone of a primary response gene , express upon macrophage differentiation , encode for egr-1 , a zinc finger transcription factor .
the egr-1 gene be observe to be transcriptionally silent in hl-60 cell , but active in u-937 and m1 cell , the latter two be predetermine for macrophage differentiation .
egr-1 antisense oligomers in the culture medium block macrophage differentiation in both myeloid leukemia cell line and normal myeloblast .
hl-60 cell constitutively express an egr-1 transgene ( hl-60egr-1 ) could be induce for macrophage , but not granulocyte , differentiation .
these observation indicate that expression of egr-1 be essential for and restrict differentiation of myeloblast along the macrophage lineage .
regulation of the human interleukin-2 gene by the alpha and beta isoforms of the glucocorticoid receptor .
the immunosuppressive effect of glucocorticoid be largely due to transcriptional inhibition of immunologically relevant gene , such a the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene .
these effect be mediate by the intracellular glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) .
in human , alternative splicing of the gr precursor mrna give rise to two receptor isoforms , term gralpha and grbeta .
we previously demonstrate that grbeta could antagonize gralpha -mediated transactivation of a glucocorticoid- responsive element ( gre ) -driven reporter gene in cos-7 cell .
the present study be design to analyze the role of the two gr isoforms on glucocorticoid-mediated transrepression of the il-2 gene .
use a recently develop transfection technique , we demonstrate that in primary human lymphocyte , stimulation of a 548 bp il-2 promoter -luciferase reporter construct by phorbol ester and calcium ionophore be reverse by dexamethasone to a similar extent a in jurkat t lymphoma cell transfected with a gralpha expression vector .
transfection of a grbeta expression vector alone do not result in il-2 promoter repression in response to glucocorticoid .
furthermore , grbeta do not antagonize the repressive effect of gralpha on il-2 promoter activity .
surprisingly , overexpression of grbeta in jurkat cell do not cause significant inhibition of gralpha -induced transactivation of a gre-dependent luciferase reporter gene either .
we conclude that the transrepressive effect of glucocorticoid on il-2 gene transcription be exclusively mediate by gralpha .
grbeta can neither antagonize gralpha -mediated transactivation nor transrepression in jurkat cell , indicate a cell type-specific pattern of grbeta -mediated antiglucocorticoid activity .
activation of human macrophage by mechanical ventilation in vitro .
positive-pressure mechanical ventilation support gas exchange in patient with respiratory failure but be also responsible for significant lung injury .
in this study , we have develop an in vitro model in which isolate lung cell can be submit to a prolonged cyclic pressure-stretching strain resemble that of conventional mechanical ventilation .
in this model , cell culture on a silastic membrane be elongate up to 7 % of their initial diameter , correspond to a 12 % increase in cell surface .
the lung macrophage be identify a the main cellular source for critical inflammatory mediator such a tumor necrosis factor-alpha , the chemokines interleukin ( il ) -8 and -6 , and matrix metalloproteinase-9 in this model system of mechanical ventilation .
these mediator be measure in supernatant from ventilate alveolar macrophage , monocyte-derived macrophage , and promonocytic thp-1 cell .
nuclear factor-kappab be find to be activate in ventilate macrophage .
synergistic proinflammatory effect of mechanical stress and molecule such a bacterial endotoxin be observe , suggest that mechanical ventilation might be particularly deleterious in preinjured or infected lung .
dexamethasone prevent il-8 and tumor necrosis factor-alpha secretion in ventilate macrophage .
mechanical ventilation induce low level of il-8 secretion by alveolar type ii-like cell .
other lung cell type such a endothelial cell , bronchial cell , and fibroblast fail to produce il-8 in response to a prolonged cyclic pressure-stretching load .
this model be of particular value for explore physical stress-induced signaling pathway , as well a for test the effect of novel ventilatory strategy or adjunctive substance aim at modulate cell activation induce by mechanical ventilation .
positive and negative regulation of the composite octamer motif of the interleukin 2 enhancer by ap-1 , oct-2 , and retinoic acid receptor .
the differentiate agent retinoic acid ( ra ) have be previously report to interfere with 12-o-tetradecanoyl-phorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) / ca(2+) -induced signal for the regulation of the -96 to -66-bp octamer motif find in the enhancer for the interleukin ( il ) -2 gene , which encode a major t lymphocyte growth factor .
the il-2 octamer motif be a composite cis-element which bind oct-1 and oct-2 as well a a tpa / ca(2+) -inducible nuclear factor , previously term octamer-associated protein ( oap40 ) .
we show here that oct-2 , despite the presence of an active transcriptional activation domain , require tpa/ca(2+)-induced signal to strongly transactivate the il-2 octamer motif in jurkat t cell .
this oct-2 -dependent transactivation be inhibit by ra .
the presence of an intact cooh-terminal domain of oct-2 contribute to both tpa / ca(2+) -induced transactivation and the ra -mediated repression .
we also show that both fo and jun component of the ap-1 factor participate in the oap40 complex .
furthermore , transfected c-jun , jun-b , jun-d , c-fos , or fos-b expression vector partially substitute for tpa and ca2+ and cooperate with oct-2 for the transactivation of the combined oap/octamer cis-element .
mutation of the genuine octamer-binding site abrogate both the binding of oct-1 and oct-2 and the tpa / ca(2+) -induced transactivation of the oap /octamer motif .
oap confer to oct-2 responsivity to both tpa /ca2+ and ra , since specific mutation of the ap-1 / oap -binding site significantly reduce the transactivation by oct-2 in response to tpa and ca2+ and abolish the inhibition by ra .
furthermore , retinoic acid receptor ( rar ) alpha be able to inhibit in vitro the formation of the complex between the nuclear ap-1 /oap and it specific bind site , result in the interference with oct-2 -dependent cis-regulatory function of this ap-1 element .
therefore , we propose that the tpa / calcium -activated ap-1 /oap element be the main target of positive or negative regulatory signal influence the il-2 octamer motif , through synergism with oct-2 and antagonism by rar .
a pebp2 alpha/aml-1-related factor increase osteocalcin promoter activity through it binding to an osteoblast-specific cis-acting element .
to identify osteoblast-specific cis-acting element and trans-acting factor , we initiate an analysis of the promoter of a mouse osteocalcin gene , an osteoblast-specific gene .
in this promoter , we identify two osteoblast-specific cis-acting element ( ducy , p. and karsenty , g. ( 1995 ) mol.cell.biol.15 , 1858-1869 ) .
the sequence of one of these element , ose2 , be identical to the dna-binding site of the pebp2 alpha/aml-1 transcription factor , the mammalian homologues of the drosophila runt protein .
here we show , use nuclear extract , recombinant protein , and a specific antiserum against aml-1 protein in dna-binding assay , that one member of this family , aml-1b , bind specifically to ose2 and be immunologically related to osf2 , the factor present in osteoblast nuclear extract that bind to ose2 .
by dna cotransfection experiment , we also demonstrate that aml-1b can increase the activity of a short osteocalcin promoter through it binding to ose2 .
lastly , the different mobility of osteoblast nuclear extract-dna complex compare with t-cell nuclear extract-dna complex , along with the inability of osf2 to be upregulated by retinoic acid , unlike the other pebp2 alpha factor , suggest that osf2 be a new member of this family of transcription factor .
thus , this study demonstrate that aml-1b can increase gene expression of an osteoblast-specific gene through it binding to an osteoblast-specific cis-acting element and present evidence that osf2 be a member of the pebp2 alpha/aml-1 family of transcription factor .
interferon-gamma potentiate the antiviral activity and the expression of interferon-stimulated gene induce by interferon-alpha in u937 cell .
binding of type i interferon ( ifn-alpha/beta ) to specific receptor result in the rapid transcriptional activation , independent of protein synthesis , of ifn-alpha-stimulated gene ( isgs ) in human fibroblast and hela and daudi cell line .
the binding of isgf3 ( ifn-stimulated gene factor 3 ) to the conserve ifn-stimulated response element ( isre ) result in transcriptional activation .
this factor be compose of a dna-binding protein ( isgf3 gamma ) , which normally be present in the cytoplasm , and other ifn-alpha-activated protein which preexist a latent cytoplasmic precursor ( isgf3 alpha ) .
we have find that isg expression in the monocytic u937 cell line differ from most cell line previously examine .
u937 cell express both type i and type ii ifn receptor , but only ifn-alpha be capable of induce antiviral protection in these cell .
pretreatment with ifn-gamma potentiate the ifn-alpha -induced protection , but ifn-gamma alone do not have any antiviral activity .
isg15 mrna accumulation in u937 cell be not detectable before 6 h of ifn-alpha treatment , peak at 24 h , and require protein synthesis .
although ifn-gamma alone do not induce isg expression , ifn-gamma pretreatment markedly increase and hasten isg expression and transcriptional induction .
nuclear extract assay for the presence of isre binding factor by electrophoretic mobility shift assay show that isgf3 be induce by ifn-alpha within 6 h from undetectable basal level in untreated u937 cell .
activation of isgf3 alpha , the latent component of isgf3 , occur rapidly .
however , the increase in isgf3 activity ultimately correlate with the accumulation of isgf3 gamma induce by ifn-alpha or ifn-gamma .

interleukin-10 inhibit interferon-gamma-induced intercellular adhesion molecule-1 gene transcription in human monocyte .
interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) be a potent monocyte regulatory cytokine that inhibit gene expression of proinflammatory mediator .
in this study , we investigate the mechanism by which il-10 downregulates expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) on the cell surface of normal human monocyte activate with interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) .
il-10 inhibition of ifn-gamma -induced icam-1 expression be apparent as early a 3 hour and be block by an anti- il-10 antibody but not by an isotype-matched control antibody .
northern blot analysis show that il-10 reduce the accumulation of icam-1 mrna in ifn-gamma -stimulated monocyte .
il-10 inhibition of icam-1 steady-state mrna be detect at 3 hour and remain at 24 hour .
nuclear run-on transcription assay show that il-10 inhibit the rate of ifn-gamma -induced transcription of the icam-1 gene , and mrna stability study show that il-10 do not alter the half-life of ifn-gamma -induced icam-1 message .
thus , il-10 inhibit ifn-gamma -induced icam-1 expression in monocyte primarily at the level of gene transcription .
activation of ifn-gamma -responsive gene require tyrosine phosphorylation of the transcriptional factor stat-1alpha ( signal transducer and activator of transcription-1alpha ) .
however , il-10 do not affect ifn-gamma -induced tyrosine phosphorylation of stat-1alpha or alter stat-1alpha binding to the ifn-gamma response element ( ire ) in the icam-1 promoter .
instead , il-10 prevent ifn-gamma -induced binding activity at the nf-kappab site of the tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) -responsive nf-kappab /c-ebp composite element in the icam-1 promoter .
these data indicate that il-10 inhibit ifn-gamma -induced transcription of the icam-1 gene by a regulatory mechanism that may involve nf-kappab .
constitutive expression of p50 homodimer in freshly isolate human monocyte decrease with in vitro and in vivo differentiation : a possible mechanism influence human immunodeficiency virus replication in monocyte and mature macrophage .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replicate more efficiently in vitro in differentiate macrophage than in freshly isolate monocyte .
we investigate whether this may be partly explain by change in expression of nf-kappab with monocyte differentiation .
we demonstrate that constitutive expression of nf-kappab in primary human monocyte change significantly with differentiation in vitro to monocyte-derived macrophage ( mdms ) and differentiation in vivo to alveolar macrophage ( am ) .
freshly isolate monocyte constitutively express high level of transcriptionally inactive p50 homodimer which decrease with time in culture in favor of the transcriptionally active p50/p65 and p50/relb heterodimers .
a in mdms , am constitutively express p50/p65 and p50/relb although at low level .
hiv infection of fresh monocyte fail to induce p50/p65 a see in mdms .
the replacement of p50 homodimers with transcriptionally active heterodimers follow time in culture may partially explain the progressive increase in susceptibility of monocyte to hiv infection during in vitro culture .
the change in nf-kappab component with monocyte differentiation in vivo may also explain the different transcriptional activity of these cell population in hiv -infected individual .
simple derivation of tfiid-dependent rna polymerase ii transcription system from schizosaccharomyces pombe and other organism , and factor require for transcriptional activation .
resolution of whole cell extract through two chromatographic step yield a single protein fraction require only the addition of tfiid for the initiation of transcription at rna polymerase ii promoter .
this approach allow the convenient generation of rna polymerase ii transcription system from saccharomyces cerevisiae , human lymphocyte , and schizosaccharomyces pombe .
tfiids from all three organism be interchangeable among all three system .
the s. cerevisiae and sch. pombe system support effect of acidic activator protein , provide a further protein fraction from s. cerevisiae be supply .
this further fraction be distinct from the mediator of transcriptional activation describe previously and represent a second component in addition to general initiation factor that may facilitate a response to acidic activator .
of the gata-binding protein , only gata-4 selectively regulate the human il-5 gene promoter in il-5 producing cell which express multiple gata-binding protein .
interleukin-5 ( il-5 ) be produce by t lymphocyte and know to support b cell growth and eosinophilic differentiation of the progenitor cell .
use atl-16t cell which express il-5 mrna , we have identify a region , within the human il-5 gene promoter , that regulate il-5 gene transcription .
this cis-acting sequence contain the core binding motif , (a/t)gata(a/g) , for gata-binding family protein and thus suggest the involvement of these family member .
in this report , we describe the cloning of human gata-4 ( hgata-4 ) and show that hgata-4 selectively interact with the -70 gata site within the il-5 proximal promoter region .
by promoter deletion and mutation analysis , we establish this region a a positive regulatory element .
cotransfection experiment reveal that both hgata-4 and pma /a23187 stimulation be necessary for the il-5 promoter activation .
the requirement of another regulatory element call cle0 , which lie downstream of the -70 gata site , be also demonstrate .
atl-16t cell express mrna of three gata-binding protein , hgata-2 , hgata-3 and hgata-4 , and each of them have a potential to bind to the consensus (a/t)gata(g/_a) motif .
however , use atl-16t nuclear extract , we demonstrate that gata-4 be the only gata-binding protein that form specific dna-protein complex with the -70 gata site .
the electrophoretic mobility shift assay with extract of co cell express gata-binding protein show that gata-4 have the high binding affinity to the -70 gata site among the three gata-binding protein .
when the transactivation ability be compare among the three , gata-4 show the high activity .
these result demonstrate the selective role of gata-4 in the transcriptional regulation of the il-5 gene in a circumstance where multiple member of the gata-binding protein be express .
cytokine : shared receptor , distinct function .
that the signal transduction pathway use by the cytokine il-2 and il-15 be identical would suggest that these cytokine have redundant role in lymphoid development ; instead , il-2 be the guardian of thymus-derived t-cell homeostasis , while interleukin-15 promote extrathymic development of t and nk cell .
gata-3 -dependent enhancer activity in il-4 gene regulation .
previously , we analyze the proximal il-4 promoter in direct th2-specific activity .
an 800-base pair proximal promoter confer some th2-selective expression in transgenic mouse .
however , this region direct extremely low reporter mrna level relative to endogenous il-4 mrna , suggest that full gene activity require additional enhancer element .
here , we analyze large genomic il-4 region for enhancer activity and interaction with transcription factor .
the proximal il-4 promoter be only moderately augment by gata-3 , but certain genomic region significantly enhance gata-3 promoter transactivation .
some enhance region contain consensus , gata site that bind th2-specific complex .
however , retroviral transduction of gata-3 into develop t cell induce il-5 to full th2 level , but only partially restore il-4 production .
thus , we propose that gata-3 be permissive , but not sufficient , for full il-4 enhancement and may act through gata element surround the il-13 / il-4 gene locus .
pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , a potent inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation , prevent apoptosis in human promyelocytic leukemia hl-60 cell and thymocytes .
we examine the effect of pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) , which potently block the activation of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , on the induction of apoptosis by a variety of agent .
treatment of a human promyelocytic leukemia cell line , hl-60 , with 10 micrograms/ml etoposide or 2 microm 1-beta-d-arabinofuranosylcytosine induce nf-kappa b activation within 1 hr and subsequently cause apoptosis within 3-4 hr .
the simultaneous addition of 50-500 microm pdtc with these agent block nf-kappa b activation and completely abrogate both morphologically apoptotic change and internucleosomal dna fragmentation for up to 6 hr .
however , pdtc fail to inhibit the endonuclease activity contain in the whole cell lysates .
the inhibitory effect of pdtc be also observe in etoposide - and dexamethasone-induced apoptosis in human thymocytes at a concentration of 1-10 microm .
since pdtc have both antioxidant and metal-ion chelating activity , we test the effect of n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) ( antioxidant ) or o-phenanthroline ( op ) ( metal-ion chelator ) on the induction of apoptosis .
pretreatment of hl-60 cell or thymocytes with 100-500 microm op for 2 hr , but not 10-60 mm nac , suppress subsequent occurrence of apoptosis induce by etoposide .
these result suggest that the activation of nf-kappa b play an important role in the apoptotic process of human hematopoietic cell .
tissue-specific activity of the gammac chain gene promoter depend upon an ets binding site and be regulate by ga-binding protein .
the gammac chain be a subunit of multiple cytokine receptor ( interleukin ( il ) -2 , il-4 , il-7 , il-9 , and il-15 ) , the expression of which be restricted to hematopoietic lineage .
a defect in gammac lead to the x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency characterize by a block in t cell differentiation .
in order to well characterize the human gammac promoter and define the minimal tissue-specific promoter region , progressive 5'-deletion construct of a segment extend 1053 base pair upstream of the major transcription start site be generate and test for promoter activity in various hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cell type .
the -1053/+34 construct allow promoter activity only in cell of hematopoietic origin , and tissue specificity be conserve in all other construct test .
the region downstream of -90 appear critical for basal promoter activity .
it contain two potential ets binding site conserve in the murine gammac promoter gene , one of which be find essential for functional promoter activity a determine by mutational analysis .
the functional ets binding site be find to bind ets family protein , principally ga-binding protein and elf-1 and could be transactivated by gabpalpha and -beta synergistically .
these result indicate that , a already report for the il2rbeta promoter , ga-binding protein be an essential component of gammac basal promoter activity .
although gabp expression be not restricted to the hematopoietic lineage , it interaction with other specific factor may contribute to the tissue-specific expression of the gammac gene .
permanent occupancy of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 enhancer by nf-kappa b be need for persistent viral replication in monocyte .
this work aim to ascertain the role of kappab-responsive element of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) enhancer not only in early initiation but also in long-term maintenance of proviral transcription in cell of the monocytic lineage .
for this purpose , we use three main approach .
the first be to abruptly terminate tumor necrosis factor-induced nf-kappab bind to the enhancer sequence in u1 monocytic cell , use a short pulse of exogenous tumor necrosis factor .
this result in concomitant decrease in nuclear nf-kappab dna-binding activity and endogenous long terminal repeat transcriptional activity .
the second be to suppress the permanent nf-kappab translocation induce by hiv-1 replication itself in chronically infected u937 cell , use a specific proteasome inhibitor ( z-lll-h ) .
as early a 2 h after addition of the inhibitor to the culture medium , there be an inhibition of both constitutive activation of nf-kappab and hiv-1 genome expression .
the third approach be to monitor the replication competence in u937 cell of an infectious hiv-1 provirus carry point mutation in the kappab-responsive element of both long terminal repeat .
compare with it wild-type counterpart , this mutate provirus show a profoundly decrease , z-lll-h -insensitive transcriptional and replicative activity in u937 monocyte .
together , our result indicate that occupancy of the viral enhancer by nf-kappab ( p50/p65 ) heterodimers be require for ongoing transcription of integrate hiv provirus in monocyte , even in cell chronically infect and permanently produce functional hiv tat protein .
thus , the ability of hiv-1 replication to activate nf-kappab be crucial to the intense self-perpetuated viral transcription observe in cell of the monocytic lineage .
the peri-kappa b site mediate human immunodeficiency virus type 2 enhancer activation in monocyte but not in t cell .
human immunodeficiency virus type 2 ( hiv-2 ) , like hiv-1 , cause aid and be associate with aid case primarily in west africa .
hiv-1 and hiv-2 display significant difference in nucleic acid sequence and in the natural history of clinical disease .
consistent with these difference , we have previously demonstrate that the enhancer/promoter region of hiv-2 function quite differently from that of hiv-1 .
whereas activation of the hiv-1 enhancer follow t-cell stimulation be mediate largely through binding of the transcription factor nf-kappa b to two adjacent kappa b site in the hiv-1 long terminal repeat , activation of the hiv-2 enhancer in monocyte and t cell be dependent on four cis-acting element : a single kappa b site , two purine-rich bind site , pub1 and pub2 , and a pet site .
we have now identify a novel cis-acting element within the hiv-2 enhancer , immediately upstream of the kappa b site , designate peri-kappa b .
this site be conserve among isolates of hiv-2 and the closely related simian immunodeficiency virus , and transfection assay show this site to mediate hiv-2 enhancer activation follow stimulation of monocytic but not t-cell line .
this be the first description of an hiv-2 enhancer element which display such monocyte specificity , and no comparable enhancer element have be clearly define for hiv-1 .
while a nuclear factor ( s ) from both peripheral blood monocyte and t cell bind the peri-kappa b site , electrophoretic mobility shift assay suggest that either a different protein bind to this site in monocyte versus t cell or that the protein recognize this enhancer element undergo differential modification in monocyte and t cell , thus support the transfection data .
far , while specific constitutive binding to the peri-kappa b site be see in monocyte , stimulation with phorbol ester induce additional , specific binding .
understand the monocyte-specific function of the peri-kappa b factor may ultimately provide insight into the different role monocyte and t cell play in hiv pathogenesis .
vitamin e therapy of acute ccl4 -induced hepatic injury in mouse be associate with inhibition of nuclear factor kappa b binding .
oxidative stress , with reactive oxygen intermediate formation , may represent a common mechanism by which liver injury be induce by diverse etiology .
oxidative stress enhance nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activity , and nf-kappa b activity have be show to enhance the expression of cytotoxic cytokine .
acute hepatic injury cause by reactive oxygen intermediate production be induce by an intraperitoneal injection of ccl4 in mouse .
this injury be significantly inhibit by intravenous pretreatment of the mouse with a water-soluble emulsion of alpha-tocopherol .
alpha-tocopherol treatment of the mouse give the ccl4 also reduce the nf-kappa b binding to level approach those find in normal mouse .
in vitro treatment of a monocyte/macrophage cell line with ccl4 lead to enhance nf-kappa b binding and an increase in tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) messenger rna level .
liver specimen take from patient with acute fulminant hepatitis have markedly increase nf-kappa b binding activity in comparison with the binding of normal liver .
these data demonstrate that abolish acute hepatic injury with alpha-tocopherol , a free radical scavenger , also eliminate increase nf-kappa b binding .
it be tempting to speculate that enhance nf-kappa b expression cause by free radical production/oxidative stress may modulate liver injury , perhaps through an effect on cytotoxic cytokine synthesis .
fibrinogen activate nf-kappa b transcription factor in mononuclear phagocyte .
adhesion to extracellular matrix be know to modulate leukocyte activation , although the mechanism be not fully understand .
mononuclear phagocyte be expose to fibrinous provisional matrix throughout migration into inflammatory focus , so this study be undertake to determine whether fibrinogen trigger activation of nf-kappa b transcription factor .
u937 cell differentiate with pma in nonadherent culture be show to express two fibrinogen-binding integrins , predominately cd11b/cd18 , and to a less extent , cd11c/cd18 .
cell stimulate with fibrinogen ( 10-100 microg/ml ) /mn2+ ( 50 microm ) for 2 h be examine by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
nf-kappa b activation , minimal in unstimulated cell , be substantially up-regulated by fibrinogen .
fibrinogen also cause activation of ap-1 , but not sp1 or camp response element-binding protein ( creb ) factor .
blocking mabs against cd18 and cd11b abrogate fibrinogen -induced nf-kappa b activation .
to determine the effect on transcriptional regulation , u937 cell be transfected with a plasmid contain the hiv-1 enhancer ( bear two nf-kappa b site ) couple to a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) reporter .
cell be subsequently stimulate with 1 ) pma for 24 h , induce cat activity by 2.6-fold , 2 ) fibrinogen /mn2+ for 2 h , induce cat activity by 3.2-fold , or 3 ) costimulation with fibrinogen and pma , induce 5.7-fold the cat activity induce by pma alone .
we conclude that contact with fibrinogen -derived protein may contribute to mononuclear phagocyte activation by signaling through cd11b/cd18 , result in selective activation of transcriptional regulatory factor , include nf-kappa b .
activation of nf-kappa b in vivo be regulate by multiple phosphorylations .
the activation of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) in intact cell be mechanistically not well understood .
therefore we investigate the modification impose on nf-kappa b /i kappa b component follow stimulation and show that the final step of nf-kappa b induction in vivo involve phosphorylation of several member of the nf-kappa b /i kappa b protein family .
in hela cell as well a in b cell , tnf-alpha rapidly induce nuclear translocation primarily of p50-p65 , but not of c-rel .
both nf-kappa b precursor and i kappa b alpha become strongly phosphorylated with the same kinetics .
in addition to the inducible phosphorylation after stimulation , b lymphocyte contain constitutive nuclear nf-kappa b reveal constitutively phosphorylated p65 and i kappa b alpha .
phosphorylation be accompany by induce processing of the precursor p100 and p105 and by degradation of i kappa b alpha .
a an in vitro model we show that phosphorylation of p105 impede it ability to interact with nf-kappa b , a have be show before for i kappa b alpha .
surprisingly , even p65 , but not c-rel , be phosphorylated after induction in vivo , suggest that tnf-alpha selectively activate only specific nf-kappa b heteromers and that modification regulate not only i kappa b molecule but also nf-kappa b molecule .
in fact , cellular nf-kappa b activity be phosphorylation-dependent and the dna binding activity of p65 -containing nf-kappa b be enhance by phosphorylation in vitro .
furthermore , we find that the induction by hydrogen peroxide of nf-kappa b translocation to the nucleus , which be assume to be trigger by reactive oxygen intermediate , also coincide with incorporation of phosphate into the same subunit that be modify after stimulation by tnf-alpha .
thus , phosphorylation appear to be a general mechanism for activation of nf-kappa b in vivo .
suppression of signal require for activation of transcription factor nf-kappa b in cell constitutively express the htlv-i tax protein .
transient short-term expression of the tax protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type-i ( htlv-i ) lead to activation of the pleiotropic transcription factor nf-kappa b .
consistent with finding obtain with transient expression assay , we observe marked accumulation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b in the nucleus of namalwa b lymphoid cell , which constitutively express tax .
in contrast , nf-kappa b activity be not detect in the nucleus follow long-term expression of tax in jurkat t lymphocyte .
the ability of both mitogen and cytokine to activate nf-kappa b be also block in jurkat cell constitutively express tax .
however , the activation of other mitogen-inducible transcription factor , such a fo and jun , be unaffected .
thus , depend on the cellular environment , the short- and long-term effect of tax expression can be quite different .
consequently , one function of tax in cell infect with htlv-i might involve cell-type-specific suppression , a oppose to activation , of distinct signal pathway .
the cell line describe here should be useful for the delineation of signaling pathway utilize in the selective regulation of gene expression .
identification of essential gata and ets binding motif within the promoter of the platelet glycoprotein ib alpha gene .
platelet glycoprotein ( gp ) ib-ix-v be a multisubunit adhesion receptor that support platelet attachment to thrombogenic surface at site of vascular injury .
the congenital absence of the receptor result in a bleeding disorder associate with " giant " platelet , a condition link the expression of the complex to platelet morphogenesis .
to understand good the expression of the gp ib-ix-v complex , study be undertake to define the essential genetic element support the expression of the alpha-subunit of the complex ( gp ib alpha ) .
gp ib alpha promoter activity be evaluate by transfection of human erythroleukemia cell with reporter plasmid cod for the enzyme , luciferase .

in cell of nonhematopoietic lineage , human endothelial and hela cell , the gp ib alpha promoter activity be no great than background level obtain with promoterless construct .

the result define essential cis-acting element responsible for the expression of gp ib alpha and provide insight into molecular event coincide with the release of normal platelet into the bloodstream .
stat6 inhibit human interleukin-4 promoter activity in t cell .
the differentiation of naive t-helper ( th ) cell into cytokine -secreting effector th cell require exposure to multiple signal , include exogenous cytokine .
interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) play a major role in this process by promote the differentiation of il-4 -secreting th2 cell .
in th2 cell , il-4 gene expression be tightly control at the level of transcription by the coordinate binding of multiple transcription factor to regulatory element in the proximal promoter region .
nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) family member play a critical role in regulate il-4 transcription and interact with up to five sequence ( term p0 through p4 ) in the il-4 promoter .
the molecular mechanism by which il-4 induce expression of the il-4 gene be not know , although the il-4 -activated transcription factor signal transducer and activator of transcription 6 ( stat6 ) be require for this effect .
we report here that stat6 interact with three bind site in the human il-4 promoter by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
these site overlap the p1 , p2 , and p4 nfat element .
to investigate the role of stat6 in regulate il-4 transcription , we use stat6 -deficient jurkat t cell with different intact il-4 promoter construct in cotransfection assay .
we show that , whereas a multimerized response element from the germline ige promoter be highly induce by il-4 in stat6 -expressing jurkat cell , the intact human il-4 promoter be repress under similar condition .
we conclude that the function of stat6 be highly dependent on promoter context and that this factor promote il-4 gene expression in an indirect manner .
the c-rel protooncogene product repress nf-kappa b p65 -mediated transcriptional activation of the long terminal repeat of type 1 human immunodeficiency virus .
the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of the type 1 human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv-1 ) and the 5' regulatory region of the gene encode the interleukin 2 receptor alpha subunit ( il-2r alpha ) share functional kappa b enhancer element involve in the regulation of these inducible transcription unit during t-cell activation .
these kappa b enhancer element be recognize by a structurally related family of interactive protein that include p50 , p65 , and the product of the c-rel protooncogene ( c-rel ) .
recent biochemical study have show that p65 and p50 form the prototypical nf-kappa b complex , which be rapidly translocate from the cytoplasm to the nucleus during t-cell activation .
this intracellular signaling complex potently stimulate kappa b-directed transcription from either the hiv-1 ltr or the il-2r alpha promoter via the strong transactivation domain present in p65 .
we now demonstrate that nuclear expression of human c-rel , which be induce by either phorbol ester or tumor necrosis factor alpha with delay kinetics relative to p65 , markedly repress p65 -mediated activation of these transcription unit .
these inhibitory effect of c-rel correlate with it dna-binding activity but not with it ability to heterodimerize with p50 , suggest that c-rel inhibition involve competition with p50 /p65 for occupancy of the kappa b enhancer element .
together , these finding suggest that one function of c-rel be a a physiologic repressor of the hiv-1 ltr and il-2r alpha promoter , serve to efficiently counter the strong transcriptional activating effect of p65 .
hla-dma and hla-dmb gene expression function through the conserve s-x-y region .
the mhc class ii homologous protein hla-dma and hla-dmb function in the loading of peptide onto class ii molecule .
like the class ii gene , the hla-dm gene contain upstream regulatory sequence similar to the s-x-y regulatory region as well a additional putative regulatory site .
to determine whether the dm gene be regulate in a similar manner a class ii gene , a series of in vivo and in vitro analysis be perform .
deletion analysis show that expression from the dm promoter be dependent on the conserve s-x-y region .
the class ii-specific transcription factor rfx and ciita be also require for expression , a cell line deficient in these factor fail to allow transcription from the dm promoter .
in addition , in vivo footprint analysis show the putative x and y box to be occupy by transcription factor in wild-type b cell , but not in rfx -deficient b cell .
in astrocyte , ifn-gamma treatment induce increase occupancy of these site .
none of the other putative regulatory site be occupy in vivo , indicate that they may not be functional .
finally , gel shift analysis show synergistic complex formation between protein that bind to the putative x box of the dm gene , a be find for the dra gene .
therefore , the dm gene share a common mechanism of regulation with the class ii gene .
effect of il-10 and il-4 on lps-induced transcription factor ( ap-1 , nf-il6 and nf-kappa b ) which be involve in il-6 regulation .
interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) , like il-4 , be know to inhibit cytokine expression in activate human monocyte .
we show that both il-10 and il-4 inhibit lps-induced il-6 mrna and protein expression by inhibit the transcription rate of the il-6 gene .
the strong inhibition of the il-6 transcription rate prompt u to study the effect of il-10 and il-4 on the expression of transcription factor .
we question whether or not il-10 and il-4 affect the expression of transcription factor that be know to be involve in the control of the il-6 transcription rate , namely activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) , nuclear factor il-6 ( nf-il6 ) , and nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappab ) .
in electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsas ) we show that il-10 and il-4 inhibit lps-induced ap-1 binding activity .
the inhibiting effect of il-4 be slightly more pronounced than that of il-10 .
downregulation of lps-induced ap-1 be accompany , and thus possibly explain , by a reduce expression at mrna level of the two major component of the ap-1 complex , namely c-fos and c-jun a determine by northern experiment .
binding activity of nf-il6 be also strongly inhibit by il-4 whereas il-10 show no effect .
nf-il6 mrna level be not affect by il-10 or il-4 , suggest that il-4 affect binding activity of preexist nf-il6 .
neither il-10 nor il-4 inhibit lps-induced nf-kappa b binding activity .
in agreement with this finding , northern experiment where p65 and p105 mrna level be determine , demonstrate that expression of these component of the nf-kappa b transcription factor be not affect by il-10 or il-4 .
furthermore , neither il-10 nor il-4 show any effect on i-kappa b mrna expression a determine by northern experiment .
thus , il-10 and il-4 similarly affect il-6 expression .
however , for il-4 this be accompany with a reduction of ap-1 and nf-il6 binding activity whereas il-10 only inhibit ap-1 binding activity .
activation of transcription by binding of nf-e1 ( yy1 ) to a newly identify element in the first exon of the human dr alpha gene .
a previously unrecognized element , located downstream of the start site of transcription in the first exon of the dr alpha gene , have be define that enhance promoter activity up to eightfold in a position-dependent manner .

it be identify a nf-e1 ( yy1 ) .

interleukin 2 signaling involve the phosphorylation of stat protein .
one of the most important cytokine involve in immune response regulation be interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) , a potent activator of the proliferation and function of t lymphocyte and natural killer cell .
the mechanism by which the effect of il-2 be propagate within cell be not understand .
while the binding of il-2 to it receptor be recently show to lead to the activation of two kinase , jak-1 and jak-3 , subsequent step in the signaling pathway to the nucleus that lead to the activation of specific gene have not be characterize .
since many cytokine that activate jak kinase also lead to the tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of member of the stat family of transcription factor , the ability of il-2 to trigger stat phosphorylation be examine .
exposure of activate human t lymphocyte or of a natural killer cell line ( nkl ) to il-2 lead to the phosphorylation of stat1 alpha , stat1 beta , and stat3 , as well a of two stat-related protein , p94 and p95 .
p94 and p95 share homology with stat1 at the phosphorylation site and in the src homology 2 ( sh2 ) domain , but otherwise be immunologically distinct from stat1 .
these stat protein be find to translocate to the nucleus and to bind to a specific dna sequence .
these finding suggest a mechanism by which il-2 bind to it receptor may activate specific gene involve in immune cell function .
opposing effect of glucocorticoid on the rate of apoptosis in neutrophilic and eosinophilic granulocyte .
eosinophil and neutrophil be closely related , terminally differentiate cell that in vitro undergo constitutive cell death by apoptosis .
the onset of apoptosis in both cell type can be delay by hemopoietins and inflammatory mediator .
although there have be a number of report demonstrate that glucocorticoid ( in particular dexamethasone ) antagonize the eosinophil life-prolonging effect of hemopoietins , direct effect of dexamethasone on eosinophil apoptosis have not be document .
in this study we examine the direct effect of glucocorticoid on eosinophil and neutrophil apoptosis in light of their common therapeutic use a anti-inflammatory and anti-allergic /hypereosinophilic agent .
we find that treatment with dexamethasone induce eosinophil apoptosis .
in contrast , dexamethasone be a potent inhibitor of neutrophil apoptosis .
the effect of dexamethasone on both cell type be mediate through the glucocorticoid receptor , i.e. , it be abolish by the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist ru38486 .
this be the first description of an agent that promote eosinophil apoptosis while inhibit neutrophil apoptosis , and thus present a novel approach to the study of control of apoptosis in these closely related cell type as well a increase our understanding of the clinical action of glucocorticoid in inflammation .
infection and replication of tat-_human immunodeficiency virus : genetic analysis of ltr and tat mutation in primary and long-term human lymphoid cell .
tat be an essential regulatory protein for the replication of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) .
mutation in the tat gene have be show to block hiv replication in human t cell .
several study have establish that tat release an elongation block to the transcription of hiv long terminal repeat ( ltr ) ; however , it be not know whether this mechanism alone be sufficient to explain the block to hiv replication in human t cell when tat be absent .
it be possible that tat be also need for other function during hiv replication .
to test these hypothesis , we study several tat mutant , include two stop codon mutant and one deletion mutant use replication-competent hiv-1 construct carry wild-type or mutant ltrs with modification in the nf-kappa b and/or sp1 binding site .
in this study , we show that tat-_hiv-1 with wild-type ltrs can replicate in hela cell , and the virus produce from hela cell can infect primary peripheral blood lymphocyte and macrophage .
it be find that the propagation of the tat mutant contain wild-type ltrs be less efficient than that of the ltr-modified tat mutant .
large amount of viral rna and particle be synthesize in infection establish use the tat mutant that contain modify ltrs .
however , this efficient propagation of the ltr-modified tat mutant be restricted to some lymphoid cell line that have be transform with other virus .
thus , despite it essential role for release an elongation block , tat be not otherwise absolutely require for synthesis of full-length hiv transcript and assembly of virus particle .
direct sequencing of the viral genome and reinfection kinetics show no evidence of wild-type reversion even after prolonged infection with the tat -virus .
the implication for in vivo hiv-1 replication and potential application of this system to the study of alternative tat function be discuss .
the dna-binding property of two heat shock factor , hsf1 and hsf3 , be induce in the avian erythroblast cell line hd6 .
avian cell express three heat shock transcription factor ( hsf ) gene correspond to a novel factor , hsf3 , and homologs of mouse and human hsf1 and hsf2 .
analysis of the biochemical and cell biological property of these hsfs reveal that hsf3 have property in common with both hsf1 and hsf2 and yet have feature which be distinct from both .
hsf3 be constitutively express in the erythroblast cell line hd6 , the lymphoblast cell line msb , and embryo fibroblast , and yet it dna-binding activity be induce only upon exposure of hd6 cell to heat shock .
acquisition of hsf3 dna-binding activity in hd6 cell be accompany by oligomerization from a non-dna-binding dimer to a dna-binding trimer , whereas the effect of heat shock on hsf1 be oligomerization of an inert monomer to a dna-binding trimer .
induction of hsf3 dna-binding activity be delay compare with that of hsf1 .
a occur for hsf1 , heat shock lead to the translocation of hsf3 to the nucleus .
hsf exhibit the property of a transcriptional activator , a judge from the stimulatory activity of transiently overexpressed hsf3 measure by use a heat shock element-containing reporter construct and a independently assay by the activity of a chimeric gal4 -hsf3 protein on a gal4 reporter construct .
these result reveal that hsf3 be negatively regulate in avian cell and acquire dna-binding activity in certain cell upon heat shock .
erythropoietin stimulate transcription of the tal1/scl gene and phosphorylation of it protein product .
activation of the tal1 ( or scl ) gene , originally identify through it involvement by a recurrent chromosomal translocation , be the most frequent molecular lesion recognize in t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia .

these result indicate that epo act at both transcriptional and posttranscriptional level on the tal1 locus in friend virus -induced erythroblast and establish a link between epo signaling mechanism and a member of a family of transcription factor involve in the differentiation of diverse cell lineage .
cloning and characterization of the beta subunit of human proximal sequence element -binding transcription factor and it involvement in transcription of small nuclear rna gene by rna polymerase ii and iii .
the proximal sequence element ( pse ) -binding transcription factor ( ptf ) , which bind the pse of both rna polymerase ii - and rna polymerase iii -transcribed mammalian small nuclear rna ( snrna ) gene , be essential for their transcription .
we previously report the purification of human ptf , a complex of four subunit , and the molecular cloning and characterization of ptf gamma and delta subunit .
here we describe the isolation and expression of a cdna encode ptf beta , as well a functional study use anti- ptf beta antibody .
native ptf beta , in either protein fraction or a ptf-oct-1-dna complex , can be recognize by polyclonal antibody raise against recombinant ptf beta .
immunodepletion study show that ptf beta be require for transcription of both class of snrna gene in vitro .
in addition , immunoprecipitation analysis demonstrate that substantial and similar molar amount of tata-binding protein ( tbp ) and tfiiib90 can weakly associate with ptf at low salt condition , but this association be dramatically reduce at high salt concentration .
along with our previous demonstration of both physical interaction between ptf gamma / ptf delta and tbp and the involvement of tfiiib90 in the transcription of class iii snrna gene , these result be consistent with the notion that a tbp -containing complex related to tfiiib be require for the transcription of class iii snrna gene , and act through weak interaction with the four-subunit ptf .
identification of two novel regulatory element within the 5'-untranslated region of the human a gamma-globin gene .
interaction between the stage selector element ( sse ) in the proximal gamma-globin promoter and hypersensitivity site 2 in the locus control region partly mediate the competitive silencing of the beta-globin promoter in the fetal developmental stage .
we have now demonstrate that a second sse-like element in the 5'-untranslated region of the gamma-gene also contribute to this competitive silencing of the beta-gene .
utilize transient transfection assay in the fetal erythroid cell line , k562 , we have show that the core enhancer of hypersensitivity site 2 can preferentially interact with the proximal gamma-promoter in the absence of the sse , completely silence a link beta-promoter .
mutation of a 20-base pair sequence of the gamma-gene 5'-untranslated region ( utr ) lead to derepression of beta-promoter activity .
a marked activation of gamma-promoter activity be also observe with this mutation , suggest the presence of a repressor .
fine mutagenesis dissect these activity to different region of the 5'-utr .
the stage selector activity be localize to a region centered on nucleotide +13 to +15 .
electromobility shift assay utilize this sequence demonstrate binding of a fetal and erythroid -specific protein .
the repressor activity of the 5'-utr be localize to tandem gata-like site , which appear to bind a complex of two protein , one of which be the erythroid transcription factor gata-1 .
these result indicate that the 5'-utr of the gamma-gene contain sequence that may be important for it transcriptional and developmental regulation .
human t cell transcription factor gata-3 stimulate hiv-1 expression .
a family of transcriptional activate protein , the gata factor , have be show to bind to a consensus motif through a highly conserve c4 zinc finger dna binding domain .
one member of this multigene family , gata-3 , be most abundantly express in t lymphocyte , a cellular target for human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection and replication .
in vitro dnase i footprinting analysis reveal six hgata-3 binding site in the u3 region ( the transcriptional regulatory domain ) of the hiv-1 ltr .
cotransfection of an hgata-3 expression plasmid with a reporter plasmid whose transcription be direct by the hiv-1 ltr result in 6- to 10-fold stimulation of ltr -mediated transcription , whereas site specific mutation of these gata site result in virtual abrogation of the activation by hgata-3 .
far , deletion of the hgata-3 transcriptional activation domain abolish gata-dependent hiv-1 trans-activation , show that the stimulation of viral transcription observe be a direct effect of cotransfected hgata-3 .
introduction of the hiv-1 plasmid in which the gata site have be mutate into human t lymphocyte also cause a significant reduction in ltr -mediated transcription at both the basal level and in ( pha- plus pma- ) stimulated t cell .
these observation suggest that in addition to it normal role in t lymphocyte gene regulation , hgata-3 may also play a significant role in hiv-1 transcriptional activation .
disruption of a gata motif in the duffy gene promoter abolish erythroid gene expression in duffy-negative individual .
the mrna for the duffy blood group antigen , the erythrocyte receptor for the plasmodium vivax malaria parasite , have recently be clone and show to encode a widely express chemokine receptor .
here , we show that the duffy antigen/chemokine receptor gene ( darc ) be compose of a single exon and that most duffy-negative black carry a silent fy*b allele with a single t to c substitution at nucleotide -46 .
this mutation impair the promoter activity in erythroid cell by disrupt a bind site for the gata1 erythroid transcription factor .
with the recent characterization of the fy*a and fy*b allele , these finding provide the molecular basis of the duffy blood group system and an explanation for the erythroid-specific repression of the darc gene in duffy-negative individual .
activation of the interleukin 6 gene by mycobacterium tuberculosis or lipopolysaccharide be mediate by nuclear factor nf-il6 and nf-kappa b [ publish erratum appear in proc natl acad sci u s a 1995 apr 11 ; 92 ( 8 ) : 3632 ]
the host response to mycobacterium tuberculosis include granuloma formation at site of infection and systemic symptom .
cytokine have be identify by immunohistochemistry in granuloma in animal model of bacillus calmette-guerin ( bcg ) infection and be release by mononuclear phagocyte upon stimulation by mycobacterial protein .
in this regard , the cytokine interleukin 6 ( il-6 ) may play a role in the clinical manifestation and pathological event of tuberculosis infection .
we have demonstrate that lipoarabinomannan ( lam ) from the mycobacterial cell wall , which be virtually devoid of lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , stimulate mononuclear phagocyte to release il-6 in a dose-response manner .
lam and lp be potent inducer of il-6 gene expression in peripheral blood monocyte .
both lam - and lp -inducible il-6 promoter activity be localized to a dna fragment , position -158 to -49 , by deletion analysis and chloramphenicol acetyltransferase assay .
two nuclear factor nf-il6 ( position -153 to -145 and -83 to -75 ) and one nuclear factor nf-kappa b ( position -72 to -63 ) motif be present within this fragment .
site-directed mutagenesis of one or more of these motif within the il-6 promoter demonstrate that each have positive regulatory activity and that they could act in a function- and orientation-independent manner .
deletion of all three element abolish inducibility of il-6 promoter activity by both lam and lp .
we conclude that the nf-il6 and nf-kappa b site mediate il-6 induction in response to both lp and lam , act a bacterial or mycobacterial response element .

in 4 case , include 3 aml with immature morphology ( 1 aml -m0 and 2 aml -m1 ) and 1 all , the signal of the calm yacs be separate in interphase cell , indicate a translocation breakpoint within the calm region .

in all 3 case , a characteristic immunophenotype be identify ( cd4+ , cd13 - , cd33+ , cd65s+ ) .
af-10 be involve in 5 of 6 evaluable case , include 1 case without detectable calm or mll rearrangement .
