negative regulation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 expression in monocyte : role of the 65-kda plus 50-kda nf-kappa b dimer .
although monocytic cell can provide a reservoir for viral production in vivo , their regulation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) transcription can be either latent , restricted , or productive .
these difference in gene expression have not be molecularly define .
in thp-1 cell with restricted hiv expression , there be an absence of dna-protein binding complex formation with the hiv-1 promoter-enhancer associate with markedly less viral rna production .
this absence of binding be localized to the nf-kappa b region of the hiv-1 enhancer ; the 65-kda plus 50-kda nf-kappa b heterodimer be preferentially lose .
add purify nf-kappa b protein to nuclear extract from cell with restricted expression overcome this lack of binding .
in addition , treatment of these nuclear extract with sodium deoxycholate restore their ability to form the heterodimer , suggest the presence of an inhibitor of nf-kappa b activity .
furthermore , treatment of nuclear extract from these cell that have restricted expression with lipopolysaccharide increase viral production and nf-kappa b activity .
antiserum specific for nf-kappa b binding protein , but not c-rel-specific antiserum , disrupt heterodimer complex formation .
thus , both nf-kappa b -binding complex be need for optimal viral transcription .
binding of the 65-kda plus 50-kda heterodimer to the hiv-1 enhancer can be negatively regulate in monocyte , provide one mechanism restrict hiv-1 gene expression .
activation of primary human t-lymphocytes through cd2 plus cd28 adhesion molecule induce long-term nuclear expression of nf-kappa b .
stimulation of highly purify human t-cells via cd2 and cd28 adhesion molecule induce and maintain proliferation for more than 3 week .
this potent interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) -dependent activation do not require monocyte or accessory cell .
long-lasting il-2 receptivity be associate with high-level expression of the inducible il-2 receptor alpha chain ( il-2r alpha ) gene that be regulate at both transcriptional and posttranscriptional level .
increase of il-2r alpha gene transcription involve the enhance binding of the transcription factor nf-kappa b to it consensus sequence in the 5'-regulatory region of the il-2r alpha gene .
to dissect the molecular basis for the unusually persistent transcription of the il-2r alpha gene , we analyze nuclear nf-kappa b bind to a radiolabeled il-2r alpha kappa b-specific oligonucleotide probe during the time course of cd2 + cd28 activation .
rest t-cell nuclear extract contain kbf1/p50 homodimer .
after stimulation , two new kappa b-specific complex be identify a nf-kappa b p50-p65 heterodimer and putative c-rel homodimer or c-rel-p65 heterodimer .
both inducible complex persist for at least 3 week .
their relative level be very similar for the duration of proliferation .
in parallel , cd2 + cd28 activation trigger a significant intracellular thiol decrease , suggest that oxygen radical be involve in the signaling pathway of adhesion molecule .
finally , micromolar amount of pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , an oxygen radical scavenger that efficiently block the nuclear appearance of nf-kappa b in t-lymphocytes , also inhibit il-2 secretion , il-2r alpha cell surface expression , and t-cell proliferation .
together , these result suggest that nf-kappa b play an important role in long-term activation of human primary t-lymphocytes via cd2 + cd28 .
impaired cortisol binding to glucocorticoid receptor in hypertensive patient .
we compare glucocorticoid receptor binding characteristic and glucocorticoid responsiveness of human mononuclear leukocyte ( hml ) from hypertensive patient and match normotensive volunteer .
we also consider association of these variable with plasma renin activity , aldosterone , cortisol , corticotropin , and electrolyte concentration .
we calculate binding affinity ( kd ; nmol/l ) and capacity ( bmax ; sites/cell ) for dexamethasone and cortisol from homologous and heterologous competition curve for specific [3h]dexamethasone binding site on hml isolate from the blood of normotensive volunteer and subject with essential hypertension .
glucocorticoid responsiveness of hml be evaluate a ic50 value ( nmol/l ) for dexamethasone and cortisol for the inhibition of lysozyme release .
we measure plasma hormone by radioimmunoassay .
kd value ( mean+/-se ) for cortisol in hml of hypertensive patient be high than in control subject ( 24.6+/-2.4 versus 17.5+/-1.7 nmol/l , p < .04 ) .
binding capacity ( 4978+/-391 versus 4131+/-321 sites/cell ) , kd value for dexamethasone ( 6.7+/-0.5 versus 5.7+/-0.3 nmol/l ) , and ic50 value for dexamethasone ( 3.4+/-0.3 versus 3.1+/-0.2 nmol/l ) and cortisol ( 12.2+/-1.6 versus 9.5+/-0.3 nmol/l ) be not significantly different .
patient with renin value less than 0.13 ng angiotensin i/l per second be markedly less sensitive to cortisol than those with high value .
both kd ( 30.3+/-2.5 versus 19.2+/-2.4 nmol/l ) and ic50 value ( 15.5+/-1.8 versus 8.9+/-1.2 nmol/l ) for cortisol be significantly high in patient with low renin value ( p < .03 ) .
other variable , include plasma hormone and electrolyte value and binding characteristic for dexamethasone , be not different .
these data suggest that cortisol binding to glucocorticoid receptor be slightly impaired in patient with essential hypertension .
in vivo , this could lead to inappropriate binding of cortisol to mineralocorticoid receptor .
hence , decrease sensitivity to cortisol be associate with renin suppression .
this hypothesis be support by evidence of hypertension and low renin activity , which others have describe in patient with primary glucocorticoid resistance due to mutation of the glucocorticoid receptor .
expression of v-src in t cell correlate with nuclear expression of nf-kappa b .
nf-kappa b be a rapidly inducible transcriptional activator that respond to a variety of signal and influence the expression of many gene involve in the immune response .
protein tyrosine kinase transmit signal from cytokine and immune receptor .
very little information exist link these two important class of signal molecule .
we now demonstrate that v-src expression correlate with nuclear expression of a kappa b binding complex similar to that induce by phorbol ester and ionomycin , a detect by electrophoretic mobility shift assay use a variety of kappa b site .
this complex be block by the tyrosine kinase inhibitor , herbimycin a .
the v-src -induced complex comprise the p50 and p65 component of nf-kappa b , a determine by supershift and immunoblot analysis .
a a functional correlate of this finding , transient co-transfection of hiv-1 ltr reporter construct in a different t cell line demonstrate that v-src activate this promoter in a kappa b-dependent manner .
we find that transactivation of the hiv-1 ltr by v-src be more sensitive to mutation of the proximal , rather than the distal , kappa b element .
the implication for t cell receptor signaling and hiv-1 gene expression be consider .
autocrine activation by interferon-gamma of stat factor follow t cell activation .
the activation of t cell require engagement of the t cell receptor/cd3 complex and co-stimulatory molecule , and result in the triggering of several signaling pathway which lead rapidly to the nuclear translocation of several transcription factor , such a nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b and nf-at .
a result of this activation process be the induction of a number of gene , include those encode cytokine such a interleukin-2 , tumor necrosis factor-alpha , and interferon ( ifn ) -gamma which have important immunoregulatory effect .
we report here that a dna-binding factor contain stat1 also become activated in human peripheral blood t lymphocyte or jurkat cell , although not until 1-2 h after stimulation .
activation be delay a further 1-2 hr when mononuclear cell culture be stimulate by an antigen which require processing .
appearance of the stat1 factor be significantly reduce in the presence of cyclosporin a , and block by cycloheximide , indicate that it activation be dependent upon a protein ( s ) synthesize in response to initial signaling event .
neutralize antiserum against ifn-gamma , but not other cytokine test , block activation of the factor almost completely , and ifn-gamma be find in the culture supernatant of stimulate cell at level at which recombinant ifn-gamma could activate the factor in naive cell .
therefore , a stat1 transcription factor be activate by ifn-gamma synthesize and release upon stimulation of t lymphocyte population .
while jurkat cell both secrete and respond to ifn-gamma in an autocrine loop , it seem likely that the respond cell may differ from those synthesize this cytokine in the mononuclear cell culture in the light of the recent report that th1 cell lack the ifn-gamma receptor chain necessary for activation of stat1 ( pernis , a. , gupta , s. , gollob , k.j. , garfein , e. , coffman , r.l. , schindler , c. , and rothman , p. , science 1995 . 269 : 245 ) .
the role of early growth response gene 1 ( egr-1 ) in regulation of the immune response .
the induction of immediate early gene in cell of the immune system be critical to determine the ultimate outcome of exposure to antigen .
the importance of many of these gene relate to the role their transcription factor product play in dictate pattern of expression of downstream , function-related gene .
evidence from several system indicate that the immediate early gene , egr-1 may be of particular importance in the immune system .
recently , the egr-1 promoter have be show to be highly responsive to the diverse biochemical signal generate by antigen and cytokine in cell of the immune system .
furthermore , an important role for egr-1 in determine the differentiation pathway of myeloid cell precursor have be recently elaborate .
finally , potential target of regulation by the zinc-finger transcription factor encode by egr-1 include the interleukin-2 , cd44 , icam-1 , and tumor necrosis factor gene .
the role of egr-1 in regulation of the immune response will be discuss in the context of these recent study .
activation of the nf-kappab pathway by inflammatory stimulus in human neutrophil .
activate neutrophil have the ability to upregulate the expression of many gene , in particular those encode cytokine and chemokines , and to subsequently release the corresponding protein .
although little be know to date concern the regulation of gene transcription in neutrophil , it be noteworthy that many of these gene depend on the activation of transcription factor , such a nf-kappab , for inducible expression .
we therefore investigate whether nf-kappab /rel protein be express in human neutrophil , as well a their fate on cell activation .
we now report that dimer consist of p50 nfkappab1 , p65 rela , and/or c-rel be present in neutrophil and that the great part of these protein complex be physically associate with cytoplasmic ikappab-alpha in rest cell .
follow neutrophil stimulation with proinflammatory agonist ( such a lipopolysaccharide [ lp ] , tumor necrosis factor-alpha [ tnf-alpha ] , and fmet-leu-phe ) that induce the production of cytokine and chemokines in these cell , nf-kappab /rel protein translocate to nuclear fraction , result in a transient induction of nf-kappab dna binding activity , a determine in gel mobility shift assay .
the onset of both process be find to be closely parallel by , and dependent on , ikappab-alpha degradation .
proinflammatory neutrophil stimulus also promote the accumulation of ikappab-alpha mrna transcript , result in the reexpression of the ikappab-alpha protein .
to our knowledge , this constitute the first indication that nf-kappab activation may underlie the action of proinflammatory stimulus towards human neutrophil gene expression and , a such , add a new facet to our understanding of neutrophil biology .
alteration of a single serine in the basic domain of the epstein-barr virus zebra protein separate it function of transcriptional activation and disruption of latency .
the zebra protein from epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) activate a switch from the latent to the lytic expression program of the virus .
zebra , a member of the bzip family of dna-binding protein , be a transcriptional activator capable of induce expression from viral lytic cycle promoter .
it have previously be think that zebra 's capacity to disrupt ebv latency reside primarily in it ability to activate transcription of gene that encode product require for lytic replication .
we generate a point mutant of zebra , z ( s186a ) , that be not impaired in it ability to activate transcription ; however , this mutation abolish it ability to initiate the viral lytic cascade .
the mutant , contain a serine -to- alanine substitution in the dna-binding domain of the protein , bind to several known zebra -binding site and activate transcription from reporter bear known zebra -responsive promoter but do not disrupt latency in ebv -infected cell line .
therefore , initiation of the ebv lytic cycle by the zebra protein require a function in addition to transcriptional activation ; a change of serine 186 to alanine in the dna-binding domain of zebra abolish this additional function and uncover a new role for the zebra protein in disruption of ebv latency .
the additional function that be require for initiation of the lytic viral life cycle be likely to require phosphorylation of serine 186 of the zebra protein , which may influence either dna recognition or transcriptional activation of lytic viral promoter in a chromatinized viral episome .
activation of nuclear factor of activate t cell in a cyclosporin a -resistant pathway .
the mechanism of action of the immunosuppressive drug cyclosporin a ( csa ) be the inactivation of the ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent serine-threonine phosphatase calcineurin by the drug-immunophilin complex .
inactive calcineurin be unable to activate the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) , a transcription factor require for expression of the interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene .
il-2 production by csa -treated cell be therefore dramatically reduce .
we demonstrate here , however , that nfat can be activate , and significant level of il-2 can be produce by the csa -resistant cd28 -signaling pathway .
in transient transfection assay , both multicopy nfat - and il-2 promoter-beta-galactosidase reporter gene construct could be activate by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) /alpha- cd28 stimulation , and this activation be resistant to csa .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay show the induction of a csa -resistant nfat complex in the nuclear extract of peripheral blood t cell stimulate with pma plus alphacd28 .
peripheral blood t cell stimulate with pma /alphacd28 produce il-2 in the presence of csa .
collectively , these data suggest that nfat can be activate and il-2 can be produce in a calcineurin independent manner .
distinct signaling property identify functionally different cd4 epitope .
the cd4 coreceptor interact with non-polymorphic region of major histocompatibility complex class ii molecule on antigen-presenting cell and contribute to t cell activation .
we have investigate the effect of cd4 triggering on t cell activating signal in a lymphoma model use monoclonal antibody ( mab ) which recognize different cd4 epitope .
we demonstrate that cd4 triggering deliver signal capable of activate the nf-at transcription factor which be require for interleukin-2 gene expression .
whereas different anti-cd4 mab or hiv-1 gp120 could all trigger activation of the protein tyrosine kinase p56lck and p59fyn and phosphorylation of the shc adaptor protein , which mediate signal to ra , they differ significantly in their ability to activate nf-at .
lack of full activation of nf-at could be correlate to a dramatically reduce capacity to induce calcium flux and could be complement with a calcium ionophore .
the result identify functionally distinct epitope on the cd4 coreceptor involve in activation of the ra /protein kinase c and calcium pathway .
a cd28 -associated signaling pathway lead to cytokine gene transcription and t cell proliferation without tcr engagement .
stimulation of rest human t cell with the cd28 -specific mab bw 828 induce proliferation and cytokine synthesis without further requirement for tcr coengagement .
this observation prompt u to postulate that signal 2 ( costimulatory signal ) alone without signal 1 ( tcr signal ) can activate t cell .
to test whether this putative function of cd28 be mediate via a particular signaling pathway , we compare early signaling event initiate in rest t cell by the stimulatory mab bw 828 with signal trigger by the nonstimulating cd28 mab 9.3 .
stimulation of t cell with bw 828 induce an increase in intracellular ca2+ , but do not lead to detectable activation of the protein kinase p56(lck) and c-raf-1 .
this pathway result in the induction of the transcription factor nf-kappa b , nf-at , and protein bind to the cd28 response element of the il-2 promoter .
on the other hand , stimulation of t cell with mab 9.3 increase the level of intracellular ca2+ and trigger the activation of p56(lck) and c-raf-1 , but be unable to induce the binding of transcription factor to the il-2 promoter .
in contrast to the differential signaling of bw 828 and 9.3 in rest t cell , the two mabs exhibit a similar pattern of early signaling event in activate t cell and jurkat cell ( p56(lck) activation , association of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase with cd28 ) , indicate that the signaling capacity of cd28 change with activation .
these data support the view that stimulation through cd28 can induce some effector function in t cell and suggest that this capacity be associate with a particular pattern of early signaling event
nf-kappa b/rel family member regulate the icam-1 promoter in monocytic thp-1 cell .
a kappa b-site be identify in the promoter of the intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) gene , which be involve in regulation of icam-1 expression by tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) and glucocorticoid .
we now report on the transcription factor which bind and transactivate this enhancer sequence .
in vitro , the icam-1 kappa b site appear to bind rela and c-rel homodimers as well a heterodimers with nf-kappa b1 , but weakly nf-kappa b1 homodimers .
in addition , both rela and c-rel , but not nf-kappa b1 , be show to transactivate an icam-1 kappa b-reporter construct .
in monocytic thp-1 cell tnf-alpha induce two nuclear complex which in vitro bind to the icam-1 kappa b site .
use antibody in an electrophoretic mobility supershift assay , one of these complex be show to contain nf-kappa b1 and rela , and to bind with high affinity to the consensus kappa b site in the hiv long terminal repeat .
the second complex contain rela , and exhibit high affinity towards the icam-1 kappa b than to the hiv kappa b site .
the glucocorticoid receptor be show to repress activity of both the rela homodimer and the nf-kappa b1 /rela heterodimer .
we argue that in vivo rela homodimers be likely to play a dominant role in tnf-alpha -induced icam-1 transcription in monocytic cell .
oca-b be a functional analog of vp16 but target a separate surface of the oct-1 pou domain [ publish erratum appear in mol cell biol 1998 apr ; 18 ( 4 ) : 2430 ]
oca-b be a b-cell-specific coregulator of the broadly express pou domain transcription factor oct-1 .
oca-b associate with the oct-1 pou domain , a bipartite dna-binding structure contain a pou-specific ( pou[s] ) domain join by a flexible linker to a pou homeodomain ( pou[h] ) .
here , we show that oca-b alter the activity of oct-1 in two way .
it provide a transcriptional activation domain which , unlike oct-1 , activate an mrna-type promoter effectively , and it stabilize oct-1 on the oct-1 -responsive octamer sequence atgcaaat .
these property of oca-b parallel those display by the herpes simplex virus oct-1 coregulator vp16 .
oca-b , however , interact with a different surface of the dna-bound oct-1 pou domain , interact with both the pou(s) and pou(h) domain and the center of the atgcaaat octamer sequence .
the oca-b and vp16 interaction with the oct-1 pou domain be sufficiently different to permit oca-b and vp16 to bind the oct-1 pou domain simultaneously .
these result emphasize the structural versatility of the oct-1 pou domain in it interaction with coregulators .
activation of nuclear factor kappa b in human neuroblastoma cell line .
the nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be a eukaryotic transcription factor .
in b cell and macrophage it be constitutively present in cell nucleus , whereas in many other cell type , nf-kappa b translocate from cytosol to nucleus a a result of transduction by tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) , phorbol ester , and other polyclonal signal .
use neuroblastoma cell line a model , we have show that in neural cell nf-kappa b be present in the cytosol and translocate into nucleus a a result of tnf alpha treatment .
the tnf alpha -activated nf-kappa b be transcriptionally functional .
nf-kappa b activation by tnf alpha be not correlate with cell differentiation or proliferation .
however , reagent such a nerve growth factor ( ngf ) and the phorbol ester phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) , which induce phenotypical differentiation of the sh-sy5y neuroblastoma cell line , activate nf-kappa b , but only in that particular cell line .
in a ngf -responsive rat pheochromocytoma cell line , pc12 , pma activate nf-kappa b , whereas ngf do not .
in other neuroblastoma cell line , such a sk-n-be(2) , the lack of pma induction of differentiation be correlate with the lack of nf-kappa b activation .
we find , moreover , that in sk-n-be(2) cell protein kinase c ( pkc ) enzymatic activity be much low compare with that in a control cell line and that the low pkc enzymatic activity be due to low pkc protein expression .
nf-kappa b be not activate by retinoic acid , which induce morphological differentiation of all the neuroblastoma cell line use in the present study .
thus , nf-kappa b activation be not require for neuroblastoma cell differentiation .
furthermore , the result obtain with tnf alpha prove that nf-kappa b activation be not sufficient for induction of neuroblastoma differentiation .
obf-1 , a novel b cell-specific coactivator that stimulate immunoglobulin promoter activity through association with octamer-binding protein .
recent biochemical and genetic study indicate that in addition to the octamer-binding protein oct-1 and oct-2 , other b cell component be require for lymphoid-restricted , octamer site-mediated immunoglobulin gene promoter activity .
use a genetic screen in yeast , we have isolate b cell-derived cdna encoding oct-binding factor 1 ( obf-1 ) , a novel protein that specifically associate with oct-1 and oct-2 .
biochemical study demonstrate that obf-1 have no intrinsic dna-binding activity and recognize the pou domain of oct-1 and oct-2 , but not those of oct-4 and oct-6 .
the obf-1 mrna be express in a highly cell-specific manner , be most abundant in b cell and essentially absent in most of the other cell or tissue test .
furthermore , expression of obf-1 in hela cell selectively stimulate the activity of a natural immunoglobulin promoter in an octamer site -dependent manner .
thus , obf-1 have all the property expect for a b cell-specific transcriptional coactivator protein .
a negative regulatory region contain a glucocorticosteroid response element ( ngre ) in the human interleukin-1beta gene .
interleukin-1 beta ( il-1beta ) be one of the most important inflammatory mediator in human inflammatory and immunological disease .
the regulation of human il-1beta gene expression have be study for several year , and a few regulatory element have be discover in the promoter region .
however , little be know about negative regulation of il-1beta expression at the transcriptional level , which may play an important role in anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effect .
we have identify a negative regulatory element located in the region between -685 and -395 .
within this region , a 19-bp nuclear factor binding site ( -570 to -552 ) be characterize by dnase i footprinting and electromobility shift assay .
a consensus sequence for a negative glucocorticoid response element ( ngre ) and a transcription activator protein-2 binding site be note within this footprint .
functional study show a 2.5-fold increase in promoter activity when this 19-bp bind site be delete in the reporter construct il-1beta /cat and il-1beta /sv40 promoter /cat .
dexamethasone ( 10(-8) m ) repress chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) production by 75 % in the wild-type fragment but not in a deletion mutant lack the 19-bp site .
a protein of about 150 kd that bind to this negative regulatory sequence be identify by uv cross-linking .
this be the first description of a negative regulatory region responsive to glucocorticoid in a cytokine gene .
characterization of 5' end of human thromboxane receptor gene .
organizational analysis and mapping of protein kinase c -- responsive element regulate expression in platelet .
platelet thromboxane receptor be acutely and reversibly upregulated after acute myocardial infarction .
to determine if platelet thromboxane receptor be under transcriptional control , we isolate and characterize human genomic dna clone contain the 5' flanking region of the thromboxane receptor gene .
the exon-intron structure of the 5' portion of the thromboxane receptor gene be determine initially by compare the nucleotide sequence of the 5' flanking genomic clone with that of a novel human uterine thromboxane receptor cdna that extend the mrna 141 bp far upstream than the previously identify human placental cdna .
a major transcription initiation site be located in three human tissue approximately 560 bp upstream from the translation initiation codon and 380 bp upstream from any previously identify transcription initiation site .
the thromboxane receptor gene have neither a tata nor a caat consensus site .
promoter function of the 5' flanking region of the thromboxane receptor gene be evaluate by transfection of thromboxane receptor gene promoter/ chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) chimera plasmid into platelet-like k562 cell .
thromboxane receptor promoter activity , a assess by cat expression , be relatively weak but be significantly enhance by phorbol ester treatment .
functional analysis of 5' deletion construct in transfected k562 cell and gel mobility shift localize the major phorbol ester -responsive motif in the thromboxane receptor gene promoter to a cluster of activator protein-2 ( ap-2 ) binding consensus site located approximately 1.8 kb 5' from the transcription initiation site .
these study be the first to determine the structure and organization of the 5' end of the thromboxane receptor gene and demonstrate that thromboxane receptor gene expression can be regulate by activation of protein kinase c via induction of an ap-2 -like nuclear factor bind to upstream promoter element .
these finding strongly suggest that the mechanism for previously describe upregulation of platelet thromboxane receptor after acute myocardial infarction be increase thromboxane receptor gene transcription in platelet-progenitor cell .
activation of jak3 , but not jak1 , be critical for il-2 -induced proliferation and stat5 recruitment by a cooh-terminal region of the il-2 receptor beta-chain .
a number of cytokine and growth factor use the jak -stat pathway to signal from the cell membrane to the nucleus .
while homodimerizing cytokine receptor may transmit signal via a single form of jak ( i.e. growth hormone receptor ) , several multicomponent cytokine receptor have be show to require simultaneous activation of pair of different jak kinase ( i.e. interferon receptor ) .
recent evidence for a preferential coupling of jak3 to interleukin-2 receptor-gamma ( il-2r gamma ) and jak1 to il-2r beta support the concept of heterotrans-activation of jak1 and jak3 cause by il-2 -induced heterodimerization of their receptor partner .
the present study verify the ability of il-2 to cause tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of jak1 and jak3 , but demonstrate that il-2 stimulate jak3 to a significantly large extent than jak1 in human t lymphocyte and the yt cell line .
this conclusion be base upon several independent criterion , include more vigorous tyrosine phosphorylation of jak3 , more marked enzymatic activation of jak3 as well a high abundance of jak3 in activate il-2 receptor complex .
furthermore , when human il-2r beta be stably express in murine ba/f3 cell , robust il-2 -induced proliferation and jak3 activation occur without detectable involvement of either jak1 , jak2 or tyk2 .
we therefore propose that il-2 receptor signal transduction do not depend on equimolar heterodimerization of jak1 and jak3 follow il-2 -induced heterodimerization of il-2r beta and il-2r gamma .
nonetheless , a membrane-proximal region of human il-2r beta ( asn240-leu335 ) be critical for jak3 activation , and the amount of jak3 present in activate il-2 receptor complex increase with time , suggest that stabilization of jak3 binding to the receptor complex rely on both il-2r beta and il-2r gamma .
moreover , stat5 be find to be the predominant stat transcription factor use by il-2 in human t cell , and specifically require a cooh-terminal region of il-2r beta ( ser386-val525 ) , while stat5 recruitment be not correlate to activation of il-2r gamma or jak3 .
glucocorticoid receptor in mononuclear cell of patient with sepsis .
glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) hormone-binding activity be study by a whole-cell method in mononuclear cell ( mnc ) from peripheral blood of 7 patient during the hemodynamic compensatory phase of sepsis .
4 patient be receive dopamine , which do not affect the gr count .
the patient ' plasma cortisol concentration be normal or slightly elevated .
despite a wide range , the mean gr count and affinity in mnc from septic patient do not differ from those in normal control , suggest that glucocorticoid could still be effective in the hemodynamic compensatory phase of sepsis .
stimulation of interferon beta gene transcription in vitro by purify nf-kappa b and a novel th protein .
the human interferon beta ( ifn-beta ) regulatory element consist of multiple enhanson domain which be target for transcription factor involve in inducible expression of the promoter .
to far characterize the protein-dna interaction mediate ifn-beta induction , positive regulatory domain ( prd ) ii binding protein be purify from phorbol ester induced jurkat t-cells and from ifn prim , cycloheximide/polyinosinic-polycytidylic acid treat hela s3 cell .
from hela cell , two major protein of 52 and 45 kilodaltons ( kd ) copurified with dna binding activity , whereas from t-cells , four protein -- a major protein of 52 kd and three minor protein of 82 , 67 , and 43-47 kd -- be purify .
also , an induction specific dna binding protein be purify from hela cell that interact with the ( aagtga ) 4 tetrahexamer sequence and the prdi domain .
this protein be immunologically distinct from irf-1/isgf2 .
uninduced or sendai virus induced hela extract be use to examine transcription in vitro use a series of ifn beta promoter deletion .
deletion upstream of the prdii element increase transcription in the uninduced extract , indicate predominantly negative regulation of the promoter .
a 2-4-fold increase in ifn-beta promoter transcription be observe in sendai virus induced extract , and deletion of prdi and prdii element decrease this induce level of transcription .
when purify prdii and tetrahexamer binding protein be add to the induce extract , a 4-fold increase in transcription be observe .
these experiment demonstrate that it be possible to modulate ifn-beta transcription in vitro but indicate that additional protein may be require to fully activate ifn-beta transcription .
cloning of the novel human myeloid-cell-specific c/ebp-epsilon transcription factor .
chicken nf-m transcription factor , in cooperation with either c-myb or v-myb , be active in the combinatorial activation of myeloid-cell-specific gene in heterologous cell type , such a embryonic fibroblast .
in human , similar effect be observe with homologous member of the ccaat/enhancer-binding protein ( c/ebp ) family of transcriptional regulator , especially the human homolog of chicken nf-m , c/ebp-beta ( nf-il6 ) .
however , the nf-il6 gene be express in a variety of nonmyeloid cell type and be strongly inducible in response to inflammatory stimulus , make it an unlikely candidate to have an exclusive role a a combinatorial differentiation switch during myelopoiesis in human cell .
by use a reverse transcription-pcr-based approach and a set of primer specific for the dna-binding domain of highly homologous member of the c/ebp family of transcriptional regulator , we have clone a novel human gene encode a member of the c/ebp gene family , identify a the human homolog of crp1 , c/ebp-epsilon .
a 1.2-kb cdna encode full-length human c/ebp-epsilon be clone from a promyelocyte-late myeloblast-derived lambda gt11 library .
molecular analysis of the cdna and genomic clone indicate the presence of two exon encode a protein with an apparent molecular mass of 32 kda and a pi of 9.5 .
primer extension analysis of c/ebp-epsilon mrna detect a single major transcription start site approximately 200 bp upstream of the start codon .
the putative promoter area be similar to those of several other myeloid-cell-specific gene in that it contain no tataaa box but have a number of purine-rich stretch with multiple site for the factor of the ets family of transcriptional regulator .
northern blot analysis indicate a highly restricted mrna expression pattern , with the strong expression occur in promyelocyte and late-myeloblast-like cell line .
western blot and immunoprecipitation study use rabbit anti-c/ebp-epsilon antibody raise against the n-terminal portion of c/ebp-epsilon ( amino acid 1 to 115 ) show that c/ebp-epsilon be a 32-kda nuclear phosphoprotein .
the human c/ebp-epsilon protein exhibit strong and specific binding to double-stranded dna contain consensus c/ebp site .
cotransfection of the c/ebp-epsilon sense and antisense expression construct together with chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter vector contain myeloid-cell-specific c-mim and human myeloperoxidase promoter suggest a role for c/ebp-epsilon transcription factor in the regulation of a subset of myeloid-cell-specific gene .
transient tranfection of a promyelocyte cell line ( nb4 ) with a c/ebp-epsilon expression plasmid increase cell growth by sevenfold , while antisense c/ebp-epsilon cause a fivefold decrease in clonal growth of these cell .
dna-binding phosphoprotein induce after t cell activation : effect of cyclosporin a .
to define novel protein involve in the early transcriptional response during the activation of human t lymphocyte , we use a high-resolution , two-dimensional gel electrophoresis system to identify nuclear , deoxyribonucleic acid ( dna ) binding protein exhibit rapid change in phosphorylation follow cell stimulation .
we identify 18 nuclear protein whose phosphorylation level change more than 5-fold upon activation .
of these , 11 be find to possess dna-binding property .
the 11 phosphoprotein with dna-binding activity , along with 4 others , be analyze far .
phosphoamino acid analysis reveal several set of protein with different phosphorylated residue kinetic analysis of the phosphorylation of the select protein be perform and reveal a complex group of transient and sustained response to cell activation .
finally , the activation-induced change in one set of phosphoprotein be dramatically inhibit by cyclosporin a .
we suggest that these phosphoprotein may be directly involve in regulate the transcriptional response to cellular activation by external stimulus .
nucleolin be one component of the b cell-specific transcription factor and switch region binding protein , lr1 .
lr1 be a b cell-specific , sequence-specific dna binding activity that regulate transcription in activate b cell .
lr1 also bind ig heavy chain switch region sequence and may function in class switch recombination .
lr1 contain two polypeptide , of 106 kda and 45 kda , and here we report that the 106-kda component of lr1 be nucleolin .
this identification , initially make by microsequence analysis , be verify by show that ( i ) lr1 -dna binding activity increase in b cell transfected with a nucleolin cdna expression construct ; ( ii ) lr1 -dna binding activity be recognize by antibody raise against recombinant human nucleolin ; and ( iii ) in b cell transfected with epitope-tagged nucleolin expression construct , the lr1 -dna complex be recognize by the anti-tag antibody .
nucleolin be an abundant nucleolar protein which be believe to play a role in rdna transcription or organization , or rrna processing .
homology between nucleolin and histone h1 suggest that nucleolin may alter dna organization in response to cell cycle control , and the nucleolin component of lr1 may therefore function to organize switch region before , during , or after switch recombination .
the demonstration that nucleolin be a component of a b cell-specific complex that bind switch region sequence suggest that the g-rich switch region may have evolve from rdna .
attenuation of hla-dr expression by mononuclear phagocyte infect with mycobacterium tuberculosis be related to intracellular sequestration of immature class ii heterodimers .
mhc class ii expression be examine in macrophage infect with mycobacterium tuberculosis .
ifn-gamma increase the surface expression of class ii molecule in thp-1 cell and this be markedly reduce in cell infect with m. tuberculosis .
despite this effect , steady state level of hla-dralpha , hla-drbeta , and invariant ( ii ) chain be equivalent in control and infected cell .
metabolic labeling combine with pulse-chase experiment and biochemical analysis show that the majority of class ii molecule in infected cell become resistant to endoglycosidase h , consistent with normal golgi processing .
however , result of intracellular staining and dual color confocal microscopy reveal a significant defect in transport of newly synthesize class ii molecule through the endocytic compartment .
thus , compare with finding in control cell , class ii molecule in infected cell colocalized to a minimal extent with a lysosomal-associated membrane protein-1 + endosomal compartment .
in addition , in contrast to control cell , class ii molecule in infected cell fail to colocalize with endocytosed bsa under condition where this marker be know to label late endosomes , lysosome , and the mhc class ii compartment .
consistent with defective transport along the endocytic pathway , the maturation of sds-stable class ii alphabeta dimer -- dependent upon removal of ii chain and peptide loading of class ii dimer in the mhc class ii compartment -- be markedly impaired in m. tuberculosis -infected cell .
these finding indicate that defective transport and processing of class ii molecule through the endosomal/lysosomal system be responsible for diminish cell surface expression of mhc class ii molecule in cell infect with m. tuberculosis .
modulation of the expression of the ifn-gamma receptor beta-chain control responsiveness to ifn-gamma in human peripheral blood t cell .
ifn-gamma have potent antiproliferative and apoptotic effect in t cell that be important in determine t cell development and polarize differentiation .
therefore , any event that enable t cell to become less responsive to ifn-_gamma may potentially alter immune responsiveness to ag .
in this work , we show that human peripheral blood t cell that be stimulate through the tcr and expand with il-2 be unresponsive to ifn-gamma , a determine by a lack of activation of jak kinase and the transcription factor , stat1 ( alpha ) , a signal transducer and activator of transcription .
this nonresponsiveness occur because of a lack of expression of the beta-_chain ( accessory factor ) of the ifn-gamma receptor , while at the same time maintain ifn-gamma receptor alpha-chain expression .
expression of the beta-chain can be restore by secondary tcr ligation or pma treatment .
t cell blast treat with pma be now responsive to ifn-gamma .
when freshly isolate , highly enriched ( > 98 % ) t cell be examine for ifn-gamma responsiveness ; these cell can respond to ifn-gamma and express beta-chain .
therefore , a t cell progress from primary tcr activation through il-2 -dependent proliferation , follow by secondary tcr stimulation , their responsiveness to ifn-gamma vary , and this may affect their ability to participate in an ongoing immune response .
the interleukin 2 receptor alpha chain /cd25 promoter be a target for nuclear factor of activate t cell .
the expression of the murine interleukin ( il ) -2 receptor alpha chain /cd25 be strongly induce at the transcriptional level after t cell activation .
we show here that nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) factor be involve in the control of cd25 promoter induction in t cell .
nf-atp and nf-atc bind to two site around position -585 and -650 located upstream of the proximal cd25 promoter .
immediately 3' from these nf-at motif , nonconsensus site be located for the binding of ap-1 -like factor .
mutation of site that suppress nf-at binding impair the induction and strong nf-atp -mediated transactivation of the cd25 promoter in t cell .
in t lymphocyte from nf-atp -deficient mouse , the expression of cd25 be severely impaired , lead to a delay il-2 receptor expression after t cell receptor ( tcr ) / cd3 stimulation .
our data indicate an important role for nf-at in the faithful expression of high affinity il-2 receptor and a close link between the tcr -mediated induction of il-2 and il-2 receptor alpha chain promoter , both of which be regulate by nf-at factor .
lipopolysaccharide -induced e-selectin expression require continuous presence of lp and be inhibit by bactericidal/permeability-increasing protein .
endothelial cell stimulate by lp express e-selectin , which play an important role in mediate neutrophil adhesion during inflammation .
e-selectin be induce within 1-2 h , peak at 4-6 h , and gradually return to basal level by 24 h .
rbpi21 , a recombinant n-terminal fragment of human bactericidal/permeability-increasing protein ( bpi ) , inhibit lp -induced e-selectin expression when add at the same time a , and up to 6 h after , lp .
delay administration of rbpi21 also affect lp -mediated activation of the nuclear factor , nf-kappa b .
two to 4 h follow lp addition to endothelial cell , when nf-kappa b be already activate , addition of rbpi21 result in marked reduction of nf-kappa b detectable at 4 or 6 h .
these result indicate that endothelial activation require continuous presence of lp , and rbpi21 act to reverse lp -mediated endothelial activation by interrupt the on-going lp signal .
differentiation of u-937 promonocytic cell by etoposide and icrf-193 , two antitumour dna topoisomerase ii inhibitor with different mechanism of action .
we have compare the action on u-937 human promonocytic leukemia cell of two dna topoisomerase ii inhibitor , namely the epipodophyllotoxin etoposide and the bisdioxopiperazine icrf-193 .
one hour pulse-treatment with 3 microm etoposide cause topoisomerase associated , primary dna breakage , which be rapidly follow by apoptosis .
by contrast , these effect be not observe upon pulse-treatment with 6 microm icrf-193 .
however , continuous treatment with subcytotoxic concentration of etoposide ( 0.15 microm ) and icrf-193 ( 0.3 microm ) produce several similar effect , namely decrease cell proliferation , accumulation of cell at g2 , increase in cell mass , and induction of differentiation .
under these condition , etoposide produce a biphasic activation of protein kinase c , which consist in an early transient activation ( from hour 1 to 6 ) of the membrane-bound enzyme follow by a late activation ( hour 48 ) of the total , membrane-bound and cytosolic enzyme .
by contrast , icrf-193 only provoke a late activation ( from hour 72 to 96 ) of the total enzyme .
when use at differentiation-inducing concentration , both topoisomerase inhibitor cause a great stimulation of ap-1 binding activity , with maximum value at hour 12 in etoposide -treated cell and at hour 48 in icrf-193 -treated cell .
by contrast , the binding activity of the nf-kappa ( b ) and egr-1 transcription factor be little affect .
it be conclude that topoisomerase ii inhibitor may induce the differentiation of promonocytic cell , independently of their capacity to cause dna strand break .
however , there be other effect , such a the early activation of protein kinase c , which be probably derive from the production of primary dna breakage by some anti- topoisomerase drug .
sequential development of structural and functional alteration in t cell from tumor-bearing mouse .
the tcr alpha beta or -gamma delta chain bind the peptide ligand , whereas the associate cd3 delta epsilon gamma and tcr zeta subunit couple the tcr to intracellular signal transduction component .
recently , several group have describe marked alteration in signal transduction element in t cell from cancer patient or in mouse bear tumor for a few week ( > 26 day ) .
the sequence in which these alteration develop be unknown .
the aim of this study be to explore the kinetics of the development of alteration in signal transduction molecule ( tcr zeta chain , nf kappab family protein , and tyrosine kinase p56 ( lck ) ) in mouse bear mc38 colon adenocarcinoma .
the result demonstrate that alteration in nf kappab family protein , specifically the failure of p65 translocation to the nucleus , occur earlier and more frequently than the decrease in zeta-chain .
these defect be parallel by an impaired ability to produce th1 cytokine ( il-2 and ifn-gamma ) .
these initial change be follow by the eventual loss of tcr zeta chain and p56 ( lck ) and a marked decrease in cytotoxic function .
an increase rate of lysosomal degradation be one of the mechanism responsible for the loss of zeta-chain .
transcriptional activity and constitutive nuclear localization of the ets protein elf-1 .
elf-1 be a lymphoid-specific transcription factor that belong to the ets protein family .
it can bind to dna target sequence within a variety of cytokine gene .
we demonstrate that elf-1 be constitutively localized in the nucleus which be dependent on the presence of amino acid 86-265 .
analysis of gal4-elf-1 fusion protein reveal that the n-terminal 86 amino acid of elf-1 contain a transcriptional activation domain , the activity of which be attenuate by an internal repression domain .
furthermore , elf-1 interact specifically with the e74 target sequence and can stimulate transcription drive by the e74 site independent of mitogenic signaling .
thus , elf-1 be able to stimulate gene transcription which may be require for the development and activity of lymphocyte .
cooperation between core binding factor and adjacent promoter element contribute to the tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3 .
tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) be mediate via cis-acting element located within 315 base pair of the transcription start .
this be achieve in part through the positive activity of the ap-1 and elf-1 site in the il-3 promoter .
the contribution to t cell-specific expression by other promoter site be assess in a transient expression assay with il-3 promoter construct link to a luciferase gene , focus initially on the core binding factor ( cbf ) site , which be footprinted in vivo upon t cell activation .
activity of the cbf site be show to be critically dependent on the adjacent activator site act-1 .
together the act-1 and cbf site form a functional unit ( ac unit ) with dual activity .
the ac unit be demonstrate to enhance basal activity of promoter both in fibroblast and t cell .
this activity be far inducible in activate t cell , but not in fibroblast .
in addition to the already identify nip repressor site , evidence be present for a second repressor region that restrict promoter activity in fibroblast .
finally , a novel positive regulatory element have be map in the il-3 promoter between nucleotide -180 and -210 that lead to increase expression in t cell .
together these result demonstrate that t cell expression of il-3 be not specify by the activity of a single tissue-specific element , but instead involve multiple interact element that provide both specific positive regulation in t cell and specific negative regulation in fibroblast .
eosinophil priming by cytokine : from cellular signal to in vivo modulation .
eosinophil play an important role in the effector phase of allergic inflammation .
this review will focus on the conversion of the unprimed eosinophil phenotype in the peripheral blood of normal individual to the primed phenotype find in the peripheral blood and tissue of allergic patient , a phenomenon call priming .
recent data on the signal initiate after cytokine receptor activation on eosinophil will be review .
identification and purification of human stat protein activate in response to interleukin-2 .
a key cytokine induce during the immune response be il-2 .
follow t cell activation , the gene encode il-2 and the various chain of it receptor be transcriptionally induce .
in turn , secrete il-2 serve to stimulate the proliferation and differentiation of t lymphocyte .
several recent study have implicate jak kinase in the signaling pathway induce by il-2 .
follow this lead , we set out to identify transcription factor induce in response to il-2 .
human peripheral blood lymphocyte be observe to contain several il-2 -inducible dna binding activity .
similar activity be also observe in a transform human lymphocyte line , term yt .
we have purify these activity and find that the principal il-2 -inducible component bear significant relatedness to a prolactin-induced transcription factor first identify in sheep mammary gland tissue .
we hypothesize that activation of this protein , designate hstat5 , help govern the biological effect of il-2 during the immune response .
interferon augment pml and pml/rar alpha expression in normal myeloid and acute promyelocytic cell and cooperate with all-trans retinoic acid to induce maturation of a retinoid-resistant promyelocytic cell line .
the pml gene be fuse to the retinoic acid receptor alpha gene ( rar alpha ) in the acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) 15 ; 17 translocation .
pml be express in diverse tissue and cell line and localized in the nucleus with a typical speckled pattern .
in the bone marrow , it be preferentially express in myeloid cell .
pml appear to be transcriptionally regulate by class i and ii interferon , which raise the possibility that interferon modulate the function and growth and differentiation potential of normal myeloid cell and precursor by activate pml -dependent pathway .
similarly , interferon could act on apl cell , alone or in combination with all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) , especially if the pml/rar alpha fusion transcript that result from the t(15;_17) be induce by interferon .
we report here that pml be express at low level or not express in normal circulate human monocyte , lymphocyte , and polymorphonucleate cell , but be markedly induce by interferon ; that pml and pml/rar alpha expression be augment by interferon in the nb4 apl cell line , which carry the t(15;_17) , and in apl blast from patient ; that interferon inhibit growth and survival of nb4 apl cell in cooperation with ra ; that interferon alone have minimal maturation effect on nb4 cell ; and , finally , that interferon gamma , but not alpha or beta , induce maturation and growth suppression of nb4 cell with de novo retinoid resistance , and partially restore ra response .
quantitation of beta 1 triiodothyronine receptor mrna in human tissue by competitive reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction .
thyroid hormone act by bind to nuclear receptor protein , the thyroid hormone receptor ( tr ) alpha and beta .
data from cell culture and animal study indicate that tr expression may be regulate to modulate target organ responsiveness to thyroid hormone .
to investigate whether such adaptive change in tr expression occur in human , we determine the mrna level of the htr beta 1 in various thyroid state .
patient with overt hypo - or hyper thyroidism be enrol in the study .
total rna be isolate from peripheral blood mononuclear cell and htr beta 1 mrna level determine by quantitative competitive reverse transcription pcr .
for comparison , htr beta 1 mrna level be determine in lymphocyte and normal thyroid tissue of euthyroid patient .
human tr beta 1 mrna level in lymphocyte be 1.8 +/- 0.4 , 1.9 +/- 0.5 , 1.1 +/- 0.4 10 ( -18 ) mol/microgram rna in hypo - , eu - and hyper thyroid patient , respectively , correspond to an estimate 0.5 -2 molecule per cell .
although the mean htr beta 1 mrna level be 40 % low in hyperthyroid than in euthyroid subject , this difference do not reach statistical significance .
similar level of htr beta 1 mrna level be detect in thyroid gland from euthyroid patient .
in summary , we develop an assay for the quantitative determination of htr beta 1 mrna level in small human tissue sample , contain as little a 50 ng of total rna .
absolute htr beta 1 mrna level be very low with an estimate one molecule of mrna be present in a mononuclear blood cell or thyrocyte .
no up-regulation of htr beta 1 be see in hypothyroid relative to euthyroid patient .
however , there be a non-significant trend towards a down-regulation of htr beta 1 mrna level in hyperthyroid patient .
bcl-2 : a repressor of lymphocyte death .
the gene and mechanism that control program cell death be currently the subject of intense study .
the bcl-2 gene , a repressor of lymphocyte death , be perhaps the best understand of the program cell death associated gene .
here , stanley korsmeyer provide a brief overview of bcl-2 , concentrate on it role in b- and t- cell development and in oncogenesis .
mutually exclusive interaction of a novel matrix attachment region binding protein and the nf-munr enhancer repressor .
implication for regulation of immunoglobulin heavy chain expression .
the immunoglobulin heavy chain ( igh ) intronic enhancer stimulate transcription from functional promoter in b lymphocyte but not other cell type .
the observation that bind site for the nuclear factor-mu negative regulator ( nf-munr ) enhancer repressor overlap nuclear matrix attachment region ( mar ) in this enhancer have lead to the hypothesis that the cell type specificity of the enhancer might be control by regulate nuclear matrix attachment ( scheuermann , r. h. , and chen , u. ( 1989 ) gene & dev. 3 , 1255-1266 ) .
to understand the role of mar in igh enhancer regulation , we have identify a novel mar-binding protein , mar-bp1 , from soluble nuclear matrix preparation base on it ability to bind to the mar associate with the igh enhancer .
purify mar-bp1 migrate a a 33-kda protein , and it can be find in nuclear matrix preparation from a number of different type of lymphoid cell line .
although specific bind site have be difficult to localize by chemical or enzymatic footprinting procedure , nf-munr binding site be critical for efficient mar-bp1 binding .
indeed , binding of the igh enhancer to either intact nuclear matrix preparation or to mar-bp1 be mutually exclusive to nf-munr binding .
these result be consistent with a model for cell-type specific regulation in which binding of the nf-munr repressor to the igh enhancer prevent nuclear matrix attachment in inappropriate cell by interfere with mar-bp1 /enhancer interaction .
regulation of transcription of the human erythropoietin receptor gene by protein bind to gata-1 and sp1 motif .
erythropoietin ( epo ) , the primary regulator of the production of erythroid cell , act by bind to a cell surface receptor ( epor ) on erythroid progenitor .
we use deletion analysis and transfection assay with reporter gene construct to examine the transcription control element in the 5' flanking region of the human epor gene .
in erythroid cell most of the transcription activity be contain in a 150 bp promoter fragment with bind site for transcription factor ap2 , sp1 and the erythroid-specific gata-1 .
the 150 bp hepor promoter exhibit high and low activity in erythroid ocim1 and k562 cell , respectively , reflect the high and low level of constitutive hepor expression .
the gata-1 and sp1 binding site in this promoter lack a tata sequence be necessary for a high level of transcription activation .
protein-dna binding study suggest that sp1 and two other ccgccc binding protein from erythroid and non-erythroid cell could bind to the sp1 binding motif .
by increase gata-1 level via co-transfection , we be able to transactivate the hepor promoter in k562 cell and non-erythroid cell , but not in the highly active ocim1 cell , although gata-1 mrna level be comparable in ocim1 and k562 .
interestingly , when we mutate the sp1 site , result in a marked decrease in hepor promoter activity , we could restore transactivation by increase gata-1 level in ocim1 cell .
these data suggest that while gata-1 can transactivate the epor promoter , the level of hepor gene expression do not depend on gata-1 alone .
rather , hepor transcription activity depend on coordination between sp1 and gata-1 with other cell-specific factor , include possibly other sp1 -like binding protein , to provide high level , tissue-specific expression .
difference in binding of glucocorticoid receptor to dna in steroid-resistant asthma .
although glucocorticosteroids be a very effective treatment for asthma and other chronic inflammatory disease , a small proportion of patient be resistant to their therapeutic effect .
the molecular mechanism for this steroid resistance be unclear .
steroid resistance can not be explain by pharmacokinetic mechanism , by a defect in the binding of steroid to glucocorticoid receptor , nor by defective nuclear translocation of this receptor , thereby suggest that the molecular abnormality lie distal to nuclear translocation .
we examine the ability of nuclear translocate glucocorticoid receptor to bind to their dna binding site ( gre ) use electrophoretic mobility shift assay in pbmc from patient with steroid-sensitive and steroid-resistant asthma .
the binding of the glucocorticoid receptor to dna in these patient be also study use scatchard analysis .
dexamethasone induce a significant rapid and sustained twofold increase in gre binding in pbmcs from steroid-sensitive asthmatic patient and nonasthmatic individual , but this be markedly reduce in steroid-resistant asthmatic patient .
scatchard analysis of glucocorticoid receptor - gre binding show no change in binding affinity but do show a reduce number of receptor available for dna binding in the steroid-resistant patient .
these result suggest that the ability of the glucocorticoid receptor to bind to gre be impaired in steroid-resistant patient because of a reduce number of receptor available for bind to dna .
rhabdomyosarcoma do not contain mutation in the dna binding domain of myogenic transcription factor .
skeletal myogenesis be regulate by a group of transcription factor ( myod , myogenin , myf5 , and myf6 ) that be " basic helix-loop-helix " protein that bind to the promoter of muscle-specific gene and promote their expression .
we have previously show that after a mutation of leu122 to arg the dna binding basic domain of myod confer c-myc -like functional characteristic to the protein .
in this study we use single-strand conformation polymorphism analysis to determine whether such mutation occur naturally in rhabdomyosarcoma .
we have find that the basic domain of all the myogenic factor remain unaltered in rhabdomyosarcoma .
selection against such mutation may be the result of functional redundancy of these myogenic transcription factor .
histamine modulate the expression of c-fos through cyclic amp production via the h2 receptor in the human promonocytic cell line u937 .
we examine the effect of histamine and it agonist on the expression of the c-fos and c-myc proto-oncogene at the transcriptional and translational level in the human promonocytic u937 cell line .
histamine transiently increase camp and c-fos expression through h2 receptor .
dibutyryl camp also increase c-fos mrna and protein , and level remain elevated even after 12 hr of treatment .
dose-dependence study use histamine and dimaprit show that the ec50 value for camp production and c-fos increase be similar , suggest that camp might be involve in c-fos induction via h2 receptor .
furthermore , study carry out use h7 , a protein kinase a /protein kinase c inhibitor , block c-fos induction , whereas no effect be observe with bisindolylmaleimide , a specific protein kinase c inhibitor .
no modification of c-myc expression could be detect on treatment with histamine or it analogue .
nevertheless , dibutyryl camp induce a down-regulation of the level of this proto-oncogene .
in addition , dibutyryl camp inhibit cell growth in a dose-dependent manner , whereas histamine fail to affect proliferation and differentiation of u937 cell .
cell pretreated with dimaprit show a decrease in the camp response to subsequent addition of h2 agonist , whereas the camp response to prostaglandin e2 remain unaltered .
this homologous mechanism of h2 receptor desensitization be time dependent .
these result indicate that histamine activate several mechanism involve in the induction of differentiation , such a camp and c-fos production , but fail to promote differentiation of u937 cell , apparently due to the rapid desensitization of h2 receptor .
cell cycle analysis of e2f in primary human t cell reveal novel e2f complex and biochemically distinct form of free e2f .
the transcription factor e2f activate the expression of multiple gene involve in cell proliferation , such a c-myc and the dihydrofolate reductase gene .
regulation of e2f involve it interaction with other cellular protein , include the retinoblastoma protein ( rb ) , the rb-related protein p107 , cyclin a , and cdk2 .
we undertake a detailed analysis of e2f dna-binding activity and their cell cycle behavior in primary human t cell .
three e2f dna-binding activity be identify in rest ( g0 ) t cell with mobility in gel shift assay distinct from those of previously define e2f complex .
one of these activity be find to be a novel , less abundant , rb- e2f complex .
the most prominent e2f activity in rest t cell ( term complex x ) be abundant in both g0 and g1 but disappear a cell enter s phase , suggest a possible role in negatively regulate e2f function .
complex x could be dissociate by adenovirus e1a with a requirement for an intact e1a conserve region 2 .
however , x fail to react with a variety of antibody against rb or p107 , implicate the involvement of an e1a-binding protein other than rb or p107 .
in addition to these novel e2f complex , three distinct form of unbound ( free ) e2f be resolve in gel shift experiment .
these specie show different cell cycle kinetics .
uv cross-linking experiment suggest that a distinct e2f dna-binding protein be uniquely associate with the s-phase p107 complex and be not associate with rb .
together , these result suggest that e2f consist of multiple , biochemically distinct dna-binding protein which function at different point in the cell cycle .
characterization of interleukin-10 receptor expression on b-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia cell .
b-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( b-cll ) cell accumulate in vivo in the g0/g1 phase of the cell cycle , suggest that their malignant expansion be due , at least in part , to a delay in cell death .
however , the cellular or molecular factor responsible for a delay in b-cll cell death be unknown .
b-cll cell do express receptor for interferon-alpha ( ifn-alpha ) and ifn-gamma , and activation of both have be show to promote b-cll survival in vitro by prevent apoptosis .
the interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) receptor be another member of the ifn receptor family , but it ligand , il-10 , have be report to induce apoptosis in b-cll cell .
in the current study , we undertake a biochemical analysis of il-10 receptor expression on freshly isolate b-cll cell and characterize the functional responsiveness of il-10 binding to it constitutively express receptor .
we show that b-cll cell bind il-10 with significant specificity and express between 47 and 127 il-10 receptor site per cell , with a dissociation constant in the range of 168 to 426 x 10(-12) mol/l .
ligand binding and activation of the il-10 receptor express on b-cll cell result in the phosphorylation of signal transducer and activator of transcription 1 ( stat1 ) and stat3 protein .
this pattern of stat protein phosphorylation be identical to il-10 receptor activation on normal cell and similar to ifn-alpha ( stat1 and stat3 ) and ifn-gamma ( stat1 ) receptor activation in cll .
far , in consecutive sample of fresh blood obtain from patient with b-cll cell , the addition of il-10 inhibit b-cll proliferation , enhance b-cll differentiation , but do not induce apoptosis .
indeed , il-10 , like ifn-gamma , be able to significantly reduce the amount of b-cll cell death cause by hydrocortisone-induced apoptosis .
we conclude that cytokine , which signal through the interferon family of receptor , have comparable functional effect on b-cll cell .
the retinoblastoma gene product negatively regulate transcriptional activation mediate by the human cytomegalovirus ie2 protein .
the ie2 gene product of human cytomegalovirus ( hcmv ) be one of a few viral regulatory protein express immediately upon infection of the host cell .
it be a potent transcriptional activator of many viral and cellular promoter .
we find that the retinoblastoma susceptibility gene product ( rb ) dramatically suppress this ie2 transactivation of various promoter .
however , unlike another tumor suppressor protein , p53 , rb do not have any significant effect on basal level of transcription , suggest that rb specifically interact with ie2 rather than other cellular factor involve in the general transcription machinery .
we find by protein-affinity chromatography that rb in nuclear extract or produce by in vitro translation directly bind to ie2 .
our result suggest that rb may regulate the life cycle of hcmv , which be endemic in the human population .
furthermore , these data may provide new insight into the slow rate of hcmv dna replication in cell and the possible involvement of hcmv in tumorigenesis .
both stat3 -activation and stat3 -independent bcl2 downregulation be important for interleukin-6 -induced apoptosis of 1a9-m cell .
a unique subclone of a bone marrow-derived stromal cell line , bms2.4 , produce soluble factor that inhibit proliferation of several type of hematopoietic cell line .
an understanding of these molecule may be informative about negative regulatory circuit that can potentially limit blood cell formation .
we use expression clone to identify interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) a one factor that suppress growth of a pre-b-cell variant line , 1a9-m .
moreover , il-6 induce macrophage-differentiation and apoptosis of 1a9-m cell .
during this process , il-6 downregulated expression of bcl2 in 1a9-m cell and stimulate bcl-xl expression , but have no effect on p53 , bax , or bak gene expression .
mechanism for transduction of il-6 -induced signal be then evaluate in il-6 -stimulated 1a9-m cell .
whereas the signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 ( stat3 ) be phosphorylated and activate , there be no effect on either stat1 or stat5 .
the importance of bcl2 and stat3 on il-6 -induced macrophage-differentiation and apoptosis be study with 1a9-m cell express human bcl2 or a dominant-negative form of stat3 , respectively .
il-6 -induced apoptosis , but not macrophage-differentiation , be block by continuously express bcl2 .
a dominant-negative form of stat3 inhibit both macrophage-differentiation and apoptosis induce by il-6 .
however , diminish stat3 activity do not prevent il-6 -induced downregulation of the bcl2 gene .
therefore , activation of stat3 be essential for il-6 -induced macrophage-differentiation and program cell death in this model .
whereas overexpression of bcl2 abrogate the apoptotic response , stat3 -independent signal appear to downregulate expression of the bcl2 gene .
demonstration of estrogen and progesterone receptor as well a ki-67 and p-145 antigen in single tumor cell from blood and pleural effusion use a slide assay .
we describe a slide assay that allow the demonstration of antigen localized in the nucleus from isolate white blood cell as well a from single tumor cell derive from malignant effusion .
with the antibody ki-67 and anti-p-145 an increase rate of nuclear and nucleolar staining result in cell from highly malignant lymphoma .
an almost identical reaction be obtain when tumor cell from malignant effusion be test .
cell isolate from the blood of patient with leukemic spread of lymphoma of low malignancy yield a weak staining comparable to that of normal mesothelial cell from non-tumorous cavity fluid .
the detection of estrogen and progesterone receptor ( er and pr ) localized in the cell nucleus can be achieve by the same assay .
the reaction be enhance by incubation of the tumor cell for 30 min at 37 degree c prior to fixation .
pleural effusion from 20 patient with breast cancer be test .
er be positive in 13 and pr be positive in 12 of the 20 sample .
in 5 case there be a divergent reaction with er and pr antibody .

in each cohort there be only one case with a negative reaction of the primary tumor and a positive reaction with the isolate tumor cell from the pleural effusion .
these result indicate that the demonstration of hormone receptor protein in cell from malignant effusion be possible and that there be a correlation with the status of the primary site of cancer .
induction of the pro-myelocytic leukaemia gene by type i and type ii interferon .
the physiological role of the pro-myelocytic leukaemia ( pml ) gene product be poorly define .
among other function , pml be involve in haematopoietic differentiation and in control of cell growth and tumorigenesis .
we investigate the regulation of human pml expression by interferon ( ifns ) and il-1 in various human haematopoietic line ( u937 , thp1 , hl60 , nb4 ) , in human diploid fibroblast and in human peripheral blood leukocyte .
cytokine-induced modulation of pml expression be assess by northern blot analysis , flow cytometry study and in situ immunolabelling .
our data show that ifns and il-1 upregulate pml transcript and protein expression in a time and dose-dependent manner .
in situ immunolabelling reveal that upregulation of protein expression by ifn-alpha be a consequence of a marked increase in both the number and the intensity of the staining of so-called pml nuclear body .
our data suggest that stimulation of pml expression by interferon and il-1 may account for upregulation of pml protein observe in inflammatory tissue and in proliferative state .
mutation of jak3 in a patient with scid : essential role of jak3 in lymphoid development .
male with x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency ( xscid ) have defect in the common cytokine receptor gamma chain ( gamma c ) gene that encode a shared , essential component of the receptor of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) , il-4 , il-7 , il-9 , and il-15 .
the janus family tyrosine kinase jak3 be the only signal molecule know to be associate with gamma c , so it be hypothesize that defect in jak3 might cause an xscid -like phenotype .
a girl with immunological feature indistinguishable from those of xscid be therefore select for analysis .
an epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -transformed cell line derive from her lymphocyte have normal gamma c expression but lack jak3 protein and have greatly diminish jak3 messenger rna .
sequencing reveal a different mutation on each allele : a single nucleotide insertion result in a frame shift and premature termination in the jak3 jh4 domain and a nonsense mutation in the jak3 jh2 domain .
the lack of jak3 expression correlate with impaired b cell signaling , a demonstrate by the inability of il-4 to activate stat6 in the ebv -transformed cell line from the patient . these observation indicate that the function of gamma c be dependent on jak3 and that jak3 be essential for lymphoid development and signaling .
imbalanced expression of the glucocorticoid receptor isoforms in culture lymphocyte from a patient with systemic glucocorticoid resistance and chronic lymphocytic leukemia .
the human glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) be express a two alternatively splice isoforms , gralpha and grbeta .
whereas gralpha be a hormone-activated transcription factor , grbeta do not bind glucocorticoid ( gc ) , be transcriptionally inactive , and be a potential inhibitor of activate gralpha .
differential expression of gr isoforms may play a role in generalize or tissue-specific gc resistance .
gc induce apoptosis in neoplastic lymphoid cell ; and , defective apoptosis be implicate in the genesis of chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( cll ) .
we study a patient with generalize gc resistance and cll .
gr number in the patient 's transform lymphocyte be approximately one half that of control cell with a approximately 10-fold reduction in binding affinity for dexamethasone .
in vitro apoptosis induction in cll cell be delay in response to gc , but not to other apoptosis inducer .
sequencing of the gr cdna and gene include the 2.3-kb coding region , the intron/exon junction , the known 5'-regulatory region , and approximately 300 bp of the 3'-region reveal no alteration .
western blot with an n-terminal antibody show normal level of immunoreactive gr , but quantitative analysis with isoform-specific c-terminal antibody reveal a markedly reduce gralpha expression , and high grbeta expression .
these finding indicate that imbalanced expression of the gr isoforms may be a mechanism of gc resistance , and may have implication for tumorigenesis by enhance cell survival .

1 .

4 .

use of new biologic marker in the ovulation induction .
