triggering of the human interleukin-6 gene by interferon-gamma and tumor necrosis factor-alpha in monocytic cell involve cooperation between interferon regulatory factor-1 , nf kappa b , and sp1 transcription factor .
we investigate the molecular basis of the synergistic induction by interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) / tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) of human interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) gene in thp-1 monocytic cell , and compare it with the basis of this induction by lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
functional study with il-6 promoter demonstrate that three region be the target of the ifn-gamma and/or tnf-alpha action , whereas only one of these region seem to be implicate in lp activation .
the three region concern be : 1 ) a region between -73 and -36 , which be the minimal element inducible by lp or tnf-alpha ; 2 ) an element located between -181 and -73 , which appear to regulate the response to ifn-gamma and tnf-alpha negatively ; and 3 ) a distal element upstream of -224 , which be inducible by ifn-gamma alone .
lp signaling be find to involve nf kappa b activation by the p50 /p65 heterodimers .
synergistic induction of the il-6 gene by ifn-gamma and tnf-alpha , in monocytic cell , involve cooperation between the irf-1 and nf kappa b p65 homodimers with concomitant removal of the negative effect of the retinoblastoma control element present in the il-6 promoter .
this removal occur by activation of the constitutive sp1 factor , whose increase binding activity and phosphorylation be mediate by ifn-gamma .
sp1 be a critical factor for the monocytic specific expression of human cd14 .
cd14 be a membrane glycoprotein express specifically on monocyte and macrophage , and it expression be markedly increase during the process of monocyte differentiation .
in order to study cd14 gene regulation , the human cd14 gene be clone from a partial ecori digested chromosome 5 library .
a 5.5-kilobase genomic clone contain the full-length cd14 coding sequence and 4.2 kilobases of 5'-upstream sequence .
one major and one minor transcription start site be identify 101 and 130 base pair ( bp ) upstream , respectively , from the protein translation start atg .
a dna fragment contain 128 bp of upstream sequence have strong , monocyte-specific promoter activity in the cd14 positive monocytic cell line mono mac 6 a compare to the nonmonocytic cell line hela and rex .
four region in this dna fragment interact with nuclear protein isolate from monocytic cell .
the sp1 transcription factor bind to three different region in the cd14 promoter .
mutation of the major sp1 binding site ( -110 bp ) decrease tissue-specific promoter activity , and these result , together with transactivation experiment , demonstrate that sp1 play a critical role in the tissue-specific expression of cd14 in monocytic cell .
cd14 sp1 site oligonucleotides bind preferentially to a 105-kda sp1 specie , which be present in high relative level in monocytic than non-monocytic cell , suggest that modification of sp1 , such a phosphorylation , may explain how the sp1 site mediate monocytic specific promoter activity .
multiple protein interact with the nuclear inhibitory protein repressor element in the human interleukin-3 promoter .
t cell expression of interleukin 3 ( il-3 ) be direct by positive and negative cis-acting dna element clustered within 300 base pair of the transcriptional start site .
a strong repressor element , term nuclear inhibitory protein ( nip ) , be previously map to a segment of the il-3 promoter between nucleotide -271 and -250 .
functional characterization of this element demonstrate that it can mediate repression when link in ci to a heterologous promoter .
dna binding experiment be carry out to characterize the repressor activity .
use varying condition , three distinct complex be show to interact specifically with the nip region , although only one correlate with repressor activity .
complex 1 result from binding of a ubiquitous polypeptide that recognize the 3' portion of this sequence and be not require for repression .
complex 2 correspond to binding of transcription factor ( upstream stimulatory factor ) to an e-box motif in the 5' portion of the nip region .
dna binding specificity of complex 3 overlap with that of upstream stimulatory factor but be clearly distinct .
to determine which of the latter two complex represent nip activity , we incorporate small alteration into the nip site of an il-3 promoter -linked reporter construct and examine their effect on nip -mediated repression .
functional specificity for repression match the dna binding specificity of complex 3 ; both repressor activity and complex 3 binding require the consensus sequence ctcacntnc .
comparison of constitutive and inducible transcriptional enhancement mediate by kappa b-related sequence : modulation of activity in b cell by human t-cell leukemia virus type i tax gene .
the kappa b sequence ( gggactttcc ) bind a factor , nf-kappa b , that be constitutively find in it functional , dna binding form only in b lymphocyte .
a factor with apparently indistinguishable sequence specificity can be induce in many other cell type , where it be use to regulate inducible gene expression .
for example , kappa b-related sequence have be show to be important for the transcription of a few inducible gene , such a the interleukin 2 receptor alpha-chain gene and the beta-interferon gene .
however , these gene be not constitutively active in b lymphocyte , suggest that other regulatory mechanism must play a role in determine the pattern of expression .
we have investigate the constitutive and inducible transcriptional activity mediate by five kappa b-related sequence element in two different cell type .
we show that in s194 plasma cell the activity of each element correlate well with the relative affinity of b-cell-derived nf-kappa b for that element .
this lead to significantly lower transcription enhancement by site derive from the interleukin 2 receptor or t-cell receptor gene in s194 cell .
however , in either el-4 ( t ) cell or s194 cell , both lower-affinity site can be significantly induce by the tax gene product of human t-cell leukemia virus type i , show that nf-kappa b activity can be modulate even in a b-cell line that constitutively express this factor .
a protein of the ap-1 family be a component of nuclear factor of activate t cell .
nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) be a transcriptional activator involve in the induction of il-2 gene expression .
the response element for nf-at be a sequence localized between -285/-254 in the il-2 regulatory region .
the composition of nf-at protein be still not fully elucidate .
we demonstrate that , in normal human t cell , an ap-1 protein be a component of the nf-at protein complex .
this be evidence by the ability of the ap-1 site to compete with the nf-at site for binding to nf-at and by the capacity of immobilize anti- jun and anti- fos antibody to deplete nf-at -binding activity from nuclear extract of activate t cell .
there be no detectable binding of in vitro translate jun /fos heterodimer ( ap-1 ) to the nf-at sequence , and the nf-at sequence be unable to inhibit the binding of jun /fos to the ap-1 sequence .
the presence of an ap-1 protein in the nf-at protein complex may regulate nf-at -binding activity through protein-protein interaction .
cd27 /cd70 interaction augment ige secretion by promote the differentiation of memory b cell into plasma cell .
the induction of ige switching in b cell require several signal give by cytokine and cell contact-delivered signal .
here , we investigate the role of cd27 /cd70 interaction in b cell ige synthesis .
the addition of cd27 ligand ( cd70 ) transfectants to b cell culture increase the ige synthesis synergistically in the presence of il-4 plus anti-cd40 mab ( anti-cd40 ) .
the effect of cd70 transfectants be dose dependent and be completely block by anti-cd70 mab .
cd27+ b cell have the ability to produce ige , which be increase by contact with cd70 transfectants , whereas cd27-_b cell do not produce ige .
cd27 /cd70 interaction enhance b cell proliferation in the presence of il-4 or il-4 plus anti-cd40 .
the augmentation of b cell proliferation by cd70 transfectants be apparent in cd27+ b cell , but be mild in cd27-_b cell .
the helper activity for ige synthesis by the cd27 /cd70 interaction do not contribute to the enhancement of germline epsilon transcript .
flow cytometric and morphological analysis demonstrate that the addition of cd70 transfectants to b cell culture remarkably promote differentiation into plasma cell in the presence of il-4 and cd40 signaling .
finally , cd27 cross-linking result in the up-regulation of positive regulatory domain i-binding factor-1 .
take together , our finding indicate that signaling via cd27 on b cell induce ige synthesis , in cooperation with il-4 and cd40 signaling , by promote the generation of plasma cell through up-regulation of positive regulatory domain i-binding factor-1 .
glucocorticoid -induced apoptosis and regulation of nf-kappab activity in human leukemic t cell .
glucocorticoid -induced apoptosis be investigate in glucocorticoid-sensitive 6tg1.1 and resistant icr27tk.3 human leukemic t cell .
follow glucocorticoid treatment of 6tg1.1 cell , chromatin fragmentation be observe after a delay of 24 h .
fragmentation be not observe in icr27tk.3 cell contain mutant glucocorticoid receptor ( l753f ) that be activation-deficient but retain the ability to repress ap-1 activity .
nor be fragmentation observe after treatment with ru38486 , indicate that repression of ap-1 activity be not involve .
a describe in other system , fragmentation require ongoing protein synthesis .
however , inhibition of protein synthesis with cycloheximide anytime during the first 18 h of steroid treatment be a effective in block chromatin fragmentation a inhibition for the entire period , suggest that synthesis of a component with a rapid turnover rate be require .
dexamethasone treatment completely block 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate induction of nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) activity and elicit an increase in the amount of immunoreactive ikappab alpha in sensitive 6tg1.1 cell but not in resistant icr27tk.3 cell .
in addition , mild detergent treatment of cell extract indicate that a substantial amount of cytoplasmic nf-kappab be complexed with ikappab alpha or some other inhibitory factor . these result suggest that induction of a labile inhibitory factor such a ikappab alpha may contribute to glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis .
coexpression of nf-kappa b /rel and sp1 transcription factor in human immunodeficiency virus 1 -induced , dendritic cell-t-cell syncytium .
productive infection of t cell with human immunodeficiency virus 1 ( hiv-1 ) typically require that the t cell be stimulate with antigen or mitogen .
this requirement have be attribute to the activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b , which synergizes with the constitutive transcription factor sp1 to drive the hiv-1 promoter .
recently , we have find that vigorous replication of hiv-1 take place in nonactivated memory t cell after syncytium formation with dendritic cell ( dc ) .
these syncytium lack activate cell a determine by an absence of stain for ki-67 cell cycle antigen .
the expression and activity of nf-kappa b and sp1 be , therefore , analyze in isolate t cell and dc from human and mouse .
we have use immunolabeling , western blot analysis , and electrophoretic mobility shift and supershift assay .
t cell lack active nf-kappa b but express sp1 a expect .
dc express high level of all known nf-kappa b and rel protein , with activity reside primarily within relb , p50 , and p65 .
however , dc lack sp1 , which may explain the failure of hiv-1 to replicate in purify dc .
coexpression of nf-kappa b and sp1 occur in the heterologous dc-t-cell syncytium that be induce by hiv-1 .
therefore , hiv-1 -induced cell fusion bring together factor that upregulate virus transcription .
since dc and memory t cell frequently traffic together in situ , these unusual heterologous syncytium could develop in infected individual and lead to chronic hiv-1 replication without ostensible immune stimulation .
isolation and characterization of gelatinase granule from human neutrophil .
we recently confirm the existence of gelatinase granule a a subpopulation of peroxidase-negative granule by double-labeling immunogold electron microscopy on intact cell and by subcellular fractionation .
further characterization of gelatinase granule have be hamper by poor separation of specific and gelatinase granule on both two-layer percoll gradient and sucrose gradient .
we have develop a three-layer percoll density gradient that allow separation of the different granule and vesicle from human neutrophil ; in particular , it allow separation of specific and gelatinase granule .
this allow u to characterize these two granule population with regard to their content of membrane protein , which become incorporate into the plasma membrane during exocytosis .
we find that gelatinase granule , define a peroxidase-negative granule contain gelatinase but lack lactoferrin , contain 50 % of total cell gelatinase , with the remain residing in specific granule .
furthermore , we find that 20 % to 25 % of both the adhesion protein mac-1 and the nadph-oxidase component cytochrome b558 be localized in gelatinase granule .
although no qualitative difference be observe between specific granule and gelatinase granule with respect to cytochrome b558 and mac-1 , stimulation of the neutrophil with fmlp result in a selective mobilization of the least dense peroxidase-negative granule , ie , gelatinase granule , which , in concert with secretory vesicle , furnish the plasma membrane with mac-1 and cytochrome b558 .
this show that gelatinase granule be functionally important relative to specific granule in mediate early inflammatory response .
activation of nuclear factor kappa b in human lymphoblastoid cell by low-dose ionize radiation .
nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be a pleiotropic transcription factor which be involve in the transcriptional regulation of several specific gene .
recent report demonstrate that ionize radiation in the dose range of 2-50 gy result in expression of nf-kappa b in human kg-1 myeloid leukemia cell and human b-lymphocyte precursor cell ; the precise mechanism involve and the significance be not yet know .
the present report demonstrate that even low dos of ionize radiation , 0.25-2.0 gy , be capable of induce expression of nf-kappa b in ebv-transformed 244b human lymphoblastoid cell .
these result be in a dose range where the viability of the cell remain very high .
after exposure to 137cs gamma ray at a dose rate of 1.17 gy/min , a maximum in expression of nf-kappa b be see at 8 h after a 0.5-gy exposure .
time-course study reveal a biphasic time-dependent expression after 0.5- , 1- and 2-gy exposure .
however , for each time examine , the expression of nf-kappa b be maximum after the 0.5-gy exposure .
the expression of the p50 and p65 nf-kappa b subunit be also show to be regulate differentially after exposure to 1.0 and 2.0 gy .
regulation of id3 cell cycle function by cdk-2-dependent phosphorylation .
the function of basic helix-loop-helix ( bhlh ) transcription factor in activate differentiation-linked gene expression and in induce g1 cell cycle arrest be negatively regulate by member of the id family of hlh protein .
these bhlh antagonist be induce during a mitogenic signalling response , and they function by sequester their bhlh target in inactive heterodimers that be unable to bind to specific gene regulatory ( e box ) sequence .
recently , cyclin e-cdk2- and cyclin a-cdk2- dependent phosphorylation of a single conserve serine residue ( ser5 ) in id2 have be show to occur during late g1-to-s phase transition of the cell cycle , and this neutralize the function of id2 in abrogate e-box-dependent bhlh homo - or hetero dimer complex formation in vitro ( e.hara , m.hall , and g.peters , embo j.16 : 332-342 , 1997 ) .
we now show that an analogous cell-cycle-regulated phosphorylation of id3 alter the specificity of id3 for abrogate both e-box-dependent bhlh homo- or heterodimer complex formation in vitro and e-box-dependent reporter gene function in vivo .
furthermore , compare with wild-type id3 , an id3 asp5 mutant ( mimic phosphorylation ) be unable to promote cell cycle s phase entry in transfected fibroblast , whereas an id3 ala5 mutant ( ablate phosphorylation ) display an activity significantly great than that of wild-type id3 protein .
cdk2-dependent phosphorylation therefore provide a switch during late g1-to-s phase that both nullify an early g1 cell cycle regulatory function of id3 and modulate it target bhlh specificity .
these data also demonstrate that the ability of id3 to promote cell cycle s phase entry be not simply a function of it ability to modulate bhlh heterodimer-dependent gene expression and establish a biologically important mechanism through which cdk2 and id-bhlh function be integrate in the coordination of cell proliferation and differentiation .
induction of nf-kappa b during monocyte differentiation be associate with activation of hiv -gene expression .
cell of the monocyte-macrophage lineage be important target of hiv infection .
we report here that the phenotypic differentiation of monocyte cell line induce by phorbol ester or tumour necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) be associate with expression of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
in parallel with such differentiation , hiv transcription , monitor use an hiv long terminal repeat reporter gene construct , be activate in such cell under the influence of enhance nf-kappa b expression .
also , in a promonocyte cell line chronically infect with hiv , nf-kappa b expression and hiv transcription be enhance on stimulation with phorbol ester or tnf alpha .
thus , stimulation of monocyte cell line by phorbol ester or tnf alpha induce cell differentiation and activate hiv transcription .
such a process may have fundamental implication in aid pathogenesis in vivo and may be important in disease progression induce by opportunistic infection directly or indirectly involve macrophage .
the lymphotoxin promoter be stimulate by htlv-i tax activation of nf-kappa b in human t-cell line .
the htlv-i transcriptional activator tax be use to gain insight into the mechanism of lymphotoxin ( lt ; tnf-beta ) gene induction .
tax-expressing cell line produce lt biologic activity .
an lt promoter ( lt-293 ) cat construct that contain an nf-kappa b site be active in the lt-producing c81-66-45 cell line , which contain defective htlv-i but express tax .
the observation that a mutate lt-kappa b construct ( m1-cat ) be inactive in c81-66-45 , confirm the importance of nf-kappa b in lt gene expression .
tax be transfected into htlv-i-negative human t-cell line .
jurkat t cell stably express tax contain elevated level of nf-kappa b that directly bind to the lt-kappa b site .
tax co-transfected with reporter construct into jurkat cell maximally activate htlv-i-ltr-cat and kappa b-fos-cat and also activate lt-293 to a less extent .
in jm t cell , tax induced lt-293 activity by two- to four-fold , though there be no induction of m1-cat .
the increase in lt-293 cat activity mirror the increase in lt biologic activity see under these condition .
these study , the first to demonstrate induction of lt promoter activity over basal level , indicate that htlv-i tax cause low-level activation of both endogenous lt and the lt promoter , at least in part through activation of nf-kappa b .
cytomegalovirus modulate interleukin-6 gene expression .
complication after lung transplantation include the development of rejection and an increase incidence of infection , particularly with cytomegalovirus ( cmv ) .
several recent study have suggest that interleukin ( il ) -6 may be use to detect both infection and rejection after lung transplantation .
in addition , il-6 may play a role in the development of bronchiolitis obliterans after transplantation .
because cmv be also associate with the development of bronchiolitis obliterans after transplantation , we determine whether cmv induce il-6 gene expression .
we demonstrate that cmv infection increase both il-6 protein and mrna in peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
we also demonstrate that the cmv immediate early 1 gene product increase expression of the il-6 promoter .
this effect of the cmv immediate early 1 gene product be dependent upon the presence of specific transcription factor binding site in the il-6 promoter .
these study demonstrate that cmv may be an important cofactor in the development of rejection and infection after transplantation through it effect on il-6 .
human herpesvirus 6 variant a , but not variant b , infect ebv -positive b lymphoid cell , activate the latent ebv genome through a bzlf-1 -dependent mechanism .
human herpesvirus 6 , a predominantly t lymphotropic virus , have be recently show to infect some ebv -positive b cell line , and to induce in them the activation of the ebv lytic cycle .
here we have confirm and extend such observation , show that ( 1 ) this phenomenon be restricted to the variant a of hhv-6 : in fact two isolates belong to the hhv-6 variant b ( ba92 and z29 ) be neither able to infect any b cell line , independently of the ebv status , nor to induce the ebv genome expression .
the only exception be represent by the p3hr1 cell , in which , however , the infection by the variant b do not determine induction of ebv antigen ; ( 2 ) the presence of the ebv genome contribute to the susceptibility of the b cell line to hhv-6 infection , increase the bind site and the percentage of infectable cell , a detect by immunoelectron microscopy ; and ( 3 ) hhv-6 infected t cell , transfected with plasmid bear the promoter region of the ebv early gene bzlf1 and bmrf1 , show a strong transactivation of these promoter .
calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ii downregulates both calcineurin and protein kinase c -mediated pathway for cytokine gene transcription in human t cell .
engagement of the t cell receptor for antigen activate phospholipase c result in an increase in intracellular free calcium concentration ( [ ca2+ ]i ) and activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) .
increase [ ca2+ ]i activate ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent kinase include the multifunctional ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ii ( cam-k ii ) , as well a calcineurin , a type 2b protein phosphatase .
recent study have identify calcineurin a a key enzyme for interleukin ( il ) -2 and il-4 promoter activation .
however , the role of cam-k ii remain unknown .
we have use mutant of these kinase and phosphatase ( gamma b*cam-k and delta cam-ai , respectively ) to explore their relative role in cytokine gene transcription and their interaction with pkc -dependent signaling system .
gamma b*cam-k and delta cam-ai , know to exhibit constitutive ca(2+)-independent activity , be cotransfected ( alone or in combination ) in jurkat t cell with a plasmid contain the intact il-2 promoter drive the expression of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter gene .
cotransfection of gamma b*cam-k with the il-2 promoter construct downregulated it transcription in response to stimulation with ionomycin and phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) .
the inhibitory effect of cam-k ii on il-2 promoter be associate with decrease transcription of it ap-1 and nf-at transactivating pathway .
under the same condition , delta cam-ai superinduced il-2 promoter activity ( approximately twofold increase ) .
when both mutant be use in combination , gamma b*cam-k inhibit the induction of the il-2 promoter by delta cam-ai .
similar result be obtain when a construct contain the il-4 promoter also be use .
gamma b*cam-k also downregulated the activation of ap-1 in response to transfection with a constitutively active mutant of pkc or stimulation with pma .
these result suggest that cam-k ii may exert negative influence on cytokine gene transcription in human t cell , and provide preliminary evidence for negative cross-talk with the calcineurin- and pkc- dependent signaling system .
involvement of alu sequence in the cell-specific regulation of transcription of the gamma chain of fc and t cell receptor .
the fc epsilon ri-gamma chain be express in a variety of hematopoietic cell where they play a critical role in signal transduction .
they be part of the high affinity ige receptor in mast cell , basophil , langerhans cell , and possibly other cell ; a component of the low affinity receptor for igg ( fc gamma riiia or cd16 ) in natural killer cell and macrophage ; and part of the t cell antigen receptor in subset of t cell .
here we have investigate the transcriptional regulation of the gamma chain gene by analyze the 2.5-kilobase sequence upstream of the transcription start site .
this sequence contain a promoter specific to cell of hematopoietic lineage .
however , the tissue specificity of this promoter be only partial because it be active in all of the hematopoietic cell test here , regardless of whether they constitutively express fc epsilon ri- gamma chain transcript .
we have identify two adjacent cis-acting regulatory element , both of which be part of an alu repeat .
the first ( -445/-366 ) be a positive element active in both basophil and t cell .
the second ( -365/-264 ) bind to nuclear factor , which appear to be different in basophil and t cell , and act a a negative element in basophil and a a positive one in t cell .
thus , this alu repeat ( 90 % identical to alu consensus sequence ) have evolve to become both a positive and negative regulator .
effect of environmental estrogen on il-1beta promoter activity in a macrophage cell line .
environmental estrogen or estrogen disrupters have recently receive a great deal of attention because of their potential health impact on reproductive tissue .
few , if any , study have be make on the impact of these compound on the immune system .
we seek to determine the activity of various environmental estrogen on the modulation of the interleukin-1beta ( il-1beta ) gene in a model monocytic cell line , her + il-1beta -cat+ .
this cell line stably transfected with the human estrogen receptor , and an il-1beta promoter construct fuse to the cat reporter gene allow u to monitor the effect of estrogenic compound on il-1beta promoter activity .
17beta-estradiol ( e2 ) markedly enhance lipopolysaccharide - ( lp ) induced il-1beta promoter -driven cat activity in a dose-dependent manner .
the mycotoxin alpha-zearalenol and zearalenone both exhibit full agonist activity , but at low potency , with ec50 value of 1.8 and 54 nm , respectively , compare with e2 at 0.5 nm .
in addition , genistein be a very low-potency agonist , have an ec50 of 1.5 microm .
similar to the e2 response , the slope factor for alpha-zearalenol , zearalenone , and genistein be close to 3.0 , suggest positive cooperativity in the estrogenic response .
the activity of the mycotoxin appear to be mediate through the estrogen receptor , since both the antiestrogens h1285 and ici 182 , 780 effectively inhibit their agonist activity in a dose-dependent manner .
representative environmental estrogenic compound both from plant and industrial source be also test .
unlike the mycoestrogens , none of the compound , with the exception of genistein , synergized with lp to enhance il-1beta promoter activity .
when test for antiestrogenic activity , the industrial compound 4-octylphenol be able to antagonize the response to e2 ; however , the response be three order of magnitude less potent than h 1285 .
naringenin , a plant flavonoid , show little or no ability to antagonize the response to e2 .
overall , the result show that some environmental estrogen that display agonist activity in reproductive tissue also have an effect on il-1 gene expression in hemopoietic-derived tissue .
glucocorticoid receptor , fibromyalgia and low back pain .
recently , fibromyalgia ( fm ) be show to be a disorder associate with an altered functioning of the stress response system .
fm patient display a hyperreactive pituitary adrenocorticotropic hormone ( acth ) release in response to corticotropin-releasing hormone ( crh ) and to insulin-induced hypoglycemia .
we suggest that negative feedback of cortisol could be derange .
therefore we investigate the property and function of the glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) in fm patient and compare the result with those of healthy person and patient with chronic low back pain ( lbp a localized pain condition ) .
forty primary fm patient ( f : m = 36 : 4 ) , 28 lbp patient ( 25 : 3 ) and 14 ( 12 : 2 ) healthy , sedentary control person be recruit for the study .
urinary free cortisol excretion in fm and lbp patient be low compare to control .
only fm patient display low cbg and basal serum cortisol concentration when compare to control .
however , plasma free cortisol concentration be similar in the three group .
there be no difference in the number of gr per cell among the three group ( fm : 6498 +/- 252 , lbp : 6625 +/- 284 , control : 6576 +/- 304 ) , but the dissociation constant ( kd ) of the fm ( 14.5 +/- 0.9 nmol/l ) and lbp ( 14.7 +/- 1.3 nmol/l ) subject be significantly high than that of the control ( 10.9 +/- 0.8 nmol/l ) ( p < .05 ) .
the maximal stimulation of the lymphocyte , a measure by the maximal thymidine incorporation ( in the absence of cortisol ) in the fm group be approximately 1.5 time high ( p < .05 ) than in the control or lbp group .
the ed50 ( the cortisol concentration give 50 % inhibition of the thymidine incorporation ) , however , be identical in all three group .
we conclude that fm patient have a mild hypocortisolemia , increase cortisol feedback resistance in combination probably with a reduce crh synthesis or release in the hypothalamus .
the role of the gr and mineralocorticoid receptor ( mr ) in the crh regulation in the fm patient remain to be solve .
the sp1 transcription factor bind the cd11b promoter specifically in myeloid cell in vivo and be essential for myeloid-specific promoter activity .
the myeloid integrin cd11b be express selectively on the surface of mature macrophage , monocyte , neutrophil , and natural killer cell .
lineage-specific expression be control at the level of mrna transcription .
recent isolation of the cd11b promoter show that 92 base pair ( bp ) of 5'-flanking dna be sufficient to direct myeloid-specific expression of a reporter gene .
to characterize regulatory sequence important for promoter activity , we perform linker scanning analysis of the 92-bp cd11b promoter and demonstrate that a sequence at bp -60 be essential for cd11b promoter activity .
we show that this sequence bind the transcription factor sp1 in vitro and in vivo .
in vivo the sp1 site be bind only in myeloid ( u937 ) cell , not in cervical carcinoma ( hela ) cell .
in addition , the macrophage transcription factor pu.1 bind the cd11b promoter in vitro and in vivo close to the sp1 site .
we propose a model in which binding of a myeloid-specific factor ( pu.1 ) allow a general factor ( sp1 ) to bind in a tissue-specific fashion thereby contribute to the myeloid-specific expression of cd11b .
calcitriol : a hematolymphopoietrope ? [ editorial ]
a medline search of the english-language literature be conduct use the indexing term ' immunology , calcitriol and vitamin d ' to identify study indicate a role for calcitriol a a primary immunomodulator .
sixty-six paper publish between january 1956 and june 1991 be identify .
forty-five of these report be cite in this review .
the data strongly suggest an endocrine , autocrine and/or paracrine role for calcitriol in immune regulation .
no unifying hypothesis have yet emerge explain this collection of data .
this paper provide a brief review of immune property currently attribute to calcitriol .
sp1 function in a chromatin -dependent manner to augment human alpha-globin promoter activity .
the 5' flanking region of the human alpha-globin gene be highly g_+_c rich and contain multiple copy of the consensus sequence for the sp1 binding site .
we investigate the role of this g_+_c-rich region in augment alpha-globin promoter activity in the presence of the far-upstream alpha-globin enhancer , hs-40 .
we show that in transiently transfected erythroid cell , deletion of the alpha-globin g_+_c-rich 5' flanking region have no effect on alpha-globin promoter activity .
however , upon stable integration into chromatin , deletion of this region cause a nearly 90 % decrease in promoter activity compare with expression from an alpha-globin promoter retain this region .
these result suggest that the alpha-globin g_+_c-rich 5' flanking region augment alpha-globin promoter activity in a chromatin -dependent manner .
we far show that this g_+_c-rich region be require for the activation of alpha-globin gene expression during erythroid differentiation .
finally , we show by both footprint analysis and functional assay that the ability of the g_+_c-rich region to increase alpha-globin promoter activity from a stably integrate alpha-globin gene be mediate by it multiple bind site for the transcription factor sp1 .
dehydroepiandrosterone modulation of lipopolysaccharide -stimulated monocyte cytotoxicity .
dehydroepiandrosterone ( dhea ) , the predominant androgen secrete by the adrenal cortex , can be convert to both potent androgen and estrogen .
in addition to it role a a precursor for other steroid hormone , dhea have be propose to play an important role in immunity .
this study have investigate dhea modulation of lp -induced monocyte cytotoxicity .
cytotoxicity marker assess include tumor cell killing , il-1 secretion , reactive oxygen intermediate release , nitric oxide synthetase activity a measure by the release of reactive nitrogen intermediate , complement receptor-1 cell surface protein , and tnf-alpha protein presence .
monocyte stimulate with lp concentration of 1.0 micrograms/ml display the above cytotoxic marker , whereas monocyte stimulate with dhea alone or with lp at a low concentration of 0.2 ng/ml do not .
however , when use simultaneously , dhea and lp 0.2 ng/ml display a synergistic effect on monocyte cytotoxicity against cancerous cell line , il-1 secretion , reactive nitrogen intermediate release , complement receptor-1 cell-surface protein , and tnf-alpha protein to level comparable with level obtain use lp 1.0 microgram/ml .
finally , scatchard plot analysis demonstrate the presence of a dhea receptor in monocyte , suggest that dhea effect on lp -stimulated monocyte be mediate through a receptor-dependent process .

functional characterization of novel il-2 transcriptional inhibitor .
il-2 -mediated t cell proliferation be a critical early event in the inflammatory process .
formation of the nfat -1 transcriptional complex on the il-2 promoter be essential for il-2 transcription .
use a cell line that be stably transfected with a trimer of the nfat -1 regulatory element link to a lac-z reporter gene , we screen for inhibitor of nfat -1-mediated beta-galactosidase activity .
win 61058 and win 53071 be identify a microm inhibitor .
these compound also inhibit beta-galactosidase mrna level .

both compound alter the nfat -1 transcriptional complex , cause it retard mobility on gel .
by these functional criterion , we believe we have identify two structurally distinct , novel inhibitor of nfat -1-mediated transcription .
htlv-1 tax induce expression of various immediate early serum responsive gene .
human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) be an etiological agent of adult t-cell leukemia ( atl ) .
we show here by mobility-shift assay that t-cell line transform with the virus contain high level of ap-1 activity .
consistent with this result , these cell line express increase level of mrna encode the ap-1 protein , c-fos , fra-1 , c-jun , junb , and jund .
