thus , tax1 be suggest to replace growth signal , at least in part , by this mechanism .
macrophage in human atheroma contain ppargamma : differentiation-dependent peroxisomal proliferator-activated receptor gamma ( ppargamma ) expression and reduction of mmp-9 activity through ppargamma activation in mononuclear phagocyte in vitro .
mononuclear phagocyte play an important role in atherosclerosis and it sequela plaque rupture in part by their secretion of matrix metalloproteinases ( mmps ) , include mmp-9 .
peroxisomal proliferator-activated receptor gamma ( ppargamma ) , a transcription factor in the nuclear receptor superfamily , regulate gene expression in response to various activator , include 15-deoxy-delta12,14-prostaglandin j2 and the antidiabetic agent troglitazone .
the role of ppargamma in human atherosclerosis be unexplored .
we report here that monocytes/macrophages in human atherosclerotic lesion ( n = 12 ) express immunostainable ppargamma .
normal artery specimen ( n = 6 ) reveal minimal immunoreactive ppargamma .
human monocyte and monocyte-derived macrophage culture for 6 day in 5 % human serum express ppargamma mrna and protein by reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction and western blotting , respectively .
in addition , ppargamma mrna expression in u937 cell increase during phorbol 12-myristate 13 acetate -induced differentiation .
stimulation of ppargamma with troglitazone or 15-deoxy-delta12,14-prostaglandin j2 in human monocyte-derived macrophage inhibit mmp-9 gelatinolytic activity in a concentration-dependent fashion a reveal by zymography .
this inhibition correlate with decrease mmp-9 secretion a determine by western blotting .
thus , ppargamma be present in macrophage in human atherosclerotic lesion and may regulate expression and activity of mmp-9 , an enzyme implicate in plaque rupture .
ppargamma be likely to be an important regulator of monocyte/macrophage function with relevance for human atherosclerotic disease .
interdomain b in zap-70 regulate but be not require for zap-70 signaling function in lymphocyte .
the protein tyrosine kinase zap-70 play an important role in t-cell activation and development .
after t-cell receptor stimulation , zap-70 associate with the receptor and be phosphorylated on many tyrosine , include y292 , y315 , and y319 within interdomain b .
previously , we demonstrate that y292 negatively regulate zap-70 function and that y315 positively regulate zap-70 function by interact with vav .
recent study have suggest that y319 also positively regulate zap-70 function .
paradoxically , removal of interdomain b ( to create the construct designate delta ) , contain the y292 , y315 , and y319 site , do not eliminate the ability of zap-70 to induce multiple gene reporter in syk-deficient dt-40 b cell and zap-70 /syk-deficient jurkat cell .
here we show that delta still utilize the same pathway a wild-type zap-70 to mediate nf-at induction .
this be manifest by the ability of delta to restore induction of calcium flux and mitogen-activated protein kinase activation and by the ability of dominant negative ra and fk506 to block the induction of nf-at activity mediate by delta .
biochemically we show that the stimulate tyrosine phosphorylation of vav , shc , and zap-70 itself be diminish , whereas that of slp-76 be increase in cell reconstitute with delta .
deletion of interdomain b do not affect the ability of zap-70 to bind to the receptor .
the in vitro kinase activity of zap-70 lack interdomain b be markedly reduce , but the kinase activity be still require for the protein 's in vivo activity .
base on these data , we conclude that interdomain b regulate but be not require for zap-70 signaling function lead to cellular response .
il4 and il13 receptor share the gamma c chain and activate stat6 , stat3 and stat5 protein in normal human b cell .
il13 induce the same biological effect a il4 in normal human b cell .
we show that a in the il4r complex , both il4r alpha and il2r gamma c be component of the il13r and that both cytokine induce stat6 , stat3 and stat5 activation in b cell .
in spite of this similar downstream signalling , il4 and il13 use a different set of janus kinase : il13 be unable to activate jak1 and jak3 .
dna methylation change in hematologic malignancy : biologic and clinical implication .
dna methylation change be among the most common detectable abnormality in human neoplasia .
hypermethylation within the promoter of select gene appear to be especially common in all type of human hematopoietic neoplasm , and be usually associate with inactivation of the involve gene ( s ) .
such hypermethylation-associated silencing of gene expression have be show for several gene regulate the growth and differentiation of hematopoietic cell , include the estrogen receptor ( er ) gene , p15 , p16 and others .
hypermethylation within the promoter of some gene appear to be an early event in the pathogenesis of neoplasia ( er , p15 ) , while other gene seem to become methylated during the progression of leukemia ( hic1 , c-abl ) .
the high prevalence of promoter methylation suggest that this molecular abnormality can be use to monitor disease activity during therapy .
in addition , new technology allow the sensitive identification of gene hypermethylation in a background of normal cell , suggest possible new strategy for the detection of minimal residual disease .
finally , reactivation of tumor-suppressor gene expression through pharmacologic inhibition of dna methyltransferase and resultant dna demethylation appear to be a promising new avenue of therapy in acute leukemia .
characterization of a cd43/leukosialin -mediated pathway for induce apoptosis in human t-lymphoblastoid cell .
the monoclonal antibody ( mab ) j393 induce apoptosis in jurkat t-cells .
nh2 -terminal amino acid sequence analysis identify the 140-kda surface antigen for mab j393 a cd43/leukosialin , the major sialoglycoprotein of leukocyte .
while jurkat cell co-expressed two discrete cell-surface isoforms of cd43 , recognize by mab j393 and mab g10-2 , respectively , only j393/ cd43 signal apoptosis .
j393/ cd43 be find to be hyposialylated , bear predominantly o-linked monosaccharide glycans , whereas g10-2/ cd43 bore complex sialylated tetra- and hexasaccharide chain .
treatment with soluble , bivalent mab j393 kill 25-50 % of the cell population , while concomitant engagement of either the cd3.tcr complex or the integrins cd18 and cd29 significantly potentiate this effect .
treatment of jurkat cell with mab j393 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of specific protein substrate that undergo hyperphosphorylation upon antigen receptor costimulation .
tyrosine kinase inhibition by herbimycin a diminish j393/ cd43 -mediated apoptosis , whereas inhibition of phosphotyrosine phosphatase activity by bis(maltolato)oxovanadium-iv enhance cell death .
signal transduction through tyrosine kinase activation may lead to altered gene expression , a j393/ cd43 ligation prompt decrease in the nuclear localization of the transcriptional regulatory protein nf-kappab and protein bind the interferon-inducible regulatory element .
since peripheral blood t-lymphocytes express cryptic epitope for mab j393 , these finding demonstrate the existence of a tightly regulate cd43 -mediated pathway for induce apoptosis in human t-cell lineage .
functional testosterone receptor in plasma membrane of t cell .
t cell be consider to be unresponsive to testosterone due to the absence of androgen receptor ( ar ) .
here , we demonstrate the testosterone responsiveness of murine splenic t cell in vitro as well a the presence of unconventional cell surface receptor for testosterone and classical intracellular ar .
bind site for testosterone on the surface of both cd4(+) and cd8(+) subset of t cell be directly reveal with the impeded ligand testosterone -bsa-fitc by confocal laser scanning microscopy ( clsm ) and flow cytometry , respectively .
binding of the plasma membrane impermeable testosterone -bsa conjugate induce a rapid rise ( < 5 s ) in [ca2+]i of fura-2-loaded t cell .
this rise reflect influx of extracellular ca2+ through non-voltage-gated and ni2+-blockable ca2+ channel of the plasma membrane .
the testosterone -bsa-induced ca2+ import be not affect by cyproterone , a blocker of the ar .
in addition , ar be not detectable on the surface of intact t cell when use anti- ar antibody direct against the amino and carboxy terminus of the ar , although t cell contain ar , a reveal by reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction and western blotting .
ar can be visualize with the anti- ar antibody in the cytoplasm of permeabilized t cell by use clsm , though ar be not detectable in cytosol fraction when use the charcoal binding assay with 3h-r1881 a ligand .
cytoplasmic ar do not translocate to the nucleus of t cell in the presence of testosterone , in contrast to cytoplasmic ar in human cancer lncap cell .
these finding suggest that the classical ar present in splenic t cell be not active in the genomic pathway .
by contrast , the cell surface receptor for testosterone be in a functionally active state , enable t cell a nongenomic response to testosterone .
cytoplasmic domain heterogeneity and function of igg fc receptor in b lymphocyte .
b lymphocyte and macrophage express closely related immunoglobulin g ( igg ) fc receptor ( fc gamma rii ) that differ only in the structure of their cytoplasmic domain .
because of cell type-specific alternative messenger rna splicing , b-cell fc gamma rii contain an insertion of 47 amino acid that participate in determine receptor function in these cell .
transfection of an fc gamma rii -negative b-cell line with complementary dna 's encode the two splice product and various receptor mutant indicate that the insertion be responsible for prevent both fc gamma rii -mediated endocytosis and fc gamma rii -mediated antigen presentation .
the insertion be not require for fc gamma rii to modulate surface immunoglobulin -triggered b-cell activation .
instead , regulation of activation involve a region of the cytoplasmic domain common to both the lymphocyte and macrophage receptor isoforms .
in contrast , the insertion do contribute to the formation of cap in response to receptor cross-linking , consistent with suggestion that the lymphocyte but not macrophage form of the receptor can associate with the detergent-insoluble cytoskeleton .
activation of nf-kappa b by phosphatase inhibitor involve the phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha at phosphatase 2a-sensitive site .
activation of nf-kappa b by various cellular stimulus involve the phosphorylation and subsequent degradation of it inhibitor , i kappa b alpha , although the underlie mechanism remain unclear .
in the present study , the role of serine/threonine phosphatase in the regulation of i kappa b alpha phosphorylation be investigate .
our study demonstrate that incubation of human t cell with low concentration ( approximately 1-5 nm ) of calyculin a or okadaic acid , potent inhibitor of protein phosphatase type 1 ( pp-1 ) and type 2a ( pp-2a ) , induce the phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha even in the absence of any cellular stimulus .
this action of the phosphatase inhibitor , which be associate with the activation of the rela.p50 nf-kappa b heterodimer , be not affect by agent that block the induction of i kappa b alpha phosphorylation by tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
furthermore , the phosphorylated i kappa b alpha from calyculin a -treated cell , but not that from tnf-alpha -stimulated cell , be sensitive to pp-2a in vitro , suggest the existence of fundamental difference in the phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha induce by the two different nf-kappa b inducer .
however , induction of i kappa b alpha phosphorylation by both tnf-alpha and the phosphatase inhibitor be associate with the subsequent degradation of i kappa b alpha .
we far demonstrate that tnf-alpha- and calyculin a-induced i kappa b alpha degradation exhibit similar but not identical sensitivity to a proteasome inhibitor .
together , these result suggest that phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha , mediate through both the tnf-alpha -inducible and the pp-2a -opposing kinase , may serve to target i kappa b alpha for proteasome -mediated degradation .
aldosterone-specific membrane receptor and rapid non-genomic action of mineralocorticoid .
functional study in extrarenal , non-epithelial cell such a smooth muscle cell and more recently circulate human lymphocyte have provide increase evidence that aldosterone produce not only classical genomic effect , but also rapid , non-genomic effect on transmembrane electrolyte movement .
these involve activation of the sodium/proton exchanger of the cell membrane at very low , physiological concentration of aldosterone with an acute onset within 1-2 min .
a second messenger cascade involve be the inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate /calcium pathway which respond over the same rapid time course .
such change clearly can not be explain by genomic mechanism , which be responsible for late effect than the membrane related rapid response .
the mechanism underlie these rapid effect of aldosterone on electrolyte have be extensively study in human lymphocyte , which thus may represent valuable tool in the delineation of the receptor-effector mechanism involve .
the unique characteristic of this new pathway for steroid action include it rapid time course , 10,000-fold selectivity for aldosterone over cortisol and the ineffectiveness of spironolactone , classical mineralocorticoid antagonist , a antagonist of the response .
activation of stat 5b in erythroid progenitor correlate with the ability of erbb to induce sustained cell proliferation .
self renewal of normal erythroid progenitor be induce by the receptor tyrosine kinase c-erbb , whereas other receptor ( c-kit/epo-r ) regulate erythroid differentiation .
to address possible mechanism that could explain this selective activity of c-erbb , we analyze the ability of these receptor to activate the different member of the stat transcription factor family .
ligand activation of c-erbb induce the tyrosine phosphorylation , dna-binding , and reporter gene transcription of stat 5b in erythroblast .
in contrast , ligand activation of c-kit be unable to induce any of these effect in the same cell .
activation of the erythropoietin receptor cause specific dna-binding of stat 5b , but fail to induce reporter gene transcription .
these biochemical finding correlate perfectly with the selective ability of c-erbb to cause sustained self renewal in erythroid progenitor .
active suppression of the class ii transactivator-encoding air-1 locus be responsible for the lack of major histocompatibility complex class ii gene expression observe during differentiation from b cell to plasma cell .
in this study the genetic control of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii gene expression during the transition from b cell to plasma cell have be analyze .
class ii molecule be not express in plasma cell because of an active suppression result in the abrogation of class ii gene transcription .
we show here that the plasma cell-specific repressor function , designate sir ( suppressor of immune response gene ) , do not act directly on the transcription of class ii gene , but instead on the transcription of the air-1 gene , whose product , the class ii transactivator ( ciita ) , be fundamental for the regulation of the constitutive and inducible expression of mhc class ii gene .
this be unambiguously demonstrate by the fact that plasmacytoma x b cell hybrid carry an air-1 locus derive from ciita -expressing cell do not express ciita -specific transcript .
transfection of a cdna contain the human ciita coding sequence under the control of an heterologous promoter restore expression of human mhc class ii gene in the hybrid and be responsible for de novo expression of mouse mhc class ii gene in both the mouse plasmacytoma cell line and the hybrid .
these result confirm and extend the notion of the functional conservation of the air-1 gene product across specie barrier .
interestingly , in ciita -transfected cell hybrid , cell surface expression of the human hla-dq heterodimer be not observe .
this result be not attributable to lack of hla -dq alpha or -dq beta transcription , because both transcript be present in the ciita -transfected hybrid , although at reduce level .
these finding far support our previous observation on the distinct regulation of expression of the human hla-dq class ii subset , which may be thus control at the posttranscriptional level by a ciita -independent mechanism .
differential induction of the nf-at complex during restimulation and the induction of t-cell anergy .
stimulation of human cd4+ t-cell clone through the t-cell receptor ( tcr ) by high dos of specific peptide result in the induction of a long-lived state of nonresponsiveness that have be call anergy .
during the induction of anergy , t cell be phenotypically similar to cell respond to an immunogenic stimulus .
the amount of tcr at the cell surface be downmodulated , whereas the cd2 and cd25 receptor be increase .
when restimulated , however , anergic t cell fail to up-regulate transcription of the il-2 gene and in consequence do not produce il-2 .
in this study , we have compare the ability of various transcription factor to bind to their appropriate site on dna .
factor be isolate from the nucleus of t cell that be in the induction phase of anergy or be undergo activation .
the pattern of binding activity in restimulated t cell be consistent with the pattern that have previously be show to regulate t-cell-specific expression of the il-2 and the beta chain of the tcr gene .
the measure binding to a tcf-1 site be the same in the nucleus of rest , activate , and anergized cell .
the inducible factor nk-kappa b , beta e2 , cd28rc , and ap-1 be not express in rest cell and be twofold lower in anergized a compare with activate cell .
in contrast , anergic t cell express approximately eightfold low amount of nf-at , a member of the class of inducible factor that regulate il-2 gene transcription .
( abstract truncate at 250 word )
hypoxia cause the activation of nuclear factor kappa b through the phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha on tyrosine residue .
the response of mammalian cell to stress be control by transcriptional regulatory protein such a nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) to induce a wide variety of early response gene .
in this report , we show that exposure of cell to hypoxia ( 0.02 % o2 ) result in i kappa b alpha degradation , increase nf-kappa b dna binding activity , and transactivation of a reporter gene construct contain two nf-kappa b dna binding site .
pretreatment of cell with protein tyrosine kinase inhibitor and the dominant negative allele of c-raf-1 ( raf 301 ) inhibit i kappa b alpha degradation , nf-kappa b binding , and transactivation of kappa b reporter construct by hypoxia .
to demonstrate a direct link between change in the phosphorylation pattern of i kappa b alpha with nf-kappa b activation , we immunoprecipitated i kappa b alpha after vary time of hypoxic exposure and find that it tyrosine phosphorylation status increase during hypoxic exposure .
inhibition of the transfer of tyrosine phosphoryl group onto i kappa b alpha prevent i kappa b alpha degradation and nf-kappa b binding .
in comparison to other activator of nf-kappa b such a phorbol myristate acetate or tumor necrosis factor , we do not detect change in the tyrosine phosphorylation status of i kappa b alpha follow treatment with either of these agent .
these result suggest that tyrosine phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha during hypoxia be an important proximal step which precede it dissociation and degradation from nf-kappa b .
costimulation of peripheral blood t cell activation by human endothelial cell .
enhance il-2 transcription correlate with increase c-fos synthesis and increase fo content of ap-1 .
endothelial cell ( ec ) act a apc for rest pbl in vitro , and may have important role in vivo in the pathogenesis of allograft rejection and delay hypersensitivity .
we previously report that human umbilical vein ec provide costimulatory signal to pha-stimulated pbl via cd2 : lymphocyte function-associated ag-3 and an unidentified ligand pair , result in a three- to eight-fold enhancement of il-2 production .
the physiologic relevance of this increase be demonstrate by the proliferative advantage provide by ec to pbl suboptimally stimulate with mab okt3 .
we now report that ec costimulation cause increase level of il-2 mrna a a result of increase il-2 transcription in pbl .
we therefore examine the effect of ec on t cell nuclear factor know to regulate il-2 transcription , include c-jun and c-fos-two component of the transcription factor ap-1 , nfat , and others .
pbl constitutively express c-jun transcript , and the level of c-jun mrna be not alter by pha activation in the absence or presence of ec .
in contrast , c-fos mrna be absent from rest t cell and be induce on pha activation .
ec alone do not induce c-fos mrna but augment the level of c-fos mrna in pha-activated t cell by 3- to 10-fold .
this effect be largely independent of the cd2 : lymphocyte function- associate ag-3 pathway .
gel-shift analysis reveal the constitutive presence of nuclear factor in rest pbl that bind to the proximal ap-1 site of the il-2 promoter and that contain immunoreactive c-jun but not c-fos protein .
in contrast , ap-1 from pha-activated cell contain c-jun and low level of c-fos .
strikingly , costimulation with ec result in a dramatic increase ( up to 15-fold ) in the c-fos content of ap-1 .
level of other nuclear factor involve in il-2 regulation be not alter by ec , although nfat-dna complex migrate at a slightly different mobility .
in summary , our data suggest that change in the composition of transcription factor ap-1 be a key molecular mechanism for increase il-2 transcription and may underlie the phenomenon of costimulation by ec .
influence of age on the production of fo and jun by influenza virus-exposed t cell .
this study investigate age-related t cell response after in vitro exposure to influenza a virus .
mononuclear leukocyte from young or elderly person be sham-exposed or expose to influenza virus for 1 , 24 , and 72 h .
immunofluorescent staining and flow cytometric analysis be then use to detect t cell produce the transcriptional regulating protein fo and jun .
few virus-exposed cell from elderly donor stain for fo and jun at each data point compare with cell from young donor .
flow cytometric analysis also show that at 72 h of virus exposure few t cell from the elderly produce interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) , suggest a link between the magnitude of the fo and jun and ifn-gamma response .
thus , failure of virus-exposed t cell to produce fo and jun could contribute to the increase in illness due to influenza virus in the elderly .
the c-jun delta-domain inhibit neuroendocrine promoter activity in a dna sequence- and pituitary- specific manner .
the transcription and transformation activity of c-jun be govern by a 27-amino acid regulatory motif , label the delta-domain , which be delete in v-jun .
we have previously show that c-jun be a potent inhibitor of the rat prolactin ( rprl ) promoter activity induce by either oncogenic ra or phorbol ester .
here , we have characterize the structural and cell-specific requirement for this c-jun inhibitory response , and we show that this c-jun inhibitory response map to the rprl footprint ii repressor site , be pituitary-specific and require the c-jun delta-domain .
moreover , alteration of any one of these feature ( e.g. , cis-element , trans-factor , or cell-specific background ) switch c-jun to a transcriptional activator of the rprl promoter .
in hela nonpituitary cell , c-jun alone activate the rprl promoter via the most proximal ghf-1/pit-1 binding site , footprint i , and synergized with ghf-1 .
finally , recombinant ghf-1 interact directly with c-jun but not c-fos protein .
these data provide important fundamental insight into the molecular mechanism by which the c-jun delta-domain function a a modulatory switch and far imply that the functional role of c-jun be dictate by cell-specific influence and the delta-domain motif .
transactivation of the interleukin-1alpha promoter by human t-cell leukemia virus type i and type ii tax protein .
human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) -infected t-cell line constitutively produce high level of interleukin-1alpha ( il-1alpha ) .
to analyze the mechanism that lead to the expression of il-1alpha in htlv-i -infected cell line , we study regulatory region of the human il-1alpha promoter involve in activation of the il-1alpha gene .
il-1alpha promoter construct drive transcription of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) reporter gene in htlv-i -positive mt-2 cell , which constitutively produce il-1alpha .
in a cotransfection assay , the tax protein of both htlv-i and htlv-ii specifically activate transcription from the il-1alpha promoter in an uninfected jurkat cell line .
a mutant tax protein deficient in transactivation of gene by the nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappab pathway be unable to induce transcriptional activity of il-1alpha promoter -cat construct , but be rescue by exogenous provision of p65/p50 nf-kappab .
we find that two il-1alpha kappab-like site ( position -1,065 to -1,056 and +646 to +655 ) specifically form a complex with nf-kappab -containing nuclear extract from mt-2 cell and that nf-kappab bind with high affinity to the 3' nf-kappab binding site than to the 5' nf-kappab site .
moreover , deletion of either 5' or 3' nf-kappab site reduce il-1alpha promoter activity in mt-2 cell and transactivation of the il-1alpha promoter by exogenous nf-kappab and tax in jurkat cell .
these data suggest a general role for tax induction of il-1alpha gene transcription by the nf-kappab pathway .
expression of il-1alpha by htlv-i productively infected cell may be important in the hypercalcemia , osteolytic bone lesion , neutrophilia , elevation of c-reactive protein , and fever frequently see in patient with htlv-i -induced adult t-cell leukemia/lymphoma .
glucocorticoid receptor on mononuclear leukocyte in polycystic ovary syndrome .
objective : many study have suggest that there be a possible hormonal dysregulation of hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal ( hpa ) axis and an increase cortisol clearance in patient with polycystic ovary syndrome ( pcos ) .
therefore in this study , we have examine the role of glucocorticoid receptor/s ( gr ) characteristic in the developing of these abnormality in patient with pcos .
method : for this purpose , the number and affinity of gr in peripheral mononuclear leukocyte ( mnl ) of 10 patient with pcos and 10 healthy woman ( control ) be determine .
result : there be no significant difference in the number ( 6500+/-1001 sites/cell and 6352+/-1697 sites/cell , respectively ; p > 0.05 ) and affinity ( 3.93+/-0.89 nm and 4.49+/-0.71 nm , respectively ; p > 0.05 ) of gr between the pcos patient and the control .
conclusion : these result suggest that the alteration in the hpa axis and in the cortisol metabolism observe in pcos be not related to gr deficiency .
[ mechanism of action of steroid hormone . i . estrogen ]
the steroid hormone be very versatile molecule : although they be related among them by their chemical structure , they have very diverse function and include antagonic .
their action mechanism be not completely clear .
the estrogen participate in the regulation of practically all the reproductive and sexual event of the female , although the intracellular action by which they take place be not well know and the proposed model do not adequately satisfy the question .
currently it be accept the existence of a cytoplasmic and/or nuclear receptor , without explain satisfactorily how the hormone come to the nucleus .
the endocrine event that be rapidly express ( second ) be due to a possible interaction with cellular membrane .
the purpose of this review be to analyze and concilliate the report data on the mechanism of action of estrogen .
long-term inositol phosphate release , but not tyrosine kinase activity , correlate with il-2 secretion and nf-at induction in anti-cd3-activated peripheral human t lymphocyte .
the cascade of event within the first few minute of t cell stimulation have be well characterize .
although many second messenger have be show to be necessary and sufficient for t cell activation in a number of model system , the rate-limiting step in peripheral t cell have not be demonstrate .
to model effective versus ineffective cd3 -mediated stimulation in peripheral t cell , we use two anti-cd3 mabs that differ in their ability to stimulate purify t cell : okt3 , which cause early second messenger generation but be unable to activate t cell without a second signal , and 64.1 , which stimulate t cell proliferation on it own .
we find that tyrosine kinase activity be similar for both mabs over a period of hour .
however , the inositol phosphate response be strong for 64.1 than for okt3 .
to tie these event to gene activation , we measure nf-kappa b and nf-at activity in the nucleus after anti-cd3 stimulation .
both stimulus induce the appearance of the nf-kappa b component ( c-rel , p65 ( rela ) , and p50 ( nf-kappa b1 ) ) and nf-kappa b dna binding activity in the nucleus .
however , only 64.1 induce nf-at in the nucleus , correlate with it ability to activate t cell .
thus , nf-at induction and il-2 secretion be correlate with the level of inositol phosphate release but not with gross level of tyrosine kinase activity induce late follow the response .
on the other hand , nf-kappa b induction and il-2 receptor expression occur even with the small second messenger response generate by okt3 .
ras-related gtp-binding protein and leukocyte signal transduction .
many aspect of leukocyte function be regulate by both heterotrimeric and ras-related gtp-binding protein , but there be little definite information about their role in the specialized process utilize by leukocyte for cell killing .
recent progress in understand the regulation of the phagocyte nadph oxidase by the rac gtp-binding protein provide a basis for define the operational characteristic of one such phagocyte system .
it be clear from various study that the activity of the nadph oxidase can be modulate through the regulation of the gtp-gdp state of rac .
protein exist in leukocyte able to modify gtp-binding protein function in this manner , and their activity may be regulate by signal generate on phagocyte stimulation .
protein of the ra superfamily be likely to be involve in a variety of normal phagocyte function through their ability to modulate the assembly of actin filament , direct vesicle trafficking and fusion , and so forth .
expression of either the tcl1 oncogene , or transcript from it homologue mtcp1/c6.1b , in leukaemic and non-leukaemic t cell from ataxia telangiectasia patient .
patient with the recessively inherit disorder ataxia telangiectasia ( a-t ) have a high level of specific chromosome translocation which can be easily observe in peripheral t cell and show a greatly increase predisposition to leukaemia/lymphoma , mainly of t cell origin .
some translocation cell proliferate into a large clone and may develop into t cell prolymphocytic leukaemia ( t-pll ) .
by the time of diagnosis of t-pll , the clone contain many more genetic change in the form of additional translocation .
t-pll be also see in non- a-t individual where expression of either tcl1 ( at 14q32 ) or the c6.1b/mtcp1 a1 transcript ( at-xq28 ) have be demonstrate in just a few instance .
we show here , that expression of tcl1 occur in leukaemic t cell from a-t patient with chromosome 14 rearrangement .
expression of tcl1 also occur in the preleukaemic clone cell of a-t patient contain the primary translocation alone .
some expression of tcl1 could also be detect in randomly select a-t patient without large cytogenetic clone and without any evidence of leukaemic change .
we also show that expression of the b1 transcript from a second gene , mtcp1 , occur at a relatively high level only in two t-pll tumour from a-t patient with t(x;14) translocation whereas the mtcp1 /a1 transcript be much more widely express in both tumour and non tumour cell of a-t and non- a-t individual .
rescue by cytokine of apoptotic cell death induce by il-2 deprivation of human antigen-specific t cell clone .
the control of cell survival and cell death be of central importance in tissue with high cell turnover such a the lymphoid system .
we have examine the effect of cytokine on il-2 deprivation-induced apoptosis of human antigen-specific t helper clone with different cytokine production profile .
we find that il-2 , interferon-alpha ( ifn-alpha ) , and ifn-beta inhibit il-2 deprivation apoptosis in th0 , th1 , and th2 clone .
we also find that il-2 protect t cell clone from il-2 deprivation apoptosis accompany active proliferation and enhance expression of p53 , rb and bcl-xl protein .
in contrast , ifn-alpha /beta rescue t cell clone from apoptosis without active proliferation , and expression of apoptosis -associated protein test so far be unaffected .
this may be due to the fact that t cell treat with il-2 contain those located in s + g2/m phase of the cell cycle , whereas the vast majority of t cell treat with ifn-alpha /beta be located in g0/g1 phase .
ifn-alpha /beta specifically induce tyrosine phosphorylation and translocation into nucleus of signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) 2 protein in the t cell clone .
in addition , over-expression of stat2 by transfection of the cdna prevent apoptosis of the t cell clone .
our present study show that ifn -alpha and -beta mediate anti-apoptotic effect through other pathway than that of il-2 in growth factor deprivation apoptosis .
superantigens activate hiv-1 gene expression in monocytic cell .
binding of superantigens to mhc class ii molecule result in transduction of biochemical signal lead to cellular activation and gene expression .
we demonstrate that the staphylococcal superantigens toxic shock syndrome toxin-1 ( tsst-1 ) and staphylococcal enterotoxin a ( sea ) activate hiv-1 -ltr -driven transcription of chloramphenicol acetyl transferase in the human monocytic cell line thp-1 .
induction of hiv-1 - ltr -driven transcription in thp-1 cell by superantigens be associate with the induction of nuclear factor-kappa b dna-binding activity .
superantigens also increase viral protein secretion from the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor -pretreated chronically infected human monocytic cell line u1 .
induction of hiv-1 gene expression in monocytic cell by superantigens occur via tumor necrosis factor-alpha -dependent and -independent mechanism .
our result suggest that superantigens and other mhc class ii ligand may activate hiv-1 gene expression in monocytes/macrophages .
reactive oxygen intermediate a apparently widely use messenger in the activation of the nf-kappa b transcription factor and hiv-1 .
hydrogen peroxide and oxygen radical be agent commonly produce during inflammatory process .
in this study , we show that micromolar concentration of h2o2 can induce the expression and replication of hiv-1 in a human t cell line .
the effect be mediate by the nf-kappa b transcription factor which be potently and rapidly activate by an h2o2 treatment of cell from it inactive cytoplasmic form .
n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) , a well characterize antioxidant which counteract the effect of reactive oxygen intermediate ( roi ) in live cell , prevent the activation of nf-kappa b by h2o2 .
nac and other thiol compound also block the activation of nf-kappa b by cycloheximide , double-stranded rna , calcium ionophore , tnf-alpha , active phorbol ester , interleukin-1 , lipopolysaccharide and lectin .
this suggest that diverse agent think to activate nf-kappa b by distinct intracellular pathway might all act through a common mechanism involve the synthesis of roi .
roi appear to serve a messenger mediate directly or indirectly the release of the inhibitory subunit i kappa b from nf-kappa b .
regulation of m-csf expression by m-csf : role of protein kinase c and transcription factor nf kappa b .
macrophage-colony-stimulating factor ( m-csf ) , also refer to a csf-1 , regulate the survival , growth , differentiation and functional activity of monocyte by bind to a single class of high-affinity cell surface receptor , know to be the product of the c-fms protooncogene .
the detection of both m-csf and c-fms expression by cell of the monocyte lineage have suggest that m-csf may act by an autocrine mechanism .
interestingly , it have be show that m-csf can induce the expression of it own gene .
although sensitivity to m-csf can be modulate by regulation of receptor expression and function , m-csf responsiveness be largely determine at a postreceptor level .
to date , little be know about the intracellular pathway of m-csf signal transduction .
we have therefore investigate the change in protein kinase c ( pkc ) activity upon exposure of monocyte to m-csf .
we show that m-csf activate and translocate pkc .
inhibition of pkc by the isoquinoline derivative h7 abolish induction of m-csf by m-csf .
furthermore , activation of pkc be pertussis-toxin-sensitive and be associate with the detection of an nf kappa b protein in nuclear extract of m-csf -induced blood monocyte but not in monocyte expose to medium treatment only .
the result suggest that m-csf induction of m-csf involve g protein , pkc and nf kappa b .
[ regulation of transcription of the interleukin-2 gene in b-lymphocytes ]
since most b cell clone immortalize with ebv virus can be induce to produce interleukin-2 , a typical t cell cytokine , we study the role of different element of the il-2 promoter in such clone by transfection .
it be find , in particular , that the element tced , which bind the transcription factor nf-kb , be very active in all three b clone test .
this element have no activity in t cell of the jurkat line .
the nfatd element , which bind the transcription factor nfat-1 and be very active in t cell , be only weakly active in one b clone and not at all in another .
different element thus contribute to il-2 promoter activity in different cell .
inhibition of the differentiation of human myeloid cell line by redox change induce through glutathione depletion .
we have investigate the effect of redox change in vivo on the differentiation of two human myeloid cell line , hl-60 and kg-1 .
the glutathione -depleting agent diethyl maleate ( dem ) prevent the development of differentiate feature in response to phorbol ester , include adherence of the cell to plastic surface and repression of the myeloperoxidase and cd34 gene .
moreover , dem abolish phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate -induced activation of the transcription factor ap-1 and egr-1 , suggest that inhibition of differentiation may be due , at least in part , to redox modification of these protein .
regulation of interferon-gamma gene expression .
interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) , also know a type ii interferon , be an important immunoregulatory gene that have multiple effect on the development , maturation , and function of the immune system .
ifn-gamma mrna and protein be express predominantly by t cell and large granular lymphocyte
the ifn-gamma mrna be induced/inhibited in these cell type by a wide variety of extracellular signal , thus implicate a number of diverse, yet convergent signal transduction pathway in it transcriptional control
in this review , i describe how dna methylation and specific dna binding protein may regulate transcription of the ifn-gamma gene in response to extracellular signal .
characterization of cd40 signaling determinant regulate nuclear factor-kappa b activation in b lymphocyte .
cd40 signaling to b cell be important for generate an effective humoral immune response .
cd40 ligation lead to b cell activation event such a proliferation , ig secretion , isotype switching , and up-regulation of cell surface molecule , as well a the generation of memory b cell .
many of these event be dependent upon the ability of cd40 to activate the transcription factor nf-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
to define the cd40 signaling component upstream of nf-kappa b activation and the functional consequence downstream of nf-kappa b activation , we examine mouse b cell transfectants express wild-type or mutant human cd40 .
analysis of cd40 cytoplasmic domain truncation and point mutant define a 10-amino acid cd40 cytoplasmic signaling determinant require for nf-kappa b activation .
a threonine residue at position 234 , previously show to be important for cd40 association with tnf receptor-associated factor 2 ( traf2 ) , traf3 , and traf5 , be not require for nf-kappa b activation .
this suggest that in b cell , cd40 -induced nf-kappa b activation can occur independently of traf2 and traf5 association .
nf-kappa b activation be independent of the transmembrane domain of cd40 , suggest that it be independent of p23 , a molecule that associate with cd40 in a region other than the cytoplasmic domain .
proteasome-dependent inhibitory kappa b alpha ( i kappa b alpha ) and i kappa b beta degradation occur downstream of cd40 ligation and precede cd40 -mediated nf-kappa b nuclear translocation .
cd40- or pervanadate- mediated i kappa b tyrosine phosphorylation be not detect .
nf-kappa b activation correlate with the ability of cd40 to induce ab secretion and the up-regulation of icam-1 and lfa-1 .
however , nf-kappa b activation be insufficient for cd40 -mediated up-regulation of b7-1 , fa , and cd23 .
pancreatic development and maturation of the islet b cell .
study of pluripotent islet culture .
pancreas organogenesis be a highly regulate process , in which two anlage evaginate from the primitive gut .
they later fuse , and , under the influence of the surround mesenchyme , the mature organ develop , be mainly compose of ductal , exocrine and endocrine compartment .
early bud be characterize by a branch morphogenesis of the ductal epithelium from which endocrine and exocrine precursor cell bud to eventually form the two other compartment .
the three compartment be think to be of common endodermal origin ; in contrast to early hypothesis , which suggest that the endocrine compartment be of neuroectodermal origin .
it be thus generally believe that the pancreatic endocrine-lineage possess the ability to mature along a differentiation pathway that share many characteristic with those of neuronal differentiation .
during recent year , study of insulin-gene regulation and , in particular , the tissue-specific transcriptional control of insulin-gene activity have provide information on pancreas development in general .
the present review summarize these finding , with a special focus on our own study on pluripotent endocrine culture of rat pancreas .
induction of activator protein ( ap ) -1 and nuclear factor-kappab by cd28 stimulation involve both phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase and acidic sphingomyelinase signal .
a major obstacle in understand the signaling event that follow cd28 receptor ligation arise from the fact that cd28 act a a costimulus to tcr engagement , make it difficult to assess the relative contribution of cd28 signal a distinct from those of the tcr .
to overcome this problem , we have exploit the observation that activate human t cell blast can be stimulate via the cd28 surface molecule in the absence of antigenic challenge ; thus , we have be able to observe the response of normal t cell to cd28 activation in isolation .
use this system , we observe that cd28 stimulation by b7-transfected cho cell induce a proliferative response in t cell that be not accompany by measurable il-2 production .
however , subsequent analysis of transcription factor generation reveal that b7 stimulation induce both activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) and nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) complex , but not nf-at .
in contrast , engagement of the tcr by class ii mhc/superantigen , either with or without cd28 ligation , result in the induction of nf-at , ap-1 , and nf-kappab as well a il-2 production .
use selective inhibitor , we investigate the signaling pathway involve in the cd28 -mediated induction of ap-1 and nf-kappab .
this reveal that nf-kappab generation be sensitive to chloroquine , an inhibitor of acidic sphingomyelinase , but not to the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase inhibitor , wortmannin .
in contrast , ap-1 generation be inhibit by wortmannin and be also variably sensitive to chloroquine .
these data suggest that in activate normal t cell , cd28 -derived signal can stimulate proliferation at least in part via nf-kappab and ap-1 generation , and that this response use both acidic sphingomyelinase and phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase -linked pathway .
inhibition of transcription factor belong to the rel/ nf-kappa b family by a transdominant negative mutant .
the kbf1 factor , which bind to the enhancer a located in the promoter of the mouse mhc class i gene h-2kb , be indistinguishable from the p50 dna binding subunit of the transcription factor nf-kappa b , which regulate a series of gene involve in immune and inflammatory response .
the kbf1/p50 factor bind a a homodimer but can also form heterodimers with the product of other member of the same family , like the c-rel and v-rel ( proto ) oncogene .
the dimerization domain of kbf1/p50 be contain between amino acid 201 and 367 .
a mutant of kbf1/p50 ( delta sp ) , unable to bind to dna but able to form homo- or heterodimers , have be construct .
this protein reduce or abolish in vitro the dna binding activity of wild-type protein of the same family ( kbf1/p50 , c- and v- rel ) .
this mutant also function in vivo a a trans-acting dominant negative regulator : the transcriptional inducibility of the hiv long terminal repeat ( which contain two potential nf-kappa b binding site ) by phorbol ester ( pma ) be inhibit when it be co-transfected into cd4+ t cell with the delta sp mutant .
similarly the basal as well a tnf or il1-induced activity of the mhc class i h-2kb promoter can be inhibit by this mutant in two different cell line .
these result constitute the first formal demonstration that these gene be regulate by member of the rel/ nf-kappa b family .
hypertension in pregnancy .
pregnancy-induced hypertension ( pih ) be a frequent cause of maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality .
in the present study we focus on the pathophysiology of pih , mainly on the role of mineralocorticoid , reverse blood pressure pattern , and the result necessity of continuous monitoring of the preeclamptic mother .
problem of antihypertensive therapy be discuss and the first result of a pilot study with urapidil be present .
to examine the role of mineralocorticoid in the pathophysiology of pih , we study plasma aldosterone and 18-hydroxy-corticosterone ( 18-oh-b ) level in 25 woman with pih and in 25 healthy pregnant woman .
furthermore , we evaluate the mineralocorticoid receptor ( mr ) count in mononuclear leukocyte in the 2 group .
the mr-count be significantly decrease in the pih -group .
the value of plasma aldosterone and 18-oh-b be also low .
these result can not be explain by receptor down-regulation due to high level of mineralocorticoid of the zona glomerulosa .
perhaps deoxycorticosterone or a hitherto unknown mineralocorticoid be responsible for the hypertension and altered mr -status .
the first result of continuous blood pressure measurement with a noninvasive , real-time blood pressure monitor ( finapres ) be present .
the comparison of the obtain value with intraarterial measurement demonstrate a good correlation between the two method .
we also report on the first experience with urapidil in the treatment of hypertension in severe preeclampsia .
the data show that hypertension in preeclamptic woman can be treat by urapidil without side effect or reflex-tachycardia .
further study will have to prove if urapidil be suit for prepartal treatment of pih as well .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat quasispecies differ in basal transcription and nuclear factor recruitment in human glial cell and lymphocyte .
the generation of genomic diversity during the course of infection have the potential to affect all aspect of hiv-1 replication , include expression of the proviral genome .
to gain a good understanding of the impact of long terminal repeat ( ltr ) sequence diversity on ltr -directed gene expression in cell of the central nervous system ( cns ) and immune system , we amplify and clone ltrs from proviral dna in hiv-1 -infected peripheral blood .
sequence analysis of nineteen ltrs clone from 2 adult and 3 pediatric patient reveal an average of 33 nucleotide change ( with respect to the sequence of the lai ltr ) within the 455-bp u3 region .
transient expression analysis in cell of neuroglial and lymphocytic origin demonstrate that some of these ltrs have activity which vary significantly from the lai ltr in u-373 mg cell ( an astrocytoma cell line ) as well a in jurkat cell ( a cd4- positive lymphocyte cell line ) .
while ltrs which demonstrate the high activity in u-373 mg cell also yield high activity in jurkat cell , the ltrs be generally more active in jurkat cell when compare to the lai ltr .
difference in ltr sequence also result in difference in transcription factor recruitment to cis-acting site within the u3 region of the ltr , a demonstrate by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
in particular , naturally occur sequence variation impacted transcription factor bind to an activate transcription factor/ camp response element binding ( atf/creb ) binding site ( located between the lef-1 and distal nf-kappab transcription factor binding site ) that we identify in previous study of the hiv-1 ltr .
these finding suggest that ltr sequence change can significantly affect basal ltr function and transcription factor recruitment , which may , in turn , alter the course of viral replication in cell of cns and immune system origin .
distinctive expression pattern of the bcl-6 protein in nodular lymphocyte predominance hodgkin 's disease .
the bcl-6 gene encode a nuclear-located kruppel-type zinc finger protein be rearrange in about 30 % diffuse large b-cell lymphoma and be express predominantly in normal germinal center b cell and related lymphoma .
these finding suggest that bcl-6 may play a role in regulate differentiation of normal germinal center b cell and that it deregulate expression cause by rearrangement may contribute to lymphomagenesis .
this prompt u to investigate the expression of the bcl-6 protein in hodgkin 's disease ( hd ) , focus on the nodular lymphocyte predominance subtype ( nlphd ) , which differ from classical hd by virtue of the b-cell nature of the malignant cell population ( so-called l & h cell ) and it relationship with germinal center .
forty-one hd sample ( 19 nlphd , 12 nodular sclerosis , and 10 mixed cellularity ) be immunostained with the monoclonal antibody pg-b6 and pg-b6p that react with a fixative-sensitive and a formalin-resistant epitope on the aminoterminal region of the bcl-6 gene product , respectively .
strong nuclear positivity for the bcl-6 protein be detect in tumor ( l & h ) cell in all case of nlphd .
in contrast , bcl-6 be express only in a small percentage of hodgkin and reed-sternberg cell in about 30 % of classical hd case .
notably , the nucleus of reactive cd3+/cd4+ t cell nearby to and rosetting around l & h cell in nlphd be also strongly bcl-6 + , but lack cd40 ligand ( cd40l ) expression .
this staining pattern clearly differ from that of classical hd , whose cellular background be make up of cd3+/cd4+ t cell show the bcl-6 -/ cd40l + phenotype .
these result far support the concept that nlphd be an histogenetically distinct , b-cell-derived subtype of hd and suggest a role for bcl-6 in it development .
epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 and latent membrane protein independently transactivate p53 through induction of nf-kappab activity .
b-cell immortalization by epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) be dependent on permanent control of the cellular process which normally regulate cell division and apoptosis , function possess by p53 in a number of normal cell type .
in study initiate to evaluate relationship between ebv latent gene and p53 , p53 level be find to increase approximately 10-fold 4 to 5 day after ebv infection of purify rest human b cell ; the induce p53 be transcriptionally active .
latent membrane protein 1 and , to a less extent , ebv nuclear antigen 2 mediate the increase in p53 level via activation of the nf-kappab transcription factor .
induction of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 expression in monocytic cell by cryptococcus neoformans and candida albicans .
because candidiasis and cryptococcosis be common in human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -infected person , the effect of cryptococcus neoformans and candida albicans on hiv expression in monocytic cell be examine .
stimulation of the latently hiv-infected myelomonocytic cell line om-10.1 with c. neoformans and c. albicans in the presence of pooled human serum cause a ratio-dependent increase in hiv production .
induction of hiv by c. neoformans be enhance by anti-capsular antibody , while induction by both organism be inhibit by anti-tnf-alpha antibody .
in thp-1 cell transfected with hiv plasmid construct , both organism induce transcription from the hiv long terminal repeat that be dependent on intact nf-kappab binding sequence .
thus , c. neoformans and c. albicans enhance hiv expression in monocytic cell through a tnf-alpha- and nf-kappab- dependent mechanism .
in hiv -infected patient , such enhancement may far impair host immunity and could accelerate the course of hiv disease .
activation of ra and mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway by terminal complement complex be g protein dependent .
assembly of terminal complement complex ( tcc ) c5b-7 , c5b-8 , and c5b-9 on target cell during acute and chronic inflammation induce hydrolysis of plasma membrane phospholipid and heterotrimeric g protein activation .
tcc also stimulate a variety of cellular activity , which include cytokine synthesis , proto-oncogene activation , and mitotic signaling .
now we report that sublytic tcc induce ra , raf-1 , and extracellular signal-regulated kinase ( erk ) 1 activation in jy25 b cell line .
when cell be expose to c5b-9 , gtp-bound ra in anti- c5b-9 immunoprecipitates be increase 3.2-fold at 2 min , while gtp-bound ra in anti- ras immunoprecipitates be increase 2-fold at 10 min .
both c5b-9 and c5b-7 , but not c5b6 , increase raf-1 kinase activity maximum 3.3-fold at 2 min and 2.8-fold at 5 min , respectively .
erk1 activity be 2-fold increase by c5b-9 at 2 min and by c5b-7 at 10 min , over the c5b6 level .
the role of mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) pathway on tcc -inducible mitotic signaling be evaluate by assess dna synthesis and activator protein 1 ( ap-1 ) dna-binding activity .
the mapk/erk-specific inhibitor pd 098,059 abolish the c5b-9 -induced dna synthesis .
involvement of g protein in the activation of mapk pathway by tcc be indicate by inhibition of raf-1 and erk1 kinase activity , as well a the dna synthesis by pretreatment of cell with pertussis toxin .
overexpression of beta-adrenergic receptor kinase 1 carboxyl-terminal peptide in jy25 cell also inhibit raf-1 and erk1 activity , indicate a direct involvement of g betagamma subunit in the signal transduction generate through activation of mapk pathway by tcc assembly in the plasma membrane .
nf-kappa b -dependent induction of the nf-kappa b p50 subunit gene promoter underlie self-perpetuation of human immunodeficiency virus transcription in monocytic cell .
the molecular mechanism underlie the sustained nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b observe in u937 monocytic cell chronically infect with human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) be study .
the activity of the promoter regulate the synthesis of the p105 precursor of the nf-kappa b p50 subunit be enhance in these cell .
deletion in this promoter indicate that this upregulation be mediate through the nf-kappa b- but not the ap-1-binding motif , by bona fide p50/p65 heterodimers .
analysis of cytosolic extract indicate that nf-kappa b level be increase in hiv -infected cell .
in contrast to the transient nf-kappa b activation induce by phorbol ester , the permanent nf-kappa b translocation induce by hiv infection be not dependent on pkc isoenzymes alpha and beta a show by the use of a specific inhibitor ( gf 109203x ) .
these observation indicate that during chronic hiv infection of u937 cell , continuous nf-kappa b ( p50/p65 ) translocation result in p105 promoter upregulation with subsequent cytosolic nf-kappa b accumulation , ready for further translocation .
this hiv -mediated mechanism result in a self-perpetuating loop of nf-kappa b production .
tat-binding protein 7 be a subunit of the 26 protease .
subunit 6 ( s6 ) , an integral component of the 26 protease from human erythrocyte , have be study by sds-page , peptide mapping and sequence analysis .
s6 be cleave with cnbr and three internal peptide be sequence .
a comparison with known protein in genbank reveal that all three s6 peptide match the predict sequence of tbp7 , tat-binding protein 7 .
base on peptide match cover more than 10 % of the tbp7 sequence , and the fact that the migration of s6 on sds-page be consistent with the estimate molecular mass for tbp7 , we conclude that subunit 6 of the 26 protease be tbp7 .
interleukin-10 stabilize inhibitory kappab-alpha in human monocyte .
interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) protect animal from lethal endotoxemia .
this beneficial effect be mediate , in part , by inhibition of inflammatory cytokine production , include tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
evidence suggest that il-10 may inhibit activation of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) through an unknown mechanism .
nf-kappab activation in response to inflammatory signal be dependent upon degradation of it associate inhibitory peptide , inhibitory kappab-alpha ( ikappab-alpha ) .
we hypothesize that il-10 prevent human monocyte nf-kappab activation and resultant tnf-alpha production by stabilization of ikappab-alpha .
the purpose of this study be to determine the effect of il-10 on lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -induced human monocyte tnf-alpha production , nf-kappab activation , and ikappab-alpha degradation .
monocyte be isolate from human donor .
cell be stimulate with endotoxin ( lp , 100 ng/ml ) with and without human il-10 ( 10 ng/ml ) .
follow stimulation , tnf-alpha be measure in cell supernatant by elisa , nf-kappab activity by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , and ikappab-alpha level by western blot .
we observe that after lp stimulation of human monocyte , tnf-alpha increase to 798+/-67 pg/ml ( p < .001 versus control ) .
il-10 attenuate lp -stimulated tnf-alpha production ( 297+/-54 ; p < .001 versus lp alone ) .
after lp stimulation in human monocyte , ikappab-alpha protein level decrease , and nf-kappab dna binding increase .
il-10 pretreatment prevent lp -induced decrease in ikappab-alpha protein level and attenuate nf-kappab dna binding .
il-10 appear to prevent activation of nf-kappab by preserve ikappab-alpha protein level , lead to a reduction in tnf-alpha release .
immunophenotype of intraductal carcinoma .
objective -- mammography and breast-conserving therapy have focus attention on the classification of intraductal carcinoma ( idc ) and emphasize the prognostic importance of comedo versus noncomedo variant .
we use histochemical marker to define the immunophenotype of 43 idcs with respect to comedo versus noncomedo status and pattern of angiogenesis .
result -- reaction in comedo carcinoma be significantly negative for estrogen receptor and progesterone receptor , and positive for p53 and her-2/neu more often than the noncomedo variant .
all seven idcs associate with paget 's disease show positive reaction for her-2/neu .
basement membrane immunoreactivity for type iv collagen and laminin be discontinuous in most example of idc regardless of type , with a trend toward more intense staining in comedo than in noncomedo carcinoma .
periductal angiogenesis be not significantly related to the type of idc but be more pronounced with comedo carcinoma .
conclusion -- these observation indicate that there be immunophenotypic correlate to the current structural classification of idc .
the immunophenotype of idc be helpful in subclassifying an idc and could prove useful a a prognostic indicator for local control in patient treat by breast-conserving therapy .
integrin-mediated tyrosine phosphorylation and cytokine message induction in monocytic cell .
a possible signaling role for the syk tyrosine kinase .
activation of cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase be an important aspect of signal transduction mediate by integrins .
in the human monocytic cell line thp-1 , either integrin -dependent cell adhesion to fibronectin or ligation of beta 1 integrins with antibody cause a rapid and intense tyrosine phosphorylation of two set of protein of about 65-75 and 120-125 kda .
in addition , integrin ligation lead to nuclear translocation of the p50 and p65 subunit of the nf-kappa b transcription factor , to activation of a reporter gene drive by a promoter contain nf-kappa b site , and to increase level of mrna for immediate-early gene , include the cytokine interleukin ( il ) -1 beta .
the tyrosine kinase inhibitor genistein and herbimycin a block both integrin -mediated tyrosine phosphorylation and increase in il-1 beta message level , indicate a causal relationship between the two event .
the component tyrosine phosphorylated subsequent to cell adhesion include paxillin , pp125fak , and the sh2 domain contain tyrosine kinase syk .
in contrast , integrin ligation with antibody induce tyrosine phosphorylation of syk but not of fak or paxillin .
in adhering cell , pre-treatment with cytochalasin d suppress tyrosine phosphorylation of fak and paxillin but not of syk , while il-1 beta message induction be unaffected .
these observation indicate that the syk tyrosine kinase may be an important component of an integrin signaling pathway in monocytic cell , lead to activation of nf-kappa b and to increase level of cytokine message .
constitutive nuclear nf-kappa b in cell of the monocyte lineage .
in monocyte , the nuclear factor nf-kappa b have be invoke a an important transcription factor in the expression of cytokine gene , of cell-surface receptor and in the expression of human immunodeficiency virus .
in such cell , dna binding activity of nf-kappa b can be detect without intentional stimulation .
in our study , cell of the human monocytic line mono mac 6 , culture in medium contain fetal-calf serum and low level of lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , also exhibit such ' constitutive ' nf-kappa b , a demonstrate by mobility-shift analysis of nuclear extract .
this nuclear nf-kappa b be still present when contaminant lp be remove by ultrafiltration and when serum be omit .
protein-dna complex of constitutive nf-kappa b be similar in mobility to the lp -induced nf-kappa b and both be recognize by an antibody specific to the p50 subunit of nf-kappa b .
by contrast , treatment of cell with pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) will only block lp -induced nf-kappa b , but not the constitutive bind protein .
use lps-free and serum-free condition , constitutive nf-kappa b can be detect in different cell line of the monocytic lineage ( hl60 , u937 , thp-1 , mono mac 1 and mono mac 6 ) , but not in molt 4 t cell or k562 stem cell .
when order accord to stage of maturation , the amount of constitutive nf-kappa b be not increase in more mature cell line .
furthermore , when induce differentiation in mono mac 6 cell , with vitamin d3 , no change in constitutive or inducible nf-kappa b can be detect .
analysis of primary cell reveal substantial constitutive nf-kappa b -binding activity in blood monocyte , pleural macrophage and alveolar macrophage .
the constitutive nf-kappa b appear to be functionally active , since a low level of tumour necrosis factor ( tnf ) transcript be detectable in monocyte , and this level can be increase by block transcript degradation use cycloheximide .
the level of constitutive nf-kappa b in these cell be variable and be frequently find to be low in the more mature macrophage .
constitutive nf-kappa b be not maintain by autocrine action of cytokine tnf , interleukin 6 , interleukin 10 , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor or macrophage colony-stimulating factor , since neutralize antibody do not reduce constitutive dna-binding activity .
furthermore , blockade of prostaglandin or leukotriene biosynthesis do not affect constitutive nf-kappa b .
( abstract truncate at 400 word )
human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax protein abrogate interleukin-2 dependence in a mouse t-cell line .
human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) be the etiologic agent of adult t-cell leukemia .
tax , the viral protein , be think to be crucial in the development of the disease , since it transform healthy t cell in vitro and induce tumor in transgenic animal .
we examine the effect of tax activity on the growth of the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) -dependent t-cell line ctll-2 .
stable expression of tax in ctll-2 transform cell growth from be il-2 dependent to il-2 independent .
tax stimulate transcription through nf-kappab and the cyclic amp -responsive element-like sequence in the htlv-1 promoter .
the finding of tax mutant segregate these two pathway suggest that the nf-kappab pathway be essential for il-2 -independent growth of ctll-2 cell while the cre pathway be unnecessary .
however , both pathway be necessary for another transformation-related activity ( colony formation in soft agar ) of ctll-2/ tax .
our result show that tax have at least two distinct activity on t cell , and suggest that tax play a crucial role in il-2 -independent t-cell transformation induce by htlv-1 , in addition to it well-known il-2 -dependent cell transformation .
the cytoplasmic domain of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) receptor alpha subunit be essential for both gm-csf -mediated growth and differentiation .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) regulate differentiation , survival , and proliferation of colony-forming unit-granulocyte-macrophage progenitor cell .
the biologic action of gm-csf be mediate by bind to a specific receptor consist of two chain designate a alpha and beta subunit .
we have demonstrate that the murine fdc-p1-derived cell line wt-19 transfected with the human gm-csf receptor alpha and beta subunit ( gm-csfr alpha and beta ) can be induce to differentiate by the addition of human gm-csf ( hgm-csf ) .
by express a series of gm-csfralpha mutant in wt19 cell , we have determine the amino acid domain of the gm-csfralpha cytoplasmic domain that regulate cell differentiation , proliferation , and survival .
we find that the membrane proximal proline-rich domain and adjacent 16 residue be essential for both hgm-csf -dependent cell proliferation and differentiation .
in contrast , the c-terminal region of the gm-csfralpha cytoplasmic domain be not necessary for cell differentiation mediate by hgm-csf , but the removal of this region severely impair the ability of hgm-csf to support cell survival .
while the activation of jak2 , shc , erk , and stat5 protein correlate with hgm-csf -mediated cell growth , cellular differentiation occur in the absence of activation of these signal transduction pathway .
the role of nuclear factor-kappa b in cytokine gene regulation .
transcription factor be dna-binding protein that regulate gene expression .
nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be a critical transcription factor for maximal expression of many cytokine that be involve in the pathogenesis of inflammatory disease , such a adult respiratory distress syndrome ( ards ) and sepsis syndrome .
activation and regulation of nf-kappa b be tightly control by a group of inhibitory protein ( i kappa b ) that sequester nf-kappa b in the cytoplasm of immune/inflammatory effector cell .
nf-kappa b activation involve signal phosphorylation , ubiquitination , and proteolysis of i kappa b .
liberate nf-kappa b migrate to the nucleus , where it bind to specific promoter site and activate gene transcription .
the activation of nf-kappa b initiate both extracellular and intracellular regulatory event that result in autoregulation of the inflammatory cascade through modulation of nf-kappa b activation .
recently , activation of nf-kappa b have be link to ards and have be show to be a critical proximal step in the initiation of neutrophilic inflammation in animal model .
activation of nf-kappa b can be inhibit in vivo by treatment with antioxidant , corticosteroid , and the induction of endotoxin tolerance .
identification of more specific and efficacious inhibitor of nf-kappa b activation might prove beneficial for the treatment of cytokine-mediated inflammatory disease .
stable expression of hb24 , a diverged human homeobox gene , in t lymphocyte induce gene involve in t cell activation and growth .
a diverged homeobox gene , hb24 , which be know to be induce follow lymphocyte activation , be introduce into jurkat t cell under the control of a constitutive promoter .
stable transfectants of hb24 be establish that express high level of hb24 mrna and possess an altered phenotype suggestive of activate t cell .
a number of gene know to be induce follow t cell activation and associate with cell growth be increase in the transfectants , include c-fos , c-myc , c-myb , hla-dr , lck , nf-kappa b , interleukin-2 and interleukin-2 receptor alpha ( il-2r alpha ) .
analysis of il-2r alpha expression by transient transfection of il-2r alpha promoter construct into the hb24 transfectants reveal constitutive expression ( about 60 % of phytohemagglutinin- and phorbol ester- activated jurkat cell ) that be dependent on the kappa b site in the il-2r alpha promoter .
furthermore , a a consequence of the increase hb24 mrna level , the jurkat hb24 transfectants proliferate more rapidly than control cell line .
thus , stable expression of hb24 confer an activation phenotype on a human t cell line , implicate this gene a an important transcriptional factor during t cell activation and growth .
cellular immune and cytokine pathway result in tissue factor expression and relevance to septic shock .
cell of monocyte lineage serve a effector cell in the cellular immune response .
in addition , they respond to lp and cytokine with activation and expression of inflammatory effector gene product similar to those elicit by the antigen driven response .
the response to antigen proceed at the t helper cell level through two independent form of cellular collaboration , contact and lymphokine .
we review the control of expression of the tissue factor ( tf ) gene and the function of the tf protein .
the enhance initiation of transcription of the tf gene appear to require engagement of a 56 bp lp response element , an enhancer that be engage by both ap-1 type heterodimeric complex as well a nf kappa b like heterodimeric complex .
dissociation of nf kappa b from ig kappa b by cytokine and lp stimulation , and possibly activate t cell , may represent a common pathway to induction of the tf and other inflammatory gene .
enhancement of expression of tf be observe upon adhesion of mo to endothelial cell and extracellular matrix protein , as well a upon engagement of leukocyte integrins .
the biological effect that follow from expression of tf by vascular cell have be resolve by analysis of function aid by the use of recombinant full length tf and truncate surface domain of tf .
the rule of assembly of the cognate ligand of tf , namely the zymogen plasma factor vii and the serine protease factor viia , with the soluble surface domain of tf in free solution , in the presence of phospholipid surface and cell surface and of the anchor tf molecule have be describe .
it be evident that assembly of the surface domain of tf with viia to form the binary tf.viia complex induce a significant increase in the kcat of the catalytic domain of viia for small peptidyl substrate and more profoundly for protein substrate .
this provide substantial evidence for an allosteric effect on the catalytic cleft of viia that be impart by bind to tf , it cognate catalytic cofactor .
it be also evident that the tf.viia complex be proteolytically active and can activate the zymogen plasma factor x to the serine protease xa in free solution , infer that extend substrate recognition by induce structural locus of the tf.viia complex be create from either or both protein to constitute a new recognition structure .
it be also evident that association of x with charged phospholipid surface enhance the proteolytic activation of this zymogen by increase recognition and susceptibility of the sessile peptide bond deduce from the markedly decrease km and increase kcat .
tnfalpha cooperate with the protein kinase a pathway to synergistically increase hiv-1 ltr transcription via downstream tre-like camp response element .
activate protein-1 ( ap-1 ) binding tpa responsive element ( tre ) be located downstream of the transcription initiation site in the u5 region of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
these downstream sequence element , term dse , can bind both ap-1 and creb/atf transcription factor .
recently , we demonstrate that the dse be also camp-responsive element ( cre ) , since they mediate activation signal elicit by cholera toxin ( ctx ) , a potent activator of the camp-dependent protein kinase a ( pka ) signal transduction pathway .
in the present study , we demonstrate that the hiv-1 dse can mediate the transcriptional synergy elicit by the combination of ctx and tnfalpha .
ctx combine with tnfalpha or il-1beta to produce a synergistic increase in p24 antigen production in u1 promonocytic cell .
transfection study of ltr reporter construct indicate that mutation of the dse site abrogate the ltr -mediated synergy induce by ctx and tnfalpha , whereas the synergy induce by ctx and il-1beta be unaffected , suggest tnfalpha and il-1beta cooperate differently with the camp /pka activation pathway to induce hiv-1 expression in u1 cell .
because the dse be also tre site , we assess the effect of the agonist combination on ap-1 -dependent transcription .
tnfalpha as well a il-1beta cooperate with ctx to produce a synergistic activation of ap-1 -mediated transcription .
these data indicate that the tre -like camp-responsive dse site within the 5'-untranslated leader can mediate the transcriptional cooperativity between tnfalpha and the camp /pka pathway .
since the dse and tre site can not bind creb/atf homodimers , we propose a mechanism in which the hiv-1 dse bind heterodimers compose of both ap-1 and creb/atf protein .
