autoregulation of the nf-kappa b transactivator rela ( p65 ) by multiple cytoplasmic inhibitor contain ankyrin motif .
rela ( p65 ) function a the critical transactivating component of the heterodimeric p50- p65 nf-kappa b complex and contain a high-affinity bind site for it cytoplasmic inhibitor , i kappa b alpha .
after cellular activation , i kappa b alpha be rapidly degrade in concert with the induce nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b .
the present study demonstrate that tumor necrosis factor alpha -induced degradation of i kappa b alpha in human t cell be precede by it rapid phosphorylation in vivo .
however , these effect on i kappa b alpha result in nuclear mobilization of only a fraction of the entire cytoplasmic pool of rela .
subsequent study have reveal that ( i ) cytoplasmic rela be stably associate not only with i kappa b alpha but also with other ankyrin motif-rich protein include the product of the nf-kappa b2 ( p100 ) and nf-kappa b1 ( p105 ) gene ; ( ii ) in contrast to rela -i kappa b alpha , rela -p100 cytoplasmic complex be not dissociate follow tumor necrosis factor alpha activation ; ( iii ) p100 function a a potent inhibitor of rela -mediated transcription in vivo ; ( iv ) the interaction of rela and p100 involve the conserve rel homology domain of both protein but not the nuclear localization signal of rela , which be require for i kappa b alpha binding ; ( v ) p100 inhibition of rela function require the c-terminal ankyrin motif domain , which mediate cytoplasmic retention of rela ; and ( vi ) a observe with i kappa b alpha , nuclear rela stimulate p100 mrna and protein expression .
these finding thus reveal the presence of a second inducible autoregulated inhibitory pathway that help ensure the rapid but transient action of nuclear nf-kappa b .
x-ray -induced secretion of cellular factor ( s ) that enhance ( s ) hiv-1 promoter transcription in various non-irradiated transfected cell line .
various cellular stress agent like ionize radiation exposure could activate human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-_1 ) replication or reporter gene expression .
in addition , extracellular factor ( s ) release by x-ray-treated human colonic carcinoma cell line ( ht29 ) might activate the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of hiv-1 in non-irradiated ht29 cell .
in the present report we show that in various transiently or stably transfected cell line , x-ray irradiation up-regulates hiv-1 ltr transcription through the kappab regulatory element .
a factor ( s ) , which be process by and act upon a variety of cell type , be detect by addition to non-irradiated cell of either x-ray -treated cell or a conditioned medium take from irradiated culture .
the magnitude of responsiveness be cell type dependent .
in addition , x-ray activation of hiv-1 ltr in transiently or stably transfected cell line be inhibit by a potent antioxidant drug , pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate and by another drug , know for it role in the trapping of growth factor , suramin .
the importance of these observation in the pathophysiology of patient with aids-related cancer treat by radiotherapy remain to be establish .
coactivation by oca-b : definition of critical region and synergism with general cofactor .
molecular dissection of the b-cell-specific transcription coactivator oca-b have reveal distinct region important , respectively , for recruitment to immunoglobulin promoter through interaction with octamer-bound oct-1 and for subsequent coactivator function .
further analysis of general coactivator requirement show that selective removal of pc4 from the essential usa fraction severely impair oct-1 and oca-b function in a cell-free system reconstitute with partially purify factor .
full activity can be restore by the combined action of recombinant pc4 and the pc4 -depleted usa fraction , thus suggest a joint requirement for pc4 and another , usa-derived component ( s ) for optimal function of oct-1 /oca-b in the reconstituted system .
indeed , usa-derived pc2 be find to act synergistically with pc4 in reproduce the function of intact usa in the assay system .
consistent with the requirement for pc4 in the reconstituted system , oca-b be find to interact directly with pc4 .
surprisingly , however , removal of pc4 from the unfractionated nuclear extract have no detrimental effect on oca-b / oct-1 -dependent transcription .
these result lead to a general model for the synergistic function of activation domain in oct-1 and oca-b ( mediate by the combined action of the multiple usa component ) and , far , suggest a functional redundancy in general coactivators .
lack of t-cell-mediated recognition of the fusion region of the pml/rar-alpha hybrid protein by lymphocyte of acute promyelocytic leukemia patient .
in previous study , it be show that the fusion region of the pml/rar-alpha protein , express by acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) cell , can be specifically recognize in vitro by donor ( d. e. ) cd4 t cell in a hla class ii dr11-restricted fashion .
we present here the result on the recognition of several pml/rar-alpha peptide by apl patient express hla dr11 .
the in vitro immunization of peripheral blood lymphocyte from four patient in remission ( s.r. , f.r. , m.m. , p. g. ) with bcr1/25 , a 25-mer pml/ rar-alpha , do not elicit either a polyclonal or a clonal immune response specific to the peptide .
we then generate new donor anti-pml/ rar-alpha cd4(+) t-cell clone .
these clone be test for their recognition of bcr1/25 .
one clone ( c3/5 , cd3(+) , cd4(+) , cd8(-) ) be select for further analysis .
clone c3/5 show specific proliferation , cytotoxicity , and cytokine ( tumor necrosis factor alpha , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ) production when challenge with autologous lymphoblastic cell line pulse with peptide bcr1/25 .
c3/5 cell develop specific proliferation and cytotoxicity when challenge with peptide-pulsed lymphoblastic cell line and peripheral blood lymphocyte from the four dr11(+) apl patient .
apl blast , available only from patient f.r. and p.g. , be not lysed by c3/5 and be unable to present peptide bcr1/25 .
incubation of apl cell with ifn-gamma fail to induce hla class ii molecule and recognition by the c3/5 clone .
since apl cell do not express hla class ii molecule , we test in two donor ( d.e. and c.h.r. ) and in patient s.r. and p.g. whether the use of 9-mer peptide ( bcr1/9 ) would generate a cd8 /hla class i -restricted response .
no peptide-specific t-cell line or clone could be generate from both donor and patient .
these finding be discuss in relation to possible therapeutic approach to the immunotherapy of apl .
c-jun and gst-pi expression in human plasma cell .
bone marrow sample from 33 patient affect by mm and mgus , and 8 patient not affect by lymphoproliferative disease be study for expression of c-jun ( a component of the transcription factor ap-1 ) and glutathione-s-transferase pi ( gst-pi ) use immunocytochemical method .
a high and frequent expression of these two protein be find both in mm and mgus patient ( 31/33 patient positive for c-jun and 29/33 patient positive for gst-pi ) and in control not affect by monoclonal gammopathy ( 7/8 patient positive for both c-jun and gst-pi ) .
no statistically significant correlation be find between c-jun- and gst-pi- positive plasma cell .
the expression of these two protein be not related to clinical or laboratory data .
our result seem to confirm a possible role of the transcriptional complex ap-1 in activate gst-pi promoter in human plasma cell .
the use of interferon-gamma-treated u937 cell in chemiluminescence assay to detect red cell , platelet and granulocyte antibody of potential clinical significance .
the chemiluminescent ( cl ) response of interferon-gamma-treated u937 ( ifn-u937 ) cell to sensitize target cell have be use to detect red cell , platelet and granulocyte antibody .
a clone of u937 cell be select which express fc receptor i ( fc gamma ri ) and which , after incubation with ifn-gamma for 72 h , be capable of generate high level of lucigenin-enhanced cl .
the cl response of ifn-u937 cell and peripheral blood human monocyte to sensitize red cell , platelet or granulocyte be then compare .
assay use monocyte or ifn-u937 cell be of comparable sensitivity for detection of antibody against all three type of target cell .
in addition , the use of ifn-u937 cell reduce interassay variation and simplified assay performance .
the potential clinical usefulness of these cl assay be suggest by the ability of both monocyte and ifn-u937 cell to respond to red cell , platelet or granulocyte sensitize with serum from pregnant woman whose baby have either haemolytic disease of the newborn ( hdn ) , alloimmune thrombocytopenia or alloimmune neutropenia respectively .
in addition , monocyte and ifn-u937 cell both respond to red cell sensitize with antibody against a variety of specificity of assume ( although not document ) clinical significance for blood transfusion recipient .
in contrast , monocyte and ifn-u937 cell respond only weakly to red cell sensitize with either anti-d in serum from mother of baby unaffected by hdn , or with antiserum contain high titre antibody with specificity not normally associate with significantly reduce red cell survival .
a novel genetic system to isolate a dominant negative effector on dna-binding activity of oct-2 .
recent study have reveal that interaction between transcription factor play an important role in regulation of gene expression in eukaryotic cell .
to isolate cdna clone that dominantly inhibit the dna-binding activity of oct-2 , choose a a representative factor , we have develop a novel screening system .
this employ an escherichia coli tester strain carry a modify lac operon a a reporter gene , with the lac operator sequence replace by an octamer sequence .
oct-2 express in this tester strain repress the expression of the reporter gene and change the phenotype of the cell from lac+ to lac- .
introduction of a cdna expression library prepare from a human t-cell line into the oct-2 -harboring tester strain allow selection of three lac+ clone out of 1 x 10(5) transformants .
one of them , ht86 , encode a putative zinc finger protein be find to derepress beta-galactosidase activity in the oct-2 -harboring tester strain at the transcriptional level .
in gel mobility shift assay , ht86 attenuate the intensity of the retard band compose of the octamer probe and oct-2 , suggest a dominant negative effect on the dna-binding activity of oct-2 .
the strategy describe here provide a new approach for study protein-protein interaction that govern the complex regulation of gene expression .
repression of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 through the novel cooperation of human factor yy1 and lsf [ publish erratum appear in j virol 1998 feb ; 72 ( 2 ) : 1709 ]
a subpopulation of stably infected cd4+ cell capable of produce virus upon stimulation have be identify in human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -positive individual ( t.-w.chun , d.finzi , j.margolick , k.chadwick , d.schwartz , and r.f.siliciano , nat.med.1 : 1284-1290 , 1995 ) .
few host factor that directly limit hiv-1 transcription and could support this state of nonproductive hiv-1 infection have be describe .
yy1 , a widely distribute human transcription factor , be know to inhibit hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) transcription and virus production .
lsf ( also know a lbp-1 , ubp , and cp-2 ) have be show to repress ltr transcription in vitro , but transient expression of lsf have no effect on ltr activity in vivo .
we report that both yy1 and lsf participate in the formation of a complex that recognize the initiation region of the hiv-1 ltr .
far , we have find that these factor cooperate in the repression of ltr expression and viral replication .
this cooperative function may account for the divergent effect of lsf previously observe in vitro and in vivo .
thus , the cooperation of two general cellular transcription factor may allow for the selective downregulation of hiv transcription .
through this mechanism of gene regulation , yy1 and lsf could contribute to the establishment and maintenance of a population of cell stably but nonproductively infect with hiv-1 .
pathogenesis of atherosclerosis .
the early lesion in the development of an atherosclerotic plaque be the fatty streak .
this chronic inflammatory reaction result from a sequence of event that begin with the trapping of low density lipoprotein ( ldl ) in the subendothelial space of the artery wall .
the trap ldl be seed with oxidative specie release by the overlie endothelium , and lipid oxidation be initiate within the ldl particle . some of the lipid that result lead to the activation of nfkb-like transcription factor that cause the expression of gene whose protein product mediate monocyte binding , monocyte chemotaxis into the subendothelial space , and conversion into macrophage .
at least 1 major gene modulate the oxidation of ldl lipid and/or the biologic response to these lipid .
the inverse relation between high density lipoprotein ( hdl ) and atherosclerotic event may in part be due to enzyme associate with hdl that destroy the biologically active lipid generate in ldl .
towards a molecular understanding of t-cell differentiation .
lymphoid differentiation be one of the best study example of mammalian development .
here han clevers and michael owen describe how the cloning of the gene that encode t-cell-specific membrane protein allow the identification of transcription factor that control the expression of these t-cell gene .
such transcription factor play a key role in the development of the mature t-cell phenotype by function a ' master regulator of t-cell differentiation ' .
transcriptional and post-transcriptional regulation of c-jun expression during monocytic differentiation of human myeloid leukemic cell .
ap-1 , the polypeptide product of c-jun , recognize and bind to specific dna sequence and stimulate transcription of gene responsive to certain growth factor and phorbol ester such a 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) .
we study the effect of tpa on the regulation of c-jun gene expression in hl-60 cell during monocytic differentiation .
low level of c-jun transcript be detectable in untreated hl-60 leukemic cell , increase significantly by 6 h , and reach near maximal level by 24 h of exposure to 32 nm tpa .
similar kinetics of c-jun induction by tpa be observe in human u-937 and thp-1 monocytic leukemia cell .
similar finding be obtain with bryostatin 1 ( 10 nm ) , another activator of protein kinase c and inducer of monocytic differentiation .
furthermore , 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 0.5 microm ) , a structurally distinct agent which also induce hl-60 monocytic differentiation , increase c-jun expression .
tpa treatment of hl-60 cell in the presence of cycloheximide be associate with superinduction of c-jun transcript .
run-on analysis demonstrate detectable level of c-jun gene transcription in untreated hl-60 cell , and that exposure to tpa increase this rate 3.3-fold .
treatment of hl-60 cell with both tpa and cycloheximide have no effect on the rate of c-jun transcription .
the half-life of c-jun rna a determine by treat hl-60 cell with tpa and actinomycin d be 30 min .
in contrast , the half-life of c-jun rna in tpa -treated hl-60 cell expose to cycloheximide and actinomycin d be great than 2 h .
these finding suggest that the increase in c-jun rna observe during tpa -induced monocytic differentiation be mediate by both transcriptional and post-transcriptional mechanism .
aspirin-like drug can protect human t lymphocyte against benzoquinone cytotoxicity : evidence for a nad(p)h:quinone reductase -dependent mechanism .
benzene toxicity towards lymphocyte be think to be mediate by metabolite of benzene include benzoquinone ( bq ) .
nad(p)h:quinone reductase ( qr ) be know to protect against bq toxicity .
the expression of the qr gene be regulate by the transcription factor ap-1 .
we have previously find that aspirin-like drug ( ald ) induce ap-1 in human t lymphocyte .
it be therefore hypothesize that ald would protect lymphocyte against bq toxicity by induce qr .
molt-4 cell ( m4 ) , a human t lymphocyte cell line , be incubate with different concentration of two ald , flurbiprofen and sodium diclofenac , and then expose to bq .
toxicity be measure by viability ( trypan blue exclusion ) .
both drug protect the cell against bq cytotoxicity in a dose-dependent manner , e.g. , sodium diclofenac at 15 microm reduce the fraction of bq -treated dead cell by 70 % .
alds induce qr activity in the m4 cell in the same range of concentration that protect the cell against bq toxicity .
the protective effect of ald be significantly reduce by dicoumarol , a qr -specific inhibitor .
since human t cell and t cell line do not metabolize arachidonic acid , our data suggest that ald can protect human t lymphocyte against a metabolite of benzene by induction of qr activity .
antisense inhibition of vitamin d receptor expression induce apoptosis in monoblastoid u937 cell .
the active vitamin d3 metabolite 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol ( 1,25(oh)2d3 ) act a an antiproliferative and differentiate agent for the monoblastoid cell line u937 and a an important immunologic mediator implicate particularly in the function of cell belong to the monocyte/macrophage lineage .
these effect be control by the vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) , a member of the steroid hormone receptor family .
the objective of this study be to develop u937 transfectants express antisense vdr mrna , and to use these to examine the role of 1,25(oh)2d3 -vdr interaction in this lineage .
a 2-kb vdr cdna insert ( include the complete vdr coding region ) be clone in an antisense orientation into the ebv episomal vector pmep4 under the control of an inducible promoter and transfected into u937 .
the resultant cell line , dh42 , be hygromycin resistant , contain vdr cdna , express few vdrs than control , and show a substantial decrease in antiproliferative response to 1,25(oh)2d3 .
however , 1,25(oh)2d3 increase the number of cell express macrophage cell surface ag , include cd14 and cd11b .
a subpopulation of small cell do not express the differentiation marker after cadmium stimulation .
cell cycle analysis show shift in the distribution of cell from g1 to s phase , which be more pronounced after cadmium treatment .
a considerable proportion of cell be outside the cycle and dna fragmentation confirm apoptosis .
thus , the functional outcome of the vdr antisense transfection suggest that in the myelomonocytic lineage , vdr expression may act a a protective mechanism against program cell death .
estrogen receptor diminish dna-binding activity of chicken gata-1 and caccc-binding protein .
the estrogen receptor ( er ) repress erythroid differentiation and erythroid-specific gene expression .
in this study , we investigate the effect of er alpha ( refer to throughout a er ) on dna-binding activity of transcription factor involve in regulate the expression of erythroid-specific gene , and , in particular , the histone h5 gene .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we find that in the presence of rabbit reticulocyte lysate , human er reduce the binding activity of chicken immature erythrocyte nuclear extracted protein to gata and caccc site in the h5 promoter and enhancer .
in contrast , the binding activity of nf1 and sp1 be not affect by er .
binding of er to an estrogen response element be enhance by addition of rabbit reticulocyte lysate .
this lysate be also necessary for er to diminish the dna-binding activity of gata-1 .
these result suggest that additional factor ( s ) be necessary for full er function .
both gata-1 and caccc-binding protein be critical for the developmentally regulate expression of erythroid-specific gene .
we hypothesize that interference in dna-binding activity of gata-1 and caccc-binding protein be the mechanism by which the er inhibit regulation of these gene .
regulation of gm-csf gene transcription by core-binding factor .
gm-csf gene activation in t cell be know to involve the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b , ap-1 , nfat , and sp1 .
here we demonstrate that the human gm-csf promoter and enhancer also encompass bind site for core-binding factor ( cbf ) .
significantly , the cbf site be in each case contain within the minimum essential core region require for inducible activation of transcription .
furthermore , these core region of the enhancer and promoter each encompass closely link bind site for cbf , ap-1 , and nfatp .
the gm-csf promoter cbf site tgtggtca be located 51 bp upstream of the transcription start site and also overlap a yy-1 binding site .
a 2-bp mutation within the cbf site result in a 2-3-fold decrease in the activity of both a 69-bp proximal promoter fragment and a 627-bp full-length promoter fragment .
stepwise deletion into the proximal promoter also reveal that the cbf site , but not the yy-1 site , be require for efficient induction of transcriptional activation .
the aml1 and cbf beta gene that encode cbf each have the ability to influence cell growth and differentiation and have be implicate a proto-oncogene in acute myeloid leukemia .
this study add gm-csf to a grow list of cytokine and receptor that be regulate by cbf and which control the growth , differentiation , and activation of hemopoietic cell .
the gm-csf locus may represent one of several target gene that be dysregulated in acute myeloid leukemia .
glucocorticoid receptor characteristic in monocyte of patient with corticosteroid -resistant bronchial asthma .
the mechanism of corticosteroid resistance in bronchial asthma have be study by determine the rank order of potency for different corticosteroid in inhibit the generation of a 3 kd molecule from peripheral blood monocyte isolate from corticosteroid-sensitive ( cs ) and corticosteroid-resistant ( cr ) asthmatic subject , which augment leukotriene b4 ( ltb4 ) generation by human neutrophil ( pmn ) stimulate by calcium ionophore .
in addition , bind study with ( 3h ) dexamethasone have be perform to determine the dissociation constant ( kd ) and receptor number ( ro ) in the monocyte of these two group of subject .
the concentration of corticosteroid produce 50 % inhibition ( ic50 ) be 600 nm , 70 nm , and 0.5 nm for hydrocortisone , methylprednisolone , and dexamethasone , respectively , in monocyte from cs individual .
there be only weak inhibition of the generation of enhancing activity by the corticosteroid in the cr asthmatic individual .
the dexamethasone kd be 2.45 +/- 0.58 nm ( mean +/- sem , n = 6 ) in the cs group and 1.6 +/- 0.35 nm ( mean +/- sem , n = 6 ) in the cr group of patient ( p = 0.14 ) .
the ro in the cs group be 3,605 +/- 984 bind site per nucleus ( mean +/- sem , n = 6 ) and 4,757 +/- 692 bind site per nucleus ( mean +/- sem , n = 6 ) in the cr group ( p = 0.23 ) .
these finding indicate that corticosteroid resistance in bronchial asthma can not be explain by abnormality in corticosteroid receptor characteristic .
signaling pathway mediate by the tnf- and cytokine- receptor family target a common cis-element of the ifn regulatory factor 1 promoter .
cd40 activation of b cell be strongly influence by the presence of cytokine .
however , the molecular basis for the interplay between these distinct stimulus be not clearly delineate .
ifn regulatory factor 1 ( irf-1 ) be a transcription factor activate by either cd40 or cytokine .
we have find that these different set of signal target a common cis-acting element in the promoter of this gene , the irf-1 gamma -activated site ( gas ) .
targeting of the irf-1 gas be not confine to activation via cd40 but extend to other stimulus that mimic the cd40 signaling cascade , like tnf-alpha and ebv .
in contrast to induction of stats by cytokine , the irf-1 gas -binding complex activate by cd40 , tnf-alpha , or ebv contain rel protein , specifically p50 and p65 .
in this system , simultaneous exposure to cd40l together with either il-4 or ifn-gamma do not lead to the activation of novel rel/stat complex .
give the importance of irf-1 in a variety of biologic function from proliferation to apoptosis , our finding support the notion that modulation of irf-1 level may be a critical control point in b cell activation .
activation of a novel serine /threonine kinase that phosphorylates c-fos upon stimulation of t and b lymphocyte via antigen and cytokine receptor .
ligation of ag receptor in t and b lymphocyte initiate signal transduction cascade which alter the expression of gene that regulate cellular proliferation and differentiation .
the transmission of signal from the membrane to the nucleus be mediate principally through the action of protein tyrosine and serine/threonine kinase .
we have identify and characterize a novel serine /threonine kinase that phosphorylated the proto-oncogene product , c-fos , and be term fo kinase .
fo kinase be rapidly activate after ligation of the cd3 and cd2 receptor in jurkat and normal human t lymphocyte and in response to il-6 and anti-igm in the human b cell line af10 and ramos , respectively .
the phorbol ester , pma , be also a potent inducer of fo kinase activity in all of the above population , suggest that pkc play a role in the regulation of this enzyme .
fo kinase phosphorylates c-fos at a site near the c-terminus , as well a a peptide derive from this region ( residue 359-370 , rkgsssnepssd ) , and fo peptide competitively inhibit c-fos phosphorylation .
fo kinase be show to be distinct from other identify serine /threonine kinase , include protein kinase a , protein kinase c , casein kinase ii , map kinase , p70s6k and p90rsk .
fo kinase be purify by anion exchange chromatography and exhibit an apparent m(r) = 65,000 and isoelectric point = 6.1 .
fo kinase may play a role in transcriptional regulation through it capacity to phosphorylate c-fos at a site require for expression of the transcriptional transrepressive activity of this molecule .
moreover , it rapid activation suggest it may have a wide role within signal transduction cascade in lymphocyte .

ebna-5 be one of the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -encoded nuclear protein require for immortalization of human b lymphocyte .
in the nucleus of ebv-transformed lymphoblastoid cell line ebna-5 be preferentially targetted to distinct nuclear focus .

cyclic amp -responsive element -dependent activation of epstein-barr virus zebra promoter by human herpesvirus 6 .
we have recently show that infection of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) genome-positive b cell by human herpesvirus 6 ( hhv-6 ) result in the expression of the immediate-early ebv zebra gene , follow by virus replication ( l.flamand , i.stefanescu , d.v.ablashi , and j.menezes , j.virol.67 : 6768-6777 , 1993 ) .
here we show that hhv-6 upregulates zebra gene transcription through a cyclic amp -responsive element ( cre ) located within the zebra promoter ( zp ) .
use human b- or t- cell line transfected with zpcat reporter gene construct , we demonstrate that a region designate the zii domain of zp be the target of hhv-6 transactivation .
mutation of the consensus ap-1/ cre site within zii abolish the inducibility of zp by hhv-6 , whereas positioning of the zii domain upstream of the beta-globin minimal promoter confer responsiveness follow hhv-6 infection .
binding of these factor to zii be prevent by oligonucleotides contain cre but not by ap-1 consensus sequence .
antibody against cre -binding ( creb ) protein but not against c-fos or c-jun be able to supershift the dna-protein complex , identify the nature of the transcription factor which bind to zii a a member of the creb family of protein .
finally , transfection of creb protein and protein kinase a expression vector be find to activate zp in jurkat cell , suggest that phosphorylated form of creb protein can play a determining role in the ebv reactivation process .
inhibition of hiv-1 latency reactivation by dehydroepiandrosterone ( dhea ) and an analog of dhea .
the initial infection with human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) in most individual usually result in the establishment of a latent or chronic infection before eventual progression toward acquire immunodeficiency syndrome .
hiv-1 can also establish a latent or persistent infection in some t cell line that show minimal constitutive virus expression .
however , activation of the t cell line lead to enhance hiv-1 replication can be induce by antigen , mitogen , and cytokine ( tumor necrosis factor alpha [ tnf-alpha ] , interleukin 1 , and interleukin-2 ) .
various gene product from other virus ( htlv-1 , hsv , ebv , cmv , hbv , and hhv-6 ) can also enhance hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) -driven reporter gene activity .
on the basis of these observation , it have be propose that reactivation of latent hiv-1 harbor in chronically infected t lymphocyte , monocyte , or macrophage play an important role in the pathogenesis of aid .
so far , there be no drug or therapy available that can provide protection against hiv-1 latency reactivation .
ach-2 , derive from a human t cell line ( cem ) , be chronically infect with hiv-1 , with low level of constitutive virus expression .
ach-2 can be convert to productive infection by stimulation of the cell with 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) , mitogen or cytokine ( tnf-alpha ) , or infection with hsv .
therefore the ach-2 cell line be a good candidate for study the effect of drug on hiv-1 activation .
previously , we have report that dhea and synthetic analog of dhea can be modest inhibitor of hiv-1 iiib replication in phytohemagglutinin-stimulated peripheral blood lymphocyte culture .

identification of the tcl1 gene involve in t-cell malignancy .
the tcl1 locus on chromosome 14q32.1 be frequently involve in chromosomal translocation and inversion with one of the t-cell receptor locus in human t-cell leukemia and lymphoma .
the chromosome 14 region translocate or rearrange involve approximately 350 kb of dna at chromosome band 14q32.1 .
within this region we have identify a gene cod for a 1.3-kb transcript , express only in restricted subset of cell within the lymphoid lineage and express at high level in leukemic cell carry a t(14;14) (q11;q32) chromosome translocation or a inv(14)(q11;q32) chromosome inversion .
the cognate cdna sequence reveal an open reading frame of 342 nt encode a protein of 14 kda .
the tcl1 gene sequence , which , to our knowledge , show no sequence homology with other human gene , be preferentially express early in t- and b- lymphocyte differentiation .
involvement of an saf-like transcription factor in the activation of serum amyloid a gene in monocyte/macrophage cell by lipopolysaccharide .
serum amyloid a ( saa ) have be link to atherosclerosis because of it ability to remodel high-density lipoprotein by the depletion of apolipoprotein a1 , it ability to bind cholesterol , and it presence in the atherosclerotic plaque of coronary and carotid artery .
in the present study , we investigate the induction mechanism of saa gene in thp-1 monocyte/macrophage cell which play a critical role in the development of atherosclerotic fatty streak and plaque formation .
we and others have show that saa gene be induce in monocyte/macrophage cell by lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
by promoter function analysis , we show that the saa promoter sequence between -280 and -226 can confer lp responsiveness .
gel electrophoretic mobility shift assay detect an induce dna-binding activity in these cell in response to lp .
characterization of the dna-binding protein by uv cross-linking , southwestern blot , and antibody ablation/supershift assay reveal that it be similar to a recently report nuclear factor designate saf .
these result demonstrate that lp -mediated saa gene induction in monocyte/macrophage cell be primarily due to the induction of saf activity .
expression of a-myb , but not c-myb and b-myb , be restricted to burkitt 's lymphoma , sig+ b-acute lymphoblastic leukemia , and a subset of chronic lymphocytic leukemia .
the a-myb gene encode a transcription factor that be related both functionally and structurally to the v-myb oncogene .
follow our observation that a-myb be express in a restricted subset of normal mature human b lymphocyte , with the phenotype cd38+ , cd39- , slgm- , we have now investigate the pattern of a-myb expression in neoplastic b cell representating the whole spectrum of b-cell differentiation and compare it to that of c-myb and b-myb .
in a panel of 32 b-cell line , a-myb be very strongly express in most burkitt 's lymphoma ( bl ) cell line , but weak or negative in 2 pre-b acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( all ) , 4 non-hodgkin 's lymphoma ( nhl ) , 6 epstein-barr virus-immortalized lymphoblastoid cell line , and 6 myeloma line .
protein expression parallel that of the rna .
we have also investigate a-myb expression in 49 fresh case of b leukemia .
among 24 all , 6 be of the null and 11 of the common type and all these be negative for a-myb expression ; on the other hand , all 7 b- all case ( slg+ ) , as well a one fresh bl case with bone marrow infiltration , express a-myb .
a-myb be undetectable in 4 prolymphocytic leukemia ( pll ) but be strongly express in 5/20 ( 25 % ) of chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( cll ) sample .
in the latter a-myb do not correlate with phenotype or clinical stage .
finally , we have study the progression of one case of cll into richter 's syndrome and have find that the richter 's cell express about 25-fold less a-myb rna than the cll cell from the same patient . the pattern of c-myb and b-myb be clearly distinct from that of a-myb .
c-myb and b-myb be express in all neoplastic group , except in cll cell .
thus , a-myb expression , unlike that of c-myb and b-myb , be restricted to a subset of b-cell neoplasia ( in particular bl and slg+b- all ) representative of a specific stage of b-cell differentiation .
this expression may in part reflect expression of a-myb by the normal germinal center b cell that be the normal counterpart of these transform b cell .
the data present strongly support a role for this transcription factor in b-cell differentiation and perhaps in b-cell transformation in some neoplasia .
role of hiv-1 nef expression in activation pathway in cd4 + t cell .
the role of the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv-1 ) nef protein in t cell activation pathway be investigate use a jurkat cd4 + cell line stably transfected with a nef expression vector .
secretion of il-2 and tnf-alpha , surface expression of il-2r , and dna-binding activity of nf-kappa b and ap-1 ( fos/jun ) complex in response to phorbol myristate acetate , tnf-alpha , or immobilize antibody to cd3 be monitor .
these parameter be not modify by nef expression in jurkat cell , whereas stimulation with the same stimulus result in partial inhibition of ltr activation in nef + jurkat cell .
this inhibition be not mediate through nef phosphorylation on thr-15 or gtp -binding activity because mutation in critical site do not alter this inhibition .
analysis of truncate ltrs confirm that inhibition of ltr activation be not mediate through nf-kappa b -binding activity but through the region contain the negative respond element ( nres ) .
these result suggest that nef downmodulates ltr activation without significantly inhibit the capacity of t cell to respond to immunological activation .
transcription factor jun-b be target of autoreactive t-cells in iddm .
target antigen define by autoantibody in iddm include insulin , a putative glycolipid that react with islet cell antibody , and a 64,000-m(r) protein recently identify a glutamic acid decarboxylase .
in addition , some iddm serum that contain antibody to glutamic acid decarboxylase also coprecipitate a 38,000-m(r) protein from islet .
this study use a high titer anti-38,000-m(r) serum to screen bacteriophage lambda cdna expression library and identify human islet and placental clone encode jun-b , the nuclear transcription protein , of predict 38,000 m(r) .
peripheral blood t-cells exhibit significant proliferation in response to a recombinant fragment of jun-b ( amino acid 1-180 ) in 12 of 17 ( 71 % ) recent-onset iddm subject , 8 of 16 ( 50 % ) ica-positive first-degree relative of iddm subject who be at risk , 3 of 12 ( 25 % ) other autoimmune disease subject , and 0 of 10 healthy control subject .
proliferation to tetanus toxoid do not differ significantly between the group .
response to jun-b be not related to age , sex , or human leukocyte antigen status .
thus , autoreactive t-cells identify a novel antigen , p38 jun-b , in iddm and appear to indicate subject at risk for the development of clinical disease .
a 3' --> 5' xpb helicase defect in repair/transcription factor tfiih of xeroderma pigmentosum group b affect both dna repair and transcription .
xpb be a subunit of the basal transcription factor tfiih , which be also involve in nucleotide excision repair ( ner ) and potentially in cell cycle regulation .
a frameshift mutation in the 3'-end of the xpb gene be responsible for a concurrence of two disorder : xeroderma pigmentosum ( xp ) and cockayne 's syndrome ( c ) .
we have isolate tfiih from cell derive from a patient ( xp11be ) who carry this frameshift mutation ( tfiihmut ) and from the mother of this patient ( tfiihwt ) to determine the biochemical consequence of the mutation .
although identical in composition and stoichiometry to tfiihwt , tfiihmut show a reduce 3' --> 5' xpb helicase activity .
a decrease in helicase and dna-dependent atpase activity be also observe with the mutate recombinant xpb protein .
the xpb mutation cause a severe ner defect .
in addition , we provide evidence for a decrease in basal transcription activity in vitro .
the latter defect may provide an explanation for many of the xp and c symptom that be difficult to rationalize base solely on an ner defect .
thus , this work present the first detailed analysis of a naturally occur mutation in a basal transcription factor and support the concept that the combined xp/ c clinical entity be actually the result of a combined transcription/repair deficiency .
rel be rapidly tyrosine-phosphorylated follow granulocyte-colony stimulating factor treatment of human neutrophil .
stimulation of neutrophil with granulocyte-colony stimulating factor ( g-csf ) result in an enhance respiratory burst , prolonged survival , and increase tumor cell killing .
the effect of g-csf be mediate by bind to specific , high affinity receptor .
g-csf receptor lack intrinsic tyrosine kinase activity , but activation of the receptor result in the rapid induction of tyrosine kinase activity .
antiphosphotyrosine immunoblots of whole cell lysates prepare from neutrophil show that the g-csf rapidly induce prominent tyrosine phosphorylation of a protein of a relative molecular mass of 80 kda .
use monospecific antibody , the 80-kda tyrosine -phosphorylated protein have be show to be p80c-rel , a proto-oncogene belong to a family of transcriptional regulator which include nf-kb .
the induction of tyrosine phosphorylation of p80c-rel be unique to g-csf in that granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor which also stimulate neutrophil and induce tyrosine phosphorylation do not result in tyrosine phosphorylation of p80c-rel .
the consequence of p80c-rel tyrosine phosphorylation be not yet know ; however , tyrosine -phosphorylated p80c-rel be capable of bind to dna , and g-csf stimulation result in an increase in the amount of p80c-rel which bind to dna .
these result demonstrate that one of the first biochemical event which occur in neutrophil follow g-csf stimulation , activation of a tyrosine kinase , lead directly to the tyrosine phosphorylation of p80c-rel .
thus , the tyrosine kinase activate by g-csf appear to directly transduce a signal to a protein which function a a transcriptional regulator .
multiple prolactin-responsive element mediate g1 and s phase expression of the interferon regulatory factor-1 gene .
the interferon regulatory factor-1 ( irf-1 ) gene be both an immediate-early g1 phase gene and an s phase gene inducible by prl in rat nb2 t lymphocyte .
to understand the mechanism by which prl regulate the biphasic expression of irf-1 , we clone the rat irf-1 gene and functionally characterize the irf-1 promoter .
upon transfection into nb2 t cell , 1.7 kilobases ( kb ) of irf-1 5'-flanking dna link to a chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) reporter gene mediate a 30-fold induction of cat enzyme activity in response to 24 h of prl stimulation .
deletion mutant contain 1.3 , 0.6 , and 0.2 kb 5'-flanking dna be incrementally less transcriptionally active , although 0.2 kb still mediate a 12-fold induction by prl .
the sequence between -1.7 and -0.2 kb link to a heterologous thymidine kinase promoter fail to respond to prl stimulation , suggest that the activity of upstream prl response element may require an interaction with promoter-proximal element .
by assay cat enzyme activity across a 24-h prl induction time course , we be able to assign g1 vs. s phase prl response of the irf-1 gene to different region of the irf-1 5'-flanking and promoter dna .
the 0.2-kb irf- cat construct be induce by prl stimulation during the g1 phase of the cell cycle .
in contrast , the 1.7-kb irf- cat construct be inducible by prl during both g1 and s phase of the cell cycle .
hence , the prl -induced biphasic expression of the irf-1 gene appear to be control by separate prl -responsive element : element in the first 0.2 kb of the irf-1 promoter region act during early activation , and element between 0.2 and 1.7 kb act in concert with the proximal 0.2-kb region during s phase progression .
rel/nf-kappa b transcription factor and the control of apoptosis .
the process of apoptosis be use to eliminate unwanted cell from a wide variety of organism .
various extracellular signal , often converge in common intracellular pathway , can induce apoptosis in a cell-type-specific fashion .
recent work from several laboratory have demonstrate that rel/nf-kappa b transcription factor regulate apoptosis in many cell type .
in most cell , rel/nf-kappa b transcription factor appear to mediate survival signal that protect cell from apoptosis ; however , under some circumstance , activation of these factor may also promote apoptosis .
adenovirus e1b 19k protein be require for efficient dna replication in u937 cell .
the adenovirus e1b 19k gene play an essential role in transformation of primary rodent cell in cooperation with e1a and in the inhibition of apoptosis during lytic infection .
it have be show that this e1b 19k protein be not necessary for viral dna replication in human cell line , such a hela and kb .
we report here that the e1b 19k mutant virus be unable to replicate efficiently in a monocyte cell line , u937 .
viral dna synthesis and late gene expression be find to be defective in u937 cell infect with e1b 19k mutant compare with wild-type virus .
early viral rna splicing pattern also differ between wild-type and dl337-infected cell .
furthermore , the defect in viral replication could be complement by dl312 virus defective in e1a expression 4 day after infection with e1b mutant , suggest persistence of the e1b mutant genome in the infected cell despite defective onset of the late phase of replication .
these result imply that e1b 19k be require for efficient viral dna replication in u937 cell .
inefficient dna replication be also find in another monocyte cell line , thp-1
mitogen stimulation of t-cells increase c-fos and c-jun protein level , ap-1 binding and ap-1 transcriptional activity .
we have analyse the effect of mitogenic lectin on c-fos and c-jun protein level as well a on activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) binding and enhancer activity in jurkat t-cells .
both c-fos and c-jun protein level be increase after con a and pha stimulation .
since t-cell stimulation increase both intracellular ca2+ and camp level and activate protein kinase c ( pkc ) , the possible involvement of these intracellular messenger in c-fos and c-jun induction be test .
pma , which directly activate pkc , mimic the effect of the lectin on c-fos and c-jun , but elevation of either intracellular ca2+ or camp level have little or no effect .
the mitogen-induced increase of c-fos and c-jun immunoreactivity be inhibit by h-7 , a kinase inhibitor with relatively high specificity for pkc , and less efficiently by h-8 , a structurally related kinase inhibitor less active on pkc , but more active on cyclic nucleotide-dependent kinase .
con a stimulation be find to increase both binding of ap-1 to the ap-1 consensus sequence , tre , and ap-1 enhancer activity , in jurkat cell .
pma be also find to increase the ap-1 enhancer activity , whereas elevation of ca2+ or camp have only minor effect .
we conclude that stimulation with mitogenic lectin be sufficient to increase both c-fos and c-jun protein level , ap-1 binding and ap-1 enhancer activity in jurkat cell and that they act via mechanism that could involve the activation of pkc .
activation of nuclear factor-kappa b by beta-amyloid peptide and interferon-gamma in murine microglia .
an increase body of evidence suggest that amyloid-beta ( a beta ) peptide and microglia be crucially involve in the pathogenesis of alzheimer 's disease .
in an effort to far elucidate the biological effect of a beta towards microglia , we investigate the ability of a beta peptide to activate nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b in the n9 murine microglial cell line .
co-stimulation of microglia with suboptimal concentration of a beta ( 25-35 ) and 100 u/ml ifn gamma result in the detection of a specific nf-kappa b dna-binding activity in nuclear extract , a determine in gel mobility shift assay .
this response require at least 120 min to be evident and supershift experiment reveal that the nf-kappa b complex contain both rela and p50 .
accordingly , immunoblot experiment show that amongst nf-kappa b /rel protein , rela and p50 be mobilize to the nucleus follow microglial cell stimulation with a beta ( 25-35 ) plus ifn gamma .
high concentration of a beta ( 25-35 ) be effective by themselves in induce nf-kappa b activation , both in the n9 microglial cell line and in rat primary microglia , as well a in human monocyte .
for purpose of comparison , microglia be also stimulate with bacterial lp , a known nf-kappa b inducer .
a expect , lp strongly induce the formation of two nf-kappa b dna-binding activity , one of which be identify a rela /p50 .
the lp response be also more rapid , a it be already evident by 40 min and remain sustained for up to 3 h .
collectively , these finding indicate that nf-kappa b activation might constitute one of the mechanism underlie the inducible expression of kappa b-dependent gene in microglia stimulate by a beta peptide and ifn gamma , or by lp .
redox regulation of the mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway during lymphocyte activation .
we have previously demonstrate an obligatory requirement for intracellular reactive oxygen specie generation during t lymphocyte activation , and have propose that intracellular reactive oxygen specie may act a signalling agent in the regulation of certain cellular process , for example , during cell cycle entry .
to test this hypothesis , we have be interest to determine which , if any , cell cycle entry event be affect by oxidative signalling .
in early study , we have identify the transcription factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 a molecular target for oxidative signalling process during cell cycle entry , and have show that oxidative signalling be involve in the regulation of early change in gene expression during the g0 to g1 phase transition .
to extend these initial observation , we have examine the effect of antioxidant treatment on the activity of the mitogen-activated protein kinase erk1 and erk2 , a member of a signal transduction pathway know to directly regulate transcription factor function .
use a a probe cysteamine , an aminothiol compound with both antioxidant and antiproliferative activity , we have identify erk2 , a key element of the map kinase pathway , a be responsive to oxidative signalling during lymphocyte activation .
these observation provide further evidence to suggest a role for intracellular oxidant generation a a regulatory mechanism during cell cycle entry , and establish a link between oxidative signalling and other aspect of the intracellular signalling network that be activate in response to mitogenic stimulation .
anti-ro(ssa) autoantibody be associate with t cell receptor beta gene in systemic lupus erythematosus patient .
several of the heterogeneous clinical manifestation of systemic lupus erythematosus have be associate with specific autoantibody .
association between hla class ii antigen and autoantibody to the ribonucleoproteins ro(ssa) and la(ssb) have be report in these patient .
because hla class ii molecule present antigen to t cell receptor ( tcrs ) , we have search for a tcr gene associate with the production of anti- ro(ssa) antibody .
a pair of restriction fragment length polymorphism ( rflps ) , one of which hybridize to the tcr constant region c beta 1 and the other to the c beta 2 gene , have be identify , suggest these may be genotypic marker for an extend region of the tcr beta locus .
this rflp pair occur in 76 % of patient with ro(ssa) precipitin , 84 % of anti- ro(ssa) -positive patient lack la(ssb) precipitin , but only 41 % of the patient lack both precipitin ( p = 0.0004 ) .
this disproportionate occurrence in a subset of lupus patient indicate that these rflps be not disease susceptibility marker , but rather be important marker for tcr gene whose product be involve in the production of anti- ro(ssa) antibody .
the majority of patient who have these rflps and hla class ii antigen previously associate with the anti- ro(ssa) response make this antibody , suggest that interaction between product of these locus occur in response to ro(ssa) .
clone pat 133 identify a gene that encode another human member of a class of growth factor-induced gene with almost identical zinc-finger domain .
we report the structure and regulation of a gene represent by clone pat 133 , which be induce upon transition from a resting state ( g0 ) through the early phase of the cell cycle ( g1 ) .
the pat 133 gene be immediately induce , with fo -like kinetics , in human t cell and in fibroblast .
primary structure analysis show that the encode protein contain three tandem zinc-finger sequence of the type cys2-xaa12-his2 .
this zinc-finger region , which be think to bind dna in a sequence-specific manner , be similar ( great than 80 % on the amino acid level ) to two previously describe transcription factor pat 225/egr1 and pat 591/egr2 .
except for the conserve zinc-finger domain , the amino acid sequence of the three protein be distinct .
this structural similarity suggest that the pat 133 gene encode a transcription factor with a specific biological function .
compare the regulation of these related zinc-finger -encoding gene show coordinate induction upon mitogenic stimulation of rest t lymphocyte and of rest fibroblast .
however , upon transition from a proliferating ( g1 ) to a resting state of the cell cycle the three gene be differently regulate .
in human histiocytic u937 cell mrna of clone pat 133 be constitutively express , whereas mrna of pat 225/egr1 be induce upon induction of terminal differentiation .
in contrast mrna represent pat 591/egr2 be not express in these cell .
this difference in gene regulation suggest distinct biological role in the control of cell proliferation for the respective protein .
requirement of prestimulated thp-1 monocytic cell for endothelial cell activation .
involvement of tnf alpha .
blood monocyte spontaneously activate endothelial cell in culture , lead to adhesion of monocytic cell onto the endothelial surface and overproduction of endothelial protein such a von willebrand factor ( vwf ) and plasminogen activator inhibitor type 1 ( pai-1 ) .
to overcome the difficulty in obtain quiescent monocyte , we study the ability of promonocytic thp-1 cell to activate endothelial cell .
lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -prestimulated and untreated thp-1 cell be cocultured with rest human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvec ) for 3 and 24 h in the presence of colimycin to neutralize lp trace .
addition of untreated thp-1 cell have little effect on huvec adhesiveness .
addition of prestimulated thp-1 cell be follow by a noticeable adhesion after 3 h which reverse to basal value within 24 h .
under these condition huvec adhesion molecule , e-selectin , vcam-1 and icam-1 , be increase at 3 h with only icam-1 remain overexpressed at 24 h .
diffusible endothelial protein such a soluble e-selectin , pai-1 and vwf to a minimal extent , increase in supernatant from huvec cocultured for 24 h with prestimulated thp-1 cell .
in those cocultures , tnf alpha concentration peak at 3 h whereas il-1 beta level progressively rise until 24 h .
addition of an anti- tnf alpha antibody decrease by 40 % e-selectin and icam-1 induction and suppress pai-1 overproduction with a weak effect on vwf .
an anti-il-1 beta antibody have negligible effect on huvec adhesion molecule , pai-1 or vwf production .
these result provide evidence that promonocytic thp-1 cell require prestimulation in order to activate huvec and that tnf alpha contribute to this phenomenon .
the role of protein kinase c signaling in activate dra transcription .
expression of human mhc hla-dra class ii gene can be up-regulated in b cell by ig cross-linking as well a by phorbol ester such a 12-o-tetradecanoyl phorbol 13-acetate ( tpa ) .
induce dra expression involve activation of restricted protein kinase c ( pkc ) isoforms , result in activate activator protein-1 -dependent transcription .
in this report expression profile and activation of pkc be analyze in human raji b lymphoblastoid cell .
transient transfection analysis with target plasmid contain either dra promoter ( wild-type or mutate ) or tpa response element demonstrate that pretreatment with the selective pkc inhibitor gf 109203x repress tpa -mediated activation .
western analysis perform on cellular fraction of rest cell and of tpa -activated cell reveal abundant expression of classical pkc-alpha ( cpkc-alpha ) , cpkc-betaii , and atypical pkc-zeta isoforms and identify a sustained translocation of cpkc-alpha and cpkc-betaii from the cytosolic compartment to membrane .
a expect , the distribution of atypical pkc-zeta be unaffected by tpa treatment and display an even distribution between cytosol and membrane .
this finding be confirm by immunofluorescence microscopy .
the tpa -mediated translocation of cpkc-alpha and cpkc-betaii be not influence by pretreatment with gf 109203x .
finally , functional activation and translocation of pkc be investigate with a selective in vitro kinase assay .
together , these result show that activate hla-dra expression in response to tpa treatment be strictly dependent on pkc activation act on the x2 box of the dra promoter and that selective inhibition of pkc enzymatic activity do not influence subcellular localization of express pkc isoenzymes .
thus , the translocation event per se occur independently of pkc activation in these cell .
triggering of hla-dr antigen differentially modulate tumor necrosis factor alpha release by b cell at distinct stage of maturation .
triggering of hla class ii antigen by the anti-hla-dr monoclonal antibody ( mab ) l243 significantly ( p < 0.05 ) and differentially enhance the release of tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) by the non-hodgkin 's lymphoma cell ri-i , ci-i , and sc-i , which be at a distinct stage of b-cell differentiation , and by the more mature burkitt lymphoma cell raji ; in contrast , it do not induce tnf-alpha release by the pre-b leukemia cell nalm-6 and bv173 .
tnf-alpha release peak at 24 h and decrease thereafter , and it be dose dependent and precede by an increase of tnf-alpha mrna detectable after 3 h of stimulation with mab l243 .
secrete tnf-alpha mediate the enhancement of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) and activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) binding activity ; in fact , the triggering of hla-dr antigen in the presence of antihuman tnf-alpha -neutralizing antibody do not upregulate nf-kappa b and ap-1 .
in contrast , release tnf-alpha be not responsible for the homotypic aggregation of ri-i , ci-i , sc-i , and raji cell induce by mab l243 , and it do not affect the proliferation of b cell investigate .
altogether , our data demonstrate that : ( a ) the ability of b cell to release tnf-alpha after triggering of hla-dr antigen depend on their stage of differentiation ; ( b ) level of release tnf-alpha seem to correlate with the stage of b-cell maturation but do not correlate with the amount of cell surface hla-dr antigen ; ( c ) secrete tnf-alpha regulate the level of expression of nf-kappa b and ap-1 by an autocrine loop ; and ( d ) intracellular signal mediate tnf-alpha release by b cell be distinct from those regulate homotypic aggregation and proliferation .
functional role of the transcription factor oct-2a and the high mobility group protein i/y in hla-dra gene expression .
the class ii major histocompatibility complex gene hla-dra be express in b cell , activate t lymphocyte , and in antigen-presenting cell .
in addition , hla-dra gene expression be inducible in a variety of cell type by interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) .
here we show that the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct-2a play a critical role in hla-dra gene expression in class ii-positive b cell line , and that the high mobility group protein ( hmg ) i/y bind to multiple site within the dra promoter , include the oct-2a binding site .
coexpression of hmg i/y and oct-2 in cell line lack oct-2 result in high level of hla-dra gene expression , and in vitro dna-binding study reveal that hmg i/y stimulate oct-2a binding to the hla-dra promoter .
thus , oct-2a and hmg i/y may synergize to activate hla-dra expression in b cell .
by contrast , oct-2a be not involve in the ifn-gamma induction of the hla-dra gene in hela cell , but antisense hmg i/y dramatically decrease the level of induction .
we conclude that distinct set of transcription factor be involve in the two mode of hla-dra expression , and that hmg i/y may be important for b cell-specific expression , and be essential for ifn-gamma induction .
calcineurin activate transcription from the gm-csf promoter in synergy with either protein kinase c or nf-kappa b /ap-1 in t cell .
two cis-acting element gm-kappa b/gc-box and cle0 , of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) gene be require for maximal induction in jurkat t cell by costimulation with phorbol-12-myristate acetate ( pma ) and ca2+ ionophore ( a23187 ) .
the gm-kappa b sequence be recognize by nf-kappa b , which be mainly induce by pma .
the cle0 sequence interact with factor , related to a pma -induced ap-1 and a pma / a23187 -induced nf- at .
we examine whether signal transducing component in t cell can activate transcription of the gm-csf gene .
cotransfection of nf-kappa b ( p50/p65 ) - or ap-1 ( c-jun/c-fos ) - expression vector into jurkat cell with a luciferase reporter contain the gm-csf promoter do not stimulate transcription from the gm-csf promoter .
in contrast , cotransfection with a combination of nf-kappa b and ap-1 significantly augment transcription from the gm-csf promoter contain the gm-kappa b/gc-box and the cle0 ( ap-1 /nf-at ) .
expression of a constitutively active calcineurin ( cn ) , a ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent protein phosphatase , potentiate by two fold the transcriptional activation by nf-kappa b /ap-1 .
both constitutively active form of cn and protein kinase c ( pkc ) synergistically activate transcription from the gm-csf promoter .
these result suggest that cooperation among nf-kappa b- , ap-1- and nf-at- binding sequence be require for induction of the gm-csf gene through pkc- and ca2+- signaling pathway downstream of t cell activation .
the dna and steroid binding domain of the glucocorticoid receptor be not alter in mononuclear cell of treat cll patient .
the aim of this study be to investigate whether mutation in the glucocorticoid receptor could account for the increase unresponsiveness of patient with chronic lymphatic leukemia ( cll ) to combination chemotherapy .
the receptor be test immunocytochemically , in steroid binding assay , and by a mutation screening ( denature gradient gel electrophoresis ) of the receptor-cdna .
the receptor concentration , a measure by stain and steroid binding test , vary considerably but show no clear correlation to clinical response .
use a highly sensitive mutation screening assay of the dna- and the steroid -binding region , none of the treat patient reveal any mutation , suggest that the glucocorticoid receptor in the cll patient test be not alter in these domain .
in one individual who have not be treat before analysis a silent mutation be find in one receptor allele .
the result suggest that mechanism other than altered ligand or dna binding of the receptor may be responsible for the lack of response to chemotherapy .
this conclusion be discuss in relation to the mechanism of corticoid resistance in mouse and human lymphoma cell in culture .

tobacco smoke ( t ) exposure be a major risk factor for human disease , and macrophage of healthy smoker have a depress capacity to release cytokine , include tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) alpha .
