regulation of the balance of cytokine production and the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) transcription factor activity by cytokine and inflammatory synovial fluid .
the balance between type 1 and 2 t helper cell cytokine production play an important role in several animal model of autoimmunity , and skewed pattern of cytokine expression have be describe in human inflammatory disease .
many cytokine activate signal transducer and activation of transcription ( stat ) transcription factor , which , in turn , activate transcription of inflammatory effector gene .
we use mononuclear cell priming culture and inflammatory synovial fluid ( sfs ) derive from arthritis patient to examine the regulation of cytokine production and stat activity by an inflammatory synovial microenvironment .
exposure to sfs during priming result in an 81 % inhibition of interferon ( ifn ) -gamma , but not interleukin ( il ) 4 , production by effector cell generate in priming culture .
sf suppression be mediate by il-4 and il-10 and inhibition of il-12 expression , and it be reverse in a dominant fashion by exogenous il-12 .
sfs block the sustained activity of transcription factor stat1 , but not stat3 , during the priming period , and stat1 activity be differentially regulate by cytokine in parallel with their positive or negative regulation of ifn-gamma production .
active stat3 , but not stat1 , be detect in cell from inflamed joint .
these result suggest a role for altered balance of stat1 and stat3 transcriptional activity in the regulation of t cell differentiation and in the pathogenesis of inflammatory synovitis .
hiv glycoprotein 120 enhance intercellular adhesion molecule-1 gene expression in glial cell .
involvement of janus kinase /signal transducer and activator of transcription and protein kinase c signaling pathway .
it be well establish that the two major glial cell in the central nervous system ( cns ) , astrocyte and microglia , be key participant in mediate the neurologic dysfunction associate with hiv infection of the cns .
in this study , we investigate the ability of the major envelope glycoprotein of hiv , glycoprotein 120 ( gp120 ) , to regulate intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) expression in glial cell , because icam-1 be important in mediate immune responsiveness in the cns , facilitate entry of hiv -infected cell into the cns , and promote syncytium formation .
our result indicate that gp120 enhance icam-1 gene expression in primary rat astrocyte , primary human astrocyte , a human astroglioma cell line crt , and primary rat microglia .
the signal transduction event involve in gp120 -mediated enhancement of icam-1 appear to involve activation of both protein kinase c and tyrosine kinase , because inhibitor of protein kinase c and tyrosine kinase abrogate gp120 -mediated icam-1 expression in both astrocyte and microglia .
moreover , gp120 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat-1 alpha ) as well a the janus kinase ( jak2 ) in glial cell .
we also demonstrate that gp120 -mediated icam-1 expression have functional significance , a it enhance the ability of monocytic cell to bind to gp120 -stimulated human astrocyte in an icam-1 /beta 2 integrin -dependent fashion .
these result provide new insight into how gp120 can influence the involvement of glial cell in the pathogenesis of aid dementia complex .
neuronal ( type i ) nitric oxide synthase regulate nuclear factor kappab activity and immunologic ( type ii ) nitric oxide synthase expression .
nitric oxide subserve diverse physiologic role in the nervous system .
no be produce from at least three different no synthase ( no ) isoforms : neuronal no ( nnos ) , endothelial no , and immunologic no ( inos ) .
we show that nnos be the predominant isoform constitutively express in glia .
no derive from nnos in glia inhibit the transcription factor nuclear factor kappab ( nf kappab ) a no inhibitor enhance basal nf kappab activation .
pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) be an inhibitor of nf kappab in most cell ; however , we show that pdtc be also a potent scavenger of no through formation of mononitrosyl iron complex with pdtc .
in jurkat cell , a human t-cell lymphoma cell line , tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) induce nf kappab activation that be inhibit by pdtc .
contrary to the result in jurkat cell , pdtc do not inhibit tumor necrosis factor-alpha -induced nf kappab activation in astrocyte ; instead pdtc itself induce nf kappab activation in astrocyte , and this may be related to scavenging of endogenously produce no by the pdtc iron complex .
in astrocyte pdtc also dramatically induce the nf kappab - dependent enzyme , inos , support the physiologic relevance of endogenous no regulation of nf kappab .
nf kappab activation in glia from mouse lack nnos respond more rapidly to pdtc compare with astrocyte from wild-type mouse .
our data suggest that nnos in astrocyte regulate nf kappab activity and inos expression , and indicate a novel regulatory role for nnos in tonically suppress central nervous system , nf kappab -regulated gene .
energy substrate , hormone response and glucocorticoid binding in lymphocyte during intense physical exercise in human follow phosphocreatine administration .
eight healthy untrained male volunteer pedal a cycle ergometer accord to two exercise protocol : the first involve step-wise increase physical exercise to maximal ( mpe ) ; the second involve prolonged ( 35 min ) submaximal physical exercise ( ppe ) at 70 % of the individual 's maximal oxygen uptake .
each volunteer perform these exercise twice , follow either an intravenous injection of phosphocreatine ( pcr ) or a placebo of an isotonic nacl solution .
anaerobic threshold ( at ) be determine from the point of departure of the ventilatory response from linearity and from the sudden increase in venous blood lactate concentration during mpe .
after exercise follow placebo administration we observe increase in concentration of blood substrate , plasma adrenocorticotropin ( acth ) , growth hormone and cortisol and in the number of glucocorticoid receptor in lymphocyte without change in the dissociation constant .
intravenous administration of pcr ( start 1 day before exercise ) lead to an increase in the total workload ( on average by 5.8 % ) and in at ( on average by 6.8 % ) during mpe and to a good tolerance of exercise during ppe .
follow pcr administration we observe low blood lactate concentration and different pattern of some enzyme activity , less pronounced change in plasma acth and cortisol concentration and in glucocorticoid binding in lymphocyte , but no change in plasma growth hormone concentration compare to the placebo .
the result show that intense physical exercise lead not only to increase in blood hormone concentration but also to an increase in the density of glucocorticoid receptor in lymphocyte .
intravenous pcr injection lead to small change in acth and cortisol concentration as well a to a low activation of glucocorticoid binding in lymphocyte .
expression of laz3/bcl6 in follicular center ( fc ) b cell of reactive lymph node and fc-derived non-hodgkin lymphoma .
chromosomal translocation result in abnormal expression of the laz3/bcl6 gene in b cell have be implicate in the tumorigenesis of non-hodgkin lymphoma ( nhl ) .
therefore we study the expression pattern of laz3/bcl6 by in situ hybridization with synthetic oligonucleotide probe in freeze tissue section from five reactive lymph node and 38 b cell and non-b nhl .
in addition , we investigate the expression of laz3/bcl6 by northern blot analysis on multiple human tissue .
the laz3/bcl6 transcript be find in a variety of tissue , include skeletal muscle , peripheral blood leukocyte , and weakly in normal lymph node .
in the tumor sample , expression of laz3/bcl6 be observe in 68 % of all b cell nhl and none of the non-b lymphoma .
all case of follicular , mixed small and large cell lymphoma show laz3/bcl6 expression confine to the neoplastic follicle .
a follicular expression pattern be also find in all non-malignant reactive lymph node .
hence , the expression of laz3/bcl6 do not correlate to malignancy , but reflect the origin of b cell from the germinal center .
activation of early growth response 1 gene transcription and pp90rsk during induction of monocytic differentiation .
the present work have study mechanism responsible for induction of early growth response 1 ( egr-1 ) gene expression during monocytic differentiation of u-937 myeloid leukemia cell .
differentiation of u-937 cell with 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) , an activator of the serine/threonine protein kinase c , be associate with transcriptional activation of egr-1 promoter-reporter construct .
the egr-1 promoter contain six cc(a/t)6gg ( carg ) motif .
the two 5'-most distal carg sequence confer tpa inducibility .
in contrast , there be little effect of tpa on egr-1 transcription in a tpa -resistant u-937 cell variant , designate tur .
treatment of both u-937 and tur cell with okadaic acid , an inhibitor of serine/threonine protein phosphatase 1 and 2a , be associate with induction of monocytic differentiation and egr-1 transcription through the 5'-most carg element .
since these finding support the involvement of serine /threonine protein phosphorylation in the regulation of egr-1 expression , we study activation of the 40 ribosomal protein s6 serine /threonine kinase , pp70s6k and pp90rsk .
although both kinase participate in regulate cell growth , there be no detectable activation of pp70s6k during tpa- or okadaic acid- induced monocytic differentiation .
moreover , rapamycin , an inhibitor of pp70s6k activation , have no effect on induction of egr-1 expression .
in contrast , analysis of pp90rsk activity by phosphorylation of a peptide derive from s6 protein demonstrate stimulation of this kinase in tpa-treated u-937 , and not tur , cell .
okadaic acid treatment of both cell type be associate with activation of pp90rsk .
corticosteroid receptor and lymphocyte subset in mononuclear leukocyte in aging .
plasma cortisol and aldosterone level and number of related receptor in mononuclear leukocyte be measure in 49 healthy aged subject ( 62-97 yr ) and in 21 adult control ( 21-50 yr ) .
in all subject , in addition , lymphocyte subset be determine a an index of corticosteroid action .
the mean number of type i and type ii receptor be significantly low in aged subject than in control ( respectively , 198 +/- 96 and 272 +/- 97 receptor /cell for type i , and 1,794 +/- 803 and 3,339 +/- 918 for type ii receptor ) .
plasma aldosterone and cortisol and lymphocyte subset be not different in the two group .
all of the parameter be also test for correlation , and a significant inverse correlation be find between age and type i and type ii receptor when all subject be plot and between aged and cd4 and age and cd4/cd8 in the aged group .
these data show that aged subject have reduction of corticosteroid receptor that be not associate with increase of related steroid and that this situation probably represent a concomitant of the normal aging process .
transcriptional and posttranscriptional regulation of erythroid gene expression in anthracycline -induced differentiation of human erythroleukemic cell .
aclacinomycin ( acla ) and doxorubicin ( dox ) be use at subtoxic concentration to induce erythroid differentiation in the human leukemic cell line k562 .
cell hemoglobinization be accompany by the increase expression of gene encode gamma-globin and porphobilinogen deaminase ( pbgd ) , an enzyme of heme synthesis .
by use run-on assay , acla be show to induce an enhancement of the transcription of erythroid gene , include gamma-globin , pbgd , erythropoietin receptor , and gata-1 transcription factor .
in contrast , in dox -treated cell , the transcription rate of these gene be unchanged in comparison with control cell .
in addition , inhibition of mrna synthesis with actinomycin d indicate that dox induce an increase stability of pbgd and gata-1 mrna , whereas acla do not affect the half-lives of these mrna .
because the increase in erythroid mrna steady-state level in anthracycline -treated cell be inhibit by cycloheximide , this suggest that transcriptional activation in acla -treated cell and mrna stabilization in dox -treated cell be dependent on de novo protein synthesis .
finally , gata-1 protein level be show to be increase in acla-treated but not in dox-treated cell .
these two anthracyclines , although closely related in their structure , appear to act a differentiation inducer by distinct mechanism .
indeed , erythroid gene expression be demonstrate to be regulate transcriptionally by acla and mainly posttranscriptionally by dox .
transactivation by ciita , the type ii bare lymphocyte syndrome-associated factor , require participation of multiple region of the tata box binding protein .
ciita be a positive regulator of class ii major histocompatibility complex gene transcription that have be find to be defective in one of the five complementation group of class ii major histocompatibility complex -negative cell line .
it n-terminal region be capable of activate transcription from a reporter gene when fuse to a dna binding domain .
we have investigate the mechanism of transactivation mediate by the ciita activation domain by study it role in the process of transcription initiation and elongation .
specifically the altered specificity tbp ( tata box binding protein ) assay have be use to analyze the response of the ciita activation domain to mutation in tbp know to disrupt it interaction with it associate general factor .
transactivation by ciita be extremely sensitive to a mutation in tbp that in yeast be know to abolish vp16 -mediated transcription but leave basal transcription unaffected .
a tbp mutant defective in interaction with tbp -associated factor tafii250 also fail to mediate transactivation through the ciita activation domain .
certain interaction between tbp and general factor that be specifically require for acidic activation domain be also require for ciita -mediated transactivation to reach it full potential .
finally , like vp16 , ciita be able to stimulate elongation of transcription .
overall the mechanism of transactivation by the human b-cell-specific ciita be very similar to that mediate by the herpes virus transactivator vp16 in the way that have be test .
protein kinase c regulate fa ( cd95/apo-1 ) expression .
fa ( cd95/apo-1 ) be a transmembrane protein of the tnf/neuron growth factor receptor family .
ligation of fa by specific ab or fa ligand ( fasl/cd95 ligand ) induce rapid apoptotic cell death in a variety of cell type .
despite progress in understand the death signal transduce from fa , very little be know with regard to the mechanism by which fa expression be regulate .
use our previously established murine t cell hybridoma model a1.1 , we show that specific protein kinase c ( pkc ) inhibitor could block activation-induced fa expression and apoptosis .
the activation of pkc with pma or 1-oleoyl-2-acetyl-sn-glycerol could mimic the tcr signal by induce the expression of fa but not fasl .
pkc -dependent fa expression be also observe in several murine and human tumor cell line .
since the inhibition of ca2+ redistribution by an inhibitor of intracellular ca2+ mobilization , 8-(diethylamino)-octyl-3,4,5-trimethoxybenzoate hydrochloride , inhibit tcr-induced fasl but not fa , the expression of fa appear to be independent of ca2+ mobilization .
significantly , expression of the newly identify fa -regulatory gene , tdag51 , be find to be dependent upon the activity of pkc .
pkc activation only induce fa expression in cell express wild-type tdag51 .
thus , fa expression be likely mediate by pkc through tdag51 .
selenium -mediated inhibition of transcription factor nf-kappa b and hiv-1 ltr promoter activity .
the eukaryotic transcription factor nf-kappa b be involve in the inducible expression of various inflammatory gene as well a in hiv-1 replication .
activation of nf-kappa b be induce by prooxidants and several stimulus elicit oxidative stress , such a cytokine , lipopolysaccharide , uv irradiation and other mediator .
various antioxidant inhibit nf-kappa b activation in response to these stimulus .
in this study , we have investigate the effect of selenium , an integral component of glutathione peroxidase ( gpx ) , on nf-kappa b activation .
in selenium -deprived jurkat and esb-l t lymphocyte , supplementation of selenium lead to a substantial increase of gpx activity .
analysis of dna binding reveal that nf-kappa b activation in response to tnf be significantly inhibit under these condition .
likewise , reporter gene assay use luciferase construct drive by the hiv-1 long terminal repeat show a dose-dependent inhibition of nf-kappa b controlled gene expression by selenium .
the effect of selenium be specific for nf-kappa b , since the activity of the transcription factor ap-1 be not suppress .
these data suggest that selenium supplementation may be use to modulate the expression of nf-kappa b target gene and hiv-1 .
overexpression of dr-nm23 , a protein encode by a member of the nm23 gene family , inhibit granulocyte differentiation and induce apoptosis in 32dc13 myeloid cell .
chronic myelogenous leukemia evolve in two clinically distinct stage : a chronic and a blast crisis phase .
the molecular change associate with chronic phase to blast crisis transition be largely unknown .
we have identify a cdna clone , dr-nm23 , differentially express in a blast-crisis cdna library , which have approximately 70 % sequence similarity to the putative metastatic suppressor gene , nm23-h1 and nm23-h2 .
the deduce amino acid sequence similarity to the protein encode by these two latter gene be approximately 65 % and include domain and amino acid residue ( the leucine zipper-like and the rgd domain , a serine and a histidine residue in the nh2- and in the cooh-terminal portion of the protein , respectively ) postulate to be important for nm23 function .
dr-nm23 mrna be preferentially express at early stage of myeloid differentiation of highly purify cd34+ cell .
it constitutive expression in the myeloid precursor 32dc13 cell line , which be growth-factor dependent for both proliferation and differentiation , result in inhibition of granulocytic differentiation induce by granulocyte colony-stimulating factor and cause apoptotic cell death .
these result be consistent with a role for dr-nm23 in normal hematopoiesis and raise the possibility that it overexpression contribute to differentiation arrest , a feature of blastic transformation in chronic myelogenous leukemia .
1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear cell from patient with primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism .
a decrease number of calcitriol ( 1,25(oh)2d3 ) receptor have be observe in parathyroid gland of uremic animal .
in human , study carry out in surgically remove parathyroid gland have show that calcitriol binding be high in primary than in secondary hyperparathyroidism .
since specific receptor for calcitriol have be describe in peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) , we have investigate the specific uptake of 3h-labelled 1,25(oh)2d3 in pbmc of 12 woman with primary hyperparathyroidism ( php ) , 8 woman with hyperparathyroidism secondary to chronic renal failure ( sh ) , 9 woman with renal transplant ( rt ) , and 23 healthy woman .
the median dissociation constant ( kd ) be similar in all three group of patient and in healthy woman ( mean +/- s.d. ( range ) : php , 1.2 +/- 1.0 ( 0.2-4 ) x 10(-10) m ; sh , 0.6 +/- 0.4 ( 0.2-1.2 ) x 10(-10) m ; rt , 1.1 +/- 0.5 ( 0.4-1.9 ) x 10(-10) m ; control , 1.0 +/- 0.6 ( 0.3-2.6 ) x 10(-10) m ) . however , the maximal binding capacity ( nmax ) be significantly enhance in php ( 3.9 +/- 1.9 ( 1.3-7.6 ) fmol/10(7) cell vs. 2.3 +/- 0.9 ( 1.1-4.4 ) fmol/10(7) cell in control ; p = 0.0006 ) and decrease in sh ( 0.8 +/- 0.5 ( 0.2-1.6 ) fmol/10(7) cell vs. 2.3 +/- 0.9 ( 1.1-4.4 ) fmol/10(7) cell in control ; p = 0.0001 ) , whereas no change be see in rt ( 2.3 +/- 0.7 ( 1.2-3.3 ) fmol/10(7) cell vs. 2.3 +/- 0.9 ( 1.1-4.4 ) fmol/10(7) cell in control ) .
in three patient with php who be subject to parathyroidectomy , the calcitriol number come down to normal .
change of calcitriol receptor in primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism could magnify the consequence of disturbance in serum concentration of calcitriol itself and might play an important role in the development of secondary hyperparathyroidism in uremia .
[ change in plasma interleukin-1 and their possible relationship with the change in glucocorticoid receptor in aged long-distance runner ]

gr be determine by whole cell assay with 3h-dex .

the gr in peripheral blood leukocyte in aged runner be 65 % of the control .
possible relationship between the change in il-1 and gr in aged long-distance runner and it physiological significance be discuss .
transform growth factor-beta suppress human b lymphocyte ig production by inhibit synthesis and the switch from the membrane form to the secreted form of ig mrna .
transform growth factor-beta ( tgf-beta ) inhibit b cell ig secretion and reduce b cell membrane ig expression .
the addition of tgf-beta to human b lymphocyte culture stimulate with staphylococcus aureus cowan strain i and il-2 completely inhibit b cell ig secretion ( great than 90 % ) and decrease b cell surface igm , igd , kappa l chain , and lambda l chain expression .
in contrast , tgf-beta have only minimal effect on two other b cell membrane protein , hla-dr and cd20 .
internal labeling with [35s]methionine and immunoprecipitation with anti-igm , anti-kappa , and anti-lambda antibody reveal a striking reduction in kappa l chain in the presence of tgf-beta .
a less pronounced reduction in lambda l chain and microh chain be also note .
northern blot analysis of rna purify from b cell treat with tgf-beta for vary time interval reveal a significant decrease in steady state kappa and lambda l chain mrna level .
furthermore , a significant decrease in the switch from the membrane form of mu and gamma to their respective secreted form be note in the presence of tgf-beta .
nuclear run-on experiment demonstrate decrease transcription of kappa l chain .
the effect of tgf-beta on two transcriptional regulatory factor , oct-2 and nuclear factor ( nf ) kappa b , know to be important in ig gene transcription be examine .
oct-2 mrna level and both oct-2 and nf-kappa b protein in nuclear extract be not alter by treatment with tgf-beta .
in contrast , level of the transcriptional factor ap-1 , which be not know to be important in b cell ig production , be reduce by tgf-beta .
these finding demonstrate that tgf-beta decrease b lymphocyte ig secretion by inhibit the synthesis of ig mrna and inhibit the switch from the membrane form to the secreted form of mu and gamma mrna .
the mechanism by which tgf-beta inhibit ig chain synthesis be unclear although it do not involve inhibition of the binding of nf-kappa b or oct-2 to their respective target sequence .
novel membrane receptor for aldosterone in human lymphocyte : a 50 kda protein on sds-page .
fast in vitro effect of aldosterone on the na+/h(+)-exchanger , inositoltrisphosphate generation and correspond specific binding to plasma membrane at kd-values of approximately 0.1 nm have be find in human mononuclear leukocyte and vascular smooth muscle cell .
the novel aldosterone membrane receptor be analyze on sds-page after label of microsomal membrane from human mononuclear leukocyte with a [125i]- aldosterone -derivative by use of based a a photoactivatable crosslinker .
binding of 1 nm [125i]- aldosterone be find at a molecular weight of approximately 50 kda which be absent with 1 microm cold aldosterone , but not cortisol in the bind medium .
this aldosterone -selectivity be typical and discriminatory for the new aldosterone membrane receptor .
solubilization of the receptor protein from membrane by high salt concentration ( 1 m nacl , 1 mm edta ) be not achieve .
it , thus , appear a an integral membrane protein .
dithiothreitol , a sulfhydryl agent , do not reduce specific aldosterone binding indicate the absence of sh-groups in the binding domain or sensitive structure of the receptor .
the result be the first to characterize the novel membrane receptor for aldosterone with regard to molecular weight and basic property .
these finding and other related result be review here .
expression of 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor on alveolar lymphocyte from patient with pulmonary granulomatous disease .
1,25(oh)2d3 be know to be produce at site of granulomatous reaction .
in order to characterize the cell type that be target for this immunoregulatory hormone , we have evaluate the expression of 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor on peripheral blood t-lymphocytes and those recover from the lung by bronchoalveolar lavage from patient with pulmonary granulomatous disease ( tuberculosis and sarcoidosis ) and from normal control subject use combined autoradiographic and immunohistochemical technique .
lavage t-lymphocytes from patient with tuberculosis or with sarcoidosis , but not those from normal control subject , express 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor a demonstrate by binding of [3h]1,25(oh)2d3 , which be inhibit by the presence of excess unlabeled 1,25(oh)2d3 , but not by the presence of unlabeled 25 ( oh ) d3 ( receptor-positive lymphocyte : sarcoidosis , 20 +/- 12 % ; tuberculosis , 31 +/- 17 % ) .
in contrast , blood lymphocyte from patient with granulomatous disease do not express detectable 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor .
the percentage of lavage t-lymphocytes express 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor be significantly great for patient with tuberculosis present with isolate hilar adenopathy than for patient with pulmonary infiltrates and/or cavity .
1,25(oh)2d3 receptor be express to a great extent on cd8+ t-lymphocytes than on cd4+ t-lymphocytes in sarcoidosis , whereas a great proportion of cd4+ than of cd8+ t-lymphocytes from patient with tuberculosis be receptor-positive .
these finding support the conclusion that the interaction of 1,25(oh)2d3 with it receptor on t-lymphocytes may play an important role in the regulation of granulomatous reaction , but because these receptor be express on different lymphocyte population , the net effect of this potent immunoregulatory molecule be likely different in sarcoidosis and tuberculosis .
down-regulation of human granzyme b expression by glucocorticoid .
dexamethasone inhibit bind to the ikaros and ap-1 regulatory element of the granzyme b promoter .
the serine protease granzyme b be an essential component of the granule exocytosis pathway , a major apoptotic mechanism use by cytotoxic t lymphocyte and natural killer cell to induce target cell apoptosis .
granzyme b gene transcription be induce in activate lymphocyte upon antigenic stimulation , and several regulatory region include cbf , ap-1 , and ikaros binding site have be show to be essential in the control of granzyme b promoter activation .
dexamethasone , a glucocorticoid that be widely use a an immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory agent , inhibit granzyme b mrna transcript in phytohemagglutinin -activated peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
transfection of a reporter construct contain the -148 to +60 region of the human granzyme b promoter demonstrate that this region be the target for dexamethasone repression .
mutation of ikaros or ap-1 binding site in the context of the granzyme b promoter demonstrate that both site participate in dexamethasone -mediated inhibition of the granzyme b promoter activity .
electromobility shift assay reveal that dexamethasone abolish the binding of nuclear transcription factor to the ikaros binding site and reduce ap-1 binding activity .
these result indicate that dexamethasone be able to abrogate the transcriptional activity of the human granzyme b gene promoter by inhibit the binding of nuclear factor at the ap-1 and ikaros site .
lysp100 -associated nuclear domain ( land ) : description of a new class of subnuclear structure and their relationship to pml nuclear body .
the pml gene be fuse to the retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar alpha ) gene in t(15;17) acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) , create a pml-rar alpha fusion oncoprotein .
the pml gene product have be localized to subnuclear dot-like structure variously term pod , nd10s , kr body , or pml nuclear body ( pml nb ) .
the present study describe the cloning of a lymphoid-restricted gene , lysp100 , that be homologous to another protein that localize to pml nb , sp100 .
in addition to sp100 homology region , one lysp100 cdna isoform contain a bromodomain and a phd/ttc domain , which be present in a variety of transcriptional regulatory protein .
by immunofluorescence , lysp100 be localized to nuclear dot that be surprisingly largely nonoverlapping with pml nb .
however , a minority of lysp100 nuclear dot exactly colocalized with pml and sp100 .
we term the lysp100 structure " land , " for lysp100 -associated nuclear domain .
although lysp100 be express only in lymphoid cell , land could be visualize in hela cell by transfection of a lysp100 cdna .
immunoelectron microscopy reveal land to be globular , electron-dense structure morphologically distinct from the annular structure characteristic of pml nb .
land be most often find in the nucleoplasm , but be also find at the nuclear membrane and in the cytoplasm , suggest that these structure may traffic between the cytoplasm and the nucleus .
by double-immunogold labeling of pml and lysp100 , some land be show to contain both pml and lysp100 .
thus , pml be localized to a second subnuclear domain that be morphologically and biochemically distinct from pml nb .
tyloxapol inhibit nf-kappa b and cytokine release , scavenge hoci , and reduce viscosity of cystic fibrosis sputum .
cystic fibrosis ( cf ) patient develop progressive cytokine -mediated inflammatory lung disease , with abundant production of thick , tenacious , protease - and oxidant-rich purulent airway secretion that be difficult to clear even with physiotherapy .
in the search for a potential treatment , we have test tyloxapol , an alkylaryl polyether alcohol polymer detergent previously use a a mucolytic agent in adult chronic bronchitis .
tyloxapol inhibit activation of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b ( nk-kappa b ) , reduce rest secretion of the cytokine interleukin-8 ( il-8 ) in culture human monocyte , and inhibit lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -stimulated release of tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , il-1 beta , il-6 , il-8 , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) , and the eiconsanoids thromboxane a2 and leukotriene b4 ( ltb4 ) .
we have previously show that tyloxapol be a potent antioxidant for hydroxyl radical ( oh ) .
tyloxapol ( 0.05 to 0.1 % wt/vol ) effectively scavenge the oxidant hypochlorous acid ( hocl ; 1 to 7.5 mm ) in vitro , and protect from hocl -mediated lung injury in rat .
tyloxapol also reduce the viscosity of cf sputum ( from 463 +/- 133 to 128 +/- 52 centipoise ) .
we conclude that tyloxapol be potentially useful a a new antiinflammatory therapy for cf lung disease , and could possibly promote clearance of secretion in the cf airway .
leukotriene b4 transcriptionally activate interleukin-6 expression involve nk-chi b and nf-il6 .
leukotriene b4 ( ltb4 ) be a notable participant in inflammation and chemotaxis .
it be , however , still unclear whether ltb4 act in this regard directly or indirectly by stimulate the release of chemotactic and inflammatory cytokine .
here we report that ltb4 induce synthesis of interleukin ( il ) -6 by human blood monocyte through transcriptional activation of the il-6 gene .
we furthermore demonstrate that this process involve activation of the transcription factor nf-chi b and , to a less extent , of nf-il6 , while the activity of the transcription factor ap-1 , show to otherwise confer il-6 inducibility , appear to be unaffected by ltb4 .
involvement of nf-chi b and nf-il6 in induction of il-6 transcription by monocyte be demonstrate use deleted form of the il-6 promoter .
activation of the il-6 promoter by ltb4 be not only associate with accumulation of the respective transcript but result in synthesis of functional il-6 protein as well .
in addition , ltb4 mediate transactivation of a heterologous promoter construct contain the nf-chi b or the nf-il6 enhancer , but not the ap-1 enhancer .
the signaling event mediate this effect appear to involve the release of h2o2 , since ltb4 fail to induce nf-chi b or nf-il6 in the presence of the scavenger of h2o2 , n-acetyl-l-cysteine .
in vivo function of an interleukin 2 receptor beta chain ( il-2rbeta ) / il-4ralpha cytokine receptor chimera potentiate allergic airway disease .
strength of t cell receptor ( tcr ) signaling , coreceptors , costimulation , antigen-presenting cell type , and cytokine all play crucial role in determine the efficiency with which type 2 t lymphocyte ( th2 , tc2 ) develop from uncommitted precursor .
to investigate in vivo regulatory mechanism that control the population of type 2 t cell and disease susceptibility , we have create line of transgenic mouse in which expression of a chimeric cytokine receptor ( the mouse interleukin 2 receptor beta chain [ il-2rbeta ] extracellular domain fuse to the cytoplasmic tail of il-4ralpha ) be target to the t lymphoid lineage use the proximal lck promoter .
this chimera transduce il-4 -specific signal in response to il-2 binding and dramatically enhance type 2 response ( il-4 , il-5 , and immunoglobulin e production ) upon in vitro tcr stimulation or in vivo antigen challenge .
thus , type 2 effector function be augment by il-4 signal transduce through a chimeric receptor express in a t cell-specific manner .
this influence be sufficient for establishment of antigen-induced allergic airway hyperresponsiveness on a disease-resistant background
nuclear factor of activate t cell and ap-1 be insufficient for il-2 promoter activation : requirement for cd28 up-regulation of re/ap .
il-2 gene transcription in t cell require both tcr and costimulatory signal .
il-2 promoter activation in jurkat t cell stimulate with superantigen present by raji b cell require cd28 activation .
the addition of rctla4ig , which block cd28 binding to it ligand , to the culture decrease il-2 promoter activation by > 80 % .
interestingly , ctla4ig do not significantly inhibit the activation of either nf of activate t cell ( nfat ) or ap-1 reporter .
therefore , activation of nfat and ap-1 be insufficient for il-2 promoter activation .
in contrast , an re/ap reporter be block by ctla4ig by > 90 % .
thus , the requirement for cd28 in il-2 promoter activation appear to be due to re/ap and not the nfat or ap-1 site .
in addition , these data suggest that transcriptional activation of re/ap be not mediate by nfat , because activation of a nfat reporter be not affect by the addition of ctla4ig .
differential interaction of nuclear factor with the leukocyte-specific pp52 promoter in b and t cell .
the leukocyte-specific , cytoskeleton-binding pp52 ( lsp-1 , wp-34 ) protein be widely express in multiple leukocyte lineage , include b and t lymphocyte , granulocyte , and macrophage .
we previously detect a tissue-specific promoter precede the exon encode the n terminus of the pp52 leukocyte protein .
here we describe the functional characterization of this promoter and identification of the factor in b and t cell that regulate it activity .
the pp52 promoter contain an initiator specify the unique 5' terminus of pp52 mrna , tandem pair of ets and sp1 motif , and a lone c/ebp motif .
all these motif be essential and collectively control transcriptional activity .
dna binding study and ab supershift assay reveal that different combination of factor interact with these motif in b cell v t cell .
the ets motif be preferentially bind by pu-1 in b cell extract from all stage of development , whereas a different ets family member react with these motif in t cell extract .
the c/ebp motif be bind by ig/ebp-1 in pre-b cell and t cell extract , but be replace by nuclear factor-il-6beta or a nuclear factor-il-6beta -ig/ebp-1 heterodimer in plasmacytoma cell extract .
despite it report role a a negative regulator of transcription , ig/ebp-1 appear to exert a stimulatory effect on this promoter .
these finding reveal the feature control the pp52 promoter in b and t cell and provide the foundation for determine the regulation of this promoter in other leukocyte lineage .
relationship between rap1 protein phosphorylation and regulation of ca2+ transport in platelet : a new approach .
although the interrelationship between the two messenger ca2+ and cyclic amp in platelet function be well document , it mechanism of action still remain to be establish .
we investigate here the question of the regulation of platelet ca(2+)-atpases by cyclic amp through the phosphorylation of the rap1 protein use a pathological model .
we first find experimental condition where ca(2+)-transport by platelet membrane vesicle appear to be dependent on the phosphorylation of the rap1 protein .
then , we study platelet of patient with congestive heart failure for their expression of the potential 97 kda ca(2+)-atpase target of regulation through the rap1 protein as well a the phosphorylation of the rap1 protein use the catalytic subunit of the cyclic amp -dependent protein kinase ( c. sub. ) .
in the first patient study , we find no significant modification in the expression of the 97 kda ca(2+)-atpase by western blotting use the pl/im 430 monoclonal antibody which specifically recognize this isoform .
in contrast , the rap1 protein be differentially phosphorylated when use 15 micrograms/ml of the c. sub .
these result allow u to use these pathological platelet to study the relationship between the expression of rap1 protein and the regulation of ca2+ transport by select a patient with severe heart failure .
we could show a decrease in the expression as well a in the phosphorylation of rap1 protein and demonstrate a low effect of c. sub. on ca2+ transport .
finally , by study a further series of patient , we could confirm that the decrease in rap1 protein expression in heart failure , whatever it extent , be variable , and could strictly correlate the expression of rap1 protein with the stimulatory effect of c. sub. on ca2+ transport .
besides the evidence for regulation of the expression of the rap1 protein in platelet from patient with heart failure , these finding constitute a new approach in favour of the regulation of platelet ca2+ transport through the phosphorylation of the rap1 protein .
deleted chromosome 20 from a patient with alagille syndrome isolate in a cell hybrid through leucine transport selection : study of three candidate gene .

the nr2 hybrid allow u to exclude three candidate gene for ag : hepatic nuclear factor 3 beta ( hnf3 beta ) , paired box 1 ( pax1 ) , and cystatin c ( cst3 ) a show by their localization outside of the deletion .
the nr2 hybrid be a powerful tool for the mapping of new probe of this region , as well a for obtain new informative probe specific for the deletion by subtractive cloning of the region .
such marker will be useful for linkage analysis and screening of cdna library .

this induction be dependent on protein kinase c activity and protein synthesis .
the cell type-specific increase in lal expression be far investigate in the thp-1 cell line with respect to transcriptional regulation .
the human monocytic leukemia cell line thp-1 differentiate into macrophage-like cell when treat with phorbol ester .
in order to determine the cis-acting element necessary for both basal and phorbol 12-myristate-13 acetate ( pma ) -enhanced promoter activity , we perform deletion analysis and reporter gene assay .
a pma responsive element have be identify between -182 bp and -107 bp upstream of the major transcription start site .

our data suggest that differentiation dependent increase of lysosomal acid lipase ( lal ) expression in thp-1 cell be mediate by a concerted action of sp1 and ap-2 .
altered dna-binding specificity mutant of eklf and sp1 show that eklf be an activator of the beta-globin locus control region in vivo .

multiple oct2 isoforms be generate by alternative splicing .
the interaction of the oct2 transcription factor with the cognate octamer motif atgcaaat be a critical determinant of the lymphoid-specific expression of immunoglobulin gene .
ectopic expression of clone oct2 cdna be show to be sufficient to reconstitute at least some aspect of this regulation in non-lymphoid cell .
we describe the isolation and characterization of multiple cdna encode mouse oct2 from a mature b-cell line and we show that a variety of isoforms of this transcription factor be generate from a single gene by an alternative splicing mechanism .
all the isoforms retain the previously characterize pou-domain and be therefore able to bind to the octamer motif .
different amount of the various isoforms be present within the same b-cell regardless of the developmental stage of b-cell differentiation and at least some of the isoforms be conserve between mouse and human .
in cotransfection experiment we show that all the isoforms be able to activate an octamer contain promoter element in fibroblast reveal an unexpected functional redundancy .
finally , we show that one of the isoforms encode the previously describe lymphoid-specific oct2b protein which have be suggest to be involve in the function of the octamer motif in the context of the immunoglobulin heavy-chain ( igh ) enhancer .
effect of tpa , bryostatin 1 , and retinoic acid on po-b , ap-1 , and ap-2 dna binding during hl-60 differentiation .
po-b be originally characterize a a transcriptional regulatory factor of the pro-opiomelanocortin ( pomc ) gene ; however , it have become increasingly clear that this protein may be active in tissue outside the pituitary , since it be present in diverse cell type , include differentiate hl-60 promyelocytic leukemia cell .
we previously show that po-b dna-binding be progressively induce during differentiation of promyelomonocytic leukemic hl-60 cell to the macrophage-like lineage ( with phorbol ester ) .
we now report that po-b dna-binding in hl-60 cell be similarly induce during differentiation to the granulocytic lineage ( with either retinoic acid or dimethylsulfoxide ) .
either a genetic or pharmacologic blockade of hl-60 differentiation prohibit these inductive effect .
these study have prompt our interest in the dynamic of other transcription factor change during hl-60 differentiation .
of these , we observe that another transcription factor ( ap-1 ) be also robustly induce at the dna-binding level during macrophage-like hl-60 differentiation , but not during granulocytic differentiation .
conversely , the dna-binding of the transcription factor ap-2 be slightly reduce by tpa -induced hl-60 differentiation but unchanged during granulocyte differentiation .
from these data , we conclude that the induction of po-b dna binding be a general marker of hl-60 myelomonocytic differentiation , but that qualitative aspect of the induction of additional distinct transcription factor , such a ap-1 , may contribute to lineage-specific determinant of cell fate .
the 29-kda protein phosphorylated in thrombin-activated human platelet be form of the estrogen receptor -related 27-kda heat shock protein .
thrombin play a critical role in platelet activation , hemostasis , and thrombosis .
cellular activation by thrombin lead to the phosphorylation of multiple protein , most of which be unidentified .
we have characterize several 29-kda protein that be rapidly phosphorylated follow exposure of intact human platelet to thrombin .
a murine monoclonal antibody raise to an unidentified estrogen receptor-related 29-kda protein selectively recognize these protein as well a a more basic , unphosphorylated 27-kda protein .
cellular activation by thrombin lead to a marked shift in the proportion of protein from the 27-kda unphosphorylated form to the 29-kda phosphoprotein specie .
use this antibody , we isolate and sequence a human cdna clone encode a protein that be identical to the mammalian 27-kda heat shock protein ( hsp27 ) , a protein of uncertain function that be know to be phosphorylated to several form and to be transcriptionally induce by estrogen .
the 29-kda protein be confirm to be phosphorylated form of hsp27 by immunoprecipitation study .
thus , the " estrogen receptor-related protein " be hsp27 , and the three major 29-kda protein phosphorylated in thrombin -activated platelet be form of hsp27 .
these data suggest a role for hsp27 in the signal transduction event of platelet activation .
inhibitor ( ik ) of ifn-gamma induced hla class ii antigen expression also inhibit hla class ii constitutive expression in the human raji b cell line .
the expression of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii antigen be constitutive in professional antigen presenting cell ( apc ) but can also be induce by interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) on the majority of the non professional apc ( e.g. fibroblast ) .
we have recently characterise a new factor call ik which be an efficient inhibitor of ifn-gamma induction of mhc class ii antigen expression .
here , we demonstrate a novel role for ik in mhc class ii expression since over-expression of this protein by stable transfection into human b cell lead to a total disappearance of constitutive mhc class ii mrna expression .

examination of ciita mrna in ik stably transfected clone reveal a marked reduction of ciita mrna transcription .
take together these result demonstrate that the ik protein play a key role in the constitutive expression of mhc class ii antigen and that inhibition induce by ik be upstream of ciita in this regulatory pathway .
signaling by il-2 and related cytokine : jak , stats , and relationship to immunodeficiency .
cytokine that bind to the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) receptor common gamma chain ( gamma c ) , include il-2 , il-4 , il-7 , il-9 , and il-15 , be important for the growth and differentiation of t and b lymphocyte , natural killer cell , macrophage , and monoctyes .

the discovery of these signaling pathway have lead to important new insight into their role in lymphocyte maturation , a it have emerge that mutation in the gene encode both gamma c and jak3 result in similar form of severe combined immunodeficiency ( scid ) .
in this review we examine the structure and function of cytokine receptor and the signaling pathway involve in their regulation of gene expression .
furthermore , we discuss recent advance that have lead to a good understanding of how cytokine elicit intracellular response , as well a their role in normal lymphoid development .
protein kinase c-zeta mediate nf-kappa b activation in human immunodeficiency virus -infected monocyte .
the molecular mechanism regulate human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) persistence in a major cell reservoir such a the macrophage remain unknown .
nf-kappa b be a transcription factor involve in the regulation of the hiv long terminal repeat and be selectively activate follow hiv infection of human macrophage .
although little information a to what signal transduction pathway mediate nf-kappa b activation in monocytes-macrophages be available , our previous work indicate that classical protein kinase c ( pkc ) isoenzymes be not involve in the hiv -mediated nf-kappa b activation .
in this study , we have focus on atypical pkc isoenzymes .
pkc-zeta belong to this family and be know to be an important step in nf-kappa b activation in other cell system .
immunoblotting experiment with u937 cell demonstrate that pkc-zeta be present in these cell , and it expression can be downmodulated by antisense oligonucleotides ( ao ) .
the hiv -mediated nf-kappa b activation be selectively reduce by ao to pkc-zeta .
in addition , cotransfection of a negative dominant molecule of pkc-zeta ( pkc-zeta mut ) with nf-kappa b -dependent reporter gene selectively inhibit the hiv - but not phorbol myristate acetate- or lipopolysaccharide- mediated activation of nf-kappa b .
that pkc-zeta be specific in regulate nf-kappa b be conclude from the inability of pkc-zeta ( mut ) to interfere with the basal or phorbol myristate acetate -inducible creb - or ap1 -dependent transcriptional activity .
lastly , we demonstrate a selective inhibition of p24 production by hiv -infected human macrophage when treat with ao to pkc-zeta .
altogether , these result suggest that atypical pkc isoenzymes , include pkc-zeta , participate in the signal transduction pathway by which hiv infection result in the activation of nf-kappa b in human monocytic cell and macrophage .
interaction between nf-kappa b - and serum response factor -binding element activate an interleukin-2 receptor alpha-chain enhancer specifically in t lymphocyte .
we find that a short enhancer element contain the nf-kappa b binding site from the interleukin-2 receptor alpha-chain gene ( il-2r alpha ) be preferentially activate in t cell .
the il-2r alpha enhancer bind nf-kappa b poorly and be only weakly activate by the nf-kappa b site alone .
serum response factor ( srf ) bind to a site adjacent to the nf-kappa b site in the il-2r enhancer , and both site together have strong transcriptional activity specifically in t cell .
surprisingly , the level of srf constitutively express in t cell be consistently high than in other cell type .
overexpression of srf in b cell cause the il-2r enhancer to function as well a it do in t cell , suggest that the high level of srf binding in t cell be functionally important .
interleukin-2 induce tyrosine phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of stat3 in human t lymphocyte .
an early biochemical event associate with t cell activation through the interleukin-2 receptor ( il-2r ) be tyrosine phosphorylation of several intracellular substrate .
the exact mechanism by which il-2 regulate transcription of different gene be presently unknown .
here , we report that stimulation through the il-2r induced tyrosine phosphorylation and subsequent nuclear translocation of stat3 , a newly identify member of the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) family of protein .
in contrast , stat1 protein be not tyrosine phosphorylated after il-2 ligation , whereas tyrosine -phosphorylated stat1 protein ( 91 and 84 kda protein ) be translocate to the nucleus following interferon-gamma treatment of hela cell .
apart from stat3 , another cytoplasmic protein be tyrosine phosphorylated and subsequently translocate to the nucleus in response to il-2 .
this protein have an apparent molecular mass of 84 kda and be not recognize by stat3 or stat1 mab or antiserum .
since il-2 induced nuclear translocation of the 84 kda protein and stat3 follow identical kinetics , p84 be a candidate for a new , yet undefined , member of the stat family .
take together , we report that il-2 induce tyrosine phosphorylation and subsequent nuclear translocation of stat3 and an a yet undefined 84-kda protein in antigen-specific human t cell line .
activate platelet induce monocyte chemotactic protein-1 secretion and surface expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 on endothelial cell [ see comment ]
background : platelet/endothelium interaction play an important role in the pathophysiology of inflammation and atherosclerosis .
the role of platelet for monocyte chemotactic protein-1 ( mcp-1 ) secretion and surface expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) on endothelial cell have be assess .
method and result : monolayers of human umbilical vein endothelial cell be incubate with nonstimulated or adp-activated platelet for 6 hour , and secretion of mcp-1 and surface expression of icam-1 be determine by elisa and flow cytometry , respectively .
in the presence of adp-activated platelet , both mcp-1 secretion and icam-1 surface expression be significantly increase compare with nonstimulated platelet ( p < 0.02 ) .
activation of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) determine by electrophoretic mobility shift assay and kappab -dependent transcriptional activity be enhance in the presence of activate platelet .
in addition , adp- activated platelet induce mcp-1 and icam-1 promoter-dependent transcription .
liposomal transfection of a double-stranded kappab phosphorothioate oligonucleotide , but not of the mutated form , inhibit mcp-1 secretion and surface expression of icam-1 on activate endothelium ( p < 0.05 ) .
conclusion : the present study indicate that activate platelet modulate chemotactic ( mcp-1 ) and adhesive ( icam-1 ) property of endothelial cell via an nf-kappab -dependent mechanism .
platelet-induced activation of the nf-kappab system might contribute to early inflammatory event in atherogenesis .
tissue and cell-type specific expression of the tuberous sclerosis gene , tsc2 , in human tissue .
tsc2 be a gene on chromosome 16p13.3 associate with the autosomal dominant neurocutaneous disorder , tuberous sclerosis complex ( tsc ) .
by use a partial nucleotide sequence from the clone tsc2 and polymerase chain reaction methodology , we construct a digoxigenin-labeled complementary dna probe to examine tsc2 gene expression in autopsy- or biopsy-derived human tissue by in situ hybridization .
tsc2 messenger rna be widely express in various cell type throughout the body , include epithelium , lymphocyte , and cell with endocrine function , e.g. , adrenal cortex and anterior pituitary .
it be prominently and selectively ( within the central nervous system ) express in pyramidal cell of the cerebral cortex and other motor neuron , e.g. , in spinal cord and brainstem nucleus .
visceral tsc2 expression be comparable in autopsy tissue from patient with and without tsc ; tsc2 messenger rna expression be most prominent in cell with a rapid mitotic rate and turnover , e.g. , epithelium and lymphocyte , with central nervous system pyramidal cell and other neuron be an obvious exception , and/or in cell with important secretory/transport function .
this widespread expression of the tsc2 gene support the view that it encode a protein vital to cell growth and metabolism or one that function a a tumor/growth suppressor .
temperature-induced down-regulation of the glucocorticoid receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear leucocyte in patient with sepsis or septic shock .
objective : activation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis be of vital importance during critical illness .
we have study the adaptive mechanism which occur at the level of the glucocorticoid receptor in glucocorticoid target tissue in patient with sepsis or septic shock .
design : the effect of hypercortisolaemia , hyperthermia and cellular composition on number of glucocorticoid receptor per cell and their affinity be evaluate , both in vitro and in vivo , in peripheral blood mononuclear leucocyte of control subject and in patient with sepsis or septic shock .
subject : fifteen patient ( age 25-79 ) with sepsis or septic shock who be admit to an intensive care unit be study .
the control group consist of 24 healthy laboratory employee .
measurement : the binding capacity and affinity of the glucocorticoid receptor be measure and compare to clinical data and the plasma cortisol concentration .
result : hypercortisolaemia , in vitro , result in a decrease affinity and a decrease binding capacity of the glucocorticoid receptor .
in vitro , hyperthermia as well a variation in the cellular composition do not influence the glucocorticoid receptor .
in vivo , there be no change in the number of receptor per cell in patient with sepsis or septic shock a compare to healthy control .
however , a decrease affinity of the glucocorticoid receptor be observe .
there be a weak but significant negative correlation between body temperature and the number of glucocorticoid receptor in the patient group .
there be no relation between circulate cortisol concentration and glucocorticoid receptor affinity and number .
conclusion : there be no obvious regulation of the number of glucocorticoid receptor by plasma cortisol concentration in vivo .
the decrease affinity of the glucocorticoid receptor together with the negative correlation between hyperthermia and the number of glucocorticoid receptor in patient with sepsis or septic shock suggest that hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis activation during critical illness be accompany by peripheral adaptation in glucocorticoid receptor number and affinity .
monocytic differentiation of hl-60 promyelocytic leukemia cell correlate with the induction of bcl-xl .
treatment of human promyelocytic leukemia hl-60 cell with phorbol ester ultimately induce the differentiation of these cell along the monocyte/macrophage lineage , whereas treatment with retinoic acid or dmso induce granulocytic/neutrophillic differentiation .
in this study , we demonstrate the disparate fate of hl-60 cell treat with the phorbol ester 12,13-phorbol dibutyric acid ( pdbu ) or dmso .
after dmso treatment , hl-60 cell eventually die via apoptosis , whereas the viability of pdbu -treated cell be not affect during the same interval .
the level of the apoptosis effector protein bak and bad be enhance , whereas there be a slight down-regulation of the apoptosis suppressor protein bcl-2 after treatment of the cell with pdbu and dmso .
treatment with dmso result in the elevation of the apoptosis effector bax , whereas treatment with pdbu do not significantly alter the level of this protein .
however , treatment of hl-60 cell with pdbu induce the rapid expression of the apoptosis suppressor protein bcl-xl , whereas the expression of this protein remain unaltered in dmso -treated cell .
the generality of this finding be confirm by the induction of bcl-xl in human myeloid u-937 cell , human peripheral blood monocyte expose to phorbol ester , and mouse thioglycollate-activated and resident peritoneal macrophage .
pdbu -treated hl-60 cell remain viable for 7 day and thereafter begin to die via apoptosis , with a concomitant down-regulation of bcl-xl .
in conclusion , we propose that bcl-xl expression be associate with differentiation and survival of hematopoietic cell along the monocyte/macrophage lineage .
mutation in the tsc2 gene : analysis of the complete cod sequence use the protein truncation test ( ptt ) .
mutation in the tsc2 gene on chromosome 16p13.3 be responsible for approximately 50 % of familial tuberous sclerosis ( tsc ) .
the gene have 41 small exon span 45 kb of genomic dna and encode a 5.5 kb mrna .
large germline deletion of tsc2 occur in < 5 % of case , and a number of small intragenic mutation have be describe .
we analyse mrna from 18 unrelated case of tsc for tsc2 mutation use the protein truncation test ( ptt ) .
three case be predict to be tsc2 mutation on the basis of linkage analysis or because a hamartoma from the patient show loss of heterozygosity for 16p13.3 marker .
three overlap pcr product , cover the complete cod sequence of mrna , be generate from lymphoblastoid cell line , translate into 35s-methionine labelled protein , and analyse by sds-page .
pcr product show ptt shift be directly sequence , and mutation confirm by restriction enzyme digestion where possible .
six ptt shift be identify .
five of these be cause by mutation predict to produce a truncate protein : ( i ) a sporadic case show a 32 bp deletion in exon 11 , and a mutant mrna without exon 11 be produce ; the normal exon 10 be also splice out ; ( ii ) a sporadic case have a 1 bp deletion in exon 12 ( 1634delt ) ; ( iii ) a tsc2 -linked mother and daughter pair have a g --> t transversion in exon 23 ( g2715t ) introduce a cryptic splice site cause a 29 bp truncation of mrna from exon 23 ; ( iv ) a sporadic case show a 2 bp deletion in exon 36 ; ( v ) a sporadic case show a 1 bp insertion disrupt the donor splice site of exon 37 ( 5007+2insa ) , result in the use of an upstream exonic cryptic splice site to cause a 29 bp truncation of mrna from exon 37 .
in one case , the ptt shift be explain by in-frame splicing out of exon 10 , in the presence of a normal exon 10 genomic sequence .
alternative splicing of exon 10 of the tsc2 gene may be a normal variant .
three 3rd base substitution polymorphism be also detect during direct sequencing of pcr product .
confirm mutation be identify in 28 % of the family study and on the assumption that half of the sporadic case should have tsc2 mutation , a crude estimate of the detection rate would be 60 % .
this compare favourably with other screening method use for tsc2 , notably sscp , and since ptt involve much less work it may be the method of choice .
activation of protein kinase c and elevation of camp interact synergistically to raise c-fos and ap-1 activity in jurkat cell .
we have earlier find that in jurkat cell activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) enhance the cyclic adenosine monophosphate ( camp ) accumulation induce by adenosine receptor stimulation or activation of g .
here we have therefore examine the effect of the phorbol ester pma ( phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ) which stimulate pkc and a combination of the adenosine receptor agonist neca ( 5'-(n-ethyl)-carboxamido adenosine ) and forskolin to raise camp , on the level of c-fos and jun and on the bind and transcriptional activity of the transcription factor , activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) .
pma treatment cause a concentration- and time-dependent increase in both c-fos and jun immunoreactivity in contrast to camp elevation that have only a slight effect .
both pma and the combination of neca and forskolin act together either to increase ( c-fos ) or decrease ( jun ) protein level as well a increase ap-1 binding , a judge by gel-shift assay , and ap-1 transcriptional activity .
furthermore there be a clear-cut synergy between the pkc stimulator and the camp elevating agent .
the result demonstrate that the simultaneous activation of pkc and elevation of camp lead to an enhance ap-1 transcriptional activity in a t-leukemia cell line , suggest that the previously observe interaction between the parallel signal transduction pathway may have functional consequence at the level of gene transcription .

bash , a novel signal molecule preferentially express in b cell of the bursa of fabricius .
the bursa of fabricius be a gut-associated lymphoid organ that be essential for the generation of a diversified b cell repertoire in the chicken .
we describe here a novel gene preferentially express in bursal b cell .
