transcriptional activity of core binding factor- alpha ( aml1 ) and beta subunit on murine leukemia virus enhancer core .
core binding factor ( cbf ) , also know a polyomavirus enhancer-binding protein 2 and sl3 enhancer factor 1 , be a mammalian transcription factor that bind to an element term the core within the enhancer of the murine leukemia virus family of retrovirus .
the core element of the sl3 virus be important genetic determinant of the ability of this virus to induce t-cell lymphoma and the transcriptional activity of the viral long terminal repeat in t lymphocyte .
cbf consist of two subunit , a dna binding subunit , cbf alpha , and a second subunit , cbf beta , that stimulate the dna binding activity of cbf alpha .
one of the gene that encode a cbf alpha subunit be aml1 , also call cbf alpha 2 .
this locus be rearrange by chromosomal translocation in human myeloproliferative disorder and leukemia .
an exogenously express cbf alpha 2 -encoded subunit ( cbf alpha 2-451 ) stimulate transcription from the sl3 enhancer in p19 and hela cell .
activity be mediate through the core element .
three different isoforms of cbf beta be also test for transcriptional activity on the sl3 enhancer .
the long form , cbf beta -187 , increase the transcriptional stimulation by cbf alpha 2-451 twofold in hela cell , although it have no effect in p19 cell .
transcriptional activation by cbf beta require binding to the cbf alpha subunit , a a form of cbf beta that lack binding ability , cbf beta -148 , fail to increase activity .
these result indicate that at least in certain cell type , the maximum activity of cbf require both subunit .
they also provide support for the hypothesis that cbf be a factor in t lymphocyte that be responsible for recognition of the sl3 core .
we also examine whether cbf could distinguish a 1-bp difference between the enhancer core of sl3 and the core of the nonleukemogenic virus , akv .
this difference strongly affect transcription in t cell and leukemogenicity of sl3 .
however , no combination of cbf alpha and cbf beta subunit that we test be able to distinguish the 1-bp difference in transcription assay .
thus , a complete understanding of how t cell recognize the sl3 core remain to be elucidate .
bcl-6 mutation in normal germinal center b cell : evidence of somatic hypermutation act outside ig locus .
the molecular mechanism involve in the process of antigen-driven somatic hypermutation of ig gene be unknown , but it be commonly believe that this mechanism be restricted to the ig locus .
b cell lymphoma commonly display multiple somatic mutation cluster in the 5'-regulatory region of bcl-6 , a proto-oncogene encode for a poz/zinc finger transcriptional repressor express in germinal center ( gc ) b cell and require for gc formation .
to determine whether bcl-6 mutation represent a tumor-associated phenomenon or reflect a physiologic mechanism , we screen single human tonsillar gc b cell for mutation occur in the bcl-6 5'-noncoding region and in the ig variable heavy chain sequence .
thirty percent of gc b cell , but not naive b cell , display mutation in the 742 bp region analyze within the first intron of bcl-6 ( overall frequency : 5 x 10(-4)/bp ) .
accordingly , an expand survey in lymphoid malignancy show that bcl-6 mutation be restricted to b cell tumor display gc or post-gc phenotype and carry mutate ig variable heavy chain sequence .
these result indicate that the somatic hypermutation mechanism active in gc b cell physiologically target non-ig sequence .
inhibition of hiv-1 replication and nf-kappa b activity by cysteine and cysteine derivative .
hiv-1 proviral dna contain two bind site for the transcription factor nf-kappa b .
hiv-1 -infected individual have , on average , abnormally high level of tumour necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) and abnormally low plasma cysteine level .
we therefore investigate the effect of cysteine and related thiols on hiv-1 replication and nf-kappa b expression .
the experiment in this report show that cysteine or n-acetylcysteine ( nac ) raise the intracellular glutathione ( gsh ) level and inhibit hiv-1 replication in persistently infected molt-4 and u937 cell .
however , inhibition of hiv-1 replication appear not to be directly correlate with gsh level .
cysteine and nac also inhibit nf-kappa b activity a determine by electrophoretic mobility shift assay and chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase ( cat ) gene expression under control of nf-kappa b binding site in uninfected cell .
this suggest that the cysteine deficiency in hiv-1 -infected individual may cause an over-expression of nf-kappa b -dependent gene and enhance hiv-1 replication .
nac may be consider for the treatment of hiv-1 -infected individual .
hiv enhancer activity perpetuate by nf-kappa b induction on infection of monocyte [ see comment ]
permissiveness to replication of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) differ in t lymphocyte and macrophage .
in t cell , hiv transcription be poorly detect in vivo .
clone , normal t lymphocyte show very little , if any , basal activity of the hiv enhancer and low nuclear expression of nf-kappa b , a potent transcriptional activator of the hiv enhancer .
in contrast , fixed tissue macrophage express detectable hiv protein , indicate permanent virus transcription .
one explanation for the perpetuation of virus infection in macrophage could be sustained nuclear nf-kappa b expression .
however , the u937 monocytic cell line , which be fully permissive to hiv replication , be know to express only low level of nuclear nf-kappa b .
we show here that chronic hiv infection result in both induction of a nuclear factor with antigenic property indistinguishable from those of nf-kappa b and permanently increase hiv enhancer activity .
this phenomenon , which be independent of tumour necrosis factor , be associate with hiv replication , and be thus likely to explain at least in part the perpetuation of hiv infection in monocyte .
the role of e-proteins in b- and t- lymphocyte development .
department of lymphocyte from hematopoietic stem cell be control , in part , by the activity of transcriptional regulatory protein .
in particular , one class of helix-loop-helix protein , term e-proteins , have be implicate in the regulation of gene expression during b-cell development .
recent analysis of gene-targeted mouse have allow a direct assessment of the functional role of several e-protein family member in hematopoiesis .
in this review we describe the defect in b- and t- lymphocyte development in mouse carry target mutation in the e-protein gene and discuss our current understanding of the role of these protein in lymphoid development
transcription factor activation in lymphokine activated killer cell and lymphocyte from patient receive il-2 immunotherapy .
administration of the cytokine interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) can result in therapeutic benefit for individual with renal cell carcinoma and melanoma .
here we report an analysis of the transcription factor family ap-1 , sp1 , nf-kappab , and signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) in cancer patient ' lymphocyte before and after il-2 immunotherapy , a assess by a gel-shift assay .
an in vitro surrogate of il-2 immunotherapy be the incubation of fresh peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) from healthy individual in il-2 for several day , result in the production of lymphokine -activated killer ( lak ) activity in these culture .
one purpose of this study be to describe the profile of transcription factor activation in these different population , and assess whether the pattern observe correlate with functional difference in these cell .
prior to in vivo il-2 administration , the typical binding pattern of transcription factor in pbmc from patient resemble that see in fresh pbmc from healthy individual .
over a 3-week course of il-2 therapy , in most patient the binding pattern of ap-1 , sp1 , and nf-kappab protein change to resemble those see in pbmc activate by il-2 in vitro .
however , the cell obtain from il-2 -treated patient do not have low-level constitutive expression of stat binding factor a do lak cell .
when these patient cell be far stimulate by il-2 in vitro , additional difference in stat induction pattern be note .
these data provide further information on the molecular event occur in immune cell generate through in vivo and in vitro administration of il-2 , and far document that there be not a precise congruence between pbmc activate in vivo and in vitro by il-2 .
activation of the hiv-1 enhancer by the lef-1 hmg protein on nucleosome-assembled dna in vitro .
lymphoid enhancer-binding factor 1 ( lef-1 ) be a regulatory high mobility group ( hmg ) protein that activate the t cell receptor alpha ( tcr alpha ) enhancer in a context-restricted manner in t cell .
in this paper we demonstrate that the distal region of the human immunodeficiency virus-1 ( hiv-1 ) enhancer , which contain dna-binding site for lef-1 and ets-1 , also provide a functional context for activation by lef-1 .
first , we show that mutation in the lef-1 -binding site inhibit the activity of multimerized copy of the hiv-1 enhancer in jurkat t cell , and that lef-1 /gal4 can activate a gal4-substituted hiv-1 enhancer 80- to 100-fold in vivo .
second , recombinant lef-1 be show to activate hiv-1 transcription on chromatin-assembled dna in vitro .
by use a nucleosome -assembly system derive from drosophila embryo , we find that the packaging of dna into chromatin in vitro strongly repress hiv-1 transcription and that repression can be counteract efficiently by preincubation of the dna with lef-1 ( or lef-1 and ets-1 ) supplement with fraction contain the promoter-binding protein , sp1 .
addition of tfe-3 , which bind to an e-box motif upstream of the lef-1 and ets-1 site , far augment transcription in this system .
individually or collectively , none of the three enhancer-binding protein ( lef-1 , ets-1 , and tfe-3 ) could activate transcription in the absence of sp1 .
a truncation mutant of lef-1 ( hmg-88 ) , which contain the hmg box but lack the trans-activation domain , do not activate transcription from nucleosomal dna , indicate that bending of dna by the hmg domain be not sufficient to activate transcription in vitro .
we conclude that transcription activation by lef-1 in vitro be a chromatin -dependent process that require a functional trans-activation domain in addition to the hmg domain .
regulation of nuclear factor-kappa b and it inhibitor i kappa b-alpha/mad-3 in monocyte by mycobacterium tuberculosis and during human tuberculosis .
blood monocyte from patient with active tuberculosis be activate in vivo , a evidence by an increase in the stimulate release of proinflammatory cytokine , such a tnf -alpha , and the spontaneous expression of il-2r .
far , monocyte from patient demonstrate an augmented susceptibility to a productive infection with hiv-1 in vitro .
mycobacterium tuberculosis and it component be strong signal to activate monocyte to production of cytokine .
in this study we examine the basis of activation of monocyte during active tuberculosis and by m. tuberculosis .
we find a constitutive degradation of i kappa b-alpha , the major cytoplasmic inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , in freshly isolate pbmc and monocyte from patient with tuberculosis .
in contrast , i kappa b-alpha level in pbmc and monocyte from healthy subject or from patient with nontuberculous pulmonary condition be intact .
far , by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , nf-kappa b be activate in monocyte from tuberculous patient .
the expression of i kappa b-alpha gene , which be responsive to activation by nf-kappa b , be up-regulated in pbmc and monocyte from patient , but not in mononuclear cell from healthy subject or those with nontuberculous lung disease .
by contrast , the expression of other adherence-associated early gene , such a il-8 and il-1 beta , be not up-regulated in pbmc of tuberculous patient .
far , m. tuberculosis and it tuberculin , purify protein derivative , induce the degradation of i kappa b-alpha and the expression of i kappa b-alpha mrna , and purify protein derivative induce the activation of nf-kappa b in monocyte .
a novel retinoic acid receptor ( rar ) -selective antagonist inhibit differentiation and apoptosis of hl-60 cell : implication of raralpha -mediated signal in myeloid leukemic cell .
retinoic acid ( ra ) induce hl-60 cell to differentiate terminally into mature granulocyte , which subsequently die by apoptosis .
the biological effect of ra be mediate by two distinct family of transcription factor : retinoic acid receptor ( rars ) and retinoid x receptor ( rxrs ) .
rars and rxrs form heterodimers and regulate retinoid-mediated gene expression .
we have recently develop a novel rar -selective antagonist ( er27191 ) which prevent rar activation by retinoids .
use this rar-selective antagonist , and rxr and rar agonist , we demonstrate the rar -mediated signaling pathway be important for differentiation and apoptosis of myeloid leukemic cell .
simple activation of rxrs be not sufficient to induce apoptosis of the cell .
interestingly , the combination of the rar-selective antagonist and 9-cis ra result in partial differentiation and apoptosis of hl-60 and nb4 cell , whereas the rar antagonist completely block all-trans ra -induced differentiation and apoptosis of the cell .
additional experiment show that level of bcl-2 protein decrease during differentiation of myeloid leukemic cell .
furthermore , hl-60 cell transduce with a bcl-2 expression vector show the same differentiation response to retinoids a do parental hl-60 cell even though apoptosis be inhibit in these bcl-2-transduced cell , suggest that differentiation and apoptosis be regulate independently in myeloid leukemic cell .
the pebp2betamyh11 fusion create by inv(16)(p13;q22) in myeloid leukemia impair neutrophil maturation and contribute to granulocytic dysplasia .
chromosomal translocation involve the gene encode the alpha and beta subunit of the pebp2/cbf transcription factor have be associate with human acute myeloid leukemia and the preleukemic condition , myelodysplasia .
inv(16)(p13;q22) fuse the gene encode the beta subunit of pebp2 to the myh11 gene encode a smooth muscle myosin heavy chain ( smmhc ) .
to examine the effect of the inv(16)(p13;q22) on myelopoiesis , we use the hmrp8 promoter element to generate transgenic mouse express the pebp2beta smmhc chimeric fusion protein in myeloid cell .
neutrophil maturation be impaired in pebp2betamyh11 transgenic mouse .
although the transgenic mouse have normal number of circulate neutrophil , their bone marrow contain increase number of immature neutrophilic cell , which exhibit abnormal characteristic .
in addition , pebp2betamyh11 inhibit neutrophilic differentiation in colony derive from hematopoietic progenitor .
coexpression of both pebp2betamyh11 and activate nra induce a more severe phenotype characterize by abnormal nuclear morphology indicative of granulocytic dysplasia .
these result show that pebp2betamyh11 can impair neutrophil development and provide evidence that alteration of pebp2 can contribute to the genesis of myelodysplasia .
in vivo modification of major histocompatibility complex class ii dra promoter occupancy mediate by the air-1 trans-activator .
rj 2.2.5 be a human b cell mutant derive from the burkitt lymphoma raji cell which be defective in the air-1 locus function .
this locus encode a transcriptional trans-activator require for the constitutive expression of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii gene .
here we show , by in vivo dnase i footprinting , that the air-1 locus defect correlate with change in the dra promoter occupancy .
interestingly , reexpression of human mhc class ii gene in rj 2.2.5 x mouse spleen cell hybrid be associate with partial reversion of dra promoter occupancy to the raji pattern .
dra promoter occupancy in other class ii-negative b cell line , derive from patient with bare lymphocyte syndrome , be drastically different from the one observe in rj 2.2.5 and raji cell .
moreover , the use of the dnase i a an in vivo footprinting agent reveal that the patient ' cell line do not display a completely " bare promoter " a previously report use dimethyl sulfate a the footprinting agent .
thus , the use of dnase i allow u , for the first time , to correlate the air-1 locus defect with class ii promoter occupancy alteration and distinguish these alteration from the one observe in phenotypically similar but genetically distinct mhc class ii-negative cell .
c-myb and ets protein synergize to overcome transcriptional repression by zeb .
the zfh family of zinc finger/homeodomain protein be first identify in drosophila where it be require for differentiation of tissue such a the central nervous system and muscle .
zeb , a vertebrate homolog of zfh-1 , bind a subset of e box and block myogenesis through transcriptional repression of muscle gene .
we present evidence here that zeb also have an important role in control hematopoietic gene transcription .
two family of transcription factor that be require for normal hematopoiesis be c-myb and ets .
these factor act synergistically to activate transcription , and this synergy be require for transcription of at least several important hematopoietic gene .
zeb block the activity of c-myb and ets individually , but together the factor synergize to resist this repression .
such repression impose a requirement for both c-myb and ets for transcriptional activity , provide one explanation for why synergy between these factor be important .
the balance between repression by zeb and transcriptional activation by c-myb /ets provide a flexible regulatory mechanism for control gene expression in hematopoietic cell .
we demonstrate that one target of this positive/negative regulation in vivo be the alpha4 integrin , which play a key role in normal hematopoiesis and function of mature leukocyte .
specific complex formation between the type ii bare lymphocyte syndrome-associated transactivators ciita and rfx5 .
two of the gene defective in the five complementation group identify in the class ii-negative bare lymphocyte syndrome or corresponding laboratory mutant have be clone .
one gene encode a protein , rfx5 , that be a member of the rfx family of dna binding protein .
the other , ciita , encode a large protein with a define acidic transcriptional activation domain ; this protein do not interact with dna .
expression plasmid encode region of rfx5 fuse to the gal4 dna binding domain activate transcription from a reporter construct contain gal4 site in a cotransfection assay in the raji human b cell line .
however , these plasmid produce transcriptional activity in hela cell only in conjunction with interferon gamma stimulation , a condition in which expression of both ciita and class ii major histocompatibility complex surface protein be induced.
furthermore , these plasmid be not active in rj2.2.5 , an in vitro mutagenized derivative of raji in which both copy of ciita be defective .
transcriptional activation by the rfx5 fusion protein could be restore in rj2.2.5 by cotransfection with a ciita expression plasmid .
finally , a direct interaction between rfx5 and ciita be detect with the yeast two-hybrid and far-western blot assay .
thus , rfx5 can activate transcription only in cooperation with ciita .
rfx5 and ciita associate to form a complex capable of activate transcription from class ii major histocompatibility complex promoter .
in this complex , promoter specificity be determine by the dna binding domain of rfx5 and the general transcription apparatus be recruit by the acidic activation domain of ciita .
glucocorticoid receptor and inhibition of 3-o-methyl-d-glucose uptake by glucocorticoid in peripheral blood leukocyte from normal human : correlation between receptor level and hormone effect in vitro .
we have measure the glucocorticoid receptor concentration in mononuclear and polymorphonuclear leukocyte , both of which be isolate from peripheral blood from ten healthy male volunteer .
in parallel , the inhibitory effect of dexamethasone on 3-o-methyl-d-glucose uptake be assay in the corresponding mononuclear leukocyte .
the glucocorticoid receptor level in mononuclear leukocyte correlate with those in polymorphonuclear leukocyte , and there be a linear relationship between the cellular glucocorticoid receptor level and glucocorticoid -mediated inhibition of the uptake of 3-o-methyl-d-glucose in mononuclear leukocyte .
when mononuclear leukocyte be incubate in the presence of 8-bromo-camp , cellular glucocorticoid receptor level increase and a more pronounced inhibitory effect of dexamethasone be observe on the transport of 3-o-methyl-d-glucose .
we conclude that the cellular glucocorticoid receptor level in peripheral blood leukocyte reflect in vitro responsiveness to glucocorticoid in mononuclear leukocyte from healthy male , and that the individual responsiveness may alter upon change in the cellular level of glucocorticoid receptor .
comparative analysis of nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) complex in human t and b lymphocyte .
nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) be a transcriptional activator that bind to sequence in the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) promoter and be think to be largely responsible for the t cell-specific inducibility of il-2 expression .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) show that specific nfat binding activity could also be induce in human b cell .
the b cell nfat complex , however , be not functional , since it fail to activate transcription from an nfat -driven chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) construct .
competition with an ap-1 motif or with anti-jun and anti-fos antibody abolish binding to the nfat motif in both t and b cell , indicate that jun and fo be critical for nfat complex formation in both cell type .
purify recombinant jun and fo protein fail to bind directly to the nfat motif .
however , when combine with unstimulated b or t cell extract , full-length , but not truncate , jun/fos heterodimers be able to form an nfat complex , indicate the presence of a constitutively express nuclear factor ( s ) in b and t cell necessary for the formation of the nfat complex in both cell type .
an nfat oligonucleotide carry mutation in the 5' purine-rich part of the nfat sequence fail to form a complex and to compete with the wild type motif for nfat complex formation in both t and b cell .
we therefore propose a model whereby a core nfat complex consist of jun , fo , and a constitutive nuclear factor be form in both t and b cell , but an additional factor and/or post-translational modification of a factor , miss in b cell , might be require for transactivation by nfat .
n- and c-terminal sequence control degradation of mad3/ i kappa b alpha in response to inducer of nf-kappa b activity .
the proteolytic degradation of the inhibitory protein mad3/ i kappa b alpha in response to extracellular stimulation be a prerequisite step in the activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b .
analysis of the expression of human i kappa b alpha protein in stable transfectants of mouse 70z/3 cell show that , a for the endogenous murine protein , exogenous i kappa b alpha be degrade in response to inducer of nf-kappa b activity , such a phorbol myristate acetate or lipopolysaccharide .
in addition , pretreatment of the cell with the proteasome inhibitor n-ac-leu-leu-norleucinal inhibit this ligand-induced degradation and , in agreement with previous study , stabilize a hyperphosphorylated form of the human i kappa b alpha protein .
by express mutant form of the human protein in this cell line , we have be able to delineate the sequence responsible for both the ligand-induced phosphorylation and the degradation of i kappa b alpha .
our result show that deletion of the c terminus of the i kappa b alpha molecule up to amino acid 279 abolish constitutive but not ligand-inducible phosphorylation and inhibit ligand-inducible degradation .
further analysis reveal that the inducible phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha map to two serine in the n terminus of the protein ( residue 32 and 36 ) and that the mutation of either residue be sufficient to abolish ligand-induced degradation , whereas both residue must be mutate to abolish inducible phosphorylation of the protein .

solution structure of the sequence-specific hmg box of the lymphocyte transcriptional activator sox-4 .
two group of hmg box protein be distinguish .
protein in the first group contain multiple hmg box , be non-sequence-specific , and recognize structural feature a find in cruciform dna and cross-over dna .
the abundant chromosomal protein hmg-1 belong to this subgroup .
protein in the second group carry a single hmg box with affinity for the minor groove of the heptamer motif aacaaag or variation thereof .
a solution structure for the non-sequence-specific c-terminal hmg box of hmg-1 have recently be propose .
now , we report the solution structure of the sequence-specific hmg-box of the sry-related protein sox-4 .
nmr analysis demonstrate the presence of three alpha-helices ( val10-gln22 , glu30-leu41 and phe50-tyr65 ) connect by loop region ( ser23-ala49 and leu42-pro49 ) .
helix i and ii be positioned in an antiparallel mode and form one arm of the hmg box .
helix iii be less rigid , make an average angle of about 90 degree with helix i and ii , and constitute the other arm of the molecule .
a in hmg1b , the overall structure of the sox-4 hmg box be l-shaped and be maintain by a cluster of conserve , mainly aromatic residue .
an enhancer-blocking element between alpha and delta gene segment within the human t cell receptor alpha/delta locus .
t cell receptor ( tcr ) alpha and delta gene segment be organize within a single genetic locus but be differentially regulate during t cell development .
an enhancer-blocking element ( bead-1 , for block element alpha/delta 1 ) be localized to a 2.0-kb region 3' of tcr delta gene segment and 5' of tcr alpha joining gene segment within this locus .
bead-1 block the ability of the tcr delta enhancer ( edelta ) to activate a promoter when located between the two in a chromatin-integrated construct .
we propose that bead-1 function a a boundary that separate the tcr alpha/delta locus into distinct regulatory domain control by edelta and the tcr alpha enhancer , and that it prevent edelta from open the chromatin of the tcr alpha joining gene segment for vdj recombination at an early stage of t cell development .
homodimerization of the human interleukin 4 receptor alpha chain induce cepsilon germline transcript in b cell in the absence of the interleukin 2 receptor gamma chain .
the cytokine interleukin ( il ) -4 and il-13 play a critical role in induce cepsilon germline transcript and ige isotype switching in human b cell .
the il-4 receptor ( il-4r ) in b cell be compose of two chain , the il-4-binding il-4ralpha chain , which be share with the il-13r , and the il-2rgamma ( gammac ) chain , which be share with il-7r , il-9r , and il-15r .
il-4 induce cepsilon germline transcript and ige isotype switching in b cell from patient with gammac chain deficiency .
induction of cepsilon germline transcript by il-4 in b cell that lack the gammac chain may involve signaling via the il-13r .
alternatively , the il-4ralpha chain may transduce intracellular signal that lead to cepsilon gene transcription independently of it association with other chain .
we show that ligand-induced homodimerization of chimeric surface receptor consist of the extracellular and transmembrane domain of the erythropoietin receptor and of the intracellular domain of il-4ralpha induce janus kinase 1 ( jak1 ) activation , stat6 activation , and cepsilon germline transcript in human b cell line bjab .
disruption of the jak1 -binding proline-rich box1 region of il-4ralpha abolish signaling by this chimeric receptor .
furthermore , b cell transfected with a chimeric cd8alpha/il-4ralpha receptor , which be express on the cell surface a a homodimer , constitutively express cepsilon germline transcript .
these result suggest that homodimerization of the il-4ralpha chain be sufficient to transduce jak1 -dependent intracellular signal that lead to ige isotype switching .
human t-cell leukemia virus type i tax associate with and be negatively regulate by the nf-kappa b2 p100 gene product : implication for viral latency .
human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) be the etiologic agent of the adult t-cell leukemia , an aggressive and often fatal malignancy of activate human cd4 t cell .
htlv-i encode an essential 40-kda protein term tax that not only transactivates the long terminal repeat of this retrovirus but also induce an array of cellular gene .
tax -mediated transformation of t cell likely involve the deregulate expression of various cellular gene that normally regulate lymphocyte growth produce by altered activity of various endogenous host transcription factor .
in particular , tax be capable of modulate the expression or activity of various host transcription factor , include member of the nf-kappa b/rel and creb/atf family , as well a the cellular factor heb-1 and p67srf .
an additional distinguishing characteristic of htlv-i infection be the profound state of viral latency that be present in circulate primary leukemic t cell .
in this study , we demonstrate that htlv-i tax can physically associate with p100 , the product of the rel-related nf-kappa b2 gene , both in transfected cell and in htlv-i -infected leukemic t-cell line .
furthermore , the physical interaction of tax with p100 lead to the inhibition of tax -induced activation of the htlv-i and human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat , reflect p100 -mediated cytoplasmic sequestration of the normally nuclearly express tax protein .
in contrast , a mutant of tax that selectively fail to activate nuclear nf-kappa b expression do not associate with p100 .

a p56lck -independent pathway of cd2 signaling involve jun kinase .
the p56 src family non-receptor tyrosine kinase have be show to be critical for t lymphocyte differentiation and activation .
hence in the absence of p56 , t cell receptor triggered activation do not occur .
we now provide evidence for a cd2 -based signaling pathway which , in contrast to that of the t cell receptor , be independent of p56 .
cd2 -mediated interleukin-2 production occur via activation of jun kinase in cell line lack p56 .
jun kinase then facilitate the binding of c-jun/c-fos heterodimers to the ap-1 consensus site and the subsequent transcriptional activity of the interleukin-2 promoter .
these data elucidate difference between tcr and cd2 signaling pathway in the same t cell .
activation of the signal transducer and transcription ( stat ) signaling pathway in a primary t cell response .
critical role for il-6 .
the t cell activation be initiate by interaction of specific ag with tcr , follow by activation of intracellular biochemical event lead to activation of several gene .
the activation of signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein in a primary tcr -mediated activation of t cell have be explore .
in purify human peripheral blood t cell , nuclear stat protein be activate approximately 3 h after activation by cross-linked anti-cd3 ab .
these stat protein be detect by use the ifn-gamma-activated sequence ( gas ) and related oligonucleotides a probe in electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
analysis of the nuclear extract with anti-stat ab indicate that they contain stat-3 and additional protein crossreactive with the stat family .
the induction of stat activity be inhibit completely by pretreatment with either cycloheximide or cyclosporin a , thus indicate that the induction be due to a secondary factor produce by the activate t cell .
a neutralizing anti- il-6 ab effectively down-regulated the early induction of stat protein and a exogenously add il-6 rapidly activate dna binding similar to tcr -mediated binding , it can be conclude that il-6 be the factor responsible for the activation of stat protein in a primary t cell response .
functional antagonism between vitamin d3 and retinoic acid in the regulation of cd14 and cd23 expression during monocytic differentiation of u-937 cell .
1,25 alpha-dihydroxicholecalciferol ( vitd3 ) and retinoic acid ( ra ) be important regulator of the proliferation and differentiation of several cell type .
this paper describe how the expression of the monocyte-macrophage ag , cd14 , and the low affinity fc receptor for ige , cd23 , be inversely regulate during vitd3 - and ra-induced monocytic differentiation of human u-937 monoblast .
pma induce the expression of both cd14 and cd23 mrna and protein .
exposure to vitd3 rapidly induce the de novo expression of cd14 mrna and protein .
the addition of cycloheximide completely block the vitd3 induction of cd14 mrna expression , indicate that the induction be dependent on ongoing protein synthesis .
while induce cd14 expression , vitd3 concomitantly suppress the basal , pma- , and ra- inducible cd23 expression in a dose-dependent manner .
in contrast , u-937 cell induce by ra strongly increase their expression of cd23 mrna and protein , whereas they completely lack detectable cd14 cell surface or mrna expression .
furthermore , the vitd3 - and the pma -induced cd14 expression be inhibit a a temporal consequence of the ra-induced differentiation .
the result suggest that there exist a functional antagonism between vitd3 and ra that may have important implication for the regulation of certain immune and inflammatory response through their inverse effect on cd14 and cd23 gene expression .
inhibition of anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody -induced t-cell proliferation by dexamethasone , isoproterenol , or prostaglandin e2 either alone or in combination .
1 .
the purpose of these study be to investigate the modulation of the proliferation of human t cell obtain from peripheral blood by dexamethasone ( dex ) , isoproterenol ( iso ) , and prostaglandin e2 ( pge2 ) .
the former two substance interact with t cell via the glucocorticoid and beta-adrenergic receptor respectively .
when occupy by their natural ligand , glucocorticosteroids and catecholamine , these receptor have a role in modulate t-cell function during stress .
during the inflammatory response increase level of pge2 bind to their receptor on t cell and thus alter responsiveness .
proliferation of t cell be induce by immobilize anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) in the presence or absence of an additional costimulatory signal deliver by anti-cd28 mab .
2 .
various physiologic concentration of dex , iso , or pge2 be add at the time of initiation of the culture and subsequent proliferation of the unstimulated t cell be determine .
the result demonstrate that physiologic concentration of all three of these agent inhibit the anti-cd3 mab -induced proliferation of t cell .
3 .
although dex and pge2 be equipotent in suppressing t-cell proliferation , iso be much less effective .
4 .
because concomitant elevation in the peripheral level of these substance may occur , experiment be perform to determine the t-cell inhibitory effect of dex together with either pge2 or iso .
synergistic suppression of t-cell proliferation be observe when various concentration of dex and pge2 , but not dex and iso , be add to culture .
this synergistic suppression could not be explain by an increase in camp accumulation in t cell stimulate with dex and pge2 .
5 .
finally , the addition of anti-cd28 mab to anti-cd3 mab-stimulated t cell overcome much of the suppression of proliferation induce by pge2 or iso but less so than that induce by dex .
activation of nf-kappa b by interleukin 2 in human blood monocyte .
we report here that interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) act on human blood monocyte by enhance binding activity of the transcription factor nf-kappa b to it consensus sequence in the 5' regulatory enhancer region of the il-2 receptor alpha chain ( p55 ) .
similarly , il-2 activate nf-kappa b in the human monocytic cell line u 937 , but not in rest human t-cells .
this effect be detectable within 15 min and peak 1 h after exposure to il-2 .
enhance nf-kappa b binding activity be follow by functional activation in that inducibility of the il-2 receptor alpha chain be mediate by enhance nf-kappa b binding and that a heterologous promoter contain the nf-kappa b consensus sequence ( -291 to -245 ) of the il-2 receptor alpha chain gene be activate .
in addition , il-2 be capable of increase transcript level of the p50 gene cod for the p50 subunit of the nf-kappa b transcription factor , whereas mrna level of the p65 nf-kappa b gene remain unchanged .
pharmacological control of antigen responsiveness in genetically modify t lymphocyte .
a chimeric tcr gene , comprise an anti-hapten single-chain ab variable fragment fuse to the transmembrane and cytoplasmic region of the human tcr zeta-chain , be use to determine whether the tetracycline-regulatable system could be use to regulate gene expression in t cell .
jurkat t cell be stably transfected with a single vector encode the tetracycline trans-activator protein , control by a constitutive promoter , and the chimeric tcr , under the control of a trans-activator protein-responsive promoter .
in the absence of tetracycline , the transfected t cell be show to express the chimeric receptor on the cell surface and could be activate by it cognate ag , lead to the secretion of il-2 .
when the cell be expose to increase concentration of tetracycline , surface expression of the chimeric receptor be suppress in a dose-dependent manner , and this suppression be sufficient to result in complete loss of responsiveness to the target ag .
prolonged suppression of trans- gene expression for up to 7 day be observe after doxycycline be remove from the culture , but eventual recovery of surface expression be complete , and the absolute time to recovery be directly proportional to the initial concentration of the drug .
pharmacologic control of trans-gene expression in gene-modified t cell will not only facilitate new approach to the study of different aspect of t cell biology , but will also provide the basis for new gene therapy strategy .
glucocorticoid receptor in lymphocyte in anorexia nervosa .
objective : the aim be to explore the down-regulation of the glucocorticoid receptor during hypercortisolaemia in anorexia nervosa .
design : urine and plasma sample be obtain for cortisol determination and blood lymphocyte be isolate for receptor binding study .
patient : sixteen anorexic patient , aged 16-27 year , with a mean +/- sem body mass index of 14.2 +/- 2.0 ( range from 11.1 to 17.4 ) , and 15 normal woman be study .
six patient be reinvestigated after a significant weight gain .
measurement : the binding capacity and affinity of the glucocorticoid receptor be measure with dexamethasone a ligand on lymphocyte .
result : in patient , both total and free plasma cortisol concentration be high than in the normal woman , a be their urinary free cortisol ; the number of glucocorticoid receptor per cell ( ro ) and the binding affinity ( kd ) for dexamethasone be , however , not significantly different ( ro : 7687 +/- 1750 v 7347 +/- 1285 sites/cell ; kd : 7.7 +/- 2.4 v 7.4 +/- 1.7 nm at 24 degree c ) .
after weight gain ( 14 +/- 2 to 16 +/- 2 kg/m2 ) , receptor number be 8421 +/- 2126 ( pre ) and 9011 +/- 500 ( post ) sites/cell , which be not significantly different ( p great than 0.2 ) ; the kd be unchanged ( 9.3 +/- 2.6 v 9.2 +/- 2.4 nm ) .
conclusion hypercortisolaemia do not down-regulate the lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor in anorexia nervosa and a post-receptor defect might be involve in peripheral tissue resistance to the effect of glucocorticoid hormone in undernutrition .
transactivation of the human immunodeficiency virus promoter by human herpesvirus 6 ( hhv-6 ) strain g and z-29 in primary human t lymphocyte and identification of transactivating hhv-6 ( g ) gene fragment .
human herpesvirus 6 ( hhv-6 ) can activate the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) promoter and accelerate cytopathic effect in hiv-infected human t cell .
this study examine the region of the hiv promoter require for hhv-6 transactivation in a heterogeneous population of primary human t lymphocyte with or without antigenic stimulation .
two different strain of hhv-6 , g and z29 , transactivated the hiv promoter .
the g strain transactivated the promoter in both stimulate and rest t cell , while the z29 strain increase hiv promoter activity only in stimulate t cell .
three dna clone contain hhv-6 ( g ) genomic fragment transactivated the hiv promoter in cotransfected t cell .
a 21.4-kb dna clone , pzvb70 , show the high transactivating ability , while two other dna fragment , pzvb10 ( 6.2 kb ) and pzvh14 ( 8.7 kb ) , show low activity .
one of these clone , pzvh14 , activate the hiv promoter construct contain a mutation in the nf kappa b site .
however , this mutate nf kappa b promoter be not transactivated during hhv-6 ( g ) infection or after cotransfection with pzvb70 or pzvb10 .
these data indicate that the nf kappa b site of the hiv promoter be essential for it transactivation during hhv-6 ( g ) infection .
by increase hiv promoter activity in primary t lymphocyte , hhv-6 may consequently increase hiv replication , lead to an increase in the cytopathic effect on coinfected human t cell .
pancreatic islet expression study and polymorphic dna marker in the gene encode hepatocyte nuclear factor -3alpha , -3beta , -3gamma , -4gamma , and -6 .
the gene encode the functionally related hepatocyte nuclear factor hnf-1alpha and hnf-4alpha play a critical role in normal pancreatic beta-cell function .
mutation in these liver -enriched transcription factor result in two form of early-onset type 2 diabetes ( maturity-onset diabetes of the young [ mody ] ) , mody3 and mody1 , which be characterize by impaired glucose-stimulated insulin secretion , early disease onset , and autosomal dominant inheritance .
the transcriptional hierarchy of hnfs suggest that other protein of the regulatory cascade might be responsible for other form of mody and/or late-onset type 2 diabetes .
in this study , we show that hnf -3alpha , -3beta , -3gamma , -4gamma , and -6 be express in pancreatic beta-cells .
we report the identification and characterization of simple tandem repeat dna polymorphism in the gene encode hnf-3alpha , -3beta , -3gamma , -4gamma , and -6 and the mapping of hnf-6 to chromosome band 15q21.1-21.2 by fluorescence in situ hybridization .
these marker will be useful to study the role of genetic variation in these gene in the pathogenesis of type 2 diabetes .
il-7 reconstitute multiple aspect of v-abl -mediated signaling .
the mechanism by which early lymphoid cell be selectively transform by v-abl be currently unknown .
previous study have show constitutive activation of il-4 and il-7 signaling pathway , a measure by activation of janus protein kinase ( jak ) 1 , jak3 , stat5 , and stat6 , in pre-b cell transform by v-abl .
to determine whether activation of these cytokine signaling pathway by v-abl be important in the cellular event induce by the abelson murine leukemia virus , the effect of il-4 and il-7 on pre-b cell transform with a temperature-sensitive v-abl mutant be examine .
whereas il-4 have little or no effect , il-7 delay both the apoptosis and cell cycle arrest that occur upon v-abl kinase inactivation .
il-7 also delay the decrease in the level of c-myc , bcl-2 , and bcl-xl that occur upon loss of v-abl kinase activity .
il-7 do not maintain v-abl -mediated differentiation arrest of the pre-b cell , a activation of nf-kappab and rag gene transcription be unaffected by il-7 .
these result identify a potential role for il-7 signaling pathway in transformation by v-abl while demonstrate that a combination of il-4 and il-7 signaling can not substitute for an active v-abl kinase in transform pre-b cell .
spi-1/pu.1 proto-oncogene induce opposite effect on monocytic and erythroid differentiation of k562 cell .
spi-1/pu.1 be a hematopoietic transcription factor of the ets family .
to analyze the effect of ectopic expression of spi-1 on the proliferation/differentiation of human myeloid leukemia cell , k562 cell be stably transfected with a spi-1 expression vector .
the transfected cell line express elevated level of spi-1 mrna and protein and high spi-1 -dna binding activity .
the spi-1 transfected cell show reduce growth rate and reduce clonogenic cell growth .
when the erythroid and monocytic differentiation marker be analyze , spi-1 overexpression result in opposite effect : erythroid differentiation be significantly inhibit in spi-1 transfectants , while spi-1 overexpression increase the monocytic differentiation of cell .
these result indicate a differential role of spi-1 on the differentiation of human myeloid leukemia cell .

charybdotoxin-sensitive , ca(2+) -dependent membrane potential change be not involve in human t or b cell activation and proliferation .
the involvement of ion channel in b and t lymphocyte activation be support by many report of change in ion flux and membrane potential after mitogen binding .
human t and b lymphocyte demonstrate an early and transient hyperpolarization after ligand binding .
inasmuch a the change in membrane potential be dependent on elevation of free cytosolic calcium , the hyperpolarization be presumably through opening of ca(2+)-stimulated k+ channel .
we have use charybdotoxin , a known inhibitor of ca(2+)-dependent k+ channel , to study the role of these channel in lymphocyte activation and mitogenesis .
we demonstrate that charybdotoxin inhibit the ligand-induced transient membrane hyperpolarization in b and t cell in a dose-dependent fashion , without affect change in cytosolic ca2+ .
however , blockade of the ca(2+)-activated k+ channel be not associate with change in cell-cycle gene activation , il-2 production , il-2r expression or b and t cell mitogenesis .
these result imply that membrane potential change secondary to the ligand-dependent opening of ca(2+)-activated k+ channel be not involve in b and t lymphocyte activation and mitogenesis .
plasma sialyltransferase level in psychiatric disorder a a possible indicator of hpa axis function .
a dysfunction in the regulation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal ( hpa ) axis , possibly attribute to a change in glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) functionality , have be implicate in depression .
we have measure both lymphocyte gr receptor binding parameter and plasma sialyltransferase activity , a a biochemical marker of gr function , in two group of patient suffer from depression or schizophrenia and in a group of age- and sex-matched control .
while there be a significant increase in plasma cortisol level in the depressed group , there be no change in the lymphocyte gr binding parameter ( k ( m ) and bmax ) .
there be , however , a significant decrease in the plasma sialyltransferase : cortisol ratio in the depressed group suggest an inability of the raise cortisol level to induce enzyme expression and this ratio may provide a useful biochemical marker of cortisol receptor function .
although there be an increase in the plasma activity of the alpha 2,6 sialyltransferase isozyme in the schizophrenic group , no other change be determine .
therefore , while the total plasma sialyltransferase : cortisol ratio reflect hpa axis function , alteration in specific isozyme activity may also be associate with other cns disease state .
cd40 be a functional activation antigen and b7-independent t cell costimulatory molecule on normal human lung fibroblast .
cd40 be an important signaling and activation ag find on certain bone marrow-derived cell .
recently , cd40 also have be show to be express by mesenchymal cell , include human fibroblast .
little be know about the role of cd40 in fibroblast .
the current study investigate the hypothesis that cd40 express on lung fibroblast be an activation structure and mechanism for interaction with hemopoietic cell .
communication between resident tissue fibroblast and t cell be necessary for normal wound healing , and can be pathologic , result in tissue fibrosis .
signaling through cd40 with soluble cd40 ligand stimulate fibroblast activation , a evidence by mobilization of nuclear factor-kappab and by induction of the proinflammatory and chemoattractant cytokine il-6 and il-8 .
ifn-gamma-primed lung fibroblast costimulate t lymphocyte proliferation utilize cd40 , but not the well-studied costimulatory molecule b7-1 and b7-2 .
data report herein support the hypothesis that cognate interaction between tissue fibroblast and infiltrate t lymphocyte , via the cd40 /cd40l pathway , augment inflammation and may promote fibrogenesis by activate both cell type .
flutamide in the treatment of hirsutism : long-term clinical effect , endocrine change , and androgen receptor behavior .
objective : to investigate the long-term effect of treatment with low dos of flutamide on clinical and hormonal parameter , as well a on the androgen receptor status , in hirsute woman .
design : eighteen hirsute patient with regular menses be study basally and during treatment with 125 mg flutamide , three time per day for 12 month .
barrier or intrauterine contraception be use during the study in sexually active woman .
safety parameter be assess throughout the study .
hirsutism , grade by the modify ferriman-gallwey score , and hormonal parameter be evaluate basally and at 4-month interval during treatment .
gonadotropin-releasing hormone and acth stimulation test be perform before and after 3 to 4 month of therapy .
in addition , the concentration of androgen receptor in mononuclear leukocyte be measure , in both the follicular and luteal phase of the menstrual cycle , basally and after 4 month of flutamide treatment .
result : flutamide be well tolerate in all woman , with the noticeable exception of one patient who present increase serum transaminase after 8 month of therapy .
hirsutism markedly improve in all woman during the treatment ( ferriman-gallwey score after 1 year : 4.1 +/- 0.5 versus 14.1 +/- 0.9 ) .
a reduction of serum androgen be find , whereas no change be observe in either basal or gnrh-stimulated gonadotropin or in the cortisol and 17 alpha-hydroxyprogesterone response to acth .
cycle remain ovulatory .
before treatment , the number of androgen receptor be high in the luteal than in the follicular phase .
this rhythmic differentiation disappear after the patient have be give the antiandrogen drug .
conclusion : flutamide be effective in the treatment of hirsutism but require constant surveillance of liver function .
androgen receptor blockade might be potentiate by a reduction of serum androgen .
flutamide affect androgen receptor behavior during the menstrual cycle .
the meaning of this finding remain to be elucidate .
induction of tyrosine phosphorylation and t-cell activation by vanadate peroxide , an inhibitor of protein tyrosine phosphatase .
rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of key cellular protein be a crucial event in the transduction of activation signal to t-lymphocytes .
the regulatory role of protein tyrosine phosphatase ( ptpases ) in this process be explore by study the effect of a powerful ptpase inhibitor , vanadate peroxide ( pervanadate ) , on the activation cascade of jurkat human leukaemic t-cells .
pervanadate induce activation of the tyrosine kinase lck and fyn ( 4- and 3-fold respectively ) and a dramatic increase in tyrosine phosphorylation of cellular protein , notably phospholipase c gamma 1 .
after this event , we observe a rise in intracellular ca2+ concentration , correspond to an influx .
this effect require surface expression of the cd45 ptpase and be not observe in cd45-deficient variant of jurkat cell .
in the cd45-negative variant , the effect of pervanadate on tyrosine phosphorylation be globally decrease and some phosphorylated substrate be specifically missing .
pervanadate also stimulate transcription of the c-fos gene and accumulation of it mrna as well a several other hallmark of t-lymphocyte activation such a surface expression of the cd69 antigen and the interleukin 2 receptor alpha-chain ( cd25 ) .
pervanadate synergized with signal deliver by t-cell antigen receptor engagement or by a phorbol ester to induce interleukin 2 production .
pervanadate activate nf-kappa b , a show by an increase in dna-binding activity of this transcription factor .
we thus conclude that ptpases play a crucial role in the negative regulation of signal transduction culminate in t-lymphocyte activation .
moreover , induction of tyrosine phosphorylation appear sufficient per se to initiate a complete activation programme .
two distinct pathway of interleukin-5 synthesis in allergen-specific human t-cell clone be suppress by glucocorticoid .
glucocorticoid ( gc ) have long be use a the most effective agent for the treatment of allergic disease accompany by eosinophilia such a chronic asthma and atopic dermatitis .
the development of chronic eosinophilic inflammation be dependent on interleukin-5 ( il-5 ) , a selective eosinophil-activating factor , produce by helper t cell .
to delineate the regulatory mechanism of human il-5 synthesis , we establish allergen-specific cd4+ t-cell clone from asthmatic patient .
gc efficiently suppress il-5 synthesis of t-cell clone activate via either t-cell receptor ( tcr ) or il-2 receptor ( il-2r ) .
induction of il-5 mrna upon tcr and il-2r stimulation be totally inhibit by dexamethasone .
human il-5 promoter/enhancer-luciferase gene construct transfected to t-cell clone be transcribe on either tcr or il-2r stimulation and be clearly downregulated by dexamethasone , indicate that the approximately 500-bp human il-5 gene segment located 5' upstream of the cod region contain activation-inducible enhancer element responsible for the regulation by gc .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay analysis suggest that ap-1 and nf-kappab be among the possible target of gc action on tcr -stimulated t cell .
nf-at and nf-kappab be not significantly induce by il-2 stimulation .
our result show that gc suppress il-5 production by human cd4+ t cell activate by two distinct stimulus , tcr and il-2r stimulation , underscore the efficacy of gc in the treatment of allergic disease via suppression of t-cell il-5 synthesis .
involvement of tyrosine phosphorylation in endothelial adhesion molecule induction .
induction of endothelial adhesion molecule by the cytokine tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf ) can occur independently of protein kinase c and activation of a protein tyrosine kinase ( ptk ) have recently be implicate in the upregulation of vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 ( vcam-1 ) by interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) on endothelial cell .
we demonstrate that the ptk inhibitor herbimycin a or genistein suppress induction of endothelial vcam-1 and e-selectin , as well a subsequent monocytic cell adhesion to endothelial cell stimulate by tnf .
inhibition study indicate that specific tyrosine phosphorylation follow ptk activation be involve in the mobilization of the transcription factor , nuclear factor kappa b , and vcam-1 mrna expression .
this may have implication for pathophysiological condition that involve the upregulation of these molecule ( e.g. inflammation and atherosclerosis ) .
binding and cooperative interaction between two b cell-specific transcriptional coactivators .
the class ii transactivator ( ciita ) and b cell octamer-binding protein 1/octamer-binding factor 1/oct coactivator from b cell ( bob1/obf-1/oca-b ) represent two b cell-specific transcriptional coactivators .
ciita and bob1 interact with protein that bind to conserve upstream sequence in promoter of class ii major histocompatibility gene and octamer-binding transcription factor oct-1 and oct-2 , respectively .
both ciita and bob1 increase the expression from the dra promoter , which be a prototypic class ii promoter .
moreover , in the presence of ciita , interaction between class ii promoter and bob1 be independent of the octamer-binding site .
use in vivo and in vitro binding assay , we confirm that bob1 bind to ciita .
thus , ciita not only activate the expression of class ii gene but recruit another b cell-specific coactivator to increase transcriptional activity of class ii promoter in b cell .
epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein-1 trigger ap-1 activity via the c-jun n-terminal kinase cascade .
the epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein-1 ( lmp-1 ) be an integral membrane protein which transform fibroblast and be essential for ebv-mediated b-cell immortalization .
lmp-1 have be show to trigger cellular nf-kappa b activity which , however , can not fully explain the oncogenic potential of lmp-1 .
here we show that lmp-1 induce the activity of the ap-1 transcription factor , a dimer of jun/jun or jun/fos protein .
lmp-1 effect on ap-1 be mediate through activation of the c-jun n-terminal kinase ( jnk ) cascade , but not the extracellular signal-regulated kinase ( erk ) pathway .
consequently , lmp-1 trigger the activity of the c-jun n-terminal transactivation domain which be know to be activate upon jnk -mediated phosphorylation .
deletion analysis indicate that the 55 c-terminal amino acid of the lmp-1 molecule , but not it traf interaction domain , be essential for ap-1 activation .
jnk -mediated transcriptional activation of ap-1 be the direct output of lmp -1-triggered signaling , a show by an inducible lmp-1 mutant .
use a tetracycline-regulated lmp-1 allele , we demonstrate that jnk be also an effector of non-cytotoxic lmp-1 signaling in b cell , the physiological target cell of ebv .
in summary , our data reveal a novel effector of lmp-1 , the sek/ jnk / c-jun / ap-1 pathway , which contribute to our understanding of the immortalizing and transforming potential of lmp-1 .
transcription factor ap-2 activate gene expression of htlv-i .
the htlv-i ltr contain three conserve regulatory element know a 21 base pair repeat which be require for stimulation of gene expression by the transactivator protein tax .
mutagenesis indicate that the 21 bp repeat can be subdivide into three motif , a , b and c , each of which influence the level of tax activation .
the a site in the 21 bp repeat have strong homology with previously describe bind site for the transcription factor ap-2 .
we demonstrate that ap-2 mrna be present in t-lymphocytes and that cellular factor from both non-transformed and transform t-lymphocytes specifically bind to the consensus motif for ap-2 in each 21 bp .
to determine the role of ap-2 in the regulation of the htlv-i ltr gene expression , we use an ap-2 cdna in dna binding and transient expression assay .
gel retardation and methylation interference study reveal that bacterially produce ap-2 bind specifically and with high affinity to all three 21 bp repeat , and that it require the core sequence aggc for specific binding .
binding of ap-2 prevent the subsequent binding of member of the creb/atf family to an adjacent regulatory motif in the 21 bp repeat .
transfection of an ap-2 expression construct into t-lymphocytes activate gene expression from the htlv-i ltr .
at least two 21 bp repeat be require for high level of ap-2 activation and mutagenesis of the ap-2 consensus binding sequence in the 21 bp repeat eliminate this activation .
