inactivation of ikappabbeta by the tax protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 : a potential mechanism for constitutive induction of nf-kappab .
in rest t lymphocyte , the transcription factor nf-kappab be sequester in the cytoplasm via interaction with member of the i kappa b family of inhibitor , include ikappabalpha and ikappabbeta .
during normal t-cell activation , ikappabalpha be rapidly phosphorylated , ubiquitinated , and degrade by the 26 proteasome , thus permit the release of functional nf-kappab .
in contrast to it transient pattern of nuclear induction during an immune response , nf-kappab be constitutively activate in cell express the tax transforming protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-1 ) .
recent study indicate that htlv-1 tax target ikappabalpha to the ubiquitin- proteasome pathway .
however , it remain unclear how this viral protein induce a persistent rather than transient nf-kappab response .
in this report , we provide evidence that in addition to act on ikappabalpha , tax stimulate the turnover of ikappabbeta via a related targeting mechanism .
like ikappabalpha , tax -mediated breakdown of ikappabbeta in transfected t lymphocyte be block either by cell-permeable proteasome inhibitor or by mutation of ikappabbeta at two serine residue present within it n-terminal region .
despite the dual specificity of htlv-1 tax for ikappabalpha and ikappabbeta at the protein level , tax selectively stimulate nf-kappab -directed transcription of the ikappabalpha gene .
consequently , ikappabbeta protein expression be chronically downregulated in htlv-1 -infected t lymphocyte .
these finding with ikappabbeta provide a potential mechanism for the constitutive activation of nf-kappab in tax -expressing cell .
interleukin-6 production in hemorrhagic shock be accompany by neutrophil recruitment and lung injury .
hemorrhagic shock ( h ) initiate an inflammatory cascade that include the production of cytokine and recruitment of neutrophil ( pmn ) and may progress to organ failure , induce acute respiratory distress syndrome ( ards ) .
to examine the hypothesis that interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) contribute to pmn infiltration and lung damage in h , we examine the lung of rat subject to unresuscitated and resuscitate h for the production of il-6 and activation of stat3 .
use semiquantitative rt- pcr , we find a striking increase in il-6 mrna level only in resuscitated h , with peak level observe 1 h after initiation of resuscitation .
increase il-6 protein expression be localized to bronchial and alveolar cell .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay of protein extract from shock lung exhibit an increase in stat3 activation with kinetics similar to il-6 mrna .
in situ dna binding assay determine stat3 activation predominantly within alveolus .
intratracheal instillation of il-6 alone into normal rat result in pmn infiltration into lung interstitium and alveolus , marked elevation of bronchoalveolar lavage cellularity , and increase wet-to-dry ratio .
these finding indicate that il-6 production and stat3 activation occur early in h and may contribute to pmn-mediated lung injury , include ards after h .
induction of il-8 expression in t cell use the cd28 costimulatory pathway .
il-8 , a potent chemotactic factor for neutrophil granulocyte and lymphocyte , be a proinflammatory cytokine secrete by a variety of cell type , include t cell .
stimulation of the cd28 cell surface molecule deliver costimulatory signal essential for lymphokine production in activate t cell via a conserve sequence element find in the promoter of several lymphokine gene .
anti- cd28 -stimulated t cell produce significant amount of il-8 ; additionally , costimulation with anti-cd3 and anti- cd28 ab result in a synergistic induction of il-8 secretion .
sequence homology , single nucleotide mutation , and anti- cd28 ab stimulation study establish that the nf-kappa b -like sequence in the promoter of the il-8 gene function a a cd28 response element .
furthermore , cyclosporin a , but not rapamycin , block the synergistic induction of il-8 expression achieve with anti-cd3 and anti- cd28 costimulation .
the involvement of a cd28 response element in the induction of il-8 expression in activate t cell may provide new insight into the pathogenesis and persistence of immune disorder characterize by increase level of il-8 , such a psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis .
the role of p16 in the e2f-dependent thymidine kinase regulation .
the role of alteration of the mts1 tumor suppressor gene on chromosome 9p21 , which encode p16 , the inhibitor of cyclin-dependent-kinase- 4 and 6 , in tumorigenesis be not yet clear .
phosphorylation of the retinoblastoma protein by cyclin-dependent kinase 4 and 6 prevent it interaction with the transcription factor e2f , which subsequently promote the expression of s phase regulated gene , such a thymidine kinase .
although a role of p16 in this regulation have be presume , there be no proof so far that loss of this tumor suppressor gene really affect e2f -mediated regulation .
we investigate the regulation of thymidine kinase in phytohemagglutinin -stimulated normal human lymphocyte and in the p16 -negative human acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell line , molt-4 and cem .
compare to normal lymphocyte , molt-4 and cem cell exhibit an altered cell cycle regulation of thymidine kinase , a much high intracellular activity of this enzyme , and high thymidine kinase mrna expression .
transient expression of p16 in normal human lymphocyte cause arrest in g1 , but be without effect on the cell growth of molt-4 and cem cell , although all of them express functional retinoblastoma protein .
nevertheless , in the two leukemia cell line transient overexpression of p16 reestablish the normal regulation of thymidine kinase , parallel by an increase of the underphosphorylated form of retinoblastoma protein and decrease of free e2f bind to it motif in the thymidine kinase promoter .
we demonstrate that loss of p16 cause upregulation of this dna precursor pathway enzyme via activation of e2f by a mechanism involve retinoblastoma protein .
physical interaction between ets and nf-kappab/nfat protein play an important role in their cooperative activation of the human immunodeficiency virus enhancer in t cell .
the transcriptional regulatory element of many inducible t-cell gene contain adjacent or overlap bind site for the ets and nf-kappab/nfat family of transcription factor .
similar array of functionally important nf-kappab/nfat and ets binding site be present in the transcriptional enhancer of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 and 2 ( hiv-1 and hiv-2 ) , suggest that this pattern of nuclear protein binding site reflect an evolutionarily conserve mechanism for regulate inducible t-cell gene expression that have be co-opted during hiv evolution .
despite these finding , the molecular mechanism by which ets and nf-kappab/nfat protein cooperatively regulate inducible t-cell gene expression remain unknown .
in the study describe in this report , we demonstrate a physical interaction between multiple ets and nf-kappab/nfat protein both in vitro and in activate normal human t cell .
this interaction be mediate by the ets domain of ets protein and the c-terminal region of the rel homology domain of nf-kappab/nfat protein .
in addition , the ets - nf-kappab / nfat interaction require the presence of dna binding site for both protein , a it be abolish by the dna intercalating agent propidium iodide and ethidium bromide and enhance by the presence of synthetic oligonucleotides contain bind site for ets and nf-kappab protein .
a dominant-negative mutant of nf-kappab p50 that bind dna but fail to interact with ets protein inhibit the synergistic activation of the hiv-1 and hiv-2 enhancer by nf-kappab ( p50 + p65 ) and ets-1 , suggest that physical interaction between ets and nf-kappab protein be require for the transcriptional activity of the hiv-1 and hiv-2 enhancer .
take together , these finding suggest that evolutionarily conserve physical interaction between ets and nf-kappab/nfat protein be important in regulate the inducible expression of t-cell gene and virus .
these interaction represent a potential target for the development of novel immunosuppressive and antiviral therapy .
role of cyclic amp response element-binding protein in cyclic amp inhibition of nf-kappab -mediated transcription .
the nf-kappab family of transcription factor regulate the inducible expression of a variety of gene .
recently , we show that elevation of intracellular cyclic amp inhibit nf-kappab -mediated transcription in human monocyte and endothelial cell without prevent nuclear translocation of nf-kappab complex .
the present study examine the molecular mechanism of this inhibition .
we hypothesize that activation of the protein kinase a signaling pathway may inhibit nf-kappab -mediated transcription by phosphorylating protein , such a camp response element-binding protein ( creb ) , which compete for limit amount of the coactivator cbp .
here , we show that the amino-terminal region ( amino acid 1-450 ) of cbp specifically interact with the carboxyl-terminal region ( amino acid 286-551 ) of nf-kappab p65 ( rela ) both in vitro and in vivo .
functional study use human endothelial cell demonstrate that overexpression of cbp rescue camp inhibition of nf-kappab -mediated transcription and transcription mediate by a chimeric protein , gal4-p65 ( 286-551 ) , which contain the gal4 dna binding domain fuse to the carboxyl-terminal region of p65 ( amino acid 286-551 ) .
in contrast , overexpression of creb inhibit gal4 -p65(286-551)-mediated transcription .
these result suggest that activation of the protein kinase a pathway inhibit nf-kappab transcription by phosphorylating creb , which compete with p65 for limit amount of cbp .
the position of the zebra activation domain do not influence it biological activity .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) be a human herpesvirus which latently infect b lymphocyte .
ebv encode a unique transcriptional activator , know a zebra , which can disrupt viral latency in b cell and induce lytic viral replication .
furthermore , zebra have be show to bind at the ebv origin of lytic replication , and be necessary for viral dna replication to occur .
previously we demonstrate that heterologous activation domain can fully substitute for the zebra activation domain .
here we extend those result by show that the position of the zebra activation domain or a heterologous replacement domain do not influence it ability to function in the disruption of ebv latency .
in this study three novel clone be construct in which the zebra activation region be reposition to the carboxy terminus of the protein .
these mutant be use to demonstrate that the ability of zebra 's wild type domain to function in the complex biological process of virus activation be not compromise by alter it position within the protein .
tumor necrosis factor-alpha mrna accumulation in human myelomonocytic cell line .
role of transcriptional regulation by dna sequence motif and mrna stabilization .
the cytokine tnf mediate many of the pathologic sign of cachexia , inflammation , and sepsis .
the current work describe the regulation of tnf in human myelomonocytic cell line after pma stimulation .
the cell line exhibit a low level of constitutive tnf mrna expression .
within 2 to 4 h of pma exposure , steady state level of tnf mrna be markedly elevated in all myelomonocytic cell line study .
this rise be due to increase mrna stability , which increase by almost twofold , and to an overall increase in transcription , which rise by more than sixfold .
at the level of the genomic tnf gene , a dnase i hypersensitive site be detect within the tnf promoter between -200 to -100 bp relative to the transcription initiation site .
although absent in nonexpressing erythroleukemia cell line , the dnase i site be present in uninduced myelomonocytic cell line and be not change after pma induction .
the pma induction of c-fos mrna correlate well with tnf gene induction ; expression of gene encode other protein in the ap-1 complex ( junb and jund ) be also induce by pma .
the nuclear extract from rest and induce ml-1 cell contain protein bind specifically to the ap-1 , ap-2 , and nf kappa b sequence located within the tnf promoter .
pma induction increase the level of a number of specific bind complex relative to the rest cell .
the regulatory mechanism of the human and murine tnf gene be discuss .
enhancing effect of 17 beta-estradiol on human nk cell activity .
the in vitro effect of 17 beta-estradiol on nk activity be study .
the proliferation and nk activity of yt-n17 ( a human nk-like cell line ) be enhance by 17 beta-estradiol ( e2 ) , and the enhancement be block by tamoxifen ( tx ) , an antagonist of e2 .
on the contrary , other steroid hormone such a tx , progesterone , and testosterone have no effect .
yt-n17 contain 11.8 fmol/mg protein of estrogen receptor ( mean of two independent assay ) , a value which be 5-10-fold high than that of other hematopoietic cell line .
an enhancement of nk activity by e2 be also see in large granular lymphocyte obtain from normal subject , and it be again suppress by tx .
these data suggest that e2 be one of the activate factor for nk/lgl cell .
il-13 induce phosphorylation and activation of jak2 janus kinase in human colon carcinoma cell line : similarity between il-4 and il-13 signaling .
we have recently report that il-13r may share a component with il-4r . here we report that both il-4 and il-13 share signaling event in human colon carcinoma cell line ( ht-29 and widr ) .
il-13 cause rapid phosphorylation of the three out of four member of the known janus family of kinase ( jak ) .
we show that jak2 kinase be rapidly phosphorylated and activate in response to il-13 .
within 1 min of activation , jak2 be phosphorylated , and peak in 10 min .
in addition , il-13 phosphorylated insulin response substrate-1 , il-4r p140 , jak1 , and tyk2 , but not jak3 kinase .
il-4 also stimulate all three kinase and substrate , but unlike in immune cell , il-4 do not involve jak3 activation for it signaling in colon cancer cell line .
furthermore , jak2 associate with the il-4r p140 before and after stimulation with il-13 .
both il-13 and il-4 induce phosphorylation of il-4 stat ( stat6 ) but not stat1 , stat3 , or stat5 .
125i- il-13 do not bind to colon cancer cell line , but unlabeled il-13 compete for the binding of 125i-il-4 .
our data suggest that il-13 utilize il-4r and it signaling pathway , and jak2 may play an important role in the function of il-4r and il-13r in colon cancer cell .
an isotype-specific activator of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii gene that be independent of class ii transactivator .
patient with one type of major histocompatibility complex class ii combined immunodeficiency have mutation in a gene term class ii transactivator ( ciita ) , which coordinately control the transcription of the three major human class ii gene , hla -dr , -dq , and -dp .
however , the experimentally derive b-lymphoblastoid cell line , clone 13 , express high level of hladq in the absence of hla-dr and hla-dp , despite it mapping by complementation analysis to this group .
it be possible that one of the clone 13 ciita allele bore a mutation that allow hla-dq , but not hla -dr or -dp transcription .
alternatively , another factor , distinct from ciita , might control hla-dq expression .
we report here that ectopic expression of ciita cdna derive by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction from clone 13 do not restore expression of hla-dq in another ciita -deficient cell line , rj2.2.5 .
in addition , no ciita protein be detectable in clone 13 nuclear extract .
in contrast , somatic cell fusion between clone 13 and rj2.2.5 restore expression of the hla-dq haplotype encode by the rj2.2.5 dqb gene .
take together , these data demonstrate the existence of an hla-dq isotype-specific trans-acting factor , which function independently of ciita .
rapid shuttling of nf-at in discrimination of ca2+ signal and immunosuppression .
cell need to distinguish between transient ca2+ signal that induce event such a muscle contraction , secretion , adhesion and synaptic transmission , and sustained ca2+ signal that be involve in cell proliferation and differentiation .
the latter class of event be block in lymphocyte by the immunosuppressive drug cyclosporin a and fk506 , which inhibit calcineurin , a ca2+ -activated serine/threonine phosphatase necessary for the nuclear import of nf-at transcription factor .
here we report that sustained high concentration of ca2+ , but not transient pulse , be require to maintain nf-at transcription factor in the nucleus , where they participate in ca2+ -dependent induction of gene require for lymphocyte activation and proliferation .
furthermore , overexpression and constitutive nuclear localization of nf-at , but not jun , fo , nf-kappab , oct or ets family member , render the interleukin-2 enhancer in jurkat t lymphocyte resistant to fk506 and cyclosporin a .
thus a primary effect of these immunosuppressive reagent be to control the subcellular localization of the nf-at family of transcription factor .
[ estrogen receptor content of peripheral blood lymphocyte in patient with systemic lupus erythematosus ]
er content in lymphocyte of peripheral blood from 27 sle patient and 20 healthy control be determine by dextran-coated charcoal assay .
er content in lymphocyte of each sample be express by both fmol/mg of lymphocyte cytosolic protein and fmol/micrograms of lymphocyte dna .
the result show that there be no significant difference between the er content of lymphocyte from the control and that from patient with sle .
but the logarithmic mean of er content in lymphocyte , express by fmol/mg of cytosolic protein , in 14 patient with active sle ( 0.9356 +/- 0.31 ) be significantly high than that in 13 patient with inactive sle ( 0.2979 +/- 0.23 , p less than 0.001 ) and in the control ( 0.6204 +/- 0.52 , p less than 0.001 ) .
the normal upper limit of er content in lymphocyte , express by fmol/micrograms of dna , be 0.136 .
the elevated rate of er content in lymphocyte in 14 active sle ( 92.9 % ) be also high than that in quieiescent patient ( 23.1 % , p less than 0.001 ) and in the control ( 10 % , p less than 0.001 ) .
moreover , the elevated level of er content be find to be related to the positive antidsdna antibody and hypocomplementemia .
the nuclear receptor ppargamma - big than fat .
work report over the past year have provide insight into the mechanism whereby ligand activation of the nuclear receptor peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma ( ppargamma ) regulate systemic glucose and lipid homeostasis .
ppargamma have also be implicate recently in the biology of monocyte and in cell-cycle regulation and cancer .
polyunsaturated fatty acid and eicosanoids bind and activate ppargamma , suggest that these lipid may serve a hormonal regulator of a variety of biological process .
study on the biological activity of triiodothyronine sulfate .
hepatic microsome and isolate hepatocytes in short term culture desulfate t3 sulfate ( t3so4 ) .
we , therefore , wish to determine whether t3so4 could mimic the action of thyroid hormone in vitro .
t3so4 have no thyromimetic effect on the activity of ca(2+)-atpase in human erythrocyte membrane at dos up to 10,000 time the maximally effective dose of t3 ( 10 ( -10 ) mol/l ) .
in gh4c1 pituitary cell , t3so4 fail to displace [125i]t3 from nuclear receptor in intact cell or soluble preparation .
thus , t3so4 be not directly thyromimetic in either an isolate human membrane system or a pituitary cell system in which nuclear receptor occupancy correlate with gh synthesis .
thyroid hormone inhibit [3h]glycosaminoglycan synthesis by culture human dermal fibroblast , and t3so4 display about 0.5 % the activity of t3 at 72 h .
human fibroblast contain roughly the same level of microsomal p-nitrophenyl sulfatase activity a that previously observe in hepatic microsome .
propylthiouracil ( 50 mumol/l ) do not affect the action of t3so4 , suggest that deiodination be not important for this activity of t3so4 .
thus , it appear t3so4 have no intrinsic biological activity , but , under certain circumstance , may be reactivate by desulfation .
steroid-resistant asthma .
cellular mechanism contribute to inadequate response to glucocorticoid therapy .
the current study examine whether alteration in glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) binding contribute to poor response to glucocorticoid therapy in asthma .
29 asthma patient with force expiratory volume in 1 s ( fev1 ) < 70 % predict be study .
patient be classify a steroid sensitive ( ss ) if their morning fev1 increase > 30 % after a 1-wk course of oral prednisone 20 mg twice daily and steroid resistant ( sr ) if they fail to increase > 15 % .
pbmc obtain from these two group , 17 sr and 12 ss , as well a 12 normal control be analyze . sr patient have two distinguishable gr binding abnormality : 15 of the 17 sr patient demonstrate a significantly reduce gr binding affinity , a compare with ss patient ( p = 0.0001 ) and normal control ( p = 0.0001 ) .
this defect be localized to t cell and revert to normal after 48 h in culture medium .
however , incubation with a combination of il-2 and il-4 sustain this abnormality .
the other two sr patient have an abnormally low gr number with normal binding affinity that be not limit to t cell .
furthermore , gr number fail to normalize after incubation in medium alone or il-2 and il-4 .
therefore , sr asthma may be due to more than one abnormality , the majority related to a reversible cytokine -induced reduction in gr binding affinity and the second related to an irreversible reduction in gr number .
these finding may have important implication for the design of alternative treatment approach for recalcitrant asthma .
mitogen activation of human peripheral t lymphocyte induce the formation of new cyclic amp response element-binding protein nuclear complex .
a large body of evidence indicate that experimental agent which raise cellular camp level inhibit t cell growth and division .
by contrast , many study have report that mitogen activation of t cell increase camp level , imply a positive physiological role for camp in the activation process .
in the present study we demonstrate that mitogen activation of human peripheral t lymphocyte induce nuclear factor that form complex with cyclic amp response element-binding protein ( creb ) .
four complex be identify by the electrophoretic mobility shift assay , two of which be induce by mitogen activation .
all four complex contain creb and be bind to the camp response element ( cre ) core sequence ( tgacgtca ) , a indicate by antibody and oligonucleotide competition experiment .
binding of the four complex to cre be prevent by dephosphorylation of nuclear extract and be restore by rephosphorylation with camp -dependent protein kinase or endogenous kinase .
similar complex be detect in nuclear extract of jurkat cell .
mitogen induction of the electrophoretic mobility shift assay complex be not account for by protein phosphorylation or by induction of creb .
rather , the data indicate that mitogen increase the level of a nuclear factor ( s ) that dimerizes with creb .
induction of new creb complex imply a physiological role for camp in mitogen activation of t lymphocyte .
regulation and specificity of mnda expression in monocyte , macrophage , and leukemia/b lymphoma cell line .
the expression of the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen ( mnda ) be observe specifically in cell of the granulocyte-macrophage lineage in our early report .
the specificity of mnda expression for cell in the granulocyte-macrophage lineage be reexamine in cell line establish from patient with philadelphia chromosome-positive chronic myeloid leukemia .
cell line that express mnda exhibit myeloid cell feature and granulocyte or monocyte differentiation could be induce in vitro , while cell line exhibit property of very early stage cell or multipotential cell do not express mnda .
cell originate from case of burkitt 's lymphoma be negative .
by contrast , three lymphoblastoid cell line ( immortalize in vitro with epstein-barr virus ) be weakly positive and mnda be up-regulated by interferon-alpha ( ifn-alpha ) treatment .
a we report previously , mnda mrna level in adherent monocyte be elevate by ifn-alpha ; in this study , we far assess mnda expression in in vitro monocyte-derived macrophage .
three additional agent ( endotoxin , phytohemagglutinin , and phorbol ester ) and other condition that affect function , cytokine production , differentiation , and/or growth of monocyte be examine for their ability to alter mnda expression .
the result vary with the agent , cell type , and stage of differentiation .
change in mnda expression occur slowly ( hour to day ) , suggest that mnda could mediate change realize over a long period .
the result also reveal a discordance in certain mnda positive cell between steady-state level or change in level of protein and mrna indicate that the regulation of mnda expression occur at more than one point .
change in mnda expression be consistent with a role in oppose macrophage differentiation and activation of monocyte /macrophages .
the role of shared receptor motif and common stat protein in the generation of cytokine pleiotropy and redundancy by il-2 , il-4 , il-7 , il-13 , and il-15 .
to understand the molecular base for cytokine redundancy and pleiotropy , we have compare the stat protein activate in peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbls ) by cytokine with shared and distinct action .
interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) rapidly activate stat5 in fresh pbl , and stat3 and stat5 in preactivated pbl .
il-7 and il-15 induce the same complex a il-2 , a feature explain by the existence of similar tyrosine -phosphorylated motif in the cytoplasmic domain of il-2r beta and il-7r that can serve a docking site for stat protein .
il-13 induce the same complex a il-4 , a finding explain by our study implicate il-4r a a shared component of the receptor .
these study demonstrate that a single cytokine can activate different combination of stat protein under different physiological condition , and also indicate two mechanism by which distinct cytokine can activate the same stat protein .
nonopsonic phagocytosis of pseudomonas aeruginosa by macrophage and polymorphonuclear leukocyte require the presence of the bacterial flagellum .
whereas the mechanism of nonopsonic phagocytosis of pseudomonas aeruginosa have be describe , the bacterial ligand require be poorly understand .
to identify the requisite bacterial ligand , study with isogenic mutant of p. aeruginosa pak lack pili , flagellum , and the rpon sigma factor be undertake .
the rpon mutant , lack pili , flagellum , and nonpilus adhesins , bind poorly and be resistant to ingestion by both macrophage and neutrophil .
pili be not absolutely require for binding or phagocytosis of p. aeruginosa .
the presence of a flagellum be not require for binding of p. aeruginosa to macrophage but be critical for the subsequent internalization of the bacterium , suggest that this factor or a surface ligand associate with it assembly be responsible for stimulation of nonopsonic phagocytosis .
cloning of are-containing gene by au-motif-directed display .
a procedure suitable for clone labile mrna that contain au motif be present ( au-dd ) .
these motif be regulatory sequence within the so-called au-rich element ( are ) often find in 3' untranslated region of gene such a cytokine , proto-oncogene , and transcription factor .
au-dd be an au-motif-directed differential display that permit the identification of are-containing gene differentially express after cell activation .
it have be apply to peripheral blood monocyte and a t cell clone to isolate 59 cdna fragment associate to activation .
fourteen percent of isolate fragment belong to already known gene that certainly be cytokine and transduction/ transcription factor .
the remain 86 % correspond to unknown gene of which 92 % have be confirm to be differentially express .
these data demonstrate the efficiency of the system and support the notion that numerous gene fall into those category remain unidentified and that they can be clone by this method .

stat3 be a serine kinase target in t lymphocyte .
interleukin 2 and t cell antigen receptor signal converge upon serine 727 .
interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) induce tyrosine phosphorylation of stats 3 and 5 ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) .
we now show that il-2 regulation of stat3 protein in t cell be a complex response involve activation of two form of stat3 : 90-kda stat3alpha and an 83-kda carboxyl-terminal truncate stat3beta .
the phosphorylation of stat protein on serine residue be also require for competent stat transcription .
a critical serine phosphorylation site in stat3alpha be at position 727 .
in this study we have produce an antiserum specific for stat3alpha protein phosphorylated on serine 727 and use this to monitor the phosphorylation of this residue during t lymphocyte activation .
our result show that phosphorylation of stat3alpha on serine 727 be not constitutive in quiescent t cell but can be induce by the cytokine il-2 .
interestingly , triggering of the t cell antigen receptor complex or activation of protein kinase c with phorbol ester also induce phosphorylation of serine 727 but without simultaneously induce stat3 tyrosine phosphorylation or dna binding .
hence , the present result show that stat3 serine phosphorylation can be regulate independently of the tyrosine phosphorylation of this molecule .
il-2 and t cell antigen receptor complex induction of stat3alpha serine 727 phosphorylation be dependent on the activity of the mek /erk pathway .
previous study have identify h-7-sensitive kinase pathway that regulate stat3 dna binding .
we show that h-7-sensitive pathway regulate stat3 dna binding in t cell .
nevertheless , we show that h-7-sensitive kinase do not regulate stat3 tyrosine phosphorylation or phosphorylation of serine 727 .
these result thus show that stat3 protein be target for multiple kinase pathway in t cell and can integrate signal from both cytokine receptor and antigen receptor .
effect of glucocorticoid on lymphocyte activation in patient with steroid-sensitive and steroid-resistant asthma .
background : glucocorticoid be important medication use to control the airway inflammation associate with asthma .
synthetic glucocorticoid vary in their binding affinity for the glucocorticoid receptor ( gcr ) .
method : we compare hydrocortisone , beclomethasone dipropionate , triamcinolone acetonide , flunisolide , and budesonide with regard to their capacity to inhibit phytohemagglutinin -induced peripheral blood mononuclear cell proliferation from six patient with steroid-sensitive asthma and seven patient with steroid-resistant asthma .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell gcr binding affinity for dexamethasone and budesonide be also determine for both patient group by use a radioligand binding assay and scatchard analysis .
result : dose-dependent inhibition be demonstrate for all glucocorticoid in both patient group , with the steroid-resistant group require approximately 2 log-fold more glucocorticoid for an equivalent degree of inhibition .
the mean concentration necessary to cause 50 % inhibition of lymphocyte proliferation ( ic50s ) for the steroid-sensitive group range from 2 x 10(-10) mol/l for budesonide to 7 x 10(-8) mol/l for hydrocortisone , whereas the mean ic50s for the steroid-resistant group range from approximately 2 x 10(-8) mol/l for budesonide to great than 10(-6) mol/l for hydrocortisone .
in addition , a significant correlation be note between the degree of inhibition of lymphocyte proliferation ( ic50 ) and the binding affinity of dexamethasone to the gcr .
patient with steroid-resistant asthma have be show to have a reduce gcr binding affinity .
the gcr binding affinity for budesonide be significantly high in both group ( i.e. , low dissociation constant ) than that obtain for dexamethasone .
conclusion : these data suggest that glucocorticoid such a budesonide , by virtue of their high gcr binding affinity and great ability to suppress lymphocyte proliferation , may therefore be beneficial in the management of difficult-to-control asthma .
interleukin ( il ) -10 inhibit nuclear factor kappa b ( nf kappa b ) activation in human monocyte .
il-10 and il-4 suppress cytokine synthesis by different mechanism .
our previous study in human monocyte have demonstrate that interleukin ( il ) -10 inhibit lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -stimulated production of inflammatory cytokine , il-1 beta , il-6 , il-8 , and tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha by block gene transcription .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) , we now show that , in monocyte stimulate with lp or tnf alpha , il-10 inhibit nuclear stimulation of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf kappa b ) , a transcription factor involve in the expression of inflammatory cytokine gene . several other transcription factor include nf- il-6 , ap-1 , ap-2 , gr , creb , oct-1 , and sp-1 be not affect by il-10 .
this selective inhibition by il-10 of nf kappa b activation occur rapidly and in a dose-dependent manner and correlate well with il-10 's cytokine synthesis inhibitory activity in term of both kinetics and dose responsiveness .
furthermore , compound such a tosylphenylalanyl chloromethyl ketone and pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate that be know to selectively inhibit nf kappa b activation block cytokine gene transcription in lp -stimulated monocyte .
take together , these result suggest that inhibition of nf kappa b activation may be an important mechanism for il-10 suppression of cytokine gene transcription in human monocyte .
il-4 , another cytokine that inhibit cytokine mrna accumulation in monocyte , show little inhibitory effect on lp -induced nf kappa b activation .
far examination reveal that , unlike il-10 , il-4 enhance mrna degradation and do not suppress cytokine gene transcription .
these data indicate that il-10 and il-4 inhibit cytokine production by different mechanism .
nf-at activation induce by a caml -interacting member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily .
activation of the nuclear factor of activate t cell transcription factor ( nf-at ) be a key event underlie lymphocyte action .
the caml ( calcium-modulator and cyclophilin ligand ) protein be a coinducer of nf-at activation when overexpressed in jurkat t cell .
a member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily be isolate by virtue of it affinity for caml .
cross-linking of this lymphocyte-specific protein , designate taci ( transmembrane activator and caml -interactor ) , on the surface of transfected jurkat cell with taci -specific antibody lead to activation of the transcription factor nf-at , ap-1 , and nfkappab .
taci -induced activation of nf-at be specifically block by a dominant-negative caml mutant , thus implicate caml a a signal intermediate .
cd4 promoter transactivation by human herpesvirus 6 .
the observation that human herpesvirus 6 ( hhv-6 ) can induce cd4 gene transcription and expression in cd4(-) cell be report several year ago ( p.lusso , a.de maria , m.malnati , f.lori , s.e.derocco , m. baseler , and r.c.gallo , nature 349 : 533-535 , 1991 ) and subsequently confirm ( p.lusso , m.s.malnati , a.garzino-demo , r.w.crowley , e. o.long , and r.c.gallo , nature 362 : 458-462 , 1993 ; g.furlini , m. vignoli , e.ramazzotti , m.c.re , g.visani , and m.laplaca , blood 87 : 4737-4745 , 1996 ) .
our objective be to identify the mechanism underlie such phenomenon .
use reporter gene construct drive by the cd4 promoter , we report that hhv-6 can efficiently transactivate such genetic element .
activation of the cd4 promoter occur in the presence of the viral dna polymerase inhibitor phosphonoformic acid , which limit expression to the immediate-early and early class of viral gene .
use deletion mutant and specific cd4 promoter mutant , we identify an atf/cre binding site located at nucleotide -67 to -60 upstream of the cd4 gene transcription start site that be important for hhv-6 transactivation .
the atf/cre site be also essential for cd4 promoter activation by forskolin , an activator of adenylate cyclase .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay and specific antibody , we show that creb-1 bind specifically to the -79 to -52 region of the cd4 promoter .
last , we have identify two open reading frame ( orfs ) of hhv-6 , u86 and u89 from the immediate-early locus a , that can transactivate the cd4 promoter in hela cell .
however , transactivation of the cd4 promoter by orfs u86 and u89 be independent of the cre element , suggest that additional hhv-6 orfs be likely to contribute to cd4 gene activation .
take together , our result will help to understand the complex interaction occur between hhv-6 and the cd4 promoter and provide additional information regard the class of transcription factor involve in the control of cd4 gene expression .
a study on the circadian rhythm of glucocorticoid receptor .
circadian rhythm in glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) be study in the rat liver and human peripheral leukocyte .
for rat expose to a natural environmental photic cycle or a 12l : 12d artificial light regime , peak value of hepatic gr be detect between 23 : 00 and 02 : 00 h .
except for a 4-hour advancement of the peak , a similar circadian rhythm of hepatic gr be detect in rat rear under a reverse lighting regimen ( 12d : 12l ; light on between 18 : 30 and 06 : 30 h ) .
in human leukocyte , the peak value of gr be find to parallel that of plasma cortisol with high and low value detect at 04:00-08:00 h and 23:00-24:00 h , respectively .
in patient suffer from cushing 's syndrome , the circadian rhythm of plasma cortisol either disappear or be invert while that of gr do not significantly deviate from the normal subject .
for apoplexic patient with lesion localized to the base of the brain a indicate by computerize tomography , the diurnal variation of gr be abolish .
conversely , diurnal rhythmicity persist in apoplexy patient whose lesion be in the cerebral cortex .
thus , we postulate that the circadian modification of gr be independent of the diurnal fluctuation in plasma cortisol level or the circadian variation in environmental lighting and that the rhythmicity might be regulate by the ' circadian pacemaker ' located in the human basal brain .
these diurnal variation in gr might serve to coordinate the reactivity of the target cell to cortisol because the diurnal rhythm of a gr -mediated response , the fractional inhibition of chemotactic migration rate of polymorphonuclear leukocyte by cortisol , be find to be synchronous with those of gr .
a conserve tissue-specific structure at a human t-cell receptor beta-chain core promoter .
the t-cell receptor ( tcr ) beta-chain promoter have be characterize a nonstructured basal promoter that carry a single conserve ubiquitous cyclic amp-responsive element .
our investigation of the human tcr beta gene uncover a surprisingly complex and tissue-specific structure at the tcr vbeta 8.1 promoter .
the core of the promoter ( position -42 to +11 ) be recognize by the lymphoid cell -specific transcription factor ets-1 , lef1 , and aml1 as well a by creb/atf-1 , a be demonstrate in gel shift and footprinting experiment .
with the exception of lef1 , these factor activate transcription in t cell .
bind site at the core region show little conservation with consensus site .
nonetheless , creb , ets-1 , and aml1 bind and activate cooperatively and very efficiently through the nonconsensus bind site at the core promoter region .
moderate ubiquitous activation be far induce by creb/atf and sp1 factor through proximal upstream element .
the tissue-specific core promoter structure be apparently conserve in other t-cell-specifically express gene such a the cd4 gene .
our observation suggest that both the enhancer and the promoter have a complex tissue-specific structure whose functional interplay potentiate t-cell-specific transcription .
specific nf-kappa b subunit act in concert with tat to stimulate human immunodeficiency virus type 1 transcription .
nf-kappa b be a protein complex which function in concert with the tat-i gene product to stimulate human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) transcription .
to determine whether specific member of the nf-kappa b family contribute to this effect , we have examine the ability of different nf-kappa b subunit to act with tat-i to stimulate transcription of hiv in jurkat t-leukemia cell .
we have find that the p49 ( 100 ) dna binding subunit , together with p65 , can act in concert with tat-i to stimulate the expression of hiv -cat plasmid .
little effect be observe with 50-kda form of p105 nf-kappa b or rel , in combination with p65 or full-length c-rel , which do not stimulate the hiv enhancer in these cell .
these finding suggest that the combination of p49 ( 100 ) and p65 nf-kappa b can act in concert with the tat-i gene product to stimulate the synthesis of hiv rna .
the scl protein display cell-specific heterogeneity in size .
scl protein production be examine in a variety of hemopoietic cell line by immunoblotting use specific polyclonal antiserum .
scl protein be detect in erythroid , megakaryocyte , mast and early myeloid cell line , as well a in several lymphoid leukemia cell line which be know to harbor scl gene rearrangement .
in most cell line , protein of molecular weight 49 and 44 kda be find , however two myeloid cell line express only low molecular weight specie of 24 and 22 kda .
this size discrepancy appear to be due to cell-specific translational regulation , since overexpression of a retrovirally transfected scl gene yield the high molecular weight form in most cell line ( gp+e-86 , at2.5 , m1 ) but only the 22 kda form in the myeloid cell line , wehi-3b/d+ .
overexpression of full-length scl protein in the lymphoid cell line , supt1 and raji , do not alter cell phenotype and there be no evidence for autoregulation of scl transcription .
the restricted pattern of scl protein synthesis be consistent with the restricted expression of scl mrna document previously .
in addition , the present result indicate that scl protein size be determine by regulation of translation in a cell-specific manner .
leukotriene b4 stimulate c-fos and c-jun gene transcription and ap-1 binding activity in human monocyte .
we have examine the effect of leukotriene b4 ( ltb4 ) , a potent lipid proinflammatory mediator , on the expression of the proto-oncogene c-jun and c-fos .
in addition , we look at the modulation of nuclear factor bind specifically to the ap-1 element after ltb4 stimulation .
ltb4 increase the expression of the c-fos gene in a time- and concentration-dependent manner .
the c-jun mrna , which be constitutively express in human peripheral-blood monocyte at relatively high level , be also slightly augmented by ltb4 , although to a much low extent than c-fos .
the kinetics of expression of the two gene be also slightly different , with c-fos mrna reach a peak at 15 min after stimulation and c-jun at 30 min .
both message rapidly decline thereafter .
stability of the c-fos and c-jun mrna be not affect by ltb4 , a assess after actinomycin d treatment .
nuclear transcription study in vitro show that ltb4 increase the transcription of the c-fos gene 7-fold and the c-jun gene 1.4-fold .
rest monocyte contain nuclear factor bind to the ap-1 element , but stimulation of monocyte with ltb4 induce great ap-1 -binding activity of nuclear protein .
these result indicate that ltb4 may regulate the production of different cytokine by modulate the yield and/or the function of transcription factor such a ap-1 -binding proto-oncogene product .
a critical role of the p75 tumor necrosis factor receptor ( p75tnf-r ) in organ inflammation independent of tnf , lymphotoxin alpha , or the p55tnf-r .
despite overwhelming evidence that enhance production of the p75 tumor necrosis factor receptor ( p75tnf-r ) accompany development of specific human inflammatory pathology such a multi-organ failure during sepsis , inflammatory liver disease , pancreatitis , respiratory distress syndrome , or aid , the function of this receptor remain poorly define in vivo .
we show here that at level relevant to human disease , production of the human p75tnf-r in transgenic mouse result in a severe inflammatory syndrome involve mainly the pancreas , liver , kidney , and lung , and characterize by constitutively increase nf-kappab activity in the peripheral blood mononuclear cell compartment .
this process be show to evolve independently of the presence of tnf , lymphotoxin alpha , or the p55tnf-r , although coexpression of a human tnf transgene accelerate pathology .
these result establish an independent role for enhance p75tnf-r production in the pathogenesis of inflammatory disease and implicate the direct involvement of this receptor in a wide range of human inflammatory pathology .
differential rna display identify novel gene associate with decrease vitamin d receptor expression .
to characterize far the function of the intracellular vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) , we have develop stable transfectant variant of a vitamin d-responsive cell line ( u937 ) which express either decrease or increase number of vdr .
in this study we have analyze change in gene expression associate with this variable vdr expression .
initial experiment indicate that a 50 % decrease in vdr level be associate with a 2-fold increase in cell proliferation and a similar rise in c-myc mrna expression .
further study be carry out use differential rna display ( dd ) .
sequence analysis of dd product reveal two cdna with identity to know gene product : the catalytic sub-unit of dna-protein kinase ( dna-pk(cs) ) , and the peroxisomal enzyme 17beta-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase type iv ( 17beta-hsd iv ) .
northern analysis confirm that expression of both mrna be reduce in cell with decrease number of vdr .
down-regulation of 17beta-hsd iv mrna expression be associate with enhance estradiol inactivation by u937 cell , suggest a link between estrogenic pathway and cell proliferation .
further northern analysis indicate that there be no significant change in 17beta-hsd iv or dna-pk(cs) mrna level follow treatment with 1,25(oh)2d3 , although expression of both gene vary with change in cell proliferation .
these data suggest that , in addition to it established role a a hormone-dependent trans-activator , vdr may influence gene expression by ligand-independent mechanism .
identification of a human lim-hox gene , hlh-2 , aberrantly express in chronic myelogenous leukaemia and located on 9q33-34.1 .
we describe the isolation of human lh-2 , a putative transcription factor contain two cysteine -rich region ( lim domain ) and a homeobox ( hox ) dna-binding domain .
high level of hlh-2 expression be observe in all case of chronic myelogenous leukaemia ( cml ) test , regardless of disease status .
hlh-2 be map to chromosome 9q33-34.1 , in the same region a the reciprocal translocation that create the bcr-abl chimera of the philadelphia chromosome ( ph ' ) , the hallmark of cml ; hlh-2 be retain on the derivative 9 chromosome and be therefore centromeric of c-abl .
the proximity of hlh-2 to the breakpoint on chromosome 9 raise the possibility of cis-activation by the t(9;22)(q34;q11) translocation .
in addition to find hlh-2 expression in all case of cml , expression be observe in lymphoid malignancy and myeloid cell line , but not in primary case of acute myelogenous leukaemia .
the role of hlh-2 in the development or progression of leukaemia be not know .
however , hlh-2 may prove useful a a marker of cml for monitor residual disease .
glucocorticoid receptor regulate expression of l-selectin and cd11/cd18 on human neutrophil [ see comment ]
background : recent study have raise the hypothesis that glucocorticoid could diminish the ability of endothelial cell to direct leukocyte traffic into inflamed tissue by inhibit expression of the adhesion molecule endothelial-leukocyte adhesion molecule-1 and intercellular adhesion molecule-1 .
the aim of the present study be to investigate whether glucocorticoid also regulate the expression of l-selectin and cd11/cd18 integrins on human neutrophil granulocyte .
method and result : incubation of human whole blood with platelet-activating factor ( paf , 1 mumol/l ) evoke downregulation of l-selectin and upregulation of cd11/cd18 adhesion receptor on neutrophil a measure by flow cytometry .
while dexamethasone ( 0.1 nmol/l to 100 mumol/l ) do not affect expression of adhesion molecule on rest neutrophil , it attenuate the paf -induced change in l-selectin and cd18 expression in a time- and concentration-dependent fashion with ic50 value of 31 and 13 nmol/l , respectively .
these effect of dexamethasone be completely abort by ru-486 ( 10 mumol/l ) , which block transcriptional activation of the glucocorticoid receptor , and by the protein synthesis inhibitor cycloheximide ( 35.5 mumol/l ) .
dexamethasone , up to a concentration of 1 mumol/l , neither affect significantly the release of granule enzyme nor interfere with paf bind to it membrane receptor .
conclusion : our result show that glucocorticoid at clinically relevant concentration exert specific action on expression of adhesion molecule on activate neutrophil , which be mediate through ligation of glucocorticoid receptor and induction of protein synthesis , and suggest a novel mechanism by which anti-inflammatory corticosteroid may inhibit leukocyte accumulation .
control of nf-kappa b activity by the i kappa b beta inhibitor .
the transcription factor nf-kappa b be maintained in an inactive cytoplasmic state by i kappa b inhibitor .
in mammalian cell , i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta protein have be purify and show to be the inhibitor of nf-kappa b through their association with the p65 or c-rel subunit .
in addition , we have isolate a third nf-kappa b inhibitor , i kappa b epsilon ( 1 ) .
upon treatment with a large variety of inducer , i kappa b alpha , i kappa b beta be proteolytically degrade , result in nf-kappa b translocation into the nucleus .
here we show that in e29.1 t cell hybridoma i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta be equally associate with p65 and that i kappa b beta be degrade in response to tnf alpha in contrast to what have be originally publish .
our data also suggest that , unlike i kappa b alpha , i kappa b beta be constitutively phosphorylated and resynthesized a a hypophosphorylated form .
the absence of slow migrating form of i kappa b beta follow stimulation suggest that the phosphorylation do not necessarily constitute the signal-induced event which target the molecule for proteolysis .
ra -dependent , ca2+ -stimulated activation of nuclear factor of activate t cell by a constitutively active cbl mutant in t cell .
t cell receptor ( tcr ) stimulation induce rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of cellular protein , include cbl , a protooncogene product whose function remain unclear .
a a first step toward elucidate the function of cbl in tcr -initiated signaling , we evaluate the ability of wild-type cbl or a transform cbl mutant ( 70z/3 ) to induce transcriptional activation of a nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) element derive from the interleukin 2 ( il2 ) promoter in transiently cotransfected jurkat-tag t cell .
70z/3 , but not cbl , cause nfat activation which be significantly enhance by stimulation with calcium ionophore , and be drastically reduce by cyclosporin a pretreatment .
a point mutation of a potential phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase ( pi3-k ) binding site ( y731eam to y731eac ) in 70z/3 disrupt the association of pi3-k with 70z/3 , but do not reduce the induction of nfat activity , suggest that the interaction between cbl and pi3-k be not require in the 70z/3 -mediated induction of nfat .
additional mapping study indicate that define deletion of c-terminal 70z/3 sequence affect to a variable degree it ability to stimulate nfat activity .
strikingly , deletion of 346 c-terminal residue augment this activity , whereas removal of 20 additional residue abolish it .
coexpression of dominant negative ra abrogate the basal or ionomycin-stimulated , 70z/3 -mediated nfat activation , suggest a functional ra be require for this activation .
these result implicate cbl in ra -dependent signaling pathway which lead to nfat activation .
alternative splicing of rna transcript encode by the murine p105 nf-kappa b gene generate i kappa b gamma isoforms with different inhibitory activity .
the gene encode the 105-kda protein ( p105 ) precursor of the p50 subunit of transcription factor nf-kappa b also encode a p70 i kappa b protein , i kappa b gamma , which be identical to the c-terminal 607 amino acid of p105 .
here we show that alternative rna splicing generate i kappa b gamma isoforms with property different from those of p70 .
one 63-kda isoform , term i kappa b gamma-1 , which lack 59 amino acid c-terminal to ankyrin repeat 7 , have a novel 35-amino acid c terminus encode by an alternative reading frame of the p105 gene .
a 55-kda isoform , i kappa b gamma-2 , lack the 190 c-terminal amino acid of p70 i kappa b gamma .
in contrast to p70 i kappa b gamma , which be a cytoplasmic protein , i kappa b gamma-1 be find in both the cytoplasm and nucleus , whereas i kappa b gamma-2 be predominantly nuclear .
the i kappa b gamma isoforms also display difference in specificity and affinity for rel/ nf-kappa b protein .
while p70 i kappa b gamma inhibit p50- , p65- , and c-rel- mediated transactivation and/or dna binding , both i kappa b gamma-1 and i kappa b gamma-2 be specific for p50 and have different affinity for this subunit .
the absence in i kappa b gamma-1 and i kappa b gamma-2 of a protein kinase a site whose phosphorylation modulate p70 i kappa b gamma inhibitory activity suggest that alternative rna splicing may be use to generate i kappa b gamma isoforms that respond differently to intracellular signal .
a t cell-specific enhancer in the interleukin-3 locus be activate cooperatively by oct and nfat element within a dnase i-hypersensitive site .
interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) be a cytokine that be express primarily in activate t cell .
here we identify an inducible t cell-specific enhancer 14 kb upstream of the il-3 gene that respond to activation of t cell receptor signaling pathway .
the il-3 enhancer span an inducible cyclosporin a -sensitive dnase i-hypersensitive site find only in t cell .
four nfat-like element exist within the enhancer .
the two most active nfat-like element be located at the center of the dnase i-hypersensitive site .
one of these nfat-like element encompass overlap oct- and nfatp/c- binding site , which function in a highly synergistic manner .
we suggest that the t cell- specific expression of the il-3 gene be partly control through the enhancer by cooperation between oct and nfat family protein .
relationship between ikappabalpha constitutive expression , tnfalpha synthesis , and apoptosis in ebv-infected lymphoblastoid cell .
in order to understand the role of nf-kappab in ebv transformation we have establish stably transfected ikappabalpha into lymphoblastoid cell .
two clone be obtain in which the loss of nf-kappab binding activity correlate with the constitutive expression of the transgenic ikappabalpha .
protein latency expression be determine by immunocytochemistry .
expression of surface marker , intracytoplasmic content of cytokine cell cycle analysis after brdu incorporation and dna staining with propidium iodide be study by flow cytometry .
percentage of apoptotic cell be determine by in-situ labelling of dna strand break .
no significative change in ebv latency nor in cell surface marker expression be find .
in contrast , intracytoplasmic tnfalpha level be strongly reduce in transfected clone .
furthermore , 30 % of ikappabalpha transfected cell be apoptotic after 8 h of tnfalpha treatment .
this correlate with a strong reduction of brdu incorporation after 24 h of tnfalpha treatment .
no effect be see with non transfected cell or with cell transfected with a control plasmid .
our result suggest that the tnfalpha gene could be one of the target of nf-kappab in ebv infected cell and that nf-kappab protect ebv -infected cell from apoptosis induce by tnfalpha , which may favour the proliferative effect of this cytokine .
single point estimation of glucocorticoid receptor in lymphocyte of normal subject and of child under long term glucocorticoid treatment .
a single point assay of glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) in human lymphocyte base on the measurement of specific dexamethasone binding have be develop and compare with a common multi-point scatchard analysis .
the assay conditions-concentration of the ligand 20 nmol/l , incubation time 2 h and the cell count 2-6 mil.
cells/tube in the assay volume 0.25 ml be find to be optimal .
an attempt be also undertake to use a cell harvester for the separation of cell from unbound ligand .
though specifically bind dexamethasone measure by whole-cell assay and that use cell harvester correlate well , almost by one order low value obtain with the latter method render it non-applicable for receptor quantitation .
the result from 9 healthy volunteer ( average gr concentration 7131 +/- 1256 sites/cell ) correlate excellently with those obtain by the scatchard analysis .
the single point assay have be also apply for determination of gh in 10 child treat with large dos of prednisone .
the average value from healthy volunteer do not differ significantly from those find in these child , though much broad range be find in patient .
the macrophage transcription factor pu.1 direct tissue-specific expression of the macrophage colony-stimulating factor receptor .
the macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( m-csf ) receptor be express in a tissue-specific fashion from two distinct promoter in monocytes/macrophages and the placenta .
in order to far understand the transcription factor which play a role in the commitment of multipotential progenitor to the monocyte/macrophage lineage , we have initiate an investigation of the factor which activate the m-csf receptor very early during the monocyte differentiation process .
here we demonstrate that the human monocytic m-csf receptor promoter direct reporter gene activity in a tissue-specific fashion .
since one of the few transcription factor which have be implicate in the regulation of monocyte gene be the macrophage- and b-cell-specific pu.1 transcription factor , we investigate whether pu.1 bind and activate the m-csf receptor promoter .
here we demonstrate that both in vitro-translated pu.1 and pu.1 from nuclear extract bind to a specific site in the m-csf receptor promoter just upstream from the major transcription initiation site .
mutation in this site which eliminate pu.1 binding decrease m-csf receptor promoter activity significantly in macrophage cell line only .
furthermore , pu.1 transactivates the m-csf receptor promoter in nonmacrophage cell .
these result suggest that pu.1 play a major role in macrophage gene regulation and development by direct the expression of a receptor for a key macrophage growth factor .
interferon alpha selectively affect expression of the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen in late stage cell in the monocytic but not the granulocytic lineage .
the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen ( mnda ) be express constitutively in cell of the myeloid lineage , appear in myeloblast cell in some case of acute myeloid leukemia and consistently be detect in promyelocyte stage cell as well a in all late stage cell include peripheral blood monocyte and granulocyte .
the human myeloid leukemia cell line , hl-60 , u937 , and thp-1 , express similar level of immunochemically detectable mnda .
although , the level of mnda mrna in primary monocyte be very low it be up-regulated at 6 h follow the addition of interferon alpha .
the effect of interferon alpha on the mnda mrna be also observe in the cell line hl-60 , u937 , and thp-1 .
the mnda mrna level in primary granulocyte be unaffected by addition of interferon alpha and other agent include interferon gamma , endotoxin , poly_(i).poly_(c) , and fmlp .
the mnda mrna level in the myeloid cell line be also unaffected by the latter four agent .
induction of differentiation in the myeloid cell line with phorbol ester induce monocyte differentiation which be accompany by a decrease in mnda mrna level .
this reduced level of mrna could then be elevated with subsequent interferon alpha treatment .
the effect of phorbol ester on mnda mrna appear to be associate with induce differentiation since inhibit cell proliferation do not alter the level of mnda mrna and cell cycle variation in mnda mrna level be not observe .
the ability of interferon alpha to up-regulate mnda mrna in phorbol ester treated myeloid cell line be consistent with the observation make in primary monocyte .

interferon induce normal and aberrant retinoic-acid receptor type alpha in acute promyelocytic leukemia cell : potentiation of the induction of retinoid -dependent differentiation marker .
treatment of the acute promyelocytic ( apl ) cell line nb4 with interferon alpha ( ifn ( alpha ) ) , as well a ifn ( beta ) and gamma , result in an increase expression of the transcript cod for retinoic-acid receptor type alpha ( rar ( alpha ) ) and the leukemia-specific retinoic acid receptor pml-rar .
transcriptional induction of the rar ( alpha ) and pml-rar mrna be rapid and it be parallel by an increase in the corresponding protein .
up-regulation of rar ( alpha ) and pml-rar gene expression by ifn ( alpha ) be accompany by a strong potentiation in the induction of 2 retinoid -dependent granulocytic marker , i.e. , granulocyte-colony-stimulating factor receptor mrna and leukocyte alkaline phosphatase .
however , ifn ( alpha ) do not have any effect on the retinoid -dependent regulation of the myeloid surface marker cd11b and cd33 .
the ifn -dependent increase in rar ( alpha ) level and the enhancing effect of the cytokine on retinoid -dependent granulocytic marker expression may be a characteristic of pml-rar positive cell , since the phenomenon be not observe in hl-60 promyelocytes .
interferon as well a retinoids inhibit the growth of nb4 cell , although the 2 class of compound do not significantly interact in term of anti-proliferative activity .
these result suggest the possible use of combination between ifns and retinoic acid in the cyto-differentiating treatment of apl patient .
expression of transcription factor during sodium phenylacetate induce erythroid differentiation in k562 cell .
during 15 day of treatment of k562 cell with sodium phenylacetate , we observe an increase in the cellular hemoglobin concentration with a similar increase in the expression of gamma-globin mrna .
morphological study demonstrate characteristic feature of erythroid differentiation and maturation .
at the same time there be no change in the level of expression of the cell surface antigenes cd33 , cd34 , cd45 , cd71 and glycophorin a .
likewise , the level of expression of the erythroid transcription factor gata-1 , gata-2 , nf-e2 , scl and rbtn2 , all express in untreated k562 cell , do not increase during sodium phenylacetate induced erythroid differentiation .
the expression of the nuclear factor evi-1 and c-myb , know to inhibit erythroid differentiation , do not decrease .
we conclude that sodium phenylacetate treatment of k562 cell increase gamma-globin mrna and induce cell maturation a judge by morphology without affect the expression of the erythroid transcription factor , some of which be know to be involve in the regulation of beta-like globin gene .
the effect of toremifene on the expression of some gene in human mononuclear cell .
toremifene exert multiple and varied effect on the gene expression of human peripheral mononuclear cell .
after short-term , in vitro exposure to therapeutical level , distinct change in p-glycoprotein , steroid receptor , p53 and bcl-2 expression take place .
in view of the increase use of antiestrogens in cancer therapy and prevention , there be obvious merit in long-term in vivo study to be conduct .
change in triiodothyronine ( t3 ) mononuclear leukocyte receptor kinetics after t3 administration and multiple cold-air exposure .
repeat cold-air exposure increase human triiodothyronine ( t3 ) plasma clearance rate .
to study the response of the nuclear t3 receptor ( nt3r ) in this condition , bind characteristic be analyze in human mononuclear leukocyte ( mnl ) .
in addition , we supplement one group of individual with a daily oral replacement dose of t3 to isolate the influence of serum thyroxine ( t4 ) and thyrotropin ( tsh ) level on receptor kinetics .
the subject be expose to cold air ( 4 degree c ) twice/d , 30 min/exposure , for a total of 80 exposure .
the t3 -subjects receive placebo [ n = 8 ] and the t3 + subject receive t3 ( 30 micrograms/d ) [ n = 8 ] in a double-blind fashion .
mononuclear leukocyte be isolate from peripheral blood before the cold exposure and drug regimen begin , and then after every 20 exposure .
the dissociation constant ( kd ) and maximum binding capacity ( mbc ) of the nt3r value be log transform to minimize between-subject variability .
in the t3 + group , serum total thyroxine ( tt4 ) , free t4 ( ft4 ) , and tsh be approx 50 % low than both basal and t3 -values .
the log10kd increase 0.304 +/- 0.139 ( p < 0.04 ) and the log10mbc increase 0.49 +/- 0.10 ( p < 0.001 ) in the t3 + subject compare to baseline .
this change in mbc represent a 311 % increase in the mbc over baseline and a fivefold increase over placebo-treated subject .
the t3 -group show no change in mbc over the study .
these result describe for the first time the rapid modulation of the nt3r in response to the combined influence of cold exposure and reduce circulate t4 and tsh .
hiv1 infection of human monocyte and macrophage promote induction or translocation of nf-kb-related factor .
in 1991 , we demonstrate , use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , that 3 different factor ( term b1 , b2 and b3 ) with affinity for the kb-enhancer target sequence be specifically detect in nuclear extract from hiv1 -infected monocyte and macrophage .
the b2 factor be induce in the nucleus of these cell only upon hiv1 infection .
the b3 factor be only slightly evident in nucleus of uninfected cell but be readily detectable in nucleus of infected monocyte .
it expression remain very low in nucleus of hiv1 -infected macrophage .
in this paper , we demonstrate that the b2 factor be express in the cytosol of monocyte and macrophage a a dna-binding protein , indicate that it be not associate with an inhibitor ( ikb ) .
this factor remain cluster in the cytosol and be translocate to the nucleus only after hiv1 infection .
the b3 factor be detect in the cytosol only when cell be hiv1 -infected .
the role of hiv1 infection in the expression and the translocation of these factor be discuss .
induce myeloid differentiation of k562 cell with downregulation of erythroid and megakaryocytic transcription factor : a novel experimental model for hemopoietic lineage restriction .
the human erythroleukemia cell line k562 can be induce to differentiate along the erythroid and megakaryocytic lineage .
here we demonstrate that hexamethylene bisacetamide ( hmba ) induce k562 cell to differentiate along a third pathway .
this be accompany by downregulation of two transcription factor normally express in erythroid , mast and megakaryocyte lineage .
northern analysis demonstrate coordinate downregulation of alpha globin and gamma globin in addition to the two lineage-restricted transcription factor , scl and gata-1 .
proliferation of the k562 cell be also suppress .
clonal assay show that the suppression be irreversible and appear analogous to the commitment of murine erythroleukemia ( mel ) cell to terminal differentiation .
in contrast to mel cell , however , k562 cell acquire a macrophage-like morphology and exhibit a complete failure to generate benzidine-positive cell .
electron microscopy reveal a marked increase in granule resemble those specific for eosinophil .
surface marker analysis show that hmba-induced cell express reduce level of glycophorin a , cd5 , cd7 and cd11b .
no upregulation of megakaryocyte or lymphoid marker occur .
thus the response of k562 cell to hmba may provide a useful experimental system for study the molecular mechanism responsible for downmodulation of lineage-restricted transcription factor during hemopoietic lineage commitment .
heterogeneous expression of the lipocalin ngal in primary breast cancer .
we have previously show that neu oncogene-initiated rat mammary carcinoma uniquely over-express neu-related lipocalin ( nrl ) , a member of the calycin protein superfamily .
here , we characterize the putative human homolog of nrl , neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( ngal ) .
ngal gene expression be find at moderate level in only 2 of 17 human tissue examine , breast and lung .
when breast cancer be examine for ngal mrna and protein level , they be find to exhibit heterogeneous expression .
ngal level vary in these tumor from undetectable to exceed those in normal breast parenchyma .
immuno-histochemical analysis confirm the presence of ngal within breast carcinoma cell but detect only low level of this protein in normal ductal epithelium .
in contrast , large amount of the protein be localized to the lumen of normal breast duct in the vicinity of ngal -expressing tumor .
interestingly , unlike nrl in rat mammary carcinoma , no significant association between ngal expression and her-2/neu activation be find in human breast tumor .
in contrast , a significant correlation between ngal expression in breast cancer be find with several other marker of poor prognosis , include estrogen and progesterone receptor -negative status and high proliferation ( s-phase fraction ) .
ngal level be stratify a high or low in breast cancer from a cohort of node-positive patient with known outcome .
no significant association between ngal expression and disease-free or overall survival be observe .
identification of the promoter region of chicken anemia virus ( cav ) contain a novel enhancer-like element .
the single promoter region in the clone genome [ noteborn et al. , j. virol. 65 ( 1991 ) 3131-3139 ] of chicken anemia virus ( cav ) in chicken t-cells be analysed via cat assay .
a unique region contain four or five near-perfect direct repeat ( dr ) of 21 bp with one 12-bp insert be prove to be the main transcription-activation element , with enhancer-like characteristic .
pcr study reveal that cav isolates from across the world all contain this promoter sequence .
electrophoretic mobility-shift assay ( emsa ) show that individual dr unit , as well a the 12-bp insert , can bind to nuclear factor of chicken t-cells .
competition assay reveal that the dr unit bind to factor other than the 12-bp insert .
a synthetic oligodeoxyribonucleotide contain an sp1-box ( 5'-gggcgg ) could compete with factor bind to the 12-bp insert .
purify human sp1 be show to have very strong affinity for the 12-bp insert .
mycobacterium tuberculosis mannose-capped lipoarabinomannan can induce nf-kappab -dependent activation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat in t cell .
tuberculosis have emerge a an epidemic , extend by the large number of individual infect with human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) .
the major goal of this study be to determine whether the mycobacterial cell wall component mannose-capped lipoarabinomannan ( manlam ) of mycobacterium tuberculosis ( m. tuberculosis ) could activate transcription of hiv-1 in t cell with the use of an in vitro cell culture system .
these experiment be of prime importance consider that cd4 -expressing t lymphocyte represent the major virus reservoir in the peripheral blood of infected individual .
use the 1g5 cell line harbour the luciferase reporter gene under the control of the hiv-1 ltr , it be first find that culture protein filtrate ( cfp ) from m. tuberculosis or purify manlam could activate hiv-1 ltr -dependent gene expression unlike similarly prepare cfp extract devoid of manlam .
the implication of protein tyrosine kinase ( s ) , protein kinase a and/or protein kinase c be highlight by the abrogation of the manlam -mediated activation of hiv-1 ltr -driven gene expression use herbimycin a and h7 .
it be also determine , use electrophoresis mobility shift assay , that m. tuberculosis manlam lead to the nuclear translocation of the transcription factor nf-kappab .
m. tuberculosis manlam result in clear induction of the luciferase gene place under the control of the wild-type , but not the kappab -mutated , hiv-1 ltr region .
finally , the manlam -mediated activation of hiv-1 ltr transcription be find to be independent of the autocrine or paracrine action of endogenous tnf-alpha .
the result suggest that m. tuberculosis can upregulate hiv-1 expression in t cell and could thus have the potential to influence the pathogenesis of hiv-1 infection .
human t cell leukemia virus-i ( htlv-i ) tax -mediated apoptosis in activate t cell require an enhance intracellular prooxidant state .
we have show that an estradiol-dependent activation of human t cell leukemia virus-i tax lead to the inhibition of cell proliferation and to the induction of apoptosis .
the present study demonstrate that a hormone-dependent activation of tax promote an enhance prooxidant state in stably transfected jurkat cell a measure by change in the intracellular level of glutathione and h2o2 ; these change be follow by apoptotic cell death .
additional stimulation of the cd3 /tcr pathway enhance the oxidative and apoptotic effect .
both tax -mediated apoptosis and oxidative stress can be potently suppress by antioxidant , a be see with the administration of recombinant thioredoxin ( adult t cell leukemia-derived factor ) or pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate .
hormone-induced tax activation induce a long-lasting activation of nf-kappab , which be a major target of reactive oxygen intermediate .
the long-term exposure of jurkat cell to hormone eventually result in a selection of cell clone that have lose tax activity .
a subsequent transfection of these apparently " nonresponsive " clone allow the recovery of tax response in these cell .
our observation indicate that change in the intracellular redox status may be a determine factor in tax -mediated dna damage , apoptosis , and selection against the long-term expression of tax function .
cd30 ligation induce nuclear factor-kappa b activation in human t cell line .
cd30 be a recently describe member of the tumor necrosis factor /nerve growth factor receptor superfamily .
in this report , we show that follow incubation of l540 cell ( hodgkin 's disease -derived , t cell-like , cd30 + cell ) with the agonistic anti- cd30 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) m44 and m67 , two nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b dna binding activity be induce in nuclear extract , a determine in gel retardation assay .
the effect of the mab towards nf-kappa b activation be rapid , a it occur within 20 min , and be sustained for up to 6 h .
by comparison , an isotype-matched antibody have no effect on nf-kappa b activation .
moreover , in human t helper ( th ) clone functionally characterize a be of the type 0 , type 1 and type 2 ( 28 % , < 1 % und 93 % cd30+ , respectively ) , the extent of cd30 -mediated nf-kappa b activation correlate with the proportion of cd30+ cell .
in all cell line investigate , the nf-kappa b complex induce follow cd30 engagement be show to contain p50 nf-kappa b1 , p65 rela , and possibly other transcription factor .
collectively , our result demonstrate that nuclear translocation and activation of nf-kappa b rank among the short-term cellular response elicit follow cd30 ligation .
dimerization of nf-kb2 with rela ( p65 ) regulate dna binding , transcriptional activation , and inhibition by an i kappa b -alpha ( mad-3 ) .
inducible expression of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) be regulate by a cellular transcription factor , nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
nf-kappa b be compose of distinct subunit ; five independent gene , nfkb1 ( p105 ) , nfkb2 ( p100 ) , rela ( p65 ) , c-rel and relb , that encode related protein that bind to kappa b dna element have be isolate .
we have previously find that nfkb2 ( p49/p52 ) act in concert with rela ( p65 ) to stimulate the hiv enhancer in jurkat t-leukemia cell .
here we examine the biochemical basis for the transcriptional regulation of hiv by nfkb2 .
use scatchard analysis , we have determine the dissociation constant of homodimeric p49 and heterodimeric p49/p65 for binding to the hiv kappa b site .
p49 have a approximately 18-fold-lower affinity for the hiv kappa b site ( kd = 69.1 pm ) than do the approximately 50-kda protein nfkb1 ( p50 ) derive from p105 ( kd = 3.9 pm ) .
in contrast , the affinity of heterodimeric nfkb2 ( p49 ) / rela ( p65 ) for this site be approximately 6-fold high ( kd = 11.8 pm ) than that of p49 alone .
consistent with these finding , in vitro transcription be stimulate 18-fold by the addition of preformed , heterodimeric nfkb2 ( p49 ) / rela ( p65 ) protein .
transcriptional activation of the hiv enhancer be also subject to regulation by recently clone i kappa b-alpha ( mad-3 ) .
recombinant i kappa b-alpha ( mad-3 ) inhibit the dna binding activity of p65 , p49/p65 , and p50/p65 but stimulate the binding of nfkb2 ( p49 ) or nfkb1 ( p50 ) .
functional activation of an hiv reporter plasmid by p49/p65 in transiently transfected jurkat t-leukemia cell be also inhibit by coexpression of mad-3 .
