effect of overexpression of il-1 receptor-associated kinase on nfkappab activation , il-2 production and stress-activated protein kinase in the murine t cell line el4 .
the association and activation of the il-1 receptor-associated protein kinase ( irak ) to the il-1 receptor complex be one of the early event detectable in il-1 signal transduction .
we generate permanent clone of the murine t cell line el4 6.1 overexpressing human ( h ) irak to evaluate the role of this kinase in il-1 signaling .
overexpression of hirak enhance il-1 -stimulated activation of the transcription factor nfkappab , whereas a truncate form ( n-irak ) specifically inhibit il-1 -dependent nfkappab activity .
in clone stably overexpressing hirak a weak constitutive activation of nfkappab correlate with a low basal il-2 production which be enhance in an il-1 -dependent manner .
compare to the parental cell line the dose-response curve of il-1 -induced il-2 production be shift in both potency and efficacy .
these result demonstrate that irak directly trigger nfkappab -mediated gene expression in el4 cell .
qualitatively different effect be observe for the il-1 -induced activation of stress-activated protein ( sap ) kinase : permanent overexpression of irak do not affect the dose dependence but prolong the kinetics of il-1 -induced activation of sap kinase , suggest that this signal branch may be regulate by distinct mechanism .
lymphocyte from cml patient lack a 47 kda factor have affinity for a genomic sterol regulatory sequence .
derange cellular cholesterol homeostasis have be widely recognize in the initiation as well a progression of various type of cancer include chronic myeloid leukaemia ( cml ) .
since the human genomic sterol regulatory element ( sre ) have be show to regulate various key gene involve in this phenomenon , the present study reveal the existence of a unique 47 kda protein factor have affinity for this sre sequence in lymphocyte from normal subject , as well a it absence in lymphocyte from untreated cml patient .
however , this factor appear when these cml patient achieve complete haematological remission ( chr ) through alpha-interferon therapy .
furthermore , an inverse relationship be also observe between the ldl receptor gene expression at the transcriptional level and the binding affinity of this 47 kda protein factor to the sre sequence .
base upon these result we propose that this factor may have a role in pathophysiology of chronic myeloid leukaemia .
the rar-rxr as well a the rxr-rxr pathway be involve in signaling growth inhibition of human cd34+ erythroid progenitor cell .
previous study have show that retinoic acid ( ra ) , similar to tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , can act a a bifunctional regulator of the growth of bone marrow progenitor , in that it can stimulate granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) - or interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) - induced gm colony formation , but potently inhibit g-csf -induced growth .
the present study , use highly enrich human cd34+ as well a lin-_murine bone marrow progenitor cell , demonstrate a potent inhibitory effect of 9-cis-ra on burst-forming unit-erythroid ( bfu-e ) colony formation regardless of the cytokine stimulating growth .
specifically , 9-cis-ra potently inhibit the growth of bfu-e response to erythropoietin ( epo ) ( 100 % ) , stem cell factor ( scf ) + epo ( 92 % ) , il-3 + epo ( 97 % ) , il-4 + epo ( 88 % ) , and il-9 + epo ( 100 % ) .
erythroid colony growth be also inhibit when cd34+ progenitor be seed at one cell per well , suggest a direct action of ra .
use synthetic ligand to retinoic acid receptor ( rars ) and retinoid x receptor ( rxrs ) that selectively bind and activate rar-rxr or rxr-rxr dimer , respectively , we dissect the involvement of the two retinoid response pathway in the regulation of normal myeloid and erythroid progenitor cell growth .
transactivation study show that both the rar ( ro 13-7410 ) and rxr ( ro 25-6603 and ro 25-7386 ) ligand be highly selective at 100 nmol/l .
at this concentration , ro 13-7410 potently inhibit g-csf -stimulated myeloid as well a scf + epo -induced erythroid colony growth .
at the same concentration , ro 25-6603 and ro 25-7386 have little or no effect on g-csf -induced colony formation , whereas they inhibit 75 % and 53 % , respectively , of scf + epo -stimulated bfu-e colony growth .
thus , the rar-rxr response pathway can signal growth inhibition of normal bone marrow myeloid and erythroid progenitor cell .
in addition , we demonstrate a unique involvement of the rxr-rxr pathway in mediate growth inhibition of erythroid but not myeloid progenitor cell .
glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis of lymphoid cell .
the induction of cell death in lymphoid cell by glucocorticoid be one of the early and most thoroughly study model of apoptosis .
although the exact mechanism by which apoptosis occur in lymphocyte be unknown many biochemical and molecular change have be show to occur in these cell in response to glucocorticoid .
the role of chromatin degradation and endonuclease in the apoptotic process have be closely study , as well a the involvement of several oncogene in glucocorticoid -induced cell lysis .
in addition , the clinical importance of glucocorticoid -induced apoptosis in the treatment of lymphoid neoplasm have recently receive increase attention .
expression of transcription factor gene after influenza a virus infection .
infection of human monocyte with influenza a virus induce a broad range of proinflammatory cytokine and mononuclear cell attracting chemokines before the infected cell undergo apoptosis .
the underlie mechanism by which the corresponding gene be transcriptionally initiate after virus infection be still poorly understand .
activation of nf-kappa b seem to play an important role in the regulation of many proinflammatory cytokine gene , but can not be the only mechanism , since several cytokine gene lack respective bind site in their promoter region .
therefore , we additionally investigate other transcription factor of possible importance such a creb , ctf , otf-1 , and otf-2 .
to explore long-term regulatory mechanism , we investigate the induction of transcription factor on the gene expression level which may be important to substitute for metabolize transcription factor protein after their activation .
we identify a cell-type-specific differential response : creb , ctf , otf-1 , oft-2 , and nf-kappa b gene be strongly induce 1 to 4 hour after influenza a virus infection in the monocytic cell line mono mac 6 , while in freshly prepare human monocyte no significant change be detect .
in infected monocyte , which die by apoptosis , the expression of creb , ctf , and otf-2 be rather suppress 8 hour after infection .
in conclusion , the long-term regulation of transcription factor gene expression in non-proliferating cell seem to be of minor importance after influenza infection since in apoptosisprone cell an immediate availability of transcription factor protein be require .
induction of sp1 phosphorylation and nf-kappa b -independent hiv promoter domain activity in t lymphocyte stimulate by okadaic acid .
in contrast to the purely enhancer-dependent effect of cytokine such a tnf on the activity of the hiv regulatory region ( ltr ) , we observe that okadaic acid ( oka ) activate hiv transcription through both the enhancer , respond to the factor nf-kappa b , and the promoter domain of the ltr .
the inducibility of hiv ltr -driven luciferase expression construct in lymphoblastoid cell stimulate by oka depend on both functional sp1 binding element and the ability of the tata box to bind the protein tbp .
in both transform and normal lymphocyte , oka stimulation induce intense phosphorylation of the constitutively express sp1 protein in the nucleus , a property of oka not share by tnf , phorbol ester , or pha and interleukin 2 .
responsiveness of ltr construct delete of kappa b element to hiv tat expression be increase upon oka but not tnf stimulation .
our result suggest that sp1 phosphorylation induce by oka , a selective inhibitor of the serine-threonine phosphatase pp2a , facilitate the formation of a transcription complex involve general transcription factor , hiv tat , and sp1 protein .
the formation of this complex would increase , independently of an in synergy with nf-kappa b , the low basal activity of the hiv ltr observe in normal t lymphocyte .
e2f-1 block terminal differentiation and cause proliferation in transgenic megakaryocyte .
the transcription factor e2f-1 play a central role in the cell cycle through it ability to activate gene involve in cell division .
e2f-1 activity be regulate by a number of protein , include the retinoblastoma susceptibility gene product , cyclin-dependent kinase , and their inhibitor , protein that have be implicate in the control of certain developmental process .
to investigate a potential role of e2f-1 in differentiation , we assay the ability of megakaryocyte to form platelet in an in vivo transgenic model .
e2f-1 expression in megakaryocyte block differentiation during maturation , result in severe thrombocytopenia .
ultrastructural analysis of megakaryocyte reveal abnormal development characterize by hyperdemarcation of cytoplasmic membrane and reduce number of alpha granule .
administration of megakaryocyte growth and development factor or interleukin 6 could not overcome the differentiation block .
additionally , e2f-1 cause massive megakaryocyte accumulation in both normal and ectopic site , first evident in e15 embryonic liver .
furthermore , significant apoptosis be observe in transgenic megakaryocyte .
these data indicate that e2f-1 can prevent terminal differentiation , probably through it cell cycle -stimulatory activity .
loss- and gain-of-function mutation reveal an important role of bsap ( pax-5 ) at the start and end of b cell differentiation .
pax-5 cod for the transcription factor bsap which be express throughout b cell development except in terminally differentiate plasma cell .
gene targeting experiment in the mouse reveal a differential dependency of fetal and adult b-lymphopoiesis on this transcription factor .
bsap be require for b-lineage commitment in the fetal liver and for progression beyond an early pro-b cell stage in adult bone marrow .
the characterization of pax-5 -deficient pro-b cell demonstrate an important role of bsap in the regulation of the cd19 , mb-1 ( ig alpha ) and n-myc gene as well a in the developmental pathway control vh-to-dhjh recombination at the immunoglobulin heavy-chain ( igh ) locus .
the human pax-5 gene be recently show to participate together with the igh locus in the chromosomal translocation t(9;14)(p13;q32) .
this translocation be characteristic of a small subset of non-hodgkin lymphoma exhibit plasmacytoid differentiation .
the translocated pax-5 gene be deregulate by the insertion of igh regulatory element into it 5' region , which may contribute to tumorigenesis by interfere with the shut-down of pax-5 transcription and thus with the completion of plasma cell differentiation
human immunodeficiency virus type-2 gene expression : two enhancer and their activation by t-cell activator .
the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) may include a spectrum of retrovirus with vary potential to infect their host , undergo long period of latent infection , and induce pathology .
since expression of the virus be in large part regulate by the sequence element in their long terminal repeat ( ltrs ) , this study be direct to an analysis of the regulatory element in the hiv-2 ltr .
the hiv-2 ltr be find to contain two enhancer .
one of these enhancer be , in part , identical to the hiv-1 enhancer .

the second enhancer interact with two nuclear binding protein ( 85 kd and 27 kd mobility ) that appear to be require for optimal enhancer function and activation .
observation such a these encourage the speculation that there may be subtle difference in the regulation of hiv-1 and hiv-2 expression that may be relevant to the possible long latency and reduce pathogenicity of hiv-2 .
estrogen and progesterone receptor in vernal keratoconjunctivitis .
purpose : sex-related influence have be implicate in the pathogenesis of vernal keratoconjunctivitis ( vkc ) , an allergic eosinophilic disease .

conclusion : sexual hormone , through their receptor , may influence the activity of eosinophil in patient with vkc .

fk506 and ciclosporin : molecular probe for study intracellular signal transduction .
the immunosuppressant ciclosporin and fk506 block the ca(2+)-dependent signal-transduction pathway emanate from the t-cell receptor , thereby inhibit the activation of helper t cell .
use these drug a probe , chemist and biologist have uncover several intracellular signalling molecule bridge the generation of second-messenger ca2+ ion and the transcriptional activation of il-2 , among which be calmodulin , calcineurin and the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) .
hence , ca2+ bind to calmodulin , lead to the binding of calmodulin to calcineurin ; the activate calcineurin , in turn , may dephosphorylate the cytoplasmic subunit of nf-at , result in it translocation from the cytoplasm into the nucleus to form a competent transcriptional activator .
a describe by jun liu , these drug manifest their effect in an unprecedented fashion .
they do not directly intercept intracellular signalling molecule .
instead , they form tight complex with two different class of abundant cytosolic receptor call immunophilins upon enter the cell , and consequently inhibit their peptidyl prolyl cis-trans isomerase activity .
the two structurally distinct immunophilin-drug complex bind to , and inhibit , the phosphatase activity of calcineurin .

apoptosis signaling pathway in normal t cell : differential activity of bcl-2 and il-1beta -converting enzyme family protease inhibitor on glucocorticoid- and fas- mediated cytotoxicity .
fa -mediated apoptosis play an important role in regulate the immune response in peripheral t cell .
restimulation of t cell blast up-regulates fa and fa ligand expression , with subsequent interaction lead to cell death .
overexpression of bcl-2 in tumor cell block apoptosis induce by many stimulus , but inhibition of fa -mediated killing have not be consistently observe .
to examine the behavior of bcl-2 in normal cell , t cell blast be transiently transfected with bcl-2 and related gene product to determine the effect on apoptotic signaling .
transient overexpression of bcl-2 in mouse and human t cell blast do not block fa -mediated apoptosis , whereas etoposide- and glucocorticoid- induced cytotoxicity be potently inhibit .
expression of bcl-xl and adenovirus e1b 19k do not interfere with anti- fas killing .
in contrast , interleukin-1beta-converting enzyme family protease inhibitor ac-devd-cho and crma block fa -mediated apoptosis .
these result suggest that peripheral t cell use distinct apoptosis signaling pathway with differential sensitivity to bcl-2 and interleukin-1beta-converting enzyme family protease inhibitor .
since t cell normally express bcl-2 and bcl-xl follow activation , their inability to block fa -mediated apoptosis may allow for the elimination of self-reactive cell and the appropriate regulation of immune response .

these finding implicate hmg-i in the hpfh phenotype ; we speculate that it may participate in the formation of multiprotein complex that regulate globin gene expression .

stimulation of human peripheral blood mononuclear cell by zinc and related cation .
zinc be an important trace element for immune function .
here , we show that zinc addition in a serum- and lipopolysaccharide-free cell culture system lead to significantly enhanced level of interleukin 1 beta ( il-1 beta ) and tumour necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) and to expression of the corresponding mrna in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) .
structurally related divalent cation like cobalt , nickel , and mercury also partially increase monokine secretion but to a much low and thus insignificant extent .
they fail to induce mrna of tnf-alpha after 3 h of culture .
therefore , monokine induction be a zinc -specific effect influence by the physicochemical property of the ion .
confirmation of the unique significance of zinc for immune function provide a good understanding of the mechanism of specific zinc -mediated immune modulation .
the ad1 and ad2 transactivation domain of e2a be essential for the antiapoptotic activity of the chimeric oncoprotein e2a-hlf .
the chimeric oncoprotein e2a-hlf , generate by the t(17;19) chromosomal translocation in pro-b-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia , incorporate the transactivation domain of e2a and the basic leucine zipper ( bzip ) dna-binding and protein dimerization domain of hlf ( hepatic leukemic factor ) .
the ability of e2a-hlf to prolong the survival of interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) -dependent murine pro-b cell after il-3 withdrawal suggest that it disrupt signaling pathway normally responsible for cell suicide , allow the cell to accumulate a transform lymphoblast .
to determine the structural motif that contribute to this antiapoptotic effect , we construct a panel of e2a-hlf mutant and program their expression in il-3 -dependent murine pro-b cell ( fl5.12 line ) , use a zinc-inducible vector .
neither the e12 nor the e47 product of the e2a gene nor the wild-type hlf protein be able to protect the cell from apoptosis induce by il-3 deprivation .
surprisingly , different combination of disable mutation within the hlf bzip domain have little effect on the antiapoptotic property of the chimeric protein , so long a the amino-terminal portion of e2a remain intact .
in the context of a bzip domain defective in dna binding , mutant retain either of the two transactivation domain of e2a be able to extend cell survival after growth factor deprivation .
thus , the block of apoptosis impose by e2a-hlf in pro-b lymphocyte depend critically on the transactivating region of e2a .
since neither dna binding nor protein dimerization through the bzip domain of hlf be require for this effect , we propose mechanism whereby protein-protein interaction with the amino-terminal region of e2a allow the chimera to act a a transcriptional cofactor to alter the expression of gene regulate the apoptotic machinery in pro-b cell .

gamma-interferon -induced resistance to 1,25-(oh)2 d3 in human monocyte and macrophage : a mechanism for the hypercalcemia of various granulomatoses .
the hypercalcemia of various granulomatoses be cause by endogenous 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d [ 1,25-(oh)2d3 ] overproduction by disease-activated macrophage .
the inability of 1,25(oh)2d3 to suppress it synthesis in macrophage contrast with the tight control of it production in macrophage precursor , peripheral blood monocyte ( pbm ) .
we examine whether 1,25(oh)2d3 resistance develop a pbm differentiate to macrophage or with macrophage activation .
normal human pulmonary alveolar macrophage ( pam ) be less sensitive to 1,25(oh)2d3 than pbm , despite similar vitamin d receptor content ; however , both pbm and pam respond to exogenous 1,25-(oh)2d3 by inhibit 1,25(oh)2d3 synthesis and induce 1,25(oh)2d3 degradation through enhancement of 24-hydroxylase mrna level and activity .
the human monocytic cell line thp-1 mimic pam in 1,25(oh)2d3 synthesis and sensitivity to exogenous 1,25(oh)2d3 .
we utilize thp-1 cell to examine the response to 1,25(oh)2d3 with macrophage activation .
activation of thp-1 cell with gamma-interferon ( gamma-ifn ) enhance 1,25(oh)2d3 synthesis 30-fold , block 1,25-(oh)2d3 suppression of it synthesis , and reduce by 42.2 % 1,25-(oh)2d3 induction of it degradation .
the antagonistic effect of gamma-ifn be not merely restricted to enzymatic activity .
in thp-1 cell and in normal pbm , gamma-ifn inhibit 1,25-(oh)2d3 induction of 24-hydroxylase mrna level without reduce mrna stability , suggest gamma-ifn inhibition of 1,25(oh)2d3 transactivating function .
these result explain 1,25(oh)2d3 overproduction in granulomatoses and demonstrate potent inhibition by gamma-ifn of 1,25(oh)2d3 action in immune cell .
possible role of nuclear factor-kappa b activity in germline c epsilon transcription in a human burkitt lymphoma b cell line .
nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) play a broad role in gene regulation , but it be not evident whether nf-kappa b act a a messenger system for germline c epsilon transcription .
we report here that the signaling cascade trigger by interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) or anti- cd40 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) participate in nf-kappa b activation responsible for germline c epsilon transcription in a human burkitt lymphoma b cell line , dnd39 .
both il-4 and anti- cd40 mab induce activation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase ( pi3-kinase ) , translocation of a zeta isoform of protein kinase c , and nuclear expression of nf-kappa b .
all such event be abrogate by treatment with ly294002 , a specific inhibitor of pi3-kinase .
in addition , n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) , a potent antioxidant , decrease nf-kappa b activation cause by il-4 , anti- cd40 mab , or their combination .
nac be also effective in diminish germline c epsilon transcription , and it potency be high in culture costimulated with il-4 and anti- cd40 mab than in those stimulate with il-4 alone .
these result indicate that il-4 and ligation of cd40 induce nf-kappa b expression via at least a mechanism dependent on the pi3-kinase pathway and suggest that nf-kappa b sensitive to nac may play a role in regulate germline c epsilon transcription .
ctl recognition of an altered peptide associate with asparagine bond rearrangement .
implication for immunity and vaccine design .
the extent to which peptide contain chemically and post-translationally modify amino acid side chain be recognize by primed ctl have not be clearly define .
we report on the ctl recognition of a mhc class i-restricted peptide contain a cyclized asparagine ( succinimide ) residue .
this modification of the asparagine side chain be a common intermediate structure during deamidation , isomerization , and bond rearrangement of amide-containing amino acid and also occur a a side reaction in peptide synthesis .
the ctl specifically recognize the succinimide-containing peptide show only weak cross-reactivity at high concentration of the parent peptide contain unmodified asparagine .
similarly , ctl raise against the parent peptide do not recognize the succinimide derivative of this peptide .
naturally process form of these structure be likely to occur give the importance and frequency of deamidation both in vitro and in vivo .
moreover , since succinimide intermediate of deamidated peptide can occasionally be very stable , these peptide have the potential to act a altered self-ags with significant implication for autoimmunity .
in addition , unwanted and potentially hazardous specificity may be elicit when use synthetic peptide in subunit vaccine in which succinimide residue may form spontaneously during storage or chemical synthesis .

these data be most consistent with notch1 oncogenesis and transcriptional activation be independent of association with rbp-jkappa at promoter site .

four p-like element be require for optimal transcription of the mouse il-4 gene : involvement of a distinct set of nuclear factor of activate t cell and activator protein-1 family protein .
we previously identify the p sequence a a critical regulatory element of the human il-4 promoter .

activator protein ( ap ) -1 family protein interact with cle0 , p , p2 and p4 .
nfat/ap-1 complex form only with p and p2 .
cross-competition assay among the p-like element reveal element-specific and common complex .
six tandem repeat of the p element link to the sv40 promoter respond to phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate , while that of other element do not . it would thus appear that component of each p-like element-binding complex be not identical and may coordinately contribute to transcriptional activity .

j delta k cell exhibit very low level of constitutive hiv production .
hiv-1 expression be activate from j delta k cell by treatment with phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) , sodium butyrate ( nab ) , or hexamethylene bisacetamide ( hmba ) , but not tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , confirm the role of nf-kappa b in mediate tnf-alpha induction of hiv transcription .
the strong induction of hiv expression by nab or hmba in j delta k cell clearly demonstrate the existence of nf-kappa b -independent mechanism of hiv activation in chronically infected cell .
j delta k cell may provide a useful model for characterize nf-kappa b -independent transcriptional activation of the hiv ltr .
shared gamma(c) subunit within the human interleukin-7 receptor complex .
a molecular basis for the pathogenesis of x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency .
genetic evidence suggest that mutation in the gamma(c) receptor subunit cause x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency ( x-scid ) .
the gamma(c) subunit can be employ in receptor complex for il -2 , -4 , -7 , -9 , and -15 , and the multiple signaling defect that would result from a defective gamma(c) chain in these receptor be propose to cause the severe phenotype of x-scid patient .
interestingly , gene disruption of either il-7 or the il-7 receptor ( il-7r ) alpha subunit in mouse lead to immunological defect that be similar to human x-scid .
these observation suggest the functional importance of gamma(c) in the il-7r complex .
in the present study , structure/function analysis of the il-7r complex use a chimeric receptor system demonstrate that gamma(c) be indeed critical for il-7r function .
nonetheless , only a limited portion of the cytoplasmic domain of gamma(c) be necessary for il-7r signal transduction .
furthermore , replacement of the gamma(c) cytoplasmic domain by a severely truncate erythropoeitin receptor do not affect measure il-7r signaling event .
these finding support a model in which gamma(c) serve primarily to activate signal transduction by the il-7r complex , while il-7r alpha determine specific signaling event through it association with cytoplasmic signaling molecule .
finally , these study be consistent with the hypothesis that the molecular pathogenesis of x-scid be due primarily to gamma(c) -mediated defect in the il-7 /il-7r system
an irf-1 -dependent pathway of dna damage-induced apoptosis in mitogen-activated t lymphocyte .
lymphocyte be particularly susceptible to dna damage-induced apoptosis , a response which may serve a a form of ' altruistic suicide ' to counter their intrinsic high potential for mutation and clonal expansion .
the tumour suppressor p53 have be show to regulate this type of apoptosis in thymocytes , but an as yet unknown , p53 -independent pathway ( s ) appear to mediate the same event in mitogen-activated mature t lymphocyte .
here we show dna damage-induced apoptosis in these t lymphocyte be dependent on the antioncogenic transcription factor interferon regulatory factor ( irf ) -1 .
thus two different anti-onco-genic transcription factor , p53 and irf-1 , be require for distinct apoptotic pathway in t lymphocyte .
we also show that mitogen induction of the interleukin-1 beta converting enzyme ( ice ) gene , a mammalian homologue of the caenorhabditis elegans cell death gene ced-3 , be irf-1 -dependent .
ectopic overexpression of irf-1 result in the activation of the endogenous gene for ice and enhance the sensitivity of cell to radiation-induced apoptosis .
upregulation of bcl-2 by the epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein lmp1 : a b-cell-specific response that be delay relative to nf-kappa b activation and to induction of cell surface marker .
an ability of the epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein lmp1 to enhance the survival of infected b cell through upregulation of the bcl-2 oncogene be first suggest by experiment involve gene transfection and the selection of stable lmp1 + clone ( s.henderson , m. rowe , c.gregory , f.wang , e.kieff , and a.rickinson , cell 65 : 1107-1115 , 1991 ) .
however , it be not possible to ascertain whether bcl-2 upregulation be a specific consequence of lmp1 expression or an artifact of the selection procedure whereby rare bcl-2 + cell already present in the start population might best be able to tolerate the potentially toxic effect of lmp1 .
we therefore reexamine this issue by use two different experimental approach that allow lmp1 -induced effect to be monitor immediately follow expression of the viral protein and in the absence of selective pressure ; activation of the nf-kappa b transcription factor and upregulation of the cell adhesion molecule icam-1 be use a early index of lmp1 function .
in the first approach , stable clone of two b-cell line carry an lmp1 gene under the control of an inducible metallothionein promoter be induce to express lmp1 in all cell .
activation of nk-kappa b and upregulation of icam-1 occur within 24 h and be follow at 48 to 72 h by upregulation of bcl-2 .
in the second approach , we test the generality of this phenomenon by transiently express lmp1 from a strong constitutively active promoter in a range of different cell type .
all six b-cell line test show nf-kappa b activation in response to lmp1 expression , and this be follow in five of six line by expression of icam-1 and bcl-2 .
in the same experiment , all three non- b-cell line show nf-kappa b activation and icam-1 upregulation but never any effect upon bcl-2 .
we therefore conclude that bcl-2 upregulation be part of the panoply of cellular change induce by lmp1 but that the effect be cell type specific .
our data also suggest that whilst nf-kappa b may be an essential component of lmp1 signal transduction , other cell-specific factor may be require to effect some function of the viral protein .
ra oncogene transformation of human b lymphoblast be associate with lymphocyte activation and with a block of differentiation .
the p21ras small gtp binding protein participate in signal transduction from cell surface receptor and affect neoplastic transformation and development in many different cell type .
in the present study , we examine the relationship between ra transformation and differentiation of human b lymphocyte .
we show that the constitutive expression of the t24 ha-ras oncogene in ebv-immortalized b lymphoblast be associate with the induction of the interleukin 2 receptor alpha subunit , with an impaired immunoglobulin gene expression , altered adhesion property and increase survival in serum-free medium .
since induction of the il-2 receptor alpha subunit be a hallmark of lymphocyte activation , we suggest that p21ras naturally trigger b cell activation .
the ras-transformed lymphocyte display a fully functional il-2r , a assess by c-fos induction follow treatment with il-2 ; nevertheless , they be not growth stimulate by this lymphokine .
the decrease expression of immunoglobulin gene indicate that the ra oncogene block terminal differentiation to plasma cell , possibly by inhibit the activity of lymphocyte-specific transcription factor .
somewhat unexpectedly , the constitutive p21ras activity do not cause an increase dna binding of transcription factor pea1 ( ap1 ) , pea3 , oct-2 or nf-kb
activation of signaling pathway and prevention of apoptosis by cytokine in eosinophil .
inhibition of apoptosis in eosinophil by cytokine such a il-5 and gm-csf may play an important role in the pathogenesis of allergic and parasitic disorder .
recently , there have be some progress in the understanding of the signal transduction pathway activate by these cytokine in eosinophil .
the il-3 , il-5 and gm-csf receptor share a common signal transducer that possess no intrinsic kinase domain .
it have be show that eosinophil stimulation by these cytokine be associate with increase in tyrosine phosphorylation of several cellular substrate .
in the past few year , there have be some progress in define the tyrosine kinase that be activate by the il-3 / il-5 / gm-csf receptor beta-subunit in eosinophil .
this review will concentrate on this topic and on it role for the regulation of eosinophil apoptosis .
platelet-activating factor stimulate transcription of the heparin-binding epidermal growth factor-like growth factor in monocyte .
correlation with an increase kappa b binding activity .
human peripheral blood monocyte respond to stimulation of platelet-activating factor ( paf ) with up-regulation of the transcript for heparin-binding epidermal growth factor-like growth factor ( hb-egf ) , a potent mitogen for vascular smooth muscle cell .
this function of paf be observe at nanomolar concentration of the ligand , start at 30 min after stimulation .
the paf -induced up-regulation of hb-egf mrna be accompany by an increase in kappa b binding activity .
these function of paf appear to be mediate through the cell surface paf receptor , a two paf receptor antagonist , web 2086 and l-659 , 989 , block both the up-regulation of hb-egf mrna and kappa b binding activity induce by paf .
the antagonist , however , have no effect on phorbol ester -induced up-regulation of hb-egf mrna and kappa b binding activity .
pretreatment of monocyte with pertussis toxin inhibit these function of paf , whereas cholera toxin have no inhibitory effect .
pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , an inhibitor for nf-kappa b activation , markedly reduce paf -stimulated kappa b binding activity as well a up-regulation of hb-egf mrna .
these result suggest a potential role of paf in hb-egf expression and provide evidence that this stimulation may occur through increase kappa b binding activity .
glucocorticoid -mediated inhibition of rantes expression in human t lymphocyte .
the chemokine rantes have be implicate in the pathogenesis of allergic inflammatory disease include asthma and rhinitis which be frequently treat with glucocorticoid .
we observe that dexamethasone dramatically inhibit rantes mrna expression dose dependently in anti-cd3 activated hut-78 t cell and human pbmcs .
inhibition of rantes expression do not appear to be secondary to il-2 inhibition and require bind to the intracellular glucocorticoid receptor .
the down-regulation of rantes expression by glucocorticoid in t cell may directly contribute to the efficacy of these agent in suppress cellular infiltration and to their anti-inflammatory property .
regulation of the nuclear factor of activate t cell in stably transfected jurkat cell clone .
two jurkat cell clone have be stably transfected with a reporter vector for the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) .
upon stimulation , they express high level of secrete heat stable placental alkaline phosphatase .
with these clone , we demonstrate that nfat activation induce by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate and ionomycin be inhibit by both cyclosporin a ( csa ) ( ic50 = 8 nm ) and fk506 ( ic50 = 160 pm ) , presumably by inhibition of calcineurin activity .
selective phosphatase inhibitor for protein phosphatase 1 ( pp1 ) and 2a ( pp2a ) that do not inhibit calcineurin , such a okadaic acid and calyculin a , also inhibit nfat activation with ic50s of 87 nm and 4 nm , respectively , suggest that okadaic acid and related inhibitor may block nfat activation through the inhibition of pp1 , instead of pp2a .
nfat activation be also inhibit by agent that increase camp concentration such a dibutyryl camp , forskolin and prostaglandin e2 .
these stable jurkat cell clone provide a convenient and sensitive tool to study nfat regulation .
an erythroid specific enhancer upstream to the gene encode the cell-type specific transcription factor gata-1 .
the transcription factor gata-1 be express in a subset of hemopoietic cell , where it mediate the cell-type specific expression of several gene .
we have clone the mouse and human gata-1 gene .
a region upstream to the first exon , and highly conserve between mouse and man , act a an erythroid specific enhancer in transient assay , if link to the gata-1 or to the sv40 promoter .
the activity of the enhancer be almost completely dependent on the integrity of a dimeric gata-1 binding site .
il-4 -dependent regulation of tgf-alpha and tgf-beta1 expression in human eosinophil .
tgfs play important role in wound healing and carcinogenesis .
we have previously demonstrate that eosinophil infiltrate into different pathologic process elaborate tgf-alpha and tgf-beta1 .
eosinophil infiltrate hamster cutaneous wound be find to express tgfs sequentially .
in this study , we examine the biologic mediator that may regulate the expression of tgf -alpha and -beta1 by eosinophil .
eosinophil be isolate from the peripheral blood of healthy donor and culture in the absence or presence of il-3 , il-4 , and il-5 .
cell be analyze by in situ hybridization and immunohistochemistry .
supernatant from these culture be assay for secrete tgf-alpha and tgf-beta1 use tgf -specific elisa .
il-3 , il-4 , and il-5 independently up-regulated tgf-beta1 mrna and product expression by eosinophil in all donor .
interestingly , tgf-alpha production by eosinophil be up-regulated by il-3 and il-5 but be down-regulated by il-4 .
consistent with the ability of il-4 to regulate eosinophil response , il-4 signaling molecule be present in human eosinophil .
the observation that il-4 can differentially regulate the expression of tgf-alpha and tgf-beta1 suggest that il-4 may serve a a physiologic molecular switch of tgf expression by the infiltrate eosinophil in wound healing and carcinogenesis .
the class ii trans-activator ciita interact with the tbp-associated factor tafii32 .
the class ii trans-_activator ( ciita ) be the main transcriptional co-activator for the expression of mhc class ii protein .
it n-terminal 125 amino acid function a an independent transcriptional activation domain .
analysis of the primary amino acid sequence of the activation domain predict the presence of three alpha-helices , each with a high proportion of acidic residue .
use site-directed mutagenesis , we find that two of these predict alpha-helices be require for full transcriptional activation by ciita .
moreover , a ciita protein in which both functional alpha-helices have be delete display a dominant negative phenotype .
this activation domain of ciita interact with the 32 kda subunit of the general transcription complex tfiid , tafii32 .
decrease transcriptional activation by n-terminal deletion of ciita be correlate directly with their reduce binding to tafii32 .
we conclude that interaction between tafii32 and ciita be responsible for activation of class ii gene .
limited proteolysis for assay ligand binding affinity of nuclear receptor .
the binding of natural or synthetic ligand to nuclear receptor be the trigger event lead to gene transcription activation or repression .
ligand bind to the ligand binding domain of these receptor induce conformational change that be evidence by an increase resistance of this domain to protease .
in vitro label receptor be incubate with various synthetic or natural agonist or antagonist and submit to trypsin digestion .
proteolysis product be separate by sds-page and quantify .
the amount of trypsin -resistant fragment be proportional to receptor occupancy by the ligand , and allow the determination of dissociation constant ( kda ) .
use the wild-type or mutate human retinoic acid receptor alpha a a model , kda value determine by classical competition binding assay use tritiated ligand be in agreement with those measure by the proteolytic assay .
this method be successfully extend to human retinoic x receptor alpha , glucocorticoid receptor , and progesterone receptor , thus provide a basis for a new , fast assay to determine simultaneously the affinity and conformation of receptor when bind to a given ligand .
demonstration of a 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 -responsive protein in human lymphocyte : immunologic crossreactivity and inverse regulation with the vitamin d receptor .
use western blot analysis with a monoclonal antibody recognize a 17-amino acid epitope of the 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 [ 1,25(oh)2d3 ] receptor , we have detect two crossreacting protein in activate normal human lymphocyte .
the small of the two protein ( 50 kda ) be indistinguishable from the classical 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor and , similar to the classical 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor , be upregulated in a dose-dependent fashion by 1,25(oh)2d3 .
the large crossreacting protein exhibit an electrophoretic mobility of 80 kda , be localized in the cell cytosol , and appear to be specific for activate lymphocyte since it be not detect in several other human cell include monocyte .
more strikingly , the 80-kda protein be downregulated in a dose-dependent fashion by 1,25(oh)2d3 ; this effect be independent of the mode of lymphocyte activation and specific for the 1,25(oh)2d3 metabolite of vitamin d3 .
however , two potent immunosuppressive agent , glucocorticoid and cyclosporin a , also inhibit the 80-kda protein .
nonradioactive quantification of glucocorticoid receptor expression during differentiation of human monocytic cell ( u937 ) .
we describe a method for relative quantification of specific mrna use a nonradioactive assay base on dna strand competition between identical sequence of biotin- and fluorescein-labeled amplicon ( probe ) and unlabeled amplicon ( target ) during hybridization .
a the target quantity increase , that of the double-labeled probe decrease in accordance with the mass action law .
this technique be successfully apply to evaluate difference in glucocorticoid receptor expression in u937 cell before and after the addition of potent differentiation inducer : 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate ( tpa ) and a combination of all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) and 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d2 ( vd ) .
we observe that tpa treatment be associate with an increase in specific binding of [3h]dexamethasone and up-regulation of gr mrna while no enhance gr expression be perceive with ra /vd treatment .
gene that regulate interleukin-4 expression in t cell .
interleukin-4 be an immunomodulatory cytokine which play a central role in the regulation of allergic and atopic immune response .

the recent identification and characterization of several key transcription factor have help to elucidate the molecular mechanism of t helper cell cytokine gene expression .
regulation of the bzlf1 promoter of epstein-barr virus by second messenger in anti-immunoglobulin-treated b cell .
initiation of the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) lytic cycle be dependent on the transcription of the bzlf1 gene .
the bzlf1 gene promoter ( zp ) be activate by crosslinking of cell surface immunoglobulin ( ig ) with anti-ig antibody in b cell , even in the absence of other viral gene .
we identify several anti-ig response element within zp , which be originally define a 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) response element ( zi repeat and zii , an ap-1-like domain ) .
since anti-ig crosslinking lead to activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) and an increase in intracellular calcium level , zp be test for the response to these cellular factor .
treatment with calcium ionophore a23187 increase zp activity .
when the calcium ionophore be use in conjunction with tpa , a pkc activator , the zp induction be synergistically enhance .
1-(5-isoquinolinyl_sulfonyl)-2-methylpiperazine , an inhibitor of pkc , inhibit the anti-ig inducibility of zp .
calmodulin antagonist , compound r24571 and trifluoperazine , block the zp activation with anti-ig .
these finding suggest that zp respond directly to change in the activity of both pkc and calcium /calmodulin-dependent protein kinase .
requirement of tyrosine kinase activation for the anti-ig -mediated zp activation be also demonstrate through the use of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor herbimycin .
these cellular gene regulatory molecule induce with anti-ig may cooperatively play an important part in achieve efficient ebv activation a see with anti-ig treatment in b cell .
lipopolysaccharide induction of the tumor necrosis factor-alpha promoter in human monocytic cell .
regulation by egr-1 , c-jun , and nf-kappab transcription factor .
biosynthesis of tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) be predominantly by cell of the monocytic lineage .
this study examine the role of various cis-acting regulatory element in the lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induction of the human tnf-alpha promoter in cell of monocytic lineage .
functional analysis of monocytic thp-1 cell transfected with plasmid contain various length of tnf-alpha promoter localize enhancer element in a region ( -182 to -37 base pair ( bp ) ) that be require for optimal transcription of the tnf-alpha gene in response to lp .
two region be identify : region i ( -182 to -162 bp ) contain an overlap sp1/ egr-1 site , and region ii ( -119 to -88 ) contain cre and nf-kappab ( designate kappab3 ) site .
in unstimulated thp-1 , cre -binding protein and , to a less extent , c-jun complex be find to bind to the cre site .
lp stimulation increase the binding of c-jun -containing complex .
in addition , lp stimulation induce the binding of cognate nuclear factor to the egr-1 and kappab3 site , which be identify a egr-1 and p50/p65 , respectively .
the cre and kappab3 site in region ii together confer strong lp responsiveness to a heterologous promoter , whereas individually they fail to provide transcriptional activation .
furthermore , increase the spacing between the cre and the kappab3 site completely abolish lp induction , suggest a cooperative interaction between c-jun complex and p50/p65 .
these study indicate that maximal lp induction of the tnf-alpha promoter be mediate by concert participation of at least two separate cis-acting regulatory element .
t cell response to epstein-barr virus transactivators in chronic rheumatoid arthritis .
rheumatoid arthritis be a multistep disorder associate with autoimmune feature of yet unknown etiology .
implication of virus such a epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) in rheumatoid arthritis pathogenesis have be suspect on the basis of several indirect observation , but thus far , a direct link between ebv and rheumatoid arthritis have not be provide .
here we show that a large fraction of t cell infiltrate affect joint from a patient with chronic rheumatoid arthritis recognize two ebv transactivators ( bzlf1 and bmlf1 ) in a major histocompatibility complex -restricted fashion .
response to these ebv antigen by synovial lymphocyte from several other chronic rheumatoid arthritis patient be readily detectable .
thus these result suggest a direct contribution of ebv to chronic rheumatoid arthritis pathogenesis .
they also demonstrate for the first time the occurrence of t cell response against ebv transactivating factor , which might be central in the control of virus reactivation .
cholecystokininb receptor from human jurkat lymphoblastic t cell be involve in activator protein-1 -responsive gene activation .
the aim of this study be to analyze the role of cholecystokinin ( cck(b) ) receptor in human lymphoblastic jurkat t cell .
we investigate the trophic effect result from activation of such a receptor by use the reporter gene strategy .
for this purpose , we transiently transfected jurkat t cell with the reporter plasmid p [(tre)3-tk-luc] and find that cck-8 be able to dose-dependently induce luciferase expression related to activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) activation with a maximal response identical to that obtain with compound know to activate ap-1 complex ( quantitatively , the same level of induction be obtain with 1 nm 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate , 100 microm diacylglycerol , or 4 nm epidermal growth factor ) .
the involvement of the cck(b) receptor in such a stimulation be demonstrate by the inhibiting effect of the selective cck(b) receptor antagonist pd-135,158 .
this effect be confirm in cos-7 cell transfected with the cdna of cck(b) receptor clone from jurkat t cell .
to well understand the ap-1 -dependent luciferase expression in jurkat t cell , we test two specific inhibitor of serine/threonine phosphatase -1 and -2a : okadaic acid and calyculin a .
these compound strongly increase the phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate response , whereas we have not observe a contribution of phosphatase inhibitor on a cck-8 -induced luciferase activity .
to confirm that cck(b) receptor be involve in ap-1 response , we investigate the cck-8 effect on interleukin-2 expression , a natural endogenous gene regulate by several factor , include ap-1 .
in jurkat t cell activate by phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate and phytohemagglutinin , cck-8 induce il-2 expression .
this induction be abolish by pd-135,158 .
our result indicate that cck-8 exert a trophic effect in jurkat t cell through stimulation of cck(b) receptor by modulation of expression of ap-1 -regulated gene .
uncoupling of cell cycle arrest from the expression of monocytic differentiation marker in hl60 cell variant .
differentiation generally lead to cell cycle arrest .
human leukemia hl60 cell respond to the presence of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 1,25d3 ) by express a number of marker of the monocyte/macrophage phenotype and become arrest predominantly in the g1 phase of the cell cycle .
we have recently report a series ( a ) of 1,25d3 -resistant variant of hl60 cell which proliferate in the presence of 1,25d3 and do not express differentiation marker ( exp. cell res. 224 , 312 , 1996 ) .
we now describe another series ( b ) of such variant , which differ from a series cell grow in similar concentration of 1,25d3 in that they express the cd14 antigen and nonspecific esterase , characteristic of the monocyte , while continue to proliferate and they develop hypotetraploid dna ( 4c ) content at high concentration of ambient 1,25d3 than the a series cell .
cell in the b series with 4c dna content ( 100b and 200b ) also differ from the a series 4c cell by the absence of dna binding by the full-length sp1 transcription factor .
however , b series cell resemble the a series cell in exhibit fast growth rate than the parental hl60 cell and show high level of vitamin d receptor and retinoid receptor x protein .
these result show that the initial step in the 1,25d3 signaling pathway be intact in b series resistant cell and lead to the appearance of early marker of monocytic differentiation .
however , the progression to subsequent event which comprise terminal differentiation and cell cycle arrest be halt during the adaptation to the presence of 1,25d3 in these cell .
thus , the availability of these variant cell should provide a system for study the link between differentiation and cell cycle arrest .
an allosteric drug , o,o'-bismyristoyl thiamine disulfide , suppress hiv-1 replication through prevention of nuclear translocation of both hiv-1 tat and nf-kappa b .
the efficacy of o , o'-bismyristoyl thiamine disulfide ( bmt ) be examine in detail against hiv-1 laboratory isolates ( htlv-iiib , jrfl , and mn ) , primary isolates ( kmt and kmo ) , and simian immunodeficiency virus ( sivmac251 ) in vitro .
bmt inhibit the replication of hiv-1 in both laboratory and primary isolates in vitro .
in addition , bmt exhibit antiviral activity against sivmac251 .
minimize energy study of bmt structure reveal that a trans-disulfide of thiamine ( holo drug ) disulfide ( tds , protodrug ) be allosterically transit to the reactive twisted disulfide of bmt ( allo drug ) by o , o'-bismyristoyl esterification of tds .
bmt inhibit nuclear translocation of both hiv-1 transactivator ( tat ) and the cellular transcriptional nuclear factor-kb ( nf-kappa b ) , result in the suppression of hiv-1 replication .
correlation of differentiation-inducing activity of retinoids on human leukemia cell line hl-60 and nb4 .
retinoids , include all-trans-retinoic acid , it isomer , and fifty synthetic retinoids ( retinobenzoic acid ) , be test for differentiation-inducing activity on human leukemia cell line hl-60 and nb4 .

isolation of a b-cell-specific promoter for the human class ii transactivator .
the class ii transactivator ( ciita ) be essential for the expression of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii antigen .
the tissular pattern of ciita and mhc class ii gene expression be tightly correlate : ciita mrna be highly express in b cell , and be induce by interferon gamma ( ifn-gamma ) in macrophage and epithelial cell line .
we first isolate two overlap cosmid encode human ciita which , when co-transfected , be able to restore mhc class ii expression in a b-lymphoblastoid cell line ( b-lcl ) defective for ciita .
subsequently , a 1.8 kilobase ( kb ) fragment of the ciita promoter be isolate and sequence .
a motif present a strong similarity to an initiator be detect , as well a putative bind site for sp1 , gata-2 , lyf-1 , ets-1 , ap1 , and mzf1 transcription factor , and two gas motif .
when introduce in front of a luciferase reporter gene , this promoter be able to direct a high luciferase activity in a human b-lcl .
in contrast , luciferase expression be not stimulate after ifn-gamma treatment when the construct be transfected in macrophage or in epithelial cell line .
however , an induction of the human ciita gene be observe in mouse macrophage and fibrosarcoma cell line , when the cell be transfected with a cosmid contain the human ciita gene , but lack the 1.8 kb promoter describe above .
take together , these data suggest the existence of an intragenic promoter drive an ifn-gamma -inducible expression of ciita .
hiv-1 vpr suppress immune activation and apoptosis through regulation of nuclear factor kappa b [ see comment ]
the hiv-1 accessory gene product vpr can influence viral pathogenesis by affect viral replication as well a host cell transcription and proliferation .
we have investigate the effect of vpr on host cell activation and confirm that it influence cellular proliferation .
however , we have also find that vpr modulate t-cell receptor ( tcr ) -triggered apoptosis in a manner similar to that of glucocorticoid .
in the absence of tcr -mediated activation , vpr induce apoptosis whereas in it presence , vpr interrupt the expect induction of apoptosis .
this regulation of apoptosis be link to vpr suppression of nf-kappa b activity via the induction of i kappa b , an inhibitor of nf-kappa b .
far , vpr suppress expression of il-2 , il-10 , il-12 , tnf alpha and il-4 , all of which be nf-kappa b -dependent .
the effect of vpr could be reverse by ru486 .
our finding that vpr can regulate nf-kappa b support the hypothesis that some aspect of viral pathogenesis be the consequence of cell dysregulation by vpr .
the human prointerleukin 1 beta gene require dna sequence both proximal and distal to the transcription start site for tissue-specific induction .
in these study , we have identify dna sequence and specific protein interaction necessary for transcriptional regulation of the human prointerleukin 1 beta ( proil-1 beta ) gene .
a cell-type-independent lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -responsive enhancer element located between -3757 and -2729 bp upstream from the transcription start site ( cap site ) consist of at least six discrete subregions which be essential to the maximal induction by lp in transfected monocyte .
the enhancer also appear to mediate phorbol myristate acetate induction in monocyte and il-1 responsiveness in fibroblast .
deletion and base substitution mutation along with dna binding study demonstrate that the enhancer contain a minimum of three functional protein binding sequence , two of which appear to be important for gene induction .
one of the essential protein which bind to the enhancer be similar or identical to member of the c/ebp family of transcription factor require for both il-1 - and lp -specific induction of the il-6 gene ( i.e. , the nf-il6 protein ) .
when ligate to the proil-1 beta cap site -proximal region ( located between -131 to +12 ) , both the proil-1 beta and the simian virus 40 enhancer element function more efficiently in monocyte than in hela cell , which be not normally competent for il-1 beta expression .
when ligate to the murine c-fos promoter , however , the proil-1 beta enhancer be inducible in phorbol myristate acetate -stimulated hela cell , suggest the existence of a proil-1 beta promoter-proximal requirement for tissue specificity .
expression and genomic configuration of gm-csf , il-3 , m-csf receptor ( c-fms ) , early growth response gene-1 ( egr-1 ) and m-csf gene in primary myelodysplastic syndrome .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell from seventeen patient with primary myelodysplastic syndrome ( md ) in advanced stage be enriched for blast and test for ( 1 ) karyotype , ( 2 ) genomic configuration and ( 3 ) expression of il-3 , gm-csf , fm and egr-1 gene which be all located on the long arm of chromosome 5 .
the expression of the m-csf gene , that have be recently reassign to the short arm of chromosome 1 ( lp ) , be also investigate .
aim of the study be to ( 1 ) assess the potential role of the expression of these gene in the maintenance and expansion of the neoplastic clone and ( 2 ) search for constitutional loss or rearrangement of one allele follow by a deletion of the second allele of the same gene in the leukemic cell .
the latter issue be investigate by compare , in 8 case , constitutive dna from skin fibroblast with leukemic dna .
eleven of the 17 patient have abnormal karyotype .
the m-csf gene be express in 6 case and the fm and the egr-1 gene be express in 2 of the latter case .
an autocrine mechanism of growth could be hypothesize only for the 2 patient whose cell express both the m-csf and fm gene .
no germline change or rearrangement be observe in any of the gene study .
thus , deregulation of gene encode for certain hemopoietic growth factor or receptor do not seem to represent a major mechanism of md progression .
inhibition of t cell activation by the extracellular matrix protein tenascin .
tenascin ( tn ) be an extracellular matrix protein that be express widely in the fetus and sparingly in the adult , but reappear at high level in certain area of tissue insult such a tumor matrix and site of wound healing .
we show here that soluble tn inhibit proliferation of human t cell in response to alpha cd3 ab co- immobilize with the extracellular matrix protein fibronectin ( fn ) .
tn also inhibit proliferation drive by alpha cd3 /il-2 or by phorbol ester/il-2 , and it prevent high level induction of il-2r .
the presence of tn in culture medium do not detectably alter the pattern of tyrosine phosphorylation result from t cell trigger with alpha cd3 , but at late time point prevent the appearance of functional nf-at1 transcription factor complex in t cell nuclear extract .
these finding be consistent with the postulate role for tn a a natural antagonist to fn action , and suggest that t cell response occur at tissue site in which tn be express could be influence by it presence .
functional interaction between the two zinc finger domain of the v-erb a oncoprotein .
the v-erb a oncogene of avian erythroblastosis virus be a mutate and virally transduce copy of a host cell gene encode a thyroid hormone receptor .
the protein express by the v-erb a oncogene bind to dna and act a a dominant negative inhibitor of both the thyroid hormone receptor and the closely related retinoic acid receptor .
the v-erb a protein have sustain two amino acid alteration within it dna-binding domain relative to that of c-erb a , one of which , at serine 61 , be know to be important for v-erb a function in the neoplastic cell .
we report here that the second alteration , at threonine 78 , also play an important , although more indirect , role : alteration of the sequence at threonine 78 such that it resemble that of c-erb a can act a an intragenic suppressor and can partially restore function to a v-erb a protein render defective due to a mutation at position 61 .
threonine 78 lie within the d-box of the v-erb a protein , a region think to mediate receptor-receptor dimerizations , and be not in physical proximity to the serine at position 61 .
it therefore appear that an indirect interaction occur between these two site and that this interaction be crucial for v-erb a function .
t cell from renal cell carcinoma patient exhibit an abnormal pattern of kappa b-specific dna-binding activity : a preliminary report .
recent data suggest that the poor induction of a t-cell response to human renal cell carcinoma ( rcc ) may be related to alteration in signal transduction pathway .
we report that t cell from rcc patient have two alteration in kappa b motif -specific dna-binding activity .
the first alteration involve the constitutive expression of substantial kappa b-binding activity in nuclear extract , which be observe in the electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
the magnitude of kappa b activity in unstimulated patient t cell be similar to that observe in t cell from normal individual that have be activate in vitro .
on the basis of western blotting experiment use antibody to kappa b/rel family protein , the kappa b-binding activity constitutively express in t cell from rcc patient be compose mostly of the nf-kappa b1 ( p50 ) subunit .
the second abnormality in kappa b-binding activity in t cell from these patient be that rela , a member of the rel homology family which be part of the normal nf-kappa b complex , be not induce in the nucleus follow activation .
western blotting analysis do not detect any rela in nuclear extract either before or after stimulation of t cell .
the altered kappa b-binding activity in t cell from rcc patient may impair their capacity to respond normally to various stimulus .
