the author reveal alteration in the functional activity of the indicate endocrine gland depend on the intensity of bronchial patency disorder and the nature of the therapeutic measure carry out .
a conserve motif in the promoter of several cytokine express by human th2-type lymphocyte .
we have recently find a novel conserve motif in the promoter of several t-cell-expressed cytokine [ human interleukin -2 , -4 , -5 and -13 and human and mouse granulocyte/macrophage-colony stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) ] .
it contain a core sequence cttgg ... ccaag which be present a part of large palindromic sequence in each gene .
this suggest that they may interact with a new family of trans-acting factor .
in transfection assay , the human gm-csf element have a strong positive effect on the expression of a reporter gene by the human t cell line jurkat j6 upon stimulation .
in dna mobility shift assay , this sequence can give either six different specific band which be compete out by different part of the sequence or one specific band which be compete out by each of the invert repeat , depend on the reconstitution condition .
in different gene , the core sequence be separate by integer number of helical turn .
consider the strong positive regulatory effect of this element and it presence in several t-cell-expressed cytokine gene , it may be crucial to the coordinate expression of these cytokine in t helper cell .
transcriptional repression of the interleukin-2 gene by vitamin d3 : direct inhibition of nfatp /ap-1 complex formation by a nuclear hormone receptor .
t- lymphocyte proliferation be suppress by 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 [ 1,25(oh)2d3 ] , the active metabolite of vitamin d3 , and be associate with a decrease in interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) , gamma interferon , and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor mrna level .
we report here that 1,25(oh)2d3 -mediated repression in jurkat cell be cycloheximide resistant , suggest that it be a direct transcriptional repressive effect on il-2 expression by the vitamin d3 receptor ( vdr ) .
we therefore examine vitamin d3 -mediated repression of activate il-2 expression by cotransfecting jurkat cell with il-2 promoter /reporter construct and a vdr overexpression vector and by dna binding .
we delineate an element confer both dna binding by the receptor in vitro and 1,25(oh)2d3 -mediated repression in vivo to a short 40-bp region encompass an important positive regulatory element , nf-at-1 , which be bind by a t-cell-specific transcription factor , nfatp , as well a by ap-1 .
vdr dna-binding mutant be unable to either bind to this element in vitro or repress in vivo ; the vdr dna-binding domain alone , however , bind the element but also could not repress il-2 expression .
these result indicate that dna binding by vdr be necessary but not sufficient to mediate il-2 repression .
by combine partially purify protein in vitro , we observe the loss of the bind nfatp /ap-1-dna complex upon inclusion of vdr or vdr -retinoid x receptor .
order of addition and off-rate experiment indicate that the vdr -retinoid x receptor heterodimer block nfatp / ap-1 complex formation and then stably associate with the nf-at-1 element .
this direct inhibition by a nuclear hormone receptor of transcriptional activator of the il-2 gene may provide a mechanistic explanation of how vitamin derivative can act a potent immunosuppressive agent .
the a-myb transcription factor in neoplastic and normal b cell .
the myb family of transcription factor have be strongly implicate in the regulation of cell growth and differentiation in the haematopoietic system .
the v-myb oncogene , carry by avian defective retrovirus , cause leukaemia in the chicken and transform haematopoietic cell in vitro .
it normal cellular equivalent c-myb , have be show to promote the proliferation and block the differentiation of haematopoietic cell in several experimental model and be require for fetal haematopoiesis .
two other member of the family have be clone more recently , a-myb and b-myb , which show sequence homology with c-myb in several domain , of which the dna binding domain as well a other regulatory domain .
both have be show to be transcription factor .
b-myb be also involve in the control of proliferation and differentiation , but , unlike c-myb , it be express in many cell type .
the third member of the family , a-myb , show the most restricted pattern of expression , suggest a very specific role for this transcription factor .
a-myb be express in a subpopulation of normal b lymphocyte activate in vivo and localised in the germinal center of peripheral lymphoid organ and be not detect at significant level in all other mature or immature haematopoietic population study , include bone marrow cell , t lymphocyte , granulocyte , monocyte , either at rest or after in vitro activation .
these study indicate that a-myb play a role during a narrow window of normal b cell differentiation .
a-myb expression have also be study in a wide range of neoplastic b cell , represent the whole spectrum of b cell differentiation .
a-myb be strongly express in burkitt 's lymphoma ( bl ) and slg+ b-acute lymphoblastic leukaemia ( b-all ) and not in all other leukaemia /lymphomas test , with the exception of a subset of cll ( about 25 % of case ) .
it be intriguing that the a-myb genome have be localised relatively close to the c-myc gene on chromosome 8 , suggest that the c-myc translocation in bl and b-all may affect a-myb transcription .
study be in progress to investigate the functional relationship between a-myb and c-myc , particularly in the context of bl cell and to determine whether a-myb be deregulate in these cell .
nuclear level of nf-kappab correlate with syncytium-forming capacity of 8e51 cell , express a defective hiv virus .
the double nf-kappab site identify in the ltr of the human immunodeficiency virus-1 ( hiv-1 ) have be demonstrate to be necessary for efficient viral transcription .
in this report we present the characterisation of nf-kappab subunit engage in complex bind to the hiv-1 nf-kappab site in human 8e51 t-cells , that harbour a defective hiv-1 .
at least four different specific nf-kappab complex be present in the nucleus of these cell .
with the use of specific antibody we have determine the composition of each complex use electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
the result show the presence of several nf-kappab family member , with the transactivating rela be engage in multiple complex .
the importance of nf-kappab complex in viral function have be establish compare the level of nf-kappab dna-binding complex with syncytia-forming activity of 8e51 cell .
in fact , 8e51 cell that have almost lose their syncytia-forming capacity be find to contain at least 10 time less active nf-kappab dna-binding complex than the actively fuse cell .
the correlation be specific a the level of at least three other transcription factor do not change .
uncoupling of nonreceptor tyrosine kinase from plc-gamma1 in an slp-76-deficient t cell .
activation of nonreceptor protein tyrosine kinase ( ptks ) be essential for t cell receptor ( tcr ) responsiveness ; however , the function of individual ptk substrate be often uncertain .
a mutant t cell line be isolate that lack expression of slp-76 ( sh2 domain-containing leukocyte protein of 76 kilodaltons ) , a hematopoietically express adaptor protein and ptk substrate .
slp-76 be not require for tcr -induced tyrosine phosphorylation of most protein , but be require for optimal tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of phospholipase c-gamma1 ( plc-gamma1 ) , as well a ra pathway activation .
tcr -inducible gene expression be dependent on slp-76 .
thus , coupling of tcr-regulated ptks to downstream signaling pathway require slp-76 .
the involvement of p23 , hsp90 , and immunophilins in the assembly of progesterone receptor complex .
to well understand the assembly mechanism for the progesterone receptor ( pr ) , we have develop cell-free system for study interaction of pr , hsp90 , and other associate protein .
when pr be incubate in rabbit reticulocyte lysate , it association with hsp90 , hsp70 , the three immunophilins fkbp54 , fkbp52 and cyp-40 , and with p23 be observe .
these interaction require atp/mg2+ and when atp be limit the pr complex be alter to one contain the protein p60 and p48 , but lack immunophilins and p23 .
we have study two pre-formed hsp90 complex that may participate in the assembly of pr complex .
one contain hsp90 bind to hsp70 and p60 and this complex form spontaneously in the absence of atp .
a second complex contain hsp90 bind to p23 plus the three immunophilins and some hsp70 .
the formation of this complex require atp .
in further study we have show that purify hsp90 can bind to purify p23 and this interaction require both atp and molybdate .
this explain , in part , the known effect of atp and molybdate on assembly of pr complex .
increase natural killer cell activity correlate with low or negative expression of the her-2/neu oncogene in patient with breast cancer .
background .
increase expression of the her-2/neu oncogene in breast cancer correlate with decrease estrogen receptor concentration and seem to be an important prognostic factor .
the author investigate whether there be a correlation between her-2/neu expression and immunologic parameter represent tumor defense in patient with breast cancer .
method .
a western blot analysis be use to investigate her-2/neu expression , whereas a chromium-release assay use the k562 cell line a target be use to measure natural killer ( nk ) cell activity .
result .
in patient with breast cancer , nk cell activity be significantly high compare with patient with benign tumor ( p = 0.006 ) or healthy control subject ( p = 0.002 ) .
moreover , 23.3 % of patient with breast cancer show an overexpression of her-2/neu protein .
within this group of patient , nk cell activity be significantly low ( 45.6 +/- 16.1 % ) compare with the group with no her-2/neu overexpression ( 57.3 +/- 11.0 % ) .
nk cell activity do not increase in patient with her-2/neu overexpression .
thus , there be a statistically significant correlation of cytolytic effector cell function with her-2/neu expression of the tumor ( p = 0.003 ) , and her-2/neu overexpression correlate with a negative estrogen receptor status ( p = 0.005 ) .
conclusion .
these data add further evidence to previous observation from the author ' laboratory that certain tumor characteristic may be associate with reaction of the host with breast cancer .
c-myc mrna expression in minor salivary gland of patient with sjogren 's syndrome .
c-myc protooncogene be implicate in the pathogenesis of b cell lymphoid malignancy and high level of c-myc mrna expression be observe in activate blood mononuclear cell .
sjogren 's syndrome ( s ) be characterize by lymphocytic infiltrates of exocrine gland , remarkable b cell hyperreactivity and a strong predisposition to b cell neoplasia .
in this study , c-myc protooncogene mrna expression in 29 labial minor salivary gland biopsy from patient with primary s and 15 control be examine use in situ hybridization histochemistry .
two 40mer oligonucleotides from the 1st and the 2nd exon of the c-myc gene , label with 35s , be use a probe .
to detect the origin of the cell hybridize with a c-myc probe , a combined immunochemistry in situ hybridization histochemistry technique be use .
high c-myc mrna expression be detect on acinar epithelial cell .
c-myc do not correlate with c-fos and c-jun protein expression .
strong c-myc mrna expression be detect in labial salivary gland of patient with long disease duration ( p less than or equal to 0.002 ) and more intense t lymphocyte infiltrates ( p less than 0.05 ) although these patient reveal no hypergammaglobulinemia .
no correlation be observe between c-myc mrna and b lymphocyte monoclonicity or lymphoma .
in conclusion , strong c-myc mrna expression be observe on epithelial cell of labial salivary gland from patient with primary s .
our finding may indicate the presence of a reactivate virus host in these cell .
a novel t-cell trans-activator that recognize a phorbol ester-inducible element of the interleukin-2 promoter .
the interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene promoter be recognize by several cell-type-specific and ubiquitous transcriptional regulator that integrate information transmit by various signaling system lead to il-2 production and t-cell activation .
use a combination of transfection , protein-dna binding , and in vitro transcription method , we have discover the novel t-cell-specific transcriptional activator tcf-1 ( for t-cell factor-1 ) , which recognize a t-cell-specific response element ( tce ) located within the il-2 promoter .
although the tce be similar in sequence to a consensus nf kappa b site , several criterion indicate that tcf-1 be distinct from nf kappa b .
however , like nf kappa b , tcf-1 activity be induce by phorbol ester and other t-cell activator .
scl and related hemopoietic helix-loop-helix transcription factor .
the helix-loop-helix ( hlh ) protein be a family of transcription factor that include protein critical to differentiation and development in specie range from plant to mammal .
five member of this family ( myc , scl , tal-2 , lyl-1 and e2a ) be implicate in oncogenic event in human lymphoid tumor because of their consistent involvement in chromosomal translocation .
although activate in t cell leukemia , expression of scl and lyl-1 be low or undetectable in normal t cell population .
scl be express in erythroid , megakaryocyte and mast cell population ( the same cell lineage a gata-1 , a zinc-finger transcription factor ) .
in addition , both scl and gata-1 undergo coordinate modulation during chemically induce erythroid differentiation of mouse erythroleukemia cell and be down-modulated during myeloid differentiation of human k562 cell , thus imply a role for scl in erythroid differentiation event .
however , in contrast to gata-1 , scl be express in the develop brain .
study of the function of scl suggest it be also important in proliferation and self-renewal event in erythroid cell .
involvement of intracellular ca2+ in oxidant-induced nf-kappa b activation .
in human jurkat t cell and it subclone wurzburg cell oxidant challenge elevate [ca2+]i by mobilize ca2+ from intracellular store .
in jurkat cell this effect be rapid and transient , but in wurzburg cell the response be slow and sustained .
h2o2 -induced nf-kappab activation in wurzburg cell be not influence by the presence of extracellular egta but be totally inhibit in cell that be load with esterify egta .
in jurkat cell that be not sensitive to h2o2 -induced nf-kappab activation , h2o2 potentiate nf-kappab activation in the presence of sustained high [ ca2+ ]i follow thapsigargin treatment .
nf-kappab regulatory effect of alpha-lipoate and n-acetylcysteine appear to be , at least in part , due to their ability to stabilize elevation of [ ca2+ ]i follow oxidant challenge .
result of this study indicate that a sustained elevated [ca2+]i be a significant factor in oxidant-induced nf-kappab activation .
v3 loop of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 suppress interleukin 2 -induced t cell growth [ publish erratum appear in aid re hum retrovirus 1997 may 1 ; 13 ( 7 ) : 633 ]
we test the effect of three linear or two loop peptide derive from the v3 region of the htlv-iii bh10 clone or the sf2 strain of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 on il-2 -driven t cell proliferation .
v3-bh10 , which consist of 42 amino acid and have a loop structure , suppress il-2 -driven proliferation of all il-2 -dependent cell [ kit225 , ed-40515(+) , kt-3 , 7-day pha-blasts , and fresh peripheral blood mononuclear cell ] test , whereas it do not suppress the cell growth of il-2 -independent cell line ( hut102 , molt-4 , and jurkat ) .
this suppressive effect be also see in il-2 -driven cell growth of cd8-positive lymphocyte purify from 7-day pha-blasts , indicate that cd4 molecule be not require for the suppression .
the treatment with anti- v3 loop monoclonal antibody ( 902 antibody ) completely abolish the suppressive effect of v3-bh10 .
in addition , v3-bh10 generate the arrest of kit225 cell and also purify cd8-positive lymphocyte in g1 phase in the presence of il-2 .
neither chromatin condensation nor dna fragmentation be detect in kit225 cell culture with v3-bh10 and il-2 .
v3-bh10 neither block radiolabeled il-2 binding to il-2 receptor nor affect tyrosyl phosphorylation of several cellular protein ( p120 , p98 , p96 , p54 , and p38 ) , which be immediately induce by il-2 stimulation .
however , v3-bh10 enhance il-2 -induced mrna expression of c-fos but not c-myc or junb .
thus , the binding of v3 loop of gp120 to the cell surface molecule ( s ) appear to affect intracellular il-2 signaling , which lead to the suppression of il-2 -induced t cell growth
activation of lymphokine gene in t cell : role of cis-acting dna element that respond to t cell activation signal .
activation of t cell be initiate by the recognition of antigen on antigen presenting cell to exert the effector function in immune and inflammatory response .
two type of helper t cell ( th ) clone ( th1 and th2 ) be define on the basis of different pattern of cytokine ( lymphokine ) secretion .
they determine the outcome of an antigenic response toward humoral or cell-mediated immunity .
although lymphokine gene be coordinately regulate upon antigen stimulation , they be regulate by the mechanism common to all as well a those which be unique to each gene .
for most lymphokine gene , a combination of phorbol ester ( phorbol 12-myristate 13 acetate , pma ) and calcium ionophores ( a23187 ) be require for their maximal induction .
yet phorbol ester alone or calcium ionophore alone produce several lymphokine .
the production of the granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be completely dependent on the two signal .
we have previously find a cis-acting region span the gm-csf promoter region ( position -95 to +27 ) that confer inducibility to reporter gene in transient transfection assay .
further analysis identify three element require for efficient induction , refer to a gm2 , gc-box and conserve lymphokine element ( cle0 ) .
gm2 define a bind site for protein ( s ) whose binding be inducible by pma .
one protein , nf-gm2 be similar to the transcription factor nf-kb .
gc-box be a bind site for constitutively bind protein .
cleo define a bind site for protein ( s ) whose optimum binding be stimulate by pma and a23187 .
viral trans-activators such a tax ( human t cell leukemia virus-1 , htlv-1 ) and e2 ( bovine papilloma virus , bpv ) protein be other agent which activate lymphokine gene expression by bypass t cell receptor ( tcr ) mediated signaling .
the trans-activation domain of e2 and tax be interchangeable although they have no obvious sequence homology between them .
the viral trans-activators appear to target specific dna binding protein such a nf-kb and sp1 to cis-acting dna site and promote lymphokine gene expression without tcr -mediated stimulation .
alpha-tocopheryl succinate inhibit monocytic cell adhesion to endothelial cell by suppress nf-kappa b mobilization .
the adherence of monocyte to activate endothelium be an early event in atherogenesis .
because antioxidant have be consider to be of antiatherosclerotic potential , we investigate the effect of alpha-tocopherol ( tcp ) and it acetate and succinate ester on monocyte adhesion to cytokine-stimulated human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvec ) .
endothelial cell be treat with tcp , alpha-tocopherol acetate ( tcp acetate ) , or alpha-tocopheryl succinate ( tcp succinate ) before stimulation with tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ; 10 u/ml , 6 h ) or interleukin-1 beta ( il-1 beta ; 10 u/ml , 6 h ) .
cytokine-stimulated cell surface expression of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 , cd106 ) and e-selectin ( elam-1 , cd62e ) , but not of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 , cd54 ) , be time- and dose- dependently inhibit by tcp succinate but not by tcp or tcp acetate .
tcp succinate ( 200 microm , 24 h ) reduce tnf-induced vcam-1 and e-selectin expression from a specific mean fluorescence intensity of 151 +/- 28 to 12 +/- 4 channel and from 225 +/- 38 to 79 +/- 21 channel , respectively .
succinate alone have no effect .
decrease adhesion molecule expression be associate with a reduction of monocytic cell adhesion .
tcp succinate ( 20 microm , 72 h ) , but not tcp ( 200 microm , 72 h ) , reduce u-937 cell adhesion to tnf-alpha -stimulated ( 10 u/ml , 6 h ) huvec by 30 % ( p < 0.025 ) and to il-1 beta -stimulated huvec by 56 % ( p < 0.010 ) .
electrophoretic mobility-shift assay of huvec nuclear protein reveal a decrease in tnf-alpha -stimulated nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation after pretreatment of huvec with tcp succinate but not with tcp , tcp acetate , or succinate alone .
in conclusion , we demonstrate that the vitamin e derivative tcp succinate prevent monocytic cell adhesion to cytokine-stimulated endothelial cell by inhibit the activation of nf-kappa b , far emphasize the antiatherosclerotic potential of lipid soluble antioxidant .
human erythroid 5-aminolevulinate synthase : promoter analysis and identification of an iron-responsive element in the mrna .
5-aminolevulinate synthase ( ala ) catalyze the first step of the heme biosynthetic pathway .
cdna clone for the human erythroid ala isozyme be isolate from a fetal liver library .
it can be deduce that the erythroid ala precursor protein have a molecular weight of 64.6 kd , and be similar in size to the previously isolate human housekeeping ala precursor of molecular weight 70.6 kd .
the mature mitochondrial form of the erythroid and housekeeping ala isozymes be predict to have molecular weight of 59.5 kd and 64.6 kd , respectively .
the two isozymes show little amino acid identity in their n-terminal signal sequence but have considerable sequence identity in the c-terminal two-thirds of their protein .
an analysis of the immediate promoter of the human erythroid ala gene reveal several putative erythroid-specific cis-acting element include both a gata-1 and an nf-e2 binding site .
an iron-responsive element ( ire ) motif have be identify in the 5'-untranslated region of the human erythroid ala mrna , but be not present in the housekeeping ala mrna .
gel retardation experiment establish that this ire motif form a protein_-_rna complex with cytosolic extract from human k562 cell and this binding be strongly compete with ire transcript from ferritin or transferrin receptor mrna .
a transcript of the ala ire , mutate in the conserve loop of the ire , do not readily form this protein_-_rna complex .
these result suggest that the ire motif in the ala mrna be functional and imply that translation of the mrna be control by cellular iron availability during erythropoiesis .
reduce mitogenic stimulation of peripheral blood mononuclear cell a a prognostic parameter for the course of breast cancer : a prospective longitudinal study .
immunosuppression have be often associate with the course of malignant disease .
in the present study , the proliferation of peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmcs ) in response to mitogenic stimulation with phytohaemagglutinin ( pha ) be assess prospectively in 90 patient with stage i-iii breast cancer .
whereas pha -induced proliferation of pbmcs derive from patient with breast cancer preoperatively be significantly decrease when compare with data obtain in healthy control individual ( p < 0.001 ) , the degree of the defect in pha -induced proliferation of pbmcs depend upon the tumour burden a manifest by tumour size and axillary lymph node involvement ( p < 0.003 in each case ) .
pha -induced proliferation of pbmcs drop significantly in patient who receive adjuvant chemotherapy consist of cyclophosphamide , methotrexate and fluorouracil ( cmf ) after an observation period of 6 month ( p < 0.01 ) , but not in patient under adjuvant treatment with tamoxifen only .
after an additional 6 month ( i.e. 12 month after surgery ) , pha -induced proliferation of pbmcs be similar in patient after adjuvant chemotherapy with cmf and in those receive continued adjuvant tamoxifen treatment ( p > 0.1 ) , but in all patient still significantly decrease a compare with healthy control ( p < 0.001 ) .
when data obtain preoperatively and after 12 month be compare , it be find that out of 23 patient whose pbmcs have experience a drop in their pha -induced proliferation , 14 ( 61 % ) have develop metastatic disease within the subsequent 24 month ( i.e. 36 month after surgery ) .
in contrast , out of 59 patient whose pbmcs show an increase in their pha -induced proliferation within the first 12 month after surgery , only one ( 2 % ) present with disease progression .
we thus conclude that pha -induced proliferation of pbmcs derive from patient with breast cancer depend upon the tumour load and be a good clinical predictor for the further course of the disease .
tcf-1 , a t cell-specific transcription factor of the hmg box family , interact with sequence motif in the tcr beta and tcr delta enhancer .
we have recently identify and clone tcf-1 , a t cell-specific transcription factor with specificity for the aacaaag motif in the cd3 epsilon enhancer and for the ttcaaag motif in the tcr alpha enhancer .
tcf-1 belong to the family of transcription-regulating protein which share a region of homology term the hmg-box .
here , we show by gel retardation analysis that tcf-1 specifically recognize the t beta 5 element of the tcr beta enhancer and the t delta 7 element of the tcr delta enhancer .
comparison of the sequence of all element recognize by tcf-1 define a consensus motif a/t a/t c a a/g a g .
these observation imply that tcf-1 be involve in the control of several t cell-specific gene and might thus play an important role in the establishment and maintenance of the mature t cell phenotype .
human cytomegalovirus induce interleukin-8 production by a human monocytic cell line , thp-1 , through act concurrently on ap-1- and nf-kappab- binding site of the interleukin-8 gene .
cytomegalovirus ( cmv ) infection induce interleukin-8 ( il-8 ) gene transcription in a human monocytic cell line , thp-1 cell , lead to il-8 secretion .
the functional analysis of the il-8 gene reveal that both ap-1- and nf-kappab factor- binding element be involve in confer the responsiveness to cmv .
moreover , electrophoretic mobility shift assay demonstrate that cmv induce the formation of nf-kappab and ap-1 complex .
these result suggest that cmv activate these transcriptional factor , result in il-8 gene expression .
tissue-specific expression of the platelet gpiib gene .
one of the major objective in the study of thrombogenesis be to determine the mechanism by which a hematopoietic progenitor be activate and commit to the megakaryocytic lineage .
recent development of primary culture of human megakaryocyte and the molecular cloning of gene that be specific to this lineage offer the possibility of get some insight into the genetic mechanism that control megakaryocytopoiesis .
one gene of interest be the glycoprotein iib ( gpiib ) gene ; gpiib , the alpha subunit of the platelet cytoadhesin gpiib-iiia , be produce in megakaryocyte at an early stage of the differentiation , whereas the other subunit of this complex , gpiiia , be express in other cell .
for these reason , the 5'-flanking region of the gpiib gene be use to identify the region that interact with dna-binding nuclear factor .
a fragment extend from -643 to +33 be capable of control the tissue-specific expression of the cat gene in transfection experiment .
within this region , we have identify several sequence that be implicate in dna protein interaction a show in dnase i footprint and gel mobility shift assay .
one region , center at -54 , be similar to a nuclear factor e1-binding site , and a region located at position -233 contain a ccaat motif .
two domain center at position -345 and -540 , respectively , bind protein that be present in megakaryocytic cell and nonrelated cell as well .
finally , two other domain , located at position -460 and -510 , interact with protein that be only present in megakaryocytic cell .
in addition , deletion of the region contain these two domain result in a significant decrease of the promoter activity .
it be very likely that these domain bind megakaryocyte-specific nuclear protein act a positive transcription factor .
the c-terminus of the b cell activator oct-2 function a an activation domain in yeast .
oct-1 and oct-2 be human transcriptional activator that bind to the same dna element but activate distinct set of gene .
we express these factor in s._cerevisiae and observe great than 5-fold stimulation of a lacz reporter gene only with oct-2 .
transfer of the oct-2 c-terminal domain onto either oct-1 ( oct1.2 ) or a nonactivating dna-binding domain from gal4 create activator capable of great than 15 and 10-fold stimulation of activity , respectively .
thus , the c-terminus of oct-2 be sufficient to confer activation potential to nonactive dna-binding fragment in yeast .
human 15-lipoxygenase gene promoter : analysis and identification of dna binding site for il-13-induced regulatory factor in monocyte .
in order to study the transcriptional control of 15-lo expression , we have clone and sequence the human 15-lo promoter region .
the 15-lo promoter be associate with a cpg island at the 5'-end of the gene , and sequence analysis reveal putative sp1 and ap2 binding site/s and absence of tata or caat motif .
transcription be initiate at one major site .
use deletion construct , we have define an active promoter region of 1056 bp .
gel-shift assay reveal that transcriptional factor ( s ) induce only in response to il-13 treatment of human peripheral blood monocyte bind to the 15-lo promoter dna .
two region , dp1 ( -140 to -92 bp ) and dp2 ( -353 to -304 bp ) of the promoter be essential for transcription in hela cell and human peripheral monocyte .
hela nuclear extract contain a specific nuclear factor ( s ) bind to 15-lo promoter dna which be distinct from those derive from il-13 -treated human peripheral monocyte nuclear extract .
in addition , fluorescent in situ hybridization ( fish ) result refine the previous localization of 15-lo to human chromosome 17p13.3 .
tal1 and lim-only protein synergistically induce retinaldehyde dehydrogenase 2 expression in t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia by act a cofactor for gata3 .
previously , we have show that tal1 and the lim-only protein gene ( lmo ) be regularly coactivated in t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( t-all ) .
this observation be likely to relate to the finding that tal1 and lmo be highly synergistic in t-cell tumorigenesis in double- transgenic mouse .
to understand the molecular mechanism of functional synergy between tal1 and lmo in tumorigenesis and transcriptional regulation , we try to identify downstream target gene regulate by tal1 and lmo by a subtractive pcr method .
one of the isolate gene , that for retinaldehyde dehydrogenase 2 ( raldh2 ) , be regularly express in most of the t-all cell line that coexpressed tal1 and lmo .
exogenously transfected tal1 and lmo , but not either alone , induce raldh2 expression in a t-all cell line , hpb-all , not express endogeneous tal1 or lmo .
the raldh2 transcript in t-all be , however , mostly initiate within the second intron .
promoter analysis reveal that a gata site in a cryptic promoter in the second intron be essential and sufficient for the tal1- and lmo- dependent transcriptional activation , and gata3 bind to this site .
in addition , force expression of gata3 potentiate the induction of raldh2 by tal1 and lmo , and these three factor form a complex in vivo .
furthermore , a tal1 mutant not bind to dna also activate the transcription of raldh2 in the presence of lmo and gata3 .
collectively , we have identify the raldh2 gene a a first example of direct transcriptional target gene regulate by tal1 and lmo in t-all .
in this case , tal1 and lmo act a cofactor for gata3 to activate the transcription of raldh2
expression of c-fos and c-jun protein and ap-1 binding activity during cell cycle progression of hl60 cell and phytohemagglutinin -stimulated lymphocyte .
the protein product of the c-fos ( p62c-fos ) and c-jun ( p39c-jun ) gene be member of the ap-1 transcription factor family and be think to play important role in the regulation of gene expression during the cell cycle .
most study on the expression of these protein in relation to the cell cycle have be perform at the mrna level , and therefore do not give direct information about the presence of the protein during the cell cycle .
we have use western blotting to investigate the presence of these protein during the cell cycle of two different cellular system : a continuously grow myeloid leukemic cell line , hl60 , and normal cell stimulate into cycle , phyto-_hemagglutinin ( pha ) -stimulated normal human peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) .
the binding activity of transcription factor ap-1 , which consist of dimer of fo and jun family protein , be also study use a gel shift assay .
we find nuclear p62c-fos , p39c-jun , and ap-1 binding activity throughout the cell cycle both in hl60 cell and in pha -stimulated pbl , and we postulate that these protein be require throughout the cell cycle and not transiently in the g0 to g1 transition a previous mrna study have indicate .
we demonstrate an uncoupling of ap-1 binding activity from p62c-fos , and p39c-jun ap-1 activity be express more strongly in the g1- and g2/m- phase enriched sample than in the s-phase enriched sample of hl60 cell , while level of nuclear p62c-fos and p39c-jun be constant .
nucleus of unstimulated pbl from different donor express p62c-fos and p39c-jun , but ap-1 be not detect in the majority of sample .
follow pha stimulation of pbl , the increase in ap-1 activity be delay with respect to the augmentation of p39c-jun expression .
we also observe that cytoplasmic p62c-fos and p39c-jun be present in hl60 cell and pha -stimulated pbl .
however , no cytoplasmic p62c-fos be detect in unstimulated pbl , although in some case cytoplasmic p39c-jun be detect , suggest that subcellular compartmentalization of these protein may occur under certain circumstance .

expression of the il-2 gene require activation of t cell through stimulation of the tcr and costimulation through accessory receptor .

interleukin 2 and 15 activate stat3alpha in human t lymphocyte .
signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 ( stat3 ) have recently be show to exist in two alternatively splice isoforms , a short form , stat3beta , and a long form , stat3alpha , display difference in transcriptional activity .
it be unknown which stat3 isoform ( s ) be activate in response to interleukin ( il ) -2 and il-15 .
here , cytokine -induced activation of stat3 in previously activate cd4(+) human t cell be examine use stat3 antibody direct against different region of stat3 .

in contrast , minimal or no activation of stat3beta be observe , suggest that il-2 and il-15 predominantly activate stat3alpha in human cd4(+) t cell .
in this way , diversity in the expression and activation of stat3 protein may provide additional mean of regulate cytokine -induced t cell response .

nuclear localization of relb be associate with effective antigen-presenting cell function .
dendritic cell ( dc ) be potent apc that enter rest tissue a precursor and , after ag exposure , differentiate and migrate to drain lymph node .
the phenotype of relb knockout mouse implicate this member of the nf kappa b/rel family in dc differentiation .
to far elucidate the role of relb in dc differentiation , mrna , intracellular protein expression , and dna binding activity of relb be examine in immature and differentiate human dc , as well a other pb mononuclear cell population .

immunohistochemical staining demonstrate relb within the differentiate lymph node interdigitating dc and follicular dc , but not undifferentiated dc in normal skin .
active nuclear relb be detect by supershift assay only in differentiated dc derive from either pb precursor or monocyte and in activate b cell .
these relb + apc be potent stimulators of the mlr .
the data indicate that relb expression be regulate both transcriptionally and post-translationally in myeloid cell .
within the nucleus , relb may specifically transactivate gene that be critical for apc function .
biphasic control of nuclear factor-kappa b activation by the t cell receptor complex : role of tumor necrosis factor alpha .
the regulation of nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b activation by the t cell receptor ( tcr ) /cd3 complex in primary human t cell have be study at various time after activation .
only p50 nf-kappa b protein bind the kappa b element of interleukin-2 receptor ( il-2r ) alpha chain promoter on rest t cell .
however , immediately after tcr/cd3 cross-linking ( after approximately 1 h ; immediate ) binding of p50.p65 heterodimers be observe .
p50.c-rel heterodimers be also detect bind to this sequence at early time point ( 7-16 h ; early ) , and both remain active at late time point ( 40 h ; late ) after activation .
this regulation take place mainly at the level of nuclear translocation of p65 and c-rel , at immediate and early time point .
activation also induce c-rel and p105/p50 mrna synthesis , but not p65 mrna whose expression be constitutive .
interestingly , all those early and late event , but not the immediate one , be inhibit by a neutralize anti- tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) monoclonal antibody .
similarly , cycloheximide prevent the p65 and c-rel translocation and consequent formation of active binding heterodimers , at early and late time .
cyclosporin a impair not only early and late , but also immediate event ; however , addition of tnf-alpha prevent all inhibition .
these result indicate that the regulation of nf-kappa b activation during t cell activation by tcr/cd3 signal be biphasic : tcr/cd3 trigger it immediate translocation , which be transient if no tnf-alpha be present .
tnf-alpha , therefore , emerge a the main factor responsible for a second phase of nf-kappa b regulation , control both translocation of p65 and c-rel , and new mrna synthesis for c-rel and p105/p50 .
characterization of a novel t lymphocyte protein which bind to a site related to steroid/thyroid hormone receptor response element in the negative regulatory sequence of the human immunodeficiency virus long terminal repeat .
we have previously identify a t lymphocyte protein which bind to a site within the ltr of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) and exert an inhibitory effect on virus gene expression .

here we characterize the t cell protein bind to this site a a 100 kd protein which be most abundant in t cell and which bind to site b a a 200 kd complex .
this protein be distinct from other member of the steroid/thyroid hormone receptor family include the coup protein which have a closely related dna binding specificity .
a mechanism for the antiinflammatory effect of corticosteroid : the glucocorticoid receptor regulate leukocyte adhesion to endothelial cell and expression of endothelial-leukocyte adhesion molecule 1 and intercellular adhesion molecule 1 .
corticosteroid be the preeminent antiinflammatory agent although the molecular mechanism that impart their efficacy have not be define .
the endothelium play a critical role in inflammation by direct circulate leukocyte into extravascular tissue by express adhesive molecule for leukocyte [ e.g. , endothelial-leukocyte adhesion molecule 1 ( elam-1 ) and intercellular adhesion molecule 1 ( icam-1 ) ] .
we therefore determine whether corticosteroid suppress inflammation by inhibit endothelial expression of adhesion molecule for neutrophil ( polymorphonuclear leukocyte ) .
preincubation of endothelial cell with endotoxin [ lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , 1 microgram/ml ] lead to a 4-fold increase in subsequent adherence of polymorphonuclear leukocyte ( p < 0.0001 , n = 10 ) to endothelial cell , an increase that be markedly attenuate when endothelial cell be treat with dexamethasone ( ic50 < 1 nm , p < 0.0001 , n = 6 or 7 ) during preincubation with lp .
moreover , the steroid receptor agonist cortisol ( 10 microm ) , but not it inactive metabolite tetrahydrocortisol ( 10 microm ) , diminish lp -induced endothelial cell adhesiveness .
further evidence that the action of dexamethasone be mediate through ligation of corticosteroid receptor [ human glucocorticoid receptor ( hgrs ) ] be provide by experiment utilize the steroid antagonist ru-486 .
ru-486 ( 10 microm ) , which prevent translocation of ligate hgr to the nucleus by inhibit dissociation of hgr from heat shock protein 90 , completely abort the effect of dexamethasone on adhesiveness of endothelial cell ( p < 0.0005 , n = 3 ) .
treatment of endothelial cell with lp ( 1 microgram/ml ) stimulate transcription of elam-1 , a show by northern blot analysis , and expression of membrane-associated elam-1 and icam-1 , a show by quantitative immunofluorescence ( both p < 0.001 , n = 9 ) .
dexamethasone markedly inhibit lp -stimulated accumulation of mrna for elam-1 and expression of elam-1 and icam-1 ( ic50 < 10 nm , both p < 0.001 , n = 4-9 ) ; inhibition of expression by dexamethasone be reverse by ru-486 ( both p < 0.005 , n = 4-6 ) .
a in the adhesion study , cortisol but not tetrahydrocortisol inhibit expression of elam-1 and icam-1 ( both p < 0.005 , n = 3 or 4 ) .
in contrast , sodium salicylate ( 1 mm ) inhibit neither adhesion nor expression of these adhesion molecule .
these study suggest that antagonism by dexamethasone of endotoxin -induced inflammation be a specific instance of the general biological principle that the glucocorticoid receptor be a hormone-dependent regulator of transcription .
precise alignment of site require for mu enhancer activation in b cell .
the lymphocyte-specific immunoglobulin mu heavy-chain gene intronic enhancer be regulate by multiple nuclear factor .
the previously define minimal enhancer contain the mua , mue3 , and mub site be transactivated by a combination of the ets-domain protein pu.1 and ets-1 in nonlymphoid cell .
the core ggaas of the mua and mub site be separate by 30 nucleotide , suggest that ets protein bind to these site from these same side of the dna helix .
we test the necessity for appropriate spatial alignment of these element by use mutate enhancer with altered spacing .
a 4- or 10- bp insertion between mue3 and mub inactivate the mu enhancer in s194 plasma cell but do not affect in vitro binding of ets-1 , pu.1 , or the mue3 -binding protein tfe3 , alone or in pairwise combination .
circular permutation and phasing analysis demonstrate that pu.1 binding but not tfe3 or ets-1 bend mu enhancer dna toward the major groove .
we propose that the requirement for precise spacing of the mua and mub element be due in part to a directed dna bend induce by pu.1 .
common and distinct intracellular signaling pathway in human neutrophil utilize by platelet activating factor and fmlp .
stimulation of human neutrophil with chemoattractants fmlp or platelet activating factor ( paf ) result in different but overlap functional response .
we question whether these difference might reflect pattern of intracellular signal transduction .
stimulation with either paf or fmlp result in equivalent phosphorylation and activation of the mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) homologue 38-kd murine map kinase homologous to hog-1 ( p38 ) mapk .
neither fmlp nor paf activate c-jun nh2-terminal mapk ( jnks ) .
under identical condition , fmlp but not paf , result in significant p42/44 ( erk ) mapk activation .
both fmlp and paf activate map kinase kinase-3 ( mkk3 ) , a known activator of p38 mapk .
both map erk kinase kinase-1 ( mekk1 ) and raf be activate strongly by fmlp , but minimally by paf .
pertussis toxin block fmlp -induced activation of the p42/44 ( erk ) mapk cascade , but not that of p38 mapk .
a specific p38 mapk inhibitor ( sk&f 86002 ) block superoxide anion production in response to fmlp and reduce adhesion and chemotaxis in response to paf or fmlp .
these result demonstrate distinct pattern of intracellular signaling for two chemoattractants and suggest that selective activation of intracellular signaling cascade may underlie different pattern of functional response .
analysis of myeloid-associated gene in human hematopoietic progenitor cell .
the distribution of myeloid lineage-associated cytokine receptor and lysosomal protein be analyze in human cd34+ cord blood cell ( cb ) subset at different stage of myeloid commitment by reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) .
the highly specific granulomonocyte-associated lysosomal protein myeloperoxidase ( mpo ) and lysozyme ( lz ) , as well a the transcription factor pu.1 , be already detectable in the most immature cd34+thy-1+ subset .
messenger rna ( mrna ) level for the granulocyte-colony stimulating factor ( g-csf ) receptor , granulocyte-macrophage ( gm ) -csf receptor alpha subunit and tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) receptor i ( p55 ) and ii ( p75 ) be also detect in this subset in addition to c-kit and flt-3 , receptor know to be express on progenitor cell .
by contrast , the monocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor ( m-csf ) receptor be largely absent at this stage and in the cd34+thy-1-cd45ra- subset .
the m-csf receptor be first detectable in the myeloid-committed cd34+thy-l-cd45ra+ subset .
all other molecule study be find to be express at this stage of differentiation .
different cocktail of the identify ligand be add to sort cd34+thy-1+ single cell .
low proliferative capacity be observe after 1 week in culture in the presence of stem cell factor ( scf ) + flt-3 ligand ( fl ) + g-csf .
addition of gm-csf to this basic cocktail consistently increase the clonogenic capacity of single cd34+thy-1+ cell , and this effect be far enhance ( up to 72.3 +/- 4.3 % on day 7 ) by the inclusion of tnf-alpha .
in conclusion , the presence of myeloid-associated growth factor receptor transcript in cd34+ cb subset do not discriminate the various stage of differentiation , with the exception of the m-csf receptor .
in addition , we show that tnf-alpha be a potent costimulatory factor of the very immature cd34+thy-1+ cb subset .
nuclear appearance of a factor that bind the cd28 response element within the interleukin-2 enhancer correlate with interleukin-2 production .
activation of t lymphocyte require the combined signaling of the t cell receptor and costimulatory molecule such a cd28 .
the ability of t cell to produce interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) be a critical control point in t lymphocyte activation .
the il-2 enhancer contain a functional motif name cd28 response element ( cd28re ) that serve a role a a target for mitogenic t cell activation signal .
the cd28re sequence reveal similarity to the consensus kappab binding motif .
here we demonstrate that cd28re bind an inducible protein with a molecular mass of approximately 35 kda call nuclear factor of mitogenic-activated t cell ( nf-matp35 ) that be clearly different from the known nf-_kappab/ rel family member .
induction of nf-matp35 be show to depend on de novo protein synthesis and be restricted to t cell that receive a mitogenic combination of t cell stimulus , not necessarily include cd28 signaling .
nonmitogenic t cell stimulation do not result in appearance of nf-matp35 .
these result indicate that mitogenic combination of t cell activation signal be integrate at the level of nf-matp35 induction .
similar to it effect on il-2 production , cyclosporin a inhibit the induction of nf-matp35 .
take together , these data demonstrate that the nuclear appearance of nf-matp35 show excellent correlation with il-2 production , which be a unique characteristic among nuclear factor implicate in the control of il-2 gene expression .
natural variant of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat : analysis of promoter with duplicated dna regulatory motif .
sequence variation in the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) region of hiv-1 be analyze in viral isolates of 17 infected individual .
two class of ltr size variant be find .
one hiv-1 variant be detect contain an additional bind site for the transcription factor sp1 .
another ltr size variation be observe in four patient in a region just upstream of the nf-kappa b enhancer .
this variation be the result of a duplication of a short dna sequence ( ctg-motif ) .
cell culture experiment demonstrate that the natural variant with four sp1 site have a slightly high promoter activity and viral replication rate than the isogenic control ltr with three sp1 site .
no positive effect of the duplicated ctg-motif could be detect .
in order to measure small difference in virus production more accurately , equal amount of a size variant and the wild-type plasmid be cotransfected into t-cells .
the virus with four sp1 site do outgrow the three sp1 virus in 35 day of culture and ctg-monomer virus outcompeted the ctg-dimer virus in 42 day .
base on these result we estimate a 5-10 % difference in virus production of the ltr variant when compare to that of wild-type .
up-regulation of high-affinity dehydroepiandrosterone binding activity by dehydroepiandrosterone in activate human t lymphocyte .
although evidence indicate that dehydroepiandrosterone ( dhea ) exert direct physiological effect , it mechanism of action remain unknown .
dhea binding site be examine use a whole-cell binding assay in a human t lymphoid cell line , peer , reveal that a single class of high-affinity bind site for dhea ( dissociation constant = 7.4 +/- 0.53 nmol/l , mean +/- se , n = 4 ) be greatly increase when treat with dhea , phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate , and the ca2+ ionophore a23187 .
bind [3h] dhea be displaced sensitively by dhea and secondarily by dihydrotestosterone , but not effectively by other steroid , include dhea sulfate .
these result not only indicate the existence of a dhea receptor , but also suggest that t cell become susceptible to regulation by dhea during the process of signal-induced activation .
ligand-dependent repression of the erythroid transcription factor gata-1 by the estrogen receptor .
high-dose estrogen administration induce anemia in mammal .
in chicken , estrogen stimulate outgrowth of bone marrow-derived erythroid progenitor cell and delay their maturation .
this delay be associate with down-regulation of many erythroid cell-specific gene , include alpha- and beta- globin , band 3 , band 4.1 , and the erythroid cell-specific histone h5 .
we show here that estrogen also reduce the number of erythroid progenitor cell in primary human bone marrow culture .
to address potential mechanism by which estrogen suppress erythropoiesis , we have examine their effect on gata-1 , an erythroid transcription factor that participate in the regulation of the majority of erythroid cell-specific gene and be necessary for full maturation of erythrocyte .
we demonstrate that the transcriptional activity of gata-1 be strongly repress by the estrogen receptor ( er ) in a ligand-dependent manner and that this repression be reversible in the presence of 4-hydroxytamoxifen .
er -mediated repression of gata-1 activity occur on an artificial promoter contain a single gata-binding site , as well a in the context of an intact promoter which be normally regulate by gata-1 .
gata-1 and er bind to each other in vitro in the absence of dna .
in coimmunoprecipitation experiment use transfected co cell , gata-1 and er associate in a ligand-dependent manner .
mapping experiment indicate that gata-1 and the er form at least two contact , which involve the finger region and the n-terminal activation domain of gata-1 .
we speculate that estrogen exert effect on erythropoiesis by modulate gata-1 activity through protein-protein interaction with the er .
