high-level replication of human immunodeficiency virus in thymocytes require nf-kappab activation through interaction with thymic epithelial cell .
we have previously demonstrate that interaction of infected thymocytes with autologous thymic epithelial cell ( tec ) be a prerequisite for a high level of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication in thymocytes ( m.rothe , l.chene , m.nugeyre , f.barre-sinoussi , and n.israel , j.virol.72 : 5852-5861 , 1998 ) .
we report here that this activation of hiv replication take place at the transcriptional level through activation of the rel/ nf-kappab transcription factor .
we first demonstrate that an hiv-1 provirus ( sf-2 strain ) very effectively replicate in thymocytes cocultured with tec whereas this provirus , with kappab site delete , fail to replicate .
we provide evidence that several nf-kappab complex be constitutively find in the nucleus of thymocytes either freshly isolate from the thymus or maintain in coculture with autologous or heterologous tec .
the prevalent complex be the heterodimer p50-p65 .
nf-kappab activity be tightly correlate with the transcriptional activity of a long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of hiv-1 transfected in thymocytes .
the cotransfection of this ltr with a mutate ikappabalpha molecule formally demonstrate that ltr transactivation be regulate by member of the rel/ nf-kappab family in thymocytes .
we also show that tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) and to a less extent interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) , secrete within the coculture , induce nf-kappab activity and a correlative ltr transactivation .
however il-7 , a crucial factor for thymopoiesis that be secrete mainly by tec , be a necessary cofactor for nf-kappab activation elicit by tnf or il-1 .
together , these data indicate that nf-kappab activation , require for a high level of hiv replication in thymocytes , be regulate in a specific manner in the thymic microenvironment which provide the necessary cytokine : tnf , il-1 , and il-7 .
the transcriptionally active factor mediate the effect of the htlv-i tax transactivator on the il-2r alpha kappa b enhancer include the product of the c-rel proto-oncogene .
the transactivator htlv-i tax activate the promoter of the gene cod for the interleukin 2 alpha-chain receptor ( il-2r alpha ) via a kappa b site that can bind several protein specie of the rel family .
tax1 strongly activate the enhancer activity of this motif , in both epithelial hela and lymphoid jurkat cell .
this activation be not observe in undifferentiated embryocarcinoma f9 cell .
overexpression of the p50 , p65 and rel protein in these cell show that significant activation of the il-2r alpha kappa b site be observe only with rel and rel plus p65 .
moreover , whereas both tax and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) be able to efficiently induce the binding of nf-kappa b to the il-2r alpha kappa b site , pma be functionally inactive .
use the dna affinity precipitation assay , we observe that tax1 be able to efficiently induce the binding of rel , whereas pma be not .
this establish a clear difference between both stimulus , indicate that rel be the functionally active factor .
we conclude from these result that the functional activity of member of the rel family be regulate by their interaction with dna and that rel can be a potent transcriptional activator on specific kappa b site .
evaluation of the role of ligand and thermal activation of specific dna binding by in vitro synthesize human glucocorticoid receptor .
we have use a dna-binding/immunoprecipitation assay to analyze the capacity of human glucocorticoid receptor ( hgr ) , generate in rabbit reticulocyte lysates , to bind dna .
in vitro translate hgr be indistinguishable from native hgr , a determine by migration on sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel , sedimentation on sucrose density gradient , and reactivity with antipeptide antibody generate against hgr .
in addition , cell-free synthesize hgr be capable of specific binding to glucocorticoid response element ( gre ) -containing dna fragment .
use this assay system , we have evaluate the contribution of ligand binding and heat activation to dna binding by these glucocorticoid receptor .
in vitro translate hgr be capable of selective dna binding even in the absence of glucocorticoid .
treatment with dexamethasone or the antiglucocorticoid ru486 have no additional effect on the dna-binding capacity when receptor preparation be maintain at 0 c ( no activation ) .
in contrast , addition of either ligand or antagonist in combination with a heat activation step promote dna binding by approximately 3-fold over that of heat-activated unliganded receptor .
agonist ( dexamethasone ) be slightly more effective in support specific dna binding than antagonist ( ru486 ) .
dna binding by in vitro synthesize gr be block by the addition of sodium molybdate to the receptor preparation before steroid addition and thermal activation .
addition of kcl result in less dna binding either due to blockage of dna- receptor complex formation or disruption of the complex .
the specificity of dna binding by cell-free synthesize hgr be analyze far by examine the ability of various dna to compete for bind to a naturally occur gre find in the mouse mammary tumor virus-long terminal repeat .
oligonucleotides contain the consensus gre be the most efficient competitor , and fragment contain regulatory sequence from glucocorticoid -repressible gene be somewhat competitive , whereas single stranded oligonucleotides be unable to compete for mouse mammary tumor virus-long terminal repeat dna binding , except when competitor be present at extremely high concentration .
together these study indicate that hgr synthesize in rabbit reticulocyte lysates display many of the same property , include gre -specific dna binding , observe for glucocorticoid receptor present in cytosolic extract of mammalian cell and tissue .
similarity between the effect of dexamethasone and ru486 suggest that the antiglucocorticoid property of ru486 do not occur at the level of specific dna binding .
the transcription factor c-myb and c/ebp alpha regulate the monocytic/myeloic gene mrp14 .
the entry of microorganism into the body induce inflammatory process .
during this process a sequence of cellular , humoral , non-specific and specific action be evoke to combat the infection .
macrophage and granulocyte , which be develop from a common progenitor cell , be the cellular component of the specific and non-specific immunoreaction .
mrp14 ( macrophage migration inhibitory related protein ) and mrp8 , two s-100 protein contain in high concentration in these cell be obviously essential for adhesion and migration of monocyte and granulocyte .
to investigate the transcriptional regulation of these gene we cotransfected construct express cat under control of the mrp14 promoter and expression construct of c/ebp alpha and v-myb , two transcription factor involve in myeloid/monocytic differentiation .
transfection with c/ebp alpha reveal a massive enhancement of the mrp14 promoter in both , hl 60 cell ( granulocytic differentiate ) and l132 fibroblast .
in contrast , v-myb reduce mrp14 promoter activity .
northern blot analysis of l132 cell transfected with the c/ebp alpha expression vector demonstrate that c/ebp alpha be sufficient to enhance mrp14 expression in the context of the whole genome .
the promoter and 5' flanking sequence control human b29 gene expression .
the product of the b-cell-specific b29 gene ( b29 , ig beta , cd79b ) be essential for ig-mediated b-cell activation via the b-cell antigen receptor complex ( bcr ) on human and murine b lymphocyte .
to well understand the regulation of this pivotal gene , we have analyze the human genomic dna sequence upstream of the b29 atg start codon for transcriptional control activity .
the human b29 gene lack either a tata or a caat box and transcription be initiate at multiple site .
the minimal promoter of the human b29 gene be contain within a 193-bp region 5' of these multiple start site .
this minimal promoter exhibit b-cell-specific activity and contain sp1 , ets , oct , and ikaros/lyf-1 transcription factor motif .
all these motif be strikingly conserve in sequence and placement relative to the previously characterize murine b29 promoter .
additional upstream gene segment dramatically affect b29 minimal promoter activity .
a newly identify motif call the b29 conserve sequence ( bcs ) , find upstream of both human and murine b29 promoter , appear to stimulate b29 transcription through a novel mechanism .
a single bcs have little effect either on the minimal b29 promoter or on a heterologous promoter .
instead , the bcs stimulate transcription by counteract 5' negative regulatory dna sequence that block the activity of the b29 minimal promoter in it absence .
these finding indicate that b29 gene expression be control by the complex interplay of positive and negative regulatory element .
expression status of bcl-6 and syndecan-1 identify distinct histogenetic subtypes of hodgkin 's disease .
the tumor cell in most case of hodgkin 's disease ( hd ) have be recently recognize to originate from the b-cell lineage , but their precise differentiation stage be not fully clarify .
recently , we have report that the histogenesis of b-cell lymphoma may be assess by monitor the expression pattern of bcl-6 , a transcription factor express in germinal center ( gc ) b cell , and cd138/ syndecan-1 ( syn-1 ) , a proteoglycan associate with post-gc , terminal b-cell differentiation .
in this study , we have apply these two marker to the study of hd histogenesis .
we have find that in nodular lymphocyte predominance hd ( nlphd ) tumor cell consistently display the bcl-6 (+)/ syn-1 (-) phenotype , indicate their derivation from gc b cell .
conversely , classic hd ( chd ) be heterogeneous because the tumor cell of a fraction of chd display the bcl-6 (-)/ syn-1 (+) phenotype of post-gc b-cells , whereas another fraction of chd be constitute by a mixture of tumor cell reflect the gc ( bcl-6 (+)/ syn-1 (-) ) or post-gc ( bcl-6 (-)/ syn-1 (+) ) phenotype .
bcl-6 (-)/ syn-1 (+) tumor cell of chd be mostly find surround by t cell express cd40l , consistent with the observation that cd40 signaling downregulates bcl-6 expression .
these data indicate that tumor cell of nlphd uniformly display a gc b-cell phenotype , whereas the phenotype of tumor cell of chd appear to be modulate by the surrounding cellular background , particularly cd40l + reactive t cell .
a novel human homeobox gene distantly related to proboscipedia be express in lymphoid and pancreatic tissue .
a novel human homeobox gene , hb9 , be isolate from a cdna library prepare from in vitro stimulate human tonsil b lymphocyte and from a human genomic library .
the hb9 gene be compose of 3 exon spread over 6 kilobases of dna .
an open reading frame of 1206 nucleotide be in frame with a diverged homeodomain .
the predict hb9 protein have a molecular mass of 41 kilodaltons and be enriched for alanine , glycine , and leucine .
the hb9 homeodomain be most similar to that of the drosophila melanogaster homeobox gene proboscipedia .
northern blot analysis of poly(a) rna purify from the human b cell line rpmi 8226 and from activate t cell reveal a major mrna transcript of 2.2 kilobases .
similar analysis of poly(a) rna from a variety of adult tissue demonstrate hb9 transcript in pancreas , small intestine , and colon .
reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction be use to examine hb9 rna transcript in hematopoietic cell line .
hb9 rna transcript be most prevalent in several human b cell line and k562 cell .
in addition , transcript be detect in rna prepare from tonsil b cell and in situ hybridization study localize them in the germinal center region of adult tonsil .
these finding suggest the involvement of hb9 in regulate gene transcription in lymphoid and pancreatic tissue .
jak1 expression be require for mediate interleukin-4-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of insulin receptor substrate and stat6 signaling molecule .
the jak1 , jak2 , jak3 , and fe tyrosine kinase have be demonstrate to undergo tyrosine phosphorylation in response to interleukin ( il ) -4 stimulation in different cell system .
however , it be not clear which , if any , of these kinase be responsible for initiate il-4-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of intracellular substrate in vivo .
in the present study , we have utilize a mutant jak1 -deficient hela cell line , e1c3 , and it parental jak1 -expressing counterpart , 1d4 , to analyze the role of jak1 in mediate il-4-induced tyrosine phosphorylation event .
il-4 treatment rapidly induce tyrosine phosphorylation of insulin receptor substrate ( irs ) -1 and irs-2 in 1d4 but not in e1c3 cell .
il-4 -mediated tyrosine phosphorylation of stat6 be pronounce in 1d4 cell , while no il-4 -induced stat6 phosphorylation be detect in e1c3 cell .
il-4 also induce stat6 dna binding activity from lysates of 1d4 but not e1c3 cell utilize a radiolabeled immunoglobulin heavy chain germline epsilon promotor sequence ( iepsilon ) in an electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
reconstitution of jak1 expression in e1c3 cell restore the ability of il-4 to induce irs and stat6 tyrosine phosphorylation .
these result provide evidence that jak1 expression be require for mediate tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of crucial molecule involve in il-4 signal transduction .
human immunodeficiency virus type-1 transcription : role of the 5'-untranslated leader region ( review ) .
human immunodeficiency virus type-1 ( hiv-1 ) transcription be dependent on the interaction of host-cell transcription factor with cis-regulatory dna element within the viral long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
much attention have focus on the series of sequence element upstream of the transcriptional initiation site in the u3 region of the ltr include the sp1 and nf-kappab binding site .
recent study , however , demonstrate that the transcribe 5'-untranslated leader region ( 5'-utr ) also contain important transcriptional element .
these regulatory element situated downstream of transcription interact with constitutive and inducible transcription factor , mediate transmission of cellular activation signal , and be important for efficient hiv-1 transcription and replication .
the 5'-utr contain bind site for the transcription factor ap-1 , nf-kappab , nf-at , irf , and sp1 .
mutation in these bind site can interfere with the viral response to cell activation signal , decrease ltr transcription , and inhibit viral replication .
the 5'-utr also interact with a specific nucleosome that be rapidly displace during transcriptional activation of the latent provirus .
we propose that the inducible transcription factor binding site in the 5'-utr comprise a downstream enhancer domain that can function independent of , or in concert with , the ltr promoter to rapidly increase latent proviral transcription in response to cell activation signal .
in this review , we describe the host-cell transcription factor that interact with the 5'-utr and discuss their role in the transcriptional regulation of hiv-1 gene expression .
a shorten life span of eklf-/- adult erythrocyte , due to a deficiency of beta-globin chain , be ameliorate by human gamma-globin chain .
use homologous recombination , both eklf allele in murine embryonic stem ( e ) cell be inactivate .
these eklf-/- e cell be capable of undergo in vitro differentiation to form definitive erythroid colony that be similar in size and number to those form by wild-type e cell .
however , the eklf-/- colony be poorly hemoglobinized and enucleate erythrocyte in these colony contain numerous heinz body .
reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) analysis reveal that adult and embryonic globin gene be appropriately regulate , with the exception of beta h1-globin , which continue to be express at a very low level .
the ratio of adult beta-globin/alpha-globin mrna in the mutant e cell be 1/15 of that in wild-type e cell .
when the eklf-/- cell be inject into blastocyst , they do not contribute at a detectable level to the mature erythrocyte compartment of the chimeric animal , base on analysis of glucose phosphate isomerase-1 ( gpi-1 ) isozymes and hemoglobin that distinguish e cell-derived erythrocyte from host blastocyst-derived erythrocyte .
in contrast , semiquantitative rt-pcr analysis of rna from reticulocyte of the same chimeric animal suggest that the e cell-derived reticulocyte be present at a level of 6 % to 8 % .
this indicate that the eklf-/- erythrocyte in adult animal must be short-lived , apparently due to the imbalance of beta- versus alpha- globin chain , lead to the precipitation of excess alpha-globin chain to form heinz body .
consistent with this hypothesis , the short life span be ameliorate by introduction into the eklf-/- e cell of a human lcr/gamma-globin gene , a evidence by the presence of e cell-derived reticulocyte as well a mature erythrocyte in the blood of the chimeric animal .
expression of the nucleoside diphosphate kinase in human skin cancer : an immunohistochemical study .
expression of nucleoside diphosphate ( ndp ) kinase , which be homologous to the nm23 gene product in a variety of specie , have be find to be inversely associate with metastatic potential .
however , the relationship remain controversial accord to the tumor cell type and experimental system , with conflict result from different research group .
in order to determine whether ndp kinase expression serve a a marker for metastatic potential in human skin cancer , we assess the level of ndp kinase expression in 9 keratoacanthoma ( ka ) , 26 squamous cell carcinoma ( sccs ) , and 25 basal cell carcinoma ( bccs ) use immunohistochemistry .
the expression of ndp kinase be intense in ka and scc compare with bcc .
however , the difference of ndp kinase expression between ka and scc be not statistically significant .
and there be no statistically significant difference in ndp kinase expression between scc with metastasis and scc without metastasis .
our result contradict the hypothesis concern the possible role of nm23 gene a a metastatic suppressor gene in human skin cancer .
the mechanism of overexpression in various tumor cell type and it biological significance in cutaneous carcinogenesis remain to be determine .
induction of bcl-2 expression by phosphorylated creb protein during b-cell activation and rescue from apoptosis .
engagement of surface immunoglobulin on mature b cell lead to rescue from apoptosis and to proliferation .
level of bcl-2 mrna and protein increase with cross-linking of surface immunoglobulin .
we have located the major positive regulatory region for control of bcl-2 expression in b cell in the 5'-flanking region .
the positive region can be divide into an upstream and a downstream regulatory region .
the downstream regulatory region contain a cyclic amp -responsive element ( cre ) .
we show by antibody supershift experiment and uv cross-linking follow by denature polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis that both creb and atf family member bind to this region in vitro .
mutation of the cre site that result in loss of creb binding also lead to loss of functional activity of the bcl-2 promoter in transient-transfection assay .
the presence of an active cre site in the bcl-2 promoter imply that the regulation of bcl-2 expression be link to a signal transduction pathway in b cell .
treatment of the mature b-cell line bal-17 with either anti-immunoglobulin m or phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate lead to an increase in bcl-2 expression that be mediate by the cre site .
treatment of the more immature b-cell line , ramos , with phorbol ester rescue the cell from calcium-dependent apoptosis .
bcl-2 expression be increase follow phorbol ester treatment , and the increase expression be dependent on the cre site .
these stimulus result in phosphorylation of creb at serine 133 .
the phosphorylation of creb that result in activation be mediate by protein kinase c rather than by protein kinase a .
although the cre site be necessary , optimal induction of bcl-2 expression require participation of the upstream regulatory element , suggest that phosphorylation of creb alter it interaction with the upstream regulatory element .
the cre site in the bcl-2 promoter appear to play a major role in the induction of bcl-2 expression during the activation of mature b cell and during the rescue of immature b cell from apoptosis .
it be possible that the cre site be responsible for induction of bcl-2 expression in other cell type , particularly those in which protein kinase c be involve .
ciprofloxacin induce an immunomodulatory stress response in human t lymphocyte .
exposure of cell to adverse environmental condition invoke a genetically program series of event result in the induction of specific gene .
the fluoroquinolone antibiotic ciprofloxacin have recently be report to upregulate interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene induction .
in the present investigation , the effect of ciprofloxacin at supratherapeutic concentration on immediate-early ( < 2 h ) gene expression in primary human peripheral blood lymphocyte be study with northern blot .
in addition , transcriptional activity of il-2 and metallothionein enhancer and promoter region and transcription factor ap-1 , nf-kappab , and nf-at be analyze by chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) and electrophoretic mobility shift assay , respectively .
the concentration of c-fos , c-jun , c-myc , junb , and fra-1 mrna be increase in activate peripheral blood lymphocyte incubate with ciprofloxacin compare to that in untreated control .
ciprofloxacin increase cat activity in stimulate lymphocyte transfected with plasmid contain either the il-2 or metallothionein enhancer .
furthermore , among the transcription factor test , ap-1 activity be increase in stimulate purify t helper lymphocyte incubate with ciprofloxacin compare to drug-free control .
take together , ciprofloxacin increase the level of immediate-early transcript , enhance il-2 and metallothionein promoter induction , and upregulated ap-1 concentration in primary lymphocyte , reflect a program commonly observe in mammalian stress response .
differential effect of protein kinase c inhibitor on fibronectin -induced interleukin-beta gene transcription , protein synthesis and secretion in human monocytic cell .
human monocytic cell express interleukin-1beta ( il-1beta ) when stimulate with the extracellular matrix glycoprotein , fibronectin ( fn ) .
protein kinase c ( pkc ) activation be consider important for this process ; however , the metabolic step at which pkc act upon to mediate the fn -induced il-1beta response remain unclear .
we perform an analysis of the mechanism by which two pkc inhibitor , calphostin c and staurosporine , prevent the fn -induced il-1beta response .
both inhibitor block the secretion of il-1beta protein into the medium of peripheral blood mononuclear cell expose to fn .
immunoprecipitation analysis reveal that unde3r these circumstance , calphostin c inhibit the production of il-1beta protein , whereas staurosporine allow protein production , but inhibit it secretion .
to determine the mechanism responsible for these difference , we turn to human u937 promonocytic cell .
u937 cell transfected with the human full-length il-1beta promoter connect to a luciferase reporter gene be submit to transcription assay , northern blotting , and dna electrophoresis mobility gel shift assay .
these study reveal that calphostin c inhibit the nuclear translocation of the transcription factor activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) which be consider necessary for fn induction of il-1beta gene transcription , and prevent the transcription of the il-1beta gene .
in contrast , staurosporine alone induce ap-1 translocation and stimulation of the gene .
overall , our data indicate that calphostin c prevent the transcription of the il-1beta gene thereby inhibit protein synthesis .
base on the high specificity of this compound for pkc , we conclude that pkc be necessary for fn -induced il-1beta protein production .
in contrast , staurosporine prevent secretion of il-1beta by unknown mechanism
dysregulation of monocytic nuclear factor-kappa b by oxidize low-density lipoprotein .
nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) /rel transcription factor may be involve in atherosclerosis , a be suggest by the presence of activate nf-kappa b in human atherosclerotic lesion .
the aim of the present study be to investigate the effect of oxidize ldl ( oxldl ) on the nf-kappa b system in human thp-1 monocytic cell as well a adherent monocyte .
our result demonstrate that short-term incubation of these cell with oxldl activate p50/p65 contain nf-kappa b dimer and induce the expression of the target gene il-8 .
this activation of nf-kappa b be inhibit by the antioxidant and h2o2 scavenger pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate and the proteasome inhibitor psi .
the oxldl -induced nf-kappa b activation be accompany by an initial depletion of i kappa b-alpha follow by a slight transient increase in the level of this inhibitor protein .
in contrast , long-term treatment with oxldl prevent the lipopolysaccharide -induced depletion of i kappa b-alpha , accompany by an inhibition of both nf-kappa b activation and the expression of tumor necrosis factor-alpha and interleukin-1 beta gene .
these observation provide additional evidence that oxldl be a potent modulator of gene expression and suggest that ( dys ) regulation of nf-kappa b /rel be likely to play an important role in atherogenesis .
differential utilization of janus kinase -signal transducer activator of transcription signaling pathway in the stimulation of human natural killer cell by il-2 , il-12 , and ifn-alpha .
il-2- , il-12- , and ifn-alpha- mediated signaling pathway be analyze in primary nk cell and in the nk3.3 cell line .
gel mobility shift and immunoprecipitation analysis reveal that in addition to activate stat3 ( signal transducer and activator of transcription-3 ) and stat5 , il-2 induce tyrosine and serine phosphorylation of stat1 alpha , which form ifn-gamma-activated sequence-binding complex by itself and with stat3 .
although il-2 and ifn-alpha activate stat1 alpha and stat5 , il-2 predominantly activate stat5 , while ifn-alpha predominantly activate stat1 alpha .
il-2 induce less stat1 alpha activation and ifn-alpha induce great stat5 activation in nk3.3 cell compare with preactivated primary nk cell .
in nk3.3 cell , il-2 induce comparable formation of c-fos promoter sis-inducible element ifn-gamma-activated sequence-binding complex contain stat3 alone with complex contain stat3 and stat1 alpha , while in preactivated primary nk cell , it preferentially induce complex contain stat3 and stat1 alpha .
thus , signaling in nk3.3 cell be not always identical with that in primary nk cell .
in contrast to il-2 and ifn-alpha , il-12 induce strong tyrosine phosphorylation of stat4 and variable weak phosphorylation of stat3 .
however , supershift analysis use the c-fos promoter sis-inducible element probe show that il-12 activate stat4 , stat1 alpha , and stat3 , and induce complex contain stat4 only , stat4 with stat1 alpha , stat3 with stat1 alpha , or stat1 alpha only in preactivated primary nk cell .
stat1 alpha activation by il-12 correlate with increase phosphorylation of serine , but not tyrosine .
finally , il-2 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of jak1 and jak3 , while il-12 induce phosphorylation of jak2 and tyk2 in both preactivated primary nk and nk3.3 cell .
differential phosphorylation and consequent differential activation of both separate and overlapping stat protein by il-2 , il-12 , and ifn-alpha may provide a molecular basis for the similarity and difference in the action of these cytokine on nk cell .
an interferon-gamma activation sequence mediate the transcriptional regulation of the igg fc receptor type ic gene by interferon-gamma .
expression of the igg fc receptor type i ( fc gamma ri ) on myeloid cell be dramatically increase by treatment with interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) .
we observe that fc gamma ri transcript level in monoblast-like u937 cell be elevate within 3 hr and peak 12 hr after exposure to ifn-gamma .
treatment of u937 with ifn-gamma for 9 hr in the presence of cycloheximide lead to super-induction of fc gamma ri expression .
nuclear run-on analysis reveal that the rate of fc gamma ri transcription be increase by ifn-gamma .
genomic sequence upstream of the fc gamma ric gene be clone and subject to primer extension analysis , which demonstrate a single transcription initiation site without a tata box .
transient transfections of cat reporter gene construct contain various fc gamma ric promoter sequence into u937 cell reveal that a 20-bp region surround the transcription start site ( -7 to +13 ) be capable of mediate transcription initiation and that an ifn-gamma responsive element ( gire ) be present within 74 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site .
a 17-bp sequence between position -51 and -35 confer ifn-gamma responsiveness on a heterologous promoter .
double-stranded gire sequence , but not a scramble sequence , be specifically bind by nuclear protein from ifn-gamma treated u937 cell .
gel shift experiment far show that the stat1 alpha protein bind to the fc gamma ric gire in response to ifn-gamma treatment of u937 cell .
the fc gamma ric gire be homologous to the ifn-gamma activation sequence ( gas ) of the guanylate binding protein and to x box element of class ii mhc gene .
our result demonstrate that transcriptional regulation of the fc gamma ric gene by ifn-gamma involve the binding of stat1 alpha to a 17-bp gas homology in the proximal promoter .
relationship between glucocorticoid receptor and response to glucocorticoid therapy in ulcerative colitis .
purpose : to clarify the relationship between the glucocorticoid receptor and the effectiveness of glucocorticoid therapy in patient with ulcerative colitis , we investigate the number and apparent dissociation constant of glucocorticoid receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear leukocyte of patient with ulcerative colitis .
material and method : eleven patient with ulcerative colitis ( 5 who respond to intravenous glucocorticoid and 6 who do not ) and ten control subject be study .
the number and apparent dissociation constant of glucocorticoid receptor be measure use a whole-cell binding assay .
result be express a a median ( interquartile range ) .
result : the number of glucocorticoid receptor from the six nonresponders , five responder , and ten healthy control be 4922 ( range , 4484-5643 ) , 3413 ( range , 3183-4450 ) , and 3610 ( range , 2594-3979 ) bind sites/cell , respectively .
the apparent dissociation constant of the glucocorticoid receptor from the nonresponders , responder , and healthy control be 7.03 ( range , 5.66-10 ) , 4.27 ( range , 4-5.13 ) , and 6.18 ( range , 5.86-6.74 ) nm , respectively .
nonresponders have a significant increase both in the number of bind site and in the apparent dissociation constant compare with responder ( p = 0.045 ; p = 0.029 ) .
conclusion : the increase number and apparent dissociation constant of glucocorticoid receptor be closely associate with the effectiveness of glucocorticoid therapy .
the measurement of the number and apparent dissociation constant of glucocorticoid receptor may be useful in predict response to glucocorticoid .
tolerance to lipopolysaccharide involve mobilization of nuclear factor kappa b with predominance of p50 homodimers .
stimulation of the human monocytic cell line mono mac 6 with lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) lead to rapid and transient expression of cytokine like tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) .
when such cell be precultured for 2 day with a low dose of lp ( 20 ng/ml ) follow by stimulation with a high dose of lp ( 1 microgram/ml ) , expression of the tnf gene be minimal , i.e. the cell be tolerant .
in nuclear run-on analysis , such tolerant cell show only a low degree of transcription , indicate that tolerance operate at or upstream of the transcription level .
the cd14 lp receptor be , however , up-regulated ( not down-regulated ) in tolerant cell , and lp can , in fact , still lead to activation of tolerant cell a evidence by mobilization of the transcription factor nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
resolution of the nf-kappa b complex in gel shift analysis show that the bind protein , mobilize in naive mono mac 6 cell , consist mainly of p50 -p65 heterodimers , while in tolerant cell , the p50 homodimer be predominant .
this increase in p50 homodimers coincide with an increase in p105 mrna , suggestive of a transcriptional up-regulation of p50 .
reporter gene analysis reveal that the nf-kappa b complex mobilize in tolerant cell be functionally inactive in that nf-kappa b -dependent luciferase construct contain the human immunodeficiency virus long terminal repeat or the tnf 5'-region show only minimal transactivation after lp stimulation .
similar to mono mac 6 cell , primary blood monocyte , when precultured with a low dose of lp , also become tolerant and produce little tnf after lp stimulation .
the tolerant blood monocyte also up-regulate cd14 , and they mobilize nf-kappa b with a predominance of p50 homodimers .
take together , these result demonstrate that tolerance to lp be determine by post-receptor mechanism that involve an altered composition of the nf-kappa b complex .
human immunodeficiency virus contain heterologous enhancer/promoters be replication competent and exhibit different lymphocyte tropism .
the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) type 1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) contain bind site for nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) and the constitutively express transcription factor sp1 , both of which be highly conserve in hiv and simian immunodeficiency virus isolates .
to delineate the effect of these motif on the replicative capacity of hiv and to explore the possibility of extend the virus host range , know heterologous enhancer/promoters be insert into the hiv-1 ltr in place of the nf-kappa b and sp1 binding site .
the effect of these substitution on viral replication in transfected hela cell and on hiv infection of human peripheral blood lymphocyte or continuous t-leukemia cell line be evaluate .
hiv in which the nf- kappa b/sp1 enhancer plus the downstream tata element be replace with heterologous enhancer/promoters be also construct .
virus contain the human cytomegalovirus immediate-early enhancer exhibit infectious kinetics similar to that of wild-type hiv in activate human peripheral blood lymphocyte and aa2 cell but replicate less efficiently in h9 and cem cell .
these study indicate that heterologous enhancer element be capable of restore tat responsiveness to the hiv ltr in the context of direct reporter gene expression as well a in the production of infectious progeny virion .
selection of optimal kappa b/rel dna-binding motif : interaction of both subunit of nf-kappa b with dna be require for transcriptional activation .
analysis of the p50 and p65 subunit of the nf-kappa b transcription factor complex have reveal that both protein can interact with related dna sequence through either homo- or hetero dimer formation .
in addition , the product of the proto-oncogene c-rel can bind to similar dna motif by itself or a a heterodimer with p50 or p65 .
however , these study have use a limited number of known kappa b dna motif , and the question of the optimal dna sequence prefer by each homodimer have not be address .
use purify recombinant p50 , p65 , and c-rel protein , optimal dna-binding motif be select from a pool of random oligonucleotides .
alignment of the select sequence allow u to predict a consensus sequence for binding of the individual homodimeric rel-related protein , and dna-protein binding analysis of the select dna sequence reveal sequence specificity of the protein .
contrary to previous assumption , we observe that p65 homodimers can interact with a subset of dna sequence not recognize by p50 homodimers .
differential binding affinity be also obtain with p50- and c-rel- selected sequence .
use either a p50- or p65- selected kappa b motif , which display differential binding with respect to the other protein , little to no binding be observe with the heterodimeric nf-kappa b complex .
similarly , in transfection experiment in which the selective kappa b binding site be use to drive the expression of a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter construct , the p65 - and p50 -selected motif be activate only in the presence of p65 and p50/65 ( a chimeric protein with the p50 dna binding domain and p65 activation domain ) expression vector , respectively , and neither demonstrate a significant response to stimulus that induce nf-kappa b activity .
these finding demonstrate that interaction of both subunit of the heterodimeric nf-kappa b complex with dna be require for dna binding and transcriptional activation and suggest that transcriptional activation mediate by the individual rel-related protein will differ dramatically , depend on the specific kappa b motif present .
expression of retinoid x receptor alpha be increase upon monocytic cell differentiation .
1 alpha,_25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( vd ) be a potent inducer of monocytic differentiation of both normal and leukemic cell .
it effect be mediate by it nuclear receptor ( vdr ) .
efficient gene activation require the heterodimerization of vdr with retinoid x receptor ( rxr ) .
in the present study use specific antibody , we analyze the expression of the rxr alpha protein in blood mononuclear cell from acute myeloid patient ( aml ) ( 10 case ) and from myelomonocytic cell line arrest at different stage of differentiation .
we observe that the rxr alpha expression increase during myelomonocytic differentiation , since the high level be find in aml sample and in myelomonocytic cell line have the high amount of monocytic precursor .
we also demonstrate that fresh leukemic cell , whatever their stage of differentiation , as well a myelomonocytic cell line , respond to vd by an increase in rxr alpha level .
combination of all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) and vd , in some case , increase this effect .
this response suggest the involvement of rxr alpha in monocytic differentiation upon vd treatment .
expression of nfat-family protein in normal human t cell .
nfat protein constitute a family of transcription factor involve in mediate signal transduction .
use a panel of specific antiserum in immunoprecipitation assay , we find that nfatp ( 135 kda ) be constitutively express in normal human t cell , while synthesis of nfatc ( predominant form of 86 kda ) be induce by ionomycin treatment .
nfat4/x be very weakly express in unstimulated cell , and it level do not increase upon treatment with activate agent .
nfat3 protein be not observe under any condition .
higher-molecular-weight specie of nfatc ( of 110 and 140 kda ) be also detect .
in addition , translation of nfatc mrna apparently initiate at two different aug codon , give rise to protein that differ in size by 36 amino acid .
additional size heterogeneity of both nfatc and nfatp result from phosphorylation .
in contrast to ionomycin treatment , exposure of cell to phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) plus anti-cd28 do not induce nfatc , indicate that under these condition , interleukin-2 synthesis by these cell be apparently independent of nfatc .
in dna binding assay , both pma plus anti-cd28 and pma plus ionomycin result in nuclear nfat .
surprisingly , the pma - ionomycin -induced synthesis of nfatc that be detect by immunoprecipitation be not mirror in the dna binding assay : nearly all of the activity be due to nfatp .
this be the first study of expression of all family member at the protein level in normal human t cell .
a novel interferon regulatory factor family transcription factor , icsat/pip/lsirf , that negatively regulate the activity of interferon-regulated gene .
we have isolate a novel cdna clone encoding interferon ( ifn ) consensus sequence-binding protein in adult t-cell leukemia cell line or activate t cell ( icsat ) ; this protein be the human homolog of the recently clone pip/lsirf .
icsat be structurally most closely related to the previously clone icsbp , a member of the ifn regulatory factor ( irf ) family of protein that bind to interferon consensus sequence ( ic ) find in many promoter of the ifn-regulated gene .
among t-cell line investigate , icsat be abundantly express in human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) -infected t cell .
when the htlv-1 tax gene be express or phorbol myristake acetate-a23187 stimulation be use , icsat expression be induce in jurkat cell which otherwise do not express icsat .
when the binding of icsat to four different ic be test , the relative difference in binding affinity for those ic be determine .
to study the functional role of icsat , we perform cotransfection experiment with the human embryonal carcinoma cell line n-tera2 .
icsat be demonstrate to possess repressive function over the gene activation induce by ifn stimulation or by irf-1 cotransfection .
such repressive function be similar to that see in irf-2 or icsbp .
however , we have find that icsat have a different repressive effect from that of irf-2 or icsbp in some ifn-responsive reporter construct .
these result suggest that a novel mechanism of gene regulation by " differential repression " be use by multiple member of repressor protein with different repressive effect on the ifn-responsive gene .
cortisol resistance in acquire immunodeficiency syndrome .
this study concern 9 iv drug abuser with acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( aid ) who develop hypercortisolism without the clinical sign or metabolic consequence of hypercortisolism .
all patient be characterize by an addisonian picture ( weakness , weight loss , hypotension , hyponatremia , and intense mucocutaneous melanosis ) .
an acquired form of peripheral resistance to glucocorticoid be suspect .
we , therefore , examine glucocorticoid receptor characteristic on mononuclear leukocyte by measure [3h]dexamethasone binding and the effect of dexamethasone on [3h]thymidine incorporation , which be one of the effect of glucocorticoid receptor activation .
glucocorticoid receptor density be increase in aid patient with an addisonian picture ( group 1 ; 16.2 +/- 9.4 fmol/million cell ) compare to value in 12 aid patient without an addisonian picture ( group 2 ; 6.05 +/- 2.6 fmol/million cell ; p less than 0.01 ) and sex- and age-matched control ( 3.15 +/- 2.3 fmol/million cell ; p less than 0.01 ) .
the affinity of glucocorticoid receptor ( kd ) be strikingly decrease ( 9.36 +/- 3.44 nm in group 1 ; 3.2 +/- 1.5 nm in group 2 ; 2.0 +/- 0.8 nm in control ; p less than 0.01 ) .
[3h]thymidine incorporation be decrease dose-dependently by dexamethasone in control and patient ; the effect be significantly blunt ( p less than 0.05 ) in group 1 patient , which suggest that activation of glucocorticoid receptor be impaired a a result of the glucocorticoid receptor abnormality .
in conclusion , aid patient with hypercortisolism and clinical feature of peripheral resistance to glucocorticoid be characterize by abnormal glucocorticoid receptor on lymphocyte .
resistance to glucocorticoid imply a complex change in immune-endocrine function , which may be important in the course of immunodeficiency syndrome .
mechanism of antiandrogen action : conformational change of the receptor .
androgen receptor mrna be translate in vitro , and androgen- and antiandrogen- bound receptor complex be study use limited proteolytic digestion by trypsin .
partial proteolysis of androgen -bound receptor protein result in a 29-kda proteolysis-resisting fragment , whereas antiandrogen binding stabilise a 35-kda fragment .
both fragment contain the entire ligand binding domain , and the 35-kda fragment extend into the hinge region of the receptor .
several antiandrogens show agonistic property for a mutate androgen receptor ( lncap cell variant ) ; trypsin digestion of antiandrogen -bound mutate receptor also result in a 29-kda fragment .
our result point to an important difference between antiandrogens and antagonist of other steroid hormone receptor .
antiandrogens result in protection of both the hinge region and c-terminus of the androgen receptor agonist proteolytic attack , whereas other study show that antiestrogens and antiprogestagens expose the c-terminal end of the ligand binding domain of their respective receptor to protease .
difference in conformation of the hinge region distinguish androgen -bound from antiandrogen -bound receptor complex , which represent an important feature of antiandrogen action .
promoter sequence , exon : intron structure , and synteny of genetic location show that a chicken cytokine with t-cell proliferative activity be il2 and not il15 .
the gene encode a chicken cytokine with t-cell proliferative activity be clone , sequence , and map .
the result show that this cytokine be chicken il2 and not il15 .
the exon:intron structure of chicken il2 correspond almost exactly to those of mammalian il2s with the exception of exon 2 and intron 2 and 3 which be short .
chicken il2 contain five repeat of the " instability " motif attta in the 3'untranslated region in exon 4 .
it be a single-copy gene , with neither structural ( amino acid ) nor promoter sequence polymorphism identify .
analysis of the predict amino acid sequence suggest that overall protein structure be conserve , but the receptor binding site be not .
a number of potential regulatory sequence similar to those find in mammal have be identify in the promoter .
these include ( 5'-3' ) a composite nf-at/ " ap-1 " element , a cd28 response element , an ap-1 element , an nf-at element , and the ap-1 part of an ap-1/octamer composite element .
the mammalian nf-kappab and octamer binding site seem to be absent , although there be alternative potential nf-kappab and octamer-binding element in the chicken il2 promoter , in close proximity to their mammalian homologues .
sequence comparison also predict other potential transcription factor binding site a yet undescribed in mammalian il2 promoter .
a taq i polymorphism be identify which enable chicken il2 to be map to chromosome 4 , link to anx5 , with synteny with mouse chromosome 3 and human chromosome 4 .
this be the first non-mammalian cytokine gene to be map .
molecular cloning of slap-130 , an slp-76-associated substrate of the t cell antigen receptor-stimulated protein tyrosine kinase .
previous work have demonstrate that slp-76 , a grb2-associated tyrosine -phosphorylated protein , augment interleukin-2 promoter activity when overexpressed in the jurkat t cell line .
this activity require region of slp-76 that mediate protein-protein interaction with other molecule in t cell , suggest that slp-76 -associated protein also function to regulate signal transduction .
here we describe the molecular cloning of slap-130 , a slp-76 -associated phosphoprotein of 130 kda .
we demonstrate that slap-130 be hematopoietic cell-specific and associate with the sh2 domain of slp-76 .
additionally , we show that slap-130 be a substrate of the t cell antigen receptor-induced protein tyrosine kinase .
interestingly , we find that in contrast to slp-76 , overexpression of slap-130 diminish t cell antigen receptor -induced activation of the interleukin-2 promoter in jurkat t cell and interfere with the augmentation of interleukin-2 promoter activity see when slp-76 be overexpressed in these cell .
these data suggest that slp-76 recruit a negative regulator , slap-130 , as well a positive regulator of signal transduction in t cell .
preferential presentation of herpes simplex virus t-cell antigen by hla dqa1*0501/dqb1*0201 in comparison to hla dqa1*0201/dqb1*0201 .
the hla dqa1 locus be polymorphic .
haplotype contain hla dqa1*0501 , but not hla dqa1*0201 , together with hla dqb1*0201 be associate with grave 's disease and celiac sprue .
in this report , we demonstrate a functional correlate of dqa1 polymorphism .
t cell infiltrate a herpes simplex virus ( hsv ) lesion from a hla dq 2,7 individual yield a virus-specific cd4+ clone restrict by dq2 .
presentation of viral peptide and protein segregate with dqa1 allele , because cell line bear dqa1*0501/dqb1*0201 heterodimers present antigen in proliferation and cytotoxicity assay much more efficiently than cell line bear dqa1*0201/dqb1*0201 .
binding of viral peptide to cell line bear dqa1*0201 , in comparison to dqa1*0501 , be only moderately reduce and may not explain this effect .
truncation and substitution analysis of peptide binding and t-cell activation be perform to determine which viral peptide residue contact tcr might therefore be present in an altered conformation by dqa1*0201/dqb1*0201 .
residue 432 , 435 , 437 , 438 , and 440 ( position p1 , p4 , p6 , p7 , and p9 ) contribute to dq2 binding , whereas residue 431 , 433 , 434 , and 436 ( position p 1 , p2 , p3 , and p5 ) contribute to tcr contact .
differential presentation of peptide by hla dq2 heterodimers vary at the dqa1 locus may have relevance to host defense and the pathogenesis of hla dq2 -associated autoimmune disease .
ets1 transactivates the human gm-csf promoter in jurkat t cell stimulate with pma and ionomycin .
activation of t helper cell result in coordinate expression of a number of cytokine involve in differentiation , proliferation and activation of the haematopoietic system .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be one such cytokine whose increase expression result partly from increase in transcription .
cis-acting element with nf kappa b , ap-1 and ets-like motif have be identify in the promoter region of the gm-csf gene , which be important for transcriptional activity follow pma and ionomycin stimulation .
a number of the ets family of transcription factor be express in t cell , include ets1 and elf1 .
here we describe the ability of these factor to interact with a site ( gm5 ) , located within the cle0 element , -47 to -40 upstream of the gm-csf transcription initiation site .
exogenous ets1 , but not elf1 , can transactivate gm-csf , through the gm5 site , in a pma / ionomycin dependent manner .
other unidentified ets-like factor present in jurkat cell be also capable of bind gm5 .
mutation of the core ets binding site from -ggaa- to -ggat- prevent the binding of ets-like factor with the exception of ets1 .
the gm-csf promoter , modify in this way to be ets1 specific , be fully responsive to pma / ionomycin induction , in addition to ets1 transactivation in the presence of pma and ionomycin .
together these data suggest that ets1 may be involve in mediate the increase gm-csf production associate with t cell activation .
intranuclear target delivery of functional nf-kappab by 70 kda heat shock protein .
the 70 kda heat shock protein ( hsp70 ) be a highly conserve , ubiquitous protein involve in chaperon protein to various cellular organelle .
here we show that when add exogenously to cell , hsp70 be readily import into both cytoplasmic and nuclear compartment in a cell-type-specific fashion .
we exploit this ability of hsp70 to deliver nf-kappab , a key transcriptional regulator of inflammatory response .
we demonstrate that a fusion protein compose of a c-terminal hsp70 peptide and the p50 subunit of nf-kappab be direct into the nucleus of cell , could bind dna specifically , and activate igkappa expression and tnfalpha production .
we therefore propose that hsp70 can be use a a vehicle for intracytoplasmic and intranuclear delivery of protein or dna to modulate gene expression and thereby control immune response .
glucocorticoid induce down-regulation of glucocorticoid receptor mrna expression in asthma .
although their precise mechanism of action remain to be elucidate , glucocorticoid represent the most effective therapy in the treatment of asthma .
interaction between the glucocorticoid receptor and the ap-1 complex have be show to regulate the transcription of some gene , include glucocorticoid receptor itself .
the aim of the present study be to compare the expression of mrna for glucocorticoid receptor in human blood monocyte obtain from seven unstable untreated asthmatic patient who be subsequently treat with high dos of parenteral corticosteroid ( methyl prednisolone 120 mg/day ) for 10 day .
mrna expression be identify after rna extraction use rnazol and analyse after reverse transcriptase , by polymerase chain reaction use a semiquantitative competitive hybridization assay .
all asthmatic patient show an improvement in their fev1 value after corticosteroid treatment ( per cent of predict value 68.28 +/- 4.93 versus 95.57 +/- 6.41 , p < 0.02 ) , and a significant decrease for glucocorticoid receptor mrna expression ( p < 0.02 ) be observe in their monocyte .
this be the first report of an ex vivo down-regulation for the glucocorticoid receptor mrna expression , follow corticosteroid treatment .
isolation of cdna clone for 42 different kruppel-related zinc finger protein express in the human monoblast cell line u-937 .
to study the complexity and structural characteristic of zinc finger protein express during human hematopoiesis and to isolate novel regulator of blood cell development , a degenerate oligonucleotide probe specific for a consensus zinc finger peptide domain be use to isolate 63 cdna clone for kruppel-related zinc finger gene from the human monoblast cell line u-937 .
by extensive nucleotide sequence and northern blot analysis , these cdna clone be find to originate from approximately 42 different gene ( hzf 1-42 ) of which only 8 have previously be describe .
northern blot analysis show that a majority of these gene be express at comparable level in u-937 and hela cell .
the large number of individual gene represent among the 63 clone and their apparent non-cell-type-specific expression suggest that the majority of the kruppel-related zinc finger gene be likely to be express in most human tissue .
in contrast , some of the gene display a restricted expression pattern , indicate that they represent potential regulator of monocyte differentiation or proliferation .
detailed structural analysis of the first 12 cdna ( hzf 1-10 ) and a partial characterization of hzf 11-42 reveal that a common feature of human kruppel-related zinc finger protein be the presence of tandem array of zinc finger range in number from 3 to over 20 that be preferentially located in the carboxy-terminal region of the protein .
in addition , several novel krab-containing zinc finger gene and a novel conserve sequence element be identify .
costimulation of camp and protein kinase c pathway inhibit the cd3 -dependent t cell activation and lead to a persistent expression of the ap-1 transcription factor .
the effect mediate by a combined stimulation of camp - and protein kinase c ( pkc ) -dependent pathway have be investigate in different cellular system , and it have be show that they may complement each other in activate cell proliferation and differentiation .
in this report , we show that upon the stimulation of both pathway t lymphocyte become refractory to activation via the cd3/t cell receptor ( tcr ) complex .
t cell preincubated with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) and dibutyryl camp ( bt2camp ) display a deficient proliferative ability in response to anti-cd3 mab stimulation , whereas lymphocyte treat individually with either bt2camp or pma respond comparably to untreated sample .
we detect an association between the reduce mitogenic response and low expression of both interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) and the alpha chain ( cd25 ) of the il-2 receptor ( il-2r ) .
analysis of intracellular ca2+ mobilization suggest that the cd3 / tcr -dependent signal transduction be impaired in pma/bt2camp-treated cell .
remarkably , we observe that these sample display a persistent expression of the c-fos protooncogene , associate to an increase ap-1 dna-binding activity , whereas no variation of creb or nf-kb be detect .
neither bt2camp nor pma individually mediate these sustained effect , which therefore appear a a consequence of the interplay between both metabolic stimulus .
altogether , the data provide the evidence that both pathway complement each other in regulate gene expression and , conversely , downregulate the tcr transduction mechanism .
a regulatory element in the cd95 ( apo-1/fas ) ligand promoter be essential for responsiveness to tcr -mediated activation .
expression of the cd95 ( apo-1/fas ) ligand ( cd95l ) in activate t cell be a major cause of t cell activation-induced apoptosis .
to study the molecular mechanism of transcriptional control of cd95l expression in t cell , we investigate the human cd95l promoter in jurkat t cell .
deletion study reveal that the cd95l proximal promoter sequence from -220 to the transcription start site be essential for t cell stimulation-induced expression of cd95l .
in this study , we discover a novel regulatory element located at -120 of the cd95l promoter which contain dna binding site for sp-1 and a yet unknown inducible factor .
mutation analysis demonstrate that binding of the inducible factor to the -120 region be crucial for the biological function of the cd95l promoter upon t cell stimulation .
the dna sequence at -120 also contain two dna motif homologous to the bind site for nf-at .
nf-at do not directly bind to this element .
however , cotransfection study with an nf-at expression vector show that nf-at may confer a strong inducible activity to the cd95l promoter at this regulatory region .
our data also show that the immunosuppressive agent cyclosporin a down-regulates cd95l transcription by inhibit the function of this positive regulatory element
stable transfection of u937 cell with sense or antisense rxr-alpha cdna suggest a role for rxr-alpha in the control of monoblastic differentiation induce by retinoic acid and vitamin d .
although retinoic acid ( ra ) have be know for many year to be a modulate agent that play a role in generate both granulocyte and monocyte , the molecular mechanism underlie this role have not be define in the monoblast lineage .
in particular , the part play by the retinoid x receptor ( rxrs ) , which be member of the steroid/thyroid hormone nuclear receptor family , have not be explore .
in this study , therefore , the human monoblastic leukemia cell line u937 have be use a a model system to investigate the role of one of the rxrs , rxr-alpha , in monoblast differentiation .
rxr-alpha mrna be present in untreated u937 cell , and level increase after induction of differentiation with phorbol ester .
the same be find for rxr-beta mrna .
use plasmid contain sense or antisense rxr-alpha sequence under the control of an inducible promoter , we generate stably transfected cell line which express either increase or decrease level of rxr-alpha , respectively .
the sense cell line ( u alpha s and it clonal derivative alpha g2s ) show increase sensitivity to ra , while the antisense cell line ( u alpha a and it clonal derivative alpha b5a ) show decrease sensitivity to ra , a demonstrate by growth inhibition and by regulation of an ra -responsive reporter gene .
both u alpha a and alpha b5a also fail to respond to another modulate agent , 1 alpha,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol ( dhcc ) , but only u alpha s and not alpha g2s show an enhance response to dhcc .
the combination of ra and dhcc together inhibit growth of both sense and antisense cell line .
in addition , alpha g2s exhibit increase expression of cd11b and cd54 , while alpha b5a cell show increase expression of cd102 , suggest that rxr-alpha have a role in regulate expression of cell adhesion molecule in u937 cell .
these result demonstrate that rxr-alpha have a role in mediate growth inhibition and cell adhesion during myelomonocytic differentiation , and suggest that different specie of heterodimers involve rxr-alpha may control the acquisition of different feature of mature monocyte/macrophage function .
differential regulation of the janus kinase -stat pathway and biologic function of il-13 in primary human nk and t cell : a comparative study with il-4 .
il-13 , a cytokine similar to il-4 , be a regulator of human b cell and monocyte function .
biologic effect of il-13 on primary human nk and t cell have not be well define .
we demonstrate that , in primary nk cell , il-13 , but not il-4 , may induce low level of ifn-gamma secretion .
when nk cell be costimulated with il-13 and il-2 , il-13 generally result in two type of reactivity : il-13 synergized with il-2 to stimulate ifn-gamma production or it modestly inhibit il-2 - mediated ifn-gamma production .
in both type of donor , the effect of il-13 on il-2 -induced ifn-gamma production be in marked contrast to the strong inhibition see with il-4 in nk cell .
additionally , il-13 suppress il-2-induced nk cytolytic and proliferative activity although less efficiently than il-4 .
in t cell , il-13 inhibit anti-cd3 mab/il-2- or pha- mediated ifn-gamma production and enhance cytolytic potential .
furthermore , we demonstrate that il-13 , like il-4 , induce distinct stat6-dna binding complex and tyrosine phosphorylation of stat6 and janus kinase 3 ( jak3 ) in nk and t cell .
we observe that ab direct against unique domain of stat6 have differential effect on complex in t cell but not in nk cell , suggest different stat6 isoforms .
these finding show that il-13 and il-4 have the ability to regulate nk and t cell activation and that il- 13 be a potent regulator of stat6 and jak3 in these cell type .
transcriptional activation of rna polymerase iii-dependent gene by the human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax protein .
the human t-cell leukemia virus -encoded tax protein be a potent activator of many viral and cellular gene transcribe by rna polymerase ii .
we find that both chromatin and cell extract derive from human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 -infected human t lymphocyte support high level of 5 rrna and trna gene transcription than chromatin or extract from uninfected t lymphocyte .
the viral protein tax be likely responsible for this high level of class ii gene transcription , a purify tax be find to stimulate both gene when add to the uninfected cell extract or in reconstitute system .
both limiting-component transcription assay and dna binding assay identify the class iii gene transcription factor tfiiib a the principle target of tax activity .
surprisingly , we find that tax increase the effective concentration of active tfiiib molecule .
these data suggest that tax stimulate rna polymerase iii-dependent gene expression by accelerate the rate and/or extent of transcription initiation complex assembly .
expression of the chemokine receptor blr2/ebi1 be specifically transactivated by epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 .
in our attempt to identify chemokine receptor that be related to burkitt 's lymphoma receptor 1 ( blr1 ) and be express in activate lymphocyte we use rt-pcr result in the isolation of a cdna encode a seven transmembrane receptor term blr2 .
the protein show significant sequence similarity to the family of g-protein coupled chemokine receptor and turn out to be identical to the recently describe receptor ebi1 .
northern blot analysis reveal that blr2 mrna could be highly stimulate in mitogen- and anti-cd3- treated peripheral blood lymphocyte .
blr2 -specific mrna could be detect in all epstein-barr virus positive b cell line .
we show that transcription of the blr2 gene could be specifically induce in epstein-barr virus negative bl 41 cell via estrogen-mediated activation of epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 , a key regulator of viral and cellular gene in immortalize b cell .
our data suggest an involvement of blr2 in the regulation of migration in activate lymphocyte and in viral pathogenesis .
engagement of the lewis x antigen ( cd15 ) result in monocyte activation .
we previously report that monocyte adhesion to tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) -treated endothelial cell increase expression of tissue factor and cd36 on monocyte .
use immunological cross-linking to mimic receptor engagement by natural ligand , we now show that cd15 ( lewis x ) , a monocyte counter-receptor for endothelial selectins may participate in this response .
we use cytokine production a a readout for monocyte activation and find that cd15 cross-linking induce tnf-alpha release from peripheral blood monocyte and cell from the monocytic cell line mm6 .
quantitative reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) show an increase in steady-state tnf-alpha mrna after 3 to 4 hour of cross-linking .
cd15 cross-linking also concomitantly increase interleukin-1 beta ( il-1 beta ) mrna , while no apparent change be observe in the level of beta-actin mrna , indicate specificity .
to examine transcriptional regulation of cytokine gene by cd15 engagement , a cat plasmid reporter construct contain il-1 beta promoter/enhancer sequence be introduce into mm6 .
subsequent cross-linking of cd15 increase cat activity .
cd15 engagement by monoclonal antibody also attenuate il-1 beta transcript degradation , demonstrate that signaling via cd15 also have posttranscriptional effect .
nuclear extract of anti- cd15 cross-linked cell demonstrate enhance level of the transcriptional factor activator protein-1 , minimally change nuclear factor-kappa b , and do not affect sv40 promoter specific protein-1 .
we conclude that engagement of cd15 on monocyte result in monocyte activation .
in addition to it well-recognized adhesive role , cd15 may function a an important signal molecule capable of initiate proinflammatory event in monocyte that come into contact with activate endothelium .
model of lineage switching in hematopoietic development : a new myeloid-committed eosinophil cell line ( yj ) demonstrate trilineage potential .
a new human leukemia cell line with an eosinophilic phenotype , designate yj , be establish from the peripheral blood cell of a patient with chronic myelomonocytic leukemia ( cmmol ) with eosinophilia .
when culture in rpmi 1640 medium contain 10 % fetal bovine serum , most yj cell be myeloblastoid with a small number of the cell have eosinophilic granule .
cell surface marker in the yj cell be positive for cd33 and be negative for cd34 , cd16 and cd23 .
the eosinophilic characteristic of yj cell be confirm by histochemical staining with fast-green/neutral-red and by the expression of mrna for eosinophil-associated granule protein , eosinophil cationic protein ( ecp ) , eosinophil-derived neurotoxin ( edn ) , eosinophil peroxidase ( epo ) , and major basic protein ( mbp ) , and for the charcot-leyden crystal ( clc ) protein .
the yj cell could be induce towards monocytic differentiation by stimulation with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) .
the monocytic characteristic of yj cell treat with pma be confirm by morphological analysis with alpha-naphthyl butyrate esterase staining , by cd14 expression , and by increase expression of egr-1 mrna .
furthermore , yj cell could be differentiate towards the neutrophil lineage by stimulation with all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) .
yj cell treat in vitro with 2 microm ra differentiate into metamyelocytes and band neutrophil , and increase the number of nitroblue tetrazolium ( nbt ) -positive cell and increase gp91phox mrna expression .
thus , the yj cell line exhibit eosinophilic characteristic , but be able to differentiate to the monocytic or neutrophilic lineage in response to pma or ra , respectively .
the expression of gene for transcription factor involve in myeloid differentiation be evaluate by northern blot analysis .
increase expression of egr-1 be observe with macrophage differentiation .
in contrast , increase expression of c/ebpbeta and mzf-1 mrna occur with neutrophilic differentiation .
the yj cell line should be useful for elucidate the molecular mechanism govern lineage switching from the eosinophil to monocytic or neutrophil lineage .
induction of ciita and modification of in vivo hla-dr promoter occupancy in normal thymic epithelial cell treat with ifn-gamma : similarity and distinction with respect to hla-dr-constitutive b cell .
in this study , the ifn-gamma induction of mhc class ii gene expression in primary culture of thymic epithelial cell ( tec ) be analyze .
this cellular system offer the advantage that mhc class ii induction be study in a " physiologic " cell lineage that , a a result of this expression within the thymus , be think to participate to the selection and maturation of the t cell .
it be find that the mhc class ii gene expression be associate with the de novo transcription of the gene encode the ciita trans-activator , a crucial mhc class ii gene regulatory factor .
furthermore , the anatomy of interaction between the mhc class ii dra promoter and corresponding bind factor be analyze by in vivo dnase i footprint .
it be find that treatment with ifn-gamma induce change in the occupancy of the dra gene regulatory sequence by nuclear factor .
the result occupancy display strong similarity with the one observe in the mhc class ii-constitutive b cell , represent by both the burkitt lymphoma line raji and normal tonsil-_derived b cell .
however , some peculiar difference be observe between the tec , either ifn-gamma -induced or not , and the constitutive b cell .
these result suggest that both common mechanism , such a the one mediate by the ciita trans-activator , and distinct tissue-specific constraint contribute to the transcriptional control of constitutive and ifn-gamma -induced mhc class ii gene expression .
membrane-associated lymphotoxin on natural killer cell activate endothelial cell via an nf-kappab -dependent pathway .
background : inhibition of complement in small animal model of xenotransplantation have demonstrate graft infiltration with natural killer ( nk ) cell and monocyte associate with endothelial cell ( ec ) activation .
we have previously demonstrate that human nk cell activate porcine ec in vitro , which result in adhesion molecule expression and cytokine secretion .
in this study , we use the nk cell line nk92 to define the molecular and cellular basis of nk cell-mediated ec activation .
method : ec be transfected with either reporter construct contain the luciferase gene drive either by e-selectin or interleukin ( il ) -8 promoter or a synthetic nf-kappab -dependent promoter .
in addition , a dominant-negative mutant tumor necrosis factor receptor i ( tnfri ) expression vector be co-transfected in inhibition study .
forty-eight hour after transfection , ec be stimulate with nk cell or nk cell membrane extract for 7 hr and activation be measure by a luciferase assay .
result : co-culture of nk cell with transfected ec enhance e-selectin , il-8 , and nf-kappab -dependent promoter activity .
nk cell membrane extract retain the capacity to activate ec and induce nuclear translocation of nf-kappab ( p50 and p65 ) .
western blotting of nk cell and membrane extract detect the presence of lymphotoxin-alpha ( ltalpha ) but not tumor necrosis factor-alpha .
furthermore , ltalpha be secrete in nk: ec co- culture .
co-transfection with dominant-negative mutant tnfri inhibit ec activation by nk cell membrane extract and by nk cell by 80 % and 47 % , respectively .
the same pattern of inhibition be observe use anti-human lt serum .
conclusion : human nk cell membrane-bound lt signal across specie via tnfri , lead to nf-kappab nuclear translocation and transcription of e-selectin and il-8 , which result in ec activation .
the discrepancy in the degree of inhibition by membrane extract and nk cell with mutant tnfri suggest that additional pathway be utilize by nk cell to activate ec
the epstein-barr virus oncogene product latent membrane protein 1 engage the tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated death domain protein to mediate b lymphocyte growth transformation and activate nf-kappab .
the epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) be essential for the transformation of b lymphocyte into lymphoblastoid cell line .
previous data be consistent with a model that lmp1 be a constitutively activate receptor that transduce signal for transformation through it carboxyl-terminal cytoplasmic tail .
one transformation effector site ( tes1 ) , located within the membrane proximal 45 residue of the cytoplasmic tail , constitutively engage tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor .
signal from tes1 be sufficient to drive initial proliferation of infected rest b lymphocyte , but most lymphoblastoid cell infect with a virus that do not express the 155 residue beyond tes1 fail to grow a long-term cell line .
we now find that mutate two tyrosine to an isoleucine at the carboxyl end of the cytoplasmic tail cripple the ability of ebv to cause lymphoblastoid cell outgrowth , thereby mark a second transformation effector site , tes2 .
a yeast two-hybrid screen identify tes2 interacting protein , include the tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated death domain protein ( tradd ) .
tradd be the only protein that interact with wild-type tes2 and not with isoleucine -mutated tes2 .
tradd associate with wild-type lmp1 but not with isoleucine -mutated lmp1 in mammalian cell , and tradd constitutively associate with lmp1 in ebv -transformed cell .
in transfection assay , tradd and tes2 synergistically mediate high-level nf-kappab activation .
these result indicate that lmp1 appropriate tradd to enable efficient long-term lymphoblastoid cell outgrowth .
high-level nf-kappab activation also appear to be a critical component of long-term outgrowth .
protein kinase c activation and protooncogene expression in differentiation/retrodifferentiation of human u-937 leukemia cell .
human u-937 leukemia cell differentiate along the monocytic lineage follow 3-day exposure to 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) .
this induction of differentiation be accompany by adherence and loss of proliferation , as well a expression/repression of differentiation-associated gene .
long term culture of tpa -differentiated u-937 cell in the absence of phorbol ester for 32-36 day result in a process of retrodifferentiation .
the retrodifferentiated cell detach from the substrate and reinitiated proliferation .
other cellular parameter , such a glycosidase activity , cytokine release , and filament expression , return to level similar to that observe in uninduced cell .
treatment of u-937 cell with tpa result in a rapid translocation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) from the cytosol to cell membrane fraction within 2-8 min .
increase level of membrane-associated pkc activity persist until 17-29 day .
however , long period of incubation be associate with a return to the distribution of pkc in control cell .
activation of pkc have be implicate in the regulation of certain immediate early response gene , and in the present study , tpa rapidly induce c-fos and c-jun gene expression .
level of c-fos and c-jun transcript remain elevated during period of pkc activation and also return to level observe in control cell by 30-36 day , when the cell enter retrodifferentiation .
staurosporine , a nonspecific inhibitor of pkc , partially block tpa -induced adherence and growth inhibition and concomitantly prevent tpa-induced c-fos and c-jun gene expression .
