stimulation of human lymphocyte proliferation and cd40 antigen expression by phosphorothioate oligonucleotides complementary to hepatitis b virus genome .
we have study the proliferation and cd40 antigen expression of lymphocyte , and the cytotoxicity to monocyte , of antisense phosphorothioate oligodeoxynucleotides complementary to the sp ii promoter of hbv mrna ( sequence i ) and the x gene ( sequence ii ) in patient with chronic hepatitis b .
the oligo sequence i stimulate proliferation of both t and , to a less extent , b cell .
the percentage of cell express cd40 in t and b cell co-cultures increase from 4.2 % to 13.8 % after oligo stimulation in patient , while it increase form 4.7 % to 48.6 % in healthy control .
the sense sequence ( sequence iii ) of the x gene also enhance the expression of cd40 antigen in patient with hepatitis b .
the proportion of cd40 cell ( 26 % ) in a rest b-cell preparation from hepatitis b patient decrease to zero after a 5-day culture with sequence i , but igg level in the culture supernatant increase .
the cytotoxic property of monocyte be not influence by the oligos .
these finding indicate that antisense oligos against hepatitis b virus ( hbv ) have mitogenic effect on the proliferation of human lymphocyte in a non-specific manner and may activate t cell to express cd40 antigen .
cross-linking of cd44 on rheumatoid synovial cell up-regulates vcam-1 .
cd44 be a ubiquitous molecule also know a hyaluronic acid or homing receptor .
however , the cellular function and it role in inflammation , for example , rheumatoid synovitis , be currently unknown .
in this study , we propose a novel function for cd44 .
use synovial cell from rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) patient , we demonstrate that cd44 cross-linking and bind to hyaluronan augment vcam-1 expression and subsequently vcam-1 -mediated cell adhesion .
briefly , we find that 1 ) rheumatoid synovial cell highly express cd44 ; 2 ) cross-linking of cd44 markedly but transiently augment vcam-1 expression and it mrna transcription much more than do il-1beta and tnf-alpha ; 3 ) hyaluronan , especially when fragmented , also up-regulated vcam-1 ; 4 ) cd44 activate the transcription factor ap-1 ; and 5 ) the integrin -dependent adhesive function of ra synovial cell to t cell be also amplify by cd44 cross-linking .
these result indicate that the adhesion of ra synovial cell to matrix such a hyaluronic acid through cd44 could up-regulate vcam-1 expression and vcam-1 -mediated adhesion to t cell , which might in turn cause activation of t cell and synovial cell in ra synovitis .
we therefore propose that such cross-talking among distinct adhesion molecule may be involve in the pathogenesis of inflammation , include ra synovitis .
glucocorticoid receptor in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell in relation to age and to sport activity .
glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) be ubiquitous molecule and be present also in the hippocampus and in several other nervous and immune tissue .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmcs ) be a good model for study of gr in human .
glucocorticoid be important for maintain cellular and humoral homeostasis and be key mediator of neuroendocrine-immune regulatory interaction .
the increase of cortisol be immunosuppressive and reduce gr concentration both in nervous and immune system .
variation of glucocorticoid in healthy aged subject and athlete have be show .
prompt by these result , we have investigate in man a possible relationship between gr binding capacity in the pbmcs and age , in relation also to plasma testosterone and cortisol .
the same parameter have be examine in a group of soccer player for comparison with the sedentary group .
gr binding capacity be high in young subject than in old one , and low in the group of athlete than in the young and old sedentary subject .
in the sedentary group a negative correlation be present between gr binding capacity and age .
plasma cortisol be high and testosterone low in the athlete ; they be negatively correlate in athlete and positively correlate in the sedentary subject .
the result for athlete agree with their low anabolic/catabolic balance .
the mechanism of reduce gr level in relation to age and sport activity could involve a loss or an involution of receptor synthesis .
however other possibility , such a altered distribution of lymphocyte subpopulation with different receptor concentration and with different cytokine production , can not be exclude .
several neuroendocrine-immune interaction could be responsible for reduce gr level with age and sport activity in man .
identification of a region which direct the monocytic activity of the colony-stimulating factor 1 ( macrophage colony-stimulating factor ) receptor promoter and bind pebp2/cbf ( aml1 ) .
the receptor for the macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( or colony-stimulating factor 1 [ csf-1 ] ) be express from different promoter in monocytic cell and placental trophoblast .
we have demonstrate that the monocyte-specific expression of the csf-1 receptor be regulate at the level of transcription by a tissue-specific promoter whose activity be stimulate by the monocyte/b-cell-specific transcription factor pu.1 ( d.-e.zhang , c.j.hetherington , h.-m.chen , and d.g.tenen , mol .cell. biol. 14 : 373-381 , 1994 ) .
here we report that the tissue specificity of this promoter be also mediate by sequence in a region ii ( bp -88 to -_59 ) , which lie 10 bp upstream from the pu.1 -binding site .
when analyze by dnase footprinting , region ii be protect preferentially in monocytic cell .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay confirm that region ii interact specifically with nuclear protein from monocytic cell .
two gel shift complex ( mono a and mono b ) be form with separate sequence element within this region .
competition and supershift experiment indicate that mono b contain a member of the polyomavirus enhancer-binding protein 2/core-binding factor ( pebp2/cbf ) family , which include the aml1 gene product , while mono a be a distinct complex preferentially express in monocytic cell .
promoter construct with mutation in these sequence element be no longer express specifically in monocyte .
furthermore , multimerized region ii sequence element enhance the activity of a heterologous thymidine kinase promoter in monocytic cell but not other cell type test .
these result indicate that the monocyte/b-cell-specific transcription factor pu.1 and the mono a and mono b protein complex act in concert to regulate monocyte-specific transcription of the csf-1 receptor .
chimeric oncoprotein e2a-pbx1 induce apoptosis of hematopoietic cell by a p53 -independent mechanism that be suppress by bcl-2 .
the chimeric oncoprotein e2a-pbx1 result from fusion of the e2a and pbx1 gene follow t(1;19) chromosomal translocation in b cell precursor acute leukemia .
experimentally b cell progenitor do not tolerate constitutive expression of e2a-pbx1 which contrast with transformation of several other cell type follow it stable expression both in vitro and in vivo .
to far investigate the effect of e2a-pbx1 on the b cell progenitor , we conditionally express e2a-pbx1 under control of a metal response element in hematopoietic precursor cell line in vitro .
inducible expression of e2a-pbx1 result in cell death with the morphologic and molecular feature of apoptosis .
a structure-function analysis demonstrate that induction of apoptosis be not a dominant-negative effect of the e2a moiety but , rather , require the dna-binding homeodomain of pbx1 .
e2a- pbx1 -induced apoptosis proceed through a bcl2 -responsive checkpoint eventuating in parp inactivation but do require p53 .
constitutive expression of e2a- pbx1 do not induce apoptosis or continued cycling of rat-1 fibroblast in low serum condition .
these study demonstrate that e2a- pbx1 initiate program cell death of hematopoietic precursers by a mechanism that require it chimeric transcriptional property , but , unlike other nuclear oncoproteins , be independent of p53 .
glucocorticoid and the immune function in the human immunodeficiency virus infection : a study in hypercortisolemic and cortisol-resistant patient .
immunological study in human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -positive patient suggest that the disease progression be accompany by a defective production of type 1 cytokine ( interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) and il-12 ] , an increase production of type 2 cytokine ( il-4 , il-6 , and il-10 ) , and an increase production of ige .
hiv infection be also associate with activation of the hypothalamo-pituitary-adrenal axis function and increase plasma and urinary cortisol concentration .
a cortisol be involve in the physiological regulation of cytokine , a study be conduct to examine cytokine pattern in two group of hypercortisolemic patient , one with normal sensitivity to glucocorticoid and the other with glucocorticoid resistance .
ten hiv-infected patient with normal receptor affinity to glucocorticoid ( aids-c ) , 10 hiv-infected patient with low receptor affinity to glucocorticoid ( aids-gr ) , and 20 healthy subject be study .
receptor characteristic of peripheral blood mononuclear cell be evaluate by [3h]dexamethasone binding .
serum cortisol and urinary free cortisol be measure by ria .
serum acth and ige be measure by immunoradiometric assay , and il-2 , il-4 , and il-10 cytokine and interferon-gamma be measure by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay .
aids-c patient show low il-2 and high il-4 , il-10 , and ige concentratios ; conversely , aids-gr patient show high il-2 and low il-4 and ige concentration .
thus , in hiv infection , elevated cortisol level suppress cell-mediated immunity and stimulate humoral immunity , whereas this response be not detect in cortisol -resistant patient .
these finding indicate that cortisol and it receptor be critically involve in the regulation of immune function in hiv infection .
cooperation of bind site for stat6 and nf kappa b/rel in the il-4 -induced up-regulation of the human ige germline promoter .
ig heavy chain class switching be direct by cytokine induce transcription from unrearranged ch gene .
subsequently , such prim cell can undergo switch recombination to express the select new isotype .
in the case of ige class switching , il-4 activate the ige germline promoter by induce the interaction of the transcription factor stat6 ( il-4stat ) with a responsive dna element in the proximal region of the promoter .
this study describe the characterization of two additional cis-acting element that interact with member of the nf kappa b/rel transcription factor family in an il-4 -independent fashion .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay show that the nucleoprotein complex form on the upstream site ( nf kappa b1 ) contain the classical p50/p65 heterodimer .
the complex on the proximal site ( nf kappa b2 ) appear to be compose of p50 and relb .
ige germline promoter reporter gene construct carry point mutation in the nf kappa b2 site be largely unresponsive to il-4 stimulation in transient transfection experiment , while plasmid with similar mutation in the nf kappa b1 site respond to cytokine stimulation well than the wild-type promoter .
the nf kappa b2 effect be dependent on the presence of the stat6 binding site , demonstrate that the nf kappa b2 motif be necessary but not sufficient for mediate cytokine up-regulation .
in addition , the combination of a nf kappa b/rel binding site and the stat6 response element confer il-4 inducibility to a heterologous minimal promoter , while the individual site have no effect .
the available data suggest that the nf kappa b2 nucleoprotein complex may cooperate with dna-bound stat6 to achieve il-4 -dependent activation of the human ige germline gene .
differentiation of t-helper lymphocyte : selective regulation by member of the stat family of transcription factor .
interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) and interleukin-12 ( il-12 ) control the differentiation of t-helper cell .
here we summarize study which investigate the mechanism by which these cytokine selectively reprogramme gene expression in t-lymphocytes .
cytokine stimulation lead to the phosphorylation of specific tyrosine residue within the intracellular domain of the corresponding cytokine receptor .
these phosphotyrosines serve a docking site for latent , cytoplasmic transcription factor know a signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein .
receptor/stat interaction be mediate by the src homology 2 ( sh2 ) domain of the corresponding stat protein .
although stat bind to the intracellular domain of the cytokine receptor strongly depend on the phosphotyrosine residue , the recruitment of a specific stat protein be dictate by amino acid residue c-terminal to the phosphotyrosine .
specific docking site within individual cytokine receptor have be identify for almost all stat protein .
the direct coupling between cytokine receptor and transcription factor help to explain how different cytokine elicit distinct pattern of gene expression .
cdna cloning of a ngfi-b/nur77-related transcription factor from an apoptotic human t cell line .
a human t lymphoid cell line , peer , die by apoptosis in the presence of pma and calcium ionophore .
a new gene , tinur , be clone from apoptotic peer cell .
the expression of the tinur gene be induce within 1 h after the cross-linking of the t cell ag receptor complex .
tinur belong to the ngfi-b/nur77 family of the steroid receptor superfamily and be an orphan receptor .
tinur bind to the same dna sequence a ngfi-b/nur77 .
we also propose that the ngfi-b/nur77 family can be classify into two subtypes .
inducible expression and phosphorylation of coactivator bob.1/obf.1 in t cell [ see comment ]
bob.1/obf.1 be a transcriptional coactivator that be constitutively express in b cell and interact with the oct1 and oct2 transcription factor .
upon activation of jurkat t cell and primary murine thymocytes with phorbol ester and ionomycin , bob.1/obf.1 expression and transactivation function be induce .
bob.1/obf.1 be phosphorylated at ser184 both in vivo and in vitro , and this modification be require for inducible activation .
mutation of ser184 also diminish transactivation function in b cell , suggest that the activate phosphorylation that be inducible in t cell be constitutively present in b cell .
thus , bob.1/obf.1 be a transcriptional coactivator that be critically regulate by posttranslational modification to mediate cell type-specific gene expression .
molecular mechanism of anoxia/reoxygenation-induced neutrophil adherence to culture endothelial cell .
the objective of this study be to ( 1 ) determine the time course of neutrophil adhesion to monolayers of human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvecs ) that be expose to 60 minute of anoxia follow by 30 to 600 minute of reoxygenation and ( 2 ) define the mechanism responsible for both the early ( minute ) and late ( hour ) hyperadhesivity of postanoxic huvecs to human neutrophil .
the result clearly demonstrate that anoxia /reoxygenation ( a/r ) lead to a biphasic increase in neutrophil adhesion to huvecs , with peak response occur at 30 minute ( phase 1 ) and 240 minute ( phase 2 ) after reoxygenation .
oxypurinol and catalase inhibit phase-1 adhesion , suggest a role for xanthine oxidase and h2o2 .
in comparison , platelet activating factor ( paf ) contribute to both phase of neutrophil adhesion .
anti-intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) and anti-p-selectin antibody ( monoclonal antibody [ mabs ] ) attenuate phase-1 neutrophil adhesion , consistent with role for constitutively express icam-1 and enhance surface expression of preformed p-selectin .
phase-2 neutrophil adhesion be attenuate by an anti-e-selectin mab , indicate a dominant role of this adhesion molecule in the late phase response .
pretreatment with actinomycin d and cycloheximide or with compete ds-oligonucleotides contain the nuclear factor-kappa b or activator protein-1 cognate dna sequence significantly attenuate phase-2 response , suggest a role for de novo macromolecule synthesis .
surface expression of icam-1 , p-selectin , and e-selectin on huvecs correlate with the phase -1 and -2 neutrophil adhesion response .
collectively , these finding indicate that a/r elicit a two-phase neutrophil-endothelial cell adhesion response that involve transcription-independent and transcription-dependent surface expression of different endothelial cell adhesion molecule .
inefficient termination of antigen response in nf-atp -deficient mouse .
in order to elucidate the role of nf-atp , one of the most prominent member of family of nf-at transcription factor in peripheral t lymphocyte , in t cell activation and differentiation we create nf-atp -deficient mouse by gene target .
such nf-atp -/- mouse be born and appear to develop a normal immune system .
apart from clear-cut defect in the synthesis of mrna for th2-type lymphokine , such a il-4 , il-5 , il-10 and il-13 , in primary and secondary stimulation of spleen cell in vitro , of a distinct impaired deletion of v beta 11+/cd4+ t lymphocyte from these mouse be detect after superantigen injection .
moreover , nf-atp -/- mouse old than 6 week show an 2-5 fold increase in number of lymphocyte .
this be correlate with an increase expression of activation marker cd44 and cd69 and decrease expression of cd62 .
retinoic acid -induced modulation of il-2 mrna production and il-2 receptor expression on t cell .
background : retinoic acid ( ra ) have important immune-modulating effect on both t and b cell function .
our laboratory have show that ra can enhance in vitro polyclonal b cell immunoglobulin ( ig ) response .
investigate cytokine know to affect b cell differentiation , we have recently show that il-6 production be augment by ra .
in the present study we have examine the immune modulating effect of ra on il-2 mrna , another important cytokine for b cell immunoglobulin production , the expression of il-2 receptor on t cell , and the ra nuclear receptor .
method : purify t cell be obtain from adenoidal tissue , and incubate with ra ( 10(-7) m ) or dmso solvent/media control for 0 , 6-8 , and 24 h .
total mrna be extract from t cell , and use rt-pcr , change in the production of il-2 and ra receptor ( rar ) - alpha , beta , gamma mrna be determine .
the effect of ra on il-2-alpha receptor expression be determine by flow cytometry on t cell .
conclusion : these study suggest that ra can augment il-2 mrna production by t cell with a possible paracrine effect on il-2r-alpha expression .
these change appear to be mediate by rar-alpha .
thus , il-2 may be another important cytokine modulate by ra in the immune response .
hemoglobin switching in human be accompany by change in the ratio of the transcription factor , gata-1 and sp1 .
background : understand the mechanism of developmental regulation of hemoglobin switching have scientific as well a clinical relevance because of the influence of fetal hemoglobin ( hbf ) production in adulthood on the clinical manifestation of thalassemia and sickle cell anemia .
we have previously find that the normal developmental pattern of globin gene expression be recapitulate in an experimental system of primary culture that support differentiation of erythroid progenitor .
we far find that high activity of the transcriptional activator , gata-1 and sp1 , be associate with normal adult erythroid differentiation .
material and method : in the present work , we have study , the activity of gata-1 and sp1 during differentiation of culture erythroid progenitor derive from cord blood and from fetal liver , as well a from beta zero- thalassemia patient .
result : the result show high gata-1 binding activity and very low sp1 activity in the fetal liver culture .
this pattern be in contrast to culture derive from normal adult peripheral blood , in which both gata-1 and sp1 activity be high .
cord blood culture show an additive combination of " adult " and " fetal " pattern .
the progenitor derive from a beta zero- thalassemia patient with high hbf production show " fetal " pattern .
on the other hand , in culture of 2 beta zero- thalassemia patient without high hbf , " adult " pattern be observe .
conclusion : in the present work , we show that human fetal and adult erythroid progenitor be distinct in their transcription factor , and that the commitment to fetal or adult program occur at a very early differentiation stage .
our study also demonstrate that under anemic stress , recruitment of fetal progenitor may occur in adulthood .
human neutrophil express gh-n gene transcript and the pituitary transcription factor pit-1b .
since gh stimulate the development and function of granulocyte , we investigate the expression of gh in granulocyte subset .
by immunocytochemistry , 25 +/- 7 % of the human neutrophil be show to express immunoreactive gh , whereas eosinophil be negative .
reverse transcription ( rt ) -pcr analysis demonstrate gh mrna in neutrophil .
restriction analysis reveal that neutrophil express the gh-n gene but not the gh-v gene .
furthermore , we demonstrate by western blot analysis that neutrophil express an alternatively splice variant of the pituitary transcription factor pit-1 , designate pit-1b .
[ molecular mechanism of age-related lymphocyte dysfunction ]
aging be classically accompany by a dysregulation of the immunologic machinery .
a a consequence , the immune response develop in senescent organism be usually inappropriate , often inefficient , sometimes aberrant , and potentially detrimental .
the age-associated immune dysfunction may be implicate to some degree in the extreme susceptibility of the elderly to infection and neoplasia and may even participate in various aspect of senescence .
the current understanding of the molecular mechanism underlie immunosenescence be still fragmentary .
the most extensively study phenomenon be the progressive decline in the proliferative capacity of t lymphocyte with aging .
the loss of proliferative potential in response to antigenic challenge be a characteristic feature of immune senescence .
it be directly implicate in the emergence of the age-related immune deficiency .
the purpose of this review be to show how the accumulation of various biochemical lesion with advance age lead to the failure of a critical cell function , namely the activation-induced lymphocyte proliferation .
the biochemical modification responsible for the defect in transduction and execution of the proliferative signal be analyze a a function of age .
the multiple alteration observe on the various biochemical pathway may appear a a consequence of a unique deleterious mechanism more fundamentally related to the process of senescence such a the inability to cope with oxidative stress .
the catalytic domain of pp56(lck) , but not it regulatory domain , be sufficient for induce il-2 production .
the lymphoid src kinase pp56(lck) have be show to be essential for the induction of different t lymphocyte response , include cd4 -mediated enhancement of ag-induced t cell activation , early t cell differentiation , induction of il-2 production , and cytotoxicity .
it be assume that pp56(lck) act on these process by phosphorylating substrate .
however , it have be recently report that the nh2 regulatory domain be sufficient to mediate cd4 accessory function .
in this report we address the contribution of the regulatory and catalytic domain of pp56(lck) to another function of this enzyme independent of cd4 : tcr-induced il-2 production .
two pp56(lck) mutant lack either the entire catalytic domain or the entire nh2 regulatory domain be generate , and their ability to trigger transactivation of the tcr-regulated nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) region of the il-2 promoter be compare .
only the catalytic , but not the nh2 regulatory , domain of pp56(lck) be able to induce nf-at region transactivation on it own and to cooperate with other intracellular signal to trigger this response .
moreover , the catalytic domain of pp56(lck) be able to induce il-2 cytokine production to an extent similar to that of wild-type pp56(lck) .
we conclude that different domain of the pp56(lck) molecule contribute to regulate distinct biologic function .
in fact , while the nh2 regulatory domain be sufficient to mediate cd4 accessory function , we show here that the catalytic domain of pp56(lck) be sufficient for induction of il-2 production , mimic tcr ligation .
the human gene encode the lectin-type oxidize ldl receptor ( olr1 ) be a novel member of the natural killer gene complex with a unique expression profile .
lox-1 be an endothelial receptor for oxidize low-density lipoprotein that play essential role in atherogenesis .
lox-1 have the high homology with c-type lectin receptor express on natural killer cell .
in the present study , we clone and characterize the human lox-1 gene ( hgmw-approved symbol olr1 ) .
the gene structure of lox-1 resemble that of the natural killer cell receptor .
fluorescence in situ hybridization and analysis of a yeast artificial chromosome contig reveal that the human lox-1 gene be located in the natural killer gene complex on chromosome 12p12-p13 , where the gene of the natural killer cell receptor cluster .
in contrast , the expression pattern of lox-1 be different from that of the natural killer cell receptor ; lox-1 be express in vascular-rich organ , but not in lymphocyte .
a 1753-bp fragment of the 5' flanking region of the lox-1 gene have a functional promoter activity .
this region contain bind site for several transcription factor , include the stat family and nf-il6 , and the expression of lox-1 be upregulated by several cytokine .
these result demonstrate that the human lox-1 gene be a new member of the natural killer gene complex with a unique expression profile .
copyright 1998 academic press .
redox status of cell influence constitutive or induce nf-kappa b translocation and hiv long terminal repeat activity in human t and monocytic cell line .
we have test the hypothesis that cellular activation event occur in t lymphocyte and monocyte and mediate through translocation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b be dependent upon the constitutive redox status of these cell .
we use phenolic , lipid-soluble , chain-breaking antioxidant ( butylate hydroxyanisole ( bha ) , nordihydroquairetic acid , or alpha-tocopherol ( vitamin e ) to show that peroxyl radical scavenging in unstimulated and pma- or tnf- stimulated cell block the function depend on nf-kappa b activation .
bha be find to suppress not only pma- or tnf- induced , but also constitutive , hiv-enhancer activity concomitant to an inhibition of nf-kappa b binding activity in both lymphoblastoid t ( j.jhan ) and monocytic ( u937 ) cell line .
this be also true for kbf ( p50 homodimer ) binding activity in u937 cell .
secretion of tnf , the product of another nf-kappa b -dependent gene , be abolish by bha in pma-stimulated u937 cell .
the anti-oxidative effect of bha be accompany by an increase in thiol , but not glutathione , content in stimulate and unstimulated t cell , whereas tnf stimulation itself barely modify the cellular thiol level .
oxidative stress obtain by the addition of h2o2 to the culture medium of j.jhan or u937 cell could not by itself induce nf-kappa b activation .
these observation suggest that tnf and pma do not lead to nf-kappa b activation through induction of change in the cell redox status .
rather , tnf and pma can exert their effect only if cell be in an appropriate redox status , because prior modification toward reduction with bha treatment prevent this activation .
it appear that a basal redox equilibrium tend toward oxidation be a prerequisite for full activation of transduction pathway regulate the activity of nf-kappa b -dependent gene .
selective effect of dna damaging agent on hiv long terminal repeat activation and virus replication in vitro .
much attention have recently focus on the observation that uv light can activate the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) .
although the mechanism of ltr activation remain obscure , several line of investigation have suggest that it be a result of activation of the nf-kappa b transcription factor ( s ) follow signaling event related to generalize dna damage .
in this report , we present data demonstrating that hiv ltr activation be not a general consequence of cellular dna damage , but rather a process unique to specific genotoxic stimulus , and that it do not necessarily depend on activation of nf-kappa b .
furthermore , we demonstrate that several of these agent can significantly increase hiv replication and accelerate cd4 -positive lymphocyte cytotoxicity in vitro .
these finding , therefore , could have clinical significance to aid patient with malignancy who be undergo radiotherapy and chemotherapy .
gabp factor bind to a distal interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) enhancer and contribute to c-raf -mediated increase in il-2 induction .
triggering of the t-cell receptor-cd3 complex activate two major signal cascade in t lymphocyte , ( i ) ca2+-dependent signal cascade and ( ii ) protein kinase cascade .
both signal cascade contribute to the induction of the interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene during t-cell activation .
prominent protein kinase cascade be those that activate mitogen-activated protein ( map ) kinase .
we show here that c-raf , which be at the helm of the classic map- erk cascade , contribute to il-2 induction through a distal enhancer element span the nucleotide from position -502 to -413 in front of the transcriptional start site of the il-2 gene .
induction of this distal il-2 enhancer differ from induction of the proximal il-2 promoter-enhancer , since it be induce by phorbol ester alone and independent from ca2+ signal .
in dna-protein binding study , we detect the binding of transcription factor gabp alpha and -beta to a dyad symmetry element ( dse ) of the distal enhancer , which be form by palindromic bind site of ets-like factor .
introduction of point mutation suppress gabp binding to the dse interfere with the induction of the distal enhancer and the entire il-2 promoter-enhancer , while overexpression of both gabp factor enhance the il-2 promoter-enhancer induction .
overexpression of bxb , a constitutive active version of c-raf , and of further member of the ra - raf - erk signal cascade exert an increase of gabp -mediated promoter-enhancer induction .
in conjunction with previously publish data on c-raf -induced phosphorylation of gabp factor ( e.flory , a. hoffmeyer , u.smola , u.r.rapp , and j.t.bruder , j.virol.70 : 2260-_2268 , 1996 ) , these result indicate a contribution of gabp factor to the raf -mediated enhancement of il-2 induction during t-cell activation .
an active v-abl protein tyrosine kinase block immunoglobulin light-chain gene rearrangement .
lymphoid cell transform by abelson murine leukemia virus have provide one of the classic model for study of early b-cell development and immunoglobulin rearrangement .
most of these cell have rearrange their heavy-chain locus but not their light chain gene , suggest that an active v-abl protein interfere with this differentiation step .
to test this hypothesis , light-chain gene structure be examine in pre-b cell transform by temperature-sensitive mutant of the abelson virus and in derivative that survive at the nonpermissive temperature because they express a human bcl-2 gene .
our study reveal that inactivation of the v-abl protein tyrosine kinase trigger high-frequency rearrangement of kappa and lambda light-chain gene .
these event be accompany by marked increase in the expression of rag-1 and rag-2 rna .
these increase occur in the absence of protein synthesis but be dependent on inactivation of the v-abl protein tyrosine kinase .
a document in the accompany paper ( klug et al. , this issue ) , an active v-abl protein also suppress the activity of nf-kappa b /rel and expression control by the kappa intron enhancer .
together these data demonstrate that the v-abl protein specifically interfere with light-chain gene rearrangement by suppress at least two pathway essential for this stage of b-cell differentiation and suggest that tyrosine phosphorylation be important in regulate rag gene expression .
il-10 cooperate with tnf-alpha to activate hiv-1 from latently and acutely infected cell of monocyte/macrophage lineage .
il-10 be elevated in hiv-1 -infected individual and have be implicate in disease progression .
in this study , we investigate the effect of il-10 on the activation of hiv-1 from infected monocyte and macrophage .
although il-10 alone do not induce hiv-1 replication , in the presence of tnf-alpha , il-10 markedly enhance virion production from a chronically infected promonocytic cell line ( u1 ) and in acutely infected monocyte-derived macrophage .
neutralize mabs to il-10 and tnf-alpha indicate that both cytokine be essential for the induction and be require to generate a synergistic increase in virus expression .
the effect of the two cytokine be distinguishable functionally since pretreatment with tnf-alpha attenuate the cytokine cooperativity , while pretreatment with il-10 potentiate their cooperativity , suggest that il-10 and tnf-alpha play different role in the activation of virus .
northern blot analysis as well a ab blocking and cytokine secretion study indicate that the induction of either endogenous tnf-alpha or il-10 be not involve in the cooperativity , nor be an up-regulation of tnf-alpha receptor .
in combination with tnf-alpha , il-10 stimulate activate protein-1 ( ap-1 ) and nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b binding activity and cooperate to increase hiv-1 steady-state mrna level and enhance long terminal repeat -directed transcription through activation of the nf-kappa b binding site , suggest the il-10 effect occur at least in part at the transcriptional level .
these result indicate that il-10 , in addition to down-regulating the cellular immune response to hiv-1 , may also play a role in tnf-alpha -mediated activation of hiv-1 replication in the monocyte/macrophage lineage .
analysis of the preexisting and nuclear form of nuclear factor of activate t cell .
the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) 3 be an inducible dna-binding protein that be essential for transcriptional induction of the il-2 gene during t cell activation .
nf-at be think to consist of two component : a ubiquitous , inducible nuclear component that we have identify a fo and jun protein , and a preexist , t cell-specific component ( nf-atp ) which be the target for the immunosuppressive agent cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 .
we have previously show that nuclear extract from activate t cell form two inducible nf-at complex with an oligonucleotide correspond to the distal nf-at site of the murine il-2 promoter , although hypotonic extract of unstimulated t cell form a single complex contain nf-atp .
we show that the ability to detect nf-atp in a gel shift assay , which be essential for purification and biochemical study of this protein , be strikingly dependent on the precise sequence of the nf-at oligonucleotide use a the labeled probe .
moreover we present evidence that the component that form the faster-migrating ( " low " ) nuclear nf-at complex be derive by a calcium-dependent , cyclosporin-sensitive , posttranslational modification of nf-atp , and that fo and jun protein stabilize it interaction with dna .
the result be discuss in the context of a model relate the two nuclear nf-at complex to nf-atp .
cross-priming of ctl response in vivo do not require antigenic peptide in the endoplasmic reticulum of immunizing cell .
it have be propose that the cross-priming of ctl response in vivo involve the transfer to host apc of heat shock protein glycoprotein 96 -chaperoned antigenic peptide release from the endoplasmic reticulum ( er ) of die or infected cell .
we have test this possibility directly use tap-deficient cell line lack antigenic er peptide derive from two model ag , the human adenovirus type 5 early region e1a and e1b .
although both protein be well express , the cell be not recognize by e1a- or e1b- specific ctls unless the relevant epitope be either provide exogenously a a synthetic peptide or target to the er in a tap-independent fashion .
despite the absence of these er peptide , the tap1-/- cell be able to efficiently cross-prime e1a- and e1b- specific ctls follow immunization of syngeneic mouse .
these result indicate that , although purify peptide/glycoprotein 96 complex be potent immunogen , the mechanism of ctl cross-priming in vivo do not depend upon antigenic peptide in the er of immunizing cell .
in vivo and in vitro effect of glucocorticoid on lymphocyte proliferation in man : relationship to glucocorticoid receptor .
interrelation between the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal system ( hpa ) and the immune system represent a well-documented biological phenomenon .
while in vitro administration of glucocorticoid may inhibit concanavalin a ( con a ) - and phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) - induced t-cell proliferation , pokeweed mitogen ( pwm ) -driven b-cell mitogenesis be relatively resistant to glucocorticoid .
to far explore the link between the hpa and the immune system in relation to glucocorticoid receptor function , dose-response curve be obtain for con a - and pha -induced t-cell mitogenesis , pwm -generated b-cell mitogenesis and spontaneous lymphocyte proliferation in 13 healthy control .
glucocorticoid effect be assess in vivo by depletion of endogenous glucocorticoid after oral administration of 1.5 g metyrapone ( met ) and subsequent glucocorticoid replacement , and in vitro by incubation of the cell with different dos of dexamethasone ( dex ) .
there be a significant decrease in pwm -induced b-cell mitogenesis and a more pronounced effect of dex administer in vitro on spontaneous lymphocyte proliferation after met treatment when compare with the dex plus met pretreated condition in vivo .
these data suggest that the inhibition of spontaneous lymphocyte proliferation by glucocorticoid in vitro be related to glucocorticoid receptor function .
the decrease in pwm -generated b-cell proliferation follow cortisol depletion by met may be see in connection with impaired glucocorticoid -mediated induction of interleukin-1 receptor synthesis .
[ plasma cortisol concentration and blood leukocyte content of glucocorticoid receptor in patient with deficiency-cold v deficiency-heat syndrome ]
plasma cortisol concentration and blood leukocyte content of glucocorticoid receptor ( gcr ) be assay in 20 patient with deficiency syndrome , 10 cold in property ( deficiency-cold ) , the other 10 hot in property ( deficiency-heat ) , and also in 10 healthy individual a normal control for the purpose of investigate the nature of cold and heat syndrome .
a a result , the case of deficiency-cold syndrome ( dc ) have a normal concentration of plasma cortisol but a lowered content of gcr in leukocyte when compare with the normal control ( p less than 0.05 ) ; the case of deficiency-heat syndrome ( dhs ) have a high concentration of plasma cortisol than the normal control ( p less than 0.05 ) and a slightly high content of gcr in leukocyte .
it be conclude that the dc be characterize by diminish biological effect of adrenocortical activity , while the dhs , by augmented biological effect of adrenocortical activity .
analysis of interaction between hugata-3 transcription factor and three gata regulatory element of hiv-1 long terminal repeat , by surface plasmon resonance .
relative affinity of transcriptional regulatory element for their respective factor have be essentially study by bandshift analysis .
here we report a real-time study of factor/dna interaction use a surface plasmon resonance approach and further characterization of recover protein involve in this interaction .
for this purpose , human gata-3 , either recombinant or in nuclear extract , and three natural gata element of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( site 1 , 2 , and 3 ) be choose , in which only site 2 be a noncanonical gata site .
direct analysis of sensorgrams , with recombinant hugata-3 , allow the comparison of association and dissociation profile of the three dna region and their ranking accord to their relative affinity .
this result , confirm by competition with each gata site , demonstrate the high relative affinity ( at least sevenfold ) of site 3 .
interaction between the canonical and unique gata site 3 and nuclear extract be also study in real time and provide information on it association and dissociation rate for native hugata-3 .
finally , recover protein be identify a genuine hugata-3 by sds-page , western blotting , and bandshift assay .

cd2 signalling induce phosphorylation of creb in primary lymphocyte .
promoter sequence responsive to cyclic amp ( camp ) be find in a number of cellular gene , and bind transcription factor of the camp response element binding protein ( creb ) / activating transcription factor-1 ( atf-1 ) family .
we have use a human t-lymphotropic virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) model of camp response element ( cre ) transcription to investigate the influence of lymphocyte activation on transcription from homologous region in the viral promoter .
we previously demonstrate increase htlv-1 transcription follow cd2 but not cd3 receptor cross-linking .
we hypothesize that this increase viral transcription be mediate , in part , through the phosphorylation of creb .
therefore , we investigate cd2 and cd3 receptor -mediated signalling in primary human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) .
cd2 , but not cd3 , cross-linking increase camp detect by competitive enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay ( elisa ) approximately fourfold .
cd2 cross-linking concurrently increase phosphorylation of creb detect by immunoblot assay eightfold .
consistent with post-translational regulation , no change in total level of creb protein be observe .
phosphorylation of creb occur through a herbimycin a and rp-camp- sensitive pathway , suggest phosphorylation require antecedent activation of both protein tyrosine kinase ( ptk ) and protein kinase a ( pka ) .
both cd2 and cd3 cross-linking increase binding of nuclear protein to a radiolabelled cre oligonucleotide probe in electrophoretic mobility shift assay suggest that lymphocyte activation enhance binding independently of phosphorylation of creb at serine 133 .
these data indicate specific modulation of the creb /atf-1 family of transcription factor by the cd2 signalling pathway and suggest cd2 receptor modulation of cre -mediated transcription follow ligand engagement ( e.g. cell-to-cell contact ) .
elevated cyclic amp inhibit nf-kappab -mediated transcription in human monocytic cell and endothelial cell .
the nf-kappab /rel family of transcription factor regulate the inducible expression of many gene in activate human monocyte and endothelial cell .
in this study , we examine the molecular mechanism by which agent that elevate intracellular camp inhibit the expression of the tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnfalpha ) , tissue factor , endothelial leukocyte adhesion molecule-1 , and vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 gene .
both forskolin and dibutyryl camp , which elevate intracellular camp by independent mechanism , inhibit tnfalpha and tissue factor expression at the level of transcription .
induction of nf-kappab -dependent gene expression in transiently transfected human monocytic thp-1 cell and human umbilical vein endothelial cell be inhibit by elevated camp and by overexpression of the catalytic subunit of protein kinase a ( pka ) .
elevated camp do not prevent nuclear translocation of p50/p65 and c-rel/p65 heterodimers , decrease nuclear translocation of p65 , or significantly modify tnfalpha -induced phosphorylation of p65 .
functional study demonstrate that transcriptional activation of a plasmid contain multimerized kappab site by p65 be inhibit by agent that elevate camp and by overexpression of the catalytic subunit of pka .
this study indicate that activation of pka reduce the induction of a distinct set of gene in monocyte and endothelial cell by inhibit nf-kappab -mediated transcription .
induction of cd8 antigen and suppressor activity by glucocorticoid in a cem human leukemic cell clone .
the relationship between glucocorticoid effect and regulation of cell surface antigen be investigate in two model of leukemic cell line , cem c7 denote ( r+ , ly+ ) and cem c1 ( r+ , ly- ) .
the reactivity of murine monoclonal antibody , anti-cd4-fitc , anti-cd8-fitc , anti-cd2-fitc and anti-calla-fitc , be analyze use flow cytometry .
the suppressor function be determine use [3h]thymidine incorporation into phytohemagglutinin -activated peripheral blood lymphocyte .
dexamethasone treatment of a human leukemic cell clone cem c7 cause an increase in a subset of cell express the surface antigen cd8 , which be present on suppressor and cytotoxic t-lymphocytes .
by comparison , there be no modification of the expression of cd4 antigen , which be express at high level in these cell .
after two day of treatment with 5 x 10 ( -8 ) m dexamethasone , cem c7 cell show a two-fold increase in suppressor activity compare to untreated cell .
in contrast , there be no regulation by glucocorticoid of either the cd8 or cd4 antigen in the leukemic clone cem c1 .
furthermore , no modification of the suppressor function in cem c1 cell by dexamethasone be observe .
in the human leukemic cell study here , the ability to induce cd8 antigen expression in a cd4+ cell correlate with the ability to induce cell lysis in a glucocorticoid receptor positive cell population .
differential interaction of nuclear factor with the pre-i enhancer element of the human il-4 promoter in different t cell subset .
the immunomodulatory cytokine il-4 affect cell of most hemopoietic lineage .
il-4 be secrete by activate th2 but not th1 cell and play a major role in the immune response by modulate the differentiation of naive th cell toward the th2 phenotype .
we have previously identify an enhancer element , pre-i , that be essential for the function of the human il-4 promoter .
to investigate the mechanism responsible for tissue-specific expression of the il-4 gene , we analyze nuclear factor bind to the pre-i site and compare the binding activity of these factor to the il-4 promoter of th1 and th2 cell .
we show that pre-i interact with pma - and pma / ionomycin -inducible , cyclosporin a -sensitive nuclear factor .
use anti-c/ebpbeta ( nf-il6 ) , anti-c/ebpdelta ( nf-il6beta ) , anti-nf-atc , anti-nf-atp , anti-fos , and anti-jun ab we demonstrate that the previously identify pre-i binding factor pos-1 be compose of different transcription factor in different th cell subset .
in the il-4 -producing th0-like human jurkat and mouse el-4 cell , pos-1 ( designate pos-1a ) contain nf-il6beta and jun .
in the mouse th2 d10 cell and in the human th2 clone , pos-1 ( designate pos-1b ) contain nf-il6beta , jun , and nf-atc/p .
in contrast , pos-1 be not find in nuclear extract of human th1 clone .
these finding suggest that pre-i may play a role in the differential regulation of il-4 gene expression level .
position effect of translocation involve the inactive x chromosome : physical linkage to xic/xist do not lead to long-range de novo inactivation in human differentiate cell .
give the report long-range cis-inactivating effect of the xist gene in early embryonic development and the lack of requirement of x- chromosome-specific element for propagate the inactive state , there exist the possibility of cis inactivation of autosomal material after de novo translocation to an inactive x chromosome ( xi ) in differentiate cell .
we have analyze de novo radiation-induced translocation between the xi and autosome to study the maintenance and spreading of x-chromosome inactivation ( x inactivation ) in relation to the position of the x-inactivation center ( xic ) /xist in differentiate cell .
autosome/ xi translocation be detect by fluorescence in situ hybridization ( fish ) .
the activation status of the chromosome involve in the translocation be determine by simultaneous immunocytogenetic study use antibody against either brdu incorporate at late s phase or acetylate histone h4 .
the position of xic/xist in the reciprocal product of the translocation be determine by xist-specific fish and computer enhancement .
in other experiment , the xq13 region carry xic/xist be localize by computer enhancement of the dapi banding pattern .
our study in differentiate cell provide a visual demonstration that physical separation from xic/xist do not result in reactivation of inactive x-chromosome material and that x inactivation be not spread to the translocate autosome irrespective of the position of xic/xist .
this observation suggest that physical linkage to xic/xist do not lead to de novo inactivation of autosomal material .
lack of il-12 signaling in human allergen-specific th2 cell .
il-12 be a powerful skewer of cd4+ t cell response toward the th1 phenotype by induce ifn-gamma production in naive th cell .
in the present study we address the question of whether il-12 can reverse established th2 response into th1/th0 response by induce ifn-gamma production in memory th2 cell .
to this aim , allergen-specific cd4+ t cell clone ( tcc ) be generate from the peripheral blood of three atopic patient , and their cytokine profile be analyze .
the majority of these tcc exhibit a strongly polarize th2 cytokine profile , and the production of ifn-gamma could not be induce by exogenous il-12 .
only those tcc with low ifn-gamma level in the absence of il-12 respond to il-12 by additional enhancement of ifn-gamma production .
the il-12 nonresponsiveness of the th2 clone be far evident by the total lack of il-12 -induced phosphorylation of stat4 ( signal transducer and activator of transcription-4 ) , a transcription factor that be typically involve in il-12 signaling .
consequently , il-12 also fail to induce the dna-binding activity of stat4 -containing complex in the nucleus of these th2 clone .
all tcc express equal level of the low-affinity il-12r beta1 subunit .
our result indicate that human allergen-specific th cell with strongly polarize th2 cytokine profile do not respond to il-12 and , therefore , can not be induce to produce ifn-gamma .
the apparent high frequency of il-12 -nonresponsive th cell within the allergen-specific population in atopic patient predict a limited skewing potential of il-12 in the case of established th2 response , but only affect newly recruit naive th cell .
chronic human immunodeficiency virus type 1 infection of myeloid cell disrupt the autoregulatory control of the nf-kappab/rel pathway via enhance ikappabalpha degradation .
productive human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection cause sustained nf-kappab dna-binding activity in chronically infect monocytic cell .
a direct temporal correlation exist between hiv infection and the appearance of nf-kappab dna-binding activity in myelomonoblastic plb-985 cell .
to examine the molecular basis of constitutive nf-kappab dna-binding activity in hiv1_-infected cell , we analyze the phosphorylation and turnover of ikappabalpha protein , the activity of the double-stranded rna-dependent protein kinase ( pkr ) and the intracellular level of nf-kappab subunit in the plb-985 and u937 myeloid cell model .
hiv-1 infection result in constitutive , low-level expression of type 1 interferon ( ifn ) at the mrna level .
constitutive pkr activity be also detect in hiv-1 -infected cell a a result of low-level ifn production , since the addition of anti-ifn-alpha/beta antibody to the cell decrease pkr expression .
furthermore , the analysis of ikappabalpha turnover demonstrate an increase degradation of ikappabalpha in hiv-1 -infected cell that may account for the constitutive dna binding activity .
a dramatic increase in the intracellular level of nf-kappab subunit c-rel and nf-kappab2 p100 and a moderate increase in nf-kappab2 p52 and rela ( p65 ) be detect in hiv-1 -infected cell , whereas nf-kappab1 p105/p50 level be not alter relative to the level in uninfected cell .
we suggest that hiv-1 infection of myeloid cell induce ifn production and pkr activity , which in turn contribute to enhance ikappabalpha phosphorylation and subsequent degradation .
nuclear translocation of nf-kappab subunit may ultimately increase the intracellular pool of nf-kappab /ikappabalpha by an autoregulatory mechanism .
enhance turnover of ikappabalpha and the accumulation of nf-kappab /rel protein may contribute to the chronically activated state of hiv-1 -infected cell .
differential regulation of proto-oncogene c-jun and c-fos in t lymphocyte activate through cd28 .
the t cell surface molecule cd28 bind to ligand on accessory cell and apc , play an important costimulatory role in the response of t cell to ag .
our knowledge of the intracellular signaling pathway couple to this receptor be incomplete .
in addition to activation of phospholipase c gamma 1 , ligation of this receptor also seem to activate a calcium -independent , cd28 -specific pathway .
in this paper , we report that cross-linking of cd28 ( but not cd2 , cd5 , lfa-1 , or cd7 ) lead to an elevation of c-jun mrna , with only minimal activation of c-fos expression .
cd28 -dependent induction of c-jun expression require protein tyrosine kinase activity , but do not depend on activation of a phorbol ester -responsive protein kinase c or elevation of cytosolic calcium .
furthermore , cd28 -dependent elevation of c-jun mrna do not appear to be mediate at the level of mrna stability .
a mechanism be suggest whereby expression of c-jun and junb , in the absence of member of the fo family , can prevent inappropriate activation of t cell cause by ligation of cd28 in the absence of a specific antigenic stimulus .
selective expression of an interleukin-12 receptor component by human t helper 1 cell .
interleukin-12 ( il-12 ) , a heterodimeric cytokine produce by activate monocyte and dendritic cell , play a crucial role in regulate interferon ( ifn ) -gamma production and in the generation of ifn-gamma -producing t helper 1 ( th1 ) cell .
here we show that the il-12 receptor ( il-12r ) beta 2 subunit , a recently clone binding and signal transducing component of the il-12r , be express on human th1 but not th2 clone and be induce during differentiation of human naive cell along the th1 but not the th2 pathway .
il-12 and type i but not type ii interferon induce expression of the il-12r beta 2 chain during in vitro t cell differentiation after antigen receptor triggering .
the selective expression and regulation of the il-12r beta 2 subunit may help to understand the basis of th1/th2 differentiation and may provide therapeutic option for alter the th1/th2 balance in several immuno-pathological condition such a autoimmune disease and allergy .
central nervous system -derived cell express a kappa b-binding activity that enhance human immunodeficiency virus type 1 transcription in vitro and facilitate tar -independent transactivation by tat .
the tat protein of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) be a potent activator of long terminal repeat -directed transcription .
while in most cell type , activation require interaction of tat with the unusual transcription element tar , astrocytic glial cell support tar -independent transactivation of hiv-1 transcription by tat .
this alternative pathway of tat activation be mediate by the viral enhancer , a kappa b domain capable of bind the prototypical form of the transcription factor nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) present in many cell type , include t lymphocyte .
tat transactivation mediate by the kappa b domain be sufficient to allow replication of tar -deleted mutant hiv-1 in astrocyte .
the present study demonstrate the existence of kappa b-specific binding factor present in human glial astrocyte that differ from prototypical nf-kappa b .
the novel astrocyte-derived kappa b-binding activity be retain on an hiv-1 tat affinity column , while prototypical nf-kappa b from jurkat t cell be not .
in vitro transcription study demonstrate that astrocyte-derived kappa b-binding factor activate transcription of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat and that this activation be dependent on the kappa b domain .
moreover , tar -independent transactivation of hiv-1 transcription be reproduce in vitro in an astrocyte factor-dependent manner which correlate with kappa b-binding activity .
the importance of the central nervous system -enriched kappa b transcription factor in the regulation of hiv-1 expression be discuss .
zap-70 tyrosine kinase , cd45 , and t cell receptor involvement in uv- and h2o2- induced t cell signal transduction .
several mammalian response to uv irradiation , include the activation of nf-kappa b , be believe to involve tyrosine phosphorylation .
uv irradiation and h2o2 treatment of t lymphocyte induce protein tyrosine phosphorylation and ca2+ signal similar to those observe follow biological stimulation .
we have examine the role of cell surface molecule in these response .
normal t lymphocyte whose surface expression of cd3 be deplete show impaired uv-induced tyrosine phosphorylation and ca2+ signal .
similarly , jurkat t cell line deficient in cd3 or cd45 expression also give impaired uv response .
however , all these cell type still give strong ca2+ and tyrosine phosphorylation response to h2o2 .
the t cell tyrosine kinase zap-70 be find to be highly responsive to uv and h2o2 treatment .
zap-70 responsiveness to uv require expression of both cd3 and cd45 , whereas only cd3 be require for the response to h2o2 .
uv -induced activation of nf-kappa b be block by cd3 depletion , indicate the importance of such cell surface molecule in biological response to uv .
in nonlymphoid cell , the epidermal growth factor receptor display increase tyrosine phosphorylation within second of uv irradiation .
these result suggest that uv -induced signal transduction be mediate via cell surface receptor that normally respond to biological stimulation , whereas h2o2 be able to partially bypass this requirement .
epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 ( ebna2 ) -oestrogen receptor fusion protein complement the ebna2-deficient epstein-barr virus strain p3hr1 in transformation of primary b cell but suppress growth of human b cell lymphoma line .
to develop a transformation system with a conditional epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 ( ebna2 ) gene , we fuse the hormone binding domain of the oestrogen receptor to the n or c terminus of ebna2 .
in promoter transactivation as well a primary b cell transformation assay these chimeric ebna2 protein be able to substitute for wild-type ebna2 in the presence of oestrogen .
here we provide evidence that this transformation be the result of double infection of a cell with two virion , the p3hr1 virus genome and a mini- ebv plasmid carry the chimeric ebna2 gene .
unexpectedly , expression of the same ebna2 -oestrogen receptor fusion protein in established human b cell lymphoma line result in growth retardation or growth arrest upon the addition of oestrogen .
by titrate the oestrogen concentration in these stably transfected cell , the growth retarding and the transactivating function of the chimeric protein could not be dissociate .
we propose that growth inhibition of established b cell lymphoma line be a novel function of ebna2 which have not be detect in the absence of an inducible system .
it remain open whether the growth retarding property of the ebna2 -oestrogen receptor fusion protein in b cell lymphoma line be due to unphysiologically high expression of the chimeric protein or to interference with a cellular programme drive proliferation in these cell line .
involvement of nuclear factor-kappa b activation in ige synthesis in human b cell .
nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be a transcription factor that bind to the consensus dna sequence in the cis-acting element of various gene .
although nf-kappa b activate the expression of many gene involve in immune and inflammatory response , little be know about the role of nf-kappa b activation in the induction of ige synthesis in human b cell .
therefore we first examine the participation of nf-kappa b in germline c epsilon transcription in a human burkitt lymphoma b cell line , dnd39 .
stimulation of dnd39 cell with il-4 or anti-cd40 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) activate phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase and subsequently induce nuclear expression of nf-kappa b , which be identify by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) , a potent antioxidant , block nf-kappa b activation cause by il-4 and by anti-cd40 mab .
although inhibition of il-4 -driven germline c epsilon transcription by nac be not sufficient , the agent remarkably diminish anti-cd40 mab -mediated up-regulation of germline c epsilon transcription .
second , we study the effect of nac on ige synthesis in human normal b cell costimulated with il-4 and anti-cd40 mab .
nac be effective in inhibit mature c epsilon transcription and ige synthesis in the t cell-independent culture system .
however , nac do not significantly affect the spontaneous production of ige by atopic b cell .
these result indicate that nf-kappa b activity be commonly inducible in dnd39 cell by il-4 and anti-cd40 mab and suggest that nf-kappa b sensitive to nac may play a role in regulate ige synthesis in b cell .
stable expression of transdominant rev protein in human t cell inhibit human immunodeficiency virus replication .
the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) rev protein be essential for viral structural protein expression ( gag , pol , and env ) and , hence , for viral replication .
in transient transfection assay , mutant form of rev have be identify that inhibit wild-type rev activity and therefore suppress viral replication .
to determine whether such transdominant rev protein could provide long-term protection against hiv infection without affect t cell function , t leukemia cell line be stably transduce with a retroviral vector encode a transdominant mutant of the rev protein , m10 .
while all the m10 -expressing cell line remain infectable by hiv-1 , these same cell fail to support a productive replication cycle when infect with a clone isolate of hiv-1 .
in addition , two out of three m10 -expressing cem clone be also resistant to highly productive infection by a heterogeneous hiv-1 pool .
expression of m10 do not affect induction of hiv transcription mediate by the kappa b regulatory element or tat .
importantly , constitutive expression of rev m10 do not alter the secretion of interleukin 2 in response to mitogen stimulation of el-4 and jurkat cell .
the inhibition of hiv infection in cell stably express a transdominant rev protein , in the absence of any deleterious effect on t cell function , suggest that such a strategy could provide a therapeutic effect in the t lymphocyte of acquire immunodeficiency syndrome patient .
hla binding characteristic and generation of cytotoxic lymphocyte against peptide derive from oncogenic protein .
aim and background : structurally alter protein ( derive from chromosomal translocation or gene mutation ) can be consider tumor specific antigen and represent an attractive target for a t-cell mediated response .
t lymphocyte recognize antigen in the form of peptide bind to hla-molecules .
material and method : peptide derive from oncogenic protein be screen for the presence of hla binding motif ; actual binding be evaluate by hla stabilization experiment use transfectants and specific anti-hla antibody .
specific lymphocyte be induce by in vitro peptide sensitization and screen by thymidine uptake or cellular cytotoxic assay .
result : we identify peptide derive from ews/fli-1 fusion protein and from mutate k-ras protein ( encompass respectively the fusion point and the mutation at position 12 ) that show bind motif for hla-cw*0702 and hla-a3 respectively .
the actual binding of these peptide be analyse in a stabilization assay .
we detect binding for the ews/fli-1 peptide and for 5 ra peptide ( 1 wild type and 4 mutate ) .
the effect of temperature , beta 2-microglobulin ( beta 2-m ) and fetal calf serum ( fcs ) on the binding and the stability of the hla/peptide complex be study .
a low temperature ( 26 degree c ) increase the binding both in hla-a3 and hla-cw*0702 , while fcs reduce it .
beta 2-m increase the binding to the hla-a3 molecule but do not influence the binding to the hla-cw*0702 .
the stability of already form complexed be somewhat different in the hla-a3 and hla-cw*0702 system : both be more stable at 26 degree c than at 37 degree c but while the beta 2-m and fcs do not influence the stability of the hla-a3 /peptide complex , they seem to cause opposite effect in the hla-cw*0702 system ( beta 2-m stabilize and fcs destabilize the complex ) .
finally , we be able to generate a specific cd8+ ctl line against a k-ras mutated peptide .
conclusion : although bind motif and actual hla binding can be detect in several case , the generation of a cellular response be infrequent , confirm that hla binding be necessary but not sufficient to obtain an in vitro response .
far optimization of culture condition , type of antigen presenting cell ( apc ) , peptide , use of stabilizer like beta 2-m be still need .
recombinant nfat1 ( nfatp ) be regulate by calcineurin in t cell and mediate transcription of several cytokine gene .
transcription factor of the nfat family play a key role in the transcription of cytokine gene and other gene during the immune response .
we have identify two new isoforms of the transcription factor nfat1 ( previously term nfatp ) that be the predominant isoforms express in murine and human t cell .
when express in jurkat t cell , recombinant nfat1 be regulate , a expect , by the calmodulin-dependent phosphatase calcineurin , and it function be inhibit by the immunosuppressive agent cyclosporin a ( csa ) .
transactivation by recombinant nfat1 in jurkat t cell require dual stimulation with ionomycin and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ; this activity be potentiate by coexpression of constitutively active calcineurin and be inhibit by csa .
immunocytochemical analysis indicate that recombinant nfat1 localize in the cytoplasm of transiently transfected t cell and translocate into the nucleus in a csa -sensitive manner follow ionomycin stimulation .
when express in co cell , however , nfat1 be capable of transactivation , but it be not regulate correctly : it subcellular localization and transcriptional function be not affect by stimulation of the co cell with ionomycin and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate .
recombinant nfat1 can mediate transcription of the interleukin-2 , interleukin-4 , tumor necrosis factor alpha , and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor promoter in t cell , suggest that nfat1 contribute to the csa -sensitive transcription of these gene during the immune response .
role of ascorbate in the activation of nf-kappab by tumour necrosis factor-alpha in t-cells .
the first product of ascorbate oxidation , the ascorbate free radical ( afr ) , act in biological system mainly a an oxidant , and through it role in the plasma membrane redox system exert different effect on the cell .
we have investigate the role of ascorbate , afr and dehydroascorbate ( dha ) in the activation of the nf-kappab transcription factor in jurkat t-cells stimulate by tumour necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
here we show , by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , that ascorbate increase the binding of nf-kappab to dna in tnf-alpha -stimulated jurkat cell .
the ability of ascorbate to enhance cytoplasmic inhibitory ikbalpha protein degradation correlate completely with it capacity to induce nf-kappab binding to dna and to potentiate nf-kappab -mediated transactivation of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat promoter in tnf-alpha -stimulated jurkat cell but not in cell stimulate with pma plus ionomycin .
afr behave like ascorbate , while dha and ascorbate phosphate do not affect tnf-alpha -mediated nf-kappab activation .
these result provide new evidence for a possible relationship between the activation of the electron-transport system at the plasma membrane by ascorbate or it free radical and redox-dependent gene transcription in t-cells .
modulatory effect of glucocorticoid and catecholamine on human interleukin -12 and interleukin -10 production : clinical implication .
interleukin-12 ( il-12 ) be a key inducer of differentiation of uncommitted t helper ( th ) cell toward the th1 phenotype , which regulate cellular immunity , whereas il-10 inhibit th1 function and potentiate th2-regulated response ( i.e. , humoral immunity ) .
to examine the potential effect of stress on th1/th2 balance , we study the ability of three prototype stress hormone - dexamethasone ( a synthetic glucocorticoid ) and the catecholamine norepinephrine and epinephrine - to alter the production of il-12 ( p70 ) and il-10 induce by bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) in human whole blood .
dexamethasone inhibit lp -induced bioactive il-12 production in a dose-dependent fashion and at physiologically relevant concentration ; it have no effect on il-10 secretion .
the glucocorticoid -induced reduction of il-12 production be antagonize by ru 486 , a glucocorticoid -receptor antagonist , suggest that it be mediate by the glucocorticoid receptor .
norepinephrine and epinephrine also suppress il-12 production in a dose-dependent fashion and at physiological concentration ; both catecholamine , however , dose-dependently increase the production of il-10 .
the effect of either catecholamine on il-12 or il-10 secretion be block completely by propranolol , a beta-adrenoreceptor antagonist , indicate that they be mediate by the beta-adrenergic receptor .
these finding suggest that the central nervous system may regulate il-12 and il-10 secretion and , hence , th1/th2 balance via the peripheral end-effectors of the stress system .
thus , stress may cause a selective suppression of th1 function and a shift toward a th2 cytokine pattern rather than generalized th suppression .
the th1-to-th2 shift may be responsible for the stress-induced susceptibility of the organism to certain infection .
through the same or a reciprocal mechanism , state associate with chronic hyperactivity or hypoactivity of the stress system might influence the susceptibility of an individual to certain autoimmune , allergic , infectious , or neoplastic disease .
physiological concentration of estradiol inhibit polymorphonuclear leukocyte chemotaxis via a receptor mediated system .
estrogen exhibit a variety of action , include immuno-modulatory effect , in vivo and in vitro .
the mechanism by which estrogen exert it anti-inflammatory effect be not yet understand .
we investigate the possible mechanism of estradiol act via the polymorphonuclear leukocyte ( pmns ) , which be important in the immune response .
the agent , 17 beta- estradiol , but not 17 alpha- estradiol , significantly reduce pmns chemotaxis to fmlp in a dose-dependent manner ( control v estrogen 10(-10)-(-6) m , p < 0.05 ) .
physiological concentration of estradiol significantly reduce the chemotaxis of pmns ( 10(-10) mol ) .
pre-incubation with clomiphene or tamoxifen which be estrogen receptor antagonist , eliminate the inhibitory effect of 17 beta- estradiol on the chemotaxis of pmns , restore it to the control level .
these observation suggest that 17 beta- estradiol suppress the chemotaxis of pmns by a receptor-dependent mechanism .
in addition , the level of estradiol in human plasma , which pmns be draw , show a close , inverse correlation with the pmns chemotaxis to fmlp ( r = -0.821 p < 0.001 ) .
estrogen may modify the activity of neutrophil during the normal menstrual cycle , not only during pregnancy , and influence inflammation .
interaction of a transcriptional activator in the env gene of the mouse mammary tumor virus with activation-dependent , t cell-specific transact factor .
the mouse mammary tumor virus env gene contain a transcriptional activator ( meta ) that can control transcription of the adjacent long terminal repeat region .
transcriptional control by meta parallel that of several lymphokine gene , be specific to t cell , dependent on their activation , and inhibit by the immunosuppressive drug cyclosporine ( csa ) .
dnase i footprinting indicate that nuclear factor from activate t lymphocyte bind a promoter-proximal site , meta(p) , and a promoter-distal site , meta(d+) , within the 400-base pair meta region .
nuclear factor from unstimulated , but not from activate cell , bind a site , meta(d-) , adjacent to meta(d+) .
meta(d+) direct transcription of a link luciferase gene , and gel shift analysis reveal binding of inducible , csa -sensitive t cell factor , in parallel with transfection result .
authentic nfat and nf-kappab target do not compete for the meta(d+) binding factor ( s ) .
the sv40 core sequence compete for meta(d+) binding factor , but meta(d+) fail to compete for the complex obtain with the sv40 probe .
our result , take together , indicate that meta(d+) be a novel transcriptional enhancer element that be similar in it cell-type specificity , activation dependence , and csa sensitivity to the nfat element .
it may be relevant to the role of mmtv in expression of ml antigen or the induction of t cell lymphoma .
tar -independent transactivation by tat in cell derive from the cns : a novel mechanism of hiv-1 gene regulation .
the tat protein of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) be essential for productive infection and be a potential target for antiviral therapy .
tat , a potent activator of hiv-1 gene expression , serve to greatly increase the rate of transcription direct by the viral promoter .
this induction , which seem to be an important component in the progression of acquire immune deficiency syndrome ( aid ) , may be due to increase transcriptional initiation , increase transcriptional elongation , or a combination of these process .
much attention have be focus on the interaction of tat with a specific rna target term tar ( transactivation responsive ) which be present in the leader sequence of all hiv-1 mrna .
this interaction be believe to be an important component of the mechanism of transactivation .
in this report we demonstrate that in certain cns-derived cell tat be capable of activate hiv-1 through a tar -independent pathway .
a tat -responsive element be find upstream within the viral promoter that in glial-derived cell line allow transactivation in the absence of tar .
deletion mapping and hybrid promoter construct demonstrate that the newly identify tat -responsive element correspond to a sequence within the viral long terminal repeat ( ltr ) previously identify a the hiv-1 enhancer , or nf-kappa b domain .
dna band-shift analysis reveal nf-kappa b binding activity in glial cell that differ from that present in t lymphoid cell .
far , we observe that tar-deleted mutant of hiv-1 demonstrate normal late gene expression in glial cell a evidence by syncytium formation and production of viral p24 antigen .
