minimal residual disease in acute myelogenous leukemia with pml/rar alpha or aml1/eto mrna and phenotypic analysis of possible t and natural killer cell in bone marrow .
here we study minimal residual disease ( mrd ) of patient with acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) who have pml/rar alpha or aml1/eto as well a the phenotypic analysis of lymphocyte subset involve in antitumor immunity .
eight patient in long-term ( lt ; 3 to 15 year ) and 15 patient in short-term ( st ; up to 3 year ) remission be study .
use the reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction ( rt ) assay , the limit of detection be 10(-5) to 10(-6) for pml/rar alpha transcript and 10(-4) to 10(-5) for the aml1/eto transcript .
simultaneously , t lymphocyte subset and nk cell from the peripheral blood ( pb ) and bone marrow ( bm ) be investigate by flow cytometric analysis .
four of the eight patient in lt and 7 of the 15 patient in st remission be mrd -positive .
although all mrd -positive patient in lt remission be still until now event-free , 3 of the 7 mrd -positive ( mrd + ) patient in st remission soon relapsed .
the total population of cd4 + , cd8 + and cd56 + [ possible t-cell and natural killer ( t/nk ) population ] in the bm of st patient and mrd +/lt patient be significantly ( p < .01 ) low .
the cd8 + cd28 + population show the same tendency ( p < .01-.02 ) .
the t/nk subset in the bm of mrd -negative ( mrd - ) lt ( mrd -/lt ) patient show similar number of cell a normal volunteer .
basically , the total percentage of the cd4 + , cd8 + and cd56 + cell population in the bm be increase and in the follow order : mrd -/lt patient , normal volunteer , mrd +/lt patient and mrd + or -/st patient .
the percentage of the t/nk-cell subset in the pb be not significantly different among these group .
thus , the difference of the possible t/nk-cell phenotype in the bm may strongly influence clinical and molecular remission .
these result still remain to be confirm by further study of the functional anti-tumor immunity of t/nk cell of aml in remission .
association of glucocorticoid insensitivity with increase expression of glucocorticoid receptor beta .
in many chronic inflammatory disorder , glucocorticoid ( gc ) insensitivity be a challenging clinical problem associate with life-threatening disease progression .
the molecular basis of gc insensitivity , however , be unknown .
alternative splicing of the gc receptor ( r ) pre-messenger rna generate a second gcr , term gcr-beta , which do not bind gc but antagonize the transactivating activity of the classic gcr , term gcr-alpha .
in the current study , we demonstrate that gc-insensitive asthma be associate with a significantly high number of gcr-beta -immunoreactive cell in peripheral blood than gc-sensitive asthmatic or normal control .
furthermore , we show that patient with gc-insensitive asthma have cytokine-induced abnormality in the dna binding capability of the gcr .
these abnormality can be reproduce by transfection of cell line with the gcr-beta gene result in significant reduction of their gcr-alpha dna binding capacity .
we conclude that increase expression of gcr-beta be cytokine inducible and may account for gc insensitivity in this common inflammatory condition .
evidence that calcineurin be rate-limiting for primary human lymphocyte activation .
cyclosporine ( csa ) be both a clinical immunosuppressive drug and a probe to dissect intracellular signaling pathway .
in vitro , csa inhibit lymphocyte gene activation by inhibit the phosphatase activity of calcineurin ( cn ) .
in clinical use , csa treatment inhibit 50-75 % of cn activity in circulate leukocyte .
we model this degree of cn inhibition in primary human leukocyte in vitro in order to study the effect of partial cn inhibition on the downstream signaling event that lead to gene activation .
in csa -treated leukocyte stimulate by calcium ionophore , the degree of reduction in cn activity be accompany by a similar degree of inhibition of each event test : dephosphorylation of nuclear factor of activate t cell protein , nuclear dna binding , activation of a transfected reporter gene construct , ifn-gamma and il-2 mrna accumulation , and ifn-gamma production .
furthermore , the degree of cn inhibition be reflect by a similar degree of reduction in lymphocyte proliferation and ifn-gamma production in the allogeneic mixed lymphocyte culture .
these data support the conclusion that cn activity be rate-limiting for the activation of primary human t lymphocyte .
thus , the reduction of cn activity observe in csa -treated patient be accompany by a similar degree of reduction in lymphocyte gene activation , and account for the immunosuppression observe .
cloning of a human homeobox gene that resemble a diverged drosophila homeobox gene and be express in activate lymphocyte .
a new homeobox gene , hb24 , have be isolate from a human b-lymphocyte cdna library .
northern blot analysis of polyadenylated rna purify from activate human b cell reveal a single mrna transcript of approximately 2.3 kb .
two cdna clone be sequence and provide 2,250 nucleotide ( nt ) of dna sequence information .
there be a single methionine codon-initiated open reading frame of 1,458 nt in frame with a homeobox and a cax repeat , and the open reading frame be predict to encode a protein of 51,659 dalton .
when the homeodomain from hb24 be compare to known mammalian and drosophila homeodomains it be find to be only moderately conserve , but when it be compare to a highly diverged drosophila homeodomain , h2.0 , it be find to be 80 % identical .
the hb24 mrna be absent or present at low level in normal b and t lymphocyte ; however , with the appropriate activation signal hb24 mrna be induce within several hour even in the presence of cycloheximide .
characterization of hb24 expression in lymphoid and select develop tissue be perform by in situ hybridization .
positive hybridization be find in thymus , tonsil , bone marrow , develop vessel , and in fetal brain .
hb24 be likely to have an important role in lymphocyte as well a in certain develop tissue .
distinct role of the molecular chaperone hsp90 in modulate dioxin receptor function via the basic helix-loop-helix and pa domain .
the intracellular dioxin receptor mediate signal transduction by dioxin and function a a ligand-activated transcription factor .
it contain a basic helix-loop-helix ( bhlh ) motif contiguous with a per-arnt-sim ( pa ) homology region .
in extract from nonstimulated cell the receptor be recover in an inducible cytoplasmic form associate with the 90-kda heat shock protein ( hsp90 ) , a molecular chaperone .
we have reconstitute ligand-dependent activation of the receptor to a dna-binding form by use the dioxin receptor and it bhlh-pas partner factor arnt express by in vitro translation in reticulocyte lysate .
deletion of the pa domain of the receptor result in constitutive dimerization with arnt .
in contrast , this receptor mutant show low level of xenobiotic response element-binding activity , indicate that the pa domain may be important for dna-binding affinity and/or specificity of the receptor .
it be not possible to reconstitute dioxin receptor function with protein express in wheat germ lysate .
in line with these observation , reticulocyte lysate but not wheat germ lysate promote the association of de novo synthesize dioxin receptor with hsp90 .
at least two distinct domain of the receptor mediate interaction with hsp90 : the ligand-binding domain located within the pa region and , surprisingly , the bhlh domain .
whereas ligand-binding activity correlate with association with hsp90 , bhlh- hsp90 interaction appear to be important for dna-binding activity but not for dimerization of the receptor .
several distinct role for hsp90 in modulate dioxin receptor function be therefore likely : correct folding of the ligand-binding domain , interference with arnt heterodimerization , and folding of a dna-binding conformation of the bhlh domain .
thus , the dioxin receptor system provide a complex and interesting model of the regulation of transcription factor by hsp90 .
a transcriptional regulatory element be associate with a nuclease-hypersensitive site in the pol gene of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 .
analysis of the chromatin organization of the integrate human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) genome have previously reveal a major constitutive dnase i-hypersensitive site associate with the pol gene ( e . verdin , j . virol . 65 : 6790-6799 , 1991 ) .
in the present report , high-resolution mapping of this site with dnase i and micrococcal nuclease identify a nucleosome-free region center around nucleotide ( nt ) 4490 to 4766 .
a 500-bp fragment encompass this hypersensitive site ( nt 4481 to 4982 ) exhibit transcription-enhancing activity ( two- to threefold ) when it be clone in it natural position with respect to the hiv-1 promoter after transient transfection in u937 and cem cell .
use in vitro footprinting and gel shift assay , we have identify four distinct bind site for nuclear protein within this positive regulatory element .
site b ( nt 4519 to 4545 ) specifically bind four distinct nuclear protein complex : a ubiquitous factor , a t-cell-specific factor , a b-cell-specific factor , and the monocyte/macrophage- and b-cell-specific transcription factor pu.1/spi-1 .
in most hiv-1 isolates in which this pu box be not conserve , it be replace by a bind site for the related factor ets1 .
factor bind to site c ( nt 4681 to 4701 ) have a dna-binding specificity similar to that of factor bind to site b , except for pu.1/spi-1 .
a gc box contain a bind site for sp1 be identify ( nt 4623 to 4631 ) .
site d ( nt 4816 to 4851 ) specifically bind a ubiquitously express factor .
these result identify a transcriptional regulatory element associate with a nuclease- hypersensitive site in the pol gene of hiv-1 and suggest that it activity may be control by a complex interplay of cis- regulatory element .
expression of c-fos correlate with ifn-alpha responsiveness in philadelphia chromosome positive chronic myelogenous leukemia .
this study evaluate ( i ) constitutive level of oncogene and p53 transcript in chronic phase cml patient and ( ii ) their modulation subsequent to in vivo therapy with rifn-alpha 2c .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) and bone marrow cell of 26 patient be examine for c-fos , c-myc , p53 and the hybrid bcr/abl mrna level .

induction of rela ( p65 ) and i kappa b alpha subunit expression during differentiation of human peripheral blood monocyte to macrophage .
we evaluate the expression and dna binding activity of nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b subunit in human peripheral blood monocyte and in monocyte-derived macrophage ( mdms ) .
constitutive dna binding activity consist of p50 homodimers be detect in nuclear extract from both cell type .
an additional complex compose of p50/rela ( p65 ) heterodimers appear only in nuclear extract from 7-day mdms .
immunoblot analysis show that the p50 subunit be constitutively express in monocyte and mdms .
in contrast , the rela ( p65 ) subunit be barely detectable in monocyte , but it level increase markedly in mdms .
analysis of rela ( p65 ) mrna reveal that the stability of rela ( p65 ) mrna be significantly high in mdms , compare with monocyte .
in mdms , an upregulation of i kappa b alpha synthesis as well a the appearance of a novel m(r) 40,000 form of i kappa b alpha be also observe .
these result suggest that macrophage differentiation result in the expression of active p50/rela ( p65 ) heterodimers with the capacity to activate target gene expression .
the parallel induction of i kappa b alpha synthesis may allow for the continuous presence of a cytoplasmic reservoir of p50/rela ( p65 ) complex that be readily available for inducer-mediated stimulation .
all-trans retinoic acid and 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 co-operate to promote differentiation of the human promyeloid leukemia cell line hl60 to monocyte .
a basis for differentiation therapy of leukemia be provide by knowledge of agent which induce specific lineage maturation .
all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) induce differentiation of hl60 cell to neutrophil and be use to treat acute promyelocytic leukemia .
we observe that ra do not induce neutrophil differentiation in serum-free grow hl60 cell whereas 50 nm 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( d3 ) induce maximal monocyte differentiation .
increase ra concentration reduce the d3 concentration require for monocyte differentiation .
cell treat with 5 nm d3 show little response , but differentiate maximally with 5 nm d3 and 10 nm ra .
the d3 analog mc903 , eb1089 and kh1060 be more potent inducer of monocyte differentiation .
the extent to which analog activity be increase after cotreatment with ra be inversely related to potency .
twenty-four hour treatment with 10 nm ra prim cell for response to 5 nm d3 ; the reverse sequence be ineffective .
prim with 10 nm ra , or subsequent treatment with d3 ( 5 nm ) , do not alter expression of mrna encode receptor for d3 ( vdr ) , ra ( rar alpha ) or 9-cis ra ( rxr alpha , beta , gamma ) .
that ra promote both neutrophil and monocyte differentiation have implication for the use of ra and d3 in treatment of leukemia and provide insight into mechanism whereby rar , vdr and rxr facilitate monocyte differentiation .
[ hormonal interaction and glucocorticoid receptor in patient with the nephrotic syndrome ]
as many a 27 child aged 6 to 15 year with morphologically verify nephropathy be examine .
four variant of change in the thyroid status , characteristic of child with different variant of nephrotic syndrome be distinguish : 1 ) biochemical sign of primary hypothyroidism , 2 ) biochemical sign of secondary hypothyroidism , 3 ) low content of t3 , 4 ) dysfunction of the hypophyseal and thyroid system .
it be show that the low level of steroid receptor , thyroid hormone that the low level of steroid receptor , thyroid hormone ( t3 and t4 ) and cortisol be typical of child with the sign of renal dysplasia .
it be assume that superaddition under such condition of immune glomerulopathy ( glomerulonephritis and nephrotic syndrome ) give rise to the resistance to the treatment with glucocorticoid .
gene for a tissue-specific transcriptional activator ( ebf or olf-1 ) , express in early b lymphocyte , adipocytes , and olfactory neuron , be located on human chromosome 5 , band q34 , and proximal mouse chromosome 11 .
murine b lymphocyte , adipocytes , and olfactory neuron contain a dna-binding protein that participate in the regulation of gene encode tissue-specific component of signal transduction .
purification and cloning of this protein , term early b-cell factor ( ebf ) , from murine b lymphocyte and independent cloning of a protein , term olf-1 , from olfactory neuronal cell reveal virtual complete amino acid sequence identity between these protein .
a a first step towards identify a human genetic disorder or mouse mutation for which ebf could be a candidate gene , we have chromosomally map the corresponding locus in both specie .
by southern hybridization analysis of somatic cell hybrid panel with murine cdna probe , fluorescence chromosomal in situ hybridization ( fish ) of human genomic clone , and analysis of recombinant inbred mouse strain , we have find single site for ebf homologous sequence on human chromosome ( chr ) 5 , band q34 , and on proximal mouse chr 11 , in an evolutionarily conserve region .
nuclear factor kappa b , a mediator of lipopolysaccharide effect .
exposure of certain cell type to bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) lead to activation of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , an inducible transcription factor .
one of nf-kappa b 's unique property be it posttranslational activation via release of an inhibitory subunit , call inhibitor of nf-kappa b ( i kappa b ) , from a sequestered cytoplasmic form .
this event be also trigger under various other condition of biomedical importance .
other bacterial toxin , tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf ) , interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) , t cell mitogen , uv light , gamma ray and oxidative stress be report to induce nf-kappa b .
the activated form of nf-kappa b , which be rapidly take up into nucleus , initiate transcription from immediate early gene in a wide variety of cell type .
most of the target gene for nf-kappa b be of relevance for the immune response and can be group into those encoding cytokine , cell surface receptor , acute phase protein and viral genome , such a that of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) .
we will discuss recent experimental evidence suggest that lp might share a pathway of nf-kappa b activation with other inducer of the factor .
this common pathway may involve reactive oxygen intermediate ( roi ) a messenger molecule .
a newly established megakaryoblastic/erythroid cell line that differentiate to red cell in the presence of erythropoietin and produce platelet-like particle .
in august , 1992 , we establish a leukemic cell line ( ns-meg ) from a patient in megakaryoblastic transformation of philadelphia chromosome-positive chronic myeloid leukemia .
the ns-meg cell be positive for alpha-naphthyl acetate esterase and periodic acid-schiff ( pa ) staining and for surface cd4 , cd7 , cd13 , cd34 , cd41a , and glycophorin a antigen .
ultrastructurally , the cell have alpha-granules , demarcation membrane , and platelet peroxidase activity .
the ns-meg cell spontaneously produce platelet-like particle which contain alpha-granules , mitochondrion and dense body , strongly suggest platelet production .
erythropoietin ( epo ) , granulocyte/macrophage colony stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) , and interleukin 3 ( il-3 ) promote the growth of ns-meg cell .
phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate increase the expression of both cd41a and cd61 antigen .
ten-day exposure to epo induce mature erythroblast and red cell .
these benzidine-positive cell be positive for hemoglobin f staining .
untreated ns-meg cell express mrna for the epo receptor ( epor ) , for gata-1 , and for alpha 1 , alpha 2 and gamma globin gene .
these result indicate that ns-meg cell undergo terminal differentiation of both megakaryocytic and erythroid lineage .
this cell line should be a very useful tool for the investigation of both megakaryocytic and erythroid maturation .
nitric oxide decrease cytokine -induced endothelial activation .
nitric oxide selectively reduce endothelial expression of adhesion molecule and proinflammatory cytokine .
to test the hypothesis that nitric oxide ( no ) limit endothelial activation , we treat cytokine-stimulated human saphenous vein endothelial cell with several no donor and assess their effect on the inducible expression of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 ) .
in a concentration-dependent manner , no inhibit interleukin ( il ) -1 alpha-stimulated vcam-1 expression by 35-55 % a determine by cell surface enzyme immunoassay and flow cytometry .
this inhibition be parallel by reduce monocyte adhesion to endothelial monolayers in nonstatic assay , be unaffected by cgmp analogue , and be quantitatively similar after stimulation by either il-1 alpha , il-1 beta , il-4 , tumor necrosis factor ( tnf alpha ) , or bacterial lipopolysaccharide .
no also decrease the endothelial expression of other leukocyte adhesion molecule ( e-selectin and to a less extent , intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ) and secretable cytokine ( il-6 and il-8 ) .
inhibition of endogenous no production by l-n-monomethyl-arginine also induce the expression of vcam-1 , but do not augment cytokine-induced vcam-1 expression .
nuclear run-on assay , transfection study use various vcam-1 promoter reporter gene construct , and electrophoretic mobility shift assay indicate that no repress vcam-1 gene transcription , in part , by inhibit nf-kappa b .
we propose that no 's ability to limit endothelial activation and inhibit monocyte adhesion may contribute to some of it antiatherogenic and antiinflammatory property within the vessel wall .
the proximal regulatory element of the interferon-gamma promoter mediate selective expression in t cell .
interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) be produce by natural killer cell and certain subset of t cell , but the basis for it selective expression be unknown .
within the region between -108 and -40 base pair of the ifn-gamma promoter be two conserve and essential regulatory element , which confer activation-specific expression in t cell .
this report describe study indicate that the most proximal of these two regulatory element be an important determinant of it restricted expression .
the proximal element be a composite site that bind member of the creb/atf , ap-1 , and octamer family of transcription factor .
jun be essential for activation-induced transcription and bind preferably a a heterodimer with atf-2 .
in contrast , creb appear to dampen transcription from this element .
the cpg dinucleotide in this element be selectively methylated in th2 t cell and other cell that do not express ifn-gamma , and methylation markedly reduce transcription factor binding .
a a target for dna methylation and for binding of transcription factor that mediate or impede transcription , this element appear to play a central role in control ifn-gamma expression .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 nef protein down-regulates transcription factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 in human t cell in vitro after t-cell receptor stimulation .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) negative factor ( nef ) have be show to down-regulate the transcription factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 in vitro .
to define the mechanism of action of the nef protein , the signal transduction pathway which may be affect in t cell by constitutive expression of the nef gene be examine .
stimulation of t cell with tumor necrosis factor , interleukin-1 , or lipopolysaccharide result in the recruitment of transcriptional factor to a similar level whether or not the cell express the nef gene .
on the other hand , stimulation of t cell by mitogen or antibody to the t-cell receptor ( tcr ) - cd3 complex result in the down-regulation of transcriptional factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 in cell express the nef gene compare with cell not express the nef gene .
because the nef protein do not affect the surface expression of the cd3 -tcr complex , we conclude that the nef protein down-regulates the transcriptional factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 in t cell in vitro through an effect on the tcr-dependent signal transduction pathway .
constitutive expression of specific interferon isotypes in peripheral blood leukocyte from normal individual and in promonocytic u937 cell .
constitutive expression of ifn-alpha5 and ifn-beta be detect in different lymphoid cell include peripheral blood mononuclear cell from normal individual follow amplification of ifn mrna by reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction and direct sequencing of the amplify product .

this endogenous ifn be also show to play a role in maintain the basal level of expression of the major histocompatibility class i gene in lymphoid cell .
these result suggest that ifn-alpha5 and ifn-beta be produce at low level in normal tissue and play an important role in the regulation of cell function and in the maintenance of homeostasis .
identification of sequence alteration in the upstream regulatory region of the estrogen receptor gene in an er-negative breast cancer cell line .
given the important role of the estrogen receptor ( er ) in the development and physiology of the breast , it be essential to delineate the mechanism responsible for it failed expression in some breast tumor .
we have clone and sequence a portion of the er upstream regulatory region from the er -positive mcf-7 and the er -negative mda-mb-231 breast cancer cell line to determine if sequence alteration in this region account for the er -negative phenotype of some tumor .
from this , we identify a number of variation between the sequence , two of which be determine to be associate with a 50 % decrease in cat activity .
calcium -dependent immediate-early gene induction in lymphocyte be negatively regulate by p21ha-ras .
the induction of immediate-early ( ie ) response gene , such a egr-1 , c-fos , and c-jun , occur rapidly after the activation of t lymphocyte .
the process of activation involve calcium mobilization , activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) , and phosphorylation of tyrosine kinase .
p21(ras) , a guanine nucleotide binding factor , mediate t-cell signal transduction through pkc -dependent and pkc -independent pathway .
the involvement of p21(ras) in the regulation of calcium -dependent signal have be suggest through analysis of it role in the activation of nf-at .
we have investigate the induction of the ie gene in response to calcium signal in jurkat cell ( in the presence of activate p21(ras) ) and their correlate consequence .
the expression of activate p21(ras) negatively regulate the induction of ie gene by calcium ionophore .
this inhibition of calcium -activated ie gene induction be reverse by treatment with cyclosporin a , suggest the involvement of calcineurin in this regulation .
a late result of inhibition of this activation pathway by p21(ras) be down-regulation of the activity of the transcription factor ap-1 and subsequent coordinate reduction in il-2 gene expression and protein production .
these result suggest that p2l(ras) be an essential mediator in generate not only positive but also negative modulatory mechanism control the competence of t cell in response to inductive stimulation .
hiv do not replicate in naive cd4 t cell stimulate with cd3/cd28 .
in this report , we demonstrate that the t cell tropic strain of hiv , lai , do not replicate in naive cd4 t cell stimulate by cross-linking cd3 and cd28 .
in contrast , lai replicate well in memory cd4 t cell stimulate in the same way .
unlike this physiologically relevant stimulation , pha stimulate productive lai replication in both naive and memory t cell .
these study be conduct with highly purify ( facs-isolated ) subset of cd4 t cell identify by expression of both cd45ra and cd62l .
remixing of purify t cell show that naive t cell do not suppress lai replication in memory t cell and that memory t cell do not restore lai expression in naive t cell .
the suppression of productive lai replication in naive t cell be not due to differential expression of viral coreceptors , nor be it due to inhibition of activation of the important hiv transcription factor , nuclear factor-kappab and activator protein-1 .
the inherent resistance of naive t cell to productive hiv infection , couple with their proliferative advantage a demonstrate here , provide a sound basis for proposed clinical therapy use ex vivo expansion and reinfusion of cd4 t cell from hiv -infected adult .
inhibition of nf-at -dependent transcription by nf-kappa b : implication for differential gene expression in t helper cell subset .
activation of individual cd4+ t cell result in differential lymphokine expression : interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) be preferentially produce by t helper type 1 ( th1 ) cell , which be involve in cell-mediated immune response , whereas il-4 be synthesize by th2 cell , which be essential for humoral immunity .
the ca(2+) -dependent factor nf-atp play a key role in the inducible transcription of both these lymphokine gene .
however , while il2 expression require the contribution of ca(2+)- and protein kinase c -dependent signal , we report that activation of human il4 transcription through the ca(2+)-dependent pathway be diminish by protein kinase c stimulation in jurkat t cell .
this phenomenon be due to mutually exclusive binding of nf-atp and nf-kappa b to the p sequence , an element located 69 bp upstream of the il4 transcription initiation site .
human il4 promoter -mediated transcription be downregulated in jurkat cell stimulate with the nf-kappa b -activating cytokine tumor necrosis factor alpha and suppress in rela -overexpressing cell .
in contrast , protein kinase c stimulation or rela overexpression do not affect the activity of a human il4 promoter contain a mouse p sequence , which be a higher-affinity site for nf-atp and a lower-affinity site for rela .
thus , competition between two general transcriptional activator , rela and nf-atp , mediate the inhibitory effect of protein kinase c stimulation on il4 expression and may contribute to differential gene expression in th cell .
gm-csf and il-2 share common control mechanism in response to costimulatory signal in t cell .
antigen complexed with major histocompatibility complex class i or ii molecule on the surface of antigen presenting cell interact with the t cell receptor ( tcr ) on the surface of t cell and initiate an activation cascade .
so call costimulatory signal , mediate by other cell surface interaction or soluble cytokine produce by antigen presenting cell , be also require for complete t cell activation .
high level of cytokine gene expression in t cell also require both tcr and costimulatory signal .
the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor require sequence in the promoter as well a a powerful enhancer located 3kb upstream to respond to tcr -like signal .
these promoter and enhancer region be mainly activate by the transcription factor nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) .
the activation of nfat by tcr signal have be well describe for interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) and il-4 gene transcription in t cell .
costimulatory signal , such a activation of the cd28 cell surface molecule on t cell , lead to activation through a distinct region of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) promoter .
this region be term the ck-1 or cd28re and appear to bind specific member of the nf-kappa b family of transcription factor .
human t leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) infect t cell and can lead to increase gm-csf expression .
we have find that the htlv-1 transactivator protein , tax , act a a costimulatory signal for gm-csf and il-2 gene transcription , in that it can cooperate with tcr signal to mediate high level gene expression .
tax activate the gm-csf promoter through the ck-1 /cd28re region and also activate nuclear factor-kappa b bind to this region .
however , other transcription factor or coactivators of nf-kappa b be require for tax activation but these remain to be identify .
the ck-1 /cd28re of gm-csf show a high degree of similarity to the il-2 cd28re and the il-3 gene also contain a related region .
this observation , together with the fact that both gm-csf and il-2 respond to tcr signal via nfat , imply a high degree of conservation in the regulation of cytokine gene expression in t cell .
xenogeneic human serum promote leukocyte adhesion to porcine endothelium under flow condition , possibly through the activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b .
endothelial cell activation and leukocyte infiltration be a consistent feature of discordant xenograft rejection .
here we evaluate whether xenogeneic serum , a a source of xenoreactive natural antibody and complement , induce endothelial cell activation with consequent leukocyte adhesion under flow condition .
porcine aortic endothelial cell ( paec ) be incubate for 1 hr 30 min or 5 hr with 10 % homologous porcine serum ( control ) or 10 % xenogeneic human serum and then perfuse with total human leukocyte in a parallel plate flow chamber under laminar flow ( 1.5 dynes/cm2 ) .
adherent cell be count by digital image analysis .
xenogeneic human serum significantly ( p < 0.01 ) increase the number of adherent leukocyte a compare with porcine serum .
a similar adhesive response be elicit by tnf alpha ( 100 u/ml ) , one of the most potent inducer of endothelial cell adhesive property , here use a positive control .
in order to elucidate possible mechanism underlie endothelial cell activation by xenogeneic serum , we focus on transcription factor nf-kappa b , a central regulator for the induction of different gene , include adhesive molecule and chemoattractants .
by confocal fluorescence microscopy , we observe a positive staining for nf-kappa b ( p65 subunit ) in the nucleus of paec expose for 1 hr 30 min to human serum , which indicate nf-kappa b activation in this setting .
at variance , in paec incubate with the homologous serum , nf-kappa b be strictly localized in the cell cytoplasm .
treatment of paec expose to xenogeneic serum with the nf-kappa b inhibitor pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate ( pdtc , 25 microm ) and tosyl-phechloromethylketone ( tpck , 25 microm ) significantly ( p < 0.01 ) reduce leukocyte adhesion in respect to paec treat with human serum alone .
finding that xenogeneic serum promote leukocyte-endothelium interaction possibly through nf-kappa b activation might be relevant for design future therapeutic strategy aim at prolong xenograft survival .
human mhc class ii gene transcription direct by the carboxyl terminus of ciita , one of the defective gene in type ii mhc combined immune deficiency .
type ii major histocompatibility complex combined immune deficiency ( type ii mhc cid or bare lymphocyte syndrome ) be a congenital immunodeficiency disease characterize by absent mhc class ii expression .
four distinct complementation group have be identify .
recently , the defective gene in group ii type ii mhc cid have be isolate and term ciita .
here , we demonstrate that ciita be an mhc class ii gene-specific transcription activator .
the transcription activation function be provide by the n-terminal acidic domain ( amino acid 26-137 ) , which be experimentally exchangeable with a heterologous viral transcription-activating domain .
the specificity of ciita for three major mhc class ii gene , dr , dq and dp , be mediate by it remain c-terminal residue ( amino acid 317-1130 ) .
the transactivation of multiple cis element , especially s and x2 , of the dr alpha proximal promoter in group ii cid cell be ciita dependent .
since ciita overexpression in normal cell do not increase class ii expression , we propose that initiation of ciita expression serve a the on-off switch , while availability of downstream interactor ( s ) limit transcription .
the candidate oncoprotein bcl-3 be an antagonist of p50/nf-kappa b -mediated inhibition .
the candidate oncogene bcl-3 be discover a a translocation into the immunoglobulin alpha-locus in some case of b-cell chronic lymphocytic leukaemia .
the protein bcl-3 contain seven so-called ankyrin repeat .
similar repeat motif be find in a number of diverse regulatory protein but the motif of bcl-3 be most closely related to those find in i kappa b protein in which the ankyrin repeat domain be think to be directly involve in inhibition of nf-kappa b activity .
no biological function have yet be describe for bcl-3 , but it be note recently that bcl-3 interfere with dna-binding of the p50 subunit of nf-kappa b in vitro .
here we demonstrate that bcl-3 can aid kappa b site -dependent transcription in vivo by counteract the inhibitory effect of p50/nf-kappa b homodimers .
bcl-3 may therefore aid activation of select nf-kappa b -regulated gene , include those of the human immunodeficiency virus .
negative transcriptional regulation of human interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene by glucocorticoid through interference with nuclear transcription factor ap-1 and nf-at .
il-2 gene transcription be affect by several nuclear protein .
we ask whether dexamethasone ( dex ) and cyclosporin a ( csa ) inhibit il-2 gene transcription by interfere with the activity of nuclear protein that bind to the il-2 promoter .
nuclear extract from primary human t lymphocyte be analyze by electrophoretic dna mobility shift assay .
both dex and csa inhibit the binding of transcription factor ap-1 and nf-at , but not of nf-kb and oct-1/oaf , to their corresponding site on the il-2 gene promoter .
to correlate change in nuclear factor binding in vitro with transcriptional activity in vivo and define the structural requirement for il-2 promoter repression , we use transient dna transfections .
jurkat cell be transfected with plasmid contain either the intact il-2 promoter or it ap-1 , nf-at , and nf-kb motif .
dex inhibit the il-2 promoter and the ap-1 , but not the nf-at and nf-kb plasmid .
in contrast , csa inhibit the il-2 promoter and the nf-at , but not the ap-1 and nf-kb plasmid .
these result suggest that in human t lymphocyte both dex and csa inhibit il-2 gene transcription through interference with transcription factor ap-1 and nf-at .
we propose that , while maximum inhibition may involve interaction with both transcription factor , ap-1 be the primary target of dex .
association of alteration in nf-kappa b moiety with hiv type 1 proviral latency in certain monocytic cell .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication be control by a complex array of virally encode and cellular protein .
a wide spectrum of level of hiv-1 expression have be demonstrate in various cell , both in cell culture and in vivo .
molecular mechanism lead to restricted hiv-1 replication may differ between certain cell type .
it be now demonstrate that hiv-1 proviral latency in the monocytic cell line u1 , in which only extremely low level of hiv-1 expression be detect in the baseline unstimulated state , be associate with alteration in nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) moiety demonstrate in these cell by electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsas ) and in situ uv cross-linking study .
a predominance of p50 nf-kappa b moiety and possibly p50 homodimers or closely related specie , rather than the p50-p56 heterodimer of nf-kappa b that be the predominant nf-kappa b specie in most t lymphocytic and monocytic cell , be demonstrate in the nucleus of u1 cell .
this pattern of nf-kappa b-related moiety differ from the latently infected t lymphocytic cell line ach-2 , and from the u937 monocytic line , the parental cell line of the u1 cellular clone .
a such , these data suggest that different proximal mechanism may lead to restricted hiv-1 replication in various cell type .
t cell-specific negative regulation of transcription of the human cytokine il-4 .
il-4 secrete by activate t cell be a pleiotropic cytokine affect growth and differentiation of diverse cell type such a t cell , b cell , and mast cell .
we investigate the upstream regulatory element of the human il-4 promoter .
a novel t cell-specific negative regulatory element ( nre ) compose of two protein-binding site be map in the 5' flanking region of the il-4 gene : -311ctcccttct-303 ( nre-i ) and -288ctttttgctt-tgc-300 ( nre-ii ) .
a t cell-specific protein neg-1 and a ubiquitous protein neg-2 bind to nre-i and nre-ii , respectively , be identify .
furthermore , a positive regulatory element be find 45 bp downstream of the nre .
the enhancer activity of the pre be completely suppress when the nre be present .
these data suggest that il-4 promoter activity be normally down-regulated by an nre via repression of the enhancer positive regulatory element .
these data may have implication for the stringent control of il-4 expression in t cell .
corticosteroid receptor in lymphocyte : a possible marker of brain involution ?
a similarity have recently be find between the regulation of corticosteroid receptor in brain and in lymphoid tissue .
we have study the regulation of corticosteroid receptor in human mononuclear leukocyte a a possible marker of brain involution .
type i corticosteroid receptor be down regulate by excess of mineralocorticoid ( primary and secondary hyperaldosteronism , pseudohyperaldosteronism ) and of glucocorticoid ( cushing 's syndrome ) . type ii corticosteroid receptor be not reduce by excess of endogenous corticosteroid ( cushing 's syndrome ) .
in normal adult there be a direct significant correlation between plasma cortisol and type i and between plasma cortisol and type ii receptor in mononuclear leukocyte , while in cushing 's syndrome the correlation be inverse between plasma cortisol at 8 a.m. and type ii receptor .
in an aged population the mean number of type i and of type ii receptor be low and plasma cortisol be high than in adult control , but the increase of plasma cortisol be not follow by a clinical picture of hypercorticism .
corticosteroid type i and type ii receptor be inversely correlate with age .
after dexamethasone suppression ( 1 mg at 11 p.m. ) type i receptor always decrease in control while the response of type ii be not homogeneous .
in an aged group of patient , both receptor be reduce by dexamethasone .
we conclude that the decrease with age of corticosteroid receptor be possibly related to a physiological involution of corticosteroid receptor and that this reduction do increase plasma cortisol concentration , without affect the glucocorticoid effector mechanism .
circumvention of tolerance for the nuclear t cell protein tcf-1 by immunization of tcf-1 knock-out mouse .
molecular event that underlie the well-defined phenotypic change of the differentiate thymocyte be poorly understand .
a candidate gene to control thymocyte differentiation , t cell factor-1 ( tcf-1 ) * encode a dna-binding protein .
it mrna expression pattern be complex during embryogenesis , yet restricted to lymphocyte postnatally .
expression study on tcf-1 protein have be hamper by the difficulty to raise antibody due to extreme evolutionary conservation .
tcf-1 knock-out mouse , generate recently in our laboratory , have strongly decrease number of thymocytes , but be otherwise normal .
we have use these mouse to generate anti- tcf-1 antibody .
by immunization with a recombinant fusion protein , we show that tcf-1 knock-out mouse readily yield antiserum titer against human and mouse tcf-1 protein .
wild-type littermates remain unresponsive to tcf-1 while they mount a high-titer antibody response to the fusion protein , maltose binding protein ( mbp ) .
subsequently , tcf-1 -specific hybridoma could be prepare from the spleen of immunize knock-out mouse .
this study illustrate the almost complete tolerance of mouse for human tcf-1 and demonstrate that this tolerance be readily break by gene knock-out .
furthermore , the usefulness of knock-out mouse for the generation of monoclonal antibody against the gene product of interest be underscore .
usf-related transcription factor , hiv-tf1 , stimulate transcription of human immunodeficiency virus-1 .
the transcription factor hiv-tf1 , which bind to a region about 60 bp upstream from the enhancer of the human immunodeficiency virus-1 ( hiv-1 ) , be purify from human b cell .
hiv-tf1 have a molecular weight of 39,000 .
binding of hiv-tf1 to the hiv long terminal repeat ( ltr ) activate transcription from the hiv promoter in vitro .
the hiv-tf1 -binding site in hiv ltr be similar to the site recognize by upstream stimulatory factor ( usf ) in the adenovirus major late promoter .
dna-binding property of hiv-tf1 suggest that hiv-tf1 might be identical or related to usf .
interestingly , treatment of purify hiv-tf1 by phosphatase greatly reduce it dna-binding activity , suggest that phosphorylation of hiv-tf1 be essential for dna binding .
the disruption of hiv-tf1 -binding site induce a 60 % decrease in the level of transcription from the hiv promoter in vivo .
these result suggest that hiv-tf1 be involve in transcriptional regulation of hiv-1 .
transcriptional control of steroid-regulated apoptosis in murine thymoma cell .
early study in murine t cell line indicate that transcriptional transactivation function encode in the glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) n-terminal domain be require for glucocorticoid -mediated apoptosis .
however , more recent study in human t cell line have suggest that the n-terminal domain be not necessary for steroid-regulated apoptosis and that gr -mediated transrepression may be the more critical mechanism .
to well understand the contribution of the gr n-terminal transactivation domain in mediate murine thymocyte apoptosis , we stably transfected gr , gr variant , and the androgen receptor ( ar ) into receptor-negative s49 murine thymoma cell .
gr expression level be show to be rate-limiting for initiate the apoptotic pathway , and a positive correlation between steroid sensitivity and gr -mediated induction of an integrate mouse mammary tumor virus ( mmtv ) ltr reporter gene be observe .
analysis of gr chimeric receptor contain the potent vp16 and e1a viral transactivation domain in place of the gr n terminus reveal that even low level expression of these receptor result in both enhance steroid sensitivity and mmtv induction , thus support a role for transactivation in apoptosis .
in contrast , we find that ar can initiate apoptosis in s49 cell after treatment with 5 alpha-dihydrotestosterone , despite it relative inability to induce high level expression of mmtv .
to investigate this far , we examine the steroid-regulated expression of an endogenous thymocyte-specific gene call gig18 .
we find that gig18 be rapidly induce to comparable level by both ar and gr , demonstrate that ar can indeed function a a transcriptional activator in s49 cell and , moreover , that gig18 induction may be a marker of early apoptotic event in steroid-treated cell .
take together , these result support our conclusion that transcriptional transactivation be a necessary signaling component of s49 cell apoptosis , although an additional role for gr -mediated transrepression can not be exclude .
epstein-barr virus ebna3c repress cp , the major promoter for ebna expression , but have no effect on the promoter of the cell gene cd21 .
ebna3c be a potent repressor of transcription when bind to dna a a fusion with the dna binding domain ( dbd ) of gala .
a survey of promoter have reveal that the wild-type , unfused ebna3c can specifically repress expression from reporter plasmid contain the epstein-barr virus cp latency-associated promoter .
repression of cp activity require amino acid 207 to 368 , which encompass a region resemble a basic dbd adjacent to a leucine zipper dna binding motif and a site which bind to the cellular factor cbf1/rbp-jkappa .
however , amino acid 207 to 368 be dispensable when the protein be bind to dna a a fusion with the gal4 dbd , thus implicate this region in dna binding .
mutation of the cbf1/rbp-jkappa binding site in ebna3c abrogate repression , strongly suggest that cbf1/rbp-jkappa be necessary for target the viral protein to cp .
consistent with this result , mutation of the ebna2 response element ( a cbf1/rbp-jkappa binding site ) in cp also prevent significant repression .
in addition , amino acid 346 to 543 , which be previously define a important for the repressor activity of the gal4-ebna3c fusion protein , also appear to be necessary for the repression of cp .
since repression by these fusion be not observe in all cell type , it seem likely that ebna3c either depend on a corepressor which may interact with amino acid 346 to 543 or be modify in a cell-specific manner in order to repress .
these data be consistent with ebna3c contribute to the regulation of ebna expression in latently infected b cell through cbf1/rbp-jkappa and another factor , but this need not directly involve ebna2 .
finally , although it have be report that ebna3c can upregulate cd21 in some b cell , we be unable to demonstrate any effect of ebna3c on reporter plasmid which contain the cd21 promoter .
lipopolysaccharide induce phosphorylation of mad3 and activation of c-rel and related nf-kappa b protein in human monocytic thp-1 cell .
many effect of lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) on gene expression , include that of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) , in monocytic cell be mediate by activation of kappa b dna-binding protein .
however , the specific member of the nf-kappa b /rel transcription factor family involve in the lp response , and the mechanism through which lp -generated signal be transduce remain unclear .
here we show that lp induce nuclear expression of c-rel/p50 heterodimers as well a p50/p65 ( nf-kappa b ) kappa b dna-binding complex in human monocytic thp-1 cell .
nuclear localization of these protein occur concomitantly with a rapid decrease in their cytosolic level and be independent of phorbol ester-sensitive protein kinase c .
within 24 h follow lp stimulation there be a striking increase in the level of c-rel , p105 , and p50 in the cytosol .
the increase level of these protein correlate with increase in the amount of their mrna during lp activation of thp-1 cell .
lp activation of thp-1 cell result in phosphorylation of mad3 ( an i kappa b -like protein ) , a rapid increase in mad3 mrna , and an increase in mad3 protein by 2 h .
thus , lp activation of human monocytic cell result in nuclear expression of c-rel /p50 and p50/p65 ( nf-kappa b ) and induce phosphorylation of mad3 .
thapsigargin induce il-2 receptor alpha-chain in human peripheral and jurkat t cell via a protein kinase c -independent mechanism .
thapsigargin ( tg ) , an inhibitor of ca(2+)-atpase , deplete intracellular ca2+ store and induce a sustained ca2+ influx without alter phosphatidyl inositol level .
tg plus phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) but not tg alone induce il-2 in jurkat t cell , suggest that tg have no effect on protein kinase c ( pkc ) .
however , tg induce increase in il-2r alpha protein as well a il-2r alpha mrna in jurkat t cell in a dose-dependent manner .
a similar increase in il-2r alpha by tg be also observe in human peripheral t cell .
far , like pma , tg markedly induce nf kappa b in jurkat t cell .
however , tg and pma exhibit a synergistic action on il-2r alpha expression , suggest that tg and pma induce il-2r alpha through distinct pathway .
pma - but not tg -induced il-2r alpha be inhibit by the pkc inhibitor h7 , whereas tg - but not pma -induced il-2r alpha be inhibit by cholera toxin , forskolin and 1 , 9-dideoxy forskolin .
in toto , these result suggest that tg induce il-2r alpha in human t cell through a pkc -independent pathway .
multiple transcription factor be require for activation of human interleukin 9 gene in t cell .
the genetic element and regulatory mechanism responsible for human interleukin 9 ( il-9 ) gene expression in a human t cell leukemia virus type i-transformed human t cell line , c5mj2 , be investigate .
we demonstrate that il-9 gene expression be control , at least in part , by transcriptional activation .
transient expression of the luciferase reporter gene link to serially delete sequence of the 5'-flanking region of the il-9 gene have reveal several positive and negative regulatory element involve in the basal and inducible expression of the il-9 gene in c5mj2 cell .
an ap-1 site at -146 to -140 be show to be involve in the expression of the il-9 gene .
a proximal region between -46 and -80 be identify a the minimum sequence for the basal and inducible expression of the il-9 gene in c5mj2 cell .
within this region , an nf-kappab site at -59 to -50 and it adjacent 20-base pair upstream sequence be demonstrate to play a critical role for the il-9 promoter activity .
dna-protein binding study indicate that nf-kappab , c-jun , and potentially novel protein ( around 35 kda ) can bind to this important sequence .
mutation at different site within this proximal promoter region abolish the promoter activity as well a the dna binding .
take together , these result suggest that the cooperation of different transcription factor be essential for il-9 gene expression in t cell .
activation of nuclear factor-kappab via t cell receptor require a raf kinase and ca2+ influx .
functional synergy between raf and calcineurin .
signal transduce via the tcr activate the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) , which , in turn , be critical to the transcriptional induction of many gene important for the proliferation and expression of a differentiate phenotype .
treatment of t cell with the protein kinase c activator pma in combination with ca2+ ionophores mimic this process , and the two agent be often substitute for tcr stimulation , bypass the tcr .
here we identify intracellular signal component involve in activation of nf-kappab follow tcr stimulation .
tcr signaling be trigger by treat jurkat t cell with pha or anti-cd3 ab , and nf-kappab activation be monitor by electrophoretic mobility shift assay and/or by kappab -dependent reporter assay .
contrary to the idea that protein kinase c be involve in tcr -mediated activation of nf-kappab , high dos of staurosporine do not interfere with activation of nf-kappab by pha , while the same dose of staurosporine completely block activation by pma .
pha -induced kappab-dependent reporter activity be , however , effectively block by a dominant negative form of raf-1 , suggest a critical role for a raf kinase .
the tcr -mediated activation of nf-kappab be also dependent on a ca2+ influx , because the ca2+ channel blocker , sk&f 96365 , as well a other agent that prevent the ca2+ influx , inhibit nf-kappab activation .
cotransfection of a constitutively active form of calcineurin largely substitute for the ca2+ requirement and reverse the blockade by sk&f 96365 .
consistent with these observation , coexpression of constitutively active form of raf-1 and calcineurin synergistically induce kappab -dependent reporter activity , suggest a physiologically relevant functional interaction between the kinase and the phosphatase .
inhibition of th1 development mediate by gata-3 through an il-4-independent mechanism .
recently , the transcription factor gata-3 be show to be selectively express in th2 but not th1 cell and to augment th2-specific cytokine .
here , we show that loss of gata-3 expression by develop th1 cell require il-12 signaling through stat4 and do not simply result from an absence of il-4 .
moreover , we demonstrate a novel role for gata-3 in directly repress th1 development distinct from it positive action on th2-specific cytokine .
gata-3 inhibit th1 cytokine by a cell-intrinsic mechanism that be not dependent on il-4 and that may involve repression of il-12 signaling .
thus , gata-3 expression and il-12 signaling be mutually antagonistic , which facilitate rapid dominance of one pathway during early th development , produce a stable divergence in cytokine profile .
characterization of cytokine differential induction of stat complex in primary human t and nk cell .
cytokine , il-2 , il-4 , il-6 , il-7 , il-12 , and il-15 be key regulator of human peripheral blood t and nk cell activation and differentiation but the precise mechanism that give rise to their differential activity within these cell be not clear .
recent study reveal that a family of transcription factor , signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stats ) directly mediate many cytokine signal .
we analyze the activation of stats in primary human t and nk cell by a variety of specific cytokine .
we demonstrate that il-12 induce stat4 only in freshly isolate primary nk cell , but not in primary t cell , consistent with the lack of the il-12 receptor in rest t cell .
in contrast , il-4 induce different c epsilon gas dna-protein binding complex in both t and nk cell .
moreover , il-4 costimulation with il-2 or il-12 do not alter their own preferential gas -like dna binding pattern when c epsilon- , fc gamma ri- , and sie gas motif contain oligonucleotide probe be compare , suggest that induction of gas-like dna-protein binding complex by il-2 , il-4 , and il-12 be highly selective and represent one important factor in determine specific gene activation .
in addition , il-6 and il-2 synergistically induce homo- and heterodimerized stat1 alpha and stat3 in both nk and t cell , consistent with their report synergism in modulate perforin gene expression .
we far demonstrate that il -2 , -7 , and -15 induce multiple stat protein , include stat5a , stat5b , stat1 alpha , stat3 , and another unidentified fc gamma ri gas dna-binding protein .
finally , we observe that activate stat5a and stat5b protein form distinct fc gamma ri gas binding pattern in t and nk cell , suggest that they might have different role in gene regulation .
our data provide evidence that the differential response in gene expression and cell activation see in primary nk and t cell on direct stimulation with different cytokine may be a direct result of distinct activation of stat transcription factor .
acetylsalicylic acid and sodium salicylate inhibit lp -induced nf-kappa b/c-rel nuclear translocation , and synthesis of tissue factor ( tf ) and tumor necrosis factor alfa ( tnf-alpha ) in human monocyte .
we have investigate the effect of acetylsalicylic acid and sodium salicylate on the lp -induced synthesis of the pro-coagulant protein tissue factor ( tf ) and the pro-inflammatory protein tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , as well a the prostaglandin pge2 in human monocyte .
both drug dose-dependently inhibit lp -induced tf and tnf-alpha synthesis at the mrna and the protein level , and reduce pge2 production .
a evidence by electro mobility shift assay ( emsa ) and the use of a nf-kappa b prototypic probe , these drug probably exert their inhibitory effect by interference with the nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b/c-rel protein .
these data may expand the understanding of the anti-thrombotic and anti-inflammatory effect of these drug when activation of monocyte occur .
evidence for a trans-acting activator function regulate the expression of the human cd5 antigen .
interspecies somatic cell hybrid be generate by fuse the mouse t-lymphoma cell line , bw5147 , with normal human t lymphocyte at different stage of differentiation .
thymocytes , activate peripheral t lymphocyte , or an activate t-cell clone be use a human partner , respectively , in three independent fusion .
irrespective of the human cell partner use for fusion , a certain number of hybrid lose cd5 surface expression over a period of time in culture .
analysis at the phenotype and genetic level show that lack of cd5 expression be due neither to segregation of human autosome 11 , on which the cd5 gene have be map , nor to deletion of the cd5 structural gene .
furthermore , loss of cd5 surface expression correlate with the absence of specific mrna .
since these hybrid preferentially segregate human chromosome , these result indicate the existence of a non-syntenic trans-active locus , or locus , positively control the expression of the human cd5 gene .
ebf and e47 collaborate to induce expression of the endogenous immunoglobulin surrogate light chain gene .
early b cell factor ( ebf ) and e47 participate in the transcriptional control of early b lymphocyte differentiation .
with the aim of identify genetic target for these transcription factor , we stably transfected cdna encode ebf or a covalent homodimer of e47 , individually or together , into immature hematopoietic ba/f3 cell , which lack both factor .
in combination , ebf and e47 induce efficient expression of the endogenous immunoglobulin surrogate light chain gene , lambda5 and vpreb , whereas other pre-b cell-specific gene remain silent .
multiple functionally important ebf and e47 binding site be identify in the lambda5 promoter/enhancer region , indicate that lambda5 be a direct genetic target for these transcription factor .
take together , these data suggest that ebf and e47 synergize to activate expression of a subset of gene that define an early stage of the b cell lineage .
abnormal apoptosis and cell cycle progression in human expose to methyl tertiary-butyl ether and benzene contaminating water .
1 . in this study we hypothesize that in individual with certain genetic makeup , mtbe , benzene or their metabolite act a adduct and may induce program cell death .
2 . our study involve a group of 60 male and female subject who be expose to mtbe and benzene -contaminated water concentration up to 76 ppb for mtbe and 14 ppb for benzene , for a period of 5 to 8 year .
for comparison , we recruit a control group consist of 32 healthy male and female with similar age distribution and without a history of exposure to mtbe or benzene .
3 . peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) of both group be test for the percentage of apoptotic cell and cell cycle progression use flow cytometry .
4 . when apoptotic lymphocyte from expose individual be compare to apoptotic lymphocyte from the control group , statistically-significant difference between each mean group be detect ( 26.4 +/- 1.8 and 12.1 +/- 1.3 , respectively ) , indicate an increase rate of apoptosis in 80.5 % of expose individual ( p < 0.0001 , mann-whitney u-test ) .
mtbe and benzene -induced apoptosis be attribute to a discrete block within the cell cycle progression .
because cell cycle analysis show that in pbl from chemically- exposed individual , between 20-50 % of cell be accumulate at the s-g2/m boundary .
5 . one of the signal molecule which mediate program cell death be nuclear factor kappa-b ( nf-kappa b ) .
nf-kappa b be examine a one of the many molecular mechanism for mediate cell death by mtbe and benzene .
indeed , addition of inhibitor of nf-kappa b activation pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) , to the lymphocyte of the chemically-exposed group be capable of inhibit program cell death by 40 % .
this reversal of apoptosis almost to the control level by inhibitor of nf-kappa b activation may indicate involvement of this signal molecule in mtbe and benzene induction of program cell death .
transcription factor nf-kappab regulate inducible oct-2 gene expression in precursor b lymphocyte .
the pou transcription factor oct-1 and oct-2 regulate the activity of octamer-dependent promoter , include those that direct transcription from rearrange immunoglobulin gene .
unlike oct-1 , which be constitutively express in many cell type , oct-2 expression be restricted primarily to b lymphocyte and can be induce in precursor b cell by stimulation with bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
however , the precise factor that mediate this induction mechanism remain unknown .
in the present study , we monitor oct-2 expression in cell arrest for the activation of nf-kappab , an lp -responsive member of the rel transcription factor family .
despite stimulation with lp , disruption of the nf-kappab signaling pathway in precursor b cell lead to the loss of inducible oct-2 dna binding activity in vitro and the suppression of oct-2 -directed transcription in vivo .
this biochemical defect correlate with a specific block to oct-2 gene expression at the level of transcription , whereas the expression of oct-1 be unaffected .
the finding that oct-2 be under nf-kappab control highlight an important cross-talk mechanism involve two distinct transcription factor family that regulate b lymphocyte function .
eicosanoids in breast cancer patient before and after mastectomy .

value be compare with those of patient with benign tumor ( n = 4 ) , or undergo a mammary reduction ( n = 7 ) .
postoperatively , blood be take as well in order to compare pre- and postoperative value .

the result show that eicosanoid synthesis in material from mammary cancer patient be different from that in benign mammary tissue .
the implication , in particular , in relation to future prognosis of the patient , remain obscure .
activation of transcription factor nf-kappa b by phagocytic stimulus in human neutrophil .
phagocytosis represent an important physiological trigger for the inducible expression of several gene in human neutrophil .
here , we report that a dna-binding activity primarily consist of the classical nf-kappa b heterodimer , p50/rela , be induce in phagocytosing neutrophil .
under these condition , nf-kappa b activation be find to be a rapid and transient response , reach a maximum by 10-15 min , and return to near-basal level by 30 min .
in neutrophil undergo the phagocytosis of opsonized yeast , the onset of nf-kappa b activation be parallel by a decline in immunoreactive i kappa b-alpha protein level , and the cellular i kappa b -alpha pool be replenish by 30 min , in agreement with our gel shift data .
we conclude that nf-kappa b activation could constitute one of the mechanism whereby the expression of kappa b-responsive gene be enhance in phagocytosing neutrophil .
to our knowledge , this represent the first demonstration that phagocytic stimulus can induce nf-kappa b activation in human neutrophil .
suppression of the human immunodeficiency virus long terminal repeat by cd8+ t cell be dependent on the nfat-1 element .
cd8+ t lymphocyte of hiv-1 infected individual produce a soluble factor that efficiently suppress hiv-1 replication at the transcriptional level .
we show here that the response of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) to mitogenic or tat -mediated activation be sensitive to the suppressive action of a herpesvirus saimiri ( hvs ) -transformed cd8+ t cell clone from an hiv-infected individual and supernatant from cd8+ t cell of hiv-1 -infected asymptomatic subject ( cd4+ > 350/microliters ) .
mutagenesis of nf kappa b or sp-1 element within the ltr result in no change in the ability of cd8+ t cell supernatant to inhibit tat- or mitogen- mediated ltr transcription .
however , the response to hiv-1 tat by a ltr in which the interleukin ( il ) -2 homology nfat-1 region be mutate result in almost complete elimination of suppression by cd8+ t cell .
this be not observe when the nfat-1 mutant ltr be activate by mitogen .
we have previously show that gene expression direct by the hiv-1 nf kappa b element be inhibit by cd8 + cell- derived supernatant ( copeland et al. , aid re hum retrovirus , 1995 ; 11 : 1321-1326 ) .
take together , these observation suggest that mitogenic activation , mediate primarily through the nf kappa b enhancer , be susceptible to cd8 -mediated inhibition , however , inhibition of tat -mediated activation may rely upon a different pathway that be nfat-1 dependent .
induction of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 by low-density lipoprotein .
low-density lipoprotein ( ldl ) be a well-established risk factor for atherosclerosis .
when endothelial cell be incubate with this lipoprotein in pathophysiologic amount , the cell be activate .
among the document cellular response to ldl be increase recruitment of monocyte , which be believe to play a major role in promote intimal plaque formation .
the finding present here link an atheogenic lipoprotein , ldl , with the induction of an adhesion molecule important in atherogenesis human ldl induce the vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 ) transcriptionally with an increase in mrna level through activation of the vcam promoter .
this effect be block by anti-vcam antibody .
after a 2-day incubation in ldl , the binding of nf-kappa b , which be believe to be a key oxidative-stress sensor for vcam regulation , remain at basal level .
in contrast , the binding activity of ap-1 and gata , on the other hand , be increase by ldl .
thus , a component of ldl -enhanced endothelial recruitment of monocyte be attribute to vcam-1 expression , which appear to be mediate through ap-1 and gata .
these data identify ldl a a vcam -inducer possibly distinct from cytokine and endotoxin .
suppression of human anti-porcine t-cell immune response by major histocompatibility complex class ii transactivator construct lack the amino terminal domain .
background : the class ii transactivator ( ciita ) be a bi- or multifunctional domain protein that act a a transcriptional activator and play a critical role in the expression of mhc class ii gene .
we have previously demonstrate that a mutate form of the human ciita gene , cod for a protein lack the amino terminal 151 amino acid , act a a potent dominant-negative suppressor of hla class ii expression .
porcine mhc class ii antigen be potent stimulators of direct t-cell recognition by human cd4+ t cell and be , therefore , likely to play an important role in the rejection response to transgenic pig donor in clinical xenotransplantation .
we be , therefore , interest in examine mutate ciita construct for their effect on porcine mhc class ii expression .
method : stable transfectants of the porcine vascular endothelial cell line piec with mutate ciita construct be test for sla-dr and sla-dq induction by recombinant porcine interferon-gamma .
transient transfectants of the porcine b-cell line l23 with the mutate ciita construct be test for the suppression of constitutive sla-dr and sla-dq expression .
t-cell proliferation study be perform use highly purify human cd4+ t cell .
result : in preliminary study , we demonstrate that transfection of the piec line with full-length human ciita construct result in strong expression of sla-dr and sla-dq antigen , thus establish the cross-species effectiveness of human ciita in the pig .
the mutate human ciita construct be , therefore , test in the pig .
piec clone stably transfected with one of these construct show up to 99 % suppression of sla-dr and sla-dq antigen induction and marked suppression of sla-dra mrna induction .
moreover , transient transfection of the porcine b-cell line l23 show up to 90 % suppression of constitutive sla-dr and sla-dq antigen expression in 5-8 day .
in functional study , interferon-gamma -stimulated piec clone transfected with this mutate ciita construct fail to stimulate purify human cd4+ t lymphocyte .
conclusion : mutated human ciita construct be potent suppressor of porcine mhc class ii expression .
sex and age distribution of 1,25(oh)2d3 receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear cell from normal human subject .
specific receptor for 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 have be describe in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) .
we have try to find out whether these receptor could show any difference in sex or age distribution .
twenty two healthy men aged 21-66 yr ( mean +/- sd 41.0 +/- 13.6 ) and nineteen healthy woman aged 22-60 yr ( 38.9 +/- 13.9 ) have be study .
the mean dissociation constant ( kd ) be similar in both sex ( 1.35 +/- 0.70 x 10(-10) m in male , 1.13 +/- 0.66 x 10(-10) m in female ) , but the concentration of bind site ( nmax ) be significantly low in female ( 2.32 +/- 0.92 fmol/10 ( 7 ) pbmc v 4.43 +/- 1.38 fmol/10(7) pbmc in male ; p = 0.0001 ) .
neither kd nor nmax be significantly correlate with age .
no difference be find between pre and post menopausal woman .
further study be need to elucidate if this sex difference in pbmc receptor for 1.25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 be of any pathophysiological relevance .
characterization of the nuclear and cytoplasmic component of the lymphoid-specific nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) complex .
the lymphoid-specific transcription complex , nf-at , be involve in early gene activation in t cell and be assemble from a pre-existing , t cell restricted cytoplasmic factor and an inducible ubiquitous nuclear component within 30 min after activation through the antigen receptor .
recent study have implicate the family of ap1 factor a component of the murine nf-at complex .
evidence be provide here that the nuclear component of human nf-at contain the phorbol ester-inducible transcription factor ap1 ( jun/fos ) .
we far characterize which ap1 family member can assume this role .
antiserum to fo inhibit nf-at dna binding a do an oligonucleotide contain a bind site for ap1 .
constitutive expression in vivo of fo , and to a less extent fra-1 , eliminate the requirement for phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) stimulation , leave nf-at -directed transcription responsive to calcium ionophore alone .
overexpression of cjun or jund , but not junb , also eliminate the requirement for pma , indicate that many but not all jun- and fos-related protein functionally activate nf-at -dependent transcription in the presence of the cytoplasmic component .
nf-at dna binding can be reconstitute in vitro use semi-purified ap1 protein mix with cytosol from t lymphocyte .
fo protein be not need for this reconstitution , and although junb be not functional , it can participate in the nf-at dna binding complex .
finally , we have partially purify the cytoplasmic component of nf-at and show by elution and renaturation from sds-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis gel that it have a molecular mass between 94 and 116 kda and may have multiple differentially modified form .

interferon exert their antiviral , antiproliferative and immunoregulatory activity by stimulate the expression of several gene .
such gene disclose a common element within their promoter , define interferon stimulated response element ( isre ) , which bind a nuclear factor ( s ) translocate from the cytoplasm to the nucleus ( isgf3 ) after the binding of interferon ( ifn ) to the specific receptor .
here we report the induction of the synthesis and of the hydrolytic activity of phospholipase c gamma 1 ( plc gamma 1 ) in human t lymphocyte by ifn-beta .
the increase level of plc gamma 1 become evident after 90 min of ifn-beta treatment and be still detectable after 24 h .
neither the plc gamma 1 overexpression induce by ifn nor the increase hydrolytic activity of the enzyme appear to be affect by pretreatment of the cell with the protein tyrosine kinase inhibitor genistein , which be know to prevent the association of isgf3 component .
these result suggest that in human t lymphocyte ifn-beta can activate other transcription factor ( s ) distinct from isgf3 to regulate plc gamma 1 expression .
in addition , the ability of this enzyme to hydrolyse pip2 , also in the presence of genistein , imply the possibility that this enzyme can exert it hydrolytic activity independently of protein tyrosine kinase activation .
alpha-lipoic acid be a potent inhibitor of nf-kappa b activation in human t cell .
acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( aid ) result from infection with a human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) .

the present study be base on report that antioxidant which eliminate ro should block the activation of nf-kappa b and subsequently hiv transcription , and thus antioxidant can be use a therapeutic agent for aid .

characterization of the murine cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor gene p27kip1 .
the cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor p27kip1 play an important role in regulate cell-cycle progression .
p27kip1 directly inhibit the catalytic activity of cyclin/cdks ( cyclin-dependent kinase ) complex and/or interfere physically with cyclin/cdks activation by cak .
interestingly , the expression level of p27kip1 mrna be maximal in rest go t-cells and rapidly decline follow anti-cd3 activation .
we report here the cloning of p27kip1 gene from murine genomic dna and the functional analysis of the promoter of the p27kip1 gene .

to analyze the regulatory mechanism control p27kip1 gene expression , we characterize the 5'-flanking region from nt -1609 to +178 .
the -326 to -615 region contain positive regulatory element .
soluble tumor necrosis factor receptor inhibit phorbol myristate acetate and cytokine-induced hiv-1 expression chronically infected u1 cell .
recombinant human tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) binding protein-1 ( r-h tbp-1 ) and recombinant human soluble dimeric tnf receptor ( rhu tnfr : fc ) be use to determine the relative contribution of tnf to phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) and cytokine-induced human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication in chronically infected cell line .
treatment of hiv-1 -infected promonocytic u1 cell with r-h-tbp-1 or rhu tnfr : fc reduce pma -induced hiv-1 p24 antigen production in a concentration-dependent manner , with a maximal inhibition of approximately 90 % .

r-htbp-1 also partially reverse inhibition of u1 cellular proliferation cause by pma .
both r-htbp-1 and rhu tnfr : fc block pma induction of nuclear factor ( nk ) -_kappa b dna-binding activity in u1 cell in association with decrease in hiv-1 replication .
we conclude that soluble tnf receptor can inhibit stimuli-induced hiv-1 expression and nk-_kappa b dna-binding activity in chronically infected u1 cell .
fa ligand induction in human nk cell be regulate by redox through a calcineurin-nuclear factor of activate t cell-dependent pathway .
fa ligand ( fasl ) on cytotoxic lymphocyte be important for mediate apoptosis of activate lymphocyte and other target cell .
we have report that nk cell function , such a proliferation , cell death , and killing activity , be subject to regulation by cellular redox status .
here , we report that expression of fasl protein and mrna in activate nk cell be also regulate by redox .
ligation of cd16 on il-2- preactivated nk cell result in reduction of intracellular peroxide level as well a induction of fasl expression .
this cd16 -induced fasl expression be suppress by oxidative stress , include thiol deprivation or treatment with hydrogen peroxide ( h2o2 ) .
addition of thiol-reducing compound , such a l-cystine , 2-me , or n-acetyl cysteine , restore fasl expression .
these data suggest that cd16 stimulation require cellular reduce status for fasl induction in nk cell .
because fasl gene activation follow cd16 cross-linking be regulate by the nf of activate t cell ( nfat ) , we examine the effect of oxidative stress on nfat activation .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay reveal that both thiol insufficiency and h2o2 treatment suppress dna-binding activity of nfat and that addition of thiol-reducing compound reverse or even enhance it .
furthermore , these oxidative stress inhibit activity of calcineurin , a serine / threonine phosphatase that regulate nfat activation .
these result suggest that suppression of calcineurin and nfat activation be a mechanism by which oxidative stress inhibit fasl induction in activate nk cell and far support the hypothesis that thiol-reducing compound might be require for maintenance of optimal nk function under physiologic oxidative condition .
steel factor affect scl expression during normal erythroid differentiation .
steel factor be one of the growth factor that control the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic cell and scl , also know a tcl-5 or tal-1 , be a transcription factor involve in erythropoiesis .
in this report , we study the role of scl in the proliferation of human peripheral blood burst-forming unit-erythroid ( bfu-e ) and the effect of steel factor on scl expression in proliferate erythroid cell .

scl protein level in bfu-e -derived cell be high in day 7 cell and decrease progressively from day 7 to day 14 of culture , suggest an association of scl with erythroid proliferation .
in contrast , scl mrna level do not decrease significantly between day 7 and day 14 cell , suggest that posttranscriptional mechanism be largely responsible for the decrease in scl protein observe .
the role of scl in steel factor -induced erythroid proliferation be then examine .
in bfu-e -derived colony culture with steel factor , colony size be significantly increase compare to control .
in day 7 and day 10 erythroid precursor culture with steel factor , scl protein be increase significantly compare to control .
the increase in scl protein level in early erythroid precursor stimulate with steel factor suggest one mechanism through which steel factor may enhance normal erythroid proliferation .
scl mrna level assess by northern blot in day 7 cell do not increase significantly in response to steel factor stimulation , suggest that posttranscriptional mechanism may also be important in the increase in scl protein observe in response to steel .
src-related proto-oncogene and transcription factor in primary human t cell : modulation by cyclosporin a and fk506 .
activation of t lymphocyte induce transcription of gene encode for lymphokine .
interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene expression be control transcriptionally by the cooperative activity of specific trans-activating factor that bind to the il-2 enhancer .
