since the induction of nf-at and ap-1 be induce by the same stimulus that stimulate il-2 production , these result indicate that the immunosuppressant action of csa and fk506 be exert at the level of these trans-activating factor .
the severe phenotype of female with tiny ring x chromosome be associate with inability of these chromosome to undergo x inactivation .
mental retardation and a constellation of congenital malformation not usually associate with turner syndrome be see in some female with a mosaic 45,x/46,x,r(x) karyotype .

study of the ring chromosome that have xist dna but do not transcribe it show that it ar allele be transcribe along with the one on the normal x allele .

a novel form of the myeloid-specific zinc finger protein ( mzf-2 ) .
background : myeloid cell development be control by tissue-specific transcription factor .
human myeloid zinc finger protein ( mzf-1 ) be a putative transcription factor contain 13 zinc finger , and have be suggest that it regulate the development of neutrophilic granulocyte .
result : here , we have isolate the murine and human cdna which encode a novel form of mzf protein ( mzf-2 ) .
murine and human mzf-2 protein consist of 814 and 775 amino acid , respectively , and have identity of 75.3 % between them .
the c-terminal half of human mzf-2 , carry the zinc finger domain , be completely identical with that of human mzf-1 , whereas the n-terminal half of mzf-2 be different from the corresponding region of human mzf-1 , and be cod by distinct exon .
mzf-2 mrna be express in myeloid cell , particularly in the cell commit to the neutrophilic lineage , and down-regulated by g-csf .
conclusion : mzf-1 and mzf-2 mrna seem to be produce by the alternative use of two different transcription initiation site .
the distinct n-terminal half of mzf-2 carry two characteristic domain , a leucine-rich domain call ler and an acidic domain , which suggest a unique function of mzf-2 in neutrophil development .
cytokine signal network and a new era in biomedical research .
elucidation of the biochemical nature of the signal transduction pathway that regulate transcription and replication be the focus of attention in molecular biology .
this research may make feasible manipulation of growth and differentiation of mammalian cell , which in turn would have profound implication in biomedical research on cell and gene therapy , and development of pharmaceutical product .
cytokine control growth , differentiation , death , and function of cell of lymphocytic , hemopoietic system , and together with nerve cell provide a pertinent model to study intercellular communication and intercellular signal network .
this review outline general feature of signal transduction and several aspect of cytokine network be discuss with emphasis on : transcriptional regulation of th1 and th2-specific cytokine gene in t cell , the role of cytokine and their receptor in growth and differentiation of hemopoietic cell , and the manipulation of cytokine network .
inhibition of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 replication in vitro by a novel combination of anti-tat single-chain intrabodies and nf-kappa b antagonist .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) tat , an early regulatory protein that be critical for viral gene expression and replication , transactivates the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) via it binding to the transactivation response element ( tar ) and , along with other cellular factor , increase viral transcription initiation and elongation .
tat also superactivates the hiv-1 promoter through a tar -independent mechanism , include tumor necrosis factor alpha-induced and protein kinase c ( pkc ) -dependent activation of nf-kappa b , and inhibitor of tat and nf-kappa b cooperatively down-regulate this tat -mediated ltr superactivation .
in this study , a combined pharmacologic and genetic strategy use two pkc ( nf-kappa b ) inhibitor , pentoxifylline ( ptx ) and go-6976 , and a stably express anti- tat single-chain intracellular antibody ( sfv intrabody ) be employ to obtain cooperative inhibition of both hiv-1 ltr -driven gene expression and hiv-1 replication .
treatment of cell with ptx and go-6976 result in cooperative inhibition of both hiv-1 ltr -driven gene expression and hiv-1 replication .
in addition , the combined use of anti- tat sfv intrabodies and the two nf-kappa b inhibitor retain the virus in the latent state for as long a 45 day .
the combined treatment result in more durable inhibition of hiv-1 replication than be see with the nf-kappa b inhibitor alone or the anti- tat sfv intrabodies alone .
together , these result suggest that in future clinical gene therapy trial , a combined pharmacologic and genetic strategy like the one report here may improve the survival of transduce cell and prolong clinical benefit .
pu.1/pip and basic helix loop helix zipper transcription factor interact with bind site in the cd20 promoter to help confer lineage- and stage-specific expression of cd20 in b lymphocyte .
cd20 be a b-lineage-specific gene express at the pre-b-cell stage of b-cell development that disappear on differentiation to plasma cell .
a such , it serve a an excellent paradigm for the study of lineage and developmental stage-specific gene expression .
use in vivo footprinting we identify two site in the promoter at -45 and -160 that be occupy only in cd20 + b cell .
the -45 site be an e box that bind basic helix-loop-helix-zipper protein whereas the -160 site be a composite pu.1 and pip binding site .
transfection study with reporter construct and various expression vector verify the importance of these site .
the composite pu.1 and pip site likely account for both lineage and stage -specific expression of cd20 whereas the cd20 e box binding protein enhance overall promoter activity and may link the promoter to a distant enhancer .
[ the value of the clinical test of glucocorticoid receptor of peripheral blood leukocyte in patient with chronic pulmonary heart disease ]
in order to inquire into the functional state of adrenal cortex in patient with pulmonary heart disease , the number of glucocorticoid receptor ( gcr ) of peripheral blood leukocyte in patient with chronic pulmonary heart disease be determine with radioligand-binding assay and the corresponding plasma cortisol level be assess with radioimmune assay .
the result show that the number of gcr in the patient be significantly reduce ( p < 0.01 ) and it be increase when their health state be improve .
however , it be still low than that in healthy subject ( p < 0.01 ) .
the number of gcr in the patient be greatly increase when these patient be treat with oxygen ( p < 0.01 ) .
no difference in plasma cortisol be find between the patient and the healthy subject ( p > 0.05 ) .
these result indicate that the function of adrenal cortex may be improve by the compensation mechanism of the patient , but the low gcr number be the result of lacking of oxygen in the patient .
the number of gcr may be improve by inhalation of oxygen .
therefore oxygen therapy be helpful in raise the activity of glucocorticoid receptor and control the development of the disease .
mutation of tyrosine 492/493 in the kinase domain of zap-70 affect multiple t-cell receptor signaling pathway .
the protein-tyrosine kinase zap-70 be implicate , together with the src kinase p56(lck) , in control the early step of the t-cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) signaling cascade .
to help elucidate far the mechanism by which zap-70 regulate these initial event , we use a dominant-negative mutant approach .
we overexpressed in the jurkat t-cell line zap-70 mutate on tyr-492 and tyr-493 in the putative regulatory loop of it kinase domain .
this mutant inhibit tcr -induced activation of nuclear factor of activate t cell by interfere with both intracellular calcium increase and ra -regulated activation of extracellular signal-regulated kinase .
moreover , tcr -induced phosphorylation of pp36-38 , think to play a role upstream of these pathway , be find to be reduce .
in contrast , overexpression of wild-type zap-70 induce constitutive activation of nuclear factor of activate t cell .
the zap-70 mutant study here could be phosphorylated on tyrosine when associate to the tcr zeta chain and be able to bind p56(lck) .
this result demonstrate that tyr-492 and tyr-493 be not responsible for the src homology domain 2-mediated association of p56(lck) with zap-70 .
our data be most consistent with a model in which recruitment to the tcr allow zap-70 autophosphorylation and binding to p56(lck) , which in turn phosphorylates tyr-492 and/or tyr-493 with consequent up-regulation of the zap-70 kinase activity .
zap-70 will then be able to effectively control phosphorylation of it substrate and lead to gene activation .
constitutively activate jak -stat pathway in t cell transform with htlv-i .
human t cell lymphotropic virus i ( htlv-i ) be the etiological agent for adult t cell leukemia and tropical spastic paraparesis ( also term htlv-i -associated myelopathy ) .
htlv-i -infected peripheral blood t cell exhibit an initial phase of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) -dependent growth ; over time , by an unknown mechanism , the cell become il-2 -independent .
whereas the jak kinase jak1 and jak3 and the signal transducer and activator of transcription protein stat3 and stat5 be activate in normal t cell in response to il-2 , this signaling pathway be constitutively activate in htlv-i -transformed cell .
in htlv-i -infected cord blood lymphocyte , the transition from il-2 -dependent to il-2 -independent growth correlate with the acquisition of a constitutively activated jak -stat pathway , which suggest that this pathway participate in htlv-i -mediated t cell transformation .
ubiquitinylation of transcription factor c-jun and c-fos use reconstitute ubiquitinylating enzyme .
recombinant c-jun and c-fos be ubiquitinylated by the ubiquitin carrier enzyme e214k , e220k , or e232k in the presence of the ubiquitin-activating enzyme , e1 .
addition of ubiquitin protein ligase e3 substantially enhance the e214k -mediated ubiquitinylation of c-jun and c-fos .
truncate c-jun and c-fos mutant protein include wbjun and wbfos be also ubiquitinylated under the same condition , suggest the site of ubiquitinylation be located within the dimerization and dna binding domain of c-jun and c-fos .
the e3-dependent ubiquitinylation of c-jun be inhibit upon the heterodimerization of c-jun with c-fos .
further addition of e220k significantly enhance ubiquitinylation of c-jun in the heterodimer suggest a regulatory role of e220k .
polyubiquitinylated c-jun , wbfos , and wbjun , but not e220k -ubiquitinylated c-jun , be readily degrade by the atp-dependent 26 s multicatalytic protease .
these result suggest that the temporal control of c-jun and c-fos may be regulate through the ubiquitinylation pathway , and the ubiquitinylation of c-jun and c-fos may in turn be regulate in response to the heterodimerization between them and the cooperation between e220k and e3 mediated polyubiquitinylation .
transcriptional activation of the macrophage colony-stimulating factor gene by il-2 be associate with secretion of bioactive macrophage colony-stimulating factor protein by monocyte and involve activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b .
human peripheral blood monocyte ( mo ) constitutively display the beta-chain of the receptor for il-2 , whereas expression of the il-2r alpha-chain be not constitutive but inducible with il-2 .
here we report that binding of human il-2 to it bind site lead to transcriptional activation of the macrophage csf ( m-csf ) gene in mo result in accumulation of m-csf mrna and subsequent release of bioactive m-csf protein a demonstrate by elisa and inhibition of il-2 induced release of an activity-stimulating growth of monocyte-type colony by a neutralize anti-m-csf antibody .
transcriptional activation of the m-csf gene by il-2 be precede by enhance binding activity of the transcription factor nf-kappa b to it recognition sequence in the 5' regulatory enhancer region of the m-csf gene .
moreover , use a heterologous promoter ( herpes thymidine kinase ) construct contain the nf-kappa b consensus sequence , it be show that nf-kappa b binding by an il-2 -induced monocyte-derived nuclear protein confer reporter gene ( human growth hormone ) activity .
take together , our finding indicate that il-2 induce gene expression of m-csf in human blood-derived mo and provide evidence for involvement of nf-kappa b in transcriptional regulation of this gene .
two-site interaction of nuclear factor of activate t cell with activate calcineurin .
transcription factor belong to the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) family regulate the expression of cytokine gene and other inducible gene during the immune response .
the function of nfat protein be directly control by the calcium- and calmodulin- dependent phosphatase calcineurin .
here we show that the binding of calcineurin to nfat be substantially increase when calcineurin be activate with calmodulin and calcium .
fk506.fkbp12 drug-immunophilin complex inhibit the interaction of nfat with activate calcineurin much more effectively than they inhibit the interaction with inactive calcineurin , suggest that part of the interaction with activate calcineurin involve the enzyme active site .
we have previously show that nfat be target to inactive calcineurin at a region distinct from the calcineurin active site ( aramburu , j. , garcia-cozar , f. j. , raghavan , a. , okamura , h. , rao , a. , and hogan , p. g. ( 1998 ) mol. cell 1 , 627-637 ) ; this region be also involve in nfat binding to activate calcineurin , since binding be inhibit by an nfat peptide span the calcineurin docking site on nfat .
the interact surface be located on the catalytic domain of the calcineurin a chain and on an 86-amino acid fragment of the nfat regulatory domain .
nfat binding to the calcineurin catalytic domain be inhibit by the calcineurin autoinhibitory domain and the rii substrate peptide , which bind in the calcineurin active site , as well a by the nfat docking site peptide , which bind to a region of calcineurin distinct from the active site .
we propose that , in rest cell , nfat be target to a region of the calcineurin catalytic domain that do not overlap the calcineurin active site .
upon cell activation , displacement of the autoinhibitory domain by calmodulin binding allow nfat to bind additionally to the calcineurin active site , thus position nfat for immediate dephosphorylation at functional phosphoserine residue .
growth regulation and cellular change during differentiation of human prostatic cancer lncap cell a induce by t lymphocyte -conditioned medium .
human prostatic epithelial cell from an androgen-dependent lncap cell line be examine in response to conditioned medium ( cm ) derive from phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) -stimulated lymphocyte .
addition of cm cause a great than 70 % reduction of cell proliferation by cell counting and cell cycle .
these cell show g1 phase arrest and the clonogenicity be reduce .

the prostate-specific antigen ( psa ) be downregulated to approximately 75 % during the process .

these include vimentin , correlate to cell shape change , cytokeratins 8 and 18 , associate with differentiate cell type of prostate epithelium , and neuron-specific enolase and serotonin , associate with neuroendocrine cell .

the activity be determine to be distinct from tgf , tnf , and some commonly known lymphokine .

increase proliferation , cytotoxicity , and gene expression after stimulation of human peripheral blood t lymphocyte through a surface ganglioside ( gd3 ) [ publish erratum appear in j immunol 1994 jul 15 ; 153 ( 2 ) : 910 ]
previous study have suggest that gangliosides have an important role in cell signaling and recognition .
however , their specific function in these process have not be clearly define .
a mab , r24 , that react specifically with a cell surface ganglioside ( gd3 ) have be demonstrate to stimulate proliferation of t cell derive from human peripheral blood .
in this study , we have investigate the mechanism by which the r24 mab affect t cell function .
we have observe that the r24 mab stimulate gd3 + t cell proliferation , cytotoxicity , and surface marker expression of il-2r alpha-chain , il-2r beta-chain , hla-dr , cd11a , and cd11c .

this treatment also cause increase tyrosine phosphorylation of specific protein substrate .
r24 -stimulated increase in proliferation , cytotoxicity , and cell surface protein expression could be block by cyclosporin and staurosporin , indicate that cyclophilin/calcineurin and protein kinase c may be involve in the r24 signaling pathway .
additionally , herbimycin a , a tyrosine kinase inhibitor , block the r24 -stimulated increase in proliferation but not cytotoxicity at concentration consistent with specificity for tyrosine kinase .
these result suggest that multiple biochemical pathway be involve in the activation of human t cell by r24 .
neutrophil and monocyte express high level of pu.1 ( spi-1 ) but not spi-b .
pu.1 ( the spi-1 oncogene ) and spi-b be closely related member of the ets transcription factor family , share similar dna binding specificity mediate by similar dna binding domain .
pu.1 and spi-b have be previously describe a be predominantly express coordinately in macrophage and b cell , but their expression in early hematopoietic stage and during the course of myeloid differentiation to monocyte and macrophage or to neutrophil have not be extensively investigate .
here , we report that pu.1 mrna be upregulated during myeloid differentiation of human purify cd34+ cell and murine multipotential fdcp-mix a4 cell , suggest that pu.1 be upregulated a an early event during differentiation of multipotential progenitor cell .
pu.1 expression be maintained at stable level during differentiation of myeloid cell line u937 and hl-60 to monocytic and neutrophilic cell .
pu.1 be express at high level in mature human monocyte and human peripheral blood neutrophil .
in contrast to pu.1 , significant level of spi-b mrna and protein be find only in some b-cell line and spleen but be not find in myeloid cell line , neutrophil , or macrophage .
in vitro translate spi-b protein can bind to pu.1 binding site in myeloid promoter and transactivate these promoter in nonmyeloid cell .
therefore , although pu.1 and spi-b may bind to similar dna control element and have redundancy of transactivation function in vitro , the lack of significant level of spi-b in myeloid cell make it unlikely that spi-b play a significant role in myeloid lineage development and gene expression .
in contrast , pu.1 be express at high level not only in monocyte and macrophage but also in neutrophil , indicate that pu.1 can activate gene expression in both major myeloid lineage .
characterization of the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen gene promoter .
mnda ( myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen ) be an interferon alpha regulate nuclear protein express only in cell of the human myelomonocytic lineage .
to identify mechanism responsible for this lineage-specific and interferon-regulated expression , the 5' flanking sequence of the gene have be characterize .
two interferon-stimulated response element ( isre ) flank a multiple transcription start site region identify mnda a a tata-less interferon-regulated gene .
other dna element present include a cluster of myb site , several ets , an ets related pu.1 site and an sp1 site located within 600 bp of the transcription start site .
in addition , dna methylation be reveal a one of the possible factor in establish mnda expression .
the 5' flanking sequence have promoter activity which be elevate by interferon alpha .
the finding indicate that mnda expression be regulate by mechanism similar to other myelomonocytic cell specific gene and gene up-regulated by interferon alpha .
transgenic expression of pml/raralpha impair myelopoiesis .
the translocation find in acute promyelocytic leukemia rearrange the promyelocytic leukemia gene ( pml ) on chromosome 15 with the retinoic acid receptor alpha ( raralpha ) on chromosome 17 .
this yield a fusion transcript , pml/raralpha , a transcription factor with report dominant negative function in the absence of hormone .
clinical remission induce with all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) treatment in acute promyelocytic leukemia be link to pml/raralpha expression in leukemic cell .
to evaluate the pml/raralpha role in myelopoiesis , transgenic mouse express pml/raralpha be engineer .
a full-length pml/raralpha cdna drive by the cd11b promoter be express in transgenic mouse .

basal total white blood cell and granulocyte count do not appreciably differ between pml/raralpha transgenic and control mouse .
cell sorter analysis of cd11b+ bone marrow cell reveal similar cd11b+ population in transgenic and control mouse .
however , in vitro clonal growth assay perform on peripheral blood from transgenic versus control mouse reveal a marked reduction of myeloid progenitor , especially in those respond to granulocyte/_macrophage colony-stimulating factor .
granulocyte/macrophage colony-stimulating factor and kit ligand cotreatment do not overcome this inhibition .
impaired myelopoiesis in vivo be show by stress these mouse with sublethal irradiation .
follow irradiation , pml/raralpha transgenic mouse , a compare with control , more rapidly depress peripheral white blood cell and granulocyte count .
a expect , nearly all control mouse ( 94.4 % ) survive irradiation , yet this irradiation be lethal to 45.8 % of pml/raralpha transgenic mouse .
lethality be associate with more severe leukopenia in transgenic versus control mouse .
retinoic acid treatment of irradiated pml/raralpha mouse enhance granulocyte recovery .
these data suggest that abnormal myelopoiesis due to pml/raralpha expression be an early event in oncogenic transformation .
adaptor function for the syk kinases-interacting protein 3bp2 in il-2 gene activation .
syk-family tyrosine kinase be essential for lymphocyte development and activation .
use a yeast two-hybrid screen to identify syk kinases-interacting protein ( skip ) , we isolate 3bp2 , an abl sh3-interacting protein of unknown function .
3bp2 be selectively express in hematopoietic/lymphoid tissue and bind via it sh2 domain activate syk-family kinase in mammalian cell , include in antigen receptor-stimulated t cell .
in addition to zap-70 , the 3bp2 sh2 domain associate in vitro with lat , grb2 , plcgamma1 , and cbl from activate t cell lysates .
transient 3bp2 overexpression induce transcriptional activation of the il-2 promoter and it nfat or ap-1 element .
this activity be dependent on the sh2 and pleckstrin-homology domain of 3bp2 , and require functional syk kinase , ra , and calcineurin .
thus , 3bp2 be an important adaptor that may couple activate zap-70 /syk to a lat -containing signal complex involve in tcr-mediated gene transcription .
il-4 down-regulates il-2 - , il-3 - , and gm-csf -induced cytokine gene expression in peripheral blood monocyte .
il-4 , a product of the t-helper 0 ( th0 ) and 2 ( th2 ) subset , be originally describe a a b-cell stimulatory factor and have subsequently be find to suppress il-1 alpha , il-1 beta , il-6 , il-8 , and tnf-alpha gene expression in monocyte stimulate with lp , and to upregulate il-1 receptor antagonist ( il1-ra ) gene expression .
in this study we investigate the effect of il-4 on the expression of cytokine gene in monocyte evoke by other t-helper cell cytokine : il-2 , il-3 , and gm-csf .
il-4 down-regulated mrna accumulation of the proinflammatory cytokine il-1 beta , il-8 , and tnf-alpha in monocyte stimulate with il-2 , il-3 , and gm-csf .
il-4 also suppress the il-2 -induced il-6 mrna expression .
temporal analysis of the il-4 down-regulatory effect on the il-2- , il-3- , or gm-csf- induced proinflammatory cytokine gene expression in monocyte provide evidence that il-4 act predominantly on the post-transcriptional level .
this be support by the observation that the down-regulatory capacity of il-4 appear to be dependent on de novo protein synthesis .
il-4 do not exert significant influence on the induction of expression of il-1-ra or various csfs by il-2 , il-3 , and gm-csf .

identification of target gene of the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct2 .
the oct2 transcription factor be express predominantly in b lymphocyte and play an essential role during the terminal phase of b cell differentiation .
the regulatory region of several gene specifically express in b cell contain functional bind site for oct2 .
nevertheless , none of the gene originally think to be regulate by oct2 be affect in their expression in oct2 -deficient b cell .
in an attempt to find such elusive oct2 target gene and to understand the molecular function of oct2 in b cell development , we isolate cdna for oct2 target gene .
so far , we have identify five potential target for oct2 : the membrane glycoprotein cd36 , the cysteine-rich secrete protein 3 ( crisp-3 ) , a mouse homolog of the human monocyte/neutrophil elastase inhibitor ( mei ) and two unknown cdna sequence nov1 and nov2 .
these target gene show quite distinct expression pattern demonstrate that transcription factor in addition to oct2 be involve in their regulation .
whereas cd36 and mei be express in all hematopoetic cell line contain oct2 , .
crisp-3 be pre-b cell-specific , nov1 be plasma b cell-specific and nov2 be b cell-specifically express .
b lymphocyte from patient with chronic lymphocytic leukemia contain signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) 1 and stat3 constitutively phosphorylated on serine residue .
to explore the pathogenesis of chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( cll ) , we examine whether phosphorylation of one or more signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) factor be abnormal in cell from cll patient .
no constitutive tyrosine phosphorylation be detect on any stat in cll cell .
to assess the phosphorylation of serine residue of stat1 and stat3 in cll cell , we raise antibody that specifically recognize the form of stat1 phosphorylated on ser-727 and the form of stat3 phosphorylated on ser-727 .
we find that in 100 % of patient with cll ( n = 32 ) , stat1 and stat3 be constitutively phosphorylated on serine .
this be in contrast to normal peripheral blood b lymphocyte or cd5+) b cell isolate from tonsil , in which this phosphorylation be absent .
serine phosphorylation of stat1 and stat3 be see occasionally in other leukemia , but it be a universal finding only in cll .
the serine phosphorylation of these stats be a continuous process , a incubation of cll cell with the kinase inhibitor h7 lead to the dephosphorylation of these serine residue .
the stat serine kinase in cll cell have not be identify , and appear to be neither mitogen-activated protein kinase nor pp70(s6k) .
in summary , the constitutive serine phosphorylation of stat1 and stat3 be present in all cll sample test to date , although the physiologic significance of this modification remain to be determine .
murine and human t-lymphocyte gata-3 factor mediate transcription through a cis-regulatory element within the human t-cell receptor delta gene enhancer .
a family of transcriptional activator have recently be identify in chicken ; these transcriptional activator recognize a common consensus motif ( wgatar ) through a conserve c4 zinc finger dna-binding domain .
one of the member of this multigene family , cgata-3 , be most abundantly express in the t-lymphocyte cell lineage .
analysis of human and murine gata-3 factor show a striking degree of amino acid sequence identity and similar pattern of tissue specificity of expression in these three organism .
the murine and human factor be abundantly express in a variety of human and murine t-cell line and can activate transcription through a tissue-specific gata-binding site identify within the human t-cell receptor delta gene enhancer .
we infer that the murine and human gata-3 protein play a central and highly conserve role in vertebrate t-cell-specific transcriptional regulation .

eotaxin be an eosinophil specific beta-chemokine assume to be involve in eosinophilic inflammatory disease such a atopic dermatitis , allergic rhinitis , asthma and parasitic infection .

phenylarsine oxide inhibit ex vivo hiv-1 expression .
phenylarsine oxide ( pao ) , which be describe a an inhibitor of tyrosine phosphatase activity , inhibit h2o2 release from human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmcs ) a measure by electrochemistry .
since human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication be know to be favor under oxidative stress condition , ex vivo experiment use uninfected pbmcs , primary monocyte or a latently infected promonocytic u1 cell line show that hiv-1 replication and reactivation , monitor by p24 antigen measurement , be inhibit by pao in a time- and concentration-dependent manner .
these observation can be link with the inhibition of nf-kappa b activation when uninfected monocyte be induce by either tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) or lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
pathogenesis .
there be many hypothesis concern the pathogenesis of endometriosis , though no single theory can explain all case .
it be likely that several mechanism be involve .
early study concentrate on the histogenesis of the endometriotic lesion .
recent evidence have implicate component of the immune system in the pathogenesis of endometriosis .
this review consider the evidence for different theory of the histogenesis of endometriosis and discuss possible immune factor that may be involve in the pathophysiology of the disease .
in vivo footprinting and mutational analysis of the proximal cd19 promoter reveal important role for an sp1/egr-1 binding site and a novel site term the pyg box .
cd19 expression begin at the pro-b cell stage of b cell development .
a such it serve a a good prototype for b cell-specific gene whose expression begin shortly after lineage commitment .
to understand the molecular mechanism control cd19 gene expression , we isolate and functionally characterize the cd19 promoter use in vivo footprinting , gel shift assay , and transfection study .
reporter construct span portion of the promoter identify a region between -85 and -200 that produce high level of reporter gene activity in lymphoid cell .
in vivo footprinting identify protected region over the known high affinity b cell lineage-specific activator protein ( bsap ) site , the low affinity bsap site , a sp1/egr-1 site term the cd19 gc box , and two novel site name the at box and pyg box .
phorbol ester treatment of a pre-b cell line up-regulated cd19 expression , induce egr-1 , and enhance the footprint over the gc box .
gel shift assay demonstrate sp1 and egr-1 bind to the cd19 gc box , while unknown nuclear protein bind the pyg and at box .
mutation in the at box or in the bsap site do not affect cd19 reporter construct activity , while a mutation of the gc box reduce it modestly , and a pyg box mutation reduce it dramatically .
bsap fail to trans-activate cd19 promoter construct in b cell or non-b cell , suggest that cis element such a the pyg and gc box be also necessary for high level cd19 promoter expression .
elf-1 and stat5 bind to a critical element in a new enhancer of the human interleukin-2 receptor alpha gene [ publish erratum appear in mol cell biol 1997 apr ; 17 ( 4 ) : 2351 ]
the interleukin 2 receptor alpha-chain ( il-2r alpha ) gene be a key regulator of lymphocyte proliferation .
il-2r alpha be rapidly and potently induce in t cell in response to mitogenic stimulus .
interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) stimulate il-2r alpha .
transcription , thereby amplify expression of it own high-affinity receptor .
il-2r alpha transcription be at least in part control by two positive regulatory region , prri and prrii .
prri be an inducible proximal enhancer , located between nucleotide -276 and -244 , which contain nf-kappab and sre/carg motif .
prrii be a t-cell-specific enhancer , located between nucleotide -137 and -64 , which bind the t-cell-specific ets protein elf-1 and hmg-i(y) protein .
however , none of these proximal region account for the induction of il-2r alpha transcription by il-2 .
to find new regulatory region of the il-2r alpha gene , 8.5 kb of the 5' end noncoding sequence of the il-2r alpha gene have be sequence .
we identify an 86-nucleotide fragment that be 90 % identical to the recently characterize murine il-2 -responsive element ( mil-2re ) .
this putative human il-2re , designate prriii , confer il-2 responsiveness on a heterologous promoter .
prriii contain a stat protein binding site that overlap with an eb motif ( gasd/ebsd ) .
these be essential for il-2 inducibility of prriii /cat reporter construct .
il-2 induce the binding of stat 5a and b protein to the human gasd element .
to confirm the physiological relevance of these finding , we carry out in vivo footprinting experiment which show that stimulation of il-2r alpha expression correlate with occupancy of the gasd element .
our data demonstrate a major role of the gasd/ebsd element in il-2r alpha regulation and suggest that the t-cell-specific elf-1 factor can serve a a transcriptional repressor .
hla-dqb1 codon 57 be critical for peptide binding and recognition .
the association of specific hla-dq allele with autoimmunity be correlate with discrete polymorphism in the hla-dq sequence that be localize within site suitable for peptide recognition .
the polymorphism at residue 57 of the dqb1 polypeptide be of particular interest since it may play a major structural role in the formation of a salt bridge structure at one end of the peptide-binding cleft of the dq molecule .
this polymorphism at residue 57 be a recurrent feature of hla-dq evolution , occur in multiple distinct allelic family , which imply a functional selection for maintain variation at this position in the class ii molecule .
we directly test the amino acid polymorphism at this site a a determinant for peptide binding and for antigen-specific t cell stimulation .
we find that a single ala --> asp amino acid 57 substitution in an hla-dq3.2 molecule regulate binding of an hsv-2 vp-16-derived peptide .
a complementary single-residue substitution in the peptide abolish it binding to dq3.2 and convert it to a peptide that can bind to dq3.1 and dq3.3 asp -57-positive mhc molecule .
these binding study be parallel by specific t cell recognition of the class ii-peptide complex , in which the substitute peptide abolish t cell reactivity , which be direct to the dq3.2 -peptide complex , whereas the same t cell clone recognize the substitute peptide present by dq3.3 , a class ii restriction element differ from dq3.2 only at residue 57 .
this structural and functional complementarity for residue 57 and a specific peptide residue identify this interaction a a key control determinant of restricted recognition in hla-dq -specific immune response .
some antioxidant inhibit , in a co-ordinate fashion , the production of tumor necrosis factor-alpha , il-beta , and il-6 by human peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
some antioxidant , include butylate hydroxyanisole ( bha ) , tetrahydropapaveroline ( thp ) , nordihydroguiauretic acid , and 10,11-dihydroxyaporphine ( dha ) , be find to be potent inhibitor of the production of tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha , il-1 beta , and il-6 by human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) stimulate by lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) ( ic50s in the low micromolar range ) .
inhibition of cytokine production be gene selective and not due to general effect on protein synthesis .
inhibition of cytokine production by pbmc be observe also when other inducer be use ( staphylococci , silica , zymosan ) .
much high concentration of other antioxidant -- include ascorbic acid , trolox , alpha-tocopherol , butylate hydroxytoluene , and the 5-lipoxygenase inhibitor zileuton -- do not affect the production of these cytokine .
the active compound do not inhibit il-1 -induced production of il-6 in fibroblast , show the cell selectivity of the effect .
antioxidant-mediated inhibition of cytokine production be correlated with low level of the corresponding messenger rna .
nuclear run-on experiment show that thp inhibit transcription of the il-1 beta gene .
thp decrease the concentration of the transcription factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 detect in nuclear extract of pbmc culture in the presence or absence of lp .
thp and dha markedly decrease the level of tnf-alpha and il-1 beta in the circulation of mouse follow lp injection .
thus antioxidant vary widely in potency a inhibitor of the activation of transcription factor and of the transcription of gene for pro-inflammatory cytokine .
coordinate inhibition of the transcription of gene for inflammatory cytokine could provide a strategy for therapy of disease with inflammatory pathogenesis and for septic shock .
expression of bcl-6 protein in normal skin and epidermal neoplasm .
bcl-6 protein be a recently identify novel transcription factor whose deregulate expression be associate with diffuse large b cell lymphoma .
it be recently show by u that the protein be located in germinal center b cell and their neoplastic counterpart .
in the present study , the expression of bcl-6 protein on normal epidermis , benign , and malignant tumor originate from epidermal cell , and squamous cell carcinoma ( scc ) cell line be investigate .
with the use of immunohistochemistry , bcl-6 protein be show to stain intensely on normal prickle cell , but none to only slightly on epidermal basal cell .
papilloma and keratoacanthoma copy their normal counterpart in the mode of expression .
various level of expression be find on seborrheic keratoses , while the expression level on basal cell epithelioma be low .
peculiarly , eccrine poromas and undifferentiated spindle-shaped basal cell epithelioma be totally unstained .
squamous cell carcinoma show a variety of expression level , while two undifferentiated spindle-shaped carcinoma and one undifferentiated scc cell line remain unstained .
these result suggest that the expression of bcl-6 protein may be associate with morphological differentiation in normal and neoplastic epidermal cell .
mechanism of interleukin-10 inhibition of t-helper cell activation by superantigen at the level of the cell cycle .
we have analyze the effect of interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) on the entry of quiescent cd4(+) t cell into the cell cycle upon stimulation with the superantigen staphylococcal enterotoxin b ( seb ) .
il-10 arrest cell at g0/g1 .
il-10 treatment prevent the downregulation of p27 ( kip1 ) , an inhibitory protein that control progression out of the g0 phase of the cell cycle .
il-10 also prevent the upregulation of the g1 cyclins d2 and d3 , protein necessary for entry and progression through the g1 phase of the cell cycle .
associate with the inhibition of the cell cycle , il-10 suppress seb induction of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) .
addition of exogenous il-2 to il-10 -treated cell significantly reverse the antiproliferative effect of il-10 .
moreover , il-10 effect on the early g1 protein p27 ( kip1 ) and cyclin d2 be similarly reverse by exogenous il-2 .
although this reversal by il-2 be pronounced , it be not complete , suggest that il-10 may have some effect not directly relate to the suppression of il-2 production .
cell separation experiment suggest that il-10 can effect purify cd4(+) t cell directly , provide functional evidence for the presence of il-10 receptor on cd4(+) t cell .
il-10 also inhibit expression of il-2 transcriptional regulator c-fos and c-jun , which also inhibit other cell function .
our study show that the mechanism of il-10 regulation of quiescent cd4(+) t-cell activation be mainly by block induction of il-2 that be critical to downregulation of p27 ( kip1 ) and upregulation of d cyclins in t-cell activation and entry into the cell cycle .
activation of the transcription factor mef2c by the map kinase p38 in inflammation .
for cell of the innate immune system to mount a host defence response to infection , they must recognize product of microbial pathogen such a lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , the endotoxin secrete by gram-negative bacteria .
these cellular response require intracellular signalling pathway , such a the four map kinase ( mapk ) pathway .
in mammalian cell the mapk p38 be think to play an important role in the regulation of cellular response during infection through it effect on the expression of proinflammatory molecule .
one mean of understand the role of p38 in these response be to identify protein with function regulate by p38 -catalysed phosphorylation .
here we demonstrate a link between the p38 pathway and a member of the myocyte-enhancer factor 2 ( mef2 ) group of transcription factor .
we find that in monocytic cell , lp increase the transactivation activity of mef2c through p38 -catalysed phosphorylation .
one consequence of mef2c activation be increase c-jun gene transcription .
our result show that p38 may influence host defence and inflammation by maintain the balance of c-jun protein consume during infection .
regulation of jun and fo gene expression in human monocyte by the macrophage colony-stimulating factor .
the macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( m-csf ) be require for the growth and differentiation of mononuclear phagocyte .
however , the signaling event responsible for these effect remain unclear .
the present study have examine the effect of m-csf on potential signaling pathway involve expression of the jun and fo early response gene .
low level of c-jun transcript be detectable in rest human peripheral blood monocyte .

m-csf treatment be also associate with a rapid induction of the jun-b gene , although expression of this gene be prolonged compare to that of c-jun .
we far demonstrate that m-csf increase c-fos mrna level in human monocyte through control at both the transcriptional and posttranscriptional level .
maximal induction of the c-fos gene be follow by that for the fos-b gene .
moreover , m-csf -induced expression of the fos-related gene , fra-1 , be delay compare to that for both c-fos and fos-b .
take together , the result indicate that m-csf treatment be associate with differential activation of multiple member of the jun/fos family and that expression of these gene could contribute to nuclear signaling mechanism that regulate a specific program of monocyte differentiation .
nuclear association of a t-cell transcription factor block by fk-506 and cyclosporin a [ see comment ]
cyclosporin a and fk506 inhibit t- and b-cell activation and other process essential to an effective immune response .
in t lymphocyte these drug disrupt an unknown step in the transmission of signal from the t-cell antigen receptor to cytokine gene that coordinate the immune response .
the putative intracellular receptor for fk506 and cyclosporin be cis-trans prolyl isomerase .
binding of the drug inhibit isomerase activity , but study with other prolyl isomerase inhibitor and analysis of cyclosporin -resistant mutant in yeast suggest that the effect of the drug result from the formation of an inhibitory complex between the drug and isomerase , and not from inhibition of isomerase activity .
a transcription factor , nf-at , which be essential for early t-cell gene activation , seem to be a specific target of cyclosporin a and fk506 action because transcription direct by this protein be block in t cell treat with these drug , with little or no effect on other transcription factor such a ap-1 and nf-kappa b .
here we demonstrate that nf-at be form when a signal from the antigen receptor induce a pre-existing cytoplasmic subunit to translocate to the nucleus and combine with a newly synthesize nuclear subunit of nf-at .
fk506 and cyclosporin a block translocation of the cytoplasmic component without affect synthesis of the nuclear subunit .
identification and characterization of a leukocyte-specific component of the nuclear body .
the nuclear body ( nb ) be a cellular organelle that be involve in the pathogenesis of acute promyelocytic leukemia and viral infection .
the nb be also a target of antibody in the serum of patient with the autoimmune disease primary biliary cirrhosis .
in this study , serum from a patient with primary biliary cirrhosis be use to identify a cdna encode a novel component of the nb , a 140-kda protein designate sp140 .
the predict amino acid sequence of the amino-terminal portion of sp140 be similar to sp100 , a previously identify nb protein .
the carboxyl portion of sp140 contain a zinc-finger domain and a bromodomain , motif that be present in protein regulate gene transcription .
high level of sp140 mrna be detect in human spleen and peripheral blood leukocyte , but not other human tissue .
