immunohistochemical technique be use to demonstrate that sp140 localize to the nb in differentiate hl60 and nb4 cell .
the location of sp140 in the nb , and expression of this gene in cell involve in host defense , suggest that sp140 may be involve in the pathogenesis of acute promyelocytic leukemia and viral infection .
coupling of a signal response domain in i kappa b alpha to multiple pathway for nf-kappa b activation .
the eukaryotic transcription factor nf-kappa b play a central role in the induce expression of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 and in many aspect of the genetic program mediate normal t-cell activation and growth .
the nuclear activity of nf-kappa b be tightly regulate from the cytoplasmic compartment by an inhibitory subunit call i kappa b alpha .
this cytoplasmic inhibitor be rapidly phosphorylated and degrade in response to a diverse set of nf-kappa b -inducing agent , include t-cell mitogen , proinflammatory cytokine , and viral transactivators such a the tax protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 .
to explore these i kappa b alpha -dependent mechanism for nf-kappa b induction , we identify novel mutant of i kappa b alpha that uncouple it inhibitory and signal-transducing function in human t lymphocyte .
specifically , removal of the n-terminal 36 amino acid of i kappa b alpha fail to disrupt it ability to form latent complex with nf-kappa b in the cytoplasm .
however , this deletion mutation prevent the induce phosphorylation , degradative loss , and functional release of i kappa b alpha from nf-kappa b in tax -expressing cell .
alanine substitution introduce at two serine residue positioned within this n-terminal regulatory region of i kappa b alpha also yield constitutive repressor that escape from tax -induced turnover and that potently inhibit immune activation pathway for nf-kappa b induction , include those initiate from antigen and cytokine receptor .
in contrast , introduction of a phosphoserine mimetic at these site rectify this functional defect , a finding consistent with a causal linkage between the phosphorylation status and proteolytic stability of this cytoplasmic inhibitor .
together , these in vivo study define a critical signal response domain in i kappa b alpha that coordinately control the biologic activity of i kappa b alpha and nf-kappa b in response to viral and immune stimulus .
cross-linking of fc gamma receptor activate hiv-1 long terminal repeat -driven transcription in human monocyte .
elevation of the level of circulate immune complex frequently accompany hiv-1 infection and be a prognostic indicator of clinical progression from asymptomatic infection to aid .
here we report that cross-linking of fc gamma ri or fc gamma rii by adherent human igg or by specific anti-fc gamma r mab activate hiv-1 gene expression in the human monocytic cell line bf24 and increase hiv rna expression in monocyte from hiv infected patient a assay by reverse transcription-pcr .
in thp-1 cell , fc gamma r cross-linking induce nf-kappa b , which be know to bind to the regulatory region of the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of hiv-1 and to activate hiv-1 transcription . anti-tnf-alpha antibody but not anti-il-1 beta antibody strongly inhibit both the induction of hiv-1 - ltr -driven transcription and the induction of nf-kappa b by fc gamma r cross-linking .
these result indicate that fc gamma r can mediate a tnf-alpha -dependent induction of hiv-1 gene transcription and suggest that immune complex may contribute to the pathophysiology of hiv-1 infection by augment viral replication in monocyte .
ra protein activity be essential for t-cell antigen receptor signal transduction .
in a jurkat cell model of t-cell activation an interleukin-2 promoter/reporter gene construct be activate by antigen receptor agonism in combination with the lymphokine interleukin-1 .
antigen receptor signal could be mimic by suboptimal activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) with phorbol ester in combination with calcium mobilization by an ionophore .
in cotransfection experiment , oncogenic rat obviate the need for pkc stimulation but do not replace either the calcium signal or interleukin-1 .
activate ra expression also replace the requirement for pkc stimulation in activation of the t-cell transcription factor nf-at .
a dominant inhibitory ra mutant specifically block antigen receptor agonism , indicate that ra activity be require for antigen receptor signaling .
in addition , an inhibitor of pkc block both activate ra and phorbol ester stimulation , suggest a role for ra upstream of pkc .
[ cortisone-resistant bronchial asthma ]
there be general agreement on the inflammatory pathogenesis of bronchial asthma : an accumulation of activate eosinophil , degranulated mast cell , t lymphocyte and in very severe form , granulocyte have constantly be find in the bronchial mucosa .
in allergic bronchial asthma , inflammation seem to be orchestrate predominantly by a subset of t lymphocyte , with a phenotype similar to the th2 subset able to produce il-4 and il-5 .
although corticosteroid be the most potent therapeutic agent use for this disease , their anti-inflammatory effect differ from patient to patient .
some criterion which can be use to define steroid-resistant bronchial asthma be list here .
this review analyze various molecular alteration responsible for the deficient response to corticosteroid treatment observe in steroid-resistant bronchial asthmatic subject .
new knowledge on the mechanism of steroid resistance may have important implication for the treatment of chronic asthma and other disease .
mouse interleukin-2 receptor alpha gene expression .
interleukin-1 and interleukin-2 control transcription via distinct cis-acting element .
we have show that interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) and il-2 control il-2 receptor alpha ( il-2r alpha ) gene transcription in cd4-cd8-_murine t lymphocyte precursor .
here we map the cis-acting element that mediate interleukin responsiveness of the mouse il-2r alpha gene use a thymic lymphoma-derived hybridoma ( pc60 ) .
the transcriptional response of the il-2r alpha gene to stimulation by il-1 + il-2 be biphasic .
il-1 induce a rapid , protein synthesis-independent appearance of il-2r alpha mrna that be block by inhibitor of nf-kappa b activation .
it also prim cell to become il-2 responsive and thereby prepare the second phase , in which il-2 induce a 100-fold further increase in il-2r alpha transcript .
transient transfection experiment show that several element in the promoter-proximal region of the il-2r alpha gene contribute to il-1 responsiveness , most importantly an nf-kappa b site conserve in the human and mouse gene .
il-2 responsiveness , on the other hand , depend on a 78-nucleotide segment 1.3 kilobases upstream of the major transcription start site .
this segment function a an il-2-inducible enhancer and lie within a region that become dnase i hypersensitive in normal t cell in which il-2r alpha expression have be induce .
il-2 responsiveness require three distinct element within the enhancer .
two of these be potential bind site for stat protein .
function and activation of nf-kappa b in the immune system .
nf-kappa b be a ubiquitous transcription factor .
nevertheless , it property seem to be most extensively exploit in cell of the immune system .
among these property be nf-kappa b 's rapid posttranslational activation in response to many pathogenic signal , it direct participation in cytoplasmic/nuclear signaling , and it potency to activate transcription of a great variety of gene encode immunologically relevant protein .
in vertebrate , five distinct dna binding subunit be currently know which might extensively heterodimerize , thereby form complex with distinct transcriptional activity , dna sequence specificity , and cell type- and cell stage-specific distribution .
the activity of dna binding nf-kappa b dimer be tightly control by accessory protein call i kappa b subunit of which there be also five different specie currently know in vertebrate .
i kappa b protein inhibit dna binding and prevent nuclear uptake of nf-kappa b complex .
an exception be the bcl-3 protein which in addition can function a a transcription activating subunit in th nucleus .
other i kappa b protein be rather involve in terminate nf-kappa b 's activity in the nucleus .
the intracellular event that lead to the inactivation of i kappa b , i.e. the activation of nf-kappa b , be complex .
they involve phosphorylation and proteolytic reaction and seem to be control by the cell ' redox status .
interference with the activation or activity of nf-kappa b may be beneficial in suppress toxic/septic shock , graft-vs-host reaction , acute inflammatory reaction , acute phase response , and radiation damage .
the inhibition of nf-kappa b activation by antioxidant and specific protease inhibitor may provide a pharmacological basis for interfere with these acute process .
nitric oxide -stimulated guanine nucleotide exchange on p21ras .
the protooncogene p21ras , a monomeric g protein family member , play a critical role in convert extracellular signal into intracellular biochemical event .
here , we report that nitric oxide ( no ) activate p21ras in human t cell a evidence by an increase in gtp -bound p21ras .
in vitro study use pure recombinant p21ras demonstrate that the activation be direct and reversible .
circular dichroism analysis reveal that no induce a profound conformational change in p21ras in association with gdp /gtp exchange .
the mechanism of activation be due to s-nitrosylation of a critical cysteine residue which stimulate guanine nucleotide exchange .
furthermore , we demonstrate that p21ras be essential for no -induced downstream signaling , such a nf-kappa b activation , and that endogenous no can activate p21ras in the same cell .
these study identify p21ras a a target of the same cell .
these study identify p21ras a a target of no in t cell and suggest that no activate p21ras by an action which mimic that of guanine nucleotide exchange factor .
reactive oxygen specie and antioxidant in inflammatory disease .
this paper aim to review the role of free radical-induced tissue damage and antioxidant defence mechanism in inflammatory disease that involve pathogenic process similar to the periodontal disease .
there be a clearly define and substantial role for free radical or reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) in periodontitis , but little research have be perform in this area .
this paper review the considerable data available relate ro activity and antioxidant defence to inflammatory disease and attempt to draw parallel with periodontitis , in an effort to stimulate more periodontal research in this important area .
the recent discovery of the transcription factor nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be review and several potential pathway for cytokine -induced periodontal tissue damage , mediate by nf-kappa b1 be discuss .
emphasis be place on cytokine that have be study in periodontitis , principally tnf-alpha , il-1 , il-6 , il-8 and beta-interferon .
the link between cellular production of such important mediator of inflammation and the antioxidant ( ao ) thiols , cysteine and reduce glutathione ( gsh ) , be discuss and it be hypothesise that nf-kappa b antagonist may offer important therapeutic benefit .
transcription factor gata-3 be differentially express in murine th1 and th2 cell and control th2-specific expression of the interleukin-5 gene .
interleukin-5 ( il-5 ) , which be produce by cd4(+) t helper 2 ( th2 ) cell , but not by th1 cell , play a key role in the development of eosinophilia in asthma .
despite increase evidence that the outcome of many disease be determine by the ratio of the two subset of cd4(+) t helper cell , th1 and th2 , the molecular basis for th1- and th2- specific gene expression remain to be elucidate .
we previously establish a critical role for the transcription factor gata-3 in il-5 promoter activation in el-4 cell , which express both th1- and th2- type cytokine .
our study report here demonstrate that gata-3 be critical for expression of the il-5 gene in bona fide th2 cell .
whereas mutation in the gata-3 site abolish antigen- or camp- stimulated il-5 promoter activation in th2 cell , ectopic expression of gata-3 in th1 cell or in a non-lymphoid , non- il-5 -producing cell line activate the il-5 promoter .
during the differentiation of naive cd4(+) t cell isolate from t cell receptor transgenic mouse , gata-3 gene expression be up-regulated in develop th2 cell , but be down-regulated in th1 cell , and antigen- or camp-activated th2 cell ( but not th1 cell ) express the gata-3 protein .
thus , gata-3 may play an important role in the balance between th1 and th2 subset in immune response .
inhibition of gata-3 activity have therapeutic potential in the treatment of asthma and other hypereosinophilic disease .
rp1 , a new member of the adenomatous polyposis coli-binding eb1-like gene family , be differentially express in activate t cell .
cross-linking of the cd3 and cd28 molecule on t lymphocyte represent one of the most effective signal for t lymphocyte activation and triggering of their cytotoxic effector function .
to identify gene that be express in t cell after stimulation , mrna from t lymphocyte that have be activate by the simultaneous stimulation of the cd3 and cd28 trigger molecule be transcribe for a differential mrna display analysis into cdna and be compare with cdna from cd28 - or cd3 -activated or rest lymphocyte .
differential expression be confirm subsequently by northern blot analysis .
one of the cdna fragment express specifically in cd3 - and cd28 -activated t cell be designate rp1 .
the predictive protein-coding region of rp1 have a significant homology to member of the recently find adenomatous polyposis coli ( apc ) protein -binding eb1 gene family , which cod for yet unknown protein ( s ) .
bacterially express rp1 protein reveal specific binding to wild-type but not to mutate apc protein .
the rapid up-regulation of rp1 mrna in properly activate t cell suggest that this gene might belong to the immediate/early gene family , which control the signal transduction cascade downstream of the tcr .
a the expression level of the rp1 gene in activate t cell and a spectrum of tumor-derived cell line correlate with the proliferative status of the cell , member of the eb1-like gene family may not only be involve in the tumorigenesis of colorectal cancer but may also play a role in the proliferative control of normal cell .
characterization of a new isoform of the nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) gene family member nfatc [ publish erratum appear in j biol chem 1996 dec 27 ; 271 ( 52 ) : 33705 ]
the cyclosporin a ( csa ) / fk506 -sensitive nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) play a key role in the inducible expression of cytokine gene in t cell .
although nfat have be recently show to be inducible in several non-t immune cell , the nfat gene family member characterize to date have be isolate only from t cell .
to far characterize nfat function in human b cell and to demonstrate cytokine gene specificity of nfat protein , we report here the isolation and characterization of a cdna clone from the raji b cell line .
the cdna clone encode a new isoform , nfatc.beta , of the nfat gene family member nfatc ( designate here nfatc.alpha ) .
the amino acid sequence of nfatc.beta differ from that of nfatc .
alpha in the first nh2-terminal 29 residue and contain an additional region of 142 residue at the cooh terminus .
northern analysis use a probe encompass a common region of both isoforms show two mrna specie of 2.7 and 4.5 kilobase pair , while an nfatc.beta -specific probe detect only the 4.5-kilobase pair mrna which be preferentially express in the spleen .
transient expression of nfatc.beta be capable of activate an interleukin-2 nfat -driven reporter gene in stimulate jurkat cell in a csa -sensitive manner .
however , nfatc.beta neither bind to the kappa3 element ( an nfat -binding site ) in the tumor necrosis factor-alpha promoter nor activate the tumor necrosis factor-alpha promoter in cotransfection assay .
these data suggest that different member or isoforms of nfat gene family may regulate inducible expression of different cytokine gene .
isolation of differentially express sequence tag from steroid-responsive cell use mrna differential display .
transcriptional control of steroid-regulated gene network by nuclear receptor protein result in the coordinate expression of a limited number of target gene .
although much be know about the structure and function of steroid receptor , relatively few cell-specific steroid-regulated gene have be isolate and characterize .
in this paper we describe result use mrna differential display reverse transcriptase pcr ( ddpcr ) to identify and isolate short cdna sequence tag from thymocyte and prostate cell under various hormone condition .
use this technique we have isolate several differentially express sequence tag ( dests ) from the mouse thymocyte cell line wehi 7.2 .
two of these dests , gig10 and gig18 , be rapidly induce by dexamethasone within 2 h of treatment .
gig10 be a novel sequence and gig18 be the mouse homologue of a human express sequence tag isolate from activate b lymphocyte .
we also use ddpcr to isolate dests from androgen-modulated rat ventral prostate tissue , one of which we characterize and find to correspond to the 3' end of prostatic spermine binding protein mrna , a known androgen-regulated gene .
modification of the original ddpcr protocol , which we find can potentially decrease the frequency of isolate false-positive dests , be describe and the merit of ddpcr , relative to other differential cdna cloning strategy , be discuss .
change in pkc isoforms in human alveolar macrophage compare with blood monocyte .
alveolar macrophage play an important role in host defense and in other type of inflammatory process in the lung .
these cell exhibit many alteration in function compare with their precursor cell , blood monocyte .
to evaluate a potential mechanism for these difference in function , we evaluate expression of protein kinase c ( pkc ) isoforms .
we find an increase in ca2+ -dependent pkc isoforms in monocyte compare with alveolar macrophage .
we also find differential expression of the ca2+ -independent isoforms in alveolar macrophage compare with monocyte .
one consequence of the activation of pkc can be increase expression of mitogen-activated protein ( map ) kinase pathway .
therefore , we also evaluate activation of the map kinase extracellular signal-regulated kinase ( erk ) 2 by the phorbol ester phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) .
pma activated erk2 kinase in both alveolar macrophage and monocyte ; however , monocyte consistently show a significantly great activation of erk2 kinase by pma compare with alveolar macrophage .
another known consequence of the activation of pkc and subsequent activation of erk kinase be activation of the transcription factor activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) .
we evaluate the activation of ap-1 by pma in both monocyte and macrophage .
we find very little detectable activation of ap-1 , a assess in a gel shift assay , in alveolar macrophage , whereas monocyte show a substantial activation of ap-1 by pma .
these study show that the differential expression of pkc isoforms in alveolar macrophage and blood monocyte be associate with important functional alteration in the cell .
induction of endothelial cell surface adhesion molecule by tumor necrosis factor be block by protein tyrosine phosphatase inhibitor : role of the nuclear transcription factor nf-kappa b .
recent study from our laboratory have indicate that protein tyrosine phosphatase ( ptpase ) inhibitor can down-modulate the tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -mediated activation of the nuclear transcription factor nf-kappa b in ml-1a , a monocytic cell line ( singh and aggarwal , j. biol. chem. 1995 : 270 : 10631 ) .
since tnf be one of the major inducer of various adhesion molecule in human endothelial cell and their expression be know to require the activation of nf-kappa b , we examine the effect of ptpase inhibitor on the tnf -mediated induction of intracellular adhesion molecule ( icam ) -1 , vascular cell adhesion molecule ( vcam ) -1 and endothelial leukocyte adhesion molecule ( elam ) -1 .
like ml-1a , human dermal microvessel endothelial cell ( mvec ) treat with tnf rapidly activate ( within 30 min ) nf-kappa b ; this effect be completely abolish by co-treatment with phenylarsine oxide ( pao ) , a specific inhibitor of ptpase .
the induction of icam-1 , vcam-1 , and elam-1 by tnf in mvec occur within 6 h and be also completely down-regulated by pao in a dose-dependent manner .
pao be find to be effective even when add 3 h after tnf , suggest a rapid mode of action of this inhibitor .
besides pao , other inhibitor of ptpase , include pervanadate and diamide , also block tnf -dependent nf-kappa b activation and induction of all the three adhesion protein .
consistent with these result , the attachment of monocyte to mvec be also block by the ptpase inhibitor .
thus , overall , our result demonstrate that a ptpase be involve either directly or indirectly in the pathway lead to the induction of endothelial cell adhesion molecule by tnf .
because of their role in cell adhesion , ptpase may provide a novel target of drug development for treatment of inflammation , atherogenesis , and tumor metastasis .
bsap : a key regulator of b-cell development and differentiation .
b-cell-specific activator protein ( bsap ) be a recently identify member of the pax-gene family of transcription factor ; in the lymphoid system , bsap be produce only in b cell .
here , markus neurath , eckhard stuber and warren strober describe the molecular structure of bsap and focus on the ability of this protein to regulate the expression of b-cell-specific gene .
they propose that bsap be a key protein of b cell and that it not only influence b-cell development but also influence the balance between b-cell proliferation and immunoglobulin secretion at late stage of b-cell differentiation .
cloning and expression of the glucocorticoid receptor from the squirrel monkey ( saimiri boliviensis boliviensis ) , a glucocorticoid-resistant primate .
new world primate such a the squirrel monkey have elevate cortisol level and glucocorticoid resistance .
we have show that the apparent binding affinity of the glucocorticoid receptor in squirrel monkey lymphocyte be 5-fold low than that in human lymphocyte ( apparent kd , 20.9 +/- 1.8 and 4.3 +/- 0.2 nmol/l , respectively ; n = 3 ) , consistent with previous study in mononuclear leukocyte isolate from the two specie .
a a first step in understand the mechanism of decrease binding affinity in new world primate , we use reverse transcription-pcr to clone the glucocorticoid receptor from squirrel monkey liver and have compare the sequence to receptor sequence obtain from owl monkey liver , cotton-top tamarin b95-8 cell , and human lymphocyte .
the squirrel monkey glucocorticoid receptor be approximately 97 % identical in nucleotide and amino acid sequence to the human receptor .
the ligand-binding domain ( amino acid 528-777 ) of the squirrel monkey glucocorticoid receptor contain four amino acid difference ( ser551 to thr , ser616 to ala , ala618 to ser , and ile761 to leu ) , all of which be present in owl monkey and cotton-top tamarin receptor .
the dna-binding domain ( amino acid 421-486 ) be completely conserve among human , squirrel monkey , owl monkey , and cotton-top tamarin receptor .
twenty-two difference from the human sequence be find in the n-terminal region ( amino acid 1-421 ) of the squirrel monkey receptor .
none of the substitution in the ligand-binding domain match mutation know to influence binding affinity in other specie .
to determine whether the substitution per se be responsible for decrease affinity , squirrel monkey and human glucocorticoid receptor be express in the tnt coupled reticulocyte lysate system .
expression of human and squirrel monkey glucocorticoid receptor and a squirrel monkey receptor in which phe774 be mutate to leu ( f774l ) be similar .
when express in the tnt system , squirrel monkey and human glucocorticoid receptor have similar , high affinity binding for dexamethasone ( apparent kd , 5.9 +/- 1.2 and 4.3 +/- 0.5 nmol/l , respectively ; n = 3 ) , whereas the squirrel monkey f774l receptor have low affinity binding ( apparent kd , 20.4 +/- 2.0 nmol/l ; n = 3 ) .
thus , substitution within the ligand-binding domain of the squirrel monkey glucocorticoid receptor can not account for the decrease binding affinity of these receptor in squirrel monkey cell .
rather , the binding affinity be probably influence by the expression of cytosolic factor that affect glucocorticoid receptor function .
[ the change in glucocorticoid receptor in peripheral leukocyte in asthmatic subject ]
the number of glucocorticoid receptor ( gcr ) in peripheral leukocyte be determine by radioligand-binding assay in extrinsic and intrinsic asthmatic .
their corresponding plasma cortisol level be assess .
the result show that the average number of gcr in asthmatic be significantly low than that in healthy subject ( p < 0.01 ) , and there be a linear correlation between the number of gcr and the course of asthma .
besides , there be also a linear correlation between the number of gcr and the age of the initial attack of asthma .
no difference in plasma cortisol level be find between asthmatic and healthy subject .
these finding suggest that there be no primary and general impairment of glucocorticoid metabolism in the asthmatic , but the number of gcr in the asthmatic be low than that in healthy control .
the decrease of the number of gcr in asthmatic , we think , be related to heredity and repeat attack of asthma .
synergism between two distinct element of the htlv-i enhancer during activation by the trans-activator of htlv-i .
we have conduct functional study of the enhancer element of human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) use the human t-cell line jurkat and molt 4 , which be negative for htlv-i , and mt-2 and tl-mor , which carry the proviral genome of htlv-i .
two distinct element have be implicate in function of the htlv-i enhancer .
one be the 21-base-pair ( bp ) core element that be responsible for trans-activation by the htlv-i trans-activator p40tax and that have the ability to bind to cyclic-amp responsive element binding factor ( creb ) -like factor ( s ) .
the other be a region interpose between the 21-bp element .
in this study we demonstrate that a subfragment ( c26 ) in the region between the 21-bp element be involve in trans-activation by p40tax , possibly through binding to an nf-kappa b -like nuclear factor or factor .
formation of the protein-dna complex with the c26 subfragment be positively affect by p40tax .
the c26 element confer partial responsiveness to p40tax when link to one copy of the 21-bp element that , by itself , show little activation in response to p40tax .
however , the c26 element alone , even when repeat , could not be activate by p40tax , unlike other nf-kappa b -binding element .
in contrast , the c26 element itself be profoundly activate upon stimulation with 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate .
these finding therefore suggest that the htlv-i enhancer contain multiple functional element , include bind site for at least creb- and nf-kappa b- like factor , which synergistically cooperate in activation of the htlv-i enhancer in response to p40tax .
our result also demonstrate that tpa-dependent activation of the htlv-i enhancer may be mediate through the c26 element .
jak3 be associate with cd40 and be critical for cd40 induction of gene expression in b cell .
cd40 be a receptor that be critical for the survival , growth , differentiation , and isotype switching of b lymphocyte .
although cd40 lack intrinsic tyrosine kinase activity , it ligation induce protein tyrosine phosphorylation , which be necessary for several cd40 -mediated event .
we show that engagement of cd40 induce tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of jak3 as well a of stat3 .
jak3 be constitutively associate with cd40 , and this interaction require a proline-rich sequence in the membrane-proximal region of cd40 .
deletion of this sequence abolish the capacity of cd40 to induce expression of cd23 , icam-1 , and lymphotoxin-alpha gene in b cell .
these result indicate that signaling through jak3 be activate by cd40 and play an important role in cd40 -mediated function .
il-10 induce the tyrosine phosphorylation of tyk2 and jak1 and the differential assembly of stat1 alpha and stat3 complex in human t cell and monocyte .
il-10 affect monocyte and t cell by drive the progression of immune responsiveness such that th2 lymphocyte-mediated effect predominate .
in this report , we show that in monocyte and t cell il-10 stimulate tyrosine phosphorylation of the signal transducer and activator of transcription , stat1 alpha and stat3 , in a differential manner such that the relative formation of homo- and hetero dimer vary between the two cell type .
moreover , monocyte express a novel il-10 -stimulated stat protein with an m(r) of 70 kda that be recognize by the anti- stat3 ab but be not observe in t cell .
il-10 treatment of both t cell and monocyte result in the ligand-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of tyk2 and jak1 , but not jak2 or jak3 .
selective modulation of immune responsiveness by il-10 in cell such a monocyte and t cell may result in part from the differential activation of stat protein pair .
the transcription factor sp1 be require for induction of the murine gm-csf promoter in t cell .
the cis-acting region , gm-kappa b/gc-box ( position -95 and -73 ) , within the murine gm-csf gene promoter be require for maximal induction by stimulation with phorbol-12-myristate acetate ( pma ) and calcium ionophore ( a23187 ) in t cell .
gm-kappa b define a bind site for nf-kappa b , and gc-box define a bind site for three ( a1 , a2 , b ) constitutive protein .
we report here that three copy of the gc-box can functionally compensate for the gm-kappa b/ gc-box region , suggest that the gc-motif can function independently of the gm-kappa b motif .
the major gc-box binding activity a1 be purify and identify a the transcription factor sp1 .
we show that depletion of sp1 ( a1 ) from nuclear extract specifically decrease in vitro transcription activity on gm-csf template .
since the human gm-csf promoter have a base difference within the gc-box , we speculate that this may explain why the human promoter be weak and that an upstream enhancer be require for the induction of the human gm-csf gene .
inducible nitric oxide : an autoregulatory feedback inhibitor of vascular inflammation .
inducible nitric oxide ( ino ) be produce at site of vascular inflammation by resident and nonresident vascular wall cell , but it role in the inflammatory process be not know .
in this study , we show that a novel function of ino be to terminate inflammatory process .
we find that ino produce by murine macrophage-like cell , raw264.7 , can inhibit cytokine -induced endothelial cell activation in a separated and mixed endothelial-raw264.7 coculture system .
both ino production and endothelial vcam-1 expression be induce simultaneously with bacterial lp and murine-specific ifn-gamma .
inhibition of ino synthase ( inos ) activity with n omega-monomethyl-l-arginine in endothelial-raw264.7 cocultures , stimulate with murine-specific ifn-gamma and lp , decrease ino production by 86 % , augment vcam-1 and inos expression in endothelial and raw264.7 cell , respectively , and increase monocyte adhesion to the endothelial cell surface .
transient transfection study use various vcam-1 promoter construct demonstrate that inhibitory effect of ino on vcam-1 gene transcription be mediate , in part , by inhibitory effect of ino on kappa b cis-acting element .
immunofluorescence study use an ab to the rela ( p65 ) subunit of nuclear factor-kappa b reveal that ino inhibit the activation of nuclear factor-kappa b .
these study indicate that ino attenuate inos expression in macrophage and inhibit monocyte adhesion to endothelial cell , and suggest that endogenously derive ino may be an important autoregulatory inhibitor of vascular inflammation
a lymphoid cell-specific nuclear factor contain c-rel-like protein preferentially interact with interleukin-6 kappa b-related motif whose activity be repress in lymphoid cell .
the proto-oncoprotein c-rel be a member of the nuclear factor kappa b transcription factor family , which include the p50 and p65 subunit of nuclear factor kappa b .
we show here that c-rel bind to kappa b site a homodimers as well a heterodimers with p50 .
these homodimers and heterodimers show distinct dna-binding specificity and affinity for various kappa b motif .
in particular , the c-rel homodimer have a high affinity for interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) and beta interferon kappa b site .
in spite of it association with p50 in vitro , however , we find a lymphoid cell-specific nuclear factor in vivo that contain c-rel but not p50 epitope ; this factor , term il-6 kappa b binding factor ii , appear to contain the c-rel homodimer and preferentially recognize several il-6 kappa b-related kappa b motif .
although it have be previously show that the il-6 kappa b motif function a a potent il-1/tumor necrosis factor-responsive element in nonlymphoid cell , it activity be find to be repress in lymphoid cell such a a jurkat t-cell line .
we also present evidence that il-6 kappa b binding factor ii function a a repressor specific for il-6 kappa b-related kappa b motif in lymphoid cell .
nf-kappa b control expression of inhibitor i kappa b alpha : evidence for an inducible autoregulatory pathway .
the eukaryotic transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) participate in many part of the genetic program mediate t lymphocyte activation and growth .
nuclear expression of nf-kappa b occur after it induce dissociation from it cytoplasmic inhibitor i kappa b alpha .
phorbol ester and tumor necrosis factor-alpha induction of nuclear nf-kappa b be associate with both the degradation of perform i kappa b alpha and the activation of i kappa b alpha gene expression .
transfection study indicate that the i kappa b alpha gene be specifically induce by the 65-kilodalton transactivating subunit of nf-kappa b .
association of the newly synthesize i kappa b alpha with p65 restore intracellular inhibition of nf-kappa b dna binding activity and prolong the survival of this labile inhibitor .
together , these result show that nf-kappa b control the expression of i kappa b alpha by mean of an inducible autoregulatory pathway .
purification of tcf-1 alpha , a t-cell-specific transcription factor that activate the t-cell receptor c alpha gene enhancer in a context-dependent manner .
the differentiation of t cell into functionally diverse subpopulation be control in part , by transcriptional activation and silencing ; however , little be know in detail about the protein that influence this developmental process .
we have purify a new t-cell-specific factor , tcf-1 alpha , that be implicate in the activation of gene encode a major component of the human t-cell receptor ( tcr ) .
tcf-1 alpha , originally identify and purify through it bind site on the hiv-1 promoter , be find to bind to the tcr alpha enhancer and to promoter for several gene express at significantly early stage of t-cell development than the tcr alpha gene ( e.g. , p56lck and cd3 delta ) .
sequence related to the tcf-1 alpha binding motif ( 5'-ggcaccctttga-3' ) be also find in the human tcr delta ( and possibly tcr beta ) enhancer .
southwestern and gel renaturation experiment with the use of purify protein fraction reveal that tcf-1 alpha activity be derive from a family of 57- to 53-kd protein that be abundantly express in mature and immature t-cell line ( jurkat , ccrf-cem ) and not in mature b cell ( jy , namalwa ) or nonlymphoid ( hela ) cell line .
a small 95-bp fragment of the tcr alpha control region that contain the tcf-1 alpha binding site juxtapose between a camp-response element ( the cre or t alpha 1 motif ) and the bind site for a distinct lymphoid-specific protein ( tcf-2 alpha ) behave a a potent t-cell-specific enhancer in vivo .
tandem copy of this enhancer function synergistically in mature ( jurkat ) t-cell line as well a rest and activate immature ( ccrf-cem ) t-cell line .
mutation of the tcf-1 alpha binding site diminish enhancer activity and disrupt the synergism observe in vivo between tandem enhancer repeat .
the tcf-1 alpha binding site be also require for tcr alpha enhancer activity in transcriptionally active extract from jurkat but not hela cell , confirm that tcf-1 alpha be a t-cell-specific transcription factor .
curiously , the tcf-1 alpha binding element be inactive in vivo when remove from it neighboring element on the tcr alpha enhancer and positioned in one or more copy upstream of a heterologous promoter .
thus , the transcriptional activity of tcf-1 alpha appear to depend on the tcf-2 alpha and t alpha 1 ( creb ) transcription factor and the context of it bind site within the tcr alpha enhancer .
jnk be involve in signal integration during costimulation of t lymphocyte .
t lymphocyte activation and interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) production require at least two signal , generate by phorbol ester ( tpa ) and ca2+ ionophore or costimulation of the t cell receptor ( tcr ) and the cd28 auxiliary receptor .
we investigate how these stimulus affect mitogen activated protein ( map ) kinase .
full activation of the map kinase that phosphorylate the jun activation domain , jnk1 and jnk2 , require costimulation of t cell with either tpa and ca2+ ionophore or antibody to tcr and cd28 .
alone , each stimulus result in little or no activation .
similar to it effect on il-2 induction , cyclosporin a ( csa ) inhibit the synergistic activation of jnk , and a competitive inhibitor of jun phosphorylation by jnk inhibit il-2 promoter activation .
by contrast , the map kinase erk1 and erk2 be fully activate by tpa or tcr stimulation and be not affect by ca2+ , cd28 , or csa .
hence , integration of signal that lead to t cell activation occur at the level of jnk activation .
in vitro suppression of program cell death of b cell by tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases-1 .
cellular pathway for induction of program cell death ( pcd ) have be identify , but little be know about specific extracellular matrix process that may affect apoptosis along those pathway .
in this study , a series of burkitt 's lymphoma ( bl ) cell line be assay for their expression of tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases ( timp ) -1 .
result indicate that timp-1 -positive bl line show resistance to cold-shock-induced apoptosis .
furthermore , recombinant timp-1 , but not timp-2 or a synthetic metalloproteinase inhibitor ( bb-94 ) , confer resistance to apoptosis induce by both cd95-dependent and -independent ( cold shock , serum deprivation , and gamma-radiation ) pathway in timp-1 -negative bl line .
timp-1 suppression of pcd be not due to metalloproteinase inhibition , a reduction and alkylation of the timp-1 do not abolish this activity .
retroviral induction of timp-1 not only result in cell survival but also in continued dna synthesis for up to 5 d in the absence of serum , while control undergo apoptosis .
this resistance to apoptosis be reverse by anti- timp-1 antibody , demonstrate that secrete timp-1 be active in block apoptosis .
furthermore , timp-1 upregulation induce expression of bcl-xl but not bcl-2 as well a decrease nf-kappab activity a compare with control .
these result demonstrate that timp-1 suppress apoptosis in b cell and suggest a novel activity for timp-1 in tissue homeostasis .
elevated glucocorticoid receptor concentration before and after glucocorticoid therapy in peripheral mononuclear leukocyte of patient with atopic dermatitis .
the number and affinity of glucocorticoid binding site in peripheral mononuclear leukocyte of patient with atopic dermatitis ( ad ) and healthy control be determine under baseline condition and after a define oral glucocorticoid treatment .
patient with ad ( n = 15 ) exhibit significantly more glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) per cell than the control group ( n = 22 ) , while the gr affinity do not differ .
methylprednisolone treatment result in a significant reduction of the gr site per cell in the steroid-treated control group ( n = 10 ) in contrast to the patient .
the dissociation constant be not affect by methylprednisolone treatment in either group .
in view of the therapeutic efficiency of glucocorticoid in ad and finding of abnormal camp and camp-phosphodiesterase activity , the elevated gr concentration in ad lend support to the hypothesis of a compensatory gr upregulation due to an insufficient action of endogenous cortisol or to altered camp -induced gr expression .
peripheral t lymphocyte from woman with breast cancer exhibit abnormal protein expression of several signal molecule .
we examine signal molecule of peripheral blood t lymphocyte obtain from woman with breast cancer .
in 6 of 14 patient , t lymphocyte display an impaired ability to translocate nfeb p65 ( rel-a ) follow activation by anti-cd3 and il-2 .
this observation be make despite normal cytoplasmic level of the rel-a protein .
we also detect abnormally low level of the signal molecule t-cell receptor ( tcr ) -zeta , zap-70 and p56lck in 4 of 14 breast cancer patient , i.e. , defect in t-cell signal molecule .
t lymphocyte from 6 of the 14 patient also exhibit an increase expression of the dual specificity phosphatase , map kinase phosphatase-1 ( mkp-1 ) .
mkp-1 inactivate map kinase and therefore may interfere with the activation of c-jun and c-fos .
abnormality of i or more signal molecule be find in 9 of 14 patient ; however , only 3 patient have t cell that exhibit all 5 defect .
our data have implication for the detection of potentially dysfunctional t cell in patient with cancer .
for example , the analysis of only 1 signal molecule may allow patient with significant defect in t-cell signaling to go unnoticed .
finally , despite impaired rel-a translocation , t cell be capable of transcribe il-2 .
impairment in the translocation of rel-b and c-rel far suggest that the nfkb family member rel-a , rel-b and c-rel be not require for the transcription of il-2 in the peripheral t lymphocyte of patient with breast cancer .
acetylation and modulation of erythroid kruppel-like factor ( eklf ) activity by interaction with histone acetyltransferases .
erythroid kruppel-like factor ( eklf ) be a red cell-specific transcriptional activator that be crucial for consolidate the switch to high level of adult beta-globin expression during erythroid ontogeny .
eklf be require for integrity of the chromatin structure at the beta-like globin locus , and it interact with a positive-acting factor in vivo .
we find that eklf be an acetylate transcription factor , and that it interact in vivo with cbp , p300 , and p/caf .
however , it interaction with these histone acetyltransferases be not equivalent , a cbp and p300 , but not p/caf , utilize eklf a a substrate for in vitro acetylation within it trans- activation region .
the functional effect of these interaction be that cbp and p300 , but not p/caf , enhance eklf 's transcriptional activation of the beta-globin promoter in erythroid cell .
these result establish eklf a a tissue-specific transcription factor that undergo post-translational acetylation and suggest a mechanism by which eklf be able to alter chromatin structure and induce beta-globin expression within the beta-like globin cluster .
the ability of bhrf1 to inhibit apoptosis be dependent on stimulus and cell type .
the development of resistance to host defense mechanism such a tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) - and fas- mediated apoptosis of transform or virus-infected cell may be a critical component in the development of disease .
to find gene that protect cell from apoptosis , we use an expression cloning strategy and identify bhrf1 , an epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) early-lytic-cycle protein with distant homology to bcl-2 , a an anti- apoptosis protein .
expression of bhrf1 in mcf-fas cell confer nearly complete resistance against both anti-fas antibody and tnf-mediated apoptosis .
in addition , bhrf1 protect these cell from monocyte-mediated killing but fail to protect them from killing mediate by lymphokine-activated killer cell .
the ability of bhrf1 to protect mcf-fas cell from apoptosis induce by various stimulus be identical to that of bcl-2 and bcl-xl .
moreover , the mechanism of action of bhrf1 resemble that of bcl-2 and bcl-xl a it inhibit tnf- and anti-fas- induced activation of two enzyme participate in the apoptosis pathway , cytosolic phospholipase a2 and caspase-3/cpp32 , but do not interfere with the activation of nf-kappab -like transcription factor .
a putative function of bhrf1 in ebv -infected epithelial cell may be to protect virus-infected cell from tnf- and/or anti-fas- induced cell death in order to maximize virus production .
surprisingly , expression of neither bhrf1 nor bcl-2 in a b-cell line , bjab , protect the cell from anti-fas-mediated apoptosis even though they increase the survival of serum-starved cell .
thus , the protective role of bhrf1 against apoptosis resemble that of bcl-2 in be cell type specific and dependent on the apoptotic stimulus .
hiv-1 nef protein inhibit the recruitment of ap-1 dna-binding activity in human t-cells .
the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat , hiv-1-ltr , contain bind site for several cellular transcription factor which contribute to hiv-1 gene expression .
our previous study on the function of the hiv-1-encoded nef protein suggest that nef may be an inhibitor hiv-1 transcription .
to determine whether nef affect the binding of cellular factor implicate in hiv-1 regulation , 32p-labeled oligonucleotides correspond to the bind site be incubate with nuclear extract prepare from nef-expressing t-cell line that be not stimulate or be stimulate with t-cell mitogen .
we find that nef inhibit the recruitment of ap-1 dna-binding activity in mitogen-stimulated human t-cells .
additionally , nef expressing cell be transiently transfected with a plasmid in which hiv-1 ap-1 dna recognition sequence be clone downstream of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) gene .
mitogen-mediated transcriptional activation of the cat gene in this construct be inhibit in nef -expressing cell but not in control cell .
these study suggest that , by inhibit ap-1 activation , nef may play a role in regulate hiv-1 gene expression in infected t-cells .
a small , nonpeptidyl mimic of granulocyte-colony-stimulating factor [ see commetns ]
a nonpeptidyl small molecule sb 247464 , capable of activate granulocyte-colony-stimulating factor ( g-csf ) signal transduction pathway , be identify in a high-throughput assay in culture cell .
like g-csf , sb 247464 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of multiple signaling protein and stimulate primary murine bone marrow cell to form granulocytic colony in vitro .
it also elevated peripheral blood neutrophil count in mouse .
the extracellular domain of the murine g-csf receptor be require for the activity of sb 247464 , suggest that the compound act by oligomerizing receptor chain .
the result indicate that a small molecule can activate a receptor that normally bind a relatively large protein ligand .
a nongenomic mechanism for progesterone-mediated immunosuppression : inhibition of k+ channel , ca2+ signaling , and gene expression in t lymphocyte .
the mechanism by which progesterone cause localized suppression of the immune response during pregnancy have remain elusive .
use human t lymphocyte and t cell line , we show that progesterone , at concentration find in the placenta , rapidly and reversibly block voltage-gated and calcium-activated k+ channel ( kv and kca , respectively ) , result in depolarization of the membrane potential .
a a result , ca2+ signaling and nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) -driven gene expression be inhibit .
progesterone act distally to the initial step of t cell receptor ( tcr ) -mediated signal transduction , since it block sustained ca2+ signal after thapsigargin stimulation , as well a oscillatory ca2+ signal , but not the ca2+ transient after tcr stimulation .
k+ channel blockade by progesterone be specific ; other steroid hormone have little or no effect , although the progesterone antagonist ru 486 also block kv and kca channel .
progesterone effectively block a broad spectrum of k+ channel , reduce both kv1.3 and charybdotoxin-resistant component of kv current and kca current in t cell , as well a block several clone kv channel express in cell line .
progesterone have little or no effect on a clone voltage-gated na+ channel , an inward rectifier k+ channel , or on lymphocyte ca2+ and cl- channel .
we propose that direct inhibition of k+ channel in t cell by progesterone contribute to progesterone -induced immunosuppression .
regulation of cd95 ( fa ) ligand expression by tcr -mediated signaling event .
stimulation of mature peripheral t cell by tcr engagement result in activation of signal that drive induction of cytokine gene expression and clonal expansion .
however , under some condition , engagement of the tcr lead instead to apoptosis .
recent study demonstrate that tcr -stimulated apoptosis require expression of cd95 ligand on activate t cell follow by an interaction between cd95 ligand and the cd95 receptor also express on this population .
the experiment report in this study be design to address the signaling event trigger by tcr engagement that be important for regulate cd95 ligand gene expression .
to approach this , we generate a luciferase reporter construct contain element of the cd95 ligand promoter .
use a previously describe mutant of the jurkat t cell line , we show that proximal signaling event dependent on the presence of the cd45 tyrosine phosphatase be require for tcr -stimulated cd95 ligand expression .
transient transfection study demonstrate far that tcr -stimulated activation of the ra signaling pathway be require for optimal activation of cd95 ligand .
next , in an effort to determine critical transcription factor that regulate cd95 ligand expression , we demonstrate a cyclosporin a-sensitive nuclear factor-at response element in the promoter region of this gene that be critical for optimal cd95 ligand reporter activity in stimulate t cell .
together , these study begin a dissection of the biochemical event that lead to expression of cd95 ligand , a required step for tcr -induced apoptosis .
a novel immunosuppressive factor in bovine colostrum block activation of the interleukin 2 gene enhancer at the nfat site .
a factor in bovine colostrum ( colostrum inhibitory factor , cif ) inhibit interleukin 2 ( il2 ) production in activated t helper cell by block the accumulation of il2 mrna .
to determine whether cif block at the level of il2 transcription , we introduce reporter plasmid into the human t leukemia cell line jurkat by transient transfection .
these contain the luciferase gene under the control of either the human il2 upstream enhancer region ( segment -326 to +45 ) or three repeat of the nfat element contain within it ( segment -255 to -285 ) .
expression of luciferase in these cell be induce by phorbol myristate acetate plus a calcium ionophore .
cif inhibit induction of either construct a do cyclosporine , which be know to block activation of the nfat element .
cif fail to inhibit several other enhancer element .
the nfat-controlled luciferase gene system distinguish cif from other t cell inhibitory activity present in colostrum , in particular , tgf beta 1 and tgf beta 2 and the glucocorticoid .
stably transfected jurkat cell behave similarly to the transiently transfected one with respect to inhibition by cif and cyclosporine .
the nfat -luc assay be a useful technique for the rapid , sensitive measurement of cif or other immunosuppressant with a similar mode of action .
[ molecular mechanism of cytokine gene expression in th1 and th2 ]
upon activation by antigen , helper t cell differentiate into one of several subset , characterize by their distinct cytokine -production pattern .
among these subset , th1 cell be know to activate cellular immunity result in inflammatory response , whereas th2 cell induce humoral and allergic response and suppress inflammation .
th1 and th2 effector function and their development be attributable to their distinct cytokine expression pattern .
recent report have demonstrate that differential expression of cell surface molecule , such a adhesion molecule and chemokine receptor , be involve in their recruitment into target tissue .
it be , therefore , suggest that clarification of the mechanism of differential gene expression in th1/th2 should lead to rational strategy for manipulate pathological immune response .
activation of helper t cell mediate by the t cell receptor induce a series of biochemical event .
among them , both the activation of pkc/ras- and cam/cn- mediated pathway play a central role in the signal transduction of cytokine gene expression .
close examination use non-transformed murine th1 and th2 clone suggest that a balance between the activity of the two signaling pathway contribute to cytokine gene expression .
we propose that one of the target of pge2 , whose effect distinguish th1 from th2 , reside in the downstream pkc/ras -mediated pathway .
expression of mrna for the gata-binding protein in human eosinophil and basophil : potential role in gene transcription .
the expression of the hematopoietic transcription factor gata-1 , gata-2 , and gata-3 be study in eosinophil and basophil .
eosinophil express mrna for gata-1 , gata-2 , and gata-3 .
basophil express gata-2 and gata-3 .
treatment of hl-60 eosinophilic sublines with either interleukin-5 or butyric acid increase the expression of gata-1 mrna concomitant with the expression of eosinophil-specific gene , whereas level of gata-2 mrna remain relatively constant .
the presence of mrna for these protein in eosinophil and basophil suggest that gene transcription in these lineage may be regulate by gata-binding protein .
human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax induction of nf-kappab involve activation of the ikappab kinase alpha ( ikkalpha ) and ikkbeta cellular kinase .
tax correspond to a 40-kda transform protein from the pathogenic retrovirus human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) that activate nuclear expression of the nf-kappab /rel family of transcription factor by an unknown mechanism .
tax expression promote n-terminal phosphorylation and degradation of ikappab alpha , a principal cytoplasmic inhibitor of nf-kappab .
our study now demonstrate that htlv-1 tax activate the recently identify cellular kinase ikappab kinase alpha ( ikkalpha ) and ikkbeta , which normally phosphorylate ikappab alpha on both of it n-terminal regulatory serine in response to tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) and interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) stimulation .
in contrast , a mutant of tax term m22 , which do not induce nf-kappab , fail to activate either ikkalpha or ikkbeta .
furthermore , endogenous ikk enzymatic activity be significantly elevated in htlv-1-infected and tax-expressing t-cell line .
transfection of kinase-deficient mutant of ikkalpha and ikkbeta into either human jurkat t or 293 cell also inhibit nf-kappab -dependent reporter gene expression induce by tax .
similarly , a kinase-deficient mutant of nik ( nf-kappab -inducing kinase ) , which represent an upstream kinase in the tnf-alpha and il-1 signaling pathway lead to ikkalpha and ikkbeta activation , block tax induction of nf-kappab .
however , plasma membrane-proximal element in these proinflammatory cytokine pathway be apparently not involve since dominant negative mutant of the traf2 and traf6 adaptor , which effectively block signaling through the cytoplasmic tail of the tnf-alpha and il-1 receptor , respectively , do not inhibit tax induction of nf-kappab .
together , these study demonstrate that htlv-1 tax exploit a distal part of the proinflammatory cytokine signaling cascade lead to induction of nf-kappab .
the pathological alteration of this cytokine pathway lead to nf-kappab activation by tax may play a central role in htlv-1 -mediated transformation of human t cell , clinically manifest a the adult t-cell leukemia
the regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha promoter region in macrophage , t cell , and b cell line .
the 1311-base pair human tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) alpha promoter region be fuse to the luciferase ( luc ) reporter gene and study in a transient transfection system in three tnf producing cell line , the u937 macrophage cell line , the mla 144 t cell line , and the 729-6 b cell line .
this full length promoter construct can be induce by phorbol 13-myristate acetate ( pma ) in each of these cell type .
analysis of a series of 5'-truncations show several peak of basal and pma induced activity suggest the presence of several positive and negative regulatory element .
a pma responsive element be localized to a region between -95 and -36 bp relative to the transcription start site .
within this region , single ap-2- and ap-1- like consensus sequence be note .
these ap-2 and ap-1 site be each modify with a double point mutation .
a modest ( 20-50 % ) reduction in tnf promoter activity be observe with the ap-2 site mutation .
however , mutation of the ap-1 site markedly diminish both the basal and pma-activated promoter activity .
also co-transfections of the wild-type promoter construct with an ap-1/c-jun expression vector result in augmented basal and pma -induced promoter activity .
involvement of rel , fo , and jun protein in binding activity to the il-2 promoter cd28 response element/ ap-1 sequence in human t cell .
cd28 be an important costimulatory molecule in the activation of human t cell .
costimulation of t cell through both the ag receptor and cd28 lead to high level il-2 production , which be vital to the development of an immune response in vivo .
previous report have suggest the cd28 stimulation contribute to the activation of the il-2 promoter by up-regulating the activity of several transcription factor , include ap-1 and nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) / rel family member as well a an uncharacterized transcription factor call cd28 response complex .
while several line of investigation have suggest that nf-kappab/rel family member make up the cd28 response complex transcription factor , other work have not support this conclusion .
recent study suggest that the cd28 response element ( cd28re ) do not function independently but work instead in conjunction with the adjacent promoter proximal ap-1 -binding site and this hypothesis be confirm here .
also in the current study , binding activity to the cd28re /ap-1 sequence of the il-2 promoter be evaluate .
although four specific complex can be detect bind to this sequence , only one of these complex be specific for both the cd28re and the adjacent ap-1 site .
of the nf-kappab/rel family member test , this cd28re /ap-1-specific complex contain predominantly c-rel , despite the fact that both p50 and rela can efficiently bind to the cd28re .
c-fos and c-jun be also find in this cd28re /ap-1-specific complex .
these data indicate that functional complex encompass both the cd28re and the ap-1-binding site influence il-2 promoter activity in cd28 -costimulated t cell .

three bind site for c/ebp protein be find in the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) long terminal repeat ( ltr ) ( v.m. tesmer , a.rajadhyaksha , j.babin , and m.bina , proc.natl.acad.sci. usa 90 : 7298-7302 , 1993 ) .

however , transcription from cripple hiv-1 ltrs lack c/ebp site can still be induce follow activation of u937 cell .
several model be suggest for how elevated nf-il6 may participate in an autostimulatory loop involve hiv infection , macrophage activation , cytokine expression , and hiv replication .
expression level of the thyrotropin receptor gene in autoimmune thyroid disease : coregulation with parameter of thyroid function and inverse relation to major histocompatibility complex class i and ii .
use a human tsh receptor ( tsh-r ) cdna probe , we investigate tsh-r transcript level in 13 human thyroid fragment by northern blot analysis ; 7 graf ' disease , 2 hashimoto 's disease , 3 endemic goiter , and 1 healthy thyroid gland be study .
tsh-r expression level be variable , but display a close correlation to the expression of thyroid peroxidase ( r = 0.703 ; p < 0.05 ) , thyroglobulin ( r = 0.817 ; p < 0.01 ) , and the nuclear oncogene c-fos ( r = 0.935 ; p < 0.001 ) , but not c-myc .
overall , tsh-r transcript level be low or absent in those thyroid in which expression of the major histocompatibility complex class i or ii ( mhc i or ii ) be high , thus establish an inverse relation ( mhc i , r = -0.791 ; p < 0.01 ; mhc ii , r = -0.784 ; p < 0.01 ) .

our finding suggest that next to lymphocyte infiltration , active regulatory event in the thyrocyte be responsible for the inverse relation between functional parameter ( tsh-r , thyroid peroxidase , thyroglobulin , and c-fos ) and immunological marker ( mhc i and ii ) .
preassociation of stat1 with stat2 and stat3 in separate signalling complex prior to cytokine stimulation .
a variety of cytokine and growth factor act through an induction of gene expression mediate by a family of latent transcription factor call stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) protein .
ligand-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the stats promote their homodimer and heterodimer formation and subsequent nuclear translocation .
we demonstrate here that stat protein heterocomplexes exist prior to cytokine treatment .
when unstimulated hela cell be rupture in hypotonic buffer without salt or detergent , immunoadsorption of either stat1 or stat2 from the result cytosol yield coimmunoadsorption of the other stat protein .
similarly , stat1 -stat3 heterocomplexes be coimmunoadsorbed from hypotonic cytosol .
stat1 and stat2 or stat1 and stat3 translate in reticulocyte lysate spontaneously form heterocomplexes when the translation lysates be mix at 0 degree c .
our data suggest that interferon-alpha /beta-induced tyrosine phosphorylation increase the stability of a preexisting , latent , stat1 - stat2 signaling complex .
newly translate stat1 bind in equilibrium fashion to stat2 and stat3 , but we show that stat2 and stat3 exist in separate heterocomplexes with stat1 , consistent with a model in which stat1 contain a common bind site for other stat protein .

we also show that this silencer have strong inhibitory activity in hela cell , a compare to k562 human erythroleukemia cell .
