two bind protein be detect in k562 nuclear extract , while only one be find in extract from hela cell .
possible mechanism by which these protein may regulate transcription of the epsilon-globin-encoding gene in erythroid and non-erythroid cell be discuss .
erythropoietin -dependent induction of hemoglobin synthesis in a cytokine -dependent cell line m-tat .
m-tat be a cytokine -dependent cell line with the potential to differentiate along the erythroid and megakaryocytic lineage .
we culture m-tat cell long term ( > 1 year ) in the continuous presence of erythropoietin ( epo ) , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) , or stem cell factor ( scf ) .
these long term culture be refer to a m-tat/epo , m-tat/gm-csf , and m-tat/scf cell , respectively .
hemoglobin concentration and gamma-globin and erythroid delta-aminolevulinate synthase mrna level be significantly high in m-tat/epo cell than in m-tat/gm-csf cell .
when the supplement cytokine be switch from gm-csf to epo , hemoglobin synthesis in m-tat/gm-csf cell increase rapidly ( within 5 h ) , and the level of gata-1 mrna increase .
in contrast , the addition of gm-csf to the m-tat/epo cell culture decrease the amount of hemoglobin , even in the presence of epo , indicate that the epo signal for erythroid differentiation be suppress by gm-csf .
thus , erythroid development of m-tat cell be promote by epo and suppress by gm-csf .
these result support the hypothesis that epo actively influence the programming of gene expression require for erythroid progenitor cell differentiation .
induction of cytokine expression in leukocyte by binding of thrombin-stimulated platelet .
background : activate platelet tether and activate myeloid leukocyte .
to investigate the potential relevance of this mechanism in acute myocardial infarction ( ami ) , we examine cytokine induction by leukocyte-platelet adhesion and the occurrence of leukocyte-platelet conjugate in patient with ami .
method and result : we obtain peripheral venous blood sample in 20 patient with ami before and daily for 5 day after direct percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty ( ptca ) and in 20 patient undergo elective ptca .
throughout the study period , cd41 immunofluorescence of leukocyte ( flow cytometry ) reveal increase leukocyte-platelet adhesion in patient with ami compare with control patient ( mean +/- se of fluorescence [ channel ] before ptca : 77 +/- 16 versus 35 +/- 9 ; p = .003 ) .
in vitro , thrombin-stimulated fixed platelet bind to neutrophil and monocyte .
within 2 hour , this result in increase mrna for interleukin ( il ) , 1 beta , il-8 , and monocyte chemoattractant protein ( mcp ) -1 in unfractionated leukocyte .
after 4 hour , il-1 beta and il-8 concentration of the cell-free supernatant have increase by 268 +/- 36 % and 210 +/- 7 % , respectively , and cellular mcp-1 content have increase by 170 +/- 8 % .
addition of activate platelet to adherent monocyte have a similar effect and be associate with nuclear factor-kappa b activation .
inhibition of binding by anti-p selectin antibody reduce the effect of activate platelet on cytokine production .
conclusion : in patient with ami , leukocyte-platelet adhesion be increase .
binding of activate platelet induce il-1 beta , il-8 , and mcp-1 in leukocyte .
our finding suggest that leukocyte-platelet adhesion contribute to the regulation of inflammatory response in ami .
stat1 pathway be involve in activation of caprine arthritis-encephalitis virus long terminal repeat in monocyte .
the caprine arthritis-encephalitis virus ( caev ) long terminal repeat ( ltr ) be activate by gamma interferon ( ifn-gamma ) in promonocytic cell .
we have previously show that a 70-bp element be necessary and sufficient for the response of the caev ltr to this cytokine .
at the 5' end , this 70-bp ifn-gamma response element contain sequence similarity to the gamma activated site ( gas ) .
here we demonstrate that the putative gas element in the caev ltr bind specifically to a cellular factor induce by ifn-gamma in promonocytic cell .
substitution mutation in this consensus sequence eliminate binding of the inducible factor .
the gas element from the 70-bp motif be sufficient to confer responsiveness to ifn-gamma use a heterologous minimal promoter .
consistent with the binding data , the same mutation in the gas element eliminate responsiveness to ifn-gamma in the context of both a functional caev ltr and a heterologous promoter .
the cellular factor that bind to the gas element be present from 5 min to 14 h after stimulation with ifn-gamma .
binding of the nuclear factor to the gas element in the caev ltr be inhibit by antibody direct against stat1 ( p91/84 ) .
thus , the gas sequence in the caev ltr be essential for the response to ifn-gamma and a stat1 -like factor bind to this site .
the stat-1 signaling pathway provide at least one mechanism for activation of the caev ltr by ifn-gamma in monocyte .
these data be the first demonstration of a role for a stat family member in the regulation of a viral promoter .
multiple signal be require for function of the human granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor gene promoter in t cell .
the human granulocyte-macrophage csf ( gm-csf ) gene be express in t cell in response to tcr activation that can be mimic by treatment of the cell with pma and ca2+ ionophore .
the gene contain a proximal functional promoter region ( -620 to +34 ) , as well a a powerful enhancer located 3 kb upstream , both of which be involve in the response of the gene to tcr activation .
the proximal promoter contain a region term cleo ( -54 to -31 ) that consist of a purine -rich element abut an activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) -like site , as well a an upstream nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) site ( -85 to -76 ) and a ck-1 element ( -101 to -92 ) .
we show in this work that mutation in either the purine -rich region of the cleo element or the nf-kappa b site result in reduce pma / ca2+ activation of a 620-bp human gm-csf promoter- luciferase reporter construct in jurkat t cell by 65 % and 50 % , respectively .
the major inducible protein complex that bind to the human cleo ( hcleo ) element be an ap-1 -like complex that be inducible by pma alone , but show increase binding in response to pma together with ca2+ ionophore .
although the binding of this complex be not cyclosporin -sensitive , promoter induction be inhibit by cyclosporin treatment .
a second weak inducible complex resemble nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) be also observe bind to the hcleo region .
by use recombinant protein , we confirm that ap-1 , nf-atp , and a high order nf-atp / ap-1 complex could all form with the hcleo element , and we have also define the sequence requirement for binding of each of these complex .
we find that expression of a constitutively active form of calcineurin could substitute for ca2+ ionophore and synergize with pma to activate the gm-csf promoter , and conversely that mutant-activated ra could substitute for pma and cooperate with ca2+ ionophore .
co-expression of ra and calcineurin , however , do not activate the gm-csf promoter , but require the additional expression of nf-kappa b p65 .
these result imply that at least three signal be require to activate the gm-csf proximal promoter , and that the signal impinge on distinct transcription factor that bind to the hcleo and nf-kappa b region of the promoter .
role of ikk1 and ikk2 in lipopolysaccharide signaling in human monocytic cell .
mononuclear phagocyte play a major role in immune and inflammatory response .
bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induce monocyte to express a variety of gene by activate the nf-kappab/rel transcription factor family .
recently , we have report that the tumor necrosis factor and interleukin 1 signaling pathway activate two kinase , ikk1 and ikk2 .
phosphorylation of the ikappab cytoplasmic inhibitor , ikappabalpha , ikappabbeta , and ikappabepsilon , by these kinase trigger proteolytic degradation and the release of nf-kappab/rel protein into the nucleus .
at present , the role of the ikks in lp signaling have not be investigate .
here , we report that lp induce ikk activity in human monocyte and thp-1 monocytic cell .
the kinetics of activation of kinase activity in monocytic cell be relatively slow with maximal activity observe at 60 min , which coincide with the degradation of ikappabs and the nuclear translocation of nf-kappab .
in transfection experiment , overexpression of wild type ikk1 , a dominant negative mutant ikk1 ( k44m ) , or wild type ikk2 do not affect lp -induced kappab -dependent transcription in monocytic cell .
in contrast , a dominant negative mutant of ikk2 inhibit lp induction of kappab -dependent transcription in a dose-dependent manner .
these result indicate that lp induction of kappab-dependent gene expression in human monocytic cell require activation of ikk2 .
gene encode general initiation factor for rna polymerase ii transcription be disperse in the human genome .
general transcription factor be require for accurate initiation of transcription by rna polymerase ii .
human cdna encode subunit of these factor have be clone and sequence .
use fluorescence in situ hybridization ( fish ) , we show here that the gene encode the tata-box binding protein ( tbp ) , tfiib , tfiie alpha , tfiie beta , rap30 , rap74 and the 62 kda subunit , of tfiih be located at the human chromosomal band 6q26-27 , 1p21-22 , 3q21-24 , 8p12 , 13q14 , 19p13.3 and 11p14-15.1 , respectively .
this dispersed localization of a group of functionally related gene provide insight into the molecular mechanism of human genome evolution and their possible involvement in human disease .
ciita activate the expression of mhc class ii gene in mouse t cell .
it have long be a puzzle that mhc class ii molecule be express in human t cell after activation but not in mouse t cell ; this expression be believe to play a role in the cell mediated immune response .
recently the mhc class ii transactivator ( ciita ) have be report to be a major regulatory factor for both the constitutive and ifn inducible expression of mhc class ii gene .
here we show that human t cell express mhc class ii have ciita transcript while mhc class ii-negative human t cell and mouse t cell do not .
the expression of mhc class ii gene in mouse t cell can be reconstitute upon transfection with the human ciita cdna .
these data indicate that the expression of ciita explain the expression or lack of expression of mhc class ii in human and mouse t cell respectively .
tyrosine phosphorylation be a mandatory proximal step in radiation-induced activation of the protein kinase c signaling pathway in human b- lymphocyte precursor [ publish erratum appear in proc natl acad sci u s a 1993 apr 15 ; 90 ( 8 ) : 3775 ]
ionize radiation trigger a signal in human b-lymphocyte precursor that be intimately link to an active protein-tyrosine kinase regulatory pathway .
we show that in b-lymphocyte precursor , irradiation with gamma-rays lead to ( i ) stimulation of phosphatidylinositol turnover ; ( ii ) downstream activation by covalent modification of multiple serine-specific protein kinase , include protein kinase c ; and ( iii ) activation of nuclear factor kappa b .
all of the radiation-induced signal be effectively prevent by the protein-tyrosine kinase inhibitor genistein and herbimycin a .
thus , tyrosine phosphorylation be an important and perhaps mandatory proximal step in the activation of the protein kinase c signaling cascade in human b-lymphocyte precursor .
our report expands current knowledge of the radiation-induced signaling cascade by clarify the chronological sequence of biochemical event that follow irradiation .
a cell type-specific enhancer in the human b7.1 gene regulate by nf-kappab .
the costimulatory molecule b7.1 provide a second signal critical for t cell activation .
the distribution of this integral membrane protein be restricted to certain tissue where it level of expression be modulate by multiple exogenous stimulus .
to identify the molecular basis for specificity and inducibility , the chromatin configuration of the human b7.1 gene be examine in intact nucleus from various cell type .
the identification of a tissue-specific deoxyribonuclease i hypersensitive site approximately 3kb upstream of the transcription start site lead to the characterization of a cell type-specific enhancer region .
this 183-bp region be both cell type specific and responsive to two distinct stimulus , lipopolysaccharide and dibutyryl camp , know to regulate b7.1 expression .
deletional and site-directed mutagenesis reveal the presence of multiple functionally critical ci element within this region , one of which be a nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappab consensus sequence .
in b7.1 -positive b cell , this element bind several member of the nf-kappab family , transcription factor already implicate in signal transduction pathway relevant to b7.1 expression .
this be the first description , to our knowledge , of regulatory element that control expression of a gene encode a b7 costimulatory molecule .
a mutation of the glucocorticoid receptor in primary cortisol resistance .
the precise molecular abnormality that cause primary cortisol resistance have not be completely describe .
in a subject with primary cortisol resistance we have observe glucocorticoid receptor ( hgr ) with a decrease affinity for dexamethasone .
we hypothesize that a mutation of the hgr glucocorticoid-binding domain be the cause of cortisol resistance .
total rna isolate from the index subject 's mononuclear leukocyte be use to produce first strand hgr cdna , and the entire hgr cdna be amplify in segment and sequence .
at nucleotide 2 , 317 we identify a homozygous a for g point mutation that predict an isoleucine ( att ) for valine ( gtt ) substitution at amino acid 729 .
when the wild-type hgr and hgr -ile 729 be express in cos-1 cell and assay for [3h]-dexamethasone binding , the dissociation constant be 0.799 +/- 0.068 and 1.54 +/- 0.06 nm ( mean +/- sem ) ( p < 0.01 ) , respectively .
when the wild-type hgr and hgr -ile 729 be express in cv-1 cell that be cotransfected with the mouse mammary tumor virus long terminal repeat fuse to the chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) gene , the hgr -ile 729 confer a fourfold decrease in apparent potency on dexamethasone stimulation of cat activity .
the isoleucine for valine substitution at amino acid 729 impair the function of the hgr and be the likely cause of primary cortisol resistance in this subject .
menopause be associate with a significant increase in blood monocyte number and a relative decrease in the expression of estrogen receptor in human peripheral monocyte .
problem : the clinical significance of the differential expression of estrogen receptor ( er ) in human monocyte be evaluate .
method : two color flow cytometry analysis be use on peripheral blood sample of young and postmenopausal female and postmenopausal female treat with estrogen replacement therapy .
in addition , the monocyte and lymphocyte count and the blood estrogen level of each patient be determine .
result : during menopause there be a significant decrease in the percentage of er positive monocyte , and an increase in blood monocyte number , which decline follow estrogen replacement therapy to value of the young .
conclusion : these finding suggest that estrogen modulate the monocyte number and it effect may be mediate through the er in the monocyte .
transcription factor bind to the core promoter of the human monoamine oxidase b gene in the cerebral cortex and in blood cell .
many study show that monoamine oxidase b in blood cell be a biological marker for personality characteristic such a sensation seeking .
the mechanism underlie this association be so far not explore .
in the present study we have perform electrophoretic mobility-shift assay to investigate the pattern of protein binding to a 150 bp fragment of the proximal 5'-flanking region of the human monoamine oxidase b gene .
we compare the pattern use nuclear extract from human brain and lymphocyte .
interestingly , a correlation be observe between monoamine oxidase b enzyme activity in blood cell ( platelet ) and the binding pattern of two uncharacterized transcription factor .
these data be well in line with the long-standing notion that interindividual difference in platelet monoamine oxidase may represent difference in expression of the enzyme rather than genotypic variation .
the epstein-barr virus rta protein activate lytic cycle gene and can disrupt latency in b lymphocyte .
the transition of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) from latency into the lytic cycle be associate with the expression of two immediate-early viral gene , bzlf1 and brlf1 .
overexpression of zebra , the product of bzlf1 , be sufficient to disrupt latency in b lymphocyte and epithelial cell by stimulate expression of lytic cycle gene , include brlf1 .
the brlf1 product rta function a a transcriptional activator in both b lymphocyte and epithelial cell .
however , rta have recently be report to disrupt latency in an epithelial specific manner ( s. zalani , e. holley-guthrie , and s. kenney , proc. natl. acad. sci. usa 93 : 9194-9199 , 1996 ) .
here we demonstrate that expression of rta be also sufficient for disruption of latency in a permissive b-cell line .
in hh514-16 cell , transfection of rta lead to synthesis of zebra , viral dna replication , and late gene expression .
however , rta by itself be less potent than zebra in the ability to activate most early and late lytic cycle gene .
in light of previous work implicate zebra in the activation of rta , we suggest a cooperative model for ebv entry into the lytic cycle .
expression of either bzlf1 or brlf1 trigger expression of the other immediate-early factor , and together these activator act individually or in synergy on downstream target to activate the viral lytic cycle .
expression of gamma-ifn responsive gene in scavenger receptor over-expressing monocyte be associate with xanthomatosis .
we have recently describe an inherit over-expression of the macrophage scavenger receptor ( sr ) in blood monocyte from member of a kindred , only two of whom display extensive xanthomatosis .
use mrna differential display we demonstrate abnormally high expression of the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat1alpha ) in monocyte from the proband ii-2 .
expression of gamma-interferon inducible protein 10 ( ip-10 ) , a stat1alpha -responsive gene and mediator of inflammatory response , be also abnormally express in the monocyte from ii-2 .
over-expression of both gene be restricted to monocyte from ii-2 and be not observe in monocyte from the clinically unaffected family member , unlike that of sr .
gel retardation assay with thp-1 cell extract identify gamma-ifn inducible dna binding activity to three potential stati dna binding element in the human ip-10 promoter region from nucleotide -_245 to -_188 .
take together these result suggest that gamma-interferon mediate cell activation be responsible for stat1alpha -induced transcription of the ip-10 gene in thp-1 macrophage as well a in monocyte from ii-2 .
analysis of monocyte from familial hypercholesterolemic ( fh ) subject , who frequently develop xanthomatosis , reveal a significant number of subject with elevated stat1alpha and ip-10 expression .
our data suggest that the inflammatory effect of gamma-ifn signaling could play a role in foam cell formation and xanthomatosis .
the nf-kappa b inhibitor , tepoxalin , suppress surface expression of the cell adhesion molecule cd62e , cd11b/cd18 and cd106 .
tepoxalin , a dual enzyme inhibitor of cyclooxygenase and 5-lipoxygenase have be show to inhibit t-cell activation .
it immunosuppressive property be distinct from cyclosporin because only tepoxalin , but not cyclosporin , suppress nf-kappa b activation .
here we report that tepoxalin selectively inhibit intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 , cd54 ) /mac-1 ( cd11b/cd18 ) dependent adhesion of polymorphonuclear cell to il-1 activated human umbilical vein endothelial cell .
the mechanism of inhibition be related to the surface expression of several cell adhesion molecule .
flow cytometry analysis on culture cell that be treat with tepoxalin or antisense oligonucleotides to the p65/p50 subunit of nf-kappa b , and then stimulate with pma , reveal a reduce expression of cd11b/cd18 on monocytic hl60 cell , and endothelial adhesion molecule-1 ( cd62e ) and vascular adhesion molecule-1 ( cd106 ) on human umbilical vein endothelial cell .
expression of other adhesion molecule such a lymphocyte function associated-antigen-1 ( cd11a /cd18 ) and cd54 be unaffected .
tepoxalin also inhibit the secretion of a nf-kappa b regulated chemokine , il-8 , a known inducer of cd11b/cd18 expression .
thus the suppression of cd11b/cd18 expression by tepoxalin may involve il-8 .
our result suggest that by inhibit nf-kappa b activation , surface expression of several adhesion molecule can be modulate and that tepoxalin may be useful in treat select adhesion mediated event such a leukocyte migration or atherosclerotic plaque formation .
single strand conformation polymorphism analysis of androgen receptor gene mutation in patient with androgen insensitivity syndrome : application for diagnosis , genetic counseling , and therapy .
recent study indicate that mutation in the androgen receptor gene be associate with androgen insensitivity syndrome , a heterogeneous group of related disorder involve defective sexual differentiation in karyotypic male .
in this report , we address the possibility of rapid mutational analysis of the androgen receptor gene for initial diagnosis , genetic counseling , and molecular subclassification of affect patient and their family .
dna from peripheral blood leukocyte of six patient from five family with various degree of androgen insensitivity be study .
exon 2 to 8 of the androgen receptor gene be analyze use a combination of single strand conformation polymorphism analysis and direct dna sequencing .
female family member be also study to identify heterozygote carrier .
point mutation in the ar gene be identify in all six patient , and all mutation cause amino acid substitution .
one patient with incomplete androgen insensitivity be a mosaic for the mutation .
four of the five mother , as well a a young sister of one patient , be carrier of the mutation present in the affect child .
our data show that new mutation may occur in the androgen receptor gene lead to sporadic androgen insensitivity syndrome .
molecular genetic characterization of the variant allele can serve a a primary tool for diagnosis and subsequent therapy , and can provide a basis for distinguish heterozygous carrier in familial androgen resistance .
the identification of carrier be of substantial clinical importance for genetic counseling .
cortivazol mediate induction of glucocorticoid receptor messenger ribonucleic acid in wild-type and dexamethasone -resistant human leukemic ( cem ) cell .
cortivazol be a phenylpyrazolo glucocorticoid of high potency and unusual structure .
in both wild-type and highly dexamethasone ( dex ) -resistant clone of the human leukemic cell line cem , exposure to cortivazol lead to cell death .
it have be show recently that in wild-type cem cell but not in a dex-resistant , glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) -defective clone icr-27 tk-3 , dex induce gr mrna .
to test the hypothesis that cortivazol act in dex -resistant cell by make use of the residual gr find there , wild-type and dex -resistant clone be treat with various concentration of cortivazol and induction of gr mrna be study .
cortivazol significantly induce gr mrna in the normal cem-c7 as well a in two class of dex -resistant clone , although the dex -resistant clone need at least 10 time more cortivazol than the normal cell for significant gr mrna induction .
increase level of gr mrna be notice as early a 3 h after treatment .
a general correlation between induction of gr mrna and lysis of the normal and dex -resistant cell be find .
positive induction of gr mrna might be one of the early crucial step in the lysis of normal and dex-resistant cem cell , or might serve a a marker for the process .
however , the lysis pathway in the dex -resistant cell be defective in that dex -resistant clone need significantly more cortivazol than the normal cell for lysis of the cell .
minimally modify low density lipoprotein -induced inflammatory response in endothelial cell be mediate by cyclic adenosine monophosphate .
we have previously show that minimally oxidize ldl ( mm-ldl ) activate endothelial cell to increase their interaction with monocyte but not neutrophil , induce monocyte but not neutrophil binding and synthesis of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 and monocyte colony-stimulating factor ( m-csf ) .
in the present study we have examine the signaling pathway by which this monocyte-specific response be induce .
both induction of monocyte binding and mrna level for m-csf by mm-ldl be not inhibit in protein kinase c-depleted endothelial cell .
a number of our study indicate that camp be the second messenger for the effect of mm-ldl cite above .
incubation of endothelial cell with mm-ldl cause a 173 % increase in intracellular camp level .
agent which increase camp level , include cholera toxin , pertussis toxin , dibutyryl camp , and isoproterenol mimic the action of mm-ldl .
agent which elevate camp be also show to activate nf kappa b , suggest a role for this transcription factor in activation of monocyte-endothelial interaction .
although endothelial leukocyte adhesion molecule ( elam ) mrna synthesis can be regulate by nf kappa b , elam be not express and elam mrna be only slightly elevated in response to mm-ldl .
we present evidence that induction of neutrophil binding by lp be actually suppress by agent that elevate camp level .

suppression of mhc class ii expression by human class ii trans-activator construct lack the n-terminal domain .
the class ii trans-activator ( ciita ) be a bi- or multi-functional domain protein which play a critical role in the expression of mhc class ii gene .
we report that removal of the n-terminal 151 amino acid , encompass all of the acidic domain but leave intact the proline / serine / threonine -rich domain , result in a mutant protein with potent suppressive property for mhc class ii expression .
hela cell stably or transiently transfected with mutant ciita construct show up to 99 % suppression of mhc class ii antigen induction by ifn-gamma and marked suppression of hla-dra mrna expression .
transient transfection of a b lymphoma line result in up to 89 % reduction of constitutive mhc class ii expression within 5 day and suppression of hla-dra mrna synthesis .
activation of human thymocytes after infection by ebv .
the discovery of ebv in certain t cell malignancy and the expression of the ebv receptor , cr2/cd21 , on a population of immature thymocytes , t lymphoblastoid cell line , and childhood acute t lymphoblastic leukemia cell suggest that ebv -receptor interaction on t cell may be of importance .
we have show that , within the thymus , a population of large , immature cell express cd21 .
ebv alter the activation response of immature thymocytes in vitro .
trigger through cd2 be mitogenic for mature , but not immature , t cell .
however , during infection by ebv , ligation of cd2 cause thymocytes to proliferate in the absence of exogenous cytokine .
this function be a result of the interaction of ebv with it receptor , cd21 , but be cause by infection rather than surface signaling , because neither specific mab nor the p3hr-1 strain of virus mimic the effect of b95-8 .
immature thymocytes be infect by ebv , a determine by the internalization of the viral genome and it transcriptional activity .
consistent with the activity of b95-8 , ebna-2 transcript be identify within infected thymocyte population .
in addition , component of the viral replicative pathway be express during infection of thymocytes .
these component include transcription of bzlf-1 , an early gene that characterize ebv -infected b cell after disruption of latency .
a second transcript be identify a encode the recently characterize raz , which also be associate with replicative infection .
the consequence of ebv infection of t cell at an early stage of differentiation may lead to failure of normal t cell repertoire development , autoimmunity , or malignancy .
regulation of pak activation and the t cell cytoskeleton by the linker protein slp-76 .
tyrosine phosphorylation of linker protein enable the t cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) -associated protein tyrosine kinase to phosphorylate and regulate effector molecule that generate second messenger .
we demonstrate here that the slp-76 linker protein interact with both nck , an adaptor protein , and vav , a guanine nucleotide exchange factor for rho-family gtpases .
the assembly of this tri-molecular complex permit the activate rho-family gtpases to regulate target effector that interact through nck .
in turn , assembly of this complex mediate the enzymatic activation of the p21-activated protein kinase 1 and facilitate actin polymerization .
hence , phosphorylation of linker protein not only bridge the tcr-associated ptk , zap-70 , with downstream effector protein , but also provide a scaffold to integrate distinct signal complex to regulate t cell function .
the state of maturation of monocyte into macrophage determine the effect of il-4 and il-13 on hiv replication .
the molecular mechanism of the effect of il-4 and il-13 on hiv infection in human monocyte a they mature into monocyte-derived macrophage over 7 day be investigate use hiv-1 ( bal ) , and low passage clinical strain .
il-4 and il-13 up-regulated the expression of both genomic and splice hiv mrna in monocyte culture on teflon , a determine by northern analysis and p24 ag assay .
use a nuclear run-on assay , il-4 stimulation be show to enhance transcription by two- to threefold .
il-4 stimulate nuclear factor-kappab nuclear translocation and binding before enhancement of hiv rna expression .
conversely , il-4 and il-13 markedly and significantly inhibit hiv replication at the transcriptional level in monocyte-derived macrophage , and this occur whether these cytokine be add before or after hiv infection .
the reversal from stimulation to inhibition occur after 3 to 5 day of adherence to plastic .
il-4 have no significant effect on hiv reverse transcription .
the effect of both cytokine on the monocyte maturation/differentiation ( cd11b , cd13 , and cd26 ) and other macrophage marker ( cd14 and cd68 ) be examine .
il-4 enhance cd11b , but inhibit cd26 expression and delay cd13 loss .
il-13 have similar effect on cd11b and cd13 , but no effect on cd26 .
hence , these cytokine do not simply enhance monocyte differentiation , but have complex and slightly divergent effect that impact on hiv replication probably through cell signaling pathway and nuclear factor-kappab translocation .
reactivation of kaposi 's sarcoma -associated herpesvirus infection from latency by expression of the orf 50 transactivator , a homolog of the ebv r protein .
kaposi 's sarcoma ( k ) -associated herpesvirus ( kshv ) , or human herpesvirus 8 , be a lymphotropic virus strongly link to several aids-related neoplasm .
the primary reservoir of infection consist of latently infected b lymphocyte and possibly other mononuclear cell .
viral reactivation from latency and spread from this lymphoid reservoir be presumably require for development of nonlymphoid tumor like k .
here we show that deregulate expression of a single viral gene , orf 50 , which encode a transactivator able to selectively upregulate delayed-early viral gene , suffice to disrupt latency and induce the lytic gene cascade in latently infected b cell .
the identification of this gene open the way to study of the physiologic mechanism control reactvation of kshv from latency .

upregulation of interleukin 6 and granulocyte colony-stimulating factor receptor by transcription factor ccaat enhancer binding protein alpha ( c/ebp alpha ) be critical for granulopoiesis .
cytokine stimulate granulopoiesis through signaling via receptor whose expression be control by lineage-specific transcription factor .
previously , we demonstrate that granulocyte colony-stimulating factor ( g-csf ) receptor mrna be undetectable and granulocyte maturation block in ccaat enhancer binding protein alpha ( c/ebpalpha ) -deficient mouse .
this phenotype be distinct from that of g-csf receptor-/- mouse , suggest that other gene be likely to be adversely affect by loss of c/ebpalpha .
here we demonstrate loss of interleukin 6 ( il-6 ) receptor and il-6-responsive colony-forming unit ( cfu-il6 ) in c/ebpalpha -/- mouse .
the observe failure of granulopoiesis could be rescue by the addition of soluble il-6 receptor and il-6 or by retroviral transduction of g-csf receptor , demonstrate that loss of both of these receptor contribute to the absolute block in granulocyte maturation observe in c/ebpalpha -deficient hematopoietic cell .
the result of these and other study suggest that additional c/ebpalpha target gene , possibly other cytokine receptor , be also important for the block in granulocyte differentiation observe in vivo in c/ebpalpha -deficient mouse .
coexpression of the interleukin-13 and interleukin-4 gene correlate with their physical linkage in the cytokine gene cluster on human chromosome 5q23-31 .
interleukin-13 ( il-13 ) and il-4 be cytokine produce by t cell that be encode by the q23-31 region of human chromosome 5 .
to investigate the regulation of il-13 gene expression by t cell , we isolate and sequence the human il-13 gene , analyze it 5'-flanking region for potential transcriptional activation element , and examine it expression in nontransformed t-lineage cell population .
the human il-13 gene be located 12.5-kb upstream of the il-4 gene and 2-kb downstream of a cpg island .
the il-13 gene 5' flank region include a segment with sequence homology to p element of the il-4 promoter involve in transcriptional activation in t cell .
mutation of the il-13 p element site significantly reduce il-13 promoter activity in response to t-cell activation .
oligonucleotides contain the il-13 or il-4 p element site specifically bind the transcriptional activator protein , nuclear factor-activated t cell , preformed ( nf-atp ) , when incubate with nuclear protein extract from activate t cell .
similar to il-4 , il-13 mrna expression be high in t-cell population enrich for cell that have previously be prim in vivo or in vitro , indicate that priming increase the expression of the il-13 and il-4 gene in a coordinate manner .
because the prim t cell contain high level of nuclear nf-atp , capable of bind to p element of the il-4 and il-13 promoter , than do freshly-isolated t cell , the nf-at-binding p element be attractive candidate to mediate the coordinate expression of these two cytokine gene .
transcription specific difference visualize by fluorescence in situ hybridization pattern on interphase nucleus of different cell type .

correspondingly , rnase treatment have no effect on hybridization pattern at all .
in conclusion an increase transcription efficiency of a cell type specific gene be accompany by a high hybridization accessibility in the corresponding cell nucleus .
inorganic lead activate nf-kappa b in primary human cd4+ t lymphocyte .
inorganic lead ( pb ) be a ubiquitous environmental contaminant that produce a variety of effect on humoral and cell mediated immune response .
the underlie molecular mechanism for pb 's complex effect on the immune system remain obscure .
many of pb 's effect on the immune system could be explain through activation of the transcription factor , nf-kappa b .
nf-kappa b be critical for t lymphocyte function and be a strong inducer of hiv-ltr activation .
we demonstrate that pb at physiologically relevant concentration activate nf-kappa b in primary human cd4+ t lymphocyte .
pb -induced activation of nf-kappa b be block by antibody for p65 and p50 subunit but not crel , indicate that the p65 : p50 heterodimer ( nf-kappa b ) be involve .
functional activation of gene expression by pb be confirm use primary cd4+ t cell transfected with an nf-kappa b dependent reporter gene construct .
pb do not activate nf-kappa b in 4 different t cell line , suggest that lymphoid cell line may not be reliable surrogate for the study of transcriptional activation in human t cell .
these data suggest that nf-kappa b may be an important molecular mediator of pb -induced immunotoxicity .
involvement of different transduction pathway in nf-kappa b activation by several inducer .
double-stimulation be use to demonstrate that , in a t lymphocytic cell line ( cem ) , phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) rapidly induce nf-kappa b through a signaling pathway which do not involve reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) and be different from the activation trigger by either h2o2 or tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
since these latter compound be know to activate nf-kappa b translocation in a redox-sensitive way , we have demonstrate that nf-kappa b activation by pma be resistant to antioxidant n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) and sensitive to kinase inhibitor staurosporine and h7 while activation by h2o2 or tnf-alpha be not .
retinoid x receptor and c-cerba/thyroid hormone receptor regulate erythroid cell growth and differentiation .
nuclear receptor be important regulator of erythroid cell development .
here we investigate the impact of retinoid x receptor ( rxr ) , retinoic acid receptor ( rar ) , and of the c-erba/thyroid hormone ( t3 ) receptor ( c-erba/tr ) on growth and differentiation of erythroid cell use an in vitro culture system of stem cell factor-dependent erythroid progenitor .
rxr , rar , and c-erba/tr -specific ligand be find to induce erythroid-specific gene expression and to accelerate erythroid differentiation in culture , with t3 be most effective .
furthermore , while ligand-activated c-erba/tr accelerate differentiation , unliganded c-erba/tr effectively block differentiation and support sustained progenitor growth in culture .
thus , c-erba/tr appear to act a a binary switch affect erythroid cell fate : unliganded c-erba/tr support growth while ligand-activated c-erba/tr induce differentiation .
additionally , to determine the impact of rxr for erythroid cell development , dominant interfere mutant rxrs , lack the transcriptional activator function af-1 and af-2 , or af-2 only , or the entire dna-binding domain , be introduce into erythroid progenitor cell via recombinant retrovirus vector and analyze for rxr -specific effect .
it be find that expression of wild-type rxr and of the rxr mutant devoid of af-1 and/or af-2 support a transient outgrowth of erythroid cell .
in marked contrast , expression of the dominant interfere deltadna-binding domain rxr , contain a deletion of the entire dna-binding domain , be incompatible with erythroid cell growth in vitro , suggest a pivotal role of rxr for erythroid cell development .
cross-linking of cd30 induce hiv expression in chronically infected t cell .
cd30 , a member of the tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) receptor family , be express constitutively on the surface of the human t cell line ach-2 , which be chronically infect with human immunodeficiency virus type-1 ( hiv ) -1 .
we demonstrate that cross-linking cd30 with an anti- cd30 -specific monoclonal antibody , which mimic the describe biological activity of the cd30 ligand ( cd30l ) , result in hiv expression .
cd30 cross-linking do not alter proliferation of ach-2 cell and the induction of hiv expression be not mediate by endogenous tnf alpha/beta .
furthermore , cross-linking of cd30 lead to nf-kappa b activation and enhance hiv transcription .
thus , cd30 -cd30l interaction mediate the induction of hiv expression by a kappa b-dependent pathway that be independent of tnf .
this mechanism may be important in the activation of hiv expression from latently infected cd4+ t cell , especially in lymphoid organ where cell to cell contact be conducive to receptor-ligand interaction .
ets1 , nfkappab and ap1 synergistically transactivate the human gm-csf promoter .
activation of helper t cell result in coordinate expression of a number of cytokine involve in differentiation , proliferation and activation of the haematopoietic system .
granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be one such cytokine , whose increase expression result mostly from increase in transcription .
cis-acting element with nfkappab , ap1 and ets -like bind motif have be identify in the promoter region of the gm-csf gene , and be important or essential for transcriptional activity follow t cell activation .
ets1 be a transcription factor of the ets family that be express in t cell .
we have previously show that ets1 can transactivate gm-csf in jurkat t cell , but only after the cell have be stimulate by treatment with pma and ionomycin , agent that mimic t cell activation .
thus we propose that ets1 , which be express constitutively in jurkat cell , may act in concert with pma/ionomycin inducible factor .
here we show that ets1 can transactivate a gm-csf reporter construct in unstimulated jurkat cell , provide that either nfkappab or ap1 transcription factor be supply by co-transfection .
we confirm that binding of endogenous nfkappab and ap1 be induce follow pma /ionomycin treatment of t cell .
transactivation by ets1 , nfkappab and ap1 be synergistic , and mutation of the individual bind site reveal that the transcriptional activity of these factor be interdependent .
our result suggest that constitutive ets1 , and inducible nfkappab and ap1 , cooperate a part of a high order transcriptional complex in activate t cell .
comparative analysis identify conserve tumor necrosis factor receptor -associated factor 3 binding site in the human and simian epstein-barr virus oncogene lmp1 .
nonhuman primate be naturally infect with a b-lymphotropic herpesvirus closely related to epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) .
these simian ebv share considerable genetic , biologic , and epidemiologic feature with human ebv , include virus-induced tumorigenesis .
however , latent , transformation-associated viral gene demonstrate marked sequence divergence among specie despite the conserve function .
we have clone the latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) homologs from the simian ebv naturally infect baboon ( cercopithicine herpesvirus 12 , herpesvirus papio ) and rhesus monkey ( cercopithicine herpesvirus 15 ) for a comparative study with the human ebv oncogene .
the transmembrane domain be well conserve , but there be striking sequence divergence of the carboxy-terminal cytoplasmic domain essential for b-cell immortalization and interaction with the tumor necrosis factor receptor signaling pathway .
nevertheless , the simian ebv lmp1s retain most function in common with ebv lmp1 , include the ability to induce nf-(kappa)b activity in human cell , to bind the tumor necrosis factor-associated factor 3 ( traf3 ) in vitro , and to induce expression of tumor necrosis factor-responsive gene , such a icam1 , in human b lymphocyte .
multiple traf3 binding site contain a pxqxt/s core sequence can be identify in the simian ebv lmp1s by an in vitro binding assay .
a pxqxt/s-containing sequence be also present in the cytoplasmic domain of the hodgkin 's disease marker , cd30 , and bind traf3 in vitro .
the last 13 amino acid contain a pxqxt/s sequence be highly conserve in human and simian ebv lmp1 but do not bind traf3 , suggest a distinct role for this conserve region of lmp1 .
the conserve traf3 binding site in lmp1 and the cd30 hodgkin 's disease marker provide further evidence that a traf3 -mediated signal transduction pathway may be important in malignant transformation .
overexpression of hsf2-beta inhibit hemin -induced heat shock gene expression and erythroid differentiation in k562 cell .
acquisition of heat shock factor 2 ( hsf2 ) dna binding activity be accompany by induce transcription of heat shock gene in hemin-treated k562 cell undergo erythroid differentiation .
previous study reveal that hsf2 consist of two alternatively splice isoforms , hsf2-alpha and hsf2-beta , whose relative abundance be developmentally regulate and vary between different tissue .
to investigate whether the molar ratio of hsf2-alpha and hsf2-beta isoforms be crucial for the activation of hsf2 and whether the hsf2 isoforms play functionally distinct role during the hemin-mediated erythroid differentiation , we generate cell clone express different level of hsf2-alpha and hsf2-beta .
we show that in parental k562 cell , the hsf2-alpha isoform be predominantly express and hsf2 can be activate upon hemin treatment .
in contrast , when hsf2-beta be express at level exceed those of endogenous hsf2-alpha , the hemin-induced dna binding activity and transcription of heat shock gene be repress , whereas overexpression of hsf2-alpha result in an enhance hemin response .
furthermore , the hemin -induced accumulation of globin , know a a marker of erythroid differentiation , be decrease in cell overexpressing hsf2-beta .
we suggest that hsf2-beta act a a negative regulator of hsf2 activity during hemin-mediated erythroid differentiation of k562 cell .
control of i kappa b-alpha proteolysis by site-specific , signal-induced phosphorylation .
i kappa b-alpha inhibit transcription factor nf-kappa b by retain it in the cytoplasm .
various stimulus , typically those associate with stress or pathogen , rapidly inactivate i kappa b-alpha .
this liberate nf-kappa b to translocate to the nucleus and initiate transcription of gene important for the defense of the organism .
activation of nf-kappa b correlate with phosphorylation of i kappa b-alpha and require the proteolysis of this inhibitor .
when either serine-32 or serine-36 of i kappa b-alpha be mutate , the protein do not undergo signal-induced phosphorylation or degradation , and nf-kappa b could not be activate .
these result suggest that phosphorylation at one or both of these residue be critical for activation of nf-kappa b .
down-regulation of nf-kappa b protein level in activate human lymphocyte by 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 [ publish erratum appear in proc natl acad sci u s a 1996 jan 9 ; 93 ( 1 ) : 524 ]
the effect of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 [ 1,25(oh)2)d3 ] , a steroid hormone with immunomodulating property , on nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) protein be examine in in vitro activate normal human lymphocyte by western blot analysis .
over a 72-hr period of activation , the expression of the 50-kda nf-kappa b , p50 , and it precursor , p105 , be increase progressively .
when cell be activate in the presence of 1,25(oh)2d3 , the level of the mature protein as well a it precursor be decrease .
the effect of the hormone on the level of p50 be demonstrable in the cytosolic and nuclear compartment ; it require between 4 and 8 hr and be specific , a 25-hydroxyvitamin d3 and 24,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 be ineffective .
besides p50 , 1,25(oh)2d3 decrease the level of another nf-kappa b protein , namely c-rel .
in addition , 1,25(oh)2d3 decrease the abundance of a specific dna-protein complex form upon incubation of nuclear extract from activate lymphocyte with a label nf-kappa b dna binding motif .
far , 1,25(oh)2d3 inhibit the transcriptional activity of nf-kappa b in jurkat cell transiently transfected with a construct contain four tandem repeat of the nf-kappa b binding sequence of the immunoglobulin kappa light chain gene link to the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter gene .
these observation demonstrate directly that there be de novo synthesis of nf-kappa b during human lymphocyte activation and suggest that this process be hormonally regulate .
two distinct transcription factor that bind the immunoglobulin enhancer microe5/kappa 2 motif .
activity of the immunoglobulin heavy and kappa light chain gene enhancer depend on a complex interplay of ubiquitous and developmentally regulate protein .
two complementary dna be isolate that encode protein , denote itf-1 and itf-2 , that be express in a variety of cell type and bind the microe5/kappa 2 motif find in both heavy and kappa light chain enhancer .
the complementary dna be the product of distinct gene , yet both itf-1 and itf-2 be structurally and functionally similar .
the two protein interact with one another through their putative helix-loop-helix motif and each possess a distinct domain that dictate transcription activation .
mineralocorticoid effector mechanism in preeclampsia .
mineralocorticoid effector mechanism be evaluate in 29 patient with preeclampsia and in 25 uncomplicated pregnancy by measurement of plasma aldosterone , level of mineralocorticoid receptor ( mr ) in mononuclear leucocyte , and subtraction potential difference ( spd ; rectal minus oral value ) .
mean value for plasma aldosterone be not different between the two group , but significant difference be observe for mr ( preeclampsia , 81 +/- 44 receptors/cell ; control , 306 +/- 168 ) and spd ( preeclampsia , 65 +/- 7 mv ; control , 12 +/- 5 mv ) .
in six case we determine mr , plasma aldosterone , and spd in patient with preeclampsia before and 3 month after delivery .
mr be reduce before delivery ( 96 +/- 27 receptors/cell ) , and spd increase ( 64 +/- 8 mv ) , with both parameter normalize after delivery ( mr , 242 +/- 79 ; spd , 14.0 +/- 4 mv ) .
aldosterone level return to normal nonpregnant value after delivery .
these data suggest an important role for abnormality in mineralocorticoid effector mechanism in the etiology of preeclampsia and could be an useful marker for diagnosis .
oxidant , transcription factor , and intestinal inflammation .
it be now well appreciate that chronic gut inflammation be characterize by enhance production of reactive metabolite of oxygen and nitrogen .
some of these oxidant be know to modulate the expression of a variety of gene that be involve in the immune and inflammatory response .
for example , certain oxidant be know to activate the nuclear transcription factor kappa b , which regulate the expression of a variety of different adhesion molecule , cytokine , and enzyme .
oxidant be also know to activate another transcription factor , activator protein-1 .
this transcription factor be compose of product from the fo and jun proto-oncogene family and be believe to be important in regulate cell growth and proliferation .
finally , oxidant be believe to promote intestinal epithelial cell apoptosis , and the b-cell lymphoma/leukemia-2 gene product be believe to inhibit this phenomenon in an antioxidant-dependent manner .
take together , these observation suggest that nontoxic concentration of reactive metabolite of oxygen and nitrogen play an important role in regulate the expression of gene involve in the inflammatory response and in modulate apoptosis .
increase interleukin 2 transcription in murine lymphocyte by ciprofloxacin .
the fluoroquinolone antibiotic , ciprofloxacin ( cipro ) , induce hyperproduction of interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) and interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) in stimulate human peripheral blood lymphocyte .
in this investigation an enhance and prolonged il-2 and il-2 mrna response be also detect in both stimulate ( t cell mitogen or alloantigens ) murine splenocytes and in the stimulate murine t cell line el-4 in the presence of ciprofloxacin ( 5-80 micrograms/ml ) a compare to control cell without antibiotic .
however , in contrast to human lymphocyte , ifn-gamma production be inhibit and ifn-gamma mrna level be unaffected at 24 h and only slightly upregulated at 48 and 72 h of culture in murine splenocytes incubate with cipro ( 20 micrograms/ml ) .
el-4 cell be transfected with a plasmid contain the il-2 promoter and enhancer region link to the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) reporter gene .
analysis of cat activity reveal that cipro enhance il-2 gene induction .
in addition , el-4 cell incubate with ciprofloxacin show an early peak and more activate nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat-1 ) a compare to control cell without antibiotic .
cipro do not affect the nuclear transcription factor ap-1 or nfil-2a .
take together , cipro inhibit ifn-gamma synthesis , but enhance il-2 production in murine lymphocyte by mean of influence nfat-1 and cause an increase il-2 transcription .
mildly oxidize low-density lipoprotein decrease early production of interleukin 2 and nuclear factor kappab bind to dna in activate t- lymphocyte .
activate t-lymphocytes be find early in atherosclerosis lesion , but little be know about their role .
oxidize low-density lipoprotein ( oxldls ) be consider to be involve in the pathogenesis of the lesion , and we have previously demonstrate that oxldls inhibit not only interleukin ( il ) -2-receptor expression on the surface of in vitro-activated t-lymphocytes but also their proliferation .
we have now investigate the effect of oxldls on blast differentiation , on il-2 synthesis and on the activation of the nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) system in activate lymphocyte .
mildly oxldls ( 50 and 100 microgram/ml ) decrease the number of lymphoblast and the level of il-2 concentration in the culture supernatant after activation of lymphocyte by phytohaemagglutinin and pma+ ionomycin .
the inhibition of il-2 production be observe in the cd3 (+) t-lymphocyte cytoplasm as early a 4 h after activation by pma+ ionomycin .
the study of nf-kappab show that oxldls lead to a decrease of activation-induced p65/ p50 nf-kappab heterodimer binding to dna , whereas the presence of the constitutive nuclear form of p50 dimer be unchanged .
this be correlate with an unchanged level of the active form of the cytosolic inhibitor protein ikappab-alpha .
take together , these observation suggest that the immunosuppressive effect of oxldls might operate via a dysregulation of the t-lymphocyte activation mechanism .
a novel growth-factor-dependent myeloid cell line derive from mouse bone marrow cell contain progenitor endowed with high proliferative potential .
constitutive expression of human colony-stimulating factor-1 receptor ( csf-1r ) confer long-lasting csf-1 -dependent proliferation to mouse myeloid cell line .
we develop mouse transgenic for human csf-1r because mouse csf-1 can not activate human csf-1r .
then bone marrow cell from transgenic mouse be plat onto ms-5 stromal cell express the membrane form of human csf-1 ( 2m-1 cell ) in order to combine the hematopoietic supporting property of stromal cell and the proliferative effect of csf-1 .
thus , we be able to derive a hematopoietic cell line , call 47.10 , that grow indefinitely under these condition , whereas no cell line could be develop from nontransgenic mouse .
proliferation of 47.10 cell be severely affect by neutralize anti- csf-1r monoclonal antibody .
morphologic and cytofluorometry analysis establish that most 47.10 cell be immature myelomonocytic cell .
consistent with this phenotype , the myeloid transcription factor pu.1 , but not the erythroid transcription factor gata-1 , be express in 47.10 cell .
a few 47.10 cell ( 3-5 % ) do not express lineage specific marker ; they differentiate spontaneously to lineage-positive cell after replating on 2m-1 cell .
in agar culture , 47.10 cell form 7- and 14-day colony in response to a cocktail of granulocyte/macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( 2.5 ng/ml ) , interleukin-3 ( 1 ng/ml ) , and mouse csf-1 ( 10 ng/ml ) .
under these condition , about 0.5 % of 47.10 cell form large 14-day colony ( > 1 mm ) compose of mature monocyte and granulocyte , reflect the presence of progenitor endowed with high proliferative potential ( hpp- 47.10 cell ) .
in conclusion , we have characterize a novel continuous myeloid cell line present a hierarchical structure similar to that of the bone marrow progenitor cell compartment .
defective survival and activation of thymocytes in transgenic mouse express a catalytically inactive form of ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase iv .
we have generate transgenic mouse that express a catalytically inactive form of ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase iv ( camkiv ) specifically in thymic t cell .
the presence of this protein result in a markedly reduce thymic cellularity , although the distribution of the remain cell be normal base on evaluation of the cd4 and cd8 cell surface antigen that be use to gauge t cell development .
isolate thymic t cell from the transgenic mouse also show a dramatically decrease survival rate when evaluate in culture under condition that do not favor activation .
when challenge with an activate stimulus such a alpha- cd3 or a combination of phorbol ester plus ionophore , the cell be severely compromise in their ability to produce the cytokine interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) .
reduction of il-2 production be secondary to the inability to phosphorylate the camp response element binding protein , creb , and induce expression of the immediate early gene such a fo b that be require to transactivate the il-2 promoter .
because transgene expression be regulate by the proximal promoter of the murine lck gene and this promoter be inactivate in t cell that exit the thymus , the mutant hcamkiv be not present in peripheral t cell .
consequently , t lymphocyte present in the spleen can be activate normally in response to either stimulus mention above , demonstrate that the effect of the inactive camkiv on activation be reversible .
our result suggest that camkiv may represent a physiologically relevant creb kinase in t cell and that the enzyme be also require to ensure normal expansion of t cell in the thymus .
whereas the pathway responsible for this latter role be yet to be elucidate , it be unlikely to include creb phosphorylation .
characterisation of regulatory sequence at the epstein-barr virus bamhi w promoter .
epstein-barr virus , a human gammaherpesvirus , possess a unique set of latent gene whose constitutive expression in b cell lead to cell growth transformation .
the initiation of this growth transforming infection depend on a viral promoter in bamhi w ( wp ) whose regulation be poorly understand .
use wp reporter construct in in vitro transfection assay , we find that wp be 11- to 190-fold more active in b cell than in non-b cell line and that three region of the promoter ( term uas1 , uas2 , and uas3 ) contribute to transcriptional activation .
the upstream region uas3 ( -1168 to -440 ) and uas2 ( -352 to -264 ) both function in a cell lineage-independent manner and be together responsible for the bulk of wp activity in non-b cell ; mutational analysis indicate the importance of a yy1 binding site in uas2 in that context .
by contrast , uas1 ( -140 to -87 ) be b cell specific and be the key determinant of the promoter 's increase activity in b cell line .
mutational analysis of uas1 sequence combine with in vitro bandshift assay reveal the presence of three bind site for cellular factor in this region .
when mutation that abolish factor binding in bandshift assay be introduce into a wp reporter construct , the loss of any one of the three uas1 binding site be sufficient to reduce promoter activity by 10- to 30-fold in b cell .
from sequence analysis , two of these appear to be novel transcription factor binding site , whereas the third be identify a a cyclic amp response element ( cre ) .
our data indicate that this cre interact with creb and atf1 protein present in b cell nuclear extract and that this interaction be important for wp activity .
interaction of sickle erythrocyte with endothelial cell in the presence of endothelial cell conditioned medium induce oxidant stress lead to transendothelial migration of monocyte .
the abnormal adherence of sickle red blood cell ( s rbc ) to endothelial cell have be think to contribute to vascular occlusion , a major cause of morbidity in sickle cell disease ( scd ) .
we determine whether the interaction of s rbc with culture endothelial cell induce cellular oxidant stress that would culminate in expression of cell adhesion molecule ( cam ) involve in the adhesion and diapedesis of monocyte and the adherence of s reticulocyte .
we show that the interaction of s rbc at 2 % concentration in the presence of multimers of von willebrand factor ( vwf ) , derive from endothelial cell-derived condition medium ( e-cm ) with culture human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvec ) , result in a fivefold increase formation of thiobarbituric acid-reactive substance ( tbars ) and activation of the transcription factor nf-kb , both indicator of cellular oxidant stress .
normal rbc show none of these phenomenon .
the oxidant stress-induced signaling result in an increase surface expression of a subset of cam , icam-1 , e-selectin , and vcam-1 in huvec .
the addition of oxygen radical scavenger enzyme ( catalase , superoxide dismutase ) and antioxidant ( probucol ) inhibit these event .
additionally , preincubation of huvec with a synthetic peptide arg-gly-asp ( rgd ) that prevent vwf -mediated adhesion of s rbc reduce the surface expression of vcam-1 and nf-kb activation .
furthermore , s rbc -induced oxidant stress result in a twofold increase in the transendothelial migration of both monocyte-like hl-60 cell and human peripheral blood monocyte , and approximately a sixfold increase in platelet-endothelial cell adhesion molecule-1 ( pecam-1 ) phosphorylation , each of which be block by protein kinase c inhibitor and antioxidant .
these result suggest that the adherence/contact of s rbc to endothelial cell in large vessel can generate enhance oxidant stress lead to increase adhesion and diapedesis of monocyte , as well a heighten adherence of s reticulocyte , indicate that injury/activation of endothelium can contribute to vaso-occlusion in scd .
characterization of a new tissue-specific transcription factor bind to the simian virus 40 enhancer tc-ii ( nf-kappa b ) element .
we have biochemically and functionally characterize a new transcription factor , np-tcii , which be present in nucleus from unstimulated t and b lymphocyte but be not find in nonhematopoietic cell .
this factor have a dna-binding specificity similar to that of nf-kappa b but be unrelated to this or other rel protein by functional and biochemical criterion .
it can also be distinguish from other previously describe lymphocyte-specific dna-binding protein .
effect of intranasal glucocorticoid on endogenous glucocorticoid peripheral and central function .
glucocorticoid be among the most potent antiinflammatory agent that can be use in the treatment of rhinitis .
their mechanism of action be multiple and complex and a number of report describe significant systemic effect of locally administer glucocorticoid .
in order to evaluate the short-term systemic effect of intranasally administer glucocorticoid , 14 normal healthy subject be treat with two dos of either budesonide ( bud ) or fluticasone propionate ( fp ) for 2 week .
before treatment , at regular interval during the treatment , 1 week and finally 6 week after termination of treatment , the effect on glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) and methallothionein ( mtiia ) mrna expression level be examine in peripheral lymphocyte use a solution hybridization assay .
serum cortisol , osteocalcin and urinary cortisol level be also determine .
an insulin tolerance test ( itt ) be perform at the end of the second week of treatment and at the end of the 6-week washout period with no statistically significant change in cortisol response .
in peripheral lymphocyte , gr mrna level be significantly down-regulated .
mtiia mrna level increase significantly .
serum osteocalcin decrease significantly during treatment with both bud and fp .
serum cortisol decrease after 1 week of treatment whereas urinary cortisol be not affect until the second week of treatment .
in conclusion , intranasal glucocorticoid at clinically recommend dos have not only significant systemic effect on adrenal function , but also have an effect on specific gene expression in peripheral lymphocyte .
these effect be receptor-dependent , reversible , and accord to serum and urinary cortisol level and itt , leave the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal function intact .
finally , these short-term systemic effect be not associate with any of the noticeable side-effects usually observe during long-term treatment with glucocorticoid .
establishment and characterization of ebv-positive and ebv-negative primary effusion lymphoma cell line harbour human herpesvirus type-8 .
in this study we report on the establishment and characterization of two novel lymphoma cell line ( cro-ap/3 and cro-ap/5 ) which carry infection by human herpesvirus type-8 ( hhv-8 ) and have derive from aids-related primary effusion lymphoma ( pel ) .
these two cell line be representative of different virologic subtypes of pel , i.e. hhv-8 +/ebv- pel in the case of cro-ap/3 and hhv-8 +/ebv+ pel in the case of cro-ap/5 .
consistent with the diagnosis of pel , both cro-ap/3 and cro-ap/5 express indeterminate ( i.e. non-b , non-t ) phenotype although immunogenotypic study document their b-cell origin .
both cell line be devoid of genetic lesion of c-myc , bcl-2 and p53 as well a gross rearrangement of bcl-6 .
detailed histogenetic characterization of these novel pel cell line suggest that pel may derive from a post-germinal centre b cell which have undergo pre-terminal differentiation .
the cro-ap/3 and cro-ap/5 cell line may provide a valuable model for clarify the pathogenesis of pel .
in particular , these cell line may help understand the relative contribution of hhv-8 and ebv to pel growth and development and may facilitate the identification of recurrent cytogenetic abnormality highlight putative novel cancer related locus relevant to pel .
transcription factor require for lymphoid lineage commitment .
intimate interaction between multipotential hemopoietic stem cell and their microenvironment work towards redefine the identity and the differentiative fate of these primitive cell .
molecular cue deliver by the microenvironment frequently act in an instructive fashion by initiate intracellular signaling pathway that ultimately target a select group of transcription factor .
these transcriptional regulator in turn trigger a cascade of genetic change that ultimately determine the course of the cell during differentiation .
gene inactivation study on the pu.1 , ikaros and gata-3 gene have reveal that their encode factor be essential for the early commitment step into the b and t lymphoid lineage .
potent inhibition of hiv type 1 replication by an antiinflammatory alkaloid , cepharanthine , in chronically infected monocytic cell .
cepharanthine be a biscoclaurine alkaloid isolate from stephania cepharantha hayata and have be show to have antiinflammatory , antiallergic , and immunomodulatory activity in vivo .
a several inflammatory cytokine and oxidative stress be involve in the pathogenesis of hiv-1 infection , we investigate the inhibitory effect of cepharanthine on tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) - and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) - induced hiv-1 replication in chronically infected cell line .
two chronically hiv-1 -infected cell line , u1 ( monocytic ) and ach-2 ( t lymphocytic ) , be stimulate with tnf-alpha or pma and culture in the presence of various concentration of the compound .
hiv-1 replication be determine by p24 antigen level .
the inhibitory effect of cepharanthine on hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) -driven gene expression and nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) activation be also examine .
cepharanthine dose dependently inhibit hiv-1 replication in tnf-alpha- and pma- stimulated u1 cell but not in ach-2 cell .
it 50 % effective and cytotoxic concentration be 0.016 and 2.2 microg/ml in pma -stimulated u1 cell , respectively .
cepharanthine be find to suppress hiv-1 ltr -driven gene expression through the inhibition of nf-kappab activation .
these result indicate that cepharanthine be a highly potent inhibitor of hiv-1 replication in a chronically infected monocytic cell line .
since biscoclaurine alkaloid , contain cepharanthine a a major component , be widely use for the treatment of patient with various inflammatory disease in japan , cepharanthine should be far pursue for it chemotherapeutic potential in hiv-1 -infected patient .
the development of functionally responsive t cell .
the work review in this article separate t cell development into four phase .
first be an expansion phase prior to tcr rearrangement , which appear to be correlate with programming of at least some response gene for inducibility .
this phase can occur to some extent outside of the thymus .
however , the profound t cell deficit of nude mouse indicate that the thymus be by far the most potent site for induce the expansion per se , even if other site can induce some response acquisition .
second be a controlled phase of tcr gene rearrangement .
the detail of the regulatory mechanism that select particular locus for rearrangement be still not know .
it seem that the rearrangement of the tcr gamma locus in the gamma delta lineage may not always take place at a developmental stage strictly equivalent to the rearrangement of tcr beta in the alpha beta lineage , and it be not clear just how early the two lineage diverge .
in the tcr alpha beta lineage , however , the final gene rearrangement event be accompany by rapid proliferation and an interruption in cellular response gene inducibility .
the loss of conventional responsiveness be probably cause by alteration at the level of signaling , and may be a manifestation of the physiological state that be a precondition for selection .
third be the complex process of selection .
whereas peripheral t cell can undergo form of positive selection ( by antigen-driven clonal expansion ) and negative selection ( by abortive stimulation lead to anergy or death ) , neither be exactly the same phenomenon that occur in the thymic cortex .
negative selection in the cortex appear to be a suicidal inversion of antigen responsiveness : instead of turn on il-2 expression , the activate cell destroy it own chromatin .
the gene that need to be induce for this response be not yet identify , but it be unquestionably a form of activation .
it be interesting that in human and rat , cortical thymocytes undergo negative selection can still induce il-2r alpha expression and even be rescue in vitro , if exogenous il-2 be provide .
perhaps murine thymocytes be deny this form of rescue because they shut off il-2r beta chain expression at an early stage or because they may be uncommonly bcl-2 deficient ( cf. sentman et al. , 1991 ; strasser et al. , 1991 ) .
even so , medullary thymocytes remain at least partially susceptible to negative selection even a they continue to mature .
differential monocyte adhesion and adhesion molecule expression in venous and arterial endothelial cell .
we compare u-937 cell adhesion and adhesion molecule expression in human umbilical venous ( huvecs ) and arterial ( huaecs ) endothelial cell expose to tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) , interleukin-1 , and lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
tnf and lp stimulate vascular cell adhesion molecule ( vcam ) -1 surface expression and adhesion of u-937 monocyte-like cell to huvecs but not to huaecs .
antibody study demonstrate that in huvecs at least 75 % of the adhesion response be vcam-1 mediate .
interleukin-1 stimulate u-937 cell adhesion to and vcam-1 surface expression in both huvecs and huaecs .
pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate and the proteasome inhibitor mg-132 block tnf - and lp -stimulated u-937 cell adhesion to huvecs .
these agent also significantly decrease tnf - and lp -stimulated increase in huvec surface vcam-1 .
tnf increase vcam-1 protein and mrna in huvecs that be block by pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate .
however , neither tnf or lp stimulate vcam-1 expression in huaecs .
tnf stimulate expression of both intercellular adhesion molecule-1 and e-selectin in huvecs , but in huaecs , only intercellular adhesion molecule-1 be increase .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay demonstrate no difference in the pattern of tnf -stimulated nuclear factor-kappab activation between huvecs and huaecs .
these study demonstrate a novel and striking insensitivity of arterial endothelium to the effect of tnf and lp and indicate a dissociation between the ability of huaecs to upregulate nuclear factor-kappab and vcam-1 .
isolation of a candidate repressor/activator , nf-e1 ( yy-1 , delta ) , that bind to the immunoglobulin kappa 3' enhancer and the immunoglobulin heavy-chain mu e1 site .
we have determine that the developmental control of immunoglobulin kappa 3' enhancer ( kappa e3' ) activity be the result of the combined influence of positive- and negative-acting element .
we show that a central core in the kappa e3' enhancer be active at the pre-b-cell stage but be repress by flank negative-acting element .
the negative-acting sequence repress enhancer activity in a position- and orientation-independent manner at the pre-b-cell stage .
we have isolate a human cdna clone encode a zinc finger protein ( nf-e1 ) that bind to the negative-acting segment of the kappa e3' enhancer .
this protein also bind to the immunoglobulin heavy-chain enhancer mu e1 site .
nf-e1 be encode by the same gene a the yy-1 protein , which bind to the adeno-associated virus p5 promoter .
nf-e1 be also the human homologue of the mouse delta protein , which bind to ribosomal protein gene promoter .
the predict amino acid sequence of this protein contain feature characteristic of transcriptional activator as well a transcriptional repressor .
cotransfection study with this cdna indicate that it can repress basal promoter activity .
the apparent dual function of this protein be discuss .
cd30 -dependent degradation of traf2 : implication for negative regulation of traf signaling and the control of cell survival .
cd30 be a cell-surface receptor that can augment lymphocyte activation and survival through it ability to induce the transcription factor nf-kappab .
cd30 , however , have also be implicate in the induction of apoptotic cell death of lymphocyte .
here we show that one of the effect of cd30 signal transduction be to render cell sensitive to apoptosis induce by the type 1 tumor necrosis factor receptor ( tnfr1 ) .
this sensitization be dependent on the traf-binding site within the cd30 cytoplasmic domain .
one of the protein that bind to these site be traf2 , a signal transduction molecule that be also utilize by tnfr1 to mediate the activation of several downstream kinase and transcription factor .
during cd30 signal transduction , we find that binding of traf2 to the cytoplasmic domain of cd30 result in the rapid depletion of traf2 and the associate protein traf1 by proteolysis .
these data suggest a model in which cd30 limit it own ability to transduce cell survival signal through signal-coupled depletion of traf2 .
depletion of intracellular traf2 and it coassociated protein also increase the sensitivity of the cell to undergo apoptosis during activation of death-inducing receptor such a tnfr1 .
consistent with this hypothesis , expression of a dominant-negative form of traf2 be find to potentiate tnfr1 -mediated death .
these study provide a potential mechanism through which cd30 , as well a other traf-binding member of the tnfr superfamily , can negatively regulate cell survival .
c/ebp beta regulation of the tumor necrosis factor alpha gene .
activate macrophage contribute to chronic inflammation by the secretion of cytokine and proteinase .
tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) be particularly important in this process because of it ability to regulate other inflammatory mediator in an autocrine and paracrine fashion .
the mechanism ( s ) responsible for the cell type-specific regulation of tnf alpha be not know .
we present data to show that the expression of tnf alpha be regulate by the transcription factor c/ebp beta ( nf-il6 ) .
c/ebp beta activate the tnf alpha gene promoter in cotransfection assay and bind to it at a site which fail to bind the closely related protein c/ebp alpha .
finally , a dominant-negative version of c/ebp beta block tnf alpha promoter activation in myeloid cell .
our result implicate c/ebp beta a an important regulator of tnf alpha by myelomonocytic cell .
inhibition of t cell and promotion of natural killer cell development by the dominant negative helix loop helix factor id3 .
bipotential t/natural killer ( nk ) progenitor cell be present in the human thymus .
despite their bipotential capacity , these progenitor develop predominantly to t cell in the thymus .
the mechanism control this developmental choice be unknown .
here we present evidence that a member ( s ) of the family of basic helix loop helix ( bhlh ) transcription factor determine lineage specification of nk/t cell progenitor .
the natural dominant negative hlh factor id3 , which block transcriptional activity of a number of known bhlh factor , be express in cd34+ progenitor cell by retrovirus-mediated gene transfer .
constitutive expression of id3 completely block development of cd34+ cell into t cell in a fetal thymic organ culture ( ftoc ) .
in contrast , development into nk cell in an ftoc be enhance .
thus , the activity of a bhlh transcription factor be necessary for t lineage differentiation of bipotential precursor , in the absence of which a default pathway lead to nk cell development be choose .
our result identify a molecular switch for lineage specification in early lymphoid precursor of human .
vitamin d3- and retinoic acid- induced monocytic differentiation : interaction between the endogenous vitamin d3 receptor , retinoic acid receptor , and retinoid x receptor in u-937 cell .
retinoic acid ( ra ) and 1,25 alpha-dihydroxycholecalciferol ( vitd3 ) be potent regulator of hematopoletic differentiation .
yet , little be know a to how the ra and vitd3 receptor network operate in hematopoietic cell , and whether receptor interaction can explain the interplay between the ra - and vitd3 -signaling pathway during differentiation .
therefore , we analyze the expression , dna binding , and transcriptional activity of the endogenous ra and vitd3 receptor [ retinoic acid receptor ( rars ) , retinoid x receptor ( rxrs ) , and vitd3 receptor ( vdr ) ] in the u-937 cell line , in which ra and vitd3 induce distinct monocytic differentiation pathway .
vitd3 induction result in the formation of vdr /rxr dna-binding complex on both vitd3 response element and ra response element ( rares ) .
however , transcriptional activation be only observe from a vitd3 response element-driven reporter construct .
several dna-binding complex be detect on rares in undifferentiated cell .
stimulation by ra result in increase rar beta /rxr dna binding , activate rare -dependent transcription , and increase expression of rar-beta .
concomitant stimulation by vitd3 inhibit the ra -stimulated formation of rar beta /rxr heterodimers , favor vdr /rxr binding to the rare .
also , vitd3 inhibit the expression of cd23 and cd49f , characteristic marker of retinoid-induced u-937 cell differentiation .
in contrast , neither the ra -stimulated , rare -mediated transcription nor the induce rar-beta expression be suppress by vitd3 , suggest that vitd3 selectively inhibit the retinoid-induced differentiation program but not the rare -mediated signal .
