these result demonstrate a complex role for vitd3 in modify the retinoid differentiation pathway and may have implication for differentiation-inducing therapy of hematopoietic tumor .
regulation of the beta-globin locus .
transcription of the human beta-globin gene cluster depend upon upstream regulatory sequence , which be collectively term the locus control region .
recent study have provide new insight into how the individual gene of the cluster be regulate through development .
the crux of transcriptional activation be how the locus control region communicate with the gene-proximal regulatory element .
modulation of normal erythroid differentiation by the endogenous thyroid hormone and retinoic acid receptor : a possible target for v-erba oncogene action .
the v-erba oncogene , a mutate version of the thyroid hormone receptor alpha ( c-erba/tr-alpha ) , inhibit erythroid differentiation and constitutively repress transcription of certain erythrocyte gene , suggest a normal function of the proto-oncogene c-erba in erythropoiesis .
here we demonstrate that the endogenous thyroid hormone receptor alpha ( c-erba/tr-alpha ) and the closely related retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar-alpha ) play a role in the regulation of normal erythroid differentiation .
retinoic acid ( ra ) distinctly modulate the erythroid differentiation program of normal erythroid progenitor and erythroblast reversibly transform by a conditional tyrosine kinase oncogene .
when add pulsewise to immature cell , differentiation be accelerate while more mature cell undergo premature cell death .
thyroid hormone ( t3 ) alone cause similar but weak effect .
interestingly , t3 strongly enhance the action of ra , suggest cooperative action of the two receptor in modulate erythroid differentiation .
expression of the human rar-alpha in receptor-negative erythroblast confer ra -induced regulation of differentiation to the otherwise unresponsive cell , thus show that the rar-alpha be essential for the ra effect .
likewise , enhance expression of exogenous c-erba/tr-alpha in erythroblast render them susceptible to modulation of differentiation by t3 , suggest a similar function of both receptor .
cell-to-cell contact activate the long terminal repeat of human immunodeficiency virus 1 through it kappab motif .
cell-to-cell contact between peripheral blood lymphocyte and transfected human colonic carcinoma cell line ht29 activate transcription of the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) of human immunodeficiency virus .
hiv-1 ltr transcription be control by a complex array of virus-encoded and cellular protein .
use various construct express a lacz reporter gene under the control of the intact or three deleted form of hiv-1 ltr , we obtain evidence that the kappab regulatory element located in the u3 region be involve in cell-to-cell activation of hiv-1 ltr .
cell-to-cell contact activate in vitro binding of the nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) p50/p65 heterodimer to an hiv-1 kappab oligonucleotide .
cell-to-cell contact activation of nf-kappab be only partially inhibit by 100 microm pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate and be not correlate with a significant decrease of cellular inhibitor kappab alpha .
nf-kappab nuclear activation be not detectable before 1 h after cell contact and be dependent on protein synthesis .
cooperation of spi-1/ pu.1 with an activate erythropoietin receptor inhibit apoptosis and epo -dependent differentiation in primary erythroblast and induce their kit ligand-dependent proliferation .
spi-1/ pu.1 be a myeloid- and b-cell specific transcription factor which be also involve in friend virus -induced murine erythroleukemia .
the pre-leukemic phase of friend erythroleukemia result from activation of the erythropoietin receptor ( epor ) by the spleen focus form virus ( sffv ) envelope glycoprotein , follow by the emergence of leukemic clone characterize by overexpression of spi-1 and mutation of the p53 tumor suppressor gene .
we develop a heterologous system to analyze the contribution of these alteration to the induction of primary erythroblast transformation .
avian erythroblast express the activate mouse epor ( r129c ) differentiate into erythrocyte in response to hepo .
expression of spi-1 in these cell inhibit this ability to differentiate and rescue the cell from the apoptotic cell death program normally induce upon hepo withdrawal .
although devoid of any effect by itself , a mutant p53 cooperate with spi-1 and epor ( r129c ) to reinforce both phenotype .
analysis of erythroblast co-expressing spi-1 and the wild-type mouse epor show that differentiation arrest and inhibition of apoptosis depend on specific cooperation between spi-1 and epor ( r129c ) .
this cooperation be also require to induce the sustained proliferation of differentiation-blocked erythroblast in response to ligand activation of the endogenous tyrosine kinase receptor c-kit .
these result show that spi-1/ pu.1 require signal emanate from specific cytokine and growth factor receptor to affect the survival , proliferation and differentiation control of primary erythroblast .
they also suggest that the function of spi-1 /pu.1 in the late phase of friend leukemia require specific signaling from the gp55 -modified epor generate during the early phase of the disease .
mouse lack the transcription factor ciita -- a second look .
we have generate a second line of mouse lack a transcription factor think to be a critical regulator of mhc class ii gene expression , ciita ( for class ii transactivator ) .
our and the previously publish line differ in the deletion that be engineer and by the fact that we remove the neomycin-resistance promoter and structural gene via the cre-loxp recombination system .
characterization of our line lead to two new finding .
first , a substantial number of cell can express class ii molecule in the absence of ciita , albeit at 5-fold reduce level , most notably dendritic cell in s.c. lymph node ; therefore , the ciita gene can not be an absolute ' master gene ' control the expression of class ii molecule , a have be think .
second , in contrast to recent result on human cell line , ciita be not critically involve in the ifn-gamma -induced up-regulation of mhc class i gene .
requirement of gata-1 and p45 nf-e2 expression in butyric acid -induced erythroid differentiation .
butyric acid ( ba ) be know to induce overexpression of fetal hemoglobin and then erythroid differentiation .
therefore , ba be currently under clinical investigation a a potential therapy for the treatment of sickle cell disease and cancer .
nevertheless , the molecular mechanism involve in ba -induced differentiation remain largely unknown .
previous report have show that ba -induced overexpression of erythroid gene occur at the transcriptional level , suggest the involvement of erythroid transcription factor .
here , we intend to demonstrate the requirement of gata-1 and nf-e2 transcription factor in the ba -induced erythroid differentiation of human leukemic k562 cell .
time-course experiment show that nuclear level of gata-1 and p45 nf-e2 protein increase during ba treatment .
moreover , antisense oligodeoxynucleotides target either gata-1 or p45 nf-e2 protein inhibit both protein expression and ba -induced differentiation .
in contrast , ba -induced cell growth inhibition be not affect .
these result provide the first direct evidence for the requirement of gata-1 and nf-e2 in ba -induced differentiation process .
vitamin d receptor expression in human lymphocyte .
signal requirement and characterization by western blot and dna sequencing .
the signal control the expression of the receptor protein for 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 in normal human lymphocyte and the relationship of this protein to the classical vitamin d receptor be examine .
lymphocyte activate with the okt3 antibody to the t-cell antigen receptor express few bind site a compare to lymphocyte that be activate by the polyclonal activator phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) .
however , combination of okt3 and phorbol myristate acetate produce a concentration of bind site similar to the pha -activated cell .
the receptor from okt3 and okt3 + phorbol myristate acetate -activated lymphocyte exhibit decrease binding to dna-cellulose compare to pha -activated lymphocyte .
in lymphocyte activate either by pha or okt3 ( but not in rest cell ) , a 50-kda specie cross-reacting with a monoclonal antibody against the intestinal vitamin d receptor be detect .
finally , rna from activate lymphocyte be amplify by polymerase chain reaction use oligonucleotide primer flank the 196 base pair long region encode the dna-binding domain of the human intestinal receptor .
the amplify product show an identical nucleotide sequence to the dna-binding domain of the human intestinal receptor .
these finding suggest that expression of the 1,25-(oh)2d3 receptor in lymphocyte be trigger by distinct and contingent signal , and that the protein and the mrna encode it be identical to the classical vitamin d receptor .
receptor for interleukin ( il ) -10 and il-6 -type cytokine use similar signaling mechanism for inducing transcription through il-6 response element .
the cytoplasmic domain of the receptor for interleukin 10 ( il-10r ) contain two box 3 sequence motif that have be identify in the signal-transducing receptor subunit for il-6-type cytokine and note to be require for activate stat3 and induce transcription through il-6-responsive element .
to determine whether the il-10r have signaling function similar to il-6r in cell normally express these receptor , leukocyte of the b- , t- , and nk- cell lineage be treat with either cytokine .
both cytokine activate factor that bind to the sis-inducible element and include stat1 and stat3 .
the cell response to il-10 characteristically differ from that to il-2/il-15 , il-4 , and interferon gamma .
the signaling capability of the il-10r for activate specific stat protein and induce gene transcription be define by reconstitution of receptor function in transfected tissue culture cell .
cos-1 cell , co-expressing the human il-10r and individual stat protein , confirm a preference of the il-10r for stat3 and stat1 .
unlike many hematopoietin receptor , the il-10r do not detectably activate stat5 .
the il-10r , together with reporter gene construct contain different il-6-responsive gene element , reconstitute in hepatoma cell an induction of transcription by il-10 that be comparable to that by il-6 .
this regulation could not be appreciably modify by enhance expression of stat protein .
the similar action of il-10r and il-6r on the induction of endogenous il-6 -responsive gene be demonstrate in hepatoma cell stably express the il-10r .
these receptor function require the presence of the box 3 motif , a show by the analysis of the mouse il-10r construct contain progressively truncate cytoplasmic domain .
the data demonstrate that the il-10r , unlike other member of the interferon receptor family , be highly effective in recruit the signaling pathway of il-6 -type cytokine receptor .
platelet-activating factor ( paf ) positively auto-regulates the expression of human paf receptor transcript 1 ( leukocyte-type ) through nf-kappa b .
the human platelet-activating factor receptor ( pafr ) gene be transcribe by two distinct promoter ( promoter 1 and promoter 2 ) to generate two transcript ( designate a pafr transcript 1 and pafr transcript 2 ) , though their open reading frame be identical .
by primer extension analysis to discriminate two transcript , we find that the level of pafr transcript 1 ( leukocyte-type ) , but not pafr transcript 2 ( tissue-type ) , be upregulated by paf as well a by 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) in the human stomach cancer cell line ( jr-st cell ) which express both functional pafr transcript 1 and pafr transcript 2 endogenously .
functional analysis of the promoter 1 with a transient expression assay use chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) gene a a reporter show that both paf and tpa activate the promoter 1 but not the deleted promoter lack the three consensus binding site for nf-kappa b located from -571 bp to -459 bp .
these finding suggest a molecular mechanism of positive regulation of pafr gene expression by paf through nf-kappa b , possibly by a phosphorylation reaction involve protein kinase c by paf .
hiv-1 ltr activity in human cd40-activated b lymphocyte be dependent on nf-kappab .
cd40-stimulated human b lymphocyte be highly permissive to a productive infection by the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 .
in these cell , nuclear factor involve in activation of the hiv-1 ltr , which contain the transcriptional control element of the virus , be unknown .
transient expression assay with plasmid contain delete part of the ltr region link to a reporter gene show that the nf-kappab binding site be essential for hiv-1 ltr activity in cd40-stimulated b lymphocyte .
in addition , electrophoretic mobility shift and supershift assay reveal that important nf-kappab binding activity compose of at least p50 , p65 , and c-rel nf-kappab subunit be present in nucleus of cd40-stimulated b cell .
these result confirm at a molecular level the ability of hiv-1 to replicate in b cell and that this activity be strongly associate with nf-kappab .
analysis of the role of protein kinase c -alpha , -epsilon , and -zeta in t cell activation .
t cell express multiple isotypes of protein kinase c ( pkc ) and although it be well accept that pkcs have an important role in t cell activation , little be know about the function of individual pkc isotypes .
to address this issue , mutationally active pkc -alpha , -epsilon , or -zeta have be transfected into t cell and the consequence for t cell activation determine .
p21ras play an essential role in t cell activation .
accordingly , the effect of the constitutively active pkcs be compare to the effect of mutationally activate p21ras .
the data indicate that pkc-epsilon and , to a less extent pkc-alpha but not -zeta , can regulate the transcription factor ap-1 and nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at-1 ) .
the ability of pkc-epsilon to induce transactivation of nf-at-1 and ap-1 be similar to the stimulatory effect of a constitutively activate p21ras .
pkc-epsilon , but not pkc-alpha nor activated p21ras , be able to induce nf-kb activity .
phorbol ester induce expression of cd69 whereas none of the activate pkc isotypes test be able to have this effect .
activate src and p21ras be able to induce cd69 expression .
these result indicate selective function for different pkc isotypes in t cell .
moreover , the data compare the effect of activate ra and pkc mutant suggest that pkc-alpha , p21ras , and pkc-epsilon be not positioned linearly on a single signal transduction pathway .
immune hyperactivation of hiv-1 -infected t cell mediate by tat and the cd28 pathway .
human immunodeficiency virus-type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection be characterize by a chronic state of immune hyperactivation in patient .
infection of human peripheral blood lymphocyte with hiv-1 in vitro result in increase interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) secretion in response to t cell activation via the cd3 and cd28 receptor .
expression of the hiv-1 transactivator tat recapitulate this phenotype and be associate with increase il-2 secretion in response to costimulation with cd3 plus cd28 .
il-2 superinduction by tat occur at the transcriptional level , be mediate by the cd28 -responsive element in the il-2 promoter , and be exclusively dependent on the 29 amino acid encode by the second exon of tat .
regulation of interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain expression and nuclear factor.kappa b activation by protein kinase c in t lymphocyte .
autocrine role of tumor necrosis factor alpha .
the regulation of interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain ( il-2r alpha ) expression and nuclear factor ( nf ) activation by protein kinase c ( pkc ) in rest t cell , have be study .
treatment of human rest t cell with phorbol ester strongly induce the expression of il-2r alpha and the activation of nf.kappa b .
this activation be due to the translocation of p65 and c-rel nf.kappa b protein from cytoplasmic store to the nucleus , where they bind the kappa b sequence of the il-2r alpha promoter either a p50.p65 or a p50. c-rel heterodimers .
interestingly , all of those event be largely indirect and mediate by endogenously secrete tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) , a they be strongly inhibit by a neutralize anti- tnf alpha monoclonal antibody .
furthermore , cyclosporin a , which block tnf alpha production induce by pkc , strongly inhibit il-2r alpha and nf.kappa b activation .
the addition of either tnf alpha or il-2 partially recover cyclosporin a -induced il-2r alpha inhibition , but only tnf alpha completely recover nf.kappa b activation .
those result indicate that , in rest t cell , pkc activation have only a trigger role , whereas the endogenously secrete tnf alpha play an essential role in the quantitative control of the expression of il-2r alpha chain or nf.kappa b activation .
chlorinate dibenzo-p-dioxins and dibenzofurans and the human immune system .
1 . blood cell receptor in volunteer with moderately increase body burden .
use monoclonal antibody ( mabs ) and flow cytometry , we study a variety of surface receptor on lymphocyte subpopulation of worker with moderately increase body burden of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( tcdd ) and of other polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins and dibenzofurans ( pcdd/pcdf ) , express here a international-toxicity equivalencies ( i-te ) .
the hypothesis to be test be whether or not human exhibit a similar susceptibility to pcdds/pcdfs with respect to the surface receptor find previously to respond to small dos of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( tcdd ) in callithrix jacchus .
these be : helper-inducer ( memory ) t cell ( cd4+cd45r0+cd45ra-cd29highcd11a+ ) , cd20+ b cell , and cytotoxic t cell ( cd8+cd56+/cd57+ ) .
furthermore , 68 triple-labellings with mabs be perform on the cell of each volunteer to possibly generate further hypothesis .
it be evaluate whether any of the variable might be use a a biomarker of effect for this class of compound .
there be two main goal : ( 1 ) to evaluate whether worker with a moderately increase pcdd/pcdf -body burden [ 25-140 ppt tcdd or 104-522 ppt i-te in blood fat ] exhibit change in the surface receptor of white blood cell , a observe in previous study in non-human primate , and ( 2 ) to clarify whether person at the upper range [ 10-23 ppt tcdd or 30-90 ppt i-te in blood fat ] of the body burden reference value of a not particularly expose population show detectable deviation in these immunological variable , when compare with person at the low and medium range [ 1-3 ppt tcdd or 9-29 ppt i-te ] of these body burden reference value .
regression analysis of our data reveal slight trend for some of the biomarkers ( e.g. cd45r0+ ) .
with one exception , these be all increase .
none of the alteration observe be of medical relevance .
the slight increase in the percentage of cd4+cd45r0+ cell remain significant even after covariant analysis take age-related change into account .
altogether , the data do not provide any evidence to support an assumption that moderately increase body burden of pcdds/pcdfs in adult induce decrease in the cellular component of the human immune system .
adult human certainly be less susceptible to this action of pcdds/pcdfs than adolescent callithrix jacchus
glucocorticoid receptor in patient with lupus nephritis : relationship between receptor level in mononuclear leukocyte and effect of glucocorticoid therapy .
we investigate the clinical significance of glucocorticoid receptor determination in 20 patient with systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) who afterwards develop nephrotic syndrome .
glucocorticoid receptor concentration in mononuclear leukocyte ( mnl ) in these patient be comparable with those in both other patient with sle and healthy person .
improvement in urinary protein excretion and in disease activity , which be score accord to the sle disease activity index system of the university of toronto , closely related to the glucocorticoid receptor concentration in mnl isolate from the corresponding patient .
in summary , glucocorticoid receptor determination in patient with lupus nephritis may be a predictive clue for assess responsiveness to glucocorticoid therapy .
critical cytoplasmic domain of human interleukin-9 receptor alpha chain in interleukin -9-mediated cell proliferation and signal transduction .
interleukin-9 receptor ( il-9r ) complex consist of a ligand-specific alpha chain and il-2r gamma chain .
in this study , two region in the cytoplasmic domain of human il-9ralpha be find to be important for il-9 -mediated cell growth .
a membrane-proximal region that contain the box1 consensus sequence be require for il-9 -induced cell proliferation and tyrosine phosphorylation of janus kinase ( jak ) .
deletion of this region or internal deletion of the box1 motif abrogate il-9 -induced cell proliferation and signal transduction .
however , substitution of the pro-x-pro in the box1 motif with ala-x-ala fail to abolish il-9 -induced cell proliferation but decrease il-9 -mediated tyrosine phosphorylation of jak kinase , insulin receptor substrate-2 , and signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 ( stat3 ) and expression of c-myc and junb .
another important region be downstream of the box1 motif and contain a stat3 binding motif ylpq .
deletion of this region significantly impair il-9 -induced cell growth , activation of jak kinase , insulin receptor substrate-2 , and stat3 and expression of early response gene .
a point mutation change ylpq into ylpa greatly reduce il-9 -induced activation of stat3 and expression of c-myc but do not affect cell proliferation .
these result suggest that cooperation or cross-talk of signal molecule associate with different domain of il-9ralpha other than stat3 be essential for il-9 -mediated cell growth .
activation of pp90rsk and early growth response-1 gene expression by pokeweed mitogen in human b cell .
the present study have examine the effect of pokeweed mitogen ( pwm ) on the induction of early growth response-1 gene ( egr-1 ) in normal human b cell .
pwm regulate egr-1 gene expression by both transcriptional and post-transcriptional mechanism .
transient transfection assay with egr-1 promoter fragment link to the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) gene demonstrate that pwm induced egr-1 transcription be confer by the carg motif ( c c[at]6gg ) in the egr-1 promoter .
the result far demonstrate the activation of s6 kinase ( pp90rsk ) , evidence by phosphorylation of s6 and serum response factor ( srf ) peptide , in pwm treated b cell .
take together , these finding suggest that pwm be able to initiate an intracytoplasmic signalling cascade and egr-1 induction in normal human b cell .
positive and negative regulation of il-2 gene expression : role of multiple regulatory site .
interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) be an important lymphokine require in the process of t cell activation , proliferation , clonal expansion and differentiation .
the il-2 gene display both t cell specific and inducible expression : it be only express in cd4+ t cell after antigenic or mitogenic stimulation .
several cis-acting regulatory site be require for induction of the il-2 gene after stimulation .
in this study , we have analyse the function of these cis-acting regulatory site in the context of the native il-2 enhancer and promoter sequence .
the result of this study suggest that the nfat ( -276 to -261 ) , the distal octamer ( -256 to -248 ) and the proximal octamer ( -75 to -66 ) site not only act a enhancer of il-2 gene transcription in the presence of cellular stimulation , but also have a silencing effect on il-2 gene expression in rest cell .
two other site display disparate effect on il-2 gene expression in different t leukemia cell line : the distal purine box ( -291 to -277 ) and the proximal purine box site ( -145 to -128 ) .
finally , the ap-1 ( -186 to -176 ) and the kappa b site ( -206 to -195 ) respond to different cellular activation in el4 cell .
the ap-1 site mediate the response to pma stimulation while the kappa b site respond to il-1 stimulation .
these data suggest that the regulation of il-2 gene expression be a complex process and multiple cis-acting regulatory site interact to exert different effect in t cell representative of alternative stage of differentiation .
glycation-dependent , reactive oxygen species-mediated suppression of the insulin gene promoter activity in hit cell .
prolonged poor glycemic control in non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus patient often lead to a decline in insulin secretion from pancreatic beta cell , accompany by a decrease in the insulin content of the cell .
a a step toward elucidate the pathophysiological background of the so-called glucose toxicity to pancreatic beta cell , we induce glycation in hit-t15 cell use a sugar with strong deoxidizing activity , d-ribose , and examine the effect on insulin gene transcription .
the result of reporter gene analysis reveal that the insulin gene promoter be more sensitive to glycation than the control beta-actin gene promoter ; approximately 50 and 80 % of the insulin gene promoter activity be lose when the cell be keep for 3 d in the presence of 40 and 60 mm d-ribose , respectively .
in agreement with this , decrease in the insulin mrna and insulin content be observe in the glycation-induced cell .
also , gel mobility shift analysis use specific antiserum reveal decrease in the dna-binding activity of an insulin gene transcription factor , pdx-1/ipf1/stf-1 .
these effect of d-ribose seem almost irreversible but could be prevent by addition of 1 mm aminoguanidine or 10 mm n-acetylcysteine , thus suggest that glycation and reactive oxygen specie , generate through the glycation reaction , serve a mediator of the phenomenon .
these observation suggest that protein glycation in pancreatic beta cell , which occur in vivo under chronic hyperglycemia , suppress insulin gene transcription and thus can explain part of the beta cell glucose toxicity .
rel-deficient t cell exhibit defect in production of interleukin 3 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor .
the c-rel protooncogene encode a subunit of the nf-kappa b -like family of transcription factor .
mouse lack rel be defective in mitogenic activation of b and t lymphocyte and display impaired humoral immunity .
in an attempt to identify change in gene expression that accompany the t-cell stimulation defect associate with the loss of rel , we have examine the expression of cell surface activation marker and cytokine production in mitogen-stimulated rel -/- t cell .
the expression of cell surface marker include the interleukin 2 receptor alpha ( il-2r alpha ) chain ( cd25 ) , cd69 and l-selectin ( cd62 ) be normal in mitogen-activated rel -/- t cell , but cytokine production be impaired .
in rel -/- splenic t cell culture stimulate with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate and ionomycin , the level of il-3 , il-5 , granulocyte-_macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) , tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , and gamma interferon ( ifn-gamma ) be only 2- to 3-fold low compare with normal t cell .
in contrast , anti-cd3 and anti-cd28 stimulated rel -/- t cell , which fail to proliferate , make little or no detectable cytokine .
exogenous il-2 , which restitute the proliferative response of the anti-cd3- and anti-cd28- treated rel-/- t cell , restore production of il-5 , tnf-alpha , and ifn-gamma , but not il-3 and gm-csf expression to approximately normal level .
in contrast to mitogen-activated rel -/- t cell , lipopolysaccharide-stimulated rel -/- macrophage produce high than normal level of gm-csf .
these finding establish that rel can function a an activator or repressor of gene expression and be require by t lymphocyte for production of il-3 and gm-csf .
x chromosome inactivation pattern in normal female .
since one of the two x chromosome be randomly inactivate at an early stage of female embryonic development , x-linked marker have be use to study the origin and development of various neoplastic disorder in affect heterozygous woman ; clonality assay have provide a useful tool to the understanding of the mechanism underlie the development of neoplasia .
recently , a technique of clonal analysis have be devise that take advantage of a highly polymorphic short tandem repeat within the x-linked human androgen receptor ( ar ) gene , result in a heterozygosity rate approach 90 % .
the rapid expansion of the number of woman now suitable for x inactivation analysis have however give rise to new controversy , one of the more troublesome be the possibility of a modification of the pattern of x-_chromosome inactivation pattern in blood cell of elderly woman .
in the present study we analyze with the ar assay a group of 166 healthy female aged between 8 and 94 year , with no history of genetic or neoplastic familial disorder .
we fail to find any correlation between age and x-_chromosome inactivation pattern ( r = 0.17 ) , even subdivide the subject in different age group accord to the criterion use by other researcher , and therefore reaffirm that , when test for with well-standardized and accurate criterion , extremely unbalanced inactivation of the x chromosome be a truly uncommon phenomenon in normal woman .
copyright 1998 academic press .
transcription factor activation and functional stimulation of human monocyte .
activation of expression of gene encode transcription factor : c-fos and c-jun and formation of ap1 transcriptional complex in human monocyte be investigate .
it be find that lipopolysaccharide induce strongly both c-fos and c-jun expression as well a ap1 formation .
interferon gamma activate strongly c-fos and weakly c-jun and ap1 .
tumor necrosis factor induce slightly c-fos and have almost no effect on c-jun and ap1 .
the data suggest that difference in functional response elicit in monocyte by all three factor may be dependent on different route on nuclear signalling employ by the factor .
modulation of endogenous il-1 beta and il-1 receptor antagonist result in opposing effect on hiv expression in chronically infected monocytic cell .
a proportion of hiv -infected individual experience episode of localized or systemic bacterial infection cause by gram-negative bacteria .
many of the clinical side effect of these infection be associate with the production of proinflammatory cytokine , which be induce primarily by lp , a constituent of the bacterial cell wall of gram-negative bacteria .
the present study examine the mechanism involve in lp -mediated induction of hiv expression in u1 cell , a promonocytic cell line chronically infect with hiv .
stimulation of u1 cell by lp alone induce minimal level of hiv expression , which be significantly enhance by granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) .
costimulation of u1 cell with lp plus gm-csf result in the accumulation of steady-state level of hiv rna ; however , only a weak induction of hiv long terminal repeat -driven transcription , which be not associate with the activation of the cellular transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b , be note .
costimulation of cell with lp plus gm-csf induce the production of proinflammatory cytokine , il-8 , il-1 beta and il-6 , but not tnf-alpha .
il-1 receptor antagonist ( ra ) inhibit lp enhancement of hiv expression in gm-csf -stimulated cell , suggest that endogenous il-1 be involve in lp -mediated viral production .
in this regard , anti-inflammatory cytokine inhibit lp plus gm-csf -stimulated hiv expression , and this effect closely correlate with inhibition of il-1 beta release and , in particular , with up-regulation of endogenous il-1ra production .
thus , the balance between an endogenously produce viral inducer ( il-1 beta ) and an inhibitor ( il-1ra ) may represent an important pathway lead to modulation of hiv expression from monocytic cell .
expression of c-fos , c-jun and jun b in peripheral blood lymphocyte from young and elderly adult .
the expression of c-fos , c-jun and jun b proto-oncogene be study in phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) activate peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) from young and aged human .
specific mrna for c-fos and c-jun be detectable within 30 min after cell activation and reach maximal level within 2 h .
both c-fos and jun b mrna decrease to pre-activation level within 6 h , while c-jun mrna remain elevated .
in pha -activated pbl , no age-related difference be observe in c-fos or jun b mrna expression .
however , c-jun mrna level decrease significantly ( 1.73 +/- 0.08 vs. 1.16 +/- 0.09 arbitrary unit , p < 0.01 , young vs. old ) in pbl from elderly individual activate with pha .
because previous work have demonstrate that t cell from elderly individual may display normal proliferative response when activate via the anti-cd2 pathway , c-jun and jun b mrna expression be also study in anti-cd2-activated purify t cell .
no age-related difference be find in the expression of either of these two proto-oncogene by anti-cd2 activated t cell .
these result suggest that the decrease il-2 production and proliferative response display by pha -activated pbl from elderly adult may be related to age-related change in c-jun mrna expression and in the ratio of c-fos to c-jun mrna .
a family of serine protease express exclusively in myelo- monocytic cell specifically process the nuclear factor-kappa b subunit p65 in vitro and may impair human immunodeficiency virus replication in these cell .
two group of u937 promonocytic cell be obtain by limit dilution cloning which differ strikingly in their ability to support human immunodeficiency virus 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication .
" plus " clone replicate the virus efficiently , whereas " minus " clone do not .
we examine these clone for difference in nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b activity which might account for the observe phenomenon .
stimulation of plus clone liberate the classical p50-p65 complex from cytoplasmic pool , whereas minus clone produce an apparently novel , faster-migrating complex , a judge by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
it be surprising that the faster-migrating complex be compose also of p50 and p65 .
however , the p65 subunit be cooh-terminally truncate , a show by immunoprecipitation .
the truncation result from limited proteolysis of p65 during cellular extraction which release particular lysosomal serine protease , such a elastase , cathepsin g , and proteinase 3 .
these specific protease be coordinately express and be present exclusively in the minus u937 clone , but not in the plus clone , a demonstrate in the case of cathepsin g .
in addition , these protease be detect in certain subclones of thp-1 and hl-60 cell and in primary monocyte , in each case correlate with the truncate from of p65 .
we demonstrate in vitro cleavage of p65 by purify elastase and cathepsin g .
it be possible that particular serine protease may have inhibiting effect on the replication of hiv-1 in myelo- monocytic cell .
the data also demonstrate that special precaution must be take when make extract from myelo- monocytic cell .
dna damaging agent induce expression of fa ligand and subsequent apoptosis in t lymphocyte via the activation of nf-kappa b and ap-1 .
apoptosis induce by dna damage and other stress can proceed via expression of fa ligand ( fasl ) and ligation of it receptor , fa ( cd95 ) .
we report that activation of the two transcription factor nf-kappa b and ap-1 be crucially involve in fasl expression induce by etoposide , teniposide , and uv irradiation .
a nondegradable mutant of i kappa b block both fasl expression and apoptosis induce by dna damage but not fa ligation .
these stimulus also induce the stress-activated kinase pathway ( sapk /jnk ) , which be require for the maximal induction of apoptosis .
a 1.2 kb fasl promoter respond to dna damage , as well a coexpression with p65 rel or fos/jun .
mutation in the relevant nf-kappa b and ap-1 binding site eliminate these response .
thus , activation of nf-kappa b and ap-1 contribute to stress-induced apoptosis via the expression of fasl .
a thiol antioxidant regulate ige isotype switching by inhibit activation of nuclear factor-kappab .
the bind site for nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) be present at the promoter region of the germline cepsilon gene , but there be little information on whether this factor be involve in regulate ige synthesis by human b cell .
accordingly , we study the role of nf-kappab in germline cepsilon transcription by use two human burkitt 's lymphoma b cell line , dnd39 and dg75 .
in both cell line , n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) , a potent thiol antioxidant , inhibit the triggering of the nuclear expression of nf-kappab by il-4 and by anti-cd40 monoclonal antibody .
although il-4 activate signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) 6 in addition to nf-kappab , nac treatment or the transfection of decoy oligodeoxynucleotides for nf-kappab or stat6 only partly block il-4 -induced germline cepsilon transcription .
however , these two decoy oligodeoxynucleotides together almost completely abrogate il-4 -induced germline cepsilon transcription .
of note , cd40 -mediated enhancement of il-4 -driven germline cepsilon transcription be markedly decrease by nac or by a decoy oligodeoxynucleotide for nf-kappab .
the effect of nac be also examine on deletional switch recombination underlie the isotype switch to ige .
nac inhibit the generation of smu/sepsilon switch fragment in normal human b cell costimulated with il-4 and anti-cd40 monoclonal antibody .
it also abolish il-4 -induced upregulation of cd40 but promote upregulation of cd23 .
these result suggest that coordination of nf-kappab and stat6 may be require for induction of germline cepsilon transcription by il-4 , and that cd40 -mediated nf-kappab activation may be important in regulate both enhancement of germline cepsilon transcription and class switching to ige .
silencing of human fetal globin expression be impaired in the absence of the adult beta-globin gene activator protein eklf .
globin gene be subject to tissue-specific and developmental stage-specific regulation .
a switch from human fetal ( gamma ) -to adult ( beta ) -globin expression occur within erythroid precursor cell of the adult lineage .
previously we and others show by target gene disruption that the zinc finger gene , erythroid kruppel-like factor ( eklf ) , be require for expression of the beta-globin gene in mouse , presumably through interaction with a high-affinity bind site in the proximal promoter .
to examine the role of eklf in the developmental regulation of the human gamma-globin gene we interbreed eklf heterozygote ( +/- ) with mouse harbor a human beta-globin yeast artificial chromosome transgene .
we find that in the absence of eklf , while human beta-globin expression be dramatically reduce , gamma-globin transcript be elevated approximately 5-fold .
impaired silencing of gamma-globin expression identify eklf a the first transcription factor participate quantitatively in the gamma-globin to beta-globin switch .
our finding be compatible with a competitive model of switching in which eklf mediate an adult stage-specific interaction between the beta-globin gene promoter and the locus control region that exclude the gamma-globin gene .
inhibition of proliferation and apoptosis of human and rat t lymphocyte by curcumin , a curry pigment .
curcumin ( diferuoylmethane ) , the yellow pigment in the rhizome of tumeric ( curcuma longa ) , an ingredient of curry spice , be know to exhibit a variety of pharmacological effect include antitumor , antiinflammatory , and antiinfectious activity .
although it precise mode of action remain elusive , curcumin have be show to suppress the activity of the ap-1 transcription factor in cell stimulate to proliferate .
in this study , we observe that curcumin ( 50 microm ) inhibit proliferation of rat thymocytes stimulate with concanavalin a ( con a ) as well a that of human jurkat lymphoblastoid cell in the logarithmic growth phase .
the pigment also inhibit apoptosis in dexamethasone-treated rat thymocytes and in uv-irradiated jurkat cell a judge by dna ladder formation , cellular morphological change , and flow cytometry analysis .
the inhibition of apoptosis by curcumin in rat thymocytes be accompany by partial suppression of ap-1 activity .
complete suppression of ap-1 activity be observe in con a -treated , proliferate thymocytes .
the capacity of curcumin to inhibit both cell growth and death strongly imply that these two biological process share a common pathway at some point and that curcumin affect a common step , presumably involve a modulation of the ap-1 transcription factor .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 nef protein inhibit nf-kappa b induction in human t cell .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) can establish a persistent and latent infection in cd4+ t lymphocyte ( w.c.greene , n.engl.j. med.324 : 308-317 , 1991 ; s.m.schnittman , m.c.psallidopoulos , h.c. lane , l.thompson , m.baseler , f.massari , c.h.fox , n.p.salzman , and a.s.fauci , science 245 : 305-308 , 1989 ) .
production of hiv-1 from latently infected cell require host cell activation by t-cell mitogen ( t.folks , d.m.powell , m.m.lightfoote , s.benn , m.a. martin , and a.s.fauci , science 231 : 600-602 , 1986 ; d.zagury , j. bernard , r.leonard , r.cheynier , m.feldman , p.s.sarin , and r.c. gallo , science 231 : 850-853 , 1986 ) .
this activation be mediate by the host transcription factor nf-kappa b [ g.nabel and d.baltimore , nature ( london ) 326 : 711-717 , 1987 ] .
we report here that the hiv-1 -encoded nef protein inhibit the induction of nf-kappa b dna-binding activity by t-_cell mitogen .
however , nef do not affect the dna-binding activity of other transcription factor implicate in hiv-1 regulation , include sp-1 , usf , ur , and nf-at .
additionally , nef inhibit the induction of hiv-1- and interleukin 2- directed gene expression , and the effect on hiv-1 transcription depend on an intact nf-kappa b -binding site .
these result indicate that defective recruitment of nf-kappa b may underlie nef 's negative transcriptional effect on the hiv-1 and interleukin 2 promoter .
further evidence suggest that nef inhibit nf-kappa b induction by interfere with a signal derive from the t-cell receptor complex .
dual effect of lp antibody on cellular uptake of lp and lp -induced proinflammatory function .
human phagocyte recognize bacterial lp ( endotoxin ) through membrane cd14 ( mcd14 ) , a proinflammatory lp receptor .
this study test the hypothesis that anti- lps ab neutralize endotoxin by block cellular uptake through mcd14 .
ab-associated change in the uptake and cellular distribution of fitc- lp be assess by flow cytometry and laser scanning confocal microscopy in human cd14-transfected chinese hamster ovary fibroblast ( cho-cd14 cell ) and human peripheral blood monocyte .
lp core- and o-side chain- specific mabs inhibit mcd14 -mediated lp uptake by both cell type in the presence of serum .
o-side chain-specific mab concurrently enhance complement-dependent lp uptake by monocyte through complement receptor-1 ( cr1 ) and uptake by cho-cd14 cell involve another heat-labile serum factor ( s ) and cell-associated recognition molecule ( s ) .
core-specific mab inhibit mcd14 -mediated uptake of homologous and heterologous lp , while produce less concurrent enhancement of non- mcd14 -mediated lp uptake .
the modulation by anti- lps mabs of mcd14 -mediated lp uptake be associate with inhibition of lp -induced nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) translocation and tnf-alpha secretion in cho-cd14 cell and monocyte , respectively , while mab enhancement of non- mcd14 -mediated lp uptake stimulate these activity .
lp -specific ab thus mediate anti-inflammatory and proinflammatory function , respectively , by prevent target cell uptake of lp through mcd14 and augment uptake through cr1 or other cell receptor .
an alternatively splice isoform of the spi-b transcription factor .
spi-b be an ets transcription factor related to the oncoprotein spi-1/pu.1 and highly express in b lymphoid cell .
the ets protein share a conserve ets domain that mediate specific dna binding .
spi-b bind dna sequence contain a core 5'-ggaa-3' and activate transcription through this motif .
up to date , the biological function of spi-b remain unknown .
here , we describe the characterization of an alternatively splice variant of spi-b , name deltaspi-b , which have lose the ets domain .
in b lymphoid cell , deltaspi-b and spi-b mrna be present simultaneously in a ratio of around 10 % .
deltaspi-b product be not able to bind dna and be recover in cytoplasmic cellular extract .
we raise the hypothesis that delta spi-b might affect spi-b function by recruit factor involve in spi-b activity .
antioxidant inhibit monocyte adhesion by suppress nuclear factor-kappa b mobilization and induction of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 in endothelial cell stimulate to generate radical .
cell adhesion to endothelial cell stimulate by tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf ) be due to induction of surface receptor , such a vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 ) .
the antioxidant pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) specifically inhibit activation of nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
since kappa b motif be present in vcam-1 and intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) promoter , we use pdtc to study the regulatory mechanism of vcam-1 and icam-1 induction and subsequent monocyte adhesion in tnf-treated human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvecs ) .
pdtc or n-acetylcysteine dose dependently reduce tnf-induced vcam-1 but not icam-1 surface protein ( also in human umbilical arterial endothelial cell ) and mrna expression ( by 70 % at 100 mumol/l pdtc ) in huvecs a assess by flow cytometry and polymerase chain reaction .
gel-shift analysis in huvecs demonstrate that pdtc prevent nf-kappa b mobilization by tnf , suggest that only vcam-1 induction be control by nf-kappa b .
since huvecs release superoxide anion in response to tnf , and h2o2 induce vcam-1 , pdtc may act a a radical scavenger .
although icam-1 induction be unaffected , inhibitor of nadph oxidase ( apocynin ) or cytochrome p-450 ( skf525a ) suppress vcam-1 induction by tnf , reveal that several radical-generating system be involve in it regulation .
pdtc , apocynin , or skf525a decrease adhesion of monocytic u937 cell to tnf-treated huvecs ( by 75 % at 100 mumol/l pdtc ) .
inhibition by anti- vcam-1 monoclonal antibody 1g11 indicate that u937 adhesion be vcam-1 dependent and suppression by antioxidant be due to reduce vcam-1 induction .
