cortisol receptor resistance : the variability of it clinical presentation and response to treatment .
primary ( partial ) cortisol receptor resistance be previously report in a total of 7 patient and 14 asymptomatic family member .
it occurrence be consider to be extremely rare .
in the present study we report on 6 patient ( 2 male and 4 female ) with the syndrome .
the first male patient present with mild hypertension .
hydrochlorothiazide therapy result in life-threatening hypokalemia .
the second male patient have slight hypertension without hypokalemia .
all four female patient present between the age of 20-30 yr with acne , hirsutism , and irregular menstruation .
low dose dexamethasone therapy ( 1-1.5 mg/day ) be of clinical benefit in these patient .
all patient show insufficient suppression of serum cortisol concentration in the overnight 1-mg dexamethasone test .
the diurnal rhythm of acth and cortisol be intact , albeit at an elevated level .
there be a normal increase in acth , cortisol , and gh ( except in one obese patient ) in response to insulin-induced hypoglycemia , while cortisol production be elevated in three patient .
circulate adrenal androgen level be increase in all patient .
glucocorticoid receptor be investigate in a whole cell dexamethasone binding assay in mononuclear leukocyte .
in the first male patient , the number of receptor be very low , while the affinity be low than that in control .
a lowered affinity to dexamethasone be find in one female patient , while a lowered number of receptor be find in three patient .
in the second male patient , no abnormality be find .
a a bioassay for glucocorticoid action we also measure dexamethasone suppressibility of mitogen-stimulated incorporation of [3h]thymidine in mononuclear leukocyte .
in the male patient with normal receptor status , dexamethasone suppressibility of [3h]thymidine incorporation be significantly low than that in healthy control with respect to both maximal suppression and ic50 .
partial cortisol receptor resistance might be less rare than previously think .
in the six patient present , at least three different form can be recognize .
therapy with dexamethasone be successful in female patient with acne and hirsutism , a the secondary increase in the production of adrenal androgen be effectively control .
the dna binding domain of the a-myb transcription factor be responsible for it b cell-specific activity and bind to a b cell 110-kda nuclear protein .
expression study as well a the use of transgenic animal have demonstrate that the a-myb transcription factor play central and specific role in the regulation of mature b cell proliferation and/or differentiation .
furthermore , it be highly express in burkitt 's lymphoma cell and may participate in the pathogenesis of this disease .
we have therefore investigate the transcriptional activity of a-myb and it regulation in several human lymphoid cell line use co-transfection assay and show that a-myb be transcriptionally active in all the b cell line study , but not in t cell .
in particular the best responder cell line be the burkitt 's cell line namalwa .
the activity of a-myb in b and not t cell be observe when either an artificial construct or the c-myc promoter be use a a reporter .
furthermore , the functional domain responsible for dna binding , transactivation , and negative regulation , previously characterize in a fibroblast context , be find to have similar activity in b cell .
the region of a-myb responsible for the b cell specific activity be define to be the n-terminal 218 amino acid contain the dna binding domain .
finally , a 110-kda protein have be identify in the nucleus of all the b , but not t , cell line that specifically bind to this a-myb n-terminal domain .
we hypothesize that this 110-kda protein may be a functionally important b cell-specific co-activator of a-myb .
a concatenated form of epstein-barr viral dna in lymphoblastoid cell line induce by transfection with bzlf1 .
the replicative form of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) dna be study use two lymphoblastoid cell line , x50-7 and 6f11 , which be latently infect by epstein-barr virus .
the lytic cycle of ebv infection be induce by transfection of the cell with the brlf1/bzlf1 coding region of the p3hr-1 defective genome .
we combine two technique to identify the productive replicative form of epstein-barr viral dna in the lytic cycle-induced cell .
restriction enzyme analysis follow by southern blot hybridization identify a significant increase in the fuse fragment encompass both end of ebv dna .
this indicate an increase in either episomal dna or concatameric linear dna .
southern blot analysis of in situ lysing gel reveal that the cellular content of linear ebv dna be also increase significantly after the initiation of the viral lytic cycle , while the amount of circular dna remain approximately constant .
we propose from these result that the source of the fuse fragment encompass both end of ebv dna be a concatenate linear ebv dna molecule , and that such a concatenate molecule most likely represent a replicative form of ebv dna in productively infected cell .
evidence for lowered induction of nuclear factor kappa b in activate human t lymphocyte during aging .
transcription factor nf kappa b ( nuclear factor kappa b ) be induce in t lymphocyte from young individual follow activation with a variety of stimulus include anti-cd3 , phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) , and tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
in contrast , activate t lymphocyte from old individual show a significant reduction in the induction of nf kappa b in response to the same stimulus .
the age-related decline in induction of nf kappa b could not be attribute to alteration in the composition of subunit , p50 and p65 be find to be the predominant subunit of induce nf kappa b in t cell from young as well a elderly donor .
furthermore , similar level of nf kappa b be find in the cytosol of unactivated t cell from both young and elderly donor suggest that precursor level of nf kappa b remain unaltered during aging .
these result suggest that an age-associated decline in the induction of nf kappa b in activate t cell from elderly individual may be attributable to altered regulation of the inhibitor , i kappa b , and may play an important role in immune dysregulation accompany aging .
signal transduction by dr3 , a death domain -containing receptor related to tnfr-1 and cd95 .
tumor necrosis factor receptor-1 ( tnfr-1 ) and cd95 ( also call fa or apo-1 ) be cytokine receptor that engage the apoptosis pathway through a region of intracellular homology , designate the " death domain . " another death domain -containing member of the tnfr family , death receptor 3 ( dr3 ) , be identify and be show to induce both apoptosis and activation of nuclear factor kappab .
expression of dr3 appear to be restricted to tissue enrich in lymphocyte .
dr3 signal transduction be mediate by a complex of intracellular signal molecule include tradd , traf2 , fadd , and flice .
thus , dr3 likely play a role in regulate lymphocyte homeostasis .
the rhombotin family of cysteine -rich lim-domain oncogene : distinct member be involve in t-cell translocation to human chromosome 11p15 and 11p13 .
a chromosomal translocation in a t-cell leukemia involve the short arm of human chromosome 11 at band 11p15 disrupt the rhombotin gene .
this gene encode a protein with duplicated cysteine -rich region call lim domain , which show homology to zinc-binding protein and to iron-sulfur center of ferredoxins .
two homologues of the rhombotin gene have now be isolate .
one of these , designate rhom-2 , be located on human chromosome 11 at band 11p13 , where a cluster of t-cell leukemia-specific translocation occur ; all translocation breakpoints at 11p13 be upstream of the rhom-2 gene .
human and mouse rhom-2 be highly conserve and , like rhombotin , encode two tandem cysteine -rich lim domain .
rhom-2 mrna be express in early mouse development in central nervous system , lung , kidney , liver , and spleen but only very low level occur in thymus .
the other gene , designate rhom-3 , be not on chromosome 11 but also retain homology to the lim domain of rhombotin .
since the rhom-2 gene be such a common site of chromosomal damage in t-cell tumor , the consistency of translocation near the rhombotin gene be far examine .
a second translocation adjacent to rhombotin be find and at the same position a in the previous example .
therefore , chromosome band 11p15 ( rhombotin ) and 11p13 ( rhom-2 ) be consistent site of chromosome translocation in t-cell leukemia , with the 11p15 target more rarely involve .
the result define the rhombotin gene family a a class of t-cell oncogene with duplicated cysteine -rich lim domain .
androgen binding site in peripheral human mononuclear leukocyte of healthy male and female .
androgen binding site have be identify in circulate human mononuclear leukocyte of healthy donor of both sex .
cell be separate from blood sample on a ficoll gradient and incubate with different concentration of [3h]testosterone in the presence or absence of a 400-fold excess of unlabelled testosterone .
binding data be derive from scatchard analysis .
the bind site fulfil the required criterion for specific steroid binding site however differ somewhat from the classic androgen receptor from genital skin fibroblast : in fertile adult male ( n = 20 ) the bind site show ( 1 ) a high affinity for testosterone ( 1.32 +/- 0.49 nm ; mean +/- sd ) , ( 2 ) a saturable capacity ( 184 +/- 52 bind site per cell ; mean +/- sd ) , and ( 3 ) a characteristic competitive binding profile for other steroid hormone ( relative binding affinity : testosterone = dihydrotestosterone > 17 beta-estradiol > progesterone , whereas aldosterone , 17-hydroxy-progesterone and cortisol do not compete appreciably ) .
furthermore the number of bind site determine use [3h]dihydrotestosterone , [3h]ru-1881 , or [3h] testosterone be comparable .
this raise the possibility that androgen receptor in peripheral mononuclear leukocyte differ from those in genital skin fibroblast .
there be no apparent correlation between serum testosterone concentration and androgen binding site .
in fertile woman remarkable change in androgen binding site be see in the course of the menstrual cycle , with a significant increase in the immediate preovulatory period .
the presence of androgen receptor in peripheral mononuclear leukocyte provide for the first time the experimental basis for an hypothesis of direct , receptor-mediated effect of androgen on mature immunocompetent cell .
the immunological implication of these result be discuss .
cell cycle-dependent initiation and lineage-dependent abrogation of gata-1 expression in pure differentiate hematopoietic progenitor .
the program activation/repression of transcription factor in early hematopoietic differentiation have not yet be explore .
the dna-binding protein gata-1 be require for normal erythroid development and regulate erythroid-expressed gene in mature erythroblast .
we analyze gata-1 expression in early human adult hematopoiesis by use an in vitro system in which " pure " early hematopoietic progenitor be induce to gradual and synchronize differentiation selectively along the erythroid or granulocyte-macrophage pathway by differential treatment with hematopoietic growth factor .
the gata-1 gene , though virtually silent in quiescent progenitor , be activate after entrance into the cell cycle upon stimulation with hematopoietic growth factor .
subsequently , increase expression along the erythroid pathway contrast with an abrupt downregulation in the granulocyte-macrophage lineage .
these result suggest a microenvironment-directed , two-step model for gata-1 expression in differentiate hematopoietic progenitor that involve ( i ) cycle-dependent initiation and ( ii ) lineage-dependent maintenance or suppression .
hypothetically , on/off switch of lineage-restricted transactivators may underlie the binary fate decision of hematopoietic progenitor .
nonpituitary human prolactin gene transcription be independent of pit-1 and differentially control in lymphocyte and in endometrial stroma .
expression of the human prl ( hprl ) gene in extrapituitary site such a the uterus ( decidualized endometrial stroma and myometrium ) and cell of the hematopoietic lineage be direct by an alternative promoter which be located approximately 6 kilobases ( kb ) upstream of the pituitary-specific start site .
in order to delineate the tissue-specific mechanism govern the control of nonpituitary prl gene expression , we have clone and sequence 3 kb 5'-flanking dna of the upstream decidual/lymphoid ( dprl ) promoter .
base on sequence homology we identify two bind motif for pit-1 and seven half-sites for glucocorticoid receptor/progesterone receptor ( pr ) binding .
we focus our study on the role of pit-1 and of pr a potential transcriptional regulator , since the pou domain protein pit-1 be essential in the control of pituitary prl expression , and progesterone induce decidual transformation of the endometrial stroma , a differentiation process during which the decidual prl gene be activate .
we demonstrate in a variety of cell type , include lymphocyte and endometrial stroma , that pit-1 be not involve in the regulation of dprl promoter/reporter gene construct carry 3 kb 5'-flanking dna .
our experiment also show that activate pr do not confer direct transcriptional control on the dprl promoter .
when we compare the activity of the transfected dprl promoter in prl- secreting and nonsecreting lymphoid cell , we find that the 3 kb 5'-flanking region of the dprl promoter do not contain element restrict expression to only those lymphocyte that produce prl but allow expression of fusion reporter gene irrespective of the status of the endogenous prl gene .
this be in sharp contrast to endometrial cell where 3 kb 5'-flanking dna confer strong transcriptional activation on the dprl promoter in decidualized endometrial stromal cell actively secrete prl , but do not allow transcription in undifferentiated non-prl-secreting endometrial stromal cell .
activation of the dprl promoter construct in these undifferentiated cell could however be induce by the addition of camp , in the absence of progesterone , suggest that a signal transduce through the camp signaling pathway be a primary inducer of decidual prl gene expression .
suppression of nuclear factor kappa b and cd18 -mediated leukocyte adhesion to the corneal endothelium by dexamethasone .
purpose : to demonstrate that leukocyte adhesion to culture corneal endothelial cell be mediate by the cd18 antigen , and to determine whether dexamethasone directly suppress adhesion by inhibit activation of nuclear factor kappa b ( nfkappab ) .
method : culture bovine corneal endothelium be stimulate for 6 hour by 40 micron/ml tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnfalpha ) .
dexamethasone be add 1 hour before tnfalpha stimulation in the dexamethasone group .
after stimulation , neutrophil separate from a healthy human volunteer be add with or without anti- cd18 antibody .
the culture plate be settle for 15 minute at 37 degree c , and then neutrophil be activate by n-formyl-methionyl-leucyl-phenylalanine for 5 minute .
nonadherent neutrophil be remove by seal and invert the culture well .
the intracellular localization of nfkappab after tnfalpha simulation be determine by confocal immunocytochemistry use an anti-p65 antibody .
result : neutrophil adhesion to culture corneal endothelial cell increase significantly on exposure to tnfalpha ( 451.4+/-45.4 cells/mm2 , n = 16 ) compare to control ( 156.7+/-27.3 cells/mm2 , n = 16 , p < 0.01 ) .
this increase adhesion be suppress by the addition of anti- cd18 antibody ( 157.6+/-25.1 cells/mm2 , n = 8 , p < 0.01 ) and by pretreatment with 10(-7) m dexamethasone ( 207.9+/-31.5 cells/mm2 , n = 10 , p < 0.01 ) .
immunocytochemistry 60 minute after stimulation reveal that nfkappab be located in the cytoplasm in unstimulated cell ; however , the addition of tnfalpha cause nfkappab to translocate into the nucleus .
pretreatment with dexamethasone taper nfkappab translocation into the nucleus .
conclusion : leukocyte adhesion to the corneal endothelium be show to be mediate by cd18 express on activate leukocyte .
pretreatment of the endothelium with dexamethasone inhibit leukocyte adhesion ; this may be due in part to the suppression of nfkappab entry into the nucleus .
evidence for normal vitamin d receptor messenger ribonucleic acid and genotype in absorptive hypercalciuria .
absorptive hypercalciuria ( a stone-forming condition ) be characterize by gut hyperabsorption of calcium , hypercalciuria , and reduce bone density .
inasmuch a these feature implicate enhance calcitriol action in gut and bone , we analyze the vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) gene to ascertain whether an abnormality of this gene mark patient with intestinal hyperabsorption of calcium .
we have compare the frequency of a restriction fragment length polymorphism ( bsm i ) associate with different allele of the vdr gene in a group of 33 well characterize absorptive hypercalciuric patient and a group of 36 normal race- and age-matched control subject .
there be no difference between the distribution of the vdr allele in the patient population when compare with the normal population .
the cod region of vdr messenger rna be also normal , a determine by both dna sequence analysis and chemical mismatch cleavage analysis of copy dna from 11 index absorptive hypercalciuric patient .
on the basis of these result , we propose that the enhance intestinal calcium absorption invariably see in absorptive hypercalciuria and attendant symptom of this disorder be not attributable to mutation of the vdr and be not link to a common vdr genotype .
glucocorticoid -resistance in peripheral-blood lymphocyte do not correlate with number of affinity of glucocorticoid-receptors in chronic renal failure patient .
glucocorticoid ( gc ) resistance in patient with chronic renal failure ( crf ) seriously impair successive gc therapy after renal transplantation .
we examine the relationship between gc -receptor ( gc-r ) parameter in peripheral-blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) and pbmc resistance to gc in 21 crf patient and 18 healthy subject .
each subject group be divide into two subgroup accord to pbmc sensitivity to prednisolone in a mitogen assay procedure ; i.e. , sensitive ( ic50 < 381 ng/ml ) and resistant ( ic50 > 381 ng/ml ) group .
in healthy subject , the mean gc-r bmax and kd in quiescent pbmc of the gc -sensitive group be 2.89 +/- 1.23 fmol/10(6) cell and 4.00 +/- 2.24 nm , respectively .
the bmax in these subject significantly increase to 6.61 +/- 2.02 ( 257.7 +/- 107.8 % ) after 24 h stimulation with concanavalin a ( p < 0.01 ) , while the kd change be not significant .
the gc-r bmax and kd in quiescent pbmc of the gc -resistant group be 5.33 +/- 1.37 fmol/10(6) cell and 3.20 +/- 1.39 nm , respectively .
both of these parameter , however , do not change significantly after mitogen stimulation .
there be a significant negative correlation between ic50s of prednisolone and increase-ratios ( post/pre ratio ) of bmax after mitogen stimulation ( p < 0.05 ) .
in crf patient , bmax and kd in quiescent pbmc of the gc -sensitive group be 6.04 +/- 2.35 fmol/10(6) cell and 3.49 +/- 1.72 nm , respectively , while those in pbmc of the gc -resistant group be 5.13 +/- 2.31 fmol/10(6) cell and 4.04 +/- 1.62 nm , respectively .
the bmax and kd be not significantly change after mitogen stimulation in both subgroup of crf .
moreover , in contrast to healthy subject , there be no correlation between ic50 and gc-r parameter in crf .
we conclude that , in healthy subject , decrease pbmc capacity to amplify gc-r number in response to mitogen be correlate with gc resistance , whereas in crf patient the resistant mechanism be not correlate with gc-r parameter .
an unknown event might be involve in gc -resistance of crf .
activation domain requirement for disruption of epstein-barr virus latency by zebra .
latent infection of b lymphocyte by epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) can be disrupt by expression of the ebv zebra protein .
zebra , a transcriptional activator , initiate the ebv lytic cascade by activate viral gene expression .
zebra be also indispensable for viral replication and bind directly to the ebv lytic origin of replication .
the study describe herein demonstrate that the activation domain .
zebra activation can be replace by a heterologous acidic , proline-rich , or glutamine-rich activation domain .
zebra activation domain swap construct retain zebra 's native ability to activate specific ebv promoter , to disrupt ebv latency , and to stimulate replication at the ebv lytic origin .
additional work , employ sequential and internal deletion of zebra 's n-terminal activation domain , indicate that it separate activity be not attributable to specific subdomains but be spread throughout it n terminus and therefore can not be inactivate by delete localized region .
the human tcf-1 gene encode a nuclear dna-binding protein uniquely express in normal and neoplastic t-lineage lymphocyte .
the tcf-1 gene encode a putative transcription factor with affinity for a sequence motif occur in a number of t-cell enhancer .
tcf-1 mrna be originally find to be express in a t cell-specific fashion within a set of human and mouse cell line .
in contrast , expression reportedly occur in multiple nonlymphoid tissue during murine embryogenesis .
we have now raise a monoclonal antibody to document expression and biochemistry of the human tcf-1 protein .
a expect , the tcf-1 protein be detectable only in cell line of t lineage .
it expression be always restricted to the nucleus .
immunohistochemistry on a panel of human tissue reveal that the tcf-1 protein be find exclusively in thymocytes and in cd3+ t cell in peripheral lymphoid tissue .
western blotting yield a set of band range from 25 kd to 55 kd , result from extensive alternative splicing .
the tcf-1 protein be detectable in all sample of a set of 22 t-cell malignancy of various stage of maturation , but be absent from a large number of other hematologic neoplasm .
these observation imply a t cell-specific function for tcf-1 , a notion corroborate by recent observation on tcf-1 knock-out mouse .
in addition , these result indicate that nuclear tcf-1 expression can serve a a pan-t-lineage marker in the diagnosis of lymphoid malignancy .
cell-type-specific regulation of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha gene in b cell and t cell by nfatp and atf-2/jun .
the human tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) gene be one of the early gene transcribe after the stimulation of a b cell through it antigen receptor or via the cd-40 pathway .
in both case , induction of tnf-alpha gene transcription can be block by the immunosuppressant cyclosporin a and fk506 , which suggest a role for the nfat family of protein in the regulation of the gene in b cell .
furthermore , in t cell , two molecule of nfatp bind to the tnf-alpha promoter element kappa 3 in association with atf-2 and jun protein bind to an immediately adjacent cyclic amp response element ( cre ) site .
here , use the murine b-cell lymphoma cell line a20 , we show that the tnf-alpha gene be regulate in a cell-type-specific manner .
in a20 b cell , the tnf-alpha gene be not regulate by nfatp bind to the kappa 3 element .
instead , atf-2 and jun protein bind to the composite kappa 3/cre site and nfatp bind to a newly identify second nfat site centered at -76 nucleotide relative to the tnf-alpha transcription start site .
this new site play a critical role in the calcium-mediated , cyclosporin a -sensitive induction of tnf-alpha in both a20 b cell and ar-5 cell .
consistent with these result , quantitative dnase footprinting of the tnf-alpha promoter use increase amount of recombinant nfatp demonstrate that the -76 site bind to nfatp with a high affinity than the kappa 3 site .
two other previously unrecognized nfatp -binding site in the proximal tnf-alpha promoter be also identify by this analysis .
thus , through the differential use of the same promoter element , the composite kappa 3/cre site , the tnf-alpha gene be regulate in a cell-type-specific manner in response to the same extracellular signal .
activation of the transcription factor nf-kappab in lipopolysaccharide -stimulated u937 cell .
during the course of serious bacterial infection , lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) interact with monocyte/macrophage receptor , result in the generation of inflammatory cytokine .
transcription factor nf-kappab be crucial in activate the transcription of gene encode proinflammatory cytokine .
in this paper , we demonstrate that the activation of nf-kappab by lp in a promonocytic cell line ( u937 ) follow a rather slow kinetics , depend on the rate of ikappab-alpha inhibitor hydrolysis .
no degradation of p105 and p100 inhibitor be observe under these condition .
the transduction pathway lead to nf-kappab activation in u937 cell involve the intracellular generation of reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) , a demonstrate by the concomitant inhibitory effect of antioxidant on nf-kappab activation and the emission of a fluorescent probe react intracellularly with hydrogen peroxide .
this ro pathway be also characterize by the use of other inhibitor .
this finding indicate that phospholipase a2 and 5-lipoxygenase be also involve .
however , the nf-kappab activation pathway involve the acidic sphingomyelinase of the endolysosomial membrane do not seem to participate in the lp -induced nf-kappab activation in u937 cell .
description and functional implication of a novel mutation in the sex-determining gene sry .
the sex-determining gene sry be screen for molecular alteration in an xy sex-reversed female by single-strand conformation polymorphism ( sscp ) technique .
an a-to-g transition be detect which lead to an exchange of a tyrosine by a cysteine in the sry protein .
the affect tyrosine residue located at the c terminus of the dna binding protein be evolutionarily strongly conserve among the member of the hmg box contain protein .
use gel shift assay and peptide synthesis such a mutation be show to abolish the sry protein dna binding ability .
the involvement of this particular amino acid in the binding specificity be also discuss .
regulation of il-6 synthesis in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell by c3a and c3a ( desarg ) .
the anaphylatoxin c3a have be report to have immunomodulatory effect on a number of different cell type .
in this study we investigate the effect of c3a and c3a ( desarg ) on gene expression and protein secretion of il-6 in human pbmcs , either alone or in combination with lp or il-1beta .
c3a or c3a ( desarg ) alone exhibit no effect on the expression or secretion of il-6 .
however , when pbmc be stimulate with lp or il-1beta , both c3a and c3a ( desarg ) be find to enhance il-6 release by pbmc in a dose-dependent manner .
since c3a have be show to induce pge2 production by monocyte , and pge2 have be show to influence cytokine production , we investigate the potential role of pge2 in c3a -mediated enhancement of lps- and il-1beta- induced il-6 production .
indomethacin block pge2 release , but have no influence on the observe effect of c3a , suggest that the effect of c3a on il-6 production be independent of pge2 formation by monocyte .
northern blot analysis show that c3a as well a c3a ( desarg ) enhance lp -induced mrna level for il-6 .
pretreatment of pbmcs with pertussis toxin block the function of c3a and c3a ( desarg ) , indicate that the action of these two molecule be mediate by a g protein -coupled pathway .
furthermore , we investigate the effect of c3a and c3a ( desarg ) on induction of nf-kappab and activate protein-1 binding .
both molecule enhance lp -induced nf-kappab and activating protein-1 binding activity .
these result demonstrate the capacity of intact c3a and it circulate des-arg form to exert immunmodulatory effect in vitro .
transcription factor binding site downstream of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 transcription start site be important for virus infectivity .
when transcriptionally active , the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) promoter contain a nucleosome-free region encompass both the promoter /enhancer region and a large region ( 255 nucleotide [ nt ] ) downstream of the transcription start site .
we have previously identify new bind site for transcription factor downstream of the transcription start site ( nt 465 to 720 ) : three ap-1 site ( i , ii , and iii ) , an ap3-like motif ( ap3-l ) , a downstream binding factor ( dbf ) site , and juxtapose sp1 site .
here , we show that the dbf site be an interferon-responsive factor ( irf ) binding site and that the ap3-l motif bind the t-cell-specific factor nf-at .
mutation that abolish the binding of each factor to it cognate site be introduce in an infectious hiv-1 molecular clone to study their effect on hiv-1 transcription and replication .
individual mutation of the dbf or ap3-l site as well a the double mutation ap-1(iii)/ ap3-l do not affect hiv-1 replication compare to that of the wild-type virus .
in contrast , provirus carry mutation in the sp1 site be totally defective in term of replication .
virus production occur with slightly delay kinetics for virus contain combined mutation in the ap-1(iii) , ap3-l , and dbf site and in the ap3-l and dbf-sites , whereas virus mutate in the ap-1(i,ii,iii) and ap3-l site and in the ap-1(i,ii,iii) , ap3-l , and dbf site exhibit a severely defective replicative phenotype .
no rna-packaging defect could be measure for any of the mutant virus a determine by quantification of their hiv genomic rna .
measurement of the transcriptional activity of the hiv-1 promoter after transient transfection of the hiv-1 provirus dna or of long terminal repeat-luciferase construct show a positive correlation between the transcriptional and the replication defect for most mutant .
inhibition of nf-at signal transduction event by a dominant-negative form of calcineurin .
an inhibitory , " dominant-negative , " form of the calcineurin catalytic ( a ) subunit be prepare , which lack the calmodulin -binding domain , autoinhibitory domain and most of it catalytic core but possess the regulatory ( b ) subunit binding domain .
when test for it ability to block calcineurin -dependent signaling in jurkat cell , expression of this " b-subunit knock-out " ( bko ) construct suppress reporter gene activity drive by nf-at , the pivotal promoter element for interleukin ( il ) -2 gene induction .
immunoprecipitation of epitope-labeled bko demonstrate for the formation of a tight complex with endogenous b subunit in jurkat cell , consistent with an inhibitory mechanism that involve the sequestration of the b subunit .
furthermore , the sharply reduce nf-at activity produce by co-transfecting bko could be " rescue " by overexpression of transfected b subunit , suggest that depletion of this subunit be responsible for the inhibition .
these data suggest the potential utility of agent that disrupt calcineurin -mediated signal transduction pathway by block formation of the catalytically active dimer of calcineurin a and b subunit .
dependence for the proliferative response to erythropoietin on an established erythroid differentiation program in a human hematopoietic cell line , ut-7 .
erythroid differentiation involve the activation of a number of erythroid-specific gene , most of which , include the globin gene and the erythropoietin receptor ( epo-r ) gene , be , at least in part , regulate by the transcription factor gata-1 .
in order to understand the relationship , if any , between expression of gata-1 , response to epo and erythroid differentiation , we analyze the expression of gata-1 , epo-r and globin gene in an epo-dependent human cell line , ut-7 epo .
the result be compare to those obtain with the parental granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) -dependent cell line , ut-7 , which have a predominantly megakaryoblastic phenotype and be unable to proliferate continuously in the presence of epo .
ut-7 epo and ut-7 express similar level of gata-1 mrna and binding activity .
the two line also express comparable level of epo-r mrna while the number of epo -binding site on ut-7 epo cell be one-sixth the number of ut-7 cell ( 2400 +/- 3 vs. 13 , 800 +/- 300 ) .
this difference in the number of bind site could be due to difference in cell surface ( ut-7 cell be 20 % small than the parental ut-7 cell ) or in receptor turnover .
by northern analysis , ut-7 cell express detectable level of beta- and gamma-globin but not alpha-globin .
in comparison , ut-7 epo cell express alpha-globin and high level of gamma-globin ( 5-fold ) and beta-globin ( from barely to clearly detectable ) .
globin chain ( alpha , beta and gamma ) be clearly detectable by affinity chromatography in ut-7 epo but not in ut-7 cell .
the frequency of the cell which express beta- and gamma- globin gene in the two cell population be measure by immunofluorescence with beta- and gamma- specific antibody .
the number of gamma-positive cell and their fluorescence intensity be high in ut-7 epo than in ut-7 cell ( 0 to 17 % barely positive cell and 23 to 40 % clearly positive cell , respectively ) , indicate that the increase in globin mrna observe in ut-7 epo be due to both an increase of gene expression per cell and an increase in number of cell contain gamma-globin .
the level of gata-1 , epo-r and globin mrna express be not affect by a 24-hour incubation of either cell line with epo , gm-csf or interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) .

transcriptional down-regulation of c-myc expression by protein synthesis -dependent and -independent pathway in a human t lymphoblastic tumor cell line .
we show that in the human t lymphoblastic tumor cell line molt4 c-myc mrna and protein expression be down-regulated after exposure to dimethyl sulfoxide , to phorbol myristate acetate , or to the calcium ionophore a23187 , which raise the intracellular calcium concentration .
a block to rna elongation be largely responsible for decrease c-myc transcription .
although negative regulation by dimethyl sulfoxide take place even when protein synthesis be inhibit by cycloheximide , the phorbol myristate acetate effect be block to some extent only by cycloheximide .
the calcium ionophore-induced c-myc suppression , however , strictly require de novo protein synthesis .
therefore , two different negative regulatory pathway be involve in c-myc regulation : one which be independent and one which depend on de novo protein synthesis .
the latter one appear to be mediate by a rapidly calcium -dependent induce gene product .
fa ligation induce apoptosis and jun kinase activation independently of cd45 and lck in human t cell .
stimulation through the fas/apo-1 receptor result in apoptosis through an incompletely characterize signaling pathway .
more be know regard signal transduction event that occur after ligation of the t-cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) .
it have be show that tcr stimulation require both the membrane tyrosine phosphatase , cd45 , and the src-family kinase , lck , to result in cellular activation .
although prior study suggest a role for protein tyrosine kinase and phosphatase in fa signaling , we report here that fa ligation induce apoptosis in t cell deficient in either cd45 or lck .
far , in normal and cd45- or lck- deficient cell line , fa stimulation result in activation of jun kinase ( jnk ) , a proposed mediator of stress activation pathway .
previous study have also demonstrate a role for endogenous ceramide release in fas-mediated apoptosis .
we show that stimulation with a synthetic ceramide analog result in jnk activation as well a apoptosis , suggest ceramide release occur proximal to jnk activation in fa signaling .
our data suggest that although cd45 and lck be not require for fa signaling , jnk activation may play an important role transduce distal signal that lead to apoptosis after fa ligation .
a germline taqi restriction fragment length polymorphism in the progesterone receptor gene in ovarian carcinoma [ see comment ]
clinical outcome in ovarian carcinoma be predict by progesterone receptor status , indicate an endocrine aspect to this disease .
peripheral leucocyte genomic dna be obtain from 41 patient with primary ovarian carcinoma and 83 control from ireland , as well a from 26 primary ovarian carcinoma patient and 101 control in germany .
southern analysis use a human progesterone receptor ( hpr ) cdna probe identify a germline taqi restriction fragment length polymorphism ( rflp ) define by two allele : t1 , represent by a 2.7 kb fragment ; and t2 , represent by a 1.9 kb fragment and characterise by an additional taqi restriction site with respect to t1 .
an over-representation of t2 in ovarian cancer patient compare with control in the pooled irish/german population ( p < 0.025 ) be observe .
a difference ( p < 0.02 ) in the distribution of the rflp genotype between irish and german control population be also observe .
the allele distribution could not be show to differ significantly from hardy-weinberg distribution in any subgroup .
use hpr cdna region-specific probe , the extra taqi restriction site be map to intron g of the hpr gene .
sequence analysis and expression in culture lymphocyte of the human fosb gene ( g0s3 ) .
g0s3 be a member of a set of putative g0/g1 switch regulatory gene ( g0s gene ) select by screen cdna library prepare from human blood mononuclear cell culture for 2 hr with lectin and cycloheximide .
the sequence show high homology with the murine fosb gene , which encode a component of the ap1 transcriptional regulator .
comparison of cdna and genomic sequence reveal a 4-exon structure characteristic of the fo family of gene .
freshly isolate cell show high level of fosb/g0s3 and fos/g0s7 mrna , which decline rapidly during incubation in culture medium .
the kinetics of expression suggest that the high initial level be cause by the isolation procedure , and do not reflect constitutive expression .
in cell preincubated for a day , level of fo mrna reach a maximum 20 min after the addition of lectin and decline to control level over the next 3 hr .
level of fosb mrna reach a maximum 40 min after the addition of lectin and decline to control level over the next 6 hr .
in freshly isolate cell , both fo and fosb mrna increase dramatically in response to the protein synthesis inhibitor cycloheximide .
in preincubated cell , the cycloheximide response be decrease , especially in the case of fosb .
these difference in expression of fo and fosb suggest different role and regulation .
region of low base order-dependent stem-loop potential in the region of the gene be define .
these indicate where base order have be adapt for purpose other than stem-loop stability ( e.g. , encode protein or gene regulation ) .
region of low potential in a 68.5-kb genomic segment contain the fosb gene suggest that the potential may help locate gene in uncharted dna sequence .
cytomegalovirus immediate early gene upregulate interleukin-6 gene expression .
background : the immediate early gene ( ie ) of human cytomegalovirus ( cmv ) can be express in monocytic cell and be know to regulate viral and cellular gene .
interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) play a central role in numerous inflammatory and immune process .
interleukin-6 level be increase in lung transplant patient clinically diagnose with cmv pneumonitis .
the regulation of il-6 be dependent on various stimulus that include lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , virus , and other cytokine .
these study examine the ability of cmv ie gene product to modulate il-6 production .
method : thp-1 cell , a monocytic cell line , be transfected with the cmv ie gene .
interleukin-6 protein and il-6 mrna be measure in control and cmv immediate early transfected cell .
cotransfection of cmv ie gene and il-6 chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) or il-6 luciferase construct be use to study il-6 promoter activity .
result : interleukin-6 protein and mrna production be significantly increase in cell transfected with the cmv ie gene and stimulate with lp compare to lp -stimulated control cell .
cytomegalovirus ie gene product significantly enhance lp stimulation of il-6 promoter activity in both il-6 cat and il-6 luciferase assay .
a deletion construct that contain a nf-kappa b site but be miss the multiple response region demonstrate a continued increase in il-6 luciferase activity in lp -stimulated cmv transfected cell .
conclusion : cytomegalovirus immediate early gene product significantly enhance expression of il-6 in lp -stimulated cell .
the increase in il-6 luciferase activity occur in the absence of the multiple response region , the area of the il-6 promoter responsive to il-1 , tnf alpha , cyclic amp , and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate .
the ability of cmv ie gene product to enhance il-6 production may play an important role in immune inflammatory state associate with cmv infection .
lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor binding during depression and after clinical recovery .
lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor binding parameter be study in 15 severely depressed patient during depression and after clinical recovery , and in 15 healthy control .
there be no difference in glucocorticoid receptor number or affinity between depressed patient and recovered or control subject .
afternoon acth and cortisol concentration do not differ significantly between the three group .
no relationship could be establish between glucocorticoid receptor binding and antidepressant medication .
these data support the view of an impaired ligand-induced plasticity of glucocorticoid receptor regulation rather than the hypothesis of decrease glucocorticoid receptor number during depression .
molecular and cellular analysis of human immunodeficiency virus -induced apoptosis in lymphoblastoid t-cell-line-expressing wild-type and mutate cd4 receptor .
we have previously show that the presence of the cd4 cytoplasmic tail be critical for human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -induced apoptosis ( j.corbeil , m.tremblay , and d.d.richman , j.exp.med.183 : 39-48 , 1996 ) .
we have pursue our investigation of the role of the cd4 transduction pathway in hiv-induced apoptosis .
to do this , wild-type and mutant form of the cd4 cytoplasmic tail be stably express in the lymphoblastoid t-cell line a2.01 .
apoptosis be prevent when cd4 truncate at residue 402 be express ; however , cell express mutate receptor that do not associate with p56(lck) ( mutate at the dicysteine motif and truncate at residue 418 ) but which conserve proximal domain of the cytoplasmic tail undergo apoptosis like wild-_type cd4 .
the difference between wild-type and mutate receptor in the induction of apoptosis be not related to level of p56(lck) or nf-_kappab activation .
initial signaling through the cd4 receptor play a major role in the sensitization of hiv-infected t cell to undergo apoptosis .
incubation of hiv-infected cell with monoclonal antibody ( mab ) 13b8-2 , which bind to cd4 in a region critical for dimerization of the receptor , prevent apoptosis without inhibit hiv replication .
moreover , the apoptotic process be not related to fa -fas ligand interaction ; however , an antagonistic anti-fas mab ( zb-4 ) enhance apoptosis in hiv-infected cell without induce apoptosis in uninfected cell .
these observation demonstrate that cd4 signaling mediate hiv-induced apoptosis by a mechanism independent of fa -fas ligand interaction , do not require p56(lck) signaling , and may involve a critical region for cd4 dimerization .
triptolide induce apoptotic death of t lymphocyte .
extract of tripterygium wilfordii hook . f ( twhf ) have immunosuppressive activity and have be use a anti-inflammatory agent in traditional chinese medicine for century .
recent study have demonstrate that triptolide be the major active component in the extract that inhibit antigen or mitogen -induced t cell proliferation .
in attempt to investigate it effect on activation of t lymphocyte , we find triptolide induce apoptotic death of t cell hybridoma and peripheral t cell but not that of thymocytes .
the triptolide -induced apoptosis be accompany by increase of devd-cleavable caspase activity and degradation of caspase substrate poly ( adp-ribose ) polymerase ( parp ) .
a specific inhibitor of caspase , zvad-fmk , prevent triptolide -induced parp degradation and dna fragmentation but not growth arrest .
furthermore , enforce expression of bcl-2 inhibit triptolide -induced degradation of parp and apoptosis .
these result indicate that triptolide induce t cell apoptosis through activate caspase , and suggest the growth arrest and apoptotic effect of triptolide may contribute to the immunosuppressive activity of twhf extract
a nuclear factor nf-gm2 that interact with a regulatory region of the gm-csf gene essential for it induction in response to t-cell activation : purification from human t-cell leukemia line jurkat cell and similarity to nf-kappa b .
activation of t cell by antigen , lectin , or a combination of phorbol-12-myristate acetate ( pma ) and calcium ionophore ( a23187 ) lead to the induction of gene for a set of lymphokine , include granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) .
we demonstrate in early study that the upstream region of the mouse gm-csf promoter at position between -95 and -73 be essential for transcriptional activation in response to pma/a23187 .
this region contain two dna-binding motif , gm2 and gc-box .
the gm2 sequence ( ggtagttccc ) be recognize by an inducible factor nf-gm2 ; the other ( ccgccc ) by constitutive factor a1 , a2 , and b .
to elucidate the mechanism of gm-csf gene activation , we have purify the inducible factor nf-gm2 from the nuclear extract of stimulate jurkat cell on the basis of specific dna-binding activity .
the purify nf-gm2 consist of 50 ( p50 ) and 65 kda ( p65 ) polypeptide and have a binding activity specific for both the gm-csf and immunoglobulin kappa ( ggaaagtccc ) enhancer .
electrophoretically purify p50 alone can form a protein-dna complex , but in the mixture , p50 associate preferentially with p65 to form the nf-gm2 complex .
in addition , p65 give per se , with low affinity , a protein-dna complex that migrate more slowly than native nf-gm2 complex .
furthermore , an antiserum against kbf1 ( identical to 50 kda nf-kappa b protein ) react with the p50 of nf-gm2 , indicate that the nf-gm2 polypeptide can not be immunologically differentiate from the 50 kda subunit of nf-kappa b .
the purify nf-gm2 activate in vitro transcription from the kappa b enhancer , while it fail to stimulate transcription from the gm-csf promoter harbor the gm2 sequence .
this suggest that the activation mechanism of the gm-csf gene through the gm2/gc-box sequence be different from that of gene carry the kappa b enhancer alone .
severe combined immunodeficiency due to defective binding of the nuclear factor of activate t cell in t lymphocyte of two male sibling .
peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) and alloreactive t cell line of two male infant bear to consanguinous parent and present with severe combined immunodeficiency ( scid ) show a pronounced deficiency in t cell activation .
although phenotypically normal , the proliferative response of the childrens ' t cell be strongly reduce but could be improve by the addition of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) .
furthermore both childrens ' t cell be unable to produce the cytokine il-2 , interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) , il-4 and tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
this multiple cytokine production deficiency could not be restore by il-2 or co-stimulatory signal provide by antigen-presenting cell ( apc ) .
moreover , mrna for il-2 and ifn-gamma could not be detect .
in contrast , expression of the activation-dependent cell surface marker cd25 and cd69 be within normal limit .
to determine whether the functional defect of the patient ' t cell be due to the absence or abnormal binding of transcription factor involve in cytokine gene expression , electrophoretic mobility shift assay be use to examine the dna binding of ap-1 , oct , creb , sp1 , nf-kappa b and the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) to their respective response element in the promoter of the il-2 gene .
whereas ap-1 , nf-kappa b , oct , creb and sp1 display normal binding activity in nuclear extract , the binding of nf-at to it il-2 promoter response element be barely detectable both before and after t cell stimulation .
our result strongly suggest that this nf-at /dna binding defect be responsible for the multiple cytokine deficiency and the scid phenotype observe in the two infant brother .
regulation of c-jun mrna expression by hydroxyurea in human k562 cell during erythroid differentiation [ publish erratum appear in biochim biophys acta 1995 dec 27 ; 1264 ( 3 ) : 409 ]
hydroxyurea ( hu ) be an antitumor agent which also induce hemoglobinization during erythroid differentiation .
in addition , hu stimulate the synthesis of fetal hemoglobin in sickle cell anemia patient .
to far understand it mechanism of action , we investigate the effect of hu on regulation of c-jun expression prior to the onset of erythroid differentiation of k562 cell .
hu induce a dose-dependent stimulation of c-jun synthesis .
the level of c-jun mrna be elevate 4 to 7.5-fold by hu within 2 h .
this be follow by a gradual decline to the basal level by 24 h .
both nuclear run-on and actinomycin d pulse experiment strongly indicate that hu regulate c-jun mrna expression by increase the rate of synthesis as well a stabilize the c-jun mrna .
in addition , the level of jun protein be elevated by 2 to 5-fold within 4 h in hu treated cell .
furthermore , concentration of hu below 250 microm slightly increase the 5x ap-1 /cat activity .
these result strongly suggest that hu induce both transcriptional and post-transcription regulation of c-jun during erythroid differentiation .
characterization of a mutant cell line that do not activate nf-kappab in response to multiple stimulus .
numerous gene require during the immune or inflammation response as well a the adhesion process be regulate by nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) .
associate with it inhibitor , i kappab , nf-kappab reside a an inactive form in the cytoplasm .
upon stimulation by various agent , i kappab be proteolyzed and nf-kappab translocate to the nucleus , where it activate it target gene .
the transduction pathway that lead to i kappab inactivation remain poorly understand .
in this study , we have characterize a cellular mutant , the 70/z3-derived 1.3e2 murine pre-b cell line , that do not activate nf-kappab in response to several stimulus .
we demonstrate that upon stimulation by lipopolysaccharide , taxol , phorbol myristate acetate , interleukin-1 , or double-stranded rna , i kappab alpha be not degrade , a a result of an absence of induce phosphorylation on serine 32 and 36 .
neither a mutation in i kappab alpha nor a mutation in p50 or rela , the two major subunit of nf-kappab in this cell line , account for this phosphorylation defect .
as well a culminate in the inducible phosphorylation of i kappab alpha on serine 32 and 36 , all the stimulus that be inactive on 1.3e2 cell exhibit a sensitivity to the antioxidant pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) .
in contrast , stimulus such a hyperosmotic shock or phosphatase inhibitor , which use pdtc -insensitive pathway , induce i kappab alpha degradation in 1.3e2 .
analysis of the redox status of 1.3e2 do not reveal any difference from wild-type 70z/3 .
we also report that the human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) -derived tax trans-activator induce nf-kappab activity in 1.3e2 , suggest that this viral protein do not operate via the defective pathway .
finally , we show that two other i kappab molecule , i kappab beta and the recently identify i kappab epsilon , be not degrade in the 1.3e2 cell line follow stimulation .
our result demonstrate that 1.3e2 be a cellular transduction mutant exhibit a defect in a step that be require by several different stimulus to activate nf-kappab .
in addition , this analysis suggest a common step in the signaling pathway that trigger i kappab alpha , i kappab beta , and i kappab epsilon degradation .
the ets protein spi-b be express exclusively in b cell and t cell during development .
spi-b and pu.1 be hematopoietic-specific transcription factor that constitute a subfamily of the ets family of dna-binding protein .
here we show that contrary to previous report , pu.1 and spi-b have very different expression pattern .
pu.1 be express at high level in b cell , mast cell , megakaryocyte , macrophage , neutrophil , and immature erythroid cell and at low level in mature erythrocyte .
pu.1 be completely absent from peripheral t cell and most t cell line base on sensitive rt-pcr assay .
in contrast , spi-b be express exclusively in lymphoid cell and can be detect in early fetal thymus and spleen .
in situ hybridization of adult murine tissue demonstrate spi-b mrna in the medulla of the thymus , the white pulp of the spleen , and the germinal center of lymph node .
spi-b expression be very abundant in b cell and both spi-b mrna and protein be detect in some t cell .
in situ hybridization and northern blot analysis suggest that spi-b gene expression increase during b cell maturation and decrease during t cell maturation .
gel-retardation experiment show that spi-b can bind to all putative pu.1 binding site , but do not reveal any preferred spi-b binding site .
finally , both pu.1 and spi-b function a transcriptional activator of the immunoglobulin light-chain enhancer e lambda 2.4 when coexpressed with pip ( pu.1 -interaction partner ) in nih-3t3 cell .
take together , these data suggest that difference in pattern of expression between spi-b and pu.1 distinguish the function of each protein during development of the immune system .
upregulation of c-fos in activate t lymphoid and monocytic cell by human immunodeficiency virus-1 tat protein .
the regulatory tat protein of the human immunodeficiency virus type-1 ( hiv-1 ) be essential for viral replication and also show pleiotropic activity on various cell function .
to get further insight into the molecular mechanism underlie the biological activity of tat , we investigate the effect of endogenous and exogenous tat protein on c-fos gene expression in t lymphoblastoid ( jurkat ) and monocytic ( u937 ) cell line , as well a in primary peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) .
transient cotransfection of tat cdna in sense orientation ( tat/s ) , together with a plasmid contain the c-fos promoter ( fc3 , from - 711 to +42 ) in front of the bacterial chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) gene significantly enhance cat activity in jurkat cell activate by the addition of 15 % fetal calf serum ( fcs ) or 5 micrograms/ml phytohemagglutinin plus 10(-7) mol/l phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) and u937 cell activate by 15 % fcs or 10(-7) mol/l pma .
this effect be specifically due to tat , since jurkat and u937 cell cotransfected either with tat cdna in antisense orientation ( tat/as ) , tat carry a mutation in the aminoacid cys22-gly22 ( tat 22/s ) or with the backbone vector alone ( prpneo-sl3 ) do not show any significant difference in c-fos promoter activity a compare to cell transfected with fc3 plasmid alone .
by use deletion mutant of the c-fos promoter , we find that the minimal dna sequence require for tat activity be located between nucleotide -404/-220 and that the serum responsive element ( sre , -317/-288 ) , present within this region , be still responsive to tat .
a single point mutation in the sre completely abrogate the responsiveness to tat/s .
exogenous recombinant tat protein be also able to upregulate c-fos promoter activity in serum-activated jurkat and u937 cell , as well a endogenous c-fos mrna expression and c-fos protein synthesis in both serum-activated cell line and primary pbmc .
c-fos protein be show essential for an optimal transactivation of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) by tat : incubation of jurkat cell with antisense , but not sense , c-fos oligonucleotides significantly reduce either the tat -enhanced expression of an ltr-cat reporter construct or the level of gag p24 in the culture supernatant of jurkat cell and pbmc acutely infect with hiv-1 .
our data suggest that the c-fos upregulation mediate by tat might play a significant role in the control of viral gene transactivation .
characterization of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 enhancer -binding protein from the human t-cell line jurkat .
the transcription of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) be under the control of cellular protein that bind to the viral long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
among the protein-binding region of the hiv-1 ltr be the transcription-enhancer region .
we show that at least one inducible , c1 , and one constitutive , c2 , protein can bind to the hiv enhancer in jurkat cell .
the two protein differ in their surface charge , since they be separable by anion-exchange chromatography .
bivalent cation such a mg2+ and zn2+ differentially affect their binding to oligonucleotides which contain the hiv-enhancer domain .
both c1 and c2 protein also bind to a similar sequence find in the interleukin-2 -receptor alpha-subunit enhancer .
the inducible c1 protein be partially purify by three chromatographic step and characterize by u.v. cross-linking a a 47 kda protein .
reduce susceptibility to hiv-1 infection of ethyl-methanesulfonate-treated cem subclones correlate with a blockade in their protein kinase c signaling pathway .
we have describe the isolation of chemically induce cem subclones that express cd4 receptor and bind soluble gp120 , yet show a markedly reduce susceptibility to infection with hiv-1 .
two subclones be find to have an abnormal response to the protein kinase c ( pkc ) activator pma .
pma treatment induce cd3 and cd25 ( il-2r ) receptor on the parental line and on other ethyl-methanesulfonate-derived subclones , but not on these two mutant .
direct assay of pkc activity be conduct .
total cellular pkc enzymatic activity be find to be normal in these subclones .
pma -induced cd4 down-modulation occur normally .
in addition , activation of c-raf kinase be normal .
since hiv-1 long terminal repeat contain two functional nuclear factor kb ( nf-kb ) regulatory element , we study the ability of pma to induce nf-kb binding activity by different assay .
chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) assay use the hiv-1 ( -139 ) long terminal repeat-cat construct show no pma induction of cat activity in these subclones ( unlike the parental line and other subclones ) .
okadaic acid , an inhibitor of phosphatase 1 and 2a , do not overcome the defect in these subclones .
gel retardation assay , use a 32p-probe contain the hiv-1 nf-kb probe and nuclear extract from pma -treated cell , show significantly reduce induction of nuclear nf-kb binding protein in these two subclones compare with wild type cem and a control subclone .
deoxycholate treatment of cytoplasmic extract from these subclones release much reduce nf-kb binding protein from their cytoplasmic pool .
thus , reduced level of pkc -induced nuclear nf-kb activity in two t cell subclones do not affect their normal cell growth , but correlate with a pronounced reduction in their susceptibility to hiv-1 infection .
absence of t-cell- and b-cell- specific transcription factor tcf-1 , gata-3 , and bsap in hodgkin 's reed-sternberg cell .
base on the presence of t cell receptor-beta ( tcr-beta ) gene rearrangement in l428 and hdlm-1 cell , the expression of cd2 in hdlm-1 cell , and the presence of immunoglobulin heavy-chain ( igh ) gene rearrangement in km-h2 cell , some researcher have conclude that these long-term cell line derive from patient with hodgkin 's disease be lymphoid in nature .
the information obtain from these cell line have also be use in argument for a lymphoid origin of h-rs cell in tissue despite the frequent absence of lymphoid marker and ig/tcr gene rearrangement in these cell .
we question whether one can use the limited expression of lymphoid marker or the limited gene rearrangement to conclude that h-rs cell have a lymphoid origin , because these marker may be aberrant in tumor cell .
in this study , we examine the expression of two t-cell-specific transcription factor ( tcf-1 and gata-3 ) and one b-cell-specific transcription factor ( bsap ) in culture h-rs cell by use a gel mobility shift assay .
the sensitivity and specificity of this assay for determination of cell lineage have be establish in a large number of culture human and murine cell line .
all three type of h-rs cell line be consistently negative for bsap , tcf-1 , and gata-3 .
the absence of gata-3 be confirm in h-rs cell in tissue by an in situ hybridization technique .
virtually all b-cell line , with the exception of some myeloma cell line , be positive for bsap , which be the transcription factor for promoter for several b-cell marker , include vpreb1 , lambda 5 , cd19 , and cd20 .
all t-cell line test be positive for tcf-1 and gata-3 , which be the transcription factor for promoter for several t-cell-restricted marker , include cd2 , cd3 , tcr , and lck .
the absence of bsap , tcf-1 , and gata-3 clearly indicate an underlying difference between h-rs cell and lymphoid cell .
role of egr-2 in up-regulation of fa ligand in normal t cell and aberrant double-negative lpr and gld t cell .
we previously identify a fa ligand regulatory element ( flre ) in the fa ligand ( fasl ) promoter that bind egr family protein and demonstrate that egr-3 ( pilot ) but not egr-1 ( ngfi-a , krox-24 , tis-8 , and zif-268 ) induce transcription of fasl .
the aberrant cd4(-) cd8(-) t cell from lpr/lpr and gld/gld mouse , which have mutation in the gene encode fa and fasl , respectively , have an activate phenotype and constitutively express high level of fasl mrna , prompt u to ask what role if any the flre and egr family protein have in this aberrant expression of fasl .
unstimulated mrl-lpr/lpr and c3h-gld/gld cd4(-) cd8(-) t cell constitutively contain high level of two protein that bind to the flre .
supershift analysis reveal these protein to be egr-1 and egr-2 ( krox-20 ) ; egr-3 be not detect .
activation of normal lymph node cell result in increase expression of egr -1 , -2 , and -3 .
a with egr-3 , expression of egr-2 be block by cyclosporin a .
although overexpressed egr-1 be ineffective , overexpressed egr-2 be as potent a egr-3 in induce fasl promoter-dependent reporter construct in t cell hybridoma and hela cell , and both up-regulated endogenous fasl mrna in hela cell .
fasl -dependent reporter construct in mrl-lpr/lpr and c3h-gld/gld cd4(-) cd8(-) t cell be constitutively active , and this activity be largely prevent by mutation of the critical egr family binding element .
thus , egr-2 , in addition to egr-3 , regulate fasl expression in activate normal t cell , and egr-2 be likely to play a direct role in aberrant fasl up-regulation in lpr/lpr and gld/gld cd4(-) cd8(-) t cell .
cutting edge : dominant effect of ile50val variant of the human il-4 receptor alpha-chain in ige synthesis .
two variant of the il-4r alpha-chain ( il-4ralpha ) gene have be recently identify in association with different atopic disorder .
to clarify the etiological relationship between the two variant , we analyze responsiveness to il-4 of transfectants with four kind of il-4ralpha carry either val or ile at 50 and either gln or arg at 551 .
the substitution of ile for val augment stat6 activation , proliferation , and transcription activity of the iepsilon promoter by il-4 , whereas that of arg for gln do not change these il-4 signal .
arg551 be not associate with atopic asthma in the japanese population .
cd23 expression and ige synthesis by il-4 be augmented in ile50 -bearing pbmc , compare with those bear val50 .
take together , substitution of arg551 do not enhance the il-4 signal for generation of germline epsilon transcript , whereas the substitution of ile50 contribute to enhancement of ige synthesis .
direct exposure to 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( tcdd ) increase infectivity of human erythrocyte to a malarial parasite .
direct exposure to 10 nm 2,3,7,8-tcdd cause a 75 % increase and a 2-fold increase in the infectivity of isolate human erythrocyte to p. falciparum after 48 hour when the parasite be in an unsynchronized or synchronized state of growth , respectively .
treatment of human erythrocyte with 10 microm sodium orthovanadate ( naov ) , an inhibitor of plasma membrane ca-atpase and phosphotyrosine phosphatase , decrease parasitemia by 30 % .
co-treatment of rbc with tcdd and naov completely block the tcdd -induced increase in parasitemia .
because erythrocyte be anucleated , these result be discuss a evidence for biochemical change by tcdd without require the activation of gene product .
translocation ( 3 ; 14 ) ( q27 ; q11 ) : a new variant translocation in a patient with non-hodgkin 's lymphoma of b-cell type with bcl6 rearrangement .
we report a 65-year-old woman with non-hodgkin 's lymphoma ( nhl ) carry a t(3;14)(q27;q11) and bcl6 rearrangement in the affect cell .
she have generalize lymphadenopathy and the bone marrow be infiltrate by lymphoma cell at presentation .

the finding suggest that a novel proto-oncogene in the vicinity of tcr alpha/delta be involve in this translocation .
contribution of nf-kappa b and sp1 binding motif to the replicative capacity of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 : distinct pattern of viral growth be determine by t-cell type .
start with a replication-incompetent molecular clone of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 , lack all the nf-kappa b and sp1 binding site present in the native long terminal repeat ( ltr ) , provirus contain reconstruct ltrs with individual or combination of nf-kappa b and sp1 element be generate and evaluate for their capacity to produce virus progeny follow transfection-cocultivation .
virus stock obtain from these experiment exhibit a continuum of replicative capacity in different human t-cell type depend on which element ( s ) be present in the ltr .
for example , in experiment involve proviral clone with ltrs contain one or two nf-kappa b element ( and no sp1 binding site ) , a hierarchy of cellular permissivity to virus replication ( peripheral blood lymphocyte = mt4 great than h9 great than cem great than jurkat ) be observe .
of note be the associate emergence of second-site ltr revertants which involve an alteration of the tata box .
these result suggest that the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ltr possess functional redundancy which ensure virus replication in different t-cell type and be capable of change depend on the particular combination of transcriptional factor present .
dissociation of the jak kinase pathway from g-csf receptor signaling in neutrophil .
activation of the granulocyte colony-stimulating factor receptor ( g-csfr ) induce rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of multiple intracellular substrate in proliferate cell and nonproliferating , terminally differentiate neutrophil .
the kinase that couple ligand bind to tyrosine phosphorylation of cellular substrate by the g-csfr with activation of specific functional program be largely unknown .
in this study , we examine early signaling event in proliferate and terminally differentiate cell follow g-csf stimulation to determine whether identical signaling cascade be activate .
in murine ba/f3 cell transfected with the human g-csfr and nfs-60 cell constitutively express the murine g-csfr , g-csf induce tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of jak1 , jak2 , and tyk2 .
tyrosine phosphorylation of stat3 and , to a less extent , stat1 be also detect follow g-csf stimulation .
use a mitogenically incompetent human g-csfr mutant in which pro639 and pro641 be substitute by alanine , the box 1 pdp motif be find to be require for activation of jak kinase , tyrosine phosphorylation of the g-csfr , and recruitment of stat protein .
notably , no activation of jak1 , jak2 , tyk2 , stat1 , or stat3 be observe in neutrophil follow g-csf stimulation .
in addition , there be no detectable activation in neutrophil of the recently clone jak3 kinase , which have be report to be express at high level a myeloid cell undergo terminal neutrophilic maturation .
these result indicate a lack of involvement of jak kinase in signaling by the g-csfr in neutrophil , and suggest utilization of alternative signal transduction pathway distinct from those in proliferate cell .
activation of the jak -stat pathway correlate with proliferative signaling by the g-csfr and require the membrane-proximal box 1 pxp motif , which be conserve in member of the cytokine receptor superfamily .
cd14 -mediated signal pathway of porphyromonas gingivalis lipopolysaccharide in human gingival fibroblast .
lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induce expression of inflammatory cytokine in monocytes/macrophages via cd14 , one of the lp receptor , which be express predominantly in these cell .
it have be demonstrate that porphyromonas gingivalis lp ( p- lp ) also be able to induce inflammatory cytokine in human gingival fibroblast .
therefore , it be important to determine whether cd14 be express in gingival fibroblast and to define the p- lp -mediated signal-transducing mechanism in the cell .
in this study , we observe unexpectedly by immunohistochemical , western blotting ( immunoblotting ) , and northern ( rna ) blotting assay that cd14 be express at high density in human gingival fibroblast .
p- lp -induced expression of the monocyte chemoattractant protein 1 ( mcp-1 ) gene in the cell be inhibit markedly by treatment with anti-human cd14 antibody and be completely inhibit by herbimycin a , a potent inhibitor of tyrosine kinase .
the inhibitor also dramatically inhibit monocyte chemotactic activity of and mcp-1 production by the cell .
furthermore , p- lp -induced expression of the mcp-1 gene in the cell also be block by inhibitor of two transcription factor , i.e. , curcumin , an inhibitor of ap-1 , and pyrolidine dithiocarbamate , an inhibitor of nf-kappab .
both inhibitor inhibit monocyte chemotactic activity in the culture supernatant of p- lp -treated cell .
gel shift mobility assay show stimulation of the ap-1 and nf-kappab content in p- lp -treated cell .
this study be the first to demonstrate the expression of cd14 in human gingival fibroblast and to show that the signal-transducing pathway of p- lp in the cell be mediate by cd14 .

potent gene regulatory and antiproliferative activity of 20-methyl analogue of 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 .
the biological active form of vitamin d3 , 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( vd ) , regulate cellular growth and differentiation .
this provide the hormone with an interesting therapeutic potential .
however , hypercalcemia be a side effect , which be cause by vd 's classical action , the regulation of calcium homeostasis .
this make the need for vd analogue with selectively increase cell regulatory property .
study with 20-epi analogue point out the importance of the carbon-20 position and lead to the development of 20-methyl derivative of vd .
in this report the biological property of the compound zk161422 and zk157202 , which be 20-methyl- and 20-methyl-23- eneanalogues , respectively , have be analyze in comparison with vd .
both compound show about 2-fold low affinity to the vd receptor ( vdr ) than vd .
however , compare to vd , their antiproliferative effect be up to 30-fold high on human peripheral blood mononuclear cell and even up to 300-fold high on human breast cancer mcf-7 cell .
whereas the hypercalcemic effect for zk157202 be also increase 10-fold , zk161422 have the same calcium -mobilizing potency a vd .
moreover , zk161422 , but not zk157202 , show preference for gene activation from a promoter carry a vd response element with a palindromic arrangement of two hexameric receptor binding site space by 9 nucleotide ( ip9 ) rather than for activation from a response element form by a direct repeat space by 3 nucleotide ( dr3 ) .
this observation support a model , in which promoter selectivity reflect the selectively increase antiproliferative effect of vd analogue .
membrane receptor for aldosterone : a novel pathway for mineralocorticoid action .
rapid nongenomic in vitro effect of aldosterone on intracellular electrolyte , cell volume , and na(+)-h+ antiport have be find in human mononuclear leukocyte ( hml ) .
binding of 125i-labeled aldosterone to plasma membrane of hml share important feature with these functional data .
this include a very low apparent dissociation constant ( kd ) of 0.1 nm for both aldosterone and the effect on the na(+)-h(+)-antiport , a high turnover rate , and the almost exclusive binding selectivity for aldosterone .
dexamethasone , ru 26988 , corticosterone , ouabain , amiloride , and 18-hydroxyprogesterone be inactive a ligand .
deoxycorticosterone acetate have an intermediate activity with an apparent kd of 100 nm .
these finding be the first to demonstrate membrane binding of aldosterone be compatible with major aspect of it nongenomic effect .
endothelial production of mcp-1 : modulation by heparin and consequence for mononuclear cell activation .
heparin be a polyanionic glycosaminoglycan ( gag ) that can bind with high affinity to a range of cytokine include interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) and member of the chemokine superfamily .
this gag also possess immunomodulatory activity in vivo and can antagonize the capacity of ifn-gamma to induce class ii mhc antigen expression , and to up-regulate intercellular adhesion molecule-1 , by culture endothelial cell .
previous study have show that binding to cell-surface heparan sulphate be essential for optimal activity of ifn-gamma and that free heparin competitively inhibit this sequestration process .
the present study be perform to increase our understanding of the immunosuppressive activity of heparin by investigation of potential antagonism of the production and function of monocyte chemotactic peptide-1 ( mcp-1 ) , a chemokine important for mononuclear leucocyte recruitment across vascular endothelium .
it be find that mixture of heparin with ifn-gamma inhibit up-regulation of the signal transducer and activator of transcription protein , stat-1 produce normally by treatment of endothelial cell with ifn-gamma .
an inhibition of mcp-1 production be observe that be specifically cause by mixture of ifn-gamma with heparin-like , and therefore cytokine-binding , gag .
it be also show that mixture of heparin -like gag with mcp-1 inhibit the rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase which be normally produce by treatment of mononuclear leucocyte with this chemokine .
blockade of this intracellular signalling event be associate with a reduction in the normal transendothelial migration response towards mcp-1 .
result from this study indicate that soluble , heparin -like gag can block ifn-gamma -dependent up-regulation of mcp-1 production by culture endothelial cell , and can also antagonize the leucocyte-activating and migration-promoting property of pre-existing mcp-1 .
these activity may contribute to the immunomodulatory property of heparin .
surfactant protein a activate nf-kappa b in the thp-1 monocytic cell line .
the expression of many gene for which product be involve in inflammation be control by the transcriptional regulator nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b .
because surfactant protein ( sp ) a be involve in local host defense in the lung and alter immune cell function by modulate the expression of proinflammatory cytokine as well a surface protein involve in inflammation , we hypothesize that sp-a exert it action , at least in part , via activation of nf-kappa b .
we use gel shift assay to determine whether sp-a activate nf-kappa b in the thp-1 cell line , a human monocytic cell line .
activation of nf-kappa b in thp-1 cell by sp-a dos as low a 1 microgram/ml occur within 30 min of sp-a treatment , peak at 60 min , and then decline .
this activation be inhibit by known inhibitor of nf-kappa b or by simultaneous treatment of the cell with surfactant lipid .
moreover , the nf-kappa b inhibitor block sp-a -dependent increase in tumor necrosis factor-alpha mrna level .
these observation suggest a mechanism by which sp-a play a role in the pathogenesis of some lung condition and point to potential therapeutic measure that could be use to prevent sp-a induced inflammation in the lung .
constitutive activation of nf-kb in human thymocytes .
nf-kb be a eukaryotic transcription regulatory factor .
in t cell and t cell line , nf-kb be bind to a cytoplasmic proteic inhibitor , the ikb .

we report difference in (ca2+)i requirement for nf-kb activation in thymocytes a compare to mature t cell .
furthermore , our result indicate that thymocytes have a constitutively active form of nf-kb , suggest that they be activate in vivo .
tramp , a novel apoptosis-mediating receptor with sequence homology to tumor necrosis factor receptor 1 and fa ( apo-1/cd95 ) .
a novel member of the tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) receptor family , designate tramp , have be identify .
the structural organization of the 393 amino acid long human tramp be most homologous to tnf receptor 1 .
tramp be abundantly express on thymocytes and lymphocyte .
it extracellular domain be compose of four cysteine-rich domain , and the cytoplasmic region contain a death domain know to signal apoptosis .
overexpression of tramp lead to two major response , nf-kappab activation and apoptosis .
tramp -induced cell death be inhibit by an inhibitor of ice-like protease , but not by bcl-2 .
in addition , tramp do not appear to interact with any of the known apoptosis -inducing ligand of the tnf family .
induction of nuclear factor kappa b/rel nuclear activity in human peripheral blood t lymphocyte by anti-hla class i monoclonal antibody .
monoclonal antibody against either monomorphic or polymorphic determinant of class i antigen induce in pbmc and highly purify t lymphocyte the nuclear activity of nf-kappa b/rel complex .
these include both p50/p50 and p50/p65 dimer , recognize by specific antibody in emsa .
