together , these result suggest that class i triggering can induce the activity of nf-kappa b/rel nuclear activity in peripheral blood t lymphocyte , thereby modulate the expression of gene regulate by these transcription factor .
mapping of the transcriptional repression domain of the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct-2a .
the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct-2a be implicate in b cell-specific transcriptional activity via the octamer motif .
structure/function analysis of various oct-2a effector region in the context of the gal4 dna-binding domain reveal that oct-2a contain two functionally different activation domain at the n and the c terminus .
the transcriptional activity of both domain be strongly potentiate by interaction with distinct b cell-specific coactivators .
recently , we have identify a repression domain located within the n terminus of oct-2a ( amino acid 2-99 ) .
when this domain be transfer to a potent activator , transcription be strongly inhibit .
in this study we present a deletion analysis of the n-terminal region of oct-2a to determine the minimal repression domain .
we identify a stretch of 23 amino acid , rich in serine and threonine residue , which be responsible for most of the repression activity .
we show that repression be strongly dependent on the type of enhancer present in the reporter plasmid as well a on the cell line test .
the possibility that oct-2a can act a an activator and/or a repressor may have important consequence for the function of oct-2a in b cell differentiation and other developmental process .
lp tolerance in monocytes/macrophages : three 3' cytosins be require in the dna binding motif for detection of upregulated nf-kappa b p50 homodimers .
when monocyte be stimulate with lp ( lipopolysaccharide ) repeatedly then the initially high expression of the tnf ( tumor necrosis factor ) gene be only very low , i.e. the cell be tolerant to lp .
tolerant cell still express the cd14 receptor and they can still be activate to mobilize nf-kappa b into nucleus .
analysis of the bind protein employ the -605 motif of the human tnf promoter ( ggggctgtccc ) reveal that in tolerant cell of the human monocytic cell line mono mac 6 there be a predominance of p50p50 of nf-kappa b .
we now show that a mutant motif that exchange the terminal 3' c for a g fail to bind the p50 homodimer that be upregulated in lp toler ant human mono mac 6 cell .
the same be true for nuclear extract take from the murine p388d1 macrophage cell line when test with the -516 motif of the murine tnf promoter ( gggggctttccc ) .
here the wild type motif give efficient binding of p50p50 that again be upregulated in tolerant cell whereas a mutant with a 3' g show hardly any binding of p50p50 .
conversely , the murine kappa light chain enhancer motif ( ggggactttccg ) do not efficiently bind the nuclear p50p50 from tolerant murine p388 macrophage .
binding be , however , readily detect when the 3' g be replace by a c .
these data show that the detection of upregulated p50 homodimers in lp tolerant cell be dependent on subtle difference in the sequence of the dna binding motif .
transcription factor effect on chromosome constitution of cell hybrid .
when immunoglobulin ( ig ) -secreting plasmacytoma be fuse to a t-cell lymphoma , ig gene expression cease in great than 95 % of the result hybrid .
in the rare hybrid that continue to express ig , all other test b lymphocyte-specific gene also remain active .
the low frequency with which these ig-expressing hybrid be recover , along with the fact that cell fusion can lead to chromosome loss , lead u to propose that this rare phenotype be due to loss of a t-cell-derived chromosome encode a factor or factor with gene silencing activity .
to identify the relevant chromosome , we have use a polymerase chain reaction ( pcr ) -assisted method of chromosome mapping to analyze both ig-silenced ( common ) and ig-expressing ( rare ) hybrid .
although no single chromosome be find to correlate with ig gene silencing , we discover that the two type of hybrid have undergo distinct pattern of chromosome loss .
moreover , we find that ectopic expression of a b-cell-specific transcription factor ( oct-2 ) dramatically alter both the phenotype and chromosome constitution of hybrid arise in these cell fusion .
glucocorticoid -mediated repression of cytokine gene transcription in human arteritis-scid chimera .
giant cell arteritis ( gca ) be a vasculitic syndrome that preferentially affect medium and large -sized artery .
glucocorticoid therapy resolve clinical symptom within hour to day , but therapy have to be continue over several year to prevent disease relapse .
it be not know whether and how glucocorticoid affect the function of the inflammatory infiltrate or why the disease persist subclinically despite chronic treatment .
gca be self-sustained in temporal artery engraft into scid mouse , provide a model in which the mechanism of action and limitation of glucocorticoid therapy can be examine in vivo .
administration of dexamethasone to temporal artery-scid chimera for 1 wk induce a partial suppression of t cell and macrophage function a indicate by the reduce tissue concentration of il-2 , il-1beta , and il-6 mrna , and by the diminish expression of inducible no synthase .
in contrast , synthesis of ifn-gamma mrna be only slightly decrease , and expression of tgf-beta1 be unaffected .
these finding correlate with activation of the ikappabalpha gene and blockade of the nuclear translocation of nfkappab in the xenotransplanted tissue .
dose-response experiment suggest that steroid dos currently use in clinical medicine be suboptimal in repress nfkappab -mediated cytokine production in the inflammatory lesion .
chronic steroid therapy be able to deplete the t cell product il-2 and ifn-gamma , whereas the activation of tissue-infiltrating macrophage be only partially affect .
il-1beta transcription be abrogate ; in contrast , tgf-beta1 mrna synthesis be steroid resistant .
the persistence of tgf-beta1-transcribing macrophage , despite paralysis of t cell function , may provide an explanation for the chronicity of the disease , and may identify a novel therapeutic target in this inflammatory vasculopathy .
regulation of il-4 expression by the transcription factor junb during t helper cell differentiation .
the molecular basis for restricted cytokine expression by t helper 1 ( th1 ) and t helper 2 ( th2 ) cell be unclear .
previous study find that p1 , an element of the interleukin 4 ( il-4 ) promoter that bind ap-1 , be important for th2-restricted il-4 expression .
here we show that junb , but not the other jun family member , be selectively induce in th2 cell and not in th1 cell during differentiation .
junb have previously be consider to be a negative regulator of transcription .
however , we show that junb bind directly to the p1 site and synergizes with c-maf to activate an il-4 luciferase reporter gene .
junb -control of il-4 expression be mediate by the phosphorylation of junb at thr 102 and - 104 by jnk map kinase .
the synergy between c-maf and junb can be attribute to cooperative dna binding , which be facilitate by junb phosphorylation .
in transgenic mouse , elevated junb level cause increase expression of several th2 cytokine in develop th1 cell .
junb also upregulated il-4 expression in response to immunization .
thus , the early increase of junb protein in th2 cell can provide the specificity for c-maf in il-4 expression during t cell development and direct thereby th2 differentiation .
hla-dr- , cd33+ , cd56+ , cd16- myeloid/natural killer cell acute leukemia : a previously unrecognized form of acute leukemia potentially misdiagnosed a french-american-british acute myeloid leukemia-m3 [ see comment ]
we have identify and characterize a previously unrecognized form of acute leukemia that share feature of both myeloid and natural killer ( nk ) cell .
from a consecutive series of 350 case of adult de novo acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) , we identify 20 case ( 6 % ) with a unique immunophenotype : cd33+ , cd56+ , cd11a+ , cd13lo , cd15lo , cd34+/- , hla-dr - , cd16 - .
multicolor flow cytometric assay confirm the coexpression of myeloid ( cd33 , cd13 , cd15 ) and nk cell-associated ( cd56 ) antigen in each case , whereas reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) assay confirm the identity of cd56 ( neural cell adhesion molecule ) in leukemic blast .
although two case express cd4 , no case express cd2 , cd3 , or cd8 and no case show clonal rearrangement of gene encode the t-cell receptor ( tcr beta , gamma , delta ) .
leukemic blast in the majority of case share unique morphologic feature ( deeply invaginated nuclear membrane , scant cytoplasm with fine azurophilic granularity , and finely granular sudan black b and myeloperoxidase cytochemical reactivity ) that be remarkably similar to those of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) ; particularly the microgranular variant ( fab aml -m3v ) .
however , all 20 case lack the t(15;17) and 17 case test lack the promyelocytic/retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar alpha ) fusion transcript in rt-pcr assay ; 12 case have 46,xx or 46,xy karyotype , whereas 2 case have abnormality of chromosome 17q : 1 with del(17)(q25) and the other with t(11;17)(q23;q21) and the promyelocytic leukemia zinc finger/ rar alpha fusion transcript .
all case test ( 6/20 ) , include the case with t(11;17) , fail to differentiate in vitro in response to all-trans retinoic acid ( atra ) , suggest that these case may account for some apls that have not show a clinical response to atra .
four of 6 case test show functional nk cell-mediated cytotoxicity , suggest a relationship between these unique cd33+ , cd56+ , cd16 - acute leukemia and normal cd56+ , cd16- nk precursor cell .
use a combination of panning and multiparameter flow cytometric sorting , we identify a normal cd56+ , cd33+ , cd16- counterpart cell at a frequency of 1 % to 2 % in the peripheral blood of healthy individual .
our study suggest that this form of acute leukemia may arise from transformation of a precursor cell common to both the myeloid and nk cell lineage ; thus we propose the designation myeloid/nk acute leukemia .
recognition of this new leukemic entity will be important in distinguish these atra -nonresponsive case from atra -responsive true apl .
[ change in leucocytic estrogen receptor level in patient with climacteric syndrome and therapeutic effect of liuwei dihuang pill ]
the number of estrogen receptor ( er ) in human peripheral leucocyte in 22 woman with climacteric syndrome be measure by radioligand method .
the result be compare with those of 12 normal child-bearing-age woman .
it wat find that the content of leucocytic er in climacteric syndrome patient be significantly low than normal child-bearing-age woman .
the author use a chinese prescription -- liuwei dihuang pill ( ldp ) to treat the patient for 2 month .
the number of leucocytic er be significantly increase after treatment .
the data indicate that decrease of er level in cell may involve in the pathogenesis of climacteric syndrome .
ldp not only increase plasma estradiol level , but also increase the leucocytic er level .
this may be the basis of the therapeutic effect on the disease .
identification of human tr2 orphan receptor response element in the transcriptional initiation site of the simian virus 40 major late promoter [ publish erratum appear in j biol chem 1995 nov 3 ; 270 ( 44 ) : 26721 ]
a dna response element ( tr2re-sv40 ) for the tr2 orphan receptor , a member of the steroid-thyroid hormone receptor superfamily , have be identify in the simian virus 40 ( sv40 ) +55 region ( nucleotide number 368-389 , 5'-gttaaggttcgtaggtcatgga-3' ) .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay , use in vitro translate tr2 orphan receptor with a molecular mass of 67 kilodaltons , show a specific binding with high affinity ( dissociation constant = 9 nm ) for this dna sequence .
dna-swap experiment use chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase assay demonstrate that androgen can suppress the transcriptional activity of sv40 early promoter via the interaction between this tr2re- sv40 and the chimeric receptor ar/tr2/ar with the dna-binding domain of the tr2 orphan receptor flank by the n-terminal and androgen-binding domain of the androgen receptor .
in addition , this tr2re- sv40 can function a a repressor to suppress the transcriptional activity of both sv40 early and late promoter .
together , these data suggest the tr2re- sv40 may represent the first identify natural dna response element for the tr2 orphan receptor that may function a a repressor for the sv40 gene expression .
dna triplex formation selectively inhibit granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor gene expression in human t cell .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be a hemopoietic growth factor that be express in activate t cell , fibroblast , macrophage , and endothelial cell .
although gm-csf do not appear to be essential for normal hemopoiesis , overexpression of gm-csf have be implicate in the pathogenesis of some disease such a myeloid leukemia and chronic inflammation .
an nf-kappab /rel binding site within the gm-csf promoter , term the kappab element appear to be important for control expression in reporter gene assay in response to a number of stimulus in t cell .
we investigate oligonucleotide -directed triple helix formation across this regulatory sequence a a potential tool to inhibit gm-csf gene transcription .
a 15-base oligonucleotide , gm3 , be target to a purine-rich region in the gm-csf proximal promoter , which overlap the kappab element .
gel mobility shift assay and dnase i footprinting demonstrate that gm3 form a sequence-specific collinear triplex with it double-stranded dna target .
triplex formation by gm3 block recombinant and nuclear nf-kappab protein bind to the gm-csf element .
gm3 also cause selective inhibition of the human t-cell lymphotrophic virus-1 tax transactivator-induced luciferase activity from a reporter construct drive by the gm-csf promoter in jurkat t cell .
finally , gm3 greatly reduce the concentration of endogenous gm-csf mrna induce by different stimulus in jurkat t cell but do not affect interleukin 3 mrna level in the same cell .
we conclude that the kappab element in the gm-csf promoter play a central role in the transcriptional activation of the endogenous gm-csf gene .
colinear triplex formation act a a selective transcriptional repressor of the gm-csf gene and may have potential therapeutic application in case of undesirable overexpression of this protein .
low cd3+cd28-induced interleukin-2 production correlate with decrease reactive oxygen intermediate formation in neonatal t cell .
the capacity of neonatal t cell to secrete interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) have be report to be variable .
we analyse il-2 production in purify neonatal and adult t cell use polyclonal activator phorbol ester + calcium ionophore ( pdbu + iono ) or receptor-mediated anti-cd3 /anti-cd3+ anti-cd28 stimulation .
pdbu + iono induce equally high il-2 level in both group and , when stimulate with plate-bound anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) , the il-2 secretion by neonatal cell be undetectable and adult cell produce low amount of il-2 ( mean 331 +/- 86 pg/ml ) .
the addition of anti-cd28 mab to anti-cd3-stimulated cell markedly increase il-2 production in both cell type , but level of il-2 in neonatal t cell remain clearly low than those of adult t cell ( respective mean value : 385 +/- 109 pg/ml and 4494 +/- 1199 pg/ml ) .
a nf-kappa b be a critical transcription factor in the control of il-2 expression , we next analyse it nuclear translocation in neonatal and adult t cell use the electrophoretic mobility shift assay and , because induction of reactive oxygen intermediate ( roi ) be require for the activation of nf-kappa b , we also analyse level of intracellular roi in these cell use the roi -reactive fluorochrome dcfh-da and flow cytometry .
in neonatal t cell nf-kappa b activation and roi formation after anti-cd3 stimulation be low compare with adult t cell and , although addition of anti-cd28 mab increase induction of nf-kappa b and roi formation , level similar to those of adult be not achieve .
after pdbu + iono stimulation , the cell show similar roi formation and il-2 secretion .
our result suggest that reduce il-2 production by neonatal t cell be specific for anti-cd3 and anti-cd3 + anti-cd28 -mediated stimulation and that these activator can not effectively activate the roi -nf-kappa b signalling pathway in neonatal t cell .
soluble factor secrete by activate t-lymphocytes modulate the transcription of the immunosuppressive cytokine tgf-beta 2 in glial cell .
coordination of the immune response to injury or disease in the brain be postulate to involve bi-directional discourse between the immune system and the central nervous system .
this cross communication involve soluble mediator , include various growth factor , cytokine , and neuropeptides .
in this report , we demonstrate that the supernatant from activate t-lymphocytes be able to induce the transcription of a potent cytokine , tgf-beta 2 in glial cell .
the activate stimulus invoke signaling mechanism distinct from known kinase or protease pathway .
activation of tgf-beta 2 transcription correlate with the loss of binding activity for an 80 kda glial labile repressor protein , glrp , to a responsive region within the tfg-beta 2 promoter .
although glrp share some characteristic with the inducible transcription factor ap-1 , it appear to be distinct from known ap-1 family member .
these data along with previous observation demonstrate the potent immunosuppressive activity of tgf-beta 2 , support a model for a feedback mechanism between the activate t-lymphocytes and astrocyte via tgf-beta 2 to regulate the immune response .
a low nm23.h1 gene expression identify high malignancy human melanoma .
the nm23 gene have be propose a a metastasis-suppressor gene , and it use have be suggest a prognostic factor .
nm23 be identify in a system of murine melanoma cell line , in which an inverse relationship be find between nm23 expression and metastatic ability .
in a human malignant melanoma study nm23 expression be find to be significantly low in metastasis that develop less than 24 month after diagnosis of the primary tumour .
the present paper study the expression of the nm23 .h1 gene in cell line which derive from primary or metastatic human malignant melanoma in relation to staging , infiltration degree , lymphocytic infiltration , cell morphology , cell pigmentation , karyotype , and disease-free survival .
the level of mrna expression of the nm23 gene be significantly low in cell line that derive from more infiltrate primary melanoma than in cell line obtain from less infiltrating tumour .
moreover , cell line derive from tumour of patient with a disease-free survival of more than 24 month ( 24-58 month ) express the nm23 gene at high level than cell line obtain from melanoma of patient with a disease-free survival of less than 24 month ( 6-15 month ) .
protective effect of notch-1 on tcr -induced apoptosis .
the notch receptor protein be originally identify in drosophila and be know to mediate cell to cell communication and influence cell fate decision .
member of this family have be isolate from invertebrate as well a vertebrate .
we isolate mouse notch-1 in a yeast two-hybrid screen with nur77 , which be a protein that have be show previously to be require for apoptosis in t cell line .
the data present below indicate that notch-1 expression provide significant protection to t cell line from tcr -mediated apoptosis .
these data demonstrate a new antiapoptotic role for notch-1 , provide evidence that , in addition to regulate cell fate decision , notch-1 can play a critical role in control level of cell death in t cell .
nuclear factor-kappab activation in human monocyte stimulate with lipopolysaccharide be inhibit by fibroblast conditioned medium and exogenous pge2 .
the nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) be think to be crucially involve in the gene activation of several cytokine , include tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf ) .
previously , we show that fibroblast conditioned medium ( fcm ) be able to inhibit both tnf mrna accumulation and protein release in peripheral blood-derived human monocyte ( pbm ) stimulate with lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
in this study we have investigate the effect of fcm on the lp -induced dna-binding activity of nf-kappab , by mean of electrophoretic shift assay ( emsa ) .
we provide evidence that fcm strongly inhibit the lp -induced nf-kappab activation in pbm .
furthermore , we show that exogenous pge2 mimic the nf-kappab inhibitory effect of fcm .
on the other hand , fcm produce in the presence of indomethacin do not inhibit nf-kappab activation by lp .
our result lend further support to the hypothesis that inflammatory and immune response of monocytes/macrophages may be modulate at the molecular level by signal originate from tissue structural cell such a fibroblast .
signalling into the t-cell nucleus : nfat regulation .
the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) play an important role in t-cell biology .
activation of t cell result in the rapid calcineurin -dependent translocation of nfat transcription factor from the cytoplasm to the nucleus .
this translocation process couple to the subsequent active maintenance of nfat in the nucleus compartment be critical for the induction of expression of several gene encode cytokine and membrane protein that modulate immune response .
the molecular cloning of the nfat family of transcription factor have facilitate rapid progress in the understanding of the signalling mechanism that control the activity of nfat .
gata-1 dna binding activity be down-regulated in late s phase in erythroid cell .
we have set out to test a model for tissue-specific gene expression that rely on the early replication of express gene to sequester limit activate transcription factor .
use an erythroid cell line , we have test the change in the dna binding activity of the lineage-restricted transcription factor gata-1 through the cell cycle .
we find that gata-1 activity be low in g1 , peak in mid-s phase , and then decrease in g2/m .
in contrast , the binding activity of two ubiquitous transcription factor , oct1 and sp1 , remain high in g2/m .
gata-1 protein and mrna vary in a similar manner through the cell cycle , suggest that the expression of the gene or the stability of it message be regulate .
although a number of transcription factor involve in the control of the cell cycle or dna replication have be show to peak in s phase , this be the first example of a lineage-restricted transcription factor display s phase -specific dna binding activity .
one interpretation of these data lead to a model in which the peak in gata-1 dna binding amplify the effect of early replication on the activation of erythroid-specific gene at the same time a prevent activation of non-erythroid gene contain gata-responsive element .
these result may also relate to recent data implicate gata-1 function in apoptosis and cell cycle progression
e2f-1 and a cyclin-like dna repair enzyme , uracil-dna glycosylase , provide evidence for an autoregulatory mechanism for transcription .
the cell cycle-dependent transcription factor , e2f-1 , regulate the cyclin -like specie of the dna repair enzyme uracil-dna glycosylase ( udg ) gene in human osteosarcoma ( saos-2 ) cell .
we demonstrate , through the deletion of the human udg promoter sequence , that expression of e2f-1 activate the udg promoter through several e2f site .
the major putative downstream site for e2f , located in the first exon , serve a a target for e2f-1/dp1 complex binding in vitro .
we also provide evidence for the functional relationship between the cyclin-like udg gene product and e2f .
high level of udg expression in a transient transfection assay result in the down-regulation of transcriptional activity through element specific for e2f -mediated transcription .
overexpression of udg in saos 2 cell be observe to delay growth late in g1 phase and transiently arrest these cell from progress into the s phase .
this hypothetical model integrate one mechanism of dna repair with the cell cycle control of gene transcription , likely through e2f .
this implicate e2f a a multifunctional target for protein and enzyme , possibly , responsive to dna damage through the negative effect of udg on e2f -mediated transcriptional activity .
kinetics of nuclear translocation and turnover of the vitamin d receptor in human hl60 leukemia cell and peripheral blood lymphocyte -- coincident rise of dna-relaxing activity in nuclear extract .
high affinity receptor ( vdr ) for 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol ( calcitriol ) be express in hl60 human leukemia cell and in low number in peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) .
hl60 cell , express some characteristic of promyelocytes , can be induce to monocytoid differentiation by calcitriol .
specific nuclear translocation of [3h]calcitriol/vdr be examine after exposure of whole cell to 10 ( -9 ) m/l calcitriol in the presence and absence of a 500-fold excess of unlabeled ligand and subsequent isolation of nucleus .
specific nuclear translocation of [3h]calcitriol/vdr be find to be time dependent reach a maximum of approximately 2100 bind sites/nucleus after 3 h of incubation in hl60 cell , whereas a maximum of approximately 310 bind sites/nucleus be find after 3 h in pbl .
pulse exposure of hl60 to radiolabeled hormone for 3 h follow by culture in medium without serum and calcitriol lead to nuclear retention of approximately 1600 radiolabeled vdr by 8 h and approximately 1000 vdr by 24 h .
radiolabeled vdr disappear from the nuclear compartment with a halflife of approximately 30 min if cell be culture with identical concentration of unlabeled hormone after the pulse ( pulse/chase-experiments ) .
no difference of vdr retention in pulse and pulse/chase-experiments be see in pbl , where vdr halflife be approximately 30 min .
no specific translocation into the nuclear compartment be see when isolate nucleus be incubate in [3h]calcitriol .
radiolabeled hormone/receptor complex of nucleus isolate from cell expose for 3 h to radiolabeled hormone -- in contrast to identical experiment with intact cell -- do not disappear from the nuclear compartment upon incubation of nucleus with identical concentration of the unlabeled compound .
the activity of dna relaxing enzyme ( e.g. topoisomerases i and ii ) in nuclear extract be measure use a pbr 322-relaxation-assay .
enhance overall enzyme activity be find in nuclear extract by 1 h after incubation with calcitriol ( final ethanol concentration 0.0001 % v/v ) in hl60 and pbl .
the enhance activity disappear after 2 h in pbl , whereas it be still enhance by 4 h in hl60 .
no effect be see in ethanol treated control .
we conclude that a specific nuclear translocation mechanism exist for calcitriol in both cell type examine , most likely due to translocation of receptor protein after hormone binding .
translocate hormone/receptor complex compete for a limited number of specific nuclear bind site .
enhance activity of topoisomerases in nuclear extract upon translocation of vdr might reflect interaction of both within the nuclear compartment , thus initiate dna-unwinding , a prerequisite of transcription initiation .
cellular and molecular mechanism of ifn-gamma production induce by il-2 and il-12 in a human nk cell line .
interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) be an important immunoregulatory protein produce predominantly by t cell and large granular lymphocyte ( lgl ) in response to different extracellular signal .
in particular , two interleukin ( il ) , il-2 and il-12 , have be show to be potent inducer of ifn-gamma gene expression in both t cell and lgl .
although it have be report that there be some t cell line that produce ifn-gamma in response to il-2 and il-12 stimulation , there have as yet be no report of a natural killer ( nk ) cell line that respond in a similar manner .
in this report we present evidence that the cell line nk3.3 derive from human nk cell , respond to both il-2 and il-12 , a measure by increase in ifn-gamma and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) cytoplasmic mrna and protein expression .
in addition , when use together il-2 and il-12 synergized in the induction of ifn-gamma and gm-csf and this synergy be attribute to an increase accumulation and stability of the ifn-gamma and gm-csf mrna .
to investigate the signaling pathway involve in the gene induction , five inhibitor , cyclosporin a ( csa ) , transform growth factor-beta , cycloheximide , genistein , and staurosporine a , be use in analyze the effect of il-2 and il-12 on nk3.3 cell .
the result suggest that activation of protein kinase c , but not new protein synthesis , be require for il-2 induction of ifn-gamma and gm-csf cytoplasmic mrna .
in contrast , il-12 induction of ifn-gamma cytoplasmic mrna appear to only partially depend on activation of protein kinase c .
furthermore , both transform growth factor-beta and genistein , a tyrosine kinase inhibitor , could suppress il-2 and il-12 signaling but csa be generally inactive .
it also be observe that suppression of cytokine gene expression by these agent be independent of the inhibition of proliferation .
in addition , il-2 but not il-12 induce nuclear factor nf-kappa b and ap1 , and regulation of the nuclear level of these two dna binding protein complex be correlate with ifn-gamma and gm-csf gene expression .
these data indicate that il-2 and il-12 may have distinct signaling pathway lead to the induction of ifn-gamma and gm-csf gene expression , and that the nk3.3 cell line may serve a a novel model for dissect the biochemical and molecular event involve in these pathway .
constitutive activation of different jak tyrosine kinase in human t cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) tax protein or virus-transformed cell .
htlv-1 infection cause an adult t cell leukemia in human .
the viral encode protein tax , be think to play an important role in oncogenesis .
our previous data obtain from a tax transgenic mouse model reveal that tax transform mouse fibroblast but not thymocytes , despite comparable level of tax expression in both tissue .
constitutive tyrosine phosphorylation of a 130-kd protein ( s ) be observe in the tax transformed fibroblast b line and in htlv-1 transformed human lymphoid line , but not in thymocytes from thy-tax transgenic mouse .
phosphotyrosine immunoprecipitation follow by western blot analysis with a set of jak kinase specific antibody , identify p130 a jak2 in the tax transformed mouse fibroblastic cell line and jak3 in htlv-1 transformed human t cell line .
phosphorylation of jak2 in tax transformed cell result from high expression of il-6 .
tyrosine phosphorylation of this protein could also be induce in balb/c3t3 cell use a supernatant from the b line , which be associate with induction of cell proliferation .
both phosphorylation and proliferation be inhibit by il-6 neutralizing antibody .
constitutive phosphorylation of jak kinase may facilitate tumor growth in both htlv-1 infected human t cell and the transgenic mouse model .
mouse deficient for the 55 kd tumor necrosis factor receptor be resistant to endotoxic shock , yet succumb to l. monocytogenes infection .
the multiple biological activity of tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) be mediate by two distinct cell surface receptor of 55 kd ( tnfrp55 ) and 75 kd ( tnfrp75 ) .
use gene targeting , we generate a tnfrp55 -deficient mouse strain .
cell from tnfrp55-/-mutant mouse lack expression of tnfrp55 but display normal number of high affinity tnfrp75 molecule .
thymocyte development and lymphocyte population be unaltered , and clonal deletion of potentially self-reactive t cell be not impaired .
however , tnf signaling be largely abolish , a judge by the failure of tnf to induce nf-kappa b in t lymphocyte from tnfrp55 -deficient mouse .
the loss of tnfrp55 function render mouse resistant to lethal dosage of either lipopolysaccharides or s. aureus enterotoxin b .
in contrast , tnfrp55-deficient mouse be severely impaired to clear l. monocytogenes and readily succumb to infection .
thus , the 55 kd tnfr play a decisive role in the host 's defense against microorganism and their pathogenic factor .
t cell priming enhance il-4 gene expression by increase nuclear factor of activate t cell .
the repetitive activation of t cell ( priming ) enhance the expression of many cytokine , such a il-4 , but not others , such a il-2 .
molecular mechanism underlie selective expression of cytokine by t cell remain poorly understand .
here we show that priming of cd4 t cell selectively enhance il-4 expression relative to il-2 expression by a transcriptional mechanism involve nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) protein .
a detect by in vivo footprinting , priming markedly increase the activation-dependent engagement of the p0 and p1 nfat-binding element of the il-4 promoter .
moreover , each proximal p element be essential for optimal il-4 promoter activity .
activate prim cd4 t cell contain more nfat1 and support great nfat -directed transcription than unprimed cd4 t cell , while activator protein 1 binding and activator protein 1 -mediated transcription by both cell type be similar .
increase expression of wild-type nfat1 substantially increase il-4 promoter activity in unprimed cd4 t cell , suggest nfat1 may be limit for il-4 gene expression in this cell type .
furthermore , a truncated form of nfat1 act a a dominant-negative , reduce il-4 promoter activity in prim cd4 t cell and confirm the importance of endogenous nfat to increase il-4 gene expression by effector t cell .
nfat1 appear to be the major nfat family member responsible for the initial increase expression of il-4 by prim cd4 t cell .
surfactant suppress nf-kappa b activation in human monocytic cell .
in addition to biophysical property , pulmonary surfactant have immunomodulatory activity .
we previously demonstrate that both synthetic ( exosurf ) and modify natural surfactant ( survanta ) downregulated endotoxin-stimulated inflammatory c ytokine mrna level and protein product ( tumor necrosis factor-alpha [ tnf ] , interleukin-1-beta [ il-1 ] , interleukin-6 [ il-6 ] ) in human alveolar macrophage .
in this study , we report that both exosurf and survanta suppress tnf mrna and secretion ( 85 +/- 4 % mean percent inhibition +/- sem by exosurf ; 71 +/- 6 % by survanta ) by endotoxin-stimulated thp-1 , a human monocytic cell line .
because surfactant downregulated inflammatory cytokine production similarly in both normal human alveolar macrophage and the thp-1 cell line , we use this cell line to investigate whether surfactant affect transcriptional mechanism .
specifically , we examine nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation because it be crucial in transcriptional regulation of many inflammatory cytokine gene include tnf , il-1 , and il-6 .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay show that both surfactant decrease activation of nf-kappa b .
the presence of both p65 and p50 nf-kappa b component in lp -activated thp-1 cell be confirm by specific antibody induction of supershifts in mobility assay .
these result be the first to suggest that surfactant 's suppressive effect on inflammatory cytokine production may involve transcriptional regulation through inhibition of nf-kappa b activation .
susceptibility to natural killer cell and down regulation of mhc class i expression in adenovirus 12 transform cell be regulate by different e1a domain .
all human adenovirus transform rodent cell in vitro , but only cell transform by serotypes belong to subgroup a ( ad12 ) and b ( ad3 ) be tumorigenic for immunocompetent animal .
in these cell , the expression of mhc-class i antigen be repress and might allow them to escape from recognition by cytotoxic t lymphocyte ( ctl ) and to develop in tumor .
furthermore , these cell line appear resistant to lysis by natural killer ( nk ) cell .
to determine the e1a domain ( s ) responsible for these property several cell line be create by transform baby rat kidney ( brk ) cell with a set of plasmid express different ad2/ad12 hybrid e1a gene product .
the mhc class 1 gene expression be inhibit in cell express the ad12 13 mrna product and in cell transform with ad2/ad12 hybrid e1a gene product harbor the c-terminal part of the conserve region ( cr ) 3 of ad12 .
susceptibility of these transform cell line to nk cell be determine by cytolytic assay .
the result obtain suggest that two ad12 e1a domain be require to induce resistance of the cell line to nk cell .
il-10 inhibit nuclear factor-kappa b/rel nuclear activity in cd3-stimulated human peripheral t lymphocyte .
il-10 markedly reduce nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b/rel nuclear activity induce in pbmc by stimulation with the anti-cd3 mab okt3 .
the inhibition be exert specifically on the nf-kappa b/rel activation induce by mab okt3 , and not that produce by pma .
a judge by supershifting the dna-protein complex with ab recognize specific component of the nf-kappa b/rel protein family , the p50/p65 ( rel a ) heterodimeric form of nf-kappa b be primarily affect .
the maximal effect be observe at the il-10 concentration of 20 u/ml .
il-10 inhibitory activity be exert on t lymphocyte and be mediate by monocyte .
indeed , monocyte pretreated with il-10 be able so inhibit nf-kappa b nuclear activity in purify t lymphocyte stimulate with okt3 .
soluble factor do not appear to be involve in the mechanism of inhibition .
on the other hand , the up-regulation of cd80 ag , find on monocyte obtain from pbmc incubate with okt3 , be not detect after addition of il-10 , and the anti-cd28 mab clb-cd28/1 restore the nf-kappa b/rel nuclear activity in il-10 -inhibited lymphocyte .
therefore , the nf-kappa b/rel inhibition might be ascribe to a lack of cooperation between accessory cell and t lymphocyte , result from down-regulation of a costimulatory molecule , such a cd80 , produce by il-10 on activate monocyte .
our result demonstrate that il-10 can inhibit the induction of nf-kappa b/rel nuclear activity in cd3-stimulated t lymphocyte .
since inappropriate activation of kappa b-driven gene have a physiopathologic role in a number of disease , such a hiv infection , our finding support the possibility of use this cytokine to suppress an undesirable activation of these transcription factor .
spontaneous occurrence of early region 1a reiteration mutant of type 5 adenovirus in persistently infected human t-lymphocytes .
mutant of type 5 adenovirus ( ad5 ) with reiterate dna sequence in the e1a region appear in a human t-lymphocyte cell line , molt-4 , persistently infect with h5sub304 , a deletion/substitution mutant that have a wild-type phenotype in viral replication .
endonuclease analysis and dna sequencing reveal dna reiteration in each mutant .
in the four representative mutant investigate , the dna reiteration all start within a six-base-pair consensus sequence , g ( or c ) ctgtg , located in the second exon of the e1a region ( at nt 1333 , 1367 , or 1419 ) .
there be not any dna homology between the breakpoints in the second exon and the inserting sequence ( start at nt 532 , 710 , or 792 ) .
northern analysis suggest that the reiterate splicing site of the representative mutant be all use in rna splicing , and the close donor and recipient joint be use most frequently .
these observation imply that during persistent infection ad5 undergo spontaneous mutation by sequence-specific breakage and nonhomologous end-end joining recombination event .
these e1a reiteration mutant could be propagate in hela , a549 , and kb cell ; they be genetically stable ; and they kill cref cell at a strikingly high frequency .
preliminary observation tend to correlate this cref cell killing with the accumulation of the early viral protein and/or viral dna in the infected cell .
this degree of cell damage be not observe in ad5wt or h5sub304 infection of cref cell .
the observe e1a reiteration provide a model to gain insight into understand the evolutionary event of some , if not all , adenovirus type during many year of symbiotic , persistent relationship in human tonsil and adenoid and possibly other lymphoid organ .
identification of bcd , a novel proto-oncogene express in b-cells .
a novel b-cell derived ( bcd ) oncogene have be isolate from the peripheral blood lymphocyte of one b-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( b-cll ) patient use dna transfer and a mouse tumorigenicity assay .
the bcd proto-oncogene be activate by a truncation in the 5' utr .
it predict for two open reading frame ( orfs ) .
orf1 consist of 240 bp that would encode 80 amino acid , while the major orf2 consist of 648 bp capable of cod for 216 amino acid .
predict peptide sequence of orf2 contain a zinc finger domain which show significant homology to gc box binding protein bteb2 and sp1 .
transfection of an expression vector contain orf2 but not full length cdna be able to transform nih3t3 cell and induce tumor in nude mouse .
bcd mrna transcript of < or = 2.6 kb be selectively express in pbl and testis of healthy individual .
within the pbl , bcd gene expression be restricted to cd19+ b-cells and absent from cd14+ monocyte and t-cells .
bcd transcript be detect in all normal pbl sample test but not in several malignant human b-cell line and not in 50 % of b-cells from b-cll patient .
however , stimulation of b-cells from b-cll patient under condition which induce differentiation into plasma cell be associate with induction of bcd gene expression .
the bcd gene may therefore play an important role in b-cell growth and development .
alteration of structural order of human erythrocyte ghost membrane by glucocorticoid and the influence of the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist ru 486 .
high-dose pulse glucocorticoid therapy have be use successfully in the clinic in severe pathological condition for about 20 year .
the mode of glucocorticoid action after administration of such megadoses be inexplicable up to now .
it be suppose that some effect may be due to membrane alteration .
in the present in-vitro experiment the effect of dexamethasone , of further glucocorticoid , and of the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist ru 486 , on structural order of human erythrocyte ghost membrane be investigate by determine the steady-state fluorescence anisotropy of diphenylhexatriene ( dph ) .
dexamethasone be find to induce a significant decrease in membrane structural order at concentration of about 10(-6) m in a concentration-dependent manner .
we find a correlation between the uptake of dexamethasone by the ghost membrane and the decrease in the structural order .
the other glucocorticoid test , methylprednisolone and corticosterone , be also effective at concentration of 10(-5) m or great .
we observe no change in membrane structural order with ru 486 up to a concentration of 10(-4) m .
however , simultaneous incubation of ru 486 with dexamethasone cause a distinct interference of ru 486 with dexamethasone .
thus , the glucocorticoid -induced membrane perturbation , the possibility to inhibit it by ru 486 , and the inactivity of the structurally related progesterone , refer to relatively specific bind site for the glucocorticoid in the membrane of erythrocyte ghost .
interleukin 1beta mediate the modulatory effect of monocyte on lncap human prostate cancer cell .
proliferative and secretory response in androgen-sensitive prostate cancer lncap cell be regulate by steroid and peptide hormone and by differentiation-promoting substance .
in the present study , we evaluate whether peripheral blood monocyte that exhibit anti-tumour activity in haematopoietic and solid tumour influence growth and secretion in the lncap cell line .
for this purpose , lncap cell be incubate with monocyte-conditioned medium ( mcm ) , and proliferation as well a expression of androgen receptor ( ar ) and secretion of prostate-specific antigen ( psa ) be assess .
conditioned medium from monocyte reduce proliferation in a dose-dependent manner .
incubation with 40 % mcm cause a 50 % reduction in cell proliferation .
ar protein decrease by 70 % and psa level in supernatant from lncap cell be reduce by approximately 80 % follow treatment with mcm .
we focus on the contribution of two major product of activate monocyte , prostaglandin e2 and interleukin 1beta ( il-1beta ) , to the mcm modulatory action .
lncap cell treat with prostaglandin e2 show neither a reduction in proliferation nor a down-regulation of ar and psa level .
the effect of mcm on cellular proliferation , ar protein and psa secretion be abolish by pretreatment of mcm with a neutralize anti- il-1beta antibody .
in addition , recombinant il-1beta be able to replace mcm for the inhibition of proliferation and down-regulation of ar and psa protein .
lncap cell be show to express the il-1beta receptor type 1 , which transduce il-1beta signal .
our finding reveal that monocyte-derived il-1beta inhibit the proliferation of androgen-responsive prostate tumour cell and reduce ar and psa level .
an interleukin-4-induced transcription factor : il-4 stat .
interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) be an immunomodulatory cytokine secrete by activate t lymphocyte , basophil , and mast cell .
it play an important role in modulate the balance of t helper ( th ) cell subset , favor expansion of the th2 lineage relative to th1 .
imbalance of these t lymphocyte subset have be implicate in immunological disease include allergy , inflammation , and autoimmune disease .
il-4 may mediate it biological effect , at least in part , by activate a tyrosine-phosphorylated dna binding protein .
this protein have now be purify and it encoding gene clone .
examination of the primary amino acid sequence of this protein indicate that it be a member of the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) family of dna binding protein , hereby designate il-4 stat .
study of the inhibitory activity of phosphotyrosine-containing peptide derive from the intracellular domain of the il-4 receptor provide evidence for direct coupling of receptor and transcription factor during the il-4 stat activation cycle .
such observation indicate that il-4 stat have the same functional domain for both receptor coupling and dimerization .
reversal of apoptosis by the leukaemia-associated e2a-hlf chimaeric transcription factor .
the e2a-hlf ( for hepatic leukaemia factor ) fusion gene , form by action of the t(17;19)_(q22;p13) chromosomal translocation , drive the leukaemic transformation of early b-cell precursor , but the mechanism of this activity remain unknown .
here we report that human leukaemia cell carry the translocation t(17;19) rapidly die by apoptosis when program to express a dominant-negative suppressor of the fusion protein e2a-hlf , indicate that the chimaeric oncoprotein probably affect cell survival rather than cell growth .
moreover , when introduce into murine pro-b lymphocyte , the oncogenic e2a-hlf fusion protein reverse both interleukin-3-dependent and p53-mediated apoptosis .
the close homology of the basic region/leucine zipper ( bzip ) dna-binding and dimerization domain of hlf to that of the ces-2 cell-death specification protein of caenorhabditis elegans suggest a model of leukaemogenesis in which e2a-hlf block an early step within an evolutionarily conserve cell-death pathway .
evaluation of the respiratory epithelium of normal and individual with cystic fibrosis for the presence of adenovirus e1a sequence relevant to the use of e1a-_adenovirus vector for gene therapy for the respiratory manifestation of cystic fibrosis .
lung disease associate with disorder such a cystic fibrosis ( cf ) may be amenable to somatic gene therapy in which there be delivery of the normal gene directly to the respiratory epithelium use e1a-_adenovirus ( ad ) type 2- or 5-based vector .
for safety reason , the ad vector be render replication deficient by deletion of the e1a region .
because there be the theoretical possibility of an e1a-_replication-deficient vector replicate a a result of recombination or complementation with ad 2/5 e1a sequence present in the target cell , this study be direct toward evaluate respiratory epithelium of normal and individual with cf for the presence of e1a sequence .
use ad 2/5 e1a-specific primer and the polymerase chain reaction to evaluate dna recover from freshly isolate nasal and bronchial epithelium recover by brushing , e1a sequence be detect in respiratory epithelium of 19 of 91 normal ( 21 % ) .
in the e1a-positive sample , the average of e1a copy number be 55 +/- 18/10(3) recover cell .
in cf individual , 7 of 52 ( 13 % ) have detectable e1a sequence in the respiratory epithelium , with e1a copy number in the positive sample of 80 +/- 21/10(3) recover cell .
these result demonstrate that there be detectable ad 2/5 e1a sequence in the respiratory epithelium of a small percentage of normal and individual with cf .
because of the theoretical potential of such sequence support replication of e1a- ad vector , human gene therapy protocol for cf utilize such vector should consider evaluate study individual for the presence of ad 2/5 e1a sequence in the respiratory epithelium .
inhibition of protein phosphatase by okadaic acid induce ap1 in human t cell .
to examine the role of protein phosphatase in t cell activation , jurkat cell be treat with okadaic acid , an inhibitor of type 1 and 2a phosphatase , and nuclear extract be examine for the presence of ap1 a a measure of early t cell activation .
okadaic acid be find to be a potent inducer of ap1 .
in contrast to phorbol ester such a phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) , the induction of ap1 by okadaic acid occur predominantly by transcriptional activation of the jun and fo family of proto-oncogene .
surprisingly , while the addition of phytohemagglutinin far enhance the induction of ap1 , the addition of pma inhibit it .
okadaic acid treatment be find to dramatically increase mrna transcript of the jun family of proto-oncogene include c-jun , jund , and junb and to a less extent the fo family include c-fos and fra-1 .
by comparison , pma be a very inefficient inducer of the jun gene family in jurkat cell .
similar to it effect on the induction of ap1 by okadaic acid , pma inhibit the induction of c-jun mrna by okadaic acid .
transfection of c-jun promoter construct confirm the marked difference between pma and okadaic acid in induce c-jun transcription .
the induction of ap1 by okadaic acid suggest that protein phosphatase 1 and 2a ( pp1 and pp2a ) may be involve in t cell activation a important negative regulator of the transcription factor ap1 .
functional characterization of the murine homolog of the b cell-specific coactivator bob.1/obf.1 .
b cell-specific transcriptional promoter activity mediate by the octamer motif require the oct1 or oct2 protein and additional b cell-restricted cofactor .
one such cofactor , bob.1/obf.1 , be recently isolate from human b cell .
here , we describe the isolation and detailed characterization of the murine homolog .
full-length cdna and genomic clone be isolate , and the gene structure be determine . comparison of the deduce amino acid show 88 % sequence identity between mouse and human bob.1/obf.1 .
the nh2-terminal 126 amino acid of bob.1/obf.1 be both essential and sufficient for interaction with the pou domain of either oct1 or oct2 .
this protein-protein interaction do not require the simultaneous binding of oct protein to dna , and high resolution footprinting of the oct -dna interaction reveal that binding of bob.1/obf.1 to oct1 or oct2 do not alter the interaction with dna .
bob.1/obf.1 can efficiently activate octamer-dependent promoter in fibroblast ; however , it fail to stimulate octamer-dependent enhancer activity .
fusion of subdomains of bob.1/obf.1 with the gal4 dna binding domain reveal that both nh2- and cooh- terminal domain of bob.1/obf.1 contribute to full transactivation function , the cooh-terminal domain be more efficient in this transactivation assay .
consistent with the failure of full-length bob.1/obf.1 to stimulate octamer-dependent enhancer element in non b cell , the gal4 fusion likewise only stimulate from a promoter-proximal position .
a new variant translocation in acute promyelocytic leukaemia : molecular characterization and clinical correlation .
translocation t(15;17)(q22;q21 ) be an acquire clonal cytogenetic change present in almost all case of acute promelocytic leukemia ( apl ) .
the molecular genetic basis of the translocation support it integral role in pathogenesis .
we describe a patient with apl in whom the leukaemic clone be characterize by a true variant of the classical t(15;17) .
the patient whose disease have numerous atypical clinical feature , have t(11;17)(q13;121) .
the chromosome 17 breakpoint be localized to intron 2 of rara by southern blotting , and there be no evidence at the molecular level for rearrangement at pml locus .
these data , along with previous report of rare variant translocation in apl , indicate that while dysregulation of rara by gene fusion may be essential for the apl phenotype , the particular fusion partner may determine clinicopathological aspect , include presentation , response to treatment with all-trans retinoic acid ( atra ) , and prognosis .
this heterogeneity suggest that the variant fusion partner of rara in apl encode factor with property both common to and distinct from those of pml .
investigation of these factor promise to shed light on the complex development pathway involve in the regulation of haematopoiesis .
induction of proto-oncogene and cytokine expression in human peripheral blood monocyte and the monocytic cell line thp-1 after stimulation with mycoplasma-derived material mdhm .
mycoplasma fermentans-derived high-molecular-weight material ( mdhm ) be originally describe to induce differentiation of murine thymocytes to cytolytic effector t-cells by stimulate il-6 release from adherent cell .
this study show that human peripheral blood monocyte ( pbmo ) also respond to mdhm with increase in il-1 beta , il-6 and tnf alpha expression , both at the mrna and protein level .
the induce expression of il-1 beta and tnf alpha mrna in the monocytic thp-1 cell line increase as quickly a in primary cell .
in contrast to pbmo , thp-1 and 14 other monocytic/myeloid leukemia-derived cell line do not secrete measurable amount of the cytokine upon treatment with mdhm .
il-1 beta and il-6 gene contain ap-1 binding site a regulatory element , the ap-1 protein be compose of c-jun and c-fos gene product .
in thp-1 cell c-jun mrna expression increase after incubation with mdhm while positive c-fos expression remain unaffected .
although these data suggest ap-1 regulate cytokine mrna expression , result from pbmo be not in accordance with this notion .
in the primary cell mdhm -induced elevation of cytokine mrna level be precede by a downregulation of c-fos expression while positive c-jun expression be not modulate .
c-myc mrna expression , constitutively high in thp-1 cell , be induce in mdhm -stimulated pbmo .
in conclusion , mdhm -stimulated induction of cytokine mrna expression be accompany by different proto-oncogene response in pbmo and thp-1 cell .
these difference may represent different regulatory pathway of the two cell system .
alternatively , these data support the notion that neither ap-1 nor the c-myc protein be involve in the mdhm -induced increase in il-1 beta , il-6 or tnf alpha mrna level .
furthermore , the present result demonstrate clearly that mycoplasma product can have a profound impact on the activation status of eukaryotic cell .
do thyroidectomy , radioactive iodine therapy , or antithyroid drug treatment alter reactivity of patient ' t cell to epitope of thyrotropin receptor in autoimmune thyroid disease ?
the effect of treatment on thyroid antibody production and t cell reactivity to thyroid antigen be study in 15 patient with graf ' disease ( gd ) before and after thyroidectomy , 19 patient with gd before and after radioactive iodine ( rai ) therapy , and 9 patient maintain euthyroid on antithyroid drug ( atd ) .
twenty subject matched for age and sex without known thyroid disease serve a control .
in gd patient , the response of peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) and tsh receptor ( tshr ) -specific t cell line to recombinant human tshr extracellular domain , thyroglobulin , and tshr peptide be examine on the day of surgery or rai therapy ( day 0 ) and also 6-8 week and 3-6 month thereafter .
reactivity to tshr peptide before surgery be heterogeneous and span the entire extracellular domain .
six to 8 week after subtotal thyroidectomy , the number of patient ' pbmc respond to any peptide and the average number of recognize peptide decrease .
a further decrease in the t cell reactivity to tshr peptide be observe 3-6 month after surgery .
the response of pbmc from graf ' patient before rai therapy be less than those in the presurgical group .
six to 8 week after rai therapy , the number of patient respond to any peptide and the average number of recognize peptide increase .
three to 6 month after rai , t cell response to tshr peptide be less than those 6-8 week after rai therapy , but still high than the value on day 0 .
response of pbmc from patient with gd , maintain euthyroid on atd , be low than those before surgery or rai therapy .
the reactivity of t cell line in different group reflect a pattern similar to pbmc after treatment .
tshr antibody and microsomal antibody level decrease after surgery , but increase after rai therapy .
the difference in the number of recognize peptide by patient ' pbmc before rai and surgery may reflect the effect of long term therapy with atd in the patient before rai vs. the short period in patient before surgery .
the decrease t cell reactivity to thyroid antigen after thyroidectomy could be the result of removal of a major part of the thyroid gland or redistribution of suppressor-inducer t cell .
the increase t cell response after rai therapy be probably epitope specific , rather than a response to the whole tshr molecule .
synchronous recognition of peptide 158-176 and 248-263 be important for the development of gd , and the loss of recognition of one of these epitope may be an early sign of immune remission and a predictor of euthyroidism .
immunosuppression by glucocorticoid : inhibition of nf-kappa b activity through induction of i kappa b synthesis [ see comment ]
glucocorticoid be among the most potent anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive agent .
they inhibit synthesis of almost all known cytokine and of several cell surface molecule require for immune function , but the mechanism underlie this activity have be unclear . here it be show that glucocorticoid be potent inhibitor of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation in mouse and culture cell .
this inhibition be mediate by induction of the i kappa b alpha inhibitory protein , which trap activate nf-kappa b in inactive cytoplasmic complex .
because nf-kappa b activate many immunoregulatory gene in response to pro-inflammatory stimulus , the inhibition of it activity can be a major component of the anti-inflammatory activity of glucocorticoid .
transcriptional regulation of the vacuolar h(+)-atpase b2 subunit gene in differentiate thp-1 cell .
monocyte-macrophage differentiation be use a a model system for study gene regulation of the human vacuolar h(+)-atpase ( v-atpase ) .
we examine mrna level of various v-atpase subunit during differentiation of both native monocyte and the cell line thp-1 , and find that transcriptional and post-transcriptional mechanism could account for increase in cell v-atpase content .
from nuclear runoff experiment , we find that one subunit in particular , the b2 isoform ( mr = 56,000 ) , be amplify primarily by transcriptional mean .
we have begin to examine the structure of the b2 subunit promoter region .
isolation and sequencing of the first exon and 5'-flanking region of this gene reveal a tata-less promoter with a high g + c content .
primer extension and ribonuclease protection analysis indicate a single major transcriptional start site .
we transfected promoter-luciferase reporter plasmid into thp-1 cell to define sequence that mediate transcriptional control during monocyte differentiation .
we find that sequence downstream from the transcriptional start site be sufficient to confer increase expression during thp-1 differentiation .
dnase i footprinting and sequence analysis reveal the existence of multiple ap2 and sp1 binding site in the 5'-untranslated and proximal cod region .
b-cell proliferation and induction of early g1-regulating protein by epstein-barr virus mutant conditional for ebna2 .
infection of primary b-lymphocytes by epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) lead to growth transformation of these b-cells in vitro .
ebv nuclear antigen 2 ( ebna2 ) , one of the first gene express after ebv infection of b-cells , be a transcriptional activator of viral and cellular gene and be essential for the transform potential of the virus .
we generate conditional ebv mutant by express ebna2 a chimeric fusion protein with the hormone binding domain of the estrogen receptor on the genetic background of the virus .
growth transformation of primary normal b-cells by mutant virus result in estrogen -dependent lymphoblastoid cell line express the chimeric ebna2 protein .
in the absence of estrogen about half of the cell enter a quiescent non-proliferative state whereas the others die by apoptosis .
ebna2 be thus require not only for initiation but also for maintenance of transformation .
growth arrest occur at g1 and g2 stage of the cell cycle , indicate that functional ebna2 be require at different restriction point of the cell cycle .
growth arrest be reversible for g1/g0 cell a indicate by the sequential accumulation and modification of cell cycle regulating protein .
ebv induce the same cell cycle regulating protein a polyclonal stimulus in primary b-cells .
these data suggest that ebv be use a common pathway for b-cell activation bypass the requirement for antigen , t-cell signal and growth factor .
hiv-1 nef lead to inhibition or activation of t cell depend on it intracellular localization .
nef of primate lentiviruses be require for viremia and progression to aid in monkey .
negative , positive , and no effect of nef have also be report on viral replication in cell .
to reconcile these observation , we express a hybrid cd8- nef protein in jurkat cell .
two opposite phenotype be find , which depend on the intracellular localization of nef .
express in the cytoplasm or on the cell surface , the chimera inhibit or activate early signaling event from the t cell antigen receptor .
activate jurkat cell die by apoptosis , and only cell with mutate nef gene express truncate nefs survive , which render nef nonfunctional .
these mutation parallel those in other viral strain passaged in vitro .
not only do these positional effect of nef reconcile diverse phenotype of nef and suggest a role for it n-terminal myristylation , but they also explain effect of nef in hiv infection and progression to aid .
overexpression of protein kinase c -zeta stimulate leukemic cell differentiation .
a function for protein kinase c -zeta ( pkc -zeta ) , a member of the phorbol ester nonresponsive atypical protein kinase c subfamily , in modulate differentiation be examine in the leukemic u937 cell .
transfected u937 cell stably overexpressing pkc-zeta display a longer doubling time , low saturation density at confluency , and an increase in adherence to plastic a compare to control cell .
pkc-zeta cell express a more differentiate phenotype a assess by change in morphology , surface antigen expression , and lysosomal enzyme activity and be distinct from parental u937 cell stimulate to differentiate by exposure to phorbol ester .
in contrast to parental u937 cell , pkc-zeta cell constitutively express mrna transcript for c-jun and a low mobility ap-1 binding activity .
thus , pkc-zeta overexpression stimulate a type of phenotypic differentiation that differ significantly from maturation occur upon activation of other pkc subfamily induce by phorbol ester treatment .
increase expression of the c-jun protooncogene and an increase in ap-1 binding activity in pkc-zeta cell provide a potential mechanism for explain the altered differentiation status of this cell .
cd40 , but not lipopolysaccharide and anti-igm stimulation of primary b lymphocyte , lead to a persistent nuclear accumulation of relb .
in this study we analyze the effect of cd40 stimulation on the activity and nuclear appearance of rel/nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) factor in primary murine b lymphocyte .
we show that triggering of cd40 signaling pathway ( s ) by cd40 ligand express on l cell lead to strong activation of an nf-kappab-controlled beta-globin reporter gene in primary b lymphocyte from transgenic mouse .
analysis of nuclear translocation of individual member of rel protein after cd40 induction of primary b cell show a strong and long-lasting accumulation of relb and , less pronounced , of c-rel .
lp stimulation do not give rise to a persistent nuclear accumulation of relb and c-rel , whereas nuclear c-rel , but not relb , accumulate after b cell receptor stimulation .
cd40 induce not only nuclear translocation but also de novo synthesis of relb rna and protein .
s107 plasmacytoma cell , which express cd40 but be defective for the nuclear appearance of p50/p65-nf-kappab , do not express relb after cd40 stimulation .
in s107 cell stably transfected with relb gene , stimulation of nuclear relb translocation by cd40 be observe .
these result indicate that stimulation of cd40 signaling pathway exert a long-lasting stimulatory effect on both the transcription and nuclear translocation of relb .
since lp and anti-igm be unable to activate relb , cd40 appear to trigger a special program of gene expression involve in the proliferation and/or differentiation of b lymphocyte .
alpha-tocopherol inhibit agonist-induced monocytic cell adhesion to culture human endothelial cell .
antioxidant have be propose to be anti-atherosclerotic agent ; however , the mechanism underlie their beneficial effect be poorly understand .
we have examine the effect of alpha-tocopherol ( alpha-tcp ) on one cellular event in atherosclerotic plaque development , monocyte adhesion to stimulate endothelial cell ( ec ) .
human umbilical vein ec be pretreated with alpha-tcp before stimulation with known agonist of monocyte adhesion : il-1 ( 10 ng/ml ) , lp ( 10 ng/ml ) , thrombin ( 30 u/ml ) , or pma ( 10 nm ) .
agonist-induced monocytic cell adhesion , but not basal adhesion , be inhibit in a time- and concentration-dependent manner by alpha-tcp .
the ic50 of alpha-tcp on an il-1 -induced response be 45 microm .
the inhibition correlate with a decrease in steady state level of e-selectin mrna and cell surface expression of e-selectin which be consistent with the ability of a monoclonal antibody to e-selectin to inhibit monocytic cell adhesion in this system .
probucol ( 50 microm ) and n-acetylcysteine ( 20 mm ) also inhibit agonist-induced monocytic cell adhesion ; whereas , several other antioxidant have no significant effect .
protein kinase c ( pkc ) do not appear to play a role in the alpha-tcp effect since no suppression of phosphorylation of pkc substrate be observe .
activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b be report to be necessary but not sufficient for e-selectin expression in ec .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay fail to show an alpha-tcp -induced decrease in activation of this transcription factor after cytokine stimulation .
it have be hypothesize that alpha-tcp act a an anti-atherosclerotic molecule by inhibit generation of oxidize ldl -- a putative trigger molecule in the atherosclerotic process .
our result point to a novel alternative mechanism of action of alpha-tcp .
relief of cyclin a gene transcriptional inhibition during activation of human primary t lymphocyte via cd2 and cd28 adhesion molecule .
cyclin a transcription be cell cycle regulated and induce by cell proliferative signal .
to understand the mechanism underline in this regulation in normal human cell , we have analyse in vivo protein-dna interaction at the cyclin a locus in primary t lymphocyte .
stimulation of purify t lymphocyte by a combination of monoclonal antibody direct at cd2 and cd28 adhesion molecule give rise to a long lasting proliferation in the absence of accessory cell .
cyclin a be observe after 4 day of costimulation with anti cd2 + cd28 whereas stimulation by anti cd2 or anti cd28 alone be not effective .
in vivo genomic dm footprinting reveal upstream of the major transcription initiation site , the presence of at least three protein binding site , two of which be constitutively occupy .
they bind in vitro respectively atf-1 and nf-y protein .
the third site be occupy in quiescent cell or in cell stimulate by anti cd2 or anti cd28 alone .
the mitogenic combination of anti cd2 + anti cd28 release the footprint a cell be commit to proliferation .
consistent with thesis result , nuclear extract prepare from quiescent cell form a specific complex with this element , whereas extract prepare from cell treat with anti cd2 + anti cd28 fail to do so after cell enter a proliferative state .
glucocorticoid receptor in normal leukocyte : effect of age , gender , season , and plasma cortisol concentration .
we measure glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) in mononuclear leukocyte ( mnl ) isolate from peripheral blood of 145 apparently healthy volunteer ( 86 men and 59 woman ) .
an age-related decrease in the number of gr be suggest between subject young than 20 year and elderly subject ; there be no apparent seasonal variation in gr .
gender difference in the number of gr be not significant , although woman show slightly few gr .
eight patient with dermatomyositis/polymyositis be examine to determine whether the number of gr in mnl could be down-regulated by their cognate ligand .
the number of gr in mnl from these patient be significantly decrease one month after the initiation of prednisolone therapy .
however , in normal subject , the gr in mnl do not demonstrate circadian variation , in contrast to concentration of plasma cortisol .

result in two affected infant .
