comparison of primary sensitization of naive human t cell to varicella-zoster virus peptide by dendritic cell in vitro with response elicit in vivo by varicella vaccination .
dendritic cell ( dc ) be potent apc during primary and secondary immune response .
the first objective of this study be to determine whether human dc mediate in vitro sensitization of naive cd4+ t cell to epitope of the immediate early 62 ( ie62 ) protein of varicella zoster virus ( vzv ) .
the induction of cd4+ t cell proliferative response to eight synthetic peptide represent amino acid sequence of the vzv ie62 protein be assess use t cell and dc from vzv -susceptible donor .
the second objective be to compare in vitro response of naive t cell with response to vzv peptide induce in vivo after immunization with varicella vaccine .
t cell proliferation be induce by three peptide , p1 , p4 , and p7 , in 71-100 % of the donor test before and after vaccination use dc a apc .
monocyte be effective apc for vzv peptide only after immunization .
two peptide , p2 and p8 , induce naive t cell proliferation less effectively and be also less immunogenic for t cell from vaccinate or naturally immune donor .
t cell recognition of specific peptide be concordant between naive , dc -mediated response , and postvaccine response use monocyte a apc in 69 % of comparison ( p = 0.05 ; chi2 ) ; the predictive value of a positive response to an ie62 peptide before immunization for t cell sensitization in vivo be 82 % .
these observation indicate that primary t cell response detect in vitro use dc a apc may be useful to characterize the potential immunogenicity of viral protein epitope in vivo .
stat-related transcription factor be constitutively activate in peripheral blood cell from acute leukemia patient .
a signal transduction pathway activate by many cytokine have recently be elaborate .
the jak kinase and the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) factor have be find to be essential component .
in this report , we describe the presence of constitutively activate stat factor in peripheral blood cell from patient with acute leukemia .
we use oligonucleotide probe from the beta-casein and irf-1 gene promoter and the isre probe to detect stat protein in nuclear extract from acute leukemia cell in bandshift assay .
specific dna protein complex formation be observe with the probe from the beta-casein and irf-1 gene promoter , but not with the isre oligonucleotide probe , when cell extract from acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( all ) and acute myeloid leukemia ( aml ) be investigate .
we use nonradioactive oligonucleotides a competitor to show the specificity of the complex formation .
specific antibody direct against the individual stat protein be use in supershift experiment .
stat5- and stat1- related factor be detect in all and stat1- , stat3- , and stat5- related protein be present in nuclear cell extract from aml .
since the cell be not treat with cytokine before the nuclear protein be extract , we conclude that these factor be constitutively activate in vivo .
it be likely that the constitutive activation of stat protein be a part of the event of leukemogenesis .
reversible differentiation of human monoblastic leukemia u937 cell by ml-9 , an inhibitor of myosin light chain kinase .
human monoblastic leukemia u937 cell be induce to differentiate into monocyte and macrophage by various agent .
we have show that 1-(5-chloronaphthalene-1-sulfonyl)-1h-hexahydro-1,4-diazepine hydrochloride ( ml-9 ) , an inhibitor of myosin light chain kinase , induce differentiation of monocytoid leukemia cell line u937 and thp-1 but not of myeloblastic leukemic ml-1 cell or erythroleukemia k562 cell .
in the present study , we far analyze the effect of ml-9 in comparison with that of 1 alpha,_25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( vd3 ) a typical inducer of monocytic differentiation .
ml-9 induce nitroblue tetrazolium ( nbt ) -reducing activity of u937 cell more rapidly than vd3 : this differentiation marker be induce significantly after incubation with ml-9 and vd3 for 4 hour and 1 day , respectively .
ml-9 also induce alpha-naphthyl acetate esterase ( anae ) activity , another monocytic differentiation marker , more rapidly than vd3 .
the maximum level of these marker induce by ml-9 be comparable to those induce by vd3 , but after removal of ml-9 from the medium by wash the cell , the expression of thesis marker decrease within 4 hour and reach basal level in 1 day , indicate that ml-9 's induction of expression of differentiation-associated phenotype be reversible .
the growth inhibition of u937 cell by ml-9 be also reversible .
similar effect be observe in another line of human monoblastic cell , thp-1 .
ml-9 have little or no effect on the morphology of u937 cell but increase the expression of monocyte-macrophage lineage-associated surface antigen , cd14 , to some extent .
irreversible terminal differentiation induce by vd3 be associate with down regulation of the expression of c-myc and upregulation of the expression of c-fos and c-jun , but ml-9 do not affect the expression of these oncogene appreciably .
ml-9 -induced differentiation be also reversible when the cell be culture with culture with ml-9 plus an anti-cancer drug such a 1-beta-d-arabino-furanosylcytosine or daunomycin .
it become irreversible , however , upon simultaneous treatment with dexamethasone and transform growth factor-beta 1 ( tgf-beta 1 ) , which do not induce differentiation of u937 cell but cause growth arrest of the cell in the g0/g1 phase of the cell cycle .
these result suggest that ml-9 should be useful for study the mechanism of monocytic differentiation .
replication of type 1 human immunodeficiency virus contain linker substitution mutation in the -201 to -130 region of the long terminal repeat .
in previous transfection analysis use the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter gene system , we determine that linker substitution ( l ) mutation between -201 and -130 ( relative to the transcription start site ) of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) cause moderate decrease in ltr transcriptional activity in a t-cell line ( s.l.zeichner , j.y.h. kim , and j.c.alwine , j.virol.65 : 2436-2444 , 1991 ) .
in order to confirm the significance of this region in the context of viral replication , we construct several of these l mutation ( -201 to -_184 , -183 to -166 , -165 to -148 , and -148 to -130 ) in provirus and prepare viral stock by cocultivation of transfected rd cell with cemx174 cell .
in addition , two mutation between -93 and -76 and between -75 and -58 be utilize , since they affect the nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) - and sp1 -binding site and be expect to diminish viral replication .
our result suggest that while transfection analysis offer an adequate approximation of the effect of the l mutation , the analysis of viral replication use a mutant viral stock present a more accurate picture , which be sometimes at variance with the transfection result .
three mutant ( -201/-184 nxs , -165/-148 nxs , and -147/-130 nxs ) have effect on viral replication that be much more severe than the effect predict from their performance in transfection analysis , and the effect of two l mutation ( -201/-184 nxs and -183/-166 nxs ) be not predict by their effect in transfection .
in addition , we observe cell type-specific permissiveness to replication of some mutant virus .
in the cell type test , the l mutation indicate an apparent requirement not only for the intact nf-kappa b and sp1-binding site but also for several region between -201 and -130 not previously associate with viral infectivity .
kappa b-specific dna binding protein be differentially inhibit by enhancer mutation and biological oxidation .
kappa b ( kappa b ) enhancer binding protein isolate from the nucleus of activate human t cell produce two distinct nucleoprotein complex when incubate with the kappa b element from the interleukin-2 receptor-alpha ( il-2r alpha ) gene .
these two dna-protein complex be compose of at least four host protein ( p50 , p55 , p75 , p85 ) , each of which share structural similarity with the v-rel oncogene product .
nuclear expression of these protein be induce with distinctly biphasic kinetics follow phorbol ester activation of t cell ( p55/p75 early and p50/p85 late ) .
dna-protein crosslinking study have reveal that the more rapidly migrate b2 complex contain both p50 and p55 while the more slowly migrate b1 complex be compose of p50 , p55 , p75 , and p85 .
site-directed mutagenesis of the wild-type il-2r alpha kappa b enhancer ( ggggaatctccc ) have reveal that the binding of p50 and p55 ( b2 complex ) be particularly sensitive to alteration of the 5' triplet of deoxyguanosine residue .
in contrast , formation of the b1 complex , reflect the binding of p75 and p85 , critically depend upon the more 3' sequence of this enhancer element .
dna binding by all four of these rel-related factor be block by selective chemical modification of lysine and arginine residue , suggest that both of these basic amino acid be require for bind to the kappa b element .
similarly , covalent modification of free sulfhydryl group with diamide ( reversible ) or n-ethylmaleimide ( irreversible ) result in a complete loss of dna binding activity .
in contrast , mild oxidation with glucose oxidase selectively inhibit p75 and p85 binding while not block p50 and p55 interaction .
these finding suggest that reduce cysteine thiols play an important role in the dna binding activity of this family of rel-related transcription factor .
regulation of the vitellogenin gene b1 promoter after transfer into hepatocytes in primary culture .
the estrogen-dependent and tissue-specific regulation of the xenopus laevis vitellogenin gene b1 promoter have be study by lipid-mediated dna transfer into xenopus hepatocytes in primary culture .
hepatocytes achieve an efficient hormonal control of this promoter through a functional interaction between the estrogen responsive element and a promoter proximal region upstream of the tata box , which be characterize by a high density of bind site for the transcription factor ctf/nf-1 , c/ebp and hnf3 .
dna accessibility to restriction enzyme within the chromosomal copy of the vitellogenin gene b1 promoter show that the estrogen responsive unit and the promoter proximal region be sensitive to digestion in uninduced and estrogen -induced hepatocytes but not in erythrocyte nucleus .
together , these finding support the notion that chromatin configuration as well a the interplay of promoter element mediate proper hormone-dependent and tissue-specific expression of the b1 vitellogenin gene .
synergism between the cd3 antigen- and cd2 antigen- derived signal .
exploration at the level of induction of dna-binding protein and characterization of the inhibitory activity of cyclosporine .
we have demonstrate earlier that the crosslinkage of the cd3/tcr complex with the cd2 antigen result in the proliferation of normal human t cell .
the effect of this synergism be perceptible at the level of induction of the il-2 gene , a process critical for t cell growth .
to far understand the molecular and nuclear basis for this synergism , we have explore the induction of dna-binding protein in highly purify normal human t cell signal via the cd3 and/or cd2 protein .
the effect of transmembrane signaling of t cell with ionomycin , and/or sn-1 , 2 dioctanoyl glycerol , be also determine .
the emergence of nuclear binding protein be investigate use interleukin-2 sequence specific oligonucleotide probe in the electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
our study demonstrate for the first time that cd3 antigen-derived signal and cd2 antigen -derived signal be synergistic in induce the emergence of transcription factor that bind to the nf-at1 , ap-1 , and nf-kb site located in the promoter/enhancer region of the il-2 gene .
moreover , cyclosporine , at concentration readily accomplish in clinical practice , be find to inhibit the emergence of these dna-binding protein in normal human t cell signal via cell surface protein implicate in antigen-dependent t cell activation and in t cell stimulate by mobilization of cellular calcium and activation of protein kinase c .
role of gata-1 in proliferation and differentiation of definitive erythroid and megakaryocytic cell in vivo .
to elucidate the contribution of gata-1 to definitive hematopoiesis in vivo , we have examine adult mouse that be render genetically defective in gata-1 synthesis ( takahashi et al , j biol chem 272 : 12611 , 1997 ) .
because the gata-1 gene be located on the x chromosome , which be randomly inactivate in every cell , heterozygous female can bear either an active wild-type or mutant ( refer to a gata-1.05 ) gata-1 allele , consequently lead to variable anemic severity .
these heterozygous mutant mouse usually develop normally , but they begin to die after 5 month .
these affect animal display marked splenomegaly , anemia , and thrombocytopenia .
proerythroblasts and megakaryocyte massively accumulate in the spleen of the heterozygote , and we show that the neomycin resistance gene ( which be the positive selection marker in e cell ) be express profusely in the abnormally abundant cell generate in the gata-1.05 mutant female .
we also observe hematopoiesis outside of the bone marrow in the affect mutant mouse .
these data suggest that a small number of gata-1.05 mutant hematopoietic progenitor cell begin to proliferate vigorously during early adulthood , but because the cell be unable to terminally differentiate , this lead to progenitor proliferation in the spleen and consequently death .
thus , gata-1 play important in vivo role for direct definitive hematopoietic progenitor to differentiate along both the erythroid and megakaryocytic pathway .
the gata-1 heterozygous mutant mouse show a phenotype that be analogous to human myelodysplastic syndrome and thus may serve a a useful model for this disorder .
prevalence of aneuploidy , overexpressed er , and overexpressed egfr in random breast aspirate of woman at high and low risk for breast cancer .
breast tissue biomarkers which accurately predict breast cancer development within a 10 year period in high risk woman be need but currently not available .
we initiate this study to determine 1 ) the prevalence of one or more breast tissue abnormality in a group of woman at high risk for breast cancer , and 2 ) if the prevalence of biomarker abnormality be great in high risk than in low risk woman .
eligible high risk woman be those with a first degree relative with breast cancer , prior breast cancer , or precancerous mastopathy .
low risk woman be those without these or other major identifiable risk factor .
ductal cell be obtain via random fine needle aspiration and cytologically classify .
biomarkers include dna ploidy , estrogen receptor ( er ) , and epidermal growth factor receptor ( egfr ) .
the prevalence of dna aneuploidy be 30 % , overexpression of er 10 % , and overexpression of egfr 35 % , in the 206 high risk woman whose median 10 year gail risk ( project probability ) of develop breast cancer be 4.5 % .
the prevalence of aneuploidy and overexpressed egfr be significantly high in the high risk woman than in the 25 low risk control ( p < 0.002 ) , whose median 10 year gail risk be 0.7 % .
the difference in the prevalence of er overexpression between high and low risk group be not statistically significant ( p = 0.095 ) .
this may be due to the low prevalence of overexpressed er and the small number of control .
a significant difference be note in the prevalence of one or more abnormal biomarkers between the high risk and low risk woman ( p < 0.001 ) .
a large prospective trial be need to determine if one or more of these biomarkers , be predictive of breast cancer development .
regulation of i kappa b alpha and p105 in monocyte and macrophage persistently infect with human immunodeficiency virus .
the mechanism regulate human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) persistence in human monocyte /macrophages be partially understand .
persistent hiv infection of u937 monocytic cell result in nf-kappa b activation .
whether virus-induced nf-kappa b activation be a mechanism that favor continuous viral replication in macrophage remain unknown .
to far delineate the molecular mechanism involve in the activation of nf-kappa b in hiv -infected monocyte and macrophage , we have focus on the regulation of the i kappa b molecule .
first , we show that persistent hiv infection result in the activation of nf-kappa b not only in monocytic cell but also in macrophage .
in hiv -infected cell , i kappa b alpha protein level be decrease secondary to enhance protein degradation .
this parallel the increase i kappa b alpha synthesis secondary to increase i kappa b alpha gene transcription , i.e. , increase rna and transcriptional activity of it promoter-enhancer .
another protein with i kappa b function , p105 , be also modify in hiv -infected cell : p105 and p50 steady-state protein level be increase a a result of increase synthesis and proteolytic processing of p105 .
transcriptional activity of p105 be also increase in infected cell and be also mediate by nf-kappa b through a specific kappa b motif .
these result demonstrate the existence of a triple autoregulatory loop in monocyte and macrophage involve hiv , p105 and p50 , and mad3 , with the end result of persistent nf-kappa b activation and viral persistence .
furthermore , persistent hiv infection of monocyte and macrophage provide a useful model with which to study concomitant modification of different i kappa b molecule .
proliferation index a a prognostic marker in breast cancer .
background .
the proliferative activity of tumor have be extensively investigate with different approach , among which the use of the monoclonal antibody ki-67 represent an easy and reliable mean of assess cell proliferation .
in this study , the proliferative activity of 129 primary breast cancer be investigate , and the result be related to prognosis .
method .
tumor sample , obtain from 129 patient who undergo surgery between january 1987 and december 1988 , be process for stain by an immunohistochemical procedure ( avidin-biotin complex ) .
the median time of observation be 42 month ( range , 31-55 month ) .
life-table analysis ( mantel-cox ) be use to assess the probability of disease-free survival ( dfs ) and overall survival ( o ) .
result .
tumor with high ki-67 proliferation index ( > 20 % ) be associate with a high 4-year probability of relapse of disease ( 55.3 % versus 79.1 % ; p = 0.003 ) and death ( 71 % versus 95.6 % ; p = 0.00005 ) when compare with tumor with low ki-67 value .
in addition , this proliferative parameter maintain it prognostic significance when the patient be stratify accord to lymph node involvement , menopausal status , and nuclear estrogen receptor content .
conclusion .
tumor proliferative activity a evaluate by the monoclonal antibody ki-67 seem to be an effective indicator of prognosis in breast cancer for dfs and o .
characterization of the human platelet/endothelial cell adhesion molecule-1 promoter : identification of a gata-2 binding element require for optimal transcriptional activity .
platelet/endothelial cell adhesion molecule-1 ( pecam-1 ) be a 130-kd member of the ig gene superfamily that be express on platelet , endothelial cell , and certain leukocyte subset .
to examine the factor control vascular-specific expression of pecam-1 , we clone the 5'-flanking region of the pecam-1 gene and analyze it transcriptional activity .
5'-rapid amplification of cdna end ( 5'-race ) analysis show that transcription initiation occur at several closely spaced nearby site originate approximately 204 bp upstream from the translation start site .
analysis of the sequence immediately upstream from the transcription initiation site ( ti ) show no canonical tata or caat element , however an initiator element commonly find in tata -less promoter encompass the ti .
5'-serially truncate pecam-1 promoter segment clone in front of a luciferase reporter drive transcription in both a lineage- and orientation-specific manner .
putative cis-acting control element present within a 300-bp core promoter include two ets site , an sp1 site , tandem e-box domain , two gata-associated site ( caccc ) , an ap-2 binding site , and a gata element at -24 .
mutational analysis show that optimal transcriptional activity require the gata sequence at position -24 , and gel-shift assay far show that the gata-2 transcription factor , but not gata-1 , bind to this region of the pecam-1 promoter .
understand the cis- and trans act factor that regulate the tissue-specific expression of pecam-1 should increase our understanding of the mechanism by which vascular-specific gene expression be achieve .
cytokine -modulating activity of tepoxalin , a new potential antirheumatic .
tepoxalin be a new dual cyclooxygenase/5-lipoxygenase anti-inflammatory compound currently under clinical investigation .
it have be show to possess anti-inflammatory activity in a variety of animal model and more recently to inhibit il-2 induced signal transduction .
the current study be conduct to evaluate the cytokine modulating activity of tepoxalin and the role of iron in these effect .
in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) stimulate with okt3/pma , tepoxalin inhibit lymphocyte proliferation with an ic50 of 6 microm .
additionally , it inhibit the production of ltb4 ( ic50 = 0.5 microm ) and the cytokine il-2 , il-6 and tnf alpha ( ic50 = 10-12 microm ) .
cytotoxicity be not demonstrate at these concentration .
add-back experiment with either cytokine ( il-2 or il-6 ) , ltb4 or conditioned medium fail to restore the proliferative response in the presence of tepoxalin .
however , the concurrent addition of iron ( in the form of ferrous or ferric chloride and other iron salt ) reverse the inhibition of proliferation cause by tepoxalin .
tepoxalin also inhibit the activation of nf kappa b , a transcription factor which act on several cytokine gene .
tepoxalin 's effect on nf kappa b be also reverse by the addition of iron salt .
these data suggest that the action of tepoxalin to inhibit proliferation in pbmc may be at least in part due to it ability to reduce the amount of available iron result in decrease activation of nf kappa b and subsequent inhibition of cytokine production .
interleukin 6-induced differentiation of a human b cell line into igm-secreting plasma cell be mediate by c-fos .
the role of the protooncogene c-fos in interleukin ( il ) 6 -induced b cell differentiation be assess .
treatment of skw 6.4 cell with il 6 induce a transient and early stimulation of c-fos sense mrna expression .
the effect appear within 30 min and return to basal level after 2 h .
the addition of antisense oligonucleotides to c-fos significantly inhibit il 6 -induced igm production by skw 6.4 cell ( p less than 0.001 ) , whereas control oligonucleotides have no inhibitory effect .
these result indicate that activation of c-fos be involve in il 6 -induced differentiation of skw 6.4 cell into igm-secreting cell .
[ correlation of lymphocytic infiltration of tumor tissue with the hormonal and metabolic state in patient with breast cancer ]
lymphocyte infiltration of tumor be study vis-a-vis hormone metabolic status , tumor tissue hormone sensitivity and tobacco smoking , in 113 breast cancer patient , aged 25-77 .
on the average , no correlation be establish between degree of lymphocyte infiltration in breast tumor and age and menopause onset .
in smoking menopausal patient , lymphocyte infiltration be find to be high than in non-smokers ( p < 0.05 ) .
there be a direct correlation between the rate of lymphocyte infiltration and the level of progesterone receptor in tumor .
some subgroup display a direct correlation between infiltration and sex-binding globulin , cholesterol , luteinizing hormone in blood , and lean body mass .
it be match by an inverse correlation between lymphocyte infiltration and blood-thyroid hormone concentration , urine catecholamine and free cortisol excretion and fat/lean body mass ratio .
consider the abovesaid as well a the lymphocyte ability to perform the dual function of immunocytes and hormonocytes , it be suggest that the result may be use in both the study of lymphocyte infiltration and research in mean of it control .
ubiquitin-mediated processing of nf-kappa b transcriptional activator precursor p105 .
reconstitution of a cell-free system and identification of the ubiquitin-carrier protein , e2 , and a novel ubiquitin-protein ligase , e3 , involve in conjugation .
in most case , the transcriptional factor nf-kappa b be a heterodimer consist of two subunit , p50 and p65 , which be encode by two distinct gene of the rel family .
p50 be translate a a precursor of 105 kda .
the c-terminal domain of the precursor be rapidly degrade , form the mature p50 subunit consist of the n-terminal region of the molecule .
the mechanism of generation of p50 be not know .
it have be suggest that the ubiquitin -proteasome system be involve in the process ; however , the specific enzyme involve and the mechanism of limited proteolysis , in which half of the molecule be spar , have be obscure .
palombella and colleague ( palombella , v.j. , rando , o.j. , goldberg , a.l. , and maniatis , t. ( 1994 ) cell 78 , 773-785 ) have show that ubiquitin be require for the processing in a cell-free system of a truncate , artificially construct , 60-kda precursor .
they have also show that proteasome inhibitor block the processing both in vitro and in vivo .
in this study , we demonstrate reconstitution of a cell-free processing system and demonstrate directly that : ( a ) the ubiquitin -proteasome system be involve in processing of the intact p105 precursor , ( b ) conjugation of ubiquitin to the precursor be an essential intermediate step in the processing , ( c ) the recently discover novel specie of the ubiquitin -carrier protein , e2-f1 , that be involve in the conjugation and degradation of p53 , be also require for the limited processing of the p105 precursor , and ( d ) a novel , approximately 320-kda specie of ubiquitin -protein ligase , be involve in the process .
this novel enzyme be distinct from e6-ap , the p53 -conjugating ligase , and from e3 alpha , the " n-end rule " ligase .
seminoma in a postmenopausal woman with a y;15 translocation in peripheral blood lymphocyte and a t(y;15)/45,x turner mosaic pattern in skin fibroblast .
we report an unusual case of a 55 year old japanese woman with a seminoma but relatively normal menses .
the patient be a phenotypic female with late onset menarche ( 18 year of age ) , who be amenorrhoeic for the first year , follow by menses of one to three day ' slight flow with dysmenorrhoea , but an otherwise normal menstrual history .
a typical seminoma be remove from the left adnexal region and an immature testis be identify separately a an associate right adnexal mass .
repeated karyotypic study on peripheral blood lymphocyte culture show only 46,x,-y,t(y;15)(q12;p13) .
cytogenetic examination of the patient 's young brother , who have father three healthy child , show an identical karyotype .
mosaicism of 46,x,-y,t(y;15)(q12;p13)/45,x cell line be find in skin sample from the patient 's elbow and genital region , although there be no clinical stigma of turner syndrome .
an androgen receptor binding assay of culture genital skin fibroblast be negative .
molecular analysis use southern blot hybridisation , pcr , and direct dna sequencing show that neither the patient nor her brother have a detectable deletion or other abnormality of y chromosome sequence , include the sry ( sex determining region of the y chromosome ) gene sequence .
these finding suggest that turner mosaicism of the 45,x cell line may have contribute to this atypical presentation in an xy female , although we can not exclude abnormality of other gene related to sex differentiation .
every enhancer work with every promoter for all the combination test : could new regulatory pathway evolve by enhancer shuffling ?
the promoter and enhancer of cell type-specific gene be often conserve in evolution , and hence one might expect that a given enhancer have evolve to work best with it own promoter .
while this expectation may be realize in some case , we have not find evidence for it .
a total of 27 combination of different promoter and enhancer be test by transfection into culture cell .
we find that the relative efficiency of the enhancer be approximately the same , irrespective of the type of promoter use , i.e. , there be no strong preference for any given enhancer/ promoter combination .
notably , we do not see particularly strong transcription when the immunoglobulin kappa enhancer ( or the immunoglobulin heavy chain enhancer ) be use to activate a kappa gene promoter .
we propose that a generally permissive enhancer/ promoter interaction be of evolutionary benefit for high eukaryote : by enhancer shuffling , gene could be easily bring under a new type of inducibility/cell type specificity .
anaphylatoxins c5a and c3a induce nuclear factor kappab activation in human peripheral blood monocyte .
the anaphylatoxins c5a and c3a be involve in the regulation of cytokine production .
in this study the capability of c5a and c3a to induce transcription factor activation be examine .
c5a and c3a stimulation of human peripheral blood monocyte result in nuclear expression of a dna binding activity with specificity to the kappab sequence .
the p50 and p65 protein , constituent of the prototypic nuclear factor kappab , be identify a component of the dna-protein complex by anti-peptide antibody in gel supershift assay .
c5a induced kappab binding activity be detect 15 min after agonist stimulation , peak at 30-40 min , and remain detectable at 2 h .
binding to kappab sequence be accompany by an initial decrease and subsequent increase in the cytoplasmic ikappabalpha level , a detect by western blotting use an anti- ikappabalpha antibody .
pertussis toxin treatment markedly decrease kappab binding activity induce by both c5a and c3a , whereas cholera toxin display no inhibitory effect .
neither of the two toxin affect kappab binding activity induce by tnfalpha in the same cell .
these result imply a potential role of the anaphylatoxins c5a and c3a in regulate leukocyte gene expression through g protein-coupled transcription factor activation .
defective translocation of protein kinase c in multidrug-resistant hl-60 cell confer a reversible loss of phorbol ester-induced monocytic differentiation .
previous study have demonstrate that human hl-60 myeloid leukemia cell differentiate in response to phorbol ester .
this event be associate with induction of the c-jun early response gene and appearance of a monocytic phenotype .
the present study have examine the effect of vincristine-selected , multidrug resistance on 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) -induced hl-60 cell differentiation .
the result demonstrate that multidrug-resistant hl-60 cell , designate hl-60/vinc , fail to respond to tpa with an increase in c-jun transcript or other phenotypic characteristic of monocytic differentiation .
by contrast , treatment of hl-60/vinc cell with okadaic acid , an inhibitor of serine /threonine protein phosphatase , induce c-jun transcription , growth arrest , and expression of the c-fms gene .
study be also perform with an hl-60/vinc revertant ( hl-60/vinc/r ) line that have regain partial sensitivity to vincristine .
the finding that hl-60/vinc/r cell respond to tpa with induction of a monocytic phenotype , but not c-jun expression , suggest that c-jun induction be not obligatory for monocytic differentiation .
other study far demonstrate that the jun-b and fra-1 gene be induce by tpa in both hl-60/vinc and hl-60/vinc/r cell , whereas c-fos expression be attenuate in the hl-60/vinc line .
since tpa activate protein kinase c ( pkc ) , we examine translocation of pkc from the cytosol to the membrane fraction .
although hl-60 and hl-60/vinc/r cell demonstrate translocation of pkc activity , this subcellular redistribution be undetectable in hl-60/vinc cell .
activity of the mitogen-activated protein kinase family with associated phosphorylation of c-jun y-peptide be markedly diminish in tpa -treated hl-60/vinc cell , but not in response to okadaic acid .
take together , these finding suggest that vincristine resistance confer insensitivity to tpa -induced differentiation and can include defect in pkc -mediated signaling event and induction of jun/fos early response gene expression .
the role of jun and fo gene family member in 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate induce hemopoietic differentiation .
terminal differentiation of the leukemic cell line u-937 and hl-60 by 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate be accompany by marked change in gene expression .
in this study , we demonstrate that the expression of jun and fo gene family member be induce with variable kinetics during 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate induce differentiation , with c-jun expression best paralleling differentiation .
the generation of ap-1 complex , a measure by dna binding activity , closely parallel morphological differentiation .
furthermore , the ability of these complex to regulate gene expression be demonstrate by increase transcription from an ap-1 drive reporter construct and marked increase in the expression of endogenous ap-1 regulated gene .
differentiation assay use water soluble phorbol ester reveal that differentiation become irreversible soon after ap-1 appear .
this tight correlation between c-jun expression , the generation of ap-1 activity , and differentiation suggest a critical role for this gene and transcriptional complex during this process .
quantification of vitamin d receptor mrna by competitive polymerase chain reaction in pbmc : lack of correspondence with common allelic variant .
it have be recently claim that polymorphism for the vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) influence several aspect of calcium and bone metabolism .
to evaluate the physiologic plausibility of these claim , we compare the abundance of the vdr mrna in peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmcs ) between different vdr genotype use a quantitative reverse transcribe polymerase chain reaction-based method .
the method be base on the coamplification of vdr cdna and an internal standard consist of known concentration of a human vdr cdna mutate at a bglii restriction site ; the interassay coefficient of variation be 11 % .
to validate the method , we make use of early receptor binding study indicate that normal human monocyte and activate , but not rest , lymphocyte express the vdr .
the concentration of the vdr mrna be 10(-8) to 10(-7) g/g of total rna in cell-sorted monocyte and in in vitro activate lymphocyte , but only 10(-12) g/g of total mrna in rest lymphocyte , establish that the vdr mrna determine by our method in pbmcs be due to constitutive expression in monocyte .
follow an initial genotype screening of 85 normal volunteer by polymerase chain reaction or restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis , 14 individual with the bb genotype , 12 with the bb genotype , and 12 with the bb genotype be select .
the concentration of the vdr mrna , correct for the number of monocyte , be similar among the three genotype group , a be the other variable examine : serum calcitriol , serum osteocalcin , and vertebral and hip bone density .
we conclude that vdr polymorphism do not affect the abundance of the vdr mrna .
the role of cellular transcription factor e2f in the regulation of cdc2 mrna expression and cell cycle control of human hematopoietic cell .
cdc2 mrna transcript be detect in immature bone marrow cell and become undetectable along with differentiation .
peripheral blood resting cell do not express cdc2 mrna , but it be induce in t-lymphocytes when the cell reentered the cell cycle in response to specific mitogen .
in contrast , cdc2 mrna could not be induce in granulocyte and monocyte even after the culture with the appropriate stimulant .
in order to investigate the mechanism of the regulation of cdc2 mrna expression in hematopoietic cell , we isolate the 5'-flanking sequence of the cdc2 gene and find the putative e2f binding site at the position of nucleotide -124 to -117 .
the binding of e2f at this region be detect by a gel-retardation assay and dnasei footprinting in phytohemagglutinin -stimulated t-lymphocytes , which be coincident with the expression of cdc2 mrna .
e2f binding be not observe in both granulocyte and monocyte .
transient chloramphenicol acetyltransferase assay reveal that the region contain e2f binding site have a strong promoter activity , and introduction of the mutation at the e2f binding site result in a significant loss of the activity .
e2f-1 and dp-1 mrna be not detectable in granulocyte , monocyte and rest t-lymphocytes but be induce after the mitogenic stimulation of t-lymphocytes .
the induction of e2f activity precede the appearance of cdc2 mrna , which be consistent with the role of e2f in the regulation of cdc2 mrna expression .
these result suggest that cdc2 mrna expression be related to the cell cycling of normal human hematopoietic cell and that e2f play some role in the regulation of it expression .
characterization of an immediate-early gene induce in adherent monocyte that encode i kappa b -like activity .
we have clone a group of cdna represent mrna that be rapidly induce follow adherence of human monocyte .
one of the induce transcript ( mad-3 ) encode a protein of 317 amino acid with one domain contain five tandem repeat of the cdc10/ankyrin motif , which be 60 % similar ( 46 % identical ) to the ankyrin repeat region of the precursor of nf-kappa b /kbf1 p50 .
the c-terminus have a putative protein kinase c phosphorylation site .
in vitro translate mad-3 protein be find to specifically inhibit the dna-binding activity of the p50/p65 nf-kappa b complex but not that of the p50/p50 kbf1 factor or of other dna-binding protein .
the mad-3 cdna encode an i kappa b-like protein that be likely to be involve in regulation of transcriptional response to nf-kappa b , include adhesion-dependent pathway of monocyte activation .
human tumor necrosis factor alpha gene regulation in phorbol ester stimulate t and b cell line .
the minimal region of the human tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) gene promoter necessary for it transcriptional induction by phorbol ester ( pma ) in human t and b lymphocyte cell line have be localized between -52 and +89 nucleotide ( nt ) relative to the gene 's transcriptional start site .
comparison of these sequence to those require to mediate virus or lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induction of the gene reveal significant difference , and thus , the sequence requirement for pma induction be distinct from those that mediate induction by virus or lp .
although three site in the tnf-alpha promoter ( kappa 1 , kappa 2 , and kappa 3 ) specifically bind the transcription factor nf-kappa b in lymphoid nuclear extract , tnf-alpha mrna induction by pma do not correlate with nf-kappa b binding activity display by different t and b cell line .
moreover , kappa 1 - kappa 3 can each be delete from the tnf-alpha promoter with little effect on the gene 's inducibility by pma .
therefore , tnf-alpha mrna induction by pma , like it induction by virus and lp , be not primarily mediate by nf-kappa b , but rather be mediate through other sequence and protein factor .
surprisingly , multimers of kappa 1 - kappa 3 can confer pma inducibility on a heterologous promoter in a b ( raji ) , but not a t ( hut78 ) cell line .
however they be not functional on a truncate tnf-alpha promoter , indicate that promoter context and cell type specificity influence the pma inducible function of these nf-kappa b binding site .
simultaneous activation of ig and oct-2 synthesis and reduction of surface mhc class ii expression by il-6 .
terminal differentiation of b cell to plasma cell in vivo be characterize by secretion of ig and extinction of mhc class ii expression on the cell surface .
we show that il-6 signaling lead to marked increase in the synthesis and secretion of ig in clonal human b cell line and newly isolate polyclonal b lymphocyte in vitro .
the il-6-induced cell resemble plasma cell in ultrastructure and in reduce expression of surface mhc class ii .
enhance ig synthesis be a result of coordinate transcriptional activation of ig gene without promoter or isotype specificity , and differential accumulation of the mrna encode the secrete form of ig heavy chain .
it be saturable and subject to negative control when il-6 stimulation be prolonged .
coordinate with temporal change in ig synthesis , the dna-binding activity and the synthesis of the b cell-enriched transcription factor oct-2 be regulate .
thus , differentiation of b cell with il-6 in vitro recapitulate the hallmark of terminal b differentiation in vivo ; oct-2 may have a role in this process .
a mammalian histone deacetylase related to the yeast transcriptional regulator rpd3p [ see comment ]
trapoxin be a microbially derive cyclotetrapeptide that inhibit histone deacetylation in vivo and cause mammalian cell to arrest in the cell cycle .
a trapoxin affinity matrix be use to isolate two nuclear protein that copurified with histone deacetylase activity .
both protein be identify by peptide microsequencing , and a complementary dna encode the histone deacetylase catalytic subunit ( hd1 ) be clone from a human jurkat t cell library .
a the predict protein be very similar to the yeast transcriptional regulator rpd3p , these result support a role for histone deacetylase a a key regulator of eukaryotic transcription .
redox signal and nf-kappab activation in t cell .
accumulating data from a number of laboratory have recently indicate that the response of transcription factor nf-kappab to alteration in the redox homeostasis of cell may play an important role in modulate immune function .
the activation of nf-kappab have be recognize to regulate a number of gene necessary for normal t cell response include il-2 , il-6 , il-8 , and several t cell surface receptor .
diminished nf-kappab activity have be show to occur in t cell with aging , suggest that impaired activation of nf-kappab might occur during cellular senescence .
in addition , aberrancy in nf-kappab activity have be implicate in the immunopathogenesis of disease involve immune or inflammatory process such a atherosclerosis and hiv-1 infection .
the role of h2o2 and other reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) a an integratory secondary messenger for divergent t cell signal have be complicate by the fact that various t cell line and peripheral blood t cell differ markedly in the level of nf-kappab activation induce by oxidant stress .
additionally , proposed pathway of nf-kappab activation have be base on indirect evidence provide by experiment which use antioxidant to inhibit active nf-kappab formation .
far , complete activation of t cell require at least two signal , one that stimulate an increase in intracellular calcium and one that stimulate enzymatic process include kinase .
similarly , substantial evidence indicate that full activation of nf-kappab require dual signal .
the ability of h2o2 or other ro to induce t cell signal and functional response by these two mechanism be review and the specific response of nf-kappab to redox change in t cell be examine .
data be also present to suggest that the redox regulation in nf-kappab activation may be relevant to immune-related disease and to aging .
a novel heterodimerization partner for thyroid hormone receptor .
peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor .
retinoid-like receptor play a central role in hormonal response by form heterodimers with other nuclear hormone receptor .
in this study we have identify the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor ( ppar ) a a new thyroid hormone receptor ( thr ) auxiliary nuclear protein , heterodimerizing with thr in solution .
although these heterodimers do not recognize a classical thyroid hormone response element ( tre ) characterize by direct repeat separate by four nucleotide ( dr+4 ) , ppar behave a a dominant negative regulator of thyroid hormone ( th ) action .
however , a th -dependent positive effect be elicit by selective interaction of the thr beta- ppar but not the thr alpha- ppar heterodimer with a novel tre ( dr+2 ) .
the critical region of thr beta be map to 3 amino acid in the distal box of the dna binding domain .
hence , ppar can positively or negatively influence th action depend on tre structure and thr isotype .
nf-kappa b activity in t cell stably express the tax protein of human t cell lymphotropic virus type i .
the effect of constitutive tax expression on the interaction of nf-kappa b with it recognition sequence and on nf-kappa b -dependent gene expression be examine in t lymphoid jurkat cell line ( 19d and 9j ) stably transform with a tax expression vector .
tax expressing t cell line contain a constitutive level of nf-kappa b binding activity , detectable by mobility shift assay and uv cross-linking use a palindromic nf-kappa b probe homologous to the interferon beta prdii site .
in jurkat and nc2.10 induction with phorbol ester result in the appearance of new dna binding protein of 85 , 75 , and 54 kda , whereas in tax expressing cell the 85-kda protein and a 92-kda dna binding protein be constitutively induce .
expression of tax protein in 19d and 9j result in transcription of the endogenous nf-kappa b -dependent granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor gene and increase basal level expression of transfected nf-kappa b -regulated promoter .
nonetheless transcription of both the endogenous and the transfected gene be inducible by pma treatment .
tax expression in jurkat t cell may alter the stoichiometry of nf-kappa b dna binding protein and thus change the expression of nf-kappa b -regulated promoter .
late gene expression from the epstein-barr virus bclf1 and bfrf3 promoter do not require dna replication in ci .
late gene expression follow and be dependent upon lytic replication of the viral genome .
although experimental evidence be lacking , lytic viral dna replication be believe to remove modification or bind factor from the genome which serve to repress late gene expression during latency or the early lytic cycle .
we have develop a reporter assay to begin characterize the mechanism that regulate late gene expression in epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) .
in this model system , the activity of late promoter-reporter fusion be measure follow transient transfection into tissue culture cell express ebv during different stage of the lytic cycle .
this system faithfully recapitulate late expression pattern from the endogenous virus , implicate specific cis-active sequence in the control of late gene expression .
in addition , these promoter respond only indirectly to the viral immediate-early transactivator , zebra .
this indirect response be mediate by other viral or virally induce activity downstream of zebra in the lytic cascade .
in this system , late gene expression be sensitive to inhibitor of the viral dna polymerase such a phosphonoacetic acid , although the reporter lack a eukaryotic origin of replication and be not replicate under the assay condition .
thus , replication of the transcriptional template be not a prerequisite for expression with late kinetics , a finding inconsistent with the current model which posit a cis-active relationship between lytic ebv dna replication and late gene expression .
rather , analysis of this system have reveal a trans relationship between late gene expression and viral dna replication and highlight the indirect and complex link between these two event .
epstein-barr virus bind to cd21 activate the initial viral promoter via nf-kappab induction .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) , an oncogenic human herpesvirus , bind to and infect normal human b lymphocyte via cd21 , the cr2 complement receptor .
study of the mechanism that enable ebv to infect nonactivated , noncycling b cell provide compelling evidence for a sequence of event in which ebv bind to cd21 on purify rest human b cell rapidly activate the nf-kappab transcription factor , which , in turn , bind to and mediate transcriptional activation of wp , the initial viral latent gene promoter .
thus , ebv bind to it cellular receptor on rest b cell trigger an nf-kappab -dependent intracellular signaling pathway which be require for infection .
two distinct signalling pathway be involve in the control of the biphasic junb transcription induce by interleukin-6 in the b cell hybridoma 7td1 .
we have measure the level of junb mrna in the b hybridoma cell line 7td1 , under interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) stimulation .
il-6 increase junb mrna in a biphasic fashion .
the first early-induced peak be transient and likely correspond to the well document typical junb mrna , stimulate in response to numerous growth factor , include il-6 .
at variance , the second peak which have never be report previously , last several hour .
a a consequence of it effect on junb mrna , il-6 stimulate , in a biphasic fashion , the nuclear accumulation of the junb protein .
in this study , we demonstrate that il-6 regulation occur exclusively at the transcriptional level and that the bimodal increase of junb mrna and junb protein can be account for by a biphasic stimulation of junb transcription .
furthermore , our data point to two major difference between the mechanism of control of the early and the late il-6 -induced junb transcription wave .
first , cycloheximide strongly potentiate the transcription of the second wave , whereas it fail to affect the early-induced burst .
second , tyrphostin , a tyrosine kinase inhibitor , impair the expression of the first but not the second junb mrna peak .
conversely , genistein , another tyrosine kinase inhibitor , totally abolish the expression of the second peak of junb mrna whereas it do not affect the expression of the first peak .
altogether these data indicate that , in 7td1 cell , il-6 control junb transcription in a biphasic fashion by mean of two separate transduction pathway .
vitamin d receptor : no evidence for allele-specific mrna stability in cell which be heterozygous for the taq i restriction enzyme polymorphism .
allelic variation of the vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) gene have be associate with the risk of develop prostate cancer in men and osteoporosis in postmenopausal woman .
three rflps ( taqi , apai , bsmi ) define two common haplotype : bat and bat .
none of these polymorphism change the translate protein .
since sequence variation in the 3' utr of vdr have be link to the different haplotype , investigator have propose that the stability of vdr mrna be influence by allelic variation .
indirect evidence suggest that allele t be less stable than allele t .
in this study , we use a rt-pcr based approach to compare the stability of the big t and small t allele in normal heterozygous lymphocyte and the heterozygous cell line nb4 ( myeloid leukemia ) and pc-3 and du 145 ( prostate cancer ) .
in all three case , we do not find a significant difference in stability .
interestingly , we consistently observe 30 % less rt-pcr product derive from the small t allele mrna in steady state , a finding which also speak against a high stability of the small t allele mrna .
these result indicate a variation in transcriptional regulation rather than mrna stability between the allele .
we hypothesize that an unknown gene or gene in linkage with the polymorphism be ( be ) responsible for the relationship between risk of prostate cancer and vdr polymorphism .
enhance differentiation of hl-60 leukemia cell to macrophage induce by ciprofibrate .

the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor ( pparalpha ) transcription factor be express in hl-60 cell , but no change be observe in it expression upon hl-60 cell differentiation .
induction of icam-1 and lfa-3 by tax1 of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 and mechanism of down-regulation of icam-1 or lfa-1 in adult-t-cell-leukemia cell line .
the present study be undertake to determine the role of htlv-i taxi in the up-regulation of icam-i and lfa-3 in human t cell transform with htlv-i and the mechanism of down-regulation of icam-i and lfa-i in atl-derived cell line .

the mechanism of down-regulation of icam-i or lfa-i in 4 atl cell line be next examine .

finally , combined treatment of mt-i with 5-azacytidine and ifn-gamma induce re-expression of icam-i .
