h582 and hut102 be also negative for the lfa-i alpha chain ( cdiia ) mrna .
no genomic change be find , and a cat reporter gene with the cd18 promoter be inactive in the 3 of them , again suggest lack of ( a ) transcriptional factor ( s ) necessary for cd18 expression .
transcription factor in immune-mediated disease .
a large amount of detailed information about the intracellular protein regulate nf-kappa b activation and the cellular response to nf-kappa b activation have emerge recently .
several small molecule , an antisense oligonucleotide , and gene therapeutic agent that inhibit nf-kappa b activation have be describe .
despite this , there be still significant gap in our understanding of this process and it consequence .
in contrast , the characterization of transcription factor selectively regulate cytokine production by cd4+ t cell subset be at a very early stage .
three interact protein have recently be show to contribute to subset-restricted expression of the il-4 gene .
there be other element regulate il-4 gene expression , however , and the relative importance of these recently identify protein have yet to be determine .
constitutive expression c-fos , c-jun , and nf kappa b mrna be in nucleated fetal blood cell and up-regulation of c-fos and c-jun with anti-cd3 stimulation .
fetal and neonatal lymphocyte be relatively resistant to activation and cytokine production when stimulate either via their t-cell antigen receptor or lectin .
the molecular mechanism ( s ) responsible for this phenomenon have not be clearly elucidate .
we have hypothesize that such defect in fetal/neonatal t-cell activation may be due to lack of expression of the transcriptional regulatory element require for t-cell activation .
we use reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction to examine both fetal and term neonatal cord blood for mrna expression of three transcription factor implicate in t-cell activation : c-jun , c-fos , and nf kappa b ( p50 subunit ) .
we demonstrate that mrna for all three of these regulatory factor be express in fetal blood cell by the 27th week of gestation and in term cord blood .
activation of term infant cord blood mononuclear cell with anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody result in up-regulation of both c-jun and c-fos mrna within 15 min of stimulation .
however , secretion of il-2 by anti-cd3-stimulated cord blood mononuclear cell be still blunt compare with control cell from adult .
we conclude that fetal nucleated blood cell constitutively express important gene for cytokine regulation and be able to increase intracellular accumulation of the mrna for these factor in response to anti-cd3 stimulation .
thus , qualitative difference in the capacity to regulate these factor could not be show in fetal blood cell .
quantitative experiment compare binding of these transcription factor to the il-2 promoter be currently under investigation .
inhibition of nf-kappa b by sodium salicylate and aspirin [ see comment ]
the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be critical for the inducible expression of multiple cellular and viral gene involve in inflammation and infection include interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) , il-6 , and adhesion molecule .
the anti-inflammatory drug sodium salicylate and aspirin inhibit the activation of nf-kappa b , which far explain the mechanism of action of these drug .
this inhibition prevent the degradation of the nf-kappa b inhibitor , i kappa b , and therefore nf-kappa b be retain in the cytosol .
sodium salicylate and aspirin also inhibit nf-kappa b -dependent transcription from the ig kappa enhancer and the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) long terminal repeat ( ltr ) in transfected t cell .
glucocorticoid -induced apoptosis of human leukemic cell be cause by the repressive function of the glucocorticoid receptor .
induction of apoptosis in lymphocyte , which may account for the therapeutic effect of glucocorticoid in various disease include leukemia , depend on the glucocorticoid receptor .
however , the event lead from the activate receptor to cell lysis be not understand .
a prevail hypothesis postulate induction of so-called ' lysis gene ' by the activate receptor .
in this study , we show that an activation-deficient glucocorticoid receptor mutant be as effective a the wild-type receptor in repression of ap-1 activity , inhibition of interleukin-2 production , inhibition of c-myc expression and induction of apoptosis .
furthermore , we show that retinoic acid can also induce apoptosis in these cell through the retinoic acid receptor , whose repressive function but not target site specificity , be similar to those of the glucocorticoid receptor .
therefore , the primary effect of the receptor in glucocorticoid -mediated apoptosis correlate with transcriptional repression rather than activation and could be mediate by interference with other transcription factor require for cell survival .
in vivo footprint analysis of the hla-dra gene promoter : cell-specific interaction at the octamer site and up-regulation of x box binding by interferon gamma .
analysis of the major histocompatibility complex class ii gene promoter dra have previously identify at least five cis-acting region require for maximal expression .
we have examine the dra promoter for protein-dna interaction in the intact cell , which may mediate transcriptional activation .
use in vivo genomic footprinting we identify interaction in b-cell line at the octamer site and the y , x1 , and x2 box .
class ii antigen express t-cell line maintain contact identical to b-cell line , while class ii-negative t-cell line exhibit no interaction .
in lymphoid cell line , the octamer site be occupy and require for maximal expression .
this be most likely due to the presence of the lymphoid-specific otf-2 factor .
in contrast , the class ii-positive nonlymphoid glioblastoma cell line do not exhibit interaction at the octamer site despite the presence of the ubiquitous otf-1 factor and an open bind site .
thus , the dra promoter discriminate against otf-1 activation at the level of dna binding in the glioblastoma line .
interferon gamma induce class ii expression in this glioblastoma cell line and , in parallel , up-regulates x1 and x2 box protein-dna interaction , while all other interaction remain unchanged .
these result suggest that interferon gamma function on a poise promoter by alter weak , nonproductive interaction at the x box to strong interaction .
these finding provide direct in vivo evidence to strongly suggest that the modulation of x1 and x2 interaction be an important constituent of the interferon gamma induction pathway .
a regulatory element in the human interleukin 2 gene promoter be a bind site for the zinc finger protein sp1 and egr-1 .
activation of the interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene after antigen recognition be a critical event for t cell proliferation and effector function .
prior study have identify several transcription factor that contribute to the activity of the il-2 promoter in stimulate t lymphocyte .
here we describe a novel regulatory element within the il-2 promoter located immediately upstream of the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) domain .
this region ( term the zinc finger protein binding region ( zip ) ) serve a bind site for two differently regulate zinc finger protein : the constitutively express transcription factor sp1 and the inducible early growth response protein egr-1 .
in unstimulated cell which do not secrete il-2 , only sp1 bind to this region , while in stimulate il-2 secreting cell the inducible egr-1 protein recognize this element .
in jurkat t cell , the zip site serve a an activator for il-2 gene expression , and a combination of zip and nfat binding site be require for maximal il-2 promoter activity .
these result suggest a critical role of the zip site for il-2 promoter activity .
erp , a new member of the ets transcription factor/oncoprotein family : clone , characterization , and differential expression during b-lymphocyte development .
the ets gene family encode a group of protein which function a transcription factor under physiological condition and , if aberrantly express , can cause cellular transformation .
we have recently identify two regulatory element in the murine immunoglobulin heavy-chain ( igh ) enhancer , pi and microb , which exhibit striking similarity to bind site for ets-related protein .
to identify ets-related transcriptional regulator express in pre-b lymphocyte that may interact with either the pi or the microb site , we have use a pcr approach with degenerate oligonucleotides encode conserve sequence in all member of the ets family .
we have clone the gene for a new ets-related transcription factor , erp ( ets-related protein ) , from the murine pre-b cell line basc 6c2 and from mouse lung tissue .
the erp protein contain a region of high homology with the ets dna-binding domain common to all member of the ets transcription factor/oncoprotein family .
three additional small region show homology to the elk-1 and sap-1 gene , a subgroup of the ets gene family that interact with the serum response factor .
full-length erp express only negligible dna-binding activity by itself .
removal of the carboxy terminus enable erp to interact with a variety of ets-binding site include the e74 site , the igh enhancer pi site , and the lck promoter ets site , suggest a carboxy-terminal negative regulatory domain .
at least three erp -related transcript be express in a variety of tissue .
however , within the b-cell lineage , erp be highly express primarily at early stage of b-lymphocyte development , and expression decline drastically upon b-cell maturation , correlate with the enhancer activity of the igh pi site .
these data suggest that erp might play a role in b-cell development and in igh gene regulation .
heterogeneity of clonal development in chronic myeloproliferative disorder .
recent report have suggest a previously unexpected variability in the expression of the dominant neoplastic clone in myeloproliferative disorder ( mpd ) .
we evaluate 49 female patient with mpd and informative at the x-linked androgen receptor ( ar ) locus to establish the x chromosome inactivation pattern of hemopoietic cell .
whereas in chronic myelogenous leukemia ( cml ) the granulocyte ( pmn ) be uniformly of monoclonal origin , a striking heterogeneity of clonal development be find in pmn from patient with other mpd , with up to 50 % of them express a polyclonal pattern of x inactivation .
gangliosides suppress tumor necrosis factor production in human monocyte .
both normal and malignant cell contain gangliosides a important cell membrane constituent that , after be shed , may influence cell of the immune system .
we have study the impact of gangliosides on the expression of tnf in blood monocyte and in the monocytic cell line mono mac 6 .
although under standard culture condition , bovine brain gangliosides ( 100 micrograms/ml ) suppress lps-stimulated tnf production 5-fold in pbmc and 10-fold in mono mac 6 cell , suppression be more efficient under serum-free condition .
look at highly purify gangliosides , gd3 , gd1a , gm3 , gm2 , and gm1 be all effective in reduce tnf production in pbmc , and in mono mac 6 by factor 10 to 50 .
the suppressive activity be lose in molecule , lack the sugar moiety or the lipid moiety .
gangliosides appear to act at an early step of activation in that tnf transcript be reduce and the mobilization of the nuclear factor kappa b be block .
furthermore , in time kinetics , gangliosides be effective for up to 30 min after addition of lp , but not thereafter .
however , the expression of the cd14 ag , a receptor molecule for lps-lps binding protein complex , be unaffected by gangliosides .
finally , when use staphylococcus aureus or platelet activating factor a a stimulus , gangliosides be able to suppress tnf production in mono mac 6 cell by factor 5 to 10 , as well .
on the other hand , phorbol ester -induced production of o2- be similar in cell treat with and without gangliosides .
take together , our data demonstrate that tnf gene expression in monocyte induce by different type of stimulus can be block by gangliosides at an early step of signal transduction .
aly , a context-dependent coactivator of lef-1 and aml-1 , be require for tcralpha enhancer function .
lef-1 be a transcription factor that participate in the regulation of the t-cell receptor alpha ( tcr alpha ) enhancer by facilitate the assembly of multiple protein into a high order nucleoprotein complex .
the function of lef-1 be dependent , in part , on the hmg domain that induce a sharp bend in the dna helix , and on an activation domain that stimulate transcription only in a specific context of other enhancer-binding protein .
with the aim of gain insight into the function of context-dependent activation domain , we clone aly , a novel lef-1 -interacting protein .
aly be a ubiquitously express , nuclear protein that specifically associate with the activation domain of lef-1 and aml-1 ( cbf alpha2 , pebp2 alpha ( b ) , which be another protein component of the tcr alpha enhancer complex .
in addition , aly can increase dna binding by both lef-1 and aml protein .
overexpression of aly stimulate the activity of the tcr alpha enhancer complex reconstitute in transfected nonlymphoid hela cell , whereas down-regulation of aly by anti-sense oligonucleotides virtually eliminate tcr alpha enhancer activity in t cell .
similar to lef-1 , aly can stimulate transcription in the context of the tcr alpha enhancer but apparently not when tether to dna through an heterologous dna-binding domain .
we propose that aly mediate context-dependent transcriptional activation by facilitate the functional collaboration of multiple protein in the tcr alpha enhancer complex .
cellular redox status influence both cytotoxic and nf-kappa b activation in natural killer cell .
the role of cellular redox status in both cytotoxic activity and nf-kappa b activation in natural killer ( nk ) cell be investigate .
the result indicate that stimulation of nk cell , either freshly isolate from peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) or long-term culture nk clone , with specific cell target result in an increase binding activity of nf-kappa b and ap-1 transcription factor measure by gel retardation .
pretreatment of nk cell with the antioxidant pyrrolidine dithiocarbarmate ( pdtc ) lead to the inhibition of nf-kappa b activation but the ap-1 binding to dna be superinduced .
the inhibition of nf-kappa b by pdtc parallel with an inhibition of spontaneous cytotoxicity mediate by nk cell .
moreover , the inhibitor of serine protease , n-alpha-tosyl-l-lysine chloromethyl ketone and n-alpha-tosyl-l-phenylalanine chloromethyl ketone , also block the cytolytic activity of nk cell against the sensitive target k562 .
in contrast , nk activity be not affect by pretreatment of the effector cell with the proteasome inhibitor n-acetyl-leu-leu-norleucinal which selectively inhibit nf-kappa b activation .
altogether , these result support the hypothesis that the activation of nk cell involve transcriptional and post-transcriptional event , and that reactive intermediate may play an important role in the molecular process related with the generation of a cytotoxic response by nk cell .
p130 , p107 , and prb be differentially regulate in proliferate cell and during cell cycle arrest by alpha-interferon .
we have determine how the phosphorylation of the retinoblastoma family ( prb , p107 , and p130 ) be govern in individual cell cycle phase of daudi b-cells during cell cycle exit trigger by alpha-interferon ( alpha-ifn ) .
alpha-ifn cause dephosphorylation of prb and loss of p130 phosphorylated form 3 .
however , the change in p130 phosphorylation in response to alpha-ifn occur before dephosphorylation of prb be complete because loss of p130 form 3 occur throughout the cell cycle prior to complete arrest in g1 , whereas prb be dephosphorylated only in g1 .
in contrast , p107 be dephosphorylated and be then deplete from cell a they exit the cell cycle .
p130 , predominantly in form 1 , and hypophosphorylated prb bind an e2f dna binding site ; p130 complex e2f-4 , whereas prb bind both e2f-4 and e2f-1 .
the phosphorylated form of e2f-4 that bind to the e2f dna site be different from hyperphosphorylated e2f-4 , which predominate in primary hemopoietic cell in g0 .
we conclude that although cell cycle arrest induce by alpha-ifn may be mediate in part by formation of a complex contain p130 and e2f-4 , alpha-ifn do not induce hyperphosphorylation of e2f-4 , which characterize primary hemopoietic cell in g0 .
functional role of in vivo footprinted dna motif within an alpha-globin enhancer .
erythroid lineage and developmental stage specificity .
transcriptional regulation of the human alpha-like globin gene , embryonic zeta 2 and adult alpha , during erythroid development be mediate by a distal enhancer , hs-40 .
previous protein-dna binding study have show that hs-40 consist of multiple nuclear factor binding motif that be occupy in vivo in an erythroid lineage- and developmental stage- specific manner .
we have systematically analyze the functional role of these factor binding motif of hs-40 by site-directed mutagenesis and transient expression assay in erythroid cell culture .
three of these hs-40 enhancer motif , 5'nf-e2/ap1 , gt ii , and gata-1(c) , positively regulate the zeta 2-globin promoter activity in embryonic/fetal erythroid k562 cell and the adult alpha -globin promoter activity in adult erythroid mel cell .
on the other hand , the 3'nf-e2/ap1 motif be able to exert both positive and negative regulatory effect on the zeta 2-globin promoter activity in k562 cell , and this dual function appear to be modulate through differential binding of the ubiquitous ap1 factor and the erythroid-enriched nf-e2 factor .
mutation in the gata-1(d) motif , which exhibit an adult erythroid-specific genomic footprint , decrease the hs-40 enhancer function in dimethyl sulfoxide-induced mel cell but not in k562 cell .
these study have define the regulatory role of the different hs-40 motif .
the remarkable correlation between genomic footprinting data and the mutagenesis result also suggest that the erythroid lineage- and developmental stage- specific regulation of human alpha-like globin promoter be indeed modulate by stable binding of specific nuclear factor in vivo .
signal and nuclear factor that regulate the expression of interleukin-4 and interleukin-5 gene in helper t cell .
mouse thymoma line el-4 cell produce cytokine such a interleukin ( il ) -2 , il-3 , il-4 , il-10 , and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor in response to phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) .
el-4 cell also produce low level of il-5 when stimulate by pma alone ; however , camp greatly augment pma -dependent il-5 production .
a transient transfection assay reveal that two signal , pma and camp , be require for optimal activation of the il-5 promoter .
in contrast , camp almost completely inhibit the pma -dependent activation of the endogenous il-2 gene , as well a the transfected il-2 promoter .
these result indicate that the il-5 gene be positively regulate by camp in a manner opposite to that for the il-2 gene .
one of the nuclear factor ( nfs ) that regulate the response of the il-5 promoter to camp and pma have property similar to nf for activate t cell .
the p sequence of the il-4 gene , define a a responsive element for pma and calcium ionophore ( a23187 ) , share sequence similarity with the nf kappa b and the nf-activated t cell binding site .
we attempt to determine whether nf(p) , a nuclear factor specific for the p sequence , be related to nf-kappa b and nuclear factor for activate t cell ( nf-at ) .
in electromobility shift assay both nf-kappa b ( p65 or p65/p50 heterodimer ) and nf-at bind to the p sequence .
however , sequence specificity of nf-at be more similar to that of nf(p) , and only a small amount of p65 be detect in nf(p) .
these result indicate that a component or component of nf-at have the potential to reconstitute nf(p) , whereas nf-kappa b alone do not account for nf(p) in jurkat crude extract .
take together , these result suggest that nf-at-like factor be involve in the regulation of il-4 and il-5 gene .
visualization of the endogenous nf-kappa b p50 subunit in the nucleus of follicular dendritic cell in germinal center .
nf-kappa b , a 50 kda/65 kda ( p50/p65 ) heterodimer , be a ubiquitous transcription factor involve in the positive regulation of various immune gene .
the aim of this study be to determine whether nf-kappa b be related to a particular cell type and/or differentiation step during immunopoiesis .
use in situ hybridization on section from non hiv hyperplastic lymph node , we find that the gene of the 105 kda precursor of p50 be overexpressed in the light zone of germinal center , with a network aspect , which suggest the involvement of follicular dendritic cell ( fdc ) .
by immunohistochemistry , p50 protein be detect in the cytoplasm and nucleus of fdc , confirm the involvement of fdc .
furthermore , p50 protein be detect in the cytoplasm of all lymphocyte .
thus , we focus our study on isolate fdc cluster from normal tonsil .
a show on tissue section , we detect the p50 in both cytoplasm and nucleus of fdc .
nucleus of lymphocyte from fdc cluster be negative .
we next study p65 and c-rel protein expression in fdc cluster .
p65 be detect in the cytoplasm of fdc , whereas nucleus be negative .
furthermore , p65 be detect in the nucleus of some lymphocyte .
c-rel protein be detect only in the cytoplasm of lymphocyte and not in the nucleus and cytoplasm of fdc .
our result indicate that , in the context of t cell-dependent b cell immunopoiesis occur in fdc cluster , p50 be mainly related to fdc with a massive overexpression in the nucleus , whereas p65 be express in a scatter manner in the nucleus of lymphocyte and c-rel protein exclusively in the cytoplasm of lymphocyte from fdc cluster .
these result suggest that the two subunit of nf-kappa b and the c-rel protein have different role in different cell type during b cell immunopoiesis .
elf-2 , a rhombotin-2 binding ets transcription factor : discovery and potential role in t cell leukemia .
rhombotin-2 ( rbtn-2 ) be a proto-oncogene only in the context of t lymphocyte .
we postulate that the oncogenic effect of rbtn-2 in t cell be likely mediate by bind protein ( s ) with t cell-specific expression .
by screen a t cell cdna library , we identify a novel ets transcription factor that bind rbtn-2 .
this protein be name elf-2 because it dna-binding domain be virtually identical to that of ets family member elf-1 .
northern analysis show similar level of two elf-2 transcript ( 3.5 kb and 3.8 kb ) in all tissue except thymus .
thymocytes express four- to 10-fold great amount of the 3.5 kb transcript than other tissue .
sequence analysis of cdna clone indicate that these transcript encode protein differ only at their amino terminus , and likely represent alternatively splice isoforms .
these isoforms ( elf-2a and elf-2b ) contain identical rbtn-2 binding region and dna-binding domain .
elf-2b lack a putative transactivation domain .
the expression pattern suggest that rbtn-2 normally interact equally with elf-2a and elf-2b .
in contrast , when rbtn-2 be inappropriately express in t cell , rbtn-2 would interact predominantly with elf-2b ; this interaction may lead to t cell proliferation .
significance of quantitative analysis of aml1 /eto transcript in peripheral blood stem cell from t(8;21) acute myelogenous leukemia .
autologous peripheral blood stem cell transplantation ( pbsct ) be replace autologous bone marrow transplantation ( bmt ) in the treatment of leukemia .
one of the potential advantage of autologous pbsct be the possibility that peripheral blood stem cell ( pbsc ) be less likely to be contaminate by leukemic cell than bone marrow graft .
however , the major problem still remain the high incidence of leukemic relapse follow autologous pbsct , which may be cause by the reinfusion of pbsc contaminate by leukemic cell .
recently , we have develop a quantitative assay use competitive reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction that estimate the number of aml1 /eto transcript in t(8;21) acute myelogenous leukemia ( aml ) , in order to determine the degree of leukemic cell contamination in pbsc harvest , and to monitor minimal residual disease ( mrd ) quantitatively in patient with t(8;21) aml .
our data indicate that although pbsc harvest collect after consolidation chemotherapy be contaminate by leukemic cell , the degree of leukemic cell contamination decrease with repeated cycle of chemotherapy .
furthermore , the mrd in pbsc harvest be less than in the corresponding bone marrow obtain on the day of the pbsc collection .
there appear to be no relationship between the number of aml1 /eto transcript find in the infuse pbsc harvest and the incidence of leukemic relapse follow autologous pbsct in our study .
however , a substantial decrease of aml1 /eto transcript be see follow autologous pbsct .
thus , the quantitative analysis of aml1 /eto transcript may be clinically useful in patient with t(8;21) aml .
protease treatment of nuclear extract distinguish between class ii mhc x1 box dna-binding protein in wild-type and class ii-deficient b cell .
the x box region be critical for direct the expression of class ii major histocompatibility complex gene in b lymphocyte .
although several class ii promoter-specific dna binding factor have be describe , only the x box region factor , rfx , show a genetic correlation with class ii expression , be deficient in some b cell line derive from patient with class ii-deficient congenital immunodeficiency .
to far evaluate the role of x box dna-binding protein in class ii gene expression , the role of the x box region be examine in both class ii-positive and -negative lymphoid cell .
in addition to the wild-type b cell line raji , two class ii transcriptional mutant cell line , sjo and rj2.2.5 , and jurkat , a class ii negative t cell line , be examine .
in contrast to wild-type b cell , neither of the class ii mutant cell line could use the x box region to direct the expression of a transiently transfected reporter gene , indicate that the x box-dependent transcriptional pathway be defective in these cell .
the binding activity of the x1 box dna-binding protein rfx be examine and find to be present in wild-type b cell and the mutant rj2.2.5 but be absent in sjo and jurkat .
however , other x1 box-specific activity be detect in all these cell line .
to determine whether these different x1 box activity represent distinct dna binding protein or multimeric form of the same factor ( s ) , protease treatment of the crude nuclear extract follow by dna-binding assay be carry out and demonstrate that b cell extract contain at least two x1-specific factor .
one of these cleave product ( band 1 pk ) correlate with rfx activity .
a similar comparison with protease-treated extract prepare from jurkat cell demonstrate the presence of the band 1pk activity despite an absence of the native rfx activity .
in contrast , protease treatment and analysis of sjo extract show no detectable level of the band 1pk activity .
these result demonstrate that multiple x1 box-specific dna-binding activity exist in all lymphoid cell , but the presence of an actively binding rfx specie correlate with class ii transcription .
molecular characterization and pattern of tissue expression of the gene for neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin from human .
neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( ngal ) be a 25-kda lipocalin first identify a a protein store in specific granule of the human neutrophil .
the protein be believe to bind small lipophilic substance such a bacterial derive formylpeptides and lipopolysaccharides ( lp ) and might function a a modulator of inflammation .
to characterize the regulation of ngal far , we have clone and sequence a 5869-bp region of the ngal gene include 1695 bp of the 5' nontranscribed region and a 3696-bp cod region encompass seven exon and six intron .

the ngal gene be highly homologous to the mouse gene 24p3 .
