prenatal immune challenge alter the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical axis in adult rat .
we investigate whether non-abortive maternal infection would compromise fetal brain development and alter hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical ( hpa ) axis function when adult .
to study putative teratogenic effect of a t cell-mediated immune response versus an endotoxic challenge , 10-d-pregnant rat receive a single intraperitoneal injection of 5 x 10 ( 8 ) human red blood cell ( hrbc ) or gram-negative bacterial endotoxin ( escherichia coli lp : 30 micrograms/kg ) .
the adult male progeny ( 3 mo old ) of both experimental group show increase basal plasma corticosterone level .
in addition , after novelty stress the hrbc group , but not the lp group , show increase acth and corticosterone level .
both group show substantial decrease in mineralocorticoid ( mr ) and glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) level in the hippocampus , a limbic brain structure critical for hpa axis regulation , whereas gr concentration in the hypothalamus be unchanged and in anterior pituitary be slightly increase .
hrbc and lp indeed stimulate the maternal immune system a reveal by specific anti- hrbc antibody production and enhance il-1 beta mrna expression in splenocytes , respectively .
this study demonstrate that a t cell-mediated immune response as well a an endotoxic challenge during pregnancy can induce anomaly in hpa axis function in adulthood .
clinically , it may be postulate that disturbed fetal brain development due to prenatal immune challenge increase the vulnerability to develop mental illness involve inadequate response to stress .
heat-shock and cadmium chloride increase the vimentin mrna and protein level in u-937 human promonocytic cell .
heat-shock for 2 hour at 42 degree c , or the administration for 3 hour of 100 or 150 microm cadmium chloride , inhibit the subsequent proliferation activity , induce the expression of functional differentiation marker , and cause an increase in the amount of the stress-responsive hsp70 protein in u-937 human promonocytic cell .
in addition , both heat and cadmium produce an increase in the amount of the intermediate filament protein vimentin , a determine by immunoblot and immunofluorescence assay .
by contrast , the amount of actin and beta-tubulin be not significantly alter .
the amount of vimentin mrna be also increase during recovery from stress , indicate that vimentin expression be not exclusively regulate at the protein level .
although cadmium cause an early , transient stimulation of c-jun and c-fos expression and ap-1 binding activity , heat-shock fail to alter both protooncogene expression and transcription factor binding , indicate that the stress-induced vimentin increase be not the result of ap-1 -mediated transcriptional activation .
finally , it be observe that the rate of decay of vimentin mrna upon actinomycin d administration be decrease in heat- and cadmium- pretreated cell in comparison to untreated cell .
these result indicate that stress treatment cause an increase in vimentin level in promonocytic cell , which may be explain at least in part by transcript stabilization .
suppression of c-jun by antisense oligonucleotides inhibit cell adhesion but not respiratory burst during phorbol ester-induced differentiation of u937 human monoblastic cell .
we study the role of the immediate early gene c-jun in cell proliferation and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) -induced differentiation in u937 human monoblastic cell , use c-jun -specific antisense ( as ) phosphorothioate oligonucleotides .
in select the most specific and potent oligonucleotide sequence , we perform extensive analysis for the binding specificity between all candidate of c-jun as oligonucleotides and the whole sequence in genbank database , use a computer program .
among the 20 select oligonucleotides , two potent 15-mer as oligonucleotides ( c-jun as oligonucleotides ) exhibit significant inhibition of cell growth in a dose-dependent manner between 2 and 10 microm .
reverse transcription-pcr and western blot analysis demonstrate that 10 microm of c-jun as oligonucleotides reduce c-jun expression at both the mrna and protein level .
more importantly , c-jun as oligonucleotides show distinct effect on two marker of pma -induced differentiation ; the c-jun as oligonucleotides inhibit cell adhesion , whereas they do not affect another marker of differentiation , respiratory burst ( measure by nitro blue tetrazolium reduction assay ) .
these result suggest a critical role of c-jun in both cell proliferation and pma -induced cell adhesion but not in pma -induced respiratory burst in u937 cell .
abnormal t lymphocyte development induce by target overexpression of ikappab alpha .
a role in thymic maturation for factor of the nf-kappab family have long be suspect , but not yet prove .
transgenic mouse with a lymphocyte-specific defect in nf-kappab activation be produce by target expression of human ikappab alpha .
the thymic cellularity of these mouse be significantly decrease .
the proportion of mature , tcrhigh thymocytes of the alphabeta lineage be reduce , and the remain tcrhigh population contain an unusually high proportion of double-positive cell .
this defect in maturation result in a transgene dose-dependent reduction in peripheral t lymphocyte , with the cd8 lineage be more severely affect .
these data provide direct evidence for the involvement of nf-kappab /rel family protein in late stage of t lymphocyte development , coincident with positive and negative selection .
the lytic transition of epstein-barr virus be imitate by recombinant b-cells .
lytic transition of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) be initiate by distinct immediate early regulator of the viral cycle , in synchronization to temporary , permissive condition during host cell differentiation .
we develop eukaryotic vector suitable to imitate the process involve in lytic transition in cell culture system .
two stable b cell line be establish : r59z activator cell be use to induce lytic ebv expression in a constitutive manner by the production of the bzlf 1 trans-activator ( zta ) .
r7-57 reporter cell , on the other hand , signal induce activity of the lytic origin of ebv replication ( ori lyt ) .
different mode , like chemical induction , lytic superinfection with ebv and single gene trans-activation convert the recombinant ori lyt element in r7-57 reporter cell .
bzlf 1 , transiently express in r7-57 reporter cell , be the only ebv trans-activator find , sufficient in induce the viral lytic cycle .
base on these experiment , trans-cellular activation of ebv be test by cocultivation of bzlf 1 -expressing r59z activator cell with the r7-57 reporter line .
no lytic effect on the reporter cell could be measure , neither by cocultivation of activator cell nor by coincubation of bzlf 1 -containing cell lysates .
latency breaking activity , however , be transfer from activator to reporter cell when active , exogenous virus be add .
the cell system describe in these experiment provide a tool for the detection of ebv reactivation and demonstrate the potential of the lytic regulatory gene bzlf 1
transcription of the hypersensitive site hs2 enhancer in erythroid cell .
in the human genome , the erythroid-specific hypersensitive site hs2 enhancer regulate the transcription of the downstream beta-like globin gene 10-50 kilobases away .
the mechanism of hs2 enhancer function be not know .
the present study employ rna protection assay to analyze the transcriptional status of the hs2 enhancer in transfected recombinant chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) plasmid .
in erythroid k562 cell in which the hs2 enhancer be active , the hs2 sequence direct the synthesis of long enhancer transcript that be initiate apparently from within the enhancer and elongate through the intervene dna into the cis-linked cat gene .
in nonerythroid hl-60 cell in which the hs2 enhancer be inactive , long enhancer transcript be not detectable .
split the hs2 enhancer between two tandem ap1 site abolish the synthesis of a group of long enhancer transcript and result in loss of enhancer function and transcriptional silencing of the cis-linked cat gene .
in direct the synthesis of rna through the intervene dna and the gene by a tracking and transcription mechanism , the hs2 enhancer may ( i ) open up the chromatin structure of a gene domain and ( ii ) deliver enhancer binding protein to the promoter sequence where they may stimulate the transcription of the gene at the cap site .
interleukin-4 inhibit the lipopolysaccharide-induced expression of c-jun and c-fos messenger rna and activator protein-1 binding activity in human monocyte .
we study the effect of interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) on the lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induction of two immediate early gene c-fos and c-jun .
these gene encode protein that form the dimeric complex activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) , which be active a a transcriptional factor .
maximal accumulation of either c-fos and c-jun messenger rna ( mrna ) occur 30 minute after lp addition .
when cell be treat with il-4 for 5 hour before lp activation , both the c-fos and the c-jun mrna expression be decrease .
the inhibition of c-fos and c-jun expression by il-4 in lps-treated cell be show to be due to a low transcription rate of the c-fos and c-jun gene .
il-4 do not affect the stability of the c-fos and c-jun transcript .
finally , use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , evidence be obtain that il-4 inhibit lps-induced expression of ap-1 protein .
these data indicate that il-4 suppress the induction of transcription factor in human activate monocyte .
mechanism that contribute to the development of lymphoid malignancy : role for genetic alteration and cytokine production .
recent study have define genetic alteration commonly associate with transform lymphocyte .
this review suggest role for these alteration in the development of lymphoid neoplasm .
damage to the gene encode protein that function in intracellular signaling , transcription , or regulation of the cell cycle have be identify and link at vary degree to the progression of certain lymphoid malignancy .
an understanding of the mechanistic consequence follow such genetic alteration be essential to an understanding of the development of these lymphoid neoplasm .
in contrast , it be also become clear that the dysregulated expression of protein that be not genetically alter can also contribute to the progression of lymphoid malignancy .
one such example be the excessive expression of " normal " lymphokine of cytokine which accompany many lymphoproliferative disease .
the dysregulated expression of cytokine during malignancy can result in the augmentation of growth of transform lymphocyte , as well a an alteration of the anti-tumor immune response .
the latter mechanism be especially important because evasion of the impending immune response be a prerequisite for the progression of lymphoproliferative disease .
take together , this review support the notion that the development of lymphoid malignancy be multifactorial , involve genetic alteration as well a dysregulated cytokine expression .
one base pair change abolish the t cell-restricted activity of a kb-like proto-enhancer element from the interleukin 2 promoter .
the inducible , t cell-specific enhancer of murine and human interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene contain the kb-like sequence gggatttcacc a an essential cis-acting enhancer motif .
when clone in multiple copy this so-called tced ( distal t cell element ) act a an inducible proto-enhancer element in e14 t lymphoma cell , but not in hela cell .
in extract of induce , il-2 secreting el4 cell three individual protein factor bind to tced dna .
the binding of the most prominent factor , name tcf-1 ( t cell factor 1 ) , be correlate with the proto-enhancer activity of tced .
tcf-1 consist of two polypeptide of about 50 kd and 105 kd ; the former seem to be related to the 50 kd polypeptide of nf-kb .
purify nf-kb be also able to bind to the tced , but tcf-1 bind strong than nf-kb to tced dna .
the conversion of the tced to a ' perfect ' nf-kb binding site lead to a tight binding of nf-kb to tced dna and , a a functional consequence , to the activity of the ' convert ' tced motif in hela cell .
thus , the substitution of the underline a residue to a c within the gggatttcacc motif abolish it t cell-restricted activity and lead to it function in both el4 cell and hela cell .
these result indicate that lymphocyte-specific factor bind to the tced be involve in the control of t cell specific-transcription of the il-2 gene .
the ap-1 site at -150 bp , but not the nf-kappa b site , be likely to represent the major target of protein kinase c in the interleukin 2 promoter .
stimulation of t cell with antigen result in activation of several kinase , include protein kinase c ( pkc ) , that may mediate the late induction of activation-related gene .
we have examine the potential role of pkc in induction of the interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) gene in t cell stimulate through the t cell receptor/cd3 complex .
we have previously show that prolonged treatment of the untransformed t cell clone ar-5 with phorbol ester result in downmodulation of the alpha and beta isozymes of pkc , and abrogate induction of il-2 mrna and protein .
here we show that phorbol ester treatment also abolish induction of chloramphenicol acetyltransferase activity in ar-5 cell transfected with a plasmid contain the il-2 promoter link to this reporter gene .
the il-2 promoter contain bind site for nuclear factor include nfat-1 , oct , nf-kappa b , and ap-1 , which be all potentially sensitive to activation of pkc .
we show that induction of a trimer of the nfat and oct site be not sensitive to phorbol ester treatment , and that mutation in the nf-kappa b site have no effect on inducibility of the il-2 promoter .
in contrast , mutation in the ap-1 site located at -150 bp almost completely abrogate induction of the il-2 promoter , and appearance of an inducible nuclear factor bind to this site be sensitive to pkc depletion .
moreover , cotransfections with c-fos and c-jun expression plasmid markedly enhance induction of the il-2 promoter in minimally stimulate t cell .
our result indicate that the ap-1 site at -150 bp represent a major , if not the only , site of pkc responsiveness in the il-2 promoter .
protein-tyrosine kinase activation be require for lipopolysaccharide induction of interleukin 1beta and nfkappab activation , but not nfkappab nuclear translocation .
in human monocyte , interleukin 1beta protein production and steady state mrna level be increase in response to lipopolysaccharide , predominantly a a result of increase transcription of the interleukin 1beta gene .
expression of interleukin 1beta and other cytokine , such a interleukin 6 and tumor necrosis factor alpha , have be show to be dependent on the activation of the transcription factor , nfkappab .
since recent study have show that lipopolysaccharide -induced tyrosine kinase activation be not require for nfkappab nuclear translocation , we seek to determine whether nfkappab translocate in the absence of tyrosine kinase activity be active in stimulate transcription .
we have find that , in the human pro-monocytic cell line , thp-1 , the lipopolysaccharide -induced expression of interleukin 1beta be dependent on tyrosine kinase activation .
tyrosine kinase be not require for lipopolysaccharide -mediated nuclear translocation of nfkappab .
however , in the absence of tyrosine kinase activity , the ability of nfkappab to stimulate transcription be impaired .
this inhibition of transcription be specific for nfkappab ; in the absence of tyrosine kinase activity , ap-1 -dependent transcription be enhance .
these result suggest that , while lipopolysaccharide -induced expression of inflammatory mediator require tyrosine kinase activity , tyrosine kinase activity be not obligatory for lipopolysaccharide signal transduction .
expression of p13mtcp1 be restricted to mature t-cell proliferation with t(x;14) translocation .
t-cell prolymphocytic leukemia ( t-pll ) , a rare form of mature t-cell leukemia , and ataxia telangiectasia clonal proliferation , a related condition occurring in patient suffer from ataxia telangiectasia , have be associate to translocation involve the 14q32.1 or xq28 region , where be located the tcl1 and mtcp1 putative oncogene , respectively .
the mtcp1 gene be involve in the t(x;14)(q28;q11) translocation associate with these t-cell proliferation .
alternative splicing generate type a and b transcript that potentially encode two entirely distinct protein ; type a transcript code for a small mitochondrial protein , p8mtcp1 , and type b transcript , contain an additional open reading frame , may code for 107 amino-acid protein , p13mtcp1 .
the recently clone tcl1 gene , also involve in translocation and inversion associate with t-cell proliferation , cod for a 14-kd protein that display significant homology with p13mtcp1 .
we have generate rabbit antiserum against this putative p13mtcp1 protein and screen for expression of p13mtcp1 normal lymphoid tissue and 33 case of immature and mature lymphoid t-cell proliferation use a sensitive western blot assay .
we also investigate the mtcp1 locus configuration by southern blot analysis .
the p13mtcp1 protein be detect in the three t-cell proliferation with mtcp1 rearrangement because of t(x;14) translocation , but neither in normal rest and activate lymphocyte nor in the other t-cell leukemia .
our data support the hypothesis that p13mtcp1 and p14tcl1 form a new protein family that play a key role in the pathogenesis of t-pll and related condition .
camp inducibility of transcriptional repressor icer in develop and mature human t lymphocyte [ publish erratum appear in proc natl acad sci u s a 1996 jul 23 ; 93 ( 15 ) : 8154 ]
stimulation of the camp -dependent signaling pathway exert an inhibitory effect on the proliferation and effector function of t cell .
the ability of t cell to form high intracellular level of camp be acquire during development in the human thymus and be retain by the majority of mature peripheral t lymphocyte .
here we show that elevated camp level in t cell correlate with the expression of the potent transcriptional repressor icer ( inducible camp early repressor ) previously describe in the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal axis .
far , in transcriptional assay in vivo , icer inhibit calcineurin -mediated expression of the interleukin 2 promoter as well a tax -mediated transactivation of the human t-lymphotropic virus type i ( htlv-i ) promoter .
thus , the induction of icer in t cell may play an important role in the camp -induced quiescence and the persistent latency of htlv-i .
occurrence of a silencer of the interleukin-2 gene in naive but not in memory rest t helper lymphocyte .
in the immune system the first activation of a naive t cell by antigen be a key step in the shaping of the peripheral t cell specificity repertoire and maintenance of self-tolerance .
in the present study , analysis of the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene activation show that naive human helper t cell ( cord blood cd4+ t cell , adult cd4+cd45ro- t cell ) regulate il-2 transcription by a mechanism involve both a silencer and an activator act on the purine-rich il-2 promoter element ( nf-at binding site ) .
by contrast , memory cell , either in vitro activate helper t cell revert to a resting state , or cd4+ t ( memory ) clone , or cd4+cd45ro+ t cell isolate ex vivo , no longer have a silencer .
their il-2 transcription seem to be control solely by the transition from inactive to active functional state of a positive transcription factor bind to these promoter element as well a it cytoplasmic or nuclear location : in rest memory t cell the activator be located in the cytoplasm and be inactive , whereas in stimulate cell it be functional in promote transcription and now reside in the nucleus .
thus , the regulation of the gene cod for the main t cell growth factor change irreversibly after the first encounter of t cell with antigen .
it be most likely that the presence of a silencer contribute to the more stringent activation requirement of naive cd4+ t cell .
influence of estradiol and tamoxifen on susceptibility of human breast cancer cell line to lysis by lymphokine-activated killer cell .
the design of combination hormonal and immunotherapeutic protocol for breast cancer patient may be facilitate by analysis of preclinical in vitro model system .
estrogen receptor positive ( er+ : mcf-7 ) and negative ( er- : mda-mb-231 ) human breast cancer cell line be utilize to evaluate the effect of tamoxifen ( tam ) and estradiol ( e2 ) on modulation of breast cancer target susceptibility to lysis by lymphokine-activated killer ( lak ) cell .
e2 -stimulated er+ cell be more susceptible to lysis by lak cell than correspond tam -treated or control cell , while treatment of er-_cells with either e2 or tam alone do not alter from control their susceptibility to this immune-mediated lysis .
all er+ and er- cell test remain sensitive after treatment with tam to lysis by lak cell .
in addition , an adenocarcinoma reactive human-mouse chimeric monoclonal antibody ( ing-1 ) be able to significantly boost in vivo generate lak cell-mediated lysis of control , e2-treated , and tam-treated er+ and er- cell .
these in vitro result provide a preclinical rationale for in vivo testing of tam , interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) , and breast cancer reactive antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity facilitate antibody in patient with refractory or high risk breast cancer .
protease inhibitor block lipopolysaccharide induction of tissue factor gene expression in human monocytic cell by prevent activation of c-rel/ p65 heterodimers .
tissue factor ( tf ) be express rapidly by human monocyte expose to bacterial endotoxin ( lipopolysaccharide , or lp ) .
transcriptional regulation be mediate by binding of c-rel /p65 heterodimers to a kappa b-like site in the tf promoter .
nuclear translocation of cytosolic c-rel/ p65 heterodimers and other member of the nf-kappa b /rel family require dissociation and proteolytic degradation of the inhibitor protein , i kappa b alpha .
the protease inhibitor n alpha-tosylphenylalanyl chloromethyl ketone ( tpck ) and n alpha-tosyl-l-lysine chloromethyl ketone ( tlck ) block activation of nf-kappa b /rel protein by prevent degradation of i kappa b alpha .
to determine if tpck and tlck inhibit lp induction of tf expression , freshly isolate human monocyte and monocytic thp-1 cell be pretreated with these inhibitor for 30 min before lp stimulation .
both tpck and tlck inhibit lp induction of tf protein , tf mrna and tf promoter activity in a dose-dependent manner .
these inhibitor specifically prevent degradation of i kappa b alpha and nuclear translocation of c-rel /p65 heterodimers .
in contrast , tpck and tlck do not block induction of an immediate-early gene encode the transcription factor , egr-1 .
take together , these data indicate that inhibit nuclear translocation of c-rel /p65 heterodimers prevent lp induction of tf gene transcription in monocytic cell .
do activation of the tal1 gene occur in a majority of patient with t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ? a pediatric oncology group study .
almost 25 % of patient with t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( t-all ) have tumor-specific rearrangement of the tal1 gene .
although tal1 expression have not be observe in normal lymphocyte , tal1 gene product be readily detect in leukemic cell that harbor a rearrange tal1 allele .
hence , it have be propose that ectopic expression of tal1 promote the development of t-all .
in this report , we show that tal1 be express in the leukemic cell of most patient with t-all , include many that do not display an apparent tal1 gene alteration .
a polymorphic dinucleotide repeat in the transcribe sequence of tal1 be use to determine the allele specificity of tal1 transcription in primary t-all cell .
monoallelic expression of tal1 be observe in the leukemic cell of all patient ( 8 of 8 ) bear a tal1 gene rearrangement .
in the leukemic cell of patient without detectable tal1 rearrangement , tal1 transcription occur in either a monoallelic ( 3 of 7 patient ) or a biallelic ( 4 of 7 patient ) fashion .
thus , tal1 activation in these patient may result from subtle alteration in cis-acting regulatory sequence ( affect expression of a single tal1 allele ) or change in trans-acting factor that control tal1 transcription ( affect expression of both tal1 allele ) .
stress response of senescent t lymphocyte : reduce hsp70 be independent of the proliferative block .
senescent human t lymphocyte culture be unable to undergo proliferation , but show no difference from early passage cell in cytotoxic function or surface antigenic profile .
a second feature of senescent t cell be the dramatic reduction in hsp70 production in response to heat shock .
this decline be associate with a decrease in binding of nuclear extract to the consensus heat shock element .
interestingly , the progressive decline in the heat shock response of culture t cell correlate with the percent proliferative life span complete rather than with the actual proliferative activity at the time of heat shock .
this suggest that for senescent t cell the reduce ability to respond to heat shock by produce hsp70 , although possibly lie at the level of transcriptional control , may nevertheless be unrelated to the reduce dna synthesis or the diminish proliferative activity also manifest by these cell .
trans-activation of the hiv promoter by a cdna and it genomic clone of human herpesvirus-6 .
human herpesvirus 6 ( hhv-6 ) be a lymphotropic herpesvirus , and in vitro , it can productively infect human cd4+ t cell a hiv-1 .
co-infection of t cell by hiv-1 and hhv-6 can lead to both activation of the hiv-1 promoter and acceleration of the cytopathic effect .
an hhv-6 ( g ) cdna clone , pcd41 , encode for a 41-kda nuclear protein be identify and characterize previously ( chang and balachandran , j. virol . 65 , 2884-2894 and 7085 , 1991 ) .
sequence analysis show that this protein have significant homology with the human cytomegalovirus ul44 gene cod for the icp36 family of early-late-class phosphoprotein .
use this cdna a the probe , a 3.8-kb ecori genomic fragment encode the hhv-6 ( g ) p41 be clone and designate a pgd41 .
when cotransfected with the hiv ltr cat into cv-1 cell , both the pcd41 and pgd41 clone trans-activated the hiv ltr .
sequence analysis of pcd41 indicate that there be two potential open reading frame ( orfs ) , a and b , which be homologous to the orfs find in the genomic clone pgd41 .
deletion construct of the pcd41 clone demonstrate that orf-a be critical for the hiv ltr activation .
deletion analysis of the pcd41 orf-a and the use of promoter construct far map an internal functional promoter within the pcd41 sequence that can direct the synthesis of the trans-activating protein .
by use hiv ltr deletion mutant , the nf-kappa b binding site be find to be critical for response to the pcd41 trans-activation .
molecular cloning of fkhrl1p2 , a member of the developmentally regulate fork head domain transcription factor family .
here we report the expression of a fork head domain protein in human t helper cell .
we clone and characterize a fork head cdna from human t helper cell mrna use differential display rt-pcr .
the cdna contain a 546-nucleotide ( nt ) open reading frame ( orf ) that cod for the carboxyl-terminal 180 amino acid ( aa ) of the recently identify fkhrl1 gene .
this orf do not contain the characteristic dna-binding domain find in member of the forkhead protein family .
in-vitro transcription/translation of this cdna express a protein of approximately 20 kda .
we have generate antibody that specifically immunoprecipitated the in-vitro-translated 20-kda protein .
this antibody also recognize in human t lymphocyte a 70-kda protein correspond in size to that predict for the fkhrl1 gene product .
the mrna level for fkhrl1 be elevated in t helper-induced lymphocyte in comparison to pha-stimulated t lymphocyte .
further characterization of fkhrl1 and it related family member should shed light on the transcriptional mechanism of this fork head gene subfamily and their role in t helper cell differentiation and regulation of cell growth .
missense mutation in exon 7 of the common gamma chain gene cause a moderate form of x-linked combined immunodeficiency .
clinical and immunologic feature of a recently recognize x-linked combined immunodeficiency disease ( xcid ) suggest that xcid and x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency ( xscid ) might arise from different genetic defect .
the recent discovery of mutation in the common gamma chain ( gamma c ) gene , a constituent of several cytokine receptor , in xscid provide an opportunity to test directly whether a previously unrecognized mutation in this same gene be responsible for xcid .
the status of x chromosome inactivation in blood leukocyte from obligate carrier of xcid be determine from the polymorphic , short tandem repeat ( cag ) , in the androgen receptor gene , which also contain a methylation-sensitive hpaii site .
a in xscid , x-chromosome inactivation in obligate carrier of xcid be nonrandom in t and b lymphocyte .
in addition , x chromosome inactivation in pmns be variable .
finding from this analysis prompt sequencing of the gamma c gene in this pedigree .
a missense mutation in the region cod for the cytoplasmic portion of the gamma c gene be find in three affect male but not in a normal brother .
therefore , this point mutation in the gamma c gene lead to a less severe degree of deficiency in cellular and humoral immunity than that see in xscid .
glucocorticoid -mediated inhibition of interleukin-2 receptor alpha and -beta subunit expression by human t cell .
to determine the mechanism of glucocorticoid ( gc ) -mediated inhibition of t cell function , the effect of dexamethasone ( dm ) on t cell proliferation and interleukin-2 receptor ( il-2r ) generation be study .
dexamethasone inhibit il-2 -induced t cell proliferation by 30 % -88 % , relative to it concentration within the culture .
the effect of dm on expression of il-2r alpha ( tac , p55 , cd25 ) and beta ( p75 ) gene in activate t cell be examine next .
in t cell stimulate with purify phytohemagglutinin ( pha-p ) and 4 beta-phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) addition of dm to the culture result in a 60 % reduction in il-2r alpha and a 30 % reduction in il-2r beta membrane expression compare to t cell culture in the absence of dm ( p < 0.01 ) .
inhibition of membrane il-2r alpha and il-2r beta expression by 10(-6) m dm be partially reversible by recombinant human il-2 ( rhil-2 ) .
by northern blot analysis , dm cause a comparable decrease in il-2r alpha and in il-2r beta mrna level to membrane receptor expression in mitogen-stimulated t cell .
by in vitro transcription assay , dm regulate il-2r alpha gene expression at a transcriptional level while transcription of il-2r beta gene be unaffected by dm .
the mechanism of action of dm on il-2r alpha transcription be examine by determine the mrna level of the p50 subunit of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , a transcription factor that stimulate il-2r alpha gene expression .
the data indicate that 10(-6) m dm increase t cell p50 nf-kappa b mrna level by four-fold compare to the level obtain in the absence of dm .
far , the level of nuclear protein capable of bind to the nf-kappa b site in activate t cell increase in response to dm .
in sum , dm regulate t cell membrane expression of il-2r by more than one molecular mechanism .
conserve element contain nf-e2 and tandem gata binding site be require for erythroid-specific chromatin structure reorganization within the human beta-globin locus control region .
proper expression of the gene of the human beta-globin gene locus require the associate locus control region ( lcr ) .
structurally , the lcr be define by the presence of four domain of erythroid-specific chromatin structure .
these domain , which have be characterize a dnase i hypersensitive site ( hs ) , comprise the active element of the lcr .
the major focus of this research be to define the cis_-acting element which be require for the formation of these domain of unique chromatin structure .
our previous investigation on the formation of lcr hs4 demonstrate that nf-e2 and tandem , inverted gata binding site be require for the formation of the native h .
similarly arrange nf-e2 and tandem gata site be present within the core region of the other human lcr hs and be evolutionarily conserve .
use site-directed mutagenesis of human hs 2 and 3 we have test the hypothesis that these nf-e2 and gata site be common requirement for the formation of all lcr hs .
we find that mutation of these element , and particularly the gata element , result in a decrease or complete loss of dnase i hypersensitivity .
these data imply the presence of common structural element within the core of each lcr h which be require for erythroid-specific chromatin structure reorganization .
anti-cd2 receptor antibody activate the hiv long terminal repeat in t lymphocyte .
the cd2 t lymphocyte glycoprotein surface molecule mediate both cell to cell adhesion and t cell activation , two process that be involve in the spread of hiv infection .
treatment of chronically hiv-infected pbmc with anti-cd2 mab have be show to induce the expression of infectious virus from these culture .
in this study we investigate the mechanism whereby anti-cd2 antibody stimulate viral production .
we demonstrate that treatment of transiently transfected t lymphocyte with anti-cd2 antibody result in activation of the hiv long terminal repeat .
furthermore , cat assay use mutate hiv long terminal repeat -cat construct and gel shift assay demonstrate that this activation be dependent on the nf-kappa b enhancer .
these study suggest that interaction of cd2 with it natural ligand , lfa-3 , may play a role in regulation of hiv expression .
the human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 posttranscriptional trans-activator rex contain a nuclear export signal .
the rex protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 be require for the nuclear export of unspliced viral mrna and , therefore , for virus replication .
in this manuscript , we demonstrate that rex shuttle between the nucleus and the cytoplasm and that it activation domain constitute a nuclear export signal that specify efficient transport to the cytoplasm .
these finding be consistent with a model for rex -mediated trans-activation in which rex -viral mrna complex be target for nuclear export by the direct action of the activation domain .
interaction of htlv-i tax with the human proteasome : implication for nf-kappa b induction .
the human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) have be etiologically associate with the development of the adult t-cell leukemia ( atl ) as well a degenerative neurologic syndrome term tropical spastic paraparesis ( tsp ) .
htlv-i encode a potent transactivator protein term tax that appear to play an important role in the process of t-cell immortalization .
even though the mechanism by which tax induce transformation be still unknown , it seem likely that the ability of tax to alter the expression of many cellular gene play an important part in this process .
tax do not bind directly to dna but rather deregulate the activity of cellular transcription factor .
one family of host transcription factor whose activity be alter by tax include nf-kappa b/rel .
these transcription factor be post-transcriptionally regulate by their assembly with a second family of inhibitory protein term i kappa b that serve to sequester the nf-kappa b/rel complex in the cytoplasm .
upon cellular activation , i kappa b alpha be phosphorylated , polyubiquitinated , and degrade in the proteasome .
this proteolytic event liberate nf-kappa b , permit it rapid translocation into the nucleus where it bind to it cognate enhancer element .
similarly , the p105 precursor of the nf-kappa b p50 subunit be also post-translationally process in the proteasome .
the mechanism by which tax activate nf-kappa b remain unclear , and finding present in the literature be often controversial .
we identify a physical interaction between tax and the hsn3 subunit of the human proteasome .
this raise the intriguing possibility that physical association of the hsn3 proteasome subunit with htlv-i tax couple with the independent interaction of tax with either p100 or p65- i kappa b alpha target these cytoplasmic nf-kappa b/rel complex to the proteasome for processing .
transcriptional activation of the vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 gene in t lymphocyte express human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 tax protein .
recruitment and extravasation of t cell through the blood-brain barrier be favor by adhesion molecule -mediated interaction of circulate t cell with endothelial cell .
since a common pathological finding in human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) -associated disease be the infiltration of htlv-1-infected t lymphocyte into various organ , we have look for the profile of adhesion molecule express by htlv-1-transformed t cell .
flow cytometry analysis indicate that these cell be express high level of vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 ( vcam-1 [ cd106 ] ) , a 110-kda member of the immunoglobulin gene superfamily , first identify on endothelial cell stimulate with inflammatory cytokine .
this adhesion molecule be also express by t cell obtain from one patient with htlv-1 -associated myelopathy/tropical spastic paraparesis but not by activate t cell isolate from one normal blood donor .
the role of the viral trans-activator tax protein in the induction of vcam-1 be first indicate by the detection of this adhesion molecule on jurkat t-cell clone stably express the tax gene .
the effect of tax on vcam-1 gene transcription be next confirm in jpx-9 cell , a subclone of jurkat cell , carry the tax sequence under the control of an inducible promoter .
furthermore , deletion and mutation analysis of the vcam-1 promoter perform with chloramphenicol acetyltransferase construct reveal that tax be trans activate the vcam-1 promoter via two nf-kappab site present at bp -72 and -57 in the vcam-1 gene promoter , with both of them be require for the tax -induced expression of this adhesion molecule .
finally , gel mobility shift assay demonstrate the nuclear translocation of protein specifically bind to these two nf-kappab motif , confirm that vcam-1 be induce on tax -expressing cell in a kappab -dependent manner .
collectively , these result therefore suggest that the exclusive tax -induced expression of vcam-1 on t cell may represent a pivotal event in the progression of htlv-1 -associated disease .
identification of an inducible regulator of c-myb expression during t-cell activation .
rest t cell express very low level of c-myb protein .
during t-cell activation , c-myb expression be induce and much of the increase in expression occur at the transcriptional level .
we identify a region of the c-myb 5' flanking sequence that increase c-myb expression during t-cell activation .
in vivo footprinting by ligation-mediated pcr be perform to correlate in vivo protein binding with functional activity .
a protein footprint be visible over this region of the c-myb 5' flanking sequence in activate t cell but not in unactivated t cell .
an electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) with nuclear extract from activate t cell and an oligonucleotide of this bind site demonstrate a new protein-dna complex , refer to a cmat for c-myb in activate t cell ; this complex be not present in unactivated t cell .
because the bind site show some sequence similarity with the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) binding site , we compare the kinetics of induction of the two bind complex and the molecular mass of the two protein .
study of the kinetics of induction show that the nfat emsa binding complex appear earlier than the cmat complex .
the nfat protein migrate more slowly in a sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel than the cmat protein do .
in addition , an antibody against nfat do not cross-react with the cmat protein .
the appearance of the cmat binding complex be inhibit by both cyclosporin a and rapamycin .
the cmat protein appear to be a novel inducible protein involve in the regulation of c-myb expression during t-cell activation .
characterization of a cofactor that regulate dimerization of a mammalian homeodomain protein .
dimerization among transcription factor have become a recurrent theme in the regulation of eukaryotic gene expression .
hepatocyte nuclear factor-1 alpha ( hnf-1 alpha ) be a homeodomain-containing protein that function a a dimer .
a dimerization cofactor of hnf-1 alpha ( dcoh ) be identify that display a restricted tissue distribution and do not bind to dna , but , rather , selectively stabilize hnf-1 alpha dimer .
the formation of a stable tetrameric dcoh-hnf-1 alpha complex , which require the dimerization domain of hnf-1 alpha , do not change the dna binding characteristic of hnf-1 alpha , but enhance it transcriptional activity .
however , dcoh do not confer transcriptional activation to the gal4 dna binding domain .
these result indicate that dcoh regulate formation of transcriptionally active tetrameric complex and may contribute to the developmental specificity of the complex .
calcineurin and the biological effect of cyclosporine and tacrolimus .
the mechanism of the immunosuppressive effect of cya and fk 506 can be monitor in vivo in human .
the picture emerge be of a close relationship between drug concentration and cn inhibition .
but many puzzle of the drug remain .
what be the role of cya in the activation of transform growth factor-beta ( tgf-beta ) , particularly in relationship to nephrotoxicity and fibrogenesis ?
how important be the anti-inflammatory ( non t ) effect of cya , and which cell do they operate in ?
be there effect of cya and fk 506 all attributable to cn inhibition , and how much of them be mediate through the nfatc family of transcription factor ?
finally , it would be useful to know what the inhibitory effect of cya be on tolerance and negative regulatory event .
signaling via il-2 and il-4 in jak3 -deficient severe combined immunodeficiency lymphocyte : jak3 -dependent and independent pathway .
both il-2 and il-4 bind to receptor contain the common gamma chain and jak3 .
although jak3 be require for proper lymphoid development , the precise role of this kinase in il-2 and il-4 signaling in lymphocyte have not be define .
here , we have study il-2 and il-4 signaling in b cell line lack jak3 .
although il-2 -induced phosphorylation of il-2r beta , jak1 , and stat5 all require the presence of jak3 , il-4 -mediated phosphorylation of jak1 , stat6 , and insulin receptor substrate 1 and 2 do not .
however , il-4 -induced effect be clearly improve follow jak3 expression .
these data indicate that il-4 signaling occur in the absence of of jak3 , but be comparatively inefficient .
these finding may help in understand the pathogenesis of the immunodeficiency that occur with mutation of jak3 and may suggest a mechanism for the pleiotropic effect of il-4 .
the role of bsap ( pax-5 ) in b-cell development .
the hierarchy of transcriptional control in b-cell development have recently be analyze by target gene inactivation in the mouse .
in this manner , the paired box contain gene pax-5 , encode the b cell specific transcription factor bsap , have be show to play a key role in early b lymphopoiesis .
other experimental strategy have implicate bsap in the control of cell proliferation , isotype switching and transcription of the immunoglobulin heavy-chain gene at late stage of b-cell differentiation .
activation of stat-3 be involve in the induction of apoptosis after ligation of major histocompatibility complex class i molecule on human jurkat t cell .
activation of janus tyrosine kinase ( jak ) and signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) after ligation of major histocompatibility complex class i ( mhc-i ) be explore in jurkat t cell .
cross-linking of mhc-i mediate tyrosine phosphorylation of tyk2 , but not jak1 , jak2 , and jak3 .
in addition , the transcription factor stat-3 be tyrosine phosphorylated in the cytoplasm and subsequently translocate to the cell nucleus .
data obtain by electrophoretic mobility shift assay suggest that the activate stat-3 protein associate with the human serum-inducible element ( hsie ) dna-probe derive from the interferon-gamma activated site ( gas ) in the c-fos promoter , a common dna sequence for stat protein binding .
an association between hsie and stat-3 after mhc-i ligation be directly demonstrate by precipitate stat-3 from nuclear extract with biotinylated hsie probe and avidin -coupled agarose .
to investigate the function of the activate stat-3 , jurkat t cell be transiently transfected with a stat-3 isoform lack the transactivating domain .
this dominant-negative act stat-3 isoform significantly inhibit apoptosis induce by ligation of mhc-i .
in conclusion , our data suggest the involvement of the jak/stat signal pathway in mhc-i -induced signal transduction in t cell .
hiv-1 tat induce the expression of a new hematopoietic cell-specific transcription factor and downregulates mip-1 alpha gene expression in activate t-cells .
mip-1 alpha be a secrete chemokine which can inhibit hematopoietic stem cell and modulate inflammatory response .
it be also an inhibitor of hiv replication in cd8+ t-cells .
the expression of mip-1 alpha be induce during cellular activation of cd4+ t-cells and monocyte .
it be also express in transform b-cells .
we have previously identify a new transcription factor family ( the mnp family ) whose expression be crucial for the induction of mip-1 alpha transcription during cellular activation and in transform b cell .
monocyte and transform b-cells normally express mnp-1 strongly and mnp-2 weakly , while t-cells strongly express only mnp-2 .
recently , we report that hiv-1 tat downregulates mip-1 alpha expression in jurkat t-cells .
in this report we show induction of mnp-1 in jurkat t-cells express hiv-1 tat .
expression of neither htlv-1 tax in jurkat t-cells nor ebv in b-cells have any effect on mnp-1 or mnp-2 expression , show that the effect be specific for hiv-1 tat .
we propose that hiv-1 tat may inhibit mip-1 alpha expression by induce mnp-1 expression in t-cells , probably by either compete with mnp-2 for binding to the mip-1 alpha promoter or by sequester it into inactive form .
acute leukemia with promyelocytic feature in pml/raralpha transgenic mouse .
acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) be associate with reciprocal chromosomal translocation involve the retinoic acid receptor alpha ( raralpha ) locus on chromosome 17 .
in the majority of case , raralpha translocate and fuse with the promyelocytic leukemia ( pml ) gene located on chromosome 15 .
the result fusion gene encode the two structurally unique pml/ raralpha and raralpha /pml fusion protein as well a aberrant pml gene product , the respective pathogenetic role of which have not be elucidate .
we have generate transgenic mouse in which the pml/ raralpha fusion protein be specifically express in the myeloid-promyelocytic lineage .
during their first year of life , all the pml/ raralpha transgenic mouse have an abnormal hematopoiesis that can best be describe a a myeloproliferative disorder .
between 12 and 14 month of age , 10 % of them develop a form of acute leukemia with a differentiation block at the promyelocytic stage that closely mimic human apl even in it response to retinoic acid .
our result be conclusive in vivo evidence that pml/ raralpha play a crucial role in the pathogenesis of apl .
octamer binding factor and their coactivator can activate the murine pu.1 ( spi-1 ) promoter .
pu.1 ( spi-1 ) , a member of the ets transcription factor family , be predominantly express in myeloid and b cell , activate many b cell and myeloid gene , and be critical for development of both of these lineage .
our previous study ( chen , h.m. , ray-gallet , d. , zhang , p. , hetherington , c.j. , gonzalez , d.a. , zhang , d.-e. , moreau-gachelin , f. , and tenen , d.g. ( 1995 ) oncogene 11 , 1549-1560 ) demonstrate that the pu.1 promoter direct cell type-specific reporter gene expression in myeloid cell line , and that pu.1 activate it own promoter in an autoregulatory loop .
here we show that the murine pu.1 promoter be also specifically and highly functional in b cell line as well .
oct-1 and oct-2 can bind specifically to a site at base pair -55 in vitro , and this site be specifically protect in b cell in vivo .
we also demonstrate that two other site contribute to promoter activity in b cell ; an sp1 binding site adjacent to the octamer site , and the pu.1 autoregulatory site .
finally , we show that the b cell coactivator obf-1/bob1/oca-b be only express in b cell and not in myeloid cell , and that obf-1/bob1/oca-b can transactivate the pu.1 promoter in hela and myeloid cell .
this b cell restricted coactivator may be responsible for the b cell specific expression of pu.1 mediate by the octamer site .
stimulation of interleukin-1 alpha and interleukin-1 beta production in human monocyte by protein phosphatase 1 and 2a inhibitor .
protein phosphatase 1 and 2a be important in regulate cellular function by control the phosphorylation state of their substrate .
in human monocyte , the inhibitor of these phosphatase , okadaic acid and calyculin a , be find to increase the mrna accumulation and cytokine production of interleukin-1 beta and interleukin-1 alpha .
the increase mrna accumulation be find to be primarily because of the increase in the transcription rate of the interleukin-1 gene .
stimulation of interleukin-1 gene transcription may be cause by the stimulation of transcription factor activity , include those of ap-1 , by these protein phosphatase inhibitor .
okadaic acid increase the synthesis of the interleukin-1 beta precursor and mature form and their secretion .
this increase processing and secretion correlate with the stimulation of il-1 beta convertase mrna accumulation .
the stimulation of interleukin-1 alpha production by okadaic acid be more modest than that of interleukin-1 beta .
however , the phosphorylation of the precursor interleukin-1 alpha cytokine be increase .
these result show that protein phosphatase 1 and 2a inhibitor exert multiple effect on cytokine production in human monocyte and suggest that these two phosphatase play important role in regulate interleukin-1 production .
[ an overexpression of retinoic acid receptor alpha block myeloid cell differentiation at the promyelocyte stage ]
retinoic acid ( ra ) , a vitamin a derivative , exert a wide range of biological effect related to cell proliferation and differentiation .
the pleiotropic effect of ra be think to be mediate through specific nuclear ra receptor ( rars ) .
rars be member of the steroid/thyroid hormone receptor superfamily and exhibit a molecular structure that possess discrete dna-binding and ra ( ligand ) -binding domain .
in hematopoietic system , ra and rars , predominantly rar alpha may play key role for the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic progenitor .
however , it be currently unknown how ra and rars be involve in regulate normal hematopoietic differentiation .
to make clear the role of ra and rar alpha in the normal hematopoiesis , i have introduce the construct of human rar alpha ( hrar alpha ) into murine bone marrow cell with retroviral vector , and select infected cell with drug resistant marker ( neo(r) ) culture on the stroma cell line ( pa6-neo ) , and analyze the behavior of infected cell .
all of procedure be do in vitro .
most cell infect with hrar alpha exhibit promyelocytic morphology and be think to be block at the promyelocytic stage in their myeloid differentiation .
furthermore , these immature cell differentiate terminally into mature granulocyte by add with ra ( 10 ( -6 ) m ) .
rar alpha infected cell be also able to differentiate into mature macrophage in the both of long term culture and il3 colony .
these observation suggest that an overexpression of rar alpha alone be effective to suppress myeloid cell differentiation and rar alpha play a crucial role in the terminal differentiation of myeloid precursor .
the system describe here may serve a a model for study the the essential gene for differentiation of normal bone marrow cell .
signal transducer and activator of transcription-3 ( stat3 ) be constitutively activate in normal , self-renewing b-1 cell but only inducibly express in conventional b lymphocyte [ see comment ]
cytokine and growth factor receptor engagement lead to the rapid phosphorylation and activation of latent , cytosolic signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein , which then translocate to the nucleus where they regulate transcriptional event from specific promoter sequence .
stat3 expression in particular have be associate with abl , src , and htlv-1 transformation of normal cell .
b-1 lymphocyte be self-renewing , cd5+ b cell that display a propensity for malignant transformation and be the normal counterpart to human chronic lymphocytic leukemia .
far , b-1 cell be characterize by aberrant intracellular signaling , include hyperresponsiveness to phorbol ester pkc agonist .
here we demonstrate that b-1 lymphocyte constitutively express nuclear activate stat3 , which be not express by unmanipulated conventional ( b-2 ) lymphocyte .
in contrast , stat3 activation be induce in b-2 cell after antigen receptor engagement in a delayed fashion ( after 3 h ) .
induction of stat3 be inhibit by both the serine/threonine protein kinase inhibitor h-7 and the immunosuppressive drug rapamycin and require de novo protein synthesis , demonstrate novel coupling between sig and stat protein that differ from the classical paradigm for stat induction by cytokine receptor .
the inability of prolonged stimulation of conventional b-2 cell with anti-ig , a treatment sufficient to induce cd5 expression , to result in sustained stat3 activation suggest that stat3 be a specific nuclear marker for b-1 cell .
thus , stat3 may play a role in b cell antigen-specific signaling response , and it constitutive activation be associate with a normal cell population exhibit intrinsic proliferative behavior .
musculin : a murine basic helix-loop-helix transcription factor gene express in embryonic skeletal muscle .
we describe the embryonic expression of musculin , a new murine member of the bhlh family of transcription factor .
musculin protein be closely related to human abf-1 , which be express in activate b cell , and to epicardin/capsulin/pod-1 , which be express in branchial myoblasts , visceral and urogenital mesoderm and epicardium .
in situ hybridisation reveal musculin expression in embryo be largely restricted to the embryonic skeletal muscle lineage .
while all skeletal muscle express the gene , only a subset of myocytes within each muscle be positive , indicate molecular heterogeneity within fetal muscle .

delta-opioid receptor express by jurkat t cell enhance il-2 secretion by increase ap-1 complex and activity of the nf-at/ap-1-binding promoter element .
recent molecular evidence point to transient and/or stage-specific expression of delta- and kappa- opioid receptor by thymic and peripheral t lymphocyte .
since medical treatment or stress commonly increase opioid level , it be important to understand the mechanism by which opioids affect t lymphocyte function .
we therefore create and study a t cell line express the clone delta-opioid receptor ( dor1 ) .
dor1 ligation by a specific dor1 agonist , deltorphin , augment il-2 secretion by synergizing with signal from tcr- cd3 and cd28 .
reporter gene construct be use to map this effect of deltorphin to the ap-1- and nf-at/ap-1- binding site of the il-2 promoter .
although dor1 signaling increase [ ca2+ ]i , deltorphin enhance transcriptional activity of the nf-at/ap-1-binding site via a mechanism independent of calcineurin and distinct from the effect of elevated [ ca2+ ]i .
deltorphin also increase accumulation of ap-1 transcription factor complex , suggest that dor1 augment il-2 secretion by increase the ap-1 component of the nf-at/ap-1 transcription factor .
these result advance the molecular understanding of opioid effect on lymphocyte , and in addition , demonstrate regulation of il-2 synthesis and secretion by the novel mechanism of receptor-mediated ap-1 induction .
ym268 increase the glucose uptake , cell differentiation , and mrna expression of glucose transporter in 3t3-l1 adipocytes .
the purpose of this study be to examine the effect of bis[4-[2,4-dioxo-5-thiazolidinyl)methyl]phenyl] methane ( ym-268 ) , a thiazolidinedione derivative , on glucose uptake , adipocyte differentiation through peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor gamma ( ppargamma ) , and phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase ( pi 3-kinase ) activity in culture cell .
ym268 and pioglitazone dose-dependently increase the 2-deoxyglucose uptake in 3t3-l1 cell .
ym268 facilitate the insulin-stimulated triglyceride accumulation in 3t3-l1 adipocytes and increase the mrna expression of fatty acid-binding protein .
ym268 , with and without insulin , increase the mrna expression of glucose transporter isoforms such a glut1 and glut4 , indicate enhancement of adipocyte differentiation .
additionally , ym268 and pioglitazone show activity of the ppargamma ligand , a member of the nuclear receptor superfamily responsible for adipogenesis .
to examine the possible involvement of the increase activity of pi 3-kinase in ym268 -stimulated glucose uptake , the enzyme activity be estimate by measure the phosphatidylinositol-3,4,5-trisphosphate ( pi-3,4,5-p3 ) concentration in human monocytic cell .
insulin dose-dependently increase the pi-3,4,5-p3 production but ym268 have no significant effect on the insulin -dependent and -independent pi 3-kinase activation .
these result indicate that the mechanism by which ym268 increase glucose uptake , may be account for in part by the enhancement of glut1 and glut4 expression through ppargamma activation .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor preferentially activate the 94-kd stat5a and an 80-kd stat5a isoform in human peripheral blood monocyte .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) induce immediate effect in monocyte by activation of the janus kinase ( jak2 ) and stat transcription factor ( stat5 ) pathway .
recent study have identify homologues of stat5 , stat5a , and stat5b , as well a low molecular weight variant of stat5 .
to define the activation of the stat5 homologues and low molecular weight variant in human monocyte and monocyte differentiate into macrophage by culture in macrophage-csf ( m-csf ) , we measure the gm-csf induced tyrosine phosphorylation of stat5a , stat5b , and any low molecular weight stat5 isoforms .
freshly isolate monocyte express 94-kd stat5a , 92-kd stat5b , and an 80-kd stat5a molecule .
whereas 94-kd stat5a be clearly tyrosine phosphorylated and bind to the enhancer element , the gamma response region ( grr ) , of the fc gamma ri gene , substantially less tyrosine phosphorylated stat5b bind to the immobilized grr element .
macrophage lose their ability to express the 80-kd stat5a protein , but retain their ability to activate stat5a .
stat5a -stat5a homodimers and stat5a -stat5b heterodimers form in response to gm-csf .
therefore , activation of stat5a predominate compare to stat5b when assay by direct immunoprecipitation and by evaluation of bind stats to immobilized grr .
selective activation of stat5 homologues in addition to generation of low molecular isoforms may provide specificity and control to gene express in response to cytokine such a gm-csf .
transcription factor requirement for u2 snrna -encoding gene activation in b lymphoid cell .
transcription of a human u2 small nuclear rna ( snrna ) -encoding gene in hela cell require a distal enhancer element , which be compose of one octamer motif ( oct ) and three sp 1-binding site .
to study the transcription factor requirement in b-cells , different u2 enhancer construction be transfected into the lymphoid cell line , bja-b .
the result show that the activation of u2 snrna transcription in b-cells also require an enhancer comprise both the oct and at least one sp 1-binding site .
deletion of all the sp 1-binding site from the enhancer reduce transcription by 80-90 % in hela , as well a in bja-b cell , whereas the removal of the octamer-binding site reduce transcription to level below detection in both cell type .
enhancer contain a single oct have , nevertheless , the capacity to partially activate u2 snrna transcription in both hela cell , in which only otf-1 be express , and in bja-b cell in which otf-2 be the predominantly express octamer-binding factor .
the most likely interpretation of our result be that both the ubiquitous transcription factor , otf-1 , and the b-cell-specific transcription factor , otf-2 , can activate u2 snrna transcription .
the result also reveal a similar functional cooperation between the transcription factor which bind to the oct and the adjacent sp 1-binding site in bja-b cell , a have be observe in hela cell , since a template which contain a weak bind site for otfs express wild-type level of u2 snrna in both cell type when the weak octamer-binding site be combine with a sp 1-binding site .
differential regulation of il-6 gene transcription and expression by il-4 and il-10 in human monocytic cell line .
il-4 and il-10 inhibit the cytokine production and mrna expression by monocytes/macrophages .
to investigate the molecular mechanism of the inhibitory effect on transcriptional or post-transcriptional regulation of il-6 gene expression by il-4 and il-10 , we study il-6 production , expression level of il-6 mrna , il-6 promoter activity , transcriptional activity of nf-kappab and nf- il-6 , and il-6 mrna stability in human monocytic cell line , thp-1 and u937 , stimulate by pma and lp in the absence or the presence of il-4 or il-10 .
both il-4 and il-10 be see to inhibit il-6 production and the expression of il-6 mrna in both monocytic cell line study .
in chloramphenicol acetyltransferase assay , utilize the transient transfection of a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter plasmid contain the il-6 gene promoter , il-4 , but not il-10 , suppress the transcriptional activity of the il-6 gene promoter stimulate by pma and lp .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay show that il-4 , but not il-10 , inhibit nuclear nf-kappab activity , and that il-4 and il-10 do not affect nf- il-6 activity .
on the other hand , il-10 enhance the degradation of il-6 mrna in a mrna stability assay .
these result suggest that il-4 may inhibit the transcription of the il-6 gene by affect nf-kappab binding activity , while il-10 may inhibit the il-6 mrna level post-transcriptionally , without suppress promoter activity .
therefore , we conclude that il-4 and il-10 inhibit il-6 production by different mechanism in human monocytic cell line .
retinoic acid-induced expression of cd38 antigen in myeloid cell be mediate through retinoic acid receptor-alpha .
cd38 be a leukocyte differentiation antigen that have be think to be a phenotypic marker of different subpopulation of t- and b- lymphocyte .
in myeloid cell , cd38 be express during early stage of differentiation .
virtually no information be available on regulation and function of cd38 .
recently we report that all-trans-retinoic acid ( atra ) be a potent and highly specific inducer of cd38 expression in human promyelocytic leukemia cell .
here we report that atra -induced expression of cd38 antigen in myeloid cell be mediate through retinoic acid-alpha receptor ( rar alpha ) .
atra fail to induce cd38 expression in a mutant subclone of the hl-60 myeloid leukemia cell line ( designate hl-60r ) that be relatively resistant to atra -induced granulocytic differentiation .
retroviral vector-mediated transduction of ra receptor ( rar alpha ) into this hl-60r subclone completely restore the sensitivity of these cell to atra in term of their ability to express cd38 .
in contrast , cd38 expression be not inducible by atra in hl-60r cell , transfected with a functional rar beta , rar gamma , or rxr alpha receptor .
induction of cd38 in acute promyelocytic and acute myeloblastic leukemia cell be independent of atra -induced cytodifferentiation .
follow culture with atra , increase cd38 protein level be also observe in normal cd34+ bone marrow cell , but not on normal circulate granulocyte .
from these result , we conclude that cd38 be atra inducible in myeloid leukemia cell and normal cd34+ bone marrow cell .
this effect be independent of differentiation and be mediate by rar alpha in hl-60 cell , suggest a similar role for rar alpha in cd38 expression in other hematopoietic cell .
a factor that regulate the class ii major histocompatibility complex gene dpa be a member of a subfamily of zinc finger protein that include a drosophila developmental control protein .
a novel dna sequence element term the j element involve in the regulate expression of class ii major histocompatibility complex gene be recently describe .
to study this element and it role in class ii gene regulation far , a cdna library be screen with oligonucleotide probe contain both the s element and the nearby j element of the human dpa gene .
several dna clone be obtain by this procedure , one of which , clone 18 , be report and characterize here .
it encode a protein predict to contain 688 amino acid residue , include 11 zinc finger motif of the c2h2 type in the c-terminal region , that be kruppel-like in the conservation of the h/c link sequence connect them .
the 160 n-terminal amino acid in the nonfinger region of clone 18 be highly homologous with similar region of several other human , mouse , and drosophila sequence , define a subfamily of kruppel-like zinc finger protein term tab ( tramtrack [ ttk ] -associated box ) here .
one of the drosophila sequence , ttk , be a developmental control gene , while a second do not contain a zinc finger region but encode a structure important in oocyte development .
an acidic activation domain be located between the n-terminal conserved region of clone 18 and it zinc finger .
this protein appear to require both the s and j element , which be separate by 10 bp for optimal binding .
antisense cdna to clone 18 inhibit the expression of a reporter construct contain the dpa promoter , indicate it functional importance in the expression of this class ii gene .
thymocytes control the cd4 gene differently from mature t lymphocyte .
we analyze the activity of the enhancer , the promoter and the silencer of the human cd4 gene during t cell development use transgenic mouse .
immunofluorescence study on thymic population of mouse carry transgene in various combination of these regulatory dna element reveal that thymocytes control the cd4 gene in a different manner than mature peripheral t lymphocyte .
the 5'-positive regulatory unit , consist of the promoter and the 5' enhancer , be already active at the cd4 - cd8 -double-negative ( dn ) stage of development .
however , it activity become low in the double-positive and a fraction of the cd4+ cd8int/- cell population , indicate that an additional enhancer , located in either the first or the third intron of the cd4 gene , be require for cd4 gene expression in this population .
the other study regulatory element be the minimal cd4 silencer which inhibit cd4 gene expression in peripheral cd8 t lymphocyte .
this silencer be inactive in the most immature dn thymocytes , which probably use a distinct silencer mechanism to down-regulate cd4 gene expression .
unexpectedly , the cd4 silencer be also active in cd4+ cd8int/- cell of the thymus , imply that an anti-silencer may be require to resume cd4 expression in this cell population .
altogether , the cd4 gene be regulate by several positive and negative regulatory mechanism which come into play in a developmentally coordinate manner .
molecular cloning and functional characterization of murine cdna encoding transcription factor nfatc .
transcription factor of the nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) family play important role in immune and inflammatory response by regulate the expression of gene encode cytokine and immunoregulatory protein .
here we describe cloning and characterization of full-length cdna encoding murine ( m ) nfatc which predict that the protein have all the conserve structural motif of nfat family member , include the rel homology domain , the nfat homology domain and the nuclear translocation signal .
mnfatc complexed with ap-1 bind specifically to the murine il-2 nfat recognition sequence and activate transcription from the co-transfected il-2 promoter in cos-7 cell .
northern blot analysis show that the cdna probe hybridize with a 4.5 kb transcript which be highly inducible in murine t cell .
by northern and in situ hybridization , mnfatc transcript be detect from the early stage of development .
in the mouse embryo , mnfatc transcript be strongly express in thymus , lung and submandibular gland and weakly in skeletal muscle and heart suggest that mnfatc may have a role both in embryogenesis and in mature t cell .
interaction of transcription factor rfx1 and mibp1 with the gamma motif of the negative regulatory element of the hepatitis b virus core promoter .
the negative regulatory element ( nre ) of the hepatitis b virus ( hbv ) core promoter contain three subregions which act synergistically to suppress core promoter activity .
one of these subregions , nre gamma , be active in both hela cervical carcinoma cell and huh7 hepatoma cell and be find to be bind by a protein factor present in both cell type .
here we show that the transcription factor rfx1 can bind to nre gamma and transactivate the core promoter through this site .
mutation which abrogate the gene-suppressive activity of nre gamma prevent rfx1 from binding to nre gamma .
in addition , rfx1 can bind simultaneously , most likely a a heterodimer , with the transcription factor mibp1 to nre gamma .
in the absence of a clone mibp1 gene for further study , we hypothesize that rfx1 act with mibp1 to negatively regulate the core promoter activity through the nre gamma site .
the ability of rfx1 to transactivate the core promoter raise the possibility that rfx1 may play a dual role in regulate hbv gene expression
epstein-barr virus nuclear protein 2 transactivation of the latent membrane protein 1 promoter be mediate by j kappa and pu.1 .
expression of the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp-1 ) oncogene be regulate by the ebv nuclear protein 2 ( ebna-2 ) transactivator .
ebna-2 be know to interact with the cellular dna-binding protein j kappa and be recruit to promoter contain the gtgggaa j kappa recognition sequence .
the minimal ebna-2 -responsive lmp-1 promoter include one j kappa -binding site , and we now show that mutation of that site , such that j kappa can not bind , reduce ebna-2 responsiveness by 60 % .
to identify other factor which interact with the lmp-1 ebna-2 response element ( e2re ) , a -236/-145 minimal e2re be use a a probe in an electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
the previously characterize factor j kappa , pu.1 , and aml1 bind to the lmp-1 e2re , along with six other unidentified factor ( lbf2 to lbf7 ) .
bind site be map for each factor .
lbf4 be b- and t-cell specific and recognize the pu.1 ggaa core sequence a show by methylation interference .
lbf4 have a molecular mass of 105 kda and be probably unrelated to pu.1 .
lbf2 be find only in epithelial cell line , whereas lbf3 , lbf5 , lbf6 , and lbf7 be not cell type specific .
mutation of the aml1- or lbf4- binding site have no effect on ebna-2 transactivation , whereas mutation of the pu.1 -binding site completely eliminate ebna-2 response .
a gst- ebna-2 fusion protein specifically deplete pu.1 from nuclear extract and bind in vitro translate pu.1 , provide biochemical evidence for a direct ebna-2 -pu.1 interaction .
thus , ebna-2 transactivation of the lmp-1 promoter be dependent on interaction with at least two distinct sequence-specific dna-binding protein , j kappa and pu.1 .
lbf3 , lbf5 , lbf6 , or lbf7 may also be involve , since their bind site also contribute to ebna-2 responsiveness .
differential regulation of coproporphyrinogen oxidase gene between erythroid and nonerythroid cell .
coproporphyrinogen oxidase ( cpo ) catalyze the sixth step of the heme biosynthetic pathway .
to assess the tissue-specific regulation of the cpo gene promoter , mouse genomic dna clone for cpo be isolate .
structural analysis demonstrate that the mouse cpo gene span approximately 11 kb and consist of seven exon , just like it human counterpart .
functional analysis of the promoter by transient transfection assay indicate that synergistic action between an sp-1 -like element at -21/-12 , a gata site at -59/-54 , and a novel regulatory element , cpre ( ggactacag - ) at -49/-41 , be essential for the promoter activity in murine erythroleukemia ( mel ) cell .
in nonerythroid nih3t3 cell , however , the gata site be not require .
gel mobility shift assay demonstrate that specific dna-protein complex can be form with each element , and that there be cell-specific difference in factor , which bind to the sp-1 -like element between mel and nih3t3 cell .
these result provide evidence for differential regulation of the promoter function of cpo gene between erythroid and nonerythroid cell .

signal lead to the activation of nf-kappa b transcription factor be strong in neonatal than adult t lymphocyte .
the molecular background of the defect in the immune reactivity of human neonate have not be fully elucidate .
a the nf-kappa b transcription factor have a central role in the control of transcription of several gene involve in immune and inflammatory response , the author have analyse the activation of nf-kappa b in human umbilical cord t lymphocyte .
the activity be test by quantitating the nuclear protein bind to an oligonucleotide contain the consensus kappa b binding sequence ( electrophoretic mobility shift assay ) .
the data obtain demonstrate that phorbol dibutyrate/calcium ionophore a23187 ( pdbu/iono ) combination induce a clearly high nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b in neonatal than adult t cell .
this high nf-kappa b activity be restricted to the cd4+ t-cell subset .

these result suggest that neonatal t cell be expose to oxidative stress-inducing signal during delivery and/or be inherently more sensitive to nf-kappa b activating signal than adult t cell .
regulation of the ets-related transcription factor elf-1 by bind to the retinoblastoma protein .
the retinoblastoma gene product ( rb ) be a nuclear phosphoprotein that regulate cell cycle progression .
elf-1 be a lymphoid-specific ets transcription factor that regulate inducible gene expression during t cell activation .
in this report , it be demonstrate that elf-1 contain a sequence motif that be highly related to the rb binding site of several viral oncoproteins and bind to the pocket region of rb both in vitro and in vivo .
elf-1 bind exclusively to the underphosphorylated form of rb and fail to bind to rb mutant derive from patient with retinoblastoma .
co-immunoprecipitation experiment demonstrate an association between elf-1 and rb in rest normal human t cell .
after t cell activation , the phosphorylation of rb result in the release of elf-1 , which be correlate temporally with the activation of elf-1 -mediated transcription .
overexpression of a phosphorylation-defective form of rb inhibit elf-1 -dependent transcription during t cell activation .
these result demonstrate that rb interact specifically with a lineage-restricted ets transcription factor .
this regulated interaction may be important for the coordination of lineage-specific effector function such a lymphokine production with cell cycle progression in activate t cell .
in situ rt-pcr detection of epstein-barr virus immediate-early transcript in cd4+ and cd8+ t lymphocyte .

therefore , inhibition of nf-kappa b activation may be an effective strategy for acquire immunodeficiency syndrome therapy .

interleukin-6 promote multiple myeloma cell growth via phosphorylation of retinoblastoma protein .
interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) mediate autocrine and paracrine growth of multiple myeloma ( mm ) cell and inhibit tumor cell apoptosis .
abnormality of retinoblastoma protein ( prb ) and mutation of rb gene have be report in up to 70 % of mm patient and 80 % of mm-derived cell line .
because dephosphorylated ( activate ) prb block transition from g1 to s phase of the cell cycle whereas phosphorylated ( inactivate ) prb release this growth arrest , we characterize the role of prb in il-6 -mediated mm cell growth .
both phosphorylated and dephosphorylated prb be express in all serum-starved mm patient cell and mm-derived cell line , but prb be predominantly in it phosphorylated form .
in mm cell that proliferate in response to il-6 , exogenous il-6 downregulated dephosphorylated prb and decrease dephosphorylated prb -e2f complex .
importantly , culture of mm cell with rb antisense , but not rb sense , oligonucleotide ( odn ) trigger il-6 secretion and proliferation in mm cell ; however , proliferation be only partially inhibit by neutralize anti- il-6 monoclonal antibody ( moab ) .
in contrast to mm cell , normal splenic b cell express dephosphorylated prb .
although cd40 ligand ( cd40l ) trigger a shift from dephosphorylated to phosphorylated prb and proliferation of b cell , the addition of exogenous il-6 to cd40l -treated b cell do not alter either prb or proliferation , a observe in mm cell .
these result suggest that phosphorylated prb be constitutively express in mm cell and that il-6 far shift prb from it dephosphorylated to it phosphorylated form , thereby promote mm cell growth via two mechanism ; by decrease the amount of e2f bind by dephosphorylated prb due to reduce dephosphorylated prb , thereby release growth arrest ; and by upregulating il-6 secretion by mm cell and related il-6 -mediated autocrine tumor cell growth .
identification of transcription factor express during atra-induced neutrophil differentiation of hl60 cell .

cd38+ cell commit towards this lineage be enriched and a population of these cell treat with dihydroxyvitamin d3 to induce neutrophil maturation .
rna extract from uninduced , atra -induced cd38+ cell , and vitamin d3 treated maturing cell culture be amplify use the degenerate primer .

the oct 1 transcription factor , and a very close homologue , kiaa0144 , be identify use the pou family primer .
the zinc-finger primer identify three zinc-finger gene .

the differential expression of the gene in the zinc finger and pou family will lead to a good understanding of the cascade of gene expression which occur follow atra -induced differentiation .
photoaffinity labeling of plasma membrane receptor for aldosterone from human mononuclear leukocyte .
non-genomic effect of aldosterone on the sodium-proton-antiport have be show in human mononuclear leukocyte which could be related to a new aldosterone membrane receptor .
in the present paper plasma membrane from human mononuclear leukocyte be covalently photolabeled with a [125i]-aldosterone derivative .
