the presence of the sulfhydryl agent dithiothreitol do not affect result suggest the absence of disulfide bridge in the steroid binding domain of the receptor .
these data be the first to define the molecular weight of the membrane receptor for aldosterone .
human neutrophil elastase proteolytically activate the platelet integrin alphaiibbeta3 through cleavage of the carboxyl terminus of the alphaiib subunit heavy chain .
involvement in the potentiation of platelet aggregation .
neutrophil elastase ( ne ) and cathepsin g be two serine proteinase release concomitantly by stimulate polymorphonuclear neutrophil .
we previously demonstrate that while ne by itself do not activate human platelet , it strongly enhance the weak aggregation induce by a threshold concentration of cathepsin g ( threshold of cathepsin g ) ( renesto , p. , and chignard , m. ( 1993 ) blood 82 , 139-144 ) .
the aim of this study be to delineate the molecular mechanism involve in this potentiation process .
two main piece of data prompt u to focus on the activation of the platelet fibrinogen receptor , the alphaiibbeta3 integrin .
first , previous study have show this integrin to be particularly prone to proteolytic regulation of it function .
second , we find that the potentiating activity of ne on the threshold of cathepsin g -induced platelet aggregation be strictly dependent on the presence of exogenous fibrinogen .
use flow cytometry analysis , ne be show to trigger a time-dependent binding of pac-1 and ap-5 , two monoclonal antibody specific for the activate and ligand-occupied conformers of alphaiibbeta3 .
furthermore , the potentiated aggregation be show to result from an increase capacity of platelet to bind fibrinogen .
indeed , the combination of ne and threshold of cathepsin g increase the binding of pac-1 approximately 5.5-fold over basal value measure on nontreated platelet , whereas this binding raise only by approximately 3-fold in threshold of cathepsin g -stimulated platelet ( p < 0.05 ) .
by contrast , phosphatidic acid accumulation , pleckstrin phosphorylation , and calcium mobilization produce by the combination of ne and threshold of cathepsin g be not significantly different from those measure with threshold of cathepsin g alone ( p > 0.05 ) , indicate that the phospholipase c /protein kinase c pathway be not involve in the potentiation of aggregation .
the foregoing data , as well a the requirement of catalytically active ne to trigger alphaiibbeta3 activation and potentiate threshold of cathepsin g -initiated platelet aggregation , lead u to examine whether the structure of this integrin be affect by ne .
immunoblot and flow cytometry analysis reveal a limited proteolysis of the carboxyl terminus of the alphaiib subunit heavy chain ( alphaiibh ) , a judge by the disappearance of the epitope for the monoclonal antibody pmi-1 .
mass spectrometry study perform on a synthetic peptide map over the cleavage domain of alphaiibh predict the site of proteolysis a located between val837 and asp838 .
treatment by ne of atp-depleted platelet or chinese hamster ovary cell express human recombinant alphaiibbeta3 clearly establish that activation of the integrin be independent of signal transduction event and be concomitant with the proteolysis of alphaiibh .
function of nf-kappa b /rel binding site in the major histocompatibility complex class ii invariant chain promoter be dependent on cell-specific binding of different nf-kappa b /rel subunit .
the promoter of the human major histocompatibility complex class ii-associated invariant-chain gene ( ii ) contain two nf-kappa b /rel bind site located at -109 to -118 ( ii kappa b-1 ) and -163 to -172 ( ii kappa b-2 ) from the transcription start site .
we report here that the differential function of each of these nf-kappa b /rel site in several distinct cell type depend on cell-specific binding of nf-kappa b /rel transcription factor .
ii kappa b-1 be a positive regulatory element in b-cell line and in the ii-expressing t-cell line , h9 , but act a a negative regulatory element in myelomonocytic and glia cell line .
in vivo protein-dna contact be detectable at ii kappa b-1 in cell line in which this site be functional a either a positive or negative regulator .
electrophoretic mobility supershift assay determine that member of the nf-kappa b /rel family of transcription factor can bind to this site in vitro and that dna-binding complex that contain p50 , p52 , p65 , and crel correlate with positive regulation whereas the presence of p50 correlate with negative regulation .
ii kappa b-2 be a site of positive regulation in b-cell line and a site of negative regulation in h9 t cell , myelomonocytic , and glial cell line .
in vivo occupancy of this site be observe only in the h9 t-cell line .
again , in vitro supershift study indicate that the presence of p50 , p52 , p65 , and crel correlate with positive function whereas the presence of only p50 and p52 correlate with negative function .
this differential binding of specific nf-kappa b /rel subunit be likely to mediate the disparate function of these two nf-kappa b /rel binding site .
the myeloid zinc finger gene , mzf-1 , regulate the cd34 promoter in vitro .
mzf-1 be a c2h2 zinc finger gene encode a putative transcriptional regulator of myeloid differentiation .
the mzf-1 protein contain 13 c2h2 zinc finger arrange in bipartite dna binding domain contain zinc finger through 4 and , in the carboxy-terminus , 5 through 13 .
we previously identify the dna consensus binding site recognize by the two dna binding domain .
to assess the transcription regulatory function of mzf-1 , the full-length mzf-1 coding region be fuse to the dna binding domain of the yeast transactivator gal4 .
the expression vector be cotransfected with the chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) reporter gene regulate by the thymidine kinase promoter contain gal4 dna binding site into nih 3t3 , 293 , k562 , and jurkat cell line .
mzf-1 repress cat reporter gene expression via gal4 binding site in the nonhematopoietic cell line nih 3t3 and 293 .
in contrast , mzf-1 activate cat reporter gene expression in the hematopoietic cell line k562 and jurkat .
the mzf-1 binding site be present in the promoter of several gene express during myeloid differentiation , include the cd34 promoter .
mzf-1 transcriptional regulation of this physiologically relevant promoter be assess in both hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cell line .
recombinant mzf-1 protein specifically bind to the consensus binding site in the cd34 promoter in mobility shift assay .
mzf-1 expression vector be cotransfected with the luciferase reporter plasmid regulate by the cd34 promoter into both nonhematopoietic and hematopoietic cell line .
a with the heterologous dna binding domain , mzf-1 repress reporter gene expression in nonhematopoietic cell line and activate expression in hematopoietic cell line .
activation of cd34 expression in hematopoietic cell line be dependent on the presence of intact mzf-1 binding site .
the cell type-specific regulation of the cd34 promoter by mzf-1 suggest the presence of tissue-specific regulators/adapters or differential mzf-1 modification that determine mzf-1 transcriptional regulatory function .
inhibition of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 replication by a tat-activated , transduce interferon gene : target expression to human immunodeficiency virus type 1 -infected cell .
we have examine the feasibility of use interferon ( ifn ) gene transfer a a novel approach to anti- human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) therapy in this study .
to limit expression of a transduce hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) -ifna2 ( the new approved nomenclature for ifn gene be use throughout this article ) hybrid gene to the hiv-1-infected cell , hiv-1 ltr be modify .
deletion of the nf-kappa b element of the hiv-1 ltr significantly inhibit tat -mediated transactivation in t-cell line , as well a in a monocyte line , u937 .
replacement of the nf-kappa b element in the hiv-1 ltr by a dna fragment derive from the 5'-flanking region of ifn-stimulated gene 15 ( isg15 ) , contain the ifn-stimulated response element , partially restore tat -mediated activation of ltr in t cell as well a in monocyte .
insertion of this chimeric promoter ( isg15 ltr ) upstream of the human ifna2 gene direct high level of ifn synthesis in tat-expressing cell , while this promoter be not responsive to tumor necrosis factor alpha -mediated activation .
isg15-ltr-ifn hybrid gene insert into the retrovirus vector be transduce into jurkat and u937 cell .
select transfected clone produce low level of ifn a ( ifna ) constitutively , and their ability to express interleukin-2 and interleukin-2 receptor upon stimulation with phytohemagglutinin and phorbol myristate acetate be retain .
enhancement of ifna synthesis observe upon hiv-1 infection result in significant inhibition of hiv-1 replication for a period of at least 30 day .
virus isolate from ifna -producing cell be able to replicate in the u937 cell but do not replicate efficiently in u937 cell transduce with the ifna gene .
these result suggest that target ifn synthesis to hiv-1 -infected cell be an attainable goal and that autocrine ifn synthesis result in a long-lasting and permanent suppression of hiv-1 replication .
experimental expression in mouse and spontaneous expression in human sle of polyomavirus t-antigen .
a molecular basis for induction of antibody to dna and eukaryotic transcription factor .
we have previously demonstrate that experimental expression of the polyomavirus transcription factor t-antigen have the potential to induce anti-dna antibody in mouse .
two set of independent evidence be present here that demonstrate a biological relevance for this model .
first , we describe result demonstrate that mouse inoculate with t-antigen-expressing plasmid produce antibody , not only to t-antigen and dna , but also to the dna-binding eukaryotic transcription factor tata-binding protein ( tbp ) , and to the camp-response-element-binding protein ( creb ) .
secondly , we investigate whether polyomavirus reactivation occur in sle patient , and whether antibody to t-antigen , dna , and to tbp and creb be link to such event .
both within and among these sle patient , frequent polyomavirus reactivations be observe that could not be explain by certain rearrangement of the noncoding control region , nor by corticosteroid treatment .
link to these event , antibody to t-antigen , dna , tbp , and creb be detect , identical to what we observe in mouse .
antibody recognize double-stranded dna be confine to patient with frequent polyomavirus reactivations .
the result describe here indicate that cognate interaction of b cell recognize dna or dna-associated protein and t cell recognize t antigen have take place a a consequence of complex formation between t ag and dna in vivo in the context of polyomavirus reactivations .
t-cell functional region of the human il-3 proximal promoter .
the human interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) gene be express almost exclusively in activate t cell .
it expression be regulate at both the transcriptional and post-transcriptional level .
we have previously show that treatment of jurkat t cell with phytohemaglutinin ( pha ) and the phorbol ester , pma , activate transcription initiation from the il-3 gene .
to define the region of the gene require for transcription activation , we generate a series of reporter construct contain different region of the il-3 gene 5' and 3' flanking sequence .
both positive and negative regulatory element be identify in the proximal 5' flanking region of the il-3 gene .
the promoter region between -173 and -60 contain the strong activate element .
the transcription factor ap-1 could bind to this positive activator region of the promoter .
we also examine the function of the il-3 ck-1/ck-2 element that be present in many cytokine gene and find that they act a a repressor of basal level expression when clone upstream of a heterologous promoter but be also inducible by pma /pha .
the tumour associated cell surface antigen a6h be costimulatory for human cd4+ but not cd8+ t cell .
the a6h monoclonal antibody ( mab ) recognize a 120,000-140,000 mw antigen that be express at similar density on 85-90 % of human cd4+ and cd8+ t cell and on renal cell carcinoma .
the binding of the a6h mab induce a costimulatory signal in anti-cd3 activate t cell .
in the present report , we show that a6h costimulated cell proliferation and cytokine production in purify cd4+ t cell .
unexpectedly , the cd8+ t-cell subpopulation fail to respond .
cd4+ t cell costimulated with the a6h mab upregulated cd80 , cd86 , cd71 , interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) r alpha , il-2r beta and il-2r gamma , while no corresponding up-regulation of these cell surface molecule be see in cd8+ t cell .
in order to investigate the nature of the a6h mab costimulus at the transcriptional level we have examine induction of the transcription factor oct-1 , ap-1 and nf-kappa b which be know to be transcriptional regulator of several cytokine and cytokine receptor gene , include the il-2 and il-2r gene .
co-ligation of the a6h antigen and the cd3 complex induce expression of the transcription factor ap-1 in cd4+ t cell , whereas no increase in nf-kappa b and octamer-binding ( oct ) protein be see compare to t cell stimulate with anti-cd3 alone .
furthermore , no induction of ap-1 be see in a6h costimulated cd8+ t cell .
these result suggest that both proximal step in cd8+ t-cell activation as well a the late phase be unresponsive to a6h ligation .
molecular difference of the a6h molecule or distinct regulation of the a6h transduced ap-1 activation pathway may exist in cd4+ and cd8+ t cell subpopulation .
cloning and functional characterization of early b-cell factor , a regulator of lymphocyte-specific gene expression .
early b-cell factor ( ebf ) be identify previously a a tissue-specific and differentiation stage-specific dna-binding protein that participate in the regulation of the pre-b and b lymphocyte-specific mb-1 gene .
partial amino acid sequence obtain from purify ebf be use to isolate cdna clone , which by multiple criterion encode ebf .
the recombinant polypeptide form sequence-specific complex with the ebf -binding site in the mb-1 promoter .
the cdna hybridize to multiple transcript in pre-b and b-cell line , but transcript be not detect at significant level in plasmacytoma , t-cell , and nonlymphoid cell line .
expression of recombinant ebf in transfected nonlymphoid cell strongly activate transcription from reporter plasmid contain functional ebf -binding site .
analysis of dna binding by deletion mutant of ebf identify an amino-terminal cysteine-rich dna-binding domain lack obvious sequence similarity to known transcription factor .
dna-binding assay with cotranslated wild-type and truncated form of ebf indicate that the protein interact with it site a a homodimer .
deletion delineate a carboxy-terminal dimerization region contain two repeat of 15 amino acid that show similarity with the dimerization domain of basic-helix-loop-helix protein .
together , these data suggest that ebf represent a novel regulator of b lymphocyte-specific gene expression .
restoration of the epstein-barr virus zebra protein 's capacity to disrupt latency by the addition of heterologous activation region .
the zebra protein have a unique biological function among herpesviral protein .
it be responsible for the disruption of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) latency and the induction of the lytic cycle .
zebra be a bzip transcriptional activator which bind a a dimer to 7-bp response element within ebv promoter and be directly involve in the stimulation of virus replication at the ebv lytic origin .
we have employ the zebra /ebv biological system to test whether a heterologous activation domain can substitute for another activation domain ( the zebra domain ) .
the zebra activation region be replace with the potent acid activation region from the herpes simplex virus vp16 protein or with the activation region of the ebv r protein .
both chimera be find to transactivate model and native promoter at equivalent or good level than zebra itself .
activation be not target- or cell-type dependent , nor be it dependent on the presence of virus .
these activation domain restore zebra 's ability to induce early antigen and to stimulate origin replication to level that be equal to or great than those of wild type .
these study suggest that the specificity of some of the known biological function of zebra be not dependent upon the nature of the activation domain present within zebra .
mutual regulation of the transcriptional activator nf-kappa b and it inhibitor , i kappa b-alpha .
the nk-kappa b transcription factor complex be sequester in the cytoplasm by the inhibitory protein i kappa b-alpha ( mad-3 ) .
various cellular stimulus relieve this inhibition by mechanism largely unknown , lead to nf-kappa b nuclear localization and transactivation of it target gene .
it be demonstrate here with human t lymphocyte and monocyte that different stimulus , include tumor necrosis factor alpha and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate , cause rapid degradation of i kappa b-alpha , with concomitant activation of nf-kappa b , follow by a dramatic increase in i kappa b-alpha mrna and protein synthesis .
transfection study reveal that the i kappa b-alpha mrna and the encode protein be potently induce by nf-kappa b and by homodimers of p65 and of c-rel .
we propose a model in which nf-kappa b and i kappa b-alpha mutually regulate each other in a cycle : saturating amount of the inhibitory i kappa b-alpha protein be destroy upon stimulation , allow rapid activation of nf-kappa b .
subsequently , i kappa b-alpha mrna and protein level be quickly induce by the activate nf-kappa b .
this resurgence of i kappa b-alpha protein act to restore an equilibrium in which nf-kappa b be again inhibit .
ciita b-cell-specific promoter suppression in mhc class ii -silenced cell hybrid .
in this study , various set of somatic cell hybrid , generate by the fusion of epithelial cell line with b-lymphoblastoid cell line , be analyze for the expression of major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii antigen .
we first demonstrate , in human and mouse intraspecies hybrid , the coordinate suppression of mhc class ii , ii ( invariant chain ) and hla-dm gene transcription , and the release of the silencing by the addition of interferon gamma .
use interspecies hybrid , the segregation of human chromosome allow u to establish that mhc class ii extinction be link to the presence in the hybrid of the chromosome from the epithelial fusion partner .
moreover , our data provide evidence that the expression pattern of mhc class ii mrna be correlate with that of the class ii transactivator ( ciita ) , suggest that ciita be the actual target of the silencing .
to gain further insight into the suppression phenomenon we perform luciferase assay which show that silencing affect the activity of the b-cell-specific promoter of ciita .
these result therefore demonstrate that the mhc class ii gene silencing in somatic cell hybrid be due to an active suppression of one of the promoter of the ciita gene , mediate by the epithelial cell fusion partner .
comparison of htlv-i basal transcription and expression of creb/atf-1/crem family member in peripheral blood mononuclear cell and jurkat t cell .
htlv-i be the etiologic agent of adult t-cell leukemia /lymphoma and be associate with tropical spastic paraparesis/ htlv-i -associated myelopathy .
follow integration into the host cell genome , htlv-i replication be regulate by both host and viral mechanism that control transcription .
low level of viral transcription ( basal transcription ) occur before expression of the virally encode tax protein ( tax -mediated transcription ) .
member of the cyclic adenosine monophosphate ( camp ) response element binding ( creb ) /activating transcription factor 1 ( atf-1 ) family of transcription factor bind three 21-bp repeat ( tax-responsive element-1 , or tre-1 ) within the viral promoter and be important for basal and tax-mediated transcription .
use mitogen stimulated and quiescent peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) and jurkat cell , we compare difference in basal transcription and amount and binding of transcription factor with tre-1 .
we demonstrate that amount of transcriptionally active phosphorylated creb protein ( p-creb ) differ between activate pbmc and jurkat cell .
follow stimulation , p-creb level remain elevated in pbmc for up to 24 hour whereas creb be dephosphorylated in jurkat cell within 4 hour follow stimulation .
the difference in p-creb level between pbmc and jurkat cell be directly correlate with basal transcription of htlv-i in the two cell type .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we determine that the pattern of band migration differ between the two cell type .
these data demonstrate that pbmc differentially regulate basal htlv-i transcription compare with jurkat t cell , and this differential regulation be due , in part to differential phosphorylation and binding of creb/atf-1 to tre-1 in the htlv-i promoter .
we demonstrate the utility of use primary lymphocyte model to study htlv-i transcription in the context of cell signaling and suggest that activate pbmc maintain elevated level of p-creb , which promote basal htlv-i transcription and enhance viral persistence in vivo .
staphylococcal enterotoxin modulate interleukin 2 receptor expression and ligand-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the janus protein- tyrosine kinase 3 ( jak3 ) and signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat protein ) .
staphylococcal enterotoxin ( se ) stimulate t cell express the appropriate variable region beta chain of ( v beta ) t-cell receptor and have be implicate in the pathogenesis of several autoimmune disease .
depend on costimulatory signal , se induce either proliferation or anergy in t cell .
in addition , se can induce an interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) nonresponsive state and apoptosis .
here , we show that se induce dynamic change in the expression of and signal transduction through the il-2 receptor ( il-2r ) beta and gamma chain ( il-2r beta and il-2r gamma ) in human antigen-specific cd4+ t-cell line .
thus , after 4 hr of exposure to sea and seb , the expression of il-2r beta be down-regulated , il-2r gamma be slightly up-regulated , while il-2r alpha remain largely unaffected .
the change in the composition of il-2rs be accompany by inhibition of il-2 -induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the janus protein- tyrosine kinase 3 ( jak3 ) and signal transducer and activator of transcription call stat3 and stat5 .
in parallel experiment , il-2 -driven proliferation be inhibit significantly .
after 16 hr of exposure to se , the expression of il-2r beta remain low , while that of il2r alpha and il2r gamma be far up-regulated , and ligand-induced tyrosine phosphorylation of jak3 and stat protein be partly normalize .
yet , il-2 -driven proliferation remain profoundly inhibited , suggest that signaling event other than jak3 /stat activation have also be change follow se stimulation .
in conclusion , our data suggest that se can modulate il-2r expression and signal transduction involve the jak/stat pathway in cd4+ t-cell line .
jnk ( c-jun nh2-terminal kinase ) be a target for antioxidant in t lymphocyte .
ap-1 have be show to behave a a redox-sensitive transcription factor that can be activate by both oxidant and antioxidant stimulus .
however , the mechanism involve in the activation of ap-1 by antioxidant be largely unknown .
in this study we show that the structurally unrelated antioxidant agent pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) , butylate hydroxyanisole , and nacetylcysteine activate jnk ( c-jun nh2-terminal kinase ) in jurkat t cell .
this activation differ substantially from that mediate by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) and ca2+ ionophore or produce by costimulation with antibody against the t cell receptor-cd3 complex and to cd28 .
the activation of jnk by classical t cell stimulus be transient , whereas that mediate by pdtc and butylate hydroxyanisole ( but not n-acetylcysteine ) be sustained .
the kinetics of jnk activation correlate with the expression of c-jun which be transient after stimulation with pma plus ionophore and prolong in response to pdtc , which also transiently induce c-fos .
in addition , jnk activation by pma plus ionophore be sensitive to inhibitor of signaling pathway involve ca2+ , protein kinase c , and tyrosine phosphorylation , which fail to inhibit the activation mediate by pdtc .
transfection of trans-dominant negative expression vector of ra and raf , together with ap-1 -dependent reporter construct , as well a western blot analysis use anti-erk ( extracellular signal-regulated kinase ) antibody , indicate that the ras/raf/erk pathway do not appear to mediate the effect of the antioxidant .
however , the combined treatment with pdtc and pma , two agent that synergize on ap-1 activation , result in the persistent phosphorylation of erk-2 .
in conclusion , our result identify jnk a a target of antioxidant agent which can be regulate differentially under oxidant and antioxidant condition .
cell type- and stage-specific expression of the cd20/b1 antigen correlate with the activity of a diverged octamer dna motif present in it promoter .
the cd20 ( b1 ) gene encode a b cell-specific protein involve in the regulation of human b cell proliferation and differentiation .
study with 5' deletion cd20 promoter-cat construct have previously reveal two region of the promoter between base -186 and -280 and between base -280 and -454 which contain positive regulatory element .
in this study we identify a sequence element present in the most proximal region located between base -214 and -201 , ttcttctaattaa , which be important in the high constitutive expression of cd20 in mature b cell and the induction of cd20 in pre-b cell .
this sequence element be refer to a the bat box and it deletion significantly reduce the activity of a cd20 promoter-cat construct in b cell .
mobility shift assay with various mutant probe and b cell nuclear extract demonstrate that the core sequence taat be essential for bind to this site .
cross competition experiment with an octamer sequence from the ig heavy chain promoter , the bat box , and a ta-rich sequence present in the cd21 promoter reveal that all three sequence bind the same nuclear protein suggest that the bat box binding protein be oct-1 and oct-2 .
southwestern blotting and uv cross-linking study confirm that the bat box binding protein be oct-1 and oct-2 .
the affinity of the bat box binding protein for the bat box be approximately 25-fold less than for the octamer sequence and the bat box binding protein dissociate from the bat box 10-fold more rapidly than from the octamer sequence .
despite this low affinity , a trimer of the bat box sequence be a efficiently transactivated by an oct-2 expression vector a be a trimer of the octamer sequence in hela cell .
the bat box and oct-2 be also implicate in the induction of cd20 in the pre-b cell line , pb-697 , via phorbol ester .
the induction of cd20 mrna be temporally associate with induction of oct-2 mrna and a bat box-deleted cd20-cat construct , in contrast to the wild type , be poorly induce by phorbol ester .
together these result suggest that the bat box binding protein be important in the b cell specific expression of cd20 and perhaps cd21 .
oncogenicity of human papillomavirus- or adenovirus- transformed cell correlate with resistance to lysis by natural killer cell .
the reason for the dissimilar oncogenicities of human adenovirus and human papillomaviruses ( hpv ) in human be unknown but may relate to difference in the capacity of the e1a and e7 protein to target cell for rejection by the host natural killer ( nk ) cell response .
a one test of this hypothesis , we compare the ability of e1a - and e7 -expressing human fibroblastic or keratinocyte-derived human cell to be selectively kill by either unstimulated or interferon ( ifn ) -activated nk cell .
cell express the e1a oncoprotein be selectively kill by unstimulated nk cell , while the same parental cell but express the hpv type 16 ( hpv-16 ) or hpv-18 e7 oncoprotein be resistant to nk cell lysis .
the ability of ifn-activated nk cell to selectively kill virally transform cell depend on ifn 's ability to induce resistance to nk cell lysis in normal ( i.e. , non-viral oncogene-expressing ) but not virally transform cell .
e1a block ifn 's induction of cytolytic resistance , result in the selective lysis of adenovirus-transformed cell by ifn -activated nk cell .
the extent of ifn -induced nk cell killing of e1a -expressing cell be proportional to the level of e1a expression and correlate with the ability of e1a to block ifn -stimulated gene expression in target cell .
in contrast , e7 block neither ifn -stimulated gene expression nor ifn 's induction of cytolytic resistance , thereby preclude the selective lysis of hpv -transformed cell by ifn -activated nk cell .
in conclusion , e1a expression mark cell for destruction by the host nk cell response , whereas the e7 oncoprotein lack this activity .
multiple p21ras effector pathway regulate nuclear factor of activate t cell .
the transcription factor , nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) be a major target for p21ras and calcium signalling pathway in the il-2 gene and be induce by p21ras signal act in synergy with calcium /calcineurin signal .
one p21ras effector pathway involve the map kinase erk-2 , and we have examine it role in nfat regulation .
expression of dominant negative mapkk-1 prevent nfat induction .
constitutively active mapkk-1 fully activate erk-2 and the transcription factor elk-1 , but do not substitute for activate p21ras and synergize with calcium /calcineurin signal to induce nfat .
expression of dominant negative n17rac also prevent tcr and p21ras activation of nfat , but without interfere with the erk-2 pathway .
the transcriptional activity of the nfat binding site be mediate by a complex comprise a member of the nfat group and ap-1 family protein .
the induction of ap-1 by p21ras also require rac-1 function .
activate rac-1 could mimic activate p21ras to induce ap-1 but not to induce nfat .
moreover , the combination of activate mapkk-1 and rac-1 could not substitute for activate p21ras and synergize with calcium signal to induce nfat .
thus , p21ras regulation of nfat in t cell require the activity of multiple effector pathway include those regulate by mapkk-1 /erk-2 and rac-1 .
fcgamma receptor -mediated mitogen-activated protein kinase activation in monocyte be independent of ra .
receptor for the fc portion of immunoglobulin molecule ( fcr ) present on leukocyte cell membrane mediate a large number of cellular response that be very important in host defense , include phagocytosis , cell cytotoxicity , production and secretion of inflammatory mediator , and modulation of the immune response .
cross-linking of fcr with immune complex lead , first to activation of protein- tyrosine kinase .
the molecular event that follow and that transduce signal from these receptor to the nucleus be still poorly define .
we have investigate the signal transduction pathway from fc receptor that lead to gene activation and production of cytokine in monocyte .
cross-linking of fcr , on the thp-1 monocytic cell line , by immune complex result in both activation of the transcription factor nf-kappab and interleukin 1 production .
these response be completely block by tyrosine kinase inhibitor .
in contrast , expression of dominant negative mutant of ra and raf-1 , in these cell , do not have any effect on fcr -mediated nuclear factor activation , suggest that the mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) signaling pathway be not use by these receptor .
however , mapk activation be easily detect by in vitro kinase assay , after fcr cross-linking with immune complex .
use the specific mapk /extracellular signal-regulated kinase kinase ( mapk kinase ) inhibitor pd98059 , we find that mapk activation be necessary for fcr -dependent activation of the nuclear factor nf-kappab .
these result strongly suggest that the signaling pathway from fc receptor lead to expression of different gene important to leukocyte biology , initiate with tyrosine kinase and require mapk activation ; but in contrast to other tyrosine kinase receptor , fcr -mediated mapk activation do not involve ra and raf .
interleukin-4 signaling in b lymphocyte from patient with x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency .
interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) be an important cytokine for b and t lymphocyte function and mediate it effect via a receptor that contain gammac .
b cell derive from patient with x-linked severe combined immunodeficiency ( x-scid ) be deficient in gammac and provide a useful model in which to dissect the role of this subunit in il-4 -mediated signaling .
we find that although il-4 stimulation of x-scid b cell do not result in janus tyrosine kinase-3 ( jak3 ) phosphorylation , other il-4 substrate include jak1 and irs-1 be phosphorylated .
additionally , we detect signal transducer and activator of transcription 6 ( stat6 ) tyrosine phosphorylation and dna binding activity in x-scid b cell with a wide range of gammac mutation .
however , reconstitution of these x-scid b cell with gammac enhance il-4 -mediated response include stat6 phosphorylation and dna binding activity and result in increase cd23 expression .
thus , gammac be not necessary to trigger il-4 -mediated response in b cell , but it presence be important for optimal il-4 -signaling .
these result suggest that two distinct il-4 signaling pathway exist .
cd80 and cd86 be not equivalent in their ability to induce the tyrosine phosphorylation of cd28 .
ligation of either cd80 ( b7-1 ) or cd86 ( b7-2 ) , two principal ligand for cd28 , be think to skew the immune response toward th1 or th2 differentiation .
we have examine early signal transduction pathway recruit follow t cell stimulation with either cd80 or cd86 .
purify human peripheral t cell or jurkat t cell be stimulate with chinese hamster ovary ( cho ) cell express either human cd80 ( cho-cd80 ) or human cd86 ( cho-cd86 ) or with anti- cd28 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) .
in the presence of phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate , both cho-cd80 and cho-cd86 , like anti-cd28 mab , be capable of stimulate cytokine production from both human peripheral t cell and jurkat t cell .
both cho-cd80 and cho-cd86 , in the presence of anti-cd3 mab , costimulated nfat -dependent transcriptional activation .
several intracellular signal protein , such a cbl and vav , be phosphorylated on tyrosine in response to cd80 , cd86 , and anti-cd28 mab .
surprisingly , although stimulation of jurkat t cell with either cho-cd80 or anti-cd28 mab result in robust tyrosine phosphorylation of cd28 itself , ligation with cho-cd86 be unable to induce detectable cd28 tyrosyl phosphorylation over a range of stimulation condition .
in addition , the association of phosphoinositide 3-kinase with cd28 and enhance tyrosine phosphorylation of phospholipase cgamma be see after anti-cd28 mab and cho-cd80 stimulation but to a much less extent after cho-cd86 stimulation .
thus , ligation of cd28 with either cd80 or cd86 lead to shared early signal transduction event such a the tyrosine phosphorylation of cbl and vav , to nfat -mediated transcriptional activation , and to the costimulation of interleukin-2 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor production .
however , cd80 and cd86 also induce distinct signal transduction pathway include the tyrosine phosphorylation of cd28 and phospholipase cgamma1 and the sh2 -dependent association of phosphoinositide 3-kinase with cd28 .
these quantitative , if not qualitative , difference between signaling initiate by these two ligand for cd28 may contribute to functional difference ( e.g. th1 or th2 differentiation ) in t cell response .
cloning of murine tcf-1 , a t cell-specific transcription factor interact with functional motif in the cd3-epsilon and t cell receptor alpha enhancer .
cd3 -epsilon gene expression be confine to the t cell lineage .
we have recently identify and clone a human transcription factor , tcf-1 , that bind to a functional element in the t lymphocyte-specific enhancer of cd3-epsilon .
in a panel of human cell line , tcf-1 expression be restricted to t lineage cell .
tcf-1 belong to a novel family of gene that contain the so-called high mobility group 1 ( hmg ) box .
here we report the cloning of murine tcf-1 .
two splice alternative be identify that be not previously observe in human tcf-1 .
murine and human tcf-1 display a 95.5 % overall amino acid homology .
recombinant murine and human tcf-1 recognize the same sequence motif in the cd3-epsilon enhancer a judge by gel retardation and methylation interference assay .
with the murine cdna clone several aspect of tcf-1 be analyze .
first , deletion analysis reveal that a region of tcf-1 contain the hmg box be sufficient for sequence-specific binding .
second , by high stringency northern blotting and in situ hybridization , tcf-1 expression be show to be confine to the thymus and to the t cell area of the spleen .
third , tcf-1 bind specifically to a functional t cell-specific element in the t cell receptor alpha ( tcr-alpha ) enhancer .
the t lineage-specific expression and the affinity for functional motif in the tcr-alpha and cd3-epsilon enhancer imply an important role for tcf-1 in the establishment of the mature t cell phenotype .
interstitial deletion constitute the major mechanism for loss of heterozygosity on chromosome 20q in polycythemia vera .
an acquire deletion of the long arm of chromosome 20 be a recurrent abnormality in myeloproliferative disorder , particularly polycythemia vera and myelodysplastic syndrome .
the association of 20q deletion with myeloid " stem cell " disorder suggest that the deletion mark the site of one or more gene , loss or inactivation of which play a role in the regulation of normal hematopoietic progenitor .
we have recently perform a detailed molecular analysis of 20q deletion in peripheral blood ( pb ) granulocyte and define a commonly delete region of 16 to 21 centimorgan ( cm ) .
to far reduce the size of the common delete region we have search for small deletion or mitotic recombination event , neither of which would be detect by conventional cytogenetics .
we have study 48 patient with polycythemia vera and four patient with idiopathic myelofibrosis .
in each case , cytogenetic analysis have either fail or have show no abnormality of chromosome 20 .
seventeen microsatellite marker that span the common delete region be use to search for loss of heterozygosity in granulocyte dna .
no instance of microsatellite instability be observe in a total of 880 comparison of granulocyte and t-cell dna .
granulocyte dna from four patient exhibit allele loss on 20q .
in each case the allele loss be cause by an interstitial deletion because heterozygosity at distal marker be retain and because quantitative southern blotting demonstrate hemizygosity .
loss of heterozygosity in pb granulocyte would be mask by the presence of significant number of normal granulocyte not derive from the malignant clone .
therefore , the human androgen receptor assay ( humara ) be use to determine granulocyte clonality .
in 21 of 27 informative female patient the majority of the granulocyte be clonally derive .
in 5 patient the granulocyte appear polyclonal and in 1 patient unilateral x inactivation be observe in both granulocyte and t cell .
these result show that , in the vast majority of patient present here , the failure to detect loss of heterozygosity can not be attribute to the presence of normal polyclonal granulocyte .
our result therefore show that allele loss on chromosome 20q in polycythemia vera do not commonly involve mitotic recombination or chromosome loss and that microsatellite instability be a rare event in this disorder .
cni-1493 inhibit monocyte/macrophage tumor necrosis factor by suppression of translation efficiency .
tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) mediate a wide variety of disease state include septic shock , acute and chronic inflammation , and cachexia .
recently , a multivalent guanylhydrazone ( cni-1493 ) develop a an inhibitor of macrophage activation be show to suppress tnf production and protect against tissue inflammation and endotoxin lethality [ bianchi , m. , ulrich , p. , bloom , o. , meistrell , m. , zimmerman , g.a. , schmidtmayerova , h. , bukrinsky , m. , donnelley , t. , bucala , r. , sherry , b. , manogue , k.r. , tortolani , a.j. , cerami , a. & tracey , k.j. ( 1995 ) mol.med.1 , 254-266 , and bianchi , m. , bloom , o. , raabe , t. , cohen , p. s. , chesney , j. , sherry , b. , schmidtmayerova , h. , zhang , x. , bukrinsky , m. , ulrich , p. , cerami , a. & tracey , j. ( 1996 ) j.exp.med. , in press ] .
we have now elucidate the mechanism by which cni-1493 inhibit macrophage tnf synthesis and show here that it act through suppression of tnf translation efficiency .
cni-1493 block neither the lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -induced increase in the expression of tnf mrna nor the translocation of nuclear factor nf-kappa b to the nucleus in macrophage activate by 15 min of lp stimulation , indicate that cni-1493 do not interfere with early nf-kappa b -mediated transcriptional regulation of tnf .
however , synthesis of the 26-kda membrane form of tnf be effectively block by cni-1493 .
far evidence for the translational suppression of tnf be give by experiment use chloram-phenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) construct contain element of the tnf gene that be involve in tnf translational regulation .
both the 5' and 3' untranslated region of the tnf gene be require to elicit maximal translational suppression by cni-1493 .
identification of the molecular target through which cni-_1493 inhibit tnf translation should provide insight into the regulation of macrophage activation and mechanism of inflammation .
[ regulatory effect of insulin on glucocorticoid receptor in human peripheral leukocyte ]
the regulatory effect of insulin on the specific bind power of glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) of human leukocyte be assess by the unoccupied receptor site capable of combine with [3h] labelled dexamethasone measure at 3 and 24 h after incubation with various concentration of insulin add to the medium .
after 3 h incubation the specific bind power with [3h] dex be decrease by 23.3 +/- 10.0 , 32.2 +/- 13.2 and 54.3 +/- 9.2 % ( p great than 0.05 , p great than 0.05 and p less than 0.01 a compare with the control value of 100 in the absence of insulin ) respectively in the presence of 20 mu/l ( physiological testing concentration ) , 200 mu/l ( physiological upper limit ) and 2,000 mu/l ( pharmacological concentration ) insulin in the incubation medium .
after 24 h incubation the decrease of these value increase respectively to 43.5 +/- 19.0 , 56.1 +/- 20.7 and 80.2 +/- 15.5 ( p less than 0.05 , p less than 0.01 and p less than 0.01 compare with control ) .
thus the inhibitory effect of insulin on the gr binding power be both dose- and time-dependent , which strongly suggest that gr be tonically control by insulin concentration change under physiological condition .
chromosome 1 aneusomy with 1p36 under-representation be related to histologic grade , dna aneuploidy , high c-erb b-2 and loss of bcl-2 expression in ductal breast carcinoma .
chromosome 1 abnormality with loss of 1p36 have be investigate in 95 breast-cancer sample by mean of a dual-target fluorescence in-situ hybridization ( fish ) technique use the puc 1.77 and p1-79 probe , specific for the 1q12 and 1p36 region , respectively .
abnormality for one or both probe be detect in 83/95 sample .
relative 1p36 under-representation be find in 79/95 .
the clinical relevance of these alteration be study by compare the fish result with several parameter currently use in breast-cancer pathology .
distinct pattern of chromosome 1 abnormality be find among the histologic type of breast carcinoma .
lobular or mucinous sample show few or no alteration , whereas most ductal sample have high chromosome 1 polysomy with under-representation of 1p36 .
in ductal carcinoma , chromosome 1 alteration increase with histologic grade , dna aneuploidy , loss of bcl-2 and high c-erb b-2 expression .
these association be find to be statistically significant .
no correlation between chromosome 1 alteration and nuclear grade , age , size , lymph-node involvement , hormonal receptor presence , proliferation activity or p53 protein expression be detect .
these result indicate the utility of this fish technique for a good definition of the biological characteristic of ductal carcinoma .
okadaic acid be a potent inducer of ap-1 , nf-kappa b , and tumor necrosis factor-alpha in human b lymphocyte .
treatment of human b lymphocyte with an optimal concentration of okadaic acid , an inhibitor of phosphatase 1 and 2a , result in the induction of the transcription factor , ap-1 and a marked increase in nf-kappa b level .
in contrast , no effect on the level of the octamer binding protein , oct-1 or oct-2 , be find .
since both ap-1 and nf-kappa b have be report to be important in the induction of the tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) gene we examine the effect of okadaic acid on tnf-alpha mrna level .
treatment with okadaic acid result in a striking increase in tnf-alpha mrna transcript within 1 h of stimulation and large amount of tnf-alpha be release into the culture medium .
although okadaic acid provide a potent inductive signal for ap-1 and nf-kappa b it do not induce either b cell proliferation or immunoglobulin secretion .
differential contribution of herpes simplex virus type 1 gene product and cellular factor to the activation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 provirus .
we have previously report that infection with herpes simplex virus type 1 ( hsv-1 ) activate expression of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) provirus in t cell .
activation of the hiv-1 provirus correlate with the activation of binding of 55- and 85- kda protein to the kappa b enhancer and binding of the 50-kda hlp-1 protein to the lbp-1 sequence of the hiv-1 long terminal repeat .
far examination of this system have show that the inhibition of hsv-1 replication by the antiviral drug acyclovir do not inhibit hsv-1-mediated induction of hiv-1 provirus .
surprisingly , the nf-kappa b and hlp-1 binding activity be substantially inhibit in acyclovir -treated cell .
in the transient-transfection assay , icp0 , but not icp4 , activate the hiv-1 long terminal repeat promoter region and the effect of icp0 be greatly enhance in the presence of the nf-kappa b binding protein , suggest that induction of the hiv-1 provirus involve cooperation between the hsv-1-activated cellular factor , nf-kappa b , and the virus-encoded transactivator , icp0 .
nf-kappa b a inducible transcriptional activator of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor gene .
the expression of the gene encode the granulocyte- macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be induce upon activation of t cell with phytohemagglutinin and active phorbolester and upon expression of tax1 , a transactivating protein of the human t-cell leukemia virus type i .
the same agent induce transcription from the interleukin-2 receptor alpha-chain and interleukin-2 gene , depend on promoter element that bind the inducible transcription factor nf-kappa b ( or an nf-kappa b -like factor ) .
we therefore test the possibility that the gm-csf gene be also regulate by a cognate motif for the nf-kappa b transcription factor .
a recent functional analysis by miyatake et al. ( s. miyatake , m. seiki , m. yoshida , and k. arai , mol. cell. biol. 8 : 5581-5587 , 1988 ) describe a short promoter region in the gm-csf gene that confer strong inducibility by t-cell-activating signal and tax1 , but no nf-kappa b -binding motif be identify .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we show binding of purify human nf-kappa b and of the nf-kappa b activate in jurkat t cell to an oligonucleotide comprise the gm-csf promoter element responsible for mediate responsiveness to t-cell-activating signal and tax1 .
a show by a methylation interference analysis and oligonucleotide competition experiment , purify nf-kappa b bind at position -82 to -91 ( gggaactacc ) of the gm-csf promoter sequence with an affinity similar to that with which it bind to the biologically functional kappa b motif in the beta interferon promoter ( gggaaattcc ) .
two kappa b-like motif at position -98 to -108 of the gm-csf promoter be also recognize but with much low affinity .
our data provide strong evidence that the expression of the gm-csf gene follow t-cell activation be control by binding of the nf-kappa b transcription factor to a high-affinity binding site in the gm-csf promoter .
evidence for repression of il-2 gene activation in anergic t cell .
the induction of clonal anergy in a t cell inhibit il-2 secretion because of the development of a proximal signal transduction defect .
fusion of anergic murine t cell to human jurkat t leukemia cell and formation of heterokaryons fail to result in a complementation of this signaling defect and restoration of murine il-2 mrna inducibility .
instead , signal transduction to the human il-2 gene become disrupt .
heterokaryons form by the fusion of anergic murine t cell to normal murine t cell also fail to accumulate intracellular il-2 protein in response to stimulation either with the combination of cd3 and cd28 mabs or with ionomycin plus a protein kinase c -activating phorbol ester .
the result argue against a loss-of-function signaling defect a the sole basis for clonal anergy induction and document the presence of a dominant-acting repressor molecule that inhibit signal transduction to the il-2 gene within viable anergic t cell .
synergistic interaction between overlap bind site for the serum response factor and elk-1 protein mediate both basal enhancement and phorbol ester responsiveness of primate cytomegalovirus major immediate-early promoter in monocyte and t-lymphocyte cell type .
cytomegalovirus ( cmv ) infection be nonpermissive or persistent in many lymphoid and myeloid cell type but can be activate in differentiate macrophage .
we have show elsewhere that both the major immediate-early gene ( mie ) and lytic cycle infectious progeny virus expression can be induce in otherwise nonpermissive monocyte-like u-937 cell culture infect with either human cmv ( hcmv ) or simian cmv ( scmv ) by treatment with the phorbol ester 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) .
two multicopy basal enhancer motif within the scmv mie enhancer , namely , 11 copy of the 16-bp cyclic amp response element ( cre ) and 3 copy of novel 17-bp serum response factor ( srf ) binding site refer to a the sne ( srf/nfkappab-like element ) , as well a four classical nfkappab site within the hcmv version , contribute to tpa responsiveness in transient assay in monocyte and t- cell type .
the scmv sne site contain potential overlap core recognition binding motif for srf , rel/nfkappab , ets , and yy1 class transcription factor but fail to respond to either serum or tumor necrosis factor alpha .
therefore , to evaluate the mechanism of tpa responsiveness of the sne motif and of a related 16-bp see ( srf/ ets element ) motif find in the hcmv and chimpanzee cmv mie enhancer , we have examine the functional response and protein binding property of multimerized wild-type and mutant element add upstream to the scmv mie or simian virus 40 minimal promoter region in the u-937 , k-562 , hl-60 , thp-1 , and jurkat cell line .
unlike classical nfkappab site , neither the sne nor the see motif respond to phosphatase inhibition by okadaic acid .
however , the tpa responsiveness of both cmv element prove to involve synergistic interaction between the core srf binding site ( ccatatatgg ) and the adjacent invert ets binding motif ( ttcc ) , which correlate directly with formation of a bind tripartite complex contain both the cellular srf and elk-1 protein .
this protein complex be more abundant in u-937 , k-562 , and hela cell extract than in raji , hf , balb/c 3t3 , or hl-60 cell , but the binding activity be alter only twofold after tpa treatment .
a 40-fold stimulation of chloramphenicol acetyltransferase activity mediate by four tandem repeat of the sne could be induce within 2 h ( and up to 250-fold within 6 h ) after addition of tpa in dna-transfected u-937 cell , indicate that the stimulation appear likely to be a true protein kinase c -mediated signal transduction event rather than a differentiation response .
slight difference in the sequence of the core srf binding site compare with that of the classical c-fos promoter serum response element , together with difference in the spacing between the srf and ets motif , appear to account for the inability of the scmv snes to respond to serum induction .
activation of a novel gene in 3q21 and identification of intergenic fusion transcript with ecotropic viral insertion site i in leukemia .
we have identify a novel gene , gr6 , located within the leukemia breakpoint region of 3q21 , that be normally express in early fetal development but not in adult peripheral blood .
gr6 be activate in the ucsd-aml1 cell line and in a leukemic sample , both of which carry a t(3;3)(q21;q26) .
in ucsd-aml1 , we have also identify fusion transcript between the ecotropic viral insertion site i ( evi1 ) gene in 3q26 and gr6 and between evi1 and ribophorin i that map 30 kb telomeric to gr6 in 3q21 .
all fusion splice the 5' end of the 3q21 gene into exon 2 of the evi1 gene , an event that be similar to the normal intergenic splicing of mds1- evi1 and to those previously document in leukemia with t(3;21) and t(3;12) , in which acute myelogenous leukemia 1- evi1 fusion and etv6- evi1 fusion , respectively , occur .
the ribophorin i -evi1 fusion in particular may be a common occurrence in t(3;3) .
inducible binding to the c-fos serum response element during t cell activation be regulate by a phosphotyrosine-containing protein .
the proto-oncogene c-fos be an immediate-early gene , and one of the first gene transcribe after stimulation of most cell with a variety of ligand .
fo expression may be a pivotal event in convert ligand-receptor interaction at the membrane into functional modulation of cell phenotype .
the serum response element ( sre ) in the c-fos regulatory region participate in induction of transcription by various growth factor and by phorbol ester and subsequent squelching of transcription .
we show that an inducible protein complex ( band a ) bind to sre dna within 10 min after mitogenic stimulation of human pbl-t , and become nondetectable by 60 min .
band a contain the serum response factor plus additional factor ( s ) .
a protein that be phosphorylated on a tyrosine residue in rest pbl-t suppress binding of a component of band a to the sre motif .
upon stimulation of the cell , this protein no longer prevent binding of dna by band a , and suppression of binding be restore within 30 min .
the phosphorylated tyrosine residue itself be important for the protein-protein interaction .
specific glucocorticoid binding at different level of human motor activity .
we study the number of glucocorticoid receptor and dissociation constant in isolate human lymphocyte as well a blood concentration of hormone produce by the hypothalamic-hypophyseal-adrenocortical system in three experimental series : at normal ( 17 subject ) , decrease ( 10 subject , a 360-d head-down bed rest ) and increase ( 8 subject , physical exercise on bicycle ergometer ) level of motor activity .
in the first series we find that the number of glucocorticoid receptor and dissociation constant do not depend on the season , on the age of subject nor on cortisol concentration in blood .
in the second series we observe the following : at the end of the first month of bed rest the number of glucocorticoid receptor and receptor affinity significantly increase ; at the beginning of the third month of bed rest specific glucocorticoid binding significantly decrease and circadian rhythm of adrenocorticotropin and cortisol in blood vary markedly ; at the end of the sixth month of bed rest the number of glucocorticoid receptor return to prebed rest level and dissociation constant decrease .
in the third series physical exercise that induce an activation of the hypothalamic-hypophyseal-adrenocortical system ( maximal physical exercise and prolonged submaximal exercise at 70 % of maximal oxygen uptake ) lead to a significant increase in the number of glucocorticoid receptor without change of dissociation constant .
these result indicate that both a decrease and an increase of human motor activity result in significant change of specific glucocorticoid binding which be not influence by change of circulate hormone concentration in blood but by some other factor affect by physical activity .
competent transcription initiation by rna polymerase ii in cell-free extract from xeroderma pigmentosum group b and d in an optimize rna transcription assay .
the human autosomal recessive disease , xeroderma pigmentosum ( xp ) , can result from mutation in any one of seven gene , designate xpa through xpg .
of these , the xpb and xpd gene encode protein that be subunit of a general transcription factor , tfiih , involve in both nucleotide excision repair ( ner ) and initiation of mrna transcription by rna polymerase ii .
in human , mutation of the xpb or xpd gene impair ner , result in hyper-sensitivity to sunlight and greatly increase skin tumor formation .
however , no transcription deficiency have be demonstrate in either xp-b or xp-d .
we have employ an optimize cell-free rna transcription assay to analyze transcription activity of xp-b and xp-d .
although the growth rate be normal , the xp-b and xp-d cell contain reduce amount of tfiih .
extract prepare from xp-b and xp-d lymphoblastoid cell exhibit similar transcription activity from the adenovirus major late promoter when compare to that in extract from normal cell .
thus , we conclude that the xp-b and xp-d lymphoblastoid cell do not have impaired rna transcription activity .
we consider the possible consequence of the reduce cellular content of tfiih for the clinical symptom in xp-b or xp-d patient , and discuss a ' conditional phenotype ' that may involve an impairment of cellular function only under certain growth condition .
mapping of the interaction site of the defective transcription factor in the class ii major histocompatibility complex mutant cell line clone-13 to the divergent x2-box .
we have previously describe a mutant b lymphoblastoid cell line , clone-13 , that express hla-dq in the absence of hla -dr and -dp .
several criterion indicate that the defect in this cell line influence the activity of an isotype-specific transcription factor .
indeed , transient transfection of hla-dra and dqb reporter construct indicate that the affect factor operate via cis-elements located between -141 base pair and the transcription initiation site .
a series of hybrid dra/dqb reporter construct be generate to further map the relevant cis-elements in this system .
insertion of oligonucleotides span the dqb x-box ( but not the dqb-w region or the dqb y-box ) upstream of -141 in a dra reporter plasmid rescue expression to nearly wild-type level .
substitution promoter be then generate where the entire x-box , or only the x1- or x2- box of hla-dra be replace with the analogous region of hla-dqb .
the dqb x2-box be able to restore expression to the silent dra reporter construct .
moreover , replacement of the dqb x2-box with the dra x2-box markedly diminish the activity of the dqb promoter in the mutant cell .
none of the hybrid reporter construct be defective when transfected into the wild-type , hla-dr/-dq positive parental cell line , jijoye .
these study suggest that the divergent x2-box of the class ii major histocompatibility complex promoter play an important role in influence differential expression of the human class ii isotypes .
interferon-gamma-induced factor bind to the interleukin-4 -responsive element of cd23b promoter in human tonsillar mononuclear cell : role in transient up-regulation of the interleukin-4 -induced cd23b mrna .
stimulation of human tonsillar mononuclear cell with interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) and interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) rapidly induce the activation of distinct nuclear factor with different mobility , both of which bind the il-4 response element ( il-4re ) of cd23b promoter a examine by electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) .
co-treatment of il-4 and ifn-gamma induce , in addition to the two distinct complex , a new complex with an intermediate mobility .
the il-4 -induced complex react with anti- stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) 6 , result in a supershift whereas the formation of the ifn-gamma -induced complex be inhibit by anti- stat 1 .
the intermediate complex appear to react with both anti- stat 6 and anti- stat 1 .
although ifn-gamma alone do not induce cd23 mrna transcription , northern blot analysis reveal a transient up-regulation of the il-4 -induced cd23 mrna by ifn-gamma within 2 h of ifn-gamma treatment in these tonsillar cell .
the result suggest that the il-4re of the il-4 -inducible gene can accommodate both il-4- and ifn-gamma- activated factor , such a stat 6 and stat 1 , either in homodimeric or heterodimeric form and the binding of these different protein to the respective promoter may play a potential regulatory role in the il-4 - inducible gene expression .
isolation and characterization of murine fra-1 : induction mediate by cd40 and surface ig be protein kinase c dependent .
the murine fra-1 gene , encode fos-related ag 1 , be isolate from a splenic cdna library and sequence .
murine fra-1 be highly homologous to rat and human fra-1 .
oligonucleotide primer base on the murine sequence be use to construct a quantitative reverse transcription-pcr assay for gene expression .
b lymphocyte stimulation via both cd40 and surface ig ( sig ) receptor substantially induce fra-1 expression , and for both receptor , induction be protein kinase c ( pkc ) dependent .
this contrast with induction of c-fos by both cd40 and sig , which be pkc independent and indicate that cd40 be capable of signal through pkc or a closely related kinase .
induction of fra-1 follow engagement of cd40 do not require protein synthesis , suggest that the pkc -dependent linkage between cd40 and fra-1 be direct .
cd40 -mediated fra-1 induction do require tyrosine kinase activity .
these result demonstrate that cd40 , like sig , may employ pkc in produce select outcome , that individual b cell receptor may signal downstream event via both pkc-dependent and pkc-independent pathway , and that multiple signal transduction pathway may be use to activate the expression of closely related gene .
c-rel be a target of pentoxifylline -mediated inhibition of t lymphocyte activation .
the possible clinical use of the methyl xanthine derivative , pentoxifylline ( pf ) , for the treatment of t cell-dependent disease be be note with increase interest .
in this paper , we study the molecular consequence of pf treatment during lymphocyte activation .
we find that in t cell , anti-cd3-induced c-rel expression be block by pf , whereas the induction of other nf-kappab family member be not significantly affect .
however , induction of nf-at , which have the same signaling requirement a c-rel induction , be not inhibit by pf .
among gene that respond to these transcription factor , il-2 mrna induction be suppress by pf , whereas il-2r ( alpha ) chain mrna induction be not affect .
these observation implicate c-rel a an il-2 promoter factor , for which experimental support be obtain from transient transfection experiment .
in contrast with the observation in t cell , c-rel induction be not block by pf in b cell .
the great selectivity of pf , compare with fk506 , at both the molecular and cellular level may prove advantageous in manipulate t cell response in vivo .
c/ebp activate the human corticotropin-releasing hormone gene promoter .
the purpose of these study be to identify whether transcription factor , associate with cytokine signalling , affect promoter activity of the corticotropin releasing hormone ( crh ) gene .
fragment of a 3.6 kb sequence of the human crh gene promoter be amplify by pcr and ligate upstream of a cat reporter .
these construct be transfected into a variety of cell line , either alone or together , with transcription factor expression vector .
basal activity of a 3070 bp crh promoter fragment be only see in neuronal and lymphoblastoid cell line .
promoter activity be increase by the transcription factor c/ebpbeta ( nf-il6 ) and more strongly , by c/ebpdelta ( nf-il6beta ) .
increase crh promoter activity follow phorbol ester treatment be inhibit by a dominant negative nf-il6 mutant , show that the effect of phorbol ester be principally mediate by c/ebp .
moreover , the inverse change in the expression of crh in the hypothalamus and spleen of arthritic rat be parallel by similar inverse change in nf-il6beta expression in these organ .
these data show that some transcription factor associate with cytokine signalling can also activate the crh promoter .
polymorphic nucleotide within the human il-4 promoter that mediate overexpression of the gene .
atopy , which predispose individual to develop asthma , severe systemic anaphylaxis , and atopic dermatitis , be usually associate with dramatically elevated total serum ige level and be think to be control by a major susceptibility gene and multiple minor susceptibility gene .
a recent sib-pair analysis reveal a tight linkage between marker on 5q31.1 and a major susceptibility gene control total serum ige level .
due to it location within this cluster and it biologic role in ig class switching and th2 cell differentiation , the il-4 gene have emerge a one major candidate for the atopy gene .
in one model , polymorphism within il-4 regulatory element might result in overexpression of the gene , amplify th2 cell differentiation and class switching to ige .
in support of this model , we report that the human il-4 promoter exist in multiple allelic form that exhibit distinct transcriptional activity in il-4 -positive t cell .
a particular allele have an unusually high transcriptional activity .
a nucleotide substitution within a recently describe oap40 element located just upstream of an nf-at site ( p sequence ) appear to be largely responsible for the increase promotor strength of this particular allelic form of the il-4 promoter .
in emsas , this substitution result in a markedly enhance affinity for sequence-specific complex exhibit an ap-1 specificity .
the identification of allelic nucleotide , which result in overexpression of the il-4 gene , provide specific target for a comprehensive screening of atopic and nonatopic individual and may provide a clue for genetic predisposition for atopy .
the ah receptor recognize dna binding site for the b cell transcription factor , bsap : a possible mechanism for dioxin-mediated alteration of cd19 gene expression in human b lymphocyte .
2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( tcdd ) inhibit murine and human b lymphocyte immunoglobulin production through an unknown mechanism .
this study investigate the effect of tcdd on expression of the cd19 gene in a human b lymphocyte cell line .
northern blot analysis show that tcdd treatment decrease steady state level of cd19 mrna by 67 % in the im-9 cell line .
use a gel mobility shift assay , we identify a dna-binding complex in im-9 nuclear extract that by several criterion appear to be the ah receptor .
in addition , the ah receptor complex recognize a dna binding site for b cell lineage-specific activator protein ( bsap ) in the promoter region of the human cd19 gene which be similar to the consensus ah receptor dna binding site .
these result suggest that the ahr could interfere with bsap -stimulated cd19 gene transcription by competition for a common dna binding site .
alternate immune system target for tcdd : lymphocyte stem cell and extrathymic t-cell development .
we here summarize evidence that thymic atrophy induce by 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ( tcdd ) can be mediate , at least in part , by damage to extrathymic t-cell precursor in bone marrow and fetal liver .
this atrophy induction do not involve apoptotic mechanism in thymocytes affect by the bcl-2 proto-oncogene .
tcdd mediate atrophy induction through it specific receptor ( the ahr ) and not through effect on the estrogen receptor .
both tcdd and estradiol induce extrathymic t-cell differentiation in the liver .
these extrathymic t-cell population include cell express elevated level of v beta t-cell receptor that be normally delete in thymic development .
inhibitory effect of e3330 , a novel quinone derivative able to suppress tumor necrosis factor-alpha generation , on activation of nuclear factor-kappa b .
(2e)-3-[5-(2,3-dimethoxy-6-methyl-1,4-benzoquinoyl)]-2-nonyl-2-_propenoic acid ( e3330 ) , be a novel agent with hepatoprotective activity .
we report the effect of e3330 on transcriptional activation of tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha gene and on nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b activation .
nuclear run-on experiment show that e3330 decrease transcriptional activation of tnf-alpha gene induce by lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) stimulation in human peripheral monocyte .
to investigate the inhibitory mechanism , we construct a secreted-type placental alkaline phosphatase ( plap ) reporter gene whose transcription be control by a 1.4-kb human tnf-alpha promoter .
a stable transformant of the plap reporter gene derive from human monocytic cell line show very little activity on the promoter before stimulation , whereas lp stimulation lead to a dramatic increase in plap activity .
e3330 inhibit this induce promoter activity in a dose-dependent manner .
there be four putative nf-kappa b binding site ( kappa b-1 , kappa b-2 , kappa b-3 , kappa b-4 ) in human tnf-alpha promoter .
by use mutate promoter- plap plasmid , we establish that these nf-kappa b site be necessary for induction of tnf-alpha transcription on stimulation with lp .
a gel retardation experiment with synthetic double-stranded oligonucleotides show that activate nf-kappa b consist of p50/p65 heterodimer bind to all four putative nf-kappa b dna probe , suggest that all four putative nf-kappa b recognition site play an important role in inducible tnf-alpha expression .
e3330 decrease activate nf-kappa b in nucleus , suggest that e3330 inhibit nf-kappa b activation and/or translocation of the nucleus .
western blotting analysis with anti-i kappa b-alpha antibody indicate that e3330 inhibit degradation of i kappa b-alpha , which be an inhibitory protein of nf-kappa b , in lp -stimulated monocyte .
e3330 may suppress the production of active oxygen specie serve a common messenger to activate nf-kappa b .
human t lymphotropic virus-i infection of human t lymphocyte induce expression of the beta-galactoside-binding lectin , galectin-3 .
animal lectin play important role in a variety of biological process via their recognition of glycoconjugates .
galectin-3 be a beta-galactoside-binding lectin previously designate a epsilon bp ( ige-binding protein ) , cbp35 , mac-2 , l-29 , and l-34 , and it expression have be associate with various physiological and pathological process , include cell growth , tumor transformation , and metastasis .
galectin-3 be widely distribute in various tissue and cell type and be express in many leukocyte , with the notable exception of b and t lymphocyte .
we now report that galectin-3 be abundantly express in a number of human t lymphotropic virus ( htlv ) -i -infected human t cell line , include f6t , hut 102 , k3t , mt-2 , and slb-i , but be not express in non- htlv-i -infected t cell line such a jurkat , cem , and molt-4 .
in addition , the galectin-3 level be markedly increase in human thymocytes after infection with htlv-i a compare with uninfected thymocytes .
the up-regulation of galectin-3 expression appear to correlate well with htlv-i gene expression , a undetectable or very low level of galectin-3 be find in the s1t and atl-1k cell line , which be nonproductively infect with htlv-i .
in co-transfection experiment , the galectin-3 promoter be significantly up-regulated by expression vector encode the 40-kd tax protein , a potent transactivator in htlv-i .
analysis of various tax mutant suggest that galectin-3 promoter induction be dependent on activation of the cyclic-amp -responsive element binding protein/activation transcription factor family of transcription factor and , to a less extent , nuclear factor-kappa b/rel induction .
transfection of human promonocytic u-937 cell with an htlv-i tax expression vector induce galectin-3 expression in this cell line .
functionally , galectin-3 be show to activate interleukin-2 production in jurkat t cell .
together , these finding raise the possibility that htlv-i tax production induce the transcription and subsequent synthesis and secretion of galectin-3 , which in turn may far activate these t cell and contribute to the altered property of cell growth find in adult t cell leukemia induce by htlv-i .
costimulation of human cd4+ t cell with lfa-3 and b7 induce distinct effect on ap-1 and nf-kappa b transcription factor .
we have earlier show that stimulation of human cd4+ t cell with sea present on chinese hamster ovary ( cho ) -dr transfectants coexpressing either b7 or lfa-3 result in distinct cytokine profile .
we now demonstrate that b7 , but not lfa-3 , strongly costimulated il-2 transcription and mrna expression in cd4+ t cell .
maximal increase in il-2 transcription be record with cho-dr/ b7 / lfa-3 , suggest a cooperative effect of b7 and lfa-3 at the transcriptional level .
gel-shift analysis demonstrate that stimulation of cd4+ t cell with cho-dr and staphylococcal enterotoxin a be sufficient to induce significant amount of nf-kappa b binding protein , whereas induction of ap-1 binding protein require costimulation .
lfa-3 induce moderate level of ap-1 , but do not influence the level of nf-kappa b , while b7 costimulation strongly induce both ap-1 and substantially enhance nf-kappa b binding protein .
the cho-dr/ b7 / lfa-3 triple transfectant induce a further increase in ap-1 and nf-kappa b binding protein compare with the double transfectants .
the level of oct-1 binding protein remain similar in all sample .
super-shift analysis reveal that the nf-kappa b complex of costimulated cd4+ t cell contain large amount of p50 , substantial amount of p65 , and marginal level of c-rel protein .
the ap-1 binding protein contain c-jun , jun-d , and fra-1 , but marginal amount of jun-b and c-fos .
our result indicate distinct effect of b7 and lfa-3 costimulation on the activity of ap-1 and nf-kappa b .
these may partly account for the differential effect of b7 and lfa-3 costimulation on il-2 expression .
bcl-6 , a poz/zinc-finger protein , be a sequence-specific transcriptional repressor .
approximately 40 % of diffuse large cell lymphoma be associate with chromosomal translocation that deregulate the expression of the bcl6 gene by juxtapose heterologous promoter to the bcl-6 coding domain .
the bcl6 gene encode a 95-kda protein contain six c-terminal zinc-finger motif and an n-terminal poz domain , suggest that it may function a a transcription factor .
by use a dna sequence select for it ability to bind recombinant bcl-6 in vitro , we show here that bcl-6 be present in dna-binding complex in nuclear extract from various b-cell line .
in transient transfectin experiment , bcl6 can repress transcription from promoter link to it dna target sequence and this activity be dependent upon specific dna-binding and the presence of an intact n-terminal half of the protein .
we demonstrate that this part of the bcl6 molecule contain an autonomous transrepressor domain and that two noncontiguous region , include the poz motif , mediate maximum transrepressive activity .
these result indicate that the bcl-6 protein can function a a sequence-specific transcriptional repressor and have implication for the role of bcl6 in normal lymphoid development and lymphomagenesis .
heterogeneous expression of epstein-barr virus latent protein in endemic burkitt 's lymphoma .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -infected cell may sustain three distinct form of virus latency .
in lymphoblastoid cell line , six ebv-encoded nuclear antigen ( ebna 1 , 2 , 3a , 3b , 3c , -lp ) , three latent membrane protein ( lmp1 , 2a , 2b ) , and two nuclear rna ( ebers ) be express .
this form of latency , term latency iii , be also encounter in some posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder .
in ebv-positive case of hodgkin 's disease , the ebers , ebna1 , and the lmps be express ( latency ii ) , whereas in burkitt 's lymphoma ( bl ) only the ebers and ebna1 have be detect ( latency i ) .
we have study the expression of ebv protein in 17 case of ebv-positive endemic bl by immunohistology .
expression of lmp1 be see in variable proportion of tumor cell in two case and ebna2 be detect in some tumor cell in three other case .
also , the bzlf1 trans-activator protein be express in a few tumor cell in 6 case , indicate entry into the lytic cycle .
a phenotypic drift from latency i to latency iii have be observe previously in some bl cell line .
our result suggest that a similar phenomenon may occur in bl in vivo and indicate that the operational definition of ebv latency be not easily apply to human tumor .
alcohol-induced regulation of nuclear regulatory factor-kappa beta in human monocyte .
acute ethanol exposure have the capacity to modulate immune function , particularly , to down regulate monocyte production of inflammatory cytokine .
however , the intracellular mechanism for these effect of ethanol be yet to be understand .
consider that nuclear regulatory factor-kappa beta ( nf-kappa b ) /rel be a common regulatory element of the promoter region of the inflammatory cytokine gene , herein , we test the hypothesis that acute ethanol affect nf-kappa b activation in human monocyte .
adherence-isolated monocyte show constitutive dna binding activity of nf-kappa b .
a clinically relevant dose ( 25 mm ) of acute ethanol treatment in vitro increase nf-kappa b binding activity in monocyte with a preferential induction of the inhibitory , p50 /p50 , nf-kappa b /rel homodimer , and result in no induction of the p65 /p50 heterodimer .
in contrast , lipopolysaccharide stimulation primarily induce the p65 /p50 heterodimer that have be show to result in gene activation .
thus , such unique activation of the inhibitory p50 /p50 homodimer by acute ethanol treatment may result in inhibition rather than activation of nf-kappa b -regulated inflammatory cytokine gene .
consequently , these result suggest that physiologically relevant concentration of ethanol may affect production of inflammatory cytokine , such a tumor necrosis factor-alpha , interleukin-1 beta , and interleukin-6 by disrupt nf-kappa b signaling in monocyte .
characterization of the cd48 gene demonstrate a positive element that be specific to epstein-barr virus -immortalized b-cell line and contain an essential nf-kappa b site .
