epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) infection of mature , rest b cell drive them to become lymphoblast express high level of cell surface molecule , such a cd48 , characteristically express on normal activate b cell .
here , we report on the identification of an enhancer element in the cd48 gene which reproducibly confer strong transcriptional activity only in ebv -positive b-lymphoblastoid cell line .
the element be not activate upon infection of established ebv -negative b-cell line , indicate that ebv fail to drive these cell to a fully lymphoblastoid phenotype .
an nf-kappa b binding site be an essential component of the element but alone be not sufficient to account for the activity or the specificity of the element .
we have detect a specific nuclear protein complex that bind to the element and show that nf-kappa b1 ( p50 ) be a part of this complex .
the ebv -encoded latent membrane protein 1 be capable of transactivating the isolate cd48 nf-kappa b site but not the intact element , suggest that the latent membrane protein 1 -driven activation of nf-kappa b/rel must interact with other regulatory pathway to control expression of cellular gene a ebv drive rest b cell into the cell cycle .
marked basophilia in acute promyelocytic leukaemia treat with all-trans retinoic acid : molecular analysis of the cell origin of the basophil .
we report a patient with acute promyelocytic leukaemia who develop marked basophilia during all-trans retinoic acid treatment .
we study genomic dna and rna extract from the patient 's peripheral leucocyte in order to determine the origin of the basophil .
the rar alpha rearranged band in the southern blot analysis and a chimaeric product of pml-rar alpha by polymerase chain reaction be strongly visible before atra treatment , but at the time of maximal basophilia both of them be markedly diminish .
these finding suggest that the basophil which appear during the atra treatment be reactive in nature rather than a leukaemic clone .
nuclear transcription factor that bind to element of the il-2 promoter .
induction requirement in primary human t cell .
prior study have identify several element that contribute to the activity of the il-2 promoter in the stimulate t cell line , jurkat .
the site and their corresponding nuclear bind factor include : nf-kappa b , ap-1 , ap-3 , oct-1 , and nf-at .
the latter " nuclear factor for activate t cell " likely contribute to the tissue specificity of il-2 gene expression .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we have study these transcription factor in primary t cell from human blood to verify their presence in a physiologic setting and to identify the signal that stimulate factor activity .
all factor be induce in the nucleus of t cell upon activation with mitogen but not with exogenous il-2 growth factor .
however , the signaling requirement and sensitivity to protein synthesis inhibitor differ considerably .
only the activity for nf-at and ap-1 site require two signal for optimal induction , i.e. , pma plus either lectin or antibody to the cd3 or cd28 surface molecule .
other factor be induce by lectin , antibody , and/or pma alone .
after appropriate stimulation , both nf-at and ap-1 be peculiarly sensitive to the protein synthesis inhibitor anisomycin .
our data correlate the activity of nf-at and ap-1 in gel shift assay with the two signal requirement for il-2 gene expression .
the normal cell cycle activation program be exploit during the infection of quiescent b lymphocyte by epstein-barr virus .
b lymphocyte in the peripheral circulation be maintained in a non-proliferative state .
antigen recognition stimulate limited proliferation , whereas infection with epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) result in continual proliferation and the outgrowth of immortal cell line .
because it be not clear at which point in cell cycle the peripheral b lymphocyte be arrest , we characterize the expression of several cell cycle-associated gene in quiescent and stimulate cell .
we show that the expression of four cell gene , cdc-2 , cyclin e , cd23 , and cyclin d2 , be up-regulated approximately 100-fold a a result of ebv -mediated immortalization .
because these gene play a positive role in cell proliferation , we suggest that this regulatory switch contribute to control entry into the cell cycle .
transient stimulation of quiescent b lymphocyte with either a cocktail of anti-cd40 , anti-igm , and il4 , or ebv result in the rapid expression of the same four gene , suggest that , after infection , ebv exploit the normal program of b-lymphocyte cell cycle activation .
effect of adenovirus 2 on cellular gene activation in blood-derived monocyte and macrophage .
we have investigate the effect of adenovirus 2 ( ad2 ) infection on human monocyte and monocyte-derived macrophage with regard to expression of tnf-alpha and il-1 beta .
in monocyte , the virus be bind to the surface without be internalize .
on the other hand , ad2 be internalize by macrophage .
no virus replication and no transcription of the ad2 early gene be observe in either of the cell .
ad2 infection induce transient increase in the mrna level for tnf-alpha and il-1 beta in both monocyte and in macrophage , although the kinetics of the transcription be slightly different .
the production of both cytokine , measure by elisa test , be enhance in monocyte .
in macrophage , a slight enhancement of tnf-alpha production be see , whereas il-1 beta be not detect .
the data indicate that cellular gene might be activate by ad2 virus infection in nonpermissive cell where no viral gene product could be detect .
age-related decrease in il-2 production by human t cell be associate with impaired activation of nuclear transcriptional factor ap-1 and nf-at .
although transcriptional factor ap-1 and nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) be important for the normal induction of il-2 , it be unknown if the age-related decline in il-2 production by activate human t cell may be associate with aberrancy in transcriptional regulatory protein .
in the current study , il-2 production by t cell from elderly ( mean 78 year ) and young ( mean 37 year ) human be measure in culture stimulate with pha , pha plus pma , crosslinked anti-cd3 mab okt3 plus pma , or pma plus ionomycin .
substantial decrease of il-2 production be observe for cell culture from 7 of 12 elderly individual in response to the different stimulus , whereas the level of il-2 produce by stimulate t cell from other elderly individual be equivalent to those observe for stimulate t cell of young subject .
analysis of nuclear extract by electrophoretic dna mobility shift assay show that decrease il-2 production by stimulate t cell of elderly individual be closely associate with impairment in the activation of both ap-1 and nf-at .
by contrast , t cell from elderly subject with normal level of il-2 production exhibit normal activation of ap-1 and nf-at .
in addition , the result of competition experiment analyze the normal component of nf-at show that the age-related reduction in stimulus-dependent nf-at complex correspond to the slow migrate complex that be compose of c-fos/c-jun ap-1 .
the resting and stimulated level of nf kappa b be reduce in t cell from certain elderly individual ; however , alteration of nf kappa b do not correlate with change in il-2 expression .
thus , these result show that age-related impairment in the activation of ap-1 and nf-at be closely associate with decrease expression of il-2 and far suggest that aberrancy in the signaling pathway important for the induction of transcriptionally active c-fos/c-jun ap-1 may contribute to the impaired activation of nf-at .
the b cell-specific nuclear factor otf-2 positively regulate transcription of the human class ii transplantation gene , dra .
the promoter of the major histocompatibility class ii gene dra contain an octamer element ( atttgcat ) that be require for efficient dra expression in b cell .
several dna-binding protein be know to bind this sequence .
the best characterize be the b cell-specific otf-2 and the ubiquitous otf-1 .
this report directly demonstrate that otf-2 but not otf-1 regulate the dra gene .
in vitro transcription analysis use protein fraction enrich for the octamer-binding protein otf-2 demonstrate a positive functional role for otf-2 in dra gene transcription .
in contrast , otf-1 -enriched protein fraction do not affect dra gene transcription although it functionally enhance the transcription of another gene .
recombinant otf-2 protein produce by in vitro transcription /translation could also enhance dra gene transcription in vitro .
in vivo transient transfection study utilize an otf-2 expression vector result in similar finding : that otf-2 protein enhance dra gene transcription , and that this effect require an intact octamer element .
together these result constitute the first direct evidence of a positive role for the lymphoid-specific octamer-binding factor in dra gene transcription .
positive and negative regulation of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor promoter activity by aml1-related transcription factor , pebp2 .
the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) gene promoter contain a consensus sequence for the polyomavirus enhancer binding-protein 2 ( pebp2 ) transcription factor , which consist of alpha and beta subunit .
there be at least two gene , alpha a and alpha b , encode the alpha subunit .
alpha b be the mouse homologue of human aml1 gene detect at the breakpoints of t ( 8 ; 21 ) and t ( 3 ; 21 ) myeloid leukemia .
we examine alpha a1 ( an alpha a -gene product ) and alpha b1 and alpha b2 ( two alpha b -encoded isomer ) for their effect on the gm-csf promoter .
pebp2 alpha a1 , alpha b1 , and alpha b2 protein bind the pebp2 site within the mouse gm-csf promoter .
pebp2 alpha a1 and alpha b1 enhance the expression of the gm-csf promoter-driven reporter plasmid in unstimulated and 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate/phytohemagglutinin-stimulated human jurkat t cell .
in contrast , the promoter activity be suppress by alpha b2 .
coexpression of alpha b1 and alpha b2 show that the promoter activity could be determine by the alpha b1 /alpha b2 ratio .
jurkat cell extract contain pebp2 site-binding protein ( s ) that cross-reacted with antimouse alpha a1 antibody .
northern blot analysis indicate the expression of human pebp2 alpha a , alpha b ( aml1 ) , and beta gene in jurkat cell .
although further study be require to determine the precise role of pebp2 in the gm-csf promoter activity , the present finding suggest the importance of the relative ratio of different pebp2 isoforms in regulate the level of the promoter activity .
attenuation of gamma interferon -induced tyrosine phosphorylation in mononuclear phagocyte infect with leishmania donovani : selective inhibition of signaling through janus kinase and stat1 .
the induction of gene transcription in response to gamma interferon be impaired in mononuclear phagocyte infect with leishmania donovani , and the mechanism involve be not fully understand .
the change in gene expression bring about by gamma interferon be think to involve transient increase in the activity of cellular protein tyrosine kinase , include the janus kinase jak1 and jak2 , lead to tyrosine phosphorylation of the transcription factor stat1 .
to investigate the mechanism account for the impaired response to gamma interferon , a model system for examine overall change in protein tyrosine phosphorylation , activation of jak1 and jak2 and phosphorylation of stat1 be develop in phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate -differentiated u-937 cell .
analysis of whole-cell lysates by antiphosphotyrosine immunoblotting show that incubation with gamma interferon bring about specific increase in phosphotyrosine labeling of several protein .
increase labeling of these protein occur to similar extent in control cell and in cell that have be infect with l. donovani for 16 h .
jak1 , jak2 , and stat1 be immunoprecipitated from control and interferon-treated cell , and tyrosine phosphorylation of these protein , detect by antiphosphotyrosine immunoblotting be use to measure their activation .
tyrosine phosphorylation of jak1 , jak2 , and stat1 increase markedly , in a dose-dependent manner , in u-937 cell incubate with gamma interferon .
in contrast , in cell infect with l. donovani , tyrosine phosphorylation of jak1 , jak2 , and stat1 be markedly impaired .
this effect be dependent upon the duration of exposure to l. donovani and be maximal and complete at 16 h .
result similar to those observe with u-937 cell be also obtain with human peripheral blood monocyte .
these finding indicate that infection of human mononuclear phagocyte with l. donovani lead to impaired gamma interferon -mediated tyrosine phosphorylation and selective effect on the jak- stat1 pathway .
unresponsiveness to gamma interferon for activation of this pathway may explain impaired transcriptional response in leishmania-infected cell .
heterodimerization and transcriptional activation in vitro by nf-kappa b protein .
the nf-kappa b family of transcription protein represent multiple dna binding , rel related polypeptide that contribute to regulation of gene involve in immune responsiveness and inflammation , as well a activation of the hiv long terminal repeat .
in this study multiple nf-kappa b related polypeptide range from 85 to 45 kda be examine for their capacity to interact with the prdii regulatory element of interferon beta and be show to possess distinct intrinsic dna binding affinity for this nf-kappa b site and form multiple dna binding homo- and hetero dimer complex in co-renaturation experiment .
furthermore , use dna template contain two copy of the prdii domain link to the rabbit beta globin gene , the purify polypeptide specifically stimulate nf-kappa b dependent transcription in an in vitro reconstitution assay a heterodimers but not a p50 homodimers .
these experiment emphasize the role of nf-kappa b dimerization a a distinct level of transcriptional control that may permit functional diversification of a limited number of regulatory protein .
activation of the nf-kappab transcription factor in a t-lymphocytic cell line by hypochlorous acid .
reactive oxygen specie ( ro ) such a hydrogen peroxide serve a second messenger in the induction of the transcription factor nf-kappab , and hence in the activation and replication of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) in human cell .
during inflammatory reaction , many oxidative specie be produce , one of which be hypochlorous acid ( hocl ) , which be responsible for the microbicidal effect of activate human polymorphonuclear leukocyte .
treatment of a t-lymphocytic cell line with micromolar concentration of hocl promote the appearance of transcription factor nf-kappab ( the heterodimer p50/p65 ) in the nucleus of the cell , even in the absence of de novo protein synthesis .
western blot analysis of the nf-kappab inhibitory subunit ( ikappab ) demonstrate that both ikappab -alpha proteolysis and p105 processing be induce by the treatment .
nf-kappab activation be very effective when cell be subject to hyperthermia before be treat with hocl .
various antioxidant , such a pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , p-bromophenacyl-bromide and nordihydroguaiaretic acid could strongly reduce nf-kappab translocation , demonstrate the importance of oxidative specie in the transduction mechanism .
moreover , ach-2 cell treat with hocl or h2o2 release tumour necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) in the supernatant .
the importance of tnf-alpha release in nf-kappab induction by hocl or h2o2 be demonstrate by the fact that : ( 1 ) the nuclear appearance of nf-kappab be promote in untreated cell ; and ( 2 ) synergism between tnf-alpha and hocl be detect .
collectively , these result suggest that hocl should be consider a an oxidative specie capable of induce nf-kappab in a t-lymphocytic cell line through a transduction mechanism involve ro , and have a long-distance effect through subsequent tnf-alpha release .
the pax-5 gene be alternatively splice during b-cell development .
the transcription factor pax-5 be express during the early stage of b-cell differentiation and influence the expression of several b-cell-specific gene .
in addition to the exist isoform ( pax-5 , which we have name pax-5a ) , we have isolate three new isoforms , pax-5b , pax-5d , and pax-5e , from murine spleen and b-lymphoid cell line use library screening and polymerase chain reaction amplification .
isoforms pax-5b and pax-5e have splice out their second exon , result in protein with only a partial dna-binding domain .
isoforms pax-5d and pax-5e have delete the 3'-region , which encode the transactivating domain , and replace it with a novel sequence .
the existence of alternative pax-5 transcript be confirm use rnase protection assay .
furthermore , pax-5a and pax-5b protein be detect use western blot analysis .
pax-5a be detectable in pro- , pre- , and mature b-cell line , but not in two plasmacytoma ; pax-5b be show to be present at low level in mature b-cell line and , unexpectedly , in one plasma cell line , but not in pro-b-cell or t-cell line .
mobility shift assay show that in vitro translate pax-5a and pax-5d , but not pax-5b or pax-5e , could interact with a b-cell-specific activator protein-binding site on the blk promoter .
use this assay , we also show that pax-5d be present in nuclear extract of some ( but not all ) b-lymphoid line and interact with the b-cell-specific activator protein-binding site .
the pattern of differential expression of alternatively splice pax-5 isoforms suggest that they may be important regulator of transcription during b-cell maturation .
regulation of nf-kappa b , ap-1 , nfat , and stat1 nuclear import in t lymphocyte by noninvasive delivery of peptide carry the nuclear localization sequence of nf-kappa b p50 .
activation of t lymphocyte by ag or cytokine result in translocation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b , ap-1 , nfat , and stat from the cytoplasm into the nucleus .
the first step in the nuclear import process be recognition of a nuclear localization sequence ( nls ) within the karyophilic protein by a cytoplasmic receptor such a the importin ( karyopherin ) -alpha subunit .
the nlss of nf-kappa b , ap-1 , and nfat differ and the nls of stat1 have not yet be identify .
herein we demonstrate that the inducible nuclear import of nf-kappa b , ap-1 , nfat , and stat1 in jurkat t lymphocyte be significantly inhibit by a cell-permeable peptide carry the nls of the nf-kappa b p50 subunit .
nls peptide-mediated disruption of the nuclear import of these transcription factor result in inhibition of i kappa b alpha and il-2 gene expression , process dependent on nf-kappa b or the combination of nf-kappa b , ap-1 , and nfat .
far , we show that inhibitory nls peptide interact in vitro with a cytoplasmic nls receptor complex comprise of the rch1/importin ( karyopherin ) -beta heterodimer express in jurkat t cell .
take together , these data indicate that the inducible nuclear import of nf-kappa b , ap-1 , nfat , and stat1 in jurkat t cell can be regulate by nls peptide deliver noninvasively to the cytoplasm of jurkat t cell to target member of the importin ( karyopherin ) -alpha beta nls receptor complex .
sequence-specific dna binding of the b-cell-specific coactivator oca-b .
b-cell-specific transcription of immunoglobulin gene be mediate by the interaction of a pou domain contain transcription factor oct-1 or oct-2 , with the b-cell-specific coactivator oca-b ( bob-1 , obf-1 ) and a prototype octamer element .
we find that oca-b bind dna directly in the major groove between the two subdomains of the pou domain , require both an a at the fifth position of the octamer element and contact with the pou domain .
an amino-terminal fragment of oca-b bind the octamer site in the absence of a pou domain with the same sequence specificity .
coactivator oca-b may undergo a pou-dependent conformational change that expose it amino terminus , allow it to recognize specific dna sequence in the major groove within the bind site for oct-1 or oct-2 .
the recognition of both the pou domain and the octamer sequence by oca-b provide a mechanism for differential regulation of octamer site contain gene by the ubiquitous factor oct-1 .
functional block for 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 -mediated gene regulation in human b lymphocyte .
element necessary for the steroid hormone 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 ) to induce a biological response include the presence of specific intracellular receptor ( vitamin d3 receptor ( vdr ) ) and modulation of gene expression via hormone-activated receptor bind to regulatory region of target gene .
these parameter be examine in normal and epstein-barr virus-immortalized human b cell and compare with 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 -responsive cell of the t and monocytic lineage .
although rest tonsillar b cell do not express vdr mrna , activation of these cell with interleukin-4 induce vdr in the absence of exogenously supplement 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 .
a indicator of hormone-mediated gene regulation we analyze modulation of cd23 , a common b cell/monocyte surface antigen , and 24-hydroxylase .
1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 inhibit cd23 expression in u937 cell , yet fail to modulate cd23 expression in b cell .
furthermore , 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 induce 24-hydroxylase mrna expression and metabolic activity in both u937 cell and lectin-activated t cell , yet fail to induce 24-hydroxylase mrna or it metabolic activity in b cell .
these finding suggest that although human b lymphocyte can express vdr mrna and protein , they exhibit a functional block for vitamin d -dependent gene regulation .
regulation of gene expression at early stage of b-cell and t-cell differentiation .
the expression of distinct set of gene at different stage of b-lymphocyte and t-lymphocyte differentiation be control at the level of transcription .
a number of recent study have describe interaction between transcription factor in lymphocyte that provide new insight into mechanism regulate gene expression .
these mechanism include the assembly of high order nucleoprotein complex and other protein-protein interaction that enhance the functional specificity of transcriptional regulator in lymphocyte .
human t cell activation through the activation-inducer molecule/cd69 enhance the activity of transcription factor ap-1 .
the induction of the ap-1 transcription factor have be ascribe to the early event lead to t cell differentiation and activation .
we have study the regulation of ap-1 activity in human peripheral blood t lymphocyte stimulate through the activation inducer molecule ( aim ) / cd69 activation pathway .
phorbol ester be require to induce aim/cd69 cell-surface expression as well a for trigger the proliferation of t cell in conjunction with anti-aim mab .
mobility shift assay show that addition of anti-aim mab to pma -treated t lymphocyte markedly enhance the binding activity of ap-1 to it cognate sequence , the phorbol ester response element .
in contrast , anti-aim mab do not induce any change in the binding activity of nf-kappa b , a transcription factor whose activity be also regulate by protein kinase c .
the increase in ap-1 -binding activity be accompany by the marked stimulation of the transcription of c-fos but not that of c-jun .
blockade of the dna-binding complex with an anti-fos mab demonstrate a direct participation of c-fos in the ap-1 complex induce by anti-aim mab .
most of the ap-1 activity could be eliminate when the anti-aim mab be add to the culture medium in the presence of cycloheximide , suggest that de novo protein synthesis be crucial for the induction of ap-1 -binding activity .
these data provide the evidence that activation of human peripheral blood t cell through the aim activation pathway regulate the activity of ap-1 .
therefore , this pathway appear a a crucial step in the initiation of early t cell activation event .
an ap1 binding site upstream of the kappa immunoglobulin intron enhancer bind inducible factor and contribute to expression .
expression of the kappa immunoglobulin light chain gene require developmental- and tissue-specific regulation by trans-acting factor which interact with two distinct enhancer element .
a new protein-dna interaction have be identify upstream of the intron enhancer , within the matrix-associated region of the j-c intron .
the binding activity be greatly inducible in pre-b cell by bacterial lipopolysaccharide and interleukin-1 but specific complex be find at all stage of b cell development test .
the footprinted bind site be homologous to the consensus ap1 motif .
the protein component of this complex be specifically compete by an ap1 consensus motif and be show by supershift to include c-jun and c-fos , suggest that this bind site be an ap1 motif and that the jun and fo family of transcription factor play a role in the regulation of the kappa light chain gene .
mutation of the ap1 motif in the context of the intron enhancer be show to decrease enhancer-mediated activation of the promoter in both pre-b cell induce with lp and constitutive expression in mature b cell .
association between expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 and integration of human t-cell-leukemia virus type 1 in adult t-cell leukemia cell .
it be know that the expression level of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) in adult t cell leukemia ( atl ) cell be high , whereas those in t-lymphoid cell be not .
in order to investigate the factor that influence the induction of icam-1 molecule , northern blot analysis to measure the expression level of icam-1 mrna and southern blot hybridization to analyze the integration of human t-cell-leukemia virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) provirus be do .
the level of icam-1 mrna expression of atl cell be generally high than those of t-lymphoid cell .
however , ilt-mat cell and atl16t(-) cell , although they be atl cell , show rather low surface icam-1 expression and icam-1 mrna expression .
southern blot hybridization show that only two and four band be find in ilt-mat and atl16t(-) cell , respectively , whereas > 10 band be detect in other atl cell .
these result suggest that monoclonal integration of htlv-1 provirus to the genome of t cell , especially the number of integration site , be one of the factor for induction of icam-1 molecule .
interleukin 12 induce tyrosine phosphorylation and activation of stat4 in human lymphocyte .
interleukin 12 ( il-12 ) be an important immunoregulatory cytokine whose receptor be a member of the hematopoietin receptor superfamily .
we have recently demonstrate that stimulation of human t and natural killer cell with il-12 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of the janus family tyrosine kinase jak2 and tyk2 , implicate these kinase in the immediate biochemical response to il-12 .
recently , transcription factor know a stats ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) have be show to be tyrosine phosphorylated and activate in response to a number of cytokine that bind hematopoietin receptor and activate jak kinase .
in this report we demonstrate that il-12 induce tyrosine phosphorylation of a recently identify stat family member , stat4 , and show that stat4 expression be regulate by t-cell activation .
furthermore , we show that il-12 stimulate formation of a dna-binding complex that recognize a dna sequence previously show to bind stat protein and that this complex contain stat4 .
these data , and the recent demonstration of jak phosphorylation by il-12 , identify a rapid signal-transduction pathway likely to mediate il-12 -induced gene expression .
role for the epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 in viral promoter switch during initial stage of infection .
during latent epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) infection of human b lymphocyte , six viral nuclear antigen ( ebnas ) be express from long primary transcript by mean of alternative splicing and alternative polyadenylylation site .
these transcript initiate from one of two promoter , cp or wp , that function in a mutually exclusive fashion .
wp be exclusively utilize during the initial stage of infection of primary b lymphocyte , follow by a switch to cp usage .
these study have be extend to show that ( i ) a mutant ebv strain lack the gene encode ebna 2 fail to switch from wp to cp usage in primary b lymphocyte , although the virus contain a functional cp ; ( ii ) a region from -429 to -245 base pair upstream of cp be essential for cp activity in b lymphocyte , but only in the context of upstream and downstream sequence ; ( iii ) this region contain an ebna 2 -dependent enhancer ; and ( iv ) dnase i protection employ nuclear extract from b and t lymphocyte reveal a b-cell-specific footprint in the region of the ebna 2 -dependent enhancer .
these result support a model for viral promoter switching during the initial stage of infection in which wp activity lead to the expression of ebna 2 , follow by activation of cp through the ebna 2 -dependent enhancer .
inhibition of hiv-1 replication by combination of a novel inhibitor of tnf-alpha with azt .
the small molecule s9a be derive from an established tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) inhibitor ( canventol ) by replacement of the isopropylidine group with a phenyl ring .
s9a at 10 to 100 nm inhibit hiv production as potently a 3'-azido-3'-deoxythymidine ( azt ) , an inhibitor of viral reverse transcriptase .
furthermore , s9a and azt in combination , at noncytoxic concentration strongly inhibit hiv-1 replication that be more than additive and substantially prolong the appearance of virus both in acutely infected cd4+ lymphocyte ( supt ) in culture and in peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmcs ) infect with a primary hiv-1 isolate .
s9a inhibit tnf-alpha promoter-driven reporter gene activity .
it be propose that the mechanism of antiviral action of s9a be on the host cell , by block tnf-alpha transcription via a tat -induced tar-independent loop , which decrease downstream nf-kappab activation of hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
s9a be superior to the first generation compound canventol , which be superior to the natural compound sarcophytol a , demonstrate that further structure-based enhancement of potency of these compound be feasible .
this study suggest a therapeutic approach against aid by application of two drug , one against a cellular and the other a viral target , which may provide an approach to the problem of frequent emergence of resistant variant to combination of drug that target only hiv gene .
structure function analysis of vitamin d analog with c-ring modification .
analog of 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 1 alpha,25-(oh) 2d3 ) with substitution on c-11 be synthesize .
small apolar substitution ( 11 alpha-methyl , 11 alpha-fluoromethyl ) do not markedly decrease the affinity for the vitamin d receptor , but large ( 11 alpha-chloromethyl or 11 alpha- or 11 beta-phenyl ) or more polar substitution ( 11 alpha-hydroxymethyl , 11 alpha-(2-hydroxyethyl ] decrease the affinity to less than 5 % of that of 1 alpha,25-oh)2d3 .
their affinity for the vitamin d -binding protein , however , increase up to 4-fold .
the biological activity of 11 alpha-methyl-1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 closely resemble that of the natural hormone on normal and leukemic cell proliferation and bone resorption , whereas it in vivo effect on calcium metabolism of the rachitic chick be about 50 % of that of 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 .
the 11 beta-methyl analog have a great than 10-fold low activity .
the differentiating effect of the other c-11 analog on human promyeloid leukemia cell ( hl-60 ) agree well with their bone-resorbing activity and receptor affinity , but they demonstrate low calcemic effect in vivo .
large or polar substitution on c-11 of 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 thus impair the binding of the vitamin d receptor but increase the affinity to vitamin d-binding protein .
the effect of many c-11-substituted 1 alpha,25-(oh)2d3 analog on hl-60 cell differentiation exceed their activity on calcium metabolism .
mineralocorticoid and mineralocorticoid receptor in mononuclear leukocyte in patient with pregnancy-induced hypertension .
to examine the role of mineralocorticoid in the pathophysiology of pregnancy-induced hypertension ( pih ) , we study plasma aldosterone and 18-hydroxycorticosterone level in 25 woman with pih and 25 normal pregnant woman , a control .
furthermore , we evaluate the mineralocorticoid receptor ( mr ) status in mononuclear leukocyte in the 2 group .
mr count be significantly ( p less than 0.0005 ) decrease in the pih group ( 148 +/- 9 bind sites/cell ) compare with the control group ( 300 +/- 17 bind sites/cell ; mean +/- sem ) .
plasma aldosterone in woman with pih be 281 +/- 61 pmol/l ; in normal pregnant woman it be 697 +/- 172 pmol/l ( p less than 0.025 ) .
plasma 18-hydroxycorticosterone be also significantly ( p less than 0.025 ) low ( pih , 1071 +/- 149 pmol/l ; control , 1907 +/- 318 pmol/l ) .
these value be determine at the onset of clinical symptom of pih .
these result can not be explain by receptor down-regulation due to high level of mineralocorticoid in pih ; a hitherto unknown mineralocorticoid may , thus , be responsible for the hypertension and altered mr status .
transcription-independent turnover of i kappa b alpha during monocyte adherence : implication for a translational component regulate i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna level .
we identify i kappa b alpha /mad-3 a an immediate-early gene in human monocyte that be express in response to a variety of signal , include adhesion , lipopolysaccharide , and phorbol myristate acetate .
within 5 min of monocyte adhesion , the level of the i kappa b alpha protein be markedly diminish but be rapidly replace in a cycloheximide-sensitive manner within 20 min .
accompany the rapid turnover of the i kappa b alpha protein be simultaneous translocation of nf-kappa b-related transcription factor to nucleus of adhered monocyte .
the demonstration that nf-kappa b can regulate i kappa b alpha /mad-3 gene transcription in other cell type suggest that the rapid increase in steady-state i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna level we observe within 30 min of monocyte adherence would result from nf-kappa b -dependent transcriptional stimulation of the i kappa b alpha /mad-3 gene .
nuclear run-on analysis indicate that , instead , while several immediate-early cytokine gene , such a the interleukin 1 beta ( il-1 beta ) gene , be transcriptionally activate during monocyte adhesion , the rate of i kappa b alpha /mad-3 gene transcription remain constant .
the adherence-dependent increase in i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna level be also not a consequence of mrna stabilization event .
interestingly , while increase in both il-1 beta and i kappa b alpha/mad-3 mrna level be detect in nucleus of adherent monocyte , cytoplasmic level of il-1 beta mrna increase during adherence whereas those of i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna do not .
take together , our data suggest that two interactive mechanism regulate monocytic i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna level .
we propose that adherent monocyte regulate nuclear processing ( or decay ) of i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna , thereby increase mrna level without stimulate i kappa b alpha /mad-3 gene transcription .
moreover , since inhibition of protein synthesis lead to accumulation of i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna without stimulate i kappa b alpha /mad-3 gene transcription , we suggest that low cytoplasmic level of i kappa b alpha /mad-3 mrna be maintain by a translation-dependent degradation mechanism .
differential activation of functionally distinct stat5 protein by il-5 and gm-csf during eosinophil and neutrophil differentiation from human cd34+ hematopoietic stem cell .
interleukin-5 ( il-5 ) and granulocyte macrophage-colony stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) be important cytokine for the proliferation , differentiation , and activation of myeloid lineage .
the jak /stat pathway be one of the signaling pathway implicate in mediate biological response induce by these cytokine .
previous study have demonstrate that these cytokine predominantly activate an 80 kda stat5 isoform in mature granulocyte .
to well understand the role of stat protein during growth and differentiation of granulocyte , we evaluate differentiation of human cd34+ hematopoietic stem cell ex vivo toward eosinophil and neutrophil .
bandshift experiment show that in an early stage of both differentiation pathway ( 14 day ) , the 94 kda stat5b protein be activate by both il-5 ( eosinophil lineage ) and gm-csf ( neutrophil lineage ) .
however , during maturation of both lineage ( day 21 and 28 ) , increase expression of a functionally distinct 80 kda stat5 isoform be observe , result in heterodimer dna-binding complex contain both the 94 and 80 kda stat5 protein .
the finding that functionally distinct isoforms of stat5 be activate during the early and late differentiation stage of granulocyte suggest that they might be involve in regulate different biological function in these cell .
the impaired transcription factor ap-1 dna binding activity in lymphocyte derive from subject with some symptom of premature aging .
the study of human disorder know a premature aging syndrome may provide insight into the mechanism of cellular senescence .
the main feature of cellular senescence in vitro be cessation of cell proliferation .
down syndrome ( d ) and neuronal ceroid-lypofuscinosis ( ncl ) be clinically characterize by the premature onset of numerous feature normally associate with human aging .
phytohemagglutinin stimulated lymphocyte derive from d subject show a statistically significant diminish proliferation capacity in comparison with lymphocyte derive from ncl and healthy individual .
we demonstrate , by apply the electrophoretic mobility shift assay , slightly impaired ap-1 dna binding activity in ncl lymphocyte and strong in d one .
our result show that the same molecular mechanism of proliferation cessation could exist in fibroblast characterize by replicative senescence and in lymphocyte derive from individual with premature aging syndrome ( down
regulation of the interleukin-1 beta ( il-1 beta ) gene by mycobacterial component and lipopolysaccharide be mediate by two nuclear factor-il6 motif .
the cytokine interleukin-1 beta ( il-1 beta ) and tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) be release by mononuclear phagocyte in vitro after stimulation with mycobacteria and be consider to mediate pathophysiologic event , include granuloma formation and systemic symptom .
we demonstrate that the mycobacterium tuberculosis cell wall component lipoarabinomannan ( lam ) be a very potent inducer of il-1 beta gene expression in human monocyte and investigate the mechanism of this effect .
we localize the lam - , lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) - , and tnf-alpha -inducible promoter activity to a -131/+15 ( position -131 to +15 ) dna fragment of the il-1 beta gene by deletion analysis and chloramphenicol acetyltransferase assay .
within this dna fragment , there be two novel 9-bp motif ( -90/-82 and -40/-32 ) with high homology to the nuclear factor-il6 ( nf-il6 ) binding site .
site-directed mutagenesis demonstrate that the two nf-il-6 motif could be independently activate by lam , lp , or tnf-alpha and that they act in an orientation-independent manner .
dna mobility shift assay reveal specific binding of nuclear protein ( s ) from lam- , lps- , or tnf-alpha- stimulated thp-1 cell to the nf-il6 motif .
we conclude that the two nf-il6 site mediate induction of il-1 beta in response to the stimulus lam , lp , and tnf-alpha .
cytokine modulation of hiv expression .
cytokine , the peptide hormone which control the homeostasis of the immune system and also play a fundamental role in inflammatory and immune mediated reaction , have be involve at multiple level in the pathogenesis of the acquire immune deficiency syndrome ( aid ) .
infection with the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) have be show to induce production of several cytokine both in vitro and in vivo .
conversely , several cytokine modulate the level of hiv expression in infected cell of both t lymphocytic and mononuclear phagocytic lineage .
activate mononuclear cell , particularly b cell which be in a state of chronic activation in hiv infected individual , release hiv -inductive cytokine and thus play a potentially important role in the pathogenesis of hiv infection .
analysis of the ligand-binding domain of human retinoic acid receptor alpha by site-directed mutagenesis .
three subtypes of retinoic acid receptor ( rar ) , term rar alpha , rar beta , and rar gamma , have be describe .
they be compose of different structural domain , include distinct domain for dna and ligand binding .
rars specifically bind all-trans-retinoic acid ( ra ) , 9-cis-ra , and retinoid analog .
in this study , we examine the functional role of cysteine and arginine residue in the ligand-binding domain of hrar alpha ( hrar alpha-lbd , amino acid 154 to 462 ) .
all conserve cysteine and arginine residue in this domain be mutate by site-directed mutagenesis , and the mutant protein be characterize by block reaction , ligand-binding experiment , transactivation assay , and protease mapping .
change of any cysteine residue of the hrar alpha-lbd have no significant influence on the binding of all-trans ra or 9-cis ra .
interestingly , residue c-235 be specifically important in antagonist binding .
with respect to arginine residue , only the two single mutation of r-276 and r-394 to alanine show a dramatic decrease of agonist and antagonist binding whereas the r272a mutation show only a slight effect .
for all other arginine mutation , no difference in affinity be detectable .
the two mutation r217a and r294a cause an increase binding efficiency for antagonist but no change in agonist binding .
from these result , we can conclude that electrostatic interaction of retinoids with the rar alpha -lbd play a significant role in ligand binding .
in addition , antagonist show distinctly different requirement for efficient binding , which may contribute to their interference in the ligand-inducible transactivation function of rar alpha .
inhibition of t lymphocyte activation by camp be associate with down-regulation of two parallel mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway , the extracellular signal-related kinase and c-jun n-terminal kinase .
the induction of t cell proliferation require signal from the tcr and a co-receptor molecule , such a cd28 , that activate parallel and partially cross-reactive signaling pathway .
these pathway be disrupt by agonist that utilize adenylate cyclase and camp -dependent protein kinase a ( pka ) .
we find that the adenylate cyclase activator , forskolin , inhibit anti-cd3 -induced shift in lck electrophoretic mobility , suggest an intervention at the tcr -coupled phosphoinositide turnover that precede the activation of pkc .
the shift of lck follow direct pkc activation by 12-o-tetradecanoyl phorbol 13-acetate , which bypass early receptor-triggered biochemical event , be insensitive to forskolin .
nevertheless , forskolin also inhibit pkc downstream event , such a c-jun expression , which be critical for the activation process of t cell .
to far analyze potential cross point between positively and negatively regulate signaling pathway in t cell , we test the effect of activator of the adenylate cyclase or pka on two parallel mitogen-activated protein kinase signaling pathway mediate by extracellular signal-regulated kinase ( erk ) and c-jun n-terminal kinase .
use a pkc -specific inhibitor , gf109203x , or pkc -depleted t cell , we find that a large part of the anti-cd3 -induced erk activation be pkc dependent .
both pkc- dependent and -independent activation of erk be sensitive to inhibition by forskolin or a cell-permeable camp analogue , dbcamp .
furthermore , the effect of 12-o-tetradecanoyl phorbol 13-acetate and ionomycin , which synergized to fully activate c-jun n-terminal kinase , be also sensitive to inhibition by forskolin .
our result suggest that pka inhibit t cell activation by interfere with multiple event along the two signaling pathway operate downstream of the tcr and the cd28 co-receptor molecule .
a human putative lymphocyte g0/g1 switch gene contain a cpg-rich island encode a small basic protein with the potential to be phosphorylated .
gene actively involve in the g0/g1 switch ( g0s gene ) may be differentially express during the lectin -induced switch of lymphocyte from the g0 to the g1 phase of the cell cycle .
this paper present study of g0s2 , a member of a set of putative g0s gene , for which cdna be clone and select on the basis of differential cdna hybridization .
g0s2 mrna increase transiently within 1-2 hr of the addition of lectin or cycloheximide to culture blood mononuclear cell .
comparison of a nearly full-length cdna sequence with the corresponding genomic sequence reveal one small intron and an open reading frame in the second exon .
the derive 103-amino-acid basic protein have two potential alpha-helical domain separate by a hydrophobic region with the potential to generate turn and assume a beta-sheet conformation .
consistent with involvement in the g0/g1 switch , the protein contain potential site for phosphorylation by protein kinase c and casein kinase ii .
the gene contain a cpg-rich island suggest expression in the germ line .
an upstream segment contain tandem dinucleotide repeat (ct)19/(ca)16 .
there be a suitably located tata box , but potential site for ccaat-box binding factor be far upstream , embedded in a 42-nucleotide repeat element .
potential site for transcription factor ap1 , ap2 , and ap3 be consistent with rapid transcriptional activation in response to induce agent .
granulosa cell tumor of the ovary .
immunohistochemical evidence of low proliferative activity and virtual absence of mutation of the p53 tumor-suppressor gene .
background and method : because the use of immunohistochemistry in the diagnosis of granulosa cell tumor ( gct ) have not be fully explore , routinely process ( formalin-fixed , paraffin-embedded ) tissue from 11 gct , adult type , be investigate immunohistochemically ( abc method ) with a broad spectrum of antibody against various marker , include p53 and ki-67 .
all of the tumor exhibit typical morphology , be limit to the ovary ( stage i ) , and 7 case follow a benign clinical course .
result : all the tumor exhibit strong expression of vimentin , but most other antigen ( include smooth muscle actin ) be express infrequently by a minority of tumor cell or not at all .
tumor cell in 9 gct express inhibin a .
all the tumor exhibit very low proliferative activity , few than 10 % of the tumor cell nucleus be stain by the antibody mib-1 ( ki-67 antigen ) .
the antibody d07 reveal marked overexpression of p53 protein in only one tumor .
clinical outcome be not find to be related to immunophenotypic difference .
conclusion : the diagnosis of gct should be base primarily on the typical morphology reveal by conventional stain , but additional immunohistochemical staining with a small panel of select antibody ( for example , against keratin , vimentin , and inhibin a ) may be helpful in a few case .
the very low proliferative activity and the lack of overexpression of p53 protein be consistent with the benign clinical behavior of the majority of gct .
p105 and p98 precursor protein play an active role in nf-kappa b -mediated signal transduction .
the rel/ nf-kappa b family of transcription factor be compose of two distinct subgroup , protein that undergo proteolytic processing and contain swi6/ankyrin repeat in their carboxyl terminus ( p105 , p98 ) , and those without such repeat that do not require processing ( p65 , c-rel , relb , and dorsal ) .
we demonstrate that the p105 and p98 precursor share functional property with the i kappa b protein , which also contain swi6/ankyrin repeat .
both p105 and p98 be find to form stable complex with other rel/ nf-kappa b family member , include p65 and c-rel .
association with the precursor be sufficient for cytoplasmic retention of either p65 or c-rel , both of which be otherwise nuclear .
these complex undergo stimulus-responsive processing to produce active p50/ c-rel and p55/ c-rel complex .
these observation suggest a second pathway lead to nf-kappa b induction , in which processing of the precursor rather than phosphorylation of i kappa b play a major role .
differential induction of dna-binding activity follow cd19 cross-linking in human b lineage cell .
the b cell-specific cell surface molecule cd19 be express at all stage of b cell development , include normal plasma cell , and mediate signal transduction via interaction with cytoplasmic effector protein .
cross-link cd19 on early human b lineage cell induce the formation of a cd19 /vav/phosphatidylinositol-3 kinase complex , tyrosine phosphorylation of cd19 and vav , and activation of the ra pathway .
to far explore the ramification of cd19 signaling , the current study examine whether phosphorylation of elk-1 , activation of activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) , or activation of nuclear factor-kappab ( nf-kappab ) transcription factor occur follow cd19 cross-linking .
the cell use be the blin-1 pre-b cell line express low level of cell surface mu heavy chain associate with surrogate light chain and the 1e8 immature b cell line express cell surface mu/kappa .
lysates from cd19 cross-linked 1e8 cell induce robust phosphorylation of an elk-1 fusion protein in vitro , whereas no phosphorylation of elk-1 fusion protein occur use lysates from cd19 cross-linked blin-1 cell .
an electrophoretic mobility shift assay employ ap-1 and nf-kappab consensus oligonucleotides be use to demonstrate that ap-1 _-binding activity increase , while constitutive nf-kappab -binding activity be not enhance , follow 2 h of cd19 cross-linking in 1e8 cell . supershift experiment reveal that jund and c-fos protein mediate anti- cd19 induced ap-1 -binding activity in 1e8 cell .
in contrast , cd19 cross-linking in blin-1 cell result in the induction of nf-kappab , but have no apparent effect on ap-1 -binding activity .
these data suggest that cd19 -mediated signal transduction activate different transcription factor at juxtapose stage of b cell development that may culminate in the activation or suppression of distinct set of gene .
tyrosine kinase and camp -dependent protein kinase activity in cd40-activated human b lymphocyte .
in vitro , human b lymphocyte undergo long-term proliferation when activate through cd40 , a protein express on their cell surface .
the nature of cd40 -dependent signal in proliferate fresh human epstein-barr virus -negative b lymphocyte be currently unknown .
in this study , a cd40 -dependent b cell culture system be use to examine the role of different signal transduction element .
protein kinase c ( pkc ) depletion generate by a long-term phorbol 12 myristate 13-acetate treatment have weak effect on proliferation .
rather , tyrosine phosphorylation be show to be directly involve in mediate cd40 -dependent signal .
the use of the protein tyrosine kinase ( ptk ) -specific inhibitor herbimycin a dramatically decrease cellular proliferation without alter the activity of the human immunodeficiency virus-1 long terminal repeat ( hiv-1 ltr ) , a promoter largely dependent on the binding of nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-_kappa b ) .
in contrast , the camp -dependent protein kinase specific inhibitor h-89 totally inhibit hiv-1 ltr activity at a concentration as low a 100 nm without affect cellular proliferation .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) and supershift assay use an nf-kappa b binding sequence from the kappa light chain a a probe , reveal that both p65 ( rela ) and c-rel be present in cd40 -stimulated b cell .
while pkc depletion do not alter the nf-kappa b level , treatment of b lymphocyte with h-89 or herbimycin a provoke a decrease in the nf-kappa b level .
these observation establish the importance of different signal transducing pathway lead to cd40 activation of b lymphocyte .
paternal expression of wt1 in human fibroblast and lymphocyte .
the wilms ' tumor suppressor gene ( wt1 ) be previously identify a be imprint , with frequent maternal expression in human placenta and fetal brain .
we examine the allele-specific expression of wt1 in culture human fibroblast from 15 individual .
seven of 15 fibroblast line be heterozygous for polymorphic allele , and the expression pattern be variable , i.e. , equal , unequal or monoallelic paternal expression in three , two and two case , respectively .
exclusive paternal expression of wt1 be also show in non-cultured peripheral lymphocyte from the latter two individual .
the allele-specific expression profile of other imprinted gene , igf2 and h19 , on human chromosome 11 be constant and consistent with those in other tissue .
our unexpected observation of paternal or biallelic expression of wt1 in fibroblast and lymphocyte , together with the previous finding of maternal or biallelic expression in placenta and brain , suggest that the allele-specific regulatory system of wt1 be unique and may be control by a putative tissue- and individual-specific modifier .
detection of the chromosome 16 cbf beta-myh11 fusion transcript in myelomonocytic leukemia .
karyotypic detection of chromosomal 16 abnormality classically associate with aml m4eo can be difficult .
characterization of the two gene involve in the inv(16)(p13q22) , cbf beta and myh11 , have allow the detection of fusion transcript by reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) .
we have analyze cbf beta -myh11 fusion transcript by rt-pcr in myelomonocytic leukemia , with or without eosinophilia , to determine whether their presence correlate with morphology .
fifty-three case ( 11 aml m4eo ; 1 aml m4 with atypical abnormal eosinophil ( aml m4 " eo " ) ; 29 aml m4 ; 8 aml m5 ; 3 cmml ; and 1 aml m2 with eosinophilia ) be analyze .
all 11 typical aml m4eo be cbf beta -myh11 positive .
the single case of aml m4 with distinctive eosinophil abnormality be negative by karyotype , rt-pcr and fluorescent in situ hybridization ( fish ) .
three of 29 ( 10 % ) aml m4 without abnormal eosinophil be cbf beta -myh11 positive , 1 of which do not show any apparent chromosome 16 abnormality by classical metaphase analysis ( 2 not test ) .
both case test also show myh11 genomic rearrangement .
none of the other leukemia be rt-pcr positive .
follow-up of three patient show residual positivity in apparent complete remission .
these data show that cbf beta -myh11 fusion transcript occur not only in the vast majority of typical aml m4eo , but also in approximately 10 % of aml m4 without eosinophilic abnormality , a much high incidence than the sporadic report of chromosome 16 abnormality in aml m4 would suggest .
take together with the detection of cbf beta - myh11 transcript in the absence of apparent chromosome 16 abnormality by classical banding technique , these data show that additional screening by either rt-pcr or fish should be perform in all aml m4 , regardless of morphologic feature , to allow accurate evaluation of the prognostic importance of this fusion transcript .
the t-cell oncogenic protein hox11 activate aldh1 expression in nih 3t3 cell but repress it expression in mouse spleen development .
hox11 be a homeobox gene essential for spleen formation in mouse , since atrophy of the anlage of a develop spleen occur in early embryonic development in hox11 null mouse .
hox11 be also express in a subset of t-cell acute leukemia after specific chromosomal translocation .
since the protein have a homeodomain and can activate transcription , it probably exert at least some of it effect in vivo by regulation of target gene .
representational difference analysis have be use to isolate cdna clone correspond to mrna specie activate follow stable expression of hox11 in nih 3t3 cell .
the gene encode the retinoic acid-synthesizing enzyme aldehyde dehydrogenase 1 ( aldh1 ) , initially call hdg-1 , be find to be ectopically activate by hox11 in this system .
study of aldh1 gene expression during spleen development show that the presence of aldh1 mrna inversely correlate with hox11 .
hox11 null mouse embryo have elevated aldh1 mrna in spleen primordium prior to atrophy , while aldh1 seem to be repress by hox11 during organogenesis of the spleen of wild-type mouse .
this result suggest that expression of aldh1 protein be negatively regulate by hox11 and that abnormal expression of aldh1 in hox11 null mouse may cause loss of splenic precursor cell by aberrant retinoic acid metabolism
a pmlraralpha transgene initiate murine acute promyelocytic leukemia .
the malignant cell of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) contain a reciprocal chromosomal translocation that fuse the promyelocytic leukemia gene ( pml ) with the retinoic acid receptor alpha gene ( rar alpha ) .
to test the hypothesis that the chimera pmlrar alpha play a role in leukemogenesis , we express a pmlrar alpha cdna in myeloid cell of transgenic mouse .
pmlrar alpha transgenic mouse exhibit impaired neutrophil maturation early in life , which progress at a low frequency over the course of several month to overt apl .
both the preleukemic state and the leukemia could be transplant to nontransgenic mouse , and the transplant preleukemia could progress to apl .
the apl recapitulate feature of the human disease , include a response to retinoic acid .
retinoic acid cause the leukemic cell to differentiate in vitro and in vivo , elicit remission of both the preleukemic state and apl in mouse .
our result demonstrate that pmlrar alpha impair neutrophil differentiation and initiate the development of apl .
the transgenic mouse describe here provide an apparently accurate model for human apl that include clear evidence of tumor progression .
the model should be useful for explore the molecular pathogenesis of apl and the mechanism of the therapeutic response to retinoic acid , as well a for preclinical study of therapeutic regimen .
in vivo anergized cd4+ t cell express perturb ap-1 and nf-kappa b transcription factor .
anergy be a major mechanism to ensure antigen-specific tolerance in t lymphocyte in the adult .
in vivo , anergy have mainly be study at the cellular level .
in this study , we use the t-cell-activating superantigen staphylococcal enterotoxin a ( sea ) to investigate molecular mechanism of t-lymphocyte anergy in vivo .
injection of sea to adult mouse activate cd4+ t cell express certain t-cell receptor ( tcr ) variable region beta-chain family and induce strong and rapid production of interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) .
in contrast , repeated injection of sea cause cd4+ t-cell deletion and anergy in the remain cd4+ t cell , characterize by reduce expression of il-2 at mrna and protein level .
we analyze expression of ap-1 , nf-kappa b , nf-at , and octamer binding transcription factor , which be know to be involve in the regulation of il-2 gene promoter activity .
large amount of ap-1 and nf-kappa b and significant quantity of nf-at be induce in sea -activated cd4+ spleen t cell , whereas oct-1 and oct-2 dna binding activity be similar in both rest and activate t cell .
in contrast , anergic cd4+ t cell contain severely reduce level of ap-1 and fos/jun-containing nf-at complex but express significant amount of nf-kappa b and oct binding protein after sea stimulation .
resolution of the nf-kappa b complex demonstrate predominant expression of p50-p65 heterodimers in activate cd4+ t cell , while anergic cell mainly express the transcriptionally inactive p50 homodimer .
these alteration of transcription factor be likely to be responsible for repression of il-2 in anergic t cell .
pivotal role for the nfil3/e4bp4 transcription factor in interleukin 3 -mediated survival of pro-b lymphocyte .
the e2a-hlf ( hepatic leukemia factor ) oncoprotein , generate in pro-b lymphocyte by fusion of the trans-activation domain of e2a to the basic region/leucine zipper ( bzip ) domain of hlf , function a an anti-apoptotic transcription factor in leukemic cell transformation .
when introduce into interleukin 3 ( il-3 ) -dependent mouse pro-b lymphocyte , e2a-hlf prevent apoptosis induce by growth factor deprivation , suggest that il-3 mediate cell survival through activation of a transcription factor whose activity can be constitutively replace by the chimeric oncoprotein .
we consider four bzip transcription factor a candidate for this putative il-3 -regulated factor , each of which bind avidly to the dna consensus sequence recognize by e2a-hlf and be related to the caenorhabditis elegans ces-2 ( cell death specification protein ) neuron-specific mediator of cell death .
the expression and binding activity of the nfil3 protein ( also call e4bp4 ) , but not of hlf , dbp , or tef , be find to be regulate by il-3 in mouse pro-b cell line ( baf-3 and fl5.12 ) .
northern blot analysis show that nfil3/ e4bp4 be regulate a a " delayed-early " il-3 -responsive gene , require de novo protein synthesis .
in the absence of il-3 , enforced expression of the human nfil3/e4bp4 cdna promote the survival but not the growth of il-3 -dependent pro-b cell .
our result implicate nfil3/e4bp4 ( nuclear factor regulate by il-3 /adenovirus e4 promoter binding protein ) in a distinct growth factor-regulated signaling pathway that be responsible for the survival of early b-cell progenitor , and whose alteration by e2a-hlf lead to childhood b lineage leukemia .
cytokine rescue from glucocorticoid induced apoptosis in t cell be mediate through inhibition of ikappabalpha .
we previously report that dexamethasone ( dex ) , a synthetic glucocorticoid , cause apoptosis in mature th cell line , and that this induction of cell death be prevent by specific cytokine , namely , by il-2 in th1 cell and by il-4 in th2 cell .
we now show that this differential rescue by specific cytokine in th cell correlate with the level of ikappabalpha that be regulate by dex and cytokine .
in both cell type the cellular level of ikappabalpha mrna and protein be evaluate by dex treatment .
interestingly , the dex -mediated ikappabalpha induction be completely inhibit by il-2 , but not il-4 , in th1 cell , while the reverse profile be see in th2 cell .
in both cell type , the cytokine that inhibit the induction of ikappabalpha by dex , also rescue these cell from dex -induced apoptosis , although the rescue cytokine be different in th1 and th2 cell .
our result imply that t cell need to maintain a certain level of nf-kappab transcriptional activity in order to survive ; up- or down-regulation of nuclear nf kappab through modulation of ikappabalpha expression by cytokine or dex may lead to cell survival or cell death , respectively .
s-allyl cysteine inhibit activation of nuclear factor kappa b in human t cell .
reactive oxygen specie be involve in signal transduction pathway lead to nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation which have be implicate in the regulation of gene transcription .
we recently report that a garlic compound , s-allyl cysteine ( sac ) , protect bovine pulmonary artery endothelial cell from oxidant injury induce by hydrogen peroxide ( h2o2 ) .
in this study we determine the effect of sac on nf-kappa b activation in human t lymphocyte ( jurkat cell ) induce by tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-_alpha ) and h2o2 .
activate nf-kappa b in nuclear extract be measure by an electrophoretic mobility shift assay use 32p-labeled probe .
sac consistently exhibit a dose-dependent inhibition of nf-kappa b activation induce by both tnf-alpha and h2o2 .
supershift with specific antibody to nf-kappa b subunit confirm that the inducible retard band observe in the emsa and p65-p50 heterodimer of the nf-kappa b /rel protein .
our data suggest that sac may act via antioxidant mechanism to block nf-kappa b activation in jurkat cell .
transcriptional regulation of interleukin 3 ( il3 ) in primary human t lymphocyte .
role of ap-1- and octamer- binding protein in control of il3 gene expression .
we have investigate the molecular and biochemical basis for activation of interleukin 3 ( il3 ) gene expression in primary human t lymphocyte follow cd3 and cd2 receptor stimulation or activation by phytohemagglutinin plus phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate .
use transfection and reporter gene assay specifically design for primary t lymphocyte in conjunction with gel retardation assay , western blot analysis and uv cross-linking study , we find that c-jun , c-fos , and octamer-binding protein play a major role in transcriptional activation of the il3 gene via their interaction with two specific region contain within the il3 5'-flanking sequence .
additionally , the region between base -107 and -59 of the il3 promoter contain putative ap-2 and sp1 binding motif appear necessary for basal level expression of the il3 gene .
the data also indicate that cd2 receptor activation and phytohemagglutinin plus phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate stimulation augment t cell il3 gene expression through the same cis- and trans-activating signal .
these result should contribute to a good understanding of the regulation of il3 gene expression in human t lymphocyte .
hiv type 1 protease activation of nf-kappa b within t lymphoid cell .
nf-kappa b be a nuclear protein of the rel oncogene family capable of enhance transcription of several cellular gene , include il-2 and the il-2 receptor , and viral gene transcribe from the hiv-1 ltr .
it have be report that hiv-1 protease may cleave the nf-kappa b precursor to it active form in vitro .
in this study the effect of hiv protease on nf-kappa b precursor activation be examine in jurkat t cell by introduce a protease expression vector into the cell .
increase nf-kappa b activity be observe and this increase activity be block by a specific inhibitor of the viral protease .
viral transcription , a measure use ltr -cat assay , be only slightly enhance in the hiv-protease expressing cell , while secretion of il-2 and expression of the il-2 receptor be not affect .
the limited activation of nf-kappa b by hiv protease appear unlikely to have a significant effect on virus expression or t cell function .
heat shock induce hiv-1 replication in chronically infected promyelocyte cell line om10.1 .
a long period of clinical latency before development of symptom be characteristic of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection .
om10.1 , a promyelocyte cell line latently infect with hiv-1 , have be develop a a model for study the mechanism of viral latency and the activation of virus expression .
we find that this latently infected cell line with heat shock at 42 degree c for 2 h result in a high level of hiv-1 production without addition of any cytokine .
the mechanism of activation be analyze by use anti-tnf-alpha antibody and various inhibitor .
although the tnf-alpha level in culture supernatant be below the sensitivity of an elisa assay system , addition of anti- tnf-alpha antibody in culture medium could partially suppress the heat shock induced hiv-1 production .
staurosporine ( pkc inhibitor ) , pentoxifylline ( nf-kappa b inhibitor ) , and ro5-3335 ( hiv-1 tat inhibitor ) also inhibit significantly the heat shock induced virus activation .
in particular , staurosporine achieve approximately 90 % inhibition of the hiv-1 antigen expression in heat shock -treated om10.1 at a non-toxic concentration .
although the mechanism of hiv-1 activation with heat shock have not be fully elucidate yet , it be presume pkc play an important role in hiv-1 activation .
thus , the present observation will provide a further insight into the pathogenesis of hiv-1 infection .
regulation of cell-type-specific interleukin-2 receptor alpha-chain gene expression : potential role of physical interaction between elf-1 , hmg-i(y) , and nf-kappa b family protein .
the interleukin 2 receptor alpha-chain ( il-2r alpha ) gene be rapidly and potently induce in t cell in response to mitogenic stimulus .
previously , an inducible enhancer between nucleotide -299 and -228 that contain nf-kappa b and carg motif be identify .
we now report the characterization of a second essential positive regulatory element located between nucleotide -137 and -64 that bind elf-1 and hmg-i(y) .
this element have maximal activity in lymphoid cell , parallel the cell type specificity of elf-1 expression .
transcription from the il-2r alpha promoter be inhibit when either the elf-1 or the hmg-i(y) binding site be mutate .
coexpression of both protein activate transcription of the -137 to -64 element in cos-7 cell .
elf-1 physically associate with hmg-i and with nf-kappa b p50 and c-rel in vitro , suggest that protein-protein interaction might functionally coordinate the action of the upstream and downstream positive regulatory element .
this be the first report of a physical interaction between an ets family member and nf-kappa b family protein .
these finding provide significant new insight into the protein-protein and protein-dna interaction that regulate cell-type-specific and inducible il-2r alpha gene expression and also have implication for other gene regulate by elf-1 and nf-kappa b family protein .
transcriptional regulation during myelopoiesis .
the coordinate production of all blood cell from a common stem cell be a highly regulate process involve successive stage of commitment and differentiation .
from analysis of mouse deficient in transcription factor gene and from the characterization of chromosome breakpoints in human leukemia , it have become evident that transcription factor be important regulator of hematopoiesis .
during myelopoiesis , which include the development of granulocytic and monocytic lineage , transcription factor from several family be active , include aml1/cbf beta , c/ebp , ets , c-myb , hox , and mzf-1 .
few of these factor be express exclusively in myeloid cell ; instead it appear that they cooperatively regulate transcription of myeloid-specific gene .
here we discuss recent advance in transcriptional regulation during myelopoiesis .
hematopoietic lineage commitment : role of transcription factor .
this review focus on the role of transcription factor in hematopoietic lineage commitment .
a brief introduction to lineage commitment and asymmetric cell division be follow by a discussion of several method use to identify transcription factor important in specify hematopoietic cell type .
next be present a discussion of the use of embryonic stem cell in the analysis of hematopoietic gene expression and the use of target gene disruption to analyze the role of transcription factor in hematopoiesis .
finally , the status of our current knowledge concern the role of transcription factor in the commitment to erythroid , myeloid and lymphoid cell type be summarize .
the interleukin-8 ap-1 and kappa b-like site be genetic end target of fk506-sensitive pathway accompany by calcium mobilization .
fk506 , an immunosuppressant , inhibit the production of several cytokine in t lymphocyte .
we observe that fk506 suppress the transcription of a chemotactic cytokine , interleukin-8 ( il-8 ) in a human t cell line , jurkat cell , activate by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) and calcium ( ca2+ ) ionophore ( ionomycin ) .
by deleted and mutate analysis of the il-8 promoter , the ap-1 and kappa b-like site be identify a the responsive element for pma and ionomycin .
fk506 suppress the transcription through the ap-1 or kappa b-like site induce by pma plus ca(2+)-mobilizing agent , but not those induce by ca(2+)-independent stimulus .
in gel retardation analysis , fk506 have little effect on the binding to the ap-1 site of pma / ionomycin -induced nuclear factor , which be recognize with anti-jund or c-fos antibody .
in contrast , fk506 or egta ( ca2+ chelator ) similarly affect the formation of kappa b-like site binding complex , which be not recognize by any antibody against the human rel family protein ( c-rel , p65 , p50 , and p49 ) .
furthermore , we confirm the previous report that fk506 suppress the pma / ionomycin -induced activation through authentic kappa b site of immunoglobulin ( ig ) gene , to which nf-kappa b binding be also decrease by fk506 , indicate that both il-8 kappa b-like site and ig kappa b site be fk506 -sensitive in spite of the difference of binding factor .
our result indicate that not only the report il-2 nf-at and nfil-2a site and ig kappa b site , but also the il-8 ap-1 and kappa b-like site be terminal of fk506 -sensitive pathway involve ca2+ mobilization .
detection of adenovirus dna in peripheral blood mononuclear cell by polymerase chain reaction assay .
adenovirus can establish persistent infection which may reactivate and cause disease in immunocompromised host .
lymphocyte have be postulate to serve a a site of adenoviral persistence base upon the ability to isolate adenovirus from tonsil and to detect adenovirus dna by southern blot hybridization in peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) .
to test this hypothesis , a more sensitive and specific polymerase chain reaction ( pcr ) assay be develop to detect adenovirus dna .
two set of nest primer be design to conserve sequence in the adenovirus e1a and hexon gene .
the e1a and hexon primer amplify dna from representative adenoviral serotypes in all six adenoviral group ( a-f ) .
both primer detect a single copy of the adenovirus type 2 genome but be less sensitive for the group b type 35 .
none of 33 pbmc specimen from healthy adult and only one of 40 pediatric sample be positive ( at a low level ) for adenovirus dna by nested pcr assay .
in comparison , pbmc from two child with fatal adenoviral infection be both strongly positive for adenovirus dna .
it be conclude that , in contrast to a previous study , pbmc be not a common site of persistent group c adenoviral infection .
in addition , assay of pbmc by the adenovirus -specific pcr may help detect early invasive disease and warrant further evaluation .
dna-binding study of the epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 ( ebna-2 ) : evidence for complex formation by latent membrane protein gene promoter-binding protein in ebna-2 -positive cell line .
the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) nuclear antigen 2 ( ebna-2 ) protein be essential for the immortalization of human primary b cell by ebv .
ebna-2 trans-activates cellular and viral gene like cd23 , c-fgr , latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) and terminal protein 1 ( tp1 ) .
trans-activation of the tp1 promoter and of the bamhi c promoter have already be investigate in detail and appear to be mediate via protein-protein interaction and not by direct binding of ebna-2 type a ( of ebv type 1 ) to the dna .
ebna-2 be able to trans-activate the expression of the lmp gene in several cell line .
various report have delineate the cis-acting element of the lmp promoter through which ebna-2 mediate trans-activation .
to determine whether ebna-2 also trans-activates the lmp promoter by protein-protein interaction , we perform a series of gel retardation assay and competition experiment with lmp promoter fragment of different size .
we determine that the protein-binding region on the lmp promoter be within a 42 bp fragment encompass nucleotide -135 to -176 relative to the lmp transcriptional start site .
none of the dna fragment investigate indicate interaction of ebna-2 with the dna via protein-protein interaction .
no significant difference between ebna-2 -positive and ebna-2 -negative nuclear extract could be see in the gel retardation assay under condition that clearly show binding of ebna-2a to the tp1 promoter .
however , analysis of sucrose gradient fraction in the gel retardation assay provide evidence that the lmp promoter -binding protein form a complex of high m(r) in ebna-2 -positive cell extract .
these complex be destroy by detergent .
we deduce from these result that ebna-2 -positive cell might indeed contain specific complex bind to the lmp promoter which be , however , too labile to be detect in a standard gel retardation assay .
thrombopoietin induce tyrosine phosphorylation of stat3 and stat5 in human blood platelet .
thrombopoietin be know to be essential for megakaryocytopoiesis and thrombopoiesis .
recently , we and others have show that thrombopoietin induce rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 and other protein in human platelet and baf3 cell , genetically engineer to express c-mpl , a receptor for thrombopoietin .
the jak family of tyrosine kinase be know to mediate some of the effect of cytokine or hematopoietic growth factor by recruitment and tyrosine phosphorylation of a variety of stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) protein .
hence , we have investigate whether stat protein be present in platelet and , if so , whether they become tyrosine phosphorylated in response to thrombopoietin .
we immunologically identify stat1 , stat2 , stat3 , and stat5 in human platelet lysates .
thrombopoietin induce tyrosine phosphorylation of stat3 and stat5 in these cell .
thrombopoietin also induce tyrosine phosphorylation of stat3 and stat5 in fdcp-2 cell genetically engineer to constitutively express human c-mpl .
thus , our data indicate that stat3 and stat5 may be involve in signal transduction after ligand binding to c-mpl and that this event may have a role in megakaryopoiesis/ thrombopoiesis or possibly a mature platelet function such a aggregation .
rapid ca2+-mediated activation of rap1 in human platelet .
rap1 be a small , ras-like gtpase whose function and regulation be still largely unknown .
we have develop a novel assay to monitor the active , gtp-bound form of rap1 base on the differential affinity of rap1gtp and rap1gdp for the rap binding domain of ralgds ( rbd ) .
stimulation of blood platelet with alpha-thrombin or other platelet activator cause a rapid and strong induction of rap1 that associate with rbd in vitro .
binding to rbd increase from undetectable level in rest platelet to > 50 % of total rap1 within 30 s after stimulation .
an increase in the intracellular ca2+ concentration be both necessary and sufficient for rap1 activation since it be induce by agent that increase intracellular ca2+ and inhibit by a ca2+ -chelating agent .
neither inhibition of translocation of rap1 to the cytoskeleton nor inhibition of platelet aggregation affect thrombin -induced activation of rap1 .
in contrast , prostaglandin i2 ( pgi2 ) , a strong negative regulator of platelet function , inhibit agonist-induced as well a ca2+ -induced activation of rap1 .
from our result , we conclude that rap1 activation in platelet be an important common event in early agonist-induced signalling , and that this activation be mediate by an increase intracellular ca2+ concentration
tap : a novel cellular protein that interact with tip of herpesvirus saimiri and induce lymphocyte aggregation .
tip of herpesvirus saimiri associate with lck and down-regulates lck -mediated activation .
we identify a novel cellular tip-associated protein ( tap ) by a yeast two-hybrid screen .
tap associate with tip follow transient expression in cos-1 cell and stable expression in human jurkat-t cell .
expression of tip and tap in jurkat-t cell induce dramatic cell aggregation .
aggregation be likely cause by the up-regulated surface expression of adhesion molecule include integrin alpha , l-selectin , icam-3 , and h-cam .
furthermore , nf-kappab transcriptional factor of aggregated cell have approximately 40-fold high activity than that of parental cell .
