thus , tap be likely to be an important cellular mediator of tip function in t cell transformation by herpesvirus saimiri .
hypoxic induction of interleukin-8 gene expression in human endothelial cell .
because leukocyte-mediated tissue damage be an important component of the pathologic picture in ischemia/reperfusion , we have seek mechanism by which pmns be direct into hypoxic tissue .
incubation of human endothelial cell ( ec ) in hypoxia , po2 approximately 14-18 torr , lead to time-dependent release of il-8 antigen into the conditioned medium ; this be accompany by increase chemotactic activity for pmns , block by antibody to il-8 .
production of il-8 by hypoxic ec occur concomitantly with both increase level of il-8 mrna , base on polymerase chain reaction analysis , and increase il-8 transcription , base on nuclear run-on assay .
northern analysis of mrna from hypoxic ec also demonstrate increase level of mrna for macrophage chemotactic protein-1 , another member of the chemokine superfamily of proinflammatory cytokine .
il-8 gene induction be associate with the presence of increase binding activity in nuclear extract from hypoxic ec for the nf-kb site .
study with human umbilical vein segment expose to hypoxia also demonstrate increase elaboration of il-8 antigen compare with normoxic control .
in mouse expose to hypoxia ( po2 approximately 30-40 torr ) , there be increase pulmonary leukostasis , a evidence by increase myeloperoxidase activity in tissue homogenate .
in parallel , increase level of transcript for ip-10 , a murine homologue in the chemokine family related to il-8 , be observe in hypoxic lung tissue .
take together , these data suggest that hypoxia constitute a stimulus for leukocyte chemotaxis and tissue leukostasis .
role of the x2 box in activate transcription from the dra promoter in b cell .
we investigate the function of the evolutionary conserve x2 box in the promoter of the hla-dra gene from the human major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) in rest and activate b cell .
nf-x2 , which contain member of the ap-1/atf/creb family of transcription factor , interact with the x2 box ( 5'-tgcgtca-3' ) from position -97 to -91 in the dra promoter .
in rest raji cell , little to no binding to the x2 box be observe .
in sharp contrast , in b cell treat with the phorbol ester 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) , strong interaction between the x2 box and nf-x2 contain c-fos be observe .
a determine by transient expression and rna analysis , the activation of protein kinase c ( pkc ) also increase rate of transcription from the wild-type dra promoter but not from a dra promoter bear clustered point mutation in the x2 box .
since the co-expression with a dominant negative c-fos abolish the responsiveness to tpa , we conclude that activate transcription of the dra gene depend on interaction between the x2 box and nf-x2 , which contain c-fos .
the role of nfatp in cyclosporin a-sensitive tumor necrosis factor -alpha gene transcription .
the tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf alpha ) gene be an immediate early gene in activate t cell , in that it be rapidly induce without a requirement for protein synthesis .
maximal induction of tnf alpha mrna can be induce by treatment of t cell with calcium ionophores alone , via a calcineurin -dependent process that be block by cyclosporin a .
we have previously identify a promoter element , kappa 3 , that be require for calcium-stimulated , cyclosporin a -sensitive induction of the tnf alpha gene in activate t cell .
here , we demonstrate that the kappa 3 binding factor contain nfatp , a cyclosporin-sensitive dna-binding protein require for interleukin-2 gene transcription .
nfatp bind to two site within the kappa 3 element , and occupancy of both site be require for tnf alpha gene induction .
thus , although the kappa 3 element have little sequence similarity to other nfatp -binding site , it appear to function a a cyclosporin-sensitive promoter element in t cell by virtue of it ability to bind nfatp .
the involvement of nfatp in transcriptional activation of both the interleukin-2 and tnf alpha gene suggest that this factor play an important role in the coordinate induction of multiple cytokine gene , start at the early stage of t cell activation .
t-cell -directed tal-1 expression induce t-cell malignancy in transgenic mouse .
the tal-1 gene specify for a basic domain-helix-loop-helix protein , which be involve in the control of normal hematopoiesis .
in human pathology , the tal-1 gene product be express in a high percentage of t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia in the pediatric age range ; however , it have not be establish whether the expression have a causal role in oncogenesis .
in this report , we describe the phenotype of mouse transgenic line obtain by induce tal-1 protein expression in lymphoid tissue use the lck promoter .
the survival rate of tal-1 transgenic animal be much low a compare with control mouse .
histopathological analysis reveal lymphoma of t-cell type , often comprise a minor b-cell component .
some mouse show marked splenic lymphocyte depletion .
primary lymphocyte culture show partial independence from exogenous growth stimulus and increase resistance to low-serum apoptosis .
to far unravel the tal-1 oncogenic potential , a strain of tal-1 transgenic mouse be crossbreed with p53-/- mouse ; the survival rate in these animal be reduce by more than one-half when compare with that of tal-1 mouse , and histopathological analysis reveal exclusively t-cell lymphoma .
these data indicate that tal-1 , express in t cell , be per se a potent oncogene , which may exert a key leukemogenetic role in the majority of t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia .
characterization of grb2-binding protein in human platelet activate by fc gamma riia cross-linking .
glutathione-s-transferase ( gst ) -grb2 fusion protein have be use to identify the potential role of grb2-binding protein in platelet activation by the platelet low-affinity igg receptor , fc gamma riia .
two tyrosine phosphoprotein of 38 and 63 kd bind to the sh2 domain of grb2 follow fc gamma riia stimulation of platelet .
both be located in the particulate fraction follow platelet activation and be also able to bind to a gst-construct contain the sh2 and sh3 domain of phospholipase c gamma 1 .
p38 also form a complex with the tyrosine kinase csk in stimulate cell and be a substrate for the kinase .
the sh3 domain of grb2 form a stable complex with sos1 and two protein of 75 kd and 120 kd , which undergo tyrosine phosphorylation in fc gamma riia stimulated cell .
the 75-kd protein be recognize by antibody to slp-76 , which have recently be isolate from t cell and sequence .
tyrosine phosphorylation of p38 and p63 be also observe in platelet stimulate by the tyrosine kinase -linked receptor agonist collagen and by the g protein -coupled receptor agonist thrombin , although phosphorylation of slp-76 be only observe in collagen -stimulated platelet .
p38 and p63 may provide a docking site for grb2 , thereby link grb2 sh3-binding protein sos1 , slp-76 , and p120 to downstream signalling event .
cell-specific bifunctional role of jun oncogene family member on glucocorticoid receptor -dependent transcription .
interaction between protein kinase c ( pkc ) - and glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) -mediated signaling be suggest by the ability of the pkc activating phorbol ester 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) to inhibit gr -dependent transcription of the mouse mammary tumor virus ( mmtv ) long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
here we report that this interference be cell specific , a tpa augment dexamethasone -induced transcriptional activation of the mmtv ltr in several t cell line but be inhibitory in nih-3t3 fibroblast .
tpa-gr synergism be determine to have occur at the gr -responsive element ( gre ) level by functional analysis of deletion mutant or synthetic gre oligonucleotides drive chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase expression .
synergism require an intact gr dna-binding domain , whereas amino- or carboxyl- terminal domain be dispensable .
the effect be abrogate by the pkc inhibitor staurosporine , suggest a role for pkc .
increase c-jun , jun-b , and jun-d expression above basal level and increase transcriptional activity of ap-1/tpa responsive element fuse to chloramphenicol acetyl-transferase vector be observe in t cell treat with tpa alone or in combination with dexamethasone .
the ability of jun protein to cooperate with gr in t cell have be investigate after transfection of c-jun , jun-b , or jun-d expression vector , which augment gr -dependent transcription from either mmtv ltr or gre .
conversely , c-jun and jun-b transfection blunt gr -dependent transcription in hela cell .
the presence of c-fos have a negative influence on gr function and correlate with the cell-specific synergistic or antagonistic activity of jun with respect to gr ; high basal expression of c-fos as well a ap-1 dna binding and transcriptional activity be observe in hela cell , but not in t cell .
furthermore overexpression of exogenous c-fos have an inhibitory effect on gr -dependent transcription from gre in t cell .
we propose that jun play a bifunctional role on gr -dependent transcriptional activation of gre , select either synergistic or antagonistic activity depend on the cell-specific microenvironment .
in this regard , intracellular level of c-fos appear to be influential .
the b29 ( immunoglobulin beta-chain ) gene be a genetic target for early b-cell factor .
early b-cell factor ( ebf ) be a transcription factor suggest a essential for early b-lymphocyte development by finding in mouse where the cod gene have be inactivate by homologous disruption .
this make the identification of genetic target for this transcription factor pertinent for the understanding of early b-cell development .
the lack of b29 transcript , cod for the beta subunit of the b-cell receptor complex , in pro-b cell from ebf -deficient mouse suggest that b29 might be a genetic target for ebf .
we here present data suggest that ebf interact with three independent site within the mouse b29 promoter .
furthermore , ectopic expression of ebf in hela cell activate a b29 promoter -controlled reporter construct 13-fold and induce a low level of expression from the endogenous b29 gene .
finally , mutation in the ebf binding site diminish b29 promoter activity in pre-b cell while the same mutation do not have a striking an effect on the promoter function in b-cell line of late differentiation stage .
these data suggest that the b29 gene be a genetic target for ebf in early b-cell development .
nuclear factor-kappa b potently up-regulates the promoter activity of rantes , a chemokine that block hiv infection .
the complex network of cytokine that be involve in inflammatory and immunoregulatory response play a critical role in the pathogenesis of hiv infection .
rantes ( regulate upon activation , normal t cell express and secrete ) be a cytokine that belong to the beta-chemokine family ; it be chemoattractant for cd4+/cd45ro t cell , it be produce by various cell type include cd8+ and cd4+ t cell as well a monocytes/macrophages , and have recently be show to suppress replication of macrophage-tropic strain of hiv in cd4+ t cell .
to investigate the molecular mechanism of rantes expression , the rantes promoter region be analyze by transient expression and gel-mobility shift assay .
we demonstrate that : 1 ) rantes promoter activity be up-regulated by pma plus ionomycin , coexpression of the p65 subunit of nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b , the proinflammatory cytokine tnf-alpha and il-1 beta , and the cd28 costimulatory pathway ; 2 ) the rantes promoter region contain four nf-kappa b binding site at position -30 , -44 , -213 , and -579 relative to the transcription start site ; 3 ) one site ( -213 ) be an nf-at ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) binding site that also have weak affinity to nf-kappa b , and the most distal site ( -579 ) also serve a a cd28-responsive element ; and 4 ) mutation on any of those nf-kappa b site or coexpression of i kappa b alpha ( cytoplasmic inhibitor of nf-kappa b ) markedly reduce the promoter activity .
thus , nf-kappa b , a potent transcriptional activator of hiv expression , be also involve in the expression of rantes , a chemokine that block infection by macrophage-tropic strain of hiv .
abnormal regulation of the il-2 promoter in lpr cd4-cd8-_t lymphocyte result in constitutive expression of a novel nuclear factor of activate t cell -binding factor .
the inert quality of mrl-ipr/ipr ( ipr ) peripheral cd4-cd8- ( cd4-8- ) t cell manifest primarily a an inability to proliferate or produce il-2 in response to tcr or mitogenic stimulation .
yet these same cell do initiate early tcr -mediated signaling event , such a generation of inositol phosphate and increase intracellular calcium .
they also display constitutively high level of p59fyn and cd3 zeta tyrosine phosphorylation .
the generation of second messenger in t cell normally lead to downstream signaling that result in transcriptional activation of the il-2 gene .
we , therefore , compare the activation state of the il-2 gene promoter region in freshly isolate and stimulate ipr cd4-8- t cell with that of normal t lymphocyte .
level of the octamer , nf-kappa b ( p50-p65 heterodimer ) , and ap-1 transcriptional factor be constitutively elevate in freshly isolate ipr cd4-8- t cell , consistent with the activate phenotype of these cell .
upon stimulation with mitogen , formation of the transactivating complex , nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) , occur with normal kinetics in ipr cd4-8- t cell .
yet , the level of the activate nf-at complex never reach those observe in similarly stimulate normal t cell .
furthermore , nuclear extract from ipr cd4-8- t cell display high level of a novel specific binding activity at the nf-at site , which be present at much low level in freshly isolate normal t lymphocyte .
upon mitogenic stimulation , the binding activity of the novel nf-at -binding factor be rapidly down-regulated in normal t cell , but persist at high level in ipr cd4-8- t cell .
these two abnormality at the nf-at site provide a potential mechanism to account for the defect in il-2 production from ipr cd4-8- t cell .
functional myc-max heterodimer be require for activation-induced apoptosis in t cell hybridoma .
t cell hybridoma respond to activation signal by undergo apoptotic cell death , and this be likely to represent comparable event related to tolerance induction in immature and mature t cell in vivo .
previous study use antisense oligonucleotides implicate the c-myc protein in the phenomenon of activation-induced apoptosis .
this role for c-myc in apoptosis be now confirm in study use a dominant negative form of it heterodimeric binding partner , max , which we show here inhibit activation-induced apoptosis .
far , coexpression of a reciprocally mutant myc protein capable of form functional heterodimers with the mutant max can compensate for the dominant negative activity and restore activation-induced apoptosis .
these result imply that myc promote activation-induced apoptosis by obligatory heterodimerization with max , and therefore , by regulate gene transcription .
concomitant downregulation of igh 3' enhancer activity and c-myc expression in a plasmacytoma x fibroblast environment : implication for dysregulation of translocate c-myc .
regulation of immunoglobulin heavy chain ( igh ) gene expression be control by a b cell-specific promoter , intronic enhancer and additional b cell-specific enhancer element identify recently in the 3' end of the igh locus .
one of the latter element , the igh 3' enhancer , be of particular interest : ( 1 ) it be b cell-specific and active only in late b cell development ; ( 2 ) in rodent plasmacytoma and in some human burkitt 's lymphoma it be part of a locus control region ( lcr ) that be involve in deregulation of the c-myc oncogene a a result of translocation into the igh locus ; and ( 3 ) it have be implicate in the mechanism that control ig gene class switch recombination .
we have use a somatic cell hybridization approach to genetically analyse regulation of the activity of the igh 3' enhancer .
when mouse mpc11 plasmacytoma cell , in which the igh 3' enhancer be active , be fuse with fibroblast , ig expression be extinguish at the level of transcription .
here we show that in a mpc11 plasmacytoma x fibroblast environment , the igh 3' enhancer be transcriptionally inactive .
furthermore , we demonstrate that binding of several b cell-specific transcription factor , essential for igh 3' enhancer activity , be lack , which may explain 3' enhancer inactivity , although the binding of repressor can not be exclude .
moreover , the high expression level of c-myc , characteristic of the parental mpc11 cell carry the t(12;15) translocation , be down-regulated in the hybrid to that in unfused fibroblast .
therefore , inactivation of the igh 3' enhancer be a multifactorial process affect several transcription factor that control the cell-specific and developmental activity of the enhancer .
prostaglandin e2 induction of binding activity to cre and ap-2 element in human t lymphocyte .
prostaglandin of the e series be immunomodulatory agent which exert inhibitory as well a stimulatory effect on a variety of immune response .
since it be know that pge2 be able to increase camp level , we investigate whether it can affect gene expression through the activation of the transcription factor which bind enhancer element in the promoter region of camp -regulated gene .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we demonstrate that a short treatment of human t lymphocyte with pge2 induce specific binding activity to cre and ap-2 , but not ap-1 , dna element .
since the okadaic acid , a potent protein phosphatase inhibitor , prolong the induction of the binding activity , phosphorylation event be likely to occur .
this activity seem to be due to increase camp level because forskolin and ibmx mimic the effect of pge2 .
more interestingly , transfection experiment with cre -cat plasmide show that pge2 activate the transcription of a cre -containing promoter .
these data support the positive role for pge2 on some immune function .
hiv-1 tat potentiate tnf -induced nf-kappa b activation and cytotoxicity by alter the cellular redox state .
this study demonstrate that human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) tat protein amplify the activity of tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) , a cytokine that stimulate hiv-1 replication through activation of nf-kappa b .
in hela cell stably transfected with the hiv-1 tat gene ( hela-tat cell ) , expression of the tat protein enhance both tnf -induced activation of nf-kappa b and tnf -mediated cytotoxicity .
a similar potentiation of tnf effect be observe in jurkat t cell and hela cell treat with soluble tat protein .
tnf -mediated activation of nf-kappa b and cytotoxicity involve the intracellular formation of reactive oxygen intermediate .
therefore , tat -mediated effect on the cellular redox state be analyze .
in both t cell and hela cell hiv-1 tat suppress the expression of mn-dependent superoxide dismutase ( mn-sod ) , a mitochondrial enzyme that be part of the cellular defense system against oxidative stress .
thus , mn-sod rna protein level and activity be markedly reduce in the presence of tat .
decrease mn-sod expression be associate with decrease level of glutathione and a low ratio of reduce : oxidize glutathione .
a truncate tat protein ( tat1-72 ) , know to transactivate the hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) , no longer affect mn-sod expression , the cellular redox state or tnf -mediated cytotoxicity .
thus , our experiment demonstrate that the c-terminal region of hiv-1 tat be require to suppress mn-sod expression and to induce pro-oxidative condition reflect by a drop in reduce glutathione ( gsh ) and the gsh : oxidize gsh ( gssg ) ratio .

the murine bcl6 gene be induce in activate lymphocyte a an immediate early gene .
the chromosomal translocation involve 3q27 be often detect in human b-cell lymphoma , especially diffuse lymphoma with a large-cell component .
the bcl6 gene have be isolate from the chromosomal breakpoint in these lymphoma .
here we clone the murine bcl6 ( mbcl6 ) cdna from the muscle cdna library use the human bcl6 ( hbcl6 ) cdna a a probe .
the predict amino acid sequence be 95 % identical to that of hbcl6 .
it contain six repeat of the kruppel-like zinc-finger motif that be completely identical to those of hbcl6 , indicate that the bcl6 gene be well conserve between human and mouse .
expression of the mbcl6 gene be ubiquitously detect in adult mouse tissue include lymphatic organ .
furthermore , it be induce in lymphocyte activate with phorbol ester and ca2+ ionophore within 30 min after stimulation .
this induction be not inhibit by treatment of the cell with a protein synthesis inhibitor , cycloheximide .
these result suggest that bcl6 play a role in activate lymphocyte a an immediate early gene .
characterization and purification of a protein kinase c substrate in human b cell .
identification a lymphocyte-specific protein 1 ( lsp1 ) .
incubation of b-chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( b-cll ) cell with phorbol ester result in the phosphorylation of two major pkc substrate , marcks ( myristoylated , alanine-rich c kinase substrate ) and mrp ( marcks -related protein ) , and of a third protein , with an apparent m.w. of 60,000 that be the most prominent protein kinase c substrate in these cell .
p60 phosphorylation be time and pma dose dependent , and be induce by cell-permeable diacylglycerol , but not by inactive phorbol ester .
two-dimensional electrophoretic analysis of the protein phosphorylation pattern from the b cell line ce demonstrate the identity between the p60 protein express in this cell line and that express in b-cll cell .
p60 be purify from ce cell and peptide microsequencing of this protein reveal that it be lymphocyte-specific protein 1 ( lsp1 ) , that be here characterize a the most prominent protein kinase c substrate in b cell .
cellular and molecular mechanism of il-5 synthesis in atopic disease : a study with allergen-specific human helper t cell .
background : cytokine produce by helper t cell be intimately involve in chronic allergic disease associate with eosinophilic inflammation .
objective : we investigate the production of il-5 , a potent growth factor and chemotactic factor for eosinophil , by cd4+ t lymphocyte in patient with asthma .
method : allergen-specific t cell clone and t cell hybridoma be establish from the peripheral blood lymphocyte of patient with asthma , and the response to various stimulus be determine .
result : after nonspecific stimulation , il-5 production by cd4+ t cell from both atopic and nonatopic subject with asthma be significantly enhance compare with that by cell from healthy control .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell from atopic asthma patient both proliferate and produce il-5 after incubation with mite allergen , suggest that mite-specific helper t cell be involve in the eosinophilic inflammation of atopic asthma .
a human il-5 promoter/enhancer luciferase gene construct transfected into il-5 -producing t cell clone be clearly transcribe after stimulation , indicate that the 515 base pair il-5 gene segment upstream of the cod region be sufficient to respond to activate signal in human helper t cell .
the same gene segment be not transcribe in il-5 -nonproducing t cell clone , suggest that human t cell il-5 synthesis be regulate at the transcriptional level .
experiment with t cell hybridoma confirm these finding and suggest that a unique transcription factor may be essential for human il-5 gene transcription .
conclusion : enhance il-5 production by helper t cell seem to cause the eosinophilic inflammation of both atopic and nonatopic asthma .
elucidation of il-5 -specific regulatory mechanism may facilitate the development of novel treatment for allergic disease associate with eosinophilic inflammation .
aspirin inhibit nuclear factor-kappa b mobilization and monocyte adhesion in stimulate human endothelial cell .
background : the induction of vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 ) and e-selectin by tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf ) be mediate by mobilization of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) .
since salicylate have be report to inhibit nf-kappa b activation by prevent the degradation of it inhibitor i kappa b , we study a potential inhibition of this pathway by acetylsalicylate ( aspirin ) in human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvecs ) .
method and result : gel-shift analysis demonstrate dose-dependent inhibition of tnf -induced nf-kappa b mobilization by aspirin at concentration range from 1 to 10 mmol/l .
induction of vcam-1 and e-selectin surface expression by tnf be dose-dependently reduce by aspirin over the same range , while induction of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) be hardly affect .
aspirin appear to prevent vcam-1 transcription , since it dose-dependently inhibit induction of vcam-1 mrna by tnf .
a a functional consequence , adhesion of u937 monocyte to tnf -stimulated huvecs be markedly reduce by aspirin due to suppression of vcam-1 and e-selectin upregulation .
these effect of aspirin be not related to the inhibition of cyclooxygenase activity , since indomethacin be ineffective .
conclusion : our data suggest that aspirin inhibit nf-kappa b mobilization , induction of vcam-1 and e-selectin , and subsequent monocyte adhesion in endothelial cell stimulate by tnf , thereby provide an additional mechanism for therapeutic effect of aspirin .
anti-ehrlichia chaffeensis antibody complexed with e. chaffeensis induce potent proinflammatory cytokine mrna expression in human monocyte through sustained reduction of ikappab-alpha and activation of nf-kappab .
ehrlichia chaffeensis be an obligatory intracellular bacterium that infect monocyte and macrophage and be the etiologic agent of human ehrlichiosis in the united state .
our previous study show that the exposure of human monocyte to e. chaffeensis induce the expression of interleukin-1beta ( il-1beta ) , il-8 , and il-10 gene in vitro but not the expression of tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) and il-6 mrna .
in this study , the effect of anti- e. chaffeensis antibody complexed with e. chaffeensis on the expression of major proinflammatory cytokine in human monocyte be examine .
human monocytic cell line thp-1 be treat with e. chaffeensis which have be preincubated with human anti- e. chaffeensis serum for 2 h , and the level of cytokine mrna be evaluate by competitive reverse transcription-pcr .
anti- e. chaffeensis antibody complexed with e. chaffeensis significantly enhance mrna expression of il-1beta in thp-1 cell .
the expression of tnf-alpha and il-6 mrna be also induce .
the level of secrete il-1beta , tnf-alpha , and il-6 during 24 h of stimulation be comparable to those induce by escherichia coli lipopolysaccharide at 1 microg/ml .
fab fragment of anti- e. chaffeensis immunoglobulin g complexed with e. chaffeensis do not induce any of these three cytokine , indicate that ehrlichial binding be require for il-1beta mrna expression and that binding of the immune complex to the fc gamma receptor be require for tnf-alpha and il-6 mrna expression and enhance il-1beta mrna expression .
furthermore , prolonged degradation of ikappab-alpha and activation of nf-kappab be demonstrate in thp-1 cell expose to anti- e. chaffeensis serum and e. chaffeensis .
this result imply that development of anti- e. chaffeensis antibody in patient can result in the production of major proinflammatory cytokine , which may play an important role in the pathophysiology of ehrlichiosis and immune response to it .
constitutive association of jak1 and stat5 in pro-b cell be dissolve by interleukin-4 -induced tyrosine phosphorylation of both protein .
the bipartite human interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) receptor be functionally express in murine pro-b cell and activate by human il-4 to evoke intracellular signaling .
mutual association of signal transducing protein within the receptor complex be then study in dependence of ligand stimulation .
