since both these protein become phosphorylated in response to il-4 receptor stimulation , the influence of tyrosine phosphorylation on their mutual contact be analyze .
association of jak1 and stat5 be find to occur exclusively between unphosphorylated protein .
transcriptional activation of human zeta 2 globin promoter by the alpha globin regulatory element ( hs-40 ) : functional role of specific nuclear factor-dna complex .
we study the functional interaction between human embryonic zeta 2 globin promoter and the alpha globin regulatory element ( hs-40 ) located 40 kb upstream of the zeta 2 globin gene .
it be show by transient expression assay that hs-40 behave a an authentic enhancer for high-level zeta 2 globin promoter activity in k562 cell , an erythroid cell line of embryonic and/or fetal origin .
although sequence located between -559 and -88 of the zeta 2 globin gene be dispensable for it expression on enhancerless plasmid , they be require for the hs-40 enhancer -mediated activity of the zeta 2 globin promoter .
site-directed mutagenesis demonstrate that this hs-40 enhancer- zeta 2 globin promoter interaction be mediate by the two gata-1 factor binding motif located at -230 and -104 , respectively .
the functional domain of hs-40 be also map .
bal 31 deletion map data suggest that one gata-1 motif , one gt motif , and two nf-e2/ap1 motif together form the functional core of hs-40 in the erythroid-specific activation of the zeta 2 globin promoter .
site-directed mutagenesis far demonstrate that the enhancer function of one of the two nf-e2/ap1 motif of hs-40 be mediate through it binding to nf-e2 but not ap1 transcription factor .
finally , we do genomic footprinting of the hs-40 enhancer region in k562 cell , adult nucleated erythroblast , and different nonerythroid cell .
all sequence motif within the functional core of hs-40 , a map by transient expression analysis , appear to bind a nuclear factor ( s ) in live k562 cell but not in nonerythroid cell .
on the other hand , only one of the apparently nonfunctional sequence motif be bind with factor in vivo .
in comparison to k562 , nucleated erythroblast from adult human bone marrow exhibit a similar but nonidentical pattern of nuclear factor binding in vivo at the hs-40 region .
these data suggest that transcriptional activation of human embryonic zeta 2 globin gene and the fetal/adult alpha globin gene be mediate by erythroid cell-specific and developmental stage-specific nuclear factor-dna complex which form at the enhancer ( hs-40 ) and the globin promoter .
t cell reactivity to sjogren 's syndrome related antigen la ( ssb ) .
objective .
many patient with primary sjogren 's syndrome ( s ) make high titer igg autoantibody to the la ( ssb ) antigen , suggest antigen specific t cell-b cell interaction .
t cell response to some nuclear antigen , particularly u1rnp , have be detect in patient with systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) and in healthy subject .
we investigate t cell reactivity to the autoantigen ssb in patient with s and healthy control .
method .
use the [3h]thymidine proliferation assay , we determine reactivity to purify recombinant ssb ( rssb ) in 20 patient with s and 19 control .
specificity be determine use tetanus toxoid , endotoxin , and 3 other autoantigens ( pbc.m2 , sc170 , and gad ) .
precursor frequency be calculate by limit dilution analysis .
hla class ii dependency be investigate use anti-class ii monoclonal antibody .
hla-dr typing be by polymerase chain reaction and sequence specific oligonucleotide typing .
result .
six of 20 patient with s and 10/19 control proliferate to la ( rssb ) .
precursor frequency of anti-ssb t cell be 1:77,040 and 1:115,000 in 2 healthy subject and 1:230,250 and 1:103,034 in two patient with s .
anti- hla-dr abrogate proliferation to ssb and tetanus toxoid .
thirteen of 15 patient with s and 4/17 control be hla-dr3 positive , with no apparent association of hla-dr3 with ssb reactivity in control .
conclusion .
anti- la(ssb) specific t cell occur in a significant proportion of control and in some patient with s .
the function of ssb t cell in control remain to be define .
they may represent immunoregulatory cell , and further analysis of these cell , and a comparison to those find in patient with s , may elucidate normal immunoregulation and the derangement that lead to sjogren 's syndrome .
high affinity aldosterone bind to plasma membrane rich fraction from mononuclear leukocyte : be there a membrane receptor for mineralocorticoid ?
in vitro effect of aldosterone on the intracellular concentration of sodium , potassium and calcium , cell volume and the sodium -proton-antiport have be describe in intact human mononuclear leukocyte ( hml ) .
in the present paper , the binding of a [125i]-labeled aldosterone derivative to plasma membrane rich fraction of hml be study .
high affinity binding of the radioligand with an apparent kd of approximately 0.1 nm be find .
aldosterone displace the tracer at a similar kd .
both canrenone and cortisol be inactive a ligand up to concentration of 0.1 microm .
the finding be the first to demonstrate membrane binding site with a high affinity for aldosterone , but not for cortisol .
these data be perfectly compatible with major property of steroidal effect on the sodium-proton-antiport in hml and thus very likely represent membrane receptor for aldosterone .
the effect of toremifene therapy on serum immunoglobulin level in breast cancer .
estrogen and anti-estrogens enhance the number of immunoglobulin ( ig ) -secreting cell in pokeweed mitogen ( pwm ) -stimulated lymphocyte culture .
lymphocyte from patient who have receive anti-estrogen therapy show similar enhancement of ig-secreting cell after pwm stimulation .
in this study the effect of anti-estrogen ( toremifene ) therapy on serum immunoglobulin ( iga , igm , igg ) level in breast cancer patient be investigate .
serum ig level be follow up to two year after or during the therapy .
an unexpected finding be that the ig level decrease during the follow-up period .
this decrease be see in patient who respond to the therapy as well a in those who do not .
a human homologue of the drosophila toll protein signal activation of adaptive immunity [ see comment ]
induction of the adaptive immune response depend on the expression of co-stimulatory molecule and cytokine by antigen-presenting cell .
the mechanism that control the initial induction of these signal upon infection be poorly understand .
it have be propose that their expression be control by the non-clonal , or innate , component of immunity that precede in evolution the development of an adaptive immune system in vertebrate .
we report here the cloning and characterization of a human homologue of the drosophila toll protein ( toll ) which have be show to induce the innate immune response in adult drosophila .
like drosophila toll , human toll be a type i transmembrane protein with an extracellular domain consist of a leucine-rich repeat ( lrr ) domain , and a cytoplasmic domain homologous to the cytoplasmic domain of the human interleukin ( il ) -1 receptor .
both drosophila toll and the il-1 receptor be know to signal through the nf-kappab pathway .
we show that a constitutively active mutant of human toll transfected into human cell line can induce the activation of nf-kappab and the expression of nf-kappab -controlled gene for the inflammatory cytokine il-1 , il-6 and il-8 , as well a the expression of the co-stimulatory molecule b7.1 , which be require for the activation of naive t cell .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor stimulate jak2 signaling pathway and rapidly activate p93fes , stat1 p91 , and stat3 p92 in polymorphonuclear leukocyte .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) , support proliferation , differentiation , and functional activation of hemopoietic cell by it interaction with a heterodimeric receptor .
although gm-csf receptor be devoid of tyrosine kinase enzymatic activity , gm-csf -induced peripheral blood polymorphonuclear leukocyte ( pmn ) functional activation be mediate by the phosphorylation of a large number of intracellular signaling molecule .
we have previously show that jak2 become tyrosine -phosphorylated in response to gm-csf in pmn .
in the present study we demonstrate that also the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) family member stat1 p91 and stat3 p92 and the product of the c-fps/fes protooncogene become tyrosine -phosphorylated upon gm-csf stimulation and physically associate with both gm-csf receptor beta common subunit and jak2 .
moreover gm-csf be able to induce jak2 and p93fes catalytic activity .
we also demonstrate that the association of the gm-csf receptor beta common subunit with jak2 be ligand-dependent .
finally we demonstrate that gm-csf induce a dna-binding complex that contain both p91 and p92 .
these result identify a new signal transduction pathway activate by gm-csf and provide a mechanism for rapid activation of gene expression in gm-csf -stimulated pmn .
physical and functional interaction between the human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 tax1 protein and the ccaat binding protein nf-y .
tax1 , a potent activator of human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) transcription , have be show to modulate expression of many cellular gene .
tax1 do not bind dna directly but regulate transcription through protein-protein interaction with sequence-specific transcription factor .
use the yeast two-hybrid system to screen for protein which interact with tax1 , we isolate the b subunit of the ccaat binding protein nf-y from a hela cdna library .
the interaction of tax1 with nf-yb be specific in that nf-yb do not interact with a variety of other transcription factor , include human immunodeficiency virus tat , human papillomavirus e6 , and bicoid , or with the m7 ( amino acid 29cp-as ) tax1 mutant .
however , nf-yb do interact with the c-terminal tax1 mutant m22 ( 130tl-as ) and m47 ( 319ll-rs ) .
we also show that in vitro-translated nf-yb specifically bind to a glutathione s-transferase- tax1 fusion protein .
far , tax1 coimmunoprecipitated with nf-y from nuclear extract of htlv-1-transformed cell , provide evidence for in vivo interaction of tax1 and nf-yb .
we far demonstrate that tax1 specifically activate the nf-y -responsive dqbeta promoter , as well a a minimal promoter which contain only the y-box element .
in addition , mutation of the y-box element alone abrogate tax1 -mediated activation .
take together , these data indicate that tax1 interact with nf-y through the b subunit and that this interaction result in activation of the major histocompatibility complex class ii promoter .
through activation of this and other nf-y driven promoter , the tax1 -nf-y interaction may play a critical role in cause cellular transformation and htlv-1 pathogenesis .
differential responsiveness of the il-5 and il-4 gene to transcription factor gata-3 .
the cytokine il-4 and il-5 be often coordinately produce by th2 cell a in asthma .
however , it be unclear whether similar molecular mechanism underlie transcription of the two gene .
we have previously show that the transcription factor gata-3 be express in th2 but not th1 cell and be crucial for activation of the il-5 promoter by different stimulus .
in a different study , gata-3 be show to be sufficient for the expression of il-4 and other th2 cytokine gene .
here , we show that ectopic expression of gata-3 be sufficient to drive il-5 but not il-4 gene expression .
also , in th2 cell , antisense gata-3 rna inhibit il-5 but not il-4 promoter activation .
the induction of il-5 gene expression by gata-3 involve high affinity binding of gata-3 to an inverted gata repeat in the il-5 promoter .
extinction of immunoglobulin gene expression in b cell upon fusion with hela cell be precede by rapid nuclear depletion of essential transcription factor and be accompany by widespread inactivation of gene express in a b cell-specific manner .
when immunoglobulin ( ig ) expressing b cell be fuse with non-b cell , ig expression be rapidly suppress at the level of transcription , a phenomenon term extinction .
here we demonstrate that fusion of hela cell with either diploid or tetraploid b cell ( daudi ) result in widespread extinction of several other b cell-encoded gene that be express in a b cell-specific manner .
in contrast , expression of b cell-expressed gene that be not dependent on cell-specific control be unaffected .
we show that the molecular mechanism ( s ) underlie ig gene extinction can be explain , at least in part , by a lack of transcription factor that be essential for ig gene transcription .
these transcription factor be either not produce due to block of transcription of their respective gene ( oct-2 , obf-1 , pu.1 ) , or be render inactive posttranslationally ( nf-kappa b , e47 ) .
by isolate daudi x hela heterokaryons a few hour after fusion , we have study the initial fate of two b cell-specific transcription factor involve in ig gene transcription , oct-2 and nf-kappa b .
this report provide the first demonstration that upon fusion with hela cell , the nuclear content of b cell-expressed transcription factor be deplete within a few hour with kinetics that be a fast or fast than that of ig gene extinction .
thus , the extinguishing mechanism be effective very early after fusion .
we suggest that extinction of ig gene be part of a global mechanism that suppress the differentiation program foreign to the hela phenotype .
reactivity of lymphocyte to a progesterone receptor-specific monoclonal antibody .
in this study we present evidence for reactivity of pregnancy lymphocyte , but not nonpregnancy lymphocyte , with the progesterone receptor-specific monoclonal antibody mpri .
use an avidin -biotin peroxidase detection system , we find a nuclear staining in 14.6 +/- 3.7 % ( mean +/- sem , n = 27 ) of pregnancy lymphocyte , while only 0.47 +/- 0.33 % ( mean +/- sem , n = 15 ) of nonpregnancy lymphocyte react with the antibody .
to characterize the receptor-bearing subset , cd8+ and cd4+ cell be deplete by complement-dependent lysis .
depletion of cd8+ cell be accompany by 62 +/- 18 % loss of progesterone receptor -bearing cell , while depletion of cd4+ cell result in a twofold increase in the number of positively stain lymphocyte .
in nonpregnancy lymphocyte a 3-day pha treatment , as well a allogeneic stimulation , result in a significant increase in the number of receptor-containing cell .
these result suggest that pregnancy , but not nonpregnancy , lymphocyte contain progesterone binding structure , and that these be inducible by mitogenic or alloantigenic stimulus .
activation and expression of the nuclear factor of activate t cell , nfatp and nfatc , in human natural killer cell : regulation upon cd16 ligand binding .
the putative factor that couple the signal transduction from surface receptor to the activation of cytokine synthesis in natural killer ( nk ) cell have not be elucidate .
we report here that the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfatp ) , a cyclosporin a ( csa ) -sensitive factor that regulate the transcription of several cytokine , mediate cd16 -induced activation of cytokine gene in human nk cell .
cd16 ( fc gamma riiia ) -induced expression of cytokine mrna in nk cell occur via a csa -sensitive and ca(2+)-dependent mechanism .
stimulation of nk cell with cd16 ligand induce nfat -like dna binding activity in the nuclear extract from these cell , a detect in electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
this occur with fast kinetics after stimulation , via a csa -sensitive and ca(2+)-dependent mechanism that do not require de novo protein synthesis .
nk cell nfat be present in the cytosol of nonstimulated cell , migrate to the nucleus upon stimulation , and can associate with ap-1 .
two distinct molecule , nfatp and nfatc , have be report to mediate nfat activity .
the result of supershift assay use nfatp- and nfatc- specific antibody indicate that nk cell activation early after cd16 ligand binding involve primarily , if not exclusively , nfatp , and western blot analysis show that this have the same electrophoretic mobility ( approximately 120 kd ) a that of t lymphocyte .
nk cell do not express nfatc constitutively , but nfatc mrna accumulation be induce in these cell within 2 h of stimulation with cd16 ligand .
however , supershift assay use the available mab recognize the t cell nfatc reveal no detectable nfatc protein in nuclear and cytoplasmic extract from cd16- or phorbol ester -stimulated cell at any time test , up to 4 h .
these result provide the first direct evidence that both csa -sensitive transcription factor , nfatp and nfatc , be express in human nk cell , and that their activation and/or expression can be regulate in primary cell by a single stimulus , that , in the case of cd16 in nk cell , result in early activation of nfatp and subsequently induce expression of nfatc mrna .
transcription factor nf-kappab regulation of renal fibrosis during ureteral obstruction .
irrespective of the etiology , many kidney disease result in inflammation and fibrosis of the tubulointerstitium , with the subsequent loss of renal function .
to initiate any disease process or for any disease process to progress , there must be change in the transcription of gene within the affect tissue .
the nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappab ) family of transcription factor regulate gene involve in inflammation , cell proliferation , and cell differentiation .
this review discuss the nf-kappab transcription factor family in general and the association of nf-kappab activation with cellular/molecular event of renal inflammation and fibrosis
oxidoreductive regulation of nuclear factor kappa b .
involvement of a cellular reducing catalyst thioredoxin .
we have investigate an oxidoreductive regulatory pathway for the dna binding activity of a pleiotropic cellular transcription factor , nuclear factor kappa b ( nf kappa b ) , have be investigate by use nf kappa b prepare from the nucleus and the cytosol of the primary human t lymphocyte .
we show that a cellular reducing catalyst thioredoxin ( trx ) play a major role in activation of the dna binding of nf kappa b in vitro and stimulation of transcription from the nf kappa b -dependent gene expression .
we demonstrate evidence suggest that redox regulation of nf kappa b by trx might be exert at a step after dissociation of the inhibitory molecule i kappa b , a cytosolic-anchoring protein for nf kappa b .
to examine the effect of trx in intact cell , we perform transient assay with a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase -expressing plasmid under the control of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) long terminal repeat and an effector plasmid express human trx .
the promoter activity from hiv long terminal repeat be greatly augment by co-transfecting the trx-expressing plasmid , whose effect be dependent on the nf kappa b -binding site .
these finding have suggest that cysteine residue ( s ) of nf kappa b might be involve in the dna-recognition by nf kappa b and that the redox control mechanism mediate by trx might have a regulatory role in the nf kappa b -mediated gene expression .
these result may also provide a clue to understanding of the molecular process of aid pathogenesis and it possible biochemical intervention .
the epstein-barr virus nuclear antigen 2 interact with an ebna2 responsive cis-element of the terminal protein 1 gene promoter .
the epstein-barr virus protein ebna2 act a a transcriptional activator of cellular and viral gene and play a crucial role in the immortalization of human primary b-cells by ebv .
we have show previously that ebna2 transactivates the promoter of the latent membrane antigen lmp , tp1 and tp2 .
the promoter of the tp1 gene be choose a a model system to study the molecular mechanism of ebna2 mediated transactivation .
to identify an ebna2 dependent cis-acting element , various tp1 promoter-reporter gene construct be transfected in the absence and presence of an ebna2 expression vector into the established b-cell line bl41-p3hr1 .
we be able to delineate an 81 bp ebna2 responsive region between -258 and -177 relative to the tp1 rna start site .
the element work in either orientation and could mediate ebna2 dependent transactivation on a heterologous promoter .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay reveal three specific protein-dna complex form with sequence of the ebna2 responsive element .
two of these be not cell type specific , but the third be detect only in ebna2 positive cell extract .
gel-shift analysis in the presence of ebna2 specific monoclonal antibody reveal that ebna2 be a component of the third complex .
thus , these experiment demonstrate that ebna2 interact with an ebna2 responsive cis-element of the tp1 promoter
identification of a physical interaction between calcineurin and nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfatp ) .
in t lymphocyte , the calcium/calmodulin-dependent serine/threonine phosphatase , calcineurin , play a pivotal role in transduce membrane-associated signal to the nucleus .
one of the putative target of calcineurin be the pre-existing , cytosolic component of the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfatp ; also refer to a nfat1 ) , which be one of several transcription factor require for the expression of interleukin 2 .
inhibition of calcineurin by the immunosuppressive drug cyclosporin a and fk506 prevent dephosphorylation of nfatp and it translocation to the nucleus .
however , a physical interaction between calcineurin and nfatp have not be demonstrate .
here we demonstrate the binding of nfatp from lysates of t cell to immobilize calcineurin .
stimulation of t cell with calcium ionophore induce a shift in the molecular weight of nfatp that be due to it dephosphorylation .
this dephosphorylation be inhibit by treatment of t cell with cyclosporin a or fk506 prior to stimulation .
of note , both the phosphorylated and the dephosphorylated form of nfatp bind to calcineurin .
furthermore , the binding of both form of nfatp to calcineurin be inhibit by pretreatment of calcineurin with a complex of fk506 and it ligand fkbp12 .
take together these data strongly suggest a direct interaction of calcineurin with nfatp and that this interaction do not depend upon the phosphorylation site of nfatp affect by activation .
human cd4 lymphocyte specifically recognize a peptide represent the fusion region of the hybrid protein pml/rar alpha present in acute promyelocytic leukemia cell .
fusion protein present in leukemic cell frequently contain a new amino acid at the fusion point .
we test whether a peptide ( bcr1/25 ) encompass the fusion region of the hybrid molecule pml/rar alpha , which be selectively express by acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) cell , can be recognize by human t lymphocyte in vitro .
cd4+ lymphocyte , at both polyclonal and clonal level , recognize peptide bcr1/25 in an hla-dr -- restricted fashion on presentation by autologous antigen-presenting cell ( apc ) or by apc express the hla-dr11 restricting molecule .
control peptide correspond to the normal pml and rar alpha protein be not recognize .
one clone ( deg5 ) also exert a high and specific cytotoxicity against autologous cell pulse with bcr1/25 .
the autologous de lcl contain a transduce pml/rar alpha fusion gene and express a bcr1 type of the pml/rar alpha hybrid protein induce the proliferation of de anti-bcr1/25 t cell clone .
it be conclude that the bcr1 type-pml/rar alpha fusion protein of apl contain an antigenic site , absent from the normal parent molecule and recognize by human cd4+ lymphocyte .
activation protein 1 -dependent transcriptional activation of interleukin 2 gene by ca2+ /calmodulin kinase type iv/gr .
the ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ( camk ) type iv/gr be selectively express in t lymphocyte and be activate after signal via the t cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) , indicate that it mediate some of the ca(2+)-dependent transcriptional event that follow tcr engagement .
here we show that camkiv/gr induce the transcription factor activation protein 1 ( ap-1 ) alone or in synergy with t cell mitogen and with the p21ras oncoprotein .
camkiv/ gr signaling be associate with transcriptional activation of c-fos but be independent of p21ras or calcineurin .
ap-1 be an integral component of the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) transcriptional complex , which be require for interleukin 2 gene expression in t cell .
we demonstrate that camkiv/gr reconstitute the capacity of the cytosolic component of nfat to direct transcription from nfat site in non- t cell .
these result reveal a central role for camkiv/gr a a ca(2+) -regulated activator of gene transcription in t lymphocyte .
increase expression of gs(alpha) enhance activation of the adenylyl cyclase signal transduction cascade .
expression of the stimulatory g protein , g(s)alpha , can vary over a 3-fold range in human tissue and in rodent central nervous system .
in fact , the offspring of alcoholic have high level of g(s)alpha expression in certain tissue compare with the offspring of nonalcoholics .
the aim of this research be to test the hypothesis that a causal relationship exist between the level of expression of g(s)alpha and induction of the adenylyl cyclase ( ac ) cascade .
the methodology employ transient transfection of hek 293 cell with a cdna for the 52-kda form of g(s)alpha under regulation by inducible metallothionein promoter .
transfectants be expose to vary concentration ( 0-125 microm ) of zinc sulfate that produce a 3-fold range of membrane g(s)alpha expression .
the range of g(s)alpha expression produce be find to mimic a physiologically relevant spectrum of g(s)alpha expression in membrane derive from human tissue and rat brain .
it be observe that induction of g(s)alpha expression increase constitutive as well a stimulate camp accumulation .
moreover , induction of g(s)alpha expression increase event distal to the accumulation of camp include the phosphorylation of the transcription factor , camp response element binding protein and transcriptional activation of camp-dependent reporter gene .
in summary , these study show that the amount of g(s)alpha expression have a marked impact on the level of activity of the ac cascade from the membrane through to the nucleus .
it be hypothesize that individual who differ in g(s)alpha expression may also differ in the expression of certain camp -dependent gene .
characterization of peripheral blood t-lymphocytes transduce with htlv-i tax mutant with different trans-activating phenotype .
tax1 , a transcriptional trans-activator of the human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) , induce the expression of many cellular gene through interaction with at least three distinct cellular transcription factor ; creb/atf , nf-kappab , and srf .
this tax1 -induced activation of cellular gene be consider to be a critical event in t-cell transformation by htlv-i .
to elucidate the role of each tax1 -inducible transcriptional pathway in t-cell transformation , we introduce tax1 mutant with different trans-activating phenotype into peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) by retroviral vector .
analysis of these pbls reveal that activation of the nf-kappab pathway be sufficient to promote the growth response to il-2 .
however , for the clonal expansion of cd4+ t-cells , which be a characteristic result of htlv-i infection , activation of the creb/atf and srf pathway be also require .
pu.1 ( spi-1 ) and c/ebp alpha regulate expression of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor receptor alpha gene .
growth factor receptor play an important role in hematopoiesis .
in order to far understand the mechanism direct the expression of these key regulator of hematopoiesis , we initiate a study investigate the transcription factor activate the expression of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) receptor alpha gene .
here , we demonstrate that the human gm-csf receptor alpha promoter direct reporter gene activity in a tissue-specific fashion in myelomonocytic cell , which correlate with it expression pattern a analyze by reverse transcription pcr .
the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter contain an important functional site between position -53 and -41 a identify by deletion analysis of reporter construct .
we show that the myeloid and b cell transcription factor pu.1 bind specifically to this site .
furthermore , we demonstrate that a ccaat site located upstream of the pu.1 site between position -70 and -54 be involve in positive-negative regulation of the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter activity .
c/ebp alpha be the major ccaat/enhancer -binding protein ( c/ebp ) form bind to this site in nuclear extract of u937 cell .
point mutation of either the pu.1 site or the c/ebp site that abolish the binding of the respective factor result in a significant decrease of gm-csf receptor alpha promoter activity in myelomonocytic cell only .
furthermore , we demonstrate that in myeloid and b cell extract , pu.1 form a novel , specific , more slowly migrate complex ( pu-sf ) when bind the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter pu.1 site .
this be the first demonstration of a specific interaction with pu.1 on a myeloid pu.1 binding site .
the novel complex be distinct from that describe previously a bind to b cell enhancer site and can be form by addition of pu.1 to extract from certain nonmyeloid cell type which do not express pu.1 , include t cell and epithelial cell , but not from erythroid cell .
furthermore , we demonstrate that the pu-sf complex bind to pu.1 site find on a number of myeloid promoter , and it formation require an intact pu.1 site adjacent to a single-stranded region .
expression of pu.1 in nonmyeloid cell can activate the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter .
deletion of the amino-terminal region of pu.1 result in a failure to form the pu-sf complex and in a concomitant loss of transactivation , suggest that formation of the pu-sf complex be of functional importance for the activity of the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter .
finally , we demonstrate that c/ebp alpha can also active the gm-csf receptor alpha promoter in nonmyeloid cell .
( abstract truncate at 400 word )
pax-5 encode the transcription factor bsap and be express in b lymphocyte , the develop cns , and adult testis .
bsap have be identify previously a a transcription factor that be express at early , but not late , stage of b-cell differentiation .
biochemical purification and cdna cloning have now reveal that bsap belong to the family of paired domain protein .
bsap be encode by the pax-5 gene and have be highly conserve between human and mouse .
an intact paired domain be show to be both necessary and sufficient for dna binding of bsap .
bind study with several bsap recognition sequence demonstrate that the sequence specificity of bsap differ from that of the distantly related paired domain protein pax-1 .
during embryogenesis , the bsap gene be transiently express in the mesencephalon and spinal cord with a spatial and temporal expression pattern that be distinct from that of other pax gene in the develop central nervous system ( cns ) .
later , the expression of the bsap gene shift to the fetal liver where it correlate with the onset of b lymphopoiesis .
bsap expression persist in b lymphocyte and be also see in the testis of the adult mouse .
all of this evidence indicate that the transcription factor bsap may not only play an important role in b-cell differentiation but also in neural development and spermatogenesis .
characterization of the human elk-1 promoter .
potential role of a downstream intronic sequence for elk-1 gene expression in monocyte .
to characterize the human elk-1 promoter , we map the transcriptional start site and isolate elk-1 -specific genomic phage clone that contain extensive upstream and downstream sequence .
a tata-like motif be identify immediately upstream of the transcriptional start site .
functional analysis of dna fragment contain the tata element and the identification of a dnase i-hypersensitive chromatin site ( h 1 ) in close proximity to the tata box suggest that the identify tata motif be important for elk-1 transcription in vivo .
sequence upstream and downstream from the tata box be find to contribute to elk-1 promoter activity .
a second hypersensitive site ( h 2 ) be identify within the first intron in pre-monocytic cell , which express elk-1 only when differentiate to monocyte .
in a variety of other cell type , which display a constitutive elk-1 expression , h 2 do not exist , suggest that inducibility of elk-1 expression be associate with the presence of h 2 .
egr-1 and the serum response factor be find to interact specifically with the intronic sequence at +265 and +448 , respectively .
because egr-1 mrna and protein level be observe to increase significantly before induction of elk-1 expression , we propose that egr-1 be important for the regulation of elk-1 transcription in differentiate monocyte .
il-1 receptor and tcr signal synergize to activate nf-kappa b -mediated gene transcription .
previous study have demonstrate that il-1 receptor ( il-1r ) - and tcr -initiated signal can interact synergistically to increase the rate of transcription of several lymphokine and lymphokine receptor gene during the competence phase of the activation program in t helper lymphocyte .
in this report we describe how signal initiate through the type i il-1r interact with signal from the antigen receptor to synergistically augment the transactivating property of nf-kappa b .
the synergistic antigen receptor initiated signal be mediate through protein kinase c because they can be mimic by the phorbol ester , 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate , but not with calcium ionophores ; and be staurosporine sensitive but cyclosporine resistant .
gel shift analysis demonstrate that nf-kappa b nuclear translocation be stimulate primarily by il-1 rather than by antigen receptor signal .
western blot and phosphorylation analysis demonstrate that the synergistic effect on nf-kappa b functional activity be independent of i kappa b alpha ( mad3 ) - nf-kappa b dissociation in the cytosol and be not associate with i kappa b nuclear translocation .
the il-1 -induced nf-kappa b dna nuclear localization be transient and can be prolonged either by an antigen receptor-initiated signal or by inhibit protein synthesis .
these result suggest that il-1 induce both nf-kappa b nuclear translocation and the synthesis of a protein ( s ) responsible for terminate nf-kappa b -dna interaction in the nucleus .
antigen receptor signal prolong nf-kappa b -dna interaction , probably by functionally antagonize the il-1 -induced synthesis of a protein ( s ) responsible for the transient nf-kappa b -dna interaction and consequently synergistically enhance il-1 -induced nf-kappa b -dependent gene transcription .
the control of lytic replication of epstein-barr virus in b lymphocyte ( review ) .
uncontrolled replication of a virus , which be harmful to the host be also disadvantageous to the virus .
most virus can not compete with the various immune mechanism and become eliminate in the course of infection .
therefore , only the time between infection and eradication remain for these virus to proliferate .
a few virus , like the herpesviruses or the papillomaviruses , however , have develop a sophisticated strategy for persist lifelong , usually asymptomatically in the host , hide from the immune system and produce infectious progeny at the same time .
this strategy depend on a separation of latency and the lytic replication , either by time due to differentiation-dependent mechanism or by spatial separation a the result of different host cell type .
both be true for the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) .
b cell and epithelial cell have a pivotal role in the life cycle of the virus .
the former can become latently infected and be think to be the virus reservoir in vivo , whereas the latter be show to be permissive for lytic replication .
however , replication of ebv in vivo be control primarily by host immune mechanism select for cell that be not permissive for viral replication a the result of a particular set of transcription factor .
these factor control the activity of the regulatory immediate-early gene and , in addition , lytic and latent cycle regulatory gene negatively interfere with each other and thus link cellular and viral gene regulatory mechanism .
disturbance of both the immune surveillance as well a viral gene regulation may result in ebv -associated disease .
no evidence for the expression of the progesterone receptor on peripheral blood lymphocyte during pregnancy [ see comment ]
the expression of the progesterone receptor in human peripheral blood lymphocyte be analyse , use an enzyme linked immunosorbent assay ( abbott pgr-eia monoclonal ) , in order to evaluate it prognostic character in the context of spontaneous abortion .
cytosol be prepare from lymphocyte of 24 healthy pregnant woman ( 11 first , 10 second and three third trimester ) , seven healthy non-pregnant woman , nine woman with recurrent spontaneous abortion , and six healthy men .
in addition , a human breast carcinoma cell line ( zr-75-1 ) , which express the progesterone receptor , be analyse throughout .
the zr-75-1 cell line show an expression of 642 fmol/mg whereas lymphocyte of pregnant woman show an expression < or = 4 fmol/mg .
lymphocyte of non-pregnant woman , woman with threaten pre-term delivery , and men show equivalent level : 3 +/- 1 , 3 +/- 2 and 5 +/- 4 fmol/mg respectively .
these result show that there be no evidence of specific expression of the progesterone receptor in pregnancy and exclude any prognostic character in spontaneous abortion .
a role for the progesterone receptor in the mechanism of the known effect of progesterone on peripheral blood lymphocyte be also exclude .
involvement of mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway in interleukin-8 production by human monocyte and polymorphonuclear cell stimulate with lipopolysaccharide or mycoplasma fermentans membrane lipoprotein .
interleukin-8 ( il-8 ) be a chemokine that belong to the alpha-chemokine or cxc subfamily and be produce by a wide variety of human cell , include monocyte and polymorphonuclear cell ( pmn ) .
il-8 be secrete in response to inflammatory stimulus , notably bacterial product such a lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , but little be know about the mechanism by which these agent mediate il-8 induction .
in this report , we show that mycoplasma fermentans lipid-associated membrane protein ( lampf ) induce the production of high level of il-8 by thp-1 ( human monocyte ) cell and pmn at the same extent a lp .
it be previously demonstrate that stimulation of monocytic cell with either lp or lampf lead to a series of common downstream signaling event , include the activation of protein tyrosine kinase and of mitogen-activated protein kinase cascade .
by use pd-98059 and sb203580 , two potent and selective inhibitor of mek1 ( a kinase upstream of erk1/2 ) and p38 , respectively , we have demonstrate that both erk1/2 and p38 cascade play a key role in the production of il-8 by monocyte and pmn stimulate with bacterial fraction .
regulation of cytokine and cytokine receptor expression by glucocorticoid .
glucocorticoid ( gc ) profoundly inhibit several aspect of t cell immunity largely through inhibition of cytokine expression at the transcriptional and posttranscriptional level .
gc be also report to act indirectly by induce transform growth factor-beta expression , which in turn block t cell immunity .
in exert their antiproliferative effect , gc diffuse into target cell where they bind their cytoplasmic receptor , which in turn translocate to the nucleus where it inhibit transcription of cytokine gene through direct binding to the glucocorticoid response element ( gre ) , which be located in the promoter region of cytokine gene or , alternatively , through antagonism of the action of transcription factor require for optimal transcriptional activation .
in contrast to their inhibitory effect on cytokine expression , gc up-regulate cytokine receptor expression that correlate with enhance cytokine effect on target cell .
in this review , we summarize the current state of knowledge of the mechanism of action of gc , include the phenomenon of steroid-induced rebound , which ensue upon gc withdrawal .
overproduction of nfkb2 ( lyt-10 ) and c-rel : a mechanism for htlv-i tax -mediated trans-activation via the nf-kappa b signalling pathway .
molecular , biochemical and epidemiological evidence implicate htlv-i a an etiologic agent of adult t cell leukemia ( atl ) .
the tax protein of htlv-i , a positive transcriptional activator of htlv-i gene expression , be a viral oncogene that also increase transcription of cellular gene include gm-csf , il-2r alpha and il-2 .
one of the cellular target of the trans-activating effect of tax be the nf-kappa b /rel family of transcription factor , pleiotropic regulator of immunoregulatory , cytokine and viral gene expression .
in this report , we demonstrate that nfkb2 ( lyt-10 ) and c-rel be overexpressed in htlv-i infected and tax-expressing cell and , together , account for the majority of the constitutive nf-kappa b binding activity in these cell before and after pma stimulation .
most importantly , we show a tax -dependent correlation between expression of nfkb2 ( p100 ) and processing to the dna binding nfkb2 ( p52 ) form , induction of c-rel , and trans-activation of nf-kappa b -mediated gene expression .
furthermore , the nfkb2 precursor be physically associate with c-rel and with tax in htlv-i infected cell .
we propose that nfkb2 synthesis and processing allow continuous nuclear expression of an otherwise cytoplasmic protein and , in conjunction with overexpression of c-rel , nfkb2 alter the nf-kappa b signalling pathway and contribute to leukemic transformation of t cell by htlv-i .
inhibition of alpha interferon but not gamma interferon signal transduction by phorbol ester be mediate by a tyrosine phosphatase .
previous study have indicate that the expression of viral oncoproteins , cell transformation , or phorbol ester treatment of cell can inhibit alpha/beta interferon ( ifn-alpha/beta ) -induced gene expression .
the mechanism by which these promoter of cell growth exert their inhibitory effect vary , but in most instance they involve a disruption of the ifn-alpha/beta-induced transcription complex isgf3 such that the dna-binding component of this complex ( the 48-kda isgf3gamma protein ) do not bind to the interferon-stimulated response element ( isre ) .
in this report , we demonstrate that phorbol ester treatment of human peripheral blood monocyte dramatically inhibit activation of ifn-alpha/b-stimulated early response gene but by a mechanism which do not involve abrogation of the isre binding of isgf3gamma .
phorbol ester treatment of monocyte inhibit ifn alpha-stimulated tyrosine phosphorylation of the transcription factor stat1alpha , stat2 , and stat3 and of the tyrosine kinase tyk2 but have no effect on ifn-gamma activation of stat1alpha .
ifnalpha-stimulated tyrosine phosphorylation of jak1 and the alpha subunit of the ifn-alpha receptor be unaffected by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) .
moreover , pma cause the dephosphorylation of tyk2 but not of jak1 , which be activate by ifn .
pretreatment of cell with vanadate prevent the effect of pma with regard to pma -induced tyk2 dephosphorylation .
these observation suggest that pma exert it inhibitory effect by activation of a tyrosine phosphatase which selectively regulate tyk2 but not jak1 activity .
cross-linking cd40 on b cell rapidly activate nuclear factor-kappa b .
the b cell-associated surface molecule cd40 function to regulate b cell response .
cross-linking cd40 on b cell can lead to homotypic cell adhesion , il-6 production , and , in combination with cytokine , to ig isotype switching .
tyrosine kinase activity be increase shortly after engagement of this receptor .
little be know about how the very early event induce by cd40 cross-linking link to cellular response .
in this study , we demonstrate that nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b and nf-kappa b-like transcription factor be activate after cross-linking cd40 on rest human tonsillar b cell and on b cell line .
the activation be rapid and be mediate through a tyrosine kinase-dependent pathway .
the complex detect in electrophoretic mobility shift assay contain p50 , p65 ( rela ) , c-rel , and most likely other component .
by use transient transfection assay , we find that cross-linking cd40 support nf-kappa b -dependent gene expression .
our result define the nf-kappa b system a an intermediate event in cd40 signaling and suggest that the cd40 pathway can influence the expression of b cell-associated gene with nf-kappa b consensus site .
[ regulation of intracellular cholesterol synthesis in hypercholesterolemia by glucocorticoid ]
the rate of endogenous cholesterol synthesis in blood lymphocyte and skin fibroblast from patient with type iia hyperlipidemia be find to be increase in comparison with healthy donor .
the cell of hyperlipidemic patient have lowered level of glucocorticoid receptor concomitantly with a partial loss of their sensitivity to glucocorticoid .
in fibroblast from patient with hereditary hypercholesteremia of homozygous type the number of glucocorticoid receptor do not exceed 10 % of their content in normal cell .
the decrease of the number of glucocorticoid receptor in patient with type iia hyperlipidemia seem to be a compensatory response of cell culminate in activation of endogenous cholesterol synthesis .
inhibition of activation of transcription factor ap-1 by cd28 signalling in human t-cells .
co-stimulation of t-lymphocytes by t-cell receptor ( tcr ) occupancy and activation of the cd28 surface molecule result in enhance proliferation and interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) production .
the increase in il-2 gene expression trigger by cd28 involve a kappa b-like sequence in the 5'-regulatory region of the il-2 promoter , call cd28 -responsive element .
stimulation of t-cells by agonistic anti- cd28 antibody in conjunction with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) - or tcr -derived signal induce the enhance activation of the transcription factor nf-kappa b .
here we report that cd28 engagement , however , exert opposite effect on the transcription factor ap-1 .
whereas anti- cd28 together with pma increase the dna binding and trans-activation activity of nf-kappa b , pma -induced activation of ap-1 be significantly suppress .
the inhibitory effect exert by anti- cd28 be observe at the level of dna binding as well a in functional reporter-gene assay .
these result suggest that the two transcription factor be independently regulate and may perform different function during t-cell activation .
analysis of oct2-isoform expression in lipopolysaccharide -stimulated b lymphocyte .
oct2-isoform expression in splenic b cell stimulate with lipopolysaccharide or lipopolysaccharide plus phorbol-di-butyrate be analyse by cdna cloning .
the frequency of oct2-positive clone be 1/15,000 in both library .
two new isoforms be find that generate novel amino- or carboxy- terminal sequence .
an isoform lack exon 11 destroy the carboxy-terminal leucin-zipper region and introduce a frame shift create a novel , proline -rich carboxy terminus .
a new exon contain a highly basic region ( 4c ) be characterize , between exon 4 and 5 .
this exon be insert between glutamine-rich region 2 and 3 , carboxy terminal of a tentative leucine-zipper structure .
in addition , a new combination isoform contain oct2a 's amino terminal insert ( exon 7a ) and oct2b 's carboxy terminal insert ( exon 13 ) be find that create a novel large isoform , oct2ab .
more frequent use of the classical oct2a and oct2b isoforms be observe in the lipopolysaccharide -stimulated b cell , while a preference for the oct2ab and oct2ba isoforms be observe in lipopolysaccharide plus phorbol-di-butyrate -treated cell .
b-lymphoblastoid cell line from multiple sclerosis patient and a healthy control produce a putative new human retrovirus and epstein-barr virus .
on several occasion we have observe retrovirus-like particle ( rvlps ) by transmission electron microscopy ( em ) of culture t cell from a patient with m .
later we establish spontaneously form b-lymphoblastoid cell line ( lcls ) from a patient with an m -like disease and from another patient with m who have a reactivate epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) infection .
both lcls be find by em to produce rvlp and ebv particle .
reverse transcriptase ( rt ) assay be positive in purify viral material from both lcls .
to substantiate these finding we initiate an intensify culturing procedure and be able to establish lcls from 5 out of 21 consecutive m patient and 1 out of 13 consecutive healthy control .
all lcls be find to produce both rvlp and ebv particle by em .
whether the putative new retrovirus ( e ) and ebv have any causal relationship to m be still not know , but the finding support this possibility .
comparative mapping of sry in the great ape .
cytogenetic study of the primate y chromosome have suggest that extensive rearrangement have occur during evolution of the great ape .
we have use in situ hybridization to define these rearrangement at the molecular level .
phu-14 , a probe include sequence from the sex determining gene sry , hybridize close to the early replicate pseudoautosomal segment in a telomeric or subtelomeric position of the y chromosome of all great ape .
the low copy repeat detect by the probe fr35-ii be obviously include in y chromosomal rearrangement during hominid evolution .
these result , combine with previous study , suggest that the y chromosome in great ape have a conserve region include the pseudoautosomal region and the testis-determining region .
the rest of the y chromosome have undergo several rearrangement in the different great ape .
a novel mitogen-inducible gene product related to p50/p105-nf-kappa b participate in transactivation through a kappa b site .
a rel-related , mitogen-inducible , kappa b-binding protein have be clone a an immediate-early activation gene of human peripheral blood t cell .
the cdna have an open reading frame of 900 amino acid capable of encode a 97-kda protein .
this protein be most similar to the 105-kda precursor polypeptide of p50-nf-kappa b .
like the 105-kda precursor , it contain an amino-terminal rel-related domain of about 300 amino acid and a carboxy-terminal domain contain six full cell cycle or ankyrin repeat .
in vitro-translated protein , truncate downstream of the rel domain and exclude the repeat , bind kappa b site .
we refer to the kappa b-binding , truncate protein a p50b by analogy with p50-nf-kappa b and to the full-length protein a p97 .
p50b be able to form heteromeric kappa b-binding complex with relb , as well a with p65 and p50 , the two subunit of nf-kappa b .
transient-transfection experiment in embryonal carcinoma cell demonstrate a functional cooperation between p50b and relb or p65 in transactivation of a reporter plasmid dependent on a kappa b site .
the data imply the existence of a complex family of nf-kappa b -like transcription factor .
various mode of basic helix-loop-helix protein -mediated regulation of murine leukemia virus transcription in lymphoid cell line .
the transcriptionally regulatory region of the lymphomagenic akv and sl3-3 murine leukemia retrovirus ( mlvs ) contain two type of e-box consensus motif , cagatg .
one type , ea/s , be located in the upstream promoter region , and the other , e ( gre ) , be located in a tandem repeat with enhancer property .
we have examine the requirement of the individual e-boxes in mlv transcriptional regulation .
in lymphoid cell line only , the e ( gre ) -binding protein complex include alf1 or heb and e2a basic helix-loop-helix protein .
ectopic alf1 and e2a protein require intact e ( gre ) motif for mediate transcriptional activation .
alf1 transactivated transcription of akv mlv through the two e ( gre ) motif equally , whereas e2a protein require the promoter-proximal e ( gre ) motif .
in t- and b- cell line , the e ( gre ) motif be of major importance for akv mlv transcriptional activity , while the ea/s motif have some effect .
in contrast , neither e ( gre ) nor ea/s motif contribute pronouncedly to akv mlv transcription in nih 3t3 cell lack dna-binding alf1 or heb and e2a protein .
the id1 protein be find to repress alf1 activity in vitro and in vivo .
moreover , ectopic id1 repress e ( gre ) -directed but not ea/s -directed mlv transcription in lymphoid cell line .
in conclusion , e ( gre ) motif and interact basic helix-loop-helix protein be important determinant for mlv transcriptional activity in lymphocytic cell line .
reconstitution of t cell antigen receptor-induced erk2 kinase activation in lck-negative jcam1 cell by syk .
the two related protein- tyrosine kinase syk and zap be rapidly phosphorylated on tyrosine residue and enzymatically activate upon crosslinking of the t cell antigen receptor .
we have previously report that the activation of syk be less dependent on the src family kinase lck than the activation of zap .
here we report that overexpression of syk in the lck -negative jcam1 cell enable the t cell antigen receptor /cd3 complex to induce a normal activation of the mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) pathway and expression of a nuclear factor of activate t cell reporter construct .
in contrast , zap and other protein- tyrosine kinase be unable to reconstitute these signaling pathway when express at the same level .
in parallel , syk be phosphorylated on tyrosine , while zap be not .
the syk -mediated t cell antigen receptor -induced mapk activation be detectable within 1 min of receptor stimulation and peak at 3-5 min .
the capacity of syk to reconstitute the mapk response require the catalytic activity of syk , an intact autophosphorylation site ( y518 and y519 ) , both src homology 2 domain and it be block by the inhibitory n17-mutated dominant-negative ra construct .
a y341 --> f mutant of syk , which be deficient in it interaction with phospholipase cy1 and vav , be less efficient than wild-type syk .
our result suggest that syk , in contrast to zap , can transduce signal from the t cell antigen receptor independently of lck .
an acute myeloid leukemia gene , aml1 , regulate transcriptional activation and hemopoietic myeloid cell differentiation antagonistically by two alternative spliced form .
the aml1 gene on chromosome 21 be disrupt in the (8;21)(q22;q22) and (3;21)(q26;q22) translocation associate with myelogenous leukemia and encode a dna-binding protein .
from aml1 gene , two representative form of protein , aml1a and aml1b , be produce by an alternative splicing .
both form have dna-binding domain , but aml1a lack a putative transcriptional activation domain which aml1b have .
here we demonstrate that aml1a , which solely have no effect a a transcriptional regulator , dominantly suppress transcriptional activation by aml1b , and that aml1a exhibit the high affinity for dna-binding than aml1b .
furthermore a dominant negative form of aml1 , aml1a , totally suppress granulocytic differentiation otherwise induce by granulocyte colony-stimulating factor when aml1a be overexpressed in 32dc13 murine myeloid cell .
such differentiation block by aml1a be cancel by the concomitant overexpression of aml1b .
these data strongly suggest that a transcriptionally active form of aml1 be essential for the myeloid cell differentiation .
in addition , we observe an altered expression level of aml1 along with the myeloid differentiation in several hemopoietic cell line .
in these case , at least , the aml1 expression level be a potential regulator for myeloid cell differentiation .
oxidative stress suppress transcription factor activity in stimulate lymphocyte .
effect of oxidative stress on stimulation-dependent signal transduction , lead to il-2 expression , be study .
purify quiescent human blood t lymphocyte be subject to : ( i ) acute exposure to hydrogen peroxide ; ( ii ) chronic exposure to hydrogen peroxide ; and ( iii ) acute exposure to ionize radiation .
the cell be then stimulate for 6 h .
dna-binding activity ( determine by the electrophoretic mobility shift assay ) of three transcription factor : nfkappab , ap-1 and nfat , be abolish in the lymphocyte by all three mode of oxidative stress .
the lymphocyte exhibit lipid peroxidation only upon exposure to the low level of hydrogen peroxide use ( 20 microm ) .
all three mode of oxidative stress induce catalase activity in the lymphocyte .
the only exception be hydrogen peroxide at 20 microm , which do not induce catalase activity .
we conclude that : ( i ) suppression of specific transcription factor function can potentially serve a a marker of exposure to oxidative stress and it effect on human lymphocyte ; ( ii ) lipid peroxidation be only detectable in human lymphocyte upon exposure to weak oxidative stress which do not induce catalase activity ; ( iii ) therefore , transcription factor dna-binding activity be more sensitive to oxidative stress than lipid peroxidation .
naive ( cd45ra+ ) t lymphocyte be more sensitive to oxidative stress-induced signal than memory ( cd45ro+ ) cell .
formation of reactive oxygen intermediate ( roi ) after oxidative stress have be show to be an activation signal for t lymphocyte , e.g. , expression of il-2 and it receptor be induce .
these roi -induced effect can , to a large extent , be attribute to the activation of the transcription factor nf-kappab .
now we have examine whether naive and memory t lymphocyte differ in their sensitivity to roi -mediated signal .
when cd45ra+ ( naive ) and cd45ro+ ( memory ) t lymphocyte be directly stimulate with h2o2 , nf-kappab nuclear translocation be strong in naive cell than in memory cell and it could be induce with low dos .
the composition of the induce nuclear nf-kappab ( level of p50 and rela protein ) be similar in these cell type .
the magnitude and kinetics of intracellular roi be similar , suggest that there be no difference in roi -forming mechanism or antioxidative capacity .
the probable regulatory point be the cytoplasmic ikappab inhibitor : in cd45ra+ cell , h2o2 cause a more profound depression in the level of ikappab alpha .
these finding indicate that t cell represent different activation and/or differentiation stage can be differentially responsive to roi -mediated signal .
mip1 alpha nuclear protein ( mnp ) , a novel transcription factor express in hematopoietic cell that be crucial for transcription of the human mip-1 alpha gene .
murine macrophage inflammatory protein 1 alpha ( mip-1 alpha ) and it human equivalent ( gos19 , ld78 , or at464 ) be member of the -c-c family of low-molecular-weight chemokines .
secrete from activate t cell and macrophage , bone marrow-derived mip-1 alpha /gos19 inhibit primitive hematopoietic stem cell and appear to be involve in the homeostatic control of stem cell proliferation .
it also induce chemotaxis and inflammatory response in mature cell type .
therefore , it be important to understand the mechanism which control the expression of mip-1 alpha /gos19 .
previous work have show that in jurkat t cell , a set of widely express transcription factor ( the ick-1 family ) affect the gos19 promoter .
one member , ick-1a , behave a a strong negative regulator .
in this communication , we provide evidence that the pathway of induction in the macrophage cell line u937 be different from that in jurkat cell .
furthermore , we show that the ick-1 binding site do not confer negative regulation in u937 cell .
we provide evidence for an additional bind site , the mip-1 alpha nuclear protein ( mnp ) site , which overlap the ick-1 site .
interaction of nuclear extract from various cell line and tissue with the mnp site lead to the formation of fast-migrating protein-dna complex with similar but distinct electrophoretic mobility .
a mutation of the mnp site which do not abrogate ick-1 binding inactivate the gos19.1 promoter in u937 cell and reduce it activity by fourfold in jurkat cell .
we propose that the mnp protein ( s ) bind at the mnp site constitute a novel transcription factor ( s ) express in hematopoietic cell .
nuclear factor of activate t cell contain fo and jun .
the nuclear factor nf-at ( ref. 1 ) be induce in t cell stimulate through the t-cell receptor/cd3 complex , and be require for interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene induction .
although nf-at have not be clone or purify , there be evidence that it be a major target for immunosuppression by cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 ( ref 2-7 ) .
nf-at induction may require two activation-dependent event : the csa -sensitive translocation of a pre-existing component and the csa -resistant synthesis of a nuclear component .
here we report that the newly synthesize nuclear component of nf-at be the transcription factor ap-1 .
we show that the inducible nuclear form of nf-at contain fo and jun protein .
furthermore , we identify a pre-existing nf-at -binding factor that be present in hypotonic extract of unstimulated t cell .
on the basis of binding , reconstitution and cotransfection experiment , we propose that activation of nf-at occur in at least two stage : a csa -sensitive stage involve modification and/or translocation of the pre-existing nf-at complex , and a csa -insensitive stage involve the addition of newly synthesize fo or fos/jun protein to the pre-existing complex .
an element upstream from the human delta-globin-encoding gene specifically enhance beta-globin reporter gene expression in murine erythroleukemia cell .
we have previously show that a dna-binding factor specific to adult hematopoietic cell ( polypryrimidine-binding factor , pybf ) bind to a pyrimidine-rich region 1 kb upstream from the human delta-globin-encoding gene ( hbd ) .
the developmental stage-specificity of pybf and the location of it bind site between the fetal and adult beta-globin ( hbb ) -like gene suggest that pbyf and it bind site may function in fetal-to-adult globin gene switching .
here , we describe the effect of 383-bp ( delta383 ) and 99-bp ( delta99 ) sequence contain the pybf -binding site on transcription from various globin and non-globin promoter , use a transient assay with the cat reporter gene in murine erythroleukemia ( mel ) cell , a cell line with abundant pybf activity .
we show that both delta383 and delta99 specifically enhance expression of cat for plasmid contain a human adult globin ( hbb ) promoter , whereas expression of similar construct use human fetal ( a gamma- ) globin ( hbg1 ) or simian virus 40 ( sv40 ) promoter be not enhance .
the result suggest that pybf and the pyrimidine-rich region upstream from hbd can specifically enhance hbb transcription in adult erythroid cell .
regulation of the tissue factor gene in human monocytic cell .
role of ap-1 , nf-kappa b/rel , and sp1 protein in uninduced and lipopolysaccharide -induced expression .
tissue factor ( tf ) expression by peripheral blood monocyte during sepsis initiate intravascular thrombosis .
bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) rapidly induce tf gene transcription in monocyte .
the human tf promoter contain bind site for the transcription factor ap-1 , c-rel/p65 , egr-1 , and sp1 .
nf-kappa b/rel protein have be show to physically interact with both ap-1 and sp1 protein .
in this study , we investigate the role of these transcription factor in uninduced and lp -induced tf gene expression in human monocytic thp-1 cell .
deletional analysis indicate that five sp1 site mediate basal expression in uninduced cell .
the two ap-1 site bind c-fos /c-jun heterodimers in both unstimulated and lps-stimulated cell .
maximal lp induction of the tf promoter require the two ap-1 site and the kappa b site within the lp response element .
disruption of the conserve spacing between the proximal ap-1 site and the kappa b site abolish lp induction .
replacement of the two ap-1 site with intrinsically bent dna partially restore lp induction , suggest an additional structural role for the ap-1 site .
synergistic transactivation of the lp response element in drosophila schneider cell by coexpression of c-fos , c-jun , c-rel , and p65 or c-jun and p65 require the transactivation domain of c-jun and p65 .
these data indicate that c-fos /c-jun , c-rel /p65 , and sp1 regulate tf gene expression in human monocytic cell .
structure and expression of the human gata3 gene .
gata3 , a member of the gata family that be abundantly express in the t-lymphocyte lineage , be think to participate in t-cell receptor gene activation through binding to enhancer .
to understand gata3 gene regulation , we clone the human gene and the 5' end of the mouse gata3 gene .
we show that the human gata3 gene contain six exon distribute over 17 kb of dna .
the two human gata3 zinc finger be encode by two separate exon highly conserve with those of gata1 , but no other structural homology between these two gene can be find .
the human and mouse gata3 transcription unit start at a major initiation site .
the promoter sequence analysis of these two gene reveal that they be embedded within a cpg island and share structural feature often find in the promoter of housekeeping gene .
finally , we show that a dna fragment contain the human gata3 transcription unit , 3 kb upstream from the initiation site and 4 kb downstream from the polyadenylation site , display t-cell specificity .
the activation of the jak2 /stat5 pathway be commonly involve in signaling through the human il-5 receptor .
the jak ( janus kinase ) family of protein tyrosine kinase and the stats ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) have be show to be activate in response to a number of cytokine and growth factor .
in this study , we evaluate the activation of jak /stat pathway upon human interleukin-5 ( hil-5 ) stimulation of two different hil-5 -responsive cell line , hil-5 receptor alpha-subunit ( hil-5r alpha ) cdna-transfected tf-1 ( tf-h5r alpha ) and butyric-acid -treated yy-1 ( yy-bu ) , and peripheral eosinophil .
immunoprecipitation and electrophoretic mobility shift analysis reveal that tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 and activation of stat5 be induce upon stimulation with hil-5 in all three cell type , while stat1 activation be only observe in eosinophil .
these result indicate that jak2 /stat5 activation be a common jak /stat pathway for hil-5 -mediated signal in these cell .
orip be essential for ebna gene promoter activity in epstein-barr virus-immortalized lymphoblastoid cell line .
during epstein-barr virus latent infection of b lymphocyte in vitro , six viral nuclear antigen ( ebnas ) be express from one of two promoter , cp or wp , whose activity be mutually exclusive .
upon infection , wp be initially active , follow by a switch to cp for the duration of latency .
in this study , the region upstream of cp be analyze for the presence of ci element involve in regulate the activity of the ebna gene promoter in established in vitro immortalize lymphoblastoid cell line ( lcls ) .
it be determine that orip , the origin for episomal maintenance during latency , be essential for efficient transcription initiation from either cp or wp in lcls , as well a in some burkitt 's lymphoma cell line .
deletion of the ebna2-dependent enhancer located upstream of cp result in a ca. two- to fivefold reduction in cp activity in the lcls assay .
more extensive deletion of sequence upstream of cp , include the ebna2-dependent enhancer , result in nearly complete loss of cp activity .
this loss of activity be show to correlate with deletion of two ccaat box , a proximal ccaat box located at bp -61 to -65 and a distal ccaat box located at bp -253 to -257 , upstream of cp .
site-directed mutagenesis of these ci element demonstrate that cp activity be highly dependent on the presence of a properly position ccaat box , with the dependence on the distal ccaat box apparent only when the proximal ccaat box be delete or mutate .
deletion of the glucocorticoid response element located at ca. bp -850 upstream of cp do not result in a significant loss in activity .
in general , deletion which diminish cp activity result in induction of wp activity , consistent with suppression of wp activity by transcriptional interference from cp .
the identification of orip and the ebna2-dependent enhancer a the major positive ci element involve in regulate cp activity in lcl suggest that ebna gene transcription be largely autoregulated by ebna 1 and ebna 2 .
uneven x inactivation in a female monozygotic twin pair with fabry disease and discordant expression of a novel mutation in the alpha-galactosidase a gene .
we describe two female monozygotic ( mz ) twin heterozygous for fabry disease , an x link disorder result from the deficient activity of alpha-galactosidase a .
while one of the twin be clinically affect , the other be asymptomatic .
enzymatic assay of alpha-galactosidase in blood leucocyte , skin fibroblast , epstein-barr virus transform lymphoid cell line , and hair follicle of the twin and their parent confirm the heterozygous status of the twin and indicate that fabry disease have occur a a result of a de novo mutation .
the son of the unaffected twin sister be show to be hemizygous .
molecular analysis of the alpha-galactosidase a gene permit the identification of an as yet undescribed point mutation at position 10182 of exon 5 which cause an asp to asn substitution at codon 231 .
single strand conformation polymorphism ( sscp ) analysis again show the heterozygous status of the twin and a normal pattern in their parent .
the basis for the discordant expression of this d novo mutation in the twin be investigate by study their x inactivation status .
analysis of the inactive x specific methylation at the androgen receptor gene show unbalanced inactivation in the twin ' fibroblast and in opposite direction .
while the maternally derive x chromosome be preferentially active in the asymptomatic twin , the paternal x chromosome be active in the other , affect twin and be find in her hemizygotic nephew .
these data suggest that the paternal x chromosome carry the de novo alpha-galactosidase a mutation and that uneven x inactivation be the underlie mechanism for disease expression in this novel female mz twin pair .
this be the first document case of female twin discordant for fabry disease .
association of traf1 , traf2 , and traf3 with an epstein-barr virus lmp1 domain important for b-lymphocyte transformation : role in nf-kappab activation .
the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) transform protein lmp1 appear to be a constitutively activate tumor necrosis factor receptor ( tnfr ) on the basis of an intrinsic ability to aggregate in the plasma membrane and an association of it cytoplasmic carboxyl terminus ( ct ) with tnfr -associated factor ( trafs ) .
we now show that in ebv-transformed b lymphocyte most of traf1 or traf3 and 5 % of traf2 be associate with lmp1 and that most of lmp1 be associate with traf1 or traf3 .
traf1 , traf2 , and traf3 bind to a single site in the lmp1 ct correspond to amino acid ( aa ) 199 to 214 , within a domain which be important for b-lymphocyte growth transformation ( aa 187 to 231 ) .
further deletional and alanine mutagenesis analysis and comparison with traf binding sequence in cd40 , in cd30 , and in the lmp1 of other lymphycryptoviruses provide the first evidence that pxqxt/s be a core traf binding motif .
the negative effect of point mutation in the lmp1 (1-231) core traf binding motif on traf binding and nf-kappab activation genetically link the trafs to lmp1 (1-231)-mediated nf-kappab activation .
nf-kappab activation by lmp1 (1-231) be likely to be mediate by traf1 /traf2 heteroaggregates since traf1 be unique among the trafs in coactivating nf-kappab with lmp1 (1-231) , a traf2 dominant-negative mutant can block lmp1 (1-231)-mediated nf-kappab activation as well a traf1 coactivation , and 30 % of traf2 be associate with traf1 in ebv-transformed b cell .
traf3 be a negative modulator of lmp1 (1-231)-mediated nf-kappab activation .
surprisingly , traf 1 , -2 , or -3 do not interact with the terminal lmp1 ct aa 333 to 386 which can independently mediate nf-kappab activation .
the constitutive association of trafs with lmp1 through the aa 187 to 231 domain which be important in nf-kappab activation and primary b-lymphocyte growth transformation implicate traf aggregation in lmp1 signaling .
interleukin-5 signaling in human eosinophil involve jak2 tyrosine kinase and stat1 alpha .
signaling by a wide variety of cytokine , include interferon , interleukin , and growth factor , involve activation of jak kinase and stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) protein .
at present , not much be know about the molecular mechanism by which interleukin-5 ( il-5 ) exert it diverse biologic effect .
human eosinophil be one of the most important target cell for il-5 and be use here to study il-5 signaling in a primary human cell .
il-5 induce rapid and transient tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 .
moreover , il-5 induce at least two dna-binding complex , use nuclear extract from normal human eosinophil and the il-6/interferon-gamma response element of the icam-1 promoter ( icam-1 pire ) in an electromobility shift assay .
from supershift experiment it be conclude that one dna-binding complex contain stat1 alpha , probably a a homodimer .
both dna-binding complex be inhibit by a phosphotyrosine antibody ( 4g10 ) , suggest that tyrosine phosphorylation be require for complex formation .
il-3 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor induce , similar to il-5 , two dna-binding complex in human eosinophil , include stat1 alpha .
these data show for the first time that molecular mechanism of il-5 signaling in human eosinophil involve member of the jak kinase family as well a member of the stat family .
p21ras initiate rac-1 but not phosphatidyl inositol 3 kinase /pkb , mediate signaling pathway in t lymphocyte .
p21ras be activate by the t cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) and then coordinate important signaling pathway for t lymphocyte activation .
effector pathway for this guanine nucleotide binding protein in t cell be mediate by the serine/threonine kinase raf-1 and the ras-related gtpase rac-1 .
in fibroblast , an important effector for the ra oncogene be phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase ( ptdins 3-kinase ) .
activation of this lipid kinase be able to induce critical rac-1 signaling pathway and can couple p21ras to cell survival mechanism via the serine /threonine kinase akt/pkb .
the role of ptdins 3-kinase in ra signaling in t cell have not be explore .
in the present study , we examine the ability of ptdins 3-kinase to initiate the rac-1 signaling pathway important for t cell activation .
we also examine the possibility that akt/pkb be regulate by ra signaling pathway in t lymphocyte .
the result show that ra can initiate a rac-1 mediated pathway that regulate the transcriptional function of ap-1 complex .
ptdins 3-kinase signal can not mimic p21ras and induce the rac mediated response of ap-1 transcriptional activation .
moreover , neither tcr or ra activation of ap-1 be dependent on ptdins 3-kinase .
pkb be activate in response to triggering of the t cell antigen receptor ; ptdins 3-kinase activity be both require and sufficient for this tcr response .
in contrast , p21ras signal be unable to induce akt/pkb activity in t cell nor be ra function require for akt/pkb activation in response to the tcr .
the present data thus highlight that ptdins 3-kinase and akt/pkb be not universal ra effector molecule .
ra can initiate rac-1 regulated signaling pathway in the context of t cell antigen receptor function independently of ptdins 3-kinase activity .
lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor : predictor of sertraline response in adolescent major depressive disorder ( mdd ) .
major depressive disorder ( mdd ) in adolescent demonstrate resistance to tricyclic antidepressant and absence of hypercortisolemia .
the efficacy of serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( sris ) be uncertain , and response predictor be unavailable .
abnormal fast feedback and negative feedback of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis implicate a dampened limbic-hippocampal glucocorticoid type ii receptor ( gcii ) .
we hypothesize that lymphocyte gcii be alter in adolescent mdd and could serve a a marker for response to sris .
in an open-label study , adolescent ( n = 20 ) meet dsm-iii-r criterion for mdd show baseline lymphocyte gcii site per cell ( sites/cell ) value of 793 +/- 106 versus 2 , 563 +/- 499 ( +/- sem ) for match control ( n = 18 ) ( t = 3.5 ; df = 36 ; p < .001 ) .
gcii be bimodally distribute , with sri responder differ from nonresponders ( t = 3.9 ; df = 14 ; p < .001 ) .
gcii accurately classify 90 percent of sertraline responder and 80 percent of nonresponders .
only sri responder show gcii sites/cell upregulated after 6 week of treatment ( t = 2.1 , df = 10 ; p < .05 ) .
cell-type-specific transactivation of the parathyroid hormone-related protein gene promoter by the human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) tax and htlv-ii tax protein .
the human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) and htlv-ii tax protein be potent transactivators of viral and cellular gene expression .
use deletion mutant , the downstream parathyroid hormone-related protein ( pthrp ) promoter be show to be responsive to both htlv-i and htlv-ii tax as well a the ap1/c-jun proto-oncogene .
transactivation of pthrp by tax be see in t cell but not in b-cell line or fibroblast .
a carboxy terminal tax deletion mutant be deficient in transactivation of both the pthrp and il2r alpha promoter but not the htlv-i long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
exogenous provision of nfkb rescue il2r alpha expression but not the pthrp promoter .
thus , htlv-i tax , htlv-ii tax , and c-jun transactivate pthrp and may contribute to the pathogenesis of hypercalcemia in adult t-cell leukemia .
the synthesis and immunogenicity of varicella-zoster virus glycoprotein e and immediate-early protein ( ie62 ) express in recombinant herpes simplex virus-1 .
in order to evaluate the condition for optimal expression and immunogenicity of varicella-zoster virus ( vzv ) protein in a herpes simplex virus-1 ( hsv-1 ) vector , we select the vzv glycoprotein e ( ge ) , encode by orf 68 and the vzv product of orf 62 , an immediate-early major tegument protein ( ie62 ) .
