immunoblot analysis and immunoperoxidase staining of infected cell monolayers demonstrate vector expression of vzv protein .
follow intracranial inoculation in mouse , both vzv ge-hsv ( tk ) and vzv ie62-hsv ( gc ) induce an igg response against vzv ge or vzv ie62 .
when test in cytotoxicity assay use t-lymphocytes from vzv immune human donor , the range of precursor frequency for t-lymphocytes that recognize vzv ge or vzv ie62 be similar whether these protein be express by hsv-1 or a vaccinia vector .
these experiment demonstrate that hsv-1 be a competent vector for expression of these vzv protein and support the feasibility of engineer a combined vaccine for these closely related alpha-herpesviruses .
effect of interleukin-10 on human peripheral blood mononuclear cell response to cryptococcus neoformans , candida albicans , and lipopolysaccharide .
deactivation of mononuclear phagocyte be critical to limit the inflammatory response but can be detrimental in the face of progressive infection .
we compare the effect of the deactivate cytokine interleukin 10 ( il-10 ) on human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) response to lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , cryptococcus neoformans , and candida albicans .
il-10 effect dose-dependent inhibition of tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf-alpha ) release in pbmc stimulate by lp and c. neoformans , with significant inhibition see with 0.1 u/ml and great than 90 % inhibition note with 10 u/ml .
in contrast , even at dos as high a 100 u/ml , il-10 inhibit tnf-alpha release in response to c. albicans by only 50 % .
il-10 profoundly inhibit release of il-1beta from pbmc stimulate by all three stimulus .
tnf-alpha mrna and release be inhibit even if il-10 be add up to 8 h after cryptococcal stimulation .
in contrast , inhibition of il-1 beta mrna be of less magnitude and occur only when il-10 be add within 2 h of cryptococcal stimulation .
il-10 inhibit translocation of nf-kappab in response to lp but not the fungal stimulus .
all three stimulus induce il-10 production in pbmc , although over 10-fold less il-10 be release in response to c. neoformans compare with lp and c. albicans .
thus , while il-10 have deactivate effect on pbmc response to all three stimulus , disparate stimulus- and response-specific pattern of deactivation be see .
inhibition by il-10 of proinflammatory cytokine release appear to occur at the level of gene transcription for tnf-alpha and both transcriptionally and posttranscriptionally for il-1beta .
ectopic expression of a conditional gata-2/estrogen receptor chimera arrest erythroid differentiation in a hormone-dependent manner .
the gata factor be a family of transcriptional regulatory protein in eukaryote that share extensive homology in their dna-binding domain .
one enigmatic aspect of gata factor expression be that several gata protein , which ostensibly share the same dna-binding site specificity , be coexpressed in erythroid cell .
to elucidate the role of individual gata factor in erythropoiesis , conditional allele of gata-1 , gata-2 , and gata-3 be prepare by fuse each of the factor to the hormone-binding domain of the human estrogen receptor ( er ) .
these gata/er chimeric factor be show to be hormone-inducible trans-activating protein in transient transfection assay .
when stably introduce into primary erythroblast or conditionally transform erythroid progenitor cell , exogenous gata-2/er promote proliferation and inhibit terminal differentiation in an estrogen -dependent manner .
these phenotypic effect be specifically attributable to the action of ectopically express gata-2/er because erythroblast express exogenous gata-2 be constitutively arrest in differentiation and because erythroid progenitor express either gal/er or gata-3/er do not display a hormone-responsive block in differentiation .
thus , the gata-2 transcription factor appear to play a role in regulate the self-renewal capacity of early erythroid progenitor cell .
i kappa b/mad-3 mask the nuclear localization signal of nf-kappa b p65 and require the transactivation domain to inhibit nf-kappa b p65 dna binding .
the active nuclear form of the nf-kappa b transcription factor complex be compose of two dna binding subunit , nf-kappa b p65 and nf-kappa b p50 , both of which share extensive n-terminal sequence homology with the v-rel oncogene product .
the nf-kappa b p65 subunit provide the transactivation activity in this complex and serve a an intracellular receptor for a cytoplasmic inhibitor of nf-kappa b , term i kappa b .
in contrast , nf-kappa b p50 alone fail to stimulate kappa b-directed transcription , and base on prior in vitro study , be not directly regulate by i kappa b .
to investigate the molecular basis for the critical regulatory interaction between nf-kappa b and i kappa b/mad-3 , a series of human nf-kappa b p65 mutant be identify that functionally segregate dna binding , i kappa b -mediated inhibition , and i kappa b -induced nuclear exclusion of this transcription factor .
result from in vivo expression study perform with these nf-kappa b p65 mutant reveal the following : 1 ) i kappa b/mad-3 completely inhibit nf-kappa b p65 -dependent transcriptional activation mediate through the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 kappa b enhancer in human t lymphocyte , 2 ) the binding of i kappa b/mad-3 to nf-kappa b p65 be sufficient to retarget nf-kappa b p65 from the nucleus to the cytoplasm , 3 ) selective deletion of the functional nuclear localization signal present in the rel homology domain of nf-kappa b p65 disrupt it ability to engage i kappa b/mad-3 , and 4 ) the unique c-terminus of nf-kappa b p65 attenuate it own nuclear localization and contain sequence that be require for i kappa b -mediated inhibition of nf-kappa b p65 dna binding activity .
together , these finding suggest that the nuclear localization signal and transactivation domain of nf-kappa b p65 constitute a bipartite system that be critically involve in the inhibitory function of i kappa b/mad-3 .
unexpectedly , our in vivo study also demonstrate that i kappa b/mad-3 bind directly to nf-kappa b p50 .
this interaction be functional a it lead to retargeting of nf-kappa b p50 from the nucleus to the cytoplasm .
however , no loss of dna binding activity be observe , presumably reflect the unique c-terminal domain that be distinct from that present in nf-kappa b p65 .
the activation of the jak -stat 1 signaling pathway by il-5 in eosinophil .
the intracellular signal transduction of il-5 in eosinophil be unknown .
the objective of this study be to investigate the involvement of the newly discover jak -stat pathway in the il-5 signal transduction mechanism .

far , the immunoprecipitated jak 2 obtain from il-5 -stimulated cell undergo autophosphorylation .
jak 2 coprecipitated with the beta-subunit of the il-5 receptor , suggest a physical association of the kinase with the receptor .

the presence of stat-1 in the nuclear extract be study by electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
il-5 induce two protein that bind to the gamma-activating sequence .
in the presence of an anti- stat-1 ab , the band be supershifted .
thus , we demonstrate that il-5 activate the jak 2 -stat 1 signaling pathway in eosinophil .
we speculate that the jak 2 -stat 1 pathway may be involve in the activation of il-5 -inducible gene in eosinophil .
x inactivation analysis in a female with hypomelanosis of ito associate with a balanced x ; 17 translocation : evidence for functional disomy of xp .
x inactivation analysis be perform on normal and hypopigmented skin sample obtain from a female with hypomelanosis of ito associate with a balanced whole arm x ; 17 translocation .

in addition , dual colour fish analysis use centromere specific probe for chromosome x and 17 show that the breakpoints on both chromosome lie within the alphoid array , make interruption of a locus on either chromosome unlikely .
while partial variable monosomy of locus on chromosome 17p can not be exclude a contribute to the phenotype in this patient , it be argue that the major likely factor be partial functional disomy of sequence on xp in cell lineage that have fail to inactivate the intact x chromosome .
constitutive dephosphorylation and activation of a member of the nuclear factor of activate t cell , nf-at1 , in tax-expressing and type i human t-cell leukemia virus-infected human t cell .
the tax gene product of the type i human t-cell leukemia virus ( htlv-i ) transactivates interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) gene through activation of an enhancer term cd28 responsive element ( cd28re ) .
tax activation of the cd28re be partially mediate by a member of the nuclear factor of activate t cell , nf-at1 .

furthermore , the dephosphorylated nf-at1 can be rapidly rephosphorylated when the cell be incubate with cyclosporin a , an immunosuppressant inhibit the serine /threonine phosphatase calcineurin .
these result suggest that activation of nf-at1 in tax-expressing and htlv-i-transformed t cell result from it dephosphorylation , which in turn may be due to deregulation of calcineurin
regulation of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 and cytokine gene expression in myeloid cell by nf-kappa b /rel transcription factor .
cd4+ macrophage in tissue such a lung , skin , and lymph node , promyelocytic cell in bone marrow , and peripheral blood monocyte serve a important target and reservoir for human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) replication .
hiv-1 -infected myeloid cell be often diminish in their ability to participate in chemotaxis , phagocytosis , and intracellular killing .
hiv-1 infection of myeloid cell can lead to the expression of surface receptor associate with cellular activation and/or differentiation that increase the responsiveness of these cell to cytokine secrete by neighbor cell as well a to bacteria or other pathogen .
enhancement of hiv-1 replication be related in part to increase dna-binding activity of cellular transcription factor such a nf-kappa b .
nf-kappa b bind to the hiv-1 enhancer region of the long terminal repeat and contribute to the inducibility of hiv-1 gene expression in response to multiple activate agent .
phosphorylation and degradation of the cytoplasmic inhibitor i kappa b alpha be crucial regulatory event in the activation of nf-kappa b dna-binding activity .
both n- and c- terminal residue of i kappa b alpha be require for inducer-mediated degradation .
chronic hiv-1 infection of myeloid cell lead to constitutive nf-kappa b dna-binding activity and provide an intranuclear environment capable of perpetuate hiv-1 replication .
increase intracellular store of latent nf-kappa b may also result in rapid inducibility of nf-kappa b -dependent cytokine gene expression .
in response to secondary pathogenic infection or antigenic challenge , cytokine gene expression be rapidly induce , enhance , and sustained over prolonged period in hiv-1 -infected myeloid cell compare with uninfected cell .
elevated level of several inflammatory cytokine have be detect in the serum of hiv-1 -infected individual .
secretion of myeloid cell-derived cytokine may both increase virus production and contribute to aids-associated disorder .
molecular mechanism of steroid action : a novel type of cross-talk between glucocorticoid and nf-kappa b transcription factor .
despite the widespread use of glucocorticoid in the treatment of disease characterize by inflammation , the molecular mechanism ( s ) by which these hormone exert this beneficial effect in patient with asthma remain to be elucidate .
therefore , we have study the transcriptional regulation of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 ( icam-1 ) a adhesion molecule be likely to play a causal role in inflammation in promote cell-cell and cell-matrix interaction .
we observe that in a monocytic ( u937 ) and a bronchial epithelial ( h292 ) cell-line dexamethasone strongly suppress basal and induce icam-1 expression .
subsequent analysis of the human icam-1 promoter have reveal that both 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate ( tpa ) and tumour necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) upregulate icam-1 expression through the presence of a nuclear factor ( nf-kappa b ) target sequence ( tggaaattcc ) .
no glucocorticoid recognition sequence be present in this promoter region and dexamethasone be still able to repress transcription when the multimerized nf-kappa b sequence be transactivated by tnf-alpha upon transfection in 293 cell .
we propose that direct interaction between the glucocorticoid receptor and nuclear factor-kappa b factor be at least a partial explanation for the effect of this hormone in inflammatory disease .
calcineurin act in synergy with pma to inactivate i kappa b/mad3 , an inhibitor of nf-kappa b .
the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) promoter consist of several independent t cell receptor ( tcr ) responsive element .
the induction of promoter dependent on these element be inhibitable by the immunosuppressant cyclosporin a ( csa ) and tacrolimus ( fk-506 ) .
calcineurin , a ca2+ /calmodulin-dependent protein phosphatase , be the fk-506 - and csa -sensitive enzyme require for tcr mediated activation of the il-2 promoter .
we report that a constitutively active form of calcineurin partially substitute for the ca2+ co-stimulus require to activate the il-2 promoter element il-2a ( which bind the factor oap and oct-1 ) and il-2e ( which bind nf-at ) , and completely substitute for the ca2+ co-stimulus require to stimulate an nf-kappa b -dependent element .
calcineurin stimulate the nf-kappa b element by enhance inactivation of i kappa b/mad3 , an inhibitor of nf-kappa b , thereby increase the amount of nuclear nf-kappa b dna binding activity .
these data provide the first demonstration in vivo that activation of a protein phosphatase can inactivate i kappa b , and suggest one possible explanation for mechanism-based toxicity associate with fk-506 and csa by demonstrate that these drug can inhibit the calcineurin -dependent activation of a virtually ubiquitous transcription factor .
activity of the kappa b enhancer of the interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain in somatic cell hybrid be accompany by the nuclear localization of nf-kappa b .
the two nuclear protein nf-kappa b ( consist of subunit p50 an dp65 ) and the dna-binding subunit of nf-kappa b ( p50 ) by itself , also call kbf1 , be constitutively express and localized in the nucleus of the human t-cell line iarc 301.5 .
in order to define the role of these two factor , which bind to the same kappa b enhancer , in transcription activation we have prepare somatic cell hybrid between iarc 301.5 and a murine myeloma .
most hybrid express both kbf1 and nf-kappa b in their nucleus , but one hybrid express only kbf1 .
the kappa b enhancer of the gene encode the interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) receptor alpha chain ( il-2r alpha ) be functional only in the hybrid express nuclear nf-kappa b .
these finding show that nuclear nf-kappa b be necessary to activate the kappa b enhancer , while kbf1 by itself be not sufficient .
we propose that kbf1 be a competitive inhibitor of nf-kappa b and discuss how these factor may be involve in the transient expression of il-2 and il-2 alpha gene during the immune response .
regulation of lymphoid-specific immunoglobulin mu heavy chain gene enhancer by ets-domain protein .
the enhancer for the immunoglobulin mu heavy chain gene ( igh ) activate a heterologous gene at the pre-b cell stage of b lymphocyte differentiation .
a lymphoid-specific element , microb , be necessary for enhancer function in pre-b cell .
a microb binding protein be encode by the pu.1/spi-1 proto-oncogene .
another sequence element , microa , be identify in the mu enhancer that bind the product of the ets-1 proto-oncogene .
the microa motif be require for microb-dependent enhancer activity , which suggest that a minimal b cell-specific enhancer be compose of both the pu.1 and ets-1 binding site .
co-expression of both pu.1 and ets-1 in nonlymphoid cell trans-activated reporter plasmid that contain the minimal mu enhancer .
these result implicate two member of the ets family in the activation of igh gene expression .
camp -dependent regulation of proenkephalin by jund and junb : positive and negative effect of ap-1 protein .
we demonstrate that jund , a component of the ap-1 transcription factor complex , activate transcription of the human proenkephalin gene in a fashion that be completely dependent upon the camp-dependent protein kinase , protein kinase a .
activation of proenkephalin transcription by jund be dependent upon a previously characterize camp - , phorbol ester - , and ca(2+) -inducible enhancer , and jund be show to bind the enhancer a a homodimer .
another component of the ap-1 transcription complex , junb , be show to inhibit activation mediate by jund .
a a homodimer junb be unable to bind the enhancer ; however in the presence of c-fos , high-affinity binding be observe .
furthermore , jund be show to activate transcription of gene link to both camp and phorbol ester response element in a protein kinase a -dependent fashion , far blur the distinction between these response element .
these result demonstrate that the transcriptional activity of an ap-1-related protein be regulate by the camp -dependent second-messenger pathway and suggest that jund and other ap-1-related protein may play an important role in the regulation of gene expression by camp -dependent intracellular signaling pathway .
the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor alpha ( pparalpha ) ligand wy 14,643 do not interfere with leukotriene b4 induced adhesion of neutrophil to endothelial cell .
peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor ( ppar ) control discrete gene involve in fatty acid and lipid metabolism .

thus , this study provide no evidence indicate a regulatory function of pparalpha in ltb4 induced adhesive interaction between endothelial cell and neutrophil
involvement of phospholipase d in the activation of transcription factor ap-1 in human t lymphoid jurkat cell .
the induction of the ap-1 transcription factor have be ascribe to the early event lead to t lymphocyte activation .
we have examine the possibility that stimulation of phospholipase d ( pld ) may regulate activation of transcription factor ap-1 in human t cell by transfecting human t lymphocyte jurkat cell with a plasmid contain an ap-1 enhancer element and a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter gene .
we have detect activatable pld in jurkat cell , and we have find that addition of phosphatidic acid ( pa ) , the physiologic product of pld action on phospholipid , be rapidly incorporate into jurkat cell and lead to activation of transcription factor ap-1 .
treatment of jurkat cell with anti-cd3 mab activate both pld and transcription factor ap-1 .
wortmannin , an inhibitor of receptor-coupled pld activation , block the anti-cd3 -induced increase in both pld activity and ap-1 enhancer activity .
we find a good correlation in the transfected cell between pld activation and induction of ap-1 enhancer activity under different experimental condition .
furthermore , ethanol , an inhibitor of the pld pathway , block the anti-cd3-stimulated ap-1 enhancer activity .
however , this anti-cd3 -mediated response be not inhibit by neomycin , an inhibitor of phosphoinositide hydrolysis .
the increase in ap-1 enhancer activity induce by pa or anti-cd3 mab be efficiently abrogate by the presence of propranolol , an inhibitor of pa phosphohydrolase and protein kinase c ( pkc ) .
furthermore , the pa - and the anti-cd3 -induced increase in ap-1 enhancer activity be block by the presence of pkc inhibitor or by pkc down-regulation .
these data indicate that pld stimulation can activate the transcription factor ap-1 in t lymphocyte , and suggest that the induction of ap-1 enhancer factor activity by pa be mediate via pkc stimulation , either through a direct activating effect of pa or through pa -derived diacylglycerol formation .
these data also provide evidence for a role of pld -derived lipid in the induction of ap-1 enhancer activity result from stimulation of the tcr/cd3 complex , suggest that increase pld activity can play an important role in t lymphocyte activation .
the human myelomonocytic cell line u-937 a a model for study alteration in steroid-induced monokine gene expression : marked enhancement of lipopolysaccharide-stimulated interleukin-1 beta messenger rna level by 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 .
the active metabolite of vitamin d , 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 [ 1,25-(oh)2d3 ] , be a potent regulator of human monocyte/macrophage function in vitro .

from these data , and take into consideration their state of differentiation and relative ease of culture , u-937 be choose over hl-60 and thp-1 a the cell line we far characterize .
in u-937 cell , optimum time and dose of pretreatment with 1,25-(oh)2d3 be determine to be 12-24 h at a receptor saturating concentration of 1,25-(oh)2d3 ( 10 nm ) .

initiation binding repressor , a factor that bind to the transcription initiation site of the histone h5 gene , be a glycosylated member of a family of cell growth regulator [ corrected ] [ publish erratum appear in mol cell biol 1996 feb ; 16 ( 2 ) : 735 ]
initiation binding repressor [ correct ] ( ibr ) be a chicken erythrocyte factor ( apparent molecular mass , 70 to 73 kda ) that bind to the sequence span the transcription initiation site of the histone h5 gene , repress it transcription .
a variety of other cell , include transform erythroid precursor , do not have ibr but a factor refer to a ibf ( 68 to 70 kda ) that recognize the same ibr site .
we have clone the ibr cdna and study the relationship of ibr and ibf .
ibr be a 503-amino-acid-long acidic protein which be 99.0 % identical to the recently report human nrf-1/alpha-pal factor and highly related to the invertebrate transcription factor p3a2 and erected wing gene product ( ewg ) .
we present evidence that ibr and ibf be most likely identical protein , differ in their degree of glycosylation .
we have analyze several molecular aspect of ibr/f and show that the factor associate a stable homodimers and that the dimer be the relevant dna-binding specie .
the evolutionarily conserve n-terminal half of ibr/f harbor the dna-binding/dimerization domain ( out limit , 127 to 283 ) , one or several casein kinase ii site ( 37 to 67 ) , and a bipartite nuclear localization signal ( 89 to 106 ) which appear to be necessary for nuclear targeting .
bind site selection reveal that the alternate rcgcrygcgy consensus constitute high-affinity ibr/f binding site and that the direct-repeat palindrome tgcgcatgcgca be the optimal site .
a survey of gene potentially regulate by this family of factor primarily reveal gene involve in growth-related metabolism .
transcriptional analysis of epstein-barr virus gene expression in ebv-positive gastric carcinoma : unique viral latency in the tumour cell .
although case-oriented evidence for an association of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) with gastric carcinoma have be accumulate recently , the interaction ( s ) between ebv and gastric epithelial cell is/are largely unknown .
in this study , we examine seven ebv -positive gastric carcinoma tissue for viral gene expression at the mrna level , from which study on the ebv oncogenicity in human epithelial cell will benefit .
reverse transcription-pcr analysis show that all seven ebv -positive tumour tissue constitutively express ebv nuclear antigen ( ebna ) 1 mrna , but not ebna2 mrna .
the ebna transcription be initiate from one of three ebna promoter , qp : by contrast , both cp and wp be silent , thus result in the lack of ebna2 mrna .
latent membrane protein ( lmp ) 2a mrna be detect in three of seven case ; however , neither lmp1 nor lmp2b mrna be detect in any of the tumour test .
transcript from the bamhi-a region of the viral genome be detectable in all case .
bzlf1 mrna and the product , an immediate-early gene for ebv replication , be not express in any of them , thereby suggest that the tumour cell carry ebv genome in a tightly latent form .
these finding far extend our previous data regard ebv latency in gastric carcinoma cell at the protein level , and have affirm that the programme of viral gene expression in the tumour more closely resemble ' latency i ' represent by burkitt 's lymphoma than ' latency ii ' represent by the majority of nasopharyngeal carcinoma .
mhc class ii signaling in b-cell activation [ see comment ]
the cognate interaction between t cell and antigen-presenting cell ( apc ) , mediate by major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii molecule , result in the delivery of activation signal to the apc .
these signal contribute to the expression of co-stimulatory activity by apc and have important consequence for cell effector function .
mhc class ii molecule also serve a receptor for b-cell stimulation by microbial superantigens .
in this review , paul scholl and raif geha discuss recent advance in our understanding of mechanism of mhc class ii signaling and analyse their role in human b-cell activation .
molecular action of prolactin in the immune system .
the immunoregulatory property of prolactin , a pituitary peptide hormone , have receive renewed attention .
the prolactin receptor , a member of the hematopoietin/cytokine receptor superfamily , be ubiquitously express by cell in the immune system .
certain subpopulation of lymphocyte synthesize and secrete biologically active prolactin , which suggest that prolactin can act a an autocrine and/or paracrine factor to modulate the activity of cell of the immune system .
this review focus on the molecular action of prolactin in the immune system .
emphasis be give to recent information about the molecular mechanism of prolactin receptor signal transduction , and the signal molecule and prolactin -inducible target gene that participate in these response .
in particular , the prolactin -inducible interferon regulatory factor-1 gene and it role in mediate diverse immune response .
the oct-2 transcription factor .
the oct-2 transcription factor be a member of the pou ( pit-oct-unc ) family of transcription factor and be express only in b lymphocyte and in neuronal cell but not in other cell type .
the primary rna transcript of the gene be subject to alternative splicing to yield different variant which can either activate or repress gene expression .
the form produce in b lymphocyte have a predominantly activating effect on gene expression whereas those produce in neuronal cell have a predominantly inhibitory effect and can repress the expression of both the herpes simplex virus immediate-early gene and the cellular tyrosine hydroxylase gene .
thus oct-2 play an important role in the regulation of cellular gene expression in both b cell and neuronal cell as well a in the control of viral latency .
calcineurin potentiate activation of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor gene in t cell : involvement of the conserve lymphokine element 0 .
granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) and interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) be produce by stimulation with phorbol-12-myristate acetate ( pma ) and calcium ionophore ( a23187 ) in human t cell leukemia jurkat cell .
the expression of gm-csf and il-2 be inhibit by immunosuppressive drug such a cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 .
early study on the il-2 gene expression show that overexpression of calcineurin ( cn ) , a ca2+/calmodulin-dependent protein phosphatase , can stimulate transcription from the il-2 promoter through the nf-at-binding site .
in this study , we obtain evidence that transfection of the cdna for cn a ( catalytic ) and cn b ( regulatory ) subunit also augment transcription from the gm-csf promoter and recover the transcription inhibit by csa .
the constitutively active type of the cn a subunit , which lack the auto-inhibitory and calmodulin-binding domain , act in synergy with pma to activate transcription from the gm-csf promoter .
we also find that the active cn partially replace calcium ionophore in synergy with pma to induce expression of endogenous gm-csf and il-2 .
by multimerizing the regulatory element of the gm-csf promoter , we find that one of the target site for the cn action be the conserve lymphokine element 0 ( cle0 ) , located at position between -54 and -40 .
mobility shift assay show that the cle0 sequence have an ap1-binding site and be associate with an nf-at-like factor , term nf- cle0 gamma .
nf- cle0 gamma binding be induce by pma /a23187 and be inhibit by treatment with csa .
these result suggest that cn be involve in the coordinate induction of the gm-csf and il-2 gene and that the cle0 sequence of the gm-csf gene be a functional analogue of the nf-at-binding site in the il-2 promoter , which mediate signal downstream of t cell activation .
il-2 gene expression and nf-kappa b activation through cd28 require reactive oxygen production by 5-lipoxygenase .
activation of the cd28 surface receptor provide a major costimulatory signal for t cell activation result in enhance production of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) and cell proliferation .
in primary t lymphocyte we show that cd28 ligation lead to the rapid intracellular formation of reactive oxygen intermediate ( roi ) which be require for cd28 -mediated activation of the nf-kappa b / cd28 -responsive complex and il-2 expression .
delineation of the cd28 signaling cascade be find to involve protein tyrosine kinase activity , follow by the activation of phospholipase a2 and 5-lipoxygenase .
our data suggest that lipoxygenase metabolite activate roi formation which then induce il-2 expression via nf-kappa b activation .
these finding should be useful for therapeutic strategy and the development of immunosuppressant target the cd28 costimulatory pathway .
dominant cytotoxic t lymphocyte response to the immediate-early trans-activator protein , bzlf1 , in persistent type a or b epstein-barr virus infection .
five healthy human leukocyte antigen-b8 ( hla-b8 ) -positive virus carrier be study to investigate the cd8+ cytotoxic t lymphocyte ( ctl ) response to an hla-b8-restricted peptide , rakfkqllq , located in the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) immediate-early trans-activator protein , bzlf1 .
of the 5 virus carrier , 4 be infect with type a and 1 with type b ebv .
use limiting-dilution analysis of peripheral blood mononuclear cell , a high rakfkqllq -specific ctl precursor frequency be demonstrate after specific peptide or autologous lymphoblastoid cell line stimulation in both type a and type b ebv carrier .
the rakfkqllq -specific ctl precursor frequency in all 5 person be at least as dominant a those observe with two other ebv-associated , hla-b8-restricted latent epitope , flrgraygl and qakwrlqtl .
these finding show that healthy virus carrier maintain a high frequency of bzlf1 -specific memory t cell , potentially to control virus spread from lytically infected cell .
an intricate arrangement of bind site for the ets family of transcription factor regulate activity of the alpha 4 integrin gene promoter .
alpha 4 integrins mediate cell-cell and cell-extracellular matrix interaction that be critical for maturation and function of the immune system as well a differentiation of skeletal muscle .
here we examine molecular mechanism control the pattern of alpha 4 expression .
the activity of construct contain 5' deletion mutant of the alpha 4 gene promoter be compare in transfection assay into cell line that express alpha 4 and cell line that do not .
the sequence between position -42 and -76 base pair ( bp ) be require for efficient transcription in cell that express alpha 4 , but it show no activity in hela cell , which do not express alpha 4 .
three bind site for the ets family of transcription factor be find in this region : two adjacent site at position -50 and -54 bp and a more 5' site at position -67 bp .
use a series of construct contain deletion and mutation in this region , we find that the 3'-most site alone be sufficient for bind ga-binding protein alpha ( gabp alpha ) / gabp beta and for a low level of transcriptional activation .
when all three site be present , a second complex " a " be detect , which contain an unknown member of the ets family .
formation of complex a be cell-type specific and correlate with a high level of transcription .
deletion of the 5'-most ets site have no effect on binding to gabp alpha/gabp beta , but it eliminate a .
concomitant with this loss of a , a new ets-1-containing complex " c " appear .
complex c substitute efficiently for complex a in transcriptional activation .
we conclude that although neither of the two 5'-most ets site alone bind nuclear protein , they appear to act a modulators which control the pattern of ets protein that bind the alpha 4 gene promoter .
this arrangement of ets site , couple with the tissue- and developmental- specific expression of ets member , likely play a key role in define the pattern of alpha 4 integrin .
cross talk between cell death and cell cycle progression : bcl-2 regulate nfat -mediated activation .
bcl-2 -deficient t cell demonstrate accelerate cell cycle progression and increase apoptosis follow activation .
increase the level of bcl-2 retard the g0 --> s transition , sustain the level of cyclin-dependent kinase inhibitor p27kip1 , and repress postactivation death .
proximal signal transduction event and immediate early gene transcription be unaffected .
however , the transcription and synthesis of interleukin 2 and other delay early cytokine be markedly attenuate by bcl-2 .
in contrast , a cysteine protease inhibitor that also block apoptosis have no substantial affect upon cytokine production .
interleukin 2 expression require several transcription factor of which nuclear translocation of nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) and nfat -mediated transactivation be impair by bcl-2 .
thus , select genetic aberration in the apoptotic pathway reveal a cell autonomous coregulation of activation .
a central role for a single c-myb binding site in a thymic locus control region .
locus control region ( lcrs ) be powerful assembly of cis element that organize the action of cell-type-specific trans-acting factor .
a 2.3-kb lcr in the human adenosine deaminase ( ada ) gene first intron , which control expression in thymocytes , be compose of a 200-bp enhancer domain and extended flanking sequence that facilitate activation from within chromatin .
prior analysis have demonstrate that the enhancer contain a 28-bp core region and local adjacent augmentative cis element .
we now show that the core contain a single critical c-myb binding site .
in both transiently cotransfected human cell and stable chromatin-integrated yeast cell , c-myb strongly transactivated reporter construct that contain polymerized core sequence .
c-myb protein be strongly evident in t lymphoblast in which the enhancer be active and be localized within discrete nuclear structure .
fetal murine thymus exhibit a striking concordance of endogenous c-myb expression with that of mouse ada and human ada lcr -directed transgene expression .
point mutation of the c-myb site within the intact 2.3-kb lcr severely attenuate enhancer activity in transfections and lcr activity in transgenic thymocytes .
within the context of a complex enhancer and lcr , c-myb can act a an organizer of thymocyte-specific gene expression via a single bind site .
signalling via cd28 of human naive neonatal t lymphocyte .
accessory molecule play a crucial role in the development of the t cell response to antigenic challenge .
we have examine the role of cd28 in modulate the ' naive ' neonatal t cell response to anti-cd2 -mediated activation .
to compare the role of cd28 , neonatal and adult t cell be stimulate with a pair of mitogenic anti-cd2 antibody in the presence or absence of anti- cd28 moab .
with anti-cd2 alone , neonatal t cell proliferate slightly but produce no detectable il-2 , whereas adult t cell proliferate vigorously , with significant il-2 production .
costimulation with anti- cd28 moab greatly enhance the proliferative response of neonatal t cell to level equivalent to those of adult t cell , whereas adult t cell show only slight increase .
although il-2 secretion be increase in the presence of anti- cd28 moab , neonatal t cell il-2 production remain low than in adult .
in contrast , enhancement of il-2 mrna expression in neonate be similar to adult level .
anti- cd28 moab costimulation increase nf kappa b level in neonate , albeit to level low than that of adult .
the cellular mechanism govern the diminish proliferative response of neonatal t lymphocyte to anti-cd2 may therefore be due to decrease nf kappa b induction , reduce il-2 mrna expression and deficient il-2 production .
although anti- cd28 moab costimulation enhance all of the above signal , nf kappa b and il-2 level remain low than in adult , suggest the need for further activation requirement in the neonate .
immediate early and early lytic cycle protein be frequent target of the epstein-barr virus -induced cytotoxic t cell response .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) , a human gamma-herpesvirus , can establish both nonproductive ( latent ) and productive ( lytic ) infection .
although the cd8+ cytotoxic t lymphocyte ( ctl ) response to latently infected cell be well characterize , very little be know about t cell control over lytic infection ; this imbalance in our understanding belie the importance of virus-replicative lesion in several aspect of ebv disease pathogenesis .
the present work show that the primary cd8+ ctl response to ebv in infectious mononucleosis patient contain multiple lytic antigen-specific reactivity at level at least as high a those see against latent antigen ; similar reactivity be also detectable in ctl memory .
clonal analysis reveal individual response to the two immediate early protein bzlf1 and brlf1 , and to three ( bmlf1 , bmrf1 , and balf2 ) of the six early protein test .
in several case , the peptide epitope and hla-restricting determinant recognize by these ctls have be define , one unusual feature be the number of response restricted through hla-c allele .
the work strongly suggest that ebv -replicative lesion be subject to direct ctl control in vivo and that immediate early and early protein be frequently the immunodominant target .
this contrast with finding in alpha- and beta- herpesvirus system ( herpes simplex , cytomegalovirus ) where viral interference with the antigen-processing pathway during lytic infection render immediate early and early protein much less immunogenic .
the unique capacity of gamma-herpesvirus to amplify the viral load in vivo through a latent growth-transforming infection may have render these agent less dependent upon viral replication a a mean of successfully colonize their host .
replication of human immunodeficiency virus-1 in primary human t cell be dependent on the autocrine secretion of tumor necrosis factor through the control of nuclear factor-kappa b activation .
tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha control t-cell activation and be a major inducer of human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -1 replication in chronically infected cell .
therefore , we have investigate it role in primary culture of hiv-infected human t lymphocyte by use neutralize anti-tnf-alpha antibody or tnf-alpha .
primary rest t lymphocyte produce tnf-alpha and support hiv replication after t-cell receptor activation .
addition of neutralize anti- tnf-alpha antibody drastically reduce p24 antigen release and prevent cd4+ cell depletion associate with infection .
anti- tnf-alpha also prevent nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation , and a good correlation between this inhibition and inhibition of hiv replication be observe .
moreover , supplement the culture with high dos of il-2 revert anti- tnf-alpha inhibition of cell proliferation but do not affect the inhibition of hiv p24 antigen release or nf-kappa b activation in the same culture .
moreover , anti- tnf-alpha inhibit hiv-1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) -driven transcription of a reporter gene in primary t cell in response to activation , either in the presence or the absence of hiv-1 tat .
our result support an important role for autocrine tnf-alpha secretion in control hiv replication in primary t cell because of it ability to maintain nf-kappa b elevated in the nucleus of t cell .
globin gene switching .
in vivo protein-dna interaction of the human beta-globin locus in erythroid cell express the fetal or the adult globin gene program .
to characterize the protein-dna interaction important for the developmental control of the human beta-globin locus , we analyze by in vivo dimethyl sulfate footprinting erythroid cell express either the fetal or the adult globin developmental program .
in the locus control region ( lcr ) of the beta-globin locus , in vivo footprint on nf-e2 ( or ap-1 ) and gata-1 motif remain the same regardless of whether the fetal or the adult globin gene be express .
in contrast , in vivo footprint on gt ( caccc ) motif differ between the cell express the fetal or the adult globin program .
in promoter region , the actively transcribe gene demonstrate extensive and consistent footprint over the canonical element , such a caccc and ccaat motif .
the adult globin expressing cell display more extensive footprint than the fetal globin expressing cell in the 3' regulatory sequence of both the agamma- and the beta- globin gene , suggest a role of these 3' element in beta-globin gene expression .
our result suggest that the bulk of protein-dna interaction that underlie the developmental control of globin gene take place in the gamma- and beta- globin gene promoter , and that gt motif of the beta-globin locus lcr may play a role in the developmental regulation of human beta-globin gene expression , perhaps by increase the probability of interaction of the lcr holocomplex with the fetal or the adult globin gene .
monochloramine inhibit phorbol ester -inducible neutrophil respiratory burst activation and t cell interleukin-2 receptor expression by inhibit inducible protein kinase c activity .
monochloramine derivative be long live physiological oxidant produce by neutrophil during the respiratory burst .
the effect of chemically prepare monochloramine ( nh2cl ) on protein kinase c ( pkc ) and pkc -mediated cellular response be study in elicited rat peritoneal neutrophil and human jurkat t cell .
neutrophil pretreated with nh2cl ( 30-50 microm ) show a marked decrease in the respiratory burst activity induce by phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) , which be a potent pkc activator .
these cell , however , be viable and show a complete respiratory burst upon arachidonic acid stimulation , which induce the respiratory burst by a pkc -independent mechanism .
the nh2cl -treated neutrophil show a decrease in both pkc activity and pma -induced phosphorylation of a 47-kda protein , which correspond to the cytosolic factor of nadph oxidase , p47 ( phox ) .
jurkat t cell pretreated with nh2cl ( 20-70 microm ) show a decrease in the expression of the interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain follow pma stimulation .
this be also accompany by a decrease in both pkc activity and nuclear transcription factor- kappab activation , also without loss of cell viability .
these result show that nh2cl inhibit pkc -mediated cellular response through inhibition of the inducible pkc activity .
detection of minimal residual disease in a patient with acute promyelocytic leukemia by rt-pcr : necessity of chemotherapy follow atra therapy .
the pml/rar alpha fusion gene result from the t_(15;17) translocation be a specific marker for acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) .
we examine bone marrow cell by reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) to detect residual pml/rar alpha mrna -containing cell follow treatment with all-trans retinoic acid ( atra ) and cytotoxic chemotherapy in a patient with apl .
this rt-pcr assay can detect one leukemic cell in 10(2) normal cell in vitro .
we show that pml/rar alpha mrna be still detectable despite clinical remission follow atra treatment , but undetectable follow consolidation with chemotherapy .
these data show that this technique be useful for the identification of minimal residual disease in patient with apl and that cytotoxic chemotherapy follow atra therapy be require for the elimination of apl cell .
latent membrane protein-1 induce cyclin d2 expression , prb hyperphosphorylation , and loss of tgf-beta 1 -mediated growth inhibition in ebv-positive b cell .
the normal cell cycle be regulate by several molecule , such a the tumor-suppressor protein prb , the g1 cyclins , the cyclin-dependent kinase , and their inhibitor .
these regulator be target by negative growth regulatory signal , such a that provide by tgf-beta .
here , we show that the presence of either wild-type ebv or it transform latent membrane protein-1 ( lmp-1 ) result in the loss of tgf-beta 1 -mediated growth inhibition in human b cell .
chemical cross-linking with 125i-labeled tgf-beta 1 show an essentially normal tgf-beta receptor profile in ebv-positive and ebv-negative burkitt 's lymphoma cell line , and these receptor be show to be functional in transduce signal , a evidence by the tgf-beta 1 -mediated modulation of junb gene expression .
however , tgf-beta 1 do not induce dephosphorylation of prb in ebv ( or lmp-1 ) -positive cell a oppose to ebv -negative cell , suggest a dichotomy in the tgf-beta 1 signaling pathway lead to separable gene regulatory and growth inhibitory response .
furthermore , lmp-1 be find to induce the expression of cyclin d2 ; normal b cell or ebv -negative burkitt 's lymphoma cell do not express d-type cyclins .
take together , these data point to a potential mechanism underlie ebv -mediated b cell transformation whereby constitutive induction of key cell cycle regulator by lmp-1 can lead to prb hyperphosphorylation and uncontrolled cell proliferation .
the product of the murine homolog of the drosophila extra sex comb gene display transcriptional repressor activity .
the heterogeneous nuclear ribonucleoprotein k protein represent a novel class of protein that may act a docking platform that orchestrate cross-talk among molecule involve in signal transduction and gene expression .
use a fragment of k protein a bait in the yeast two-hybrid screen , we isolate a cdna that encode a protein whose primary structure have extensive similarity to the drosophila melanogaster extra sex comb ( esc ) gene product , esc , a putative silencer of homeotic gene .
the cdna that we isolate be identical to the cdna of the recently positionally clone mouse embryonic ectoderm development gene , eed .
like esc , eed contain six wd-40 repeat in the c-terminal half of the protein and be think to repress homeotic gene expression during mouse embryogenesis .
eed bind to k protein through a domain in it n terminus , but interestingly , this domain be not find in the drosophila esc .
gal4- eed fusion protein repress transcription of a reporter gene drive by a promoter that contain gal4-binding dna element .
eed also repress transcription when recruit to a target promoter by gal4- k protein .
point mutation within the eed gene that be responsible for severe embryonic development abnormality abolish the transcriptional repressor activity of eed .
result of this study suggest that eed -restricted homeotic gene expression during embryogenesis reflect the action of eed a a transcriptional repressor .
the eed -mediated transcriptional effect be likely to reflect the interaction of eed with multiple molecular partner , include k protein .
a serum response element and a bind site for nf-y mediate the serum response of the human thrombospondin 1 gene .
the expression of thrombospondin 1 ( tsp 1 ) , a member of the tsp gene family , be rapidly induce by growth factor .
we test the ability of human tsp 1 -chloramphenicol acetyltransferase construct to respond to serum in stably transfected nih-3t3 cell .
two transcriptional element in the tsp 1 promoter , a distal element at -1280 and a proximal element at -65 , be require for the response of the human tsp 1 gene to serum .
the distal element contain the 5'-cc(a_+_t)6gg-3' consensus sequence characteristic of a serum-response element ( sre ) .
deletion or mutation in this element reduce the serum response of the tsp 1 gene by 80-90 % .
in gel-shift assay , the -1280 element and the c-fos sre cross -competed , whereas their functional and bind mutant do not .
the proximal element contain the sequence 5'-ggccaatggg-3' , which closely resemble the consensus binding motif for the ccaat-binding factor nf-y ( cbf , cp1 , alpha cp1 ) .
deletion or mutation in this element also reduce the serum response by 80-90 % .
methylation interference analysis of the -65 region identify a pattern of contact with nuclear factor resemble that for nf-y , and an nf-y -binding site and the proximal tsp 1 element cross-competed in gel-shift assay , whereas their bind mutant do not .
finally , an abbreviate tsp 1 promoter/5'-flank , contain the sre- and nf-y- binding site , mediate a serum response that be close in magnitude to that of the parent promoter .
we conclude that the serum response of the human tsp 1 gene require the coordinate function of an sre- and nf-y- binding site .
monocytic cell type-specific transcriptional induction of collagenase .
interstitial collagenase ( mmp-1 ) , a metalloproteinase produce by resident and inflammatory cell during connective tissue turnover , cleave type i collagen fibril .
this catalytic event be rate limit in remodeling of tissue rich in fibrillar collagen such a the skin and lung .
the regulation of collagenase expression be cell-type specific ; bacterial lp and zymosan , a yeast cell wall derivative , be potent inducer of collagenase expression in macrophage , but do not alter fibroblast collagenase expression .
since promoter element control collagenase transcription in monocytic cell have not be previously define , we seek to delineate responsive cis-acting element of the collagenase promoter in transiently transfected human ( u937 ) and murine ( j774 ) monocytic cell line .
deletion construct contain as little a 72 bp of 5'_-flanking sequence of the collagenase promoter be sufficient for lps- or zymosan- mediated transcriptional induction , whereas phorbol inducibility exhibit an absolute requirement for upstream element include the polyoma enhancer a-binding protein-3 site ( -83 to -91 ) and ttca sequence ( -102 to -105 ) in both monocytic cell and fibroblast .
mutagenesis of the activator protein-1 [ ap-1 ] site at -72 abolish basal promoter activity and lp /zymosan inducibility , while mutagenesis of an nf-kappab-like site at -20 to -10 have no effect .
nuclear extract from lp - and zymosan -treated cell show strong ap-1 activity by gel-shift analysis , and supershift analysis show the ap-1 complex contain specific member of both the jun and fo gene family .
these data indicate that , in contrast to most lp effect , ap-1 , but not nuclear factor-kappab , mediate lp induction of collagenase transcription in macrophagelike cell .
furthermore , a compare to regulation by phorbol ester , collagenase induction in monocytic cell by cell wall derivative of bacteria or yeast be largely independent of upstream promoter sequence .
the promoter of the cd19 gene be a target for the b-cell-specific transcription factor bsap .
the cd19 protein be express on the surface of all b-lymphoid cell with the exception of terminally differentiate plasma cell and have be implicate a a signal-transducing receptor in the control of proliferation and differentiation .
here we demonstrate complete correlation between the expression pattern of the cd19 gene and the b-cell-specific transcription factor bsap in a large panel of b-lymphoid cell line .
the human cd19 gene have be clone , and several bsap -binding site have be map by in vitro protein-dna binding study .
in particular , a high-affinity bsap-binding site instead of a tata sequence be located in the -30 promoter region upstream of a cluster of heterogeneous transcription start site .
moreover , this site be occupy by bsap in vivo in a cd19-expressing b-cell line but not in plasma or hela cell .
this high-affinity site have be conserve in the promoter of both human and mouse cd19 gene and be furthermore show to confer b-cell specificity to a beta-globin reporter gene in transient transfection experiment .
in addition , bsap be find to be the only abundant dna-binding activity of b-cell nuclear extract that interact with the cd19 promoter .
together , this evidence strongly implicate bsap in the regulation of the cd19 gene .
the modulation of glucocorticoid receptor content by 3-o-methyl-d-glucose transport in human mononuclear leukocyte in obesity .
glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) and 3-o-methyl-d glucose ( 3-o-mg ) transport be determine in mononuclear leukocyte ( mnl ) from 11 abdominal obese subject , 10 pituitary-dependent cushing 's syndrome ( cushing 's disease ) and 10 healthy control .
use a whole-cell competitive binding assay and 3h-dexamethasone a tracer , mnl of abdominal obese subject be find to have 4855 +/- 1389 sites/cell which be significantly low ( p < 0.05 ) than control ( 6234 +/- 1568 sites/cell ) , although no significant difference be find in the mean serum cortisol level .
their mean kd ( affinity ) be also significantly low than that find in the healthy control ( obese kd : 2.92 +/- 0.84 nmol/l , control kd : 4.55 +/- 0.67 nm , p < 0.05 ) .
on the other hand , the receptor characteristic in cushing 's disease patient be within the normal range .
at the same time , 3-o-mg transport be determine in the same subject .
in cushing 's disease , 3-o-mg transport be within the normal range , whereas in abdominal obesity this value be significantly low than the healthy control ( abdominal obese : 31.90 +/- 8.20 ; control : 46.26 +/- 12.91 fmol/10(6) cell , min , p < 0.05 ) .
we also find a positive correlation between 3-o-mg transport and gr binding capacity in abdominal subject ( r = 0.89 , p < 0.001 ) , however we do not find such a correlation in cushing 's disease ( r = 0.60 , p > 0.05 ) .
these result indicate that , in abdominal obesity , the gr binding capacity in mnl be influence by the change in glucose transport .
induction of t cell anergy by high concentration of immunodominant native peptide be accompany by il-10 production and a block in jnk activity .
the ability to induce anergy in antigen-specific t cell have potential therapeutic value for alter pathologic immune response .
this study be undertake to far analyze change in cytokine production and intracellular signaling during anergy induction use high concentration of native peptide ligand of tetanus toxoid ( tt ) - and myelin basic protein ( mbp ) - specific human t cell line .
