epstein-barr virus-transforming protein latent infection membrane protein 1 activate transcription factor nf-kappab through a pathway that include the nf-kappab -inducing kinase and the ikappab kinase ikkalpha and ikkbeta .
the epstein-barr virus oncoprotein latent infection membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) be a constitutively aggregate pseudo-tumor necrosis factor receptor ( tnfr ) that activate transcription factor nf-kappab through two site in it c-terminal cytoplasmic domain .
one site be similar to activate tnfrii in associate with tnfr -associated factor traf1 and traf2 , and the second site be similar to tnfri in associate with the tnfri death domain interact protein tradd .
tnfri have be recently show to activate nf-kappab through association with tradd , rip , and traf2 ; activation of the nf-kappab -inducing kinase ( nik ) ; activation of the ikappab alpha kinase ( ikkalpha and ikkbeta ) ; and phosphorylation of ikappab alpha .
ikappab alpha phosphorylation on ser-32 and ser-36 be follow by it degradation and nf-kappab activation .
in this report , we show that nf-kappab activation by lmp1 or by each of it effector site be mediate by a pathway that include nik , ikkalpha , and ikkbeta .
dominant negative mutant of nik , ikkalpha , or ikkbeta substantially inhibit nf-kappab activation by lmp1 or by each of it effector site .
aberrant splicing of the tsg101 and fhit gene occur frequently in multiple malignancy and in normal tissue and mimic alteration previously describe in tumour .
intragenic deletion of tsg101 , the human homolog of a mouse gene ( tsg101 ) that act to suppress malignant cell growth , be report in human breast tumour .
we screen tsg101 for somatic mutation in dna and rna sample isolate from a variety of common human malignancy , ebv-immortalised b-cells , and normal lung parenchyma .
intragenic tsg101 deletion in rna transcript be frequently find in all type of sample .
analysis of dna fail to show genomic rearrangement correspond to transcript contain deletion in the same sample .
the breakpoints of most transcript deletion coincide with genuine or cryptic splice site sequence , suggest that they result from alternative or aberrant splicing .
a similar spectrum of transcript deletion have previously be describe in the putative tumour suppressor gene fhit .
we analyse fhit in the same series of rna sample and detect truncate fhit transcript frequently in both tumour and normal tissue .
in addition , transcript from tsg101 , fhit and seven other gene be analyse in rna isolate from normal peripheral blood lymphocyte .
large tsg101 and fhit intragenic transcript deletion be detect and these appear to be the predominant transcript in ' aged ' lymphocyte .
similar alteration be not detect in transcript of the other gene which be analyse .
our finding demonstrate that truncate tsg101 and fhit transcript be commonly detect in both normal and malignant tissue and that a significant fraction of these be likely to be the result of aberrant splicing .
while we can not exclude that alteration in tsg101 and fhit occur during cancer development , our data indicate that in this context the commonly observe transcript abnormality be misleading .
cag repeat length variation in sperm from a patient with kennedy 's disease .
use a modify sperm typing protocol , the mutation frequency of the cag repeat region at the androgen receptor locus have be measure use a rare semen sample from an individual with spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy ( sbma ) .
among 258 x chromosome-containing sperm , 19 % have a repeat number equal to the donor 's somatic dna ( 47 repeat ) , 66 % be expansion and 15 % be contraction .
the average expansion be 2.7 repeat .
more than half of the expansion involve one or two repeat ; the large be 11 repeat .
68 % of the contraction be also one or two repeat but six ( 16 % ) be very large ( 12-25 repeat ) .
one contraction generate an allele in an intermediate size range ( 33-39 repeat ) .
such allele have not be observe among more than 900 normal and sbma x-chromosomes that have be examine .
comparison of the sbma sperm typing result with mutation frequency data on normal allele support the hypothesis that trinucleotide repeat expansion may have a different molecular origin than contraction .
sp family member preferentially interact with the promoter proximal repeat within the htlv-i enhancer .
human t cell lymphotropic virus type i ( htlv-i ) encode the transactivator protein , tax , which facilitate viral transcription from three 21 bp repeated element within the u3 region of the long terminal repeat ( ltr ) .
examination of the basal factor interact with the 21 bp repeat element through electrophoretic mobility shift ( em ) analysis have demonstrate the formation of dna-protein complex common to each of the 21 bp repeat ( c1-c3 ) as well a three dna-protein complex specific to the promoter proximal ( pp ) repeat ( u1 ( u1a/u1b ) and u2 ; 1-4 ) .
these study have indicate that the individual repeat be not identical with respect to the cellular factor with which they interact .
em analysis utilize a series of mutate pp repeat element demonstrate that the nucleotide sequence requirement for u1 ( u1a/u1b ) and u2 formation be separable from those require for c1-c3 formation .
competition em analysis utilize sp1 and creb binding site oligonucleotides demonstrate that sp family member be critical component of u1 ( u1a/u1b ) and u2 and that atf/creb family member be critical component of c1-c3 .
em supershift analysis have demonstrate that sp1 be involve in u1a formation while sp3 be involve in u1b and u2 formation .
em analysis perform with nuclear extract from tax -expressing jurkat cell and htlv-i -transformed peripheral blood mononuclear cell demonstrate that tax prevent the formation of u1 ( u1a/u1b ) and u2 dna-protein complex .
therefore , tax appear to inhibit the interaction of sp family member with the pp repeat .
base on these observation , it be possible that the interaction of sp and atf/creb family member with the pp repeat during basal and tax -mediated transcription may play a critical role in viral gene expression during the initial stage of virus infection or during activation of a latent infection .
expression of the runt domain -encoding pebp2 alpha gene in t cell during thymic development .
the pebp2 alpha a and pebp2 alpha b gene encode the dna-binding subunit of a murine transcription factor , pebp2 , which be implicate a a t-cell-specific transcriptional regulator .
these two related gene share the evolutionarily conserve region encode the runt domain .
pebp2 alpha b be the murine counterpart of human aml1 , which be located at the breakpoints of the 8;21 and 3;21 chromosome translocation associate with acute myeloid leukemia .
northern ( rna ) blot of various adult mouse tissue reveal that the level of expression of both gene be most prominent in the thymus .
furthermore , transcript of pebp2 alpha a and mouse aml1/ pebp2 alpha b be detect in t lymphocyte in the thymus from day 16 embryo and newborn , as well a 4-week-old adult mouse , by in situ hybridization .
the expression of the gene persist in peripheral lymph node of adult mouse .
the transcript be detect in all the cd4- cd8- , cd4+ cd8+ , cd4+ cd8- , and cd4- cd8+ cell population .
the result indicate that both gene be express in t cell throughout their development , support the notion that pebp2 be a t-cell-specific transcription factor .
transcript of mouse aml1/ pebp2 alpha b be also detect in day 12 fetal hematopoietic liver and in the bone marrow cell of newborn mouse .
the implication of mouse aml1/ pebp2 alpha b expression in hematopoietic cell other than those of t-cell lineage be discuss in relation to myeloid leukemogenesis .
prolactin and interleukin-2 receptor in t lymphocyte signal through a mgf-stat5-like transcription factor .
the cell surface receptor for prl and interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) be structurally distinct , but share regulatory task in t lymphocyte .
they can stimulate proliferation and activate transcription of over-lapping set of gene of t cell .
prl and il-2 receptor activation be both link to the jak/stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) pathway .
we investigate the ability of prl and il-2 to activate stat protein in different t cell line .
the dna binding specificity , the reactivity toward stat-specific antiserum , and the mol wt of il-2 - and prl -induced dna-binding protein in nb2 and c196 t cell line be investigate .
a comparison with the stat protein induce by interferon-gamma , prl , and il-6 in t47d mammary tumor cell be make .
we find that these parameter be indistinguishable for one of the prl- and il-2- induced factor .
a transcription factor closely related to mammary gland factor-stat5 be rapidly activate upon interaction of il-2 and prl with their respective receptor .
activation of a second protein related to stat1 be also observe .
our result emphasize the role of prl a a regulator of the immune response and indicate that the stat factor mammary gland factor-stat5 and stat1 play a role in the regulation of gene expression during t cell development .
mechanism involve in the inhibition of growth of a human b lymphoma cell line , b104 , by anti-mhc class ii antibody .
the mechanism involve in the inhibition of growth of a human b lymphoma cell line , b104 , by anti-mhc class ii antibody ( ab ) be compare with those in anti-igm ab -induced b104 growth inhibition .
two anti-mhc class ii ab , l227 and 2.06 , inhibit the growth of b104 cell , although 2.06 , but not l227 , need to be far cross-link with a goat anti-mouse igg ab ( gam ) to show the effect .
l227 induce an increase in intracellular free ca2+ concentration ( [ ca2+ ]i ) from the intracellular pool and little or no protein tyrosine phosphorylation , phosphatidyl inositol turnover , or expression of egr-1 mrna , whereas 2.06 plus gam induce an increase in [ ca2+ ]i from both the intracellular and , in particular , the extracellular pool .
the inhibition of b104 cell growth induce by anti-mhc class ii ab be ca(2+) -independent and not inhibit by actinomycin d or cyclosporin a , and cell cycle arrest at the g2/m interphase be not observe .
these feature be very different from those observe in b104 cell death induce by anti-igm ab .
neither dna fragmentation nor the morphology of apoptosis be observe .
these finding demonstrate that cross-linking of mhc class ii molecule transduce the negative signal through intracellular mechanism different from those present in the cross-linking of surface igm .
the regulation of hiv by retinoic acid correlate with cellular expression of the retinoic acid receptor .
objective : to analyze the effect of retinoic acid ( ra ) on hiv-1 expression and correlate this effect with expression level of ra receptor ( rars ) in t-lymphoid and monocytoid cell line .
design and method : the effect of all-trans and 9-cis ra on hiv-1 production in t-lymphoid ( h9 , cem ) and monocytoid ( u937 , thp-1 ) cell line be measure during acute and chronic infection .
the expression level of human rar alpha ( hrar alpha , receptor for all-trans ra ) and the human retinoid-x receptor alpha ( hrxr alpha receptor for 9-cis ra ) be determine by northern blot analysis .
result : both all-trans and 9-cis ra inhibit virus replication in hiv-1 iiib-infected monocytoid cell , in the presence and absence of the co-stimulatory agent phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) .
the retinoids have weak or no stimulatory effect on hiv production by t-cell line .
hiv production by pma -stimulated t-cell line be inhibit by these retinoids .
the 9-cis ra be generally more effective than all-trans ra in inhibit hiv production and in combination generally more effective than the single agent alone .
human rar alpha be express in h9 , u937 and thp-1 cell , but almost undetectable in cem cell .
human rxr alpha be significantly express in u937 and thp-1 cell , weakly express in h9 cell and not detectable in cem cell .
after stimulation by pma , rxr alpha expression increase in h9 and u937 cell but not in cem cell .
human rar alpha expression be unchanged in h9 and cem cell , and elevate in u937 cell , after pma stimulation .
conclusion : the effect of ra on hiv-1 expression be cell-type-dependent and partially correlate with cellular expression of rars .
endogenous or exogenously administer ra may have a significant role in hiv regulation .
anti-immunoglobulin m activate nuclear calcium /calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ii in human b lymphocyte .
we and others have previously show that the nuclear protein , ets-1 , be phosphorylated in a calcium-dependent manner after ligation of immunoglobulin ( ig ) m on b lymphocyte .
a this phosphorylation be independent of protein kinase c activity , we test whether a calcium /calmodulin-dependent protein kinase ( cam kinase ) might phosphorylate the ets-1 protein after elevation of intracellular free calcium concentration .
the dephosphorylated form of ets-1 have be show to bind to chromatin , suggest that the operative kinase should be detectable in the nucleus .
we prepare nuclear extract from two human b cell line in which increase intracellular free calcium level correlate with increase phosphorylation of the ets-1 protein .
activity of the cam kinase be determine use a synthetic peptide substrate both in the absence and presence of an inhibitor specific for the cam kinase family , kn-62 .
stimulation of cell with anti-igm lead to increase activity of a nuclear kinase that could phosphorylate the peptide , and this activity be reduce by 10 microm kn-62 .
kinase activity be reduce in lysates preadsorbed use an antibody specific for cam kinase ii .
two-dimensional phosphopeptide map of the ets-1 protein from cell incubate with ionomycin or anti-igm contain two unique phosphopeptides that be absent in untreated cell .
incubation of isolate ets-1 protein with purify cam kinase ii produce phosphorylation of peptide that migrate identically to those find in cell incubate with either anti-igm or ionomycin .
these data suggest a model of signal transduction by the antigen receptor on b lymphocyte in which increase intracellular free calcium can rapidly activate nuclear cam kinase ii , potentially result in phosphorylation and regulation of dna-binding protein .
positive regulator of the lineage-specific transcription factor gata-1 in differentiating erythroid cell .
the zinc finger transcription factor gata-1 be a major regulator of gene expression in erythroid , megakaryocyte , and mast cell lineage .
gata-1 bind to wgatar consensus motif in the regulatory region of virtually all erythroid cell-specific gene .
analysis with culture cell and cell-free system have provide strong evidence that gata-1 be involve in control of globin gene expression during erythroid differentiation .
target mutagenesis of the gata-1 gene in embryonic stem cell have demonstrate it requirement in normal erythroid development .
efficient rescue of the defect require an intact gata element in the distal promoter , suggest autoregulatory control of gata-1 transcription .
to examine whether gata-1 expression involve additional regulatory factor or be maintain entirely by an autoregulatory loop , we have use a transient heterokaryon system to test the ability of erythroid factor to activate the gata-1 gene in nonerythroid nucleus .
we show here that proerythroblasts and mature erythroid cell contain a diffusible activity ( tag ) capable of transcriptional activation of gata-1 and that this activity decrease during the terminal differentiation of erythroid cell .
nucleus from gata-1 -mutant embryonic stem cell can still be reprogrammed to express their globin gene in erythroid heterokaryons , indicate that de novo induction of gata-1 be not require for globin gene activation follow cell fusion .
phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase couple the interleukin-2 receptor to the cell cycle regulator e2f .
cell cycle progression initiate by interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) in t cell be critical for lymphoproliferation and an immune response .
phosphatidyl inositol 3-kinase ( pi3k ) be activate by il-2 .
however , nuclear target for pi3k be not know .
here we identify the cell cycle regulator e2f a an il-2 target in t lymphocyte and pi3k a the critical signaling pathway .
we eliminate both stat5 and raf /mek pathway from e2f regulation .
protein kinase b ( pkb ) be activate by il-2 via pi3k .
the expression of an active pkb be sufficient to induce e2f activity .
inhibition of pi3k inhibit phosphorylation of rb , induction of cyclin d3 , and degradation of p27kip1 .
these result establish a crucial pi3k / pkb -mediated link between the il-2 teceptor and the cell cycle machinery .
sp3 mediate transcriptional activation of the leukocyte integrin gene cd11c and cd11b and cooperate with c-jun to activate cd11c .
the leukocyte integrin gene cd11c and cd11b be express predominately in myelomonocytic cell .
in previous experiment , the -70 to -65 and -121 to -103 region of the cd11c promoter and the -66 to -59 region of the cd11b promoter be show to be essential for sp1- mediated activation of these gene .
in vivo genomic footprinting have also reveal cell-specific binding of protein , presumably sp1 , to these region .
in this study , electrophoretic mobility shift analysis show that the sp1 -related factor , sp3 , also bind at or near these same region .
cotransfection of sp3 along with cd11c promoter -luciferase construct into sp-deficient drosophila schneider 2 cell show that sp3 could activate the cd11c promoter .
deletion of both the -70 to -65 and -121 to -103 region of the cd11c promoter result in the loss of activation by sp3 .
both site show activation by sp3 ; however , the -70 to -65 region be more responsive to sp3 than to sp1 .
similar transfection analysis of the -66 to -59 region of the cd11b promoter show sp3 -dependent expression .
far , cotransfection analysis in drosophila cell show that sp3 , a be previously show for sp1 , also synergizes with c-jun to activate cd11c .
antisense experiment that knock out endogenous sp3 expression in the myelomocytic cell line , hl60 , reveal that sp3 participate in activation of the cd11c and cd11b promoter in vivo .
regulation of human epsilon germline transcription : role of b-cell-specific activator protein .
germline transcript initiate from promoter upstream of the immunoglobulin switch region , and be necessary to target the appropriate switch region for recombination and switching .
different cytokine activate transcription at the appropriate germline promoter .
because bind site for b-cell-specific activator protein ( bsap ) be located upstream of several switch region in the immunoglobulin heavy chain gene cluster , bsap might play a role in the regulation of germline transcription and isotype switching .
we investigate whether bsap play a role in the transcriptional regulation of the epsilon germline promoter in human b cell .
our result show that bsap play a role in both il-4 -dependent induction and cd40 -mediated upregulation of human epsilon germline transcription .
bsap be unique among the transcription factor that regulate epsilon germline expression , because it be b cell specific , and be at the merging point of two signalling pathway that be critical for ige switching .
synthetic glucocorticoid that dissociate transactivation and ap-1 transrepression exhibit antiinflammatory activity in vivo .
some of the most potent antiinflammatory and immunosuppressive agent be synthetic glucocorticoid .
however , major side effect severely limit their therapeutic use .
the development of improved glucocorticoid-based drug will require the separation of beneficial from deleterious effect .
one possibility toward this goal be to try to dissociate two main activity of glucocorticoid , i.e. transactivation and transrepression .
screening of a library of compound use transactivation and ap-1 transrepression model in transiently transfected cell identify dissociate glucocorticoid , which exert strong ap-1 inhibition but little or no transactivation .
importantly , despite high ligand binding affinity , the prototypic dissociate compound , ru24858 , act a a weak agonist and do not efficiently antagonize dexamethasone-induced transcription in transfected cell .
similar result be obtain in hepatic htc cell for the transactivation of the endogenous tyrosine amino transferase gene ( tat ) , which encode one of the enzyme involve in the glucocorticoid-dependent stimulation of neoglucogenesis .
to investigate whether dissociate glucocorticoid retain the antiinflammatory and immunosuppressive potential of classic glucocorticoid , several in vitro and in vivo model be use .
indeed , secretion of the proinflammatory lymphokine interleukin-1beta be severely inhibit by dissociate glucocorticoid in human monocytic thp 1 cell .
moreover , in two in vivo model , these compound exert an antiinflammatory and immunosuppressive activity a potent a that of the classic glucocorticoid prednisolone .
these result may lead to an improvement of antiinflammatory and immunosuppressive therapy and provide a novel concept for drug discovery .
modulation of transcription factor nf kappa b activity by intracellular glutathione level and by variation of the extracellular cysteine supply .
hiv -infected individual and siv -infected rhesus macaque have , on the average , decrease plasma cysteine and cystine concentration and decrease intracellular glutathione level .
we now show that a depletion of intracellular glutathione in a human t cell line ( molt-4 ) inhibit the activation and nuclear translocation of the transcription factor nf kappa b , whereas incubation with increase extracellular concentration of cysteine inhibit the dna-binding and transactivating activity of nf kappa b .
because inhibition of dna-binding activity be associate with increase intracellular glutathione disulfide level and gssg can be show to inhibit the dna-binding activity directly in cell-free system , our study suggest that gssg be a physiologically relevant inhibitor in intact cell also .
nf kappa b control many immunologically important gene , so our study suggest that the immune system may be sensitive not only against a cysteine and glutathione deficiency but also against an excess of cysteine .
regulation of cd14 expression during monocytic differentiation induce with 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 .
cd14 , a monocyte/macrophage receptor for the complex of lp and lp binding protein , be a differentiation marker for the monocyte/macrophage lineage .
we have analyze the regulation of cd14 expression during 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( vitd3 ) -induced monocytic differentiation .
use facs , northern blotting , and nuclear run-on analysis , we demonstrate that the up-regulation of cd14 expression during monocytic cell maturation be regulate mainly at the level of gene transcription , and that new protein synthesis be require for cd14 induction .
we have recently clone the cd14 5' upstream sequence and demonstrate it tissue-specific promoter activity .
use stable transfection of the monocytoid u937 cell line with a series of deletion mutant of the cd14 5' upstream sequence couple to a reporter gene construct , we show that bp -128 to -70 be the critical region for the induction of cd14 expression .
this region contain two bind site for the sp1 transcription factor .
a 3-bp mutation at the distal sp1-binding site not only eliminate sp1 interaction , but also abolish most of the vitd3 induction of cd14 expression .
electrophoretic mobility shift analysis do not detect a direct interaction of the cd14 distal sp1-binding site with the vitamin d3 receptor and it partner , the retinoid x receptor .
these data demonstrate that vitd3 induce cd14 indirectly through some intermediary factor , and suggest a critical role for sp1 in this process .
identification of an i kappa b alpha-associated protein kinase in a human monocytic cell line and determination of it phosphorylation site on i kappa b alpha .
nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) be stored in the cytoplasm a an inactive form through interaction with i kappa b .
stimulation of cell lead to a rapid phosphorylation of i kappa b alpha , which be presume to be important for the subsequent degradation .
we have recently report the establishment of a lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -dependent cell-free activation system of nf-kappa b in association with the induction of i kappa b alpha phosphorylation .
in this study , we have identify a kinase in cell extract from the lp -stimulated human monocytic cell line , thp-1 , that specifically bind and phosphorylates i kappa b alpha .
lp stimulation transiently enhance the i kappa b alpha -bound kinase activity in thp-1 cell .
mutational analysis of i kappa b alpha and competition experiment with the synthetic peptide identify major phosphorylation site by the bind kinase a ser and thr residue in the c-terminal acidic domain of i kappa b alpha .
moreover , we show that the peptide , correspond to the c-terminal acidic domain of i kappa b alpha , block the lp -induced nf-kappa b activation as well a inducible phosphorylation of endogenous i kappa b alpha in a cell-free system use thp-1 cell .
these result suggest that the bound kinase be involve in the signaling pathway of lp by induce the phosphorylation of the c-terminal region of i kappa b alpha and subsequent dissociation of the nf-kappa b . i kappa b alpha complex .
inhibition of p105 processing by nf-kappab protein in transiently transfected cell .
regulation of the transcription factor nf-kappab involve proteasome-mediated processing of the nf-kappab1 p105 precursor protein , which generate the p50 subunit of nf-kappab .
the processing of p105 occur constitutively in vivo but can be markedly enhance by various cellular activation agent , although the underlying regulatory mechanism be not yet clear .
in the present study , we demonstrate that signal-mediated induction of p105 processing in human t cell be associate with de novo synthesis of this precursor protein .
transient transfection study perform in cos7 cell reveal that the newly synthesize p105 protein appear to be more rapidly process compare to it accumulate form that be already associate with the process product p50 .
interestingly , the processing rate of p105 be markedly inhibit in cell co-transfected with p50 or other nf-kappab subunit , include rela and c-rel , that physically interact with p105 .
these finding suggest that the processing of p105 be subject to negative regulation by the various nf-kappab subunit .
we far demonstrate that p105 undergo degradation in lipopolysaccharide -stimulated human monocytic cell .
however , the inducible degradation of p105 be not couple with the generation of p50 .
together , these study demonstrate that the processing and inducible degradation of p105 be differentially regulate .
stimulation of the t-cell antigen receptor-cd3 complex signaling pathway by the tyrosine phosphatase inhibitor pervanadate be mediate by inhibition of cd45 : evidence for two interconnected lck/fyn- or zap-70- dependent signaling pathway .
the tyrosine phosphatase specific inhibitor pervanadate be a potent activator of t lymphocyte through induction of tyrosine phosphorylation and downstream event of the activation cascade .
use cd45- or cd3- negative variant of the jurkat leukemic t-cell line we show that the different biochemical event induce by pervanadate appear to be dependent on the presence at the cell surface of either cd45 or cd3 .
cd45 -dependent event such a tyrosine phosphorylation of shc , activation of nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) , transcription factor , and stimulation of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) promoter and of cd69 and cd25 surface expression parallel activation of the tyrosine kinase lck and fyn .
by contrast , stimulation of calcium influx , a cd3 -dependent event , parallel zap-70 activation .
the data demonstrate that the t-cell antigen receptor -cd3 ( tcr- cd3 ) complex be functionally link to two different protein tyrosine kinase ( ptk ) module with separate specific function and that cd45 may be an important regulator of this coupling .
transcription factor gata-1 and erythroid development .
in summary , we derive an experimental system that allow u to dissect the function of gata-1 in red cell development at a genetic level .
we have establish the essential nature of gata-1 during both primitive and definitive erythropoiesis .
by ablate the expression of the endogenous gata-1 gene , we be in a position to introduce a variety of construct that harbor subtle modification in flanking or protein-coding sequence .
we can now study regulatory region and functional domain of the protein in the context of a true erythroid environment , experiment that have not be possible heretofore .
although the assay involve the dramatic loss of red cell production , it should be possible to define important regulatory domain that can then be assay use less stringent system , such a cell-free extract for in vitro transcription .
the ideal situation would be analysis conduct in gata-1 -erythroid cell .
however , these cell have be impossible to generate give the requirement of gata-1 for epo receptor expression and red cell viability ( c. simon and s. orkin , unpublished observation ) .
it may be possible to produce such cell by first express the epo receptor under the influence of a constitutive promoter and then target the gata-1 gene .
if gata-1 -red cell be available , the analysis would involve the actual transcription of or chromatin structure surround the globin gene .
structure-function study of the gata-1 protein could be greatly simplify and a large number of mutant study .
however , the e cell system can be use a an alternative until target erythroleukemia cell become available .
other application involve the introduction of other gata-binding protein family member to determine whether they rescue the mutation .
if they can not , chimeric protein can be test to identify which amino acid distinguish the different family member .
we feel that these experiment be vital to understand the function of gata-1 during erythroid ontogeny .
how do gata-1 regulate red cell gene like globin or the epo receptor ? once we identify the functional domain of the gata-binding protein , we hope to learn what protein gata-1 bind to in the basic transcription machinery or in chromatin .
be gata-1 necessary for globin gene switching ? gata-1 may be modify differently during development so that the locus control region can interact with different globin promoter .
we may find that one region of the protein be require for embryonic expression and another for adult globin gene expression .
expression of egr-1 correlate with the transform phenotype and the type of viral latency in ebv genome positive lymphoid cell line .
in this paper we have investigate the role of egr-1 in b cell growth regulation by examine the gene expression in a panel of b cell line , include both ebv genome negative and ebv carry cell line .
egr-1 expression correlate with the cellular phenotype and the specific pattern of viral latency establish within the individual cell line .
thus , constitutive activation of egr-1 gene be invariably associate with unrestricted expression of viral latent gene in all group iii ebv genome carry cell line .
in contrast , egr-1 expression be abrogate in group i burkitt tumor cell , irrespective of the ebv genome carrying status .
activate viral gene expression associate with phenotypic conversion of group i cell line in to group ii or iii restore the egr-1 gene expression .
several form of egr-1 protein be find within the different group of cell line , and the binding activity to dna consensus sequence be investigate .
finally , time course analysis of egr-1 expression during the early step of ebv infection in vitro demonstrate that egr-1 be upregulated within minute from the initial interaction with the b lymphocyte .
il-2 -induced growth of cd8+ t cell prolymphocytic leukemia cell mediate by nf-kappab induction and il-2 receptor alpha expression .
the binding of interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) to it receptor on normal t cell induce nuclear expression of nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) , activation of the il-2 receptor ( il-2r ) alpha chain gene , and cell proliferation .
in the present study , the role of il-2r signaling in the growth of cd8+ t cell prolymphocytic leukemia ( t-pll ) cell have be investigate .
flow cytometry reveal that primary leukemia cell from a patient with cd8+ t-pll express il-2r alpha and beta chain , and the cell show a proliferative response and an increase in il-2ralpha expression on culture with exogeneous il-2 .
northern blot analysis fail to detect il-2 mrna , suggest that il-2 may act in a paracrine manner in vivo .
electrophoretic mobility-shift assay reveal that recombinant il-2 increase nf-kappab binding activity in nuclear extract of the leukemia cell , and northern blot analysis show that il-2 increase the abundance of mrna encode the nf-kappab component c-rel and kbf1 in these cell .
il-2 binding analysis demonstrate that il-2 markedly increase the number of low affinity il-2rs on the leukemia cell , without an effect on the number of high-affinity il-2rs .
these result show that il-2 be capable of induce the nuclear expression of nf-kappab in primary cd8+ t-pll cell , and that this effect be mediate , at least in part , at a pretranslational level
triggering of complement receptor cr1 ( cd35 ) and cr3 ( cd11b/cd18 ) induce nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b ( p50 /p65 ) in human monocyte and enhance viral replication in hiv-infected monocytic cell .
monocyte/macrophages may harbor hiv in a nonproductive fashion for prolonged period of time .
viral gene expression may be reactivate by stimulation of the cell with lp or cytokine such a tnf-alpha in vitro .
the effect of lp and tnf-alpha be mediate by their ability to induce nuclear translocation of the dna-binding heterodimer nf-kappa b ( p50 /p65 ) , which bind to a specific sequence in the hiv-long terminal repeat .
the present study demonstrate that triggering of complement receptor cr1 ( cd35 ) and cr3 ( cd11b/cd18 ) enhance viral replication in hiv-infected human monocytic cell .
monocytic cell line and normal peripheral blood monocyte be infect with hiv-1 in vitro and culture in the presence or absence of f(ab')2 fragment of monoclonal anti- cr1 or anti- cr3 ab or with c3 fragment .
stimulation of cr1 or cr3 induce a two- to fourfold increase in the amount of cell-associated and release p24 ag in cell culture that be equivalent to that observe in control culture trigger with lp .
we far observe that stimulation of cr1 or cr3 induce the nuclear translocation of nf-kappa b p50 /p65 in infected cell .
translocation of nf-kappa b p50 /p65 be also observe follow stimulation of cr1 or cr3 of uninfected peripheral blood monocyte from hiv-seronegative donor .
the amount of protein translocate be similar to that observe when cell be stimulate with rhtnf-alpha .
tnf-alpha do not mediate the translocation of nf-kappa b p50 /p65 induce by triggering of complement receptor .
take together , these observation suggest that hiv gene expression may be activate in infected monocyte through interaction of the cell with complement-opsonized particle and that enhance viral replication be associate with c3 receptor -mediated nuclear translocation of the nf-kappa b complex .
[ effect of antihypertensive therapy with captopril on gluco- and mineralo corticoid receptor of peripheral blood lymphocyte in hypertensive patient of various age ]
binding of 3h-dexamethasone and 3h-aldosterone by peripheral lymphocyte receptor be investigate in healthy person and hypertensive patient before and after 2-week captopril treatment .
the number of glucocorticoid and mineralocorticoid binding site be increase in hypertensive v normotensives .
the treatment with the ace inhibitor captopril lead to activation of hormone-receptor interaction .
there be a more marked rise of the number of receptor in middle-aged ( 44-55 year ) hypertensive v elderly ( 61-80 year ) subject after captopril treatment .
interleukin-7 can induce the activation of jak 1 , jak 3 and stat 5 protein in murine t cell .
the activation of janus protein tyrosine kinase ( jak ) and stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) protein have recently be link to the signal transduction mechanism of several cytokine .
il-7 be observe to induce a rapid and dose-dependent tyrosine phosphorylation of jak 1 and jak 3 and concomitantly , the tyrosine phosphorylation and dna binding activity of multiple stat protein .
the stat protein utilize by il-7 be identical to those induce by il-2 and could be identify a various stat 5 isoforms .
moreover , the induction of both jak 1 and 3 , and stat 5 activity strongly correlate with the growth-promoting effect of il-7 , suggest that this signal transduction mechanism may play a key role in il-7 -induced proliferation .
differential autoregulation of glucocorticoid receptor expression in human t- and b- cell line .
regulation of glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) expression by it cognate ligand be examine in the glucocorticoid-sensitive human leukemic t-cell line 6tg1.1 and in the human b-cell line im-9 .
in contrast to the decrease in gr mrna see in im-9 cell after treatment with 1 microm dexamethasone for 16-18 h , treatment of 6tg1.1 cell result in an 8-fold increase in gr mrna , a determine by northern blot and rnase protection analysis , with a corresponding 3- to 4-fold increase in gr protein .
half-maximal induction of gr mrna and protein in 6tg1.1 cell be observe between 10-100 nm dexamethasone , and inclusion of 1 microm ru 38486 completely block the effect of 100 nm dexamethasone , demonstrate that positive autoregulation of gr expression in 6tg1.1 cell be a receptor-mediated response .
positive autoregulation of gr expression be also observe in glucocorticoid-resistant cem-c1 cell , which contain functional gr , but whose growth be unaffected by glucocorticoid .
thus , positive autoregulation be neither a consequence nor the sole cause of growth arrest .
the degree of negative autoregulation in im-9 cell and positive autoregulation in 6tg1.1 cell be unaffected by inhibition of protein synthesis with cycloheximide .
measurement of gr mrna turnover in 6tg1.1 cell treat with actinomycin-d reveal a half-life of 2.5 h , which be unaffected by dexamethasone treatment .
a similar half-life be determine in im-9 cell and be also unaffected by steroid treatment .
these result be consistent with the interpretation that glucocorticoid -mediated autoregulation of gr expression be a tissue-specific primary transcriptional response .
the mhc class ii transactivator ( ciita ) require conserve leucine charged domain for interaction with the conserve w box promoter element .
the class ii transactivator ciita be require for transcriptional activation of the major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii gene .
aside from an n-terminal acidic transcriptional activation domain , little be know about how this factor function .
extensive mutagenesis of ciita be undertake to identify structural motif require for function .
the ability of mutant to activate a reporter gene under the control of mhc class ii conserved w-x-y or x-y regulatory element be determine .
two mutant display differential activity between the two promoter , activate transcription with the w-x-y but not the x-y element .
all mutant be test for their ability to interfere with wild-type ciita activity .
five ciita mutant construction be able to down-regulate wild-type ciita activity .
three of these mutant contain target disruption of potential functional motif : the acidic activation domain , a putative gtp -binding motif and two leucine charged domain ( lcd motif ) .
the other two contain mutation in region that do not have homology to describe protein .
the characterization of ciita mutant that be able to discriminate between promoter with or without the w box strongly suggest that ciita require such interaction for function .
the identification of lcd motif require for ciita function bring to light a previously undefined role of these motif in ciita function .
g(anh)mtetra , a natural bacterial cell wall breakdown product , induce interleukin-1 beta and interleukin-6 expression in human monocyte .
a study of the molecular mechanism involve in inflammatory cytokine expression [ publish erratum appear in j biol chem 1994 jun 17 ; 269 ( 24 ) : 16983 ]
it be believe that induction of cytokine expression by bacterial cell wall component play a role in the development and course of sepsis .
however , most attention have be focus on lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
we study the ability of n-acetylglucosaminyl-1,6-anhydro-n-acetylmuramyl-l-alanyl-d-_isoglutamyl-m-diaminopimelyl-d-alanine ( g(anh)mtetra ) , a naturally occur breakdown product of peptidoglycan that be produce by soluble lytic transglycosylase of escherichia coli , to induce cytokine expression in human monocyte .
g(anh)mtetra be find to strongly induce interleukin ( il ) -1 beta and il-6 mrna expression after 2 h and il-1 beta and il-6 protein secretion after 48 h of activation .
the increase in mrna accumulation be at least partly due to an increase in the transcription rate of the respective gene and be accompany by a strong induction of nuclear factor-kappa b and activator protein-1 transcription factor expression .
experiment use inhibitor of protein kinase c , protein kinase a , and tyrosine kinase-dependent pathway reveal that g(anh)mtetra -induced il-1 beta and il-6 mrna expression involve activation of an h7-inhibitable pathway .
by use the protein synthesis inhibitor cycloheximide , it be show that g(anh)mtetra -induced il-6 mrna expression depend on the synthesis of new protein , whereas g(anh)mtetra -induced il-1 beta mrna accumulation do not .
when response to g(anh)mtetra be compare with those to lp and muramyldipeptide ( mdp ) , it be find that the optimal response to g(anh)mtetra induction be similar to that of lp but significantly high than the response to mdp .
furthermore , maximal g(anh)mtetra -induced il-1 beta and il-6 mrna expression could be enhance by co-stimulation with lp or mdp , suggest that different receptor and/or transduction pathway be involve .
these result indicate that g(anh)mtetra induce il-1 beta and il-6 expression in human monocyte suggest a possible role for g(anh)mtetra in the release of cytokine during sepsis .
transcription mediate by nfat be highly inducible in effector cd4+ t helper 2 ( th2 ) cell but not in th1 cell .
transcriptional factor of the nfat family play an important role in regulate the expression of several cytokine gene during the immune response , such a the gene for interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) and il-4 , among others .
upon antigen stimulation , precursor cd4+ t helper ( pth ) cell proliferate and differentiate into two population of effector cell ( eth1 and eth2 ) , each one express a specific pattern of cytokine that distinguish them from their precursor .
eth2 cell be the major source of il-4 , while gamma interferon be produce by eth1 cell .
here we have use reporter transgenic mouse to show that dna binding and transcriptional activity of nfat be transiently induce during the differentiation of pth cell into either eth1 or eth2 cell to mediate the expression of il-2 a a common growth factor in both pathway .
however , although nfat dna binding be similarly induce in both eth1 and eth2 cell upon antigen stimulation , only the nfat complex present in eth2 cell be able to mediate high-level transcription , and relatively little nfat transcriptional activity be induce in eth1 cell .
in contrast to activate pth cell , neither eth1 nor eth2 cell produce significant il-2 upon stimulation , but the high level of nfat transcriptional activity directly correlate with the il-4 production induce in response to antigen stimulation in eth2 cell .
these data suggest that activate nfat be involve in the effector function of eth2 cell and that the failure of eth1 cell to produce il-4 in response to an antigen be due , at least partially , to a failure to induce high-level transcription of the il-4 gene by nfat .
regulation of nfat could be therefore a critical element in the polarization to eth1 or eth2 .
involvement of egr-1 /rela synergy in distinguish t cell activation from tumor necrosis factor-alpha -induced nf-kappa b1 transcription .
nf-kappa b be an important transcription factor require for t cell proliferation and other immunological function .
the nf-kappa b1 gene encode a 105-kd protein that be the precursor of the p50 component of nf-kappa b .
previously , we and others have demonstrate that nf-kappa b regulate the nf-kappa b1 gene .
in this manuscript we have investigate the molecular mechanism by which t cell line stimulate with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) and phytohemagglutin ( pha ) display significantly high level of nf-kappa b1 encoding transcript than cell stimulate with tumor necrosis factor-alpha , despite the fact that both stimulus activate nf-kappa b .
characterization of the nf-kappa b1 promoter identify an egr-1 site which be find to be essential for both the pma / pha -mediated induction as well a the synergistic activation observe after the expression of the rela subunit of nf-kappa b and egr-1 .
furthermore , egr-1 induction be require for endogenous nf-kappa b1 gene expression , since pma / pha -stimulated t cell line express antisense egr-1 rna be inhibit in their ability to upregulate nf-kappa b1 transcription .
our study indicate that transcriptional synergy mediate by activation of both egr-1 and nf-kappa b may have important ramification in t cell development by upregulating nf-kappa b1 gene expression .
induction of the cd11b gene during activation of the monocytic cell line u937 require a novel nuclear factor ms-2 [ publish erratum appear in j immunol 1999 jul 15 ; 163 ( 2 ) : 1091 ]
the differentiation of myeloid precursor into mature myelomonocytic cell be characterize by the induction of the gene encode the beta2 integrin cd11b .
the transcription factor sp1 and pu.1 prime the cd11b promoter , but the nature of the factor responsible for it inducible expression be unknown .
in addition to the cd11b gene , the homologous gene encode cd11a and cd11c also exhibit inducible expression during myeloid differentiation .
therefore , we compare the nucleotide sequence of the cd11a , cd11b , and cd11c gene promoter to identify common element that might contribute to inducible expression .
this analysis identify one such element repeat four time within the cd11b promoter .
mutation of these element indicate that two , ms-2beta and ms-2gamma , be critical to the induction of the cd11b gene during differentiation of the pro-monocytic cell line u937 .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay indicate that ms-2beta and ms-2gamma interact with nuclear factor that be induce during u937 differentiation .
these factor be detect at the time the cd11b promoter be activate .
the molecular mass of these factor be approximately 28 kda , and their dna binding characteristic be indistinguishable from those of the novel nuclear factor ms-2 .
take together , our data indicate that ms-2 mediate induction of the cd11b gene a cell of the monocytic lineage mature .
the presence of multiple potential bind site for ms-2 in the promoter region of a wide range of gene express in mature myeloid cell suggest this factor play a general role in myeloid differentiation .
control of nfatx1 nuclear translocation by a calcineurin -regulated inhibitory domain .
the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) regulate cytokine gene expression in t cell through cis-acting element located in the promoter of several cytokine gene .
nfatx1 , which be preferentially express in the thymus and peripheral blood leukocyte , be one of four member of the nfat family of transcription factor .
we have perform domain analysis of nfatx1 by examine the effect of deletion mutation .
we find that nfatx1 dna binding activity and interaction with ap-1 polypeptide be dependent on it central rel similarity region and that transcriptional activation be reduce by deletion of either it n-terminal domain or it c-terminal domain , suggest the presence of intrinsic transcriptional activation motif in both region .
we also identify a potent inhibitory sequence within it n-terminal domain .
we show that the inactivation of the inhibition be dependent on the activity of calcineurin , a calcium-calmodulin-dependent phosphatase .
we also show that calcineurin associate with the n-terminal domain of nfatx1 at multiple docking site and cause a reduction of size , indicative of dephosphorylation , in nfatx1 .
we have map the inhibitory activity to less than 60 residue , contain motif that be conserve in all nfat protein .
finally , we demonstrate that deletion in nfatx1 of the map 60 residue lead to it nuclear translocation independent of calcium signaling .
our result support the model propose that the n-terminal domain confer calcium -signaling dependence on nfatx1 transactivation activity by regulate it intracellular localization through a protein module that associate with calcineurin and be a target of it phosphatase activity .
temporal control of igh gene expression in develop b cell by the 3' locus control region .
the suggest role of the downstream 3' region act a a locus control region ( lcr ) , have allow comparison to be make between the regulation of the igh locus with other model system whose gene expression be govern by lcr activity .
here we summarize the importance of the igh 3' lcr and it putative functional role in igh gene expression and compare it with the 5' lcr regulatory region of the human beta-globin locus .
regulation of interleukin-1 beta production by glucocorticoid in human monocyte : the mechanism of action depend on the activation signal .
glucocorticoid be know to downregulate interleukin-1 beta production in monocytic cell by two different mechanims : direct inhibition of the gene transcription and destabilization of the preformed interleukin-1 beta mrna .
now we have examine the effect of the nature of the monocyte activating signal on these two inhibitory mechanims .
when human monocyte be preincubated with dexamethasone for 1 hour and then stimulate either with bacterial lipopolysaccharide or phorbol myristate , it be find that dexamethasone inhibit the lipopolysaccharide-induced interleukin-1 beta protein production , but the phorbol myristate -induced production be increase 3-10 fold .
this difference be also see at the mrna level .
when dexamethasone be add to the culture 3 hour after the stimulators , it clearly decrease the interleukin-1 beta mrna level regardless of the stimulator use ( although the effect be clearly weak on the pma-induced mrna ) .
thus these data suggest that the phorbol myristate-induced signal ( prolonged protein kinase c activation ? ) can not be inhibit by prior incubation with dexamethasone and it also protect the induce mrna for the degradative action of dexamethasone .
distinct mechanism for n-acetylcysteine inhibition of cytokine-induced e-selectin and vcam-1 expression .
we have examine the effect of n-acetyl-l-cysteine ( nac ) , a well-characterized , thiol-containing antioxidant , on agonist-induced monocytic cell adhesion to endothelial cell ( ec ) .
nac inhibit interleukin-1 ( il-1 beta ) -induced , but not basal , adhesion with 50 % inhibition at approximately 20 mm .
monocytic cell adhesion to ec in response to tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) , lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , alpha-thrombin , or phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) be similarly inhibit by nac .
unlike publish study with pyrrolidinedithiocarbamate , which specifically inhibit vascular cell adhesion molecule 1 ( vcam-1 ) , nac inhibit il-1 beta -induced mrna and cell surface expression of both e-selectin and vcam-1 .
nac have no effect on the half-life of e-selectin or vcam-1 mrna .
although nac reduce nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) activation in ec a measure by gel-shift assay use an oligonucleotide probe correspond to the consensus nf-kappa b binding site of the vcam-1 gene ( vcam- nf-kappa b ) , the antioxidant have no appreciable effect when an oligomer correspond to the consensus nf-kappa b binding site of the e-selectin gene ( e-selectin -nf-kappa b ) be use .
because nf-kappa b have be report to be redox sensitive , we study the effect of nac on the ec redox environment .
nac cause an expect dramatic increase in the reduce glutathione ( gsh ) level in ec .
in vitro study demonstrate that whereas the binding affinity of nf-kappa b to the vcam- nf-kappa b oligomer peak at a gsh -to-oxidized glutathione ( gssg ) ratio of approximately 200 and decrease at high ratio , the binding to the e-selectin -nf-kappa b oligomer appear relatively unaffected even at ratio > 400 , i.e. , those achieve in ec treat with 40 mm nac .
these result suggest that nf-kappa b binding to it consensus sequence in the vcam-1 and e-selectin gene exhibit marked difference in redox sensitivity , allow for differential gene expression regulate by the same transcription factor .
our data also demonstrate that nac increase the gsh -to- gssg ratio within the ec suggest one possible mechanism through which this antioxidant inhibit agonist-induced monocyte adhesion to ec .
characterization of nf(p) , the nuclear factor that interact with the regulatory p sequence ( 5'-cgaaaatttcc-3' ) of the human interleukin-4 gene : relationship to nf-kappa b and nf-at .
the p sequence of the human interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) gene , which be define a a responsive element for phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate and calcium ionophore ( a23187 ) in jurkat t cell , share sequence similarity with the nf-kappa b and the nf-at binding site .
we examine whether nf(p) , a nuclear factor specific for the p sequence , be related to nf-kappa b and nf-at .
nf-kappa b ( p65 or p65/p50 heterodimer ) bind to the p sequence in electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) and activate transcription through the p sequence when expression plasmid be cotransfected with p sequence -driven reporter plasmid in jurkat t cell .
in emsas , nf(p) binding be inhibit by the unlabeled nf-at binding site but not by the unlabeled ap1 binding site and purify nf-at contain an activity that bind to the p sequence .
both mobility shift and sequence specificity of nf-at be similar to those of nf(p) and only a small amount of p65 be detect in nf(p) in crude nuclear extract .
these result indicate that the component ( s ) of nf-at have the potential to reconstitute nf(p) whereas nf-kappa b alone can not account for nf(p) in crude extract .
unlike nf-at , nf(p) do not contain ap1 a it dna binding component .
the suppression of t cell function and nf(kappa)b expression by serine protease inhibitor be block by n-acetylcysteine .
direct evidence that n-acetylcysteine ( nac ) enhance the immune response of peripheral blood t cell at the level of nf(kappa)b be present .
in addition , nac block the suppression of t cell mitogenesis and cytokine production by protease inhibitor such a n-tosylphenylalanine chloromethyl ketone ( tpck ) .
the proliferative response of purify cd4+ or cd8+ t cell be suppress more strongly by tpck when anti-cd28 rather than the phorbol ester pma be use a the mitogenic coactivator .
cytokine ( il-2 , il-6 , inf-gamma ) production be inhibit 95-100 % by concentration of tpck that totally suppress the mitogenesis of cd4+ or cd8+ cell .
use electrophoretic mobility shift assay , we find that tpck virtually abolish ( to less than 1 % ) the level of nf(kappa)b ( but not oct-1 ) find in nuclear and whole cell extract of activate t cell .
strikingly , the immunosuppressive effect of tpck be block when t cell be pretreated for 15 min with 5 mm nac .
nac not only block the effect of tpck but enhance mitogenesis and cytokine production ( > 2.5-fold in some case ) upon activation of unsuppressed t cell .
our data support the notion that nf ( kappa ) b and i ( kappa ) b protease play obligate role in t cell activation and mitogenesis , role that be enhance significantly by nac .
the small gtp -binding protein rho potentiate ap-1 transcription in t cell .
the rho family of small gtp -binding protein be involve in the regulation of cytoskeletal structure , gene transcription , specific cell fate development , and transformation .
we demonstrate in this report that overexpression of an activated form of rho enhance ap-1 activity in jurkat t cell in the presence of phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) , but activate rho ( v14rho ) have little or no effect on nfat , oct-1 , and nf-kappab enhancer element activity under similar condition .
overexpression of a v14rho construct incapable of membrane localization ( caax delete ) abolish pma -induced ap-1 transcriptional activation .
the effect of rho on ap-1 be independent of the mitogen-activated protein kinase pathway , a a dominant-negative mek and a mek inhibitor ( pd98059 ) do not affect rho -induced ap-1 activity .
v14rho bind strongly to protein kinase calpha ( pkcalpha ) in vivo ; however , deletion of the caax site on v14rho severely diminish this association .
evidence for a role for pkcalpha a an effector of rho be obtain by the observation that coexpression of the n-terminal domain of pkcalpha block the effect of activate rho plus pma on ap-1 transcriptional activity .
these data suggest that rho potentiate ap-1 transcription during t-cell activation
detection of intracellular signal transduction molecule in pbmc from rhesus macaque and sooty mangabey .
one of the manifestation of human hiv-1 and nonhuman primate siv infection that lead to disease be reason to be secondary to generalize t-cell dysfunction .
the molecular mechanism associate with the t-cell dysfunction remain to be elucidate .
to address this issue , we seek to utilize the nonhuman primate model to study intracellular signaling event in cell from disease-susceptible rhesus macaque and disease-resistant sooty mangabey .
because relatively little be know about these event in nonhuman primate , our laboratory define optimal condition , reagent , and assay for the study of signal transduction event in cell from nonhuman primate .
the protein phosphorylation pattern in the two monkey exhibit quantitative , qualitative , and kinetic difference .
antibody to stat6 detect a unique band in macaque cell lysates .
this band be markedly decrease human cell lysates and never see in mangabey cell lysates .
detection of various other intracellular signaling protein be also describe .
arrest development : understand v-abl .
the protein tyrosine kinase activity of the v-abl oncogene have be demonstrate to subvert the normal second messenger system use by lymphoid cell for growth and differentiation .
transformation of bone marrow with the abelson murine leukemia virus result in the appearance of b cell lineage cell arrest at the pre-b cell stage .
recent report have characterize these cell express high v-abl kinase activity a deficient in detectable nf-kappab dna binding activity and low level rag gene expression .
these observation suggest that v-abl may be inhibit the differentiation of b cell by block these two crucial element in the maturation pathway .
regulation of ikb alpha phosphorylation by pkc- and ca(2+)- dependent signal transduction pathway .
the ca(2+) -dependent phosphatase calcineurin , a target of fk506 and csa , synergizes with pkc -induced activation of nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappa b in t cell line .
we have investigate whether this synergy be present in other cell type and the mechanism ( s ) by which these two pathway lead to nf-kappa b activation .
while this synergy be present in other cell type , in the monocytic cell line u937 calcineurin be also sufficient to activate nf-kappa b .
have previously show that ca(2+)- and pkc- dependent pathway synergize by accelerate the degradation of ikb alpha , we focus on the regulation of ikb alpha phosphorylation .
while pkc -dependent pathway sequentially result in the phosphorylation and in an incomplete degradation of ikb alpha in t cell line , co-activation of ca(2+) -dependent pathway accelerate the rate of ikb alpha phosphorylation and result in it complete degradation .
activation of ca(2+) -dependent pathway alone do not result in the phosphorylation and/or degradation of ikb alpha in jurkat t or in u937 cell .
treatment of t cell with the selective pkc inhibitor gf109203x abrogate the pma -induced ikb alpha phosphorylation /degradation irrespective of activation of ca(2+) -dependent pathway , but not the phosphorylation and degradation of ikb alpha induce by tnf-alpha , a pkc -independent stimulus .
contrary to the interaction with pkc , ca(2+) -dependent pathway synergize with tnf-alpha not at the level of ikb alpha phosphorylation , but at the level of it degradation .
these result indicate that ca(2+) -dependent pathway , include the phosphatase calcineurin , participate in the regulation of nf-kappa b in a cell specific fashion and synergize with pkc -dependent and -independent pathway at the level of ikb alpha phosphorylation and degradation .
tcl1 oncogene activation in preleukemic t cell from a case of ataxia-telangiectasia .
the tcl1 oncogene on human chromosome 14q32.1 be involve in chromosome translocation [ t(14;14)(q11;q32.1) and t(7;14)(q35;q32.1) ] and inversion [ inv14(q11;q32.1) ] with tcr alpha/beta locus in t-cell leukemia , such a t-prolymphocytic ( t-pll ) .
it be also involve in t- acute and - chronic leukemia arise in case of ataxia-telangiectasia ( at ) , an immunodeficiency syndrome .
similar chromosomal rearrangement occur also in the clonally expand t cell in at patient before the appearance of the overt leukemia .
we have analyze the expression of tcl1 mrna and protein in peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbls ) from four at case and from healthy control .
we find that the tcl1 gene be overexpressed in the pbls of an at patient with a large clonal t-cell population exhibit the t(14;14) translocation but not in the lymphocyte of the other case .
fluorescence in situ hybridization of the tcl1 genomic locus to lymphocyte metaphase from the at patient with the t-cell clonal expansion show that the breakpoint of the t(14;14) translocation lie within the tcl1 locus and be accompany by an invert duplication of the distal part of chromosome 14 .
these data indicate that tcl1 be activate in preleukemic clonal cell a a consequence of chromosome translocation involving sequence from the tcr locus at 14q11 .
deregulation of tcl1 be the first event in the initiation of malignancy in these type of leukemia and represent a potential tool for clinical evaluation .
mek1 and the extracellular signal-regulated kinase be require for the stimulation of il-2 gene transcription in t cell .
tcr engagement stimulate the activation of the protein kinase raf-1 .
active raf-1 phosphorylates and activate the mitogen-activated protein ( map ) kinase /extracellular signal-regulated kinase kinase 1 ( mek1 ) , which in turn phosphorylates and activate the map kinases/extracellular signal regulated kinase , erk1 and erk2 .
raf-1 activity promote il-2 production in activate t lymphocyte .
therefore , we seek to determine whether mek1 and erk activity also stimulate il-2 gene transcription .
expression of constitutively active raf-1 or mek1 in jurkat t cell enhance the stimulation of il-2 promoter -driven transcription stimulate by a calcium ionophore and pma , and together with a calcium ionophore the expression of each protein be sufficient to stimulate nf-at activity .
expression of mek1 -interfering mutant inhibit the stimulation of il-2 promoter -driven transcription and block the ability of constitutively active ra and raf-1 to costimulate nf-at activity with a calcium ionophore .
expression of the map kinase-specific phosphatase , mkp-1 , which block erk activation , inhibit il-2 promoter and nf-at -driven transcription stimulate by a calcium ionophore and pma , and in addition , mkp-1 neutralize the transcriptional enhancement cause by active raf-1 and mek1 expression .
we conclude that the map kinase signal transduction pathway consist of raf-1 , mek1 , and erk1 and erk2 function in the stimulation il-2 gene transcription in activate t lymphocyte .
stimulation of hiv replication in mononuclear phagocyte by leukemia inhibitory factor .
this study examine the effect of leukemia inhibitory factor ( lif ) on human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) replication in mononuclear phagocyte ( mnp ) .
lif induce a dose-dependent increase in p24 antigen production in the chronically infected promonocytic cell line u1 .
the magnitude and time kinetics of the lif effect be similar to interleukin 1 ( il-1 ) , il-6 , and tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) , other cytokine know to induce hiv replication in this cell line .
to characterize mechanism responsible for these lif effect , level of hiv mrna , activation of the dna binding protein nuclear factor ( nf ) -kb , signal transduction pathway , and potential interaction with other cytokine be analyze .
lif increase steady-state level of hiv mrna at 2.0 , 4.3 , and 9.2 kb .
this be detectable by 24 h and persist until 72 h .
the dna binding protein nf-kb be a central mediator in cytokine activation of hiv transcription .
nf-kb level be high in unstimulated u1 cell a compare to the parent cell line u937 .
in both cell line lif increase nf-kb activity .
induction of nf-kb and hiv replication by cytokine be at least in part dependent on reactive oxygen intermediate .
the oxygen radical scavenger n-acetyl-l-cysteine , but not an inhibitor of nitric oxide synthase , inhibit lif -induced hiv replication .
lif induce the production of other cytokine in monocyte but it effect on hiv replication be not inhibit by antibody to il-1 , tnf , or il-6 .
these result identify lif a a stimulus of hiv replication .
