induction of mn sod in human monocyte without inflammatory cytokine production by a mutant endotoxin .
endotoxin selectively induce monocyte mn superoxide dismutase ( sod ) without affect level of cu , zn sod , catalase , or glutathione peroxidase .
however , little be know about the structure-activity relationship and the mechanism by which endotoxin induce mn sod .
in this study we demonstrate that a mutant escherichia coli endotoxin lack myristoyl fatty acid at the 3' r-3-hydroxymyristate position of the lipid a moiety retain it full capacity to coagulate limulus amoebocyte lysate compare with the wild-type e . coli endotoxin and markedly stimulate the activation of human monocyte nuclear factor-kappab and the induction of mn sod mrna and enzyme activity .
however , in contrast to the wild-type endotoxin , it fail to induce significant production of tumor necrosis factor-alpha and macrophage inflammatory protein-1alpha by monocyte and do not induce the phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of mitogen-activated protein kinase .
these result suggest that 1 ) lipid a myristoyl fatty acid , although it be important for the induction of inflammatory cytokine production by human monocyte , be not necessary for the induction of mn sod , 2 ) endotoxin -mediated induction of mn sod and inflammatory cytokine be regulate , at least in part , through different signal transduction pathway , and 3 ) failure of the mutant endotoxin to induce tumor necrosis factor-alpha production be , at least in part , due to it inability to activate mitogen-activated protein kinase .
direct suppression of stat1 function during adenoviral infection .
the action of adenoviral e1a oncoprotein on host immune-response gene have be attribute to interaction with p300/cbp-type transcriptional coactivators in competition with endogenous transcription factor such a signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein .
however , we show that mutant form of e1a that no longer bind p300/cbp can still interact directly with stat1 ( via e1a n-terminal and stat1 c-terminal residue ) and block ifngamma-driven , stat1 -dependent gene activation and consequent function during early-phase infection in the natural host cell .
the result provide a distinct and more specific mechanism for e1a -mediated immune suppression and an alternative model of ifngamma -driven enhanceosome formation that may allow for other adaptor ( in addition to p300/cbp ) to link stat1 to the basal transcription complex .
the immediate-early gene product egr-1 regulate the human interleukin-2 receptor beta-chain promoter through noncanonical egr and sp1 binding site .
the interleukin-2 il-2 receptor beta-chain ( il-2rbeta ) be an essential component of the receptor for il-2 and il-15 .
although il-2rbeta be constitutively express by lymphocyte , it expression can be far induce by a number of stimulus , include phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) .
we have now characterize factor that bind to an enhancer region located between nucleotide -170 and -139 of the human il-2rbeta promoter .
both sp1 and sp3 bind to the 5' portion of this region , whereas a pma -inducible factor ( pif ) mainly bind to it 3' portion and bind to the sp binding motif as well .
in jurkat t cell , induction of pif dna binding activity be rapidly induce , require de novo protein synthesis , and be sustained at a high level for at least 23 h .
interestingly , pif be constitutively activate in human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 -transformed mt-2 cell .
in this paper , we demonstrate that pif be egr-1 base on it recognition by anti- egr-1 antiserum in gel mobility shift assay , even though the il-2rbeta dna binding motif differ substantially from the canonical egr-1 binding site .
in addition , egr-1 bind to the sp binding site .
in jurkat cell , both site be require for maximal il-2rbeta promoter activity , and in helas3 cell , transfection of egr-1 could drive activity of a reporter construct contain both site .
moreover , sp1 and egr-1 could form a complex with kinetics that correlate with the production of egr-1 in jurkat cell upon pma stimulation .
thus , sp1 and egr-1 physically and functionally cooperate to mediate maximal il-2rbeta promoter activity .
defective transcription of the il-2 gene be associate with impaired expression of c-fos , fosb , and junb in anergic t helper 1 cell .
anergic cd4+ th cell do not produce il-2 when challenge with ag-pulsed accessory cell because of a transcriptional defect .
in this work , we report that these anergic t cell be defective in their ability to up-regulate protein binding and transactivation at two critical il-2 dna enhancer element : nf-at ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ; a sequence that bind a heterotrimeric nfatp , fo , and jun protein complex ) and activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) ( that bind fo and jun heterodimers ) .
western blot analysis of nuclear extract show that the impaired dna-protein interaction in anergic t cell be associate with poor expression of the inducible ap-1 family member c-fos , fosb , and junb .
however , the reduce expression of these protein be not the result of a global tcr/cd3 -signaling defect because cd3 cross-linking induce an equivalent increase in intracellular-free calcium ion , as well a nfatp dephosphorylation , translocation to the nucleus , and dna binding in both normal and anergic t cell .
thus , defective il-2 gene transcription appear to be due , at least in part , to a selective block in the expression of the ap-1 fo and jun family member in anergic t cell .
calcium dependent activation of the nf-at transcription factor by p59fyn .
a reporter gene under the control of a t-cell antigen receptor element be activate in jurkat cell by antigen receptor triggering or by a combination of phorbol myristate acetate , which activate protein kinase c , and a calcium ionophore .
both these signal be necessary for expression of the reporter gene .
when co-transfected with a construct capable of overexpressing the tyrosine kinase p59fyn , the reporter gene be activate by pma alone .
thus p59fyn could replace the calcium ionophore but not activation of protein kinase c .
the activation by p59fyn plus pma be block by egta and by the immunosuppressant drug cyclosporin a .
a microtitre assay system for glucocorticoid receptor : decrease receptor concentration in myocardial infarction .
a major difficulty in determination of glucocorticoid receptor site be the very complicated assay procedure .
therefore , we describe a microtitre assay system for glucocorticoid receptor which be a whole-cell competitive binding radioassay use [3h]-dexamethasone a radioligand .
this modification of a previously describe protocol simplify and reduce laboratory work and allow assay reproducibility to be control more reliably .
thus enable to perform the test on multiple blood sample in parallel , we investigate cardiac infarction patient over a 12-day period to test if glucocorticoid receptor binding be alter in this ' stressful ' disease .
on the first day of the disease , glucocorticoid receptor capacity be significantly decrease without alteration of the receptor-ligand affinity , whereas on day 4 and 12 the number of receptor site be normal again .
this result fit well into the general observation of stress-induced down-regulation of immune response .
itk , a t cell-specific tyrosine kinase , be require for cd2-mediated interleukin-2 promoter activation in the human t cell line jurkat .
we investigate the functional role of itk , a member of the cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase tec family , in t cell activation .
stimulation of either cd2 or t cell receptor ( tcr ) /cd3 on tcells by monoclonal antibody-mediated cross-linking induce tyrosine phosphorylation of itk , which be maximal as early a 1 min after stimulation .
the tyrosine kinase activity in the anti- itk immunoprecipitate be significantly activate upon these stimulation .
interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) promoter activity stimulate by cross-linking of cd2 , tcr /cd3 , and cd28 with antibody be significantly reduce by transient expression of an itk mutant lack the kinase activity .
the reduction parallel a decrease in tyrosine phosphorylation of endogenous wild-type itk .
stimulation of cd2 or tcr/cd3 induce activation of the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) , the bind site of which be include in the il-2 gene promoter .
the activation of nfat be also impair by expression of the itk mutant .
these result demonstrate that itk play a role in il-2 production , indicate a critical involvement of itk in the initial stage of t cell activation by mediate signal from the tcr/cd3 complex , cd2 , and cd28 .
cd14 -mediated translocation of nuclear factor-kappa b induce by lipopolysaccharide do not require tyrosine kinase activity .
during the course of serious bacterial infection , lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) be believe to interact with macrophage receptor , result in the generation of inflammatory mediator and systemic symptom include hemodynamic instability and shock .
cd14 , a glycosylphosphatidylinositol-linked antigen , function a an lp signaling receptor .
a critical issue concern the mechanism by which cd14 , which have no transmembrane domain , transduce it signal follow lp binding .
recently , investigator have hypothesize that cd14 -mediated signaling be effect through a receptor-associated tyrosine kinase ( tk ) , suggest a multicomponent receptor model of lp signaling .
wild-type chinese hamster ovary ( cho ) -k1 cell can be activate by endotoxin to release arachidonate follow transfection with human cd14 ( cho/ cd14 ) .
nuclear translocation of cytosolic nf-kappa b be correlate with a number of lp -inducible response .
we seek to determine if this pathway be present in cho/ cd14 cell and to elucidate the relationship of nf-kappa b activation to the cd14 receptor system .
lp -stimulated translocation of nf-kappa b in cho/ cd14 cell resemble the same response in the murine macrophage-like cell line raw 264.7 .
protein synthesis inhibitor and corticosteroid , which suppress arachidonate release and the synthesis of proinflammatory cytokine , have no effect on translocation of nf-kappa b in cho/ cd14 or raw 264.7 cell , demonstrate that nf-kappa b translocation be an early event .
although tk activity be consistently observe by immunoblotting extract from activate raw 264.7 cell , lps-induced phosphotyrosine residue be not observe from similarly treat cho/cd14 cell .
furthermore , the tk inhibitor herbimycin a and genistein fail to inhibit translocation of nf-kappa b in cho/cd14 or raw 264.7 cell , although both of these agent inhibit lp -induced tk activity in raw 264.7 cell .
these result imply that tk activity be not obligatory for cd14 -mediated signal transduction to occur in response to lp .
cyclosporin a interfere with the inducible degradation of nf-kappa b inhibitor , but not with the processing of p105/ nf-kappa b1 in t cell .
the transcription factor nf-kappa b control the induction of numerous cytokine promoter during the activation of t lymphocyte .
inhibition of t cell activation by the immunosuppressant cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 exert a suppressive effect on the induction of these nf-kappa b -controlled cytokine promoter .
we show for human jurkat t leukemia cell , as well a human and mouse primary t lymphocyte , that this inhibitory effect be accompany by an impaired nuclear translocation of the rel protein c-rel , rela/p65 and nf-kappa b1/p50 , whereas the nuclear appearance of relb remain unaffected .
csa do not interfere with the synthesis of rel protein , but prevent the inducible degradation of cytosolic nf-kappa b inhibitor i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta upon t cell activation .
csa neither inhibit the processing of the nf-kappa b1 precursor p105 to p50 , nor do it " stabilize " the c-terminal portion of p105 , i kappa b gamma , which be degrade during p105 processing to mature p50 .
these result indicate that csa interfere with a specific event in the signal-induced degradation of i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta , but do not affect the processing of nf-kappa b1/ p105 to p50 .
analysis of cytokine signaling in patient with extrinsic asthma and hyperimmunoglobulin e .
background : recent data suggest that the regulation of class switching to ige by cytokine be mediate by stat transcription factor .
the induction of ige by il-4 and il-13 occur through the activation of the intracellular signal-transducing protein stat6 , whereas the inhibition of ige class switching by interferon-y ( ifn-gamma ) occur through the activation of statl .
objective : we hypothesize that in extrinsic asthma or in case of markedly elevated ige ( ie , hyperimmunoglobulin e [ hie ] ) increase level of ige may be associate with alteration in the cytokine level or the activation of stat6 .
method : pbmcs and serum from 8 patient with extrinsic asthma ( mean ige , 285+/-100 iu/ml ) , 3 patient with hie ( mean ige , 7050+/-1122 iu/ml ) , and 14 nonatopic control subject ( mean ige , 112+/-28 iu/ml ) be analyze .
result : the mean il-4 level detect by elisa be much great in patient with hie than control subject ( 88.6+/-11.5 pg/ml v 11.5+/-7.1 pg/ml , p = .005 ) , and increase il-4 level among patient with both asthma and hie correlate with the increase ige level .
in contrast , il-13 level be not elevated .
level of stat6 protein present in pbmcs do not differ in the patient and control subject .
examination of stat6 dna-binding activity demonstrate no activation of il-4 signaling in patient with either hie or acute asthma .
interestingly , evidence for the presence of b cell that have already switch to ige be see in pbmcs of several patient with asthma or hie .
conclusion : these result indicate that ( 1 ) ige production in asthma and hie usually be associate with elevated level of il-4 , but not il-13 , in the peripheral blood ; ( 2 ) the increase serum il-4 level in asthma and hie be not sufficient to induce stat6 activation in pbmcs ; and ( 3 ) evidence of switch recombination to epsilon may be detect in isolate case of elevated ige .
this imply that high level of ige in these patient either result from b cell that have already undergo class switching , from ig class switching that be localized to target tissue , or both .
inhibition of nf-kappa b activation in vitro and in vivo : role of 26 proteasome .
it be become increasingly apparent that nf-kappa b play a critical role in regulate the inflammatory response .
data obtain from study in our laboratory demonstrate that the proteasome play an important role in the inflammatory cascade by regulate the activation of nf-kappa b .
indeed , the availability of selective and orally active proteasome inhibitor should prove useful in delineate the role of the proteasome and nf-kappa b in other pathophysiological condition such a cancer and heart disease .
inhibition of phorbol ester-induced monocytic differentiation by dexamethasone be associate with down-regulation of c-fos and c-jun ( ap-1 ) .
previous study have show that treatment of human myeloid leukemia cell with 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) be associate with induction of monocytic differentiation and expression of the c-jun and c-fos early response gene .
the present work demonstrate that the glucocorticoid dexamethasone inhibit tpa -induced increase in c-jun and c-fos mrna level in u-937 leukemia cell .
these finding be associate with a block in appearance of the monocytic phenotype , include inhibition of tpa -induced increase in lamin a , lamin c , and vimentin transcript .
other study have demonstrate that tpa -induced monocytic differentiation and expression of the c-jun and c-fos gene in myeloid leukemia cell be regulate by protein kinase c ( pkc ) .
the finding that dexamethasone have no effect on tpa -induced activation of pkc suggest that this glucocorticoid inhibit signal downstream or parallel to this enzyme .
nuclear run-on assay demonstrate that : ( 1 ) induction of c-jun and c-fos expression by tpa be regulate by transcriptional mechanism , ( 2 ) tpa -induced expression of c-jun and c-fos do not require protein synthesis , and ( 3 ) tpa -induced expression of both gene be inhibit at the transcriptional level by dexamethasone .
to far define the effect of dexamethasone at the molecular level , we prepare a series of delete c-jun promoter fragment link to the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) gene .
increase in cat activity during transient expression of these construct in tpa -treated u-937 cell could be assign to the region ( -97 to -20 ) of the promoter that contain the ap-1 binding site .
this induction of cat activity be sensitive to dexamethasone .
these finding suggest that dexamethasone down-regulates tpa -induced transcription of the c-jun gene during monocytic differentiation by inhibit activation of the ap-1 site .
nf-kappab only partially mediate epstein-barr virus latent membrane protein 1 activation of b cell .
the latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) be require for ebv -induced immortalization of human b cell and cause tumorigenic transformation of cell line .
lmp1 expression induce phenotypic change resemble b cell activation , such a cell size increase and up-regulation of cell surface activation marker .
lmp1 contain two domain that activate the transcription factor nf-kappab , one through interaction with traf protein and the other with the tradd protein .
the purpose of the present study be to investigate the importance of nf-kappab induction in the up-regulation of the b cell activation marker icam-1 and cd71 by lmp1 .
this study show that expression of lmp1 activate transcription from p50/p65- and c-rel- responsive promoter , and that this activity can be completely inhibit by expression of a dominant inhibitory ikappab mutant .
icam-1 and cd71 be nevertheless up-regulated by lmp1 in primary b cell and cell line express the dominant ikappab .
furthermore , lmp1 -induced cell size increase of primary b cell be unaffected by ikappab expression .
it be conclude that even when lmp1 be unable to activate nf-kappab , it be still capable of induce certain characteristic of activate b cell , strongly suggest that lmp1 can also activate cell independently of nf-kappab .
nf-kappab activation be a critical regulator of human granulocyte apoptosis in vitro .
during beneficial inflammation , potentially tissue-damaging granulocyte undergo apoptosis before be clear by phagocyte in a non-phlogistic manner .
here we show that the rate of constitutive apoptosis in human neutrophil and eosinophil be greatly accelerate in both a rapid and concentration-dependent manner by the fungal metabolite gliotoxin , but not by it inactive analog methylthiogliotoxin .
this induction of apoptosis be abolish by the caspase inhibitor zvad-fmk , correlate with the inhibition of nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappab ) , and be mimic by a cell permeable inhibitory peptide of nf-kappab , sn-50 ; other nf-kappab inhibitor , curcumin and pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ; and the proteasome inhibitor , mg-132 .
gliotoxin also augment dramatically the early ( 2-6 h ) pro-apoptotic effect of tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) in neutrophil and unmask the ability of tnf-alpha to induce eosinophil apoptosis .
in neutrophil , tnf-alpha cause a gliotoxin -inhibitable activation of an inducible form of nf-kappab , a response that may underlie the ability of tnf-alpha to delay apoptosis at late time ( 12-24 h ) and limit it early killing effect .
furthermore , cycloheximide display a similar capacity to enhance tnf-alpha induce neutrophil apoptosis even at time point when cycloheximide alone have no pro-apoptotic effect , suggest that nf-kappab may regulate the production of protein ( s ) which protect neutrophil from the cytotoxic effect of tnf-alpha .
these data shed light on the biochemical and molecular mechanism regulate human granulocyte apoptosis and , in particular , indicate that the transcription factor nf-kappab play a crucial role in regulate the physiological cell death pathway in granulocyte .
cloning and expression of the epstein-barr virus -encoded dutpase : patient with acute , reactivate or chronic virus infection develop antibody against the enzyme .
the gene encode the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -specific dutpase be amplify from virus dna by pcr .
the active enzyme be express in escherichia coli and in insect cell a a non-fusion protein .
the protein from e. coli specifically convert dutp to dump and do not react with other dntps or ntps .
preliminary experiment yield a km value of about 0.8 microm for dutp .
mabs against the dutpase react with a protein of approximately 31 kda in 12-o-tetradecanoyl-phorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) -stimulated b cell harbour either type 1 or type 2 ebv .
the protein be find in untreated cell at low level , whereas induction of the lytic replication cycle by tpa treatment or by provide the immediate early transactivator bzlf1 in trans result in increase expression .
we demonstrate that the virus dutpase isolate from ebv -infected cell be a phosphoprotein .
the protein express in insect cell be use to test for the presence of specific antibody in serum from normal , healthy carrier and from patient with various disease .
while the serum of ebv -negative individual ( 0/3 ) or healthy carrier ( 0/33 ) do not contain detectable level of antibody , patient with mononucleosis ( 5/18 ) , chronic ebv infection ( 2/7 ) , ebv reactivation ( 7/20 ) and human immunodeficiency virus infection ( 5/24 ) show elevated antibody titre against the enzyme .
this indicate that the dutpase be express during ebv replication and reactivation .
the enzyme might therefore be a potential target for drug therapy under condition of active dna replication .
e3 , a hematopoietic-specific transcript directly regulate by the retinoic acid receptor alpha .
retinoic acid ( ra ) -induced maturation mediate by the retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar alpha ) have be implicate in myeloid development .
we have use differential hybridization analysis of a cdna library construct from the murine ra -inducible mpro promyelocyte cell line to identify immediate-early gene induce by ra during granulocytic differentiation .
e3 , one of nine sequence identify , be upregulated in an immediate-early manner , with transcript level peak after 60 minute exposure to ra .
e3 transcript be ra -inducible in hl60 cell , but not in an ra -resistant subclone , hl60r , that harbor a mutate rar alpha gene .
however , when hl60r cell be transduce with a functional copy of the rar alpha gene , ra induce a 10-fold increase in e3 mrna level .
e3 transcript be present in the myeloid , b-lymphoid , and erythroid lineage , absent in nonhematopoietic cell , and encode a highly hydrophobic , potentially phosphorylated polypeptide of unknown function with significant homology to a putative protein express in myeloid cell .
the murine e3 promoter harbor a single bipartite retinoic acid response element which in transient transfection assay confer ra sensitivity .
these result indicate that e3 be a hematopoietic-specific gene that be an immediate target for the activate rar alpha during myelopoiesis .
bcl-6 and the molecular pathogenesis of b-cell lymphoma .
the result present identify the first genetic lesion associate with dlcl , the most clinically relevant form of nhl .
although no proof yet exist of a role for these lesion in dlcl pathogenesis , the feature of the bcl-6 gene product , it specific pattern of expression in b cell , and the clustering of lesion disrupt it regulatory domain strongly suggest that deregulation of bcl-6 expression may contribute to dlcl development .
a more precise definition of the role of bcl-6 in normal and neoplastic b-cell development be the goal of ongoing study of transgenic mouse engineer either to express bcl-6 under heterologous promoter or lack bcl-6 function due to target deletion .
in addition to contribute to the understanding of dlcl pathogenesis , the identification of bcl-6 lesion may have relevant clinical implication .
dlcl represent a heterogeneous group of neoplasm which be treat homogeneously despite the fact that only 50 % of patient experience long-term disease-free survival ( schneider et al. 1990 ) .
the fact that bcl-6 rearrangement identify biologically and clinically distinct subset of dlcl suggest that these lesion may be useful a marker in selection of differential therapeutic strategy base on different risk group .
furthermore , the bcl-6 rearrangement can be use to identify and monitor the malignant clone with sensitive pcr-based technique .
since clinical remission have be observe in a significant fraction of dlcl case , these marker may serve a critical tool for sensitive monitoring of minimal residual disease and early diagnosis of relapse ( gribben et al. 1993 ) .
a hydrophobic domain of ca2+ -modulating cyclophilin ligand modulate calcium influx signaling in t lymphocyte .
ca2+ -modulating cyclophilin ligand ( caml ) be originally describe a a cyclophilin b-binding protein whose overexpression in t cell cause a rise in intracellular calcium , thus activate transcription factor responsible for the early immune response .
a report here , structure-function analysis of the caml gene in jurkat t cell indicate that two of caml 's putative membrane-spanning domain be necessary and sufficient for the modulation of intracellular calcium .
we propose that the hydrophobic c-terminal tail of caml form it effector domain , thus implicate the n-terminal hydrophilic domain in a regulatory role .
these finding define a novel protein motif that function in intracellular calcium signaling .
binding of hmg-i ( y ) elicit structural change in a silencer of the human beta-globin gene .
protein involve in repression of the human beta-globin gene may be useful in the treatment of sickle cell anemia , in conjunction with therapy to reactivate fetal globin gene .
if there be a reciprocal elevation of gamma-globin expression upon repression , this approach could be useful in additional hemoglobinopathy .
we previously show that repression of the beta-globin gene appear to be mediate through two dna sequence , silencer i and ii , and identify a protein term bp1 which bind to both silencer sequence .
in this study , we clone two cdna encoding protein which bind to an oligonucleotide in silencer i contain a bp1 binding site .
these cdna correspond to hmg-i and hmg-y , isoforms regard a architectural protein .
we demonstrate that binding of hmg-i(y) to this oligonucleotide cause bending/flexure of the dna .
hmg-i(y) also bind to a second oligonucleotide contain a bp1 binding site located in a negative control region upstream of the delta-globin gene , suggest a role for hmg-i(y) in repression of adult globin gene .
expression study reveal that hmg-i(y) be ubiquitously express in human tissue that do not express beta-globin , be present in 48 of 50 tissue and six hematopoietic cell line examine .
furthermore , hmg-i(y) expression be down-regulated during differentiation of primary erythroid cell .
we present a model in which hmg-i(y) alter dna conformation to allow binding of repressor protein , and in which the relative amount of hmg-i(y) help to determine the repressive state of the beta-globin gene .
constitutive overexpression of the l-selectin gene in fresh leukemic cell of adult t-cell leukemia that can be transactivated by human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 tax .
l-selectin be an adhesion molecule of the selectin family that mediate the initial step of leukocyte adhesion to vascular endothelium .
upon cellular activation , expression of the l-selectin gene be downregulated at both the protein and mrna level .
to understand the mechanism of leukemic cell infiltration into organ , we study the expression and regulation of l-selectin mrna in fresh leukemic cell of adult t-cell leukemia ( atl ) patient and investigate the response of the l-selectin promoter to human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) tax , which be a viral transcriptional transactivator .
flow cytometry show that l-selectin be express on fresh atl cell along with other activation antigen .
northern blot analysis show that atl cell overexpressed that l-selectin mrna and that the level be aberrantly upregulated after pma stimulation .
study use in situ hybridization show expression of the l-selectin mrna in the infiltrate leukemic cell in the liver of two atl patient .
intravenous injection of a rat t-cell line that overexpresses l-selectin show increase organ infiltration .
the induction of tax expression in jpx9 cell result in about a twofold increase in the mrna expression level compare with the basal level .
chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) assay after transient cotransfection show about a fivefold transactivation of the l-selectin promoter by tax .
the serum level of the shed form of l-selectin be significantly increase in atl patient ( mean +/- sd , 4,215.4 +/- 4,111 ng/ml ) compare with those of asymptomatic carrier and healthy blood donor ( mean +/- sd , 1,148.0 +/- 269.0 ng/ml and 991.9 +/- 224 ng/ml , respectively ) .
these result indicate that atl cell constitutively overexpress the l-selectin gene that can be transactivated by htlv-1 tax .
the overexpression of l-selectin , as well a of inflammatory cytokine , by atl cell may provide a basis for atl cell to attach the vascular endothelium , lead to transmigration and organ infitration .
a myc-associated zinc finger protein binding site be one of four important functional region in the cd4 promoter .
the cd4 promoter play an important role in the developmental control of cd4 transcription .
in this report , we show that the minimal cd4 promoter have four factor binding site , each of which be require for full function .
use biochemical and mutagenesis analysis , we determine that multiple nuclear factor bind to these independent site .
we determine that an initiator-like sequence present at the cap site and an ets consensus sequence be require for full promoter function .
we also demonstrate that the myc-associated zinc finger protein ( maz ) appear to be the predominant factor bind to one of these site .
this last site closely resemble the me1a1 g3ag4ag3 motif previously show to be a critical element in the p2 promoter of the c-myc gene .
we therefore believe that the maz transcription factor be also likely to play an important role in the control of developmental expression of the cd4 gene .
lmp-1 activate nf-kappa b by target the inhibitory molecule i kappa b alpha .
lmp-1 , an epstein-barr virus membrane protein express during latent infection , have oncogenic property , a judge from it ability to transform b lymphocyte and rodent fibroblast .
lmp-1 induce the expression of bcl2 , an oncogene which protect cell from apoptosis , as well a of gene encode other protein involve in cell regulation and growth control .
the mechanism by which lmp-1 upregulates these protein be unknown , but it be plausible that lmp-1 modify signal transduction pathway that result in the activation of one or more transcription factor that ultimately regulate transcription of oncogenic gene .
nf-kappa b , a transcription factor control the expression of gene involve in cell activation and growth control , have be show to be activate by lmp-1 .
the mechanism ( s ) regulate this activation remain unknown .
our data indicate that increase nf-kappa b dna binding and functional activity be present in b-lymphoid cell stably or transiently express lmp-1 .
i kappa b alpha be selectively modify in lmp-1 -expressing b cell .
a phosphorylated form of i kappa b alpha and increase protein turnover-degradation correlate with increase nf-kappa b nuclear translocation .
this result in increase transcription of nf-kappa b -dependent-genes , include those encode p105 and i kappa b alpha ( mad3 ) .
these result indicate that lmp-1 activate nf-kappa b in b-cell line by target i kappa b alpha .
identification of the pathway activate by lmp-1 to result in posttranslational modification of i kappa b alpha will aid in determine the role of this virus-host cell protein interaction in epstein-barr virus -mediated oncogenesis .
one gene , two transcript : isolation of an alternative transcript encode for the autoantigen la/ss-b from a cdna library of a patient with primary sjogrens ' syndrome .
a cdna library be prepare from peripheral blood lymphocyte of an autoimmune patient with primary sjogrens ' syndrome .
the cdna library be screen with the patient own autoimmune serum be monospecific for the nuclear autoantigen la/ss-b .
thereby an alternative type of la mrna be identify that differ from the known la mrna due to an exchange of the exon 1 .
sequencing of the genomic region between the exon 1 and 2 show that the alternative 5'-end be a part of the intron .
in addition , the presence of an alternative promoter site , which exist within the intron downstream of the exon 1 , become evident .
in consequence , the alternative la mrna be the result of a promoter switching combine with an alternative splicing mechanism .
in the intron , further transcription factor binding site , include a nf-kappa b element , be identify lead to the suggestion that the expression of the gene encode for the nuclear autoantigen la/ss-b alter in dependence on disease condition .
the il-4 receptor alpha-chain cytoplasmic domain be sufficient for activation of jak-1 and stat6 and the induction of il-4 -specific gene expression .
the common gamma-chain ( gamma(c) ) be a functional component of the il-4r , yet cell lack gamma(c) be able to respond to il-4 .
this have lead to the suggestion that a surrogate gamma'-chain , which can interact with the il-4r alpha chain to mediate signaling , be express on cell lack gamma(c) .
an alternative possibility be that in the absence of gamma(c) , the il-4r alpha chain be able to transduce signal by homodimerization .
to test this latter possibility , a chimeric receptor contain the extracellular domain of c-kit ( the stem cell factor ( scf ) receptor ) and the cytoplasmic and transmembrane domain of the il-4r alpha chain be generate .
treatment of cell express the chimeric receptor kit/il-4r alpha with scf induce activation of the il-4r alpha-associated kinase jak-1 and the transcription factor stat6 .
however , tyrosine phosphorylation of jak-3 , which associate with gamma(c) , be not induce by scf in these cell .
scf -mediated ligation of kit/il-4r alpha be sufficient to elicit il-4 -specific gene expression , include up-regulation of cd23 and synthesis of germ-line epsilon transcript .
in the t cell line ctll2 , ligation of kit/il-4r alpha induce cellular proliferation .
finally , in jak-1 -deficient hela cell , stat6 activation by il-4 be completely abolish .
together , these data demonstrate that the il-4r alpha cytoplasmic domain be sufficient to activate jak-1 and stat6 and to induce expression of il-4 target gene , thus identify a mechanism by which il-4 signaling can proceed in the absence of jak-3 and gamma(c) .
differentiation-dependent expression of a human carboxylesterase in monocytic cell and transcription factor bind to the promoter .
carboxylesterases play an important role in defense and clearance mechanism of the monocyte/macrophage system .
during the differentiation process of cell from the monocytic cell line thp-1 we observe a transient transcriptional upregulation of a human carboxylesterase analyze by mean of northern blot .
in pma-treated thp-1 cell we could detect three major transcription initiation site a reveal by nuclease protection assay carry out with two overlap antisense rna probe .
we have recently clone the carboxylesterase upstream sequence and show it basal promoter activity in cho cell .
use electrophoretic mobility shift analysis we demonstrate that the promoter region span base pair -1 to -275 , which contain several putative bind site for transcription factor , be bind by nuclear factor sp1 and irbp but not by c/ebps .
take together these data indicate that carboxylesterase gene transcription in thp-1 cell start at multiple initiation site and that sp1 and irbp may be critical factor for modulate the differentiation-dependent transcription of this human carboxylesterase gene .
the mechanism of action of cyclosporin a and fk506 .
csa and fk506 be powerful suppressor of the immune system , most notably of t cell .
they act at a point in activation that lie between receptor ligation and the transcription of early gene .
here , stuart schreiber and gerald crabtree review recent finding that indicate csa and fk506 operate a prodrugs : they bind endogenous intracellular receptor , the immunophilins , and the result complex target the protein phosphatase , calcineurin , to exert the immunosuppressive effect .
interleukin-7 upregulates the interleukin-2-gene expression in activate human t lymphocyte at the transcriptional level by enhance the dna binding activity of both nuclear factor of activate t cell and activator protein-1 .
in the present report , we study the role of the stromal-derived cytokine interleukin-7 ( il-7 ) in the il-2-gene regulation in activate t lymphocyte .
production of il-2 require the formation of transcription factor involve in the il-2 -gene regulation .
t-cell receptor ( tcr ) /cd3 engagement result in the activation of nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) , activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) , and nuclear factor kappab ( nfkappab ) , whereas the cd28 responsive complex ( cd28rc ) be activate in response to the cd28 signal .
costimulation of phytohemagglutinin /anti-cd28 activate t lymphocyte with il-7 induce a fivefold enhance il-2 -mrna accumulation and a 2.5-fold enhance protein secretion .
the il-2 -gene transcription rate be increase 3.4-fold , indicate that the effect of il-7 be in part mediate at the transcriptional level .
the molecular mechanism underlie the il-7 effect involve the upregulation of the dna binding activity of nfat ( 60 % ) and ap-1 ( 120 % ) , without affect the activity of nfkappab and cd28rc , which be confirm by transfection assay .
we also show that the il-7 -induced enhancement of the ap-1 -dna binding activity be not cyclosporin a-sensitive .
since ap-1 be part of the nfat complex , we conclude that the il-7 -signaling pathway be involve in the activation of the fo and jun protein of which ap-1 consist .
inhibitory action of nm23 protein on induction of erythroid differentiation of human leukemia cell .
we recently identify a differentiation inhibitory factor ( i-factor ) in mouse myeloid leukemia m1 cell a a murine homolog of the human nm23-h2 gene product .
nm23 gene encode protein that participate in tumor metastasis regulation and in various fundamental cellular process , although their mechanism of action be still unknown .
although all nm23 protein contain nucleoside diphosphate ( ndp ) kinase activity , it have not be establish that the enzyme activity mediate the various function of nm23 protein .
in the present experiment , we examine the effect of nm23 protein on various differentiation induction system of human leukemic cell include hl-60 , u937 , hel/s , ku812f , k562 , and hel cell .
native human erythrocyte ndp kinase protein inhibit the induction of erythroid differentiation of hel , ku812 and k562 cell , but not the induction of monocytic or granulocytic differentiation of hl-60 , u937 and hel/s cell .
the erythroid differentiation of hel cell be inhibit by recombinant human nm23 -h1 , -h2 , mouse nm23 -m1 , and -m2 protein .
moreover , both the mutant nm23-h2his protein and truncate nm23-h2 protein contain n-terminal ( 1-60 ) peptide , which do not have ndp kinase activity , also inhibit erythroid differentiation of hel cell .
these result suggest that ( 1 ) the differentiation inhibitory activity of i-factor /nm23 protein be not restricted to monocytic differentiation of m1 cell , ( 2 ) the inhibitory activity be exhibit without specie specificity , and ( 3 ) the differentiation inhibitory activity of the nm23/ndp kinase protein be independent of it enzyme activity and require the presence of n-terminal peptide .
calcium signalling in t cell stimulate by a cyclophilin b-binding protein .
the immunosuppressant drug cyclosporin a block a calcium -dependent signal from the t-cell receptor ( tcr ) that normally lead to t-cell activation .
when bind to cyclophilin , cyclosporin a bind and inactivate the key signalling intermediate calcineurin .
to identify potential cellular homologues of cyclosporin a that might regulate calcium signalling , we have clone human gene encode cyclophilin b-binding-proteins use the yeast two-hybrid system .
one gene product , when overexpressed in jurkat t cell , specifically induce transcription from the interleukin-2 enhancer , by activate the t-cell-specific transcription factor nf-at and nf-il2a .
this protein , term calcium -signal modulating cyclophilin ligand ( caml ) , act downstream of the tcr and upstream of calcineurin by cause an influx of calcium .
caml appear to be a new participant in the calcium -signal transduction pathway , implicate cyclophilin b in calcium signalling , even in the absence of cyclosporin .
regulation of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor and e-selectin expression in endothelial cell by cyclosporin a and the t-cell transcription factor nfat .
nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) be originally describe a a t-cell-specific transcription factor athat support the activation of cytokine gene expression and mediate the immunoregulatory effect of cyclosporin a ( csa ) .
a we observe that activate endothelial cell also express nfat , we test the antiinflammatory property of csa in endothelial cell .
significantly , csa completely suppress the induction of nfat in endothelial cell and inhibit the activity of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) gene regulatory element that use nfat by 60 % .
csa similarly mediate a reduction of up to 65 % in gm-csf mrna and protein expression in activate endothelial cell .
csa also suppress e-selectin , but not vascular cell adhesion molecule-1 ( vcam-1 ) expression in endothelial cell , even though the e-selectin promoter be activate by nf-kappa b rather than nfat .
hence , induction of cell surface expression of this leukocyte adhesion molecule by tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha be reduce by 40 % in the presence of csa , and this be reflect by a 29 % decrease in neutrophil adhesion .
the effect of csa on endothelial cell be also detect at the chromatin structure level , a dnasel hypersensitive site within both the gm-csf enhancer and the e-selectin promoter be suppress by csa .
this represent the first report of nfat in endothelial cell and suggest mechanism by which csa could function a an antiinflammatory agent .
a case of hypersensitivity to thyroid hormone with normally function thyroid gland and increase nuclear triiodothyronine receptor .
a 52-year-old male present himself with tachycardia crisis which appear first during childhood , increase in frequency without goiter or exophthalmos .
cardiac and adrenergic disease be exclude .
the thyroid function be normal regard t4 , free t4 and t3 , tbg , radioiodine uptake , tsh and t3 suppressibility ; however the tsh response to trh be decrease .
the lymphocyte nuclear t3 receptor be find with an affinity close to that of normal volunteer ( ka : 1.42 x 10(10) m-1 v 1.95 +/- 0.35 x 10(10) m-1 ) and a binding capacity markedly increase ( 9.9 v 3.7 +/- 0.4 fmol t3 / 100 microgram dna ) .
pindolol be inefficient on the dysrhythmia which disappear with carbimazole and relapse after withdrawal of the antithyroid drug .
under carbimazole , the plasma t4 markedly decrease ( 27.7 +/- 3.6 nmol/l ) but the patient remain euthyroid .
the clinical course and the laboratory data suggest that the tachycardia crisis be the consequence of a hypersensitivity of the heart to thyroid hormone , associate with an increase number of t3 nuclear receptor site in lymphocyte .
biphasic control of nf-kappa b activation induce by the triggering of hla-dr antigen express on b cell .
the regulation of nf-kappa b activation follow the triggering of hla-dr antigen by mab l243 have be study at various time in raji cell .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay demonstrate a strong increase of nf-kappa b dna binding after triggering of hla-dr antigen .
use tnf-alpha-activity neutralizing antibody , the author demonstrate that the upregulation of nf-kappa b be find to depend , at late time point , on an autocrine effect of tnf-alpha secrete follow triggering of hla-dr antigen .
in contrast , it be find to be tnf-alpha independent in the early time point .
moreover , the upregulation of nf-kappa b binding activity be regulate by the triggering of select epitope of hla-dr antigen .
in fact , mab l243 but not the staphylococcal superantigens , staphylococcal exotoxin toxic shock syndrome toxin-i or staphylococcal enterotoxin b , regulate the nf-kappa b binding activity .

the role of stat4 in species-specific regulation of th cell development by type i ifns .
type i ifns ( ifn-alpha/beta ) , in addition to il-12 , have be show to play an important role in the differentiation of human , but not mouse , th cell .
we show here that ifn-alpha/beta act directly on human t cell to drive th1 development , bypass the need for il-12 -induced signaling , whereas ifn-alpha can not substitute il-12 for mouse th1 development .
the molecular basis for this specie specificity be that ifn-alpha /beta activate stat4 in differentiate human , but not mouse , th cell .
unlike il-12 , which act only on th1 cell , ifn-alpha /beta can activate stat4 not only in human th1 , but also in th2 cell .
however , restimulation of human th2 line and clone in the presence of ifn-alpha do not induce the production of ifn-gamma .
these result suggest that activation of stat4 , which be necessary for the differentiation of naive t cell into polarize th1 cell , be not sufficient to induce phenotype reversal of human th2 cell .

abnormality of p16 , p15 and cdk4 gene in recurrent malignant astrocytomas .
abnormality in the p16 , p15 and cdk4 gene that regulate transition through the g1 phase of the cell cycle have be implicate in the malignant progression of astrocytomas .
the result of the present study demonstrate that dysfunction of these gene also occur during recurrence of glial tumor that be highly malignant at first presentation .
analysis of 10 match pair of high grade malignant astrocytomas and their subsequent recurrence identify three distinct group .
the primary and recurrent tumor in group a do not show structural alteration in the p16 , p15 or cdk4 gene , whereas homozygous codeletion of p16 and p15 be observe in both primary and recurrent tumor in group b .
the primary tumor in group c have a normal profile of p16 , p15 and cdk4 at presentation .
upon recurrence , however , the tumor sustain either deletion of p16 alone or codeletion of both p16 and p15 or amplification of cdk4 .
analysis of the molecular difference between primary anaplastic astrocytomas /glioblastomas and their subsequent recurrence , which be clinically indistinguishable , may provide good therapeutic option for treatment .
lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor number in posttraumatic stress disorder .
objective : the author ' objective be to investigate the possibility that glucocorticoid receptor change may be involve in the dysregulation of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal ( hpa ) axis in posttraumatic stress disorder ( ptsd ) .
method : they measure the number of lymphocyte cytosolic glucocorticoid receptor and plasma cortisol concentration in 15 consecutively admit male combat vietnam veteran with ptsd and in a normal comparison group of 11 subject .
result : both the patient and the normal comparison subject show a morning-to-afternoon decline in glucocorticoid receptor concentration , parallel the normal diurnal decline in cortisol level .
the number of glucocorticoid receptor be 63 % great in the morning and 26 % great in the afternoon in the patient with ptsd than in the normal subject .
no group difference in cortisol level be observe , nor be glucocorticoid receptor number and cortisol level correlate .
the number of morning glucocorticoid receptor be positively correlate with symptom of ptsd and anxiety .
conclusion : these result provide further evidence for a dysregulation of the hpa axis in ptsd .
the finding that patient with ptsd have a substantially great number of lymphocyte glucocorticoid receptor than normal comparison subject be consistent with the author ' previous observation of low 24-hour urinary cortisol excretion in subject with ptsd .
furthermore , the receptor change observe be opposite of those report in major depressive disorder .
the present data , along with other finding of hpa abnormality in ptsd , support the possibility of a great negative feedback sensitivity at one or more level of the hpa axis .
constitutive and inducible protein/dna interaction of the interferon-gamma promoter in vivo in [ correct ] cd45ra and cd45r0 t helper subset [ publish erratum appear in eur j immunol 1997 jul ; 27 ( 7 ) : 1830 ]

this novel target site , denote the c-site , be show by several criterion , include cell distribution study , stimulation experiment , supershift assay , and cross-competition electrophoretic mobility shift assay to bind the transcription factor ap-1 .
mutation of the c-site that prevent ap-1 binding to this site be sufficient strikingly to reduce inducible promoter activity in primary cd45r0 t cell .
in summary , the data demonstrate that ifn-gamma gene transcription in primary t cell be regulate in vivo at the level of constitutive and inducible protein/dna interaction .
we propose a model where basal transcription be maintain by binding of various transcription factor to the ifn-gamma promoter , whereas pma + pha -inducible ifn-gamma transcription in cd45r0 t cell be associate with binding of ap-1 to the c-site .

effect of ara-c on neutral sphingomyelinase and mitogen- and stress- activated protein kinase in t-lymphocyte cell line .

pma act synergistically with ionomycin to activate jnk mapks in jurkat and el4 within 10 minute .

thus , ceramide be not a positive signal for erk activation in t-cell line .

interaction between the class ii transactivator and creb binding protein increase transcription of major histocompatibility complex class ii gene .

we conclude that cbp , a histone acetyltransferase , play an important role in the transcription of class ii gene .
interleukin-3 expression by activate t cell involve an inducible , t-cell-specific factor and an octamer binding protein .
interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) be exclusively express by activate t and natural killer cell , a function that be tightly control both in a lineage-specific and in a stimulation-dependent manner .
we have investigate the protein binding characteristic and functional importance of the act-1-activating region of the il-3 promoter .
this region bind an inducible , t-cell-specific factor over it 5' end , a site that be necessary for the expression of il-3 in the absence of other upstream element .
over it 3' end , it bind a factor that be ubiquitously and constitutively express .
this factor be oct-1 or an immunologically related octamer-binding protein , and it play a role in coordinate the activity of several regulatory element .
these characteristic make the act-1 site analogous to the activate arre-1 site in the il-2 promoter .
furthermore , and despite a lack of sequence homology , the promoter of il-3 and il-2 share an organizational pattern of regulatory element that be likely to be important for the t-cell-specific expression of these gene .
v-erba overexpression be require to extinguish c-erba function in erythroid cell differentiation and regulation of the erba target gene caii .
the v-erba oncoprotein represent a retrovirus-transduced oncogenic version of the thyroid hormone ( t3/t4 ) receptor c-erba ( type alpha ) .
it contribute to virus-induced erythroleukemia by efficiently arrest differentiation of red cell progenitor and by suppress transcription of erythrocyte-specific gene .
here , we show that v-erba and c-erba bind directly to sequence within the promoter of the erythrocyte-specific carbonic anhydrase ii ( caii ) , a gene whose transcription be efficiently suppress by v-erba .
this erba-binding site confer thyroid hormone responsiveness to a heterologous promoter in transient expression experiment and be a target for efficient down-regulation of caii transcription by the v-erba oncoprotein .
in stably transform erythroblast coexpressing the v-erba oncoprotein and the c-erba/t3 receptor at an approximately equimolar ratio , c-erba activity be dominant over v-erba .
t3 efficiently induce erythroid differentiation in these cell , thus overcome the v-erba -mediated differentiation arrest .
likewise , t3 activate caii transcription as well a transient expression of a t3 -responsive reporter gene contain the caii -specific erba-binding site .
the c-erba -dependent activation of this caii reporter construct could only be suppress by very high amount of v-erba .
our result suggest that overexpression of v-erba be require for it function a an oncoprotein .
comparison of retinoic acid and phorbol myristate acetate a inducer of monocytic differentiation .
several human myeloid leukemia cell line grow in vitro can be induce to differentiate to more mature monocyte/macrophage-like cell by treatment with protein kinase c -activating phorbol ester , such a pma .
in addition to pma , cell of the thp-1 myeloid leukemia cell line acquire macrophage-like characteristic after treatment with all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) .
to analyze the signal transduction mechanism induce by ra , we first compare the effect of pma and ra on the expression of gene which be know to be regulate during monocytic differentiation .
both ra and pma effectively down-regulated c-myc expression , while c-myb expression decrease only after pma treatment .
expression of the beta 2-integrin gene , cd11a and cd11b , be clearly increase after both of these treatment .
their effect on the src-family tyrosine kinase gene be different : hck expression be similarly induce by these agent but lyn expression be strong and more rapid after ra treatment .
ra also enhance lyn mrna production rapidly in hl-60 , indicate that the activation of lyn gene expression be common in monocytic and granulocytic maturation of myeloid leukemia cell .
to examine whether the ap-1 enhancer activity be involve in ra -induced monocytic differentiation , thp-1 cell be transiently transfected with a chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) -reporter gene contain 5 copy of the ap-1 binding site .
in contrast to pma , ra do not induce any cat activity in these cell , thus suggest that the ra -induced change in the expression of those gene describe above be not dependent on the ap-1 enhancer activity .
peptide vaccination can lead to enhance tumor growth through specific t-cell tolerance induction .
vaccination with synthetic peptide represent cytotoxic t lymphocyte ( ctl ) epitope can lead to a protective ctl-mediated immunity against tumor or virus .
we now report that vaccination with a ctl epitope derive from the human adenovirus type 5 e1a-region ( ad5e1a234-243 ) , which can serve a a target for tumor-eradicating ctl , enhance rather than inhibit the growth of ad5e1a-expressing tumor .
this adverse effect of peptide vaccination be rapidly evoke , require low dos of peptide ( 10 microgram ) , and be achieve by a mode of peptide delivery that induce protective t-cell-mediated immunity in other model .
ad5e1a -specific ctl activity could no longer be isolate from mouse after injection of ad5e1a-peptide , indicate that tolerization of ad5e1a -specific ctl activity cause the enhance tumor outgrowth .
in contrast to peptide vaccination , immunization with adenovirus , express ad5e1a , induce ad5e1a -specific immunity and prevent the outgrowth of ad5e1a -expressing tumor .
these result show that immunization with synthetic peptide can lead to the elimination of anti-tumor ctl response .
these finding be important for the design of safe peptide -based vaccine against tumor , allogeneic organ transplant , and t-cell-mediated autoimmune disease .
nf-kappa b activation by tumor necrosis factor alpha in the jurkat t cell line be independent of protein kinase a , protein kinase c , and ca(2+) -regulated kinase .
nf-kappa b be a dna-binding regulatory factor able to control transcription of a number of gene , include human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) gene .
in t cell , nf-kappa b be activate upon cellular treatment by phorbol ester and the cytokine tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnf alpha ) .
in the present work , we investigate the molecular event lead to nf-kappa b activation by tnf alpha in a human t cell line ( jurkat ) and it subclone jct6 , which present a deficiency in the pka transduction pathway .
we find that in both cell line , both phorbol ester and tnf alpha be able to activate nf-kappa b .
phorbol activation be positively modulate by ca2+ influx while tnf alpha activation be not .
furthermore , while pma activation be inhibit by the pkc inhibitor staurosporin , the tnf alpha effect be unchanged .
tnf alpha do not activate camp production and it signal be not modulate by camp activator .
moreover , camp activator do not activate nf-kappa b in jurkat cell .
thus , tnf alpha -induced nf-kappa b activation be find to be mediate by none of the major signal-mediating kinase such a protein kinase c ( pkc ) , protein kinase a , or ca(2+)-regulated kinase .
furthermore , we find that cytoplasmic acidification facilitate nf-kappa b activation by both tnf alpha and pkc , by a mechanism that increase nf-kappa b /i kappa b dissociation without affect the nf-kappa b translocation step .
retinoic acid activate interferon regulatory factor-1 gene expression in myeloid cell .
all-trans-retinoic acid ( atra ) be the drug of choice in the treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) .
atra induce both in vitro and in vivo differentiation of apl cell into mature granulocyte .
however , the molecular mechanism involve in atra -dependent growth inhibition and cellular differentiation be not presently understand .
the nb4 cell line , which be derive from the bone marrow of a patient with apl during relapse , can be use a a model system to study the growth and differentiation of apl cell .
because interferon ( ifn ) regulatory factor ( irf-1 and irf-2 ) and other ifn-inducible gene product regulate cell growth , we analyze the effect of atra on the expression of these gene .
we show that atra directly activate irf-1 gene expression , follow by activation of irf-2 and 2'-5' oligoadenylate synthetase ( oas ) gene expression with slow kinetics .

the atra -induced expression of irf-1 , an activator of transcription and repressor of transformation , may be one of the molecular mechanism of atra -induced growth inhibition , and the basis for the synergistic action of atra and ifns in myeloid leukemia cell .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 tat upregulates interleukin-2 secretion in activate t cell .
dysregulation of cytokine secrete by t cell may play an important role in the pathogenesis of aid .
to investigate the effect of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) tat on interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) expression , we use il-2 promoter -chloramphenicol acetyltransferase construct and il-2 -secreting jurkat t cell a a model system .

il-12 -induced activation of nk and t cell occur in the absence of immediate-early activation gene expression .
the response of lymphocyte to il-2 and il-12 , involve proliferation , differentiation , and cytokine production , be only partially overlap , and may depend on induce differential expression of specific set of gene .

this indicate that functional difference observe in il-2- and il-12- stimulated cell may depend , at least in part , on differential gene regulation .
function of glutathione and glutathione disulfide in immunology and immunopathology .

a model of latent adenovirus 5 infection in the guinea pig ( cavia porcellus ) .

ccaat/enhancer binding protein epsilon be preferentially up-regulated during granulocytic differentiation and it functional versatility be determine by alternative use of promoter and differential splicing .
ccaat/enhancer binding protein ( c/ebp ) epsilon be a recently clone member of the c/ebp family of transcription factor and be express exclusively in cell of hematopoietic origin .
the human c/ebpepsilon gene be transcribe by two alternative promoter , palpha and pbeta .

tissue factor expression of human monocyte be suppress by lysophosphatidylcholine .
the expression of tissue factor ( tf ) , the principal initiator of coagulation , be increase during inflammation and atherosclerosis .
both condition be promote by lysophosphatidylcholine ( lysopc ) .
we observe in the present study that lysopc ( 1 to 10 micromol/l ) dose-dependently reduce tf activity in human monocyte , a elicit by lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
lysophosphatidylethanolamine ( lysope ) and other lysophospholipids do not affect lp -induced tf activity of human monocyte .
tf antigen expression a elicit by lp be also lower by lysopc .
phospholipid analysis indicate a selective increase in the lysopc content of the monocyte after preincubation with the lysophospholipid .
lysopc inhibit the tf activity of mono mac-6 cell to a similar extent a in the monocyte .
lp binding to plasma membrane receptor and internalization of lp into monocyte be not affect by lysopc .
in contrast , lp -mediated nuclear binding of nuclear factor-kappab/rel to a tf-specific kappab site be inhibit by lysopc .
induction of tf mrna expression by lp tend to be partially reduce by the lysophospholipid .
preincubation with lysopc increase monocytic camp level .
inhibition of adenylyl cyclase by pretreatment with 2'-deoxy-3'-adenosine monophosphate partially reverse the inhibition of tf activity promote by lysopc .
in conclusion , lysopc markedly decrease lp -mediated tf expression of human monocyte , the effect probably be mediate by both transcriptional and posttranscriptional mechanism .
lysopc may thus attenuate activation of coagulation during inflammation and atherosclerosis .
