a 73 kda protein be identify by this analysis : this protein be highly enrich in cell line of b lymphoid origin a compare to pancreatic beta-cells and fibroblast cell .
the detection of this protein selectively in extract of lymphoid cell correlate with the presence of the e box -binding activity lef1/bcf1 in these cell ; this binding activity be previously show to be efficiently recognize by antiserum direct against e2a gene product .
transfection of cell with full length e2a cdna lead to appearance of protein co-migrating with the 73 kda protein on sd gel electrophoresis and co-migrating with lef1/bcf1 on mobility shift analysis .
our result be consistent with the view that the dna-binding activity lef1/bcf1 be a homodimer of e2a protein ; the selective appearance of this putative cell-specific transcription factor in b lymphoid cell seem to be attributable , at least in part , to the elevated e2a protein concentration in these cell .
efficient transcription and replication of simian immunodeficiency virus in the absence of nf-kappab and sp1 binding element .
ten mutant of the simian immunodeficiency virus ( siv ) sivmac239 bear deletion ( delta ) or substitution ( subst ) in the nf-kappab and/or sp1 binding element be create , and the replicative capacity of the mutant be analyze .
all mutant , include one extensively mutagenized strain entirely miss the nf-kappab and four spl binding element , replicate with wild-type kinetics and to a wild-type level in peripheral blood mononuclear cell culture in 50 to 100 % of the experiment .
one group of mutant replicate very similarly to sivmac239 in kinetics and yield in cemxl74 cell ( 2x nfkappab > or = slvmac239 approximately deltanfkappab approximately deltaspl234 approximately substnfkappab approximately substspl2 approximately substsp23 ) , while a second group replicate with delay or slightly delay kinetics in cemxl74 cell ( sivmac239 > substsp34 > deltanfkappabdeltaspl234 approximately deltanfkappabdeltasp1 > substspl234 ) .
reversion or additional mutation be not detect in the u3 and r region of proviral dna from cemxl74 cell infect with the sivmac239 mutant .
similar result be obtain when mutant of sivmacmer ( a macrophage-competent derivative of sivmac239 ) be test in peripheral blood mononuclear cell and cemx174 culture .
however , the growth of most mutate virus be suppress in primary rhesus monkey alveolar macrophage ( sivmacmer approximately 2xnfkappab approximately substnfkappab > deltanfkappab > deltanfkappab deltaspl234 approximately deltanfkappabdeltaspl > deltaspl234 approximately substspl2 > substsp23 approximately substsp34 approximately substspl234 > or = sivmac239 ) .
thus , change in the sp1 binding site have the most dramatic effect on sivmac replication in primary macrophage culture .
analysis of long terminal repeat -driven secrete alkaline phosphatase activity in transient assay show that , unlike human immunodeficiency virus type 1 , the siv long terminal repeat possess an enhancer region just upstream of the nf-kappab element which maintain significant level of basal transcription in the absence of nf-kappab and sp1 site .
this region be responsive to transactivation by tat .
in addition , the siv tata box be show to be strong than that of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 .
therefore , the surprisingly high replicative capacity of nf-kappab and sp1 binding site mutant of sivmac be due to unique feature or the enhancer/promoter region .
phosphorylation of the transcription factor nfatp inhibit it dna binding activity in cyclosporin a-treated human b and t cell .
cyclosporin a ( csa ) exert it immunosuppressive effect by inhibit the activity of nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) , thus prevent transcriptional induction of several cytokine gene .
this effect be think to be largely mediate through inactivation of the phosphatase calcineurin , which in turn inhibit translocation of an nfat component to the nucleus .
here we report that csa treatment of raji b and jurkat t cell line yield a phosphorylated form of nfatp that be inhibit in dna-binding and in it ability to form an nfat complex with fo and jun .
immunoblot analysis and metabolic labeling with [32p]orthophosphate show that csa alter nfatp migration on sds-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis by increase it phosphorylation level without affect subcellular distribution .
dephosphorylation by in vitro treatment with calcineurin or alkaline phosphatase restore nfatp dna binding activity and it ability to reconstitute an nfat complex with fo and jun protein .
these data point to a new mechanism for csa -sensitive regulation of nfatp in which dephosphorylation be critical for dna binding .
retinoic acid downmodulates erythroid differentiation and gata1 expression in purify adult-progenitor culture .
all-trans retinoic acid ( ra ) be an important morphogen in vertebrate development , a normal constituent in human adult blood and be also involve in the control of cell growth and differentiation in acute promyelocytic leukemia .
we have examine the effect of ra on normal hematopoiesis by use early hematopoietic progenitor cell ( hpc ) stringently purify from adult peripheral blood .
in clonogenetic fetal calf serum -supplemented ( fcs+ ) or -nonsupplemented ( fcs- ) culture treat with saturating level of interleukin-3 ( il-3 ) granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) and erythropoietin ( ep ) ( combine with c-kit ligand in fcs(-)-culture condition ) , ra induce a dramatic dose-dependent shift from erythroid to granulomonocytic colony formation , the latter colony be essentially represent by granulocytic clone .
this shift be apparently not cause by a recruitment phenomenon , because in fcs+ culture , the total number of colony be not significantly modify by ra addition .
in fcs- liquid-suspension culture supplement with saturating ep level and low-dose il-3 /gm-csf , adult hpc undergo unilineage erythropoietic differentiation : here again , treatment with high-dose ra induce a shift from the erythroid to granulocytic differentiation pathway .
study on ra time-response or pulse treatment in semisolid or liquid culture show that early ra addition be most effective , thus indicate that early but not late hpc be sensitive to it action .
we then analyze the expression of the master gata1 gene , which encode a finger transcription factor require for normal erythroid development ; addition of ra to hpc stimulate into unilineage erythropoietic differentiation in liquid culture cause a virtually complete inhibition of gata1 mrna induction .
these result indicate that ra directly inhibit the erythroid differentiation program at the level of early adult hpc , and may lead to a shift from the erythroid to granulocytic differentiation pathway .
this phenomenon be correlate with inhibition of gata1 induction in the early stage of erythropoietic differentiation .
encephalomyocarditis virus internal ribosomal entry site rna-protein interaction .
translational initiation of encephalomyocarditis virus ( emcv ) mrna occur by ribosomal entry into the 5' nontranslated region of the emcv mrna , rather than by ribosomal scanning .
internal ribosomal binding require a cis-acting element term the internal ribosomal entry site ( ire ) .
ire element have be propose to be involve in the translation of picornavirus mrna and some cellular mrna .
internal ribosome binding likely require the interaction of trans-acting factor that recognize both the mrna and the ribosomal complex .
five cellular protein ( p52 , p57 , p70 , p72 , and p100 ) cross-link the emcv ire or fragment of the ire .
for one of these protein , p57 , bind to the ire correlate with translation .
recently , p57 be identify to be very similar , if not identical , to polypyrimidine tract-binding protein .
on the basis of cross-linking result with 21 different emcv ire fragment and cytoplasmic hela extract or rabbit reticulocyte lysate a the source of polypeptide , consensus binding site for p52 , p57 , p70 , and p100 be propose .
it be suggest that each of these protein recognize primarily a structural feature of the rna rather than a specific sequence .
c/ebp activator be require for hiv-1 replication and proviral induction in monocytic cell line .
previous work have show that c/ebp site and c/ebp transcriptional activator be necessary for hiv-1 ltr activity in monocytes/macrophages .
we have investigate the role that c/ebp protein play in induction and replication of hiv-1 .
ectopic expression of the dominant negative c/ebp protein lip inhibit hiv-1 mrna and virus production in activate u1 cell , demonstrate that c/ebp protein be require for provirus induction .
u1 line overexpressing c/ebp activator nf-il-6 produce more viral mrna and virus particle follow cellular activation than control line , demonstrate that c/ebp protein be limit for virus transcription .
hiv-1 harboring mutation within two c/ebp site be cripple in their ability to replicate in u937 promonocytic cell , indicate that these site be require for replication .
these data identify c/ebp protein a regulator of hiv-1 expression in monocytes/macrophages .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) replicative gene expression in tumour cell of aids-related non-hodgkin 's lymphoma in relation to cd4 cell number and antibody titre to ebv .
objective : to determine whether activation of epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) replication in tumour cell of aids-related non-hodgkin 's lymphoma ( arnhl ) be correlate with cd4+ cell count and influence antibody response to ebv [ anti-z epstein-barr replicative activator ( zebra ) , anti-early antigen ( ea ) , anti-viral capsid antigen ( vca ) ] .
design : retrospective study base on immunohistochemistry and in situ hybridization to detect ebv replicative gene product in tissue sample from patient affect by arnhl and correlation with cd4+ cell count and result of ebv serology ( include anti- zebra activity ) in serum from the same patient .
method : seventeen out of 22 case of arnhl be select for the presence of ebv [ epstein-barr early region ( eber ) rna-positive ] .
immunohistochemistry be perform with anti- zebra , anti- ea -restricted , anti- vca antibody and in situ hybridization with bhlf1/noti oligoprobes on tumour sample .
result be statistically correlate with those of cd4+ cell count ( 17 out of 17 ) and with anti- ebv antibody titre ( 13 out of 17 ) assess use standard immunofluorescence method and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay procedure use recombinant zebra protein and synthetic peptide a antigen .
result : bzlf1 ( zebra ) or early gene product ( ea-r and ea-d/bhlf1/noti ) be detect in a small proportion ( < 0.01-5 % ) of tumour cell in eight of these 17 case by immunohistochemistry and in situ hybridization .
demonstration of replicative gene expression do not correlate with either low cd4+ cell count ( p > 0.05 ) or anti- ebv antibody titre ( p > 0.05 ) .
anti- zebra activity be not significantly increase in patient affect with arnhl , the cell of which express replicative gene product ( p > 0.05 ) .
conclusion : the degree of immunodeficiency do not clearly enhance replicative gene expression in tumour cell of arnhl .
ebv serology , include anti- zebra activity , be not a reliable tool for predict the occurrence of such proliferation .
involvement of the n-terminal region of the human mineralocorticoid receptor hormone-binding domain in agonist and antagonist binding a reveal by a new monoclonal antibody .
to gain a good understanding of the mechanism of bind to the human mineralocorticoid receptor ( hmr ) , we develop a new monoclonal antibody ( mab ) raise against the hormone-binding domain ( hbd ) .
for this purpose , mouse be immunize with a fusion protein include the sequence thr729-lys984 of hmr .
after elisa screening , mab 18c7 be select for it specificity towards the hbd .
this antibody recognize both the denature and native mr form , as well a the hetero-oligomeric mr form and the transformed mr state .
by use several hbd subfragments , the mab 18c7 epitope be located in the n-terminal region of the hbd from thr729 to leu765 .
we then study the effect of the antibody on aldosterone and progesterone binding to the hmr .
when 18c7 be incubate with liganded mr , it be able to partly displace ( 20 % ) the hormone from it bind site .
when 18c7 be incubate with mr before aldosterone or progesterone , the antibody inhibit 75-80 % of the binding .
the effect of 18c7 on the binding be similar with both hormone .
a sucrose gradient analysis indicate the simultaneous presence of two kind of receptor complex : the steroid-mr complex and the antibody-mr complex .
after it associate protein , especially the heat-shock protein hsp90 , have be cross-linked with the hmr by dimethylpimelimidate , 18c7 be still able to react with the receptor .
our result indicate that the epitope recognize by 18c7 be directly implicate in hormone binding .
the lack of steroid binding of hbd mutant with the thr729-leu765 sequence delete [ jalaguier , mesnier , leger and auzou ( 1996 ) j.steroid biochem.mol.biol.57 , 43-50 ] support this hypothesis .
because of the similar behaviour of aldosterone and progesterone , we conclude that the n-terminal thr729-leu765 region of the hbd be similarly involve in the binding of both hormone .
molecular basis of a multiple lymphokine deficiency in a patient with severe combined immunodeficiency .
we have previously report that the t lymphocyte of a child with severe combined immunodeficiency be defective in the transcription of several lymphokine gene that include il2 , il3 , il4 , and il5 , which encode interleukin 2 , 3 , 4 , and 5 ( il-2 , -3 , -4 , and -5 ) .
to determine whether the defect in the patient 's t lymphocyte involve a trans-acting factor common to the affect lymphokine gene , we examine the ability of nuclear factor from the patient 's t lymphocyte to bind response element present in the regulatory region of il2 .
nuclear factor nf-kb , activation protein 1 ( ap-1 ) , oct-1 , and nf-il-2b binding activity be normal .
in contrast , the binding of the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) to it response element in the il2 enhancer and to an nf-at -like response element present in the il4 enhancer be abnormal .
to ascertain whether the abnormal nf-at binding activity be related to an impaired function , we transfected patient and control t lymphocyte with construct contain the reporter gene encoding chloramphenicol acetyl transferase ( cat ) under the control of the entire il2 regulatory region or of multimers of individual enhancer sequence .
cat expression direct by the il2 regulatory region or by a multimer of the nf-at -binding site be markedly low in the patient relative to control .
in contrast , cat gene expression direct by a multimer of the oct-1 proximal ( oct-1p ) -binding site be equivalent in patient and control .
these result indicate that an abnormality of/or influencing nf-at may underlie the multiple lymphokine deficiency in this patient .
a functional t-cell receptor signaling pathway be require for p95vav activity .
stimulation of the t-cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) induce activation of multiple tyrosine kinase , result in phosphorylation of numerous intracellular substrate .
one substrate be p95vav , which be express exclusively in hematopoietic and trophoblast cell .
it contain a number of structural motif , include src homology 2 , src homology 3 , and pleckstrin homology domain and a putative guanine nucleotide exchange domain .
the role of p95vav in tcr -mediated signaling process be unclear .
here , we show that overexpression of p95vav alone in jurkat t cell lead to activation of the nuclear factor , include nfat , involve in interleukin-2 expression .
furthermore , p95vav synergizes with tcr stimulation in induce nfat- and interleukin-2- dependent transcription .
in contrast , nfat activation by a g-protein-coupled receptor be not modulate by p95vav overexpression , suggest that the effect be specific to the tcr signaling pathway .
although removal of the first 67 amino acid of p95vav activate it transforming potential in nih 3t3 cell , this region appear to be require for it function in t cell .
we far demonstrate that the p95vav -induced nfat activation be not mimic by ra activation , though it function be dependent upon ra and raf .
furthermore , the activating function of p95vav be block by fk506 , suggest that it activity also depend on calcineurin .
to far dissect p95vav involvement in tcr signaling , we analyze various jurkat mutant deficient in tcr signaling function or tcr expression and show that an intact tcr signaling pathway be require for p95vav to function .
however , overexpression of p95vav do not appear to influence tcr -induced protein tyrosine phosphorylation or increase in cytoplasmic free calcium .
take together , our data suggest that p95vav play an important role at an yet unidentified proximal position in the tcr signaling cascade .
immune response of peripheral blood mononuclear cell to hbx-antigen of hepatitis b virus .
the hepatitis b virus genome encode a transcriptional transactivator protein designate hbxag .
we have investigate whether this antigen be a target structure for human t-lymphocytes .
use recombinant hbxag protein , we find hbxag -specific stimulation of peripheral blood mononuclear cell in patient with acute hepatitis b virus infection ( 6 of 6 ) and chronic hepatitis b virus infection ( 6 of 17 ) but not in healthy individual .
with hbxag -specific synthetic polypeptide , several t-cell epitope be identify .
most be located in the carboxyterminal half of the hbxag protein .
five t-cell clone specific for a t-cell epitope located at the carboxyterminal region of hbxag be establish and find to belong to the cd2/cd4-positive , cd8-negative subtype .
these data establish for the first time hbxag a an antigen in the cellular immune response .
interleukin-12 expression in b cell by transformation with epstein-barr virus .
although interleukin ( il ) -12 be originally purify from an epstein-barr ( ebv ) -transformed b cell line and the high correlation of ebv infection and il-12 expression have be suggest , no study have report whether ebv infection be directly link to il-12 expression .
to address this issue , we have investigate il-12 expression in b cell during in vitro transformation with ebv .
human peripheral b cell become capable of constitutively produce p40 by in vitro transformation with ebv , coincident with the expression of latent membrane protein 1 ( lmp1 ) of ebv .
these b cell express p40 and p35 mrna , and phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) stimulation strongly enhance p40 and p70 production .
furthermore , transfection with lmp1 expression vector into a human b lymphoma cell line , daudi , lead to p40 production with nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappab activation .
these result suggest that transformation of primary b cell with ebv induce il-12 expression potentially through lmp1 expression .

sublethal level of oxidative stress stimulate transcriptional activation of c-jun and suppress il-2 promoter activation in jurkat t cell .
sublethal level of oxidative stress be well know to alter t cell functional response , but the underlying mechanism be unknown .
the current study examine the effect of oxidative stress on transcriptional activity mediate by c-fos/c-jun ap-1 and the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) .
the present result show that jurkat t cell acutely expose to micromolar concentration of h2o2 exhibit substantial increase in ap-1 binding activity and the expression of c-jun but not c-fos mrna .
the preferential induction of c-jun by h2o2 do not represent redox stabilization of mrna transcript , and oxidative signal closely resemble pha/ pma stimulation by effectively transactivating the full length c-jun promoter via the proximal jun1 tumor promoter-responsive element ( tre ) -like promoter element .
similarly , the complex bind the consensus ap-1 tre and jun tre-like motif in cell expose to oxidative signal or pha/ pma be indistinguishable , be compose of c-fos , c-jun , and jund .
however , pha/ pma but not oxidative signal induce the coordinate activation of reporter construct contain the ap-1 -tre , nf-at , and il-2 promoter region along with il-2 mrna expression .
furthermore , sublethal level of h2o2 actively suppress the transcriptional activation of nf-at and il-2 reporter as well a the expression of il-2 mrna in cell stimulate with pha/ pma .
gel shift analysis reveal that oxidative suppression of nf-at represent inhibition in the early generation of nfat complex rather than the binding of preformed nf-at complex .
these result suggest that oxidative signal can positively and negatively regulate t cell transcriptional event and that change in cellular redox can uncouple ap-1 regulation of c-jun from transcriptional up-regulation of il-2 via nf-at .
cloning and characterization of nf-atc and nf-atp : the cytoplasmic component of nf-at .
present evidence indicate a pathway of signal transmission in t cell that be outline in figure 1 .
the elevation in intracellular calcium that be induce by interaction at the antigen receptor lead to the activation of the calcium-dependent phosphatase calcineurin .
this in turn lead to the nuclear association of the cytosolic component of nf-atc .
the activation of calcineurin and the nuclear import of nf-atc can both be block by cyclosporin a or fk506 in complex with their respective immunophilins .
once in the nucleus , nf-atc interact with nf-atn to form an active transcriptional complex .
nf-atn be a ubiquitous protein , can be synthesize in response to pma , and have many similarity to ap-1 .
the mechanism by which nf-atc enter the nucleus be unknown , and although it appear to require calcineurin , nf-atc have not yet be show to be an in vivo substrate of calcineurin .
alternative mechanism include the possibility that nf-atc operate on some cytoplasmic anchor or that other protein that be control by calcineurin carry out the nuclear import of nf-atc .
although nf-atp copurifies with nf-atc , there be as yet no understanding of how nf-atp be function in vivo .
now that these protein be purify and clone , the major goal will be to understand their role and the role of other family member in thymic development .
a critical role of sp1- and ets- related transcription factor in maintain ctl-specific expression of the mouse perforin gene .
this study be design to determine the potential cis-elements involve in transcriptional regulation of the mouse perforin gene .
dnase i hypersensitive site ( dhs ) mapping reveal that the perforin locus contain six dhs within 7.0 kb of the 5' upstream sequence ( -7.0 kb ) and two dhs in intron 2 .
the six 5' upstream and one intronic dhs be detect in only perforin-expressing lymphocyte .
chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) activity direct by 5' upstream promoter be detect preferentially in perforin-expressing cell line .
a construct term pfp5a contain -795 bp exhibit the high cat activity , and pfp9a20 contain only -73 bp also produce significantly high cat activity in ctll-r8 cell .
the proximal region in pfp9a20 contain two potential sp1 binding site ( gc box and gt box ) and one ets binding site ( eb ) .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay show that each of the cis-elements bind specific protein factor .
when single-point mutation be introduce to each gc box , eb , and gt box in pfp9a20 , at least 3-fold less cat activity be observe in ctll-r8 cell .
to confirm the importance of the three cis-acting element in the perforin gene expression , point mutation be introduce again to each proximal gc box , eb , and gt box of pfp5a .
the point mutation result in a 2.5- to 3-fold reduction of cat activity .
the result suggest that a combination of the three proximal cis-acting element may constitute a minimal region responsible for ctl-specific expression of perforin .
a novel ets-related transcription factor , elf-1 , bind to human immunodeficiency virus type 2 regulatory element that be require for inducible trans activation in t cell .
human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) and hiv-2 be structurally related retrovirus which both cause aid in human .
although both virus establish latency in quiescent human-peripheral-blood t cell , the asymptomatic phase of hiv-2 infection may be more prolonged than that of hiv-1 .
the latent phase of both hiv-1 and hiv-2 infection have be show to be disrupt by t-cell activation , a process that require host cell transcription factor .
in the case of hiv-1 , the transcription factor nf-kappa b be sufficient for inducible transcriptional activation .
in contrast , factor in addition to nf-kappa b be require to activate hiv-2 transcription in infected t cell .
in this report , we demonstrate that a novel ets-related transcription factor , elf-1 , bind specifically to two purine-rich motif in the hiv-2 enhancer .
mutagenesis experiment demonstrate that these elf-1 binding site be require for induction of hiv-2 transcription follow t-cell-receptor-mediated t-cell activation .
moreover , elf-1 be the only factor present in activate t-cell nuclear extract that bind to these site in electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
thus , elf-1 be a novel transcription factor that appear to be require for the t-cell-receptor-mediated trans activation of hiv-2 gene expression .
these result may explain difference in the clinical spectrum of disease cause by hiv-1 and hiv-2 and may also have implication for the design of therapeutic approach to hiv-2 infection .
a novel sp-1 site in the human interleukin-1 beta promoter confer preferential transcriptional activity in keratinocytes .
to investigate the mechanism of transcriptional activation of interleukin-1beta ( il-1beta ) in non-monocytic cell , we construct a series of reporter plasmid with the bacterial chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene link to various part of the human il-1beta promoter and perform transient transfection experiment .
we identify a promoter segment that activate transcription most efficiently in keratinocytes .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) with a 43-mer oligonucleotide derive from the functionally identify cis-acting element reveal specific complex .
by competition analysis with transcription factor consensus sequence oligonucleotides and by immunosupershift , transcription factor sp-1 or a closely related protein be show to bind to this regulatory element .
the close match to the know sp-1 consensus sequence within the respective region be a tcccctcccct motif .
mutation of this motif almost completely , and specifically , abolish the binding of two low-mobility complex and lead to a 95 % decrease of constitutive transcriptional activation of a reporter construct il-1beta ( -170/+108 ) .
likewise , activation of this reporter construct by tumor necrosis factor-alpha depend on the sp-1 site .
these observation suggest that a so-far-unrecognized sp-1 site in the human il-1beta promoter may participate in the transcriptional regulation of this gene in keratinocytes .
uncouple activation-dependent hs1 phosphorylation from nuclear factor of activate t cell transcriptional activation in jurkat t cell : differential signaling through cd3 and the costimulatory receptor cd2 and cd28 .
cd3 , cd2 , and cd28 be functionally distinct receptor on t lymphocyte .
engagement of any of these receptor induce the rapid tyrosine phosphorylation of a shared group of intracellular signaling protein , include vav , cbl , p85 phosphoinositide 3-kinase , and the src family kinase lck and fyn .
ligation of cd3 also induce the tyrosine phosphorylation of hs1 , a 75-kda hematopoietic cell-specific intracellular signaling protein of unknown function .
we have examine change in hs1 phosphorylation after differential stimulation of cd3 , cd2 , and cd28 to elucidate it role in t cell and to far delineate the signaling pathway recruit by these receptor .
unlike ligation of cd3 , stimulation with anti- cd28 mab or cho cell express the cd28 ligand cd80 or cd86 do not lead to tyrosine phosphorylation of hs1 in jurkat t cell .
additionally , no tyrosine phosphorylation of hs1 be induce by mitogenic pair of anti- cd2 mabs capable of activate the transcription factor nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) .
costimulation through cd28 and/or cd2 do not modulate the cd3 -dependent phosphorylation of hs1 .
in vivo study indicate that cd3 -induced hsi phosphorylation be dependent upon both the src family tyrosine kinase lck and the tyrosine phosphatase cd45 , do not require mek1 kinase activity , and be regulate by protein kinase c activation .
thus , although cd3 , cd28 , and cd2 activate many of the same signaling molecule , they differ in their capacity to induce the tyrosine phosphorylation of hsi .
furthermore , activation-dependent tyrosine phosphorylation of hs1 be not require for nfat transcriptional activation .
be celiac disease due to molecular mimicry between gliadin peptide -hla class ii molecule -t cell interaction and those of some unidentified superantigen ?
this paper present a new hypothesis for the etiology and pathogenesis of celiac disease ( cd ) .
it be our contention that cd be trigger by the binding of one or more gliadin peptide to cd -associated hla class ii molecule .
furthermore , we propose that these putative cd peptide bind to oligosaccharide residue on hla class ii molecule distal to the peptide-binding groove invoke recognition and binding by specialize subset of gamma delta t cell receptor-bearing lymphocyte .
the binding of these gamma delta t cell serve a a signal for abrogation of oral tolerance to ingest protein set in motion a series of immune response direct against the small intestinal epithelium of cd patient .
cd patient be victimize by this self-distructed immune response because of inheritance of certain combination of hla-dq and dr haplotype .
dimer encode by hla-dr haplotype may be the primary restriction element for lectin-like , gliadin peptide while the degree of immune suppression ( or lack thereof ) to ingest gliadins be govern by inherit hla-dq haplotype .
finally , we speculate that molecular mimicry between one or more gliadin peptide and some , a yet unidentified , bacterial or viral superantigen play a role in disease pathogenesis .
thiol modulation inhibit the interleukin ( il ) -1 -mediated activation of an il-1 receptor-associated protein kinase and nf-kappa b .
the interleukin-1 receptor type i ( il-1ri ) be associate with other protein thus form a complex system by which il-1 exert it various signal .
the initiate event be still uncertain , but activation of a recently describe receptor-associated protein kinase be one of the early event detectable ( martin et al. , eur.j.immunol.1994.24 : 1566 ) .
il-1 signaling be commonly accompany by oxidative process and be think to be subject to redox regulation .
we therefore investigate whether the activation of the il-1ri -associated protein kinase could be a target for redox regulation and whether an altered activity of the kinase could influence il-1 -mediated nf-kappa b activation .
a murine t cell line , el4 , be stimulate with il-1 with and without pretreatment with different compound know to influence the cellular redox status .
thiol modifying agent like diamide , menadione , pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( pdtc ) , diethyl dithiocarbamate or phenylarsine oxide inhibit the il-1 -induced activation of the il-1ri-associated protein kinase .
n-acetylcysteine , alpha,alpha'-dipyridyl , aminotriazole or nitrofurantoin do not show any effect .
the inhibition by pdtc be reversible unless glutathione synthesis be block by buthionine sulfoximine .
the describe condition which inhibit or prevent the activation of the il-1ri -associated kinase similarly impair the activation of nf-kappa b in el4 cell .
from these observation we conclude that free thiols in the il-1ri complex be essential for the activation of the il-1ri -associated protein kinase and that this process be mandatory for il-1 signaling lead to nf-kappa b activation .
erythropoietin induce tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 , stat5a , and stat5b in primary culture human erythroid precursor .
we examine signaling by erythropoietin in highly purify human colony forming unit-erythroid cell , generate in vitro from cd34(+) cell .
we find that erythropoietin induce tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 , stat5a , and stat5b .
tyrosine phosphorylation of jak2 reach a peak around 10 minute after stimulation and be maximum at 5 u/ml of erythropoietin .
tyrosine phosphorylation of stat5 be accompany by the translocation of activate stat5 to the nucleus a show by electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsa ) use 32pi-labeled stat5 binding site in the beta-casein promoter .
tyrosine phosphorylation stat1 or stat3 be not detect in human erythroid precursor after stimulation with erythropoietin .
crkl , an sh2/sh3 adapter protein , become coimmunoprecipitated specifically with stat5 from erythropoietin -stimulated erythroid cell ; although it be show to become associate with c-cbl in the study use cell line .
thus , human erythroid precursor can be expand in vitro in sufficient number and purity to allow it usage in signal transduction study .
this report set a basis for further study on signaling in primary culture human erythroid precursor , which in turn contribute to our good understanding in the differentiation process of erythrocyte and their precursor .
[ the trend of molecular biology study on eosinophil ]
recently , many investigator have be interested in the study on eosinophil biology since gene association with eosinophil such a interleukin-5 or eosinophil granule protein ( epo , ecp , edn , mbp , and clc ) , be isolate .
however , the molecular basis for the commitment of progenitor to the eosinophil lineage have not be determine .
the mechanism by which eosinophil-specific gene encode primary and secondary granule protein ( e.g. ecp , edn , epo , mbp , and clc ) be express and regulate during eosinophilopoiesis be also unknown .
in this paper , i describe the characterization of gene encode eosinophil granule protein and the mrna expression of gata-1 binding transcription factor during eosinophil differentiation .
tissue-specific regulation of the rabbit 15-lipoxygenase gene in erythroid cell by a transcriptional silencer .
the 15-lipoxygenase ( lox ) gene be express in a tissue-specific manner , predominantly in erythroid cell but also in airway epithelial cell and eosinophil .
we demonstrate in this report that the 5' flanking dna of the 15-lox gene contain sequence which down-regulate it activity in a variety of non-erythroid cell line but not in two erythroid cell line .
the element have characteristic of a transcriptional ' silencer ' since it function in both orientation .
the main activity of the silencer have be map to the first 900 bp of 5' flanking dna , which contain nine bind site for a nuclear factor present in non- erythroid cell but not in erythroid cell .
these bind site have similar sequence and multiple copy of the bind site confer tissue-specific down-regulation when attach to a minimal lox promoter fragment .
the 5' flanking dna also contain a cluster of three bind site for the gata family of transcription factor .
pattern of pan expression and role of pan protein in endocrine cell type-specific complex formation .
the pan gene encode at least two distinct transcript , pan-1 and pan-2 ( also know a e47 and e12 , respectively ) , by the mechanism of alternative rna splicing .
northern blot analysis perform on rat and mouse tissue have detect ubiquitously express pan transcript , but the abundance , distribution , and form of pan protein have not be clearly define .
study of cell line represent endocrine , fibroblast , and lymphoid lineage use polyclonal antiserum to detect e2a protein have suggest that significant e2a protein expression be restricted to b-lymphocytes .
we have develop a monoclonal antibody , yae , which be specific for pan/ e2a protein , and have use the yae antibody to examine a variety of endocrine and nonendocrine cell lineage for difference in pan/ protein expression , subcellular localization , and heteromeric complex formation .
in contrast to previous result obtain use polyclonal antiseras to detect pan/ e2a protein , we report comparable level of pan protein in gh/prl- and insulin- producing , b- and t- lymphocyte cell .
ief-1 , a pancreatic beta-cell type-specific complex believe to regulate insulin expression , be demonstrate to consist of at least two distinct specie , one of which do not contain pan molecule .
although it have be postulate that pituitary endocrine cell and pancreatic endocrine beta-cells share identical pan/e2a complex , native-western analysis of pituitary and endocrine beta-cells detect pan protein in distinct cell type-specific complex .
inhibition of lipopolysaccharide -induced monocyte interleukin-1 receptor antagonist synthesis by cortisol : involvement of the mineralocorticoid receptor .
glucocorticoid , a a part of their physiological role in the control of inflammatory and immune process , suppress the expression of interleukin-1 ( il-1 ) and other cytokine .
human monocyte il-1 receptor antagonist ( il-1ra ) messenger ribonucleic acid ( mrna ) expression and protein secretion be inhibit by dexamethasone .
we have now far study the regulation of il-1ra by the major physiological human glucocorticoid , cortisol .
we find that cortisol incubation induce a decrease in il-1ra mrna expression and a significant inhibition of il-1ra protein secretion in cell culture of human peripheral monocyte stimulate with the bacterial endotoxin lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) .
oral administration of 276 mumol cortisol to normal subject also decrease lp -induced il-1ra synthesis in culture monocyte .
by coincubating the monocyte with either the mineralocorticoid antagonist spironolactone or the glucocorticoid receptor antagonist ru 38486 , the in vitro cortisol -induced inhibition of lp -stimulated il-1ra secretion be partially reverse .
the mineralocorticoid aldosterone exert a significant decrease in lp -induced monocyte il-1ra secretion in vitro , which be block by coincubation with spironolactone .
in addition , the expression of mineralocorticoid receptor mrna in human monocyte be observe by pcr of reverse transcribe rna .
our result far indicate that corticosteroid physiologically control the il-1/ il-1ra system during inflammatory or immune process .
moreover , we provide evidence that , in addition to a glucocorticoid receptor -mediated effect , the mineralocorticoid receptor be involve in the inhibition of monocyte il-1ra secretion by cortisol .
epithelial cell-initiated inflammation play a crucial role in early tissue damage in amebic infection of human intestine .
background & aim : entamoeba histolytica infection of the intestine can induce severe gut inflammation .
the aim of this study be to assess the role of the host inflammatory response in the tissue damage observe with amebiasis and the role of the intestinal epithelial cell in initiate that response .
method : e. histolytica infection be establish in human intestinal xenograft in severe combined immunodeficient ( scid-hu-int ) mouse .
human intestinal epithelial cell inflammatory response to amebic infection be inhibit by the intraluminal administration of an antisense oligonucleotide to the human p65 subunit of nuclear factor kappab , and the role of neutrophil in tissue damage observe with amebiasis be study by deplete neutrophil from scid-hu-int mouse .
result : administration of the antisense oligonucleotide block the production of human interleukin 1beta and interleukin 8 by intestinal epithelial cell and inhibit neutrophil influx into the e. histolytica -infected intestinal xenograft .
inhibition of the gut inflammatory response by the antisense oligonucleotide or the depletion of neutrophil from scid-hu-_int mouse block the increase in intestinal permeability observe with amebic infection .
conclusion : intestinal epithelial cell initiate an inflammatory response with result neutrophil-mediated tissue damage in response to e. histolytica infection ; this inflammatory cascade can be block by inhibit the transcription of gene regulate by nuclear factor kappab .
effect of the antisense myb expression on hemin- and erythropoietin- induced erythroid differentiation of k562 cell .
in order to elucidate the role of c-myb gene in erythroid differentiation of k562 cell induce by hemin ( hm ) and erythropoietin ( epo ) , we construct recombinant plasmid that could produce antisense myb rna after induction with dexamethasone .
during treatment with hm , k562 cell constitutively express c-myb mrna , and 50 % of them begin to synthesize hemoglobin ( hb ) .
expression of antisense myb rna reduce the amount of c-myb mrna , and the percentage of hb -synthesizing cell be decrease to 20 % .
in the presence of epo , c-myb mrna decline and 20 % of k562 cell synthesize hb regardless of antisense myb rna expression .
it be suggest that constitutive expression of c-myb mrna be necessary for hm -induced differentiation , and that a decrease in the amount of c-myb mrna induce by antisense myb rna expression suppress hm -induced differentiation .
the amount of c-myb mrna in k562 cell be reduce during the differentiation induce by epo .
expression of gata-1 mrna be almost constant during hm -induced differentiation , but increase during epo treatment .
it be suppose that the mechanism of hm -induced differentiation be distinguish from that of epo -induced differentiation in k562 cell .

the protective effect of sp and bp on the il-2mrna synthesis in stressful condition and by the t-cells treatment with the csa be demonstrate .
gata transcription factor associate with a novel class of nuclear body in erythroblast and megakaryocyte .
the nuclear distribution of gata transcription factor in murine haemopoietic cell be examine by indirect immunofluorescence .
specific bright focus of gata-1 fluorescence be observe in erythroleukaemia cell and primary murine erythroblast and megakaryocyte , in addition to diffuse nucleoplasmic localization .
these focus , which be preferentially find adjacent to nucleoli or at the nuclear periphery , do not represent site of active transcription or binding of gata-1 to consensus site in the beta-globin locus .
immunoelectron microscopy demonstrate the presence of intensely label structure likely to represent the gata-1 focus see by immunofluorescence .
the gata-1 nuclear body differ from previously describe nuclear structure and there be no co-localization with nuclear antigen involve in rna processing or other ubiquitous ( spl , c-jun and tbp ) or haemopoietic ( nf-e2 ) transcription factor .
interestingly , gata-2 and gata-3 protein also localize to the same nuclear body in cell line co-expressing gata -1 and -2 or gata -1 and -3 gene product .
this pattern of distribution be , thus far , unique to the gata transcription factor and suggest a protein-protein interaction with other component of the nuclear body via the gata zinc finger domain .
interleukin -4 and -13 induce upregulation of the murine macrophage 12/15-lipoxygenase activity : evidence for the involvement of transcription factor stat6 .
when human monocyte or alveolar macrophage be culture in the presence of interleukin ( il ) -4 or il-13 , the expression of the reticulocyte-type 15-lipoxygenase be induce .
in mouse a 15-lipoxygenase be not express , but a leukocyte-type 12-lipoxygenase be present in peritoneal macrophage .
to investigate whether both lipoxygenase isoforms exhibit a similar regulatory response toward cytokine stimulation , we study the regulation of the leukocyte-type 12-lipoxygenase of murine peritoneal macrophage by interleukin and find that the activity of this enzyme be upregulated in a dose-dependent manner when the cell be culture in the presence of the il-4 or il-13 but not by il-10 .
when peripheral murine monocyte that do not express the lipoxygenase be treat with il-4 expression of 12/15-lipoxygenase mrna be induce , suggest pretranslational control mechanism .
in contrast , no upregulation of the lipoxygenase activity be observe when the macrophage be prepare from homozygous stat6 -deficient mouse .
peritoneal macrophage of transgenic mouse that systemically overexpress il-4 exhibit a threefold to fourfold high 12-lipoxygenase activity than cell prepare from control animal .
a similar upregulation of 12-lipoxygenase activity be detect in heart , spleen , and lung of the transgenic animal .
moreover , a strong induction of the enzyme be observe in red cell during experimental anemia in mouse .
the data present here indicate that ( 1 ) the 12-lipoxygenase activity of murine macrophage be upregulated in vitro and in vivo by il-4 and/or il-13 , ( 2 ) this upregulation require expression of the transcription factor stat6 , and ( 3 ) the constitutive expression of the enzyme appear to be stat6 independent .
the cytokine -dependent upregulation of the murine macrophage 12-lipoxygenase and it induction during experimental anemia suggest it close relatedness with the human reticulocyte-type 15-lipoxygenase despite their difference in the positional specificity of arachidonic acid oxygenation .
expression of pilot , a putative transcription factor , require two signal and be cyclosporin a sensitive in t cell .
few known gene ( il-2 , member of the il-8 family , interferon-gamma ) be induce in t cell only through the combined effect of phorbol myristic acetate ( pma ) and a ca(2+)-ionophore , and expression of only these gene can be fully suppress by cyclosporin a ( cya ) .
we have identify a putative transcription factor , designate pilot , with an identical dual signal requirement for expression .
induction of the pilot gene be detectable in human t cell 20 min follow activation in the presence of cycloheximide and be fully suppress by cya .
the pilot protein have a calculate m(r) of 42.6 kda and contain three zinc finger of the c2h2-type at the carboxyl-terminus which be highly homologous to the zinc finger region of the transcription factor egr1 , egr2 , and pat 133 .
in contrast to t cell , in fibroblast pilot gene expression require only one signal ( pma ) and be not affect by cya .
this observation directly demonstrate the existence of a ca2+ signal-dependent regulatory element obligatory for expression of some gene in t cell but not in fibroblast .
this differential expression model will be valuable in the dissection of the dual signal pathway in t cell and the effect of cya upon it .
