differential nuclear localization of p50 , p52 , and relb protein in human accessory cell of the immune response in situ .
the rel/nf-kappa b protein , p50 , p52 , p65 , c-rel , and relb , constitute a family of transcription factor involve in the positive regulation of a variety of gene during the immune response .
recently , it have be show that relb knockout mouse have no dendritic cell ( dc ) .
an overexpression of p50 have be describe in follicular dendritic cell ( fdc ) .
a constitutive nf-kappa b activity have be report in mature macrophage .
this lead to the hypothesis that some of the rel/ nf-kappa b protein be key nuclear factor in function of accessory cell of the immune response .
therefore , we investigate in situ the nuclear localization of rel/ nf-kappa b protein in accessory cell of the immune system by immunohistochemistry and double labeling by immunofluorescence from five normal human tonsil and five lymph node with follicular hyperplasia .
nuclear p65 and c-rel protein be find in all cell type include lymphocyte .
in germinal center gc , p50 , p52 , and relb be find in the nucleus of fdc only and be not detect in the nucleus of cd68+ cell .
in t cell area , p50 , p52 , and relb be find in the nucleus of hla-dr+ cell with an antigen-presenting cell ( apc ) morphology .
p52 and relb be detect in the nucleus in both cd1a+ and cd68+ cell from the t cell area , whereas p50 be find only in cd68- and cd1a- cell .
cell with nuclear p50 be negative for the cd38 , cd20 and cd2 marker .
these result show that , physiologically , high level of nuclear of p50 , p52 and relb be restricted to accessory cell of the immune system , which include fdc in gc , and dc and macrophage in the t cell zone , that specialize scavenger macrophage from gc do not have detectable level of p52 and relb , whereas macrophage from the t cell area , know to present the antigen to t cell , do have both nuclear p52 and relb , and that in the t cell zone , p52 and relb be located in nucleus of both cd1a+ , cd68+ or both , cell apc , whereas p50 be restricted to cd1a- and cd68-_apc .
the different pattern of p50 , p52 and relb protein nuclear localization may provide insight into their different role during the immune response in vivo .
c-terminal activate and inhibitory domain determine the transactivation potential of bsap ( pax-5 ) , pax-2 and pax-8 .
pax-5 encode the transcription factor bsap which play an essential role in early b cell development and midbrain patterning .
in this study we have analyse the structural requirement for transcriptional activation by bsap .
in vitro mutagenesis and transient transfection experiment indicate that the c-terminal serine / threonine / proline -rich region of bsap contain a potent transactivation domain of 55 amino acid which be active from promoter and enhancer position .
this transactivation domain be find to be inactivate by a naturally occur frameshift mutation in one pax-5 allele of the acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell line reh .
the function of the transactivation domain be negatively regulate by adjacent sequence from the extreme c-terminus .
the activate and inhibitory domain function together a an independent regulatory module in different cell type a show by fusion to the gal4 dna binding domain .
the same arrangement of positively and negatively act sequence have be conserve in the mammalian pax-2 and pax-8 , the zebrafish pax-b as well a the sea urchin pax-258 protein .
these data demonstrate that the transcriptional competence of a subfamily of pax protein be determine by a c-terminal regulatory module compose of activate and inhibitory sequence .
cyclosporin a inhibit early mrna expression of g0/g1 switch gene 2 ( g0s2 ) in culture human blood mononuclear cell .
cyclosporin a ( csa ) may achieve it immunosuppressive effect by inhibit the calcium- and calmodulin-dependent phosphatase calcineurin which be require for activation of target gene by member of the nfat ( nuclear factor of activate t cell ) transcription factor family .
among these target gene be the gene encode interleukin-2 ( il2 ) , a cytokine facilitate progression through the g1 phase of the cell cycle .
however , il2 do not reverse csa inhibition , suggest that at least one other nfat-sensitive gene may be involve .
the human g0/g1 switch gene , g0s2 , have potential nfat-binding site in the 5' flank and encode a small basic potential phosphoprotein of unknown function .
use a sensitive , reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) assay , g0s2 mrna level be assay in culture blood mononuclear cell .
freshly isolate cell contain high level of g0s2 mrna which rapidly decline .
this " spontaneous stimulation " be also note with some other g0s gene and have be attribute to some aspect of the isolation procedure .
in cell that have be preincubated to lower mrna level , there be a transient increase in g0s2 mrna , peak between 1-2 h , in response to concanavalin-a ( cona ) , or to the combination of phorbol ester ( tpa ) , and the calcium ionophore , ionomycin .
both these response be inhibit by csa .
our result suggest that g0s2 expression be require to commit cell to enter the g1 phase of the cell cycle , and that , while not exclude other possible target , early inhibition of g0s2 expression by csa may be important in achieve immunosuppression .
g0s2 may be of value a a reporter gene for analyze the mechanism of action of csa and it influence on the positive and negative selection of lymphocyte in response to self and not-self antigen .
inhibition of vitamin d receptor -retinoid x receptor -vitamin d response element complex formation by nuclear extract of vitamin d-resistant new world primate cell .
most new world primate ( nwp ) genus evolve to require high circulating level of steroid hormone and vitamin d .
we hypothesize that an intracellular vitamin d binding protein ( idbp ) , present in both nuclear and cytoplasmic fraction of nwp cell , or another protein ( s ) may cause or contribute to the steroid hormone-resistant state in nwp by disruption of the receptor dimerization process and/or by interference of receptor complex bind to the consensus response element present in the enhancer region of steroid-responsive gene .
we employ electromobility shift assay ( emsa ) to screen for the presence of protein capable of bind to the vitamin d response element ( vdre ) .
nuclear and post- nuclear extract be prepare from two b-lymphoblastoid cell line know to be representative of the vitamin d -resistant and wild type phenotype , respectively .
the extract be compare for their ability to retard the migration of radiolabeled double stranded oligomers representative of the vdres of the human osteocalcin and the mouse osteopontin gene promoter .
a specific , retarded band contain vdr-rxr be identify when wild type cell but not when vitamin d -resistant cell nuclear extract be use in the binding reaction with either probe .
in addition , vitamin d -resistant cell nuclear extract contain a protein ( s ) which be bind specifically to the vdre and be capable of completely inhibit vdr-rxr- vdre complex formation ; these effect be not demonstrate with nuclear extract from the wild type cell line or with the post-nuclear extract of the vitamin d -resistant cell line .
we conclude that a vdre -binding protein ( s ) , distinct from idbp and present in nuclear extract of cell from a prototypical vitamin d -resistant nwp , be capable of inhibit normal vdr-rxr heterodimer bind to the vdre .
human interferon regulatory factor 2 gene .
intron-exon organization and functional analysis of 5'-flanking region .
interferon regulatory factor 2 ( irf-2 ) be a transcriptional regulatory protein that terminate interferon beta expression initiate by interferon regulatory factor 1 .
in this study , we isolate the genomic dna for human irf-2 gene , determine the intron-exon structure of the human irf-2 gene , map the major transcription initiation site , identify a number of potential regulatory element in the 5'-flanking region , and localize the irf-2 gene on human chromosome 4 .
the irf-2 promoter region contain a cpg island , with several gc box , a putative nf-kappa b -binding site , and a caat box , but no tata box .
when the promoter region be link with a heterologous reporter gene , we find that the promoter region be inducible by both interferon ( interferon -alpha and -gamma ) and interferon regulatory factor 1 .
the region which induce these induction be identify a be confine to 40 nucleotide 5' to the major transcriptional initiation site by test a series of clone with truncate promoter of irf-2 .
this region contain element which be share with the transcriptional enhancer of other gene include interferon regulatory factor 1 , interferon beta , and interferon-inducible gene .
these data suggest that interferon regulatory factor 1 not only trigger the activation of the interferon signal transduction pathway , but also may play a role in limit the duration of this response by activate the transcription of irf-2 .
involvement of stat3 in interleukin-6 -induced igm production in a human b-cell line .
interleukin-6 ( il-6 ) be an important b-cell growth and differentiation factor .
il-6 treatment of the human lymphoblastoid cell line , skw6.4 , lead to increase igm production .
we have previously show that il-6 induce activation of jak1 and jak2 in human b cell line .
a chimeric il-6 receptor , comprise of the intracellular tail of the il-6 receptor subunit gp130 fuse to the extracellular domain of the epidermal growth factor ( egf ) receptor , be stably transfected into skw6.4 cell .
egf treatment induce igm production in cell transfected with an intact gp130 cytoplasmic tail , but not in untransfected cell or cell transfected with a cytoplasmic tail lack all four signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) binding site .
moreover , egf treatment induce stat3 phosphorylation in cell transfected with the intact chimeric egf-gp130 receptor along with induction of dna-mobility shift of a classical interferon-gamma-activated site .
to define far the relation between stat3 activation and enhance igm production , we determine the effect of chimeric gp130 on the transcriptional activation of a genetic element link to immunoglobulin production , namely the immunoglobulin heavy chain enhancer ( igh-enhancer ) .
parental as well a transfected skw6.4 cell be transiently transfected with an igh-enhancer -luciferase construct .
the transcriptional activity of the igh-luciferase construct be induce upon ligation of the full-length chimeric receptor but not by truncate gp130 receptor .
moreover , the gp130 -induced activity of this reporter gene be abrogate by stat3ee , a mutant stat3 incapable of bind dna .
these result indicate that il-6 -induced b-cell differentiation , a measure by igm production , may be control by stat3 protein .
identification of a major positive regulatory element located 5' to the human zeta-globin gene .
the function of the zeta-globin promoter be study use a series of zeta-globin promoter deletion construct to drive luciferase expression in transiently transfected human erythroleukemia cell .
the promoter be use without enhancer , or with enhancer derive from the beta-globin locus control region and the alpha-globin hs-40 enhancer .
when transfected into k562 cell , which express zeta-globin , comparable amount of activity be obtain from the -557 and -417 zeta- luciferase construct and the alpha- luciferase construct when no enhancer or the alpha-globin locus enhancer be use .
when the construct be transfected into ocim1 cell , which do not express zeta-globin , the zeta-globin promoter be at best 20 % a active a the alpha-globin promoter .
when sequence from -417 to -207 5' to the zeta-globin mrna cap site be delete , up to 95 % of the zeta-globin promoter activity be lose in k562 cell .
reinsertion of these sequence into zeta- luciferase construct miss the -417 to -207 region show that the sequence lack classical enhancer activity .
point mutation of a gata-1 site at -230 reduce promoter activity by 37 % .
point mutation of a ccacc site at -240 have no effect .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay indicate that the -230 gata-1 site have a relatively low affinity for gata-1 .
these experiment show the presence of a strong positive-acting element , located between -417 and -207 bp 5' to the zeta-globin mrna cap site , be necessary for high-level promoter activity in k562 cell .
this element require gata-1 and additional unknown factor for maximal activity .
identification of transcriptional suppressor protein that bind to the negative regulatory element of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 .
two different protein which independently bind to neighbor sequence within the negative regulatory element ( nre ) of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) be detect in the nuclear extract of a virus-infected human t cell line .
one of the factor bind to a novel dyad symmetrical sequence .
this sequence be well conserve in various hiv-1 isolates and partial homology be find with the promoter region of the human retinoblastoma gene .
similar dna binding activity be detect in a variety of virus-uninfected human t cell line and hela cell by mean of a gel mobility shift assay .
the other factor bind to a putative ap-1 recognition sequence predict for the hiv-1 nre .
however , this factor do not bind to a typical ap-1 site .
the insertion of multiple copy of the bind site for the former or latter factor into a heterologous promoter reduce the promoter activity to one-tenth or one-third , respectively .
thus , each factor may function a a novel negative regulator of transcription .
[ change in leucocytic estrogen receptor level in patient with gynecomastia ]
the number of estrogen receptor ( er ) in human peripheral leucocyte in 13 men with gynecomastia be measure by radioligand binding method . the result be compare with those of 13 sex- and age-matched healthy subject .
it be find that the number of er in leucocyte be significantly increase in gynecomastia ( r of leucocyte be 1054 +/- 254 sites/cell ) .
it suggest that increase of er level play an important role in the pathogenesis of gynecomastia .
detection of oestrogen receptor variant in endometrium , myometrium , leiomyoma and peripheral blood mononuclear cell : comparison to variant present in breast cancer .
oestradiol have mitogenic and regulatory effect on various organ and cell , mediate mainly by it nuclear receptor ( er ) .
the presence of aberrant er form in oestrogen-dependent tumour have be discuss in correlation with tumour progression .
er variant , generate by alternative splicing , have be detect in human breast cancer , but also in normal mammary gland , therefore their role in tumorigenesis have be question .
we have investigate , by the use of the reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction amplification technique , the possible existence of er variant in other normal oestrogen target organ and cell , such a uterus ( myometrium and endometrium ) , in peripheral blood mononuclear cell and in a benign uterus tumour ( leiomyoma ) .
we have detect variant er in these sample and have compare the variant profile to that observe in breast cancer .
all tissue and cell study express both wild-type er and variant specie .
variant form encompass er with deletion of exon 2 , 5 and 7 .
variant with exon 5 delete be detect only in peripheral blood mononuclear cell and in breast cancer .
variant with exon 2 and 7 delete be present in all specimen test .
these result corroborate previous finding that the presence of er variant be not a characteristic of breast cancer .
the physiological significance and possible clinical relevance of the variant er form remain to be elucidate .
high level of the dna-binding activity of e2f in adult t-cell leukemia and human t-cell leukemia virus type i -infected cell : possible enhancement of dna-binding of e2f by the human t-cell leukemia virus i transactivating protein , tax .
transcription factor e2f bind to cellular promoter of certain growth- and cell cycle- controlling gene and form distinct heteromeric complex with other nuclear protein .
it have therefore be propose that e2f be involve in cellular proliferation control .
human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) be an etiological agent of adult t-cell leukemia ( atl ) .
we show here by mobility-shift assay that e2f -containing dna-binding complex be detect in htlv-i -infected t-cell line and leukemic cell obtain from atl patient but not in an uninfected t-cell line , jurkat , and normal peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
the tax protein , encode by htlv-i , be a potent transcription activator of viral and several cellular gene .
we demonstrate that expression of tax can induce the e2f -containing dna-binding complex in jurkat t cell .
thus , tax , through enhancement of the dna-binding activity of e2f , may be capable of regulate cellular gene expression implicate in the proliferation and transformation of t cell in atl .
this activity may be relevant to the mechanism whereby htlv-i which do not contain oncogene induce neoplasia .
transcriptional regulation during t-cell development : the alpha tcr gene a a molecular model .
the regulation of gene expression during lymphocyte differentiation be a complex process involve interaction between multiple positive and negative transcriptional regulatory element .
in this article , transcriptional regulation of the archetypal t-cell -specific gene , alpha tcr , be discuss .
major recent development , include the identification of novel family of transcription factor that regulate multiple t-cell gene during thymocyte ontogeny and t-cell activation , be describe .
constitutive nf-kappa b activation , enhance granulopoiesis , and neonatal lethality in i kappa b alpha -deficient mouse .
transcription factor belong to the nf-kappa b family be control by inhibitory i kappa b protein , mainly i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta .
apparently normal at birth , i kappa b alpha -/- mouse exhibit severe runting , skin defect , and extensive granulopoiesis postnatally , typically die by 8 day .
hematopoietic tissue from these mouse display elevated level of both nuclear nf-kappa b and mrna of some , but not all , gene think to be regulate by nf-kappa b .
nf-kappa b elevation result in these phenotypic abnormality because mouse lack both i kappa b alpha and the p50 subunit of nf-kappa b show a dramatically delay onset of abnormality .
in contrast to hematopoietic cell , i kappa b alpha -/- embryonic fibroblast show minimal constitutive nf-kappa b , as well a normal signal-dependent nf-kappa b activation that be concomitant with i kappa b beta degradation .
our result indicate that i kappa b beta , but not i kappa b alpha , be require for the signal-dependent activation of nf-kappa b in fibroblast .
however , i kappa b alpha be require for the postinduction repression of nf-kappa b in fibroblast .
these result define distinct role for the two form of i kappa b and demonstrate the necessity for stringent control of nf-kappa b .
ifn-gamma and il-10 inhibit induction of il-1 receptor type i and type ii gene expression by il-4 and il-13 in human monocyte .
the th2-type cytokine il-4 and il-13 induce expression of a distinct subset of gene in human monocyte .
these include fc epsilonrii ( cd23 ) , 15-lipoxygenase , il-1 receptor antagonist ( il-1ra ) , and type i and type ii il-1 receptor ( il-1r ) .
ifn-gamma have be show to inhibit induction of cd23 and 15-lipoxygenase in monocyte ; however , the effect of ifn-gamma on type i and type ii il-1r gene expression have not be define .
we examine the effect of ifn-gamma on both basal and il-4 / il-13 -induced il-1r gene expression in primary monocyte .
il-4 and il-13 induce dose- and time-dependent increase in il-1ri and il-1rii mrna level .
ifn-gamma decrease basal expression as well a the induction of these gene by il-4 and il-13 .
inhibition of il-1ri and il-1rii mrna level by ifn-gamma be transcriptionally mediate , and correlate directly with decrease production of soluble il-1rii .
furthermore , the ability to suppress il-1ri and il-1rii mrna level be not unique to ifn-gamma because il-10 also inhibit expression of these gene in il-4 / il-13 -stimulated monocyte .
inhibition of il-1r gene expression by ifn-gamma and il-10 be not due to down-regulation of surface il-4r because pretreatment with these cytokine do not decrease the number of il-4 binding site per cell .
however , suppression of il-1r gene expression by ifn-gamma and il-10 be associate with decrease tyrosine phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of the il-4 / il-13 -inducible transcription factor , stat6 , suggest a potential mechanism by which ifn-gamma and il-10 may mediate their suppressive effect .
these finding demonstrate that certain cytokine , include ifn-gamma and il-10 , antagonize the ability of il-4 and il-13 to induce increase expression of the il-1ri and il-1rii gene in monocyte .
induction of transcription factor in human t lymphocyte by aspirin -like drug .
aspirin-like drug ( ald ) induce calcium mobilization , an essential component of t cell activation , but do not induce the biosynthesis of il-2 .
to understand the extent to which ald may mimic mitogenic stimulation , we study cytoplasmic and nuclear signaling step in ald -treated t cell .
we find that ald induce a transient activation of protein kinase ( pkc ) but have no effect ( in comparison to anti-cd3 antibody ) on protein tyrosine phosphorylation nor on pcl gamma 1 tyrosine phosphorylation .
ald -induced calcium mobilization and pkc activation be independent of tyrosine protein kinase activity a show by the lack of effect of herbimycin , a tyrosine -protein kinase -specific inhibitor .
although we detect no il-2 mrna in ald -treated cell , the nucleus of these cell contain protein capable of bind to three regulatory sequence in the il-2 promoter region : nfat , nf kappa b , and ap-1 .
these binding activity be express only in activate t cell .
the expression of ap-1 depend on calcium mobilization and pkc activation .
these data suggest that ald cause transient but significant change in t cell transmembrane signaling , although some event induce by stimulation with anti-cd3 antibody be not induce by ald .
the signal be transmit to the nucleus and induce dna-binding activity by several transcription factor .
however , the ald stimulus be not capable of cause complete t cell activation .
transcription factor egr-1 activity down-regulates fa and cd23 expression in b cell .
activation of mature b cell via ag receptor cross-linking induce transient expression of the transcription factor egr-1 .
although the activate signal lead to egr-1 induction have be study extensively , little be know about the gene that be place far downstream within this activation cascade and that be transcriptionally regulate by egr-1 .
to identify such target gene , we establish egr-1 -overexpressing transfectants from the murine b cell line k46 and from human ramos b cell .
all clone derive from k46 b cell show increase expression of cd44 .
most interestingly , expression of cd95 ( fa /apo-1 ) and of cd23 be down-regulated in all k46 transfectants .
a a consequence , they become resistant to apoptosis induce by anti-cd95 ab treatment .
similarly , the egr-1 -expressing ramos cell show reduce level of cd95 expression .
thus , egr-1 seem to control the expression of downstream target gene not only a a transcriptional activator , but also a a repressor molecule .
in b cell , egr-1 therefore play a critical role in integrate the short-lived signal deliver by triggering of the ag receptor into phenotypic change , include repression of cd95 and cd23 transcription .
structure and function analysis of the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen promoter : evidence for the role of sp1 and not of c-myb or pu.1 in myelomonocytic lineage-specific expression .
the human myeloid nuclear differentiation antigen ( mnda ) be express specifically in mature cell of the myelomonocytic lineage and in monocyte and granulocyte .
epitope enhancement be use to confirm the strict lineage- and stage-specific expression of mnda in bone marrow as well a in other paraffin-embedded fixed tissue .
a 1-kb region of the gene that include 5' flanking sequence be report earlier to contain functional promoter activity and be specifically demethylated in express cell in contrast to null cell .
further analysis have reveal that this 1-kb fragment promote high reporter gene activity in mnda -expressing cell than non-expressing cell , indicate cell-specific difference in transactivation .
this sequence contain consensus element consistent with myeloid-specific gene expression , include a pu.1 consensus site near the major transcription start site and a cluster of c-myb site located several hundred base upstream of this region .
however , analysis of deletion mutant localize nearly all of the promoter activity to a short region ( -73 to -16 ) that do not include the cluster of c-myb site .
a 4-bp mutation of the core sp1 consensus element ( gc box ) ( -20 ) reduce overall promoter activity of the 1-kb fragment .
mutation of the pu.1 site do not significantly affect promoter activity .
only a small region ( -35 to +22 ) include the sp1 element and transcription start site , but not the pu.1 site be footprinted .
the 4-bp mutation of the core sp1 consensus element abolish footprinting at the site and an antibody super-shift reaction show that sp1 be one of the factor bind the consensus site .
the sp1 site also co-localizes with a dnase i hypersensitive site .
the result indicate that dna methylation , chromatin structure , and transactivation at an sp1 site contribute to the highly restricted expression of this myelomonocytic lineage specific gene .
bcl-2 protein inhibit bufalin -induced apoptosis through inhibition of mitogen-activated protein kinase activation in human leukemia u937 cell .
in a previous study , we demonstrate that bufalin , which be an active principle of chinese medicine , chan'su , cause apoptosis in human leukemia u937 cell by anomalous activation of mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) via the signaling pathway of ra , raf-1 , and mapk kinase-1 .
here , we report the effect of overexpression of bcl-2 in u937 cell on the signaling pathway of apoptosis that be induce by bufalin .
the result indicate that the apoptosis induce by bufalin in u937 cell be significantly inhibit by overexpression of the bcl-2 protein .
no significant difference be detect in the activation of mapk kinase-1 that be induce by bufalin in wild-type or bcl-2-overexpressed u937 cell ; however , the activation of mapk by bufalin be significantly attenuate in the cell overexpressing bcl-2 .
bufalin treatment activate activator protein-1 transcriptional activity ; however , this activation be decrease to 40 % in bcl-2 -overexpressed u937 cell .
these result indicate that bcl-2 act downstream of mapk kinase-1 but upstream of mapk and suggest that , in the signaling pathway of the apoptotic process induce by bufalin , the transcriptional activity of activator protein-1 may be down-regulated through the inhibition of mapk activity by bcl-2 .
alpha 4 beta 1 ( cd49d/cd29 ) integrin costimulation of human t cell enhance transcription factor and cytokine induction in the absence of altered sensitivity to anti-cd3 stimulation .
the integrin alpha 4 beta 1 can provide a costimulus to induce il-2 secretion and il-2r expression lead to enhance proliferation of purify , peripheral blood t cell .
similar to expression of il-2 , we demonstrate that recombinant vascular-cell adhesion molecule-1 , when co-immobilized with anti-cd3 mab , significantly enhance the induction of transcription factor nf-at , ap-1 , and nf-kappa b a determine by electromobility shift assay .
alpha 4 beta 1 ligation alone have no effect on transcription factor binding .
the requirement for induction of transcription factor reflect the requirement for the secretion of multiple cytokine , include il-2 , tnf-alpha , ifn-gamma , and granulocyte macrophage-csf .
in contrast to freshly isolate t cell , in vitro-cultured t cell do not require costimulation for cytokine secretion in response to anti-cd3 alone .
comparison of the dose response to anti-cd3 stimulation demonstrate that half-maximal induction of il-2 be achieve use the same dose of anti-cd3 for both freshly isolate and culture t cell .
furthermore , the dose of okt3 require to achieve half-maximal activation be the same use pma or different concentration of alpha 4 beta 1 ligand .
therefore , costimulation by alpha 4 beta 1 ligand be not due to stabilization of the interaction of the cell with it substrate .
we conclude , rather , that alpha 4 beta 1 in freshly isolate t cell deliver a distinct signal that synergizes early with signal initiate by tcr/cd3 ligation to induce dna binding of multiple transcription factor require for cytokine gene induction .
expression of ah receptor ( tcdd receptor ) during human monocytic differentiation .
we have previously find a high expression of human ah receptor ( tcdd receptor ) mrna in peripheral blood cell of individual .
in this paper , the expression of this gene in blood cell be first investigate in fraction of nucleated cell , reveal predominant expression of the ah receptor gene in the monocyte fraction .
then the expression level of ahr mrna in various hematopoietic cell line be examine together with those of arnt and p450ia1 .
ahr be express at high level in monocytoid u937 , thp1 , and hel/s cell , and at moderate level in promyelocytic hl60 cell and erythroblastic hel cell .
however , it be not detect in lymphoid cell molt4 ( t cell ) and ball1 ( b cell ) , nor in k562 erythroblast .
furthermore , a specific induction of ahr during monocytic differentiation be investigate in hl60 and hel cell .
hl60 cell be induce to differentiate toward monocytes-macrophages by incubation with phorbol ester , show a 5- to 2-fold increase of ahr mrna .
the incubation with transform growth factor beta 1 and 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 result in a 5- to 7-fold increase of ahr mrna .
the hel cell also exhibit a similar elevation of ahr mrna level , when they have differentiate toward monocyte-macrophage cell by these combined inducer , but little change in the mrna level be observe when the cell be induce to differentiate into other cell type .
treatment of the differentiate hl60 cell with 3-methylcholanthrene , a ligand of ahr , induce the expression of the p450ia1 gene .
these result indicate that expression of ahr mrna be significantly induce during monocytic differentiation and that the differentiate cell be responsive to xenobiotics .
our result suggest that ahr may play an important role in the function of monocyte and also in the eventual activation of environmental carcinogen .
costimulation requirement for ap-1 and nf-kappa b transcription factor activation in t cell .
the transcriptional activity of the il-2 promoter require t-cell costimulation deliver by the tcr and the auxiliary receptor cd28 .
several transcription factor participate in il-2 promoter activation , among which be ap-1 -like factor and nf-kappa b .
protein phosphorylation have an important role in the regulation of these two factor : ( 1 ) it induce the transactivating capacity of the ap-1 protein c-jun ; and ( 2 ) it be involve in the release of the cytoplasmic inhibitor , i kappa b , from nf-kappa b , allow translocation of the latter into the nucleus .
we have recently show that both phosphorylation process require t-cell costimulation .
furthermore , in activate t cell , the kinetics of the two phosphorylation event be essentially similar .
accord to our result , however , the kinase responsible for the two process be distinct entity .
whereas tpck inhibit phosphorylation of i kappa b and , consequently , activation of nf-kappa b , it markedly enhance the activity of jnk , the map kinase-related kinase that phosphorylates the transactivation domain of c-jun .
we , therefore , propose the activation scheme present in figure 3 for t-cell costimulation .
costimulation result in the activation of a signaling pathway that lead to the simultaneous induction of the two transcription factor , ap-1 and nf-kappa b .
integration of the signal generate by tcr and cd28 engagement occur along this pathway , which then bifurcate to induce i kappa b phosphorylation and nf-kappa b activation on the one hand , and jnk activation and c-jun phosphorylation on the other .
we be currently engage in define where the two signal integrate along the ap-1 / nf-kappa b pathway .
the interleukin 2 cd28-responsive complex contain at least three member of the nf kappa b family : c-rel , p50 , and p65 .
optimal activation of t cell require at least two signal .
one signal can be deliver by the antigen-specific t-cell receptor , and the second signal be provide by the costimulatory molecule ( s ) deliver by the antigen-presenting cell .
cd28 be a t-cell surface molecule and stimulation through this protein play an important role in deliver the second activation signal .
in this report , we show that in human peripheral blood t cell , cd28 -mediated signal transduction involve the rel family protein -- c-rel , p50 , and p65 .
treatment of peripheral blood t cell with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) and anti-cd28 monoclonal antibody ( mab ) result in augmentation of nuclear c-rel , p50 , and p65 , and this augmentation can occur in the presence of the immunosuppressant cyclosporin a .
it be also show in this report that , in response to pma/anti-cd28 mab or anti-cd3/anti-cd28 mab , c-rel , p50 , and p65 be associate with cd28 -responsive element present in the promoter of the human interleukin 2 gene .
the functional significance of c-rel involvement in the cd28 -responsive complex be demonstrate by transient transfection analysis , where cotransfection of c-rel augment the level of expression of a chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter gene link to the cd28 -responsive element .
interferon up-regulate stat1 , stat2 , and irf family transcription factor gene expression in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell and macrophage .
ifn signaling be mediate by binding of ifns to their receptor and subsequent activation of janus tyrosine kinase ( jak ) - stat signaling pathway .
stimulation of cell with ifn-alpha lead to the assembly of ifn-stimulated gene factor 3 transcription factor complex form by stat1 , stat2 , and p48 protein .
ifn-gamma signaling be mediate by homodimeric stat1 protein .
although these signal molecule be express constitutively , there be also evidence of transcriptional regulation by ifns .
we have characterize the expression of stat and ifn regulatory factor ( irf ) family transcription factor in primary human blood mononuclear cell and macrophage in response to ifn-alpha and ifn-gamma stimulation .
we show that ifn-alpha and ifn-gamma rapidly and efficiently enhance stat1 , stat2 , p48 , and irf-1 gene expression .
ifn-gamma induce irf-1 gene expression more strongly than ifn-alpha .
stimulation experiment in the presence of protein synthesis inhibitor , cycloheximide , suggest that these gene be activate directly by ifns .
irf-2 gene be apparently only weakly responsive to ifns in these cell .
when macrophage be pretreated with low dos of ifn-gamma and then stimulate with ifn-alpha , clearly enhance formation of specific transcription factor complex be detect .
this suggest that high intracellular level of stat1 , stat2 , and p48 protein may result in enhance signal transduction for cytokine utilize these transcription factor .
host control of hiv-1 parasitism in t cell by the nuclear factor of activate t cell .
post hiv-1 entry , productive hiv-1 infection of primary t cell require overcome several cellular block to provirus establishment and replication .
activation of unknown host intracellular event overcome such inhibitory step and be concomitant with hiv-1 replication .
we show that the transcription factor nfatc be sufficient a a cellular factor to induce a highly permissive state for hiv-1 replication in primary cd4+ t cell .
nfatc overcome a blockade at reverse transcription and permit active hiv-1 replication .
pharmacologic blockade of endogenous nfat activity by fk506 or csa inhibit synthesis of reverse transcription and also potently block hiv-1 replication .
t cell therefore can become competent for hiv-1 replication by control of regulate host factor such a the nfatc transcription factor .
the host mechanism regulate by such permissivity factor be potential target for anti- hiv-1 therapy .
access epstein-barr virus -specific t-cell memory with peptide-loaded dendritic cell .
the conventional mean of study epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -induced cytotoxic t-lymphocyte ( ctl ) memory , by in vitro stimulation with the latently infected autologous lymphoblastoid cell line ( lcl ) , have important limitation .
first , it give no information on memory to lytic cycle antigen ; second , it preferentially amplify the dominant component of latent antigen-specific memory at the expense of key subdominant reactivity .
here we describe an alternative approach , base on in vitro stimulation with epitope peptide-loaded dendritic cell ( dc ) , which allow one to probe the ctl repertoire for any individual reactivity of choice ; this method prove significantly more efficient than stimulation with peptide alone .
use this approach we first show that reactivity to the immunodominant and subdominant lytic cycle epitope identify by t cell during primary ebv infection be regularly detectable in the ctl memory of virus carrier ; this imply that in such carrier chronic virus replication remain under direct t-cell control .
we far show that subdominant latent cycle reactivity to epitope in the latent membrane protein lmp2 , though rarely undetectable in lcl -stimulated population , can be reactivate by dc stimulation and selectively expand a polyclonal ctl line ; the adoptive transfer of such preparation may be of value in target certain ebv-positive malignancy .
purification and characterization of the human sr 31747a-binding protein .
a nuclear membrane protein related to yeast sterol isomerase .
sr 31747a , define a a sigma ligand , be a novel immunosuppressive agent that block proliferation of human and mouse lymphocyte .
use a radiolabeled chemical probe , we here purify a target of sr 31747a and call it sr 31747a -binding protein ( sr-bp ) .
purify sr-bp retain it binding property and migrate on sds-polyacrylamide gel a a mr 28,000 protein .
cloning of the cdna encode human sr-bp show an open reading frame for a 223-amino acid protein , which be homologous to the recently clone sigma 1 receptor .
interestingly , the deduce amino acid sequence be find to be related to fungal c8-c7 sterol isomerase , encode by the erg2 gene .
the erg2 gene product have be identify recently a the molecular target of sr 31747a that mediate antiproliferative effect of the drug in yeast .
northern blot analysis of sr-bp gene expression reveal a single transcript of 2 kilobases which be widely express among organ , with the high abundance in liver and the low abundance in brain .
subcellular localization analysis in various cell , use a specific monoclonal antibody raise against sr-bp , demonstrate that this protein be associate with the nuclear envelope .
when study the binding of sr 31747a on membrane from yeast express sr-bp , we find a pharmacological profile of sigma 1 receptor ; binding be displace by (+)-pentazocine , haloperidol , and (+)-skf 10,047 , with (+)-skf 10,_047 be a more potent competitor than (-)-skf 10,047 .
scatchard plot analysis reveal kd value of 7.1 nm and 0.15 nm for (+)-pentazocine and sr 31747a , respectively , indicate an affinity of sr-bp 50-fold high for sr 31747a than for pentazocine .
additionally , we show that pentazocine , a competitive inhibitor of sr 31747a binding , also prevent the immunosuppressive effect of sr 31747a .
take together , these finding strongly suggest that sr-bp represent the molecular target for sr 31747a in mammalian tissue , which could be critical for t cell proliferation .
ablation of transplant htlv-i tax-transformed tumor in mouse by antisense inhibition of nf-kappa b [ publish erratum appear in science 1993 mar 12 ; 259 ( 5101 ) : 1523 ]
mouse transgenic for the human t cell leukemia virus ( htlv-i ) tax gene develop fibroblastic tumor that express nf-kappa b-inducible early gene .
in vitro inhibition of nf-kappa b expression by antisense oligodeoxynucleotides ( odns ) inhibit growth of these culture-adapted tax-transformed fibroblast as well a an htlv-i -transformed human lymphocyte line .
in contrast , antisense inhibition of tax itself have no apparent effect on cell growth .
mouse treat with antisense to nf-kappa b odns show rapid regression of transplant fibrosarcomas .
this suggest that nf-kappa b expression may be necessary for the maintenance of the malignant phenotype and provide a therapeutic approach for htlv-i -associated disease .
human monocyte bind to fibronectin enhance ifn-gamma -induced early signaling event .
leukocyte integrins be fundamentally important in modulate adhesion to extracellular matrix component and to other cell .
this integrin-mediated adhesion control leukocyte arrest and extravasation during the onset of inflammatory response .
moreover , integrin -ligand interaction trigger signaling pathway that may influence leukocyte phenotype and function at site of inflammation .
in the current study , we evaluate the combinatorial effect of monocyte adhesion and ifn-gamma on intracellular signaling pathway .
ifn-gamma trigger a well-defined signal transduction pathway , which although not directly stimulate by monocyte adherence to fibronectin or arginine-glycine-aspartate ( rgd ) -coated substrata , be enhance significantly in these matrix-adherent cell .
compare with monocyte in suspension or adherent on plastic surface , monocyte adherent to fibronectin or rgd exhibit a great than threefold increase in steady state level of ifn-gamma -induced mrna for the high affinity fc gammari receptor .
by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , this increase in mrna be associate with a 5- to 10-fold increase in the stat1-containing dna-binding complex that bind to fc gammari promoter element .
furthermore , the tyrosine phosphorylation of stat1 and the tyrosine kinase jak1 and jak2 be enhance significantly in rgd -adherent monocyte compare with control cell .
these result suggest a novel mechanism by which integrin -mediated cell adhesion can modulate the magnitude of cytokine -induced signal transduction pathway , thereby amplify cellular event lead to monocyte activation and inflammation .
aml1a but not aml1b inhibit erythroid differentiation induce by sodium butyrate and enhance the megakaryocytic differentiation of k562 leukemia cell .
aml1 may play a role in growth and differentiation of cell along erythroid and/or megakaryocytic lineage , because a significant level of the aml1 gene be express in these cell .
we overexpressed aml1a ( without the transcription-activating domain ) and aml1b ( with the domain ) protein in k562 leukemia cell , which can be induce to differentiate into hemoglobin-producing cell and megakaryocyte .
the aml1a -transfected k562 cell have a reduce capacity to differentiate in the presence of sodium n-butyrate but not in the presence of other inducer , such a hemin , 1-beta-d-arabinofuranosylcytosine , and herbimycin a .
the aml1 antisense oligodeoxynucleotide but not the sense oligomer recover it differentiation-inducing capacity in the presence of butyrate .
on the other hand , aml1b confer a similar differentiation-inducing capacity upon k562 cell transfected with vector alone .
aml1a expression be associate with enhance sensitivity to megakaryocytic differentiation induce by phorbol ester .
these result provide evidence that aml1 protein play a role in erythroid and megakaryocytic differentiation .
dna-binding and transcriptional regulatory property of hepatic leukemia factor ( hlf ) and the t(17;19) acute lymphoblastic leukemia chimera e2a- hlf .
the t(17;19) translocation in acute lymphoblastic leukemia result in creation of e2a- hepatic leukemia factor ( hlf ) chimeric protein that contain the dna-binding and protein dimerization domain of the basic leucine zipper ( bzip ) protein hlf fuse to a portion of e2a protein with transcriptional activation property .
an in vitro bind site selection procedure be use to determine dna sequence preferentially bind by wild-type hlf and chimeric e2a- hlf protein isolate from various t(17;19)-bearing leukemia .
all be find to selectively bind the consensus sequence 5'-gttacgtaat-3' with high affinity .
wild-type and chimeric hlf protein also bind closely related site identify previously for bzip protein of both the proline - and acidic amino acid-rich ( par ) and c/ebp subfamily ; however , e2a- hlf protein be significantly less tolerant of certain deviation from the hlf consensus binding site .
these difference be directly attributable to loss of an hlf ancillary dna-binding domain in all e2a- hlf chimera and be far exacerbated by a zipper mutation in one isolate .
both wild-type and chimeric hlf protein display transcriptional activator property in lymphoid and nonlymphoid cell on reporter gene contain hlf or c/ebp consensus binding site .
but on reporter gene with nonoptimal bind site , their transcriptional property diverge and e2a- hlf competitively inhibit activation by wild-type par protein .
these finding establish a spectrum of bind site-specific transcriptional property for e2a- hlf which may preferentially activate expression of select subordinate gene a a homodimer and potentially antagonize expression of others through heteromeric interaction .
thrombin and thrombin receptor agonist peptide induce early event of t cell activation and synergize with tcr cross-linking for cd69 expression and interleukin 2 production .
thrombin stimulation of the t leukemic cell line jurkat induce a transient increase in [ ca2+ ]i .
proteolytic activity of the enzyme be require for this effect since diisopropyl fluorophosphate-thrombin fail to increase [ ca2+ ]i .
furthermore , hirudin and anti-thrombin iii inhibit the thrombin-induced [ ca2+ ]i rise in jurkat t cell .
a synthetic thrombin receptor agonist peptide ( trp ) of 7 residue ( sfllrnp ) be find to be as effective a thrombin for [ ca2+ ]i mobilization , and both agonist induce ca2+ release exclusively from internal store .
thrombin stimulate tyrosine phosphorylation of several protein of molecular mass 40 , 42 , 70 , 120 , and 130 kda .
there be a good correlation between thrombin -induced tyrosine phosphorylation of the latter three protein and ca2+ mobilization .
thrombin and trp also cause translocation of protein kinase c from the cytosol to the plasma membrane .
a a likely consequence of these event , thrombin activate the nuclear factor nf-kb .
several cell line of hematopoietic origin include the leukemic t cell line hpb.all and the erythroleukemic cell line k562 be responsive to thrombin , whereas others such a thp1 , a myelomonocytic cell line , and bl2 , a burkitt lymphoma be refractory to thrombin or trp stimulation .
the magnitude of the thrombin response in the different cell type parallel the expression of the thrombin receptor mrna .
we find that activation of jurkat t cell by a combination of phytohemagglutinin and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate lead to a dramatic inhibition of thrombin receptor mrna expression and to a concomitant loss of the thrombin response .
finally , we demonstrate that thrombin and trp enhance cd69 expression and interleukin 2 production induce by t cell receptor cross-linking in both jurkat t cell and peripheral blood lymphocyte .
these finding highlight the role of thrombin a a potential regulator of t lymphocyte activation .
interleukin-2 promoter activity in epstein-barr virus -transformed b lymphocyte be control by nuclear factor-chi b .
the regulation of interleukin ( il ) -2 gene expression have be investigate mainly in t lymphocyte , the predominant producer of il-2 .
however , b cell can also synthesize il-2 .
in the present study we analyze the control of il-2 promoter activity in epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) -transformed b cell clone which be capable of secrete il-2 at a low level after stimulation with phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate and the ca2+ ionophore ionomycin .
transient transfections use reporter construct with multiple of transcription factor binding site from the il-2 promoter [ distal nuclear factor ( nf ) -at , proximal nf-at , ap-1/octamer ( ups ) or nf-chi b ( tced ) site ] be perform .
in ebv-transformed b clone , the chi b site exert the strong inducible activity ; the nf-at binding site show either no or only weak activity compare to jurkat t cell .
an il-2 promoter bear a defective nf- chi b site be completely inactive in ebv-transformed b cell , while it still have activity in jurkat t cell .
in seven ebv-b cell clone or line differ in their capacity to secrete il-2 , the activity of the il-2 promoter correlate well with the status of il-2 secretion .
similarly , a human immunodeficiency virus promoter , whose activity be control through chi b factor , be find to be active in the il-2 producing ebv- b cell , but inactive in the non- il-2 -producing cell .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay use protein extract from ebv- b cell and the il-2 nf-chi b probe reveal the constitutive generation of chi b complex in il-2 -secreting cell consist mainly of heterodimeric p50/p65 complex .
a weak chi b complex formation and faster-migrating complex be detect in non- il-2 -secreting cell .
these result demonstrate that the il-2 nf-chi b site be indispensable for the activity of the il-2 promoter in ebv-transformed b cell , whereas other transcription factor appear to be less important for il-2 expression in these cell .
a novel b cell-derived coactivator potentiate the activation of immunoglobulin promoter by octamer-binding transcription factor .
a novel b cell-restricted activity , require for high level of octamer / oct -dependent transcription from an immunoglobulin heavy chain ( igh ) promoter , be detect in an in vitro system consist of hela cell -derived extract complement with fractionate b cell nuclear protein .
the factor responsible for this activity be designate oct coactivator from b cell ( oca-b ) .
oca-b stimulate the transcription from an igh promoter in conjunction with either oct-1 or oct-2 but show no significant effect on the octamer / oct -dependent transcription of the ubiquitously express histone h2b promoter and the transcription of usf- and sp1- regulated promoter .
take together , our result suggest that oca-b be a tissue- , promoter- , and factor- specific coactivator and that oca-b may be a major determinant for b cell-specific activation of immunoglobulin promoter .
in light of the evidence show physical and functional interaction between oct factor and oca-b , we propose a mechanism of action for oca-b and discuss the implication of oca-b for the transcriptional regulation of other tissue-specific promoter .
interleukin-10 and transform growth factor-beta promoter polymorphism in allergy and asthma .
interleukin-10 ( il-10 ) and transform growth factor beta ( tgf-beta ) be inhibitory for b and t cell , ige production , and mast cell proliferation , and they induce apoptosis in eosinophil .
these cytokine be therefore candidate gene which could contribute to the development of asthma or allergy .
we investigate the hypothesis that polymorphic nucleotide within the il-10 and tgf-beta gene promoter would link to the expression of allergy and asthma .
dna take from family with an asthmatic proband be examine for base exchange by single-stranded conformational polymorphism ( sscp ) .
we demonstrate the presence of a polymorphism in the promoter region of the il-10 gene and four in the tgf-beta gene promoter ( 3 in tgf-beta1 and 1 in tgf-beta2 ) .
the il-10 gene polymorphism be a c -to- a exchange 571 base pair upstream from the translation start site and be present between consensus binding sequence for sp1 and elevated total serum .
this polymorphism be associate with elevated total serum ige in subject heterozygotic or homozygotic for this base exchange ( p < 0.009 ) .
the base exchange at -509 ( from the transcription initiation site ) in the tgf-beta promoter also link to elevated total ige ( p < 0.01 ) .
this polymorphism represent a c -to- t base exchange which induce a yy1 consensus sequence and be present in a region of the promoter associate with negative transcription regulation .
anoxia/reoxygenation-induced tolerance with respect to polymorphonuclear leukocyte adhesion to culture endothelial cell .
a nuclear factor-kappab -mediated phenomenon .
expose human umbilical vein endothelial cell ( huvecs ) to anoxia/reoxygenation ( a/r ) result in an increase in polymorphonuclear leukocyte ( pmn ) adhesion to huvecs .
this a/r -induced hyperadhesion be completely prevent by a previous ( 24 hour earlier ) exposure of huvecs to a/r .
this phenomenon have be term " a/r tolerance . "
expose huvecs to a/r induce an increase in nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) in huvec nucleus within 4 hour .
interfere with either nf-kappab activation ( proteasome inhibitor ) or translocation ( double-stranded oligonucleotides contain nf-kappab binding sequence ) prevent the development of a/r tolerance ( ie , the increase in a/r -induced pmn adhesion to huvecs be the same after the first and second a/r challenge ) .
no production by huvecs be increase after the second a/r challenge , but not after the first a/r challenge .
inhibition of no synthase ( no ) during the second a/r challenge prevent the development of a/r tolerance with respect to pmn adhesion .
however , while huvecs contain endothelial no protein , no inducible no be detect in either tolerant or nontolerant cell .
further study indicate that inhibition of gtp-cyclohydrolase i ( an enzyme involve in de novo synthesis of an important cofactor for no activity , tetrahydrobiopterin ) prevent the generation of no in a/r -tolerant cell .
extracellular generation of no ( no donor ) do not effect the hyperadhesion response induce by the initial a/r challenge .
a/r also induce an oxidant stress in naive huvecs , but not in a/r -tolerant huvecs .
inhibition of no during the second a/r insult result in the generation of an oxidant stress similar to that observe after the first a/r challenge .
take together , the finding of the present study be consistent with a role for nf-kappab in the development of a/r tolerance ( with respect to pmn adhesion ) , perhaps by transcriptional regulation of gtp -cyclohydrolase .
the increase no production during the second a/r insult reduce pmn adhesion most likely by reduce the intracellular oxidant stress induce by a/r .
the transcription factor , nm23h2 , bind to and activate the translocate c-myc allele in burkitt 's lymphoma .
we have identify an in vivo footprint over the puf site on the translocate c-myc allele in burkitt 's lymphoma cell .
the puf site on the silent normal c-myc allele be unoccupied .
we demonstrate by electrophoretic mobility shift assay , electrophoretic mobility shift assay with antibody , uv cross-linking follow by sds-gel electrophoresis , and western analysis that nm23h2 in b cell nuclear extract bind to the c-myc puf site .
transfection experiment with c-myc promoter construct in both dhl-9 and raji cell reveal that the puf site function a a positive regulatory element in b cell with a drop in activity with mutation of this site .
access to this site be block in the normal silent c-myc allele ; these data suggest that the nm23h2 protein be involve in deregulation of the translocate c-myc allele in burkitt 's lymphoma cell .
negative regulation by hla-do of mhc class ii -restricted antigen processing .
hla-dm be a major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii-like molecule that facilitate antigen processing by catalyze the exchange of invariant chain-derived peptide ( clip ) from class ii molecule for antigenic peptide .
hla-do be a second class ii-like molecule that physically associate with hla-dm in b cell .
hla-do be show to block hla-dm function .
purify hla-dm -do complex could not promote peptide exchange in vitro .
expression of hla-do in a class ii+ and dm+ , do- human t cell line cause the accumulation of class ii- clip complex , indicate that hla-do block dm function in vivo and suggest that hla-do be an important modulator of class ii-restricted antigen processing .
enhancement of human immunodeficiency virus 1 replication in monocyte by 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol .
human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) expression and replication be under tight regulatory control .
we demonstrate that 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol [ 1,25-(oh)2d3 ] enhance the replication of monocyte- and lymphocyte-tropic strain of hiv-1 up to 10,000-fold in monocyte cell line , peripheral blood monocyte , and unfractionated peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
1,25(oh)2d3 be therefore one of the most potent regulator of hiv-1 replication describe to date .
precursor of 1,25(oh)2d3 enhance hiv-1 replication in proportion to their affinity for the 1,25(oh)2d3 intracellular receptor , suggest that 1,25(oh)2d3 influence hiv-1 replication by mechanism involve this receptor .
these study may have important implication for the design of effective therapy of hiv-1 infection .
e1a gene expression induce susceptibility to killing by nk cell follow immortalization but not adenovirus infection of human cell .

this differential effect of e1a expression on the cytolytic phenotype of infected and stably transfected human cell suggest that human nk cell provide an effective immunologic barrier against the in vivo survival and neoplastic progression of e1a-immortalized cell that may emerge from the reservoir of persistently infected cell in the human host .

gene transcription through activation of g-protein-coupled chemoattractant receptor .

recently , these g-protein-coupled serpentine receptor have be find to transduce signal lead to gene transcription and translation in leukocyte .

requirement for induction of vitamin d-mediated gene regulation in normal human b lymphocyte .
mature human lymphocyte be unique target of 1 alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 1 alpha,25(oh)2d3 ) in that vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) be not constitutively express , and specific cellular activation signal be require for both the up-regulation of vdr and establishment of reactivity to the lipophilic ligand .

however , this apparent lack of response to the secosterol can be overcome by stimulation of b lymphocyte with a combination of these cellular activation signal , which be sufficient to lead to g1 cell cycle progression .

furthermore , biologic function be modulate , in that the hormone inhibit proliferation in a subset of the activate b cell .
these observation suggest that reactivity to 1 alpha,25(oh)2d3 be tightly regulate in b lymphocyte , require specific signal for it initiation .

a novel mutation in the cod sequence of the fy*b allele of the duffy chemokine receptor gene be associate with an altered erythrocyte phenotype .
the duffy blood group system be of clinical and biological significance .
antibody to duffy antigen be responsible for some case of transfusion incompatibility and newborn hemolytic disease .
the duffy protein be a receptor for the plasmodium vivax erythrocyte-binding protein and be also a receptor for various chemokines ( thus rename duffy antigen receptor for chemokines [ darc ] ) .
the two duffy polymorphic antigen , fya and fyb ( cod by the fy*a and fy*b allele ) , be present on erythrocyte membrane .
the fy(a-b-) phenotype be the predominant one in population of black people and also occur in other population , include some non-ashkenazi jewish group .
the fy(a-b-) phenotype have be associate with a mutation in the fy*b promoter at the gata box that abolish the expression of erythrocyte duffy protein .
we describe here a novel mutation , present in the fy*b cod sequence ( 271c --> t ) , that be associate with some fy(b-) phenotype among non-ashkenazi jew and among brazilian black .
the mutation be present in fy(b-) individual , who have wild-type fy*b gata and carry the previously describe 304g --> a substitution .
the 271c --> t and 304g --> a can be identify by restriction enzyme-generated restriction fragment length polymorphism .
the 271c --> t substitution represent a considerable change in chemical nature ( arg91 --> cys ) , one which may affect the antigenic determinant of darc , and thus be of clinical significance .
the mutation may have implication for some physiological role of darc and be of interest in malaria research and in study of population genetics .

role for a novel 5' palindromic octamer sequence .

effect of glucocorticoid on transcription factor activation in human peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
glucocorticoid have an inhibitory effect on inflammatory and immune response , and this may be through the modulation of transcription factor bind to dna .

this may be an important molecular site of steroid action .

interleukin-7 signaling in human b cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukemia cell and murine baf3 cell involve activation of stat1 and stat5 mediate via the interleukin-7 receptor alpha chain .

these finding establish that stat1 and stat5 , and possibly stat3 , be activate upon stimulation of precursor b cell with il-7 .

c-fos and c-jun mrna expression in activate cord and adult lymphocyte : an analysis by northern hybridization .
background and objective : to far analyze the neonatal immune response to an antigenic challenge such a blood transfusion , c-fos and c-jun mrna expression be analyze in twelve in-vitro-stimulated normal cord blood and ten in-vitro-stimulated normal adult peripheral blood lymphocyte sample .
material and method : lymphocyte sample be stimulate by either the mitogen phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) or the monoclonal antibody alphacd3 .
proliferation rate and northern blot hybridization be employ .
result : cord lymphocyte reveal a great proliferation rate with pha and alphacd3 than adult lymphocyte ( p = 0.0081 and 0.0023 , respectively ) .
in addition , northern blot analysis of cord and adult sample reveal similar maximal increase in c-fos ( 99+/-15 and 126+/-11 % , p = 0.0126 ) and c-jun ( 123+/-9 and 185+/-38 % , p = 0.0291 ) mrna expression , respectively , as early a 15 min post- alphacd3 stimulation .
adult lymphocyte show an equivalent increase in mrna expression of c-fos and c-jun ( 140+/-25 and 155+/-31 % ) at 30 min post- pha stimulation , while cord lymphocyte maximum c-fos and c-jun expression ( 82+/-6 and 142+/-12 % ) occur at 15 min post- pha stimulation ( c-fos , p = 0.0354 ; c-jun , p = 0.0112 ) .
conclusion : although cord lymphocyte proliferation rate be significantly great than those of adult lymphocyte follow stimulation , lymphocyte activation , a analyze by c-fos and c-jun mrna expression , appear similar in both cord and adult sample .
we conclude that cord lymphocyte activation exhibit an adult-type profile .
nuclear rel-a and c-rel protein complex be differentially distribute within human thymocytes .
nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) /rel protein be inducible transcriptional regulator of numerous cellular gene .
