this detection suggest a preferential activation of p50/c-rel in medullary thymocytes , whereas p50/p65 be present in both cortical and medullary region of human thymus lobule .
however , the intensity of p65 labeling be much high in several thymocytes from the medulla .
p65 , p50 , and c-rel activity be find in both cd4- and cd8- positive thymocytes .
these observation suggest that p65 and c-rel complex play distinct role in gene expression and that both form of nf-kappa b play critical role during late stage of the intrathymic maturation of t cell .
interaction of the human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 tax transactivator with transcription factor iia .
the tax protein of human t-cell lymphotropic virus type 1 ( htlv-1 ) be a 40-kda transcriptional activator which be critical for htlv-1 gene regulation and virus-induced cellular transformation .
tax be localized to the dna through it interaction with the site-specific activator cyclic amp-responsive element-binding protein , nf-kappab , and serum response factor .
it have be suggest that the recruitment of tax to the dna position tax for interaction with the basal transcriptional machinery .
on the basis of several independent assay , we now report a physical and functional interaction between tax and the transcription factor , tfiia .
first , tax be find to interact with the 35-kda ( alpha ) subunit of tfiia in the yeast two-hybrid interaction system .
importantly , two previously characterize mutant with point mutation in tax , m32 ( y196a , k197s ) and m41 ( h287a , p288s ) , which be show to be defective in tax -activated transcription be unable to interact with tfiia in this assay .
second , a glutathione -s-transferase ( gst ) affinity-binding assay show that the interaction of holo- tfiia with gst- tax be 20-fold high than that observe with either the gst- tax m32 activation mutant or the gst control .
third , a coimmunoprecipitation assay show that in htlv-1 -infected human t lymphocyte , tax and tfiia be associate .
finally , tfiia facilitates tax transactivation in vitro and in vivo .
in vitro transcription study show reduce level of tax -activated transcription in cell extract deplete of tfiia .
in addition , transfection of human t lymphocyte with tfiia expression vector enhance tax -activated transcription of an htlv-1 long terminal repeat-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter construct .
our study suggest that the interaction of tax with the transcription factor tfiia may play a role in tax -mediated transcriptional activation .
a factor know to bind to endogenous ig heavy chain enhancer only in lymphocyte be a ubiquitously active transcription factor .
the transcriptional enhancer located in the first intron of the immunoglobulin heavy chain constant region be a major determinant of b-cell-specific expression of immunoglobulin gene .
like other enhancer , the ig heavy chain enhancer contain several short sequence motif that bind specific transcription factor .
each bind site contribute to the overall activity of the enhancer , however no single element seem absolutely require for activity .
for a good understanding of the ig heavy chain enhancer component , we have clone and analyze individual sequence element .
we find that the factor that bind to the e3 enhancer motif , catgtggc , be a ubiquitous transcription factor .
it be present in an active form in both b cell and non- b cell , where it can mediate transcriptional activation in vitro and in vivo .
however , despite it ability to activate transcription of a transfected reporter gene , the factor be apparently unable to bind to the endogenous ig heavy chain enhancer in non- lymphoid cell : in previous experiment by others , the characteristic in vivo footprint of this factor , designate nf-mue3 , be detect in b cell but not in non-b cell .
from this and other finding the picture emerge that there be at least three category of factor which mediate cell-type-specific transcription in b lymphocyte : ( a ) cell-specific factor such a oct-2a and oct-2b that be not express in most other cell type : ( b ) ubiquitous factor such a nf-kappa b that be constitutively active in b cell but be sequester in an inactive form in other cell ; ( c ) ubiquitously active factor , exemplify by the one bind to the e3 sequence motif .
this factor be present in an active form in a variety of cell type but be apparently unable to bind to the endogenous ig heavy chain enhancer in non-b cell , perhaps due to a non-permissive chromatin structure of the ig heavy chain locus .
phosphatidylinositides bind to plasma membrane cd14 and can prevent monocyte activation by bacterial lipopolysaccharide .
although bacterial lipopolysaccharides ( lp ) and several other microbial agonist can bind to mcd14 ( membrane cd14 ) , a cell-surface receptor find principally on monocyte and neutrophil , host-derived mcd14 ligand be poorly define .
we report here that phosphatidylinositol ( ptdins ) , phosphatidylinositol -4-phosphate , and other phosphatidylinositides can bind to mcd14 .
phosphatidylserine ( p ) , another anionic glycerophospholipid , bind to mcd14 with low apparent affinity than do ptdins .
lp -binding protein , a lipid transfer protein find in serum , facilitate both p - and ptdins - mcd14 binding .
ptdins bind to mcd14 can be block by anti-cd14 monoclonal antibody that inhibit lp -mcd14 binding , and ptdins can inhibit both lp -mcd14 binding and lp -induced response in monocyte .
serum-equilibrated ptdins also bind to mcd14 -expressing cell , raise the possibility that endogenous ptdins may modulate cellular response to lp and other mcd14 ligand in vivo .
differanisole a , a novel antitumor antibiotic , enhance growth inhibition and differentiation of human myeloid leukemia cell induce by 9-cis retinoic acid .
differanisole a , 3,5-dichloro-2-hydroxy-4-methoxy-6-n-propylbenzoic acid , inhibit growth of human myeloid leukemia cell .
the compound induce g1 arrest and granulocytic differentiation of hl-60 cell , although the differentiation-inducing effect be modest .
differanisole a and 9-cis retinoic acid ( 9cisra ) synergistically inhibit the growth and induce functional and morphologic differentiation of hl-60 and nb4 cell , whereas the combined treatment with differanisole a and all-trans retinoic acid or 1alpha,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 be less effective .
similar result be obtain in primary culture of leukemia cell from a patient with acute promyelocytic leukemia .
the synergistic effect on growth inhibition and induction of differentiation require simultaneous treatment with differanisole a and 9cisra .
differanisole a and an rxr-specific ligand ( ro47-5944 ) cooperatively inhibit the cell growth , while the combined effect of differanisole a and an rar-specific ligand am80 be just additive .
differanisole a in combination with 9cisra may have implication for therapy of acute promyelocytic leukemia patient .
antisense oligonucleotides to the p65 subunit of nf-kappa b block cd11b expression and alter adhesion property of differentiate hl-60 granulocyte .
nf-kappa b be a pleiotropic regulator of a variety of gene implicate in the cellular response to injury .
this function have be attribute to the coordinate binding of subunit of nf-kappa b to distinct region of the promoter element of numerous gene , include cytokine , growth factor receptor , and adhesion molecule .
antisense phosphorothioate oligonucleotides to the p50 and p65 subunit of the nf-kappa b complex be use to define the physiologic role of this transcription factor in rest and stimulate granulocyte .
a reduction in the expression of p65 be produce by treatment with the phosphorothioate antisense oligodeoxynucleotide .
this reduction be accompany by rapid change in the cellular adhesion of dimethyl sulfoxide -differentiated hl-60 leukemia cell stimulate by 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol 13-acetate ( tpa ) .
these effect be characterize by a marked reduction in cd11b integrin expression on the surface of treat cell .
furthermore , the p65 antisense oligomer effectively abolish an upregulation of cd11b that be produce by formyl-met-leu-phe and tpa .
however , the p65 antisense phosphorothioate oligodeoxynucleotide have no significant effect on the production of reactive oxygen intermediate or on phagocytosis by these cell .
these finding indicate that antisense oligomers to p65 can be use to define the role of nf-kappa b in the activation pathway of neutrophil .
surrogate thyroglobulin receptor and t cell proliferation in hashimoto 's thyroiditis .
immunoglobulin molecule on the surface of a b lymphocyte be the endogenous " receptor " to which specific antigen bind .
study in mouse have show that a monoclonal antibody , conjugate with palmitate to provide a lipid tail , can be insert into the cell membrane to provide a " surrogate " antigen receptor .
we have investigate whether a palmitate conjugate of a human monoclonal antibody specific for thyroglobulin ( tg ) could function a a surrogate tg receptor on blood mononuclear cell separate into fraction enrich for t cell or deplete of t cell ( non-t cell ) .
use flow cytometry , we detect surrogate tg receptor on non-t ( but not on t ) cell from 11 of 11 individual study ( 5 hashimoto patient and 6 control donor ) .
in contrast , endogenous tg receptor could only be detect on non- t cell from 1 of 3 hashimoto patient and from 0 of 4 control donor .
because of the efficient binding of tg by surrogate receptor on non-t cell , we assess the ability of such cell to present tg to t cell .
proliferation in response to tg be observe in t cell from only 1 of 5 hashimoto patient .
this low frequency of response be no different from that previously detect use culture of t cell and autologous dendritic cell .
therefore , the successful generation of surrogate receptor on non-t cell be not associate with more efficient tg presentation of t cell .
furthermore , the significance of the present study be that the t cell , not the antigen-presenting cell , be likely to be the limit element in the t cell proliferative response to tg and other thyroid autoantigens .
transcriptional induction of collagenase-1 in differentiate monocyte-like ( u937 ) cell be regulate by ap-1 and an upstream c/ebp-beta site .
in this report , we demonstrate that the ap-1 site and a distal promoter element regulate transcriptional induction of collagenase-1 during monocytic differentiation .
chloramphenicol acetyltransferase expression construct contain region of the human collagenase-1 promoter be stably or transiently transfected into u937 cell , and reporter activity be assess at various time after the onset of phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ( pma ) -mediated differentiation .
rapid and strong induction of promoter activity be lose in construct with a mutant ap-1 element ; however , at 16-96 h post-pma , the mutant collagenase-1 promoter display ap-1 independent pma-mediated transactivation .
the ap-1 mutant construct also show delay transcriptional activation in pma-treated fibroblast .
western and supershift analysis indicate that functional jun and fo protein be present in nuclear extract of pma-differentiated u937 cell .
promoter deletion construct demonstrate the potential role of distal promoter sequence in regulate collagenase-1 transcription .
in particular , western , supershift , and promoter deletion analysis suggest a role for ccaat/enhancer-binding protein-beta ( c/ebp-beta ) binding site between -2010 and -1954 in regulate transcription of collagenase-1 in monocytic cell .
our finding suggest that distinct regulatory element , act somewhat independently of each other , control expression of collagenase-1 .
in addition , our data suggest that the rapid pma-mediated induction of collagenase-1 transcription be control by a mechanism distinct from that regulate the sustained expression of this proteinase in activate macrophage .
epstein-barr virus sm protein .
the protein product of the epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) bmlf1 open reading frame have be characterize in the early productive cycle in b95-8 and akata cell .
the sm protein derive from the splice rna join bslf2 to bmlf1 be much the most abundant protein .
sm be a phosphoprotein in ebv -infected cell and can be phosphorylated in vitro with casein kinase ii ( ckii ) .
computer analysis of the sm protein sequence show a c terminal section of sm to be related to genome positional homologues of four other herpesviruses and reveal consensus ckii site near the n terminus of the ebv sm protein , the herpes simplex virus ( hsv ) icp27 protein and the herpesvirus saimiri ( hvs ) open reading frame 57 protein .
site-directed mutagenesis of the consensus ckii site in ebv sm greatly reduce the in vitro phosphorylation of sm by ckii .
the mechanism of transactivation by bmlf1 protein have be controversial but sm be show to transactivate gene expression from a cat reporter construct by increase the amount of cytoplasmic cat mrna .
mutagenesis of the ckii site in sm make no difference to the transactivation in this transient transfection assay .
nuclear factor-kappab induction in cd45ro+ and cd45ra+ t cell subset during aging .
an increase in the ratio of memory to naive t cell have be postulate to underlie immune hyporesponsiveness accompany aging .
our analysis of the induction of nuclear factor-kappab ( nfkappab ) in activate memory ( cd45ro+ ) and naive ( cd45ra+ ) t cell subset from young and elderly donor have demonstrate that , regardless of donor age , memory t cell be not significantly alter in their responsiveness to tnf-alpha -mediated induction of nfkappab .
although treatment with tnf-alpha induce nuclear localization of nfkappab in both memory and naive t cell subset , irrespective of the age of the donor , the level of induce nfkappab be significantly low in both subset of t cell obtain from the elderly , when compare to those in young .
examination of ikappab alpha regulation reveal that tnf-alpha -mediated degradation of ikappab alpha in both memory and naive t cell from the elderly be severely impaired , thus contribute to the lowered induction of the observe nfkappab .
in addition , this age-related decrease in induction of nuclear nfkappab correlate with decrease in intracellular il-2 receptor expression and anti-cd3 -induced proliferation of both memory and naive t cell subset .
take together , our result suggest that the age-related hyporesponsiveness can not be attribute to a skewing of the t cell population towards a memory phenotype in the elderly .
identification of an ionomycin /cyclosporin a -responsive element within the human t cell receptor gamma enhancer .
activation through the ca2+ / calcineurin pathway be essential to the transcription of many cytokine gene .
the conserve cis-acting sequence , ggaaaa , and transcription factor bind to this sequence be involve in the response to increase intracellular ca2+ concentration .
here we report the identification and importance of the same sequence in a non-cytokine gene , the human t cell receptor gamma ( tcrg ) enhancer .
result from site-directed mutation and electrophoretic mobility shift assay strongly suggest that this sequence mediate the ionomycin -induced activation of the tcrg enhancer .
our study provide an explanation for a previous observation that tcrg mrna level , but not mrna level for t cell receptor alpha and -beta , be increase by ionomycin treatment .
the linkage between t-cell and dendritic cell development in the mouse thymus .
thymic dendritic cell ( dc ) mediate negative selection at a relatively late stage of the t-cell developmental pathway .
we present evidence that the development of thymic dc and of t-lineage cell be link via a common precursor at an early stage of thymocyte development .
t-lineage precursor population from the adult mouse thymus , prior to t-cell receptor gene rearrangement , display a capacity to produce dc as well a t cell in the thymus , and be very efficient precursor of dc in culture .
these lymphoid/ dc precursor have little capacity to form myeloid cell , indicate that thymic dc be a lymphoid-related rather than myeloid-related lineage .
in contrast to myeloid-related dc , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor be not require for the development of these lymphoid-related dc in vivo or in vitro .
dc can develop in mutant mouse lack mature t cell , provide the common precursor be present .
however , in mutant mouse lack functional ikaros transcription factor , there be deficiency in lymphoid precursor cell , in mature lymphoid cell and in dc .
glucocorticoid and interferon-alpha in the acquire immunodeficiency syndrome .
some patient with acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( aid ) develop glucocorticoid resistance characterize by low receptor affinity ( kd ) for glucocorticoid in mononuclear , cell and high value of acth and cortisol .
a glucocorticoid regulate interferon-alpha ( ifn alpha ) production , we hypothesize that ifn alpha , a cytokine produce predominantly by monocyte in aid , should be increase in cortisol -resistant aid , attribute the lack of cortisol inhibition to ifn alpha production .
therefore , we examine glucocorticoid receptor characteristic on monocyte by [3h]dexamethasone binding and measure ifn alpha , cortisol , and acth in aid patient with ( aid -gr ) or without glucocorticoid resistance ( aid -c ) and control ( c ) .
monocyte of aid -gr patient have a receptor kd of 10.5 +/- 4.2 nmol/l that be high than that in the aid -c group ( 2.9 +/- 0.8 nmol/l ) and normal subject ( 2.0 +/- 0.8 nmol/l ; p < 0.01 ) .
ifn alpha level be increase in the aid -gr group ( 17 +/- 6 vs.
4 +/- 1 u/ml in the aid -c group and 2 +/- 0.5 u/ml in the c group ; p < 0.01 ) .
correlation be find between plasma ifn alpha and receptor kd on monocyte of aid -gr ( r = 0.77 ) and between ifn alpha and plasma cortisol in the same group ( r = 0.74 ) .
the poly(i)-poly(c)-induced ifn alpha production by monocyte be inhibit by glucocorticoid in the c and aid -c group ( approximately 80 % inhibition in both group ) ; the effect be reverse by the receptor antagonist ru-38486 .
by contrast , glucocorticoid fail to inhibit ifnalpha production from aid -gr monocyte ( approximately 20 % inhibition ) .
in conclusion , elevated ifn alpha level in aid -gr may be due to the lack of inhibitory effect of cortisol on ifn alpha production due to cortisol resistance in monocyte
a mouse carry genetic defect in the choice between t and b lymphocyte .
transgenic mouse with human cd3epsilon gene have be show to exhibit early arrest of t cell development in the thymus .
the present study show that , instead of t cell , b cell be generate in the thymus of a line , tg epsilon26 , of the human cd3epsilon transgenic mouse .
the accumulation of mature b cell in the thymus be find only in tg epsilon26 mouse , not in other human cd3epsilon transgenic mouse line or other t cell-deficient mouse , include cd3-epsilon knockout mouse and tcr-beta/tcr-delta double knockout mouse .
hang drop-mediated transfer into 2-deoxyguanosine-treated thymus lobe show that lymphoid progenitor cell rather than thymus stromal cell be responsible for abnormal b cell development in tg epsilon26 thymus , and that tg epsilon26 fetal liver cell be destine to become b cell in normal thymus even in the presence of normal progenitor cell undergo t cell development .
these result indicate that lymphoid progenitor cell in tg epsilon26 mouse be genetically defective in thymic choice between t cell and b cell , generate b cell even in normal thymus environment .
interestingly , tg epsilon26 thymocytes express gata-3 and tcf-1 , but not lef-1 and pebp-2alpha , among t cell-specific transcription factor that be involve in early t cell development , indicate that gata-3 and tcf-1 express during thymocyte development do not necessarily determine the cell fate into t cell lineage .
thus , tg epsilon26 mouse provide a novel mouse model in that lineage choice between t and b lymphocyte be genetically defective .
processing of the precursor of nf-kappa b by the hiv-1 protease during acute infection .
transcription of the human immunodeficiency virus type-1 ( hiv-1 ) genome be regulate in part by cellular factor and be stimulate by activation of latently infected t cell .
t-cell activation also correlate with the induction of the factor nf-kappa b which bind to two adjacent site in the hiv-1 long terminal repeat .
this factor consist of two dna-binding subunit of relative molecular mass 50,000 ( 50k ) associate with two 65k subunit .
it be located in the nucleus in mature b cell , but be present in other cell type a an inactive cytoplasmic complex .
external stimulus , include those that activate t cell , result in nuclear translocation of active nf-kappa b .
the cloning of the complementary dna for the 50k subunit help to identify an exclusively cytoplasmic 105k precursor ( p105 ) ( v.b. , p.k. and a.i. , manuscript submit ) .
the expression of active nf-kappa b might therefore also be regulate by the extent of processing of p105 .
because hiv-1 require active nf-kappa b for efficient transcription , we test the effect of hiv-1 infection on the processing of the human 105k precursor .
we show here that the hiv-1 protease can process p105 and increase level of active nuclear nf-kappa b complex .
1,25-dihydroxy vitamin d3 and 12-o-tetradecanoyl phorbol-13-acetate synergistically induce monocytic cell differentiation : fo and rb expression .
1,25-dihydroxy vitamin d3 and 12-o-tetradecanoyl phorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) interact synergistically to induce monocytic differentiation of u937 histiocytic lymphoma cell .
addition of tpa cause an otherwise ineffective dose of 1,25-dihydroxy vitamin d3 to induce differentiation .
the induce differentiation depend on the simultaneous ( vs. sequential ) presence of both agent .
the kinetics of induced differentiation be consistent with a g1 specific cellular response to initiate the metabolic cascade culminate in cell differentiation .
the induce differentiation occur with down-regulation of c-fos protein and an accompany up-regulation of rb protein expression , consistent with a possible need for up-regulated rb expression to maintain a given differentiate phenotype and suppress transcriptional activator that might typically be associate with proliferation .
epstein-barr virus replicative gene transcription during de novo infection of human thymocytes : simultaneous early expression of bzlf-1 and it repressor raz .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) be know to infect b cell and epithelial cell .
we and others have show that ebv can also infect a subset of thymocytes .
infection of thymocytes be accompany by the appearance of linear ebv genome within 8 hr of infection .
circularization of the ebv genome be not detect .
this be in contrast to the infection in b cell where the genome can circularize within 24 hr of infection .
the appearance of the bamhi zlf-1 gene product , zebra , by rt-pcr , be observe within 8 hr of infection .
the appearance of a novel fusion transcript ( raz ) , which comprise region of the bzlf-1 locus and the adjacent brlf-1 locus , be detect by rt-pcr .
zebra protein be also identify in infected thymocytes by immunoprecipitation .
in addition , we demonstrate that the ebna-1 gene in infected thymocytes be transcribe from the fp promoter , rather than from the cp/wp promoter which be use in latently infected b cell .
transcript encode gp350/220 , the major coat protein of ebv , be identify , but we do not find any evidence of transcription from the lmp-2a or eber-1 locus in infected thymocytes .
these observation suggest that de novo ebv infection of thymocytes differ from infection of b cell .
the main difference be that with thymocytes , no evidence could be find that the virus ever circularize .
rather , ebv remain in a linear configuration from which replicative gene be transcribe .
gata-3 repress gp91phox gene expression in eosinophil-committed hl-60-c15 cell .
to study the regulatory mechanism of gp91phox gene expression in eosinophil , we transiently transfected eosinophil-committed hl-60-c15 cell with gp91phox promoter construct , and identify a negative element from bp -267 to -246 of the gp91phox gene , the deletion of which cause an 83 % increase in promoter activity .
electrophoresis mobility shift assay demonstrate gata-3 bind to the gata consensus site from bp -256 to -250 .
an 81 % increment in promoter activity be obtain when a mutation be introduce in the gata-3 binding site of the bp -267 to +12 construct , which be comparable to that of the bp -245 to +12 construct .
we therefore conclude that gata-3 specifically bind to the gata site negatively regulate the expression of the gene in hl-60-c15 cell .
oxidant-regulation of gene expression in the chronically inflamed intestine .
it be become increasingly apparent that the chronic gut inflammation observe in the idiopathic inflammatory bowel disease ( e.g. ulcerative colitis , crohn 's disease ) be associate with enhance production of leukocyte-derived oxidant .
oxidant such a hydrogen peroxide be know to activate certain transcription factor such a nuclear transcription factor kappa beta .
nuclear transcription factor kb ( nf-kappa b ) be a ubiquitous transcription factor and pleiotropic regulator of numerous gene involve in the immune and inflammatory response .
this transcription factor be activate via the selective phosphorylation , ubiquination and degradation of it inhibitor protein i-kb thereby allow translocation of nf-kappa b into the nucleus where it upregulates the transcription of a variety of adhesion molecule ( e.g. icam-1 , vcam-1 ) , cytokine ( tnf , il-1 , il-6 ) and enzyme ( inos ) .
the proteolytic degradation of the post-translationally modify i-kappa b be know to be mediate by the 26 proteasome complex .
base upon work from our laboratory , we propose that inhibition of nf-kappa b activation produce significant anti inflammatory activity which may be mediate by the inhibition of transcription of certain pro-inflammatory mediator and adhesion molecule .
signal transduce through the cd4 molecule on t lymphocyte activate nf-kappa b .
we have demonstrate that native envelope glycoprotein of hiv-1 , gp160 can induce activation of the transcription factor , nf-kappa b .
the stimulatory effect of gp160 be mediate through the cd4 molecule , since pretreatment with soluble cd4 abrogate it activity .
the gp160 -induced nf-kappa b complex consist of p65 , p50 and c-rel protein .
the stimulatory effect of gp160 on nf-kappa b activation be protein synthesis independent , be dependent upon protein tyrosine phosphorylation , and abrogate by inhibitor of protein kinase c .
the gp160 -mediated activation of nf-kappa b in cd4 positive t cell may be involve in biological effect , e.g. , enhance hiv replication , hypergammaglobulinemia , increase cytokine secretion , hypercellularity in bone marrow and apoptosis .
a thymus-specific member of the hmg protein family regulate the human t cell receptor c alpha enhancer .
the human t cell-specific transcription factor tcf-1 alpha play a key role in the tissue-specific activation of the t cell receptor ( tcr ) c alpha enhancer and bind to pyrimidine -rich element ( 5'-pyctttg-3' ) present in a variety of other t cell-specific control region .
use amino acid sequence information derive from the dna affinity-purified protein , we have now isolate cdna clone encode tcf-1 alpha .
the tcf-1 alpha cdna contain a single 68-amino-acid domain that be homologous to a region conserve among high-mobility group ( hmg ) and nonhistone chromosomal protein .
expression of full-length and mutant cdna clone in bacteria reveal that the single hmg motif , which be predict to contain two extend alpha-helical segment , be sufficient to direct the sequence-specific binding of tcf-1 alpha to dna .
northern blot experiment demonstrate far that tcf-1 alpha mrna be highly tissue specific , find primarily in the thymus or t cell line .
the immature cem t cell line express relatively low level of tcf-1 alpha mrna , which be increase upon activation of these cell by phorbol ester .
interestingly , the clone tcf-1 alpha protein be a potent transcriptional activator of the human tcr alpha enhancer in nonlymphoid cell line , whereas the activity of the endogenous protein in t cell line be strongly dependent on an additional t cell-specific protein that interact with the core enhancer .
tcf-1 alpha be currently unique among the newly emerge family of dna-binding regulatory protein that share the hmg motif in that it be a highly tissue-specific rna polymerase ii transcription factor .

study have demonstrate abnormality of the cd3/t-cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) and pathway of signal transduction in t lymphocyte from animal and patient with advanced malignancy .
diminish expression of tcrzeta and p56(lck) that be associate with the tcr and reduce nuclear localization of rela contain nuclear factor kappab ( nfkappab ) complex have be note .
these defect have be describe in t cell from patient with malignant melanoma , renal cell carcinoma ( rcc ) , ovarian cancer , and colorectal cancer .
preliminary observation also indicate possible correlation with clinical variable such a stage in select instance .
to far characterize altered expression of tcrzeta , p56(lck) , and impaired activation of nfkappab , t lymphocyte be obtain from 65 patient with rcc , the majority of whom be receive combination cytokine therapy [ interleukin ( il ) -2 , ifn alpha -containing regimen ] and 37 control individual .
in 29 of these patient , level of tcrzeta and p56(lck) be determine by western blot of t-cell lysates and semiquantitated use densitometry .
relative level be then correlate with a series of clinical variable include response to therapy , performance status , survival , disease site , age , and others .
in another group of 28 patient ( three individual from the first group ) , the frequency of abnormal nfkappab activation be study use electrophoretic mobility shift assay after activation of t cell with phorbol myristate acetate/ionomycin or anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody .
change in these signal molecule during cytokine treatment be also investigate .
tcrzeta and p56(lck) be detect in the peripheral blood t cell in 27 of 29 patient , and overall , reduce level be note visually in 12 of 29 ( 41 % ) and 13 of 29 ( 45 % ) individual , respectively .
when level be semiquantitated use densitometry , significant decrease of tcrzeta ( p = 0.029 ) and p56(lck) ( p = 0.029 ) but not cd3epsilon ( p = 0.131 ) , compare with control level , be find .
in patient treat with il-2/ ifn alpha -based therapy , relative level of tcrzeta increase significantly ( p = 0.002 ) on day 15 of cycle one compare with the baseline .
correlation of tcrzeta or p56(lck) level with response or disease variable , except for low tcrzeta level ( p < 0.001 ) in the presence of bone metastasis , be not find .
abnormal nfkappab activation after stimulation with phorbol myristate acetate/ionomycin and/or anti-cd3 monoclonal antibody be find in 59 % of patient ( 17 of 28 ) and be not account for by the advanced age of the study cohort .
activation of nfkappab in peripheral blood t cell be inducible during cytokine therapy in four of six individual who display impaired nfkappab activity prior to therapy .
moreover , impaired activation of nfkappab do not appear link to a reduction of tcrzeta expression , because in five patient , normal tcrzeta level be present although kappab binding be not inducible .
in the majority of patient with advanced rcc , peripheral blood t cell express tcrzeta and p56(lck) , and in a subset , reduce level of these tcrzeta associated molecule be see that may increase during cytokine -based therapy .
abnormal activation of nfkappab be also present in > 50 % of patient and may also revert to normal during il-2/ ifn alpha -based treatment .
this alteration in nfkappab activation occur in the presence of normal expression of tcrzeta -associated signaling element .
the clinical significance of these finding remain unclear .
lymphocyte from the site of disease suggest adenovirus be one cause of persistent or recurrent inflammatory arthritis .
the assessment of synovial lymphocyte reactivity to adenovirus antigen stimulation be undertake in patient with persistent or recurrent inflammatory arthritis .

five patient be find with repeat maximal response to adenovirus antigen ; in one of these adenovirus nucleotide sequence be present in a synovial biopsy specimen .
it be conclude that adenovirus may be one cause of persistent or recurrent inflammatory arthritis .
modulation of mrna expression of a novel human myeloid-selective ccaat/enhancer binding protein gene ( c/ebp epsilon ) .
human c/ebp epsilon be a newly clone gene cod for a ccaat/enhancer binding protein that may be involve in the regulation of myeloid differentiation .
our study show that level of c/ebp epsilon mrna be markedly increase in nb4 cell ( promyelocytic leukemia line ) , because they be induce by 9-cis retinoic acid ( 9-cis ra ) to differentiate towards granulocyte .
accumulation of c/ebp epsilon mrna occur as early a 1 hour after exposure of nb4 cell to 9-cis ra ( 5 x 10(-7) mol/l ) ; and at 48 hour , level be increase by 5.1-fold .
dose-response study show that 10(-7) to 10(-6) mol/l 9-cis ra ( 12 hour ) result in peak level of c/ebp epsilon mrna ; but even 10(-10) mol/l 9-cis ra increase level of these transcript .
nb4 cell pulse-exposed ( 30 minute ) to all-trans retinoic acid ( atra ) , wash , and culture ( 3 day ) with either dimethylsulfoxide ( dmso ) or hexamethylene bisacetamide ( hmba ) have a prominent increase in level of c/ebp epsilon mrna and an increase in granulocytic differentiation , but exposure to either dmso or hmba alone have no effect on base level of c/ebp epsilon and do not induce differentiation .
macrophage-differentiation of nb4 reduce level of c/ebp epsilon mrna .
nuclear run-off assay and half-life study show that accumulation of c/ebp epsilon mrna by 9-cis ra be due to enhance transcription .
furthermore , this c/ebp epsilon mrna accumulation do not require synthesis of new protein factor because 9-cis ra induce c/ebp epsilon mrna accumulation in the absence of new protein synthesis .
atra also induce expression of c/ebp epsilon protein in nb4 cell , a show by western blotting .
in contrast to the increase of c/ebp epsilon in 9-cis ra -mediated granulocytic differentiation , the dmso -induced differentiation of hl-60 cell down the granulocytic pathway be associate with an initial reduction of c/ebp epsilon mrna level .
in summary , we have discover that expression of c/ebp epsilon mrna be markedly enhance a the nb4 promyelocytes be induce by retinoids to differentiate towards granulocyte .
this induction of c/ebp epsilon mrna expression be transcriptionally mediate and occur in the absence of synthesis of additional protein factor .
we suspect that the c/ebp epsilon promoter/enhancer contain a retinoic acid-response element that be directly stimulate by retinoids .
effect of cd45 on nf-kappa b .
implication for replication of hiv-1 .
increase level of replication of the hiv type 1 be observe after the activation of infected t cell through the tcr .
however , anti- cd45 antibody inhibit these effect in cell from infected individual .
in this study , we examine interrelationship between cd45 and hiv-1 far .
we measure effect on the hiv-1 ltr in t cell line that be stimulate with antibody against cd45 and in those that lack the expression of cd45 on their surface .
first , anti- cd45 antibody do not affect basal but decrease activated level of expression from the hiv-1 ltr .
second , t cell , which lack cd45 and can not signal via the tcr , support high level of viral replication and gene expression .
this be due to the presence of active nf-kappa b complex in the nucleus of cd45 -t cell .
additionally , infected t cell display low level of cd45 on their surface .
thus , cd45 play an active role in the physiology of t cell and in the replication of hiv-1 .
carboxyl-terminal 15-amino acid sequence of nfatx1 be possibly create by tissue-specific splicing and be essential for transactivation activity in t cell .
nfat regulate transcription of a number of cytokine and other immunoregulatory gene .
we have isolate nfatx , which be one of four member of the nfat family of transcription factor and be preferentially express in the thymus and peripheral blood leukocyte , and an isoform of nfatx , nfatx1 .
here we provide evidence show that 15 amino acid in the carboxyl-terminal end of nfatx1 be require for it maximum transactivation activity in jurkat t cell .
a fusion between these 15 amino acid and the gal4 dna binding domain be capable of transactivating reporter drive by the gal4 dna binding site .
interestingly , this 15-amino acid transactivation sequence be well conserve in nfat family protein , although the sequence contiguous to the carboxyl-terminal region of the nfat family be much less conserve .
we also report three additional isoforms of nfatx , designate nfatx2 , nfatx3 , and nfatx4 .
this transactivation sequence be alter by tissue-specific alternative splicing in newly isolate nfatx isoforms , result in low transactivation activity in jurkat t cell .
nfatx1 be express predominantly in the thymus and peripheral blood leukocyte , while the skeletal muscle express primarily nfatx2 .
in jurkat cell , transcription from the nfat site of the il-2 promoter be activate strongly by nfatx1 but only weakly by nfatx2 .
these data demonstrate that the 15-amino acid sequence of nfatx1 be a major transactivation sequence require for induction of gene by nfatx1 in t cell and possibly regulate nfat activity through tissue-specific alternative splicing .
regulation of nf-kappa b activity by i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta stability .
transcription factor nf-kappa b must be release from cytoplasmic inhibitory molecule ( i kappa b ) in order to move to the nucleus and to activate it target gene .
little be know about the mechanism regulate the maintenance of constitutive nuclear nf-kappa b in some cell-types and of sustained nuclear nf-kappa b activity after stimulation .
increase turnover have be implicate in the regulation of constitutive nf-kappa b activity in mature b cell .
we therefore compare the turnover of i kappa b alpha and i kappa b beta in mature b cell and hela cell .
both protein display a high turnover in b cell although i kappa b beta be considerably more stable than i kappa b alpha .
the half-life of both inhibitor be increase in hela cell .
in contrast , all other nf-kappa b /i kappa b molecule test be relatively stable in both cell-types .
the elevated turnover of endogenous i kappa b alpha in namalwa cell be inhibit by a proteasome inhibitor and thus seem to be drive by the same degradation machinery a the slow turnover in non-b cell .
furthermore , we investigate the process involve in persistent activation of nf-kappa b .
tnf-alpha signaling lead to a rapid depletion of cellular i kappa b beta pool .
i kappa b alpha be efficiently resynthesized whereas i kappa b beta level stay low for a prolonged time .
nf-kappa b binding activity can be detect for several hour after stimulation .
we find that removal of the tnf-alpha containing medium cause a rapid decrease in nuclear nf-kappa b .
a phosphoform of newly synthesize i kappa b alpha be visible when degradation by the proteasome be inhibit and new i kappa b alpha display the same property regard phosphorylation and degradation in response to a second inducer .
there be no significant difference in the turnover of pre- and post-inductive i kappa b alpha .
these observation suggest that resynthesis of i kappa b alpha and removal of the stimulus be obligatory step for the inactivation of nuclear nf kappa b .
regulation of c-jun expression during induction of monocytic differentiation by okadaic acid .
the present work have examine the effect of okadaic acid , an inhibitor of type 1 and 2a protein phosphatase , on the regulation of c-jun expression during monocytic differentiation of u-937 leukemia cell .
the result demonstrate that okadaic acid treatment be associate with induction of a differentiate monocyte phenotype characterize by : ( a ) growth arrest ; ( b ) increase in mac-1 cell surface antigen expression ; ( c ) down-regulation of c-myc transcript ; and ( d ) induction of tumor necrosis factor gene expression .
this induction of monocytic differentiation be associate with transient increase in c-jun mrna level , which be maximal at 6 h .
similar effect be obtain for the c-fos gene .
run-on analysis demonstrate detectable level of c-jun transcription in u-937 cell and that this rate be increase approximately 40-fold follow okadaic acid exposure .
c-jun mrna level be superinduced in cell treat with both okadaic acid and cycloheximide , whereas inhibition of protein synthesis have little , if any , effect on okadaic acid -induced c-jun transcription .
the half-life of c-jun mrna be similar ( 45-50 min ) in both untreated and okadaic acid -induced cell .
in contrast , treatment with both okadaic acid and cycloheximide be associate with stabilization ( t 1/2 = 90 min ) of c-jun transcript .
take together , these finding indicate that the induction of c-jun transcription by okadaic acid be control primarily by a transcriptional mechanism .
since previous study have demonstrate that the c-jun gene be autoinduced by jun/ap-1 , we also study transcription of c-jun promoter ( position -132/+170 ) -reporter gene construct with and without a mutate ap-1 element .

the carboxyl-terminal cytoplasmic domain of cd36 be require for oxidize low-density lipoprotein modulation of nf-kappab activity by tumor necrosis factor-alpha .
the binding of oxidize low-density lipoprotein ( ox ldl ) by monocyte -macrophages cause pleiotropic effect , include change in gene expression , and be think to represent an early event in atherogenesis .
the integral membrane glycoprotein cd36 appear to play a physiological role in binding and uptake of ox ldl by monocyte- macrophage , although the molecular event associate with cd36 -ox ldl interaction be unknown .
to approach this issue , we use cd36 transfected chinese hampster ovary ( cho ) cell , expose them to ox ldl , and determine change in the activity of the transcription factor nf-kappab .
we report here that ox ldl enhance dna binding activity of nuclear extract to an nf-kappab sequence follow activation of cd36 -producing cho cell with the proinflammatory cytokine tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) .
this enhance dna binding activity be inhibit by coincubation of cd36 transfected cell with the human cd36 -specific antibody okm5 .
we also determine that activation of nf-kappab dna binding activity require an intact carboxyl-terminal cytoplasmic segment on cd36 .
our result support the idea that human cd36 mediate signal transduction event in response to ox ldl .
microtubule mediate cellular 25-hydroxyvitamin d3 trafficking and the genomic response to 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 in normal human monocyte .
the genomic action of 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( 1,25(oh)2d3 ) be mediate by the intracellular vitamin d receptor ( vdr ) .
although immunocytochemistry have show that disruption of microtubular assembly prevent nuclear access of the sterol- vdr complex , the role of microtubule in the response to 1,25(oh)2d3 have not be study in viable cell .
our study examine this interaction in normal human monocyte .
monocyte convert 25(oh)d3 to 1,25(oh)2d3 and to 24-hydroxylated metabolite more polar than 1,25(oh)2d3 .
microtubule disruption totally abolish the ability of exogenous 1,25(oh)2d3 to suppress it own synthesis and to induce 24-hydroxylase mrna and activity , without affect either total 1,25(oh)2d3 uptake or maximal 1,25(oh)2d3 -vdr binding .
thus , intact microtubule be essential for 1,25(oh)2d3 -dependent modulation of gene transcription .
interestingly , microtubule disruption also decrease monocyte 1,25(oh)2d3 synthesis , not by decrease the vmax of monocyte mitochondrial 1 alpha-hydroxylase but through an increase in the km for 25(oh)2d3 .
we examine 25(oh)d3 transport .
microtubule disruption do not affect total cellular 25(oh)d3 uptake but reduce it intracellular trafficking to the mitochondrion .
thus , microtubule participate in intracellular 25(oh)d3 transport , and their integrity determine normal 1,25(oh)2d3 synthesis .
inhibition of nuclear factor kappab activation attenuate apoptosis resistance in lymphoid cell .
death-inducing ligand ( dils ) such a tumor necrosis factor alpha ( tnfalpha ) or the cytotoxic drug doxorubicin have be show to activate a nuclear factor kappab ( nfkappab ) -dependent program that may rescue cell from apoptosis induction .
we demonstrate here that trail ( tnf-related apoptosis -inducing ligand ) , a recently identify dil , also activate nfkappab in lymphoid cell line in a kinetic similar to tnfalpha .
nfkappab activity be independent from fadd , caspase , and apoptosis induction .
to study the influence of nfkappab activity on apoptosis mediate by trail , cd95 , tnfalpha , or doxorubicin , nfkappab activation be inhibit use the proteasome inhibitor n-acetyl-l-leucinyl-l-leucinyl-l-norleucinal or transient overexpression of mutant ikappabalpha .
sensitivity for induction of apoptosis be markedly increase by these treatment in apoptosis sensitive cell line .
moreover , both in cell line and in primary leukemia cell that be resistant towards induction of apoptosis by dils and doxorubicin , antagonization of nfkappab activity partially restore apoptosis sensitivity .
these data suggest that inhibition of nfkappab activation may provide a molecular approach to increase apoptosis sensitivity in anticancer treatment .
transcriptional regulation of the beta-casein gene by cytokine : cross-talk between stat5 and other signal molecule .
the beta-casein promoter have be widely use to monitor the activation of stat ( signal transducer and activator of transcription ) 5 since stat5 be originally find a a mediator of prl-inducible beta-casein expression .
however , not only be expression of the beta-casein gene regulate by stat5 but it be also affect by other molecule such a glucocorticoid and ra .
in this report , we describe the transcriptional regulation of the beta-casein gene by cytokine in t cell .
we have find that the beta-casein gene be express in a cytotoxic t cell line , ctll-2 , in response to interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) , which activate stat5 .
while il-4 do not activate stat5 , it induce expression of stat5 -regulated gene in ctll-2 , i.e. beta-casein , a cytokine-inducible sh2-containing protein ( ci ) , and oncostatin m ( osm ) , suggest that stat6 activate by il-4 substitute for the function of stat5 in t cell .
il-2 -induced beta-casein expression be enhance by dexamethasone , and this synergistic effect of dexamethasone require the sequence between -155 and -193 in the beta-casein promoter .
coincidentally , a deletion of this region enhance the il-2 -induced expression of beta-casein .
expression of an active form of ra , ras(g12v) , suppress the il-2 -induced beta-casein and osm gene expression , and the negative effect of ra be mediate by the region between -105 and -193 in the beta-casein promoter .
in apparent contradiction , expression of a dominant negative form of ra , rasn17 , also inhibit il-2 -induced activation of the promoter contain the minimal beta-casein stat5 element as well a the promoter of ci and osm .
in addition , ras(g12v) complement signaling by an erythropoietin receptor mutant defective in ra activation and augment the activation of the beta-casein promoter by the mutant erythropoietin receptor signaling , suggest a possible role of ra in stat5 -mediated gene expression .
these result collectively reveal a complex interaction of stat5 with other signaling pathway and illustrate that regulation of gene expression require integration of opposing signal
molecular cloning and characterization of a cdna , chemr1 , encode a chemokine receptor with a homology to the human c-c chemokine receptor , ccr-4 .
chemokines refer to a rapidly expand family of small cytokine whose primary function be recruitment of leukocyte to inflammatory site .
these be know to bind to seven-transmembrane-domain contain receptor .
a cdna clone , chemr1 , resemble the typical g protein-coupled receptor , be isolate from a mouse cytotoxic t-lymphocyte ( ctl ) library .
northern blot analysis in mouse cell line suggest that it expression be find in a variety of cell , include t cell , b cell , and macrophage .
the chemr1 gene scya3r2 be a single-copy gene whose open reading frame may be in a single exon and map to the distal region of mouse chr 9 where the mouse macrophage inflammatory protein-1alpha ( mip-1alpha ) receptor gene scya3r and two related c-c chemokine receptor-like gene reside .
amino acid sequence comparison show that chemr1 be 84 % identical to human ccr-4 , indicate that chemr1 be likely to be a mouse ccr-4 .
binding assay use 125i-labeled c-c chemokines in mammalian cell indicate that chemr1 do not bind mip-1alpha , rantes , or mip-1beta , whereas ccr-1 bind mip-1alpha and rantes .
our result be different from the report property of human ccr-4 .
this suggest that chemr1 may be a receptor for unidentified c-c chemokine or a low-affinity receptor for mip-1alpha .
transcriptional regulation of the pyruvate kinase erythroid-specific promoter .
mammal pyruvate kinase be encode by two gene .
the l gene produce the erythroid ( r-pk ) or the hepatic ( l-pk ) isozymes by the alternative use of two promoter .
we report the characterization of the cis- and trans- acting element involve in the tissue-specific activity of the l gene erythroid promoter .
a r-pk dna fragment extend from -870 to +54 relative to the cap site confer erythroid specificity to a reporter gene .
within this region , we define a minimal promoter ( -62 to +54 ) that display erythroid-specific activity and contain two dna binding site .
one , located at -50 , bind member of the ccacc/sp1 family and the other , located at -20 , bind the erythroid factor gata-1 .
although the -20 gata binding site ( agataa ) be also a potential tfiid binding site , it do not bind tfiid .
furthermore , the substitution of this gata binding site by a canonical tfiid binding site suppress the promoter activity .
mutation and deletion of both site indicate that only the association of ccacc/sp1 and gata binding site can drive efficient and tissue-specific expression of this r-pk minimal promoter .
finally , by co-transfection experiment , we study the element involve in the hgata-1 transactivation of the r-pk promoter in hela cell .
dexamethasone suppression test : corticosteroid receptor regulation in mononuclear leukocyte of young and aged subject .
the dexamethasone suppression test ( dst ) be consider an indicator of the function of the adrenal pituitary axis .
the effect of the steroid be mediate by it binding to corticosteroid receptor .
we previously suggest that the measurement of corticosteroid receptor in lymphocyte be an index of an analogous pattern in brain .
in the present study , corticosteroid type i and type ii receptor in mononuclear leukocyte be measure in 10 elderly subject and in 9 young adult , before and after overnight dst ( 1 mg ) .
receptor be measure by radioreceptor assay .
in all the subject , dexamethasone be able to suppress plasma cortisol .
the number of type i and type ii receptor before the test be low in elderly subject than in adult .
in the control group , dexamethasone produce a significant depression of type i receptor ( from 267 +/- 72 to 169 +/- 71 receptor per cell ) , which can be interpret a a primary involvement of type i receptor in the response to dexamethasone ; type ii receptor decrease in half the subject ( from 2849 +/- 703 to 2345 +/- 569 receptor per cell ) .
in elderly healthy subject , type ii receptor be also significantly decrease ( from 1796 +/- 671 to 720 +/- 345 ) .
we suggest that in young subject type ii receptor be initially up-regulated by dexamethasone , and then down-regulated , while in aged subject an up-regulation can not be achieve , a suggest by the high value of plasma cortisol usually find in age subject .
ro 09-2210 exhibit potent anti-proliferative effect on activate t cell by selectively block mkk activity .
by use high throughput screening of microbial broth , we have identify a compound , designate ro 09-2210 , which be able to block anti-cd3 induced peripheral blood t cell activation with an ic50 = 40 nm .
ro 09-2210 be also able to block antigen-induced il-2 secretion with an ic50 = 30 nm , but be considerably less potent at block ca2+ flux stimulate by anti-cd3 treatment .
to determine the mechanism of action of ro 09-2210 , we set up a transient expression system in jurkat t cell use a variety of reporter gene construct and show effective inhibition of phorbol ester / ionomycin -induced nf-at activation and anti-cd3 induce nf-at with ic50 = 7.7 and 10 nm , respectively .
ro 09-2210 be also able to inhibit phorbol ester / ionomycin -induced activation of ap1 with ic50 = < 10 nm .
we far show that ro 09-2210 be unable to inhibit c-jun induced expression of ap1 -dependent reporter construct ( ic50 > 500 nm ) , but be able to potently inhibit ras-induced ap1 activation ( ic50 = 20 nm ) .
this suggest that ro 09-2210 be inhibit an activator of ap-1 which be upstream of c-jun and downstream of ra signaling .
to investigate far , we then purify a number of different kinase , include pkc , phk , zap-70 , erk , and mek 1 ( a mkk ) , and show that ro 09-2210 be a selective inhibitor of mek1 in vitro ( ic50 = 59 nm ) .
inhibition of rna polymerase ii transcription in human cell by synthetic dna-binding ligand [ see comment ]
sequence-specific dna-binding small molecule that can permeate human cell potentially could regulate transcription of specific gene .
multiple cellular dna-binding transcription factor be require by hiv type 1 for rna synthesis .
two pyrrole-imidazole polyamide be design to bind dna sequence immediately adjacent to bind site for the transcription factor ets-1 , lymphoid-enhancer binding factor 1 , and tata-box binding protein .
these synthetic ligand specifically inhibit dna-binding of each transcription factor and hiv type 1 transcription in cell-free assay .
when use in combination , the polyamide inhibit virus replication by > 99 % in isolate human peripheral blood lymphocyte , with no detectable cell toxicity .
the ability of small molecule to target predetermined dna sequence located within rna polymerase ii promoter suggest a general approach for regulation of gene expression , as well a a mechanism for the inhibition of viral replication .
synergy between signal transduction pathway be obligatory for expression of c-fos in b and t cell line : implication for c-fos control via surface immunoglobulin and t cell antigen receptor .
expression of the protooncogene c-fos be control by three main regulatory pathway involve kinase c , camp , and calcium .
kinase c mediate it effect via phosphorylation of serum response factor ( srf ) which interact with the serum response element ( sre ) ; camp and calcium mediate their effect via phosphorylation of creb ( camp regulatory element binding protein ) presumably by activation of a protein kinase a or calmodulin-regulated kinase .
we have examine the function of these element in burkitt 's lymphoma cell ( ramos and daudi ) as well a a t lymphocytic cell line ( jurkat ) .
we have find that stimulation of any one of these pathway alone have little or no effect on c-fos induction .
however , kinase c activation ( pma stimulation ) combine with either camp ( forskolin plus mix ) or calcium stimulation ( ionophore ) lead to greatly enhance c-fos induction .
by contrast , camp in the presence of calcium show no synergy in c-fos induction .
okadaic acid augment pma- as well a calcium- mediated activation of c-fos , and have little or no effect when combine with camp .
the main difference between ramos ( b cell ) and jurkat ( t cell ) in the regulation of c-fos be that camp plus calcium be strongly synergistic in jurkat and be without effect in ramos .
analysis of ap-1 activity use gel mobility shift assay confirm that the requirement for synergy in c-fos mrna induction be parallel by requirement for synergy in induction of ap-1 activity .
signaling in b cell due to anti-ig stimulation involve both kinase c activation and release of intracellular calcium , and result in c-fos mrna induction .
our result indicate that synergy between the kinase c activation and calcium be need for efficient c-fos induction since neither of these two alone induce c-fos well .
that synergy of signaling pathway be relevant for the anti-ig induction of c-fos be support by the fact that camp -inducing agent and okadaic acid far enhance anti-ig induction of c-fos .
these result suggest that cell-specific pattern of synergy be an essential feature for c-fos induction and may be relevant for c-fos control through b and t cell antigen receptor .
helenalin , an anti-inflammatory sesquiterpene lactone from arnica , selectively inhibit transcription factor nf-kappab [ see comment ]
alcoholic extract prepare form arnicae flos , the collective name for flowerheads from arnica montana and a. chamissonis ssp. foliosa , be use therapeutically a anti-inflammatory remedy .
the active ingredient mediate the pharmacological effect be mainly sesquiterpene lactones , such a helenalin , 11alpha,13-dihydrohelenalin , chamissonolid and their ester derivative .
while these compound affect various cellular process , current data do not fully explain how sesquiterpene lactones exert their anti-inflammatory effect .
we show here that helenalin , and , to a much less degree , 11alpha,13-dihydrohelenalin and chamissonolid , inhibit activation of transcription factor nf-kappab .
this difference in efficacy , which correlate with the compound ' anti-inflammatory potency in vivo , may be explain by difference in structure and conformation .
nf-kappab , which reside in an inactive , cytoplasmic complex in unstimulated cell , be activate by phosphorylation and degradation of it inhibitory subunit , ikappab .
helenalin inhibit nf-kappab activation in response to four different stimulus in t-cells , b-cells and epithelial cell and abrogate kappab -driven gene expression .
this inhibition be selective , a the activity of four other transcription factor , oct-1 , tbp , sp1 and stat 5 be not affect .
we show that inhibition be not due to a direct modification of the active nf-kappab heterodimer .
rather , helenalin modify the nf-kappab/ ikappab complex , prevent the release of ikappab .
these data suggest a molecular mechanism for the anti-inflammatory effect of sesquiterpene lactones , which differ from that of other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( nsaid ) , indomethacin and acetyl salicylic acid .
adenovirus e1a inhibit ifn -induced resistance to cytolysis by natural killer cell .
infection of target cell with cytopathic virus inhibit ifn induction of cytolytic resistance to nk cell-mediated cytolysis [ ifn -mediated cytoprotection ( ifn -mcp ) ] .
it have be think that the virally induce inhibition of ifn -mcp be secondary to the shutdown of cellular macromolecular synthesis that accompany cytopathic virus infection .
group c , adenovirus serotype 5 ( ad5 ) infection inhibit both ifn -mcp and cellular protein synthesis .
this study determine if the ad5-induced inhibition of ifn -mcp be independent of adenovirus ( ad ) infection and secondary only to the expression of the ad early region 1a gene ( e1a ) .
to test this hypothesis , 4-h nk cytolysis assay be perform on ifn-gamma-treated human cell infect with an ad5 e1a deletion mutant , dl343 , or transfected with the ad5 e1a gene .
ifn -mcp be not inhibit by infection with dl343 , despite the production of large amount of both early ( e1b , p55 ) and late ( hexon ) ad protein .
in contrast to e1a -negative , parental cell line , ifn -mcp be block in ad5 e1a -transfected epithelial and fibroblastic cell line .
genetic mapping study within the e1a gene demonstrate that expression of only the first exon of e1a be sufficient to inhibit ifn -mcp .
dna sequence homology of e1a gene between different ad group ( group a , ad12 ; group c , ad5 ) be limit almost entirely to three conserve region located within the first exon of e1a .
because ifn -mcp be also block in ad12 e1a -transfected cell line , expression of one or more of the e1a -conserved region may be necessary to inhibit ifn -mcp .
in summary , the expression of e1a gene product inhibit ifn -mcp independently of virus infection .
e1a 's inhibition of ifn -mcp have the net effect of promote the selective nk cell-mediated clearance of ad-infected or ad-transformed human cell .
tumor suppressor protein a regulator of cell differentiation .
the product of the tumor suppressor gene be consider to function a specific inhibitor of tumor cell growth .
in this communication , we present evidence to show that these protein inhibit tumor cell proliferation by participate in the activation of tumor cell differentiation .
the ml-1 human myeloblastic leukemia cell use in this study proliferate when treat with insulin-like growth factor i and transferrin but differentiate to monocyte when expose to tumor necrosis factor alpha or transform growth factor beta1 , or to macrophage-like cell when treat with both these cytokine .
initiation of proliferation but not of differentiation be follow by a 20- to 25-fold increase in the nuclear level of the dna polymerase-associated processivity factor pcna and of the proliferation-specific transcription factor e2f1 .
in contrast , induction of differentiation but not of proliferation be follow by a 25- to 30-fold increase in the nuclear level of the tumor suppressor protein p53 ( wild type ) , prb , and p130/rb2 and of the p53-dependent cyclin kinase inhibitor p21/cip1 .
p53 and p21/cip1 , respectively , inhibit the expression and activation of pcna , whereas p130 and prb , respectively , inhibit the expression and activation of e2f1 .
a a result , g1-s-associated dna and mrna synthesis be inhibit , growth uncouple from differentiation , and maturation enable to proceed .
where this function of the tumor suppressor protein be impaired , the capacity for differentiation be lose , which lead to the sustained proliferation that be characteristic of the cancer cell .
cross-linking cd40 on b cell preferentially induce stress-activated protein kinase rather than mitogen-activated protein kinase .
the b cell-associated surface molecule cd40 play a key role in t cell-dependent b cell maturation , a individual with defect in either cd40 or it ligand be impaired in immunoglobulin isotype class switching and germinal center formation .
cd40 signaling activate downstream effector , include the tyrosine protein kinase , lyn , the phosphatidylinositol-3-kinase ( pi-3 kinase ) , and the transcription factor , nf-kappa b .
in this study , we demonstrate that stress-activated protein kinase ( sapk ) be activate after cd40 cross-linking on various b cell line or human tonsillar b cell .
the activation be rapid and transient and be mediate through a cyclosporin a -insensitive pathway .
furthermore , this signaling pathway appear not to rely on protein kinase c .
while cd40 ligation strongly activate the sapks ( up to 25-fold ) , it do not affect member of the mitogen-activated protein kinase family ( mapk ; erk1 and erk2 ) .
consistent with these data , cd40 signal up-regulate c-jun but not c-fos mrna and alter the transcription factor atf2 but not the raf-1 protein .
in summary , cd40 signaling preferentially induce sapk but not mapk .
presence of a variant form of the estrogen receptor in peripheral blood mononuclear cell from normal individual and lupus patient .
estrogen may participate in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) via it intracellular receptor .
to investigate the presence of various isoforms of the estrogen receptor ( er ) in sle we isolate rna from mononuclear cell of lupus patient and normal control .
use rt-pcr we be able to identify both the full length wild-type form and an isoform of the er which precisely lack exon v in both patient and normal individual .
our result , although limited , suggest that normal individual can express both the wild-type and truncate version at the same time , whereas lupus patient only express either the wild-type or the truncate er .
this finding may lead to a good understanding of the reason for the prevalence of lupus in female and of the estrogenic effect on sle disease activity .
enhance responsiveness to nuclear factor kappa b contribute to the unique phenotype of simian immunodeficiency virus variant sivsmmpbj14 .
infection with a variant of simian immunodeficiency virus , sivsmmpbj14 , lead to severe acute disease in macaque .
this study be design to investigate the functional significance of previously describe mutation in the viral long terminal repeat ( ltr ) and to elucidate their contribution to the unique phenotype of sivsmmpbj14 .
ltr -directed transcription be measure by use luciferase reporter construct that be transiently transfected into culture cell .
in a wide range of cell type , the basal transcriptional activity of the ltr from sivsmmpbj14 be find to be 2- to 4.5-fold high than that of an ltr from a non-acutely pathogenic strain .
these ltrs differ by five point mutation and a 22-bp duplication in sivsmmpbj14 , which include a nuclear factor kappa b ( nf kappa b ) site .
transcriptional difference between these ltrs be far enhance by two- to threefold upon treatment of cell with phorbol ester or tumor necrosis factor alpha or by cotransfection with plasmid express nf kappa b subunit .
mutagenesis study , and the use of a reporter construct contain an enhancerless promoter , indicate that these transcriptional effect be due principally to the 22-bp sequence duplication and the nf kappa b site contain within it .
finally , infectious virus stock that be isogenic except for the ltr be generate .
the ltr from sivsmmpbj14 be find to confer an increase in the kinetics of virus replication in culture cell .
inclusion of this ltr in recombinant sivs also result in a two- to threefold rise in the extent of cellular proliferation that be induce in quiescent simian peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
these study be consistent with the hypothesis that ltr mutation assist sivsmmpbj14 in respond efficiently to cellular stimulation and allow it to replicate to high titer during the acute phase of viral infection .
inhibition of nuclear factor kappa b subunit p65 mrna accumulation in lipopolysaccharide -stimulated human monocytic cell treat with sodium salicylate .
lipopolysaccharide be one of the most potent trigger substance for monocyte and macrophage cause secretion of inflammatory mediator such a tumor necrosis factor and interleukin-1 .
the nature of the nuclear factor involve in regulation of these cytokine gene be still unknown .
nuclear factor kappa b ( nf-kappa b ; heterodimer of p50 and p65 ) protein have be suggest to play an important role in gene transcription of inflammatory mediator when monocyte be stimulate with lipopolysaccharide .
nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug such a salicylate have be use to treat symptom of inflammation , and a new mechanism of drug action be suggest recently .
salicylate have be show to inhibit lipopolysaccharide -induced gene transcription via inhibition of nf-kappa b activation by prevent the degradation of nf-kappa b inhibitor " i kappa b " , block the translocation of nf-kappa b into the nuclear compartment .
however , the nature of the subunit involve in this mechanism have not be define .
to examine the mechanism by which salicylate affect cytokine gene transcription , the amount of active and inactive nf-kappa b and nf-kappa b mrna , in porphyromonas gingivalis lipopolysaccharide -stimulated human monocytic cell be assess .
high dos of sodium salicylate suppress nf-kappa b p65 mrna accumulation , result in suppression of total nf-kappa b , p50 on tissue oligonucleotide have no effect on lipopolysaccharide -induced nf-kappa b activation .
the data demonstrate that the p65 subunit of nf-kappa b be inhibit by salicylate treatment and highlight the role of salicylate in the control of gene expression of inflammatory mediator .
solution structure of a pou-specific homeodomain : 3d-nmr study of human b-cell transcription factor oct-2 .
the pou dna-binding motif define a conserve family of eukaryotic transcription factor involve in regulation of gene expression .
this bipartite motif consist of an n-terminal pou-specific domain ( pous ) , a flexible linker , and a c-terminal pou-specific homeodomain ( pouhd ) .
here we describe the solution structure of a pou-specific homeodomain .
an nmr model be obtain from oct-2 , a human b-cell specific transcription factor which participate in the regulation of immunoglobulin gene .
a fragment of oct-2 containing pouhd and an adjoining linker be express in escherichia coli and characterize by three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance ( 3d-nmr ) spectroscopy .
complete 1h and 15n resonance assignment of the pouhd moiety be present .
the pouhd solution structure , a calculate by distance geometry and simulated annealing ( dg/sa ) , be similar to that of canonical homeodomains .
a salient difference between solution and crystal structure be observe in the c-terminal segment of alpha-helix 3 ( the hth recognition helix ) , which be not well order in solution .
because this segment presumably fold upon specific dna binding , it flexibility in solution may reduce the intrinsic dna affinity of pouhd in the absence of pous .
tumor necrosis factor receptor expression and signal transduction in hiv-1 -infected cell .
objective : to examine the inter-relationship between hiv-1 infection and the cell surface receptor for tumor necrosis factor ( tnf ) -alpha , an immunoregulatory cytokine that can enhance hiv-1 replication .
design : infected promyelocytic and promonocytic cell be examine because they normally express both type of tnf receptor .
method : tnf receptor surface expression be determine by specific monoclonal antibody recognition and flow cytometry , and signal transduction be detect by gel shift analysis .
hiv-1 activation and expression be quantitated by reverse transcriptase assay .
result : in the om-10.1 promyelocytic model of chronic infection , tnf-alpha-induced hiv-1 expression also result in a substantial increase in 75 kd tnf receptor ( tr75 ) expression although 55 kd tnf receptor ( tr55 ) level be not dramatically alter .
a series of uninfected parental hl-60 subclones all reduce tr75 surface expression in response to tnf-alpha treatment .
enhance tr75 expression on om-10.1 cell follow the same tnf-alpha -dose dependency a that observe for hiv-1 production .
an increase in tr75 expression be also evident during the peak of an acute hiv-1 infection of hl-60 promyelocytes .
although tr55 expression be unaltered during tnf-alpha -induced hiv activation , this receptor be still involve in the viral activation process .
antibody cross-linking of tr55 , in the absence of exogenous tnf-alpha , induce maximal hiv-1 expression , an up-modulation of surface tr75 , and nuclear nf-kappa b activity in om-10.1 culture .
surprisingly , this be the case even when an antagonistic anti-tr55 antibody be use .
anti-tr55 antibody cross-linking in chronically infected u1 promonocytic culture could only partially substitute for tnf-alpha-induced hiv-1 expression .
conclusion : our result demonstrate that hiv-1 infection can selectively influence the surface expression of tnf receptor , potentially influence it own expression and alter normal immunoregulatory signal transduction .
inhibitory effect of growth hormone on tnf-alpha secretion and nuclear factor-kappab translocation in lipopolysaccharide -stimulated human monocyte .
several study have point to a link between immune and endocrine system , include a regulatory function of gh on monocyte activation .
the present study demonstrate that human thp-1 promonocytic cell , engineer by gene transfer to constitutively produce human growth hormone ( hgh ) , secrete depress amount of tnf-alpha in response to challenge by lp .
the effect of gh appear to occur in an autocrine fashion , since the inhibitory effect on tnf-alpha secretion by constitutive gh production could be abolish in the presence of anti-hgh mab .
the gh -induced inhibitory effect be also observe use normal human monocyte and monocyte-derived macrophage .
inhibition of tnf-alpha production by thp-1-hgh-transfected cell culture in the presence of lp be dependent on a selective pathway , since no inhibition of tnf-alpha production be observe when cell be culture in the presence of pma .
inhibition of tnf-alpha secretion by lp -stimulated thp-1-hgh cell be associate with a decrease in nuclear translocation of nuclear factor-kappab .
the capacity of gh to inhibit lp -induced tnf-alpha production by monocyte without alter other pathway lead to tnf-alpha production may be of potential relevance in septic shock , since gh be available for clinical use .
expression of id2 and id3 mrna in human lymphocyte .
helix-loop-helix ( hlh ) transcription factor be involve in cellular growth and differentiation .
the id ( inhibitor of dna binding and differentiation ) hlh protein , in a dominantly negative fashion , regulate transcriptional activity of basic hlh protein .
we examine by northern hybridization the expression of id2 and id3 mrna in human leukemia/lymphoma line and patient sample , as well a rest and activate normal human lymphocyte from peripheral blood ( pbl ) .
the id2 mrna be abundantly express in 5/12 t-cell and 3/4 b-cell line , and id3 mrna be detect in 4/12 t-cell and 3/4 b-cell line .
interestingly , id2 , but not id3 , mrna be strongly express in 4/5 t-cell line infect with human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) ( atl-1k , mt-2 , s-lb1 ) and type ii ( mo ) .
another unexpected finding be that t-cell leukemia and t-cell line often express either id2 or id3 mrna .
in addition , rest pbl constitutively express prominent level of id2 mrna , but not id3 mrna .
upon pha -stimulation , id2 expression decrease and id3 level increase with biphasic kinetics .
take together , our study reveal three unexpected finding which require further analysis : ( 1 ) expression of id2 mrna be often associate with lymphocytic transformation by htlv-i or -ii ; ( 2 ) t-cells usually express either id2 or id3 mrna , but b-cells often express both simultaneously ; ( 3 ) non-dividing , normal pbl express high level of id2 and no id3 mrna ; and with the onset of cellular proliferation , level of id2 mrna decrease while level of id3 mrna increase , suggest that regulation of expression of these closely related gene be disparate .
the p65 subunit of nf-kappa b regulate i kappa b by two distinct mechanism .
transcription factor nf-kappa b ( p50/p65 ) be generally localized to the cytoplasm by it inhibitor i kappa b .
overproduced i kappa b , free from nf-kappa b , be rapidly degrade .
overexpression of p65 increase endogenous i kappa b protein in both carcinoma and lymphoid cell by two mechanism : protein stabilization and increase transcription of i kappa b mrna .
in contrast , p65 delta , a naturally occur splice variant , fail to markedly augment i kappa b protein level .
both overexpressed p65 and coexpressed p50 be cytoplasmic , whereas p65 delta be partly nuclear , indicate that the i kappa b induce by p65 can maintain nf-kappa b in the cytoplasm .
thus , p65 and i kappa b be link in an autoregulatory loop , ensure that nf-kappa b be hold in the cytoplasm until cell be specifically induce to translocate it to the nucleus .
the use of glucocorticoid in acute lymphoblastic leukemia of childhood .
molecular , cellular , and clinical consideration .
glucocorticoid have be include in almost all treatment regimen for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia for decade .
however , optimal agent , dos , and/or schedule have yet to be define despite extensive clinical application .
new data on the pharmacokinetics , pharmacodynamics , and molecular mechanism of action of glucocorticoid have suggest alternative approach in all .
these suggest that prolonged , i.e. 28 day , glucocorticoid therapy may be unnecessary a exposure to glucocorticoid induce down-regulation of glucocorticoid receptor .
dexamethasone may be superior to prednisone in conventional equi-effective dos .
blast sensitivity to glucocorticoid correlate closely with sensitivity to other , putatively non-cross-resisting agent and with outcome after multi-agent therapy , suggest overlapping mechanism of action , and focus attention on the determinant of the threshold for apoptosis .
increase success in the treatment of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia have lead to increase awareness of avascular necrosis of bone a a potentially disabling sequela of glucocorticoid therapy , especially in adolescent and young adult patient .
multifactor cis-dominant negative regulation of il-2 gene expression in anergized t cell .
the molecular mechanism underlie il-2 transcriptional blockade in anergic t cell clone be not fully understand .
to examine whether an active negative regulatory process occur , we create a reporter construct contain a an enhancer four copy of the nf-at site and one copy of the octamer site ( 4x nf-at-oct ) .
this construct be only slightly reduce ( 1.3-fold ) in it expression when stimulate under anergic condition , while a whole mouse il-2 enhancer construct show a reduction of 4.3-fold .
addition of the -176 to -96 sequence to the 4x nf-at-oct construct do not impart the ability to be affect by anergy , but addition of the -236 to -96 sequence do , demonstrate that anergy be an active inhibitory process and that more than the presence of the -150 ap-1 binding site ( -152 to -147 ) be require to mediate the effect .
mutational study of the -236 to -96 sequence indicate that the presence of both the -130 ap-1-like site ( -187 to -181 ) and the -150 proximal ap-1 site be necessary to observe anergy .
because the -180 site be not require for trans-activation , it be possible to confirm by mutation in the normal mouse il-2 enhancer that this site be absolutely essential for anergy induction .
the simple model to explain these result be that anergy be mediate by a complex of multiple transcription factor that exert a cis-acting dominant negative regulatory effect on the trans-activation of the il-2 gene .
glucocorticoid receptor binding in three different cell type in major depressive disorder : lack of evidence of receptor binding defect .
1 .
in order to far understand the apparent glucocorticoid resistance in major depressive disorder , circadian variation in cortisol concentration , dexamethasone suppression and glucocorticoid receptor binding in mononuclear leukocyte , polymorphonuclear leukocyte and culture skin fibroblast be measure in rigidly define major depressive disorder patient and non-depressed psychiatric control .
2 .
mononuclear leukocyte bind to glucocorticoid correlate significantly with polymorphonuclear leukocyte bind to glucocorticoid , but both determination fail to differentiate major depressive disorder and control subject .
3 .
