initial and post- dexamethasone in vitro fibroblast bind to glucocorticoid be not different between major depressive disorder and non-depressed control subject .
4 .
the phenomenon of glucocorticoid resistance in major depressive disorder remain unexplained .
regulation of fas-ligand expression during activation-induced cell death in t lymphocyte via nuclear factor kappab .
t cell receptor engagement activate transcription factor important for cytokine gene regulation .
additionally , this signaling pathway also lead to activation-induced apoptosis in t lymphocyte that be dependent on fasl transcription and expression .
here we demonstrate that nuclear factor kappab ( nf-kappab ) , which be involve in the transcriptional regulation of many cytokine gene express in activate lymphocyte , also play a role in t cell activation-induced fasl expression .
inhibition of nf-kappab activity in a t cell hybridoma lead to decrease fasl expression and apoptosis upon t cell receptor stimulation .
we identify the nf-kappab site in the fasl promoter that contribute to such regulation .
co-expression of p65 ( rel a ) with the fasl promoter enhance it activity , and co-expression of ikappab dramatically inhibit the inducible promoter activity .
in contrast , the transcription factor ap-1 be not require for activation-induced fasl promoter activity .
these result define a role for nf-kappab in mediate fasl expression during t cell activation .
regulation of [ ca2+ ]i rise activate by doxepin-sensitive h1-histamine receptor in jurkat cell , clone human t lymphocyte .
to clarify the presence of histamine receptor and it transmembrane mechanism in human t lymphocyte , we investigate the effect of agonist or antagonist of histamine receptor subtypes and bacterial toxin on intracellular concentration of ca2+ [ ca2+ ]i ) , [3h]pyrilamine binding and c-fos mrna expression in jurkat cell , clone human t lymphocyte .
h1-agonists ( histamine and 2-methylhistamine ) cause a transient rise of [ ca2+ ] , and h1-antagonists ( pyrilamine and doxepin ) inhibit the histamine -induced [ ca2+ ]i rise more potently than the h2-antagonist ( cimetidine ) on the h3-antagonist ( impromidine ) .
binding parameter of [3h] pyrilamine binding be kd = 5.53 nm and bmax = 2 , 647 sites/cell .
pretreatment with b.pertussis , v.cholera. or c.botulinum toxin do not influence histamine -induced [ ca2+ ]i rise .
western blot analysis use antibody against subunit of gtp-binding protein indicate that gq/g11 richly exist in jurkat cell .
histamine induce mrna expression of an immediate early gene c-fos .
pretreatment with a protein kinase c activator , phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate , cause almost complete inhibition of histamine -induced [ ca2+ ]i rise , but do not do so by activator of camp- and cgmp- dependent protein kinase .
human interleukin-13 activate the interleukin-4-dependent transcription factor nf-il4 share a dna binding motif with an interferon-gamma-induced nuclear bind factor .
the effect of interleukin-13 ( il-13 ) and interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) on cellular function be show to be quite similar .
we provide evidence that in monocyte as well a in t lymphocyte both il-4 and il-13 activate the same recently identify transcription factor nf-il4 which bind to the specific responsive element il-4re .
in addition , we show that a nuclear factor activate by interferon-gamma also interact with the il-4re .
it differ from nf-il4 in the electrophoretic mobility of the complex with dna , in it dna-binding specificity and in the protein interact with the dna sequence .
sensitivity against various enzyme inhibitor suggest that component of the signal transduction pathway be share by all three cytokine .
rb and a novel e2f-1 binding protein in mhc class ii deficient b-cell line and normal ifn-gamma induction of the class il transactivator ciita in class ii non-inducible rb -defective tumor line .
the major histocompatibility ( mhc ) class ii gene encode cell surface protein that bind antigenic peptide for presentation to t-cells .
the class ii protein be express constitutively on b-cells and ebv- transformed b-cells , and be inducible by ifn-gamma on a wide variety of cell type .
retinoblastoma protein ( rb ) be a tumor suppressor and function a a transcriptional repressor by bind and inactivate the transactivator e2f-i .
rb -defective tumor line be non-inducible for mhc class ii by ifn-gamma , or very weakly inducible , but transfection of 2 different line with rb expression vector re-establishes or substantially enhance class ii inducibility .
therefore , we examine the rb status of a series of b-cell mutant that be defective in class ii expression , generate either in vitro or derive from bare lymphocyte syndrome ( bls ) patient .
nuclear matrix-bound rb be detectable in all case , indicate that loss of rb be not responsible for decrease class ii expression in these line .
a second e2f-i binding protein , most likely dp-i , be also apparently normal in both class ii-positive and -negative b-cell line .
we also examine the ifn-gamma induction of ciita in rb -defective line .
ciita be a class ii gene transactivator know to be defective in one form of bls and to be require for the induction of mhc class ii by ifn-gamma .
ciita mrna be normally inducible by ifn-gamma in class ii non-inducible , rb -defective line , and in one line , re-expression of rb have no effect on ciita mrna induction level .
thus , the block in mhc class ii inducibility in rb -defective cell be not due to a block in ciita inducibility .
identification of a herpesvirus saimiri cis-acting dna fragment that permit stable replication of episome in transform t cell .
herpesvirus saimiri be a lymphotropic herpesvirus capable of immortalize and transform t cell both in vitro and in vivo .
immortalize and transform t cell harbor several copy of the viral genome a a persisting genome .
the mapping of the cis-acting genetic cis-acting segment ( orip ) require for viral episomal maintenance be report here .
viral dna fragment that potentially contain orip be clone into a plasmid that contain the hygromycin resistance gene .
after several round of subcloning follow by transfection , orip be map to a 1.955-kb viral segment .
this viral fragment permit stable plasmid replication without deletion or rearrangement as well a episomal maintenance without integration or recombination .
the function of orip depend on a trans-acting factor ( s ) encode by the viral genome .
the 1.955-kb viral segment include a dyad symmetry region located between two small nuclear rna gene and be located upstream of the dihydrofolate reductase gene homolog .
therefore , this orip contain novel element distinct from those of other dna virus .
characterization of the human gene encoding lbr , an integral protein of the nuclear envelope inner membrane .
we have characterize the human gene encoding lbr , an integral protein of the nuclear envelope inner membrane .
restriction mapping show that the transcription unit span approximately 35 kilobases .
a transcription start site be located approximately 4 kilobases 5' to the translation initiation codon , and an rna splice of 3863 base occur in the 5'-untranslated region to generate mature hela cell mrna .
5' to the identify transcription start site be two ccaat sequence and potential recognition site for several transcription factor include sp1 , ap-1 , ap-2 , and nf-kb .
there be 13 protein coding exon in the lbr gene .
lbr 's nucleoplasmic domain be encode by exon 1-4 , and it hydrophobic domain , with eight putative transmembrane segment , be encode by exon 5-13 .
the hydrophobic domain be homologous to three yeast polypeptide , suggest that this high eukaryotic gene could have evolve from recombination between a gene that encode a soluble nuclear protein and a membrane protein gene similar to those in yeast .
these result be the first to demonstrate the structural organization of a vertebrate gene encode an integral membrane protein of the nuclear envelope that may be a member of a family of polypeptide conserve in evolution .
generation of cd1+relb+ dendritic cell and tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase-positive osteoclast-like multinucleated giant cell from human monocyte .
we previously show that granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) and macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( m-csf ) stimulate the differentiation of human monocyte into two phenotypically distinct type of macrophage .
however , in vivo , not only csf but also many other cytokine be produce under various condition .
those cytokine may modulate the differentiation of monocyte by csfs .
in the present study , we show that cd14+ adherent human monocyte can differentiate into cd1+relb+ dendritic cell ( dc ) by the combination of gm-csf plus interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) and that they differentiate into tartrate-resistant acid phosphatase ( trap ) -positive osteoclast-like multinucleated giant cell ( mgc ) by the combination of m-csf plus il-4 .
however , the monocyte-derived dc be not terminally differentiate cell ; they could still convert to macrophage in response to m-csf .
tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) stimulate the terminal differentiation of the dc by downregulating the expression of the m-csf receptor , cfms mrna , and abort the potential to convert to macrophage .
in contrast to il-4 , interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) have no demonstrable effect on the differentiation of monocyte .
rather , ifn-gamma antagonize the effect of il-4 and suppress the dc and mgc formation induce by gm-csf + il-4 and m-csf + il-4 , respectively .
take together , these result provide a new aspect to our knowledge of monocyte differentiation and provide evidence that human monocyte be flexible in their differentiation potential and be precursor not only of macrophage but also of cd1+relb+dc and trap-positive mgc .
such a diverse pathway of monocyte differentiation may constitute one of the basic mechanism of immune regulation .
an il-2 response element in the human il-2 receptor alpha chain promoter be a composite element that bind stat5 , elf-1 , and a gata family protein .
expression of the human interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) receptor alpha chain gene be potently upregulated by it own ligand , il-2 .
in this study , we characterize an essential upstream il-2 response element that contain both consensus and non-consensus gas motif , two putative ets binding site ( eb ) , one of which overlap the consensus gas motif , and a gata motif , which overlap the non-consensus gas motif .
we demonstrate that although the individual component of this element do not respond to il-2 , together they form a composite element capable of confer il-2 responsiveness to a heterologous promoter .
multiple factor include stat5 , elf-1 , hmg-i(y) and gata family protein bind to the il-2 response element and mutation of any one of these bind site diminish the activity of this element .
an unidentified ets family protein bind to the eb overlap the consensus gas motif and appear to negatively regulate the human il-2r alpha promoter .
thus , il-2 -induced il-2r alpha promoter activity require a complex upstream element , which appear to contain bind site for both positive and negative regulatory factor .
interferon-gamma modulate the lipopolysaccharide -induced expression of ap-1 and nf-kappa b at the mrna and protein level in human monocyte .
interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) modulate the expression of several cytokine by human monocyte at the transcriptional level .
in view of these finding , we analyze the effect of ifn-gamma on the expression of different transcription factor in activate human monocyte .
priming of human monocyte with ifn-gamma result in the down regulation of c-fos and c-jun mrna in response to stimulation with lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) compare to the effect of lp alone .
not only be this effect observe at the mrna level , but activator protein-1 ( ap-1 ) dna binding capacity be affect as well , a strong reduction be observe in the lp -induced dna-binding activity of ap-1 in the presence of ifn-gamma .
lp -stimulated monocyte show an increase expression of p105 mrna , the precursor of the p50 subunit of the transcription factor nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , while no effect be notice on the expression of p65 mrna .
in contrast , ifn-gamma priming do not affect the expression of p105 transcript but enhance the expression of p65 mrna ( two-fold ) .
prim with ifn-gamma follow by lp stimulation result in a further increase in the expression of p65 mrna .
this be due to an increase in the half-life of p65 mrna ( 75 v 150 minute ) .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsas ) demonstrate that unstimulated monocyte predominantly express p50 nf-kappa b .
stimulation with lp or ifn-gamma result in the expression of p50 and p65 subunit , while the combination of ifn-gamma plus lp cause a further increase in the expression of nf-kappa b .
with western blotting , it be show that nuclear extract from monocyte contain p50 and p65 protein in response to lp and ifn-gamma stimulation .
however , the combined stimulation do not result in enhance p50 and p65 protein expression .
the effect of ifn-gamma on the transcription factor be specific , since no change be observe in the expression of nf-il-6 or i kappa b alpha , the inhibitor of nf-kappa b .
we conclude that the effect of ifn-gamma on the expression of the transcription factor ap-1 and nf-kappa b may be important for the modulatory effect of ifn-gamma on the cytokine expression in activate human monocyte .
induction of interleukin-12 p40 transcript by cd40 ligation via activation of nuclear factor-kappab .
interleukin-12 be produce in response to infection with bacteria or parasite or to bacterial constituent such a lp in monocytes/macrophages and dendritic cell , and also generate by the interaction between activate t cell and antigen-presenting cell via cd40 -cd40 ligand ( cd40l ) .
so far , transcriptional analysis of p40 have be carry out only use bacterial constituent such a lp a stimulus .
in the present study , we have characterize the transcriptional induction of p40 by cd40 ligation in a human b lymphoblastoid cell line , daudi , and a human acute monocytic leukemia cell line , thp-1 .
these cell , stimulate by an agonistic monoclonal antibody against cd40 or by transfection with a cd40l expression vector , secrete p40 and show enhance p40 mrna expression .
sequence analysis of the p40 promoter region identify two potential nuclear factor ( nf ) -kappab binding site conserve between mouse and human .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay reveal that the potential nf-kappab binding sequence which be located around 120 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site in murine and human p40 gene form an nf-kappab complex with nuclear extract from daudi cell stimulate by cd40 ligation .
moreover , transfection of daudi cell with the polymerized nf-kappab binding sequence ligate to a thymidine kinase /chloramphenicol acetyltransferase ( cat ) reporter plasmid greatly induce cat activity , but transfection with the polymerized mutate nf-kappab binding sequence do not .
these result suggest that the nf-kappab binding site located around 120 bp upstream of the transcription initiation site in murine and human p40 promoter region could be important for the p40 induction by cd40 ligation via activation of nf-kappab .
calcineurin mutant render t lymphocyte resistant to cyclosporin a .
the immunosuppressant cyclosporin a ( csa ) and fk506 have be widely use to prevent and treat graft rejection after human organ and tissue transplantation .
csa and fk506 associate with intracellular bind protein ( i.e. , csa with cyclophilin a and fk506 with fkbp12 ) to form protein/drug complex that suppress the immune system by prevent activation of t cell in response to antigen presentation .
the common target of csa and fk506 be calcineurin , a ca2+/calmodulin-regulated , serine/threonine-specific protein phosphatase that regulate the nuclear import of a transcription factor , nf-at , require for expression of t cell activation gene .
in previous study , we identify calcineurin mutation that block binding by the cyclophilin a /csa or fkbp12 /fk506 complex and thereby render yeast cell resistant to the antifungal effect of csa or fk506 .
in this report , we demonstrate that the corresponding mutation in murine calcineurin render the t cell receptor signal transduction cascade csa resistant in human jurkat t cell .
our finding support the recently determine calcineurin x-ray crystal structure , provide evidence that calcineurin be the only csa -sensitive component limit signaling from the t cell receptor to the nucleus , and suggest a mean to render cell and tissue resistant to the toxic side effect of csa and fk506 .
transcriptional activation and repression , two property of the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct-2a .
the lymphoid-specific transcription factor oct-2a contain two transcriptional activation domain which be located within the n-terminal and c-terminal region .
to study their differential activation property , we link the isolate effector domain to the gal4 dna-binding domain .
we have show that both activate region of oct-2a , isolate from their natural context , can activate transcription a promoter factor .
in contrast to the c-terminus , activation by the n-terminal domain be dependent on a yet unidentified factor ( s ) bind to the simian virus 40 enhancer .
the result obtain by duplication of activation domain or their mixed combination suggest that the domain be functionally independent .
however , activation from a remote position could only be achieve with the c-terminus of oct-2a in b cell .
in lymphoid cell , high activation level be observe , suggest that distinct b-cell-specific cofactor in concert with the effector domain of oct-2a might be involve in mediate transcription from proximal and remote position .
furthermore , we identify a repression domain at the n-terminus of oct-2a .
when transfer to a potent activator , transcriptional stimulation be inhibit efficiently .
these result underscore the modular structure of oct-2a with separable domain for activation and repression and suggest that oct-2a might have complex regulatory function in vivo .
isolation of a rel-related human cdna that potentially encode the 65-kd subunit of nf-kappa b [ publish erratum appear in science 1991 oct 4 ; 254 ( 5028 ) : 11 ]
a dna probe that span a domain conserve among the proto-oncogene c-rel , the drosophila morphogen dorsal , and the p50 dna binding subunit of nf-kappa b be generate from jurkat t cell complementary dna with the polymerase chain reaction ( pcr ) and degenerate oligonucleotides .
this probe be use to identify a rel-related complementary dna that hybridize to a 2.6-kilobase messenger rna present in human t and b lymphocyte .
in vitro transcription and translation of the complementary dna result in the synthesis of a protein with an apparent molecular size of 65 kilodaltons ( kd ) .
the translate protein show weak dna binding with a specificity for the kappa b bind motif .
this protein-dna complex comigrated with the complex obtain with the purify human p65 nf-kappa b subunit and binding be inhibit by i kappa b-alpha and -beta protein .
in addition , the 65-kd protein associate with the p50 subunit of nf-kappa b and the kappa b probe to form a complex with the same electrophoretic mobility a the nf-kappa b -dna complex .
therefore the rel-related 65-kd protein may represent the p65 subunit of the active nf-kappa b transcription factor complex .
inhibition of rat splenocyte proliferation with methylprednisolone : in vivo effect of liposomal formulation .
the effect of a liposomal formulation of methylprednisolone ( mpl ) on the inhibition of lymphocyte proliferation in spleen cell be investigate follow iv dosing in rat .
liposome do not alter the suppressive action of mpl when place in lymphocyte culture .
rat splenocytes be find to have great sensitivity to mpl ( ec50 = 7.9 nm ) than do human peripheral blood lymphocyte ( ec50 = 28 nm ) .
in vivo study in rat utilize 2 mg/kg iv bolus dos of liposomal mpl compare to drug in solution .
animal be sacrifice at various time post-dosing until 120 h , spleen be excise and , after incubation of lymphocyte with pha , splenocyte blastogenic response be assess by measure cellular incorporation of 3h-thymidine .
the suppressive effect of liposomal mpl in comparison with free drug be significantly prolonged ( > 120 h v < 18 h ) .
inhibition effect versus time be describe by a pharmacodynamic model use mpl concentration in plasma a an input function .
a nonlinear relationship be find between suppression of splenocyte proliferation and the concentration of bind glucocorticoid receptor in spleen .
only partial receptor occupancy accompany complete lymphocyte suppression .
the suppression of endogenous corticosterone in plasma for both treatment be similar with value from l- mpl rat return to baseline after 24 h .
these result demonstrate enhance efficacy of local immunosuppression by target spleen with liposomal mpl .
oct2 transactivation from a remote enhancer position require a b-cell-restricted activity .
previous cotransfection experiment have demonstrate that ectopic expression of the lymphocyte-specific transcription factor oct2 could efficiently activate a promoter contain an octamer motif .
oct2 expression be unable to stimulate a multimerized octamer enhancer element in hela cell , however .
we have test a variety of oct2 isoforms generate by alternative splicing for the capability to activate an octamer enhancer in nonlymphoid cell and a b-cell line .
our analysis show that several oct2 isoforms can stimulate from a remote position but that this stimulation be restricted to b cell .
this result indicate the involvement of either a b-cell-specific cofactor or a specific modification of a cofactor or the oct2 protein in oct2 -mediated enhancer activation .
mutational analysis indicate that the carboxy-terminal domain of oct2 be critical for enhancer activation .
moreover , this domain confer enhancing activity when fuse to the oct1 protein , which by itself be unable to stimulate from a remote position .
the glutamine-rich activation domain present in the amino-terminal portion of oct2 and the pou domain contribute only marginally to the transactivation function from a distal position .
expression of erythroid-specific gene in megakaryoblastic disorder .
currently available data indicate that erythroid and megakaryocytic differentiation pathway be closely related to each other , and there may exist progenitor cell common to those two lineage may exist .
acute megakaryoblastic leukemia ( aml-m7 ) and transient myeloproliferative disorder in down 's syndrome ( tmd ) be characterize by rapid growth of abnormal blast cell which express megakaryocytic marker .
these blast cell express lineage-specific transcription factor such a gata-1 common to these lineage and frequently express erythroid-specific mrna such a gamma-globin and erythroid delta-aminolevulinate synthase ( alas-e ) , indicate that most of the blast in m7 and tmd case have erythroid and megakaryocytic phenotype .
these result suggest that blast in m7 and tmd may correspond to progenitor of both erythroid and megakaryocytic lineage .
posttranscriptional regulation of macrophage tissue factor expression by antioxidant .
tissue factor ( tf ) expression by cell of monocyte/macrophage lineage represent an important mechanism underlie the initiation of fibrin deposition at site of extravascular inflammation .
recent evidence suggest a role for oxidant stress in the signalling pathway of various cell type by virtue of it ability to induce dna binding of various transcription factor , include nuclear factor kappa b and ap-1 .
the effect of antioxidant treatment on lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) -induced tf expression be examine in murine peritoneal macrophage and human monocyte .
both pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate , an oxidant scavenger , and n-acetyl-cysteine , a precursor of the endogenous antioxidant glutathione , inhibit stimulation of macrophage procoagulant activity by lp .
northern blot analysis show that neither of these agent reduce lp -stimulated tf mrna accumulation , thereby suggest a posttranscriptional mechanism for the effect .
immunofluorescence study of human monocyte use polyclonal anti- tf antibody show that n-acetyl-cysteine treatment prevent the characteristic plasmalemmal localization of tf antigen that occur in response to lp .
western blot analysis show that n-acetyl-cysteine reduce the accumulation of the 47-kd mature glycoprotein in lp -treated cell , a finding consistent with the result of the immunofluorescence study .
furthermore , these condition do not result in an accumulation of the less mature form of tf .
when consider together , these data suggest that antioxidant exert their effect by impair translation and/or by cause degradation of newly translate protein .
the effect of antioxidant on tumor necrosis factor appear to be specie specific , with no effect on lp -induced tumor necrosis factor in murine cell , but with inhibition in human monocyte .
the posttranscriptional effect of antioxidant on tf expression data suggest a novel mechanism whereby these agent might modulate monocyte /macrophage activation .
hmg box contain transcription factor in lymphocyte differentiation .
the identification of the mammalian sex-determining gene sry have lead to the discovery of a large family of related ( ' hmg box ' ) transcription factor that control developmental event in yeast , c. elegans , drosophila and vertebrate .
in lymphocyte differentiation , several hmg box protein play a decisive role .
sox-4 be important for very early b-cell differentiation , while tcf-1/lef-1 play a crucial role in early thymocyte development .
tcf/lef protein have recently be find to constitute a downstream component of the wingless/wnt signal transduction pathway .
in fly , this pathway control segment polarity ; in xenopus it control the definition of the body axis .
deregulation of the pathway occur in several human tumor .
these insights in the molecular event that be involve in tcf/lef function in these organism may eventually lead to the understanding of the function of these hmg box protein in lymphoid development
translocation breakpoints in three patient with campomelic dysplasia and autosomal sex reversal map more than 130 kb from sox9 .
campomelic dysplasia ( cmpd1 ) and autosomal xy sex reversal ( sra1 ) be cause by mutation in the sry-related gene sox9 on 17q .
unexpectedly , the 17q breakpoints in four cmpd1 translocation case previously analyze by u and others map 50 kb or more from sox9 .
here , we present clinical , cytogenetic , and molecular data from a new cmpd1 /sra1 patient with t(6;17)(q14;q24) .
fluorescence in situ hybridization have show that the 17q breakpoint in this case map to the same region a the breakpoints in the other translocation case , at least 130 kb from sox9 .
likewise , the breakpoints in two of the previously describe case also map more than 130 kb and , a show by pulsed field gel electrophoresis analysis , at most 400 kb or 690 kb from sox9 .
by use a sox9 coding sequence polymorphism , expression of both sox9 allele have be demonstrate by the reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction in lymphoblastoid cell from one of the translocation case .
the role of the ikaros gene in lymphocyte development and homeostasis .
the ikaros gene , which encode a family of hemopoietic-specific zinc finger protein , be describe a a central regulator of lymphocyte differentiation .
during fetal development , it be require at the early stage of t cell and b cell specification .
in the adult , however , lymphoid lineage rely on ikaros at distinct phase of their development .
it activity be essential for the generation of b cell but not of t cell precursor , although the differentiation of the latter be not normal .
a significant increase in cd4 thymocytes and their immediate precursor be detect , and because these cell lack marker that correlate with positive selection , a deregulation in their maturation process be suggest .
furthermore , ikaros-null thymocytes hyperproliferate in response to t cell receptor ( tcr ) signaling ; within day after their appearance in the thymus , clonally expand population be detect .
deregulated tcr -mediated response and the fast kinetics of tumor development in these mutant thymocytes implicate ikaros a a central tumor suppressor gene for the t cell lineage .
in addition , lack of natural killer cell and selective defect in gamma delta t cell and dendritic antigen-presenting cell point to ikaros a an essential factor for the establishment of early branchpoints of the t cell pathway .
the dominant interference activity of ikaros isoforms unable to bind dna and their effect in lymphocyte development suggest that ikaros work in concert with other factor .
the role of aiolos , a lymphoid-restricted and structurally related gene , in lymphoid differentiation be discuss .
a model be propose that define ikaros a the backbone of a complex regulatory protein network that control cell fate decision and regulate homeostasis in the hemo-lymphoid system .
change in this regulatory network may reflect differentiation and proliferation adjustment make in hemo-lymphoid progenitor and precursor a they give rise to the cell of our immune system .
nuclear factor-il6 activate the human il-4 promoter in t cell .
positive regulatory element i ( pre-i ) be a strong enhancer element essential for expression of the human il-4 gene .
to identify transcription factor bind to pre-i , we screen a cdna expression library from jurkat t cell and isolate a cdna encoding nuclear factor ( nf ) -il6 ( also know a c/ebp beta ) .
nf-il6 mrna be find in human jurkat t cell and in the mouse th2 clone d10 , but not in th1 clone 29 .
rnf-il6 express in bacteria be show to specifically bind to pre-i .
pre-i form multiple dna-protein complex with nuclear extract from jurkat cell .
some of these complex be demonstrate to contain nf-il6 by use anti- c/ebp beta ab .
overexpression of nf-il6 enhance expression of the chloramphenicol acetyl transferase reporter gene link to the pre-i -thymidine kinase or the human il-4 promoter more than 10-fold in jurkat cell .
promoter deletion study reveal two additional nf-il6 binding site located at position -44 to -36 ( c/ebp proximal ) and -87 to -79 ( c/ebp medial ) , respectively .
our result demonstrate that nf-il6 be involve in transcriptional activation of the human il-4 promoter in t cell .
activation of distinct transcription factor in neutrophil by bacterial lp , interferon-gamma , and gm-csf and the necessity to overcome the action of endogenous protease .
human neutrophil can be induce to actively transcribe a number of early-response gene , in particular those encode cytokine , chemokines , and the high-affinity surface receptor for igg , fcgammari .
although little be know to date about the regulation of gene transcription in neutrophil , several indication point to a role for distinct transcription factor , such a member of the nf-kappab and stat family .
in this study , we investigate whether these transcription factor become activate under stimulatory condition which be know to induce gene transcription in neutrophil .
unexpectedly , we find that conventional procedure employ to prepare cellular extract cause the release of proteolytic activity that be normally store in intracellular granule , result in the degradation of various nf-kappab /rel and stat protein .
to circumvent this problem , we develop an alternative procedure which allow u to show that in neutrophil , lp and tnfalpha induce a nf-kappab dna-binding activity which essentially consist of p50/rela dimer , and that ifngamma promote the binding of stat1 homodimers to the ifngamma response region of the fcgammari promoter .
moreover , we report that neutrophil stimulation with gm-csf result in the formation of a stat5 -containing dna-binding activity .
collectively , the current finding open new perspective about mechanism that be likely to regulate gene transcription in neutrophil .
in addition , the procedure describe herein could prove useful in other cell type that express high level of endogenous protease .
structural and functional characterization of the human cd36 gene promoter : identification of a proximal pebp2/cbf site .
cd36 be a cell surface glycoprotein compose of a single polypeptide chain , which interact with thrombospondin , collagen type i and iv , oxidize low density lipoprotein , fatty acid , anionic phospholipid , and erythrocyte parasitized with plasmodium falciparum .
it expression be restricted to a few cell type , include monocyte/macrophages .
in these cell , cd36 be involve in phagocytosis of apoptotic cell , and foam cell formation by uptake of oxidize low density lipoprotein .
to study the molecular mechanism that control the transcription of the cd36 gene in monocytic cell we have isolate and analyze the cd36 promoter .
transient expression experiment of 5'-deletion fragment of the cd36 promoter couple to luciferase demonstrate that as few a 158 base pair upstream from the transcription initiation site be sufficient to direct the monocyte-specific transcription of the reporter gene .
within the above region , the fragment spanning nucleotide -158 to -90 be require for optimal transcription in monocytic cell .
biochemical analysis of the region -158/-90 reveal a bind site for transcription factor of the polyomavirus enhancer-binding protein 2/core-binding factor ( pebp2/cbf ) family at position -103 .
disruption of the pebp2/cbf site markedly diminish the role of the pebp2/cbf factor in the constitutive transcription of the cd36 gene .
the involvement of member of the pebp2/cbf family in chromosome translocation associate with acute myeloid leukemia , and in the transcriptional regulation of the myeloid-specific gene encode for myeloperoxidase , elastase , and the colony-stimulating factor receptor , highlight the relevance of the regulation of the cd36 gene promoter in monocytic cell by member of the pebp2/cbf family .
the hematopoietic transcription factor pu.1 be downregulated in human multiple myeloma cell line .
pu.1 be a hematopoietic transcription factor belong to the ets-family .
it be identical to the spi-1 oncogene , which be implicate in spleen focus-forming virus-induced murine erythroleukemias .
pu.1 seem to be require for early development of multiple hematopoietic lineage , but it expression in mature cell be preferentially observe in cell of the b-cell-and monocyte/macrophage- differentiation lineage .
it bind the so-called pu box , an important tissue-specific regulatory dna element present in a number of gene express in these cell lineage .
we have analyze the expression and activity of pu.1 during human b-cell development use a panel of b-cell line represent different stage of maturation , from early precursor to differentiate plasma cell .
pu.1 mrna expression and pu.1 dna binding activity , a measure by northern blot analysis and electrophoretic mobility shift assay , respectively , be evident in cell line represent pro-b , pre-b , and mature b cell .
we could also show pu box -dependent transactivation of a reporter gene in transient transfections in these cell line .
in contrast , in a number of multiple myeloma cell line , represent differentiate , plasma cell-like b cell , pu.1 dna binding activity , mrna expression , and pu box -dependent transactivation be absent or detectable at a very low level .
in lymphoblastoid cell line , which exemplify an intermediate stage of b-cell differentiation , a reduce expression and activity be observe .
the finding in the human multiple myeloma cell line represent the first example of b cell with downregulated pu.1 expression and apparently contradict observation in the murine system in which pu.1 be express and active in plasmacytoma cell line .
at present , it be unclear whether the lack of pu.1 expression and activity in human multiple myeloma cell line represent a malignancy-associated defect in these cell or exemplify a normal developmental regulation in terminally differentiate b cell .
induction of monocytic differentiation and nf-kappa b -like activity by human immunodeficiency virus 1 infection of myelomonoblastic cell .
the effect of human immunodeficiency virus 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection on cellular differentiation and nf-kappa b dna binding activity have be investigate in a new model of myeloid differentiation .
plb-985 cell represent a bipotential myelomonoblastic cell population capable of either granulocytic or monocytic differentiation after induction with appropriate inducer .
by virtue of the presence of cd4 on the cell surface , plb-985 cell be chronically infect with hiv-1 strain iiib .
plb-iiib cell clearly possess a more monocytic phenotype than the parental myeloblast , a determine by differential staining , increase expression of the myeloid-specific surface marker , and transcription of the c-fms proto-oncogene .
nf-kappa b binding activity be inducible by tumor necrosis factor and phorbol myristate acetate in plb-985 .
however , in plb-iiib cell , constitutive expression of a novel nf-kappa b complex be detect , compose of protein range between 70 and 110 kd .
these protein interact specifically with the symmetric nf-kappa b site from the interferon beta ( ifn-beta ) promoter .
mutation affect the 5' guanine residue of the kappa b site be unable to compete for these nf-kappa b -related protein .
inducibility of endogenous ifn-beta and ifn-alpha rna be also increase in plb-iiib cell .
these study indicate that hiv-1 infection of myelomonoblastic cell may select for a more mature monocytic phenotype and that unique subunit association of nf-kappa b dna binding protein may contribute to differential nf-kappa b -mediated gene expression .
opposite effect of the acute promyelocytic leukemia pml-retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar alpha ) and plzf-rar alpha fusion protein on retinoic acid signalling .
fusion protein involve the retinoic acid receptor alpha ( rar alpha ) and the pml or plzf nuclear protein be the genetic marker of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apls ) .
apls with the pml-rar alpha or the plzf-rar alpha fusion protein be phenotypically indistinguishable except that they differ in their sensitivity to retinoic acid ( ra ) -induced differentiation : pml-rar alpha blast be sensitive to ra and patient enter disease remission after ra treatment , while patient with plzf-rar alpha do not .
we here report that ( i ) like pml-rar alpha expression , plzf-rar alpha expression block terminal differentiation of hematopoietic precursor cell line ( u937 and hl-60 ) in response to different stimulus ( vitamin d3 , transform growth factor beta1 , and dimethyl sulfoxide ) ; ( ii ) pml-rar alpha , but not plzf-rar alpha , increase ra sensitivity of hematopoietic precursor cell and restore ra sensitivity of ra-resistant hematopoietic cell ; ( iii ) pml-rar alpha and plzf-rar alpha have similar ra binding affinity ; and ( iv ) pml-rar alpha enhance the ra response of ra target gene ( those for rar beta , rar gamma , and transglutaminase type ii [ tgase ] ) in vivo , while plzf-rar alpha expression have either no effect ( rar beta ) or an inhibitory activity ( rar gamma and type ii tgase ) .
these data demonstrate that pml-rar alpha and plzf-rar alpha have similar ( inhibitory ) effect on ra-independent differentiation and opposite ( stimulatory or inhibitory ) effect on ra -dependent differentiation and that they behave in vivo a ra -dependent enhancer or inhibitor of ra -responsive gene , respectively .
their different activity on the ra signalling pathway might underlie the different response of pml-rar alpha and plzf-rar alpha apls to ra treatment .
the plzf-rar alpha fusion protein contain an approximately 120-amino-acid n-terminal motif ( call the poz domain ) , which be also find in a variety of zinc finger protein and a group of poxvirus protein and which mediate protein-protein interaction .
deletion of the plzf poz domain partially abrogate the inhibitory effect of plzf-rar alpha on ra-induced differentiation and on ra-mediated type ii tgase up-regulation , suggest that poz-mediated protein interaction might be responsible for the inhibitory transcriptional activity of plzf-rar alpha .
severe 5-fluorouracil toxicity secondary to dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase deficiency .
a potentially more common pharmacogenetic syndrome .
this study describe the inheritance of a defect in pyrimidine catabolism and it association with drug-induced toxicity in a patient receive 5-fluorouracil ( fura ) a adjuvant chemotherapy for breast carcinoma .
the study population include the affect patient ( proband ) , nine of her blood relative , and seven healthy volunteer .
the activity of dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase ( dpd ) , the initial enzyme of pyrimidine ( and fura ) catabolism , in peripheral blood mononuclear cell be measure in each subject by a specific radiometric assay use fura a the substrate .
the proband have no detectable dpd activity .
when enzyme level in the proband and relative be compare with that in control , an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance be demonstrate .
this be the third patient with severe fura toxicity secondary to an alteration in pyrimidine catabolism and the second from our clinic population suggest that the frequency of this genetic defect may be great than previously think .
monitor dpd activity may be important in the management of patient experience severe toxicity secondary to fura chemotherapy .
switch gear during t-cell maturation : rantes and late transcription .
although much be understand about the induction of gene express early ( within 24 h ) after t-cell activation , little be know about the regulation of expression of gene express ' late ' ( three or more day ) post-stimulation .
a good understanding of transcriptional regulation at this important stage of t-cell maturation may yield new insight into t-cell development and new immunotherapeutic target .
the role of rel/ nf-kappa b protein in viral oncogenesis and the regulation of viral transcription .
rel /nf-kappa b be a ubiquitous transcription factor that consist of multiple polypeptide subunit , and be subject to complex regulatory mechanism that involve protein-protein interaction , phosphorylation , ubiquitination , proteolytic degradation , and nucleocytoplasmic translocation .
the sophisticated control of rel /nf-kappa b activity be not surprising since this transcription factor be involve in a wide array of cellular response to extracellular cue , associate with growth , development , apoptosis , and pathogen invasion .
thus , it be not unexpected that this versatile cellular homeostatic switch would be affect by a variety of viral pathogen , which have evolve mechanism to utilize various aspect of rel /nf-kappa b activity to facilitate their replication , cell survival and possibly evasion of immune response .
this review will cover the molecular mechanism that be utilize by mammalian oncogenic virus to affect the activity of rel/ nf-kappa b transcription factor and the role of rel /nf-kappa b in the regulation of viral gene expression and replication .
danazol decrease transcription of estrogen receptor gene in human monocyte .
1. administration of danazol for over one month reduce the level of estrogen receptor ( er ) and it mrna to approximately 50 and 20 % , respectively in monocyte .
2. danazol do not alter the degradation rate of er mrna in monocyte .
3. danazol decrease the transcription rate of er gene to approximately 50 % in monocyte in a run-on assay .
4. danazol may release estrogen predominance via the reduction of transcription for er gene , which lead to the reduction of er mrna and er expression in monocyte .
target degradation of c-fos , but not v-fos , by a phosphorylation-dependent signal on c-jun .
the proto-oncogene product c-fos and c-jun heterodimerize through their leucine zipper to form the ap-1 transcription factor .
the transcriptional activity of the heterodimer be regulate by signal-dependent phosphorylation and dephosphorylation event .
the stability of c-fos be find to also be control by intracellular signal transduction .
in transient expression and in vitro degradation experiment , the stability of c-fos be decrease when the protein be dimerized with phosphorylated c-jun .
c-jun protein isolate from phorbol ester-induced cell do not target c-fos for degradation , which suggest that c-fos be transiently stabilize after stimulation of cell growth .
v-fos protein , the retroviral counterpart of c-fos , be not susceptible to degradation target by c-jun .
effect of alpha-lipoic acid and dihydrolipoic acid on expression of proto-oncogene c-fos .
the transcription factor ap-1 be an important human mediator of the cellular response to serum , growth factor , and phorbol ester such a 12-o-tetradecanoyl-phorbol-13 acetate ( tpa ) .
the ap-1 complex consist of distinct protein heterodimers encode by the proto-oncogene c-fos and c-jun mrna whose gene expression can be induce by tpa , cyclic amp and growth factor .
recent finding suggest an involvement of reactive oxygen specie in the pathway of tpa and protein kinase c lead to expression of c-fos and c-jun mrna .
to investigate the role of reactive oxygen specie we study the effect of alpha-lipoic acid and dihydrolipoic acid ( natural thiol antioxidant ) on the expression of c-fos mrna in human jurkat t cell .
when cell be preincubated with dihydrolipoic acid ( 0.2 mm ) the expression of c-fos mrna be suppress at 30 min after stimulation of tpa ( 0.5 microm ) whereas in the case of preincubation of alpha-lipoic acid ( 0.2 microm ) , the expression be enhance at 30 min .
these study support the idea that superoxide anion radical play a role in the expression of c-fos mrna .
generation of cytotoxic t lymphocyte against immunorecessive epitope after multiple immunization with adenovirus vector be dependent on haplotype .
currently , adenovirus ( ad ) be be consider a a vector for the treatment of cystic fibrosis as well a other disease .
however , the cytotoxic t lymphocyte ( ctl ) response to ad could limit the effectiveness of such approach .
since the ctl response to virus infection be often focus on one or a few immunodominant epitope , one approach to circumvent this response be to create vector that lack these immunodominant epitope .
the effectiveness of this approach be test by immunize mouse with human group c adenovirus .
three mouse strain ( c57bl/10snj [ h-2b ] , c3heb/fej [ h-2k ] , and balb/cbyj [ h-2d ] ) be immunize with wild-type ad or ad vector lack the immunodominant antigen ( s ) , and the ctl response be measure .
in c57bl/10 ( b10 ) mouse , a single inoculation intraperitoneally ( i.p. ) lead to the recognition of an immunodominant antigen in e1a .
when b10 mouse be inoculate multiple time either i.p.
or intranasally with wild-type ad or an ad vector lack most of the e1 region , subdominant epitope outside this region be recognize .
in contrast , c3h mouse inoculate with wild-type ad recognize an epitope map within e1b . when inoculate twice with ad vector lack both e1a and e1b , no immunorecessive epitope be recognize .
the immune response to ad in balb/c mouse be more complex .
ctls from balb/c mouse inoculate i.p. with wild-type ad recognize e1b in the context of the major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class i dd allele and a region outside e1 associate with the kd allele .
when balb/c mouse be inoculate with e1 -deleted ad vector , only the immunodominant kd-restricted epitope be recognize , and dd-restricted ctls do not develop .
this report indicate that the emergence of ctls against immunorecessive epitope follow multiple administration of ad vector lack immunodominant antigen be dependent on haplotype and could present an obstacle to gene therapy in an mhc -diverse human population .
abnormality of oct-1 dna binding in t cell from sjogren 's syndrome patient .
primary sjogren 's syndrome ( s ) be an autoimmune rheumatic disease characterize by t cell hypoactivity .
to understand the diminish t cell response to activation signal , we measure nucleoprotein dna-binding activity regulate gene expression during t cell activation use the electrophoretic mobility shift assay .

moreover , defective dna binding be correct by treatment with acid phosphatase .
response to intranasal fluticasone propionate in perennial allergic rhinitis not associate with glucocorticoid receptor characteristic .
background : the reduction of symptom due to treatment with corticosteroid vary among patient with perennial rhinitis .
most patient will respond but a few patient respond less to these drug .
objective : to investigate the association in reduction of symptom due to glucocorticoid and glucocorticoid receptor characteristic in patient with perennial allergic rhinitis , in vitro glucocorticoid receptor binding study be perform with peripheral blood mononuclear cell use dexamethasone and in vitro production of mediator be measure .
method : during a double-blind placebo-controlled crossover study , 200 microgram fluticasone propionate aqueous nasal spray ( in the active treatment period ) and placebo ( in the placebo treatment period ) be administer twice daily for 2 week to 22 patient allergic to house dust mite .
at the end of both treatment period symptom be score after allergen provocation ( 100 , 1000 , 10000 bu/ml ) and during the 9.5 hour after this challenge .
receptor binding study with dexamethasone be perform with peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
leukotriene b4 produce by monocyte in vitro and soluble interleukin-2 receptor release by lymphocyte in vitro and cortisol level in plasma be determine .

also no significant partial correlation of the level of leukotriene b4 ( 45.6 +/- 105.3 ng/10(6) cell ) produce by monocyte in vitro , soluble interleukin-2 receptor ( 734 +/- 237 ng/10(6) cell ) release by lymphocyte in vitro and cortisol level ( 571 +/- 236 ng/ml ) in plasma with the symptom score after active treatment be find .
conclusion : the reduction of symptom due to topical fluticasone propionate in patient with rhinitis and allergy to house dust mite be not correlate with the characteristic of the glucocorticoid receptor .
regulation of sialoadhesin expression on rat macrophage .
induction by glucocorticoid and enhancement by ifn-beta , ifn-gamma , il-4 , and lipopolysaccharide .
sialoadhesin be a macrophage-restricted member of the ig superfamily that mediate adhesion with lymphoid and myeloid cell .
it be express on a subpopulation of macrophage in lymphoid tissue and in chronic inflammation ( e.g. , during autoimmune disease ) .
we have study the regulation of sialoadhesin expression in vitro and show that glucocorticoid ( gc ) induce sialoadhesin expression on freshly isolate rat macrophage and the rat macrophage cell line r2 .
the cytokine ifn-beta , ifn-gamma , il-4 , and lp , although unable to induce sialoadhesin expression by themselves , be able to enhance gc -mediated induction of sialoadhesin .
sialoadhesin expression be functional a show by cell adhesion assay with human rbc .
northern blot experiment indicate that regulation predominantly occur at the mrna level .
comparison of the different combination of gc and cytokine /lps reveal difference in the level of gc -dependent enhancement of sialoadhesin expression , with ifn-beta and il-4 be more potent than ifn-gamma and lp .
moreover , the effect of ifn-gamma and lp could be reproduce by priming , whereas ifn-beta and il-4 be require simultaneously with gc .
the regulation of sialoadhesin expression be mediate by the gc receptor , and not by mineralocorticoid receptor , a show by inhibition experiment with specific antagonist .
finally , it be demonstrate that macrophage in the adrenal gland , the major site of endogenous gc production , express sialoadhesin .
this study demonstrate that gc act a a primary inducer of sialoadhesin expression on rat macrophage , and that the response can be enhance by ifn-beta , t cell-derived cytokine , or lp .
stimulation of b and t cell activate expression of transcription and differentiation factor .

suppression by azelastine hydrochloride of nf-kappa b activation involve in generation of cytokine and nitric oxide .
the influence of the anti-allergy agent azelastine hydrochloride ( azeptin ) on nf-kappa b activation associate with the generation of cytokine and nitric oxide ( no ) be investigate in various kind of human and mouse cell .
azeptin dose-dependently suppress both dna and protein synthesis in human gingival fibroblast ( hf ) and also suppress blastogenesis of human peripheral blood lymphocyte ( pbl ) . generation of tumor necrosis factor-alpha , interleukin 1-beta , granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor and interleukin-6 from 10(-5) m azeptin -treated pbl and human monocyte ( hm ) be decrease to approximately 1/3 to 2/3 of the control level .
in parallel with the decrease cytokine generation , each cytokine mrna be less express in the presence of 10(-5) m azeptin .
in addition , both inducible nitric oxide synthase -mrna level and no generation in mouse peritoneal macrophage be suppress by 10(-5) m azeptin .
be compatible with those result , azeptin ( 10(-5) m ) suppress activation of nf-kappa b in pbl , hm and hf .
these result appear to indicate that suppression of cytokine and no generation by azeptin result at least partially from the inhibition of nf-kappa b activation .
thrombin generation by apoptotic vascular smooth muscle cell .
thrombin activation require assembly of a prothrombinase complex of activate coagulation factor on an anionic phospholipid surface , classically provide by activate platelet .
we have previously show that anionic phosphatidylserine be expose by rat vascular smooth muscle cell ( vsmcs ) undergo apoptosis after serum withdrawal .
in this study , use a chromogenic assay , we have show thrombin generation by apoptotic vsmcs express c-myc ( vsmc-myc ) with an area under the thrombin -generation curve ( auc ) of 305 +/- 17 nmol x min/l and a peak thrombin ( pt ) of 154 +/- 9 nmol/l .
the thrombin -generating potential of the apoptotic vsmc-myc cell be great than that of unactivated platelet ( p = .003 for auc ; p = .0002 for pt ) and similar to calcium-ionophore activate platelet ( auc of 332 +/- 15 nmol x min/l , p = .3 ; pt of 172 +/- 8 nmol/l , p = .2 ) .
thrombin activation be also see with apoptotic human vsmcs ( auc of 211 +/- 8 nmol x min/l ; pt of 103 +/- 4 nmol/l ) and be inhibit by annexin v ( p < .0001 for auc and pt ) .
vsmc-myc cell maintain in serum generate less thrombin than after serum withdrawal ( p = .0002 for auc and pt ) .
vsmcs derive from human coronary atherosclerotic plaque that apoptose even in serum also generate thrombin ( auc of 260 +/- 2 nmol x min/l ; pt of 128 +/- 4 nmol/l ) .
we conclude that apoptotic vsmcs possess a significant thrombin -generating capacity secondary to phosphatidylserine exposure .
apoptotic cell within atherosclerotic plaque may allow local thrombin activation , thereby contribute to disease progression .
separation of oxidant-initiated and redox-regulated step in the nf-kappa b signal transduction pathway .
study present here show that overall nf-kappa b signal transduction begin with a parallel series of stimuli-specific pathway through which cytokine ( tumor necrosis factor alpha ) , oxidant ( hydrogen peroxide and mitomycin c ) , and phorbol ester ( phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate ) individually initiate signaling .
these initial pathway culminate in a common pathway through which all of the stimulate agent ultimately signal nf-kappa b activation .
we distinguish the stimuli-specific pathway by show that the oxidative stimulus trigger nf-kappa b activation in only one of two human t-cell line ( wurzburg but not jurkat ) , whereas tumor necrosis factor alpha and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate readily stimulate in both line .
we propose the common pathway a the simple way of accounting for the common requirement and property of the signaling pathway .
we include a redox-regulatory mechanism ( s ) in this common pathway to account for the previously demonstrate redox regulation of nf-kappa b activation in jurkat cell ( in which oxidant do n't activate nf-kappa b ) ; we put tyrosine phosphorylation in the common pathway by show that kinase activity ( inhibitable by herbimycin a and tyrphostin 47 ) be require for nf-kappa b activation by all stimulus test in both cell line .
since internal site of oxidant production have be show to play a key role in the cytokine -stimulated activation of nf-kappa b , and since tyrosine kinase and phosphatase activity be know to be alter by oxidant , these finding suggest that intracellular redox status control nf-kappa b activation by regulate tyrosine phosphorylation event ( s ) within the common step of the nf-kappa b signal transduction pathway .
the role of caspase in t cell development and the control of immune response .
apoptosis be responsible for the removal of potentially autoreactive or useless t cell during thymic selection and activate t cell in the periphery .
specific family of receptor , kinase , transcription factor , and cysteine protease , term caspase , be involve in the apoptotic cascade lead to proteolysis of specific substrate and to morphological change associate with program cell death .
although common member of the apoptotic cascade be share between different cell type , it appear that cell-specific factor can influence the response to a given apoptotic stimulus .
characterization and understanding of the basic mechanism involve in the different pathway protect or lead to cell death may provide novel way to control inappropriate apoptosis involve in several disease .
human t-cell leukemia virus type i tax activation of nf-kappa b /rel involve phosphorylation and degradation of i kappa b alpha and rela ( p65 ) -mediated induction of the c-rel gene .
the tax gene product of human t-cell leukemia virus type i ( htlv-i ) be a potent transcriptional activator that both stimulate viral gene expression and activate an array of cellular gene involve in t-cell growth .
tax act indirectly by induce or modify the action of various host transcription factor , include member of the nf-kappa b /rel family of enhancer-binding protein .
in rest t cell , many of these nf-kappa b /rel factor be sequester in the cytoplasm by various ankyrin-rich inhibitory protein , include i kappa b alpha .
htlv-i tax expression lead to the constitutive nuclear expression of biologically active nf-kappa b and c-rel complex ; however , the biochemical mechanism ( s ) underlie this response remain poorly understand .
in this study , we demonstrate that tax -stimulated nuclear expression of nf-kappa b in both htlv-i -infected and tax -transfected human t cell be associate with the phosphorylation and rapid proteolytic degradation of i kappa b alpha .
in contrast to prior in vitro study , at least a fraction of the phosphorylated form of i kappa b alpha remain physically associate with the nf-kappa b complex in vivo but be subject to rapid degradation , thereby promote the nuclear translocation of the active nf-kappa b complex .
we far demonstrate that tax induction of nuclear c-rel expression be activate by the rela ( p65 ) subunit of nf-kappa b , which activate transcription of the c-rel gene through an intrinsic kappa b enhancer element .
in normal cell , the subsequent accumulation of nuclear c-rel act to inhibit it own continued production , indicate the presence of an autoregulatory loop .

a novel transcription factor regulate expression of the vacuolar h+-atpase b2 subunit through ap-2 site during monocytic differentiation .
during monocyte-to-macrophage differentiation , the cellular content of vacuolar h+-atpase ( v-atpase ) increase more than 4-fold .
we have show previously that amplify expression of the b2 subunit of the v-atpase occur solely by increase transcription , and that the 5'-untranslated region of the b2 gene , contain multiple consensus binding site for the transcription factor ap-2 and sp1 , be require for this expression .

these finding suggest that a novel ap-2 -like transcription factor be responsible for v-atpase b subunit amplification during monocyte differentiation .
targeted disruption of the myd88 gene result in loss of il-1- and il-18- mediated function .

mouse generate by gene targeting to lack myd88 have defect in t cell proliferation as well a induction of acute phase protein and cytokine in response to il-1 .

furthermore , il-18 -induced activation of nf-kappab and c-jun n-terminal kinase ( jnk ) be block in myd88 -/- th1-developing cell .
take together , these result demonstrate that myd88 be a critical component in the signaling cascade that be mediate by il-1 receptor as well a il-18 receptor .
induction of the pou domain transcription factor oct-2 during t-cell activation by cognate antigen .
oct-2 be a transcription factor that bind specifically to octamer dna motif in the promoter of immunoglobulin and interleukin-2 gene .
all tumor cell line from the b-cell lineage and a few from the t-cell lineage express oct-2 .

transcriptional regulation of the gene encode the human c-type lectin leukocyte receptor aim/cd69 and functional characterization of it tumor necrosis factor-alpha -responsive element .
the human activation antigen cd69 be a member of the c-type animal lectin superfamily that function a a signal-transmitting receptor .
although the expression of cd69 can be induce in vitro on cell of most hematopoietic lineage with a wide variety of stimulus , in vivo it be mainly express by t- lymphocyte located in the inflammatory infiltrates of several human disease .
to elucidate the mechanism that regulate the constitutive and inducible expression of cd69 by leukocyte , we isolate the promoter region of the cd69 gene and carry out it functional characterization .
sequence analysis of the 5'-flanking region of the cd69 gene reveal the presence of a potential tata element 30 base pair upstream of the major transcription initiation site and several putative binding sequence for inducible transcription factor ( nf-kappa b , egr-1 , ap-1 ) , which might mediate the inducible expression of this gene .
transient expression of cd69 promoter-based reporter gene construct in k562 cell indicate that the proximal promoter region span position -78 to +16 contain the cis-acting sequence necessary for basal and phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate -inducible transcription of the cd69 gene .
removal of the upstream sequence located between position -78 and -38 result in decrease promoter strength and abolish the response to phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate .
we also find that tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) be capable of induce the surface expression of the cd69 molecule as well a the promoter activity of fusion plasmid that contain 5'-flanking sequence of the cd69 gene , suggest that this cytokine may regulate in vivo the expression of cd69 .

transcription factor a target for oxidative signalling during lymphocyte activation .
we previously have demonstrate a requirement for oxidative event during cell cycle entry in t lymphocyte and have hypothesise that reactive oxygen specie may act a intracellular signal agent during lymphocyte activation .
in the current study , cysteamine , an aminothiol compound with antioxidant activity , have be use to far investigate the role of oxidative signalling during lymphocyte activation .
treatment of normal human peripheral blood lymphocyte with cysteamine in vitro be find to inhibit proliferation in a dose-dependent manner , with essentially complete inhibition occur at a dose of 400 microm .
this inhibitory effect be limited to the first 2 h after mitogenic activation , localize the time-frame of action of cysteamine to within the commitment period .
it therefore be of interest to establish which , if any , commitment event be affect by oxidative signalling during cell cycle entry .
take the il-2 gene a a candidate , we examine the effect of cysteamine treatment on early gene expression during lymphocyte activation , and on the activity of transcription factor ap-1 , nf-kappa b , nf-at and oct1 , whose function be require for expression of the il-2 mrna .
cysteamine treatment inhibit both expression of the il-2 mrna and secretion of il-2 into the culture medium .
the inhibitory effect of cysteamine may be mediate at least in part by an effect on transcription factor function , a the dna binding activity of ap-1 and nf-kappa b extract from mitogen-stimulated cell be significantly inhibit by cysteamine treatment .
interestingly , oct1 and nf-at dna binding activity be not affect by cysteamine treatment , suggest that oxidative signalling process operate in a selective manner .
the identification of regulatory protein , such a transcription factor , a molecular target for oxidative signalling provide further evidence to implicate oxidative signalling a be intimately involve in the g0 to g1 phase transition in t lymphocyte .
lipopolysaccharide induction of tissue factor gene expression in monocytic cell be mediate by binding of c-rel/p65 heterodimers to a kappa b-like site .
exposure of monocytic cell to bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) activate the nf-kappa b /rel family of protein and lead to the rapid induction of inflammatory gene product , include tissue factor ( tf ) .
tf be the primary cellular initiator of the coagulation protease cascade .
here we report the characterization of a nuclear complex from human monocytic cell that bind to a kappa b-like site , 5'-cggagtttcc-3' , in the 5'-flanking region of the human tf gene .
this nuclear complex be activate by lp with kinetics that precede induction of the tf gene .
in vitro binding study demonstrate that the tf site bind translate c- rel and p65 homodimers but not p50/p65 heterodimers or p50 homodimers .
base-pair substitution in the tf site indicate that the presence of a cytosine at position 1 preclude binding of nf-kappa b .
in fact , under low-ionic-strength condition , the tf complex do not migrate with translate p50/p65 dimer but instead comigrated with c-rel /p65 dimer .
antibody against the nf-kappa b and rel protein and uv cross-linking study reveal the presence of c-rel and p65 and the absence of p50 in the tf complex and far show that c-rel/ p65 heterodimers selectively bind to the tf kappa b-like site .
functional study indicate that the tf site confer lp inducibility on a heterologous promoter and be transactivated by c-rel or p65 .
take together , our result demonstrate that binding of c-rel/ p65 heterodimers to a novel kappa b-like site mediate lp induction of tf gene expression in monocytic cell .
appraisal of potential therapeutic index of antioxidant on the basis of their in vitro effect on hiv replication in monocyte and interleukin 2 -induced lymphocyte proliferation .
antioxidant molecule have be suggest to be of therapeutic value in the treatment of hiv -infected patient .
to evaluate this possibility , we examine in vitro the effect of two type of antioxidant molecule in term of inhibition of hiv replication in monocyte , one of the main reservoir of hiv , and also in term of modulation of the immune competence a measure by pbmc proliferation .
we test the effect of bha , a phenolic , lipid-soluble , chain-breaking antioxidant , and nac , a known glutathione precursor with some direct free-radical scavenging property as well , on the regulation of hiv -1 expression in latently infected u1 cell and in productively and chronically infected u937 cell .
both antioxidant inhibit tnf - or pma- induced nf-kappa b activity in u1 cell , as well a the sustained nf-kappa b activity permanently induce by the virus itself in chronically hiv -infected u937 cell .
this result in only a partial inhibition of tnf - or pma- induced hiv replication in u1 cell , and no detectable effect on hiv replication in chronically infected u937 cell .
this may be the first limitation to potential antiviral effect of antioxidant therapy .
another limitation be that antioxidant concentration high enough to block nk-kappa b activation be show to have a suppressive effect on immune function in vitro , because nac and bha block il-2 -induced pbmc proliferation .
these data warrant prudence in the design of antioxidant-based therapy aim at suppress hiv replication .
abundant expression of erythroid transcription factor p45 nf-e2 mrna in human peripheral granurocytes .
transcription factor nf-e2 be crucial for regulation of erythroid-specific gene expression .
p45 subunit of nf-e2 contain a basic-leucine zipper domain and dimerizes with the small maf family protein to form functional nf-e2 complex .

a neutrophil occupy approximately 92 % of the cell in granulocyte fraction of human peripheral blood cell .
a neutrophil occupy approximately 92 % of the cell in this fraction , the cell express p45 be most likely to be neutrophil .
p45 mrna be also express in hl-60 promyelocytes , albeit the expression level be much low than that of the granulocyte fraction .
hl-60 cell be find to express mafk mrna , indicate the presence of genuine nf-e2 complex in the cell .
although p45 mrna be transcribe from two different promoter , anf-e2 promoter and fnf-e2 promoter , in erythroid and megakaryocytic lineage cell , p45 mrna be transcribe only from anf-e2 promoter .
the expression of p45 megakaryocytic lineage cell , p45 mrna be transcribe only from anf-e2 promoter .
the expression of p45 mrna in the neutrophil decline rapidly after transfer of the cell to in vitro culture and g-csf could not sustain the expression from the down-regulation , suggest the e2 may also participate in the regulation of neutrophil-specific gene expression .
tyrosine 113 , 128 , and 145 of slp-76 be require for optimal augmentation of nfat promoter activity .
slp-76 ( sh2 domain leukocyte protein of 76 kda ) be a recently identify substrate of the tcr-stimulated protein tyrosine kinase that function in the signal transduction cascade link the tcr with il-2 gene expression .
in this report , we demonstrate that engagement of the tcr result in tyrosine phosphorylation of slp-76 in it amino-terminal acidic region .
two tyrosine ( y113 and y128 ) fall within an identical five amino-acid motif and be show to be phosphorylated upon tcr ligation .
although mutation of either y113 and y128 have a minimal effect on slp-76 function , mutation of both residue decrease significantly the ability of slp-76 to promote t cell activation .
a third tyrosine within the amino-terminal region ( y145 ) appear to be the most important for optimal slp-76 function , a alter it alone to phenylalanine have a potent impact on slp-76 augmentation of nfat promoter activity .
thrombopoietin support in vitro erythroid differentiation via it specific receptor c-mpl in a human leukemia cell line .
thrombopoietin ( tpo ) act on megakaryopoiesis and erythropoiesis in vitro and in vivo .
we isolate a novel subline , ut-7/gmt , from the human leukemia cell line ut-7/gm ( n. komatsu , et al. , blood , 89 : 4021-4033 , 1997 ) .
a small population of ut-7/gm cell positively stain for hemoglobin ( hb ) after a 7-day exposure to tpo .
more than 50 % of tpo -treated ut-7/gmt cell positively stain for hb .
use ut-7/gmt cell , we examine how tpo promote hemoglobinization .
tpo induce tyrosine phosphorylation of the tpo receptor but not the erythropoietin ( epo ) receptor .
there be no competition between tpo and epo for binding to epo receptor .
these finding suggest that tpo have a direct effect on hemoglobinization via a specific receptor on ut-7/gmt cell .
isoelectric focusing demonstrate that tpo induce fetal and adult hb synthesis , whereas epo induce embryonic , fetal , and adult hb synthesis .
thus , our data suggest that tpo have a distinct action on erythropoiesis .
mechanism of transactivation by nuclear factor of activate t cell -1 .
nuclear factor of activate t cells-family protein ( nfat1/ nfatp , nfatc , nfat3 , and nfat4/nfatx/nfatc3 ) play a key role in the transcription of cytokine gene and other gene during the immune response .
we have define the mechanism of transactivation by nfat1 .
nfat1 possess two transactivation domain whose sequence be not conserve in the other nfat-family protein , and a conserve dna-binding domain that mediate the recruitment of cooperate nuclear transcription factor even when it be express in the absence of other region of the protein .
the activity of the nh2-terminal transactivation domain be modulate by an adjacent regulatory region that contain several conserve sequence motif represent only in the nfat family .
our result emphasize the multiple level at which nfat-dependent transactivation be regulate , and predict significant difference in the architecture of cooperative transcription complex contain different nfat-family protein .
the t cell activation factor nf-atc positively regulate hiv-1 replication and gene expression in t cell .
clinical deterioration in human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection be associate with increase level of viral replication and burden in the peripheral blood and lymphoid organ .
t cell activation and ensuing cellular gene activation can be critical for hiv-1 replication .
the hypothesis that the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nf-at ) may influence hiv-1 replication be therefore compelling give the tight correlation of hiv-1 transcriptional induction to t cell activation .
we report that certain nf-at ( rel ) family member productively bind the kappab regulatory element , synergize with nf-kappab and tat in transcriptional activation of hiv-1 , and enhance hiv-1 replication in t cell .
these result link regulatory factor critical to t cell commitment directly to hiv-1 replication .
the myeloid-cell-specific c-fes promoter be regulate by sp1 , pu.1 , and a novel transcription factor .
the protein product of the c-fps/fes ( c-fes ) proto-oncogene have be implicate in the normal development of myeloid cell ( macrophage and neutrophil ) .
mrna for c-fes have be detect exclusively in myeloid cell and vascular endothelial cell in adult mammal .
although a 13-kilobase-pair ( kb ) human c-fes transgene exhibit high level of expression in mouse , the sequence that confer myeloid-cell-specific expression of the human c-fes gene have not be define .
transient-transfection experiment demonstrate that plasmid contain 446 bp of c-fes 5'-flanking sequence link to a luciferase reporter gene be active exclusively in myeloid cell .
no other dna element within the 13-kb human c-fes locus contain positive cis-acting element , with the exception of a weakly active region within the 3'-flanking sequence .
dnase i footprinting assay reveal four distinct site that bind myeloid nuclear protein ( -408 to -386 , -293 to -254 , -76 to -65 , and -34 to +3 ) .
however , the first two footprint reside in sequence that be largely dispensable for transient activity .
plasmid contain 151 bp of 5'-flanking sequence confer myeloid-cell-specific gene expression .
electrophoretic mobility shift analysis demonstrate that the 151-bp region contain nuclear protein binding site for sp1 , pu.1 , and/or elf-1 , and a novel factor .
this unidentified factor bind immediately 3' of the pu.1 /elf-1 site and appear to be myeloid cell specific .
mutation of the pu.1 /elf-1 site or the 3' site ( fp4-3' ) within the context of the c-fes promoter result in substantially reduce activity in transient transfections .
furthermore , transient-cotransfection assay demonstrate that pu.1 ( and not elf-1 ) can transactivate the c-fes promoter in nonmyeloid cell line .
we conclude that the human c-fes gene contain a strong myeloid-cell-specific promoter that be regulate by sp1 , pu.1 , and a novel transcription factor .
distinct dnase-i hypersensitive site be associate with tal-1 transcription in erythroid and t-cell line .
the tal-1 gene , frequently activate in human t-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( t-all ) , be express in the erythroid , megakaryocytic , and mast cell lineage during normal hematopoiesis .
to gain further insight into the molecular mechanism that control tal-1 expression , we investigate tal-1 chromatin structure in erythroid/megakaryocytic cell line and in t-cell line either with or without tal-1 rearrangement .

five major dnase-i hypersensitive site ( h ) be map in the tal-1 locus .
h i , iv , and v be exclusively observe in the erythroid/megakaryocytic cell line that express tal-1 from the promoter 1a and 1b .
h ii be weak in hematopoietic cell line , absent in hela , and greatly enhance in jurkat , suggest that this region might be implicate in the cis-activation of tal-1 promoter 1b in this cell line .
h iii be weak in hel and jurkat , and greatly enhance in du528 , a t-cell line that bear a t_(1;14) and initiate tal-1 transcription within exon 4 .
these result suggest that distinct regulatory element be associate with the use of the different tal-1 promoter .
retinoic acid inhibit cd40 + interleukin-4 -mediated ige production in vitro .
to elucidate the role of retinoic acid ( ra ) in anti- cd40 + interleukin-4 ( il-4 ) -mediated b-cell activation , the effect of 10(-12) to 10(-6) mol/l ra be study in anti-cd40 ( 1 microgram/ml ) + il-4 ( 5 ng/ml ) -mediated proliferation and ig synthesis by human peripheral blood mononuclear cell ( pbmc ) and b cell in healthy donor .
anti-cd40 + il-4 -mediated proliferation of pbmc and b cell be inhibit by ra in a dose-dependent manner , with maximal inhibition of 62 % +/- 5 % in pbmc and 55 % +/- 4.4 % in b cell by all-trans ra , and 58 % +/- 6.7 % and 51 % +/- 4.7 % , respectively by 13-cis ra .
ige synthesis be even more markedly inhibit by ra start at concentration of > 10(-14) mol/l for b cell and > 10(-10) mol/l for pbmc .
maximal inhibition of ige production for b cell be at 10(-8) mol/l for all-trans ra ( 94 % +/- 1.8 % ) and 96 % +/- 3.2 % for 13-cis ra .
low concentration of ra inhibit ige synthesis ( 10(-10) mol/l ) affect neither b-cell proliferation nor the production of iga , igg , and igm .
elucidation of the mechanism involve in this inhibition of ige production show that epsilon germline transcription be decrease by ra , whereas production of interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) be not enhance in the presence of ra .
to differentiate whether the ra effect be mediate by ra receptor alpha , beta , and gamma , the expression of the retinoic acid receptor ( rar ) be examine by reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) .
the data show that unstimulated human peripheral b cell express mrna of the ra receptor alpha , beta , and gamma .
use retinoids with different receptor binding specificity ( cd336 , cd437 , cd2019 , cd367 ) , dose-dependent inhibition of ige synthesis be show by all four derivates , but be most mark by an ra bind the alpha receptor with high specificity .
take together , this study show that ra inhibit ige production of anti-cd40 + il-4 -stimulated b cell in vitro .
