a novel function of stat1 and stat3 protein in erythropoietin -induced erythroid differentiation of a human leukemia cell line .
we recently determine that erythropoietin ( epo ) activate 3 member of the signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) family , stat1alpha , stat3 , and stat5 , in the human epo -dependent cell line , ut-7 and ut-7/ epo ( kirito et al , j biol chem 272 : 16507 , 1997 ) .
in addition , we have show that stat1alpha , but not stat3 , be involve in epo -induced cellular proliferation .
in this study , we examine the role of stat1alpha and stat3 in epo -induced erythroid differentiation .
ut-7/gm be use a a model system , because this cell line can differentiate into erythroid-lineage cell with epo treatment ( komatsu et al , blood 89 : 4021 , 1997 ) .
we find that epo do not activate stat1alpha or stat3 in ut-7/gm cell .
transfection experiment show that both stat1alpha and stat3 inhibit the induction by epo of gamma-globin and erythroid-specific 5-aminolevulinate synthetase transcript , result in a reduction of the percentage of hemoglobin-positive cell .
dominant negative form of stat1alpha or stat3 promote the epo -induced erythroid differentiation of ut-7/gm cell , even in the presence of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor , although this cytokine never induce erythroid differentiation of the parent ut-7/gm cell with or without epo .
a cell cycle analysis show that the constitutive activation of stat1alpha , but not stat3 , shorten the period of g0/g1 prolongation cause by epo stimulation .
take together , our data suggest that stat1alpha and stat3 act a negative regulator in epo -induced erythroid differentiation .
specifically , stat1alpha may activate a cell cycle-associated gene ( s ) , lead to the entry of cell into the cell cycle .
a novel primer extension method to detect the number of cag repeat in the androgen receptor gene in family with x-linked spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy .
x-linked spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy ( sbma ) , an adult-onset form of motor neuron disease , be recently report to be cause by amplification of the cag repeat in the androgen receptor gene .
we report here a simple and rapid strategy to detect the precise number of the cags .
after the dna fragment contain the cag repeat be amplify by the polymerase chain reaction , a primer extension be carry out ; the extension of the end-labelled reverse primer adjacent to 3' end of cag repeat stop at the first t after cag repeat with the incorporation of dideoxy atp in the reaction mixture .
the resultant primer product be analyse by denature polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis and autoradiography .
this method could be quite useful to detect not only cag repeat in sbma but also other polymorphic dinucleotide and trinucleotide repeat .

in this first study of tcr repertoire selection for an ebv lytic antigen , a bzlf1 -reactive component of diverse clonotypes be identify in primary type a or type b ebv infection which be sustained in the ebv -specific memory response throughout life-long infection .

activation of human monocytic cell by treponema pallidum and borrelia burgdorferi lipoprotein and synthetic lipopeptides proceed via a pathway distinct from that of lipopolysaccharide but involve the transcriptional activator nf-kappa b .
there be increase evidence that lipoprotein of treponema pallidum and borrelia burgdorferi be key inflammatory mediator during syphilis and lyme disease .
a principal objective of the present study be to identify more precisely similarity and divergence among lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) - and lipoprotein-lipopeptide- induced immune cell signaling event .
like lp , purify native b. burgdorferi ospa and synthetic analog of ospa , ospb , and two t. pallidum lipoprotein ( tpp47 and tpp17 ) all induce nf-kappa b translocation in thp-1 human monocytoid cell .
acylation of ospa and the synthetic peptide be requisite for cell activation .
polymyxin b abrogate only the response to lp .
by use 70z/3-derived pre-b-cell line either lack or express human cd14 ( the lp receptor ) , it be observe that expression of human cd14 impart responsiveness to lp but not to ospa or spirochetal lipopeptides ( assess by induction of nf-kappa b and expression of surface immunoglobulin m ) .
finally , the biological relevance of the observation that t. pallidum lipoprotein -lipopeptides induce both nf-kappa b and cytokine production in monocyte be support by the ability of the synthetic analog to promote human immunodeficiency virus replication in chronically infected u1 monocytoid cell ; these observation also suggest a potential mechanism whereby a syphilitic chancre can serve a a cofactor for human immunodeficiency virus transmission .
the combined data lend additional support to the proposal that spirochetal lipoprotein and lp initiate monocyte activation via different cell surface event but that the signaling pathway ultimately converge to produce qualitatively similar cellular response .
activation of c-jun n-terminal kinase in bacterial lipopolysaccharide -stimulated macrophage .
activation of macrophage by bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) induce transcription of gene that encode for proinflammatory regulator of the immune response .
previous work have suggest that activation of the transcription factor activator protein 1 ( ap-1 ) be one lp -induced event that mediate this response .
consistent with this notion , we find that lp stimulate ap-1 -mediated transcription of a transfected reporter gene in the murine macrophage cell line raw 264.7 .
a ap-1 activity be regulate in part by activation of the c-jun n-terminal kinase ( jnk ) , which phosphorylates and subsequently increase the transcriptional activity of c-jun , we examine whether lp treatment of macrophage result in activation of this kinase .
lp treatment of raw 264.7 cell , murine bone marrow-derived macrophage , and the human monocyte cell line thp-1 result in rapid activation of the p46 and p54 isoforms of jnk .
treatment with wild-type and rough mutant form of lp and synthetic lipid a result in jnk activation , while pretreatment with the tyrosine kinase inhibitor herbimycin a inhibit this response .
binding of lp - lp binding protein ( lbp ) complex to cd14 , a surface receptor that mediate many lp response , be find to be crucial , a pretreatment of thp-1 cell with the monoclonal antibody 60b , which block this binding , inhibit jnk activation .
these result suggest that lp activation of jnk in monocyte/macrophage cell be a cd14- and protein tyrosine phosphorylation- dependent event that may mediate the early activation of ap-1 in regulate lp -triggered gene induction .
octamer independent activation of transcription from the kappa immunoglobulin germline promoter .
previous analysis of immunoglobulin v region promoter have lead to the discovery of a common octamer motif which be functionally important in the tissue-specific and developmentally regulate transcriptional activation of immunoglobulin gene .
the germline promoter ( ko ) located upstream of the j region gene segment of the kappa locus also contain an octamer motif ( contain a single base pair mutation and refer to a the variant octamer ) which have be show previously to bind oct-1 and oct-2 transcription factor in vitro .
to far elucidate the role of this variant octamer motif in the regulation of germline transcription from the unrearranged kappa locus , we have quantitated the relative binding affinity of oct-1 and oct-2 for the variant octamer motif and determine the functional role of this octamer motif in transcriptional activation .
we find that , although the variant octamer motif bind oct-1 and oct-2 in vitro with 5-fold low affinity than the consensus octamer motif , mutation of the variant octamer motif to either a consensus octamer or non- octamer motif have no effect on transcriptional activation from the germline promoter .
we also find significant difference in activation of germline and v region promoter by kappa enhancer .
our result suggest that the germline promoter and v region promoter differ in their dependence on octamer for activation and respond differently to enhancer activation .
these finding have important implication in regulation of germline transcription as well a concomitant activation of the v-j recombination of the kappa light chain locus .
tuberculosis and chronic hepatitis b virus infection in african and variation in the vitamin d receptor gene .
the active metabolite of vitamin d , 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 , be an important immunoregulatory hormone [ 1 ] .
it effect be exert by interaction with the vitamin d receptor , which be present on human monocyte and activate t and b lymphocyte .
variation in the vitamin d receptor gene be type in 2015 subject from large case-control study of three major infectious disease : tuberculosis , malaria , and hepatitis b virus .
homozygote for a polymorphism at codon 352 ( genotype tt ) be significantly underrepresented among those with tuberculosis ( chi2 = 6.22 , 1 df , p = .01 ) and persistent hepatitis b infection ( chi2 = 6.25 , 1 df , p = .01 ) but not in subject with clinical malaria compare with the other genotype .
therefore , this genetic variant , which predispose to low bone mineral density in many population , may confer resistance to certain infectious disease .
the tax protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 mediate the transactivation of the c-sis/platelet-derived growth factor-b promoter through interaction with the zinc finger transcription factor sp1 and ngfi-a/egr-1 .
transcriptional up-regulation of the c-sis/platelet-derived growth factor-b ( pdgf-b ) proto-oncogene by the tax protein of human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 have be implicate a one possible mechanism of cellular transformation by human t-cell leukemia virus type 1 .
in previous work , we identify an essential site in the c-sis/pdgf-b promoter , tax-responsive element 1 ( tre1 ) , necessary for transactivation by tax .
we also identify sp1 , sp3 , and ngfi-a/egr-1 a the primary nuclear transcription factor bind to tre1 which mediate tax responsiveness .
in the present work , we have investigate the mechanism ( s ) whereby tax transactivates the c-sis/pdgf-b proto-oncogene .
in vitro transcription assay show that tax be able to significantly increase the transcriptional activity of a template contain the -257 to +74 region of the c-sis/pdgf-b promoter .
electrophoretic mobility shift assay analysis show that tax increase the dna binding activity of both sp1 and ngfi-a/egr-1 use a tre1 probe .
analysis of tax mutant show that two mutant , iexc29s and iexl320g , be unable to significantly transactivate the c-sis/pdgf-b promoter .
finally , co-immunoprecipitation analysis reveal that tax be able to stably bind to both sp1 and ngfi-a/egr-1 .
interestingly , co-immunoprecipitation analysis also reveal that tax mutant iexc29s be unable to interact with ngfi-a/egr-1 , whereas tax mutant iexl320g be able to interact with ngfi-a/egr-1 .
transcription of a minimal promoter from the nf-il6 gene be regulate by creb/atf and sp1 protein in u937 promonocytic cell .

this region contain bind site for the camp response element-binding protein/activation transcription factor ( creb/atf ) and sp1 family of transcription factor .
each site be functionally important and contribute independently to transcription of the nf-il6 gene in u937 cell .
lactobacillus and vaginal host defense : activation of the human immunodeficiency virus type 1 long terminal repeat , cytokine production , and nf-kappab .
lactobacillus , a component of the normal vaginal flora , can activate the human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) -1 long terminal repeat ( ltr ) in the jurkat t lymphocyte and thp-1 macrophage cell line .
activation of the ltr in jurkat cell be strongly enhance by vanadate and inhibit by catalase , implicate h2o2 .
in contrast , activation in thp-1 cell occur in the absence of vanadate and be unaffected by catalase .
the active material partition into the phenol layer on hot aqueous phenol extraction .
lactobacillus also increase tumor necrosis factor -alpha and interleukin -1beta production and activate nf-kappab in thp-1 cell and increase tumor necrosis factor -alpha production by human monocyte .
human vaginal fluid specimen have comparable property , which correlate with their bacterial content .
these finding suggest the presence in vaginal fluid of agent ( s ) derive from indigenous bacteria that can activate the hiv-1 ltr , cytokine production , and nf-kappab in cell of macrophage lineage , with possible influence on vaginal physiology and host defense .
blockade of t-cell activation by dithiocarbamates involve novel mechanism of inhibition of nuclear factor of activate t cell .
dithiocarbamates ( dtcs ) have recently be report a powerful inhibitor of nf-kappab activation in a number of cell type .
given the role of this transcription factor in the regulation of gene expression in the inflammatory response , nf-kappab inhibitor have be suggest a potential therapeutic drug for inflammatory disease .
we show here that dtcs inhibit both interleukin 2 ( il-2 ) synthesis and membrane expression of antigen which be induce during t-cell activation .
this inhibition , which occur with a parallel activation of c-jun transactivating function and expression , be reflect by transfection experiment at the il-2 promoter level , and involve not only the inhibition of nf-kappab -driven reporter activation but also that of nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) .
accordingly , electrophoretic mobility shift assay ( emsas ) indicate that pyrrolidine dtc ( pdtc ) prevent nf-kappab , and nfat dna-binding activity in t cell stimulate with either phorbol myristate acetate plus ionophore or antibody against the cd3-t-cell receptor complex and simultaneously activate the binding of ap-1 .
furthermore , pdtc differentially target both nfatp and nfatc family member , inhibit the transactivation function of nfatp and mrna induction of nfatc .
strikingly , western blotting and immunocytochemical experiment indicate that pdtc promote a transient and rapid shuttling of nfatp and nfatc , lead to their accelerate export from the nucleus of activate t cell .
we propose that the activation of an nfat kinase by pdtc could be responsible for the rapid shuttling of the nfat , therefore transiently convert the sustained transactivation of this transcription factor that occur during lymphocyte activation , and show that c-jun nh2-terminal kinase ( jnk ) can act by directly phosphorylating nfatp .
in addition , the combined inhibitory effect on nfat and nf-kb support a potential use of dtcs a immunosuppressant .
hiv-1 envelope glycoprotein induce activation of activate protein-1 in cd4+ t cell [ publish erratum appear in j biol chem 1995 dec 1 ; 270 ( 48 ) : 29038 ]
activation of cd4 positive t cell be a primary requirement for human immunodeficiency virus ( hiv ) entry , efficient hiv replication , and progression to aid , utilize cd4 positive t cell line and purify t cell from normal individual , we have demonstrate that native envelope glycoprotein of hiv , gp 160 , can induce activation of transcription factor , activate protein-1 ( ap-1 ) .
the stimulatory effect of gp160 be mediate through the cd4 molecule , since treatment of gp160 with soluble cd4-igg abrogate it activity , and cd4 negative t cell line fail to be stimulate with gp160 .
immunoprecipitation of the gp 160 -induced nuclear extract with polyclonal antibody to fo and jun protein indicate that ap-1 complex be comprise of member of these family of protein .
the gp160 -induced ap-1 complex be dependent upon protein tyrosine phosphorylation and be protein synthesis-independent .
this stimulation can also be abolish by inhibitor of protein kinase c , but it be unaffected by calcium channel blocker or cyclosporine a .
this gp160 treatment adversely affect the functional capability of t cell : pre-treatment of cd4+ t cell with gp160 for 4 h at 37 degree c inhibit anti-cd3 -induced interleukin-2 secretion .
effect similar to gp160 be see with anti-cd4 mab .
the aberrant activation of ap-1 by gp160 in cd4 positive t cell could result in up-regulation of cytokine contain ap-1 site , e.g. interleukin-3 and granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor , and concurrently lead to t cell unresponsiveness by inhibit interleukin-2 secretion .
highly polarize hla class ii antigen processing and presentation by human intestinal epithelial cell .
the high concentration of foreign antigen in the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract be separate from the underlie lymphocyte by a single cell layer of polarize epithelium .
intestinal epithelial cell can express hla class ii antigen and may function a antigen-presenting cell to cd4(+) t cell within the intestinal mucosa .
use tetanus toxoid specific and hla-dr-restricted t lymphocyte , we show that polarize intestinal epithelial cell direct to express hla-dr molecule be able to initiate class ii processing only after internalization of antigen from their apical surface .
coexpression of the class ii transactivator ciita in these cell , which stimulate highly efficient class ii processing without the characteristic decline in barrier function see in polarize monolayers treat with the proinflammatory cytokine gamma-ifn , facilitate antigen processing from the basolateral surface .
in both case , peptide presentation to t cell via class ii molecule be restricted to the basolateral surface .
these data indicate a highly polarize functional architecture for antigen processing and presentation by intestinal epithelial cell , and suggest that the functional outcome of antigen processing by the intestinal epithelium be both dependent on the cellular surface at which the foreign antigen be internalize and by the underlying degree of mucosal inflammation
to be or not to be a responder in t-cell response : ubiquitous oligopeptides in all protein .
amino acid sequence of all protein be essay write in the same language .
accordingly , the same set of word and phrase ( oligopeptides ) appear in totally unrelated protein .
the reason that only certain individual of particular major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) haplotype can mount t-cell response against a given antigen of pathogen be find in the fact that t-cell receptor be design to recognize 18-20 residue-long peptide fragment sandwiched between two alpha-helices of class i or class ii mhc molecule .
at this range of peptide length , most would appear a self , while nonselfness of the remainder be destine to be quite ambiguous , hence create responder and nonresponders .
downstream activation of a tata-less promoter by oct-2 , bob1 , and nf-kappab direct expression of the homing receptor blr1 to mature b cell .
the chemokine receptor , blr1 , be a major regulator of the microenvironmental homing of b cell in lymphoid organ .
in vitro study identify three essential element of the tata-less blr1 core promoter that confer cell type- and differentiation- specific expression in the b cell of both human and mouse , a functional promoter region ( -36 with respect to the transcription start site ) , a nf-kappab motif ( +44 ) , and a noncanonical octamer motif ( +157 ) .
the importance of these site be confirm by in vivo study in gene-targeted mouse deficient of either oct-2 , bob1 , or both nf-kappab subunit p50 and p52 .
in all of these animal , the expression of blr1 be reduce or absent .
in mouse deficient only of p52/ nf-kappab , blr1 expression be unaffected .
thus our data demonstrate that blr1 be a target gene for oct-2 , bob1 , and member of the nf-kappab /rel family and provide a link to the impaired b cell function in mouse deficient for these factor .
salicylate inhibit lipopolysaccharide -induced transcriptional activation of the tissue factor gene in human monocytic cell .
binding of plasma factor vii/viia to the tissue factor ( tf ) receptor initiate the coagulation protease cascade .
tf expression by circulate monocyte be associate with thrombotic and inflammatory complication in a variety of disease .
transcriptional activation of the human tf gene in monocytic cell expose to bacterial lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) be mediate by binding of c-rel /p65 heterodimers to a kappa b site in the tf promoter .
here , we report that a family of anti-inflammatory agent , know a the salicylate , inhibit lp induction of tf activity and tf gene transcription in human monocyte and monocytic thp-1 cell at clinically relevant dos .
furthermore , sodium salicylate block the lp -induced proteolytic degradation of i kappa b alpha , which prevent the nuclear translocation of c-rel /p65 heterodimers .
in contrast , two other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug , ibuprofen and indomethacin , do not inhibit lp induction of the tf gene .
these result indicate that salicylate inhibit lp induction of tf gene transcription in monocytic cell by prevent nuclear translocation of c-rel /p65 heterodimers .
the clinical benefit of salicylate in the treatment of several disease , include atherosclerosis and rheumatoid arthritis , may be related to their ability to reduce monocyte gene expression .
a negative role for phosphoinositide 3-kinase in t-cell antigen receptor function .
background : a delicate balance between positive and negative regulatory mechanism during t-cell activation determine the specificity and magnitude of an immune response .
phosphoinositide 3-kinase ( pi 3-kinase ) be activate by a diverse set of receptor that determine t-cell function , include the t-cell antigen receptor ( tcr ) , the costimulatory receptor cd28 , and negative regulator of t-cell activation such a ctla-4 .
pi 3-kinase be also regulate by the haematopoietic cytokine that determine t-cell differentiation and lymphocyte proliferation .
pi 3-kinase can thus dynamically influence the outcome of the immune reaction at various stage .
in this study , we investigate the importance of pi 3-kinase in tcr -directed t-cell activation use activate or inhibitory version of pi 3-kinase .
result : certain aspect of tcr response such a the induction of transcriptional activity of ap1 and serum response factor be not affect by expression of the mutant form of pi 3-kinase .
we find , however , that pi 3-kinase profoundly influence the transactivation capacity of ' nuclear factor of activate t cell ' ( nf-at ) elicit by the tcr : expression of an activated form of pi 3-kinase inhibit tcr -mediated nf-at response , whereas expression of a dominant negative mutant of pi 3-kinase potently enhance tcr -controlled nf-at induction .
these effect of pi 3-kinase be not mediate by previously identify pi 3-kinase effector , such a protein kinase b , a positive regulator of pi 3-kinase , or the gtpase rac , and be therefore likely to involve a novel , a yet unknown , effector molecule .
conclusion : our result establish that pi 3-kinase can both positively and negatively regulate t-cell function , and uncover a previously unrecognized function for pi 3-kinase in t cell a a selective negative regulator of tcr -signalling event and therefore a a determinant of t-cell homeostasis .
displacement of an e-box-binding repressor by basic helix-loop-helix protein : implication for b-cell specificity of the immunoglobulin heavy-chain enhancer .
the activity of the immunoglobulin heavy-chain ( igh ) enhancer be restrict to b cell , although it bind both b-cell-restricted and ubiquitous transcription factor .
activation of the enhancer in non- b cell upon overexpression of the basic helix-loop-helix ( bhlh ) protein e2a appear to be mediate not only by the binding of e2a to it cognate e box but also by the result displacement of a repressor from that same site .
we have identify a " two-handed " zinc finger protein , denote zeb , the dna-binding specificity of which mimic that of the cellular repressor .
by employ a derivative e box that bind zeb but not e2a , we have show that the repressor be active in b cell and the igh enhancer be silence in the absence of binding competition by bhlh protein .
hence , we propose that a necessary prerequisite of enhancer activity be the b-cell-specific displacement of a zeb -like repressor by bhlh protein .
t-helper-cell determinant in protein antigen be preferentially located in cysteine-rich antigen segment resistant to proteolytic cleavage by cathepsin b , l , and d .
we report on a computer algorithm capable of predict the location of t-helper-cell epitope in protein antigen ( ag ) by analyse the ag amino acid sequence .
the algorithm be construct with the aim of identify segment in ag which be resistant to proteolytic degradation by the enzyme cathepsin b , l , and d .
these be prominent enzyme in the endocytic pathway through which soluble protein ag enter apc , and resistant segment in ag may , therefore , be expect to contain more t-cell determinant than susceptible segment .
from information available in the literature on the substrate specificity of the three enzyme , it be clear that a cysteine be not accept in any of the s2 , s1 , s1' , and s2' subsites of cathepsin b and l , and not in the s1 and s1' subsites of cathepsin d .
moreover , we have notice that cysteine -containing t-cell determinant in a number of protein ag be particularly rich in the amino acid alanine , glycine , lysine , leucine , serine , threonine , and valine .
by search protein ag for cluster of amino acid contain cysteine and two of the other amino acid we be able to predict 17 out of 23 empirically know t-cell determinant in the ag with a relatively low number of false ( positive ) prediction .
furthermore , we present a new principle for search ag for potential amphipatic alpha-helical protein segment .
such segment accord well with empirically known t-cell determinant and our algorithm produce a low number of false positive prediction than the principle base on discrete fourier transformation previously describe .
ifn-gamma priming of monocyte enhance lp -induced tnf production by augment both transcription and mrna stability .
the induction of cytokine expression in monocyte / macrophage by bacterial endotoxin or lipopolysaccharide be a critical , highly regulate host defence response .
the augmentation of lp response by interferon gamma ( ifn-gamma ) , refer to a priming , be well establish .
however , the mechanism ( s ) by which priming occur be poorly define .
use tumour necrosis factor ( tnf ) induction a a model , experiment be design to analyse in detail the priming effect on the lp response in human monocyte .
priming by ifn-gamma be primarily manifest at the level of tnf mrna accumulation .
ifn-gamma pre-treatment affect the magnitude rather than the sensitivity of the lp response .
priming occur after several hour of treatment , and the primed state be induce by either ifn-gamma or gm-csf , but not m-csf .
prim monocyte transcribe tnf mrna at a high rate than freshly isolate monocyte upon activation with lp .
the increase transcriptional rate correlate with a marked increase in nuclear factor-kappa b activity in these cell a determine by electrophoretic mobility shift assay use a consensus nf-kappa b oligonucleotide .
an additional significant finding be than tnf mrna induce in prim cell be much more stable than in unprimed cell ( t1/2 increase 6-8-fold ) .
consistent with the increase mrna stability , the duration of mrna accumulation be longer follow lp stimulation in prim monocyte , in addition to be of great magnitude .
finally , prim and unprimed cell possess a differential sensitivity to the kinase inhibitor h-89 .
h-89 substantially suppress lp -induced tnf mrna accumulation in unprimed cell , but have no effect on prim monocyte follow lp stimulation .

transcriptional regulation of the interleukin-2 gene in normal human peripheral blood t cell .
convergence of costimulatory signal and difference from transform t cell .
to study transcriptional regulation in normal human t cell , we have optimize condition for transient transfection .
interleukin-2 ( il-2 ) promoter -reporter gene behavior closely parallel the endogenous gene in response to t cell receptor and costimulatory signal .
a assess with mutagenized promoter , the most important il-2 cis-regulatory element in normal t cell be the proximal ap-1 site and the nf-_kappab site .
both primary activation , with phytohemagglutinin or antibody to cd3 , and costimulation , provide by pair of cd2 antibody or b7-positive ( b cell ) or b7-negative ( endothelial ) accessory cell , be mediate through the same cis-elements .
interestingly , the nuclear factor of activate t cell site be much less important in normal t cell than in jurkat t cell .
we conclude that il-2 transcriptional regulation differ in tumor cell line compare with normal t cell and that different costimulatory signal converge on the same cis-elements in the il-2 promoter .
activation of the human delta-globin gene promoter in primary adult erythroid cell .
restoration of the ccaat box or insertion of an erythroid kruppel-like factor ( eklf ) binding site in the delta promoter activate it expression in several erythroid cell line .
we extend these study use a novel primary human adult erythroid cell ( haec ) system to investigate these effect at the late erythroblast stage .

transcriptional basis for hyporesponsiveness of the human inducible nitric oxide synthase gene to lipopolysaccharide/interferon-gamma .
the work report here resolve , at the level of gene regulation , the controversy a to whether or not human monocyte /macrophages can produce nitric oxide ( no ) when stimulate with lipopolysaccharide ( lp ) , with or without co-stimulation by interferon-gamma ( ifn-gamma ) .
study include structural comparison of the promoter for human and mouse inducible no synthase ( inos ) gene , transfection and assay of human and mouse inos promoter region in response to lp +/- ifn-gamma , and electrophoretic mobility shift assay of kappa b response element .
two explanation for hyporesponsiveness of the human inos promoter to lp +/- ifn-gamma be find : ( 1 ) multiple inactivate nucleotide substitution in the human counterpart of the enhancer element that have be show to regulate lp / ifn-gamma induced expression of the mouse inos gene ; and ( 2 ) and absence of one or more nuclear factor in human macrophage ( e.g. , an lp -inducible nuclear factor-kappa b/ rel complex ) , that be ( be ) require for maximal expression of the gene .
the importance of resolution of this controversy be that future research in this area should be direct toward the understanding of alternative mechanism that can result in the successful production of no .
suppression of a cellular differentiation program by phorbol ester coincide with inhibition of binding of a cell-specific transcription factor ( nf-e2 ) to an enhancer element require for expression of an erythroid-specific gene .
induction by hemin increase , while induction with 12-o-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( tpa ) repress , erythroid-specific gene expression in the human cell line k562 .
we analyze the effect of hemin or tpa induction on the binding and activity of transcription factor at a regulatory element find within the transcriptional regulatory sequence of many erythroid-specific gene .
tpa induction increase the binding of ubiquitous ap-1 factor to this element .
tpa induction inhibit the binding of the lineage limited transcription factor nf-e2 to this transcriptional control element .
hemin induction of k562 cell do not facilitate the binding of nf-e2 to it recognition site .
hemin induction appear to nonspecifically increase the expression of transiently transfected gene in k562 cell .
beyond this nonspecific increase in gene expression , hemin induction act to increase the activity of the lineage limited transcription factor nf-e2 .
the divergent effect of hemin and tpa on gene expression in k562 cell be mediate , in part , by their contrasting effect on the transcription factor nf-e2 .
role of egr1 in regulation of stimulus-dependent cd44 transcription in b lymphocyte .
the immediate-early gene egr-1 encode a transcription factor ( egr1 ) that link b-cell antigen receptor ( bcr ) signal to downstream activation event through the regulation of previously unidentified target gene .
here we identify the gene encode the lymphocyte homing and migration protein cd44 a a target of egr1 regulation in b cell .
bcr -induced increase in cd44 mrna expression and transcription level be show to occur in egr1 -expressing but not in nonexpressing subclones of the b-cell line wehi-231 .
kinetics of egr-1 transcription and the appearance of nuclear egr1 protein precede cd44 induction and occur within 30 min after stimulation in the egr1 -expressing subclone .
a single egr1 binding motif be demonstrate at bp -301 of the human cd44 promoter .
cotransfection of a cd44 promoter-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter construct with an egr-1 expression vector result in a 6.5- to 8.5-fold induction of transcriptional activity relative to an empty expression vector .
the egr1 binding motif be show to be necessary for stimulus-induced expression of a cd44 promoter-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporter construct in nontransformed b lymphocyte and be require for transactivation by an egr1 expression vector in a b-cell line .
these study identify egr1 a an intermediary link bcr -derived signal to the induction of cd44 .
the relevance of these molecular event to bcr signal transduction and antigen-stimulated b-cell-mediated immune response be discuss .
bcl-6 expression during b-cell activation .
translocation involve the bcl-6 gene be common in the diffuse large cell subtype of non-hodgkin 's lymphoma .
invariably , the bcl-6 coding region be intact , but it 5' untranslated region be replace with sequence from the translocation partner .
the present study show that bcl-6 expression be regulate in lymphocyte during mitogenic stimulation .
rest b and t lymphocyte contain high level of bcl-6 mrna .
stimulation of mouse b cell with anti- igm or igd antibody , bacterial lipopolysaccharide , phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate plus ionomycin , or cd40 ligand lead to a five-fold to 35-fold decrease in bcl-6 mrna level .
similar downregulation of bcl-6 mrna be see in human b cell stimulate with staphylococcus aureus plus interleukin-2 or anti-igm antibody and in human t lymphocyte stimulate with phytohemagglutinin .
bcl-6 mrna level begin to decrease 8 to 16 hour after stimulation , before cell enter s phase .
although polyclonal activation of b cell in vitro invariably decrease bcl-6 mrna expression , activate b cell from human germinal center express bcl-6 mrna at level comparable to the level in rest b cell .
despite these similar mrna level , bcl-6 protein expression be threefold to 34-fold high in germinal center b cell than in rest b cell , suggest that bcl-6 protein level be control by translational or posttranslational mechanism .
these observation suggest that the germinal center reaction provide unique activation signal to b cell that allow for continued , high-level bcl-6 expression .
effect of glucocorticoid in rheumatoid arthritis .
diminish glucocorticoid receptor do not result in glucocorticoid resistance .
objective .
lymphocyte of patient with rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) have diminish receptor density ; thus , patient with ra should show partial resistance to glucocorticoid .
we investigate the glucocorticoid sensitivity of lymphocyte in ra patient compare with healthy subject .
method .
we determine the effect of glucocorticoid on lymphocyte proliferation and cytokine release .
result .
proliferation and cytokine release be inhibit in ra patient to the same extent a in healthy control .
conclusion .
diminish receptor density in ra patient do not result in glucocorticoid resistance .
putative steroid binding domain of the human mineralocorticoid receptor , express in e. coli in the presence of heat shock protein show typical native receptor characteristic .
domain e , consider a the putative hormone binding domain ( hbd ) of the human mineralocorticoid receptor ( hmr ) be express in escherichia coli a a fusion protein with either maltose binding protein ( mbp ) or glutathione s-transferase ( gst ) .
these bacterially-produced mr construct have no steroid binding activity per se .
in fact , heat shock protein association ( hsp ) be require for high affinity ligand-binding of the mr .
after incubation of purify mbp- or gst- hbd with rabbit reticulocyte lysate , know to be rich in heat shock protein , we obtain saturable binding of [3h]aldosterone .
the kd value for aldosterone be 0.3 nm and the bmax = 32 pmol/mg .
hormone binding specificity be assess by competition study with various steroid ligand .
sucrose gradient assay perform with [3h]aldosterone -mbp-hbd reveal complex sediment at 8.3s and 4.9s with [3h]progesterone-mbp-hbd .
western-blot analysis of the sedimentation peak show the concomitant presence of mbp-hbd by a monoclonal anti-mbp antibody , and hsp90 by a monoclonal anti-hsp antibody .
moreover , follow incubation with the anti-rabbit hsp90 monoclonal antibody the sedimenting gradient show a 10.4s sedimenting complex .
these analysis demonstrate that the [3h]aldosterone - mbp-hbd complex be at least associate with hsp90 in reticulocyte lysate and that the hbd of hmr be sufficient to bind hsp90 .
deletion of a relatively short amino- ( 729-766 ) or carboxy- terminal ( 940-984 ) region of the hbd fragment eliminate all steroid-binding property .
overall , these result indicate that the integrity of domain e be necessary and sufficient to bind steroid ligand , agonist or antagonist , with characteristic similar to the entire native mr .
peripheral blood t cell and monocyte and b cell line derive from patient with lupus express estrogen receptor transcript similar to those of normal cell .
objective : to identify and characterize estrogen receptor ( er ) transcript express in immune cell of patient with systemic lupus erythematosus ( sle ) and healthy donor .
method : peripheral blood monocyte and t cell be prepare from patient with sle ( n = 6 ) and healthy donor ( n = 8 ) .

some monocyte and t cell be stimulate with estradiol , pma , and ionomycin .

result : in all cell test , er mrna be express without prior in vitro stimulation .

precise deletion of the exon suggest that they be alternatively splice transcript .
whether the detected transcript be translate into functional receptor protein remain to be determine .
in vitro stimulation do not affect er mrna expression .
the presence of variant do not correlate with disease activity or medication .
conclusion : monocyte , t cell , and b cell in patient express transcript of the normal wild type er and the hormone binding domain variant in vivo .
infection with theileria annulata induce expression of matrix metalloproteinase 9 and transcription factor ap-1 in bovine leucocyte .
theileria annulata infect bovine leucocyte and result in their reversible transformation such that they become immortalise and metastatic .
the present study describe parasite-induced change in host cell gene expression which have a direct bearing on this transformation process .
t. annulata -infected leucocyte produce a number of novel metalloproteinase activity .
one of these , previously call b1 , be a 97-kda protein which be secrete in large amount and have be purify from protein-free , conditioned medium .
an antiserum to this enzyme be use to isolate a cdna clone .

we also assay the level of transcription factor ap-1 and demonstrate that it be constitutively present in increase amount in theileria-infected cell .

cell specific expression of human bruton 's agammaglobulinemia tyrosine kinase gene ( btk ) be regulate by sp1- and spi-1/pu.1-family member .
bruton 's agammaglobulinemia tyrosine kinase ( btk ) be a cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase involve in the human disease x-linked agammaglobulinemia ( xla ) .
the gene be express in all hematopoietic cell with the exception of t-cells and plasma cell .
for this expression pattern the first 280 bp upstream of the major transcriptional start site seem to be sufficient .

the transcription factor spi-1/pu.1 as well a the closely related factor spi-b bind to the pu-box in b-cells .

mutation of either site reduce the expression in transient transfection experiment .
however , mutation of the pu box have no effect in the t-cell line jurkat , where none of the spi-1 family member be express .
in addition spi-b as well a pu.1 be able to transactivate btk expression .
in fetal liver of pu.1-/- mouse , which lack lymphoid and myeloid cell , expression of btk be reduce two- to threefold but not abolish .
collectively this study show that expression of the btk gene be regulate by the combined action of sp1- and pu.1- family member .
tissue transglutaminase-dependent posttranslational modification of the retinoblastoma gene product in promonocytic cell undergo apoptosis .
the retinoblastoma gene product ( prb ) play an important role in control both cell release from the g1 phase and apoptosis .
we show here that in the early phase of apoptosis , prb be posttranslationally modify by a tissue transglutaminase ( ttg ) -catalyzed reaction .
in fact , by employ a novel haptenized lysis synthetic substrate which allow the isolation of glutaminyl-ttg substrate in vivo , we identify prb a a potential ttg substrate in u937 cell undergo apoptosis .
in keep with this finding , we show that apoptosis of u937 cell be characterize by the rapid disappearance of the 105,000- to 110,000-molecular-weight prb form concomitantly with the appearance of a smear of immunoreactive product with a molecular weight of great than 250,000 .
the shift in prb molecular weight be reproduce by add exogenous purify ttg to extract obtain from viable u937 cell and be prevent by dansylcadaverine , a potent enzyme inhibitor .
the effect of the prb posttranslational modification during apoptosis be investigate by determine the e2f-1 level and by isolate and characterize prb -null clone from u937 cell .
notably , the lack of prb in these u937-derived clone render these p53-null cell highly resistant to apoptosis induce by serum withdrawal , calphostin c , and ceramide .
take together , these data suggest that ttg , act on the prb protein , might play an important role in the cell progression through the death program .
phorbol ester reduce constitutive nuclear nf kappa b and inhibit hiv-1 production in mature human monocytic cell .
nf kappa b be a potent mediator of specific gene expression in human monocyte and have be show to play a role in transcription of the hiv-1 genome in promonocytic leukemia .

these result be in striking contrast to the increase in nuclear nf kappa b and hiv-1 replication induce by phorbol ester in promonocytic leukemia cell u937 and hl-60 , and emphasize the importance of study cytokine regulation of hiv-1 in normal monocyte .
cd30 be a cd40 -inducible molecule that negatively regulate cd40 -mediated immunoglobulin class switching in non-antigen-selected human b cell .
we use our monoclonal model of germinal center maturation , cl-01 b cell , to investigate the role of cd30 in human b cell differentiation .

our data suggest that cd30 critically regulate the cd40 -mediated differentiation of non-antigen-selected human b cell .
novel aldosterone receptor : specificity-conferring mechanism at the level of the cell membrane .
functional study in extra-renal , nonepithelial cell such a smooth muscle cell and more recently circulate human lymphocyte have provide increase evidence that aldosterone produce not only classical genomic effect , but also rapid non-genomic effect on transmembrane electrolyte movement .
these involve activation of the sodium/proton-exchanger of the cell membrane at very low , physiological concentration of aldosterone with an acute onset within 1-2 minute .
a second messenger cascade involve be the inositol-1,4,5-trisphosphate /calcium pathway which respond over the same rapid time course .
such change clearly can not be explain by genomic mechanism , which be responsible for late effect than the membrane-related rapid response .
in addition to it rapid time course the unique characteristic of this new pathway for steroid action include a 10000-fold selectivity for aldosterone over cortisol and the ineffectiveness of spironolactone , classical mineralocorticoid antagonist , a antagonist of the response .
subsequently bind site have be demonstrate in the plasma membrane of human lymphocyte which show pharmacological ( aldosterone specificity ) and kinetic ( high turnover ) property identical with those of the rapid aldosterone effect in the same cell .
sds-page analysis of the receptor protein have show a molecular weight of approximately 50 kd .
the present paper review the data support a new , two-step model for non-genomic and genomic aldosterone effect .
it also suggest a novel specificity-conferring mechanism for mineralocorticoid action at the membrane level .
monocyte tethering by p-selectin regulate monocyte chemotactic protein-1 and tumor necrosis factor-alpha secretion .
signal integration and nf-kappa b translocation [ see comment ]
adhesion molecule that tether circulate leukocyte to endothelial cell may also transduce or modulate outside-in signal for cellular activation , provide an initial regulatory point in the inflammatory response .
adhesion of human monocyte to p-selectin , the most rapidly express endothelial tethering factor , increase the secretion of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 ( mcp-1 ) and tumor necrosis factor-alpha ( tnf-alpha ) by the leukocyte when they be stimulate with platelet-activating factor .
increase cytokine secretion be specifically inhibit by g1 , an anti- p-selectin mab that prevent p-selectin from bind to it ligand ( p-selectin glycoprotein ligand-1 ) on myeloid cell .
moreover , tethering by p-selectin specifically enhance nuclear translocation of nuclear factor-kappa b ( nf-kappa b ) , a transcription factor require for expression of mcp-1 , tnf-alpha , and other immediate-early gene .
these result demonstrate that p-selectin , through it ligand on monocyte , may locally regulate cytokine secretion in inflamed tissue .
sterol dependent ldl-receptor gene transcription in lymphocyte from normal and cml patient .
sterol regulatory element ( sre ) have be recognize to regulate various key gene cod for especially low density lipoprotein ( ldl ) -receptor , 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme a ( hmg-coa ) reductase and hmg-coa synthase know to play a crucial role in the cholesterol feedback mechanism .
the deranged cholesterol feedback mechanism have be widely recognise in initiation as well a progression of various type of cancer include chronic myeloid leukaemia ( cml ) .
consequently , the present study be address to understand this phenomenon and reveal the existence of a unique 47 kda protein factor have affinity for this sre sequence in lymphocyte from normal subject as well a it absence in lymphocyte from untreated cml patient .
however , this factor appear when the cml patient achieve complete haematological remission ( chr ) through alpha-interferon therapy .
far , an inverse relationship be also observe between sterol modulated ldl -receptor gene transcription and the binding affinity of this 47 kda factor to the sre sequence .

an 11-base-pair dna sequence motif apparently unique to the human interleukin 4 gene confer responsiveness to t-cell activation signal .
we have identify a dna segment that confer responsiveness to antigen stimulation signal on the human interleukin ( il ) 4 gene in jurkat cell .
the human il-4 gene , of 10 kilobases , be compose of four exon and three intron .
a cis-acting element ( p sequence ) reside in the 5' upstream region ; no additional dna segment with enhancer activity be identify in the human il-4 gene .

the p sequence do not share homology with the 5' upstream sequence of the il-2 gene , even though surround sequence of the il-4 gene share high homology with the il-2 gene .
we conclude that a different set of protein recognize il-2 and il-4 gene .
the spatial distribution of human immunoglobulin gene within the nucleus : evidence for gene topography independent of cell type and transcriptional activity .
the three-dimensional positioning of immunoglobulin ( ig ) gene within the nucleus of human cell be investigate use in situ hybridization and confocal microscopy .
the visualization of heavy and light chain gene in b-lymphoid cell show that the three ig gene be differentially and nonrandomly distribute in different nuclear subvolumes : the kappa gene be find to be preferentially confine to an out nuclear volume , whereas the gamma and lambda gene consistently occupy more central position within the nucleus , the lambda gene be more interior when compare with the gamma gene .
the data far show that these overall topographical distribution be independent of gene transcriptional activity and be conserve in different cell type .
although subtle gene movement within those define topographical region can not be exclude by this study , the result indicate that tissue specificity of gene expression be not accompany by drastic change in gene nuclear topography , rather suggest that gene organization within the nucleus may be primarily dependent on structural constraint impose on the respective chromosome .
epstein-barr viral latency be disrupt by the immediate-early brlf1 protein through a cell-specific mechanism .
epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) , the causative agent of infectious mononucleosis , be a human herpesvirus associate with epithelial cell malignancy ( nasopharyngeal carcinoma ) as well a b-cell malignancy .
understand how viral latency be disrupt be a central issue in herpesvirus biology .
epithelial cell be the major site of lytic ebv replication within the human host , and viral reactivation occur in ebv -associated nasopharyngeal carcinoma .
it be know that expression of a single viral immediate-early protein , bzlf1 , be sufficient to initiate the switch from latent to lytic infection in b cell .
cellular regulation of bzlf1 transcription be therefore think to play a key role in regulate the stringency of viral latency .
here we show that , unexpectedly , expression of another viral immediate-early protein , brlf1 , can disrupt viral latency in an epithelial cell-specific fashion .
therefore , the mechanism lead to disruption of ebv latency appear to be cell-type specific .
clone a cdna from human nk/ t cell which cod for a protein with high proline content .
a cdna clone , b4-2 , be isolate from a natural killer ( nk ) minus t cell subtractive library .
the b4-2 clone cod for an mrna of 2061 bp in length .
it encode a deduce 327 aa protein with a calculate molecular mass of 35.2 kda .
searching of b4-2 dna and protein sequence against various database reveal no high homology to other sequence .
however , b4-2 have an unusually high proline content ( 13 % ) , contain a putative nuclear targeting sequence , and have several spxx motif which be frequently find in gene regulatory protein .
one of the stretch of proline in b4-2 closely resemble the ligand for protein with sh3 domain .
northern hybridization data show that b4-2 be not a lymphoid specific gene and be express in a hepatoma cell line and also weakly transcribe or absent in a variety of other cell .
a polyclonal antiserum raise against recombinant b4-2 recognize a 32-34 kda protein in lymphocyte .
decrease il-12 production and th1 cell development by acetyl salicylic acid -mediated inhibition of nf-kappab .
il-12 be a 75-kda heterodimeric cytokine compose of two covalently link p35 and p40 chain .
this pro-inflammatory cytokine play a prominent role in the development of th1 cell-mediated immune response .
th1 cell-mediated immune response have be implicate in the pathogenesis of chronic inflammatory autoimmune disease .
thus , il-12 appear to be a critical factor in the generation and maintenance of chronic inflammatory condition .
in this study , we investigate the effect of a commonly prescribe anti-inflammatory drug , acetyl salicylic acid ( asa ) , on il-12 production and th1 cell development .
asa be find to inhibit secretion of the il-12 heterodimer as well a p40 monomer by human monocytic cell .
this be associate with the down-regulation of il-12p40 mrna expression .
analysis of the regulation of the p40 gene promoter reveal that asa inhibit nf-kappab activation and binding to the p40-kappab site in the p40 promoter , lead to transcriptional repression of the p40 gene .
addition of asa to an in vitro t helper cell differentiation system , at concentration compatible with plasma level reach during anti-inflammatory therapy , result in reduce development of th1 cell .
these result suggest that the inhibition of nf-kappab activation by asa lead to down-regulation of il-12 production and inhibition of th1 cell development .
il-2 and il-7 induce heterodimerization of stat5 isoforms in human peripheral blood t lymphoblast .
despite difference in t cell response induce by interleukin ( il ) -2 and il-7 , both cytokine modulate t cell function by activation of signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein .
we examine the contribution of the two isoforms of stat5 , stat5a and stat5b , to il-2- and il-7- induced activation of human peripheral blood t lymphoblast .
both cytokine induce assembly of stat5a and stat5b contain complex capable of bind to the interferon-gamma activation sequence ( gas ) , and these complex rapidly translocate ( within 1 min ) into the nucleus of il-2- or il-7- treated cell .
the kinetics of this translocation be delay in il-7 -treated a compare to il-2 -treated cell .
il-2 and il-7 be equivalent in their ability to induce tyrosine phosphorylation of stat5a and stat5b and to facilitate binding of these stats to an immobilize gas element .
both il-2 and il-7 induce substantial amount of stat5a /stat5b heterodimerization .
moreover , we observe constitutive association of stat3 with each stat5 isomer .
these data suggest that il-2 and il-7 induce assembly of stat heterodimers in a similar manner and that subsequent cellular response may be drive by induction of similar set of gene .
use of arsenic trioxide ( as2o3 ) in the treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) : ii .
clinical efficacy and pharmacokinetics in relapsed patient .
the therapeutic effect of arsenic trioxide ( as2o3 ) in the treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia ( apl ) be evaluate among 15 apl patient at relapse after all-trans retinoic acid ( atra ) induce and chemotherapy maintain complete remission ( cr ) .
as2o3 be administer intravenously at the dose of 10 mg/d .
clinical cr be achieve in nine of 10 ( 90 % ) patient treat with as2o3 alone and in the remain five patient treat by the combination of as2o3 and low-dose chemotherapeutic drug or atra .
during the treatment with as2o3 , there be no bone marrow depression and only limited side effect be encounter .
pharmacokinetic study , which be perform in eight patient , show that after a peak level of 5.54 micromol/l to 7.30 micromol/l , plasma arsenic be rapidly eliminate , and the continuous administration of as2o3 do not alter it pharmacokinetic behavior .
in addition , increase amount of arsenic appear in the urine , with a daily excretion account for approximately 1 % to 8 % of the total daily dose administer .
arsenic content in hair and nail be increase , and the peak content of arsenic could reach 2.5 to 2.7 microg/g tissue at cr .
on the other hand , a decline of the arsenic content in hair and nail be observe after withdrawal of the drug .
we conclude that as2o3 treatment be an effective and relatively safe drug in apl patient refractory to atra and conventional chemotherapy .
activation of the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor promoter in t cell require cooperative binding of elf-1 and ap-1 transcription factor .
the granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor ( gm-csf ) gene have be study extensively a a model system of transcriptional induction during t-lymphocyte activation .
the gm-csf gene be not express in rest peripheral blood t cell but be rapidly induce at the transcriptional level follow activation through the cell surface t-cell receptor .
a highly conserve 19-bp element located immediately 5' of the human gm-csf tata box ( bp -34 to -52 ) , herein call purine box 1 ( pb1 ) , have be show to bind a t-cell nuclear protein complex and to be require for transcriptional induction of the gm-csf gene follow t-cell activation .
the pb1 sequence motif be highly conserve in both human and murine gm-csf gene .
in this report , we demonstrate that the pb1 element alone confer inducibility on a heterologous promoter follow transfection into human jurkat t cell .
in addition , we identify a major pb1 nuclear protein-binding complex that be not present in rest peripheral blood t cell but be rapidly induce follow t-cell activation .
sequence analysis reveal that pb1 be compose of adjacent bind site for ets and ap-1 transcription factor .
in vitro mutagenesis experiment demonstrate that both the ets and ap-1 site be require for binding of the inducible pb1 nuclear protein complex and for the transcriptional activity of this element and the gm-csf promoter in activate t cell .

the involvement of multiple tumor necrosis factor receptor ( tnfr ) -associated factor in the signaling mechanism of receptor activator of nf-kappab , a member of the tnfr superfamily .
receptor activator of nf-kappab ( rank ) be a recently identify member of the tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily and be express on activate t cell and dendritic cell .
it cognate ligand ( rankl ) play significant role in the activation of dendritic cell function and osteoclast differentiation .
we demonstrate here the interaction of rank with tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor ( trafs ) 1 , 2 , 3 , 5 , and 6 both in vitro and in cell .
mapping of the structural requirement for traf /rank interaction reveal multiple traf binding site cluster in two distinct domain in the rank cytoplasmic tail .
these traf binding domain be show to be functionally important for the rank -dependent induction of nf-kappab and c-jun nh2-terminal kinase activity .
site-directed mutagenesis demonstrate that these traf binding site exhibit selective binding for different traf protein .
in particular , traf6 interact with membrane-proximal determinant distinct from those bind trafs 1 , 2 , 3 , and 5 .
when this membrane-proximal traf6 interaction domain be delete , rank -mediated nf-kappab signaling be completely inhibit while c-jun nh2-terminal kinase activation be partially inhibit .
an nh2-terminal truncation mutant of traf6 inhibit rankl -mediated nf-kappab activation , but fail to affect constitutive signaling induce by receptor overexpression , reveal a selective role for traf6 in ligand-induced activation event .
transcriptional regulation of the ferritin heavy-chain gene : the activity of the ccaat binding factor nf-y be modulate in heme-treated friend leukemia cell and during monocyte-to-macrophage differentiation .
the ferritin h-chain gene promoter regulation be analyze in heme-treated friend leukemia cell ( flcs ) and during monocyte-to-macrophage differentiation .
in the majority of cell line study , the regulation of ferritin expression be exert mostly at the translational level .
however , in differentiate erythroid cell , which must incorporate high level of iron to sustain hemoglobin synthesis , and in macrophage , which be involve in iron storage , transcriptional regulation seem to be a relevant mechanism .
we show here that the minimum region of the ferritin h-gene promoter that be able to confer transcriptional regulation by heme in flcs to a reporter gene be 77 nucleotide upstream of the tata box .
this cis element bind a protein complex refer to a hrf ( heme-responsive factor ) , which be greatly enhance both in heme-treated flcs and during monocyte-to-macrophage differentiation .
the ccaat element present in reverse orientation in this promoter region of the ferritin h-chain gene be necessary for binding and for gene activity , since a single point mutation be able to abolish the binding of hrf and the transcriptional activity in transfected cell .
by competition experiment and supershift assay , we identify the induce hrf a contain at least the ubiquitous transcription factor nf-y .
nf-y be form by three subunit , a , b , and c , all of which be necessary for dna binding .
cotransfection with a transdominant negative mutant of the nf-ya subunit abolish the transcriptional activation by heme , indicate that nf-y play an essential role in this activation .
we have also observe a differential expression of the nf-ya subunit in heme-treated and control flcs and during monocyte-to-macrophage differentiation .
bik , a novel death-inducing protein share a distinct sequence motif with bcl-2 family protein and interact with viral and cellular survival-promoting protein .
the survival-promoting activity of the bcl-2 family of protein appear to be modulate by interaction between various cellular protein .
we have identify a novel cellular protein , bik , that interact with the cellular survival-promoting protein , bcl-2 and bcl-xl , as well a the viral survival-promoting protein , epstein barr virus -bhrf1 and adenovirus e1b-19 kda .
in transient transfection assay , bik promote cell death in a manner similar to the death-promoting member of the bcl-2 family , bax and bak .
this death-promoting activity of bik can be suppress by coexpression of bcl-2 , bcl-xl , ebv-bhrf1 and e1b-19 kda protein suggest that bik may be a common target for both cellular and viral anti-apoptotic protein .
while bik do not show overt homology to the bh1 and bh2 conserved domain characteristic of the bcl-2 family , it do share a 9 amino acid domain ( bh3 ) with bax and bak which may be a critical determinant for the death-promoting activity of these protein .
a new mouse gene , srg3 , related to the swi3 of saccharomyces cerevisiae , be require for apoptosis induce by glucocorticoid in a thymoma cell line .
we isolate a new mouse gene that be highly express in thymocytes , testis , and brain .
this gene , srg3 , show a significant sequence homology to swi3 , a yeast transcriptional activator , and it human homolog baf155 .
srg3 encode 1,100 amino acid and have 33-47 % identity with swi3 protein over three region .
the srg3 protein contain an acidic nh2 terminus , a myb-like dna binding domain , a leucine-zipper motif , and a proline- and glutamine-rich region at it cooh terminus .
rabbit antiserum raise against a cooh-terminal polypeptide of the srg3 recognize a protein with an apparent molecular mass of 155 kd .
the serum also detect a 170-kd protein that seem to be a mouse homologue of human baf170 .
immunoprecipitation of cell extract with the antiserum against the mouse srg3 also bring down a 195-kd protein that could be recognize by an antiserum raise against human swi2 protein .
the result suggest that the srg3 protein associate with a mouse swi2 .
the srg3 protein be express about three time high in thymocytes than in peripheral lymphocyte .
the expression of anti-sense rna to srg3 mrna in a thymoma cell line , s49.1 , reduce the expression level of the srg3 protein , and decrease the apoptotic cell death induce by glucocorticoid .
these result suggest that the srg3 protein be involve in the glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis in the thymoma cell line .
this implicate that the srg3 may play an important regulatory role during t cell development in thymus .
stat3 recruitment by two distinct ligand-induced , tyrosine-phosphorylated docking site in the interleukin-10 receptor intracellular domain .
recent work have show that il-10 induce activation of the jak -stat signaling pathway .
to define the mechanism underlie signal transducer and activator of transcription ( stat ) protein recruitment to the interleukin 10 ( il-10 ) receptor , the stat protein activate by il-10 in different cell population be first define use electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
in all cell test , il-10 activate stat1 and stat3 and induce the formation of three distinct dna binding complex that contain different combination of these two transcription factor .
il-10 also activate stat5 in ba/f3 cell that stably express the murine il-10 receptor .
use a structure-function mutagenesis approach , two tyrosine residue ( tyr427 and tyr477 ) in the intracellular domain of the murine il-10 receptor be find to be redundantly require for receptor function and for activation of stat3 but not for stat1 or stat5 .
twelve amino acid peptide encompass either of these two tyrosine residue in phosphorylated form coprecipitated stat3 but not stat1 and block il-10 -induced stat3 phosphorylation in a cell-free system .
in contrast , tyrosine-phosphorylated peptide contain tyr374 or tyr396 do not interact with stat3 or block stat3 activation .
these data demonstrate that stat3 but not stat1 or stat5 be directly recruit to the ligand-activated il-10 receptor by bind to specific but redundant receptor intracellular domain sequence contain phosphotyrosine .
this study thus support the concept that utilization of distinct stat protein by different cytokine receptor be dependent on the expression of particular ligand-activatable , tyrosine-containing stat docking site in receptor intracellular domain .
the activity of the ccaat-box binding factor nf-y be modulate through the regulate expression of it a subunit during monocyte to macrophage differentiation : regulation of tissue-specific gene through a ubiquitous transcription factor .
in this study , we analyze the regulation of nf-y expression during human monocyte to macrophage maturation .
nf-y be a ubiquitous and evolutionarily conserve transcription factor that bind specifically to the ccaat motif present in the 5' promoter region of a wide variety of gene .
we show here that in circulate monocyte , nf-y binding activity be not detect on the ccaat motif present in the promoter of gene such a major histocompatibility complex ( mhc ) class ii , gp91-phox , mig , and fibronectin , whereas during macrophage differentiation , a progressive increase in nf-y binding activity be observe on these promoter .
analysis of nf-y subunit expression indicate that the absence of nf-y activity in circulate monocyte be cause by a lack of the a subunit .
furthermore , addition of the recombinant nf-y a subunit restore nf-y binding .
we show that the lack of nf-ya protein be due to posttranscriptional regulation and not to a specific proteolytic activity .
in fact , nf-ya mrna be present at the same level at all day of monocyte cultivation , whereas the protein be absent in freshly isolate monocyte but be progressively synthesize during the maturation process .
we thus conclude that the nf-y a subunit play a relevant role in activate transcription of gene highly express in mature monocyte .
in line with this conclusion , we show that the cut/cdp protein , a transcriptional repressor that inhibit gpc91-phox gene expression by prevent nf-y binding to the caat box , be absent in monocyte .
effect of prostaglandin e2 on th0-type human t cell clone : modulation of function of nuclear protein involve in cytokine production .
the effect of prostaglandin e2 ( pge2 ) on cytokine production and proliferation of the cd4+ human helper t cell clone sp-b21 be investigate .
in cell stimulate with anti-cd3 mab , pge2 inhibit cell proliferation and the production of all the cytokine examine .
addition of ril-2 fully restore the proliferative response and partially restore the production of il-4 and il-5 , but not that of other cytokine .
in contrast , in cell stimulate with phorbol myristate acetate ( pma ) / a23187 , pge2 enhance the production of il-4 and il-5 , and only partially inhibit the production of other cytokine .
therefore , the effect of pge2 vary depend on the mode of t cell activation , and the il-4 and il-5 be regulate differently from other cytokine .
in a mobility shift assay , only the nf-kappa b ( p50 /p50 ) homodimer be observe in a complex form with the kappa b sequence in unstimulated sp-b21 cell .
when cell be stimulate with anti-cd3 mab or pma /a23187 , a complex formation of nf-kappa b ( p50 /p65 ) heterodimer with the kappa b sequence be induce .
interestingly , pge2 or di-butyryl ( bt2 ) camp abolish the binding of nf-kappa b ( p50 /p65 ) heterodimer to the kappa b sequence in cell stimulate with anti-cd3 mab but not with pma /a23187 .
our result suggest that the target of pge2 action be a component in the signal transduction pathway lead to the activation of protein kinase c .
however , the inhibition of the t cell activation signal by pge2 be selective .
pge2 enhance the complex formation with nf-at , ap-1 and cle0 sequence when the cell be activate by either anti-cd3 mab or pma /a23187 stimulation .
it seem therefore that pge2 , by elevate camp level , interfere with the activation pathway for nf-kappa b but not for nf-at , ap-1 or cle0 binding protein .
the winged-helix transcription factor trident be express in actively divide lymphocyte .
we recently identify the winged-helix transcription factor trident and describe it expression pattern in synchronize fibroblast .

during t cell differentiation , expression peak in the actively divide immature single positive cell .

these observation imply a function for trident in divide lymphocyte .

immobilization and recovery of fusion protein and b-lymphocyte cell use magnetic separation .
a new approach to facilitate immobilization and affinity purification of recombinant protein and select human b lymphocyte have be develop .
