leiomyosarcoma of the vulva : report of a case .
a 52-year-old female present with a progressively enlarge vulvar mass .
pathological evaluation reveal a high-grade vulvar leiomyosarcoma .
immunohistochemical and ultrastructural study be perform to support the diagnosis .
in an effort to well understand the biology of this tumor additional immunohistochemical study for the protein product of p53 tumor suppressor gene and estrogen receptor expression by tumor cell , as well a the type of immune cell infiltrate the tumor be perform .
tumor cell show an overexpression of p53 protein and be estrogen receptor -positive .
macrophage and t and b lymphocyte infiltrate the tumor in moderate number with occasional lymphoid aggregate formation .
this study be the first attempt to well understand the biology of these tumor .
involvement of transcription factor yb-1 in human t-cell lymphotropic virus type i basal gene expression .
sequence which control basal human t-cell lymphotropic virus type i ( htlv-i ) transcription likely play an important role in initiation and maintenance of virus replication .
we previously identify and analyze a 45-nucleotide sequence ( downstream regulatory element 1 [ dre 1 ] ) , +195 to +240 , at the boundary of the r/u5 region of the long terminal repeat which be require for htlv-i basal transcription .
we identify a protein , p37 , which specifically bind to dre 1 .
an affinity column fraction , contain p37 , stimulate htlv-i transcription approximately 12-fold in vitro .
we now report the identification of a cdna clone ( 15b-7 ) , from a jurkat expression library , that bind specifically to the dre 1 regulatory sequence .
binding of the cdna fusion protein , similarly to the result obtain with purify jurkat protein , be decrease by introduction of site-specific mutation in the dre 1 regulatory sequence .
in vitro transcription and translation of 15b-7 cdna produce a fusion protein which bind specifically to the htlv-i +195 to +240 oligonucleotide .
the partial cdna encode a protein which be homologous to the c-terminal 196 amino acid of the 36-kda transcription factor , yb-1 .
cotransfection of a yb-1 expression plasmid increase htlv-i basal transcription approximately 14-fold in jurkat t lymphocyte .
on the basis of the molecular weight , dna-binding characteristic , and in vivo transactivation activity , we suggest that the previously identify dre 1 -binding protein , p37 , be yb-1 .
ap-1 derive from mature monocyte and astrocyte preferentially interact with the htlv-i promoter central 21 bp repeat .
characterization of the cellular transcription factor interact with the human t cell lymphotropic virus type i ( htlv-i ) long terminal repeat ( ltr ) be essential to dissect the mechanism involve in viral transcription that may be pertinent to the oncogenic and neuropathogenic process associate with htlv-i infection in both the immune and nervous system .
electrophoretic mobility shift ( em ) analysis utilize oligonucleotides homologous to each of the 21 bp repeat element react with nuclear extract derive from cell line of lymphocytic , monocytic , neuronal , and glial cell origin have demonstrate differential binding of cellular factor to the three 21 bp repeat ( 1-4 ) .
atf/creb and sp family member interact with the 21 bp repeat to form dna-protein complex common to all cell type examine .
however , a unique dna-protein complex be detect when the promoter central 21 bp repeat be react with nuclear extract derive from either the u-373 mg glioblastoma cell line or the thp-1 mature monocytic cell line .
base on nucleotide sequence requirement and immunoreactivity , we demonstrate that this dna-protein complex be comprise of the ap-1 component , fo and jun .
[ ngfi-b/nur77 family involve in t-cell apoptosis ]
ngfi-b/nur77 be a member of the steroid receptor superfamily .
ngfi-b/nur77 and it related gene constitute a family and the ngfi-b/nur77 family consist of three subtypes , name nur77 alpha , nur77 beta , nur77 gamma .
we clone human nur77 beta cdna , call tinur .
although ngfi-b/nur77 be essential for tcr-mediated apoptosis in t-cell hybridoma , the report on nur77 knock-out mouse and nur77 dominant negative transgenic mouse suggest that there be a functional redundancy among ngfi-b/nur77 family .
ngfi-b/nur77 bind to the response element by monomer or heterodimer with retinoid x receptor ( rxr ) .
assume that 9-cis-retinoic acid ( 9-cis-ra ) inhibit tcr-mediated apoptosis , nur77 may cause apoptosis by monomer in the absence of 9-cis-ra and may inhibit apoptosis by heterodimer with rxr in the presence of 9-cis-ra .
nf-m ( chicken c/ebp beta ) induce eosinophilic differentiation and apoptosis in a hematopoietic progenitor cell line .
caat/enhancer binding protein ( c/ebps ) be transcriptional activator implicate in the differentiation process of various cell lineage .
we have show earlier that nf-m , the chicken homolog of c/ebp beta , be specifically express in myelomonocytic and eosinophilic cell of the hematopoietic system .
to investigate the role of nf-m in hematopoietic cell lineage commitment , we construct a conditional form of the protein by fuse it to the hormone binding domain of the human estrogen receptor .
this construct be stably express in a multipotent progenitor cell line transform by the myb-ets oncoprotein .
we report here that both nf-m -dependent promoter construct and resident gene could be activate by addition of beta-estradiol to the nf-m -estrogen receptor express progenitor .
at the same time , we observe a down-regulation of progenitor-specific surface marker and the up-regulation of differentiation marker restricted to the eosinophil and myeloid lineage .
in addition to the onset of differentiation , cell death be induce with typical apoptotic feature .
our result suggest that nf-m play an important role in commitment along the eosinophil lineage and in the induction of apoptosis .
treatment of hl60 cell with various combination of retinoids and 1 alpha , 25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 result in differentiation towards neutrophil or monocyte or a failure to differentiate and apoptosis .
it be well document that treatment of serum-grown hl60 cell with 10(-7) m all-trans retinoic acid ( all-trans ra ) induce neutrophil differentiation , whereas treatment with 10(-7) m 1 alpha , 25 dihydroxyvitamin d3 ( d3 ) induce differentiation towards monocyte .
in recent investigation , use serum-free grown hl60 cell , we observe that all-trans ra , at 10(-7) m , do not induce neutrophil differentiation and that all-trans ra , at 10(-8) m , reduce the d3 concentration require for monocyte differentiation to 5 x 10(-9) m .
in this study , co-operative interaction between all-trans and 9-cis ra and d3 which promote neutrophil and monocyte differentiation of hl60 cell have be analyse in detail .
treatment of serum-free grown hl60 cell with 5 x 10(-7) m all-trans ra or 9-cis ra result in sub-optimal neutrophil differentiation ( up to 25 % mature cell ) .
a show for all-trans ra , 9-cis ra cooperate with d3 to promote monocyte differentiation .
culture of hl60 cell in 5 x 10(-7) m 9-cis ra together with a wide range of concentration of d3 result in promotion of neutrophil differentiation at 10(-15)-10(-12) d3 , a failure to differentiate and apoptosis at 10(-11)-10(-10) m d3 , follow by co-operativity between 9-cis ra and 5 x 10(-9) m d3 in induce monocyte differentiation in the absence of neutrophil differentiation .
similar result be obtain when hl60 cell be treat with 5 x 10(-7) all-trans ra together with a wide range of concentration of d3 .
cross titration analysis of the effect of 9-cis ra and d3 on hl60 cell differentiation be undertake to determine the boundary of the concentration of each agent , alone and in combination , that give rise to optimal neutrophil and monocyte differentiation of hl60 cell .
the observe cooperativities between either 9-cis ra or all-trans ra and d3 have important implication for the use of combination of these agent in differentiation therapy .
transcription factor of t and b lymphocyte -- basic research and clinical perspective for gastroenterology .
tissue specific regulation of gene expression by transcription factor be a fascinating new field in molecular immunology .
this review summarize data on specific regulation of promoter and enhancer by nuclear trans-acting factor in lymphocyte .
the structural class of transcription factor be describe and basic method for detection and analysis of transcription factor be detail .
furthermore , the most important trans-acting factor of t and b lymphocyte ( e.g. nf-kb , nf-at and stat family ) and their functional importance be describe .
several method for specific down-regulation of transcription factor be show that may be relevant to treatment of human disease .
the data be discuss with regard to their potential clinical relevance for gastroenterology .
regulation of glucocorticoid receptor in human mononuclear cell : effect of glucocorticoid treatment , cushing 's disease and ketoconazole .
glucocorticoid receptor ( gcr ) be determine by a whole cell assay in human mononulear leukocyte ( hmnl ) from control subject , patient receive glucocorticoid therapy for systemic disease and cushing 's disease patient with or without ketoconazole therapy .
prolonged corticosteroid treatment result in down-regulation of gcr , while the mean level of gcr in cushing 's disease be normal .
in this group , however , receptor level and morning plasma cortisol value show a negative correlation , indicate a subtle down-regulatory effect .
furthermore , gcr be unaltered after these patient receive ketoconazole , in spite of a marked reduction in morning plasma cortisol and urinary free cortisol .
we also observe that ketoconazole be a weak competitor of gcr in intact cell , although it significantly inhibit [3h] dexamethasone binding in cytosolic preparation from rat tissue .
the result suggest that gcr in hmnl be down-regulated by synthetic steroid give in vivo , but they show very mild down-regulation in hypercortisolemic patient suffer from cushing 's disease .
finally , we do not observe either up-regulation or antagonism of gcr by ketoconazole treatment , at the time that cortisol level of patient with cushing 's disease be reduce .
this indicate that the beneficial effect of ketoconazole in cushing 's disease be due to adrenal cortisol suppression and not to interaction with gcr of target cell , and that the process of gcr regulation in hmnl be a complex phenomenon await far elucidation .
nasal nk- and t-cell lymphoma share the same type of epstein-barr virus latency a nasopharyngeal carcinoma and hodgkin 's disease .
nasal t/nk-cell lymphoma can be far separate into those of natural killer ( nk ) cell lineage or of t-cell lineage , with difference in cellular phenotype , t-cell receptor ( tcr ) gene rearrangement and tcr transcript expression .
both nk- and t-cell subtypes be closely associate with epstein-barr virus ( ebv ) .
in this study , ebv gene expression be determine in 23 case of nasal lymphoma ( nl ) by in situ hybridisation ( ish ) , reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction ( rt-pcr ) and immunohistochemistry ( ih ) .
of the 23 case , 19 be classify a nk-cell and 4 a t-cell tumour .
ish for ebv -encoded small non-polyadenylated rna show that all case , whether nk or t , harbour ebv in virtually all tumour cell .
rt-pcr demonstrate that nl of both subtypes express ebnai of the quk splice pattern , the latent membrane protein , lmp 1 and 2 and the bamhi a rightward transcript in the absence of ebna2 mrna , compatible with the latency type ii pattern .
in addition , analysis of ebv protein expression by ih reveal a heterogeneous pattern of ebv gene expression at the single-cell level consist of both lmp1+ and lmp1- tumour cell , suggest a mixture of latency i and ii .
although 2 early lytic transcript , bzlf1 and bhrf1 , be also detect in 13 and 10 case , respectively , the lack of zebra staining in any case indicate that these lytic transcript be most likely express by rare cell in the biopsy enter lytic cycle .
the viral transcriptional pattern similar to that of nasopharyngeal carcinoma and hodgkin 's disease suggest that ebv can exploit common regulatory mechanism for gene transcription in diverse host cell type .
down-regulation of immunogenic protein ( ebna2-ebna6 ) in nasal lymphoma may enable tumour cell to evade host cytotoxic t-cell surveillance .
tpl-2 induce il-2 expression in t-cell line by trigger multiple signaling pathway that activate nfat and nf-kappab .
the tpl-2 kinase activate the nuclear factor of activate t cell ( nfat ) and induce il-2 expression in t-cell line .
here we show that the activation of the il-2 promoter by tpl-2 be inhibit by mutant signal molecule that inhibit the mitogen-activated protein kinase ( mapk ) or the calcineurin /nfat pathway and be promote by combination of signal molecule that activate these pathway .
we , therefore , conclude that signal generate by the convergence of the mapk and the calcineurin /nfat pathway be necessary and sufficient for the activation of the il-2 promoter by tpl-2 .
the activation of both the il-2 promoter and an nfat -driven minimal promoter be show to depend on signal transduce by raf1 .
however , it be only the il-2 promoter whose activation by tpl-2 be fully block by the dominant negative mutant mek1s218/222a and the mek1/mek2 inhibitor pd098059 .
since the activation of nfat be mapk -dependent these finding suggest that the activation of mapk by tpl-2 be either independent or only partially dependent on mek1 and mek2 .
in addition , they suggest that the activation of the il-2 promoter be under the control of not only nfat but also a second factor whose activation be mek -dependent .
experiment in cos-1 and el-4 cell confirm both hypothesis and reveal that the second factor activate by tpl-2 be nf-kappab .
while the activation of the il-2 promoter and an nfat -driven minimal promoter by tpl-2 be fully block by the dominant negative mutant nfat delta418 , it be only partially block by the calcineurin inhibitor cyclosporin a suggest that the tpl-2 -mediated nfat activation be under the control of a combination of calcineurin- dependent and independent pathway .
both pathway be fully block by bcl-2 or bcl-x(l) .
cis-acting sequence require for inducible interleukin-2 enhancer function bind a novel ets-related protein , elf-1 .
the recent definition of a consensus dna binding sequence for the ets family of transcription factor have allow the identification of potential ets binding site in the promoter and enhancer of many inducible t-cell gene .
in the study describe in this report , we have identify two potential ets binding site , ebs1 and ebs2 , which be conserve in both the human and murine interleukin-2 enhancer .
within the human enhancer , these two site be located within the previously define dnase i footprint , nfat-1 and nfil-2b , respectively .
electrophoretic mobility shift and methylation interference analysis demonstrate that ebs1 and ebs2 be essential for the formation of the nfat-1 and nfil-2b nuclear protein complex .
furthermore , in vitro mutagenesis experiment demonstrate that inducible interleukin-2 enhancer function require the presence of either ebs1 or ebs2 .
two well-characterized ets family member , ets-1 and ets-2 , be reciprocally express during t-cell activation .
surprisingly , however , neither of these protein bind in vitro to ebs1 or ebs2 .
we therefore screen a t-cell cdna library under low-stringency condition with a probe from the dna binding domain of ets-1 and isolate a novel ets family member , elf-1 .
elf-1 contain a dna binding domain that be nearly identical to that of e74 , the ecdysone-inducible drosophila transcription factor require for metamorphosis ( hence the name elf-1 , for e74-like factor 1 ) .
elf-1 bind specifically to both ebs1 and ebs2 in electrophoretic mobility shift assay .
it also bind to the purine-rich cd3r element from the human immunodeficiency virus type 2 long terminal repeat , which be require for inducible virus expression in response to signalling through the t-cell receptor .
take together , these result demonstrate that multiple ets family member with apparently distinct dna binding specificity regulate differential gene expression in rest and activate t cell .
lymphoid cell resistance to glucocorticoid in hiv infection .
in human infect with the hiv-1 virus there may be a disproportionate severity of sign and symptom of illness compare to the fraction of cd4+ infected t-lymphoid cell .
in part , this may be due to altered intercellular signalling system and intracellular signal transduction .
glucocorticoid be well known for their effect on the vitality and function of lymphoid cell .
patient with hiv infection often show elevated circulating level of cortisol , suggest some misfunction in the regulatory system that maintain the level of this critical hormone .
at the cellular level , it be know that both acute hiv infection and glucocorticoid can cause apoptotic cell death in thymic lymphocyte .
however , chronically hiv -infected cell appear to be resistant to glucocorticoid-evoked cell death .
glucocorticoid receptor -ligand binding study on patient ' cell have show reduce affinity between the receptor binding site and test steroid .
in vitro , chronically hiv -infected cell of the lymphoid cem line display resistance to glucocorticoid-induced apoptosis .
these cell show reduce number of bind site with little alteration in apparent affinity between ligand and receptor .
thus it appear that there may often be malfunction of the normal glucocorticoid response in hiv -infected cell probably due to altered interaction between the glucocorticoid receptor and it hormone .
such alteration may have clinical consequence , include the possibility of a relatively long life span of infected cd4+ t-lymphocytes , as well a systemic effect of chronically elevated cortisol level .
a human putative lymphocyte g0/g1 switch gene homologous to a rodent gene encode a zinc-binding potential transcription factor .
g0s24 be a member of a set of gene ( putative g0/g1 switch regulatory gene ) that be express transiently within 1-2 hr of the addition of lectin or cycloheximide to human blood mononuclear cell .
comparison of a full-length cdna sequence with the corresponding genomic sequence reveal an open reading frame of 326 amino acid , distribute across two exon .
potential phosphorylation site include the sequence psptspt , which resemble an rna polymerase ii repeat report to be a target of the cell cycle control kinase cdc2 .
comparison of the derive protein sequence with those of rodent homologs allow classification into three group .
group 1 contain g0s24 and the rat and mouse tis11 gene ( also know a ttp , nup475 , and zfp36 ) .
member of this group have three tetraproline repeat .
group 1 and 2 have a serine-rich region and an " arginine element " ( rrlpif ) at the carboxyl terminus .
all group contain cysteine- and histidine-rich putative zinc finger domain and a serine-phenylalanine " sfs " domain similar to part of the large subunit of eukaryotic rna polymerase ii .
comparison of group 1 human and mouse genomic sequence show high conservation in the 5' flank and exon .
a cpg island suggest expression in the germ line .
g0s24 have potential site for transcription factor in the 5' flank and intron ; these include a serum response element .
protein and genomic sequence show similarity with those of a variety of protein involve in transcription , suggest that the g0s24 product have a similar role .
pentoxifylline for the treatment of infection with human immunodeficiency virus .
cytokine dysregulation in human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( hiv-1 ) infection have be document in numerous study and have be cite a an important component in the pathogenesis of this retroviral infection .
pharmacological modification of cytokine dysregulation , therefore , have be suggest a a therapeutic modality for hiv-1 infection .
dr. dezube of beth israel hospital ( boston ) concisely review the state of our knowledge regard the effect of pentoxifylline on expression of tumor necrosis factor-alpha , a cytokine know to influence hiv-1 replication and to play a possible role in the clinical manifestation of advanced infection with this virus .
pentoxifylline , a trisubstituted xanthine derivative , have be use to decrease blood viscosity and be reasonably well tolerate by most recipient of the drug .
result of preliminary study , many of which be conduct by dr. dezube , suggest that use of this agent in combination with antiretroviral compound may prove useful in the treatment of patient with hiv-1 infection .
glucocorticoid resistance in chronic asthma .
glucocorticoid pharmacokinetics , glucocorticoid receptor characteristic , and inhibition of peripheral blood t cell proliferation by glucocorticoid in vitro .
a total of 37 chronic , severe , nonsmoking asthmatic patient with documented reversible airway obstruction be classify a glucocorticoid-sensitive or -resistant on the basis of change in fev1 , fvc , and peak expiratory flow ( pef ) after oral prednisolone .
the resistant patient show no significant improvement in airflow limitation .
phytohemagglutinin ( pha ) -induced proliferation of peripheral blood t lymphocyte from the sensitive but not the resistant asthmatic patient be significantly ( p less than 0.01 ) inhibit by dexamethasone ( 10 ( -7 ) mol/l ) , reflect a shift of the dose-response curve .
when all the asthmatic patient be analyze together , there be a significant correlation between the degree of sensitivity of t cell to dexamethasone and the clinical responsiveness to prednisolone ( p less than 0.01 ) .
no difference be observe between six of the sensitive and resistant patient in the clearance of plasma prednisolone derive from orally administer prednisone .
peripheral blood mononuclear cell glucocorticoid receptor be also characterize in five sensitive and seven resistant patient .
the number and binding affinity of these receptor could not account for the observe difference in the susceptibility of these cell to functional inhibition by dexamethasone in vitro .
these result suggest that clinical glucocorticoid resistance in chronic asthma do not reflect abnormal glucocorticoid clearance but may be due at least partly to a relative insensitivity of t lymphocyte to glucocorticoid .
this lack of sensitivity be unexplained but be not attributable to abnormality of cellular glucocorticoid receptor .
inhibition of dexamethasone binding to human glucocorticoid receptor by new world primate cell extract .
to determine if new world primate express an inhibitor that influence glucocorticoid receptor ( gr ) binding characteristic , we examine [3h]dexamethasone binding in cytosol prepare from b95-8 lymphoid cell , derive from the cotton top tamarin ( saguinus oedipus ) , in combination with cytosol prepare from human or rat tissue .
b95-8 cytosol inhibit specific binding of [3h]dexamethasone ( p < 0.01 ) when mix with cytosol prepare from either a human lymphoid cell line ( hl ) or rat thymus .
the inhibitory activity be heat labile and trypsin sensitive .
peak inhibitory activity be find in the 150-200 kd fraction after sephacryl g-200 ultrafiltration .
scatchard analysis of [3h]dexamethasone binding use mixed cytosol show a diminish gr apparent binding affinity when compare to hl cytosol .
kinetic study use mixed cytosol indicate that b95-8 cytosol do not affect the apparent dissociation rate of [3h]dexamethasone .
these data demonstrate that b95-8 cell contain a competitive inhibitor that prevent binding of dexamethasone to it cognate receptor .
dimethyldithiocarbamate inhibit in vitro activation of primary human cd4+ t lymphocyte .
dithiocarbamates ( dtc ) , a diverse group of industrial and therapeutic chemical , have be report to inhibit , enhance or have no effect on the immune system .
these apparent inconsistency reflect the complexity of the dtcs biological activity and be probably due in part to difference in dose , route of exposure , animal specie use and/or specific compound test .
the study describe herein be undertake to investigate the immunotoxicity of one member of this family , dimethyldithiocarbamate ( dmdtc ) .
we demonstrate that 0.1-0.5 microm dmdtc inhibit tnf-alpha -induced activation of nf-kappab in primary human cd4+ t cell .
this inhibition be not accompany by a loss in viability , and dmdtc -treated t cell retain other active signaling pathway throughout the exposure duration .
the inhibition of nf-kappab be apparently permanent a dmdtc -treated t cell do not regain normal tnf-alpha activation , even after 72 h in culture .
dmdtc do not appear to alter nf-kappab directly a pre-incubation of nuclear extract with dmdtc do not diminish binding activity of this protein .
we far demonstrate that 0.1-0.5 microm dmdtc inhibit intracellular il-2 production and decrease surface expression of cd25 ( the alpha subunit of the il-2 receptor ) in t cell stimulate with phorbol ester .
these data demonstrate that dmdtc be a potent immunosuppressive compound in vitro .
